excerpts: However it was a bit plain, and the bell peppers were in large chunks dispersed unevenly in the burrito.
plain.author: Em F.
plain.review:
I finally got to try this place after hearing so much about it from friends and Bobby Flays throw down.

Overall this place has pretty decent burritos, chips, and quesadilla. However nothing special enough to warrant my return. I will stick with El Farolito from now on and NEVER stray again.

Chips and sauce were ok. Chips were a bit thick. Sauce was pretty good, albeit a bit on the heavy side.

Shrimp Burrito. SUPERRRR salty. I ended up forgoing half of it, and fishing out the shrimp to eat. I can tell ingredients are fresh. However it was a bit plain, and the bell peppers were in large chunks dispersed unevenly in the burrito.

Beef quesadilla. It's very small for how much your pay, but pretty good. 4 pieces of quesadilla and beef that was flavorful. However the beef was on the dry and chewy side. (El Farolito is 20000000% better. ARguably they have the best quesadillas in town.)

Breakfast Burrito.  SOOO salty and greasy, that I was honestly not even sure what I was eating. I would definitely stay far away from this.

All in all...not bad by any means. However it would be a disappointment if you are expecting it to live up to its hype.

excerpts: My wife and I were craving just a few plain ole bean and cheese burritos...nothing else.
No rice, no meat, no fixins, just BEANS AND CHEESE.
Mine with refried black, hers with pinto (per their choices).
Easy, right?
Wrong.
Super wrong.
We get our order, excited and hungry, go home and what do I find?
Rice.
Everywhere.
And this time after I explicitly explained JUST refried black BEANS AND CHEESE.
I even watched her write it down.
So, I called back AGAIN and what does the woman on the other end say?
She repeats back "Oh, sorry, so you wanted rice, beans, and cheese??
I almost lost it.
I said NO, just beans and cheese.
I then just asked for a refund instead for the overpriced burritos I didn't even order.
Hopefully that actually happens, but knowing what had just transpired, I'm not holding my breath.
plain.author: A S.
plain.review:
My experience at this place was so ridiculously annoying it's really comedic. The food is standard Mission Mexican hole in the wall fare, nothing amazing. The one star is for the complete lack of listening skills. I mean like talking to a wall, literally.

My wife and I were craving just a few plain ole bean and cheese burritos...nothing else. No rice, no meat, no fixins, just BEANS AND CHEESE. Mine with refried black, hers with pinto (per their choices). Easy, right? Wrong. Super wrong. We get our order, excited and hungry, go home and what do I find? Rice. Everywhere. Awesome.

My wife was too hungry to care so ate away, but I was annoyed so I called back and they graciously agreed to make me another. So I biked back there, get my order and come home and guess what...RICE AGAIN! And the wrong kind of beans. And this time after I explicitly explained JUST refried black BEANS AND CHEESE. I even watched her write it down. So, I called back AGAIN and what does the woman on the other end say? She repeats back "Oh, sorry, so you wanted rice, beans, and cheese??" I almost lost it. I said NO, just beans and cheese. I then just asked for a refund instead for the overpriced burritos I didn't even order. Hopefully that actually happens, but knowing what had just transpired, I'm not holding my breath.

excerpts: I'm usually a super burrito gal, so this plain version was new to me.
The Mexi-Pino was still so tasty
and I venture to say better as a "classic" because you can taste the flavor of the adobo.
plain.author: Tiffany E.
plain.review:
I've been hearing about the Mexi-Pino burrito for quite some time now. This creation, made with Filipino style chicken adobo (meat simmered in vinegar and soy with garlic), garlic rice, and tomatoes, generously wrapped in a flour tortilla is deeelocious! At the recommendation of a friend/Papalote patron, I ordered the burrito "classic." You have to ask for "super" to get  the sour cream, cheese, and guac goodness. I'm usually a super burrito gal, so this plain version was new to me. The Mexi-Pino was still so tasty and I venture to say better as a "classic" because you can taste the flavor of the adobo. It was filling, yet not too heavy, and I walked out feeling muy feliz. 

Also, their salsa is pretty tasty with a little bite to it. I bought a jar of fresh made salsa and 2 extra burritos (for the husband and parentals) to bring home. The guy at the counter was really nice. He recommended the fresh salsa vs. the jars on the counter. He also hooked it up with a frequent customer card and marked off 3 burritos because he knew my sis and I had also just shared one in the dining area.

excerpts: I can seriously eat Chicken Adobo plain and having it in my burrito was perfect.
The portions here kinda big for a small girl like myself
so I split half a burrito- great advice for those sharing a meal.
Plus you get chips and dip complimentary before your meal!
plain.author: Janet N.
plain.review:
Working with Korean and Mexican fusion food really has taken a toll on my view on burritos, quesadillas and the like. Don't get me wrong I love Mexican food with a passion. 

It was refreshing to come to a place that had everything right going on with their food, but somewhat unexpected. Hello? Whoevers idea it was to put Chicken Adobo in a burrito is quite amazing in my book.

The Chicken Adobo Burrito is not on the menu but was recommended by friends who've been to Papalote before and boy I'm glad they did. I can seriously eat Chicken Adobo plain and having it in my burrito was perfect. The portions here kinda big for a small girl like myself so I split half a burrito- great advice for those sharing a meal. Plus you get chips and dip complimentary before your meal! Be careful the dip is a bit spicy, but addicting.

Pair your meal with a Jarritos or Pure Cane Sugar Cola!

Though the food was delicious, our service kinda sucked to be honest. Half of the table got their food and decided to wait for the other half to receive their food. Probably 10 minutes later we asked 2 waiters about our food and said they'd check the kitchen only to come back saying it was coming out. The other half the table was famished beyond words to wait longer and finished. Then our food finally came out ... with no apology either. Huh? I guess so ... 4 stars for the food itself, service that's another question.

excerpts: A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain.
plain.author: Jonathan L.
plain.review:
My friend was watching the Throwdown Challenge on the Food Network and saw the Triple Threat being put on the spotlight. To make a long story short, I'm sitting there, watching two of my buddies take on the Triple Threat. Not wanting to shell out $20+ for a burrito, I'm munching on a normal carne asada burrito.

I was really happy with how the carne asada came out. The meat is so tender and juicy and the steak marinade is fantastic. I wish it wasn't $9 but the quality speaks for itself. 

From my friends' comments, I'd say that the chicken in the Triple Threat is not so great. A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain. The shrimp is stir fried with garlic and is great. 

Great burritos but too pricey. I don't recommend the Triple Threat unless you're doing it for the sake of doing it. The normal burritos are sufficient.

excerpts: The menu is pretty plain, choice of meat and 99 cents extra for "super" which seems worth it.
plain.author: Julie N.
plain.review:
I was so excited for a burrito. Oh si, que rico me voy a tragar un burrito. The menu is pretty plain, choice of meat and 99 cents extra for "super" which seems worth it.  It adds cheese, sour cream and guac. I would get slapped if my mother heard me say "guac" she'd thing "guacala" and that don't sound too appetizing. I was eager and saw they bottled and sold their own tomato salse, hmmm must be guud. Chips and salsa was good, crunchy chips and mildly spiced sauce. Then the burrito came.. dun dun dun. 

Ay caramba, guacala!

The rice was dry as hell, ni de fiesta. "Arroz de fiesta" is spanish for party rice. Where people make big batches of tasteless, dry packed rice to serve at weddings and quincianeras. This wasn't even at their level. My carne asada was dry but my tortilla was hella on hit. I ran out of hot sauce, I requested more they charged me $1.10 for two small ass portions. WTF?! lol oh ya and the decor is awesome, the atmosphere feels mexican. There is mexican music blaring and dragon kites to match their red walls. I bet this place was one a chinese food take out and all they did was keep the loud red feng shui walls and flying dragon kites and call it tex mex. My horchata was ok a little sweet. They charged me for fucking salsa it's a spiced up taco bell trying to be a La Vics and a La Vics, it is not. Eh... In ADDITION the $22.50 was not worth the two burritos and one drink we purchased.

excerpts: Nonetheless, it's scrumptious, plain and simple.
Worth going, worth the price.
Word to the wise: from the look of the place, you'll have to wait for a while to find a table during peak times.
plain.author: Naveen A.
plain.review:
I went here after it was ranked the #2 burrito joint in SF by the 7x7 magazine.  (El Farolito was first.)  The burrito was gigantic, and tasty, and a good half of it is still around for dinner.

Overall, this isn't really a place you go to for ambience--even though it has it, and beer--but moreso for awesome food:
Food: 5
Service: 4
Price: 4

Clearly, food carries the day.  I ordered a chile verde (pork) burrito, with guacamole and sour cream, on a spinach tortilla.  It was delicious, with the ingredients well mixed in the burrito (a big selling point).  I added a little of the well-spiced salsa provided with my chips to the burrito and it really hit the spot.  The pork was cooked that day, and fairly tender.  The guacamole wasn't spectacular in its own right, but mixed well with the flavors of the burrito.  And there was some form of pickled vegetable in the burrito that was just the right touch.  The burrito was gargantuan, though, so I brought most of it home.

The only detractors are as follows.  There isn't enough salsa to go around, and according to another review, you have to pay for extra.  Also, it may be that I was unreasonably hungry, but I felt the 10+ minutes I waited for my burrito was a bit more than needed, even for fresh ingredients.  Lastly, at $9.30 for a super burrito, there are cheaper places with quality that's just as good.

Nonetheless, it's scrumptious, plain and simple.  Worth going, worth the price.  Word to the wise: from the look of the place, you'll have to wait for a while to find a table during peak times.

excerpts: It's spicy and is great on chips, the burrito, a plain flour tortilla....
plain.author: Desiree L.
plain.review:
I'm seriously pretty upset right now that I do not live in the city. I was hungover at my friends apartment and was way too lazy to even get up off the couch let alone leave the apartment to get food. 

We were watching Throwdown with Bobby Flay and this delicious looking burrito came up on the TV--The Triple Threat. I was hooked. I watched the entire show and was pumped when I found out these guys were based in San Francisco. 

I left the apartment immediately to find this place. The Triple Threat is HUGE (I think it should have been split among 3-4 people) and is $19.95. Sad. $20 burritos are always disappointing, but I couldn't not order it. It has prawns, chicken and beef in it. I was hesitant when I saw the chicken and I assumed it would be dry. It was not dry -- it was amazing instead.  

The salsa is amazing and I had to ask for my own because I didn't want to share anymore. It's spicy and is great on chips, the burrito, a plain flour tortilla....by the end I was just spooning it into my mouth. 

Their other burritos are very reasonably priced ($6-8) and the portions are also very large. And it's only 99 cents to add sour cream, guacamole, and cheese!  The staff is really friendly despite how busy they are and always wipe down the tables between guests. yay. 

Bobby Flay definitely has nothing on this place. I'm excited to go back.

excerpts: If you're looking for a tasty burrito that uses fresh ingredients and is just plain addicting - then Papalote all the way.
plain.author: Derek M.
plain.review:
My favorite burrito in the city.  Other burritos from taqueria's in the mission manage to all taste the same to me.  

If you're looking for a tasty burrito that uses fresh ingredients and is just plain addicting - then Papalote all the way.

excerpts: the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain.
plain.author: Amy H.
plain.review:
Chilaquiles!

After walking by a few months ago and seeing someone chow down on a huge plate of nachos through the window, I knew I had to come back and check this place out sometime. I actually had no idea it was featured on Throwdown until the day before we went.

We arrived at 11:45am and it was totally dead. But our friends weren't here yet so we walked around the corner for a cup of coffee. 20 minutes later we walked back and there was a huge line out the door. 

So it's definitely not worth all the hype but the food is still pretty decent, and it's not your typical greasy Mexican joint like one would expect.

- Chips and Salsa - I thought the chips were just average - I've had better. The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. A generous serving of chips topped w/ cheese, sauce, and egg and served w/ beans and rice on the side
- Chile Verde burrito - a fat burrito, enough for two people. Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over. I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
- Chicken tacos - the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain. Served on two flour tortillas w/ lettuce and tomatoes.

I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.

One last note - the service is great and the staff was so friendly. With crowded tables and a 20 minute line out the door they could have easily been stressed out. But they all had a great attitude, were attentive, and thanked us with smiles on our way out.

excerpts: it's plain disgusting.
But really, Papalote is plaing GO-OOO-OOD, mang.
plain.author: Kelly H.
plain.review:
Dolores Park is maddening on sunny weekends.  I feel that I would rather skin both knees than go to Dolores Park on a sunny Saturday with friends.  With that said, I have been known to give in to peer pressure when there is beer or hookers involved.  In this case, it involved beer and good friends with beards.  And if you know me, you know that I will do almost anything for a fine man with a beard and the chicken fajitas from Chili's. 

Dolores Park, Coors Lights, PBR, temperature drops 20 degrees, smoke something, and so begins my Saturday evening of mystery.  This included stopping in to Papalote - whose name just sincerely rrrrolls off the tongue - and ordering a Mole Chicken quesadilla.  I had heard of people liking this place immensely, saying GO, GO, GO!  But I was like "I've been to taquerias, ya'll.  Just chill."  But THIS taqueria IS different.  It gives you about 12 choices of meat and veggie combos and sorts them in a taco, quesadilla, and burrito menu, making it SUPER EASY to order if you're at all fucked up or stupid.  I cannot wait to go back - seriously the menu is so organized and beautiful it's plain disgusting.  But really, Papalote is plaing GO-OOO-OOD, mang.

excerpts: $9 plain burrito.
plain.author: Justin W.
plain.review:
Salsa is pureed and spicy - satisfying with lots of umami. Like a sauce at an Indian buffet. Not really Mexican, but fine. Not worth $7 per jar by any means.

Menu is absurdly, ridiculously, outlandishly overpriced. $9 plain burrito. Enough said.

Food itself never, ever rises above mediocre. Ever. Take the grilled chicken - tasteless and dry, except for the burnt bits. Really subpar. I've had better at airport Chilis.

For Marina tourists only.

excerpts: fish taco- plain, but the fish was marinated well.
chips and salsa- chips were the thick kind, and salsa was liquidy, quite tasty, but left me craving the usual fresh, chunky salsa
im used to.
price- higher than others.
plain.author: Lina C.
plain.review:
BIG price, SMALL burrito. not as good as expected, based on the 100s of reviews. we ordered: 

1. carne asada burrito 
2. fish taco. 

burrito- wrap to stuffing ratio was off- too much wrap. mid-sized burrito, not the juicy fat type with thin skin.
fish taco- plain, but the fish was marinated well.
chips and salsa- chips were the thick kind, and salsa was liquidy, quite tasty, but left me craving the usual fresh, chunky salsa im used to.
price- higher than others. ~7.15 burrito, $6.75 fish taco.

this place is above average, but i enjoy El Farolito much more, or El Gruyense in Redwood City

excerpts: On top of that, I ordered it super and they gave me plain.
plain.author: Emily L.
plain.review:
Salsa was gooood.  Served a little warm and has a different kick and tang to it like I've never tasted before.  But when I asked for more chips, they wanted to charge me an extra $1.  Maybe I'm spoiled but at most Mexican restaurants where the burritos cost as much as they do here, it's FREE.

Ordered the adobo chicken burrito, not cuz I'm Filipino, but cuz all of my people were ranting and raving about it.  Chicken was good and juicy and flavored "ok."  Maybe they all just got excited b/c they got their country's dish in a mexican wrap and they thought it was neat.  Who knows.  On top of that, I ordered it super and they gave me plain.  When I told one of the owners about it, he brought me sour cream, guac, and cheese on a plate on the side.  I didn't know this was build your own burrito.  Would definitely check it out again and if it beat Bobby Flay, there must be something right about this place...I just haven't discovered it yet.

excerpts: Tasteless tortilla, over salted, and frankly, just plain dull.
I mean the burrito.
I also waited 40mins for my take out burrito.
Does that happen anywhere?
plain.author: k m.
plain.review: Best burrito in SF? Like Obama winning the Nobel Peace Prize. Absurd. Tasteless tortilla, over salted, and frankly, just plain dull. I mean the burrito. I also waited 40mins for my take out burrito. Does that happen anywhere?

excerpts: You even have the option of plain, whole wheat or spinach tortillas.
plain.author: Danielle M.
plain.review: The chips and salsa are everything they are hyped to be! Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling. You even have the option of plain, whole wheat or spinach tortillas. Make sure to order extra salsa!

excerpts: It was just kind of dry and plain-ish.
It wasn't bad by any stretch of the imagination, but I expected spectacular from the birthplace of the mission-style burrito.
I think we do burritos better down here in LA.
If I ever go back maybe I'll try the carne asada- that would be harder to dry out.
All in all, I think if there wasn't hype
I wouldn't feel a kind of let-down from this burrito place.
plain.author: Amanda B.
plain.review: Maybe I just got the wrong thing here? I guess there was a lot of hype or something, because this was on the boyfriend's list of places to try during a recent bay trip. I got a chicken burrito, and all I can say is I've definitely had better. It was just kind of dry and plain-ish. It wasn't bad by any stretch of the imagination, but I expected spectacular from the birthplace of the mission-style burrito. I think we do burritos better down here in LA. If I ever go back maybe I'll try the carne asada- that would be harder to dry out. All in all, I think if there wasn't hype I wouldn't feel a kind of let-down from this burrito place.

excerpts: This place seems like more of a sit-down type place as opposed to the plain burrito joint of La Taqueria.
plain.author: Michael S.
plain.review:
I'm on the great burrito tour and stopped at Papalote for my second burrito (La Taqueria being the first).  Papalote is a little trendier place with a nice dining area and cool music in the background (which some old guy was actually dancing to whilst eating his burrito...free entertainment, I guess).  Service was friendly.  This place seems like more of a sit-down type place as opposed to the plain burrito joint of La Taqueria.

They bring you chips and salsa to start.  The salsa was amazing!  Somehow they mixed creamy into the salsa vernacular and it works!  The burrito came a little later (the wait was a little long, but it takes time for good food) looking delicious with a little side of fruit compote of some sort.

Comparing the actual burrito next to La Taqueria's is a little difficult....I would describe is as "nicer."  I'm not sure what that really means, but it is what it is.  I got the carne asada.  Overall, the burrito was delicious!  The carne asada was very flavorful and it was pretty "clean" to eat.  La Taqueria is  messier and felt a little more authentic and the flavors were just different.  I preferred La Taqueria's carnitas, but that's not to say Papalote isn't very good.

This is a great place to come with friends and enjoy a beer and burrito.  Or, as were 3 other customers, a great place to come and read a book and enjoy some tasty food.

I'll definitely be coming back!

excerpts: And where do they get off charging three dollars for a plain taco?
Maybe I'm being harsh because I think seafood tacos are a waste of time and stomach space, but white wine?
Oh, and they have tofu on the menu.
I like tofu as much as the next gal, but man...
And I've only seen the place packed with white people, the kind with dreads or people who look like they just got out of yoga class.
Ok, so here's where I give credit; the salsa was good.
It was nice and spicy.
plain.author: Daniella C.
plain.review:
There's something really off about this place for me. Maybe it's the soyrizo burrito on the menu, or maybe it's because the people who rave about it are usually vegetarians or hipsters. Those are two groups you generally can't trust in regards to good Mexican food. And yeah, I know, I know I'm not first generation, Lily, but I'm fairly certain that authentic Mexican food does not include shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter. And where do they get off charging three dollars for a plain taco? Maybe I'm being harsh because I think seafood tacos are a waste of time and stomach space, but white wine? Oh, and they have tofu on the menu. I like tofu as much as the next gal, but man... And I've only seen the place packed with white people, the kind with dreads or people who look like they just got out of yoga class.
Ok, so here's where I give credit; the salsa was good. It was nice and spicy. The chile verde pork was very tender. There was Yucatan hot sauce, which is always a plus. And there was spiced up jicama served as the side, which was deliciously refreshing.
Basically, overrated white washed Mexican food, which is fine as long as you know what you're in for.

excerpts: but we ordered right away (plain quesadilla, triple threat burrito, guacamole, & chicken tacos).
I know that's alot of food, but we're a family of three and we shared everything.
$50 for dinner...seems a little much, especially since the triple threat was $20.
got a table fairly quick
but we were then trapped there by all the people waiting for pickup.
Got our food after about 20 minutes.
It was good, but not great.
the triple threat burrito was again good, but not $20 good.
plain.author: Theresa S.
plain.review:
sorry to the papalote faithful out there, but i was pretty underwhelmed/disappointed.  we went to the fulton/masonic location.  super crowded but we ordered right away (plain quesadilla, triple threat burrito, guacamole, & chicken tacos).  I know that's alot of food, but we're a family of three and we shared everything.  $50 for dinner...seems a little much, especially since the triple threat was $20.  got a table fairly quick but we were then trapped there by all the people waiting for pickup.  Got our food after about 20 minutes.  It was good, but not great.  the triple threat burrito was again good, but not $20 good.  Plus it was missing the prawns/shrimp.  would have gotten up to complain but one i couldn't get up (again was trapped by everyone waiting) and two i didn't really want to wait another 20 minutes for a new burrito.

if we were in the area, might stop in and try the nachos...they did look good!  but all in all won't go out of my way for this one.  I'll stick with our close to home favorites:)

excerpts: not that it is inedible, but it is so fucking plain.
the tofu seems like cubed tofu straight outta the box dumped into a vat of the sauce.
and they give you way too much of this stuff.
plain.author: Clarence B.
plain.review:
welllll.... Papalote had come so highly recommended and so pumped up by Yelpers that me and my girl were fucking dying to eat it... and this shit is not all it's cracked up to be.

(-) No salsa bar. this is a crime in the Mission. and then they have the balls to charge you for another little tiny shot glass if you need more (they give you ONE tiny serving for two people with two meals and your chips). it's fucking good salsa, but being cheap with it is wack as hell.

(-) fuck up your order. make SURE you specify that you don't want the fucking "super" burrito when you only want the "regular". and i don't really know how to do this cuz when you specifically say "i would like the REGULAR" and they say "okay" and then still give you the super, you may have to make it yourself to get the regular.

(-) refried beans are black beans. look, i'm from the southwest. we rock PINTO beans. pinto beans taste better to us. if you are from southern mexico or central america, you go black. two different worlds. i don't want refried black beans dude.

(-) tofu mole is crap. not that it is inedible, but it is so fucking plain. the tofu seems like cubed tofu straight outta the box dumped into a vat of the sauce. and they give you way too much of this stuff. mole is too rich to eat a serving this big.. it makes you sick afterwards. this dish (which costs $10 by the way) needs a better combination of sides. perhaps some calabacitas, more jicama salad, some greens and maybe some fruit. 

(-) limited agua frescas. straight up: i need limonada available every fucking day.

(-) "please wait to be seated" in a burrito shop? puh-lease.

there are some good things too:
(+) vegan friendly.
(+) chips are top notch.

overall, i wouldn't complain if friends wanted to eat here and i was out-voted (i'd just stick to nachos or tacos), but otherwise i think i'm avoiding this modern bogosity.

excerpts: The food is pretty plain.
I wasn't impressed with what I got
and I thought the price was a bit high.
plain.author: Meghan B.
plain.review: Nothing special here.  Wait, that's not true...the red wall and the logo are pretty special.  The food is pretty plain.  I wasn't impressed with what I got and I thought the price was a bit high.

excerpts: You cannot go wrong with the plain old rice and bean burrito, but if you can have meat the chicken and carne asada burritos
should be your choice.
plain.author: Aamir V.
plain.review:
Papalote is the be-all, end-all of burritos in the Mission.  Fresh?  You bet.  Tasty?  Of course.  Salsa worthy of a pligrimage?  Absolutely.

You cannot go wrong with the plain old rice and bean burrito, but if you can have meat the chicken and carne asada burritos should be your choice.  They also have some other intriguing options like soyrizo, so make sure you schedule multiple visits.

The nachos are mediocre - pass on those.

I hate that they ration the salsa, but it's understandable.  That stuff is truly amazing.

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
plain.author: Cindy L.
plain.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: and I still have a good amount of rice and beans
rice and beans.author: Janet H.
rice and beans.review:
Not quite sure why this place only has 3.5 stars, but I've learned to overlook Yelp ratings once in awhile. There are many Mexican restaurants in the area, so reviewers are probably just comparing to the classics like El Farolito and La Taqueria... but I personally loved Papalote because of its naked burrito with adobo chicken. 

I seriously would've never known of this place until a yoga friend of mine was eating it before class. It looked so tasty that I got it the next day before yoga class (slightly bad idea)... yes, it is on the pricier side and added up to $13 but it is a meal for 3 days. I had it for lunch yesterday, and then lunch today... and I still have a good amount of rice and beans left that I can pair with other protein for dinner tonight. 

Papalote was also featured on Bobby Flay's show, which is pretty cool. The food is flavorful and I enjoyed every bite. It even comes with a generous serving of guacamole! Bonus points for their amazing complimentary salsa for their chips!

When you get the chicken burrito or deconstructed bowl, be sure to ask for the adobo chicken, not the pollo asado... the adobo is shredded and so tender, while the pollo asado I believe is just diced roasted chicken. Luckily they were able to change my order last minute when I realized there was a difference. 

I'm going to yoga again on Tuesday and I'm planning on getting another naked burrito. It's that good!

excerpts: At best maybe they ran out of beef and thought they could make it up with extra rice and beans.
The place is way overrated.
I feel ripped off.
I took the food to go, and only realized it was all rice and beans after I arrived home, and did not feel like driving back to return it.
Maybe they would have put some meat in the burrito if they knew I was eating there in the restaurant.
Either way, El Papelote is obviously just looking to charge as much as they can for the lowest cost possible.
I live in the neighborhood and will not be back.
rice and beans.author: Bob J.
rice and beans.review: $14 for a large heavy carne asada burrito with lots of rice, beans, guacamole but had to hunt for the meat. In fact, I had to unwrap the burrito to be sure there was even any meat in it. What I found were a few tiny diced squares of beef that looked like someone's skimpy night-before leftovers. At best maybe they ran out of beef and thought they could make it up with extra rice and beans. The place is way overrated. I feel ripped off. I took the food to go, and only realized it was all rice and beans after I arrived home, and did not feel like driving back to return it. Maybe they would have put some meat in the burrito if they knew I was eating there in the restaurant. Either way, El Papelote is obviously just looking to charge as much as they can for the lowest cost possible. I live in the neighborhood and will not be back.

excerpts: It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ...
this was the opposite, which I like).
I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa.
It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious.
The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride.
Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.
rice and beans.author: Linda S.
rice and beans.review: Best burrito I've had, ever. Had the grilled veggie burrito with guacamole. It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ... this was the opposite, which I like). I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa. It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious. The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride. Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.

excerpts: I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!)
with a spinach tortilla.
I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!!
Would get it again for sure.
It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick.
I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good
but I like the soyrizo add-on more!
The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us.
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!
rice and beans.author: Pooja S.
rice and beans.review:
Went here for dinner and really loved it! I think it's hard to be creative / differentiated with Mexican food, and Papalote managed to be. It's a small place and I would not pick coming here for the ambiance / if you want an intimate setting. Also really difficult if you have a large group because it's so small, and usually pretty crowded. I got pretty lucky and got a table in under 10 minutes. 

Sat down after ordering food, and the waiter immediately came with chips and salsa. Chips were a bit stale, and while their salsa was good, I don't think it was as amazing as it's hyped up to be. Don't get me wrong - I did still really like it, just think it is as good as other salsas I've tried. 

The burritos are HUGE and super filling!! Portion size is great, and I thought the price was pretty good! I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!) with a spinach tortilla. I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!! Would get it again for sure. It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick. I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good but I like the soyrizo add-on more! The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us. 
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!

excerpts: It was a lot of rice and beans for $13.
rice and beans.author: Pizzle D.
rice and beans.review:
Well I felt a little duped after eating here. 

I had located this little hole in the wall using yelps reviews and photos of the food. I ran across Dungeness crab enchiladas and was sold. Upon looking over the menu board there was no crab or enchiladas any where in sight. Oh well, must have been a special, no big deal. I had a carne asada super burrito which I thought was quite tasty. My girl on the other hand who ended up getting the prawn super burrito ($12.95), received only 4 small very over cooked prawns in her burrito, she was pissed. It was a lot of rice and beans for $13.
On the other hand I felt as though I received a healthy amount of carne asada and enjoyed my burrito well enough.

excerpts: Despite great flavor, there was very little meat in it mostly rice and beans.
$11 for a burrito and can of coke come on now.
Get over being on tv.
Shave $3 off that price and you are 5 star material.
Crossed off my bucket list.
rice and beans.author: Jim G.
rice and beans.review:
Would rate as 3.5 stars if yelp let me
now  why low rating, well burrito was delish.  Great taste.   Had the chile verde burrito. That salsa they give you on table more like a sauce is awesome.  Would hav bought a bottle if i wasnt flying home and knew damn tsa people would keep it.  But lets get real.  Despite great flavor, there was very little meat in it mostly rice and beans.  $11 for a burrito and can of coke come on now.  Get over being on tv.  Shave $3 off that price and you are 5 star material.  Crossed off my bucket list.

excerpts: Amidst my mountains of rice and beans, though, I found maybe only a couple pieces of steak.
It was kinda small and, while tasty, was not exactly memorable.
A good burrito, and I wouldn't mind going to this place again.
I definitely won't be seeking it out, though...
especially given how bad the parking situation is around it, even on Sunday...
rice and beans.author: Brian B.
rice and beans.review: Far too Chipotle-esaue for my liking.  It's fresh, pretty tasty, and has some good salsa to put on top.  Amidst my mountains of rice and beans, though, I found maybe only a couple pieces of steak.  It was kinda small and, while tasty, was not exactly memorable.  A good burrito, and I wouldn't mind going to this place again.  I definitely won't be seeking it out, though...especially given how bad the parking situation is around it, even on Sunday...

excerpts: The contents were very tasty with plenty of grilled beef and flavorful rice and beans.
I only had one funny bit of gristle in the burrito, so I would call that a rousing success for the Bay Area.
They also give you tasty chips and a cup of their salsa before the meal.
HOWEVER, if you want more salsa to go with your meal, it costs an additional fifty cents for each refill.
WTF?!
Most places load you up on salsa without an additional charge.
rice and beans.author: Jason W.
rice and beans.review:
Oh man, that orange salsa.... SO GOOD! I buy it by the jarful at Whole Foods and dump it on everything at home. Sure it's expensive, but it's way better than Frontera or any of that other hoity-toity stuff that tries to pass for gourmet salsa. Based on the quality of their salsa, I was very excited to try the Papalote restaurant in the Mission today!

Papalote is a small restaurant on a largely residential block of 24th street. It's conveniently located a couple of blocks from the 24th & Mission BART stop and also a block away from a good friend's house. If I'd known it was this close, I would have gone numerous times already! Inside the restaurant are a handful of tables next to a large window which offers a good people watching view of the street outside. You order at the counter up front and then take a number and sit down.

I ordered a carne asada burrito with beans and rice. The burrito was about average in size, but that's ok because I don't like overeating these days. The contents were very tasty with plenty of grilled beef and flavorful rice and beans. I only had one funny bit of gristle in the burrito, so I would call that a rousing success for the Bay Area. They also give you tasty chips and a cup of their salsa before the meal. HOWEVER, if you want more salsa to go with your meal, it costs an additional fifty cents for each refill. WTF?! Most places load you up on salsa without an additional charge. This is something they really should consider since it seems a little chintzy of them.

My two lunch friends had the pork chile verde tacos and the fish burrito. The tacos looked good, but seemed to be piled high with garnish which seemed a little weird. If I order the tacos in future, I'll get them with just meat and tortilla. The fish burrito looked like a winner and my friend swears by it, so I'm either getting that next time or trying the machaca which is hard to find in the Bay Area!

Papalote is a very clean, stylish restaurant. Food gets delivered quickly and the staff are all super nice. I'll definitely come back again, but maybe I'll bring my own Papalote salsa from home if they're going to charge me for salsa!

excerpts: Lots of rice and beans but not a fair amount of meat, which was also prepared in a way that it dry out, taking away flavor and texture.
rice and beans.author: Sabrina B.
rice and beans.review: Average and expensive burrito, no flavorful nor traditional like La Taqueria on mission st. Found a whole side of avocado inside steak burrito, oddly enough it was not ripe and impossible to bite or cut with knife as it was very hard. Lots of rice and beans but not a fair amount of meat, which was also prepared in a way that it dry out, taking away flavor and texture. White fish tacos...will simply put; blend, no seasoned and not worthy the high pricey tag!  The only bright side is; they have great friendly customer service. Anyhow! I'm Walking to La Taqueria now to get the real deal! Yay

excerpts: 13 bucks for rice and beans?!
rice and beans.author: Ali G.
rice and beans.review:
Been here a couple of times and
Problems:
1. First visit screwed up my order
2. Next visit screwed up my order
3. Tonight I had to get takeout bc my bf wanted to eat there, got home (dumb me) and for my shrimp super burrito there was no shrimp, no cheese, no guacamole, and no sour cream. 13 bucks for rice and beans?! FAIL

Done

excerpts: The rice and beans were mediocre.
rice and beans.author: Augusto L.
rice and beans.review:
Seriously, people that don't know Mexican food rate this place as 4 stars and above but coming from the Central Valley and being raised in a Mexican household, I will tell you that this place is EXTREMELY overrated. 

I rejected the 20 something dollar burrito because I don't care what you put in a burrito, a 20 dollar price tag is insane and a no go for me! 

I went with the super Carne Asada burrito and it was NO BUENO. I actually put tasty under my 'quick tip' while checking in but that was only after the first bite. Their salsa is actually pretty good. When I got to the meat, OMG - no flavor! This thing needed to be knocked upside the head or tortilla with a pound of salt because it was so flavorless! 

The rice and beans were mediocre. 

After more than 4 years of living in the Bay Area, I am still not satisfied with the Mexican food joints in the area. This is just another Mexican food joint that is seriously over-hyped by people.

If your taste buds are satisfied because you're paying a fortune for your food, then kudos to you but some of the best burrito's I have had costed me no more than 6 dollars. 

1 star for the service and the decor but that's all this place will get from me (actually Yelp does not allow me to assign 0 stars). 

If you want great Mexican food, hit the Central Valley for it. Hell, I will make you something if you wish! Haha.

excerpts: Amazing rice and beans burrito.
We are visiting SF from Vancouver, where Mexican food is really hard to find, and this place totally hit the spot.
The salsa was also fantastic!
FYI that the bathroom is kind of dark/gross,
but hey, at least they have one!
rice and beans.author: Sarah V.
rice and beans.review: Amazing rice and beans burrito. We are visiting SF from Vancouver, where Mexican food is really hard to find, and this place totally hit the spot. The salsa was also fantastic! FYI that the bathroom is kind of dark/gross, but hey, at least they have one!

excerpts: I didn't realize how big the portions were until they gave us the plates, but it was huge and it came with rice and beans, mmmmm.
They also gave us generous portions of warm tortillas.
My cousin and I immediately dug in, things were bursting out of our tacos and the couple who just sat down next to us, waiting for their food were staring at us.
rice and beans.author: Helen P.
rice and beans.review:
Look. I love Mexican food. I'm from Southern California, it's part of the culture here. So my cousin and I couldn't help but eat some more mexican food while we were up in SF, especially as our last meal.  We were dragging our luggage all over the streets of Mission looking for this restaurant, which is some what difficult to find when you are obviously not familiar with the area and when its kind off the street without a large sign. But we found it finally and when I walked in I knew we were in a good place. 

Lots of sizzling and delicious smells and lots of people grubbing, those are always good signs. I didn't feel like eating tacos (I always eat them in LA so I wanted something a little different) and I saw the mole and I knew I wanted it immediately. I love mole, I love the sauce, sweet, salty and delicious. And I got a nice hochata, I love horchata (although I wish they gave me a little more ice since it was pretty hot in the restaurant!). My cousin got the carnitas verde (I think- well it certainly had the verde sauce). 

I didn't realize how big the portions were until they gave us the plates, but it was huge and it came with rice and beans, mmmmm. They also gave us generous portions of warm tortillas. My cousin and I immediately dug in, things were bursting out of our tacos and the couple who just sat down next to us, waiting for their food were staring at us. I have to say I liked my cousin dish because it had a little heat to it, some spice, but the chicken mole was pretty good too. I wish I had more room in my stomach to finish it all or could take it to go if I was staying longer, but unfortunately I couldn't finish it all (yes I was disappointed in myself).

I highly recommend people to grub here if they get a chance. I do have a warning about the bathroom, it was a little frightening in there (and quite nesty) so I would use it for washing up. But nonetheless I loved the food and that was the most important part of the experience!

excerpts: The burrito was nothing special (again, the meat was overcooked and very dry), and neither were the rice and beans.
rice and beans.author: Elben S.
rice and beans.review:
Overrated, much? Their famous salsa was a good surprise, but it was nothing extraordinary. The chicken in the chicken mole was overcooked and dry; a waste of good mole sauce. The burrito was nothing special (again, the meat was overcooked and very dry), and neither were the rice and beans.

Oh well.

excerpts: I would probably subsist on them if I could; the rice and beans are always fresh and the meat is perfectly cooked.
The dining space is cramped and gets crowded, so I prefer doing takeout.
The line can be crazy and the waiting area is small, but I don't think I've ever waited more than 10 minutes or so.
rice and beans.author: Katie M.
rice and beans.review: The salsa alone is worth a trip (I'm wary of superlatives, but I will tentatively state that it is the best salsa I have ever had). I don't know what it is about it that makes it so unique, but it is, and it's delicious. The burritos are perfect; yes, they are more expensive than other options around the Mission, but I think they are worth it. I would probably subsist on them if I could; the rice and beans are always fresh and the meat is perfectly cooked. The dining space is cramped and gets crowded, so I prefer doing takeout. The line can be crazy and the waiting area is small, but I don't think I've ever waited more than 10 minutes or so.

excerpts: First, we ordered taquitos and a side of rice and beans.
rice and beans.author: Deb J.
rice and beans.review:
I went to Papalote in the Mission District on a recent weekend visit.  It was recommended by the owner of the B&B where I was staying.  As this is San Francisco, I expected the food to be a bit more authentic and I was sorely disappointed.

The staff was friendly enough and the menu was readable.  My complaint?  First, we ordered taquitos and a side of rice and beans.  My partner ordered the carne asada (beef) taquitos and I ordered the chicken.  What we received were huge chunks of meat (we are used to shredded meat) and long strands of lettuce and huge chunks of tomato.  There was no flavor at all in the meat or chicken and the abundance of watery tomato and lettuce made the taquitos so watery that they dissolved the tortilla.

The horchata and strawberry drinks were watery and not at all flavorful.  I am used to taquitos that have double tortillas with shredded chicken or beef and topped with salsa and chopped cilantro and onion.  Not here.

I would not recommend this place, and when I told my friend who we were visiting, she said that the place was always full and that there were way better taquerias to be had along Mission Street.

So, to not be too mean, I gave this place two stars, but really would have given it one.  Oh, and the huge burrito (which by the way, is an American invention) at the table next to me was burried under a mountain of mozzarella cheese.  Yech.

excerpts: Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican.
Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste!
worth the visit!
rice and beans.author: Danny S.
rice and beans.review:
Ever since i became a vegetarian it has been difficult to find a good legitimate burrito place, that is until i found this place! 
It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo). Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican. Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste! worth the visit!

excerpts: Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over.
I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
rice and beans.author: Amy H.
rice and beans.review:
Chilaquiles!

After walking by a few months ago and seeing someone chow down on a huge plate of nachos through the window, I knew I had to come back and check this place out sometime. I actually had no idea it was featured on Throwdown until the day before we went.

We arrived at 11:45am and it was totally dead. But our friends weren't here yet so we walked around the corner for a cup of coffee. 20 minutes later we walked back and there was a huge line out the door. 

So it's definitely not worth all the hype but the food is still pretty decent, and it's not your typical greasy Mexican joint like one would expect.

- Chips and Salsa - I thought the chips were just average - I've had better. The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. A generous serving of chips topped w/ cheese, sauce, and egg and served w/ beans and rice on the side
- Chile Verde burrito - a fat burrito, enough for two people. Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over. I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
- Chicken tacos - the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain. Served on two flour tortillas w/ lettuce and tomatoes.

I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.

One last note - the service is great and the staff was so friendly. With crowded tables and a 20 minute line out the door they could have easily been stressed out. But they all had a great attitude, were attentive, and thanked us with smiles on our way out.

excerpts: the rice and beans were a bit crunchy.
i mean c'mon
....crunchy?
dry?
rice and beans.author: Sharon T.
rice and beans.review:
ummm, i'm gonna throw it out there. the burrito was seriously one of the worst burritos i've ever had. and i've eaten a lot of them!  i had the veggie burrito and the hubby had the shrimp burrito.  it lacked flavor and it was dry! the rice and beans were a bit crunchy. i mean c'mon....crunchy? dry? that's definitely how you f-up a burrito.

the only thing they have going for them is their sauces.  the salsa is super yummy and i can drink that stuff.  2 stars for the sauce....

i will say, 7x7 never lets me down, and they claim that the carne asada burrito here is one of the best. maybe i'll come back for the salsa and give papalote's another chance and try the carne asada burrito.

maybe it was an off day? either way, for now... thumbs down.

excerpts: I get the rice and beans super burrito with pinto beans
and it's never steered me wrong.
Except for last night when I ate an entire burrito in about 5 minutes.
Note to self: never do that again.
I could feel the little burrito climbing around in my belly for a good hour afterwards.
Don't get me wrong, the burrito was happy in there, but making itself known just the same.
All I can say is, "It hurt so good.
rice and beans.author: Jen G.
rice and beans.review:
I love Papalote! It's right on my way home and it's pretty affordable to boot. I get the rice and beans super burrito with pinto beans and it's never steered me wrong. Except for last night when I ate an entire burrito in about 5 minutes. Note to self: never do that again. I could feel the little burrito climbing around in my belly for a good hour afterwards. Don't get me wrong, the burrito was happy in there, but making itself known just the same. All I can say is, "It hurt so good."

Did I mention that I had to unbutton my top button of the pants at the bar later that night? I had to give my burrito some more room to breathe!

excerpts: because i wish they had organic options, TWICE now they've messed up my husband's burrito (rice and beans for the vegetarian) and pollo (for me, the carnivorous one), AND they are on the pricier side.
but despite all of that? they still get 4.. maybe even 4.5 stars..
rice and beans.author: Bella S.
rice and beans.review:
man, i go here WAY too much. there are so many things i love about this place. their ingredients always seem fresh and delicious, and they'll put your burrito on a whole-wheat tortilla. i go here about once a week. that's how much i love it.

so why only 4 stars, you ask? because i wish they had organic options, TWICE now they've messed up my husband's burrito (rice and beans for the vegetarian) and pollo (for me, the carnivorous one), AND they are on the pricier side. but despite all of that? they still get 4.. maybe even 4.5 stars..

excerpts: The size was perfect, not Godzilla sized  and overflowing with rice and beans, and not too tiny to leave me wanting more.
rice and beans.author: Christy L.
rice and beans.review:
The first time I went to Papalote's, I tried the Super Pollo burrito, and it was so good it made my toes curl.  

Okay, toe curling aside...this burrito was, by far, one of the best burritos here in the city that I had tasted.  The size was perfect, not Godzilla sized  and overflowing with rice and beans, and not too tiny to leave me wanting more.  It was like a perfect little package of burrito love that I could hold in my hands!

When I took my first bite, I was in heaven.  The flavors were savory and every bite contained an equal part of all the yummy ingredients.  Nothing is more annoying than biting into a burrito and eating all rice, then all beans then your meat and...oh, there's the cheese (you get the idea).  The tortilla was nicely grilled prior to being assembled, giving it a nice crispy texture.

The salsa is so friggin good you'll want more (and they take this into consideration because they charge you extra if you go back for more).  For those who just can't get enough, I believe you can purchase their salsa to take home.

The only reason I didn't give Papalote's 5 stars was because on a few recent occasions that I went in, the burrito just wasn't up to par.  I'm not sure if the burrito assembly line in the back was having an off day, but the taste and quality just wasn't there.  

All in all, a great burrito for a good price with salsa that'll knock your shoes off and curl your toes.

excerpts: Good cuts of meat, tasty rice and beans, solid coma inducing size, and great hot sauce!
Just be sure to call in your order or prepare to eat at senior citizen friendly hours.
rice and beans.author: Erick K.
rice and beans.review:
Normally, I would be skeptical about a local burrito joint if 1) it's overrun by hipsters 2) it has a tofu burrito on the menu 3) It was featured in a Food Network show (Bobby Flay's Throwdown show) - not that I'm anti-Food Network, it's just that they don't always seem to choose the "best" places, just the ones that will accommodate for the tv cameras and crowd. 

Despite making the foolish attempt to order the burrito on site... what's up with all the places around here? It's like anyplace with some kind of buzz requires a 20 minute wait!  Ah yeah, anyhow, I ordered my standard test: the carne asada! Master that, and I'll come back and try more. Good cuts of meat, tasty rice and beans, solid coma inducing size, and great hot sauce! Just be sure to call in your order or prepare to eat at senior citizen friendly hours.

excerpts: It had way too many rice and beans, not enough salsa, and was really dry.
rice and beans.author: Heather P.
rice and beans.review:
I came here in 2006 on a burrito crawl through the Mission (I know...it seemed like a good idea?!) and after stalking this place via Burritoeater.com and Burritophile.com for two years I was ready to try it again. Granted I had the regular chicken burrito -not the super- but the basic burrito should be able to stand on its own, right?  It had way too many rice and beans, not enough salsa, and was really dry. I would recommend adding the extras in to make it a little tastier.

I might be back to try something a little more adventurous but will have to concur with my burrito blogs for menu options :) Asfor the basic burrito...i've had better!

excerpts: I discovered today if you ask for a veggie burrito it comes with potatoes and carrots as well as rice and beans.
It was just too much and I won't order it again.
But for the most part I've had excellent luck here.
rice and beans.author: anne m.
rice and beans.review: This place is good because it's healthy mexican, not too greasy and not overly salty. Overseasoned Mexican is NOT good!  I really like their salsa but to me it's more like a sauce or sofrito.  Good and spicey.  I discovered today if you ask for a veggie burrito it comes with potatoes and carrots as well as rice and beans.  It was just too much and I won't order it again.  But for the most part I've had excellent luck here.  Their grilled chicken burrito is fantastic.  They are a couple of bucks more than your average taqueria but it's worth it.

excerpts: Usually you might get a rice and beans, but at papalote you can get two kinds of grilled veges, soyrizo, tofu con achiote and tofu mole.
Amazing.
Everything is incredibly fresh and grilled to order - no vats of food cooked hours ago here.
Salsa is amazing, i could drink it i think.
you just can't go wrong - not a typical burrito, go to another one of the millions of burrito joints in the mission for that - but a damn good burrito...
rice and beans.author: amy b.
rice and beans.review: This is the best burrito, especially for thoseof us that don't eat meat.  Usually you might get a rice and beans, but at papalote you can get two kinds of grilled veges, soyrizo, tofu con achiote and tofu mole.  Amazing.  Everything is incredibly fresh and grilled to order - no vats of food cooked hours ago here.  Salsa is amazing, i could drink it i think.  you just can't go wrong - not a typical burrito, go to another one of the millions of burrito joints in the mission for that - but a damn good burrito...

excerpts: As a vegetarian I love all of the options, but I often end up going with a super rice and beans burrito simply because the flavors are so delicious on their own.
The salsa is to die for and like nothing else I've tasted.
Added bonus-
the owner throws some of the best parties in the city (check out his monthly Da Joint) and spins great hip-hop.
Pick up one of the several flyers on the counter as you head out the door.
rice and beans.author: Michie L.
rice and beans.review: Papalote is one of the reasons I miss living and working in the Mission. As a vegetarian I love all of the options, but I often end up going with a super rice and beans burrito simply because the flavors are so delicious on their own. The salsa is to die for and like nothing else I've tasted. Added bonus- the owner throws some of the best parties in the city (check out his monthly Da Joint) and spins great hip-hop. Pick up one of the several flyers on the counter as you head out the door.

excerpts: Wonderfully grilled tortilla... tasty rice and beans.
rice and beans.author: Jeff S.
rice and beans.review:
I wanted to not like it, I really did. I heard about the elitist attitude the people who work here have. I walk by every day and see the ridiculously long lines and tons of people ALWAYS waiting, but in my quest to find the best burrito spot in the mission I had to try it. When I walked by and the front door wasn't overflowing with hungry San Franciscans I knew it was now or never. I ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito. "Do you mind waiting 20 minutes?" she asks. What? For a burrito?! But they are supposed to be good... "Uhm, OK..." So I walked around the corner to my house and waited patiently for the 20 minutes to pass then went back, waited five minutes more, and headed home. I tried a chip on the way (the best tell tale sign of a good burrito spot!) and... god damn it. Fresh, crunchy, delicious. I get home and open up the fancy little salsa tub... oh no! It's delicious too. I intrepidly peel back the foil and take a bite of the burrito, and my worst fears are realized: hot, flavorful, juicy steak. Wonderfully grilled tortilla... tasty rice and beans. Its good... its really good. 

I don't think the attitude or ridiculously long wait time was excusable, but these people have a hot commodity on their hands and everybody wants some. I noticed a lot of people had called in their orders and didn't have to wait at all, which would be perfect for, oh I dunno, someone whos back door is about 40 yards away from Papalote? I'll be back. God damn it... I'll be back...

excerpts: I'd never had one till today, always opting for the basic rice and beans, instead.
I was feeling celebratory since it's Chinese New Year, so I splurged and topped it all off with some guava soda.
The salsa was tasty as ever, the burrito piping hot and so delectable.
A bit salty however, but that's what the soda is for.
The ingredients tasted very fresh, and the burrito was huge.
I left very full.
I deduct a star because the music in the dining area was just a bit too loud.
rice and beans.author: Milk and Cheese ..
rice and beans.review: Excellent soyrizo burrito. I'd never had one till today, always opting for the basic rice and beans, instead. I was feeling celebratory since it's Chinese New Year, so I splurged and topped it all off with some guava soda. The salsa was tasty as ever, the burrito piping hot and so delectable. A bit salty however, but that's what the soda is for. The ingredients tasted very fresh, and the burrito was huge. I left very full. I deduct a star because the music in the dining area was just a bit too loud.

excerpts: After  shelling out a hefty $14.50 for a shrimp quesadilla with rice and beans on the side, I was expecting a solid meal.
I got the opposite, the quesadilla looked like an apple turnover, upon further inspection contained 4 shrimp?
the rice and beans were portioned for an infant, and the "platter" itself represented nothing of a platter.

the side of jicama and tomato salad I had mistaken as a garnish and the teaspoon of sour cream was only useful for adding some flavor to the beans.. which by the way cost $1.75 EACH rice AND beans totaling $ 3.50!
oh and the waiter there wouldn't let us get another round of salsa..
1.00 extra!

I'm not sure how this place gets away charging airport prices and serving Uno Mas quality Mexican food only 2 blocks away from Mission st, but next time I will stick to a place like Taqueria Cancun, get fresh authentic Mexican fare for half the price..
this place should check it out and take some notes....
rice and beans.author: Derek S.
rice and beans.review: this is worse Mexican food then I got at the Houston airport on my layover to Miami,. Not only is the food way overpriced and sub par at best, but you have to deal with a cluster fuck of scrambling yuppies attempting to scrap up a table, not to mention the sweaty line you have to wait in to order. After  shelling out a hefty $14.50 for a shrimp quesadilla with rice and beans on the side, I was expecting a solid meal. I got the opposite, the quesadilla looked like an apple turnover, upon further inspection contained 4 shrimp? the rice and beans were portioned for an infant, and the "platter" itself represented nothing of a platter. the side of jicama and tomato salad I had mistaken as a garnish and the teaspoon of sour cream was only useful for adding some flavor to the beans.. which by the way cost $1.75 EACH rice AND beans totaling $ 3.50!.. oh and the waiter there wouldn't let us get another round of salsa.. 1.00 extra!  I'm not sure how this place gets away charging airport prices and serving Uno Mas quality Mexican food only 2 blocks away from Mission st, but next time I will stick to a place like Taqueria Cancun, get fresh authentic Mexican fare for half the price.. this place should check it out and take some notes....

excerpts: The wonderful thing is that puppies aren't 80% rice and beans, so it's taste heaven.
We live on the other side of the Mission, while there are many places closer than Papalote's, in 4 years we haven't yet found a replacement...
rice and beans.author: B V.
rice and beans.review: My wife and I LOVE this place. We won't eat burritos anywhere else. 'Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for. The wonderful thing is that puppies aren't 80% rice and beans, so it's taste heaven. We live on the other side of the Mission, while there are many places closer than Papalote's, in 4 years we haven't yet found a replacement...

excerpts: I had eaten a most gigantic rice and beans burrito (super-style) before I even knew what was happening...
it was that delicioso.
rice and beans.author: Elizabeth J.
rice and beans.review:
I had eaten a most gigantic rice and beans burrito (super-style) before I even knew what was happening... it was that delicioso.  AND they serve you chips and salsa, which is right on in my broke book.

Definitely a great place for veggies and vegans.  Didn't try the vegan delights, but I sure will next time!  

Oh yes, there will be a next time.

excerpts: My friend ordered their veggie burrito, I ordered a chicken burrito.
Barely any chicken inside and the amount of guacamole and sour cream
veggie.author: Don K.
veggie.review:
Was driving around the mission last night trying to find a place to park, intending on going somewhere completely different. Rounded the corner on 24th and Papalote caught my eye. Parked a few blocks away (lucky at that!) and walked back down to restaurant. Had a vegan friend with me who was aware of their vegan mole, which he had read on line. 

Walked inside, smaller place with some family style seating on one side and a few single tables along walls. Very colorful and fun vibe, loved the large dragonflies suspended from ceiling. Waited in line for a bit and ordered at the counter. My friend ordered their veggie burrito, I ordered a chicken burrito. Was asked if I wanted guacamole and sour cream and I said sure, thinking I'd have a t least a scoop of each. 

Free chips and mole arrived at table, the mole was the best part of the dinner! If I were just there for the mole, then 4 stars. Burritos arrived, nothing on the side, everything wrapped up. The flavor was decent, ingredients fresh....but the price $14+ did not seem justified for what I got. Barely any chicken inside and the amount of guacamole and sour cream I paid the extra $1.99 for seemed like a rip off. 

In short, I feel good food but way overpriced. Would I go back again? No, sadly not.

excerpts: Veggie options.
Friendly staff.
Noise level is high -- all hard surfaces.
Small, often crowded, dining area.
Better to take out or delivery.
veggie.author: Kenneth O.
veggie.review: Decent taqueria fare, better than many. Range of offerings and options (spinach tortillas) and tasty housemade salsa you can buy. Veggie options. Friendly staff. Noise level is high -- all hard surfaces. Small, often crowded, dining area. Better to take out or delivery.

excerpts: I got a veggie burrito and it was fantastic!
The retired black beans, which are vegan, are some of the best I have ever tasted.
The pico was slamming!
The tomatoes in it tasted so fresh and juicy.
Husband got nachos and he says they were great.
This place has lots of vegetarian and vegan options and my meat eating husband was happy with his meal too.
So glad we came here!
Plus the place is easy to find street parking and it's in nice little spot.
Only thing I hate is the bathroom as it gives me the creeps.
But the seating area is great and they have these cool art pieces on the wall that change colors when you use flash photography on them.
Plus free chips and their signature salsa when you dine in.
What more can you ask?
veggie.author: Marley M.
veggie.review: Delicious!! I got a veggie burrito and it was fantastic! The retired black beans, which are vegan, are some of the best I have ever tasted. The pico was slamming! The tomatoes in it tasted so fresh and juicy. Husband got nachos and he says they were great. This place has lots of vegetarian and vegan options and my meat eating husband was happy with his meal too. So glad we came here! Plus the place is easy to find street parking and it's in nice little spot. Only thing I hate is the bathroom as it gives me the creeps. But the seating area is great and they have these cool art pieces on the wall that change colors when you use flash photography on them. Plus free chips and their signature salsa when you dine in. What more can you ask?

excerpts: So far, I've gotten the veggie burrito and the quesadilla and have no complaints about either.
veggie.author: Kavita P.
veggie.review:
I've come here a few times after my friend insisted we go here over La Taqueria. Typically recommending anything over La Taquiera is blasphemy in my eyes, but I trusted her, and I'm so glad I did. 

The mole and salsa here are sooooo good! She told me they're like crack (aka super addictive), and she was right. I now always get a little extra to take home with me. (FYI, if you sit there and get food they have take away containers and they have the little containers for sauce.) 

The people working there are super friendly and patient when you're not sure what to do with their menu (which I appreciate). So far, I've gotten the veggie burrito and the quesadilla and have no complaints about either. Both are pretty big and easily last me 1.5 - 2 meals. 

Given that this place is pretty affordable and they have much better seating options than La Taqueria, I come here whenever I want to sit and eat somewhere (and generally deal with a shorter line, since they're off the main Mission streets). 

Definitely recommend this place. It will not disappoint.

excerpts: My husband ordered his usual--a prawn and chicken quesadilla, and I ordered my usual--a veggie burrito.
Our total came out to be around $29!
What's even worse is that my husband's quesadilla was so tiny (only two pieces) and barely any prawns in there.
They didn't even put his quesadilla in a box, they just wrapped it in foil, which caused the food to get all messed up and sloppy.
We typically don't mind paying extra for top quality food,
veggie.author: Cin W.
veggie.review:
I've been a longtime customer of Papalote; however, they're really going downhill.  Their food is just ok, but extremely overpriced.  I get it..that they supposedly use fresh ingredients and all that but, come on.  We hadn't been there for a while, but finally decided to order for pick-up a few weeks back.

My husband ordered his usual--a prawn and chicken quesadilla, and I ordered my usual--a veggie burrito.  Our total came out to be around $29! What's even worse is that my husband's quesadilla was so tiny (only two pieces) and barely any prawns in there.  They didn't even put his quesadilla in a box, they just wrapped it in foil, which caused the food to get all messed up and sloppy.  We typically don't mind paying extra for top quality food, but like I said, the quality is not even that great anymore. 

I really like the owners--Miguel and Judy (I think), so I feel bad writing this review.  But I feel really ripped off and I feel like they totally just jacked up their prices while diminishing their quality.  Also, this place is always filled with damn hipsters and techies (who are extremely annoying).

excerpts: Maybe this place is good if you don't eat meat since they have multiple veggie options.
There are SO MANY taquerias in this area that do a great job of both, more affordably, so I'm confused.
I'm personally sad they didn't have the mexican-filipino fusion burrito
I had heard about :(
veggie.author: Hana S.
veggie.review: My carne asada burrito cost about $12 and was meh. Maybe this place is good if you don't eat meat since they have multiple veggie options. There are SO MANY taquerias in this area that do a great job of both, more affordably, so I'm confused. I'm personally sad they didn't have the mexican-filipino fusion burrito I had heard about :(

excerpts: They have veggie mole.
veggie.author: Joey M.
veggie.review:
My #1 taqueria in mission, which by extension means #1 taqueria in USA and world. 

They have veggie mole. Excellent.

Pro tip is to buy a jar of their awesome salsa to take home.

excerpts: I thought I had ordered a veggie burrito with those portions...
veggie.author: Ann L.
veggie.review: Are you serious now? I been to a few taquerias and this one takes the cake in skimpy as fck in their portions. I had a shrimp burrito... which only had 4 pieces of shrimp. It was packed with rice and veggies and cost $12?! I thought I had ordered a veggie burrito with those portions...My friend had the steak burrito and there was barely any steak. Stop cheating your customers.

excerpts: I got a veggie burrito which was good but nothing that wax amazing.
I do agree they have some solid sauces.
I imagine the meat options could be better but as a vegetarian it was okay.
Definitely a hipsters stop for Mexican food.
veggie.author: Linda L.
veggie.review:
Came here to celebrate cinco de mayo and the first thing you'll notice is they one out the door for pick up or delivery. Definitely a popular spot in the area and known for their hot sauces. 

As required by cinco de mayo I got a corona along with some free crazily chips that I used to eat with the amazing green sauce there. I got a veggie burrito which was good but nothing that wax amazing. I do agree they have some solid sauces. I imagine the meat options could be better but as a vegetarian it was okay. Definitely a hipsters stop for Mexican food.

excerpts: Unlike other places, you can be sure that the oil used for the veggie options is kept separately from the meat.
veggie.author: Ringo M.
veggie.review:
I'm gonna say something really snobbish. Ready? Here goes.

I don't like Papalolte because it's a hipster-infested burrito place.

Oops i mean hipster-invested.

Oh you know it's hipster because: 

One, everything in the restaurant is spanking clean. 

Two, they have this signature creamy salsa that all silicon techies like to irrationally rave about in their work patios. 

Three, you always see these Postmates/Grubhub/UberEats/Eat24 people hanging around, waiting to pick up a Pork Chile Verde no sour cream extra guac spinach wrap for some techie who does the software programming for Postmates/Grubhub/Uber. 

Four, remember that delicious salsa mentioned above? Yeah they sell it separately in a jar. 

Five, and probably the most evident indicator of Papalolte's hipster affiliation, a burrito costs like $10 to $11 #damndaniel

My good friend, Salty P, swears by this place though. He loves pouring that creamy salsa on each bite of his carne asada while convincing us that Papalote is actually the best burrito place in Mission. But we can't trust this guy to give an unbiased opinion. Salty P. wears a beard, rocks an expensive vest, and has like, 5 hydroflask bottles ("i need it").

Although i might not like Papalote, i do recommend it to my vegetarian friends though. I know other burrito places offer vegetarian options, too, but Papalote takes their vegetarian menu seriously. Unlike other places, you can be sure that the oil used for the veggie options is kept separately from the meat. You can sleep easy knowing that a piece of meat may not have snuck its way into your Soyrizo Burrito. How can we be so sure? Because unlike other burrito places, Papalote actually has something to lose. They got a chain store down at Fulton.

So yeah, if you don't have any dietary restrictions and/or if you're not a hipster, then i would go Cancun and El Faro instead. But if you are a vegetarian and/or keeps a leather notebook in your butt pocket, then Papalote is the place for you :)

excerpts:
I love Papalote for going the extra mile providing several vegan options including:
veggie with potato, carrot, and mushroom
grilled veggie with eggplant and zucchini
vegan soyrizo
marinated grilled tofu
I went with the veggie burrito and had them add avocado.
It came with chips and a yummy homemade salsa.
I will be sure to visit here the next time in the Bay Area as was wonderful!
veggie.author: Shane S.
veggie.review:
The Mission is packed with burrito places and all are super great yet my favorite burrito is at Papalote. I'm a longtime vegan of 16 years so Mexican food has always been a favorite.

I love Papalote for going the extra mile providing several vegan options including:
veggie with potato, carrot, and mushroom
