grilled veggie with eggplant and zucchini
vegan soyrizo
marinated grilled tofu

All of these come with beans, rice, pico de gallo.

I went with the veggie burrito and had them add avocado. It came with chips and a yummy homemade salsa. I will be sure to visit here the next time in the Bay Area as was wonderful!

excerpts: The veggie burrito is delicious here!
It's all fresh ingredients in generous portions.
veggie.author: Jacqui C.
veggie.review: The veggie burrito is delicious here! It's all fresh ingredients in generous portions. I love the chips and salsa here too! It can get crowded sometimes so I like to just order ahead and pick up.

excerpts: I always loved Papalote for your veggie options.
I ordered a veggie burrito to go tonight and it turned out to be a carne asada burrito.
Seriously not cool..
veggie.author: Elena K.
veggie.review: I am so sad to write this.. I always loved Papalote for your veggie options. I ordered a veggie burrito to go tonight and it turned out to be a carne asada burrito. Seriously not cool..

excerpts: One the best veggie burritos, the potato, mushroom, carrot, is my favorite the soyrizo can also be made vegan too.
The papalote sauce is also crazy good ask them to put it in your burrito for extra flavor!
veggie.author: J.s. H.
veggie.review: One the best veggie burritos, the potato, mushroom, carrot, is my favorite the soyrizo can also be made vegan too. The papalote sauce is also crazy good ask them to put it in your burrito for extra flavor!

excerpts: I just moved to San Francisco and have been searching for a great veggie burrito.
Been to all the regulars and "famous" ones in the mission.
This place is by far the best!
So many options including the filling as well as the types of tortilla.
Eggplant was the one I went with
and I'll definitely be back.
My only request is that they do enchiladas and not just burritos / quesasillas
veggie.author: Alex B.
veggie.review: I just moved to San Francisco and have been searching for a great veggie burrito. Been to all the regulars and "famous" ones in the mission. This place is by far the best!  So many options including the filling as well as the types of tortilla. Eggplant was the one I went with and I'll definitely be back. My only request is that they do enchiladas and not just burritos / quesasillas

excerpts: Best salsa in the city and killer veggie options.
A little more $$ than your average taqueria in the mission, but this place is on another level.
veggie.author: Justin H.
veggie.review: Best salsa in the city and killer veggie options. A little more $$ than your average taqueria in the mission, but this place is on another level. Try the tofu mole.

excerpts: With a combination of Mexican and American Food this restaurante has a great options with soyrizo, f the best veggie food's invention or grilled vegetables!!
Only bad thing us the noise.
Is a very small restaurante and sometimes members of some groups (today next to me) were screaming all time!!
But that is out control of the restaurante!!!!
veggie.author: Arturo R.
veggie.review:
Maybe one of the best places in SF for vegans and vegetarians with richs flavors.
With a combination of Mexican and American Food this restaurante has a great options with soyrizo, f the best veggie food's invention or grilled vegetables!!
 Only bad thing us the noise. Is a very small restaurante and sometimes members of some groups (today next to me) were screaming all time!! But that is out control of the restaurante!!!!

excerpts: , chicken and grilled veggie nachos
(Again... OMG!)
to start.
veggie.author: Suzanne P.
veggie.review: This place is the reason that The Mission is famed for burritos! We stopped in on a Sunday evening, a little before your typical dinner rush. We were able to order quickly and got a small table with no wait. Go here with an appetite b/c no matter how much you want to stop eating, you just can't! We had the house made salsa (OMG! So good!), chicken and grilled veggie nachos (Again... OMG!) to start. Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito. I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid. Burrito can't be beat! Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!

excerpts: I tried the veggie with carrot, potato, mushroom - it was fantastic!!!
veggie.author: Pamela M.
veggie.review:
Really delicious burrito and that salsa that comes with is both unique and out of this world! 

They don't serve ground  beef or pulled meats, however my friend had the pork and it was just about as close as you can get o pulled pork it was so nicely cooked, tender, moist and came apart easily.

I tried the veggie with carrot, potato, mushroom - it was fantastic!!! Loved the charred flavor of the veggies. 

Great place to stop for a filling, yummy bite!

excerpts: Had the grilled veggie burrito with guacamole.
It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ...
this was the opposite, which I like).
I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa.
It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious.
The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride.
Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.
veggie.author: Linda S.
veggie.review: Best burrito I've had, ever. Had the grilled veggie burrito with guacamole. It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ... this was the opposite, which I like). I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa. It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious. The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride. Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.

excerpts: I appreciated all the veggie options.
However, the veggie burrito was a little too greasy and salty for me.
The roasted tomato salsa was delicious though.
Overall, I'd recommend La Taqueria!
veggie.author: Joshua R.
veggie.review: I appreciated all the veggie options. However, the veggie burrito was a little too greasy and salty for me. The roasted tomato salsa was delicious though. Overall, I'd recommend La Taqueria!

excerpts: They have a bunch of different veggie options
veggie.author: Malika R.
veggie.review:
All I can say about Papalote is I love the salsa!! Everytime I've gone, I've wanted to buy a bottle of it but I always resist. They have very interesting combinations for their entrees. You can choose between tacos, quesadillas, salads or burritos and then pick whatever protein you want. They have a bunch of different veggie options so it's exciting to keep coming here and try different things. 

I think my favorite would be the potato, carrot, mushroom. They put a lot of these veggies in there so you get some in every bite. If you get a burrito, make it super so you can get sour cream, guac and cheese! I've heard to tofu is very good as well so I'll be back to try that!

It gets kind of crowded at dinner time (6:30-8:30) and the place is pretty small so I would recommend pick up if you're going around that time.

excerpts: I enjoyed their veggie burrito and salsa!
Wish they provided more salsa for free but whatever "not all salsa is free".
I think Jesus said that.
veggie.author: j. t.
veggie.review: yummy! I enjoyed their veggie burrito and salsa!  Wish they provided more salsa for free but whatever "not all salsa is free".  I think Jesus said that.

excerpts: Grabbed a veggie burrito (potatoes, mushrooms, carrots) with guacamole to go.
veggie.author: Stephanie L.
veggie.review:
Grabbed a veggie burrito (potatoes, mushrooms, carrots) with guacamole to go. The veggies are delicious and the vegan black refried beans are awesome! The papalote roasted tomato salsa is kind of amazing. 

I love that they have such a great vegetarian and vegan selection. Definitely worth checking out.

excerpts: I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!)
with a spinach tortilla.
I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!!
Would get it again for sure.
It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick.
I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good
but I like the soyrizo add-on more!
The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us.
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!
veggie.author: Pooja S.
veggie.review:
Went here for dinner and really loved it! I think it's hard to be creative / differentiated with Mexican food, and Papalote managed to be. It's a small place and I would not pick coming here for the ambiance / if you want an intimate setting. Also really difficult if you have a large group because it's so small, and usually pretty crowded. I got pretty lucky and got a table in under 10 minutes. 

Sat down after ordering food, and the waiter immediately came with chips and salsa. Chips were a bit stale, and while their salsa was good, I don't think it was as amazing as it's hyped up to be. Don't get me wrong - I did still really like it, just think it is as good as other salsas I've tried. 

The burritos are HUGE and super filling!! Portion size is great, and I thought the price was pretty good! I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!) with a spinach tortilla. I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!! Would get it again for sure. It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick. I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good but I like the soyrizo add-on more! The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us. 
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!

excerpts: I had a veggie burrito and my boyfriend had carne asada nachos.
We ate everything lol
veggie.author: Mihaela P.
veggie.review:
I saw this place on TV and decided to give it a try. Not gonna lie, the place itself was not the cleanest and there was not enough room to move around. I definitely felt a bit claustrophobic when it got full. 
The chips and salsa they serve prior to bringing your food were not that great. The chips were very hard (almost stale) so I just assume that they don't make their own chips but take them out of a bag. 
The food was really good, though. That's why I'm giving this place 4 stars despite the ambience. I had a veggie burrito and my boyfriend had carne asada nachos. We ate everything lol

excerpts: Great veggie burrito.
Call ahead to pick up your order.
So yummy
and they have multiple options for vegans.
Staff is awesome as well!
veggie.author: Madelyn T.
veggie.review: Great veggie burrito. Call ahead to pick up your order. So yummy and they have multiple options for vegans. Staff is awesome as well!

excerpts: I got the veggie burrito, which was tasty, but damn those hunks of carrot and potatoes are big!
Pour a little of the heavenly red sauce on before each burrito bite and you can't go wrong.
Yum!
veggie.author: Kendra B.
veggie.review: I got the veggie burrito, which was tasty, but damn those hunks of carrot and potatoes are big! Pour a little of the heavenly red sauce on before each burrito bite and you can't go wrong. Yum!

excerpts: Suprisingly good veggie burrito here.
I got the standard veggie one, with potatoes, carrots, and mushrooms.
I love mushrooms and have never seen them in a burrito
so I got this one.
I'm often skeptical of potatoes in a burrito, but these were fresh cut, as were the carrots, and large chunks full of flavor.
I love that you can pick what kind of rice, beans and wrap that you want.
The papalote's salsa is amazing!
veggie.author: Kristi P.
veggie.review: Suprisingly good veggie burrito here. I got the standard veggie one, with potatoes, carrots, and mushrooms. I love mushrooms and have never seen them in a burrito so I got this one. I'm often skeptical of potatoes in a burrito, but these were fresh cut, as were the carrots, and large chunks full of flavor. I love that you can pick what kind of rice, beans and wrap that you want. The papalote's salsa is amazing! I upgraded to get cheese/sour cream/guac and it was the perfect combo. Comes with a small bowl of chips and salsa on side.  I would definitely come back here next time I am in the Mission. Also, not at all crowded at 3pm on a Monday! Seems reasonably priced for what you are getting (granted bc it's SF, when you add tax tip and a beer the prices get high).

excerpts: Been coming here for years because of the superior salsa and veggie options.
Still the best for veggie options, and yes...their precious salsa, but i'll hit up the plethora of better and cheaper options for my meat burritos from now on.
Sigh....
veggie.author: Drew W.
veggie.review:
Been coming here for years because of the superior salsa and veggie options.  But now that I'm eating meat once again, I have to say the meat burritos are rather meh.

Carne asada is too salty and low quality cuts and the chili verde too dry.  And now that the prices have been raised sky high, what's with still charging for extra salsa?!  You can't just give one extra for fux sake?!

Still the best for veggie options, and yes...their precious salsa, but i'll hit up the plethora of better and cheaper options for my meat burritos from now on. Sigh....

excerpts: I had a veggie burrito and it ruled.
The guacamole was awesome as well.
They have a huge jar of pickled jalapeños that are addictive.
And yes, the salsa is super tasty.
The only drawback would be the limited seating but I would never NOT recommend this place because of that.
veggie.author: Larry M.
veggie.review: Absolutely delicious. 3 of 4 people in our family is vegetarian or vegan. This was a great option for all of us.  I had a veggie burrito and it ruled. The guacamole was awesome as well. They have a huge jar of pickled jalapeños that are addictive. And yes, the salsa is super tasty.  The only drawback would be the limited seating but I would never NOT recommend this place because of that.

excerpts: When I want the standard veggie burrito and we opt for Papalote, I get the bean and cheese and add the other toppings to build to my liking.
Their version of the veggie has potatoes and carrots which I really don't care for.
veggie.author: Esther A.
veggie.review:
When I want the standard veggie burrito and we opt for Papalote, I get the bean and cheese and add the other toppings to build to my liking. Their version of the veggie has potatoes and carrots which I really don't care for. 

Definitely call in your order. We were in and out in two minutes flat which was great because we parked nearby which was not even a legit parking spot. Our first visit to Papalote we waited a good 20 minutes or so for take out as we were unaware how busy this place was. 

Prices are a bit higher than your average taqueria but the ingredients are also higher in quality. I say it's worth it. 

I've tried many taquerias in my days although far from a personal favorite, their claim to fame is their salsa. And for me, it's justified.

excerpts: The veggie breakfast burrito with soyrizo is heaven on a plate for any vegetarian.
As is obvious, the salsa here is also out of this world and will make any Mexican food better.
Also, the people behind the counter are super friendly and always have a smile on their faces, or that may just be because they recognize me from coming here all the time.
Two thumbs up!
veggie.author: Isaac R.
veggie.review: The veggie breakfast burrito with soyrizo is heaven on a plate for any vegetarian. As is obvious, the salsa here is also out of this world and will make any Mexican food better. Also, the people behind the counter are super friendly and always have a smile on their faces, or that may just be because they recognize me from coming here all the time. Two thumbs up!

excerpts: I got the veggie burrito with potatoes/carrots/mushrooms and whole black beans  and it was delicious.
Really well balanced flavors.
Adding guacamole and some sour cream makes for an awesome, filling meal.
veggie.author: Drini C.
veggie.review: Really delicious burritos! I got the veggie burrito with potatoes/carrots/mushrooms and whole black beans  and it was delicious. Really well balanced flavors. Adding guacamole and some sour cream makes for an awesome, filling meal.

excerpts:
you have a friend that is vegetarian or vegan, this is a great place to take them to because there are a ton of vegan and veggie selections
-Their trademark salsa sauce is indeed very delicious
veggie.author: Wendy S.
veggie.review:
Pros:
-If you have a friend that is vegetarian or vegan, this is a great place to take them to because there are a ton of vegan and veggie selections
-Their trademark salsa sauce is indeed very delicious

Cons:
-Expensive for a burrito
-Burritos are okay from a meat eater's perspective; I feel like there are better and cheaper options

excerpts:
Vegan and veggie options?
Check.
Tasty, thick salsa like you've never had before?
Check.
Making an ass out of myself in front of complete strangers. 
Knocking over condiments with my bag. 
Damn, those tables are small.
veggie.author: Amy J.
veggie.review:
Healthier Mexican food?
Check.
Vegan and veggie options?
Check.
Tasty, thick salsa like you've never had before?
Check.
Making an ass out of myself in front of complete strangers. Knocking over condiments with my bag. Damn, those tables are small.
Priceless.

I would definitely go here again, especially for the salsa. My burrito had just the right amount of flavor and was the perfect size. Not too big, not too small. I dunno if I could eat a super which is only 99 cents more but that's just me.

I discovered the Mission library along the way. Score. Check them out. They're not like any other taqueria in the area.

excerpts: my go-to burrito here is the grilled veggie one - i just love the fresh vegetables that they use and it's good to always make it SUPER
veggie.author: Priya G.
veggie.review:
Can I say BEST BURRITO in san francisco? this place is so delicious i don't even know what to say about it. 

my go-to burrito here is the grilled veggie one - i just love the fresh vegetables that they use and it's good to always make it SUPER (guac, sour cream, and cheese) and i usually get black beans and throw it into a spinach tortilla. nomtastic. the other burritos that are good are soy riso and chicken. so so so safe and such a solid meal for about $8. if you're not a big eater, you can always save half of it for later, which makes an amazing meal or even better - amazing drunk food! (haha)

their special sauce is tasty and if you want more, i believe its $0.50 for each extra cup of it. i would get more - i usually have a cup for just the chips, and another cup just for my burrito.

thank you sf for the best burrito in the world!!!!!! love you.

excerpts: I gave them 2 stars cause the ingredients were good and there are veggie and vegan options
but if you want a good taco, look anywhere else.
Take your hunger to El Faralitos or the truck at 23rd and Treat.
You will save money fill your belly and in the end be happier.
veggie.author: Bucky W.
veggie.review:
Quick review- overprice, bad mole, one tortilla tacos, better off going to many other places.

A group of friends and I did a taco crawl.  6 or 7 places along 24th st.  This was the worst.  The ingredients were good but it lacked flavor and was the most expensive of all the places we went.  Up to 2x more in price than every other place and small too.  Plus the worst of all the worst is only one small ass tortilla per taco. I am native and never gotten a taco with only one tortilla. The mole was bland.  I gave them 2 stars cause the ingredients were good and there are veggie and vegan options but if you want a good taco, look anywhere else.  Take your hunger to El Faralitos or the truck at 23rd and Treat.  You will save money fill your belly and in the end be happier.

excerpts:
Lots of veggie alternatives
4.
veggie.author: Alice C.
veggie.review:
From the "That's what she said" joke potential to the succulent flavor, I love [almost] everything about meat.

So you can imagine what I'm about to say is very difficult, but it's also a testimony to how skilled Papalote is at making a healthier alternative not taste like feet.

That being said, the best thing I've tried on this menu is actually the soyrizo (soy chorizo)!  I tried a piece of the soyrizo quesadilla, and was very pleasantly surprised.  It was well seasoned, and the texture was not weird.  I think this dish will be my go-to from now on!

OTHER DISHES I'VE TRIED:
1. Chips and salsa - this is on the 7x7 100 things to try list.  The salsa was really good and different than any other salsa I've tasted, but I still think the soyrizo was more stand-out.
2. Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.  Awesome!
3. Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
4. Jicama salad - usually comes on the side with your meal, and refreshingly delicious!  

LIKES:
1. Large portions 
2. Leftovers still tasty 2 days later
3. Lots of veggie alternatives
4. Seems more health conscious than the average taqueria

DISLIKES:
1. Dine in was crowded...you'd probably be annoyed/displeased if you're claustrophobic.  You can phone in orders though.
2. Prices are a bit higher than what you'd expect to find at other Mexican places in the Mission - the steak fajitas were $13.95!  (and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...but then you can just get the soyrizo!)

excerpts: They had fish and I had veggie.
We all thought the food was fresh and excellent.
Amazing.
And no lard or animal fats in anything, I really trust them.
veggie.author: Cynthia B.
veggie.review:
I went here yesterday with my mom and aunt for the first time.  We all got burritos.  They had fish and I had veggie.  We all thought the food was fresh and excellent.  Amazing.  And no lard or animal fats in anything, I really trust them.  The place was super busy, but had a fun vibe to it.  

So why only 4 stars?  We all agreed that we thought the prices were too high.  but then again, if I was the owner of a place that was that popular I would raise the prices too.  So I will go back here anytime, food was great.  But only if I don't have to pay.

excerpts: I'm of the pescetarian nature myself and flip flop through the various veggie options (grilled veggie, tofu mole, etc., etc.).
Lots of points for customizability (beans, tortillas, tacos/quesadillas/burritos).
When I have out of town guests visiting I often take them to Papalote's for a SF super mission burrito experience.
veggie.author: Stephen S.
veggie.review: Papalote's is not my favorite burrito in San Francisco but I can't fault anyone who claims that it's theirs. They definitely know what they're doing here and offer a plethora of options for meat lovers and vegetarians alike. I'm of the pescetarian nature myself and flip flop through the various veggie options (grilled veggie, tofu mole, etc., etc.). Lots of points for customizability (beans, tortillas, tacos/quesadillas/burritos). When I have out of town guests visiting I often take them to Papalote's for a SF super mission burrito experience.

excerpts: As a vegetarian friendly gal, (I eat the fishes, cause, well you know, so I can't claim full veggie status)
veggie.author: Shira O.
veggie.review:
Wow. Yippee. Delish. Yummers. As a vegetarian friendly gal, (I eat the fishes, cause, well you know, so I can't claim full veggie status) I am in LOVE with their soyrizo burrito. I buy soyrizo from TJs and make it at home, but the balance and the spiciness they achieve is just out of this world. 

Also, the creamy/saucey/spicey/what the HECK do they put in that saucy sauce is also mind blowing.

So for the record, that's 1--out of this world reference and 1--mind blowing reference...which if you haven't already garnered means this place is pretty flippin' good!

excerpts: I ordered the grilled veggie burrito, and really enjoyed the fresh, juicy, kinda tangy onions, eggplant and zucchinis!
veggie.author: Jo D.
veggie.review:
This review is a bit overdue.. Papalote was recommended by my sf soul-sister. (thanks Dez!)  
So we're in the city, starving for burritos...  what better place to be than in the Mission..?!?!  Super excited to taste the food here.

Paplote is conveniently located away from the super busy part of the Mission, so it's easy to find parking in the residential area surrounding it.  I ordered the grilled veggie burrito, and really enjoyed the fresh, juicy, kinda tangy onions, eggplant and zucchinis!  I've never had a burrito like this before... 

Talk about a great spot with lots of urban flavor!!

excerpts: What's the point of ordering a veggie burrito if all you get is rice?
Ps.
Dont come in 40 minutes before they close, u wont get to eat there.
Because no customer is worth any extra time.
veggie.author: ken p.
veggie.review: If I wanted a rice burrito I would've ordered a rice burrito. What's the point of ordering a veggie burrito if all you get is rice? Ps. Dont come in 40 minutes before they close, u wont get to eat there. Because no customer is worth any extra time.

excerpts: They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork
veggie.author: Tiffany N.
veggie.review:
THE CHIPS & SALSA - BOMB.COM!
When I first had it, I wasn't used to the fact that it wasn't chunky salsa but thennnn I tried it and the flavor just blew me away! It's SO good - I can't even describe it aside from the fact that it is spicy. Bottled sauce is available for purchase.

My go-to when I want a burrito WITHOUT feeling heavy/disgusting after
IE.) the "I should go and work out after eating this but really, I'm gonna take my lazy ass to sleep"

Anyways, on to the burritos -
Not the hugest I've seen (hahaha) but it's filling and ingredients taste fresh. Burritos avg around $7-9.

Chicken Adobo burrito is muy deliciouso - love the garlic rice in it that really adds a good hint of flavor. the adobo chicken is not as vinegary as authentic adobo but you can still taste it. 
Filipino inspire - It's a must try when ambitious to step outside of a carna asada burrito (there's nothing wrong because I like carna asada too!)

They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork so you really do have A LOT to choose from. 

+Not your late night burrito joint - closes at 10pm!
+accepts credit card
+ small, colorful and clean eating area with cool local flyers for events around the Bay scattered everywhere

excerpts: The menu on the wall has some options on the left side such as "Veggie," "Grilled Veggie," and "Soyrizo".
The next few columns to the right then have prices for exactly what dish you would like your first choice to be and then you move on to picking additional ingredients.
I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here
I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here
(Potato, carrot, mushroom) and partly because I wanted more flavor than a bland veggie
burrito
I've had at way too many other places.
veggie.author: David O.
veggie.review:
This place is a little confusing, but good. I didn't understand the menu right away as I was standing in line to order so I got nervous that I would be holding up the line while deciding. No pressure or anything. There's just always a line. The menu on the wall has some options on the left side such as "Veggie," "Grilled Veggie," and "Soyrizo". The next few columns to the right then have prices for exactly what dish you would like your first choice to be and then you move on to picking additional ingredients. The additional($) ingredients are things like cheese and sour cream which come standard at most taquerias so the burritos that would be around $6 at those other places are $10 here.

I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here (Potato, carrot, mushroom) and partly because I wanted more flavor than a bland veggie burrito I've had at way too many other places. I added cheese, sour cream and guacamole to my burrito and there was plenty of all three in it. The burrito itself was flavorful and filling so I definitely wasn't disappointed with my choice.

So..the sauce. The sauce is slightly spicy, smokey, and delicious. Just had to throw in my opinion about the sauce everyone mentions, I guess. I might even buy the jars they sell and use it when I get burritos at other places :p

Overall I like this place. It's impossible to park around Valencia/Mission most of the time but if you can make it to this location it's worth it

excerpts: I got the grilled veggie and it was HUGE
, BF got meat.
veggie.author: Michelle L.
veggie.review:
The last time I came to SF I failed to eat a burrito and it's been killing me for more then a year. So, this time, hot off the plane, it was BART to Papalote and a burrito was in my system before I even checked in to the hotel.

I got the grilled veggie and it was HUGE, BF got meat. The loudly vegetarian girl sitting next to me got meat accidentally and was scandalized. 

Overall: a little pricey, but portions are worth it, and the quality is excellent. Would recommend.

excerpts: and I had their guacamole and chips while my friend had their veggie burrito.
Their guacamole was delicious but disappointed with the bland flavor and very little portions of their chips.
I liked the pickled Jalapeños they give for free which you can find beside the counter.
Had a portion of my friend's veggie burrito and it was tasteless to me.
There are other burrito places within that neighborhood
I'd rather go to to be honest.
Their prices were even too high for me.
$8 for guacamole and chips?
Too much.
veggie.author: Janis P.
veggie.review: Went here one evening and I had their guacamole and chips while my friend had their veggie burrito.  Their guacamole was delicious but disappointed with the bland flavor and very little portions of their chips.  I liked the pickled Jalapeños they give for free which you can find beside the counter.  Had a portion of my friend's veggie burrito and it was tasteless to me.  There are other burrito places within that neighborhood I'd rather go to to be honest.  Their prices were even too high for me.  $8 for guacamole and chips?  Too much.

excerpts: I waited THIRTY frickin minutes for my ONE order of veggie nachos last night.
But damn it, those veggie nachoes doused with extra hot sauce are still delicious!
I will never walk in here with a craving, I know now to call in my order next time.
veggie.author: Diane L.
veggie.review:
I waited THIRTY frickin minutes for my ONE order of veggie nachos last night.  

Granted it was the night before Veterans Day and people were probably more inclined to eat out on a Monday night (damn all of you who got the day off today), and it was smack dab during the peak of the dinner rush when I came, I still think waiting 30 minutes is outrageous.  I'm a pretty patient person when it comes to food, but I completely lost my patience when I saw that others who ordered after me were receiving their food before me!  When I went up to the cashier with my receipt, it's as if she already knew what I was going to ask her, and she just gave me a shoulder shrug to blow me off.  And much to my dismay, there was no "Thanks for waiting" or "Sorry for the long wait" or even anything free!  

But damn it, those veggie nachoes doused with extra hot sauce are still delicious!  I will never walk in here with a craving, I know now to call in my order next time.

excerpts: Their veggie burrito is great, with the tortilla expertly grilled and stuffed with goodness.
Like most people who've tried their house salsa, I love it,.
veggie.author: Jordan Z.
veggie.review:
I've been to Papalote twice, and both times were fantastic. Their veggie burrito is great, with the tortilla expertly grilled and stuffed with goodness. Like most people who've tried their house salsa, I love it,. It tastes vaguely like Doritos chip seasoning (and I mean that in the best way possible). 

They have a big jar of picked peppers and veggies as a nice condiment, and they stock every table with Yucateca green habanero hot sauce.

excerpts: Today I went with the grilled veggie burrito, which was delicious.
My only complaint is that it was loaded with black beans, which I requested, I just wish there had been more of the grilled zucchini and eggplant.
Oh well, it was still deliciously satisfying.
veggie.author: Emily S.
veggie.review:
Just go.

Seriously.

So, if you like delicious tacos and burritos and oh, fresh salsa, then Papalote is your kind of place. The first time I came here for lunch I had the soyrizo tacos which were fantastic. They serve it fresh with a side of your own chips and salsa. 

After going there for lunch this afternoon with some friends, I decided it was time to write a review. Today I went with the grilled veggie burrito, which was delicious. My only complaint is that it was loaded with black beans, which I requested, I just wish there had been more of the grilled zucchini and eggplant. Oh well, it was still deliciously satisfying. We all shared an order of chips and salsa, on top of the side of chips and salsa that they already give each individual order. The salsa is SO good. My friend talked me into buying a jar of it on my way home, one of the best decisions I made all day. It's fresh with a definite kick, so beware if you're sensitive to spice. Also, highly recommend getting your burrito/taco to-go and enjoying it in Dolores Park when the weather's nice.

Side note, they also serve Mexican cokes (pure cane sugar=the real stuff) as well as a wide range of cold beers to enjoy with your delicious Mexican entree of choice.

excerpts: cause I'm stuck with the veggie (really beans, or at best chile relleno) options over there.
Papalote gives the treatment veggie options deserve.
Also, there salsa is not only better than any other, it is a redefinition of the category 'salsa'.
veggie.author: Ory P.
veggie.review:
Two words: Mole Tofu. This place is the answer to every vegetarian's dreams. I know nothing of the chicken adobo, or whether the carnitas (if they even have it) stacks up against El Farolito's or Taquieria Cancun's. That can't matter to me cause I'm stuck with the veggie (really beans, or at best chile relleno) options over there. Papalote gives the treatment veggie options deserve. 
Also, there salsa is not only better than any other, it is a redefinition of the category 'salsa'. It's more like a mole or adobo, but creamier, that decided it wanted to be served cold on chips instead of used as a marinage/grilling sauce on proteins.
Another place there game is on another level are the prints of famous singers (done as two-tones that make them surreal and pop) covering the walls. Go there because Prince (and apparently the Mexican National Team:http://sfist.com/2014/07/07/mexican_world_cup_players_return_fr.php) sent you.

excerpts: Veggie burritos are great.
veggie.author: Michael O.
veggie.review:
Favorite burrito in SF, hands down.  I take friends here all the time when visiting.  A cross between legit Mexican and Mission hipster/funk.

Veggie burritos are great.  Recommend the classic vegetarian (with potatoes) with cheese, no rice, add guac, whole wheat tortilla

excerpts: The veggie taco had ingredients that just didn't work well together, the chips were tough, the salsa was weird, and the guac didn't help.
You could do better in your own kitchen, even if you're not a cook.
veggie.author: Anna S.
veggie.review: Not worth it.  Friendly and fast service, for sure, but the food is bland and stale-tasting.  The veggie taco had ingredients that just didn't work well together, the chips were tough, the salsa was weird, and the guac didn't help.  You could do better in your own kitchen, even if you're not a cook.

excerpts: I heard about Papalote because they beat douchebag bobby flay in the throwdown show and was surprised at how many veggie options they have.
Highly suggest the Soyrizo or the grilled veggie if your a vegetarian.
Also, the salsa that comes with every buritto is awesome.
Its a little on the spicy side
veggie.author: Kameron K.
veggie.review:
Mmm

I heard about Papalote because they beat douchebag bobby flay in the throwdown show and was surprised at how many veggie options they have.

Highly suggest the Soyrizo or the grilled veggie if your a vegetarian.  Also, the salsa that comes with every buritto is awesome.  Its a little on the spicy side but is one of the best salsas I've had.

Highly recommend calling in to place your order, its usually ready in 10 minutes and beats having to wait in the long line.

excerpts: The Veggie burrito (trust me)
doused in their ridiculously delicious salsa, and a big glass of horchata.
veggie.author: Amanda P.
veggie.review:
Papalote is great! This is the kind of Mexican food that doesn't make you feel gross for hours after you eat it. The ingredients are fresh and flavorful, and not greasy like many/most Mexican restaurants. It's not the most traditional I've ever had, but who cares if it tastes good!

My recommendations: The Veggie burrito (trust me) doused in their ridiculously delicious salsa, and a big glass of horchata.

excerpts: It's a slightly unfair comparison - I had the soy chorizo tacos instead of the usual veggie burrito (b/c their veggie burritos had weird shit like zucchini in them) - but the soy-rizo was too salty.
And while I like that they have their own style of salsa (bottled, trademarked, and sold), I prefer two distinct offerings: red and green, or hot and hotter.
If El Castillito bottled their green salsa I would chug it for breakfast.
veggie.author: seema s.
veggie.review:
Definitely a departure from the usual Mission taqueria... colorful, clean dining area, bussed tables, skillfully wrapped silverware, etc.  But I came in expecting superior Mission Mexican and was underwhelmed.  

It's a slightly unfair comparison - I had the soy chorizo tacos instead of the usual veggie burrito (b/c their veggie burritos had weird shit like zucchini in them) - but the soy-rizo was too salty.  And while I like that they have their own style of salsa (bottled, trademarked, and sold), I prefer two distinct offerings: red and green, or hot and hotter.  If El Castillito bottled their green salsa I would chug it for breakfast.

excerpts: My friend enjoyed her grilled  veggie burrito.
veggie.author: Lorissa W.
veggie.review:
My friend enjoyed her grilled  veggie burrito. For about 5 bucks, it was a good size and had nice presentation.

My grilled veggies were cut up in tiny pieces like baby food. That was odd. It tasted fresh and nicely grilled but a little bland. I added their salsa and that made it better.

Papolotte has excellent salsa. 

The downsides: LOUD music blasting from two speakers at their highest volume in a small dining room (this isn't a club!) It was hard to hear my friend talk and the loud music was hurting my ears.

The cashier was rude to me. I asked her to lower the volume of the music since I was the only person there waiting for my friend, she didn't do anything about it. The second time I asked her to turn down the music, she finally did something. When I tried to order food, she pretended not to see me and basicly had trouble hiding her dislike of me.  She ruined the ambience of the place.  What happened to good customer service?

excerpts: I still think it's really good, but the last time I visited I noticed the veggies in my veggie tacos were drenched in butter, and the salsa I usually love just felt thick and heavy.
And I just have to say...
it was kind of too much.
Obviously I'll give it another try; but for now I'm going to have to take off a star.
veggie.author: Amber K.
veggie.review: Papalote used to be one of my favorite white-ican restaurants (yup, Mexican food for white people). I still think it's really good, but the last time I visited I noticed the veggies in my veggie tacos were drenched in butter, and the salsa I usually love just felt thick and heavy. And I just have to say... it was kind of too much.  Obviously I'll give it another try; but for now I'm going to have to take off a star. :(

excerpts: The last time I ordered a veggie burrito, the potatoes weren't cooked enough.
Today, I tried again - my friend's veggie taco was inedible, she said the potatoes tasted bad and she threw it out.
My "super" burrito with pintos was actually not a super, and they put in black beans.
veggie.author: judah m.
veggie.review:
Something's happening at Papalote, and it's not good. Seems like things are going on a downhill slide. I used to love, love their burritos and their salsa. The last time I ordered a veggie burrito, the potatoes weren't cooked enough.

Today, I tried again - my friend's veggie taco was inedible, she said the potatoes tasted bad and she threw it out. My "super" burrito with pintos was actually not a super, and they put in black beans. (this was a pickup order, so I didn't realize this til I was back home).

I hope things turn around soon, or I may just stop trying. Two strikes so far for two visits in a row...

excerpts: I had the grilled veggie burrito.
I LOVE zucchini in my mexican food and this included it....
And not just a few slices
but it was STUFFED with zucchini...
veggie.author: L P.
veggie.review:
I waltzed in with a friend early one Sunday evening. We went for a walk, saw Papalote, and thought sure, let's try it. 

AND WE DID. 

I had the grilled veggie burrito. I LOVE zucchini in my mexican food and this included it....And not just a few slices but it was STUFFED with zucchini...and a side of pinto beans, rice, eggplant, sourcream and cheese. My friend had the Mole/chicken burrito and she also enjoyed it...Although I think she enjoyed the strangely orange free salsa more. It WAS good after all. We left stuffed and pleased. Especially since when we arrived at 4 we walked right in and up to the cashier. Then when we left at 5ish there was a line out the door. We had the right burritos at the right time...with drinks for the right price...20 bucks. 

(By the way, this story took place approximately 5 hours ago. I decided to write this review promptly bc I also decided to promptly eat my burrito leftovers as soon as I got home....which is now....Also, it's even better cold. Yesssssss)

Go here and go early.

excerpts: The veggie burrito I ordered was almost identical to the shrimp
burrito my friend got.
She really didn't get many shrimp for the price.
veggie.author: Leeann M.
veggie.review:
Average. I know that they beat Bobby Flay in a throwdown but I am really not sure how. The veggie burrito I ordered was almost identical to the shrimp burrito my friend got. She really didn't get many shrimp for the price.

Maybe it was an off day. I will say the play was packed so maybe what they ordered was better.

excerpts: That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas.

We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in.
veggie.author: S H.
veggie.review:
I will preface this review by noting that we should have called ahead and asked about the amount of garlic in their food. My husband has an allergy, & there were a lot of items on the menu he couldn't eat. That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas. We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in. If my husband had been able to eat the salsa, it certainly wouldn't have been enough. 

The fajitas came out pretty quickly. The eggplant, zucchini & carrots were cooked a pleasant amount--not mushy. Lettuce, diced toms, and jicama (I think) all tasted fresh. The refried beans were good (though on the runnier end of the spectrum, just fyi) and the avocado slices were ripe and there were a good number of them. Wish the same had been true of  the tortillas! The order came with 3 clearly mass-produced, traditional-sized (i.e. taco, not burrito), flour tortillas--not enough to deal with even half of the food on the plate. Though they did not charge us extra when we asked for more, this just reinforced the impression created by the salsa--that they were trying to give us as little as possible. I suppose this could be a considered strategy to reduce food waste (which we would support!), though, if that's their rationale, it would help to explain that, and advise customers they need only ask for more. 

Overall, the food was fine, but not what I expected after hearing my sis talk about having seen this joint on TV, and seeing it mentioned in The Rough Guide to Cali. Could not shake the impression that you're not quite getting your money's worth. I may go back for the tofu mole everyone raves about, but probably only if I'm already in the neighborhood. I'll give 3 stars--because I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that the absence of garlic really impacted the flavor of the food.

excerpts: All are good, but I crave the veggie burrito.
Oh, and the salsa is perfect: spicy and flavorful.
veggie.author: Heather T.
veggie.review:
Best veg burrito on the planet, with big chunks of potato, tender carrot medallions, and sauteed mushrooms. Plus, all of their beans are vegan (even the pinto beans are made without lard). I've had the veg tacos, the mole, and the veg quesadilla too. All are good, but I crave the veggie burrito. Oh, and the salsa is perfect: spicy and flavorful. It's so perfect that I buy it by the jar for home.

My husband jokes at me because whenever he asks where I feel like eating lunch, the answer is always Papalote.

excerpts: I have also tried the grilled veggie burrito (not that great as it had no guac, cheese, salsa or sour cream).
You can't go wrong with the quesadillas either!
Cute little spot
veggie.author: Niki V.
veggie.review: The sauce! The sauce is worth writing a million words for. You can also buy the jar of sauce which makes it that much better. I usually get the carne asada burrito and it's never failed to impress. I have also tried the grilled veggie burrito (not that great as it had no guac, cheese, salsa or sour cream). You can't go wrong with the quesadillas either! Cute little spot

excerpts: Wish I was in SF longer to try out their other veggie options.
Two tacos to an order made for a filling meal without feeling overstuffed.
Yum!!
veggie.author: Christina K.
veggie.review: We ordered by phone and picked up soyrizo and a tofu taco. The soyrizo is awesome and so is the salsa that everyone talks about. I hear the tofu tastes like paneer, which makes it sound even tastier!! Wish I was in SF longer to try out their other veggie options. Two tacos to an order made for a filling meal without feeling overstuffed. Yum!!

excerpts: The veggie burritos are also pretty tasty.
The portions are quite large and a burrito will easily make two meals.
veggie.author: Steve B.
veggie.review:
The good: Their salsa is pretty good, although it seems to have lost some of its fire lately, and their chicken mole is delicious.  The veggie burritos are also pretty tasty.  The portions are quite large and a burrito will easily make two meals.  You can call ahead and order food to-go and avoid the ridiculous line that often develops. 

The bad: I think the food is overpriced, especially given the volume of sales and the fact that their service can be mediocre.  But, they keep a line out the door so the market seems to say otherwise.  I've had orders messed up repeatedly -- from getting the wrong dish entirely to minor things like missing salsa or not getting a whole wheat tortilla -- especially when I order to-go.

The bottom line: Worth checking out, but not my go-to taqueria.

excerpts: They have more veggie options than other Mexican places.
I have had a regular veggie burrito, with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots.
It was really good, but I do wish there had been more mushrooms in there.
The potatoes and carrots had been cooked nice and soft but not mushy and seasoned well.
veggie.author: Angela T.
veggie.review:
I have been to both Papalote locations, on Fulton and in the Mission. Both are great. They are well known for their salsa, which is REALLY good. The salsa is what makes Papalote really special. Like most other Mexican restaurants in the Mission, you get chips and salsa with your food. So while chips and salsa are just a plus to the burritos normally, I personally think the salsa is just as awesome and special as the burrito. 

Onto the burritos... They have more veggie options than other Mexican places. I have had a regular veggie burrito, with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots. It was really good, but I do wish there had been more mushrooms in there. The potatoes and carrots had been cooked nice and soft but not mushy and seasoned well. I also tried the soyrizo which was also awesome. 

If you want some guacamole, sour cream,, and cheese in your burrito, you got to pay an extra 99 cents to get it super. The burritos here are a little pricier than other places in the Mission (around $6.50 -$9 for a burrito) and they are not as big either... BUT they are delicious...

excerpts: I ordered the super veggie burrito.
They have this really yummy vegan salsa.
I'm addicted to it!
Bought some to take home with me yesterday.
veggie.author: A T.
veggie.review: Seating is a bit tight, and pricing is a bit high, but the food is delicious!  Yummy!  I hear it's organic too.  I ordered the super veggie burrito.  They have this really yummy vegan salsa.  I'm addicted to it!  Bought some to take home with me yesterday.

excerpts: Super veggie friendly.
Definitely would come back and try the other veggie dishes.
veggie.author: Irene L.
veggie.review: Liked this little place alot! I had the marinated tofu burrito w/ guacamole and sour cream. Super veggie friendly. They have SOYRIZO here! OMG! :) Prices are good and getting a table isn't too hard. People come in and out pretty quickly. Service is fast, you order, sit down, and bam w/ minutes they bring your food to your table. The salsa and chips are yummy. Definitely would come back and try the other veggie dishes.

excerpts: Great selection of meat/veggie/fake-meat to add to your burrito.
veggie.author: Dori S.
veggie.review:
Fabulous Mexican food with one of the best, most memorable house salsas I've ever had!  Great selection of meat/veggie/fake-meat to add to your burrito.  

Place is small - don't be deterred by the line out the door!  Also, make sure to pick up a jar of their salsa, which can be found in a drink cooler to the right...mmmmm!!

excerpts: The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy.
veggie.author: Will A.
veggie.review: A bit less traditional than the other taqueria's in the mission, but a nice variation. I always order the chicken mole burrito and it's unique and delicious. Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission? The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy. Gotta love free chips and salsa, and the creamy spicy salsa is delicious.

excerpts: The beans had flavor and it's nice to have a place that uses veggie instead of chicken broth
so vegetarians have more options.
veggie.author: Jackie K.
veggie.review: Great tofu burrito.  Fresh and delicious albeit it expensive for a burrito.  Still cheaper than any sit down dinner and thus, worth it.  The beans had flavor and it's nice to have a place that uses veggie instead of chicken broth so vegetarians have more options.

excerpts: From your choice of wheat, spinach and tomato tortillas to tofu and veggie options, a burrito does not have to be heavy and give you food coma!!
We tried the carne asada tacos ( 2 for $5.95) and Veggie grilled burrito ($6.50).
The veggie burrito was definitely not as great as the burritos from El Farolito.
veggie.author: Shirley W.
veggie.review:
If you're expecting big chunks of tomatoes, onions and cilantro in their famous salsa, you'll be disappointed.  In essence, the salsa is made with roasted tomatoes and pureed into a smooth consistence but packed with flavor.  Their salsa is different but I personally like my chunks of tomatoes in my salsa. However their avocado dip ($2.75) was chunky and delish!

At Papalote, you have the option of making your burrito as healthy as you'd like.  From your choice of wheat, spinach and tomato tortillas to tofu and veggie options, a burrito does not have to be heavy and give you food coma!!  Once you order food, you'll be seated by one of the friendly workers.

The bathroom is kinda cool. Almost every inch of the wall space and the ceiling is covered in graffiti.  They've used graffiti as an art and it brings in a cool vibe.  

Parking is kinda hard especially in the Mission but if you bike to Papalote, you can park your bike at the bike racks in front and watch

We tried the carne asada tacos ( 2 for $5.95) and Veggie grilled burrito ($6.50).  The carne asada tacos had huge cube chunks of marinated meat. The veggie burrito was definitely not as great as the burritos from El Farolito.

excerpts: I think Warren had a veggie burrito because he's one of "those kind.
You know what I mean: they don't eat meat because Jesus told him not to via a text message while he was watching Goonies on DVD three years ago.
veggie.author: Jason B.
veggie.review:
This place is good. A friend of mine who lives in San Fran (Warren, who plays drums for Tussle and probably a bunch of other lame bands - just kidding!) took me (and The Woman Who I'm Currently Married To) to this joint. The burritos were pretty damn good. TWWICMT suggested that I try some black beans in my carne asada burrito with beans and cheese only (#2) and ya know what, it was a wonderful suggestion. I think Warren had a veggie burrito because he's one of "those kind." You know what I mean: they don't eat meat because Jesus told him not to via a text message while he was watching Goonies on DVD three years ago. It wasn't even the special edition, just the crappy pan and scan version!

I'm hitting this place up when I come back. You hear that Warren?

excerpts: Veggie options are plentiful and the quality of the experience has been exceptional every visit.
Easily my favorite spot so far for a quality mission burrito.
veggie.author: Cory H.
veggie.review: The best burrito in San Francisco.  Veggie options are plentiful and the quality of the experience has been exceptional every visit.  Easily my favorite spot so far for a quality mission burrito.

excerpts: What I am really interested in... is their veggie options!
I will drop in again and try something.
It's just going to be difficult because once I find something good, I can't help ordering it.
It's a good thing I work in this neighborhood....
veggie.author: Donna K.
veggie.review:
I am only speaking from the quesadilla perspective... and yea their super quesadillas are very very delish. What really makes the quesadilla is the meat of choice (I get carne asada) and their special salsa.

The carne asada is cooked just right! Not chewy or tough, but juicy and tender. Plus, the amount they put in their quesadilla is good for the portion. Not too much (but would I really complain??) or too little.

I loved how the quesadilla wasn't too cheesy and the outside was nice and crisp. I like to load mine up with guacamole, sour cream, and salsa for every bite. I don't know how you can eat it any other way! The guacamole makes the meat not too smokey, the sour cream gives it a little tang, and the salsa brings out the juiciness of the meat.

That's right... the salsa is yummy! I just wish it had more of a kick or was spicy in some way. Tasting it alone I couldn't really pinpoint anything special about it, but I love how it tastes with my carne asada. I didn't actually enjoy eating it with the chips. It was too substantial for the chips, which were thin and kind of papery. Not a fan.

What I am really interested in... is their veggie options! I will drop in again and try something. It's just going to be difficult because once I find something good, I can't help ordering it. It's a good thing I work in this neighborhood....

excerpts: Their veggie burritos are good, but...
veggie.author: L B.
veggie.review:
Their veggie burritos are good, but...

1. Don't get carne asada with no rice. It's 89% black beans, 10% steak, and 1% salsa.  Bleh.

2. The "Mkt Price" for a side of guac was $3.25 for about two tablespoons. That's insane.

excerpts: the grilled veggie burrito didn't taste very good
veggie.author: Miss C.
veggie.review:
Sad... I used to like their food. Last few times I went back the grilled veggie burrito didn't taste very good (ended up taking a couple bites then throwing it away each time...), their guacamole was not very flavorful, and their salsa was NOT hella good...

Boo... Bring back the yum or I'm not gonna come (back)!

excerpts:
I've been wanting a little extra oomf in my veggie selections!
Also, the salsa here is BOMB, the staff is super nice, and they play sweet, sweet dub all day on the stereo!
Absolute win!
veggie.author: Erin P.
veggie.review:
The idea of tofu in my burrito used to weird me out super badly before I came to Papalote.
Now, it's my most favorite thing in the world, and good thing, too! I've been wanting a little extra oomf in my veggie selections!
Also, the salsa here is BOMB, the staff is super nice, and they play sweet, sweet dub all day on the stereo!
Absolute win!

excerpts: It gives you about 12 choices of meat and veggie combos and sorts them in a taco, quesadilla, and burrito menu, making it SUPER EASY to order if you're at all fucked up or stupid.
I cannot wait to go back - seriously the menu is so organized and beautiful
veggie.author: Kelly H.
veggie.review:
Dolores Park is maddening on sunny weekends.  I feel that I would rather skin both knees than go to Dolores Park on a sunny Saturday with friends.  With that said, I have been known to give in to peer pressure when there is beer or hookers involved.  In this case, it involved beer and good friends with beards.  And if you know me, you know that I will do almost anything for a fine man with a beard and the chicken fajitas from Chili's. 

Dolores Park, Coors Lights, PBR, temperature drops 20 degrees, smoke something, and so begins my Saturday evening of mystery.  This included stopping in to Papalote - whose name just sincerely rrrrolls off the tongue - and ordering a Mole Chicken quesadilla.  I had heard of people liking this place immensely, saying GO, GO, GO!  But I was like "I've been to taquerias, ya'll.  Just chill."  But THIS taqueria IS different.  It gives you about 12 choices of meat and veggie combos and sorts them in a taco, quesadilla, and burrito menu, making it SUPER EASY to order if you're at all fucked up or stupid.  I cannot wait to go back - seriously the menu is so organized and beautiful it's plain disgusting.  But really, Papalote is plaing GO-OOO-OOD, mang.

excerpts: We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.
So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!
Without drinks.
But whatever.
I tell her it's really good
and I fork over some money.
So the food is brought out and I get the shrip
and I say FUCK--
what I really wanted was Prawns.
Maybe it's due to me being an unsophisticted Mid-westerner, but I ordered shrimp not expecting them to be those tiney nasty thing but the big jumbo ones.
So I walked back and spit out my WINE AND BUTTER soaked nasty ass shrimp that had no flavor.
At Papalote i like to order a plate with shrimp
veggie.author: Biggie M.
veggie.review:
Once upon a time I wrote a glowing review for Papalote.  You can read it.   I once gave Papalote 4 stars.  It's beneath the astrix.

Here is my updated review for Papalote.

I took a good friend of mine who lives in Oakland, has a kid and never gets out of the house to the Mission.  We had an erreand to run but she was craving a good Mission Burrito.  Said friend is vegan, so I suggested Papalote, since they have tofu options, soyrizo, and vegan mole. 

We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.  So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!  Without drinks.  But whatever.  I tell her it's really good and I fork over some money.  So the food is brought out and I get the shrip and I say FUCK--what I really wanted was Prawns.  
Maybe it's due to me being an unsophisticted Mid-westerner, but I ordered shrimp not expecting them to be those tiney nasty thing but the big jumbo ones.  

I went to the counter and told the manager and he said tough luck.  I was kind of incredulous.  You think if someone has just spent a shitload of money--22 BUCKS for ONE MEAL at a fucking taqueria you could throw three prawns at them.  he was just an asshole and said you ordered wrong too bad.  So I walked back and spit out my WINE AND BUTTER soaked nasty ass shrimp that had no flavor.  

Then they brought the fajitas out and they gave us ONE tortilla and I was so pissed by then I couldn't even complain for fear they guy would be like--"well it only comes with one tortilla--tough."

So I left the place so pissed because I really wanted my FAVORITE taqueria to be my friend's favorite new place and maybe she would like it enough to come into the city more.

I was so upset that I decided to call the manager--who was the rude guy to complain--and guess what he was a dick then too.  I even told him that it was my favorite taqueria and instead of eating near my school in Potrero Hill sometimes--there are porbably 20 taqueria between it and Papalote I truck there.  

I was a regular customer--but that's what shitty customer service can do.  I'll miss you Papalote--or at least your PRAWNS.

I

**************************************************************************



At Papalote i like to order a plate with shrimp (STRIKE THIS APPARANTLY THEY ARE PRAWNS), beans, rice and guac.

That's it.

It's really good and filling.  It ends up being more expensive than an acutal burrito which is annoying.    However I keep ordering it like that, because that's how I like to eat it.

Their beans are the best--and vegan too which pleases many of my picky picky friends.  I like to take out and eat on the steps of the scary church with the big neon cross across Valencia Street.

excerpts: Now I just need to try some of their veggie/vegan options like tofu tacos or a soyrizo burrito (how awesome is it that they offer these things!?).
veggie.author: Stephanie P.
veggie.review:
Ohhhh baby I had some delish fish tacos for dinner last night. Sauteed in butter and wine, wrapped in soft corn tortillas with salsa fresca, sour cream and guacamole on top... hmm... I think I'm ready for Round 2.

I've been meaning to hit up Papalote for a while now, because it looked so damn cute. Forget cute - this place is scrumptious! The food tastes fresh, not heavy and greasy. In addition to my fish tacos, I had bites of a quesadilla, burrito, and chicken taco, so I got pretty good sampling of the menu. Now I just need to try some of their veggie/vegan options like tofu tacos or a soyrizo burrito (how awesome is it that they offer these things!?). As a self-proclaimed breakfast burrito connoisseur, breakfast offerings all day are also highly appreciated.

A definite new favorite for Mexican food in San Francisco.

excerpts: Only downer today was the chips were fried in either ollllld veggie oil or else meat oil.
Bleh.
Hey, Matt Gonzalez was there today for lunch.
That means something, right?
veggie.author: Melanie C.
veggie.review:
I think it's hard to balance Healthy Mexican with Soupy Zesty Rar Mexican, and Papalote I think is pretty dang good at it.  

Very fresh ingredients and yet still has that satisfying umph.

Lots of vegetarian choices, lean meats, succulent camarones, and that famous pureed salsa. Only downer today was the chips were fried in either ollllld veggie oil or else meat oil.  Bleh.

Hey, Matt Gonzalez was there today for lunch.  That means something, right?  :)

excerpts: Ordered the gaucamole and marinated veggie fajitas.
As for the veggie fajitas, the eggplant was not completely cooked and the veggies being marinated in the salsa made no difference to the taste of the vegetables at all.
veggie.author: Manjesh N.
veggie.review:
The best thing about this place - the salsa. It was spicy and very tasty. The rest of the food was average.

Ordered the gaucamole and marinated veggie fajitas. The guac was not that good - it needed more lime. 

As for the veggie fajitas, the eggplant was not completely cooked and the veggies being marinated in the salsa made no difference to the taste of the vegetables at all.

excerpts:
beef, chicken, soyrizo, veggie...

i liked the veggie the best.
veggie.author: Susy C.
veggie.review:
mad props for feeding my department on e-day.
the food was yummy, and not to mention we had a huge variety of it!
it was like a plethora of quesdillas, i was so happy.
beef, chicken, soyrizo, veggie...

i liked the veggie the best.
i haven't actually been inside the restaurant itself, my co-worker picked up the food and brought it back to work.

Papalote's, I SALUTE YOU! Thank you for supporting our hardworking department. =)

excerpts: Still, they're unique in their offerings; the chips are great, as is their in-house salsa; and not counting the usual beans, rice and salsa burrito, there are just too few mexican joints with such a large menu for the veggie crowd.
veggie.author: Marsha Z.
veggie.review:
I was never thrilled with their mole, and their breakfast burrito was way too salty for my tastes--possibly worse than Chipotle, which says a lot.  Still, they're unique in their offerings; the chips are great, as is their in-house salsa; and not counting the usual beans, rice and salsa burrito, there are just too few mexican joints with such a large menu for the veggie crowd.  

I've always considered Mariachi's, just a BART stop away, the place to satiate any vegetarian burrito craving in the Mission.  But Papalote is a close second.

excerpts: A friend gives raves to the veggie burrito.
veggie.author: Liz P.
veggie.review:
Everyone raves about the salsa and rightfully so.  Others bitch that  if you want extra, you pay extra.  Please, it's fifty cents more and worth every penny.  Unlike any other salsa I've tasted.  Hotness varies each visit.

I find the food hit or miss.  The carne asada is bland and tough.  Shrimp tacos are the same.  Tortillas are the stiff, packaged variety.

The chile verde is delicious and now my favorite item on the menu.  I've tasted the fish tacos and not a fishy taste or smell about them.  A friend gives raves to the veggie burrito.  The chilaquiles are divine.

Papalote is located in what I call N'mission -- on the edge of Noe and the Mission.  If you're not into kids, then beware of the Noe Stroller Set.  They can overtake the place with often times not so well-behaved children.  Or clueless parents.  And why oh why can't they leave their strollers on the sidewalk?  The place is tiny enough.

Only a few tables in the joint, so you usually have to hover over diners like a vulture and swoop in as soon as one is free.

excerpts: The veggie burrito, loaded with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots, is ama-to-the-zing.
Add a little Paplote original spicy sauce, and you've got yourself a tastebud explosion!
I love, love the sauce.
It's spicy and delightful, and whether you're putting it on chips, a veggie burrito, fish tacos, or carne asada, it's the bomb.
veggie.author: Lisa F.
veggie.review:
Who your papa? 

Say what? 

Who your papa?

PAPALOTE!!!! 

No, I wasn't a cheerleader in my past (or current life), but if eating at Paplote's somehow came down to cheerleading for a burrito, I would do it. Somehow I don't think one will ever have to don short skirts to eat here, but just for the record, I would. In a heartbeat. But anyway...

This is my favorite spot in the Mission (SF, for that matter) for a burrito. When I have visitors seeking culinary delights I take 'em here. The veggie burrito, loaded with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots, is ama-to-the-zing. Add a little Paplote original spicy sauce, and you've got yourself a tastebud explosion! I love, love the sauce. It's spicy and delightful, and whether you're putting it on chips, a veggie burrito, fish tacos, or carne asada, it's the bomb. 

Don't be put off by the line or the small size of the restaurant. I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to place my order, and believe you me, it's worth it no matter how long you wait. A little insider advice: call ahead and place your order to go. They make call-in orders quick snap. Before you know it,  you'll be lickin your paws clean after scarfing that delicious Papalote's treat.

excerpts:
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.
veggie.author: Cory C.
veggie.review:
So looking through the reviews for this restaurant, I do realize that the food is ok, and most of the time the service is good.

I called papolote to order some food for my boyfriend and I.  I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

We walked on down to the store a few minutes later to pick up the order.

"Hi, Im just here to pick up an Order for Cory"
"Oh Yes" she replies...
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

She begins to tell me that she didnt hear me on the phone say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

I was extremely confused.  Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  She was extremely rude and unappologetic, all the while rolling her eyes and talking to me like i was the iddiot.  

I work in the service industry, and if the order comes out wrong, whether or not it was the customers fault, you get them a new order no questions asked.  

I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

She turned to the woman working the other register and said something to her in Spanish, and the woman looked at her and said... JUST VOID IT.

I dont care about the price, it was all about principal.  ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

Over all a bad experience.  Maybe the woman was having a bad day, but for some reason i got the impression that she always acts like that.

THe food wasnt that great.  Ive had better from El Farolito down the street on Mission and 24th.

Watch out for the woman who works the register and doesnt wear a uniform.  Shes Crazy!

excerpts: I always get the veggie  fajitas or just a side of beans (BLACK REFRIED YESSS) and tofu
and I'm always happy and craving more.
veggie.author: haley d.
veggie.review:
I live pretty close  to  this spot.  I'm moving,  but let me tell you - I will be making as many trips here as I can afford. I always get the veggie  fajitas or just a side of beans (BLACK REFRIED YESSS) and tofu and I'm always happy and craving more. Luckilly, when my boyfriend isn't looking,  I steal bites from his burrito.  

The star off is for one of the counter girls.  She's so unpleasant and rude. Everyone  else is so  sweet  she really stands  out. If the beans weren't so good, I'd  throw them at her.

excerpts: Veggie burrito is awesome with lots of taste.
veggie.author: Maitai N.
veggie.review: Cheers for the great salsa:) Veggie burrito is awesome with lots of taste. Prawn tacos was not bad.

excerpts: Week one, we ordered the regular veggie but got the grilled veggie burrito.
Week two, the burrito labeled "VEGGIE" was actually the chicken burrito.
veggie.author: Sig N.
veggie.review: Here's the deal...if the service sucks, it doesn't matter how good the food is. Don't get me wrong, I think Papalote makes a quality product but two weeks in a row they've messed up the take out order. Week one, we ordered the regular veggie but got the grilled veggie burrito. Week two, the burrito labeled "VEGGIE" was actually the chicken burrito. Additionally, the chicken burrito was supposed to be super (which was on the receipt so we were charged) but was not. Sorry, Papalote, don't care if you beat Bobby Flay in throwdown. Tighten it up.

excerpts: I love that there are lots of other non-lard/veggie options
--that's the main reason to come here.
If you want a big fatty burrito, they are good here, but probably better elsewhere
veggie.author: Amy G.
veggie.review:
So Papalote is literally the closest restaurant to my house.  I admit to eating here at least once a week.  The fish tacos are fantastic.  I love that there are lots of other non-lard/veggie options--that's the main reason to come here.  If you want a big fatty burrito, they are good here, but probably better elsewhere and you don't need to go far...

People rave about the salsa, I personally am not into it.  Does it have cream in it?  My friend visiting from New York thought it tasted like Doritios--I agree.

excerpts: We ordered the bean dip, shrimp quesadilla, and veggie fajita, and besides the servings being on the skimpy side, there was just not much seasoning to any of it.
veggie.author: Kirsten L.
veggie.review:
Papalote is over rated and over priced. The small space, which otherwise is well decorated, quickly gets really loud. Also, for some odd reason I've been cold both time I've visited and kept my jacket on, which is always anti-relaxing to me. It enhances the in-and-out mode, but with those prices and the wait on the food we've had, it's seems like a paradox. Considering the decor too, I'd like to feel like sticking around and hanging out. 

The food is bland. We ordered the bean dip, shrimp quesadilla, and veggie fajita, and besides the servings being on the skimpy side, there was just not much seasoning to any of it.

It's the second time I'm back, and the second time I again got annoyed with the rushed service at the counter.

Next time, I'll remember to disagree on going to Papalote's...

excerpts: Veggie Burgers, Veggie Dogs, Soy Bacon
veggie.author: Matthew F.
veggie.review:
I fucking hate vegetarian "wannabe" food with a passion.
Veggie Burgers, Veggie Dogs, Soy Bacon; you can go fuck yourselves.

So I see and hear people rave about the soyrizo, and I am forced to try it.

Holy. Shit.

Better than any chorizo I've ever had. 
The Camarones (Shrimp) is light, blends nicely with the spices and rice, and just feels enjoyable to eat, perfect for not feeling like a sweaty piece of shit afterwards like most other Mexican places, which will keep you on the toilet so long you'll get new honeycombs on your jeans.

In fact, none of these burritos is going to weigh you down. 

The Mole is overcooked and has a strong basic taste in it. Meh.

They sell salsa by the pint in mason jars for $5.95, and I keep it constantly stocked in my fridge. It varies in spice from day to day, but no matter how hot it is, it's a crazy, unique, amazing salsa that I can't figure out the contents of.  Perfect for snacking, and can hold up it's own as a condiment against sriricha.

excerpts: i had the veggie burrito and the hubby had the shrimp burrito.
it lacked flavor and it was dry!
veggie.author: Sharon T.
veggie.review:
ummm, i'm gonna throw it out there. the burrito was seriously one of the worst burritos i've ever had. and i've eaten a lot of them!  i had the veggie burrito and the hubby had the shrimp burrito.  it lacked flavor and it was dry! the rice and beans were a bit crunchy. i mean c'mon....crunchy? dry? that's definitely how you f-up a burrito.

the only thing they have going for them is their sauces.  the salsa is super yummy and i can drink that stuff.  2 stars for the sauce....

i will say, 7x7 never lets me down, and they claim that the carne asada burrito here is one of the best. maybe i'll come back for the salsa and give papalote's another chance and try the carne asada burrito.

maybe it was an off day? either way, for now... thumbs down.

excerpts: I had ordered the grilled veggie burrito (great, by the way) and a side of chips and guacamole.
veggie.author: Amy Z.
veggie.review:
The first time I came here, to the Mission location, I had kind of a bad experience.

I had ordered the grilled veggie burrito (great, by the way) and a side of chips and guacamole. My friend was already seated with his chips and salsa when I sat down. One of the waiters came out from the kitchen almost immediately afterward with some guacamole and a small bowl of chips, and when he got to my table he unloaded the guac but turned right around with my chips still on the tray! When I asked the cashier, she told me that it's restaurant policy. To only serve one bowl of chips regardless of the number of diners and what they've ordered, such as CHIPS and guacamole? They give way too few chips per table. 

The salsa's amazing, though. Kind of like enchilada sauce.

The burritos are great: moist yet not drippy.

I still come here, I just don't order side dishes.

excerpts:
The vegan re-fried beans make for the best veggie burrito in the city. 
Portions are small but the salsa is unusually satisfying. 
The mom with the super round face who works the register is an angel.
 
The place is so busy and the ordering area / pantry is so small, it's hard not to get annoyed. 
Bring an appetizer and a magazine; the long wait is especially unbearable if your nut and twig vegan diet has your stomach to craving meat so badly that it starts digesting itself.
veggie.author: Puffy P.
veggie.review:
Burritos should not be vegan, but if your too stubborn to listen to reason, than go to Papalote.  The vegan re-fried beans make for the best veggie burrito in the city. 
Portions are small but the salsa is unusually satisfying. 
The mom with the super round face who works the register is an angel.
 
The place is so busy and the ordering area / pantry is so small, it's hard not to get annoyed. Bring an appetizer and a magazine; the long wait is especially unbearable if your nut and twig vegan diet has your stomach to craving meat so badly that it starts digesting itself.
