excerpts: They have so many vegetarian options, including the phenomenal grilled veggie burrito (potatoes and carrots!) and the equally amazing soyrizo burrito (soy chorizo!).
Make sure to order things "super" so that they come with sour cream/
They don't cook veggie stuff (beans, rice, vegetables) with lard, so all is fair game for vegetarians.
veggie.author: Claire K.
veggie.review:
Papalote is my favorite burrito place in the Bay Area by a long shot!  They have so many vegetarian options, including the phenomenal grilled veggie burrito (potatoes and carrots!) and the equally amazing soyrizo burrito (soy chorizo!).  Make sure to order things "super" so that they come with sour cream/guac/etc.  

They don't cook veggie stuff (beans, rice, vegetables) with lard, so all is fair game for vegetarians.  I love that the burritos are a bit healthier than the standard Mission taqueria, so I don't feel quite as terrible when I leave.

The salsa is fantastic--people come for the salsa alone!  The bean dip is yet another thing to rave about.  I love this place.  Best burritos ever.

excerpts: The salsa is awsome and I enjoyed everything I tried (carnitas tacos, prawn quesadilla and a bit of my friend's veggie burrito).
I will definitely go back.
veggie.author: Nicole M.
veggie.review: This place is absolutely delicious and it bustles. If you aren't too hungry, it worth the time you spend in line (and quite possibly waiting for a table). The salsa is awsome and I enjoyed everything I tried (carnitas tacos, prawn quesadilla and a bit of my friend's veggie burrito). I will definitely go back.

excerpts: One time I forgot to make my veggie burrito "super" and it kinda sucked w/o the sour cream and guac.
veggie.author: Sid D.
veggie.review:
Very fresh Mexican food with vegan beans and organic veggies and meat.  Word is already out about this place so the lines are super long.  Make sure to call ahead of time w/ your order and beat the crowd...

One time I forgot to make my veggie burrito "super" and it kinda sucked w/o the sour cream and guac.  They do always include good veggies like zucchini and eggplant tho!  And i LOOOOOOOVE their salsa.

excerpts: I've eaten there way too many times by now, and I actually don't think I've ever been disappointed by the food - so many veggie options!
veggie.author: Angela P.
veggie.review:
Papalote lives very close to me, and I'm so glad it's my neighbor!  Friendly people work there, and the burritos are so very, very tasty.  I've eaten there way too many times by now, and I actually don't think I've ever been disappointed by the food - so many veggie options!  Mmm soyrizo.  

Also wonderful are their 10 burrito cards - get ten punches and you are rewarded with a free burrito of any kind!  I typically keep at least three of these cards in my wallet at all times.

excerpts: I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore
so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.
The rice and bean burrito.
It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.
Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.
veggie.author: TeTeDaMouse C.
veggie.review:
Papalote is up there when it comes to delicious Mexican food.  It's definitely in the top three and funny, for the life of me, I don't know remember the names of the other two because I'm hazy from the glow of Papalote's deliciousness.  While the proximity of my next job location to Papalote wouldn't be the deciding factor in picking one job over the other, it would definitely be a perk.

Papalote is a restaurant where I don't miss meat as part of my meal.  Their vegan and vegetarian burritos are delicious.  I usually order my burrito with black beans, a whole wheat tortilla, and make it a super so I can have their delicious guacamole.  The cheese is nice too. I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.  The rice and bean burrito.  It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.  Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.  It's hard to describe; it's a bit smoky.  

I love me some Papalote!  If I was vegan or vegetarian, it wouldn't be hard because of Papalote.  I firmly believe the restaurant would get me through the hard times.

excerpts: I love the veggie tacos (potatoes, carrots, mushrooms in a corn tortilla).
Everything always tastes fresh.
veggie.author: Sharon G.
veggie.review:
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant ever.  The salsa is fabulous.  Too bad they give it to you in teeny tiny little containers and then charge you for more--  but hey, it's worth it.  I would probably sit there all day and eat chips and salsa if it was free.

I love the veggie tacos (potatoes, carrots, mushrooms in a corn tortilla).  Everything always tastes fresh.  I love that everything isn't smothered in cheese, either.  Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.) I even brought my mom here and she loved it, too!

And parking sucks, but that's to be expected.

excerpts: I had a mole which was delicious and my friend had a soy/veggie one which was spiced really well.
It was a decent price but a little more expensive
veggie.author: Michelle S.
veggie.review:
EXCELLENT burritos.  I had a mole which was delicious and my friend had a soy/veggie one which was spiced really well.  It was a decent price but a little more expensive then i am use to for a burrito.

Nice atmosphere, little space to sit and enjoy the meal.  It was PACKED when i was there.  I recommend this place especially if you like mexican food!

excerpts: Food was actually really good, I ordered the veggie burrito and the tofu tacos (gotta love my vegetarian ass!) - and they were both fabulous, washed it down with a guiness.
veggie.author: Bhumika K.
veggie.review:
Food was actually really good, I ordered the veggie burrito and the tofu tacos (gotta love my vegetarian ass!) - and they were both fabulous, washed it down with a guiness.  

Problem?  Why only 2-stars?  The service was shitty.  We went in at around 9pm, and the lady with the slick back hair told us 4 times they were trying to close up so we needed to hurry. 

Bitch, let me eat my paid for food in peace, the place closes at 10.

excerpts: I had the grilled veggie - eggplant and zucchini
burrito, which was really yummy.
Also, the salsa that they give you for your chips is amazing.
veggie.author: meagan m.
veggie.review:
Honestly, the food was really good. I had the grilled veggie - eggplant and zucchini burrito, which was really yummy. Also, the salsa that they give you for your chips is amazing. I was just upset when I asked for a small side of sour cream and they charged me $1.50 - then I looked on the menu, and a side of sour cream, guacamole and Cheese was listed as $.99, WTF? Whatever, I'm sure I'll be back because it was healthy and tasty, but they need to get their prices in order!!! Oh yeah, and get some larger water cups while you're at it. 

Thank you.

excerpts: I've pretty much only have had their Regular Veggie Burrito and gallons of their delicious & addicting house made salsa, but I love it!
It's a little crowded, especially in the front where you have to order.
That can be annoying sometimes, but once you eat the food you forget anyway.
veggie.author: Daffodil K.
veggie.review: I've pretty much only have had their Regular Veggie Burrito and gallons of their delicious & addicting house made salsa, but I love it! It's a little crowded, especially in the front where you have to order. That can be annoying sometimes, but once you eat the food you forget anyway.

excerpts: I was thinking that perhaps they were making the veggie stuff taste so good to make up for not having meat...
veggie.author: Phuong T.
veggie.review:
I gotta be honest: the first time I came here, I wasn't that impressed.  I had a standard burrito with carne asada, nothing to write home about.  

However, as a USF student, it's damn close to campus, so I made a second trip.  And I wasn't in the mood for anything too heavy this time around, so I had the eggplant and zucchini tacos.  DAMN.  Tastiest thing I've ever had in a tortilla.  I had it to go, so when I finally sat down to eat, the juices had split my tacos in half, making it impossible to hold, and I had no fork available.  However, it was so flavorful that I very quickly forgave the cooks at Papalote.

(I'm not vegetarian, btw.  I was thinking that perhaps they were making the veggie stuff taste so good to make up for not having meat... you know, to sell it to the carnivores, too.)

I got a little wiser by visit #3.  I ordered the eggplant and zucchini BURRITO this time.  And damn, that was satisfying.  Lasted me two meals!  And I didn't need a fork this time. :)  

Prices range from about $3-$7 for various items (thank god they accommodate for students).  I'm planning to make regular trips out there between classes.  Trip #4 will involve the marinated tofu at my classmate's suggestion.  

Oh yeah, and parking might be a pain.  Recommend the 1-hour street parking on Masonic or the Albertson's parking across the street (but you'll have to buy something from Albertson's to get it validated there, I think).

excerpts: the only one that thinks $8 for a super veggie burrito is pricey?
ok fine
maybe it's not THAT pricey but factor in my 30
+ minute wait time in the cold.
veggie.author: Ami V.
veggie.review:
maybe they forgot to put the crack in my burrito? not sure, but i was expecting more after many a friend ranted/raved about papalote. don't get me wrong...it was tasty, but I don't think it's anything to call home about. am i the only one that thinks $8 for a super veggie burrito is pricey? ok fine maybe it's not THAT pricey but factor in my 30+ minute wait time in the cold. (in fairness that was a rookie mistake since you can call ahead of time and wait in a shorter phone order only line).

i'd like to take this time to apologize to the taqueria around the corner from my house. after your affordable, no line, deliciousness, i'm so sorry i betrayed you.

excerpts: My only other complaint is that they use enough garlic in their veggie and seafood dishes it's practically sacrilegious.
veggie.author: Lauren G.
veggie.review:
Their smokey tasting salsa really is the shit and I can never get enough.  It is, that good.

I'm a big fan of choosing seafood options when going out for Mexican dining.  This is definitely where Papalote is lacking.  There are a good two prawns in their prawn tacos and the rest of the pico de gallo and lettuce they use, while it's quality and I do like that, it's just that it is basically what you end up getting full on, not shrimp.

Don't get me wrong, I do like this place - a lot, it's very good.

My only other complaint is that they use enough garlic in their veggie and seafood dishes it's practically sacrilegious.

However, this could be a great arsenal against an unwanted admirer/stalker . . . 

The burritos are good and the quesadilla are also, ask for their house salsa on everything, it really takes it up a notch.

excerpts: great veggie burrito, amazing salsa, great staff.
i come as often as i can.
veggie.author: Ryan L.
veggie.review:
usually a "dont beleive the hype" type, but the hype was spot on.
great veggie burrito, amazing salsa, great staff. 
i come as often as i can.

excerpts: My roommate recommended the grilled veggie burrito with Tofu.
Great suggestion.
veggie.author: Adam L.
veggie.review:
Their Salsa is legit...

People come here and just buy the salsa, which comes in a really cool jar. it's a bit pricey at 6.50 but worth every penny.  Also they are pretty stingy with the salsa that they give out for free. They serve it in one little cup at a time, but they will refill it over and over for you.

My roommate recommended the grilled veggie burrito with Tofu. Great suggestion. I'm a big meat lover but decided to go healthy and it paid off. 

Had a good dark bohemian beer to go with it. I prefer Modelo Negro, but they don't carry it. 
This was my first  Papalote experience, but I will deffintely return. 

Thank you Papalote.

excerpts: My now "veggie" burrito was very mediocre with all beans and rice, even though I ordered the "super" - which supposedly comes with cheese and guacamole.
Very disappointed.
And definitely NOT worth $10!!
Don't see what all the fuss is about.
Do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks to another Mexican joint.
There are plenty of them!
veggie.author: Tallulah J.
veggie.review: This place is a rip-off. I ordered a Carne Asada burrito. Had to wait about 20 minutes for my food - when the place wasn't even that full! When my burrito finally came, guess what? NO MEAT! WTF!? Are you kidding me? At first i just thought that the meat was in the middle and patiently worked my way to it, but was very disappointed to find nothing there. My now "veggie" burrito was very mediocre with all beans and rice, even though I ordered the "super" - which supposedly comes with cheese and guacamole. Very disappointed. And definitely NOT worth $10!! Don't see what all the fuss is about. Do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks to another Mexican joint. There are plenty of them!

excerpts: I was afraid of the idea of tofu or veggie burritos - and a mission food joint that uses No Lard....?
However, when I got to Papalote
I decided to try it rather than going with the meat.
It was fabulous, filled with grilled spiced eggplant and zucchini!
So tasty!
veggie.author: E R.
veggie.review:
I loved this place.  I was afraid of the idea of tofu or veggie burritos - and a mission food joint that uses No Lard....?  However, when I got to Papalote I decided to try it rather than going with the meat.  It was fabulous, filled with grilled spiced eggplant and zucchini!  So tasty!  I have to go back to try the fish tacos - I hear they're divine and maybe the fajitas...

It's crowded, there does always seem to be a line.  You can't sit until you've ordered, so by the time you get a seat your food is just about there and you don't have to deal with people squatting on tables who have not ordered yet - which I think is a good idea.

I was suprised by the price of the bottled beer, until I realized the beer was this gi-normous supersized bottle.

The price of the food is fair and the place is nice and clean especially for a place in the mission; )

excerpts: I have had three different burritos there  up to date (carne, veggie and something with fish) and they were good.
Not great though.
veggie.author: Jorge B.
veggie.review:
Nice, but a bit overrated.

I have had three different burritos there  up to date (carne, veggie and something with fish) and they were good. Not great though.

excerpts: Papalote's veggie nachos are fantastic.
veggie.author: Anabelle B.
veggie.review:
Yeah, I know, they are just nachos, but damn! Papalote's veggie nachos are fantastic. 

When I recommend this place to my co-workers, I say it's Mexican with a "twist", Potatoes and carrots in my burrito, wtf? But it works and I love it! I just wish they would serve more chips and salsa = ( oh well, I can live with a small portion.

excerpts: I've had the prawn tacos and the veggie burrito...
both very good.
I've also tried the tofu and it was delicious (my beef eating friends order it!).
Be careful if ordering a side of beans....
it's a whole plate!
And their guacamole is dang good if you just add a lil salt.
Also, the prices are ridiculously affordable.
Makes me not feel so bad for eating out instead of making my own dinner!
veggie.author: Shantal M.
veggie.review: The salsa alone deserves all the stars.  I ask for extra so I can bring it home and add it to my own dishes.  I've had the prawn tacos and the veggie burrito...both very good.  I've also tried the tofu and it was delicious (my beef eating friends order it!).  Be careful if ordering a side of beans....it's a whole plate! And their guacamole is dang good if you just add a lil salt.  Also, the prices are ridiculously affordable.  Makes me not feel so bad for eating out instead of making my own dinner!

excerpts: What: I ordered the Veggie Super Burrito, they ordered chicken fajitas, veggie burrito, and fish tacos.
When: Friday night.
Line was a little long and seating limited, but it went fast....
Eat fast as well as people are waiting and watching you eat.
Why: I guess my expectations were a little high for this place, since Bobby Flay lost!
I didnt expect it to be as fast food-ish and fast eating!
I thought it was a sit down, and order type of place, but turned out to be order at the counter and if you want to eat there, wait for a seat.
Besides that point, the food was great.
The salsa was definitely worth talking about after as well as
the size of the portions- huge!
4 stars only because ambiance was more of a to-go place, vs eat there place.
veggie.author: R P.
veggie.review:
Who: Double date.
What: I ordered the Veggie Super Burrito, they ordered chicken fajitas, veggie burrito, and fish tacos.
When: Friday night. Line was a little long and seating limited, but it went fast....Eat fast as well as people are waiting and watching you eat.
Why: I guess my expectations were a little high for this place, since Bobby Flay lost! I didnt expect it to be as fast food-ish and fast eating! I thought it was a sit down, and order type of place, but turned out to be order at the counter and if you want to eat there, wait for a seat. Besides that point, the food was great. The salsa was definitely worth talking about after as well as the size of the portions- huge! 4 stars only because ambiance was more of a to-go place, vs eat there place.

excerpts: All right, but I'd rather have a $3 taco truck veggie burrito than one of these.
veggie.author: Ryan C.
veggie.review: All right, but I'd rather have a $3 taco truck veggie burrito than one of these. Yes, the salsa is great, so maybe I would go here and just get chips and salsa. We got the chile verde burrito and the soyrizo burrito. I suppose they deserve props for offering lots of vegetarian options to wean people off meat. The chile verde was just all right--big hunks of slightly dry and stringy meat in a not very flavorful sauce; the soyrizo spicy and as you might expect; both burritos running over with no structural integrity--the kind of SF burrito that ordinarily is wrapped in foil, but perhaps they are trying to avoid the foil here and so you eat it with knife and fork.

excerpts: Great food, but they raised their prices a few months ago and now to get a veggie burrito with tofu and made super (guacamole, sour cream & cheese-an additional $.99)
I'm sorry, but I can't pay that for a burrito.
I used to get out the door for $11.
and that was doable,
but $15. for a medium sized burrito is just ridiculous.
Haven't gone back since.
If price is not an issue to you though, the food is very tasty.
veggie.author: Gaea W.
veggie.review: Great food, but they raised their prices a few months ago and now to get a veggie burrito with tofu and made super (guacamole, sour cream & cheese-an additional $.99) it's $15 ! I'm sorry, but I can't pay that for a burrito. I used to get out the door for $11. and that was doable, but $15. for a medium sized burrito is just ridiculous. Haven't gone back since. If price is not an issue to you though, the food is very tasty.

excerpts: And their veggie burrito is simple but incredible.
I prefer it SUPER!
veggie.author: Heather E.
veggie.review:
The best salsa ever!

And their veggie burrito is simple but incredible.  I prefer it SUPER!

excerpts:
here's the 411. 
+ good vegan and veggie opinions 
+ chips are made fresh there

+ salsa = spicy goodness, bold, flavorful 
+ soy chirizo
veggie.author: Jocelyn T.
veggie.review:
oh my gosh. AMAZING! i have been asking people where their favorite taqueria is and majority have pointed me in this direction. 

okay, i'm not sure how the burritos are since i'm a taco girl [FYI, when you order tacos, you get two - no choice, so that's why they're only about $1 cheaper than a burrito]. BUT, i'm sure the burritos are as delicious. i'm salivating just writing this review! 

here's the 411. 
+ good vegan and veggie opinions 
+ chips are made fresh there
+ salsa = spicy goodness, bold, flavorful 
+ soy chirizo = AMAZING...tastes like meat 

- the wait can be a little long to order and getting your food [but SO worth it] 
+ you can call and order for pick-up to avoid lines 

the decor is actually nice and hip - i want to say. it's a great place to sit and catch up [when it's not so busy which is rare]. however, it's nice to be close your neighbors so you can see what they're having and usually cute folks are there! : ) so it's not so bad sitting close to them and their friends! haha. but seriously, it does seem filled with young hipster-ish folks. 

i can't wait to go back because i seriously want to try every filling off their menu for tacos/burritos [minus, the beef and pork stuff, of course].

excerpts: I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself.
Have never had a burrito here
veggie.author: Grace S.
veggie.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: I went to Papalote after reading the review in one of the free papers, which praised the healthy cooking and number of the veggie options.
veggie.author: Amelia I.
veggie.review:
I went to Papalote after reading the review in one of the free papers, which praised the healthy cooking and number of the veggie options. I was particularly intrigued by the 'soyrizo', as I used to love chorizo before I stopped eating sausages, burgers, and all those other products made with mashed up scrag ends of meat.

I ordered the soyrizo burrito to eat in. At least, I think I ordered the soyrizo burrito, but I'm not entirely sure that the server understood what I said, and the burrito I received didn't seem to contain anything immediately identifiable as soyrizo. It did contain a bland mixture of rice, beans, tomatoes and onions, but I was expecting that. At least the salsa that came with it was tasty, although it didn't make up for the burrito disappointment. If I go back, I might try ordering soyrizo as a side. If I get a plate with nothing on it, I'll know that they're just making it up!

excerpts: The veggie burrito is also unique and tastes great with black beans.
veggie.author: Brian S.
veggie.review:
This is not your average SF Mexican food restaurant, so if you like dirty greasy burritos this is not for you.  You can find that type at El Farolito or Can Cun which I also love.  

But this is a level above, it fresh and veg friendly.  So skip the regular burrito and try the mole its by far the best I have had.  The veggie burrito is also unique and tastes great with black beans.

And as everyone mentioned the salsa is great and they DO sell it by the jar.

excerpts: I had the veggie, which I completely loved.
The triple threat wasnt my choice that day, but it looked monstrously delish as well.
The owner was nearby,  playing with daughter while we ate, making sure we were enjoying our meal, etc... def a must hit if you're in the area!
I can see why they won the throwdown!!
veggie.author: Mia A.
veggie.review: After the won against Bobby Flay, we decided to check it out.  Parking is weak, but keep in mind that you're in the city & its like that just about EVERYWHERE!  Once we got inside, everyone was super friendly, chatting with customers & joking around, offer food suggestions & making you feel welcome.  The food was delicious!  I had the veggie, which I completely loved.  The triple threat wasnt my choice that day, but it looked monstrously delish as well.  The owner was nearby,  playing with daughter while we ate, making sure we were enjoying our meal, etc... def a must hit if you're in the area!  I can see why they won the throwdown!!

excerpts: Also, for a cheap and healthy option Taqueria Cancun is amazing for a veggie burrito.
However, if you're willing to spend the extra couple of dollars here you wont' be disappointed.
This is absolutely delightful!
I highly recommend it.
veggie.author: Sashy R.
veggie.review: Try the soyrizo burrito adding potatoes. Make sure the potatoes are cooked all the way through ask for them crispy. This is about as good as it gets when it comes to burritos. B.C. burrito in Hawaii is amazing as well. Also, for a cheap and healthy option Taqueria Cancun is amazing for a veggie burrito. However, if you're willing to spend the extra couple of dollars here you wont' be disappointed. This is absolutely delightful! I highly recommend it.

excerpts: My friend ordered the Veggie Burrito, which was okay.
The owner is very nice.
I am definitely coming back to this place : )
veggie.author: Ces T.
veggie.review: We ordered the Triple Threat Burrito and Chicken Adobo Burrito.The Triple Threat was good but i think the Chicken Adobo Burrito is the Winner Burrito.I am pinay and his Adobo passed the Adobo test with flying colors, I should say the Adobo Burrito is a pretty good idea,i love it! My friend ordered the Veggie Burrito, which was okay. The owner is very nice.I am definitely coming back to this place : )

excerpts: I enjoy the veggie or shrimp burritos/ tacos.
The salsa/chips are perfect.
They serve beer.
It;s usually crowded but worth the wait.
veggie.author: Heidi L.
veggie.review: This place is fantastic!! I enjoy the veggie or shrimp burritos/ tacos. The salsa/chips are perfect. They serve beer. It;s usually crowded but worth the wait.

excerpts: Another time i got veggie fajitas and it did not dissapoint.
the only thing that sucks is that the two times i've gone i've had to get it to go
because its virtually IMPOSSIBLE to get seating here, a bunch of middle aged hipsters who think they are still young take up the enitre space.
Shouldn't they be eating somewhere like a fancy steakhouse?
veggie.author: Peeta B.
veggie.review: Yum,this place is good. I had one of thier vegeterian quesadillas, it had squash and i forget what else. But they gave me some kind of salsa and lord, that salsa was bomb. Another time i got veggie fajitas and it did not dissapoint. the only thing that sucks is that the two times i've gone i've had to get it to go because its virtually IMPOSSIBLE to get seating here, a bunch of middle aged hipsters who think they are still young take up the enitre space.Shouldn't they be eating somewhere like a fancy steakhouse?

excerpts: Plus their veggie burritos come with carrots and potatoes in replacement of sour cream and cheese.
But of course you can add the fats if you want...
just ask to "super" your meal.
The prawn burrito is my favorite, but the veggie fajitas (eggplant, zucchini, carrots, etc.) are satisfying if you're really hungry.
The only downside about this place is the wait, because sometimes the lines are out-
the- door, which really sucks when you make the commute
and there's no where to sit.
So plan accordingly if you go at night.
veggie.author: Leah E.
veggie.review:
Best salsa I've ever had in my life, and TRUST, I have had many a salsa to compare, being a San Diegan and a Mexican food enthusiast. 
Papalote is healthy, fresh, flavorful, and unique. They offer black beans and whole wheat tortillas for crying out loud! Plus their veggie burritos come with carrots and potatoes in replacement of sour cream and cheese. But of course you can add the fats if you want... just ask to "super" your meal. The prawn burrito is my favorite, but the veggie fajitas (eggplant, zucchini, carrots, etc.) are satisfying if you're really hungry.
The only downside about this place is the wait, because sometimes the lines are out- the- door, which really sucks when you make the commute and there's no where to sit. So plan accordingly if you go at night.

excerpts: Papalote, a hipsterized taqueria with colorful walls and an impressive array of veggie options (mmm...soyrizo), is clearly a darling of the Mission scene.
Even in the middle of the afternoon with half the tables empty, there was a takeout line going out the door.
But I have to go with Maria D on this one:    you're paying for this trendiness with small portions.
Otherwise, I'll stick to the authentic taquerias for my burrito fix--soyrizo or no.
veggie.author: Wes M.
veggie.review: Papalote, a hipsterized taqueria with colorful walls and an impressive array of veggie options (mmm...soyrizo), is clearly a darling of the Mission scene.  Even in the middle of the afternoon with half the tables empty, there was a takeout line going out the door.  But I have to go with Maria D on this one:    you're paying for this trendiness with small portions.  Like my prawn burrito with hardly any prawns in it.  And yes, that creamy orange salsa is awesome, but you have to pay extra for chips & salsa, and even then you only get a tiny bowl of chips.  I could get the same delicious sauce by ordering the fajitas at El Toreador in West Portal.  Otherwise, I'll stick to the authentic taquerias for my burrito fix--soyrizo or no.

excerpts: I must say that their veggie burritos are full of wrong (carrots in a burrito?)
but everything else is jam-packed full of good.
They're not fast, but damn are they quality.
Fresh ingredients (take that like man-whore Baja Fresh) makes this a taqueria I'll keep coming back to.
veggie.author: Chris M.
veggie.review: I must say that their veggie burritos are full of wrong (carrots in a burrito?) but everything else is jam-packed full of good.  They're not fast, but damn are they quality.  Fresh ingredients (take that like man-whore Baja Fresh) makes this a taqueria I'll keep coming back to.

excerpts: skeptical because of the hype, but that super veggie burrito is on point. and that salsa...
damn
veggie.author: Monika S.
veggie.review: skeptical because of the hype, but that super veggie burrito is on point. and that salsa... damn

excerpts: Love the fish tacos, fish burritos, super veggie burrito, and the breakfast is slammin too.
Huevos rancheros, yum.
If you don't like this place, something is wrong with you.
Oh, they are sticklers about the salsa, you get one cup, and they will charge you extra for more, so be prepared, but it is totally worth it.
veggie.author: Brooke A.
veggie.review: Salsa is one word, ORGASMIC!!! I absolutely love this place. I have even bought a whole jar of that heavenly salsa. Love the fish tacos, fish burritos, super veggie burrito, and the breakfast is slammin too. Huevos rancheros, yum. If you don't like this place, something is wrong with you. Oh, they are sticklers about the salsa, you get one cup, and they will charge you extra for more, so be prepared, but it is totally worth it.

excerpts: I discovered today if you ask for a veggie burrito it comes with potatoes and carrots as well as rice and beans.
It was just too much and I won't order it again.
But for the most part I've had excellent luck here.
veggie.author: anne m.
veggie.review: This place is good because it's healthy mexican, not too greasy and not overly salty. Overseasoned Mexican is NOT good!  I really like their salsa but to me it's more like a sauce or sofrito.  Good and spicey.  I discovered today if you ask for a veggie burrito it comes with potatoes and carrots as well as rice and beans.  It was just too much and I won't order it again.  But for the most part I've had excellent luck here.  Their grilled chicken burrito is fantastic.  They are a couple of bucks more than your average taqueria but it's worth it.

excerpts: also, i love their refried black beans and they have plenty of veggie options.
veggie.author: maggie m.
veggie.review:
at first, i really didn't want to like this place because of the lines and sometimes annoying customers (you know, the dudes with skinny jeans and 80s style haircuts). but they've never disappointed me.  my favorite is the prawn burrito.  also, i love their refried black beans and they have plenty of veggie options.  only four stars because my burritos could always use an extra prawn or two.  plus, i don't think they need to charge for an extra side of hot sauce- considering, its about 3 tablespoons of sauce. 

the best times to go are before or after the lunch/dinner rush.  you will easily find a place to sit and maybe your food will be prepared with an extra amount of tlc.

excerpts: It was exactly what I should have expected to arrive in the Mission: a veggie/vegan friendly, catering to the non-latino population, hipster spot.
Then one night my brother suggested we go there (who happens to fit into the above said catagory), and I figured what the hell.
What the hell!
This place is great!
My husband was almost drinking the table salsa, and every dish we got was scrumptious.
And hey, even vegan, white, hipsters need a place to eat too.
Ive beenback a couple of times since, and it's consistantly been good.
veggie.author: Mollie M.
veggie.review: When I first spotted this place, i had to laugh. It was exactly what I should have expected to arrive in the Mission: a veggie/vegan friendly, catering to the non-latino population, hipster spot. Then one night my brother suggested we go there (who happens to fit into the above said catagory), and I figured what the hell. What the hell! This place is great! My husband was almost drinking the table salsa, and every dish we got was scrumptious. And hey, even vegan, white, hipsters need a place to eat too. Ive beenback a couple of times since, and it's consistantly been good.

excerpts: But they had this AMAZING roasted veggie and tofu mole burrito that I still dream about 6 years later.
Botano is no longer, but Papalote is as close as I'll get until Cynthia and Tony open up a new place.
veggie.author: Lauren D.
veggie.review: Tofu mole...  My first apartment in the city was on Haight between Fillmore and Webster, right above a club called The Top.  Every night my floor shook.  And there were drive by shootings on a pretty regular basis.  But the upside was a wonderful burrito joint called Botana.  Authentic?  Probably not.  But they had this AMAZING roasted veggie and tofu mole burrito that I still dream about 6 years later.  Botano is no longer, but Papalote is as close as I'll get until Cynthia and Tony open up a new place.

excerpts: as a vegetarian for the month of march, i tried the veggie burrito, and it far exceeded any expectations i had.
grilled zuccini, eggplant and mushroom (worth the extra $1)
veggie.author: stephanie w.
veggie.review:
as a vegetarian for the month of march, i tried the veggie burrito, and it far exceeded any expectations i had. grilled zuccini, eggplant and mushroom (worth the extra $1) - delicious, i ate myself silly and regretted it after, but it was delicious. 

can't speak to the rest, but will def go back in april to try.

excerpts: And the veggie options are actually decent and extensive which is good if you have lots of whiny vegetarian friends
like I do.
But the meaty things?
Try somewhere else.
veggie.author: patrick g.
veggie.review: Word up on the fish tacos which are better than most. And the veggie options are actually decent and extensive which is good if you have lots of whiny vegetarian friends like I do. But the meaty things? Try somewhere else.

excerpts: I get the veggie burrito which has potatoes and carrots with black beans.
And I love it.
Also, I am oddly obsessed with the small portion of cucumber citrus salad they serve on the side.
I think it's because it's such a small amount
and you don't seem to be able to order a large serving of it.
I can only dream...
veggie.author: Sharon T.
veggie.review: I go to Papalote when I want something that's kinda burrito-esque, but not quite a super authentic Mexican burrito. I get the veggie burrito which has potatoes and carrots with black beans. And I love it. Also, I am oddly obsessed with the small portion of cucumber citrus salad they serve on the side. I think it's because it's such a small amount and you don't seem to be able to order a large serving of it. I can only dream...

excerpts: I love the veggie burrito.
The salsa is as great as everyone says.
The service is great.
Everything is always fresh.
It's awesome to finally have a good Mexican restaurant with some veggie food other than the ole "vegetarian burrito".
And of course, the salsa is amazing.
It's like velvet.
veggie.author: Jennifer C.
veggie.review: Living a 1/2 block from Papalote is dangerous, very dangerous. I've got my intake down to about twice a week.  My regulars are the soyrizo burrito and the tofu mole burrito.  It's awesome to finally have a good Mexican restaurant with some veggie food other than the ole "vegetarian burrito".  And of course, the salsa is amazing. It's like velvet.  The only downsides are (1) the soyrizo is super salty and makes me really freakin thirsty (2) they charge $1 for extra chips (3) $.50 for extra salsa (4) the long lines (5) the front door doesn't close and its always freezing.  But other than that !!!  its pretty amazing.

excerpts: The first time I went, I got a veggie potato burro thing with soyrizo.
This was amazing.
Period.
The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.
The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.
veggie.author: Nathan M.
veggie.review:
I visited San Francisco to run the marathon in August.  A friend from Phoenix had recommended that I swing by Papalote to get some assuredly delicious vegan mole.  I ended up going here twice, and forgoing some of the other places that were recommended to me.  In other words, the food was so good that I skipped out on seeing some places that I may not ever get a chance to see again.

The first time I went, I got a veggie potato burro thing with soyrizo.  This was amazing.  Period.  Super delicious.

The second time, I had the vegan mole burro with a side of guacamole.  The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.  I mean, it wasn't bad, but it didn't taste freshly prepared.

So, the food was delicious, but the store itself sucks.  It was packed out the door both times we went, preventing any possibility of actually sitting down to eat.  The first time we went, it was like 3pm on a Saturday, and the second time was abour 1pm on a Monday.  Weird times to be so completely busy.  It was really loud as well, and I could barely hear the server girl who was very frustrating to work with anyways.  She was just sort of rude, and kept turning around and joking with the grill guys while I was trying to order, then gave me attitude when I corrected her inaccurate record of my order.  I don't know, it just added stress to something that should be delicious and stress free (mexican food).  Oh, also, the bathroom is sort of gross, and they keep all of their produce in the common area where a thousand dirty hipsters assuredly wipe their gross hands all over my delicious cucumbers and tomatoes.  It HAS to be against some sort of health code to store produce in the area where people stand in line to order.  Right?  

So, four stars because the food was excellent.  Would have been five if the girl wasn't such a biatch, or if the place was like one square foot larger.

Go here, but get take out.

excerpts: The grilled veggie tacos where delicious.
I had never had grilled eggplant and zucchini in a taco before, but I will be coming back here for more!
veggie.author: Julie F.
veggie.review: The grilled veggie tacos where delicious. I had never had grilled eggplant and zucchini in a taco before, but I will be coming back here for more! They also put cheese, sour cream, and guacamole on it if you'd like. It was so good, I can't wait to try other things on the menu. The wait for a table and food was pretty long, but it was cinco de mayo, so it was probably abnormally long. I have a feeling this place is generally pretty busy, and for good reason.

excerpts: I ordered the super veggie burritos which comes with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots.
I thought putting potatoes in a burrito was unusual until I tried it.
veggie.author: reena p.
veggie.review: Papalote is a great taqueria for vegetarians and healthful eaters! You can order burritos, quesadillas, and tacos with grilled veggies or tofu.  I ordered the super veggie burritos which comes with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots.  I thought putting potatoes in a burrito was unusual until I tried it.  There veggies are not bland at all! There was some serious garlic action in their veggies!  You also get free chips and salsa.  There salsa is super tasty too.

excerpts: That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo.
I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago.
That's how amazing the Chile Verde is.
It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh.
The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.
veggie.author: Lawrence S.
veggie.review:
I've always considered the burrito to be the perfect culinary invention: every food group delightfully wrapped in a tight, nutritional envelope. And even though Burritos and Tacos and Quesadillas don't really showcase the true sophistication of Mexican cuisine, sometimes you just want that massive hunk of goodness in your belly. That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo. I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago. That's how amazing the Chile Verde is. It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh. And unlike other "healthy" burrito options, like those found at Whole Foods, Papalote doesn't try to foist a dry tortilla sandwich off on you.

n.b. The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.

excerpts: Minus one star for the veggie tacos which had no toppings save the vegetables.
Later saw that the menu said we could add the sour cream and guac if we wanted.
But you woulda thought the cashier would have mentioned this to us when we ordered?
Will be back to try these again, and the nachos as well.
But still not completely sold.
veggie.author: Purnima M.
veggie.review: They make a five star mole, even when combined with grilled and marinated tofu. This sounded suspicioud but tasted surprisingly good. These guys also make a stellar salsa, hot and spicy, but so different from anything else I've tried. Minus one star for the veggie tacos which had no toppings save the vegetables. Later saw that the menu said we could add the sour cream and guac if we wanted. But you woulda thought the cashier would have mentioned this to us when we ordered? Will be back to try these again, and the nachos as well. But still not completely sold.

excerpts: I started off getting their veggie burritos, which come with carrots, potatoes and mushrooms.
I was a little indifferent about the thought of eating a burrito with carrots, but OMG!!!
veggie.author: Amber Y.
veggie.review: I just absolutely love this place! Their burritos are so damn good, there are no words that can describe the ecstasy that my mouth goes through when I'm eating one. I started off getting their veggie burritos, which come with carrots, potatoes and mushrooms. I was a little indifferent about the thought of eating a burrito with carrots, but OMG!!! And since I can't give up the delicious seasoning in the soyrizo burrito, I order the soyrizo with all veggies. I get the best of both. And no, I am not a vegetarian by any means... I just don't do meat in my burritos. It's one of my many food oddities. I haven't tried anything else but the burritos, however, I know I don't need to to give them the 5 stars they deserve. They are always friendly and quick with my orders (I order to-go with my co-workers just about every other Sunday) and they always get them right. Their chips aren't greasy, like many other taqueria chips are, and although they don't have chunky salsa, their hot sauce is so delicious and has a great spice to it. They have a different style to how they make their food: Their menu is not as typical as most taquerias. It is very unique and special. Oh, and one more thing....they have refried black beans!

excerpts: And a delicious nutritious super veggie for under 5 bucks!
With vegan refried beans!
veggie.author: Kiren K.
veggie.review:
I'd heard all the reviews and finally decided to try it for myself. 

I'm in love with Papalote!

 From the first delicious bite to the last. The salsa is amazing. Some kind of (tomato creamy) wonderful. Don't let my weird description deter you! It's good. And a delicious nutritious super veggie for under 5 bucks! With vegan refried beans! I'm going back tonight.  

To be fair, seating can be scarce. :/

excerpts: Just called to order in advance, ate my veggie burrito and many chips...
it was easy, tasty, and I don't feel like I ate a heavy meal.
I did have higher expectations for the veggie burrito based on the reviews but wasn't blown away by it.
I will be back to try more!
veggie.author: Debbie Y.
veggie.review: Just called to order in advance, ate my veggie burrito and many chips...it was easy, tasty, and I don't feel like I ate a heavy meal.  I did have higher expectations for the veggie burrito based on the reviews but wasn't blown away by it.  I will be back to try more!

excerpts:
if you're veggie, they have veggie food for you...
small dining area if you want to eat at the  place, but it's pretty full of young kids who don't seem to take showers often...
veggie.author: charlotte s.
veggie.review:
the food's tasty but if i'm craving taqueria food, somehow it doesn't really satisfy me..  maybe it's the lack of manteca in their beans or something.
if you're veggie, they have veggie food for you...
small dining area if you want to eat at the  place, but it's pretty full of young kids who don't seem to take showers often...

excerpts: Perhaps because it is veggie friendly?
Maybe I should have ordered something vegetarian?
MD and I each ordered a quesadilla.
veggie.author: Miss Information X.
veggie.review: I didn't think that the food was that great.  It's clean and bright and the serivice is just fine.  I just fail to understand how there could be lines out the door of this place. Perhaps because it is veggie friendly?  Maybe I should have ordered something vegetarian?  MD and I each ordered a quesadilla.  MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.  The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.  Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy. There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper) Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.

excerpts: Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for.
veggie.author: B V.
veggie.review: My wife and I LOVE this place. We won't eat burritos anywhere else. 'Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for. The wonderful thing is that puppies aren't 80% rice and beans, so it's taste heaven. We live on the other side of the Mission, while there are many places closer than Papalote's, in 4 years we haven't yet found a replacement...

excerpts: One of the better burrito spots, some good veggie options.
Going with a friend who can't eat a whole burrito, get the nachos and 1 burrito to share.
The creamy salsa is fantastic.
veggie.author: annie s.
veggie.review: One of the better burrito spots, some good veggie options. Going with a friend who can't eat a whole burrito, get the nachos and 1 burrito to share. The creamy salsa is fantastic.

excerpts: Amazing super veggie burrito.
Amazing salsa.
My favorite burrito in SF.
This is a special place.
veggie.author: Dan M.
veggie.review: Amazing super veggie burrito. Amazing salsa. My favorite burrito in SF. This is a special place.

excerpts: This place is a special treat, the veggie burrito is the best and the salsa is fantastic!
veggie.author: John W.
veggie.review: This place is a special treat, the veggie burrito is the best and the salsa is fantastic!

excerpts: In this paradise of Mexican food establishments, Papalote still draws crowds every night for its veggie/vegan options and generally healthier menu.
For delicious fattening burritos, I'll head down the block to El Farolito, but for my average weeknight the tofu or grilled veggie burrito is essential.
Also - try phoning ahead for to-go orders, there's a shortage of standing-around room.
veggie.author: Emily B.
veggie.review: In this paradise of Mexican food establishments, Papalote still draws crowds every night for its veggie/vegan options and generally healthier menu. For delicious fattening burritos, I'll head down the block to El Farolito, but for my average weeknight the tofu or grilled veggie burrito is essential. Also - try phoning ahead for to-go orders, there's a shortage of standing-around room.

excerpts: Awesome veggie burritos.
They have a veggie SoyRIZO burrito that is too good for words.
veggie.author: Matthew T.
veggie.review: This place is simply great!  Awesome veggie burritos.  They have a veggie SoyRIZO burrito that is too good for words.  They serve chicken that is grilled to perfection and among the best quality I could have hoped for.  The kicker here is the homemade salsa.  I know you're thinking Salsa?!  But, this is special and you have to try it to know how awesome it is.  They do charge a little more than your normal burrito shack.  But, it is worth every penny.  It is too bad that they do not deliver.  Other than the wait to order this place has no down sides.

excerpts: Yummy veggie options.
veggie.author: Leah P.
veggie.review: This is the place to go when you want a good, healthy burrito, and still want to be able to walk with all pants buttons in place afterwards.  Great salsa for sure!  Yummy veggie options.

excerpts: I liked the grilled veggie burrito, for what it was...
but it really wasn't "burrito-y" enough for me.
I don't really know what that means, but there you have it.
Good, clean atmosphere.
veggie.author: Tovah S.
veggie.review: Yes, it's true about the salsa.  Quite delicious.  My four-year-old date very much enjoyed the yellow dragon hovering above our table.  I liked the grilled veggie burrito, for what it was... but it really wasn't "burrito-y" enough for me.  I don't really know what that means, but there you have it.    Good, clean atmosphere.

excerpts: Love the Grilled Veggie Burrito.
Papalote's phone number is in my address book for a reason.
veggie.author: Kristen Y.
veggie.review: Love the Grilled Veggie Burrito. Papalote's phone number is in my address book for a reason.

excerpts: anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito.
bad move on my part.
the burrito was dry and had no flavour.
to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go?
i was very confused - considering i
JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago
and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant.
so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream.
veggie.author: James J.
veggie.review:
not too sure if this place is as cracked up as people say it is. BUT i think i didn't order the right things though. it was my first time here on Sunday and my expectations were high - considering all of my friends rave about this place. first of all, i didn't know their burritos came with no cheese. however, that was probably more my fault considering i was a little slow and hungover to really read the fine print and ask any questions. anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito. bad move on my part. the burrito was dry and had no flavour. to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go? i was very confused - considering i JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant. so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream. REALLY? 

so anyways my gf got soyrizo tacos and they were ok, but she actually makes a better one than they do. i enjoyed the "complimentary" side of chips and salsa, but i agree with some other reviewers on here, why are you so stingy on the salsa? if i go back and ask for more, are you gonna charge me $2? the salsa isn't your typical chunky tomato-wee cilantro type - it's more like a tomato-wee creamy kind. not much zip to it, but still good.

anyways, i'm thinking i didn't order the right thing from here because my friends seem to know good food. i'm thinking i need to quit being a pussy and order a burrito with meat in it - most probably carnitas! mmm ...

excerpts: Try the super veggie with a spinach wrap!!!
Best food, and fills you up!
veggie.author: Mel D.
veggie.review: Try the super veggie with a spinach wrap!!! Best food, and fills you up!

excerpts: Great vegetarian options (grilled veggie burrito is a favorite).
Whole wheat tortillas are really good.
veggie.author: John B.
veggie.review:
Delicious food that keeps us coming back once a week.  Great vegetarian options (grilled veggie burrito is a favorite).  Whole wheat tortillas are really good.  The salsa is one-of-a-kind and irresistible.

We normally phone ahead and give it an extra 5-10 minutes, because there's always a wait.  Recently, we got some salsa that was not even close to the normal stuff.  New cook? Out of ingredients? What gives?  Even still, this is our standby neighborhood restaurant, quite delicious but don't expect authentic Mexican.

excerpts: The burritos are fine, Ive tried the carne asada, shrimp and the veggie.
That's with pinto beans and guacamole.
veggie.author: Roger W.
veggie.review:
The best thing about this place is that it feels really good to be in there. I love Mexican food, but there aren't many Mexican restaurants in the Mission that I enjoy spending any real time in. The restaurant is cute and nicely designed. Its colorful and small, but feels more cozy then crammed. The place is clean and, though it has the elements of other burrito spots around here-- you order at the counter, no servers, small place with a community vibe, it doesn't feel thrown together like other places. Its more of a spot I would go with a date I wanted to impress or didn't know very well, then the place I seek out late night when I want to stuff my face with a group of also drunk friends. 

The food is good but, like a lot of Mexican restaurants, it lacks anything really distinguishing. EXCEPT, the salsa is super good. I feel the urge to repeat that last sentence. I live really close to Papalote and, on the day I moved in, two separate friends brought up the Mexican restaurant near by with the awesome salsa. The shrimp tacos were nice. The shrimp grilled in white wine and garlic. They are plated on a couple of open soft tacos with crunchy lettuce and pico de gallo, and taste very fresh. They were even better when I dumped the salsa all over them. The burritos are fine, Ive tried the carne asada, shrimp and the veggie. That's with pinto beans and guacamole. All were good, but not wet enough for my taste. 

The staff are friendly. I came in with a group of friends the other night, and one of the guys put himself out for a little bit trying to reorganize tables so we could sit. 

The place is pricier than its competitors, but you pay for the package. Or maybe you pay for the salsa (which, on a side note, I'm pretty sure you can buy on its own to carry out).

excerpts: I think the food is really pretty good, and I appreciate that they have veggie options.
However, I'm a little put off by the prices.
I think they're on the high side, and they charge you extra for a little tub of salsa.
I mean, come on.
I always grit my teeth when i'm picking up a to-go burrito from there and only get a couple of singles back from my $10 bill.
Since when is a burrito not around $5-6?
veggie.author: Ann F.
veggie.review: I just moved 2 blocks from Papalote, so it's now my official "neighborhood" burrito place.  I have to admit, I'm not thrilled.  I think the food is really pretty good, and I appreciate that they have veggie options.  However, I'm a little put off by the prices.  I think they're on the high side, and they charge you extra for a little tub of salsa.  I mean, come on.  I always grit my teeth when i'm picking up a to-go burrito from there and only get a couple of singles back from my $10 bill.  Since when is a burrito not around $5-6?

excerpts: For vegetarians, they have a very hearty veggie
burrito that properly utilizes potatoes.
veggie.author: Rahul T.
veggie.review:
This is the place for the best salsa in town! Oh wow, the stuff is excellent. Yeah, that's right you know what I'm talking about ... the red stuff! 

The meat is very high quality and succulent on all acounts. I really like what they do with their mole sauce as well as their variety of tortilla. 

For vegetarians, they have a very hearty veggie burrito that properly utilizes potatoes.

excerpts: We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom.
Very good, I give it 4 out of 5.
Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff.
veggie.author: Miguel V.
veggie.review:
Papalote- 
The chips are just ok, the salsa is very good. The salsa has a nice flavor, fluidity and color. You can pour it over anything! Oh yeah, it's served in little black containers opposed to the clear Solo cup every other Taqueira uses; it added a little piazzas. We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom. Very good, I give it 4 out of 5. Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff. Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos....... Absolutely awesome! One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time. The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste. Excellent blend! I'd go back just for this dish. Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5. These guys set the bar on tofu. Tacos Mole with Chicken.....You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt. The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy. I gave them 2 out of 5. Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good. They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro. Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes. I gave them 4 out of 5. Friend had a carne asada burrito.......Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt. Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about. I gave the burrito 3 out of 5. 
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait. It was an order as you pay type place. I really like the grates they use on their grills opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses. The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!

excerpts: Delicious enough to daydream about - the chicken mole and the veggie (potato & mushroom)
burritos are highly recommended!
veggie.author: J R.
veggie.review: Delicious enough to daydream about - the chicken mole and the veggie (potato & mushroom) burritos are highly recommended!

excerpts: Veggie, Meaty, Seafood.
It's all good.
Lines are long which is weak
but it's worth the wait.
veggie.author: T S.
veggie.review: Best fresh burrito in the misson, I know you've heard it a millon times but this place is it. Veggie, Meaty, Seafood. It's all good. Lines are long which is weak but it's worth the wait. Fish Tacos and the salsa makes it even better.

excerpts: My recommendation is the Grilled Veggie Burrito with black beans in the spinach tortilla.
And I'd have to say that after Bay to Breakers, the second location on Fulton provided exactly the burrito I needed to keep going.
Tan delicioso!
veggie.author: Ezza S.
veggie.review: I thank my lucky stars that this slice of heaven is on the walk home from the BART. Who even knew that a "healthy" burrito could taste so good?! Their salsa is the real reason to visit- is it bottled for resale? My recommendation is the Grilled Veggie Burrito with black beans in the spinach tortilla. And I'd have to say that after Bay to Breakers, the second location on Fulton provided exactly the burrito I needed to keep going. Tan delicioso!

excerpts: I was sad when I moved out of the mission because I still crave Papalote's veggie burritos and their wonderful salsa.
The lines always long, but it's worth the wait.
Yum.
I think I have to take the J Church there very soon to get my fix.
veggie.author: Katrina F.
veggie.review: I was sad when I moved out of the mission because I still crave Papalote's veggie burritos and their wonderful salsa. The lines always long, but it's worth the wait. Yum. I think I have to take the J Church there very soon to get my fix.

excerpts: Then I found the grilled veggie burrito.
black beans.
with only guacamole and their awesome (strange) salsa added.
my favorite lunch nearby when I forget to pack one for work.
veggie.author: Katie R.
veggie.review: I didn't like it at first. Then I found the grilled veggie burrito. black beans. with only guacamole and their awesome (strange) salsa added. my favorite lunch nearby when I forget to pack one for work.

excerpts: I had a veggie burrito, and it was quite interesting.
I've never had one with potato and carrot, but it was pretty good.
veggie.author: Tariq I.
veggie.review: One of my favorite taquerias. Their salsa is amazing, the best I've ever had. I had a veggie burrito, and it was quite interesting. I've never had one with potato and carrot, but it was pretty good.

excerpts: fresh, tasty mexican food, veggie quesadilla, great chips & salsa, very busy at times.
veggie.author: Damien J.
veggie.review:
muy muy bueno.
fresh, tasty mexican food, veggie quesadilla, great chips & salsa, very busy at times.

excerpts: Best burrito place for people on the veggie side of things that I know of.
They will make a believer out of you!
veggie.author: Aram D.
veggie.review: I eat lunch here about three days a week.  And that's saying something, cause the Mission has a few options.  Best burrito place for people on the veggie side of things that I know of.  They will make a believer out of you!

excerpts: The grilled veggie burrito is to die for -
I've been thinking about it all week.
My husband is wild for their nachos and is even starting to suggest going to Papalote himself - this, from a die hard La Taqueria fan!
Keep it up Papalote, and I'll keep coming back for more!
veggie.author: Catherine H.
veggie.review: SO GOOD!  The salsa is amazing.  If they sold it to take home, it would be worth the trip and the search for parking just to pick up a bottle.  That being said, everything else I've tried is incredible as well!  The fish tacos are spectacular - I am a big cheese lover and usually have buyer's remorse if my plate of Mexican food doesn't include cheese but the flavors in the fish tacos were so good, I didn't feel like I missed out on a thing.  The grilled veggie burrito is to die for - I've been thinking about it all week.  My husband is wild for their nachos and is even starting to suggest going to Papalote himself - this, from a die hard La Taqueria fan!  Keep it up Papalote, and I'll keep coming back for more!

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good.
veggie.author: Willy c.
veggie.review: This place is pretty damn good.  The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good. The shrimp isn't as good as La Corneta, but this is a great place for burrito diversity if you're sick of the same old ricy overstuff in the mission. It 's also nice when you don't feel like falling into the mexi-coma before you even get home  (aka reasonable portions)...

excerpts: To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three".
I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy.

I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos.
Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it
but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa".
I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips.
Great place and good value.
veggie.author: Abheek G.
veggie.review: I have eaten here so many times that I feel obliged to write a review. Any time I tell people where I live, they say "Oh you're so close to Papalote, I've always wanted to eat there". To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three". I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy. I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos. Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa". I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips. Great place and good value.

excerpts: soyrizo heaven and inventive veggie burritos.
love and love.
many of the mission style burrito places leave the veggie option bland and basic.
veggie.author: Liz S.
veggie.review: soyrizo heaven and inventive veggie burritos. love and love. many of the mission style burrito places leave the veggie option bland and basic. this place takes it up a notch and keeps the spice right for the veggies!

excerpts: lots of veggie options, killer hot sauce and guacamole, and they never ever  mess up your order.
if you just drop in and order you'll have to wait a while for your food, so is best to call ahead or eat in!
veggie.author: Amy P.
veggie.review: the best burrito in san francisco hands down. definitely not your typical mission taqueria and that's why it's awesome. lots of veggie options, killer hot sauce and guacamole, and they never ever  mess up your order. if you just drop in and order you'll have to wait a while for your food, so is best to call ahead or eat in!

excerpts: Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie,
how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?
Yuck.
veggie.author: Jessica T.
veggie.review: Papalote, I really do love you.  I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.  Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie, how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?  Yuck.  The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.  My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.  Thank you very much.

excerpts: So many veggie options and the staff seem like they really want you to be there.
Been coming here for years and love that you can call ahead for take out.
My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.
veggie.author: M C.
veggie.review: Prices have gone up a bit here and the wait can be long since the food is cooked per order, but the food is excellent. So many veggie options and the staff seem like they really want you to be there. Been coming here for years and love that you can call ahead for take out. My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.

excerpts: you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter.
i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something.
it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.
veggie.author: Angi C.
veggie.review: located on the noe/mission border, this taqueria is definitely fancier than the others on 24th. you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter. i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something. it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.

excerpts: The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).
veggie.author: Cecilia B.
veggie.review: Ordered take-out burritos - along with extra salsa - from the Mission location.  The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).  The shrimp super was excellent.  Everything was fresh and made-to-order.  No choice of salsa but the house version is amazing - blended rather than chunky but very tasty and spicy.  Definitely worth the visit and a return trip!

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
veggie.author: Cindy L.
veggie.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: i only wish the line were a little shorter but for a papalote veggie super burrito, i would wait until the end of time.
veggie.author: Joanna M.
veggie.review: yum. yum. yum. i only wish the line were a little shorter but for a papalote veggie super burrito, i would wait until the end of time.

excerpts: the veggie burrito is pretty good and the salsa is insane.
i love it.
being from san diego, i'm really picky about my mexican food...
papalote is the best i've found so far.
veggie.author: eve l.
veggie.review: papalote is one of the only mexican food spots i eat at regularly and enjoy. the veggie burrito is pretty good and the salsa is insane. i love it. being from san diego, i'm really picky about my mexican food...papalote is the best i've found so far.

excerpts: Veggie taco and soyrizo taco.
The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small.
Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.
The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small.
Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.
veggie.author: Sarah J.
veggie.review: Veggie taco and soyrizo taco. Chips and salsa. The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small. Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.

excerpts: I get the veggie burrito and am always happy to find big chunks of fresh veggies in there.
Squash, carrots, eggplant, they dont mess around at Papalote.
Nothing's too greasy or heavy, and the salsa is really great.
Sometimes the ordering area can be a little hectic, but take a deep breath....
you're about to get some quality, well-priced Mexican food.
Yum.
veggie.author: Muffin F.
veggie.review: Papalote probably doesn't need my praise, but I love it so much that I am writing a glowing review any way. It's usually pretty busy in there, and with good reason. The food is just good. I get the veggie burrito and am always happy to find big chunks of fresh veggies in there. Squash, carrots, eggplant, they dont mess around at Papalote. Nothing's too greasy or heavy, and the salsa is really great. Sometimes the ordering area can be a little hectic, but take a deep breath....you're about to get some quality, well-priced Mexican food. Yum.

excerpts:
I love Papalote for going the extra mile providing several vegan options including:
veggie with potato, carrot, and mushroom
grilled veggie with eggplant and zucchini
vegan soyrizo
marinated grilled tofu
I went with the veggie burrito and had them add avocado.
It came with chips and a yummy homemade salsa.
I will be sure to visit here the next time in the Bay Area as was wonderful!
grilled veggie.author: Shane S.
grilled veggie.review:
The Mission is packed with burrito places and all are super great yet my favorite burrito is at Papalote. I'm a longtime vegan of 16 years so Mexican food has always been a favorite.

I love Papalote for going the extra mile providing several vegan options including:
veggie with potato, carrot, and mushroom
grilled veggie with eggplant and zucchini
vegan soyrizo
marinated grilled tofu

All of these come with beans, rice, pico de gallo.

I went with the veggie burrito and had them add avocado. It came with chips and a yummy homemade salsa. I will be sure to visit here the next time in the Bay Area as was wonderful!

excerpts: , chicken and grilled veggie nachos
(Again... OMG!)
to start.
grilled veggie.author: Suzanne P.
grilled veggie.review: This place is the reason that The Mission is famed for burritos! We stopped in on a Sunday evening, a little before your typical dinner rush. We were able to order quickly and got a small table with no wait. Go here with an appetite b/c no matter how much you want to stop eating, you just can't! We had the house made salsa (OMG! So good!), chicken and grilled veggie nachos (Again... OMG!) to start. Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito. I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid. Burrito can't be beat! Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!

excerpts: Had the grilled veggie burrito with guacamole.
It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ...
this was the opposite, which I like).
I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa.
It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious.
The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride.
Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.
grilled veggie.author: Linda S.
grilled veggie.review: Best burrito I've had, ever. Had the grilled veggie burrito with guacamole. It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ... this was the opposite, which I like). I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa. It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious. The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride. Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.

excerpts: my go-to burrito here is the grilled veggie one - i just love the fresh vegetables that they use and it's good to always make it SUPER
grilled veggie.author: Priya G.
grilled veggie.review:
Can I say BEST BURRITO in san francisco? this place is so delicious i don't even know what to say about it. 

my go-to burrito here is the grilled veggie one - i just love the fresh vegetables that they use and it's good to always make it SUPER (guac, sour cream, and cheese) and i usually get black beans and throw it into a spinach tortilla. nomtastic. the other burritos that are good are soy riso and chicken. so so so safe and such a solid meal for about $8. if you're not a big eater, you can always save half of it for later, which makes an amazing meal or even better - amazing drunk food! (haha)

their special sauce is tasty and if you want more, i believe its $0.50 for each extra cup of it. i would get more - i usually have a cup for just the chips, and another cup just for my burrito.

thank you sf for the best burrito in the world!!!!!! love you.

excerpts: I'm of the pescetarian nature myself and flip flop through the various veggie options (grilled veggie, tofu mole, etc., etc.).
Lots of points for customizability (beans, tortillas, tacos/quesadillas/burritos).
When I have out of town guests visiting I often take them to Papalote's for a SF super mission burrito experience.
grilled veggie.author: Stephen S.
grilled veggie.review: Papalote's is not my favorite burrito in San Francisco but I can't fault anyone who claims that it's theirs. They definitely know what they're doing here and offer a plethora of options for meat lovers and vegetarians alike. I'm of the pescetarian nature myself and flip flop through the various veggie options (grilled veggie, tofu mole, etc., etc.). Lots of points for customizability (beans, tortillas, tacos/quesadillas/burritos). When I have out of town guests visiting I often take them to Papalote's for a SF super mission burrito experience.
