excerpts: I ordered the grilled veggie burrito, and really enjoyed the fresh, juicy, kinda tangy onions, eggplant and zucchinis!
grilled veggie.author: Jo D.
grilled veggie.review:
This review is a bit overdue.. Papalote was recommended by my sf soul-sister. (thanks Dez!)  
So we're in the city, starving for burritos...  what better place to be than in the Mission..?!?!  Super excited to taste the food here.

Paplote is conveniently located away from the super busy part of the Mission, so it's easy to find parking in the residential area surrounding it.  I ordered the grilled veggie burrito, and really enjoyed the fresh, juicy, kinda tangy onions, eggplant and zucchinis!  I've never had a burrito like this before... 

Talk about a great spot with lots of urban flavor!!

excerpts: The menu on the wall has some options on the left side such as "Veggie," "Grilled Veggie," and "Soyrizo".
The next few columns to the right then have prices for exactly what dish you would like your first choice to be and then you move on to picking additional ingredients.
I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here
I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here
(Potato, carrot, mushroom) and partly because I wanted more flavor than a bland veggie
burrito
I've had at way too many other places.
grilled veggie.author: David O.
grilled veggie.review:
This place is a little confusing, but good. I didn't understand the menu right away as I was standing in line to order so I got nervous that I would be holding up the line while deciding. No pressure or anything. There's just always a line. The menu on the wall has some options on the left side such as "Veggie," "Grilled Veggie," and "Soyrizo". The next few columns to the right then have prices for exactly what dish you would like your first choice to be and then you move on to picking additional ingredients. The additional($) ingredients are things like cheese and sour cream which come standard at most taquerias so the burritos that would be around $6 at those other places are $10 here.

I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here (Potato, carrot, mushroom) and partly because I wanted more flavor than a bland veggie burrito I've had at way too many other places. I added cheese, sour cream and guacamole to my burrito and there was plenty of all three in it. The burrito itself was flavorful and filling so I definitely wasn't disappointed with my choice.

So..the sauce. The sauce is slightly spicy, smokey, and delicious. Just had to throw in my opinion about the sauce everyone mentions, I guess. I might even buy the jars they sell and use it when I get burritos at other places :p

Overall I like this place. It's impossible to park around Valencia/Mission most of the time but if you can make it to this location it's worth it

excerpts: I got the grilled veggie and it was HUGE
, BF got meat.
grilled veggie.author: Michelle L.
grilled veggie.review:
The last time I came to SF I failed to eat a burrito and it's been killing me for more then a year. So, this time, hot off the plane, it was BART to Papalote and a burrito was in my system before I even checked in to the hotel.

I got the grilled veggie and it was HUGE, BF got meat. The loudly vegetarian girl sitting next to me got meat accidentally and was scandalized. 

Overall: a little pricey, but portions are worth it, and the quality is excellent. Would recommend.

excerpts: Today I went with the grilled veggie burrito, which was delicious.
My only complaint is that it was loaded with black beans, which I requested, I just wish there had been more of the grilled zucchini and eggplant.
Oh well, it was still deliciously satisfying.
grilled veggie.author: Emily S.
grilled veggie.review:
Just go.

Seriously.

So, if you like delicious tacos and burritos and oh, fresh salsa, then Papalote is your kind of place. The first time I came here for lunch I had the soyrizo tacos which were fantastic. They serve it fresh with a side of your own chips and salsa. 

After going there for lunch this afternoon with some friends, I decided it was time to write a review. Today I went with the grilled veggie burrito, which was delicious. My only complaint is that it was loaded with black beans, which I requested, I just wish there had been more of the grilled zucchini and eggplant. Oh well, it was still deliciously satisfying. We all shared an order of chips and salsa, on top of the side of chips and salsa that they already give each individual order. The salsa is SO good. My friend talked me into buying a jar of it on my way home, one of the best decisions I made all day. It's fresh with a definite kick, so beware if you're sensitive to spice. Also, highly recommend getting your burrito/taco to-go and enjoying it in Dolores Park when the weather's nice.

Side note, they also serve Mexican cokes (pure cane sugar=the real stuff) as well as a wide range of cold beers to enjoy with your delicious Mexican entree of choice.

excerpts: Highly suggest the Soyrizo or the grilled veggie if your a vegetarian.
Also, the salsa that comes with every buritto is awesome.
Its a little on the spicy side
grilled veggie.author: Kameron K.
grilled veggie.review:
Mmm

I heard about Papalote because they beat douchebag bobby flay in the throwdown show and was surprised at how many veggie options they have.

Highly suggest the Soyrizo or the grilled veggie if your a vegetarian.  Also, the salsa that comes with every buritto is awesome.  Its a little on the spicy side but is one of the best salsas I've had.

Highly recommend calling in to place your order, its usually ready in 10 minutes and beats having to wait in the long line.

excerpts: I had the grilled veggie burrito.
I LOVE zucchini in my mexican food and this included it....
And not just a few slices
but it was STUFFED with zucchini...
grilled veggie.author: L P.
grilled veggie.review:
I waltzed in with a friend early one Sunday evening. We went for a walk, saw Papalote, and thought sure, let's try it. 

AND WE DID. 

I had the grilled veggie burrito. I LOVE zucchini in my mexican food and this included it....And not just a few slices but it was STUFFED with zucchini...and a side of pinto beans, rice, eggplant, sourcream and cheese. My friend had the Mole/chicken burrito and she also enjoyed it...Although I think she enjoyed the strangely orange free salsa more. It WAS good after all. We left stuffed and pleased. Especially since when we arrived at 4 we walked right in and up to the cashier. Then when we left at 5ish there was a line out the door. We had the right burritos at the right time...with drinks for the right price...20 bucks. 

(By the way, this story took place approximately 5 hours ago. I decided to write this review promptly bc I also decided to promptly eat my burrito leftovers as soon as I got home....which is now....Also, it's even better cold. Yesssssss)

Go here and go early.

excerpts: That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas.

We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in.
grilled veggie.author: S H.
grilled veggie.review:
I will preface this review by noting that we should have called ahead and asked about the amount of garlic in their food. My husband has an allergy, & there were a lot of items on the menu he couldn't eat. That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas. We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in. If my husband had been able to eat the salsa, it certainly wouldn't have been enough. 

The fajitas came out pretty quickly. The eggplant, zucchini & carrots were cooked a pleasant amount--not mushy. Lettuce, diced toms, and jicama (I think) all tasted fresh. The refried beans were good (though on the runnier end of the spectrum, just fyi) and the avocado slices were ripe and there were a good number of them. Wish the same had been true of  the tortillas! The order came with 3 clearly mass-produced, traditional-sized (i.e. taco, not burrito), flour tortillas--not enough to deal with even half of the food on the plate. Though they did not charge us extra when we asked for more, this just reinforced the impression created by the salsa--that they were trying to give us as little as possible. I suppose this could be a considered strategy to reduce food waste (which we would support!), though, if that's their rationale, it would help to explain that, and advise customers they need only ask for more. 

Overall, the food was fine, but not what I expected after hearing my sis talk about having seen this joint on TV, and seeing it mentioned in The Rough Guide to Cali. Could not shake the impression that you're not quite getting your money's worth. I may go back for the tofu mole everyone raves about, but probably only if I'm already in the neighborhood. I'll give 3 stars--because I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that the absence of garlic really impacted the flavor of the food.

excerpts: I have also tried the grilled veggie burrito (not that great as it had no guac, cheese, salsa or sour cream).
You can't go wrong with the quesadillas either!
Cute little spot
grilled veggie.author: Niki V.
grilled veggie.review: The sauce! The sauce is worth writing a million words for. You can also buy the jar of sauce which makes it that much better. I usually get the carne asada burrito and it's never failed to impress. I have also tried the grilled veggie burrito (not that great as it had no guac, cheese, salsa or sour cream). You can't go wrong with the quesadillas either! Cute little spot

excerpts: The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy.
grilled veggie.author: Will A.
grilled veggie.review: A bit less traditional than the other taqueria's in the mission, but a nice variation. I always order the chicken mole burrito and it's unique and delicious. Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission? The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy. Gotta love free chips and salsa, and the creamy spicy salsa is delicious.

excerpts: the grilled veggie burrito didn't taste very good
grilled veggie.author: Miss C.
grilled veggie.review:
Sad... I used to like their food. Last few times I went back the grilled veggie burrito didn't taste very good (ended up taking a couple bites then throwing it away each time...), their guacamole was not very flavorful, and their salsa was NOT hella good...

Boo... Bring back the yum or I'm not gonna come (back)!

excerpts:
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.
grilled veggie.author: Cory C.
grilled veggie.review:
So looking through the reviews for this restaurant, I do realize that the food is ok, and most of the time the service is good.

I called papolote to order some food for my boyfriend and I.  I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

We walked on down to the store a few minutes later to pick up the order.

"Hi, Im just here to pick up an Order for Cory"
"Oh Yes" she replies...
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

She begins to tell me that she didnt hear me on the phone say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

I was extremely confused.  Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  She was extremely rude and unappologetic, all the while rolling her eyes and talking to me like i was the iddiot.  

I work in the service industry, and if the order comes out wrong, whether or not it was the customers fault, you get them a new order no questions asked.  

I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

She turned to the woman working the other register and said something to her in Spanish, and the woman looked at her and said... JUST VOID IT.

I dont care about the price, it was all about principal.  ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

Over all a bad experience.  Maybe the woman was having a bad day, but for some reason i got the impression that she always acts like that.

THe food wasnt that great.  Ive had better from El Farolito down the street on Mission and 24th.

Watch out for the woman who works the register and doesnt wear a uniform.  Shes Crazy!

excerpts: Week one, we ordered the regular veggie but got the grilled veggie burrito.
Week two, the burrito labeled "VEGGIE" was actually the chicken burrito.
grilled veggie.author: Sig N.
grilled veggie.review: Here's the deal...if the service sucks, it doesn't matter how good the food is. Don't get me wrong, I think Papalote makes a quality product but two weeks in a row they've messed up the take out order. Week one, we ordered the regular veggie but got the grilled veggie burrito. Week two, the burrito labeled "VEGGIE" was actually the chicken burrito. Additionally, the chicken burrito was supposed to be super (which was on the receipt so we were charged) but was not. Sorry, Papalote, don't care if you beat Bobby Flay in throwdown. Tighten it up.

excerpts: I had ordered the grilled veggie burrito (great, by the way) and a side of chips and guacamole.
grilled veggie.author: Amy Z.
grilled veggie.review:
The first time I came here, to the Mission location, I had kind of a bad experience.

I had ordered the grilled veggie burrito (great, by the way) and a side of chips and guacamole. My friend was already seated with his chips and salsa when I sat down. One of the waiters came out from the kitchen almost immediately afterward with some guacamole and a small bowl of chips, and when he got to my table he unloaded the guac but turned right around with my chips still on the tray! When I asked the cashier, she told me that it's restaurant policy. To only serve one bowl of chips regardless of the number of diners and what they've ordered, such as CHIPS and guacamole? They give way too few chips per table. 

The salsa's amazing, though. Kind of like enchilada sauce.

The burritos are great: moist yet not drippy.

I still come here, I just don't order side dishes.

excerpts: They have so many vegetarian options, including the phenomenal grilled veggie burrito (potatoes and carrots!) and the equally amazing soyrizo burrito (soy chorizo!).
Make sure to order things "super" so that they come with sour cream/
They don't cook veggie stuff (beans, rice, vegetables) with lard, so all is fair game for vegetarians.
grilled veggie.author: Claire K.
grilled veggie.review:
Papalote is my favorite burrito place in the Bay Area by a long shot!  They have so many vegetarian options, including the phenomenal grilled veggie burrito (potatoes and carrots!) and the equally amazing soyrizo burrito (soy chorizo!).  Make sure to order things "super" so that they come with sour cream/guac/etc.  

They don't cook veggie stuff (beans, rice, vegetables) with lard, so all is fair game for vegetarians.  I love that the burritos are a bit healthier than the standard Mission taqueria, so I don't feel quite as terrible when I leave.

The salsa is fantastic--people come for the salsa alone!  The bean dip is yet another thing to rave about.  I love this place.  Best burritos ever.

excerpts: I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore
so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.
The rice and bean burrito.
It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.
Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.
grilled veggie.author: TeTeDaMouse C.
grilled veggie.review:
Papalote is up there when it comes to delicious Mexican food.  It's definitely in the top three and funny, for the life of me, I don't know remember the names of the other two because I'm hazy from the glow of Papalote's deliciousness.  While the proximity of my next job location to Papalote wouldn't be the deciding factor in picking one job over the other, it would definitely be a perk.

Papalote is a restaurant where I don't miss meat as part of my meal.  Their vegan and vegetarian burritos are delicious.  I usually order my burrito with black beans, a whole wheat tortilla, and make it a super so I can have their delicious guacamole.  The cheese is nice too. I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.  The rice and bean burrito.  It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.  Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.  It's hard to describe; it's a bit smoky.  

I love me some Papalote!  If I was vegan or vegetarian, it wouldn't be hard because of Papalote.  I firmly believe the restaurant would get me through the hard times.

excerpts: I had the grilled veggie - eggplant and zucchini
burrito, which was really yummy.
Also, the salsa that they give you for your chips is amazing.
grilled veggie.author: meagan m.
grilled veggie.review:
Honestly, the food was really good. I had the grilled veggie - eggplant and zucchini burrito, which was really yummy. Also, the salsa that they give you for your chips is amazing. I was just upset when I asked for a small side of sour cream and they charged me $1.50 - then I looked on the menu, and a side of sour cream, guacamole and Cheese was listed as $.99, WTF? Whatever, I'm sure I'll be back because it was healthy and tasty, but they need to get their prices in order!!! Oh yeah, and get some larger water cups while you're at it. 

Thank you.

excerpts: My roommate recommended the grilled veggie burrito with Tofu.
Great suggestion.
grilled veggie.author: Adam L.
grilled veggie.review:
Their Salsa is legit...

People come here and just buy the salsa, which comes in a really cool jar. it's a bit pricey at 6.50 but worth every penny.  Also they are pretty stingy with the salsa that they give out for free. They serve it in one little cup at a time, but they will refill it over and over for you.

My roommate recommended the grilled veggie burrito with Tofu. Great suggestion. I'm a big meat lover but decided to go healthy and it paid off. 

Had a good dark bohemian beer to go with it. I prefer Modelo Negro, but they don't carry it. 
This was my first  Papalote experience, but I will deffintely return. 

Thank you Papalote.

excerpts: I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself.
Have never had a burrito here
grilled veggie.author: Grace S.
grilled veggie.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: The grilled veggie tacos where delicious.
I had never had grilled eggplant and zucchini in a taco before, but I will be coming back here for more!
grilled veggie.author: Julie F.
grilled veggie.review: The grilled veggie tacos where delicious. I had never had grilled eggplant and zucchini in a taco before, but I will be coming back here for more! They also put cheese, sour cream, and guacamole on it if you'd like. It was so good, I can't wait to try other things on the menu. The wait for a table and food was pretty long, but it was cinco de mayo, so it was probably abnormally long. I have a feeling this place is generally pretty busy, and for good reason.

excerpts: Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for.
grilled veggie.author: B V.
grilled veggie.review: My wife and I LOVE this place. We won't eat burritos anywhere else. 'Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for. The wonderful thing is that puppies aren't 80% rice and beans, so it's taste heaven. We live on the other side of the Mission, while there are many places closer than Papalote's, in 4 years we haven't yet found a replacement...

excerpts: For delicious fattening burritos, I'll head down the block to El Farolito, but for my average weeknight the tofu or grilled veggie burrito is essential.
Also - try phoning ahead for to-go orders, there's a shortage of standing-around room.
grilled veggie.author: Emily B.
grilled veggie.review: In this paradise of Mexican food establishments, Papalote still draws crowds every night for its veggie/vegan options and generally healthier menu. For delicious fattening burritos, I'll head down the block to El Farolito, but for my average weeknight the tofu or grilled veggie burrito is essential. Also - try phoning ahead for to-go orders, there's a shortage of standing-around room.

excerpts: I liked the grilled veggie burrito, for what it was...
but it really wasn't "burrito-y" enough for me.
I don't really know what that means, but there you have it.
Good, clean atmosphere.
grilled veggie.author: Tovah S.
grilled veggie.review: Yes, it's true about the salsa.  Quite delicious.  My four-year-old date very much enjoyed the yellow dragon hovering above our table.  I liked the grilled veggie burrito, for what it was... but it really wasn't "burrito-y" enough for me.  I don't really know what that means, but there you have it.    Good, clean atmosphere.

excerpts: Love the Grilled Veggie Burrito.
Papalote's phone number is in my address book for a reason.
grilled veggie.author: Kristen Y.
grilled veggie.review: Love the Grilled Veggie Burrito. Papalote's phone number is in my address book for a reason.

excerpts: anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito.
bad move on my part.
the burrito was dry and had no flavour.
to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go?
i was very confused - considering i
JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago
and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant.
so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream.
grilled veggie.author: James J.
grilled veggie.review:
not too sure if this place is as cracked up as people say it is. BUT i think i didn't order the right things though. it was my first time here on Sunday and my expectations were high - considering all of my friends rave about this place. first of all, i didn't know their burritos came with no cheese. however, that was probably more my fault considering i was a little slow and hungover to really read the fine print and ask any questions. anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito. bad move on my part. the burrito was dry and had no flavour. to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go? i was very confused - considering i JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant. so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream. REALLY? 

so anyways my gf got soyrizo tacos and they were ok, but she actually makes a better one than they do. i enjoyed the "complimentary" side of chips and salsa, but i agree with some other reviewers on here, why are you so stingy on the salsa? if i go back and ask for more, are you gonna charge me $2? the salsa isn't your typical chunky tomato-wee cilantro type - it's more like a tomato-wee creamy kind. not much zip to it, but still good.

anyways, i'm thinking i didn't order the right thing from here because my friends seem to know good food. i'm thinking i need to quit being a pussy and order a burrito with meat in it - most probably carnitas! mmm ...

excerpts: Great vegetarian options (grilled veggie burrito is a favorite).
Whole wheat tortillas are really good.
grilled veggie.author: John B.
grilled veggie.review:
Delicious food that keeps us coming back once a week.  Great vegetarian options (grilled veggie burrito is a favorite).  Whole wheat tortillas are really good.  The salsa is one-of-a-kind and irresistible.

We normally phone ahead and give it an extra 5-10 minutes, because there's always a wait.  Recently, we got some salsa that was not even close to the normal stuff.  New cook? Out of ingredients? What gives?  Even still, this is our standby neighborhood restaurant, quite delicious but don't expect authentic Mexican.

excerpts: My recommendation is the Grilled Veggie Burrito with black beans in the spinach tortilla.
And I'd have to say that after Bay to Breakers, the second location on Fulton provided exactly the burrito I needed to keep going.
Tan delicioso!
grilled veggie.author: Ezza S.
grilled veggie.review: I thank my lucky stars that this slice of heaven is on the walk home from the BART. Who even knew that a "healthy" burrito could taste so good?! Their salsa is the real reason to visit- is it bottled for resale? My recommendation is the Grilled Veggie Burrito with black beans in the spinach tortilla. And I'd have to say that after Bay to Breakers, the second location on Fulton provided exactly the burrito I needed to keep going. Tan delicioso!

excerpts: Then I found the grilled veggie burrito.
black beans.
with only guacamole and their awesome (strange) salsa added.
my favorite lunch nearby when I forget to pack one for work.
grilled veggie.author: Katie R.
grilled veggie.review: I didn't like it at first. Then I found the grilled veggie burrito. black beans. with only guacamole and their awesome (strange) salsa added. my favorite lunch nearby when I forget to pack one for work.

excerpts: The grilled veggie burrito is to die for -
I've been thinking about it all week.
My husband is wild for their nachos and is even starting to suggest going to Papalote himself - this, from a die hard La Taqueria fan!
Keep it up Papalote, and I'll keep coming back for more!
grilled veggie.author: Catherine H.
grilled veggie.review: SO GOOD!  The salsa is amazing.  If they sold it to take home, it would be worth the trip and the search for parking just to pick up a bottle.  That being said, everything else I've tried is incredible as well!  The fish tacos are spectacular - I am a big cheese lover and usually have buyer's remorse if my plate of Mexican food doesn't include cheese but the flavors in the fish tacos were so good, I didn't feel like I missed out on a thing.  The grilled veggie burrito is to die for - I've been thinking about it all week.  My husband is wild for their nachos and is even starting to suggest going to Papalote himself - this, from a die hard La Taqueria fan!  Keep it up Papalote, and I'll keep coming back for more!

excerpts: To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three".
I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy.

I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos.
Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it
but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa".
I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips.
Great place and good value.
grilled veggie.author: Abheek G.
grilled veggie.review: I have eaten here so many times that I feel obliged to write a review. Any time I tell people where I live, they say "Oh you're so close to Papalote, I've always wanted to eat there". To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three". I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy. I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos. Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa". I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips. Great place and good value.

excerpts: Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie,
how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?
Yuck.
grilled veggie.author: Jessica T.
grilled veggie.review: Papalote, I really do love you.  I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.  Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie, how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?  Yuck.  The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.  My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.  Thank you very much.

excerpts: My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.
grilled veggie.author: M C.
grilled veggie.review: Prices have gone up a bit here and the wait can be long since the food is cooked per order, but the food is excellent. So many veggie options and the staff seem like they really want you to be there. Been coming here for years and love that you can call ahead for take out. My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
grilled veggie.author: Cindy L.
grilled veggie.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: Got the vegetarian super burrito with retried beans and marinated tofu.
Really good place for someone that's vegetarian or even
vegan!
I wasn't too fond of the sauce the chips came with.
Over all the food was good.
marinated tofu.author: Myleen R.
marinated tofu.review: Tried this place for the first time even though I live close to the place. Everyone was hyping it up, so I thought I'd give it a try. Got the vegetarian super burrito with retried beans and marinated tofu. Really good place for someone that's vegetarian or even vegan! I wasn't too fond of the sauce the chips came with. Over all the food was good.

excerpts: I ordered 2 marinated tofu tacos, which were pretty boring, taste-wise.
marinated tofu.author: Rosalind C.
marinated tofu.review:
Very underwhelmed. I ordered 2 marinated tofu tacos, which were pretty boring, taste-wise. (*Much* better tofu tacos across the Bay, at Cholita Linda.) 

The worst is that each taco had only *one* tortilla. Wtf? The tofu tacos were already very heavy and moist (given the tofu itself and lots of chopped tomatoes), and so the thin tortillas just disintegrated the moment I tried to lift them, spilling the contents all over the plate. 

On the plus side, the salsa that came with complimentary chips was pretty good. I put most of it on the disintegrated tacos to give the sad remains of my ruined tacos a modicum of flavor. 

Skip!

excerpts: My go-to is the marinated tofu burrito, and I'm obsessed with their signature roasted red pepper salsa.
marinated tofu.author: Shilpa R.
marinated tofu.review: The best (vegetarian) burrito in San Francisco! I absolutely love that they have multiple solid vegetarian options. My go-to is the marinated tofu burrito, and I'm obsessed with their signature roasted red pepper salsa.

excerpts: Marinated tofu burrito was great.
Salsa was phenomenal.
Free chips were a nice touch.
marinated tofu.author: Christian C.
marinated tofu.review: Marinated tofu burrito was great. Salsa was phenomenal. Free chips were a nice touch.

excerpts: We got a table right away and ordered marinated tofu tacos for me and mole chicken burrito for him.
marinated tofu.author: Q D.
marinated tofu.review:
Cute little place with good food. My boyfriend and I aren't locals so we were surprised at how packed everywhere in the Mission was on a Wednesday night. There was a line spilling onto the street when we first passed by so we looked for another place we heard about. That place was also full so we walked back up to Papalote and the line was basically gone. We got a table right away and ordered marinated tofu tacos for me and mole chicken burrito for him.

I liked my tacos even though they fell apart. The marinade was tasty so I definitely recommend anything with that but I think I would have enjoyed a burrito a little more. My boyfriend destroyed his burrito in no time, so I take it that it was delicious too. The salsa was awesome and I wish we bought some jars of it but we rushed out of there when another long line formed. I'm kind of sad that I'm back home already, cause I really would have liked to have tried their other stuff, as they are very vegetarian friendly and had more interesting flavors, unlike most Mexican places near me.

excerpts: Get Achiote Marinated Tofu, grilled vegetables(carrots, potatoes, mushrooms), and guacamole in a burrito.
marinated tofu.author: Matt T.
marinated tofu.review:
Supposedly the best burrito in San Francisco.  

I wouldn't necessarily say that.  It was good, and definitely gets props for vegan options (soyrizo, tofu as protein options).  They also have pretty comprehensive choices (whole wheat tortillas, mushrooms, black, pinto, or refried black beans).  The house made roasted tomato salsa was sorta special too.

I'd come here again if I was in the mood for burritos and in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here if chipotle was nearby.

UPDATE: Came here a second time.  Get Achiote Marinated Tofu, grilled vegetables(carrots, potatoes, mushrooms), and guacamole in a burrito.  Much better than the vegan soyrizo combo I got the first time.  It was a very satisfying burrito, better than chipotle.  I've come here like 15+ times over the past year.  Updated to 5 star.

excerpts: I got a pollo taco, he got a marinated tofu burrito, and we shared guacamole and chips.
Thanks to Yelp reviews we made sure to try the house hot sauce, yum.
marinated tofu.author: Wendy L.
marinated tofu.review: Great place for vegans! I got a pollo taco, he got a marinated tofu burrito, and we shared guacamole and chips. Thanks to Yelp reviews we made sure to try the house hot sauce, yum.

excerpts: Our favorites are grilled veggies (eggplant and zucchini) with whole black beans and marinated tofu (which has a perfectly firm texture) and whole pintos.
marinated tofu.author: Jessica L.
marinated tofu.review:
This restaurant has great vegetarian and vegan options.  The beans and rice are made vegan and they have 2 vegetable options and 3 tofu options.  The burritos are large and they do cross the $10 threshold but it is a lot of food.  

My boyfriend and I have a tradition of splitting a burrito once per week and earning a punch on our loyalty card for a free burrito.  Our favorites are grilled veggies (eggplant and zucchini) with whole black beans and marinated tofu (which has a perfectly firm texture) and whole pintos.  Make it a super with sour cream, guac, and cheese for only $1.  

The salsa is BOMB so we always get an extra side and sometimes a jar to take home!

excerpts: Papalote is known for their Triple Threat Burrito and have high reviews on the prawn burrito, but I went with the Marinated Tofu.
Typical me for always doing something different from the general population.
If I were to return, I will stick with what people like and try the prawn burrito.
marinated tofu.author: Elaine Y.
marinated tofu.review:
After hearing all the reviews about this place and seeing it on Bobby Flay's show, thought it was time to give this place a try. I might have hyped this place up too much and I was a little bit disappointed. One mistake I made was to order something that the reviews were suggesting. Papalote is known for their Triple Threat Burrito and have high reviews on the prawn burrito, but I went with the Marinated Tofu. Typical me for always doing something different from the general population. The burrito was good, but it wasn't as good as the regular chicken burritos that I have had elsewhere. It feels like it's missing some sauce. It was really nice that Papalote is so generous with their ingredients and packed the burrito with beans, rice, sour cream, gracamole, and meat, but it tasted a bit on the dry side.

Their chips and salsa is good. Their house salsa is definitely their specialty. They sell them in jars at the restaurant. If I were to return, I will stick with what people like and try the prawn burrito.

excerpts: Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies.
Can't go wrong!
Their homemade salsas are so good too.
marinated tofu.author: Jessica G.
marinated tofu.review: Love love love this place! Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies. Can't go wrong!  Their homemade salsas are so good too.

excerpts: The marinated tofu is surprisingly delicious.
marinated tofu.author: Lisa W.
marinated tofu.review:
As much as I love getting an al pastor super burrito dripping with fat at Cancun, sometimes you just want something a little lighter and fresher - and Papalote hits the spot. The marinated tofu is surprisingly delicious. I think I was a lion in a past life (...rawr) and almost never go for the vegetarian option, but I was talked into the tofu and it was really, really flavorful. 

Come here for tasty burritos that won't make you feel like you're pregnant with food triplets, and make sure you grab a couple of crunchy pickled jalapenos (you can wrap them in the foil on the counter if you're getting your food to go). And even if you're not that hungry, get the super burrito - the regular burrito is pretty bland.

They sell their famous salsa in jars, too!

excerpts: Tried a marinated tofu
burrito.
I've always been a skeptic of Tofu in burritos, I usually just opt for extra beans.
I should have done the same here.
marinated tofu.author: Raman S.
marinated tofu.review:
This place was interesting as it seems to make a slightly healthier cuisine than most Mission Mexican restaurants.  It is on the Valencia side, I suppose.

Tried a marinated tofu burrito.  I've always been a skeptic of Tofu in burritos, I usually just opt for extra beans.  I should have done the same here.  No discredit to the preparation, it was delicious, but tofu and burritos just dont mix easily in my book.

The best thing they have going is their salsa.  It is highly addictive.  I am planning to buy a jar next time I swing by.  Its legit.

excerpts: My marinated tofu burrito was great.
Plenty of soy, plenty of black beans and plenty of salsa, all wrapped up nicely in a wheat tortilla.
But the cost.
Did I bring London prices back with me?
No burrito should be over $7.
marinated tofu.author: Jason B.
marinated tofu.review:
As is tradition with my European travels these days, the first thing I do upon returning to my beloved San Francisco (don't worry babe, I may be cheating on you with Berlin, Madrid and London but I'm always coming home) is get something you can't find anywhere else: a massive burrito. I was thinking Papalote from the minute I stepped on my flight home, and I was still thinking about it the minute I stepped off. Next stop: 24th Street Mission BART / i.e. burrito mecca.

Such a hyped member of our Mexican food scene, but I can't say I share your enthusiasm. My marinated tofu burrito was great. Plenty of soy, plenty of black beans and plenty of salsa, all wrapped up nicely in a wheat tortilla. But the cost. Did I bring London prices back with me? No burrito should be over $7. Or $8 plus change, as is the case here.

A reluctant three stars. Quality and portions were great, earning them a third star, but I can't go higher at these prices.

excerpts: The marinated tofu tacos lacked taste.
marinated tofu.author: Jason P.
marinated tofu.review:
The food network combined with the 7x7 list almost forced me to come here on my last SF visit.  After ordering a burrito, chips and salsa and a couple of tacos, I decided to take a seat.  It was amusing that even the lady behind the counter noticed the feast that I ordered and told the food runner how the number of people at our table was less than the number of entrees ordered in Spanish.  

The rice and bean burrito was excellent, as were the chips and salsa (the 7x7 item).  The marinated tofu tacos lacked taste.  I really wish I had opted for the soyrizo, but my stomach was recovering still and I did not feel the need to risk it.  Next time, soyrizo will be my taco filling of choice!

excerpts: I went with the marinated tofu (with black beans) on the recommendation of the Burrito Eater
marinated tofu.author: Kathleen M.
marinated tofu.review: My first real Mission burrito. I went with the marinated tofu (with black beans) on the recommendation of the Burrito Eater, I got it super (with sour cream, cheese and guacamole). I was delicious, but honestly not much different than Chipotle, except more expensive. It comes with (warm) chips and salsa, but I didn't eat very many since I knew the burrito was going to be big, so it was kind of a waste. I would have rather paid extra for chips if I wanted them. I would be happy to eat here again, but there are so many other places I have to try, I wouldn't make a special trip to go here.

excerpts: The marinated tofu is now $7.50.
Add a dollar for guac and tax
and it's around $9.35... for ONE burrito...
marinated tofu.author: aaron f.
marinated tofu.review:
I've enjoyed Papalote's food very often since moving to the Bay Area. They just recently raised their prices though.  $5 for a rice and bean burrito is kind of steep!  The marinated tofu is now $7.50. Add a dollar for guac and tax and it's around $9.35... for ONE burrito... during a pretty harsh economic downturn.

Congrats, I do realize you were voted best burrito in some local rag and the line got 50x longer, but this is just really milking it. Congrats on your Food Network show, too. I'll be over at Mariachi's (with enough change from my $10 to take the Muni home) if you need me.

excerpts: I had the marinated tofu burrito w/ guacamole and sour cream.
marinated tofu.author: Irene L.
marinated tofu.review: Liked this little place alot! I had the marinated tofu burrito w/ guacamole and sour cream. Super veggie friendly. They have SOYRIZO here! OMG! :) Prices are good and getting a table isn't too hard. People come in and out pretty quickly. Service is fast, you order, sit down, and bam w/ minutes they bring your food to your table. The salsa and chips are yummy. Definitely would come back and try the other veggie dishes.

excerpts: I was just underwhelmed by Papalote's marinated tofu.
I was assured it would be amazing.
That feels like a trick bourne of ulterior motives.
What motives?
marinated tofu.author: Jennifer B.
marinated tofu.review:
I was just underwhelmed by Papalote's marinated tofu.  I was assured it would be amazing.  That feels like a trick bourne of ulterior motives.  What motives?  I'm not sure.

The rest of the burrito held up the slack for the tofu.  I will not sit back and call tofu in a burrito great simply because too few places want to put it in burritos - it has to be superior tofu.  Soyrizo stands the winner of vegan protein options here for me.

Be warned, the wait for food here is longer than you'd think for a taqueria.

excerpts: It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo).
marinated tofu.author: Danny S.
marinated tofu.review:
Ever since i became a vegetarian it has been difficult to find a good legitimate burrito place, that is until i found this place! 
It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo). Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican. Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste! worth the visit!

excerpts: All options I have tried at Papalote have been very good, though I think the Marinated Tofu (super)
marinated tofu.author: Sam D.
marinated tofu.review:
Spectacular burritos that don't feel like they are missing anything.  All options I have tried at Papalote have been very good, though I think the Marinated Tofu (super) Burrito with the black refried beans stands as my top pick and the best burrito I have had in San Francisco during the limited 2 months I've lived in the city.

The salsa and chips that you get with every order are also top notch.  Can be very crowded though!

excerpts: and she always gets the marinated tofu (super, of course).
marinated tofu.author: Bill H.
marinated tofu.review:
As a couple of vegetarians who still hanker for some tasty Mexican food (we come from New Mexico), Papalote was a great discovery. We ate at the restaurant the first time, but it's almost always packed -- a testament to their tasty menu -- so we've become devoted taker-outers.

Me, I always go for the Soyrizo burrito SUPER (with sour cream, guacamole and cheese, the only way to go!) and she always gets the marinated tofu (super, of course).

For us to-go fans, that the burritos come with a bag of chips and their awesome salsa is icing on the cake. And the nachos are bad-ass.

A few of their dishes aren't so super -- like the overly oily-cheesey queso dishes -- but on the whole, you can't go wrong. Parking ain't easy (is it ever in this city?), which makes take out an even better option.

excerpts: The soyrizo is overrated in my book, but their marinated tofu is just great.
marinated tofu.author: Nori H.
marinated tofu.review:
Pros: 
  * Vegan-friendly.  The soyrizo is overrated in my book, but their marinated tofu is just great.
  * Refried black beans!!

Cons:
  * Unless you call ahead (and who *plans* to want a burrito?!), you have to wait 20-30 minutes to get your order.  Minus 2 stars right there.

Conclusion: I'm sticking to Pancho Villa.

excerpts:
The roasted salsa is amazing, as is their mole sauce, and their marinated tofu, and the soyrizo...

tags: vegetarian
marinated tofu.author: Nithin R.
marinated tofu.review:
The most veg-friendly taqueria I've been to. They have so many veg options, which is good, because we come here at least twice a month. 

The roasted salsa is amazing, as is their mole sauce, and their marinated tofu, and the soyrizo...

tags: vegetarian

excerpts: - their soyrizo (taco, burrito, whatevs) is amazing as is the marinated tofu burrito.
marinated tofu.author: Karen K.
marinated tofu.review:
I've been transitioning to a vegan diet (in other words, i eff up alot and catch myself with a cheesy slice o' pizza and a reg. latte every now and again), and its hard peoples, really HARD to eat out if you have a restrictive diet.  That being said, Papalote is making my life easier in oh so many ways - their soyrizo (taco, burrito, whatevs) is amazing as is the marinated tofu burrito.  I love the chips, I love the salsa, and they are even starting to recognize me when i go in, which makes me happy.  

I want to be clear on this - even if you are not a veg/vegan, this place is delicious.  hear me?  word.

excerpts: I got the marinated tofu burrito
and it lasted for 2 days!
marinated tofu.author: Perry S.
marinated tofu.review:
Papalote is the perfect joint for the hungry. The burrito is humongous! I got the marinated tofu burrito and it lasted for 2 days! It was good cold too ;). 

I was going to get the carne asada, just because I can roll my 'R' like nobody's business, but decided to go on the healthy's side. It was not disappointing let me tell u. Get the super burrito. It's worth it. 

They give u the chips and salsa for appetizer. The salsa was hot!! Really hot. Me likie long time ;).

The place a bit on the small size but it wasn't busy when I was there. Next time I'm totally gonna try the soyrizo. Oh, did I tell u the burrito is huuuge?! Or the fact I can say "I would like one caRne asada, please."

excerpts: I got the Marinated Tofu (it was supposed to be on a spinach tortilla, but it seems that burrito places often advertise burrito flavors they actually don't have).
marinated tofu.author: David Z.
marinated tofu.review:
I was on the quest for an amazing burrito during my two days in SF, and I decided Papalote was the place to get it (based on my Yelp research, of course).

The burrito, while not my Platonic ideal of the perfect burrito, was quite good, especially for its price. I got the Marinated Tofu (it was supposed to be on a spinach tortilla, but it seems that burrito places often advertise burrito flavors they actually don't have). 

The burrito was heavy and warm, filled with tofu, beans, and rice. It was a little different than what I'm used to, but quite enjoyable nonetheless. The salsa was also unusual--rather than resembling pico, it was much smoother and creamier. And, in case people out there judge a burrito joint on its chips, I'd say they were above average. 

All that for $6.30, which is slightly less than the going rate in Atlanta (a much cheaper city overall). The only thing is (and it seems this is common in big cities) there's not much room to sit. So it's best to take it to go.

excerpts: If I am not feeling the soyrizo I can always feed the beast with their amazing marinated tofu tacos.
marinated tofu.author: Angie R.
marinated tofu.review:
I have one word to say about Papalote: SOYRIZO

I never knew they could make a fake meat product that actually drips bright orange grease when you eat it. The grease doesn't actually stain your clothes, but it comes close people, it comes close...

Paplote is my go-to place after yoga on Tues. and Thurs. in the Mission. If I am not feeling the soyrizo I can always feed the beast with their amazing marinated tofu tacos. And I love, love, love the salsa they serve with their chips.

There is also more traditional Mexican fare, including the obligatory dead animals for those who like to eat them. Prices are about the same as other Mexican joints in the Mission, maybe a buck or two higher.

Papalote loses two stars because:

1. They can be extremely agro about kicking you out about 10 seconds after they close.

2. They made fun of my white friend for being Whitey Whiterson, in Spanish, not knowing that Mr. Whiterson actually speaks Spanish. Not cool.

excerpts: Good vegetarian options too (grilled, marinated tofu!).
Good salsa.
Free chips.
They bring the food to your table too!
Sure it may take a little longer than most taquerias but its worth the wait knowing that what you ordered is fresh.
Oh, did I mention how good the prices are?!
marinated tofu.author: Jackie O.
marinated tofu.review:
I was skeptical at first but now I'm really into this place! They make your food as you order it--That's right, when you order grilled chicken, they grill it right then. That means there are no metal tins of grilled chicken or carne just sitting there all day being heated. Good vegetarian options too (grilled, marinated tofu!). Good salsa. Free chips. They bring the food to your table too!
Sure it may take a little longer than most taquerias but its worth the wait knowing that what you ordered is fresh.
Oh, did I mention how good the prices are?!

excerpts: vegan soyrizo, marinated tofu, etc.
marinated tofu.author: Rob C.
marinated tofu.review:
2.5 like a fancy chipotle in taste.  quintessential sf.  look at the menu.  vegan soyrizo, marinated tofu, etc.  no carnitas, al pastor, etc.
took away 2 carne asada tacos here, $7 topped with guac. and all the americanized toppings.  steak cooked to order at least, otherwise not my style.  as a side note, the salsa with the chips was very nice and hearty.

excerpts: Besides the salsa, which is a litmus test for any Mexican restaurant, there's the Marinated Tofu.
Though I'm no longer a vegetarian I need Papalote's Marinated Tofu every once in a while
marinated tofu.author: Francisco G.
marinated tofu.review:
As a burrito connoisseur I have to say that Papalote is sublime.

Now, Papalote is not a run of the mill burrito shop.  There's hundreds if not thousands of excellent burrito places in the Mission alone.  There's burrito shops next to burrito shops, burrito shops stacked on top of each other.  Burrito shops on wheels!

...But there's something unique about this place, starting with the salsa.

I have dreams about their delicious salsa and am thankful that you can buy it by the pint.

It's become a ritual to me whenever I go there not to eat the salsa with the chips right away, the secret is to use it on the burrito.

The salsa makes everything better.  Heavenly's the word.

Besides the salsa, which is a litmus test for any Mexican restaurant, there's the Marinated Tofu.

OMG!  Though I'm no longer a vegetarian I need Papalote's Marinated Tofu every once in a while or my life is just not complete.

It's hard for me to write about the cons when I love the little imperfections or nuances of this place and the food is this addictive.

The portions are not humongous, they're modest...

And it's way too far from my house.  I want a Papalote truck parked on the street where I live or better yet, following me around the city wherever I go.

But I can't have that and that's very painful to me.

excerpts: Trip #4 will involve the marinated tofu at my classmate's suggestion.
marinated tofu.author: Phuong T.
marinated tofu.review:
I gotta be honest: the first time I came here, I wasn't that impressed.  I had a standard burrito with carne asada, nothing to write home about.  

However, as a USF student, it's damn close to campus, so I made a second trip.  And I wasn't in the mood for anything too heavy this time around, so I had the eggplant and zucchini tacos.  DAMN.  Tastiest thing I've ever had in a tortilla.  I had it to go, so when I finally sat down to eat, the juices had split my tacos in half, making it impossible to hold, and I had no fork available.  However, it was so flavorful that I very quickly forgave the cooks at Papalote.

(I'm not vegetarian, btw.  I was thinking that perhaps they were making the veggie stuff taste so good to make up for not having meat... you know, to sell it to the carnivores, too.)

I got a little wiser by visit #3.  I ordered the eggplant and zucchini BURRITO this time.  And damn, that was satisfying.  Lasted me two meals!  And I didn't need a fork this time. :)  

Prices range from about $3-$7 for various items (thank god they accommodate for students).  I'm planning to make regular trips out there between classes.  Trip #4 will involve the marinated tofu at my classmate's suggestion.  

Oh yeah, and parking might be a pain.  Recommend the 1-hour street parking on Masonic or the Albertson's parking across the street (but you'll have to buy something from Albertson's to get it validated there, I think).

excerpts: Papalote has it all....spinach tortillas, guacamole OR regular avocado, soyrizo, marinated tofu, perfectly seasoned grilled veggies, and beer.
Don't even get me started on the salsa.
Fuck, my mouth is already watering.....
no joke!
The salsa is amazing and definitely what sets this place apart from other spots in the mission.
Delicious and spicy in all the right ways [insert sexual joke
here].
On the real though.....
Papalote is on top of their flavor game.
I always bring my out-of town guests here...
everyone loves it.
Thank you thank you thank you.
marinated tofu.author: Emily S.
marinated tofu.review: Sometimes I daydream about eating burritos. Papalote makes those dreams come true. Papalote has it all....spinach tortillas, guacamole OR regular avocado, soyrizo, marinated tofu, perfectly seasoned grilled veggies, and beer. Don't even get me started on the salsa. Fuck, my mouth is already watering.....no joke! The salsa is amazing and definitely what sets this place apart from other spots in the mission. Delicious and spicy in all the right ways [insert sexual joke here]. On the real though.....Papalote is on top of their flavor game. I always bring my out-of town guests here... everyone loves it. Thank you thank you thank you.

excerpts: I got the marinated tofu, which was pretty good, but she got the chile verde, which was...
wow.
So tender, and flavor for days.
It's a cute little place, but I could see it getting CROWDED on busy nights.
marinated tofu.author: Ed M.
marinated tofu.review:
I couldn't get enough of the salsa! Damn, I'm craving it right now. 

My friend and I were just walking around the neighborhood looking for eats when their colorful  dining area sucked us in... I got the marinated tofu, which was pretty good, but she got the chile verde, which was...wow. So tender, and flavor for days. It's a cute little place, but I could see it getting CROWDED on busy nights.

excerpts: Marinated Tofu with refried Black Beans !
marinated tofu.author: Dave W.
marinated tofu.review:
Marinated Tofu with refried Black Beans !

Great Salsa, super fresh and the dude who runs the place is all about good vibes. 

Check it out.

excerpts: I ordered the very thing they raved about - the marinated tofu burrito.
I was entirely dissapointed.
marinated tofu.author: Inna H.
marinated tofu.review:
My roommates had been raving about it for a long time so I finally went. 

I ordered the very thing they raved about - the marinated tofu burrito. I was entirely dissapointed. The tofu was soggy and flavorless and the ingredients around it didn't seem to make up for it. 

I would give the place less stars for that burrito but they had a decent beer selection and the jicama salad on the side was a nice touch. They do bring you chips while you are waiting and they taste very fresh but the salsa that accompanies them leaves much to be desired for me. 

I am willing to think that other items on the menu are better but the tofu didn't do it for me.

excerpts: First off, the marinated tofu buritto is the shizzy.
If you dine-in, be prepared for a burrito on a plate, unless you ask for foil.
Compared to farralito and  other nearby joints, the size of their log is a little smaller.
The tortilla is crispy on the outside but is still a little chewy,maybe too much on the chewy.
I just like to unhinge my jaw, and drop a burrito straight down in one gulp with NO CHEWING.
That's how I like it, i don't chew, I just swallow.
Jokes aside, how about their salsa.
A brown and smooth liquid, that I haven't found anywhere else.
It's great.
FYI, I think their horchata is made with soy milk, which ROCKS!
Best of all, you can dine-in and not feel like a stabbing may occur.
I would bring my southern ass backwoods family here and not worry about giving them a heartattack.
Well, I dunno, it IS the Mission.
marinated tofu.author: Jeremy P.
marinated tofu.review:
Sweet Mercy, I think this place is going to make me a fat ass.
I am a burrito whore and my post will read as such.

First off, the marinated tofu buritto is the shizzy. If you dine-in, be prepared for a burrito on a plate, unless you ask for foil.  Compared to farralito and  other nearby joints, the size of their log is a little smaller.  The tortilla is crispy on the outside but is still a little chewy,maybe too much on the chewy. I just like to unhinge my jaw, and drop a burrito straight down in one gulp with NO CHEWING.  That's how I like it, i don't chew, I just swallow.

 Jokes aside, how about their salsa. A brown and smooth liquid, that I haven't found anywhere else.  It's great.

FYI, I think their horchata is made with soy milk, which ROCKS!

Best of all, you can dine-in and not feel like a stabbing may occur.  I would bring my southern ass backwoods family here and not worry about giving them a heartattack.  Well, I dunno, it IS the Mission.

excerpts: Oh, marinated tofu!
Yes, I'll stand in line.
marinated tofu.author: Alana D.
marinated tofu.review:
Amazing salsa.
Oh, marinated tofu!
Yes, I'll stand in line.

excerpts: marinated tofu.
marinated tofu.author: Laura B.
marinated tofu.review:
marinated tofu.  fresh grilled veggies.  vegetarian beans.  amazing salsa.  delicious rice.  crispy chips.  MOTHERFUCKING SOYRIZO.

it's like all my little vegan pig dreams came true.  i've always said that the only cusine that's hard to do vegan is the burrito (yes, i consider the burrito to be a cuisine) and papalote has revolutionized my burrito eating life.  if you are vegetarian or vegan, go here NOW!

excerpts: Papalote is one of the few SF Mexican restaurants that offers customers the choice of substituting vegan/vegetarian options (soyrizo, marinated tofu) in their dishes.
The decor is punchy, the employees very friendly, and their tofu quesadilla is a light, delicious, and quick bite.
So why give the place only 3 stars?", one may ask.
Well, for me, Pokez in San Diego still sets the bar in the "Best Vegan Mexican Restaurant" division.
marinated tofu.author: Momo R.
marinated tofu.review: Papalote is one of the few SF Mexican restaurants that offers customers the choice of substituting vegan/vegetarian options (soyrizo, marinated tofu) in their dishes.  The decor is punchy, the employees very friendly, and their tofu quesadilla is a light, delicious, and quick bite.  "So why give the place only 3 stars?", one may ask.  Well, for me, Pokez in San Diego still sets the bar in the "Best Vegan Mexican Restaurant" division.

excerpts: They make a five star mole, even when combined with grilled and marinated tofu.
This sounded suspicioud but tasted surprisingly good.
These guys also make a stellar salsa, hot and spicy, but so different from anything else I've tried.
marinated tofu.author: Purnima M.
marinated tofu.review: They make a five star mole, even when combined with grilled and marinated tofu. This sounded suspicioud but tasted surprisingly good. These guys also make a stellar salsa, hot and spicy, but so different from anything else I've tried. Minus one star for the veggie tacos which had no toppings save the vegetables. Later saw that the menu said we could add the sour cream and guac if we wanted. But you woulda thought the cashier would have mentioned this to us when we ordered? Will be back to try these again, and the nachos as well. But still not completely sold.

excerpts: If you want a marinated tofu burrito with fruit salsa on a Fiestaware plate to go with your all natural Izze soda, then this is the place for you!
marinated tofu.author: Amy E.
marinated tofu.review: If you want a marinated tofu burrito with fruit salsa on a Fiestaware plate to go with your all natural Izze soda, then this is the place for you!

excerpts: Gotta give this place 5 stars for the awesome Marinated tofu burrito!!
Yummy!!
The hubby got the nachos and quesadia
(sp?)
and those were good as well.
THe thing i liked the most is that the plates were not drenched with grease like some of the other mexican restaurants i have been to, esp.
on the quesadia plate.
marinated tofu.author: Shelley N.
marinated tofu.review: Gotta give this place 5 stars for the awesome Marinated tofu burrito!! Yummy!! The hubby got the nachos and quesadia (sp?) and those were good as well. THe thing i liked the most is that the plates were not drenched with grease like some of the other mexican restaurants i have been to, esp. on the quesadia plate.  The nachos were good, not too much cheese, not too little just enough... good food, will definitely come back!!

excerpts:
So...I crave the marinated tofu burrito on a regular basis
The grilled vegetable burrito is crazy good-
But that freaking marinated tofu is just incredible
The chips are awesome and the salsa totally lives up to the hype
I was greeted with a familiar brown bag full chips and salsa and a marinated tofu burrito (tastes good even reheated!) 
such a nice welcome home
Soooooooooo goooooooood
  
(oh and apparently the meat choices are also super awesome...tasty enough that the boy will gladly wait in line on a regular basis to bring home takeout)
marinated tofu.author: Maxine M.
marinated tofu.review:
So...I crave the marinated tofu burrito on a regular basis
The grilled vegetable burrito is crazy good-
But that freaking marinated tofu is just incredible
The chips are awesome and the salsa totally lives up to the hype
(oh and 50 cents for extra salsa is so not a big deal)
My husband works down the street from this location
And when I see him come home with that brown paper bag full o burrito and chips and salsa
I get a huge smile on my face 
 I'm not sure what this says about me 
(well, I guess I do know what it says but whatever- shove it!)
But when I returned from a trip to Austin last week-
 I was happy to find that instead of flowers...I was greeted with a familiar brown bag full chips and salsa and a marinated tofu burrito (tastes good even reheated!) 
such a nice welcome home
Soooooooooo goooooooood
  (oh and apparently the meat choices are also super awesome...tasty enough that the boy will gladly wait in line on a regular basis to bring home takeout)

excerpts: Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos.......
Absolutely awesome!
One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time.
The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste.
Excellent blend!
I'd go back just for this dish.
Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5.
These guys set the bar on tofu.
marinated tofu.author: Miguel V.
marinated tofu.review:
Papalote- 
The chips are just ok, the salsa is very good. The salsa has a nice flavor, fluidity and color. You can pour it over anything! Oh yeah, it's served in little black containers opposed to the clear Solo cup every other Taqueira uses; it added a little piazzas. We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom. Very good, I give it 4 out of 5. Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff. Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos....... Absolutely awesome! One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time. The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste. Excellent blend! I'd go back just for this dish. Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5. These guys set the bar on tofu. Tacos Mole with Chicken.....You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt. The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy. I gave them 2 out of 5. Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good. They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro. Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes. I gave them 4 out of 5. Friend had a carne asada burrito.......Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt. Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about. I gave the burrito 3 out of 5. 
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait. It was an order as you pay type place. I really like the grates they use on their grills opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses. The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!

excerpts: you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter.
i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something.
it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.
marinated tofu.author: Angi C.
marinated tofu.review: located on the noe/mission border, this taqueria is definitely fancier than the others on 24th. you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter. i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something. it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
marinated tofu.author: Cindy L.
marinated tofu.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: I like the tofu mole, my friend likes the marinated tofu.
We fight about which is better, but really, they're both quite good.
marinated tofu.author: Rosie R.
marinated tofu.review: Attention vegetarians: Yummy, yummy tofu burritos here.  I like the tofu mole, my friend likes the marinated tofu.  We fight about which is better, but really, they're both quite good.

excerpts: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo.

The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city.
marinated tofu.author: Eugene P.
marinated tofu.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts: I took my bestie who is vegan and she loved loved loved the soyrizo!
The location is small and the line will probably be out the door
but it's worth the wait.
If you aren't walking the city, pick up a jar (or 3) of the sauce because you will want to put it on everything!
soyrizo.author: Roma N.
soyrizo.review: Fresh ingredients and a house salsa that is amazing on everything! I always get the burrito and it's outstanding. I took my bestie who is vegan and she loved loved loved the soyrizo! The location is small and the line will probably be out the door but it's worth the wait. If you aren't walking the city, pick up a jar (or 3) of the sauce because you will want to put it on everything!

excerpts: You can sleep easy knowing that a piece of meat may not have snuck its way into your Soyrizo Burrito.
How can we be so sure?
Because unlike other burrito places, Papalote actually has something to lose.
soyrizo.author: Ringo M.
soyrizo.review:
I'm gonna say something really snobbish. Ready? Here goes.

I don't like Papalolte because it's a hipster-infested burrito place.

Oops i mean hipster-invested.

Oh you know it's hipster because: 

One, everything in the restaurant is spanking clean. 

Two, they have this signature creamy salsa that all silicon techies like to irrationally rave about in their work patios. 

Three, you always see these Postmates/Grubhub/UberEats/Eat24 people hanging around, waiting to pick up a Pork Chile Verde no sour cream extra guac spinach wrap for some techie who does the software programming for Postmates/Grubhub/Uber. 

Four, remember that delicious salsa mentioned above? Yeah they sell it separately in a jar. 

Five, and probably the most evident indicator of Papalolte's hipster affiliation, a burrito costs like $10 to $11 #damndaniel

My good friend, Salty P, swears by this place though. He loves pouring that creamy salsa on each bite of his carne asada while convincing us that Papalote is actually the best burrito place in Mission. But we can't trust this guy to give an unbiased opinion. Salty P. wears a beard, rocks an expensive vest, and has like, 5 hydroflask bottles ("i need it").

Although i might not like Papalote, i do recommend it to my vegetarian friends though. I know other burrito places offer vegetarian options, too, but Papalote takes their vegetarian menu seriously. Unlike other places, you can be sure that the oil used for the veggie options is kept separately from the meat. You can sleep easy knowing that a piece of meat may not have snuck its way into your Soyrizo Burrito. How can we be so sure? Because unlike other burrito places, Papalote actually has something to lose. They got a chain store down at Fulton.

So yeah, if you don't have any dietary restrictions and/or if you're not a hipster, then i would go Cancun and El Faro instead. But if you are a vegetarian and/or keeps a leather notebook in your butt pocket, then Papalote is the place for you :)

excerpts:
I love Papalote for going the extra mile providing several vegan options including:
veggie with potato, carrot, and mushroom
grilled veggie with eggplant and zucchini
vegan soyrizo
marinated grilled tofu
I went with the veggie burrito and had them add avocado.
It came with chips and a yummy homemade salsa.
I will be sure to visit here the next time in the Bay Area as was wonderful!
soyrizo.author: Shane S.
soyrizo.review:
The Mission is packed with burrito places and all are super great yet my favorite burrito is at Papalote. I'm a longtime vegan of 16 years so Mexican food has always been a favorite.

I love Papalote for going the extra mile providing several vegan options including:
veggie with potato, carrot, and mushroom
grilled veggie with eggplant and zucchini
vegan soyrizo
marinated grilled tofu

All of these come with beans, rice, pico de gallo.

I went with the veggie burrito and had them add avocado. It came with chips and a yummy homemade salsa. I will be sure to visit here the next time in the Bay Area as was wonderful!

excerpts: Their soyrizo gave me food poisoning, only after I ordered did I see their health score was 74.
Disgusting.
Barf.
Never again!
soyrizo.author: Sloane F.
soyrizo.review: I normally avoid this place but I went on a whim cause Arizmendi was closed and I needed lunch quick.. big mistake. Their soyrizo gave me food poisoning, only after I ordered did I see their health score was 74. Disgusting. Barf. Never again!

excerpts: I got the Vegan Soyrizo burrito
and it was delicious.
Would highly recommend visiting!
soyrizo.author: Michelle H.
soyrizo.review: Great place for a very filling meal. Love that they have good vegan options. I got the Vegan Soyrizo burrito and it was delicious. Would highly recommend visiting!
