excerpts: One the best veggie burritos, the potato, mushroom, carrot, is my favorite the soyrizo can also be made vegan too.
The papalote sauce is also crazy good ask them to put it in your burrito for extra flavor!
soyrizo.author: J.s. H.
soyrizo.review: One the best veggie burritos, the potato, mushroom, carrot, is my favorite the soyrizo can also be made vegan too. The papalote sauce is also crazy good ask them to put it in your burrito for extra flavor!

excerpts: I usually get the soyrizo burrito + potatoes.
soyrizo.author: Shereen A.
soyrizo.review:
I can't get enough of this place and their homemade hot sauce (purchased by the bottle of course). Always been out of horchata, so never tried it, but it's on my list. 

I haven't tried anything meaty here yet but I can't imagine it'd be anything less than delicious. I usually get the soyrizo burrito + potatoes. Rice, beans, pico de gallo on wheat tortilla noms.

Even when I'm full, I'm never too full. If I am, it's a bonus snack for tomorrow.

I could probably eat here everyday, forever.

excerpts: I tried the soyrizo one and LOVED IT.
I'm sold!
soyrizo.author: Ezra B.
soyrizo.review:
Best salsa I've EVER HAD!!!

Man it's so good, I started buying it in stores to use for chips and salsa at home!

The burritos are pretty good here, too :) I tried the soyrizo one and LOVED IT. I'm sold!

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito and papalotes sauce...
mucho way happy in my mouth.
soyrizo.author: Bethany P.
soyrizo.review: So very vegan friendly. Hubby is not vegan and enjoyed the meat. The soyrizo burrito and papalotes sauce...mucho way happy in my mouth.

excerpts: With a combination of Mexican and American Food this restaurante has a great options with soyrizo, f the best veggie food's invention or grilled vegetables!!
Only bad thing us the noise.
Is a very small restaurante and sometimes members of some groups (today next to me) were screaming all time!!
But that is out control of the restaurante!!!!
soyrizo.author: Arturo R.
soyrizo.review:
Maybe one of the best places in SF for vegans and vegetarians with richs flavors.
With a combination of Mexican and American Food this restaurante has a great options with soyrizo, f the best veggie food's invention or grilled vegetables!!
 Only bad thing us the noise. Is a very small restaurante and sometimes members of some groups (today next to me) were screaming all time!! But that is out control of the restaurante!!!!

excerpts: Always like visiting Papalote with their great soyrizo vegetarian option.
Orders come with chips + their famous salsa.
Burrito bowls are my go-to here
and they make them great.
This restaurant is small, with limited seating, so be prepared to wait.
soyrizo.author: TZ J.
soyrizo.review: Always like visiting Papalote with their great soyrizo vegetarian option.  Orders come with chips + their famous salsa.  Burrito bowls are my go-to here and they make them great.  This restaurant is small, with limited seating, so be prepared to wait.

excerpts: I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!)
with a spinach tortilla.
I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!!
Would get it again for sure.
It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick.
I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good
but I like the soyrizo add-on more!
The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us.
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!
soyrizo.author: Pooja S.
soyrizo.review:
Went here for dinner and really loved it! I think it's hard to be creative / differentiated with Mexican food, and Papalote managed to be. It's a small place and I would not pick coming here for the ambiance / if you want an intimate setting. Also really difficult if you have a large group because it's so small, and usually pretty crowded. I got pretty lucky and got a table in under 10 minutes. 

Sat down after ordering food, and the waiter immediately came with chips and salsa. Chips were a bit stale, and while their salsa was good, I don't think it was as amazing as it's hyped up to be. Don't get me wrong - I did still really like it, just think it is as good as other salsas I've tried. 

The burritos are HUGE and super filling!! Portion size is great, and I thought the price was pretty good! I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!) with a spinach tortilla. I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!! Would get it again for sure. It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick. I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good but I like the soyrizo add-on more! The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us. 
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!

excerpts: I didn't care for the soyrizo.
soyrizo.author: Brandi W.
soyrizo.review:
Oh, Papalote. We've had some good times together. Your tofu mole burrito is so hearty and delicious, but I'm afraid we must part ways for a little while. This isn't necessarily break-up, but I need a little break. I think we should see other people. 

The service is spot-on, but the execution of the food has been very hit or miss lately. 

Maybe one day our paths will cross again. That tofu mole burrito is the stuff dreams are made of. Your salsa is fabulous, as is the guacamole. Unfortunately, everything else that I've tried here just hasn't been that good. I didn't care for the soyrizo. Maybe you were just having an off day?

No hard feelings. I wish you nothing but the best in your future endeavors.

excerpts: The vegan soyrizo burrito here is my absolute favorite!
I crave it constantly and probably have it like 3x a week for dinner.
My favorite order is: soyrizo burrito with the black refried beans and add guacamole.
My only frustration is that even though I always order and extra cup of salsa- because the salsa is AMAZING- they forget the 2nd salsa like 30% of the time-
and I still get charged for it.
I also would love to have jalopenos in my burrito.
They will add them if you ask-
but they will seriously put like 50 in.
I wish I could somehow convey I would just like a few : )
soyrizo.author: Sky B.
soyrizo.review:
The vegan soyrizo burrito here is my absolute favorite! I crave it constantly and probably have it like 3x a week for dinner. The people who work there probably think I never cook (this is kind of true)

My favorite order is: soyrizo burrito with the black refried beans and add guacamole. 
My only frustration is that even though I always order and extra cup of salsa- because the salsa is AMAZING- they forget the 2nd salsa like 30% of the time- and I still get charged for it.  I also would love to have jalopenos in my burrito. They will add them if you ask- but they will seriously put like 50 in. I wish I could somehow convey I would just like a few : ) So now I just ask for them on the side or use my own at home : )

Yummiest burrito every. Expensive for a burrito- but definitely my favorite in SF.

excerpts: Love the variety of options for "meats" (e.g., soyrizo) and beans (very few places offer refried black beans), and
the salsa really is to die for.
They used to sell it fresh out of the refrigerator, and we used to take a jar home after every visit.
Now they're selling it in a labeled, shelf-stable jar, and it's just not as good (must be preservatives or something).
The stuff they serve with your dine-in order is the good (fresh) stuff.
soyrizo.author: Andrew M.
soyrizo.review:
Five stars for the salsa, three stars for the burritos. My wife likes Papalote because the ingredients seem "fresher" than other taquerias, but I think that's actually what detracts a little from their flavor... they seem kind of bland to me. Not enough commingling of juices and so on, or something like that.

Love the variety of options for "meats" (e.g., soyrizo) and beans (very few places offer refried black beans), and the salsa really is to die for. They used to sell it fresh out of the refrigerator, and we used to take a jar home after every visit. Now they're selling it in a labeled, shelf-stable jar, and it's just not as good (must be preservatives or something). The stuff they serve with your dine-in order is the good (fresh) stuff.

excerpts: It was good, and definitely gets props for vegan options (soyrizo, tofu as protein options).
They also have pretty comprehensive choices (whole wheat tortillas, mushrooms, black, pinto, or refried black beans).
Much better than the vegan soyrizo combo I got the first time.
It was a very satisfying burrito, better than chipotle.
I've come here like 15+ times over the past year.
Updated to 5 star.
soyrizo.author: Matt T.
soyrizo.review:
Supposedly the best burrito in San Francisco.  

I wouldn't necessarily say that.  It was good, and definitely gets props for vegan options (soyrizo, tofu as protein options).  They also have pretty comprehensive choices (whole wheat tortillas, mushrooms, black, pinto, or refried black beans).  The house made roasted tomato salsa was sorta special too.

I'd come here again if I was in the mood for burritos and in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here if chipotle was nearby.

UPDATE: Came here a second time.  Get Achiote Marinated Tofu, grilled vegetables(carrots, potatoes, mushrooms), and guacamole in a burrito.  Much better than the vegan soyrizo combo I got the first time.  It was a very satisfying burrito, better than chipotle.  I've come here like 15+ times over the past year.  Updated to 5 star.

excerpts: I ended up ordering Super Soyrizo burrito (10+).
There was a serving of complementary chips and home mad creamy salsa.
The salsa was very good (50 cents for extra sauce).
The soyrizo burrito was good.
It was very saucy/juicy and well structured (almost no dripping).
You could taste all the flavors and it was full of it.
I would try out other options (breakfast burrito :) when I am around.
Try regular burrito if you don't want too many ingredients.
It is little bit more pricey then other places in the neighborhood.
However, it is still worth a try.
soyrizo.author: Sid P.
soyrizo.review:
Very good, savory, and delicious food. I came here with a friend for lunch. There are many choices for Vegans and Vegetarians. I ended up ordering Super Soyrizo burrito (10+). There was a serving of complementary chips and home mad creamy salsa. The salsa was very good (50 cents for extra sauce). I would recommend ordering an additional side of chips and salsa (1.69) if you want more salsa.

The soyrizo burrito was good. It was very saucy/juicy and well structured (almost no dripping). You could taste all the flavors and it was full of it. I would try out other options (breakfast burrito :) when I am around. Try regular burrito if you don't want too many ingredients. It is little bit more pricey then other places in the neighborhood.  However, it is still worth a try.

excerpts: The vegan soyrizo burrito is my favorite and I always make sure to have jars of Papalote hot salsa at home.
At the restaurant, you can get the freshly made salsa to take home or the more familiar store version that you find at up scale supermarkets and both are excellent.
Really good food and the best salsa on the planet!
soyrizo.author: Jan P.
soyrizo.review: The vegan soyrizo burrito is my favorite and I always make sure to have jars of Papalote hot salsa at home. At the restaurant, you can get the freshly made salsa to take home or the more familiar store version that you find at up scale supermarkets and both are excellent. Really good food and the best salsa on the planet!

excerpts: Where else can I get a soyrizo or tofu mole burrito?
The ingredients are always fresh and that salsa is killer!
Just wish they would include more of it or have a salsa bar...
The cute and sweet girls @ the counter are always helpful and nice when I call in my order, seriously, who doesn't if it's for take-out?
Papalote gets extremely busy and isn't the biggest space in the world.
soyrizo.author: John B.
soyrizo.review:
This would probably be my favorite place to grab lunch if it weren't for the high end price attached to a traditionally reasonably priced food. Although I don't really mind paying a premium for their exceptional quality & service. 

Where else can I get a soyrizo or tofu mole burrito? The ingredients are always fresh and that salsa is killer! Just wish they would include more of it or have a salsa bar... The cute and sweet girls @ the counter are always helpful and nice when I call in my order, seriously, who doesn't if it's for take-out? Papalote gets extremely busy and isn't the biggest space in the world. #shoutout to Alma and the girls for always getting my order just right while greeting me with a beautiful smile when I pick it up. 

Yum! Can't stop thinking about my next visit...

excerpts: The veggie breakfast burrito with soyrizo is heaven on a plate for any vegetarian.
As is obvious, the salsa here is also out of this world and will make any Mexican food better.
Also, the people behind the counter are super friendly and always have a smile on their faces, or that may just be because they recognize me from coming here all the time.
Two thumbs up!
soyrizo.author: Isaac R.
soyrizo.review: The veggie breakfast burrito with soyrizo is heaven on a plate for any vegetarian. As is obvious, the salsa here is also out of this world and will make any Mexican food better. Also, the people behind the counter are super friendly and always have a smile on their faces, or that may just be because they recognize me from coming here all the time. Two thumbs up!

excerpts: I ordered the soyrizo tacos.
They are like a mix between real Mexican style (not fried shells) and Cali-style (lettuce).
I think the tortillas are homemade, and I loved that they were kind of thick.
The soyrizo was perfectly seasoned, and the lettuce was super fresh.
soyrizo.author: Courtney S.
soyrizo.review:
Delicioso! Came here for lunch with my two gf's around 1:30 on Saturday. It was busy but not packed; we were able to get a seat right after we ordered. 
So this place you order at the front and then find a seat. They will bring you a little serving of chips (individualized) and this yummy yummy salsa-type thing. I'm not exactly sure what it is, but it was really good - and kind of spicy too, which I LOVED! They will also bring your food to the table.

I ordered the soyrizo tacos. They are like a mix between real Mexican style (not fried shells) and Cali-style (lettuce). I think the tortillas are homemade, and I loved that they were kind of thick. The soyrizo was perfectly seasoned, and the lettuce was super fresh. The whole package was very good.

My gf's ordered burritos and they looked amazing! The tortillas looked like legit mexican-style tortillas, and they were huge! So worth the like $10. I'll have to try a burrito next time.

All-in-all, I can say I will definitely recommend this place to friends, and I definitely would love to come back!

excerpts: it was the soyrizo burrito and the flavors were great, left the west for a while came back and now in 2014 had the super chicken burrito.
This place still has the consistently great flavor that it did 10 years ago.
soyrizo.author: Marc R.
soyrizo.review:
Had my first burrito of Papalote in 2004 it was the soyrizo burrito and the flavors were great, left the west for a while came back and now in 2014 had the super chicken burrito. This place still has the consistently great flavor that it did 10 years ago. Salsa is really good and chips are crisp and fresh. 

Only downside to this place is that it is cramped with very little seating when its busy also the line can get overwhelming for my likes. 

Pop in give it a try and see WHY they beat Bobby Flay at Salsa Cook Off!

excerpts: we order one carne asada burrito and one soyrizo burrito
the soyrizo tasted an awful lot like the frozen chorizo breakfast
burrito
you can buy at trader joes for 4 dollars,
im being serious.
the carne asada was good, the meat was fresh and probably one of the better carne asada meats i've seen in a burrito

, i can see if they justified charging 7.50 for their chips and salsa, since that is what its known for, but burrito for almost 8 bucks, no way

2) got our order wrong, we made it clear, one carne and one soyrizo, said it twice.

what the waiter brought us was two soyrizos, then had the audacity to show us the receipt, which clearly stated 2 soyrizo (but come on, are you telling me that the lady who punched it into the computer didnt make any mistake?)
soyrizo.author: Long C.
soyrizo.review:
I came here for 2 reasons, 1) after reading about it on the paper (or was it yahoo, i forget), and 2) because my friend recommended it

I know this place is known for there salsa, and yes they get props for their salsa, it was quite delicious, though personally i'd still prefer the fresh stuff over the "processed" salsa (i dont know if its processed or if they just intentionally make it into a mush/mash consistency)

Yes this place makes solid burritos, but then again, i don't think i've ever eaten a bad burrito, actually, i dont think i've ever eaten bad mexican food, its just one thing that is hard to mess up

we order one carne asada burrito and one soyrizo burrito

the soyrizo tasted an awful lot like the frozen chorizo breakfast burrito you can buy at trader joes for 4 dollars, im being serious. the carne asada was good, the meat was fresh and probably one of the better carne asada meats i've seen in a burrito 

so why do they only get 3 stars?

1) 7.50 for a burrito, too expensive, i can see if they justified charging 7.50 for their chips and salsa, since that is what its known for, but burrito for almost 8 bucks, no way

2) got our order wrong, we made it clear, one carne and one soyrizo, said it twice. what the waiter brought us was two soyrizos, then had the audacity to show us the receipt, which clearly stated 2 soyrizo (but come on, are you telling me that the lady who punched it into the computer didnt make any mistake?) 

3) salsa and chip portion was alright, but when i asked for a bit more salsa for my burrito, and the waiter said an extra 50 cents, sorry, thats 50 cents im not willing to pay for something that other restaurants give out for free in unlimited portions

in summation, this is san francisco, where burrito joints and food trucks litter almost every street corner, i have definitely had better burritos elsewhere, dont know what the hype is all about

excerpts: I used to get the tofu mole burrito until I had their soyrizo.
soyrizo.author: Justin S.
soyrizo.review:
What can I say about this place that hasn't been said a million times already? First of all, the salsa is so delicious that I had to send a jar down to my mom and dad in LA (they loved it), and secondly, everything else I've had there has been equally amazing.

I am a vegan and they have plenty of vegan options. No lard in any of the beans, thank god. I used to get the tofu mole burrito until I had their soyrizo. Now I get that so often that they know my order as soon as I walk through the door.

The staff is super friendly and they are super fast, especially if you call in your order while you're on your way, which I usually do so I can go eat in the park.

The dining room is clean, if a bit too small at times, and the bathroom is... Crowdsourced artistic... But certainly clean.

So, they may be more expensive that other mission taquerias, but the quality makes it worth it. Pretty much the only bad thing about this place is that they're only open til 10pm.

excerpts: If only there was a way to get tofu/soyrizo AND veggies without it costing so much!
No matter what I order I end up overspending.
soyrizo.author: J K.
soyrizo.review:
This is probably my favorite burrito place, due to their vegetarian friendliness.  (I wish that 90% of "vegetarian" burritos in this city weren't filled with lard and chicken stock.)  Sure, I liked it better before it was overflowing with Mission hipsters, but what can you do...

The salsa is awesome and those teeny tiny containers aren't nearly big enough.  I really hope I don't find out that its secret ingredient isn't beef or something, cause I do love it. 

The only downside is its priciness.  If only there was a way to get tofu/soyrizo AND veggies without it costing so much!  No matter what I order I end up overspending.  And if I'm getting really nit-picky, I have noticed the burritos have been pretty rice-heavy lately.

Tip: If you eat in, your burrito won't be wrapped in foil, so you'll be risking the always embarrassing burrito "spill-out" all over your plate.

excerpts: That being said, the best thing I've tried on this menu is actually the soyrizo (soy chorizo)!
I tried a piece of the soyrizo quesadilla, and was very pleasantly surprised.
It was well seasoned, and the texture was not weird.
The salsa was really good and different than any other salsa I've tasted, but I still think the soyrizo was more stand-out.
but then you can just get the soyrizo!)
soyrizo.author: Alice C.
soyrizo.review:
From the "That's what she said" joke potential to the succulent flavor, I love [almost] everything about meat.

So you can imagine what I'm about to say is very difficult, but it's also a testimony to how skilled Papalote is at making a healthier alternative not taste like feet.

That being said, the best thing I've tried on this menu is actually the soyrizo (soy chorizo)!  I tried a piece of the soyrizo quesadilla, and was very pleasantly surprised.  It was well seasoned, and the texture was not weird.  I think this dish will be my go-to from now on!

OTHER DISHES I'VE TRIED:
1. Chips and salsa - this is on the 7x7 100 things to try list.  The salsa was really good and different than any other salsa I've tasted, but I still think the soyrizo was more stand-out.
2. Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.  Awesome!
3. Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
4. Jicama salad - usually comes on the side with your meal, and refreshingly delicious!  

LIKES:
1. Large portions 
2. Leftovers still tasty 2 days later
3. Lots of veggie alternatives
4. Seems more health conscious than the average taqueria

DISLIKES:
1. Dine in was crowded...you'd probably be annoyed/displeased if you're claustrophobic.  You can phone in orders though.
2. Prices are a bit higher than what you'd expect to find at other Mexican places in the Mission - the steak fajitas were $13.95!  (and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...but then you can just get the soyrizo!)

excerpts: I am in LOVE with their soyrizo burrito.
I buy soyrizo from TJs and make it at home, but the balance and the spiciness they achieve is just out of this world.
soyrizo.author: Shira O.
soyrizo.review:
Wow. Yippee. Delish. Yummers. As a vegetarian friendly gal, (I eat the fishes, cause, well you know, so I can't claim full veggie status) I am in LOVE with their soyrizo burrito. I buy soyrizo from TJs and make it at home, but the balance and the spiciness they achieve is just out of this world. 

Also, the creamy/saucey/spicey/what the HECK do they put in that saucy sauce is also mind blowing.

So for the record, that's 1--out of this world reference and 1--mind blowing reference...which if you haven't already garnered means this place is pretty flippin' good!

excerpts: Soyrizo & egg burrito, all day every day.
soyrizo.author: Von W.
soyrizo.review:
Soyrizo & egg burrito, all day every day.  

I crave it if I don't have once every couple of weeks.  It be callin me man that sh** just be callin me!

excerpts: The best soy burrito, called soyrizo that I ever had and the salsa is so delicious.
soyrizo.author: FoodCritic F.
soyrizo.review:
I wish this place was here in NJ. Another great place for vegetarians.
The best soy burrito, called soyrizo that I ever had and the salsa is so delicious. Chipotle and Qdoba do not stand a chance with this place.

Please open this place in Central NJ.

excerpts: the Soyrizo super burrito.
Beware of waits on the weekends (the place has limited seating).
soyrizo.author: Bianca G.
soyrizo.review:
I usually go to Cancun when I feel like having a burrito in the Mission, but you can't beat Papalote's house salsa.

Love the Soyrizo super burrito. Beware of waits on the weekends (the place has limited seating).

excerpts: Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies.
Can't go wrong!
Their homemade salsas are so good too.
soyrizo.author: Jessica G.
soyrizo.review: Love love love this place! Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies. Can't go wrong!  Their homemade salsas are so good too.

excerpts: For any vegans all the bean options are safe (stated on the menu) and they even have tofu and soyrizo too.
Matter of fact a soyrizo burrito is what skillfully defeated my hangover on Saturday.
soyrizo.author: Justin N.
soyrizo.review:
The food is easily 5 stars , I've had tacos and burritos aplenty here, and the salsa they make is amazingly good. For any vegans all the bean options are safe (stated on the menu) and they even have tofu and soyrizo too. Matter of fact a soyrizo burrito is what skillfully defeated my hangover on Saturday. Thanks again huge burrito, I owe you.

I just can't quite go 5 stars because every time I'm here the employees seem so unhappy to be working. It's just kind of odd, like no one smiles, they don't really give a vibe like they're happy their lobby is bursting with customers. Like it's a hassle.

But even though they are not the most chipper bunch the food is fantastic, that's why the place is always so packed with customers. Just look happy I'm at your restaurant when I order like one time guys and I promise to go up to 5 stars.

excerpts: Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty.
soyrizo.author: Tony B.
soyrizo.review:
Love me my papalote and have for years. Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty. 

On those rare times you have the space and minutes to sit down and dine in a civilized manner, the pollo al achiote and the fish tacos are the way to go.

The salsa is so good I buy it in the fresh jars in their fridge and have it as an after-work snack with some local casa sanchez chips. 

I just wish they had a bigger space so it wasn't always so crowded! And I suspect their burritos have gotten slightly smaller in the 8 years I've been coming here.

excerpts: The menu on the wall has some options on the left side such as "Veggie," "Grilled Veggie," and "Soyrizo".
The next few columns to the right then have prices for exactly what dish you would like your first choice to be and then you move on to picking additional ingredients.
I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here
I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here
(Potato, carrot, mushroom) and partly because I wanted more flavor than a bland veggie
burrito
I've had at way too many other places.
soyrizo.author: David O.
soyrizo.review:
This place is a little confusing, but good. I didn't understand the menu right away as I was standing in line to order so I got nervous that I would be holding up the line while deciding. No pressure or anything. There's just always a line. The menu on the wall has some options on the left side such as "Veggie," "Grilled Veggie," and "Soyrizo". The next few columns to the right then have prices for exactly what dish you would like your first choice to be and then you move on to picking additional ingredients. The additional($) ingredients are things like cheese and sour cream which come standard at most taquerias so the burritos that would be around $6 at those other places are $10 here.

I got the soyrizo burrito partly because I heard bad things about the "Veggie" burrito here (Potato, carrot, mushroom) and partly because I wanted more flavor than a bland veggie burrito I've had at way too many other places. I added cheese, sour cream and guacamole to my burrito and there was plenty of all three in it. The burrito itself was flavorful and filling so I definitely wasn't disappointed with my choice.

So..the sauce. The sauce is slightly spicy, smokey, and delicious. Just had to throw in my opinion about the sauce everyone mentions, I guess. I might even buy the jars they sell and use it when I get burritos at other places :p

Overall I like this place. It's impossible to park around Valencia/Mission most of the time but if you can make it to this location it's worth it

excerpts: Also as a vegetarian they offer an amazing soyrizo burrito, this topped off with the papalote salsa ( I recommend ordering atleast an extra) makes it a favorite.
Extra star for the cute and very personable staff taking the orders.
soyrizo.author: Kellen H.
soyrizo.review: When it comes to (gringo style) burritos this is the place!  Also as a vegetarian they offer an amazing soyrizo burrito, this topped off with the papalote salsa ( I recommend ordering atleast an extra) makes it a favorite. Extra star for the cute and very personable staff taking the orders.

excerpts: Soyrizo Burrito, meh.
soyrizo.author: Spring L.
soyrizo.review:
YELP. I am mad at you. 
Chips and dip, yeah okay.
Soyrizo Burrito, meh.
Fish tacos, +3. 
I was trying to go to La Taqueria but they were closed for winter cleaning. I should've went to El Farolito instead.

excerpts: I had the soyrizo tacos which were fantastic.
soyrizo.author: Emily S.
soyrizo.review:
Just go.

Seriously.

So, if you like delicious tacos and burritos and oh, fresh salsa, then Papalote is your kind of place. The first time I came here for lunch I had the soyrizo tacos which were fantastic. They serve it fresh with a side of your own chips and salsa. 

After going there for lunch this afternoon with some friends, I decided it was time to write a review. Today I went with the grilled veggie burrito, which was delicious. My only complaint is that it was loaded with black beans, which I requested, I just wish there had been more of the grilled zucchini and eggplant. Oh well, it was still deliciously satisfying. We all shared an order of chips and salsa, on top of the side of chips and salsa that they already give each individual order. The salsa is SO good. My friend talked me into buying a jar of it on my way home, one of the best decisions I made all day. It's fresh with a definite kick, so beware if you're sensitive to spice. Also, highly recommend getting your burrito/taco to-go and enjoying it in Dolores Park when the weather's nice.

Side note, they also serve Mexican cokes (pure cane sugar=the real stuff) as well as a wide range of cold beers to enjoy with your delicious Mexican entree of choice.

excerpts: I had the Soyrizo burrito.
This burrito is chocked full of delicious Soyrizo, rice, ad beans.
Toward the end though, the saltyness caught up with me.
Soyrizo is pretty salty, so it is understandable.
soyrizo.author: Peter V.
soyrizo.review:
What a Burrito... As a vegan, this is the best burrito I have had since I have lived in San Francisco. Really close to 5 stars, but I need something to push me over that edge that was missing a little. 

The standard mission vegetarian burrito tends to be pretty tasteless and disappointing. The proprietors here seem to have actually put some creativity and effort into the vegan options which makes me know that I will be back many times. General rule: If you love the vegans, the vegans will love you.

I had the Soyrizo burrito. This burrito is chocked full of delicious Soyrizo, rice, ad beans. Toward the end though, the saltyness caught up with me. Soyrizo is pretty salty, so it is understandable. Next time, I will be consuming the tofu mole burrito. I have high hopes.

As for the salsa, It was good. I wouldn't cross into the great department because I didn't find it as spicy as I would like for a GREAT salsa. They do provide 2 hot sauces that you can douse your burrito in.

excerpts: I guess I can see why people would like soyrizo burritos, but it's not the type of burrito I would crave for.
It is better than other vegetarian burritos at other tacquerias, but it wasn't not enough to thrill me.
I'm not a vegetarian, but every now
and then I'll try the vegetarian menu.
Maybe I should have stuck to a pollo burrito like I always get.
But I did try the carne asado burrito my friend got, and it was good, but again not enough to thrill me.
And I actually didn't like the tomato salsa too much.
soyrizo.author: April D.
soyrizo.review:
I guess I can see why people would like soyrizo burritos, but it's not the type of burrito I would crave for. It is better than other vegetarian burritos at other tacquerias, but it wasn't not enough to thrill me. I'm not a vegetarian, but every now and then I'll try the vegetarian menu. Maybe I should have stuck to a pollo burrito like I always get. But I did try the carne asado burrito my friend got, and it was good, but again not enough to thrill me. And I actually didn't like the tomato salsa too much. I don't understand the hype, but I guess everyone has different taste buds... 

I mean don't get me wrong, it wasn't gross, but I have had just as good or even better burritos.

excerpts: I had the soyrizo super burrito
and it was a mess...
soyrizo.author: Sgtslut F.
soyrizo.review:
Absolutely awful...the most overrated burrito joint i have ever been to...talk about neutralizing Mexican food!...

I had the soyrizo super burrito and it was a mess...my girlfriend had the chicken burrito and she compared the fowl niblets to dog food...

overpriced and generally disgusting....

imagine the cuisine at Chevy's accompanied by PBR guzzling hipsters and you have a fraction of an idea of what this place is like...

with a plethora of great burrito joints within a five block radius, who would eat here?

excerpts: I really wish I had opted for the soyrizo, but my stomach was recovering still
and I did not feel the need to risk it.
Next time, soyrizo will be my taco filling of choice!
soyrizo.author: Jason P.
soyrizo.review:
The food network combined with the 7x7 list almost forced me to come here on my last SF visit.  After ordering a burrito, chips and salsa and a couple of tacos, I decided to take a seat.  It was amusing that even the lady behind the counter noticed the feast that I ordered and told the food runner how the number of people at our table was less than the number of entrees ordered in Spanish.  

The rice and bean burrito was excellent, as were the chips and salsa (the 7x7 item).  The marinated tofu tacos lacked taste.  I really wish I had opted for the soyrizo, but my stomach was recovering still and I did not feel the need to risk it.  Next time, soyrizo will be my taco filling of choice!

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito will cure all meat-cravings.
Soyrizo!
Soyrizooooooooo!
I love you SO!
It is so perfectly spicy, and the burritos here are huge!
I'm talking the size of my face.
soyrizo.author: Jessie H.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is slightly miraculous in that I never even feel the need to eat their meat options.  I freaking LOVE meat, particularly chicken (when it comes to burritos), but I never need to even go there at Papalote.  The soyrizo burrito will cure all meat-cravings.

Soyrizo! Soyrizooooooooo! I love you SO! It is so perfectly spicy, and the burritos here are huge! I'm talking the size of my face.  Face-sized burritos for the win!

Sorry, got a little excited there.  I'm trying to say that Papalote's vegetarian options are amazing (this coming from a girl that doesn't even like vegetables, haaa).  And then there's the salsa.  Is there cream in that salsa? I can't figure it out.  At any rate, the salsa is the crack.  Crackalacking salsa.  I need you all the time. Like right now.  Salsa.  I NEED YOU.

excerpts: Highly suggest the Soyrizo or the grilled veggie if your a vegetarian.
Also, the salsa that comes with every buritto is awesome.
Its a little on the spicy side
soyrizo.author: Kameron K.
soyrizo.review:
Mmm

I heard about Papalote because they beat douchebag bobby flay in the throwdown show and was surprised at how many veggie options they have.

Highly suggest the Soyrizo or the grilled veggie if your a vegetarian.  Also, the salsa that comes with every buritto is awesome.  Its a little on the spicy side but is one of the best salsas I've had.

Highly recommend calling in to place your order, its usually ready in 10 minutes and beats having to wait in the long line.

excerpts: Soyrizo?
I nearly always get the soyrizo, sometimes with guacamole.
Always AMAZING.
And enormous for super-cheap.
soyrizo.author: Sue A.
soyrizo.review:
Best burrito ever. TONS of delicious vegan options. Soyrizo? Tofu mole? grilled veggies? 

I nearly always get the soyrizo, sometimes with guacamole. Always AMAZING. And enormous for super-cheap. I work in the Financial District and have spent entire lunch breaks trekking to and from papalote to get an excellent burrito and get back in time to sit at my desk and eat while working -it's totally worth it. 

And the salsa. Did I mention the salsa? SO DELICIOUS. You can buy it by the jar at the store, or you can now buy it on-line for delivery. When I found this out, I sent the link to everyone I know, and they all reacted "This is the best day of my life". It's that good. 

While i've only ever gotten vegan burritos here, I've been told the non-vegan ones are also good. But can't really comment. 

Their other location is also good. So good that when our office was in the Presidio, we would regularly drive over and get burritos for the whole office (~25 people). 

Go here!!

excerpts: I decided I am going to try the Soyrizo
taco(my experience with soy stuff before hasn't been good
Then my soyrizo taco came.
I poked it a little bit and CHOMP!
it did not taste like soy at all!
it actually kinda taste like meat!
I love it!
It was gone in like less than 10min....
fatty me.
soyrizo.author: Miss C.
soyrizo.review:
Hmmm... how the hell did I live in the Mission area and never been to this place up until now? I guess this is my wake up call to go out and explore more... 

So, we had a craving for tacos and decided that we are going to try a new place. After some yelping, we decided to try this one. Why? Because I live like 4 blocks away. 

We got kind of confused at first because we saw that in the Yelp pictures, the logo is pretty colorful, but we saw no sign when we got to Poplar st. 
But no worries, we quickly found it because people were lining up! 

I decided I am going to try the Soyrizo taco(my experience with soy stuff before hasn't been good but, eh) 

As we sat down, they gave us a complimentary chips (1 bowl for each person!) and the BEST salsa my tongue has ever sampled! EVER! Omg, it has the right amount of spicyness and zestiness! Then my soyrizo taco came. I poked it a little bit and CHOMP! it did not taste like soy at all! it actually kinda taste like meat! I love it! It was gone in like less than 10min.... fatty me. lol. 

All in all I would totally come back! :)

excerpts: I had the soyrizo burrito (husband had the carne asada
and he was
it was absolutely delicious).
I love that you can have a choice of beans at this place (all of which are vegan).
soyrizo.author: Carrie T.
soyrizo.review:
I recently went here for the first time and I fell in LOVE with the salsa. I am pretty I would drink a large glass of it if I could. 

This place is super vegan friendly, they have quite a few different options. I had the soyrizo burrito (husband had the carne asada and he was it was absolutely delicious). I love that you can have a choice of beans at this place (all of which are vegan). I had the black refried. 

I think I could say this is the BEST burrito I have EVER had. 

The reason for four stars instead of five: Our burritos came with chips and salsa, and while the salsa is heaven, I thought the chips were just "okay."  Also, this location is pretty tiny with limited seating and customers were packed in there like sardines. We arrived just in time to grab the last two seats. 

I'm still dreaming about that salsa.

excerpts: The soyrizo is so good.
Making your taco order "super" will totally fill you up if you don't want a burrito.
soyrizo.author: Stephanie A.
soyrizo.review: The soyrizo is so good. Making your taco order "super" will totally fill you up if you don't want a burrito. But if you do, my go-to burrito is a super carne asada burrito. The salsa is AMAZING. Calling ahead and picking up is also great if you don't want to wait in line.

excerpts: If you want a soyrizo tofu bastardized burrito papalote is still your spot.
soyrizo.author: Mike I.
soyrizo.review:
I walked more than two miles in the pouring rain to enjoy the triple threat burrito here. I was sadly disappointed. I've had the super carne asada burrito here before and it was pretty good. The triple threat was a complete dud. It was relatively small considering the amount of meat it contained. A normal El Faralito burrito is bigger. Also the triple threat is WAY overpriced, $19.95 and that is without the super upgrade. RIP OFF. 

Finally the biggest rip is the .55 you have to pay for extra salsa. 

El Faralito is better if you eat meat. If you want a soyrizo tofu bastardized burrito papalote is still your spot.

excerpts:
loved the soyrizo tacos

lots of options for veggies and vegans

chips were a lil hard

staff was super friendly, okay prices.
soyrizo.author: Coco J.
soyrizo.review:
loved the soyrizo tacos

lots of options for veggies and vegans

chips were a lil hard

staff was super friendly, okay prices.

I'd like to go back and try more , mmmmm

excerpts: The place is ripe with delicious vegetarian/pescatarian options (the soyrizo burrito is pretty damned amazing) but there are a few drawbacks as well.
soyrizo.author: Victor W.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is one of the best Mexican joints in the Mission - fresh ingredients, creative recipes, and just the right amount of food. The place is ripe with delicious vegetarian/pescatarian options (the soyrizo burrito is pretty damned amazing) but there are a few drawbacks as well. 

Hipsters. Skinny jeans, Buddy Holly glasses, kafais, Che hats, and an overall  smuggness of being part of a large group of ironic looking non-conformist conformists are unfortunate elements of getting food at Papalote. When you order, try to curb your urge to kick the guy behind you in the shins while he waxes on about how The Faint was heavily influenced by Black Flag's early albums.

Also, make sure to call ahead to place your order so you don't have to wait forever for your food. 

Overall: great place, great options, slightly pricey for a burrito joint, and enough misanthropic trust fund babies to fill an entire screening of Nick & Nora's Ultimate Playlist.

excerpts: The first two times I had the soyrizo SUPER burrito (hey, go big or go home, right?!)
and they were amazing both times, except that it can be a bit salty.
I would still highly recommend it though, especially because soyrizo burritos aren't something often offered at other places.
soyrizo.author: Alvina W.
soyrizo.review:
So I have been back twice (for take out) since my last review.  I was right the first time - Papalote is best enjoyed in the comfort of your home (or in my case, the home of a fellow fatty) :)

The first two times I had the soyrizo SUPER burrito (hey, go big or go home, right?!) and they were amazing both times, except that it can be a bit salty.  I would still highly recommend it though, especially because soyrizo burritos aren't something often offered at other places.

Tonight I tried the tofu w/ achiote burrito, which I could have sworn I had the first time I went...but alas, my burrito buddy proved me wrong with her detailed review documenting exactly what I ate (shout out to Ms. Julie S. who I'm sure is reading this review) ;)

I would highly recommend the tofu super burrito.  The tofu tastes more like paneer - and since I was craving Indian food also, it really hit the spot!  The tofu wasn't dry and went really well with the other fixings.  My only complaint was that the tofu wasn't really well dispersed...I had to eat almost half of my burrito to find the tofu...but when I did, it was DEE-LISH!

I definitely will be back.  Tip: call ahead!!! You don't want to get stuck in line!

excerpts: Soyrizo burrito is vegetarian perfection.
The salsa is amazing, very amazing.
soyrizo.author: Jonathan T.
soyrizo.review:
Soyrizo burrito is vegetarian perfection.  The salsa is amazing, very amazing.  It is always busy it seems and getting stuffed into a long table surrounded by couples on dates is kind of awkward, but the food is so good I cannot remove a star for this.  

Well worth the wait and the price (nearly twice that of my usual $5 burrito).

excerpts: I got a regular soyrizo burrito with pinto beans, but it had the texture of a refried bean sandwich.
The flavors were decent, but burrito was just a soft mesh of mexican tastes.
The salsa is admittedly good, but you can get that at the grocery store and put it on a burrito from any other location in the city and you will likely have a better experience.
soyrizo.author: Ben M.
soyrizo.review: I got a regular soyrizo burrito with pinto beans, but it had the texture of a refried bean sandwich. The flavors were decent, but burrito was just a soft mesh of mexican tastes. The salsa is admittedly good, but you can get that at the grocery store and put it on a burrito from any other location in the city and you will likely have a better experience.

excerpts: Meat eaters and vegans alike should enjoy the tasty, savory soyrizo burrito here.
soyrizo.author: Jeff G.
soyrizo.review:
Meat eaters and vegans alike should enjoy the tasty, savory soyrizo burrito here.

Whenever I make it to the mission I grab an extra one to take home for the next day.

It rarely makes it that long.

P.S. Guacamole as a side or as an addon is expensive but it's tasty and you get plenty.

excerpts: We ordered by phone and picked up soyrizo and a tofu taco.
The soyrizo is awesome and so is the salsa that everyone talks about.
I hear the tofu tastes like paneer, which makes it sound even tastier!!
soyrizo.author: Christina K.
soyrizo.review: We ordered by phone and picked up soyrizo and a tofu taco. The soyrizo is awesome and so is the salsa that everyone talks about. I hear the tofu tastes like paneer, which makes it sound even tastier!! Wish I was in SF longer to try out their other veggie options. Two tacos to an order made for a filling meal without feeling overstuffed. Yum!!

excerpts: I ordered the soyrizo burrito (not particularly adventurous, but it's what I was in the mood for).
It was just okay, not any better or worse than what I might make at home using store-bought soyrizo.
I wasn't unhappy with my meal, but I wasn't impressed.
soyrizo.author: Jay S.
soyrizo.review:
An experience that has shaken my faith in the taste of my fellow San Franciscans. I just cannot understand the hype around this place. It wasn't bad, but I don't think I'd come back here- it's just not a good value.

I've tried Papalote's food before. I have vague memories of eating there before I lived in SF and I'd had their takeout at a friend's house before. I don't remember being blown away by it, but I don't remember hating it either. Then again, I'm from Socal, so Mexican food is one category in which SF tends to let me down.

Fast forward to last night. We get there and, though the wait was somewhat long, the staff was so friendly and attentive that it wasn't a bother at all. 

I ordered the soyrizo burrito (not particularly adventurous, but it's what I was in the mood for). It was just okay, not any better or worse than what I might make at home using store-bought soyrizo. I wasn't unhappy with my meal, but I wasn't impressed. I'd rate it 3 stars on its own. 

My girlfriend's burrito was a different story. She orded the lime-seasoned prawn burrito, but the seasoning was so bland that she actually thought they'd given her the wrong burrito! I asked the (very polite and attentive) waitress if perhaps they'd prepared her the shrimp burrito with the butter-wine sauce by mistake, but it turns out it was the right burrito, just not a very good one.*

The other problem, besides flavor, was the number of prawns. This was an $11 burrito that had 4 smallish prawns in it. I don't expect it to be loaded up like a shrimp burrito, but I eat a lot of Mexican food and I know what $11 should buy me. I am not a diner with a sense of entitlement, I just don't want to feel ripped off. 4 tiny prawns just isn't gonna cut it in a huge burrito. It was basically a beans, rice and cheese burrito w/ a cameo appearance by some prawns.

The biggest surprise though, was the salsa. Papalote is renowned for their salsa. So I found it surprising that a Mexican place famous for its salsa DOESN'T GIVE YOU ANY SALSA WITH YOUR FOOD.... YOU HAVE TO BUY IT. **

I am, as my obnoxious use of capital letters might indicate, dead serious: Salsa with your chips is free, but you have to pay to have salsa with your food. 

You get a small (maybe 2 oz) cup of salsa with your chips. The place is popular, so you wait with that basket of chips for quite a while before your food comes. When your food arrives, it does not come with salsa. As it turns out, if you want salsa with your food you have two choices:

(1) Eat your chips without salsa, so you can save the salsa for your food. C'mon son. This might not be objectively unreasonable, but it's unreasonable in light of custom: what Mexican restaurant expects you to eat chips without salsa?

(2) Purchase more salsa to go with your food, at the rate of $0.50 per small cup.

Admittedly, $0.50 is not a big deal, but the idea that the only way to enjoy salsa with your food at this Mexican restaurant is to either pay extra or eat your chips without salsa just reeks of, dare I say it, arrogance. It's like they're so gassed up over people telling them how dope their salsa is that they think they're doing us a favor by letting us eat there. 

I get it. You're world-famous for your salsa. You sell the salsa separately in a jar. People would probably consume insane amounts of the salsa if you didn't regulate it somehow.... but is it going to kill you to give me one cup of salsa with my chips and one cup of salsa with my food? I mean, seriously, that just comes off as really, really cheap. I purchase a $30 fast-Mexican meal for two and have to pay extra to get the salsa? How is that cost not built into my $10 burrito?? 

This is the kind of disregard for customer perspective that causes once-great businesses to fail. Not saying I see Papalote failing anytime soon, but it was a *huge* turnoff for me and I probably won't eat there again because of that last straw. Two people can eat at Rubio's (which actually has very good food for fast-Mexican), spend $20 and enjoy several cups of their delicious salsas or free! The mind boggles.

Also, the salsa is tasty, but not something I would have thought to rave about if Papalote wasn't already well-hyped for its salsa. Despite really wanting to love my dining experience at Papalote, I walked away not understanding what the fuss is about. So disappointed.

______________

* I love my girlfriend, but I'm not the type to give a place a shitty review just because she had a bad experience (see my review of Sushi Raw if you have any doubts). That being said, her burrito was so skimpy on prawns that I was disappointed just *watching* her eat it. It was like watching someone pick the wrong door on a game show over and over again: bite after bite with not a prawn in sight.

** I KNOW!!

excerpts: and I love their soyrizo!
Can take a while so plan ahead - or call ahead.
soyrizo.author: Mary W.
soyrizo.review: This place is tasty! I'm not even a vegetarian and I love their soyrizo! Can take a while so plan ahead - or call ahead.

excerpts:
Soyrizo
     +

Spicy, chunky soy pieces won over this omnivore
2.
soyrizo.author: Chuck N.
soyrizo.review:
Wednesday, 8:45PM.

To enter Mission's Mexican food market, folks best be bringing their A-game or find some way to distinguish themselves from the competition. 

Papalote does both and is establishing a spicy niche in the area. 

Stuffed our faces in:
1. Soyrizo
     +Spicy, chunky soy pieces won over this omnivore
2. Mole, tofu taco
     +Cocoa pepper and chili concoction goes great with the hard shell
3. Triple threat
     +Chicken? Carne asada? Shrimp? Dig the combo man!
     - Only four prawns? Put a little more than that, c'mon now!
4. Salsa
     +Spicy kick without overwhelming the rest of the mix
     - Staff is stingy with this goodness

And then...?
The Triple Threat wasn't enough for my raging hunger, which is a testament to me being a PHATTTTY. Still paying a return visit though, I've got the seafood burritos and nachos to try!

excerpts: I love that they have soyrizo and tofu as meat options.
soyrizo.author: Joshua C.
soyrizo.review:
Somebody call 911 because I just murdered the chicken adobo burrito at Papalote. 

Seriously, I love the idea of putting chicken adobo into a burrito. Effing genius. 

The chicken was so damn tender and the adobo flavor was present but not overpowering. The whole time I was eating it, I felt confused. Tastes like Filipino food yet tastes like Mexican food. Either way, I ate the whole damn thing. 

The horchata was good but I prefer a little more cinnamon in mines. I love that they have soyrizo and tofu as meat options. 

Papalote was definitely worth the journey from Oakland. I just hop on BART and walk a few blocks and I'm in the Mission. I don't venture out here much, but I'd make the trip for Papalote again.

P.S. If you have room, Anthony's Cookies is a couple blocks away.

P.P.S. Their chips are not that great. Best tortilla chips in SF? Velvet Cantina. No question about it.

excerpts: I also tried the soyrizo which was also awesome.
soyrizo.author: Angela T.
soyrizo.review:
I have been to both Papalote locations, on Fulton and in the Mission. Both are great. They are well known for their salsa, which is REALLY good. The salsa is what makes Papalote really special. Like most other Mexican restaurants in the Mission, you get chips and salsa with your food. So while chips and salsa are just a plus to the burritos normally, I personally think the salsa is just as awesome and special as the burrito. 

Onto the burritos... They have more veggie options than other Mexican places. I have had a regular veggie burrito, with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots. It was really good, but I do wish there had been more mushrooms in there. The potatoes and carrots had been cooked nice and soft but not mushy and seasoned well. I also tried the soyrizo which was also awesome. 

If you want some guacamole, sour cream,, and cheese in your burrito, you got to pay an extra 99 cents to get it super. The burritos here are a little pricier than other places in the Mission (around $6.50 -$9 for a burrito) and they are not as big either... BUT they are delicious...

excerpts: Soyrizo burrito =
best burrito
I have ever had.
soyrizo.author: Anna S.
soyrizo.review:
Soyrizo burrito = best burrito I have ever had.  Mmmm.

Papalote's number is saved in my phone.

excerpts: I absolutely love their soyrizo burrito!
soyrizo.author: Fallon P.
soyrizo.review: I absolutely love their soyrizo burrito! They have the best chips and salsa in the city! I did try their adobo burrito and it was a tad bit too salty for my liking, but other than that, I don't have any complaints about this place AT ALL!

excerpts: That inspired me to try the soyrizo burrito (with cheese and grilled mushrooms).
I have one word for you..
DAMN.
That was THE best non-meat burrito I've ever had
soyrizo.author: erica c.
soyrizo.review:
First off, let me just say that the "salsa," or whatever their creamy hot sauce is called, was AMAZING.  It was spicy, creamy and loaded with flavor.  I damn near ate my whole basket of chips to get to the last drop of that sauce.  :-)

Second, while I DO eat meat, I was a vegetarian for 10 years.  That inspired me to try the soyrizo burrito (with cheese and grilled mushrooms).  I have one word for you..  DAMN.  That was THE best non-meat burrito I've ever had and I love Pancho Villa's tofu.

My girlfriend had a carne asada and grilled shrimp burrito which she devoured (all 100 pounds of her).  Needless to say, she enjoyed hers, too.

We met the owner, Miguel,  who also gave us a sample of his chicken adobo (over rice), which is a burrito meat option (and quite popular, I hear).  While I thought that to be somehow wrong, I have to admit that the adobo was absolutely delicious.   It was SO tender.

The eating area is small but the tables do clear quickly.  And while their prices may be on the high side, I'm definitely one who believes in getting what you pay for... and we certainly did.

Miguel, thank you for your hospitality.  You'll definitely be seeing me again.

P.S.  My 9-year old son proclaims Papalote to be his favorite  - and he's eaten a quite a few burritos, living in South City.  :-)

excerpts: and muthafuckin soyrizo on the menu.
soyrizo.author: Sean C.
soyrizo.review:
OK, so like really good mexican food. Its a little different than the traditional mexican that I was expecting. Its sort of like Cali-mex...really fresh ingredients, not super heavy, oh yeah...and muthafuckin soyrizo on the menu. Nice.

Whoop ass salsa fo' shizzle. They thankfully don't hold back too much on the hotness here...I'm a big fan, but this could peeve some. 

The place is flirting with 5 stars, but there is a wicked wait, pretty indifferent help, and seating is pretty much impossible. Be prepared to hover, pounce, and cry if needed to get a seat for your and your peeps. If you plan on going here with more than 4 people, you better not plan on staying if you arrive anywhere near a meal time. Some day, I'll head there when I'm wasted and try to turn it into a pickup scene. "Hey baby, want to nosh on my salsa?"...I predict 50% smack ratio.

Next time, I'm trying the Mari C. endorsed fish taco.

excerpts:
Dear Soyrizo burrito w/ refried black beans, 
I love you.
I miss you.
Thank goodness you haven't changed.
Prawn burritos & tacos are good too, but my heart belongs to the soyrizo burrito - seriously one of the best vegetarian items in San Francisco.
soyrizo.author: Kimberly C.
soyrizo.review:
Dear Soyrizo burrito w/ refried black beans, 
I love you. I miss you. Thank goodness you haven't changed.  You are my favorite burrito in town. 

Satisfied my craving for this ol' fave when visiting last week.  It lived up to memory, as the did the famous secret-recipe orange-colored salsa.  Nom nom nom.  Yes they charge for extra servings of it, but I think it's worth it.  Prawn burritos & tacos are good too, but my heart belongs to the soyrizo burrito - seriously one of the best vegetarian items in San Francisco.

Chips are just ok & the 3 small chunks of jicama on the plate are just silly.

Papalote is quick, not too pricey & very tasty.  A no-fuss modern (not traditional) taqueria.

p.s. the reverse engineered Ersatz Papalote Salsa recipe on http://www.chow.com/recipes/10646 is yummy, but still fails at recreating the original.  I make it & enjoy it, but just don't compare it to the housemade anymore

excerpts: They have several delicious vegetarian options that are all amazing from grilled veggies to soyrizo meat substitutions.
soyrizo.author: Phillip K.
soyrizo.review:
As a vegetarian, good Mexican food is few and far between.  Papalote is a GREAT exception.  They have several delicious vegetarian options that are all amazing from grilled veggies to soyrizo meat substitutions.  

They also have plenty of real meat options if you are with a group of meat-eaters.  

They charge for extra salsa which is annoying but their house salsa is one of the best I've every had.

excerpts: They have SOYRIZO here!
OMG!
Prices are good and getting a table isn't too hard.
People come in and out pretty quickly.
Service is fast, you order, sit down, and bam w/ minutes they bring your food to your table.
The salsa and chips are yummy.
soyrizo.author: Irene L.
soyrizo.review: Liked this little place alot! I had the marinated tofu burrito w/ guacamole and sour cream. Super veggie friendly. They have SOYRIZO here! OMG! :) Prices are good and getting a table isn't too hard. People come in and out pretty quickly. Service is fast, you order, sit down, and bam w/ minutes they bring your food to your table. The salsa and chips are yummy. Definitely would come back and try the other veggie dishes.

excerpts: Soyrizo stands the winner of vegan protein options here for me.
soyrizo.author: Jennifer B.
soyrizo.review:
I was just underwhelmed by Papalote's marinated tofu.  I was assured it would be amazing.  That feels like a trick bourne of ulterior motives.  What motives?  I'm not sure.

The rest of the burrito held up the slack for the tofu.  I will not sit back and call tofu in a burrito great simply because too few places want to put it in burritos - it has to be superior tofu.  Soyrizo stands the winner of vegan protein options here for me.

Be warned, the wait for food here is longer than you'd think for a taqueria.

excerpts: The glowing reviews about the Soyrizo burrito and salsa are spot-on, both are just that unique and delicious.
soyrizo.author: James G.
soyrizo.review: The glowing reviews about the Soyrizo burrito and salsa are spot-on, both are just that unique and delicious.

excerpts: Me, I always go for the Soyrizo burrito SUPER (with sour cream, guacamole and cheese, the only way to go!)
soyrizo.author: Bill H.
soyrizo.review:
As a couple of vegetarians who still hanker for some tasty Mexican food (we come from New Mexico), Papalote was a great discovery. We ate at the restaurant the first time, but it's almost always packed -- a testament to their tasty menu -- so we've become devoted taker-outers.

Me, I always go for the Soyrizo burrito SUPER (with sour cream, guacamole and cheese, the only way to go!) and she always gets the marinated tofu (super, of course).

For us to-go fans, that the burritos come with a bag of chips and their awesome salsa is icing on the cake. And the nachos are bad-ass.

A few of their dishes aren't so super -- like the overly oily-cheesey queso dishes -- but on the whole, you can't go wrong. Parking ain't easy (is it ever in this city?), which makes take out an even better option.

excerpts: Texture on the tofu and soyrizo was spot-on, no soggy burritos here.
This place is tiny and getting a seat can be very hectic, I was thankful to finally plop down with the chips, guac and salsa and dig in.
Love me some refried black beans, that alone earns this place an additional star.
soyrizo.author: Cori W.
soyrizo.review:
Fantastic guacamole and salsa, the combination is killer. Love that they offer so many veg friendly options, the tofu is even high-protein wildwood brand. Texture on the tofu and soyrizo was spot-on, no soggy burritos here. This place is tiny and getting a seat can be very hectic, I was thankful to finally plop down with the chips, guac and salsa and dig in. 
Love me some refried black beans, that alone earns this place an additional star.

excerpts: The soyrizo is overrated in my book, but their marinated tofu is just great.
soyrizo.author: Nori H.
soyrizo.review:
Pros: 
  * Vegan-friendly.  The soyrizo is overrated in my book, but their marinated tofu is just great.
  * Refried black beans!!

Cons:
  * Unless you call ahead (and who *plans* to want a burrito?!), you have to wait 20-30 minutes to get your order.  Minus 2 stars right there.

Conclusion: I'm sticking to Pancho Villa.

excerpts: And I'm glad I chose last night because the soyrizo burrito that I had was pretty-pretty brilliant AND HUGE!
soyrizo.author: Natalie R.
soyrizo.review:
I live about a mile from here so I was waiting for a nice evening to take a walk over and for some reason I chose last night which made little to no sense considering I was debilitated by a lack of sleep and an out of character hangover that left my limbs drooping all day , but I guess I was inspired or I just really needed the sustenance provided by a burrito. 

And I'm glad I chose last night because the soyrizo burrito that I had was pretty-pretty brilliant AND HUGE! I almost ate the whole thing which is f'ed up just because.

 It was very busy inside and though I did have to wait, it wasn't an unreasonable amount of time. I am vegan and the fact that I could not make up my mind on what to get made me kind of happy, considering sometimes I'm just left to eat the one or two things available to tweak on the menu. I will absolutely go here again, especially to try that tofu mole burrito. Sounds like a win.

Cons: place is cramped (though I was there at dinner hour) and my scale told me I weighed 2 more pounds than normal this morning. Coincidence?

excerpts:
The roasted salsa is amazing, as is their mole sauce, and their marinated tofu, and the soyrizo...

tags: vegetarian
soyrizo.author: Nithin R.
soyrizo.review:
The most veg-friendly taqueria I've been to. They have so many veg options, which is good, because we come here at least twice a month. 

The roasted salsa is amazing, as is their mole sauce, and their marinated tofu, and the soyrizo...

tags: vegetarian

excerpts: then I had their soyrizo burrito.
I can't believe it took me so long.
I can guarantee you that it didn't take long for me to find my way back there...again and again and again.
soyrizo.author: Renee D.
soyrizo.review: For years, people kept saying to me, "you've never been to Papalote?!?"  I didn't understand why this was so surprising...then I had their soyrizo burrito.  I can't believe it took me so long. I can guarantee you that it didn't take long for me to find my way back there...again and again and again.

excerpts: Soyrizo burrito!
soyrizo.author: shane s.
soyrizo.review:
Soyrizo burrito! Say no more.

Excellent menu. Vegan friendly is an understatement. The salsa might be the best I have EVER had.

The only complaint I can even think of is that it gets real crowded real quick. If Papalote opened a location in Oakland, I would be in heaven (hint hint).

excerpts: for the impending winter, which I wouldn't -- well, then I would come to Papalote and order some Soyrizo in my burrito.
soyrizo.author: Rachel G.
soyrizo.review:
If I ate food, which I don't, and I wanted some Mexican, which I rarely do, and I didn't want to gain 6,000lbs. for the impending winter, which I wouldn't -- well, then I would come to Papalote and order some Soyrizo in my burrito.

Hold the beans.  Hold the tortilla.  Hold the cheese.  Hold the sour cream.

Cause what's better and lower in fat than fake innards made of soy on a plate?

Delish.

excerpts: - their soyrizo (taco, burrito, whatevs) is amazing as is the marinated tofu burrito.
soyrizo.author: Karen K.
soyrizo.review:
I've been transitioning to a vegan diet (in other words, i eff up alot and catch myself with a cheesy slice o' pizza and a reg. latte every now and again), and its hard peoples, really HARD to eat out if you have a restrictive diet.  That being said, Papalote is making my life easier in oh so many ways - their soyrizo (taco, burrito, whatevs) is amazing as is the marinated tofu burrito.  I love the chips, I love the salsa, and they are even starting to recognize me when i go in, which makes me happy.  

I want to be clear on this - even if you are not a veg/vegan, this place is delicious.  hear me?  word.

excerpts: On my first try I had the Soyrizo Burrito per my bf's suggestion.
It was filling, tasty
and I was surprised how Soyrizo tasted like Chorizo.
On this trip, I wanted to try something new and different.
soyrizo.author: Morgan L.
soyrizo.review:
Second visit to Papalote and still happy with their quality and taste.   On my first try I had the Soyrizo Burrito per my bf's suggestion.  It was filling, tasty and I was surprised how Soyrizo tasted like Chorizo.  On this trip, I wanted to try something new and different.   I believe I had mole sauce before but not knowing that Chocolate was one of the main ingredients.   Thanks to all those food traveling shows I was anxious to test out their mole sauce with Tofu.  BTW, you can also order the mole sauce with chicken.  I know this is weird but I don't like to have rice or beans in my burrito (I guess I'm more of a fajita girl) so I usually add sour cream and guacamole instead. 

On my first bite i was pleasantly surprised by the sweet taste of the mole sauce.  You can taste the chocolate!   The sour cream and guacamole did not overwhelm the mole sauce at all.   I actually finished the burrito since I kept wanting the taste of the mole sauce.  Now I'm going to try mole sauce at different restaurant to see if what I had was the real thing.   

The homemade salsa was not too spicy but complimented the chips and burritos very well.   You can even buy a jar of the salsa for $5.99.   It's that good.

excerpts: Said friend is vegan, so I suggested Papalote, since they have tofu options, soyrizo, and vegan mole.
We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.
So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!
Without drinks.
But whatever.
I tell her it's really good
and I fork over some money.
So the food is brought out and I get the shrip
and I say FUCK--
what I really wanted was Prawns.
soyrizo.author: Biggie M.
soyrizo.review:
Once upon a time I wrote a glowing review for Papalote.  You can read it.   I once gave Papalote 4 stars.  It's beneath the astrix.

Here is my updated review for Papalote.

I took a good friend of mine who lives in Oakland, has a kid and never gets out of the house to the Mission.  We had an erreand to run but she was craving a good Mission Burrito.  Said friend is vegan, so I suggested Papalote, since they have tofu options, soyrizo, and vegan mole. 

We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.  So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!  Without drinks.  But whatever.  I tell her it's really good and I fork over some money.  So the food is brought out and I get the shrip and I say FUCK--what I really wanted was Prawns.  
Maybe it's due to me being an unsophisticted Mid-westerner, but I ordered shrimp not expecting them to be those tiney nasty thing but the big jumbo ones.  

I went to the counter and told the manager and he said tough luck.  I was kind of incredulous.  You think if someone has just spent a shitload of money--22 BUCKS for ONE MEAL at a fucking taqueria you could throw three prawns at them.  he was just an asshole and said you ordered wrong too bad.  So I walked back and spit out my WINE AND BUTTER soaked nasty ass shrimp that had no flavor.  

Then they brought the fajitas out and they gave us ONE tortilla and I was so pissed by then I couldn't even complain for fear they guy would be like--"well it only comes with one tortilla--tough."

So I left the place so pissed because I really wanted my FAVORITE taqueria to be my friend's favorite new place and maybe she would like it enough to come into the city more.

I was so upset that I decided to call the manager--who was the rude guy to complain--and guess what he was a dick then too.  I even told him that it was my favorite taqueria and instead of eating near my school in Potrero Hill sometimes--there are porbably 20 taqueria between it and Papalote I truck there.  

I was a regular customer--but that's what shitty customer service can do.  I'll miss you Papalote--or at least your PRAWNS.

I

**************************************************************************



At Papalote i like to order a plate with shrimp (STRIKE THIS APPARANTLY THEY ARE PRAWNS), beans, rice and guac.

That's it.

It's really good and filling.  It ends up being more expensive than an acutal burrito which is annoying.    However I keep ordering it like that, because that's how I like to eat it.

Their beans are the best--and vegan too which pleases many of my picky picky friends.  I like to take out and eat on the steps of the scary church with the big neon cross across Valencia Street.

excerpts: Next time I'm totally gonna try the soyrizo.
Oh, did I tell u the burrito is huuuge?!
soyrizo.author: Perry S.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is the perfect joint for the hungry. The burrito is humongous! I got the marinated tofu burrito and it lasted for 2 days! It was good cold too ;). 

I was going to get the carne asada, just because I can roll my 'R' like nobody's business, but decided to go on the healthy's side. It was not disappointing let me tell u. Get the super burrito. It's worth it. 

They give u the chips and salsa for appetizer. The salsa was hot!! Really hot. Me likie long time ;).

The place a bit on the small size but it wasn't busy when I was there. Next time I'm totally gonna try the soyrizo. Oh, did I tell u the burrito is huuuge?! Or the fact I can say "I would like one caRne asada, please."

excerpts:
ok, there's not much need for another review of this place, so this is short and vegetarian oriented:
1) soyrizo, yummy, but really really filling.
Watch out.
2) delicious salsa but
yu get about a shot-glass's worth, and they charge you for more.

Booo
3) Grilled tofu:  Yummy,  not as filling as soyrizo.
4) Bathrooms:  Nasty!
soyrizo.author: Ali M.
soyrizo.review:
ok, there's not much need for another review of this place, so this is short and vegetarian oriented:
1) soyrizo, yummy, but really really filling.  Watch out.
2) delicious salsa but yu get about a shot-glass's worth, and they charge you for more.  Booo
3) Grilled tofu:  Yummy,  not as filling as soyrizo.
4) Bathrooms:  Nasty!

excerpts: I was mildly surprised by the interesting 'Mexicant' menu, including healthy options like soyrizo and vegan mole.
I was even more surprised after having a burrito there, that I not only liked it...
soyrizo.author: Satoru Y.
soyrizo.review:
A white-washed tacqueria owned and run by Mexicans; go figure...it's still great.

If other taquerias in the city, like El Castillito, were home-slobs sporting a greasy wife-beater, then Papalote would be their alluring and demure cousin.  I remember the first time I stumbled upon this modern-looking, hipster tacqueria on a night roaming the Outer Mission.  Hipster places springing up in the Mission is akin to pissing on gremlins: I guess only children of the 80's may get this reference.  I was mildly surprised by the interesting 'Mexicant' menu, including healthy options like soyrizo and vegan mole. I was even more surprised after having a burrito there, that I not only liked it...I loved it.

Myself, being a carnivore, love all of the meaty servings that they have to offer.  I personally love their Carne Asada and Chile Verde Burritos.  They are very flavorful, and not heavy at all: A combination in a burrito that you would think would cause a paradox that would unravel space-time.  However, it all works to me, and it doesn't feel I ate a truck when I leave.  Also, their Salsa is deserving of all the accolodates that it receives.

Delicious and health-conscious food, reminds me of what I miss about the city the most.

excerpts: Now I just need to try some of their veggie/vegan options like tofu tacos or a soyrizo burrito (how awesome is it that they offer these things!?).
soyrizo.author: Stephanie P.
soyrizo.review:
Ohhhh baby I had some delish fish tacos for dinner last night. Sauteed in butter and wine, wrapped in soft corn tortillas with salsa fresca, sour cream and guacamole on top... hmm... I think I'm ready for Round 2.

I've been meaning to hit up Papalote for a while now, because it looked so damn cute. Forget cute - this place is scrumptious! The food tastes fresh, not heavy and greasy. In addition to my fish tacos, I had bites of a quesadilla, burrito, and chicken taco, so I got pretty good sampling of the menu. Now I just need to try some of their veggie/vegan options like tofu tacos or a soyrizo burrito (how awesome is it that they offer these things!?). As a self-proclaimed breakfast burrito connoisseur, breakfast offerings all day are also highly appreciated.

A definite new favorite for Mexican food in San Francisco.

excerpts: Soyrizo!!!
soyrizo.author: Shannon Z.
soyrizo.review:
Soyrizo!!!  & Tofu Mole! It is a vegetarian/vegan dream. It is not authentic Mexican food but it is the next best thing.  The salsa is wonderful & creamy, a nice change to the standard salsa. The downfall...I have seen a cockroach crawling around on the inside of the window, while I ate (but that is why 3 stars only). But lets get real for a  second,  aren't cockroaches everywhere? Also sometimes the line is long or there is a lack of seating.

in summary:
healthy,
tasty,
veg friendly,
cheap, 
and worth your visit (and sometimes wait)

excerpts: I also wish they had more meat options, and no, "soyrizo" does not count.
soyrizo.author: Andy M.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote has several features that set it apart from other Mission burrito joints:
1) it seems very clean and seeing a cockroach is highly unlikely
2) the space is slightly modern and interesting
3) I get the distinct impression that roving mariachi bands never come in here (I could be wrong)
4) They just plonk the burrito down on a plate - no foil

I miss the foil (it keeps the burrito from exploding out the bottom), and I do like roving bands of mariachis. I also wish they had more meat options, and no, "soyrizo" does not count. I like the chile verde, but I want some carnitas and/or al pastor. I guess they are trying to do a lighter version of burritos, which is okay, but I'd still rather have the carnitas at La Taqueria or the pastor at El Toro. Still, they make good tasting food, the salsa is great, and the no cockroach thing is always a plus.

excerpts: But our soyrizo, pollo asado, and chicken mole quesadillas were taking an eternity.
The soyrizo quesadilla was excellent.
The chicken mole fantastic.
But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night.
The chicken mole fantastic.
But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night.
soyrizo.author: Jenny K.
soyrizo.review:
Hm. This is a tough one for me. The food is so fresh and tasty and the salsa insanely good, but the service, incomprehensibly long wait and nickel-and-diming are absurd.

We came here to grab some food  to-go before Dolores Park Movie Night. Little did we know that it would take 30 MINUTES for our order to be ready. Does it really take that long to make three quesadillas? Really? 

The lady at the cash register is also not friendly. She is the Mexican Food Nazi with scary eyebrows to match.
