We adore the salsa (shit, I could drink the stuff it's so freakin' good!) and asked for extra chips to go with the jar we were buying. She shook her head, "No extra chips," and told us each little scoop cost $1. $1!!! 

We stood around and watched order after order (by people who ordered AFTER us, by the way) go out the door. But our soyrizo, pollo asado, and chicken mole quesadillas were taking an eternity. 

When we finally got our food 30 minutes later, it was almost worth the wait. ALMOST. The soyrizo quesadilla was excellent. The chicken mole fantastic. But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night. And let's not forget that the food is over-priced. 

I am going to have to try the one on Fulton. It's closer to where I live and I am hoping the service and wait are better than the Mission location.

excerpts: I have one word to say about Papalote: SOYRIZO
If I am not feeling the soyrizo I can always feed the beast with their amazing marinated tofu tacos.
soyrizo.author: Angie R.
soyrizo.review:
I have one word to say about Papalote: SOYRIZO

I never knew they could make a fake meat product that actually drips bright orange grease when you eat it. The grease doesn't actually stain your clothes, but it comes close people, it comes close...

Paplote is my go-to place after yoga on Tues. and Thurs. in the Mission. If I am not feeling the soyrizo I can always feed the beast with their amazing marinated tofu tacos. And I love, love, love the salsa they serve with their chips.

There is also more traditional Mexican fare, including the obligatory dead animals for those who like to eat them. Prices are about the same as other Mexican joints in the Mission, maybe a buck or two higher.

Papalote loses two stars because:

1. They can be extremely agro about kicking you out about 10 seconds after they close.

2. They made fun of my white friend for being Whitey Whiterson, in Spanish, not knowing that Mr. Whiterson actually speaks Spanish. Not cool.

excerpts:
beef, chicken, soyrizo, veggie...

i liked the veggie the best.
soyrizo.author: Susy C.
soyrizo.review:
mad props for feeding my department on e-day.
the food was yummy, and not to mention we had a huge variety of it!
it was like a plethora of quesdillas, i was so happy.
beef, chicken, soyrizo, veggie...

i liked the veggie the best.
i haven't actually been inside the restaurant itself, my co-worker picked up the food and brought it back to work.

Papalote's, I SALUTE YOU! Thank you for supporting our hardworking department. =)

excerpts: As a vegetarian of ethics and not of revulsion, Papalote's soyrizo burrito hits my niche-taste with gusto.
soyrizo.author: Fernando V.
soyrizo.review:
As a vegetarian of ethics and not of revulsion, Papalote's soyrizo burrito hits my niche-taste with gusto. 

I have never tried anything else there, and probably will never care to. In this case, that's a compliment..

excerpts: I totally love that they have vegan options like their beans(all of which are vegan), soyrizo, and tofu.
soyrizo.author: Joni S.
soyrizo.review:
I started going to Papalote over a year ago and loved it so much I ate here once a week.  As a vegetarian burritos can be bland but even their bean and cheese burritos are far from bland.  My only complaint is that they grill the tortillas but maybe that's too much to ask.  Their salsa is extraordinary.  I think this place survives off of the sheer awesomeness of it's salsa(chips are good too).  I totally love that they have vegan options like their beans(all of which are vegan), soyrizo, and tofu.  The downside is waiting in line in the cold and their curmudgeonly staff.  

p.s.  I usually order it to go and they have always gotten my order right on.  But if you're eating there the burritos come unwrapped(no foil) so you eat them with a knife and fork.  I prefer a hand held burrito.

excerpts:
I also found Papalote's tortilla chips too hard, and the soyrizo's texture wasn't as meaty as Mariachi's.

refried!
- the brownish red soyrizo, which has an intense salty (almost bacony) flavor that I just lurrved.
soyrizo.author: angela n.
soyrizo.review:
Yesterday our burritos were tightly wrapped and a bit thin.  So they were less messy to eat, but also less filling, than your average Mission burritos.  I also found Papalote's tortilla chips too hard, and the soyrizo's texture wasn't as meaty as Mariachi's.

But when it comes to flavor, Papalote might have the edge, for three reasons:
- the smokey red salsa, speckled with black chilis -- Its makes your heart skip a beat (from the joy as well as the spiciness).
- refried black beans. what's better than fried? refried!
- the brownish red soyrizo, which has an intense salty (almost bacony) flavor that I just lurrved.

My husband liked that his carne asada was freshly made and piping hot.  

Horchata was creamy and sweet.  I asked for no ice so as to get more horchata. Thumbs up.

excerpts: Soyrizo.
It is SO good.
Go try it.
I prefer tacos to burritos because the soyrizo is very heavy and will make you feel really really full.
If I eat a whole soyrizo burrito, I don't feel so hot.
soyrizo.author: Penelope C.
soyrizo.review:
One word. Soyrizo. It is SO good. Go try it. I prefer tacos to burritos because the soyrizo is very heavy and will make you feel really really full. If I eat a whole soyrizo burrito, I don't feel so hot. Tacos are the perfect amount of food for me.

Minus one star because you're liable to stand there for ten minutes with pretty much no line and the staff with still manage to not help you.

Oh, and the salsa makes me drool just thinking about it.

excerpts: I ordered the super soyrizo burrito.
soyrizo.author: Amanda C.
soyrizo.review:
I had to check out Papalote after hearing my friends rave and rave.

It was 7:30pm on a Thursday night and there was a line out the door.  The place is broken up into two sections - a dining room and the order line where you order to dine-in or take-out.

It's the same ingredients across the board that you can get in quesadilla, burrito and taco? form.  Some very tasty-sounding vegetarian options.

I ordered the super soyrizo burrito.  Super = $.99 = sour cream, guacamole, etc etc.

And I did not regret it one bit.  IT WAS SO GOOD.  Down to the last bite that I knew I shouldn't have had but couldn't help myself.

The wait was horrific as I had enough time to order, wait five minutes, leave the place to go to my friend's house to pick up some dishes, clean those dishes and come back and STILL wait another ten minutes.  But it was well worth it.

Papalote FTW!

excerpts: Still my burrito of choice: soyrizo, whole wheat tortilla, black beans, extra veggies.
soyrizo.author: David K.
soyrizo.review:
When it comes to burritos, I can talk smack.  I used to live near "the mish" and ate burritos almost daily.

Papalote rocks the best combination of authentic Me-hee-can-o flava with the health food fresh-mex scene.  My burrito-loving friends are sometimes offended: "no self-respecting burrito place should have soy-rizo burritos".  Al contrario, the genius of Papalote is that they keep it real with carne asada while infusing new flavors into the mix.  And of course it's all from scratch!

Note that I'm not some vegetarian hippy-dude.  Still my burrito of choice: soyrizo, whole wheat tortilla, black beans, extra veggies.

If Mexico were alive today, this is how he'd be making burritos.

Always order an extra salsa or two.  Sure, they charge you $.50, but go half-sies with your amigos.  It's just that good.

I first learned about this place from a girl I met on a bus.  You first learned about this place from me.  Play it on the playa, player!

excerpts:
I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  
On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  
I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.
soyrizo.author: Cory C.
soyrizo.review:
So looking through the reviews for this restaurant, I do realize that the food is ok, and most of the time the service is good.

I called papolote to order some food for my boyfriend and I.  I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

We walked on down to the store a few minutes later to pick up the order.

"Hi, Im just here to pick up an Order for Cory"
"Oh Yes" she replies...
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

She begins to tell me that she didnt hear me on the phone say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

I was extremely confused.  Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  She was extremely rude and unappologetic, all the while rolling her eyes and talking to me like i was the iddiot.  

I work in the service industry, and if the order comes out wrong, whether or not it was the customers fault, you get them a new order no questions asked.  

I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

She turned to the woman working the other register and said something to her in Spanish, and the woman looked at her and said... JUST VOID IT.

I dont care about the price, it was all about principal.  ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

Over all a bad experience.  Maybe the woman was having a bad day, but for some reason i got the impression that she always acts like that.

THe food wasnt that great.  Ive had better from El Farolito down the street on Mission and 24th.

Watch out for the woman who works the register and doesnt wear a uniform.  Shes Crazy!

excerpts: I go to Papalote for two reasons: Soyrizo and Salsa.
We'll start with the Soyrizo.
The first time I had the privilege of letting it pass my palate, it was in a taco.
More of a burrito woman myself, I think I went with the Tacos because they were cheaper
and I was in a hurry.
But damn, the moment that luscious fake meat hit my taste buds
I had the foodie equivalent of a full body orgasm, complete with yummy aftershocks hours later.
I'm sure there are other great things on the menu, but give me some soyrizo and salsa
and I'm a satisfied lady.
Mmm...
soyrizo.author: Becca B.
soyrizo.review:
I go to Papalote for two reasons: Soyrizo and Salsa.

We'll start with the Soyrizo.  The first time I had the privilege of letting it pass my palate, it was in a taco.  More of a burrito woman myself, I think I went with the Tacos because they were cheaper and I was in a hurry.  But damn, the moment that luscious fake meat hit my taste buds I had the foodie equivalent of a full body orgasm, complete with yummy aftershocks hours later.  When fake meat is better than any real meat you've ever experienced, you know you have a winner.

Next: The Salsa.  I think the quality of the salsa speaks for itself when the menu says you can buy jars of the stuff and they have about 600 little mason jars waiting to be filled ... BUT, lemme tell you this shit is good.  You get a little taste of it free when you eat in-house.  After my taste I was hooked and bought a jar so I could mainline it at home.  It's so good that the little kick of spiciness it does have still does not deter me from eating it in great quantities (and I'm the type of person that cannot handle hot spicy at all.)  My eyes water and my nose runs as I eat it, and I love every delicious moment.

I'm sure there are other great things on the menu, but give me some soyrizo and salsa and I'm a satisfied lady.  Mmm...

excerpts: So I see and hear people rave about the soyrizo, and I am forced to try it.
soyrizo.author: Matthew F.
soyrizo.review:
I fucking hate vegetarian "wannabe" food with a passion.
Veggie Burgers, Veggie Dogs, Soy Bacon; you can go fuck yourselves.

So I see and hear people rave about the soyrizo, and I am forced to try it.

Holy. Shit.

Better than any chorizo I've ever had. 
The Camarones (Shrimp) is light, blends nicely with the spices and rice, and just feels enjoyable to eat, perfect for not feeling like a sweaty piece of shit afterwards like most other Mexican places, which will keep you on the toilet so long you'll get new honeycombs on your jeans.

In fact, none of these burritos is going to weigh you down. 

The Mole is overcooked and has a strong basic taste in it. Meh.

They sell salsa by the pint in mason jars for $5.95, and I keep it constantly stocked in my fridge. It varies in spice from day to day, but no matter how hot it is, it's a crazy, unique, amazing salsa that I can't figure out the contents of.  Perfect for snacking, and can hold up it's own as a condiment against sriricha.

excerpts: As far as Papalote goes on its own, I have been a long-time eater of their mushroom quesadilla (simple and good), their soyrizo nachos (great for us non meat eaters!), and their fish tacos (which are the healthy, non-beer battered kind).
soyrizo.author: Shannon R.
soyrizo.review:
There's not much to say about Papalote that hasn't already been said. However, I will say this: My boyfriend discovered this really bangin' combination: Have'a corn chips with Papalote salsa...I'm telling you, this is Latino-Asian fusion at it's finest, people! 

Sure, the chips they serve at Papalote are nice and fresh and good, but if you ever buy a jar of salsa to go from them, just go across the street to the Valencia Farmers Market grocery store, and pick up a bag of Have'a corn chips (they are basically very fresh, crispy tortilla chips infused with soy-sauce...as weird as it may sound, it works!) And with the Papalote Salsa, oh hells yeah!!!

As far as Papalote goes on its own, I have been a long-time eater of their mushroom quesadilla (simple and good), their soyrizo nachos (great for us non meat eaters!), and their fish tacos (which are the healthy, non-beer battered kind).

excerpts: A soyrizo burrito was my last meal in San Francisco.
I am a humongous carnivore but the soyrizo is so good, I rarely order anything else.
soyrizo.author: Adrienne W.
soyrizo.review:
How much do I love Papalote?

A soyrizo burrito was my last meal in San Francisco.  

I had lived in the Mission for nearly 3 years and Papalote is what I wanted for my last meal.  I'll miss you, Papalote! 

PS I am a humongous carnivore but the soyrizo is so good, I rarely order anything else.

excerpts: Soyrizo.
SO AMAZING.
I remember the first time I had Papalote, it was like an epiphany in my mouth.
Why oh why don't more places have soyrizo?
As long as they have some piping hot soyrizo in the kitchen, I will be back for more.
Did I mention the soyrizo?
soyrizo.author: Shirin S.
soyrizo.review:
Soyrizo.  SO AMAZING.  I remember the first time I had Papalote, it was like an epiphany in my mouth.  Why oh why don't more places have soyrizo?  It can't be hard to make, and I know I've seen it at my local Trader Joe's...

But I digress.  Papalote has some spotty service (particularly when dealing with drunk chicks who have spent the better part of the evening at the Mission Bar for happy hour), but I could care less.  As long as they have some piping hot soyrizo in the kitchen, I will be back for more.

Did I mention the soyrizo?

excerpts: They have so many vegetarian options, including the phenomenal grilled veggie burrito (potatoes and carrots!) and the equally amazing soyrizo burrito (soy chorizo!).
Make sure to order things "super" so that they come with sour cream/
They don't cook veggie stuff (beans, rice, vegetables) with lard, so all is fair game for vegetarians.
soyrizo.author: Claire K.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is my favorite burrito place in the Bay Area by a long shot!  They have so many vegetarian options, including the phenomenal grilled veggie burrito (potatoes and carrots!) and the equally amazing soyrizo burrito (soy chorizo!).  Make sure to order things "super" so that they come with sour cream/guac/etc.  

They don't cook veggie stuff (beans, rice, vegetables) with lard, so all is fair game for vegetarians.  I love that the burritos are a bit healthier than the standard Mission taqueria, so I don't feel quite as terrible when I leave.

The salsa is fantastic--people come for the salsa alone!  The bean dip is yet another thing to rave about.  I love this place.  Best burritos ever.

excerpts: this just shot back to being my favorite place for burritos.. will try the soyrizo today for the first time.
soyrizo.author: Ajesh S.
soyrizo.review: I just discovered their garlic fried rice, wow! this just shot back to being my favorite place for burritos.. will try the soyrizo today for the first time.

excerpts: This was the first burrito in SF that I had found were they had a Soyrizo burrito and one Tofu burrito that was marinated and grilled.
I really enjoyed the Soyrizo burrito; it had tons of flavor (although I only got a bite or two of it -
I hear it can be filling).
I had the tofu burrito... it was pretty good.
soyrizo.author: Vrinda S.
soyrizo.review:
I had heard about this place on Yelp. I wanted to try a Mexican place with a number of vegetarian options and that had something different to offer. This was the first burrito in SF that I had found were they had a Soyrizo burrito and one Tofu burrito that was marinated and grilled. 

I really enjoyed the Soyrizo burrito; it had tons of flavor (although I only got a bite or two of it - I hear it can be filling). I had the tofu burrito... it was pretty good. I finished the whole thing. 

Will definitely go again! I loved their salsa and chips...

excerpts: Mmm soyrizo.
soyrizo.author: Angela P.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote lives very close to me, and I'm so glad it's my neighbor!  Friendly people work there, and the burritos are so very, very tasty.  I've eaten there way too many times by now, and I actually don't think I've ever been disappointed by the food - so many veggie options!  Mmm soyrizo.  

Also wonderful are their 10 burrito cards - get ten punches and you are rewarded with a free burrito of any kind!  I typically keep at least three of these cards in my wallet at all times.

excerpts: So I asked for the Denver (onions, bell pepps, shrooms and cheese) and asked to add Soyrizo.
Was going to be $4.50!!
Sorry
but I'm willing to pay for quality and for food
I can't easily make at home.
I can make a Soyrizo burrito at home easy.
soyrizo.author: Steven M.
soyrizo.review:
Will start by saying I "grew up" loving Papalote. Been in the mission for 12 years. It was cool when the brothers were around more and caring for the place. I really like their food BUT they've gone too far. Went for a breakfast burrito...they have 4 choices, all pretty basic without anything special and they are all $9-10. So I asked for the Denver (onions, bell pepps, shrooms and cheese) and asked to add Soyrizo. Was going to be $4.50!! Sorry but I'm willing to pay for quality and for food I can't easily make at home. I can make a Soyrizo burrito at home easy. 

So I said no thanks and left. Funny how blatantly overcharging can put a bad taste in ur mouth. Had to run errands up in Noe, so stopped at a cool, sustainable little Mex place on 24th past Castro. Bfast burrito with roasted potatoes, poblanos, etc was $6.50 and added carnitas for $2.50. It was huge and delicious.

Not sure if I'm going back to papalote for reg burritos or not. Hope u guys are paying attention and adjust your pricing. I might pay $15 for a really interesting, more gourmet bfast burrito...but not your basic one.

excerpts: vegan soyrizo, marinated tofu, etc.
soyrizo.author: Rob C.
soyrizo.review:
2.5 like a fancy chipotle in taste.  quintessential sf.  look at the menu.  vegan soyrizo, marinated tofu, etc.  no carnitas, al pastor, etc.
took away 2 carne asada tacos here, $7 topped with guac. and all the americanized toppings.  steak cooked to order at least, otherwise not my style.  as a side note, the salsa with the chips was very nice and hearty.

excerpts: Had a great soyrizo burrito (and half of my friend's mole burrito) and it was really delicious!
soyrizo.author: Susan D.
soyrizo.review: Had a great soyrizo burrito (and half of my friend's mole burrito) and it was really delicious! Loved the chips and salsa that's made from fire roasted tomatoes which comes with your burrito. It's a little pricier than your average taqueria but worth it since their vegan options are incredibly tasty.

excerpts: Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.)
soyrizo.author: Sharon G.
soyrizo.review:
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant ever.  The salsa is fabulous.  Too bad they give it to you in teeny tiny little containers and then charge you for more--  but hey, it's worth it.  I would probably sit there all day and eat chips and salsa if it was free.

I love the veggie tacos (potatoes, carrots, mushrooms in a corn tortilla).  Everything always tastes fresh.  I love that everything isn't smothered in cheese, either.  Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.) I even brought my mom here and she loved it, too!

And parking sucks, but that's to be expected.

excerpts: Now I will say the one good thing about soyrizo.
soyrizo.author: Vasile S.
soyrizo.review:
HEY DON'T JUST FOLLOW THE CROWD KIDS--

There is no Reason on Gods green earth that this place should be as popular as it seems to be.NONE. Seriously folks. Here a few of the reasons:

1. You have pay for extra chips or salsa. And pay ALOT

2. God awful to nonexistent customer service

3. Insane packed lines to wait for so so mexican food

Now I will say the one good thing about soyrizo. tasty no doubt. 

But come on--this is the mission in sf, it not like there not a thousand other taqueria all around you, be an individual man go to an actual good place.

excerpts: The soyrizo is excellent: slightly sweet, perfectly mushy, and seasoned in heaven.
soyrizo.author: Ross G.
soyrizo.review:
The soyrizo is excellent: slightly sweet, perfectly mushy, and seasoned in heaven. The salsa is smoky and smooth. 

One of my favorite burrito places. I would move to the city to be closer to The Papa, but they had the genius to put themselves 3 minutes away from the 24th Street BART stop.

Sometimes I worry that I'm not going to get a table, and you can't save a table while your friend orders. Mercifully, the Gods of Vegan Mexican Food in the Mission always smile down on us and a table opens at just the right moment. Now I must sacrifice a tofu-shaped virgin to appease this cruel cruel god.
____________________________________________________
I once saw a "wanted" sign here posted by some girl who struck up a conversation with some guy while she waited for her order. It was a really cute sign about how they hit it off and she even went to the effort of taking out an email address so he could get in touch, something like "webothwaitedforburritos@something.com" which I thought was a cute touch. I hope they reconnected and got married. Does anyone have closure on this?

excerpts: But the Super Soyrizo Burrito is SO good that I can't bring myself to order anything else.
soyrizo.author: Linda L.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is in my speed dial.

I am sure that there are many tasty tasty things that they make at Papalote.  But the Super Soyrizo Burrito is SO good that I can't bring myself to order anything else.  

I always have a really hard time because the salsa is also SO good... and I want to fill up on chips and salsa before the burrito comes and then it's even harder to finish the whole thing.  If I go alone next time, and no one's looking, perhaps I'll just drink the salsa and skip the chips... 

Seriously though, it is often distressing to me because I wish I could eat a whole super burrito without getting to the pants unbuttoning level of stuffed-ness.  Don't get me wrong, I still eat the whole thing, it's hard to stop, I just deal with the consequences.

I have also tried the vegan mole tacos which were a tad salty but super yummy and the mole burrito which was a little drippy but good also.

I wish it were open later than 10.

excerpts: My stomach hurt after the ginormous soyrizo burrito here, but it was sooooo worth it.
They also have delicious homemade salsa.
soyrizo.author: Kaye W.
soyrizo.review: My stomach hurt after the ginormous soyrizo burrito here, but it was sooooo worth it.  They also have delicious homemade salsa.

excerpts: And Soyrizo tacos.
And most importantly...
soyrizo.author: JC R.
soyrizo.review:
Yum. Yum. YUM!!!

Hey you could probably find a more "authentic" taqueria in the mission, but they probably don't have delicious roasted habanero salsa. And Soyrizo tacos. And most importantly...TOFU MOLE TACOS!!!

2 taco's are 4 bucks, and you get the tortilla chips and habenero salsa gratis. Plus like most of the taqueria's in the mission they have other delicious things...like real sugar-cane coke in a glass bottle.

Love it.

excerpts: Papalote has it all....spinach tortillas, guacamole OR regular avocado, soyrizo, marinated tofu, perfectly seasoned grilled veggies, and beer.
Don't even get me started on the salsa.
Fuck, my mouth is already watering.....
no joke!
The salsa is amazing and definitely what sets this place apart from other spots in the mission.
Delicious and spicy in all the right ways [insert sexual joke
here].
On the real though.....
Papalote is on top of their flavor game.
I always bring my out-of town guests here...
everyone loves it.
Thank you thank you thank you.
soyrizo.author: Emily S.
soyrizo.review: Sometimes I daydream about eating burritos. Papalote makes those dreams come true. Papalote has it all....spinach tortillas, guacamole OR regular avocado, soyrizo, marinated tofu, perfectly seasoned grilled veggies, and beer. Don't even get me started on the salsa. Fuck, my mouth is already watering.....no joke! The salsa is amazing and definitely what sets this place apart from other spots in the mission. Delicious and spicy in all the right ways [insert sexual joke here]. On the real though.....Papalote is on top of their flavor game. I always bring my out-of town guests here... everyone loves it. Thank you thank you thank you.

excerpts: I had a plate of soyrizo tacos that were quite delectable.
soyrizo.author: Nader A.
soyrizo.review:
We headed out to Papalote to get a quick meal before my flight back to Vegas. Being the first customers to arrive right as the store was opening we got our food pretty quickly.

I'm always amazed at the number of vegan friendly places in the area and Papalote is no different. I had a plate of soyrizo tacos that were quite delectable.

excerpts: The soyrizo here is amazing.
I have tried to cook it myself from one of those packaged things you get from the store and lets
just say it wasnt so good.
So I was a little skeptical when I ordered it.
But based on some of the reviews here I had to try it.
I have tried it as a burrito and a taco.
Out of the two I would go with the taco.
It the taco you can really appreciate the taste of the soyrizo.
The burrito is good too.
I got that route when I want something really fulfilling.
I have also tried the tofu in a burrito.
It was good.
I was had already eaten some tacos
so I was only able to eat half of the burrito.
The burrito ingredients at times overpower the taste of the tofu so
soyrizo.author: Richard C.
soyrizo.review:
I have finally found it! A REALLY good mexican place in SF. Not only that, but one that has good vegetarian food. I'll just jump to the food:
The soyrizo here is amazing. I have tried to cook it myself from one of those packaged things you get from the store and lets just say it wasnt so good. So I was a little skeptical when I ordered it. But based on some of the reviews here I had to try it. I have tried it as a burrito and a taco. Out of the two I would go with the taco. It the taco you can really appreciate the taste of the soyrizo. The burrito is good too. I got that route when I want something really fulfilling. I have also tried the tofu in a burrito. It was good. I was had already eaten some tacos so I was only able to eat half of the burrito. The burrito ingredients at times overpower the taste of the tofu so next time I might try it as a taco. 

The salsa is meh. It a bit above average from what I have experienced out here but I wasnt too excited by it. I have to attribute the hype of the salsa to the type of customers going here. (you know what Im talking about) 

The prices are excellent here. For the amount of people that come here and order the wait is within reason. And as usual for the area parking sucks. All in all I have found my burrito spot.

excerpts: They have a really awesome selection of vegetarian and even vegan (soyrizo) ingredient options.
soyrizo.author: Miel H.
soyrizo.review:
I wonder about adding to the review pile when it is above 600, but hell, this place is worth it. 

If you are in the hood, make it a stop. They have a really awesome selection of vegetarian and even vegan (soyrizo) ingredient options. The guac doesn't taste like the prepackaged bag kind. 

The salsa IS to die for and the chips are real -  thick and crunchy and not greasy. Plus, it is only .99cents to upgrade to a super on a burrito and it is money well spent. Depending on your order, a burrito is around $7 bucks and most definitely won't leave you hungry.

Not open late, and not a huge seating area. But they do take phone orders for pickup.

excerpts: Perhaps the buzz is because they offer vegan or soyrizo alternatives?
Even the much-vaunted salsa?
Meh.
soyrizo.author: R.B. W.
soyrizo.review: Not sure what all the fuss is about.  The place is cramped, not so clean, and devoid of personality.  I've heard people raving about the place, and finally had dinner there.  But wow...totally and completely underwhelmed.  I head out for Mex at least a couple times a week, but won't be revisiting Paplote.  Perhaps the buzz is because they offer vegan or soyrizo alternatives?  Even the much-vaunted salsa?  Meh. The food was okay, but way too much rice in the burrito, and perhaps three shrimp.  For a $11 burrito, I felt rooked.  I'll stick with Pancho Villa's Super Burrito, or head to San Jalisco for their awesome mole, and go to El Metate for some great fish tacos.

excerpts: Tofu mole burritos are super yummy , and the Soyrizo is delicious !
Both are my fav's !
Yes it's a tiny place and can be pretty crowded , and
yes you'll have to wait abit , they aren't the fastest around !
It's all about the taste !
PS - you can buy that salsa to go to in a quart jar , supreme !
soyrizo.author: Michael B.
soyrizo.review: Really love this place.  Like everyone else say's about the salsa , it's pretty awesome ! Tofu mole burritos are super yummy , and the Soyrizo is delicious !  Both are my fav's ! Yes it's a tiny place and can be pretty crowded , and yes you'll have to wait abit , they aren't the fastest around ! It's all about the taste ! A+ !  PS - you can buy that salsa to go to in a quart jar , supreme !

excerpts: They have soyrizo, which is my favorite.
soyrizo.author: Charlotte O.
soyrizo.review:
This is the healthy, clean alternative to every other GD taqueria in the Mission.  They have soyrizo, which is my favorite.

Here's my advice, though.  Get a jar of the delicious salsa and take it home.  The salsa gets five stars.

excerpts: I've had every version they have -- chicken carne asada, soyrizo, triple threat -- I have to say the grilled tofu is the best.
Guac, sour cream, black beans.
soyrizo.author: Jeff G.
soyrizo.review:
Best burrito in the city? I think it might be. Apologies to Gordo's, El Farolito, and Taq Cancun.

Lets see...

I get a super burrito, tomato tortilla, and the grilled tofu. Grilled tofu is something I would only get here. I've had every version they have -- chicken carne asada, soyrizo, triple threat -- I have to say the grilled tofu is the best. Guac, sour cream, black beans. Ahh, the simple pleasures in life. 

That fucking salsa. Its not fair how good that shit is. Its not runny, you dip a chip, and it comes out covered, no drip. Yeah. Exactly. Ive bought it by the mason jar, put it on everything. 

The bottled salsa on the table is a, dare I say, GREAT change of pace. Habenero El Yucateco? Yes. 

The apps are good too. The black bean dip with some chips is the ultimate ice breaker. Or something.

If you want to have a delicious burrito that uses fresh ingredients, or if you just want to mingle with the hipster fixed-gear crowd, Papalote is the spot.

excerpts: My fav: soyrizo tacos and the most kick ass roasted salsa anywhere!
soyrizo.author: max k.
soyrizo.review:
It doesn't get any better for vegetarians! My all-time favorite burrito and taco place. My meat-eating friends also love it! I have no complaints about this place except it gets crowded sometimes.

My fav: soyrizo tacos and the most kick ass roasted salsa anywhere!

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito that is.....!!!!
soyrizo.author: Kimberly H.
soyrizo.review:
Fresh ingredients, good solid menu, and reasonable price!!! I love this place.

The salsa is the bomb-diggity-bomb-bomb!!!! as for the chips.....they suck just like all chips in San Francisco.....I like homeade chips ok, not bagged! sorry. 

It is my favorite burrito in the city. 
The soyrizo burrito that is.....!!!! So good, don't forget to make it "super!"

When I was a meat eater, I loved the Chicken mole, it is pretty yumm. But as far as vegetarian/vegan options, this is a great place! They have fresh vegetables, and the black beans taste good. 

It is nice atmosphere too, and I know you gotta wait a little, but it's so worth it. Beside, they play reggae in there!! What's not to love?

excerpts: We got the chile verde burrito and the soyrizo burrito.
I suppose they deserve props for offering lots of vegetarian options to wean people off meat.

The chile verde was just all right--big hunks of slightly dry and stringy meat in a not very flavorful sauce; the soyrizo spicy and as you might expect; both burritos running over with no structural integrity--the kind of SF burrito that ordinarily is wrapped in foil, but perhaps they are trying to avoid the foil here
and so you eat it with knife and fork.

The chile verde was just all right--big hunks of slightly dry and stringy meat in a not very flavorful sauce; the soyrizo spicy and as you might expect; both burritos running over with no structural integrity--the kind of SF burrito that ordinarily is wrapped in foil, but perhaps they are trying to avoid the foil here
and so you eat it with knife and fork.
soyrizo.author: Ryan C.
soyrizo.review: All right, but I'd rather have a $3 taco truck veggie burrito than one of these. Yes, the salsa is great, so maybe I would go here and just get chips and salsa. We got the chile verde burrito and the soyrizo burrito. I suppose they deserve props for offering lots of vegetarian options to wean people off meat. The chile verde was just all right--big hunks of slightly dry and stringy meat in a not very flavorful sauce; the soyrizo spicy and as you might expect; both burritos running over with no structural integrity--the kind of SF burrito that ordinarily is wrapped in foil, but perhaps they are trying to avoid the foil here and so you eat it with knife and fork.

excerpts: but I have to admit that the soyrizo tacos are pretty tasty but my alltime favorite is the fish burrito - straight up, don't go super.
Why do I love the fish burrito?
It's is sauted in white wine with your choice of beans.
The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.
The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings.
You can usually share a fish burrito, and maybe get a quesadilla in case
soyrizo.author: Spoon G.
soyrizo.review:
++UPDATE 10/29: Last time I went in to pick up some food I spent some time reading their SF inspection report. Let's just say they failed the inspection - things like storing food on the floor, the refrigerator temperature was not low enough...basically they didn't get a score because they had to fix so many things. Should you be afraid? I haven't gotten sick, but it was a bit off putting so I am lowering my score to 3 stars.++

Why do I love Papalote in the Mission? A few good reasons. I am not a vegetarian but I have to admit that the soyrizo tacos are pretty tasty but my alltime favorite is the fish burrito - straight up, don't go super.

Why do I love the fish burrito? It's is sauted in white wine with your choice of beans. The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.  The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings. You can usually share a fish burrito, and maybe get a quesadilla in case one of you gets a bit hungry.

The chips and salsa are also acclaimed. I do like the salsa, but I have to say it is a touch too spice for my taste.

They also do a great takeout - they are on my speed dial.

excerpts: You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos.
but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito.
However, the prices are a bit steep
soyrizo.author: Grace S.
soyrizo.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: I always get the soyrizo burrito, it is one of my favorites
- tastes like something I would actually make at home.
Back in the day my mom would make soy "chorizo" for me, but she would mix it with eggs.
It came in a box, it looked something like bacos - you had to add water and let it reconstitute.
It was kind of icky if you think about it.
Thanks papalote, you remind me of my childhood.
Also, the guy that owns this place is very good to the local community...
soyrizo.author: Raul A.
soyrizo.review:
The salsa is smokey and eveything always seems to be super fresh.  I always get the soyrizo burrito, it is one of my favorites - tastes like something I would actually make at home. Back in the day my mom would make soy "chorizo" for me, but she would mix it with eggs. It came in a box, it looked something like bacos - you had to add water and let it reconstitute. It was kind of icky if you think about it.  Thanks papalote, you remind me of my childhood. Also, the guy that owns this place is very good to the local community...what's not to like?

OK, that being said I need to go on a rant about some of the reviews here. WHY do non-Mexican pendejos feel like they have the knowledge to call vegetarian options "non traditional"?, or to say that by "adding" vegan options it creates some form of  hybrid "healty twist" to Mexican food? Mexican food *is* healthy...or it can be, if you know where to get it. Burritos are NOT authentic Mexican food, so when reviewers complain that Papalote doesn't serve "authentic Mexican burritos" I can't help to roll my eyes.

Newsflash - in Mexico we DO eat vegetables. As a matter of fact, in many parts of Mexico meat was such a commodity that 98% of the diet was comprised of vegetarian options - just adding a little bit of meat in the shape of local available animals.  Even in super crowded cement and iron Mexico City you can go to any marchanta making quesadillas and ask for Flor the Calabaza, calabacitas con elote, rajas, papa con queso, hongos and delicious huitlacoche. Ohhh...if I could only find that here in the US! 

:-(

excerpts: I was particularly intrigued by the 'soyrizo', as I used to love chorizo before I stopped eating sausages, burgers, and all those other products made with mashed up scrag ends of meat.
I ordered the soyrizo burrito to eat in.

At least, I think I ordered the soyrizo burrito, but I'm not entirely sure that the server understood what I said, and the burrito I received didn't seem to contain anything immediately identifiable as soyrizo.
It did contain a bland mixture of rice, beans, tomatoes and onions, but I was expecting that.
At least the salsa that came with it was tasty, although it didn't make up for the burrito disappointment.
If I go back, I might try ordering soyrizo as a side.
If I get a plate with nothing on it, I'll know that they're just making it up!
soyrizo.author: Amelia I.
soyrizo.review:
I went to Papalote after reading the review in one of the free papers, which praised the healthy cooking and number of the veggie options. I was particularly intrigued by the 'soyrizo', as I used to love chorizo before I stopped eating sausages, burgers, and all those other products made with mashed up scrag ends of meat.

I ordered the soyrizo burrito to eat in. At least, I think I ordered the soyrizo burrito, but I'm not entirely sure that the server understood what I said, and the burrito I received didn't seem to contain anything immediately identifiable as soyrizo. It did contain a bland mixture of rice, beans, tomatoes and onions, but I was expecting that. At least the salsa that came with it was tasty, although it didn't make up for the burrito disappointment. If I go back, I might try ordering soyrizo as a side. If I get a plate with nothing on it, I'll know that they're just making it up!

excerpts: Try the soyrizo burrito adding potatoes.
Make sure the potatoes are cooked all the way through ask for them crispy.
This is about as good as it gets when it comes to burritos.
B.C. burrito in Hawaii is amazing as well.
soyrizo.author: Sashy R.
soyrizo.review: Try the soyrizo burrito adding potatoes. Make sure the potatoes are cooked all the way through ask for them crispy. This is about as good as it gets when it comes to burritos. B.C. burrito in Hawaii is amazing as well. Also, for a cheap and healthy option Taqueria Cancun is amazing for a veggie burrito. However, if you're willing to spend the extra couple of dollars here you wont' be disappointed. This is absolutely delightful! I highly recommend it.

excerpts: My friend says the vegetarian options are awesome, he likes soyrizo, and I guess some people look for that in their food, a vegetarian option that is.
soyrizo.author: Devon L.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is awesome to the core.  They give you your choice of beans and tortillas for burritos, which I enjoy because I'm not partial to the typical, "flour tortilla brown pinto beans" burrito persuasion.  My friend says the vegetarian options are awesome, he likes soyrizo, and I guess some people look for that in their food, a vegetarian option that is.  
The chicken and beef are grilled fresh to order, its always tender without gristle or fat.  I love their burritos, yo.  
The best part is the Barbie size portion of chips and salsa they bring for you and and your four friends to share.  Its tiny, but the salsa is the best ever.  The first time I tasted it I was like, "Dang.  Thats a good salsa"  
Minus one star because seating here sucks ass, and pretentious assholes won't move their chairs over an inch to make room.

excerpts: I drool for the soyrizo and grilled veggies, even dream about them.
soyrizo.author: Maria L.
soyrizo.review:
Heavenly tacos for vegans.
I drool for the soyrizo and grilled veggies, even dream about them. (Pass on the tofu mole) Fresh ingredients and complex flavors.  And their salsa, don't get me started... it's delicious. However this is the reason I give them 4 stars and not 5: why do they have to be so darn skimpy about their chips and salsa. They give you a small bowl while you wait for your food, but if you want more it costs extra........ for chips? Are you kidding me?!?
The service is good. The line to order is generally the longest wait. They have good beer in the cooler (others on tap) and art in the dinning room is always changing.

excerpts: I prefer these "less authentic" tacos because they come with plenty of tomatoes and you can stuff them with alternative ingredients like tofu, prawns, or soyrizo.
Great chips and a very spicy salsa complete the meal.
soyrizo.author: Sonia C.
soyrizo.review: I prefer these "less authentic" tacos because they come with plenty of tomatoes and you can stuff them with alternative ingredients like tofu, prawns, or soyrizo.  Great chips and a very spicy salsa complete the meal.

excerpts: Anyway, love love love that soyrizo burrito - my favorite in the city.
Thank for reading, hope this was helpful.
soyrizo.author: sue m.
soyrizo.review: The food in this place is very tasty indeed - why do the people who work there have to be so rude????They leave a bad taste in my mouth- not sure they are worth going back- The least they could do is be a little more thankful to their customers who helped make them successful. I don't get why it feels like you are inconveniencing them when you order a meal. Basically, they are saying get the hell out of here as you are not worthy of this lovely food. ouch- I get that they are very busy and want you to hustle your ass when you order- god forbid you order a burrito wrong - cuz by gosh if you live in the Mission,  you should know how and deserve the cashier chick to bite your head off. Anyway, love love love that soyrizo burrito - my favorite in the city. Thank for reading, hope this was helpful.

excerpts: MOTHERFUCKING SOYRIZO.
soyrizo.author: Laura B.
soyrizo.review:
marinated tofu.  fresh grilled veggies.  vegetarian beans.  amazing salsa.  delicious rice.  crispy chips.  MOTHERFUCKING SOYRIZO.

it's like all my little vegan pig dreams came true.  i've always said that the only cusine that's hard to do vegan is the burrito (yes, i consider the burrito to be a cuisine) and papalote has revolutionized my burrito eating life.  if you are vegetarian or vegan, go here NOW!

excerpts: I think their burritos (my favorites are chile verde and soyrizo) are far superior to their tacos, which tend to have too much lettuce.
Their nachos are also great.

In fact, the only reasons I'm rating them four stars instead of five are the 1) recent 13% price increase; 2) long wait/table scarcity during peak times; and 3) small, close together tables that necessitate having to sit too close to greasy poser hipsters (though some of them are cute) when dining in.
soyrizo.author: Steven W.
soyrizo.review: I LOVE Papalote and I have been coming here at least once a week for three years.  There really isn't much else to write.  I feel as if the restaurant offers traditional Mexican food minus some of the cuisine's more negative aspects (e.g., lard).  I think their burritos (my favorites are chile verde and soyrizo) are far superior to their tacos, which tend to have too much lettuce.  Their nachos are also great.  In fact, the only reasons I'm rating them four stars instead of five are the 1) recent 13% price increase; 2) long wait/table scarcity during peak times; and 3) small, close together tables that necessitate having to sit too close to greasy poser hipsters (though some of them are cute) when dining in.

excerpts: Papalote, a hipsterized taqueria with colorful walls and an impressive array of veggie options (mmm...soyrizo), is clearly a darling of the Mission scene.
Even in the middle of the afternoon with half the tables empty, there was a takeout line going out the door.
But I have to go with Maria D on this one:    you're paying for this trendiness with small portions.
Otherwise, I'll stick to the authentic taquerias for my burrito fix--soyrizo or no.
soyrizo.author: Wes M.
soyrizo.review: Papalote, a hipsterized taqueria with colorful walls and an impressive array of veggie options (mmm...soyrizo), is clearly a darling of the Mission scene.  Even in the middle of the afternoon with half the tables empty, there was a takeout line going out the door.  But I have to go with Maria D on this one:    you're paying for this trendiness with small portions.  Like my prawn burrito with hardly any prawns in it.  And yes, that creamy orange salsa is awesome, but you have to pay extra for chips & salsa, and even then you only get a tiny bowl of chips.  I could get the same delicious sauce by ordering the fajitas at El Toreador in West Portal.  Otherwise, I'll stick to the authentic taquerias for my burrito fix--soyrizo or no.

excerpts: I ordered the soyrizo tacos and it tasted like the cook had forgotten to remove the plastic casing (literally super chemically plastic taste).
After that i have been weary of going back.
soyrizo.author: Greg M.
soyrizo.review: Everybody thinks I am crazy that i don't like paplote's.  I am a meat eater - but am fond of fake meat as well.  I ordered the soyrizo tacos and it tasted like the cook had forgotten to remove the plastic casing (literally super chemically plastic taste).  After that i have been weary of going back.

excerpts: the soyrizo tacos are pretty good, but the amount of guacamole and chips you get for the money is just pathetic.
it is fairly cheap and fairly healthy, but that's no excuse.
you won't find me waiting in line for this crap.
*a year later
and they still get balls.
yellow sweaty ones.
i tried them again the other night.
jeesus.
soyrizo.author: schitzen h.
soyrizo.review:
i went there for the first time with my lady carrying heavy bags of books. while she was ordering, i went to one of the many empty tables and put my stuff down and the "waiter" came over to tell me that "i must" wait until i order to sit down while at the same time the cashier was telling my girlfriend the same thing. this happens every time we go there, which has made us not want to go there. the burritos kind of suck. the soyrizo tacos are pretty good, but the amount of guacamole and chips you get for the money is just pathetic. it is fairly cheap and fairly healthy, but that's no excuse. 
you won't find me waiting in line for this crap.
*a year later and they still get balls. yellow sweaty ones. i tried them again the other night. jeesus.

excerpts: Soyrizo burrito...
nuff said
soyrizo.author: Lindsay F.
soyrizo.review: Um, hello?!  Soyrizo burrito... nuff said

excerpts: You wish it weren't quite so clean-cut but are pleased with the crisp fresh vegetables and zesty mole, you feel a little ridiculous for eating soyrizo
but then you remember that soyrizo is really nice and treats you well, you sort of feel bad for not going for Benicio Del Toro/La Tacqueria down the street
and you know you like Benicio better
but there's something both annoying and comforting about Toby.
The horchata ladle will always be sparkling like his semi-bovine smile
and you'll get what you expect.
All I know is that I dream of soyrizo quesadillas, and if that makes me a frippie then I can stand that for an hour or so.
soyrizo.author: Tory S.
soyrizo.review: If Papalote were a celebrity, it might be Tobey Maguire.  You sort of hate it for not being something else and then grudgingly appreciate it for always being just what it is and nothing more.  You wish it weren't quite so clean-cut but are pleased with the crisp fresh vegetables and zesty mole, you feel a little ridiculous for eating soyrizo but then you remember that soyrizo is really nice and treats you well, you sort of feel bad for not going for Benicio Del Toro/La Tacqueria down the street and you know you like Benicio better but there's something both annoying and comforting about Toby.  The horchata ladle will always be sparkling like his semi-bovine smile and you'll get what you expect.  All I know is that I dream of soyrizo quesadillas, and if that makes me a frippie then I can stand that for an hour or so.

excerpts: Usually you might get a rice and beans, but at papalote you can get two kinds of grilled veges, soyrizo, tofu con achiote and tofu mole.
Amazing.
Everything is incredibly fresh and grilled to order - no vats of food cooked hours ago here.
Salsa is amazing, i could drink it i think.
you just can't go wrong - not a typical burrito, go to another one of the millions of burrito joints in the mission for that - but a damn good burrito...
soyrizo.author: amy b.
soyrizo.review: This is the best burrito, especially for thoseof us that don't eat meat.  Usually you might get a rice and beans, but at papalote you can get two kinds of grilled veges, soyrizo, tofu con achiote and tofu mole.  Amazing.  Everything is incredibly fresh and grilled to order - no vats of food cooked hours ago here.  Salsa is amazing, i could drink it i think.  you just can't go wrong - not a typical burrito, go to another one of the millions of burrito joints in the mission for that - but a damn good burrito...

excerpts: I liked the soyrizo veg burrito.
Parking is always a problem in the area (best to take bart to 24th) and be ready for long lines.
soyrizo.author: ITesh J.
soyrizo.review: This is one of my fav hole-in-wall Mexican place in the City.  I liked the soyrizo veg burrito.  Parking is always a problem in the area (best to take bart to 24th) and be ready for long lines. Free chips and salsa too.  Chips weren't that great but the salsa... Holy smokes...that was hot!

excerpts: Papalote is one of the few SF Mexican restaurants that offers customers the choice of substituting vegan/vegetarian options (soyrizo, marinated tofu) in their dishes.
The decor is punchy, the employees very friendly, and their tofu quesadilla is a light, delicious, and quick bite.
So why give the place only 3 stars?", one may ask.
Well, for me, Pokez in San Diego still sets the bar in the "Best Vegan Mexican Restaurant" division.
soyrizo.author: Momo R.
soyrizo.review: Papalote is one of the few SF Mexican restaurants that offers customers the choice of substituting vegan/vegetarian options (soyrizo, marinated tofu) in their dishes.  The decor is punchy, the employees very friendly, and their tofu quesadilla is a light, delicious, and quick bite.  "So why give the place only 3 stars?", one may ask.  Well, for me, Pokez in San Diego still sets the bar in the "Best Vegan Mexican Restaurant" division.

excerpts: Vegetarian mole, soyrizo, and the famous Papalote salsa.
soyrizo.author: kellan e.
soyrizo.review: Least authentic burrito in the Mission, but oh so good.  Vegetarian mole, soyrizo, and the famous Papalote salsa.

excerpts: My regulars are the soyrizo burrito and the tofu mole burrito.
The only downsides are (1) the soyrizo is super salty and makes me really freakin thirsty (2) they charge $1 for extra chips
soyrizo.author: Jennifer C.
soyrizo.review: Living a 1/2 block from Papalote is dangerous, very dangerous. I've got my intake down to about twice a week.  My regulars are the soyrizo burrito and the tofu mole burrito.  It's awesome to finally have a good Mexican restaurant with some veggie food other than the ole "vegetarian burrito".  And of course, the salsa is amazing. It's like velvet.  The only downsides are (1) the soyrizo is super salty and makes me really freakin thirsty (2) they charge $1 for extra chips (3) $.50 for extra salsa (4) the long lines (5) the front door doesn't close and its always freezing.  But other than that !!!  its pretty amazing.

excerpts: My soyrizo egg burrito and bf's carne asada burrito was just okay.
Expensive for the mediocrity.
We won't be back.
soyrizo.author: Presto G.
soyrizo.review: I don't understand the rave reviews. The roasted tomato salsa was good, although the 50 cent charge for extra was not appreciated. My soyrizo egg burrito and bf's carne asada burrito was just okay. Expensive for the mediocrity. We won't be back.

excerpts: Maybe it's the soyrizo burrito on the menu, or maybe it's because the people who rave about it are usually vegetarians or hipsters.
Those are two groups you generally can't trust in regards to good Mexican food.
And yeah,
I know,
I know
soyrizo.author: Daniella C.
soyrizo.review:
There's something really off about this place for me. Maybe it's the soyrizo burrito on the menu, or maybe it's because the people who rave about it are usually vegetarians or hipsters. Those are two groups you generally can't trust in regards to good Mexican food. And yeah, I know, I know I'm not first generation, Lily, but I'm fairly certain that authentic Mexican food does not include shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter. And where do they get off charging three dollars for a plain taco? Maybe I'm being harsh because I think seafood tacos are a waste of time and stomach space, but white wine? Oh, and they have tofu on the menu. I like tofu as much as the next gal, but man... And I've only seen the place packed with white people, the kind with dreads or people who look like they just got out of yoga class.
Ok, so here's where I give credit; the salsa was good. It was nice and spicy. The chile verde pork was very tender. There was Yucatan hot sauce, which is always a plus. And there was spiced up jicama served as the side, which was deliciously refreshing.
Basically, overrated white washed Mexican food, which is fine as long as you know what you're in for.

excerpts: The first time I went, I got a veggie potato burro thing with soyrizo.
This was amazing.
Period.
The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.
The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.
soyrizo.author: Nathan M.
soyrizo.review:
I visited San Francisco to run the marathon in August.  A friend from Phoenix had recommended that I swing by Papalote to get some assuredly delicious vegan mole.  I ended up going here twice, and forgoing some of the other places that were recommended to me.  In other words, the food was so good that I skipped out on seeing some places that I may not ever get a chance to see again.

The first time I went, I got a veggie potato burro thing with soyrizo.  This was amazing.  Period.  Super delicious.

The second time, I had the vegan mole burro with a side of guacamole.  The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.  I mean, it wasn't bad, but it didn't taste freshly prepared.

So, the food was delicious, but the store itself sucks.  It was packed out the door both times we went, preventing any possibility of actually sitting down to eat.  The first time we went, it was like 3pm on a Saturday, and the second time was abour 1pm on a Monday.  Weird times to be so completely busy.  It was really loud as well, and I could barely hear the server girl who was very frustrating to work with anyways.  She was just sort of rude, and kept turning around and joking with the grill guys while I was trying to order, then gave me attitude when I corrected her inaccurate record of my order.  I don't know, it just added stress to something that should be delicious and stress free (mexican food).  Oh, also, the bathroom is sort of gross, and they keep all of their produce in the common area where a thousand dirty hipsters assuredly wipe their gross hands all over my delicious cucumbers and tomatoes.  It HAS to be against some sort of health code to store produce in the area where people stand in line to order.  Right?  

So, four stars because the food was excellent.  Would have been five if the girl wasn't such a biatch, or if the place was like one square foot larger.

Go here, but get take out.

excerpts: My friends kept pushing the soyrizo burrito, but I wanted MEAT, real meat.
I got the pork verde burrito.
It was pretty awesome.
Salsa was great.
soyrizo.author: Suzanne P.
soyrizo.review: So, I was in town for a wedding and was on the hunt for the best burrito in the city. My host has lived in the area for years, and he said, Papalote, hands down. We went right around closing time, but they were happy to serve us. My friends kept pushing the soyrizo burrito, but I wanted MEAT, real meat. I got the pork verde burrito. It was pretty awesome. Salsa was great.

excerpts: Best taco joint for vegans in the city in my opinion: the tofu and soyrizo options are fantastic.
Avoid Papalote during the time when everyone gets off work, the queue can get very long.
soyrizo.author: Olivia G.
soyrizo.review: Best taco joint for vegans in the city in my opinion: the tofu and soyrizo options are fantastic.  Avoid Papalote during the time when everyone gets off work, the queue can get very long.

excerpts: That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo.
I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago.
That's how amazing the Chile Verde is.
It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh.
The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.
soyrizo.author: Lawrence S.
soyrizo.review:
I've always considered the burrito to be the perfect culinary invention: every food group delightfully wrapped in a tight, nutritional envelope. And even though Burritos and Tacos and Quesadillas don't really showcase the true sophistication of Mexican cuisine, sometimes you just want that massive hunk of goodness in your belly. That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo. I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago. That's how amazing the Chile Verde is. It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh. And unlike other "healthy" burrito options, like those found at Whole Foods, Papalote doesn't try to foist a dry tortilla sandwich off on you.

n.b. The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.

excerpts: And since I can't give up the delicious seasoning in the soyrizo burrito, I order the soyrizo with all veggies.
I get the best of both.
And no, I am not a vegetarian by any means...
I just don't do meat in my burritos.
It's one of my many food oddities.
I haven't tried anything else but the burritos, however, I know I don't need to to give them the 5 stars they deserve.
They are always friendly and quick with my orders (I order to-go with my co-workers just about every other Sunday) and they always get them right.
Their chips aren't greasy, like many other taqueria chips are, and although they don't have chunky salsa, their hot sauce is so delicious and has a great spice to it.
They have a different style to how they make their food: Their menu is not as typical as most taquerias.
It is very unique and special.
Oh, and one more thing....
they have refried black beans!
soyrizo.author: Amber Y.
soyrizo.review: I just absolutely love this place! Their burritos are so damn good, there are no words that can describe the ecstasy that my mouth goes through when I'm eating one. I started off getting their veggie burritos, which come with carrots, potatoes and mushrooms. I was a little indifferent about the thought of eating a burrito with carrots, but OMG!!! And since I can't give up the delicious seasoning in the soyrizo burrito, I order the soyrizo with all veggies. I get the best of both. And no, I am not a vegetarian by any means... I just don't do meat in my burritos. It's one of my many food oddities. I haven't tried anything else but the burritos, however, I know I don't need to to give them the 5 stars they deserve. They are always friendly and quick with my orders (I order to-go with my co-workers just about every other Sunday) and they always get them right. Their chips aren't greasy, like many other taqueria chips are, and although they don't have chunky salsa, their hot sauce is so delicious and has a great spice to it. They have a different style to how they make their food: Their menu is not as typical as most taquerias. It is very unique and special. Oh, and one more thing....they have refried black beans!

excerpts: Excellent soyrizo burrito.
soyrizo.author: Milk and Cheese ..
soyrizo.review: Excellent soyrizo burrito. I'd never had one till today, always opting for the basic rice and beans, instead. I was feeling celebratory since it's Chinese New Year, so I splurged and topped it all off with some guava soda. The salsa was tasty as ever, the burrito piping hot and so delectable. A bit salty however, but that's what the soda is for. The ingredients tasted very fresh, and the burrito was huge. I left very full. I deduct a star because the music in the dining area was just a bit too loud.

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito is awesome!
soyrizo.author: M K.
soyrizo.review: Back in the day when I worked at Buffalo Exchange I would go here about twice a month. It's a favorite for two reasons- non greasy mex and great vegetarian menu. The soyrizo burrito is awesome! And tofu mole tacos are decent. I recommend the prawn burrito as well from when I was a carnivore. Nacho experiences here vary: I have had burned chips a few times. Also They must put crack in the salsa cuz I crave it baaaddd!! and the guac is good too. Always a line out the door so it helps to call ahead and they have great photography on the walls. Good for family, date, take out, and hangovers.

excerpts: On the downside: I think they put waaay too much soyrizo in my burrito -it has a really strong flavor and can easily overpower the veggies/beans/salsa/tortilla/etc.
Next time I go
I'm going to ask them to keep the soyrizo to a minimum and put in more beans/other veggies.
I really like that salsa too, and fresh tortilla chip service, damn good! = )
I'm going to ask them to keep the soyrizo to a minimum and put in more beans/other veggies.
I really like that salsa too, and fresh tortilla chip service, damn good! = )
soyrizo.author: Michael C.
soyrizo.review: Went there for the first time today, and I'm sure I'll be back!  Good prices, and lots of vegan options.  On the downside: I think they put waaay too much soyrizo in my burrito -it has a really strong flavor and can easily overpower the veggies/beans/salsa/tortilla/etc.  Next time I go I'm going to ask them to keep the soyrizo to a minimum and put in more beans/other veggies.  I really like that salsa too, and fresh tortilla chip service, damn good! = )

excerpts: I cant stop thinking about the SOYRIZO!
My favorite place for mexican.
Not authentic...but I am still in love.
soyrizo.author: Rosie M.
soyrizo.review: A vegetarian's dream. I cant stop thinking about the SOYRIZO! My favorite place for mexican. Not authentic...but I am still in love.

excerpts: the menu offers a great range of options, such as tofu and soyrizo, as well as quality ingredients.
also, try the refried black beans!
soyrizo.author: Lauren K.
soyrizo.review:
I would come here strictly for the salsa, but, the burritos are also super delicious! 
I can't pin down exactly what makes the salsa so addictive, but we've definitely bought mason jars of stuff to bring back to san diego. 
the menu offers a great range of options, such as tofu and soyrizo, as well as quality ingredients. also, try the refried black beans!

excerpts: I enjoy the vegetarian options (tofu, soyrizo, mixed veggies) and I do find myself craving their salsa.
soyrizo.author: Kerry D.
soyrizo.review: Definitely one of my top 3 favorite burrito joints.  I enjoy the vegetarian options (tofu, soyrizo, mixed veggies) and I do find myself craving their salsa.  I've also tried their steak and chicken options and I'm subtracting a star for just a little something missing....not sure what it is....but I find their food lacks that extra flavor that makes it "out of this world."   And the fact that they cheap you on the salsa.  A shot-glass of salsa for multiple people and a $1 for a refill does NOT suffice.

excerpts: What I love is that you can get delicious soyrizo tacos with amazing vegan salsa for cheap.
soyrizo.author: Sara W.
soyrizo.review: I use to live right next to Papalotes and come 2+ times per week. What I love is that you can get delicious soyrizo tacos with amazing vegan salsa for cheap. While I agree that some of their dishes are "drier" than other neighboring spots, in my opinion it's because this is one of few places that doesn't coat your food in sloppy sour cream and too much cheese. I love this place!

excerpts: They have a veggie SoyRIZO burrito that is too good for words.
soyrizo.author: Matthew T.
soyrizo.review: This place is simply great!  Awesome veggie burritos.  They have a veggie SoyRIZO burrito that is too good for words.  They serve chicken that is grilled to perfection and among the best quality I could have hoped for.  The kicker here is the homemade salsa.  I know you're thinking Salsa?!  But, this is special and you have to try it to know how awesome it is.  They do charge a little more than your normal burrito shack.  But, it is worth every penny.  It is too bad that they do not deliver.  Other than the wait to order this place has no down sides.

excerpts: I tried the marinated soy and soyrizo burritos- both good, neither memorable.
The ingredients are fresh, the service is solid.
It's not your traditional taqueria where they make it in front of you, but it's good nonetheless.
Take your veg friends here...
soyrizo.author: Rohit G.
soyrizo.review: I tried the marinated soy and soyrizo burritos- both good, neither memorable.  The ingredients are fresh, the service is solid.  It's not your traditional taqueria where they make it in front of you, but it's good nonetheless.  Take your veg friends here...

excerpts: All I can say is I love the Soyrizo burrito $5.15.
My GF and I usually split it.
+ their salsa is the bomb.
My only wish is that it'd come with 2 salsas instead of one.
Also the service tends to suck.
soyrizo.author: Julie V.
soyrizo.review: All I can say is I love the Soyrizo burrito $5.15.  My GF and I usually split it.  + their salsa is the bomb.  My only wish is that it'd come with 2 salsas instead of one.  Also the service tends to suck.

excerpts: It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options.
It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for -
it's spicy and creamy and complex
-- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice.
The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried.
I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.
soyrizo.author: Jennifer C.
soyrizo.review: Papalote is my local burrito joint. It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options. It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for - it's spicy and creamy and complex -- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice. The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried. I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.

excerpts: I'm so NOT a vegetarian; but I'm  addicted to their soyrizo burritos.!
Their food is really  filling but doesn't give you that comatose, must-lie-down-and-do -nothing -but
-digest
feeling that other burrito places do.
Yes, the service can be slow- they are not spooning it up from a steam table!
We always call ahead-
I think they know our number now; the food is always ready.
I think I need to buy their salsa by the jar...
soyrizo.author: Linda F.
soyrizo.review: I'm so NOT a vegetarian; but I'm  addicted to their soyrizo burritos.! Their food is really  filling but doesn't give you that comatose, must-lie-down-and-do -nothing -but -digest feeling that other burrito places do. Yes, the service can be slow- they are not spooning it up from a steam table! We always call ahead- I think they know our number now; the food is always ready. I think I need to buy their salsa by the jar...

excerpts: If you have a strong stomach you should try the soyrizo burrito, it's pretty good.
I have foresaken that one, gave me gas.
soyrizo.author: Gina R.
soyrizo.review: It's really good and healthy, but lately the tortillas for the tacos are falling apart as you eat them, so if I could give this 3 and a half stars, I would. In the past, the tacos were SO GOOD with the delicious lettuce and super tasty and not too spicy salsa. Nachos are delish as well. Burritos are good too. If you have a strong stomach you should try the soyrizo burrito, it's pretty good. I have foresaken that one, gave me gas. Their prawn tacos used to be two big prawns but now it's little shrimps...they should really bring back the prawns, they are so damn good. Also 2 tacos for under $5 is a pretty good deal considering how gentrified Valencia Street has become.

excerpts: One word: Soyrizo.
The burritos here are amazing, which is hard to find being a vegetrian.
Get the Soyrizo burrito with the whole wheat tortilla and make sure to ask for extra of that orange looking salsa they give you with your chips-- so good!
soyrizo.author: Ashe M.
soyrizo.review: One word: Soyrizo. The burritos here are amazing, which is hard to find being a vegetrian. Get the Soyrizo burrito with the whole wheat tortilla and make sure to ask for extra of that orange looking salsa they give you with your chips-- so good!
