excerpts: soyrizo everything, tofu everything, papas everything.
it all is delicious and well priced!

the salsa [which comes to you while you wait with a side of chips] is absolutely amazing; spicy, smooth, orange. in a neighborhood where the norm is meat, meat, meat and mystery lipids and fried beans, this is a healthy, refreshing alternative.
soyrizo.author: Rachel W.
soyrizo.review:
yummo. a haven for vegetarians [who aren't afraid of the gluten!] soyrizo everything, tofu everything, papas everything. it all is delicious and well priced! the salsa [which comes to you while you wait with a side of chips] is absolutely amazing; spicy, smooth, orange. in a neighborhood where the norm is meat, meat, meat and mystery lipids and fried beans, this is a healthy, refreshing alternative. good in or to-go.

busy all the time and waiting room is at a premium, so I say order ahead!

excerpts: so anyways my gf got soyrizo tacos
and they were ok,
but she actually makes a better one than they do.
soyrizo.author: James J.
soyrizo.review:
not too sure if this place is as cracked up as people say it is. BUT i think i didn't order the right things though. it was my first time here on Sunday and my expectations were high - considering all of my friends rave about this place. first of all, i didn't know their burritos came with no cheese. however, that was probably more my fault considering i was a little slow and hungover to really read the fine print and ask any questions. anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito. bad move on my part. the burrito was dry and had no flavour. to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go? i was very confused - considering i JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant. so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream. REALLY? 

so anyways my gf got soyrizo tacos and they were ok, but she actually makes a better one than they do. i enjoyed the "complimentary" side of chips and salsa, but i agree with some other reviewers on here, why are you so stingy on the salsa? if i go back and ask for more, are you gonna charge me $2? the salsa isn't your typical chunky tomato-wee cilantro type - it's more like a tomato-wee creamy kind. not much zip to it, but still good.

anyways, i'm thinking i didn't order the right thing from here because my friends seem to know good food. i'm thinking i need to quit being a pussy and order a burrito with meat in it - most probably carnitas! mmm ...

excerpts: Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good.
They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro.
Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes.
I gave them 4 out of 5.
soyrizo.author: Miguel V.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote- 
The chips are just ok, the salsa is very good. The salsa has a nice flavor, fluidity and color. You can pour it over anything! Oh yeah, it's served in little black containers opposed to the clear Solo cup every other Taqueira uses; it added a little piazzas. We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom. Very good, I give it 4 out of 5. Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff. Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos....... Absolutely awesome! One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time. The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste. Excellent blend! I'd go back just for this dish. Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5. These guys set the bar on tofu. Tacos Mole with Chicken.....You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt. The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy. I gave them 2 out of 5. Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good. They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro. Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes. I gave them 4 out of 5. Friend had a carne asada burrito.......Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt. Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about. I gave the burrito 3 out of 5. 
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait. It was an order as you pay type place. I really like the grates they use on their grills opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses. The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!

excerpts: soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla.
soyrizo.author: mark c.
soyrizo.review:
frreeessssshhhhh. thats the version here. remixed with health conscious ingredients. no LARD. vegan friendly. 

nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn. what!), food with integrity. fresh fresas and horchata made daily.

the salsa. if you know, then i need not go any further.
if you dont, well, thats your fault. 

soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla. 
i mean c'mon, can you say that about another burrito joint? 

the staff is friendly, fast, and efficient.

party flyers, community events, and awards plaster the walls and counter, i mean does your burrito joint have a write up in the 
WALL ST JOURNAL? 
didnt think so.

but hey, dont take my word for it. peep game yo.
you wont be sad, unless the grease, lard, and oil is your thing.

excerpts: The atmosphere is cheery and cozy, and you can get Orangina with your delicious soyrizo tacos, which is a special combo for a mission taqueria.
The table service is usually very quick and friendly, although the folks at the counter can be a little testy.
One of my favorites.
soyrizo.author: Teresa F.
soyrizo.review: The salsa at Papalote will knock your socks off!  Yum...  The atmosphere is cheery and cozy, and you can get Orangina with your delicious soyrizo tacos, which is a special combo for a mission taqueria.  The table service is usually very quick and friendly, although the folks at the counter can be a little testy.  One of my favorites.

excerpts: They also have some other intriguing options like soyrizo, so make sure you schedule multiple visits.
soyrizo.author: Aamir V.
soyrizo.review:
Papalote is the be-all, end-all of burritos in the Mission.  Fresh?  You bet.  Tasty?  Of course.  Salsa worthy of a pligrimage?  Absolutely.

You cannot go wrong with the plain old rice and bean burrito, but if you can have meat the chicken and carne asada burritos should be your choice.  They also have some other intriguing options like soyrizo, so make sure you schedule multiple visits.

The nachos are mediocre - pass on those.

I hate that they ration the salsa, but it's understandable.  That stuff is truly amazing.

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good.
soyrizo.author: Willy c.
soyrizo.review: This place is pretty damn good.  The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good. The shrimp isn't as good as La Corneta, but this is a great place for burrito diversity if you're sick of the same old ricy overstuff in the mission. It 's also nice when you don't feel like falling into the mexi-coma before you even get home  (aka reasonable portions)...

excerpts: soyrizo heaven and inventive veggie burritos.
love and love.
many of the mission style burrito places leave the veggie option bland and basic.
soyrizo.author: Liz S.
soyrizo.review: soyrizo heaven and inventive veggie burritos. love and love. many of the mission style burrito places leave the veggie option bland and basic. this place takes it up a notch and keeps the spice right for the veggies!

excerpts: oh it had to be love, discovering your vegan beans, addictive salsa and mole with tofu and that glorious soyrizo.
Then there was my year long boycott because of
"Blondie," who on more than one occasion hung up on me, yelled at me and just gave off a generally sour and bummed out vibe that I don't really want in my life.
But, apparently, after months of visits again, Blondie is gone and there is nothing but warm love and yumminess in my belly.

But I feel that it's a bittersweet reunion, you see, a reunion that reminds me of some of my less ruling characteristics--I've reached this new plateau in the banal and repetitive exercise that is my existence on this planet.
I walk in to Papa Lote, and the nice shorter girl smiles, says "Super Soyrizo?
I nod, and my food arrives a couple minutes later.
This means I'm probably mere weeks, maybe days, from going in and reaching the ultimate and ultimately revealing plateau--walking in and asking for, gulp, "The Usual."
Due to my work schedule, I've reached this plateau at Love N Haight, and this
, I'm fine with.
But, alas, with Papa Lote, it's just sheer and utter laziness.
I mean, with food this good two blocks from your house, how often would you cook?
soyrizo.author: Ben V.
soyrizo.review: Oh Papa Lote, the times we've shared.  "Yuppie Burrito" and I have had our ups and downs.  It was love, oh it had to be love, discovering your vegan beans, addictive salsa and mole with tofu and that glorious soyrizo.  Then there was my year long boycott because of "Blondie," who on more than one occasion hung up on me, yelled at me and just gave off a generally sour and bummed out vibe that I don't really want in my life.  But, apparently, after months of visits again, Blondie is gone and there is nothing but warm love and yumminess in my belly.  But I feel that it's a bittersweet reunion, you see, a reunion that reminds me of some of my less ruling characteristics--I've reached this new plateau in the banal and repetitive exercise that is my existence on this planet.  I walk in to Papa Lote, and the nice shorter girl smiles, says "Super Soyrizo?" I nod, and my food arrives a couple minutes later.  This means I'm probably mere weeks, maybe days, from going in and reaching the ultimate and ultimately revealing plateau--walking in and asking for, gulp, "The Usual."  Due to my work schedule, I've reached this plateau at Love N Haight, and this, I'm fine with.  But, alas, with Papa Lote, it's just sheer and utter laziness.  I mean, with food this good two blocks from your house, how often would you cook?

excerpts: Tasty vegan options (including a Soyrizo burrito and grilled veg burrito) and fantastic housemade salsa!
soyrizo.author: D. B.
soyrizo.review: Tasty vegan options (including a Soyrizo burrito and grilled veg burrito) and fantastic housemade salsa!

excerpts: while i was blissfully enjoying my soyrizo, guacamole and tofu mole burrito
, i blurted out, "five stars" in between moans of pleasure.
a friend i was with asked me, "are you always such a positive yelp reviewer?
to which i laughed because i've had a few people comment on my superfluous 1 and 2 star reviews (which, i think, is not a reflection of my own negativity but a product of south orange county living).
the salsa was AMAZING!
and creamy and delicious.
even the pickled jicama spiced with chile was delicious.
the prices are even decent and if i hadn't decided to fix it up so much it would have been under $5.
of course, with all my fixin's it ended up being $8.
still not terrible for a big burrito with plenty of heart and soul.
i was full enough to be happy the entire hour and a half
that bryan
and i spent walking around the mission looking for our lost car.

excerpts: I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.
soyrizo.author: Jessica T.
soyrizo.review: Papalote, I really do love you.  I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.  Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie, how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?  Yuck.  The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.  My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.  Thank you very much.

excerpts: you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter.
i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something.
it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.
soyrizo.author: Angi C.
soyrizo.review: located on the noe/mission border, this taqueria is definitely fancier than the others on 24th. you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter. i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something. it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.

excerpts: they also have soyrizo which is awesome in a quesodilla
, probably my favorite burritos in the mission, i wish they were closer to our house

the tables are a little awkwardly packed in, and the line sometimes snakes out the door, perhaps they could expand to 16th....

soyrizo.review: i could just go to eat the salsa, which is amazing.  they also have soyrizo which is awesome in a quesodilla, probably my favorite burritos in the mission, i wish they were closer to our house they they are. the tables are a little awkwardly packed in, and the line sometimes snakes out the door, perhaps they could expand to 16th....

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
soyrizo.author: Cindy L.
soyrizo.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: great vegetarian options- not only tofu but soyrizo too; the nachos were delish.
i kind of drive out of my way (all the way from glen park)  to this placewhen
i'm craving good quick mexican food, if that tells you anything.
soyrizo.author: ms.kiki g.
soyrizo.review: great vegetarian options- not only tofu but soyrizo too; the nachos were delish. i kind of drive out of my way (all the way from glen park)  to this placewhen i'm craving good quick mexican food, if that tells you anything.

excerpts: Papalote's vegan soyrizo burrito made my March.
I had it with black beans on spinach tortilla, and man
oh man, what a treat.
Their housemade salsa is ticker than tick, and their tortilla chips are really awesome too.
Everything seems to be reasonably priced - my burrito was $5.75, and worth every finger-lickin' cent.
soyrizo.author: Sophie K.
soyrizo.review: Oh frabjous day! Papalote's vegan soyrizo burrito made my March. I had it with black beans on spinach tortilla, and man oh man, what a treat. Their housemade salsa is ticker than tick, and their tortilla chips are really awesome too. Everything seems to be reasonably priced - my burrito was $5.75, and worth every finger-lickin' cent.

excerpts: i am in love with the soyrizo at papalote.
whether in a burrito or taco, it's amazingly delicious.
their salsa is also divine, but they don't give you enough.
the best part about this place is that you don't feel overly fully after finishing a meal.
soyrizo.author: selma s.
soyrizo.review: i am in love with the soyrizo at papalote. whether in a burrito or taco, it's amazingly delicious. their salsa is also divine, but they don't give you enough. the best part about this place is that you don't feel overly fully after finishing a meal.

excerpts: Veggie taco and soyrizo taco.
The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small.
Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.
The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small.
Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.
soyrizo.author: Sarah J.
soyrizo.review: Veggie taco and soyrizo taco. Chips and salsa. The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small. Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.

excerpts: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo.

The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city.
soyrizo.author: Eugene P.
soyrizo.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts: Got the Tofu Mole.
mole.author: Chris W.
mole.review: These guys recently added the Healthy SF tax to app their orders and increased their prices. Compared to their competition El Farolito, which is a block from this place, their burritos are overpriced and underwhelming in taste. Got the Tofu Mole.

excerpts: I always get the chicken mole burrito, with Spanish rice, and a spinach tortilla.
You can pick the rice, beans and tortilla.
Plus you get some of their amazing salsa (also available at Whole Foods) with the chips.
My friends liked the grilled chicken burrito as well with the sour cream, guacamole etc.
We often get the guacamole and chips, although we never finish.
mole.author: Vivian W.
mole.review: I love this place.  I always get the chicken mole burrito, with Spanish rice, and a spinach tortilla.  You can pick the rice, beans and tortilla.  Plus you get some of their amazing salsa (also available at Whole Foods) with the chips.  My friends liked the grilled chicken burrito as well with the sour cream, guacamole etc.  We often get the guacamole and chips, although we never finish.

excerpts: Had a vegan friend with me who was aware of their vegan mole, which he had read on line.
Free chips and mole arrived at table, the mole was the best part of the dinner!
If I were just there for the mole, then 4 stars.
Burritos arrived, nothing on the side, everything wrapped up.
The flavor was decent, ingredients fresh....but the price $14+ did not seem justified for what I got.
mole.author: Don K.
mole.review:
Was driving around the mission last night trying to find a place to park, intending on going somewhere completely different. Rounded the corner on 24th and Papalote caught my eye. Parked a few blocks away (lucky at that!) and walked back down to restaurant. Had a vegan friend with me who was aware of their vegan mole, which he had read on line. 

Walked inside, smaller place with some family style seating on one side and a few single tables along walls. Very colorful and fun vibe, loved the large dragonflies suspended from ceiling. Waited in line for a bit and ordered at the counter. My friend ordered their veggie burrito, I ordered a chicken burrito. Was asked if I wanted guacamole and sour cream and I said sure, thinking I'd have a t least a scoop of each. 

Free chips and mole arrived at table, the mole was the best part of the dinner! If I were just there for the mole, then 4 stars. Burritos arrived, nothing on the side, everything wrapped up. The flavor was decent, ingredients fresh....but the price $14+ did not seem justified for what I got. Barely any chicken inside and the amount of guacamole and sour cream I paid the extra $1.99 for seemed like a rip off. 

In short, I feel good food but way overpriced. Would I go back again? No, sadly not.

excerpts: We got the chicken mole and a chicken verde and the house salsa and chips.
If they had a liquor license it would be the best place ever for a Mexican dinner night!!
That being said, it was a perfect first lunch in San Francisco.
The salsa is puréed and creamy like a mole and absolutely delicious!
That was my favorite part of the meal.
Nice kick of spice but not too spicy that you can't eat it all
The food was all very fresh and I liked the mole but could have used a little spicy kick
(I added hot sauce).
I wasn't as keen on the verse sauce
but it was all still good and
that salsa is just awesome.
mole.author: Heather B.
mole.review:
3.5 stars. This was our first meal in San Francisco during this most recent trip. My fiancé and I each ordered a taco order since you get 2 of the same and we wanted to mix and match. We got the chicken mole and a chicken verde and the house salsa and chips. If they had a liquor license it would be the best place ever for a Mexican dinner night!! That being said, it was a perfect first lunch in San Francisco. The salsa is puréed and creamy like a mole and absolutely delicious! That was my favorite part of the meal. Nice kick of spice but not too spicy that you can't eat it all 
The food was all very fresh and I liked the mole but could have used a little spicy kick (I added hot sauce). I wasn't as keen on the verse sauce but it was all still good and that salsa is just awesome.

excerpts: The mole and salsa here are sooooo good!
She told me they're like crack (aka super addictive), and she was right.
I now always get a little extra to take home with me.
mole.author: Kavita P.
mole.review:
I've come here a few times after my friend insisted we go here over La Taqueria. Typically recommending anything over La Taquiera is blasphemy in my eyes, but I trusted her, and I'm so glad I did. 

The mole and salsa here are sooooo good! She told me they're like crack (aka super addictive), and she was right. I now always get a little extra to take home with me. (FYI, if you sit there and get food they have take away containers and they have the little containers for sauce.) 

The people working there are super friendly and patient when you're not sure what to do with their menu (which I appreciate). So far, I've gotten the veggie burrito and the quesadilla and have no complaints about either. Both are pretty big and easily last me 1.5 - 2 meals. 

Given that this place is pretty affordable and they have much better seating options than La Taqueria, I come here whenever I want to sit and eat somewhere (and generally deal with a shorter line, since they're off the main Mission streets). 

Definitely recommend this place. It will not disappoint.

excerpts: The mole is a must try!
Take a salsa to-go as a nice souvenir!
mole.author: Karlos G.
mole.review: As expected, fire tacos with fire salsa. They are authentically making basic Mexican food with intricate flavors. As a dis hard taco connoisseur I give this place a whopping five stars for their originality and flare. The mole is a must try! Take a salsa to-go as a nice souvenir!

excerpts: They have veggie mole.
mole.author: Joey M.
mole.review:
My #1 taqueria in mission, which by extension means #1 taqueria in USA and world. 

They have veggie mole. Excellent.

Pro tip is to buy a jar of their awesome salsa to take home.

excerpts: The chicken mole is to die for, along with the salsa they bring out in the beginning.
Not to mention that the burritos are as big as my forearm.
This is one of the pricier taquerias in the mission, but still i the 10-17 dollar range.
Definitely recommend checking Papalote out, and getting the chicken mole if that is your thing!
Definitely recommend checking Papalote out, and getting the chicken mole if that is your thing!
mole.author: Ross S.
mole.review: With so many great Mexican restaurants in the mission, which do you choose?! Papa life is a solid choice, with a few standout items on the menu. The chicken mole is to die for, along with the salsa they bring out in the beginning. Not to mention that the burritos are as big as my forearm. This is one of the pricier taquerias in the mission, but still i the 10-17 dollar range. Definitely recommend checking Papalote out, and getting the chicken mole if that is your thing!

excerpts: One of my girls swears by two menu items: the mole and the chile verde.
I've tried both, and
I'm a much bigger fan of the CHILE VERDE because the pork makes my taste buds dance a happy dance.
I get it as a salad to cut down on carbs and because the jicama and fresh salsa pair so well with the salty pork and the awesome green serrano sauce, which I drizzle errywhere.
mole.author: Adele F.
mole.review:
Holy. Guacamole. Papalote now has a "buy 10 burritos get 1 free" frequent rewards card.

This is new! As of a few weeks ago! I could have gotten so many free burritos by now!

Aside from free burritos, what makes this place great?

1) Convenient. I live a block from this location. And when my friends and I are feeling like lazy bums...sorry, since we ARE lazy bums, we call in bulk to-go orders, wait 15 minutes, and send over volunteer tributes to pick up our stash.

2) Quality. Their meat is GOOD. Tender. Moist. And they are so generous. One of my girls swears by two menu items: the mole and the chile verde. I've tried both, and I'm a much bigger fan of the CHILE VERDE because the pork makes my taste buds dance a happy dance. I get it as a salad to cut down on carbs and because the jicama and fresh salsa pair so well with the salty pork and the awesome green serrano sauce, which I drizzle errywhere. I've also tried their carne asada burrito and breakfast burrito, both of which are bomb. Oh, when they say scrambled eggs, they really mean pulverized eggs--it's pretty awesome.

3) Customizable. Tacos, burritos, naked burritos, quesadillas, salads--meat/tofu vehicles of all types. Last I checked, their "make it super" option, which adds sour cream, cheese, and guacamole was only $1. Seems like the prices now are more expensive per online source?

4) Crack sauce. When I first tried it, I wasn't a big fan because it's spicy. It's still spicy, but I've learned to better ignore my screaming pain receptors. There's something about eating crunchy tortilla chips with a creamy sauce that makes everything taste way better. I love this combination so much that I always save my leftover chips and sauce for future snacking. I even save my friends' leftover chips and sauce. My boyfriend thinks I'm crazy, squirreling away all of those mini sauce containers in our fridge. I think I'm GENIUS. They sell jars of this stuff, and I'm getting it FO' FREE.

5) REWARDS CARD. This perk deserves to be repeated. FYI: valid for burrito purchases only.

Downside: seating. It looks like a seat-yourself situation, but one of the waitstaff will usually be around the dining room entrance to keep an eye out for tables. The room holds about 20 people, so you might have to wait for a bit during rush hours.

But srsly, Papalote is dope-alote. Time to reap some free burritos.

excerpts: The mole entree is tasty also, but go with dat burrito first.
mole.author: Joanna L.
mole.review:
That SALSA. Let me drink it by the jar. Addictive. Buy in the store or order here- http://papalotesalsa.com/

The Mexipino burrito is good! Some garlic rice in that tortilla, mmm... The mole entree is tasty also, but go with dat burrito first. 

Inefficient service and long wait times (both for waiting in line to order and waiting for food to come). Only one person taking orders at the counter, and she's taking phone orders as well. Should be at least two people doing this task. So, order your food by phone and pick it up. A staff member is good at delegating table seating for those who ordered first. I dig that authoritative nature- people gotta sit to eat.

excerpts: I had the chicken mole burrito and lord was it succulent.
Held me the rest of the day and clearly delayed how quickly the post-work wine bar outing landed on me.
I'd go again :)
mole.author: Anne G.
mole.review:
So, I went here today with a friend.  Turned out it's like her hands-down favorite place.  Ordered catering for them for her wedding rehearsal.  Had her husband pick up burritos for her each time she'd delivered a baby (3x).  Begged him to take her here before they went to see Hamilton.  My friend's name is Kegan and I told her she should post a review!!!

I had the chicken mole burrito and lord was it succulent.  Held me the rest of the day and clearly delayed how quickly the post-work wine bar outing landed on me.  I'd go again :)

excerpts: I had the chicken mole tacos and my friend had a bean and rice burrito and they both were great.
They also had this insane sauce to eat with the nacho chips they give out for free and it was the most amazing sauce I've had.
I'd buy it in a bottle if I could.
Definitely a must try!
mole.author: Raksha M.
mole.review: We didn't know what to expect coming in, and we're blown away by how good the food was. It's not the cheapest on mission, but it's just so damn good. I had the chicken mole tacos and my friend had a bean and rice burrito and they both were great. They also had this insane sauce to eat with the nacho chips they give out for free and it was the most amazing sauce I've had. I'd buy it in a bottle if I could. Definitely a must try!

excerpts: Vegan mole tofu salad bowl is incredible.
I orderit every time with avocado and am never disappointed.
The hicima on it is a great crunch that cuts through the spice.
Always leave with a fresh jar of salsa.
It never lasts a day on our house.
mole.author: Danielle P.
mole.review: Vegan mole tofu salad bowl is incredible. I orderit every time with avocado and am never disappointed. The hicima on it is a great crunch that cuts through the spice. Always leave with a fresh jar of salsa. It never lasts a day on our house.

excerpts: The dude next to me was eating the mole burrito and that will be my next item I try.
Parking can be a challenge and the seating area is tight during the lunch rush.
Be patient it is worth it.
mole.author: Manny G.
mole.review: The prawn burrito was excellent, I had every intention of eating half and taking home the remainder. Well let's just say that idea went out the window after the first bite. Did I forget to mention that I had Wolfed down more than my share of the delicious guacamole. My wife had the Carne asada burrito, it was good nothing to write home about. The dude next to me was eating the mole burrito and that will be my next item I try.  Parking can be a challenge and the seating area is tight during the lunch rush. Be patient it is worth it.

excerpts: Awesome,  mole is excellent.
Ever Salsa has great taste,  my preference is the Habanero.
mole.author: William M.
mole.review: Awesome,  mole is excellent. Ever Salsa has great taste,  my preference is the Habanero.

excerpts: Mole is excellent.
The tacos though... why?
mole.author: H K.
mole.review:
This place has to serve the worst tacos in San Francisco. Pretty much anywhere is better. 

As far as the burritos and the salsa, this place is great. Mole is excellent. The tacos though... why?

excerpts: (This review about food is only for Mole tofu burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.)

Bad:
- Mole was super salty!
(It was about 7 PM.
So it might be cooked down and concentrated?
(PLEASE TASTE IT FROM TIME
TO TIME!!!)
- Horchata was thin and waterly...
I should avoid mole next time.
mole.author: Mariko H.
mole.review:
I heard good things about Papalote Mexican Grill but I have a mixed feeling about it on my first visit... (This review about food is only for Mole tofu burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.)

Good:
- friendly stuff
- fast service
- reasonable price
- variety of choices for tortilla, beans, and ingredients
- tasty Papalote salsa that comes with chips! (I want to buy a bottle next time.)

Bad:
- Mole was super salty! (It was about 7 PM. So it might be cooked down and concentrated? (PLEASE TASTE IT FROM TIME TO TIME!!!)
- Horchata was thin and waterly... (Maybe it has been sitting there for a long time and diluted...?)

This place is extremely popular. People are constantly making a long line. It's supposed to be good. I should avoid mole next time.

excerpts: Try the tofu mole.
mole.author: Justin H.
mole.review: Best salsa in the city and killer veggie options. A little more $$ than your average taqueria in the mission, but this place is on another level. Try the tofu mole.

excerpts: Really like Mole burrito and seafood burrito.
mole.author: Yuhuan T.
mole.review:
I didn't know I can really enjoy burritos until I came here... Thank you Papalote! 

Really like Mole burrito and seafood burrito. Highly recommend to make it super if you love creamy burritos.

The portion is huge. Can never finish in a meal.

excerpts: My friend had the chicken mole burrito and thought it was really great, granted, it was her first time trying mole.
Only thing I didn't like was the Horchata.
Personally, it was too grainy for me and had some floral aftertaste
but maybe I'm not used to it?
Despite that, I'll definitely be returning here!
mole.author: Janelle S.
mole.review:
Came here for a quick fix of the sudden Mexican food cravings... Friendly service and the food was delicious! The place itself is pretty small so I could see it on peak time getting crowded but we came here on a Sunday evening for dinner and found a spot to sit with no problem-- not crowded but most tables were occupied. They offer ordering to go ahead of time so that's a good alternative if you don't want to stay or want to do pick up. 

I really enjoyed their salsa! It's unique, creamy and has a load of taste to it-- I ended up stuffing myself with chips and the salsa (comes with every order) to the point where I got too full to finish the carne asada burrito I ordered, which by the way, was good too. I got the smaller of the two burrito sizes but found it too be a hefty amount. My friend had the chicken mole burrito and thought it was really great, granted, it was her first time trying mole. Only thing I didn't like was the Horchata. Personally, it was too grainy for me and had some floral aftertaste but maybe I'm not used to it? Despite that, I'll definitely be returning here!

excerpts: My naked burrito with chicken mole - brown rice and super - was UNREAL.
And the portion was huge.
(SHARE!)
That salsa is amazing.
I'm older now.
I love the cleaner environment.
Worth the extra $.
mole.author: Andrew K.
mole.review: My naked burrito with chicken mole - brown rice and super - was UNREAL. And the portion was huge. (SHARE!) That salsa is amazing. I'm older now. I love the cleaner environment. Worth the extra $.

excerpts: My friend and I split the chicken mole burrito.
Meh.
Our kids got a cheese quesadilla ($5.15) and 4 chicken tacos ($19).
The chicken was nicely seasoned but the taco tortillas were kinda stiff.
mole.author: R A.
mole.review:
I was not impressed. At all. My friend and I split the chicken mole burrito. Meh. Our kids got a cheese quesadilla ($5.15) and 4 chicken tacos ($19). The chicken was nicely seasoned but the taco tortillas were kinda stiff. 

The guacamole was good but $9.75??   The service was excellent.

I would give the food 3 stars cuz it wasn't "bad" but the prices were too high for what you got, so I gave it 2 stars.

excerpts: My friend and I split a chili verde burrito and a mole burrito.
Both were phenomenal.
The mole burrito can only be described as a warm and a loving caress in my mouth; the chili verde was exciting and exquisitely spiced and danced on my taste buds.
Both were amazing in different ways.
The salsa that the chips came with was also amazing.
Bought a jar; taking it home and gonna eat it forever.
mole.author: Riva L.
mole.review:
Let me start off this review with the fact that I do not go for Mexican food. It's not necessarily that I don't like it, it's just that I basically crave everything else before I go for something South-of-the-Border. So, when visiting a friend in SF, she pretty much had to drag me here.

Papalote is now the only Mexican place I will willingly go to. I had the greatest burritos and salsa of my life. My friend and I split a chili verde burrito and a mole burrito. Both were phenomenal. The mole burrito can only be described as a warm and a loving caress in my mouth; the chili verde was exciting and exquisitely spiced and danced on my taste buds. Both were amazing in different ways.
 
The salsa that the chips came with was also amazing. Bought a jar; taking it home and gonna eat it forever.

excerpts: I had the super size buritto chicken mole the first time
and I had it again on this visit.
This is the best mole sauce I have ever had.
BAM!
Get it!!!
mole.author: Scott C.
mole.review: Second time here and both times the venue was selected by my dinner date as their respective favorite - so there is that. I am reasonably I had the super size buritto chicken mole the first time and I had it again on this visit. This is the best mole sauce I have ever had. BAM! Get it!!! Before digging into that bad boy, we shared a large chorizo con queso apetizer which comes with choice of hot tortilla or chips. If you use up the tortilla, they will give you chips - no losing there. On this visit, my date had the fish tacos and was thoroughly please with her selection as well. We will keep coming back. See ya!

excerpts: The Tofu mole is one of the best burritos in the city though so its worth it.
mole.author: Martin L.
mole.review:
The Burritos are great and they serve em up right. The chips are thick and lovely like they should be. The salsa is so good they bottle it, but you don't get to serve yourself so you've got to be sparing. And you drop a little more money than at most taquerias so its a little bit of a treat. 
The Tofu mole is one of the best burritos in the city though so its worth it.

excerpts: Got a mole burrito with guac and bottle of Modelo - $20.
Food quality was good 4/5, value 3/5
mole.author: Timur T.
mole.review: Got a mole burrito with guac and bottle of Modelo - $20. Food quality was good 4/5, value 3/5

excerpts: I  prefer tacos over burritos, and their mole tofu tacos are delicious, but the serving size I feel is a bit small (compared to a burrito), and it always leaves me hungry, but getting two servings would be too much.
If it was three instead of two tacos I think that would be better, but then I don't eat chips, and if I ate even half the tortilla chips they are generally provide I'd certainly be enough.
mole.author: Daniel C.
mole.review: The food here is fantastic, in substantial part due to the fantastic sauce, which can also be purchased separately for take-home.  It's extremely crowded, with a huge take-out business.  I  prefer tacos over burritos, and their mole tofu tacos are delicious, but the serving size I feel is a bit small (compared to a burrito), and it always leaves me hungry, but getting two servings would be too much.  If it was three instead of two tacos I think that would be better, but then I don't eat chips, and if I ate even half the tortilla chips they are generally provide I'd certainly be enough.

excerpts: I had the tofu mole burrito with refried black beans, wrapped in spinach tortilla and upgraded to super for just 99 cents!
That mole sauce was one of the best I've ever tried.
mole.author: Delani D.
mole.review:
Salsa!!!!! Oh my!!!! Soooooo good.

I was just watching on the travel channel the other day  a show about the best burritos in the country and Papalote was in it. I kept thinking about how bad I wanted to try their burritos. Well, it just so happen that we went up to the bay this weekend for my bf's DJ gigs and one of them was at the mission district. Since we were in the area, I couldn't pass up the chance. 

We got there around 8pm, an hour before closing time. It was nice to get free chips and salsa while waiting for our food. As I've already mentioned, the salsa is bomb!!! The chips, on the other hand, I didn't really care for. They were kinda stale. Then burritos came. I had the tofu mole burrito with refried black beans, wrapped in spinach tortilla and upgraded to super for just 99 cents! Super means they add sour cream, guacamole and cheese. I got mine without the sour cream. The burrito was delicious! That mole sauce was one of the best I've ever tried. Although, I wish I would've gotten whole black beans instead of refried because everything in my burrito was mushy. 

Burrito was devoured and I couldn't move for half an hour. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in SF.

excerpts: We were pretty excited to dig into the chicken mole (mine) and chicken asado burrito (the boyfriend's).
My boyfriend's burrito was pretty good, but my chicken mole was terrible.
I am not the type of girl that leaves food on the plate, but I felt the dish was pretty much inedible.
The rice was way under cooked -- totally raw in the middle.
My boyfriend's burrito was pretty good, but my chicken mole was terrible.
I am not the type of girl that leaves food on the plate, but I felt the dish was pretty much inedible.
The rice was way under cooked -- totally raw in the middle.
The chicken was overcooked -- stringy and tough.
The mole sauce didn't taste all that multi-dimensional or complex.
mole.author: Alice W.
mole.review:
My boyfriend's coworker raves about the place so we decided to give it a try when we were in the neighborhood. The place was pretty happening and the cashier girl was super sweet. We were pretty excited to dig into the chicken mole (mine) and chicken asado burrito (the boyfriend's). 

Unfortunately, the place really fell flat. My boyfriend's burrito was pretty good, but my chicken mole was terrible. I am not the type of girl that leaves food on the plate, but I felt the dish was pretty much inedible. The rice was way under cooked -- totally raw in the middle. The chicken was overcooked -- stringy and tough. The mole sauce didn't taste all that multi-dimensional or complex. I did, however, love the small bit of jicama salad on the plate. 

The burrito here is worth a try and the rice is probably not normally that terrible. I'm willing to give the place another try, but will definitely get the burrito and avoid any of the entree plates.

excerpts: That said, the chicken mole burrito was sensational.

Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken).
You don't even have to try!
Get the guac!

Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken).
You don't even have to try!
Get the guac!
mole.author: Tuwie N.
mole.review:
So, a classy burrito place is not an oxymoron! haha burritos here will set you a back a couple more bucks than your average mexican joint, but it is definitely delicious and worth it if you order right. That said, the chicken mole burrito was sensational. 
Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken). You don't even have to try! Get the guac! Get the cheese! 

The salsa that came with the chips (pretty sure it's free when you order, they just set it down on our table as we sat down after ordering) was unique and unlike any other salsa I've ever tasted. It looks and has the consistency of vodka sauce, but it is just the right amounts of creamy, spicy, tomato-y and tasty. amazing!

excerpts: Your tofu mole burrito is so hearty and delicious, but I'm afraid we must part ways for a little while.
This isn't necessarily break-up, but I need a little break.
That tofu mole burrito is the stuff dreams are made of.
Your salsa is fabulous, as is the guacamole.
Unfortunately, everything else that I've tried here just hasn't been that good.
mole.author: Brandi W.
mole.review:
Oh, Papalote. We've had some good times together. Your tofu mole burrito is so hearty and delicious, but I'm afraid we must part ways for a little while. This isn't necessarily break-up, but I need a little break. I think we should see other people. 

The service is spot-on, but the execution of the food has been very hit or miss lately. 

Maybe one day our paths will cross again. That tofu mole burrito is the stuff dreams are made of. Your salsa is fabulous, as is the guacamole. Unfortunately, everything else that I've tried here just hasn't been that good. I didn't care for the soyrizo. Maybe you were just having an off day?

No hard feelings. I wish you nothing but the best in your future endeavors.

excerpts: Went in today and ordered a salad with the tofu mole.
As a vegetarian, I get excited for veg mole dishes!
Well...I got mole, all right.
I really should've taken a picture, but suffice to say my salad was absolutely soupy with the sauce.
I could have drank the mole left in the old bowl.
But I didn't.
All I got was kickback, even as I pointed to my bowl of mole soup that the busser walked by with.
First, I was told what it was.
Like telling me it's mole explains the mess.
Then it was that nobody else had a problem with it.
Like it might not have been an accident/new guy dumping the sauce on?
I hate crappy service even more than I hate bland mole soup.
mole.author: Jessica F.
mole.review:
Maybe they're losing their touch? Went in today and ordered a salad with the tofu mole. As a vegetarian, I get excited for veg mole dishes! Well...I got mole, all right. I really should've taken a picture, but suffice to say my salad was absolutely soupy with the sauce. I had to ask for another bowl to fish out the salad, which was of course still drenched. I could have drank the mole left in the old bowl. But I didn't. Because it wasn't particularly flavorful, unfortunately.

Of course the cashier knew why I'd asked for the new bowl, but I figured I'd just say something after. I ate it because I didn't want to waste, but I thought it would be worth letting them know that someone had a bit of a heavy sauce hand. All I got was kickback, even as I pointed to my bowl of mole soup that the busser walked by with. First, I was told what it was. Like telling me it's mole explains the mess. Then it was that nobody else had a problem with it. Like it might not have been an accident/new guy dumping the sauce on? Like they'd pour that much sauce in a burrito-??!!

I hate crappy service even more than I hate bland mole soup.

excerpts: As for me: chicken (the mole version is very nicely seasoned; oftentimes the meat of a burrito is an afterthought.
mole.author: Johnny T.
mole.review:
Beyond being an incredibly fun name to say,* the fine folks at Papalote are churning out tasty fare that may not be 100% authentic but it's mighty tasty to gringo tongues throughout the Bay area. I ate my burrito whilst sitting on a couch and drinking wine. No, that's not their set up (although, it's a winning idea; give me some commission on it), I ate from (my friends' home). Take out is the way to avoid the crazy lines and unwashed masses.

You'll also need time to prepare for the order because there are many options available to you: meat, super or not, type of tortilla, beans... this ain't your average slop-it-together-burrito joint. As for me: chicken (the mole version is very nicely seasoned; oftentimes the meat of a burrito is an afterthought. Not here), of course, super (cheese and double guac, hold the sour cream), spinach tortilla, and refried black beans. First off, the burrito (super!) was huge. It took all my fatty power and a lot of time to finish it. Come here hungry. Secondly, it's all about the guac. Like I mentioned earlier, the meat tasted great alone but pair it up with that guacamole? Goodness gracious. Delicious. I could have eaten that guac with a spoon... and I did because we ordered sides of guac, chips and salsa. All were magically delicious. My spinach tortilla wasn't as pronounced in flavor as I expected/hoped for, but there was so much going on on my plate that it wasn't that big of a deal. In a city that hypes its burrito prowess, Papalote is legit. I'd, gladly, come here again. I just made myself hungry writing this review.

*You just said it, didn't you?

excerpts: Anyway, after reading yelp reviews I ordered the chicken mole burrito.
The chicken was in huge hunks, rather than being properly shredded, and was BONE DRY.
We're talking difficult to chew dry.
The mole was bland.
The chips were stale.
All of that said, the salsa was delicious.
I think from now on I'll limit my purchases to the jars of salsa they sell at the cash register.
mole.author: Becca F.
mole.review: I really wanted to love this place but was disappointed.  Personally, I think this place is overhyped.  I'm a carnitas fan, which is not an option here.  What kind of taqueria doesn't have carnitas?  Anyway, after reading yelp reviews I ordered the chicken mole burrito.  The chicken was in huge hunks, rather than being properly shredded, and was BONE DRY.  We're talking difficult to chew dry.  The mole was bland.  The chips were stale.  All of that said, the salsa was delicious.  I think from now on I'll limit my purchases to the jars of salsa they sell at the cash register.

excerpts: The mole is incredible.
mole.author: Lucy B.
mole.review:
I've been coming here for years and years and years and it's the best vegetarian burrito in the Bay Area. I'm certain of it. The mole is incredible. 

The space/ambiance leaves something to be desired... And I don't mean being fancy. The layout of the long tables just isn't all that great. 

What makes Papalote so exceptional, though, is its salsa. We buy it by the jar. I eat it with a spoon. This is why I'll always come back.

excerpts: (4.5) Came for a mole burrito, stayed for the salsa.
By far my favorite salsa in the Mission.
mole.author: Irina P.
mole.review: (4.5) Came for a mole burrito, stayed for the salsa. By far my favorite salsa in the Mission.

excerpts: We got a table right away and ordered marinated tofu tacos for me and mole chicken burrito for him.
mole.author: Q D.
mole.review:
Cute little place with good food. My boyfriend and I aren't locals so we were surprised at how packed everywhere in the Mission was on a Wednesday night. There was a line spilling onto the street when we first passed by so we looked for another place we heard about. That place was also full so we walked back up to Papalote and the line was basically gone. We got a table right away and ordered marinated tofu tacos for me and mole chicken burrito for him.

I liked my tacos even though they fell apart. The marinade was tasty so I definitely recommend anything with that but I think I would have enjoyed a burrito a little more. My boyfriend destroyed his burrito in no time, so I take it that it was delicious too. The salsa was awesome and I wish we bought some jars of it but we rushed out of there when another long line formed. I'm kind of sad that I'm back home already, cause I really would have liked to have tried their other stuff, as they are very vegetarian friendly and had more interesting flavors, unlike most Mexican places near me.

excerpts: When I ordered the Chicken Mole plate the cashier asked me if I wanted to make it super.
I asked what that entailed and she said, "sour cream salsa and guacamole for $.99
" Uhhhhh como-what?
For SIXTEEN GOD DAMN DOLLARS
you guys aren't gonna slap some condiments on my plate?
I should have turned around and left at that moment or at least changed my order
but I just declined the super-cision and moved on.
Oh and if Papalote wants a lesson on how to make Mole I'd be happy to oblige.
I mean, on Mondays you can get the nectar of the Gods at Los Compadre's in South City on Grand Ave, but not even comparing it to that, Paplote's sucked.
Lay off the crunched up bran flakes!
Overall we spent almost $40 on 2 crappy skimpy plates, mine-bad mole his huevos
(his huevos machaca was pretty good tho) mushy over-cooked, over-stirred, cheapy-bought rice, really good refried beans, an insulting scoop of jicama salad and no god-damn condiments.
mole.author: Emma H.
mole.review:
I wish I could turn back time and never have chosen to go to this place for lunch yesterday. With the plethora of amazing food in sf, scratch that- in the area, scratch tha-t ON THAT ONE DAMN STREET! whhhyyy oh why did I chose a place with mediocre food and insane prices? 

Ok so their confusing weird menu offers 79 types of burritos or tacos at sort of decent prices or if you don't want a burrito you can choose an egg dish or a plate. When I ordered the Chicken Mole plate the cashier asked me if I wanted to make it super. I asked what that entailed and she said, "sour cream salsa and guacamole for $.99" Uhhhhh como-what? For SIXTEEN GOD DAMN DOLLARS you guys aren't gonna slap some condiments on my plate? I should have turned around and left at that moment or at least changed my order but I just declined the super-cision and moved on. Next we sat at a table and were brought a sugar bowl of chips and a salad-dressing cup of salsa which held 3 tablespoons of their overly-salty-not-as-good-as-pancho-villa salsa. 

My husband and I inhaled the salsa on 2 chips each and waited about 30 mins, drank all of our drinks then finally received our skimpy lame-ass non-condiment-having plates. I asked the food runner "can we have more salsa with our food?" and she said "yes but that's 50 cents" UM COMO WHAT? Are you people insane? You give out 2 tsp of salsa and then charge if somebody consumes it in 5.2 seconds? There should be disclaimers galore on those little shot glasses of sauce! We paid the stupid 50 cents because we basically had to, for we had no condiments on our stupid, un-super plate. We were given either 4 or 6 tortillas for 2 plates, my man eats minimum 6 tortillas so I had 1 and he the rest and we just packaged our food up to-go since we knew we'd be in for another up-charge if god forbid we want more of their crappy hard chewy tortillas. Oh and if Papalote wants a lesson on how to make Mole I'd be happy to oblige. I mean, on Mondays you can get the nectar of the Gods at Los Compadre's in South City on Grand Ave, but not even comparing it to that, Paplote's sucked.  Lay off the crunched up bran flakes! Wtf is that about? 

Overall we spent almost $40 on 2 crappy skimpy plates, mine-bad mole his huevos (his huevos machaca was pretty good tho) mushy over-cooked, over-stirred, cheapy-bought rice, really good refried beans, an insulting scoop of jicama salad and no god-damn condiments.

excerpts: My wife loves the Chicken Mole quesadilla (it's great).
I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito.
I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito.
mole.author: Marcus C.
mole.review:
Papolote has become a go-to for takeout Mexican. Tip top burritos and quesadillas with excellent house-made salsa/sauce and mediocre tortilla chips. My wife loves the Chicken Mole quesadilla (it's great). I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito. It tastes great, but I prefer the more classic burrito offerings (from them and everyone else). 

If you haven't checked Papolote off your list of Mexican stops in the Mission, it's about time that you do.

excerpts: Epic chicken mole tacos and roasted pepper salsa!!
mole.author: Diana S.
mole.review:
Epic chicken mole tacos and roasted pepper salsa!! Wish there was something that came close to the quality and deliciousness out here in NYC.

Tip: You can buy their salsa there, both fresh and bottled. I snagged a bottled jar and it made it through TSA just fine (in my checked luggage and wrapped up in clothes).

excerpts: Where else can I get a soyrizo or tofu mole burrito?
The ingredients are always fresh and that salsa is killer!
Just wish they would include more of it or have a salsa bar...
The cute and sweet girls @ the counter are always helpful and nice when I call in my order, seriously, who doesn't if it's for take-out?
Papalote gets extremely busy and isn't the biggest space in the world.
mole.author: John B.
mole.review:
This would probably be my favorite place to grab lunch if it weren't for the high end price attached to a traditionally reasonably priced food. Although I don't really mind paying a premium for their exceptional quality & service. 

Where else can I get a soyrizo or tofu mole burrito? The ingredients are always fresh and that salsa is killer! Just wish they would include more of it or have a salsa bar... The cute and sweet girls @ the counter are always helpful and nice when I call in my order, seriously, who doesn't if it's for take-out? Papalote gets extremely busy and isn't the biggest space in the world. #shoutout to Alma and the girls for always getting my order just right while greeting me with a beautiful smile when I pick it up. 

Yum! Can't stop thinking about my next visit...

excerpts: I asked the cashier if she recommended the chile verde or the chicken mole, and she said chile verde.
I'm terrified of how crappy the mole might be.
mole.author: Naoko M.
mole.review:
I was looking forward to finally going to Papalote and I have to say the hype is not worth it. Is the salsa delicious? Absolutely. That's about all I can say.

My gripes:
1) You can't "mix and match" your tacos - meaning, if you want to try two kinds of meat, you have to end up with 4 tacos. See, typically I go to taquerias and get 2 or 3 tacos, each with a different protein so I can sample. Much to my dismay, when I asked about this the nice lady said I have to get the 2 tacos.  That's kind of crappy.

2) The chile verde was pretty bad.  Despite having some heat, it was otherwise bland from the flavor side.  The pork was fake-tender. By that I mean, you could break of pieces easiily with a fork, but it was still dry. Clearly it had been simmering for too long in too high of heat. Even I, the home cook, know this - poor technique in the kitchen.  The scary part? I asked the cashier if she recommended the chile verde or the chicken mole, and she said chile verde. I'm terrified of how crappy the mole might be.

3) The tacos come covered in lettuce and tomatoes. What?  Why? There's so much of it too. I appreciate wanting to promote eating veggies and all, but I came here to eat a taco - with meat.  Not ok.

4) Guacamole - was also bland. I had to add some salt. There was no limey zip, and I'm not even sure how but I didn't really get the flavor of avocado. 

5) Service - When the gentleman brought out my tacos, I asked about my side of guac. He looked at the ticket in his hand, which I also saw, and it clear said "Chile Verde, Guacamole." He seemed very confused. My friend also pointed out that on her (separate) order, she had asked and paid for 2 extra salsas and those were not brought out either. He seemed confused and flustered. Eventually we got everything we needed but it wasn't like he was bringing out multiple plates of food at once. He literally was only carrying my tacos in one hand and the ticket that clearly stated "Guacamole" in the other.  Also, on an unrelated note - flies in the air. Not ideal.

This place is probably great for vegetarians/vegans who otherwise can't get Mexican food, but for us meat eaters, don't bother.  

2 stars for the salsa. Good news is you can buy jars of that stuff and never eat anything else here. That's probably my go-to plan from now on.

excerpts: Great pollo con mole!
And they have tofu con mole for all you vegs!!
Definitely going back!!
mole.author: William H.
mole.review: Great organic Mexican food with gluten free and vegan options! Great pollo con mole! And they have tofu con mole for all you vegs!! Definitely going back!!

excerpts: I'm very disappointed from this place they overcharge and nothing there tastes so good the only thing that I liked was the salsa the mole was disgusting not even with beef
mole.author: Zohar I.
mole.review: I'm very disappointed from this place they overcharge and nothing there tastes so good the only thing that I liked was the salsa the mole was disgusting not even with beef

excerpts: I used to get the tofu mole burrito until I had their soyrizo.
mole.author: Justin S.
mole.review:
What can I say about this place that hasn't been said a million times already? First of all, the salsa is so delicious that I had to send a jar down to my mom and dad in LA (they loved it), and secondly, everything else I've had there has been equally amazing.

I am a vegan and they have plenty of vegan options. No lard in any of the beans, thank god. I used to get the tofu mole burrito until I had their soyrizo. Now I get that so often that they know my order as soon as I walk through the door.

The staff is super friendly and they are super fast, especially if you call in your order while you're on your way, which I usually do so I can go eat in the park.

The dining room is clean, if a bit too small at times, and the bathroom is... Crowdsourced artistic... But certainly clean.

So, they may be more expensive that other mission taquerias, but the quality makes it worth it. Pretty much the only bad thing about this place is that they're only open til 10pm.

excerpts: With mole?
Hello.
Yep.
You're going.
mole.author: Patrick B.
mole.review: You know it based on the probable line.  Plus, a vegan burrito?  With mole?  Hello. Yep.  You're going.

excerpts: Quick review- overprice, bad mole, one tortilla tacos, better off going to many other places.
The mole was bland.
mole.author: Bucky W.
mole.review:
Quick review- overprice, bad mole, one tortilla tacos, better off going to many other places.

A group of friends and I did a taco crawl.  6 or 7 places along 24th st.  This was the worst.  The ingredients were good but it lacked flavor and was the most expensive of all the places we went.  Up to 2x more in price than every other place and small too.  Plus the worst of all the worst is only one small ass tortilla per taco. I am native and never gotten a taco with only one tortilla. The mole was bland.  I gave them 2 stars cause the ingredients were good and there are veggie and vegan options but if you want a good taco, look anywhere else.  Take your hunger to El Faralitos or the truck at 23rd and Treat.  You will save money fill your belly and in the end be happier.

excerpts: I got the mole plate.
It was as if it was stored for weeks.
It was so dry.
Not tasty.
The meat was nearly a "powder" when I chewed it.
I wrote this review because I spent nearly $20 on a mole plate and felt it was a complete waste.
Do the cooks even taste what they are serving?
How can you serve that?
I'm positive it is not what the intent of a mole dish is supposed to be.
mole.author: Joseph W.
mole.review: Another hipster touristy taqueria. I got the mole plate. It was as if it was stored for weeks. It was so dry. Not tasty. The meat was nearly a "powder" when I chewed it. My friends got steak tacos. They said they were decent but not excellent. This is a great place for out of towners and hipsters. I wrote this review because I spent nearly $20 on a mole plate and felt it was a complete waste. Do the cooks even taste what they are serving? How can you serve that? I'm positive it is not what the intent of a mole dish is supposed to be.

excerpts: We ordered the mole chicken tacos and chile verde with pork.
The tortillas were super soft and not dried out.
The tomatoes and lettuce on top were very fresh.
The chile verde was just YUMMY!
The mole was a bit over powering and thick.
This is the best taco in town!
Will come back again for sure!
mole.author: Irene C.
mole.review:
Order at front and get seated.  They'll bring you warm tortilla chips and "salsa" to your table.  The "salsa" isn't your typical chopped tomatoes and onion but very spicy roasted tomato dip.

We ordered the mole chicken tacos and chile verde with pork.  The tortillas were super soft and not dried out.  The tomatoes and lettuce on top were very fresh.  The chile verde was just YUMMY!  The mole was a bit over powering and thick.  This is the best taco in town!  Will come back again for sure!

excerpts: I'm of the pescetarian nature myself and flip flop through the various veggie options (grilled veggie, tofu mole, etc., etc.).
Lots of points for customizability (beans, tortillas, tacos/quesadillas/burritos).
When I have out of town guests visiting I often take them to Papalote's for a SF super mission burrito experience.
mole.author: Stephen S.
mole.review: Papalote's is not my favorite burrito in San Francisco but I can't fault anyone who claims that it's theirs. They definitely know what they're doing here and offer a plethora of options for meat lovers and vegetarians alike. I'm of the pescetarian nature myself and flip flop through the various veggie options (grilled veggie, tofu mole, etc., etc.). Lots of points for customizability (beans, tortillas, tacos/quesadillas/burritos). When I have out of town guests visiting I often take them to Papalote's for a SF super mission burrito experience.

excerpts: I got a chicken mole super burrito for $7.93.

The mole was pretty good, as was all the other fillings:
+
+ Chicken = Shredded and tender perfect chompos for me to eats!
+ Guac
= Mush!
Texture, flavor, aesthetically pleasing.
Who doesn't like avocados?
mole.author: Vivian C.
mole.review:
My first excursion to Papalote today was pretty good.

This is actually 3.5 stars, rounded down because, well, 4 stars means it's got to be really solid, and Papalote's kind of there, but just not quite. 

Some observations, aite here we goes:

1. They take card.  Woot! For a moment, after I stepped in, I panicked because I thought I wouldn't be able to get a burrito since I hardly ever carry around cash.  But phew!  They do!  And then I said to myself, "Oh silly, of COURSE they take card!  Gringo burrito place, duh!"  

2. I got a chicken mole super burrito for $7.93.  The mole was pretty good, as was all the other fillings:
+ Cheese = MELTED, I approve.
+ Black Beans = Soft and flavorful, good job there!
+ Chicken = Shredded and tender perfect chompos for me to eats!  
+ Guac = Mush! Texture, flavor, aesthetically pleasing.  Who doesn't like avocados?
+ Rice = Soft, just right. 

3.  Good location, close to the 24th/Mission BART.  Even though I work in the FiDi, I can easily BART here and back during a lunch break and still have time to spare.  

4.  Hipster paradise indeed.  There were two very nice girls in front of me, with cute bags and flowy skirts and interesting hair.  Such a nice, appropriate place for the hipsters, hippies, and happy white people.  

5.  So, I tried their chips and salsa finally.  It's on that 7x7 "100 Things to Eat in SF" list.  There must be something wrong with my taste buds.  The chips were not that great, nothing special.  You want awesome chips?  Tropisueno's got awesome chips!  The salsa, however, was bangin'.  Unfortunately, I can't take the heat, and one tiny taste set my entire mouth on fire.  It was good, yes, but painful.  

So, why the 3.5 stars?  This review seems to suggest a solid 4, maybe more, right?  Well, I mean, I definitely LIKED my burrito, but it was just...not totally 100% there. . .  

You know what I mean?  Imagine meeting a person, or attending a class, and even though he/she/it is perfectly fine and nice and all, you're just not blown away.  

And you could go either way, go with it, or not.  That's kind of how I felt about Papalote after my meal.  Certainly a decent meal, but I'm not about to jump around recommending it to everyone I know.  

No, no, that shameless plugging is still reserved for my all-time favorite, El Farolito. 

But Papalote?  Eh, she's alright.

excerpts: Chicken Mole: Chocolatey and pasty
, this is pretty decent mole.
mole.author: Adam B.
mole.review:
The best (and only) Adobo Burrito I've ever had is from Papalote's secret menu!  I thought I was over Mexican food since Mexican food is so overexposed in the Mission, but Filipino fusion helps breath new vida into it.  The non-Filipino fusion food is good, but not by as large a margin.

Adobo Burrito: This was my reason for coming here and it did not disappoint.  The chicken was even more fall apart tender than the traditional Mexican options.  The adobo flavor was thankfully high on the garlic, soy and pepper while not getting overly vinegary.  No beans because that would have been weird.  The garlic rice was a nice touch to add an extra bit of zing.  What a great, portable way to enjoy Filipino food!  Now if only they'd do pork adobo...

Chicken Mole: Chocolatey and pasty, this is pretty decent mole.  The chicken was a tad firm, perhaps they should stew it longer?

Refried Beans: I liked the concept of refried black beans because pintos usually get all the refrying action.  Heavier than the pinto though.

Rice: Standard.  Was disappointed with my side since the garlic rice in the adobo burrito was way better!

Chips & Salsa: Pretty nice for free (with purchase of a meal).  The chips were standard, but the salsa was great!  Smoky and creamy.  No wonder why people rave about this compared to the more standard varieties all over the Mission.

excerpts: Good mole sauce.
My burrito guru said they have every combo of meat/sauce/extra for your taco
/burrito/etc.
Interesting deco and reasonable price for the location.
A good spot for hangout or a casual lunch date.
mole.author: Alexa X.
mole.review: Good mole sauce.  My burrito guru said they have every combo of meat/sauce/extra for your taco/burrito/etc. Interesting deco and reasonable price for the location. A good spot for hangout or a casual lunch date.

excerpts: I got a tofu burrito with mole sauce.
It was bomb.
mole.author: Ben E.
mole.review: It's like you can just walk into any taqueria in the Mission and get one of the best burritos of your life. I got a tofu burrito with mole sauce. It was bomb.

excerpts: I ordered two tacos and went for the Mole.
Woman at the counter couldn't recommend because she doesn't like mole, well, I should have gone with her "no like".
I LOVE mole, and this was bad; watery, thin, blach.
The chicken that was covered by the mole was DRY DRY DRY.
Biting into it wasn't soft and juicy
, rather it was hard and chewy.
Last thing was I asked for no lettuce (lettuce is a cheap way to 'fill').
Unfortunately lettuce was on my mole, which made it worse(r).
mole.author: Mark M.
mole.review:
I know I know...it's supposed to be better. I've heard for years how great the food was. I (sadly) won't be going back.

MY GO-TO TAQUERIA
Zapata - 18th/Collingwood

I ordered two tacos and went for the Mole. Woman at the counter couldn't recommend because she doesn't like mole, well, I should have gone with her "no like". I LOVE mole, and this was bad; watery, thin, blach. The chicken that was covered by the mole was DRY DRY DRY. Biting into it wasn't soft and juicy, rather it was hard and chewy. Last thing was I asked for no lettuce (lettuce is a cheap way to 'fill'). Unfortunately lettuce was on my mole, which made it worse(r).

: - (

Chips & Salsa (*****)

I know, this place is supposed to be great.

Sorry...

excerpts: Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies.
Can't go wrong!
Their homemade salsas are so good too.
mole.author: Jessica G.
mole.review: Love love love this place! Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies. Can't go wrong!  Their homemade salsas are so good too.

excerpts: Definitely check out their mole - muy rico!
mole.author: Jenn C.
mole.review: Delicious Mexican taqueria with - SURPRISE! - delicious VEGAN options!  I'm a fan though I don't get here as often as I used to when I lived in the neighborhood.  Definitely check out their mole - muy rico!

excerpts: Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty.
mole.author: Tony B.
mole.review:
Love me my papalote and have for years. Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty. 

On those rare times you have the space and minutes to sit down and dine in a civilized manner, the pollo al achiote and the fish tacos are the way to go.

The salsa is so good I buy it in the fresh jars in their fridge and have it as an after-work snack with some local casa sanchez chips. 

I just wish they had a bigger space so it wasn't always so crowded! And I suspect their burritos have gotten slightly smaller in the 8 years I've been coming here.

excerpts: Decided to brave the "overrated" reviews and give their vegan tofu mole
burrito a try, since life without mole is not worth living.
mole.author: Charles B.
mole.review:
This is 2nd in my Vegan the Mission series.

Decided to brave the "overrated" reviews and give their vegan tofu mole burrito a try, since life without mole is not worth living. Happy to say it was yummy and filling and came with a nice, if skimpy, salsa on the side.

Go on a Sunday afternoon to avoid the lines.

excerpts: The tofu mole tacos (although a bit spicy) are really, really good.
I've become obsessed with their roasted tomatillo salsa which I buy at Rainbow Grocery and put on everything.
mole.author: Priscilla M.
mole.review: Large selection of vegetarian and vegan options. The tofu mole tacos (although a bit spicy) are really, really good. I've become obsessed with their roasted tomatillo salsa which I buy at Rainbow Grocery and put on everything.

excerpts: Ok, this review is for the mole chicken burrito.
Straight up edible crack rocks.
Delicious.
Easily the best burrito I've ever had.
The mole sauce is perfectly seasoned and it just rocks.
It's the downfall of my near-vegetarianism.
They do have a tofu mole burrito
mole.author: Faith S.
mole.review:
Ok, this review is for the mole chicken burrito. Straight up edible crack rocks. Delicious. Easily the best burrito I've ever had. The mole sauce is perfectly seasoned and it just rocks. It's the downfall of my near-vegetarianism. They do have a tofu mole burrito but I just can't imagine it being as scrumptious.

The salsa is also extremely fresh-tasting and delicious. Love, love Papalote.

excerpts: your fish and prawn tacos, your mole sauce, your burritos...
mole.author: Peter S.
mole.review:
sadness...

I used to love you Papalote...you were cute, better than your average taqueria...your fish and prawn tacos, your mole sauce, your burritos...all had a little something extra, an attention to detail, maybe the fresh greens on the taco, the slices of radish, it was worth a couple extra bux.

But just like a good TV show, success has robbed you of everything that made you special.  Now all I see is:
-- OK Food, still good, but seems to have lost that something extra...no longer better than the cheaper taquerias one block away
--Crowded/long lines/noisy, people constantly standing around waiting, staring at you to finish so they can have your seat
--$$$ - No longer worth the extra few bucks

OH, and my tacos fell apart, they now use one corn tortilla instead of two - did that 2 cents per tortilla really save you that much money  Papalote? 
It pains me to see how success has ruined a formerly great little place.  I'll always remember you the way you were....sadness

excerpts:
Amazing Healthy Mexican

Best Mole I have had.
mole.author: Ethan K.
mole.review:
Amazing Healthy Mexican

Best Mole I have had. Salsa and Chips is also very famous, and for good reason.

Very, very, good food at a very reasonable price.

excerpts: Didn't eat anything else all day, had a chicken mole burrito
then later that night had to leave my own birthday party to go home and hang out in the bathroom all night.
I'll never live down having friends show up to my party and I not be there.
Thankfully it passed (ahem) within 24 hrs but the timing could not be worse.
I urge you to pass as well on Papalote.
mole.author: Alex A.
mole.review: I got food poisoning from a burrito here on my birthday. Didn't eat anything else all day, had a chicken mole burrito then later that night had to leave my own birthday party to go home and hang out in the bathroom all night. I'll never live down having friends show up to my party and I not be there. Thankfully it passed (ahem) within 24 hrs but the timing could not be worse. I urge you to pass as well on Papalote.

excerpts: Two words: Mole Tofu.
This place is the answer to every vegetarian's dreams.
It's more like a mole or adobo, but creamier, that decided it wanted to be served cold on chips instead of used as a marinage/grilling sauce on proteins.
Another place there game is on another level are the prints of famous singers (done as two-tones that make them surreal and pop) covering the walls.
Go there because Prince (and apparently the Mexican National Team:http://sfist.com/2014/07/07/mexican_world_cup_players_return_fr.php) sent you.
mole.author: Ory P.
mole.review:
