Two words: Mole Tofu. This place is the answer to every vegetarian's dreams. I know nothing of the chicken adobo, or whether the carnitas (if they even have it) stacks up against El Farolito's or Taquieria Cancun's. That can't matter to me cause I'm stuck with the veggie (really beans, or at best chile relleno) options over there. Papalote gives the treatment veggie options deserve. 
Also, there salsa is not only better than any other, it is a redefinition of the category 'salsa'. It's more like a mole or adobo, but creamier, that decided it wanted to be served cold on chips instead of used as a marinage/grilling sauce on proteins.
Another place there game is on another level are the prints of famous singers (done as two-tones that make them surreal and pop) covering the walls. Go there because Prince (and apparently the Mexican National Team:http://sfist.com/2014/07/07/mexican_world_cup_players_return_fr.php) sent you.

excerpts: and I saw the mole
and I knew I wanted it immediately.
I love mole, I love the sauce, sweet, salty and delicious.
And I got a nice hochata
, I love horchata (although I wish they gave me a little more ice since it was pretty hot in the restaurant!).
My cousin got the carnitas verde (I think-
I have to say I liked my cousin dish because it had a little heat to it, some spice, but the chicken mole was pretty good too.
mole.author: Helen P.
mole.review:
Look. I love Mexican food. I'm from Southern California, it's part of the culture here. So my cousin and I couldn't help but eat some more mexican food while we were up in SF, especially as our last meal.  We were dragging our luggage all over the streets of Mission looking for this restaurant, which is some what difficult to find when you are obviously not familiar with the area and when its kind off the street without a large sign. But we found it finally and when I walked in I knew we were in a good place. 

Lots of sizzling and delicious smells and lots of people grubbing, those are always good signs. I didn't feel like eating tacos (I always eat them in LA so I wanted something a little different) and I saw the mole and I knew I wanted it immediately. I love mole, I love the sauce, sweet, salty and delicious. And I got a nice hochata, I love horchata (although I wish they gave me a little more ice since it was pretty hot in the restaurant!). My cousin got the carnitas verde (I think- well it certainly had the verde sauce). 

I didn't realize how big the portions were until they gave us the plates, but it was huge and it came with rice and beans, mmmmm. They also gave us generous portions of warm tortillas. My cousin and I immediately dug in, things were bursting out of our tacos and the couple who just sat down next to us, waiting for their food were staring at us. I have to say I liked my cousin dish because it had a little heat to it, some spice, but the chicken mole was pretty good too. I wish I had more room in my stomach to finish it all or could take it to go if I was staying longer, but unfortunately I couldn't finish it all (yes I was disappointed in myself).

I highly recommend people to grub here if they get a chance. I do have a warning about the bathroom, it was a little frightening in there (and quite nesty) so I would use it for washing up. But nonetheless I loved the food and that was the most important part of the experience!

excerpts: I always order the same thing-- the tofu mole, and twice recently I was served regular grilled tofu with no mole sauce.
When they did get my order right, there hasn't been as much mole sauce as there used to be.
mole.author: V M.
mole.review:
I have always really loved this place, but the last several times I've gone in, the quality and level of service has gone down significantly.  I always order the same thing-- the tofu mole, and twice recently I was served regular grilled tofu with no mole sauce.  When they did get my order right, there hasn't been as much mole sauce as there used to be.  Moreover, the people at the registers always are rude, act annoyed and seem like they really hate their jobs. 

I hope this place starts paying more attention to quality and customer service.

excerpts: Next time, I will be consuming the tofu mole burrito.
mole.author: Peter V.
mole.review:
What a Burrito... As a vegan, this is the best burrito I have had since I have lived in San Francisco. Really close to 5 stars, but I need something to push me over that edge that was missing a little. 

The standard mission vegetarian burrito tends to be pretty tasteless and disappointing. The proprietors here seem to have actually put some creativity and effort into the vegan options which makes me know that I will be back many times. General rule: If you love the vegans, the vegans will love you.

I had the Soyrizo burrito. This burrito is chocked full of delicious Soyrizo, rice, ad beans. Toward the end though, the saltyness caught up with me. Soyrizo is pretty salty, so it is understandable. Next time, I will be consuming the tofu mole burrito. I have high hopes.

As for the salsa, It was good. I wouldn't cross into the great department because I didn't find it as spicy as I would like for a GREAT salsa. They do provide 2 hot sauces that you can douse your burrito in.

excerpts: Chicken mole burrito, no rice, black beans, tomato tortilla - outta sight!
The best burrito EVER.
Homemade roasted red pepper salsa is undeniably the best salsa I have ever, ever, ever, ever, ever had.
mole.author: Evan G.
mole.review:
HOLY FRICKIN COW!  Chicken mole burrito, no rice, black beans, tomato tortilla - outta sight!  The best burrito EVER.  Homemade roasted red pepper salsa is undeniably the best salsa I have ever, ever, ever, ever, ever had.  And the homemade chips are delicious.

I can't even tell you how many "Buy 10 Burritos, get the 11th free" cards I've filled up here.  

Usually best to call ahead if you want something for take-away, as the line (and the wait) can be a bit long.  And it's not really that the wait is that long, it's just that there's not a lot of space to wait.  

Fresh ingredients, and I like the respectful menu options for vegetarians and vegans.

excerpts: But given the price, my mole burrito wasn't really cutting it.
The food was satisfactory, and the decor and service reflected the higher prices.
However,  with alternatives nearby I'd be hard-pressed to come back to Papalote for delicious burritos.
mole.author: Bill H.
mole.review: I dunno -- I get the upscale take on burritos.  But given the price, my mole burrito wasn't really cutting it.  The food was satisfactory, and the decor and service reflected the higher prices.  However,  with alternatives nearby I'd be hard-pressed to come back to Papalote for delicious burritos.

excerpts: Chicken Mole:  was rich as mole negro should be.
The sauce is deeply flavored BUT
way over-chocolate-y, covering up practically all the chili pepper flavors.
The chicken breast was tough, overcooked to the point in which it required earnest effort to cut with a fork.
mole.author: Ben S.
mole.review:
2.5 stars

The pollo asado burrito remains delicious on account of their special marinade and the grill flavor.  Every bite yum.  
But what if I came in one day with the family and we tried something different... perhaps one of their plates?

Pork chile verde:  should've been named Green Pork in Garlic Sauce cause that's all we could taste.  Not the tangy, intangible yum of tomatillos. Not the zing of chili.  Hell, not even pork-flavored. Care to guess what you COULD taste?  Fail.

Chicken Mole:  was rich as mole negro should be.  The sauce is deeply flavored BUT way over-chocolate-y, covering up practically all the chili pepper flavors.  The chicken breast was tough, overcooked to the point in which it required earnest effort to cut with a fork. 

Spanish omelet:  good cheesy goodness with mushrooms and bell peppers throughout but it suffered from overcooked eggs.  Browned scrambled egg has a particularly strong flavor and if you dig it, you'll be pleased.  I find it just short of revolting.

Conclusion:  stick with the burrito at $7.50 and pass on the $13 plates.

excerpts: I just discovered the chicken mole burrito.
mole.author: Julia G.
mole.review:
I just discovered the chicken mole burrito. If you need a change from the classics, this is it.

Papalote ingredients are definitely above average quality. Salsa, obviously quite outstanding as many before have stated. They are really milking the Bobby Flay throwdown thing these days, but I guess who can blame them.

Call in your order or be prepared to wait.

excerpts: The chicken mole kind of stunk.
The sauce was pretty heavy on the sweetness; it could have used more chiles.
The chicken was not super moist, and it was $13.
The chicken burrito was a bit dry, but the chile verde pork was better.
mole.author: Solomon W.
mole.review:
Yes, I took friends here just because I saw it on Throwdown.  I knew I had to get the salsa here, but we also tried some of their various dishes.  This place is cool for not over-advertising their fame, and also keeping their restaurant very local and quaint.  We had to wait a few minutes to even sit down for some quick-paced Mexican grub.

The food here is served in large portions, but the prices are quite up there.  They are known for their sun-dried tomato salsa, but it is somewhat one-dimensional in my opinion.  It lacks the freshness of salsa (they sell it by the bottle), and it has too much American jazziness to it.

The best thing by far is the fish, in any form.  The white wine and butter sauce is exquisite, and the fish is extremely moist and tender.  The quesadilla option is a bit pricey, though.

The chicken mole kind of stunk.  The sauce was pretty heavy on the sweetness; it could have used more chiles.  The chicken was not super moist, and it was $13.  The chicken burrito was a bit dry, but the chile verde pork was better.  The CV had a tangy, hearty sauce that paired well with the tender pork.

There is nothing to really rave about here, but I guess it is worth a shot if you are into unique salsas and stuff.  The food is a little pricier than normal, but it does the job, and there are offerings to satisfy everyone.

excerpts: The chicken in the chicken mole was overcooked and dry; a waste of good mole sauce.
mole.author: Elben S.
mole.review:
Overrated, much? Their famous salsa was a good surprise, but it was nothing extraordinary. The chicken in the chicken mole was overcooked and dry; a waste of good mole sauce. The burrito was nothing special (again, the meat was overcooked and very dry), and neither were the rice and beans.

Oh well.

excerpts: Tofu mole?
mole.author: Sue A.
mole.review:
Best burrito ever. TONS of delicious vegan options. Soyrizo? Tofu mole? grilled veggies? 

I nearly always get the soyrizo, sometimes with guacamole. Always AMAZING. And enormous for super-cheap. I work in the Financial District and have spent entire lunch breaks trekking to and from papalote to get an excellent burrito and get back in time to sit at my desk and eat while working -it's totally worth it. 

And the salsa. Did I mention the salsa? SO DELICIOUS. You can buy it by the jar at the store, or you can now buy it on-line for delivery. When I found this out, I sent the link to everyone I know, and they all reacted "This is the best day of my life". It's that good. 

While i've only ever gotten vegan burritos here, I've been told the non-vegan ones are also good. But can't really comment. 

Their other location is also good. So good that when our office was in the Presidio, we would regularly drive over and get burritos for the whole office (~25 people). 

Go here!!

excerpts: Mole Burrito - I would not recommend this one.
Maybe its because I'm used to the freshness of the grilled pollo
burrito
but I was disappointed I chose this.
mole.author: Preetesh B.
mole.review:
Been here a million times and it gets better and better. But since everyone loves this place for the burritos, I wanted to comment on two things:

Pechuga al Achiote: SUPER healthy and great. I would recommend this if you're looking for a non-burrito option.

Mole Burrito - I would not recommend this one. Maybe its because I'm used to the freshness of the grilled pollo burrito but I was disappointed I chose this.

excerpts: That said, their mole burrito is delicious, and it was almost worth the wait.
mole.author: Sydney H.
mole.review:
3.5 stars, rounded down because of how long it takes to get a burrito to go on a Tuesday night.  Apparently, you can call ahead and pick it up right away, which is what I should have done.  It's pretty tiny, you have to wait even longer for a table.

My theory about Papalote's excellent ratings:  Roughly half of San Francisco is vegetarian, if not vegan.  The vast majority of burrito places, even here, seem to think that a vegetarian burrito means "beans and cheese only" (recipe for an evening of stink if I ever heard one).  Therefore, Papalote gets amazing ratings from half of the city purely for using vegetables.  Like, real, fresh vegetables, which is nice, but not as nice as the reviews make it out to be.

That said, their mole burrito is delicious, and it was almost worth the wait.  Since I wanted both meat and veggies in it, they charged me close to $13.  It was enough for two meals, but still...$13 for a burrito of any sort seems a bit excessive, no matter how delicious.

excerpts: So, instead i was torn between the mole burrito or the chile verde.
Per the cashiers recommendation, i chose the chili verde.
mole.author: Anthony D.
mole.review:
excited to check this place out after finding out it beat out bobby flaw on throwdown, i made the journey to experience 'the best burrito' in san francisco last sunday. BAD IDEA!

what a waste of time and hype. First off, the 'triple threat' cost $20, seriously, 20 bucks for a damn burrito, not in this life time. 

So, instead i was torn between the mole burrito or the chile verde. Per the cashiers recommendation, i chose the chili verde. While waiting i was brought some chips and salsa. 

Heard the salsa was great, what a disappointment. It is the better type, i think habanero; however, it just wasnt anything special. If you want a real good orange salsa, try Iguana in SJ, definitely the best. I mean my friends mom could make a better one in her sleep, and she probably has.

Back to the point. well i was given the salsa with some chips, which were store bought (not the great house made ones at REAL mexican restaurants). Once my burrito arrived I asked for some more salsa, since I used the other on the chips they gave me. The worker told me I only get 1 salsa per order and I would have to pay if I wanted any more!! ARE YOU SERIOUS?!? Youre telling me the salsa that came with my chips was the only salsa I got to use for both my super burrito and my dipping my chips? WAT A JOKE! 

any other legitimate mexican restaurant usually hands salsa out like its halloween or even keeps them in self serve so you can basically dip your burrito in before you eat, lol. Not this place, their are like the salsa nazis for some bland lame duck salsa. 

Havent even gotten to the burrito. So, i could barely even taste the green chili and the pork was rather dry and cut too large. I mean i have had chili verde cut that large before but usually its been simmered in sauce so long that it just melts in your mouth, not this one. Felt like I was eating over cooked chicken. 

Only good marking this place gets is they allow the option of getting spinach tortillas and whole black beans. Although, DEFINITELY NOT worth $9 PLUS, the extra cost of salsa!!

BOOOO!

excerpts: I tried the mole chicken burrito which was delicious.
My two other friends had the $20 burrito (I had a small taste).
Nothing spectacular, just lots of different types of meat but the exact same size as mine which I didn't expect--- thought it was going to be huge.
Yes, their salsa is unique and yummy, but nothing to go ga-ga over.
And it was nice that the owner was out to mingle, but I'm sure he's just ride out the 15-minute fame wave as long as possible.
I couldn't have phrased it better than yelp does with my two-star rating:
"Meh.
I've experienced better.
mole.author: Christine Y.
mole.review:
Of COURSE my friends and I went here after hearing about that throwndown bobby flay thing triple threat burrito thing. Sooo... we waddled down to the mission and found parking right away which, according to my friend, was probably the most positive thing about this whole experience. 
I tried the mole chicken burrito which was delicious. My two other friends had the $20 burrito (I had a small taste). Nothing spectacular, just lots of different types of meat but the exact same size as mine which I didn't expect--- thought it was going to be huge. 
Yes, their salsa is unique and yummy, but nothing to go ga-ga over. And it was nice that the owner was out to mingle, but I'm sure he's just ride out the 15-minute fame wave as long as possible. 
I couldn't have phrased it better than yelp does with my two-star rating: "Meh. I've experienced better."

excerpts: Tried the Triple Threat burrito and, on a another occasion, the chicken mole.
Would come back for take out.
Seats are hard to get to dine in and so is parking.
mole.author: November C.
mole.review: The food is undoubtedly great here! Tried the Triple Threat burrito and, on a another occasion, the chicken mole. Would come back for take out. Seats are hard to get to dine in and so is parking.

excerpts: The chicken mole was whack... avoid it.
mole.author: Ricky H.
mole.review:
Cheesy cheesy goodness...

The cheesy fish quesadilla revisits me in my dreams sometimes and I'm a fan of the sauce. Although I don't see what all the fuss is about it is still really good. 

The burritos were pleasing, not too fancy. 
The chicken mole was whack... avoid it. 

If you're going to Papalote, send me a fish quesadilla please.

excerpts: I had tried this place a while ago for their chicken mole tacos and found it alright.
Then I saw Papalote beat Bobby Flay with their Triple Threat Burrito.
mole.author: Michael H.
mole.review:
I still don't know understand the hype of this place. I had tried this place a while ago for their chicken mole tacos and found it alright. Then I saw Papalote beat Bobby Flay with their Triple Threat Burrito. Since I couldn't find the bakery I was looking for I decided to give it another shot.

I didn't realize that the Triple Threat Burrito is $20! Instead I got the carne asada burrito to-go. The burrito is good. Big chunks of meat and a good balance of ingredients. They also pack your bag with chips and some killer good orange hot sauce. For some reason the sauce tastes better this time around. I think the sauce is better suited for hefty savory burritos.

Considering that Papalote is as busy as a liquor store on New Year's Eve, I would rather go somewhere less congested, cheaper, and just as good. The wait isn't worth the food. If it's not that crazy packed, give it a shot.

excerpts: I came to Papalote specifically because I'd never had mole negro before, and a friend recommended the chicken mole at this place.
After hearing how crowded and crazy it is, we almost didn't go -- but I'm glad we tried it.
It came with more chicken that I could eat at one sitting, partly because it was pieces of white meat that had gotten very dried out during the cooking process.
The mole sauce was amazing -- rich, complexly flavored, chocolaty and just slightly sweet.
However, it wasn't enough to moisten the chicken, and the dry meat combined with the uber-rich sauce made the dish hard to finish (and I didn't).
I could have used a lot more greens on my plate to offset the rich/dryness of the mole.
mole.author: Beth W.
mole.review:
I came to Papalote specifically because I'd never had mole negro before, and a friend recommended the chicken mole at this place. After hearing how crowded and crazy it is, we almost didn't go -- but I'm glad we tried it. Despite the crowds, we were able to sit down at a table and (semi) enjoy our meal, although we were crammed in close with other diners and the servers kept banging into my chair. 

Anyway, where was I? Oh yes. The food. 

The salsa, as others have said, is unique and tasty. It's on the spicy side, blended, and a little bit creamy. I almost ate all of it with chips while waiting for my meal, but saved some. That turned out to be a good thing. 

My portion was huge. It came with more chicken that I could eat at one sitting, partly because it was pieces of white meat that had gotten very dried out during the cooking process. The mole sauce was amazing -- rich, complexly flavored, chocolaty and just slightly sweet. However, it wasn't enough to moisten the chicken, and the dry meat combined with the uber-rich sauce made the dish hard to finish (and I didn't). 

The house-made pinto beans were very bland -- and adding the leftover salsa helped, but only a little bit. Their tortillas are store-bought; I was a little disappointed by that. And the jicama salad was teeny-tiny. I could have used a lot more greens on my plate to offset the rich/dryness of the mole. 

My date had the pork salsa verde; he said it was "just OK" and had similar blandness issues with his black beans. 

The service was friendly and fast. 

So, a few stars for tasty sauces, but several stars taken away for crowds, dry meat, and bland beans. We probably won't be back.

excerpts: My friend had the Mole/chicken burrito and she also enjoyed it...
Although I think she enjoyed the strangely orange free salsa more.
It WAS good after all.
We left stuffed and pleased.
Especially since when we arrived at 4 we walked right in and up to the cashier.
Then when we left at 5ish there was a line out the door.
We had the right burritos at the right time...with drinks for the right price...
mole.author: L P.
mole.review:
I waltzed in with a friend early one Sunday evening. We went for a walk, saw Papalote, and thought sure, let's try it. 

AND WE DID. 

I had the grilled veggie burrito. I LOVE zucchini in my mexican food and this included it....And not just a few slices but it was STUFFED with zucchini...and a side of pinto beans, rice, eggplant, sourcream and cheese. My friend had the Mole/chicken burrito and she also enjoyed it...Although I think she enjoyed the strangely orange free salsa more. It WAS good after all. We left stuffed and pleased. Especially since when we arrived at 4 we walked right in and up to the cashier. Then when we left at 5ish there was a line out the door. We had the right burritos at the right time...with drinks for the right price...20 bucks. 

(By the way, this story took place approximately 5 hours ago. I decided to write this review promptly bc I also decided to promptly eat my burrito leftovers as soon as I got home....which is now....Also, it's even better cold. Yesssssss)

Go here and go early.

excerpts: It was so tasty that I may even consider the tofu mole...
mole.author: Wendy L.
mole.review:
Oh, yeah, come to papa...  

I'd heard a ton about Paplote and how great it is....and it is great.  Where else can you get a great, 3 lb. super burrito for so little?  I had the carne asada...yum...love the carne asada.  I was surprised by the Noe Valley weekday dinner rush last week, but I guess if I lived in Noe, I'd be there all the time too....  I was a little disappointed with the amount of guacamole you get with a side order, but otherwise, fantastic!

It was so tasty that I may even consider the tofu mole...

excerpts: The mole burrito was pretty tasty, but somehow I thought it would taste stronger.
mole.author: Amy N.
mole.review:
I ordered the Adobo burrito (off menu). It's mildly-spiced chicken, rice, and tomatoes (no beans). I was expecting something more vinegar-y, more reminiscent of Filipino food, but it was just OK. I wanted the flavor to be more pronounced.

The mole burrito was pretty tasty, but somehow I thought it would taste stronger. It wasn't bland, just milder than I expected.

The salsa was excellent, though.

I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.

One day I'll return to try their fish burrito. Sauteed in white wine and butter? In a burrito? I am skeptical as to the taste (white wine flavor in a burrito?) but intrigued.

excerpts: I may go back for the tofu mole everyone raves about, but probably only if I'm already in the neighborhood.
I'll give 3 stars--because I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that the absence of garlic really impacted the flavor of the food.
mole.author: S H.
mole.review:
I will preface this review by noting that we should have called ahead and asked about the amount of garlic in their food. My husband has an allergy, & there were a lot of items on the menu he couldn't eat. That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas. We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in. If my husband had been able to eat the salsa, it certainly wouldn't have been enough. 

The fajitas came out pretty quickly. The eggplant, zucchini & carrots were cooked a pleasant amount--not mushy. Lettuce, diced toms, and jicama (I think) all tasted fresh. The refried beans were good (though on the runnier end of the spectrum, just fyi) and the avocado slices were ripe and there were a good number of them. Wish the same had been true of  the tortillas! The order came with 3 clearly mass-produced, traditional-sized (i.e. taco, not burrito), flour tortillas--not enough to deal with even half of the food on the plate. Though they did not charge us extra when we asked for more, this just reinforced the impression created by the salsa--that they were trying to give us as little as possible. I suppose this could be a considered strategy to reduce food waste (which we would support!), though, if that's their rationale, it would help to explain that, and advise customers they need only ask for more. 

Overall, the food was fine, but not what I expected after hearing my sis talk about having seen this joint on TV, and seeing it mentioned in The Rough Guide to Cali. Could not shake the impression that you're not quite getting your money's worth. I may go back for the tofu mole everyone raves about, but probably only if I'm already in the neighborhood. I'll give 3 stars--because I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that the absence of garlic really impacted the flavor of the food.

excerpts: I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.
YUMMMY fish!
Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.
Ok on the chicken mole.
I love that place.
Ok on the chicken mole.
I love that place.
mole.author: Anna C.
mole.review:
I recently moved to Bernal Heights and walk through the Mission everyday to get to and from BART.  The smell of grilled meats is enough to make me want to try every single mexican restaurant in the mission.  

I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.  YUMMMY fish!  Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.  Ok on the chicken mole. I love that place.  Looking forward to going back to try their carne asada and others.

excerpts: It was the first time I had heard of a Chicken Mole option for a burrito - and it did not disappoint!
mole.author: Amanda D.
mole.review:
The ingredients are fresh, and the options come by the dozen. Meat options are plentiful and unique. The menu has so many different options for any vegan, vegetarian, or good 'ole meat eater like myself. I personally loved the whole wheat tortilla option for no extra charge. It was the first time I had heard of a Chicken Mole option for a burrito - and it did not disappoint! 

However, the best part of the meal cannot be overlooked. The chips and salsa, which is served by the bowl to each person, is unmissable. Easily one of the best salsas I've had. It's smokey, garlicy and has enough kick to leave a little warmth in the back of the throat. So good.

The only downside I saw was the Triple Threat's price. Why, El Papalote, do you have a $20 burrito on your menu if it is roughly the same size as your other normal priced ones? I get that is filled with good meat, but damn! You better get a whole pound of shrimp in there for that price. 

I'd def. come back to El Papalote! Especially after beating Bobby Flay.

excerpts: I've had the veg tacos, the mole, and the veg quesadilla too.
mole.author: Heather T.
mole.review:
Best veg burrito on the planet, with big chunks of potato, tender carrot medallions, and sauteed mushrooms. Plus, all of their beans are vegan (even the pinto beans are made without lard). I've had the veg tacos, the mole, and the veg quesadilla too. All are good, but I crave the veggie burrito. Oh, and the salsa is perfect: spicy and flavorful. It's so perfect that I buy it by the jar for home.

My husband jokes at me because whenever he asks where I feel like eating lunch, the answer is always Papalote.

excerpts: When you are paying 15$ for a plate there is no excuse for dry chewy chili verde or mole.
The 9$ burrito is easily bested by cheaper offerings from pancho villa, gordo, la corneta, el faralote, chipotle etc.
I'll shed a tear for what papalote used to be
but I won't be coming back for anything but a jar of that salsa.
mole.author: Christopher K.
mole.review:
I used to frequent papalote and sing its praises to everyone I met. 
No more.
It's been almost 2 years and I have to say, other than the still excellent salsa, this place is no longer worth the visit.  When you are paying 15$ for a plate there is no excuse for dry chewy chili verde or mole. The 9$ burrito is easily bested by cheaper offerings from pancho villa, gordo, la corneta, el faralote, chipotle etc. 
I'll shed a tear for what papalote used to be but I won't be coming back for anything but a jar of that salsa.

excerpts: Chicken mole tacos and chile verde burrito pleeeeeaaase!
mole.author: Keika L.
mole.review:
I feel so fortunate that I live on the same block as this restaurant. 

Chicken mole tacos and chile verde burrito pleeeeeaaase!

excerpts: I ordered the chicken mole burrito.
I am a big fan of mole sauce and almost always order mole when eating Mexican food.
It is a legit mole sauce, rich and well balanced.
I was visiting from Seattle and this was my favorite burrito on my visit.
mole.author: Joel W.
mole.review: Great salsa!  I ordered the chicken mole burrito.  I am a big fan of mole sauce and almost always order mole when eating Mexican food.  It is a legit mole sauce, rich and well balanced.  I was visiting from Seattle and this was my favorite burrito on my visit.

excerpts: I'm excited to try some of their other burritos & have heard the mole is killer.
mole.author: Mel A.
mole.review:
Prawn burrito  w/ black beans was AWESOME. Definitely order it "super."

Order extra salsa for sure...it has a smoked kick to it that makes it's very tasty!

I'm excited to try some of their other burritos & have heard the mole is killer.

excerpts:
Mole, tofu taco
     +Cocoa pepper and chili concoction goes great with the hard shell
3.
mole.author: Chuck N.
mole.review:
Wednesday, 8:45PM.

To enter Mission's Mexican food market, folks best be bringing their A-game or find some way to distinguish themselves from the competition. 

Papalote does both and is establishing a spicy niche in the area. 

Stuffed our faces in:
1. Soyrizo
     +Spicy, chunky soy pieces won over this omnivore
2. Mole, tofu taco
     +Cocoa pepper and chili concoction goes great with the hard shell
3. Triple threat
     +Chicken? Carne asada? Shrimp? Dig the combo man!
     - Only four prawns? Put a little more than that, c'mon now!
4. Salsa
     +Spicy kick without overwhelming the rest of the mix
     - Staff is stingy with this goodness

And then...?
The Triple Threat wasn't enough for my raging hunger, which is a testament to me being a PHATTTTY. Still paying a return visit though, I've got the seafood burritos and nachos to try!

excerpts: I ordered a regular chicken mole burrito and since I don't like pico de gallo, I asked if there was another salsa they could put into the burrito
mole.author: Patrick H.
mole.review:
Oh man it was warm last night even at 9PM in the Mission, but inside Papalote it was about 100°F. I don't know how the people were eating in the dining room. There were boxes of produce by the door and the poor bell peppers were suffering too.  I ordered a regular chicken mole burrito and since I don't like pico de gallo, I asked if there was another salsa they could put into the burrito but they did not offer to put the orange salsa in :(.  

And then I waited....and waited...it took 20-25 minutes to finally get my burrito.

The verdict? The burrito was pretty good and so was the orange salsa that comes w/ the side of chips. But for the above average price and the long wait, I'd try other tacquerias in the area before venturing back to Papalote. They could use a new location w/ a larger kitchen to help the orders go through more quickly, and so the cooks aren't stepping on each others' toes as much.

One last note...like buying yogurt, I like to order 2-3 tacos each w/ different meats, but they only come in pairs here.

excerpts: The good: Their salsa is pretty good, although it seems to have lost some of its fire lately, and their chicken mole is delicious.
mole.author: Steve B.
mole.review:
The good: Their salsa is pretty good, although it seems to have lost some of its fire lately, and their chicken mole is delicious.  The veggie burritos are also pretty tasty.  The portions are quite large and a burrito will easily make two meals.  You can call ahead and order food to-go and avoid the ridiculous line that often develops. 

The bad: I think the food is overpriced, especially given the volume of sales and the fact that their service can be mediocre.  But, they keep a line out the door so the market seems to say otherwise.  I've had orders messed up repeatedly -- from getting the wrong dish entirely to minor things like missing salsa or not getting a whole wheat tortilla -- especially when I order to-go.

The bottom line: Worth checking out, but not my go-to taqueria.

excerpts: I love the tofu mole burrito and of course, the fresh salsa is glorious!
Great for vegetarians and vegans.
mole.author: Regine M.
mole.review: This is by far my favorite mexican food place in the bay! I love the tofu mole burrito and of course, the fresh salsa is glorious! Great for vegetarians and vegans.

excerpts: I was drunk off of mole.
I got the chicken mole quesadilla, and I loved the flour tortilla.
It was light and crisp, with an almost translucent, shiny quality.
I don't know how, but it managed to contain the mass of mole and chicken that was inside.
mole.author: Lucia C.
mole.review:
If anyone in Mission heard a loud asian girl squawking "I'm SO FULL!" yesterday afternoon, that was me.  And I apologize for any disturbance/annoyance I might have caused you on your peaceful Saturday. 

I was drunk off of mole.

My brother and I went, but didn't get the famed 20 dollar burrito. I was afraid a burrito that costs that much would never live up to expectations, although it is supposed to feed two.

We opted instead to get different things, so we could taste more of what Pa Pa Lo Te has to offer, and it definitely didn't disappoint.

My brother got the carne asada burrito, and the meat was thick, tender, well-seasoned, and ABUNDANT. I love a restaurant that can bowl over its customers with its portions and flavor. (Note: I think my family's stomachs are smaller when it comes to some things, so what I think is a huge portion may be normal for others.)

I got the chicken mole quesadilla, and I loved the flour tortilla. It was light and crisp, with an almost translucent, shiny quality. I don't know how, but it managed to contain the mass of mole and chicken that was inside. The meat was steeped in gooey goodness and kept me well-satisfied for the rest of the day.

The roasted tomato salsa actually didn't do much for me. The heat was nice, but otherwise all I tasted was salt and a bit of garlic. Guacamole was good, but nothing supreme.  Fresh tomato salsa had a bit of jicama in it, i think, which was a very thoughtful, refreshing touch - cooled off my mouth nicely. It was fun to get the Mexican bottled Coke, which does taste different from the American stuff.

Service was quick, polite and friendly.  The staff kept the small dining area clean and tidy.

All in all a delicious experience, though since I don't live in the area, I'll probably be trying out all of the surrounding taquerias. 

Suggestions, anyone?

excerpts: I always order the chicken mole burrito
and it's unique and delicious.
Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission?
mole.author: Will A.
mole.review: A bit less traditional than the other taqueria's in the mission, but a nice variation. I always order the chicken mole burrito and it's unique and delicious. Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission? The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy. Gotta love free chips and salsa, and the creamy spicy salsa is delicious.

excerpts: It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo).
mole.author: Danny S.
mole.review:
Ever since i became a vegetarian it has been difficult to find a good legitimate burrito place, that is until i found this place! 
It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo). Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican. Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste! worth the visit!

excerpts: Today ordered a mole tofu burrito with brown rice, refried black beans, cheese, pico de gallo and whole wheat tortilla.
The ingredients blended perfectly.
The tofu was fresh and firm.
And the mole was homey, not overpowering, a rich but thin, hearty gravy that brought everything together.
My kids love the food here, but since we never make it here before sunset, I tend to just order take out for us to eat on the drive home.
The neighborhood isn't necessarily bad, just not family friendly.
And while the staff are fantastic, in the evenings, the customers tend to be grown ups having grown up conversations over alcohol.
mole.author: Mark X.
mole.review: I am vegetarian, mostly vegan, so I am not the best person to rate authentic/traditional Mexican food, which in my experience, is generally not vegetarian or vegan friendly.  That said, I have tried dozens of mom+pop burrito places throughout CA, and Papalote is in a league of their own, light years ahead of the rest.  Today ordered a mole tofu burrito with brown rice, refried black beans, cheese, pico de gallo and whole wheat tortilla.  The ingredients blended perfectly.  The tofu was fresh and firm.  And the mole was homey, not overpowering, a rich but thin, hearty gravy that brought everything together.  My kids love the food here, but since we never make it here before sunset, I tend to just order take out for us to eat on the drive home.  The neighborhood isn't necessarily bad, just not family friendly.  And while the staff are fantastic, in the evenings, the customers tend to be grown ups having grown up conversations over alcohol.

excerpts: I recommend the chile verde chicken burrito and the mole chicken burrito.
I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here.
It is not overpowering or too thick.
I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here.
It is not overpowering or too thick.
mole.author: Joyce L.
mole.review:
LOVE this PLACE! 

The homemade salsa is something I randomly will crave. It is good. 

I recommend the chile verde chicken burrito and the mole chicken burrito. I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here. It is not overpowering or too thick. The tacos are also nice because they come with a lot of lettuce and tomatoes--yay more veggies!

The Triple Threat, which won in Bobby Flay's recent throwdown, is close to $20. I personally don't like eating that much meat in a burrito--so I don't think it's worth it.

excerpts: Don't be put off by the lack of latinos in this place because the mole chicken burrito is legit.
mole.author: Roger H.
mole.review:
Don't be put off by the lack of latinos in this place because the mole chicken burrito is legit. 

Not the best burrito I've had but the healthiest burrio I've ever had because I didn't feel gross afterwards.

excerpts: that orange salsa and chicken mole!!!
its so good
i bought a jar of the salsa to take home...
and you know what it's better than la vic's orange sauce!
mole.author: Mara G.
mole.review: that orange salsa and chicken mole!!! its so good i bought a jar of the salsa to take home... and you know what it's better than la vic's orange sauce!

excerpts: So I've been here previously and found the mole chicken burrito to be meh.
Maybe mole isn't my thing.
mole.author: Bipasha M.
mole.review:
Get the pescado tacos!!  Do it now!

So I've been here previously and found the mole chicken burrito to be meh.  Maybe mole isn't my thing.

Today I decided to be fair and give them another shot.  At $6.75 for two pescado tacos, I was a bit hesitant since I'm trying out that whole "staying on a budget" thing.  But it was SOOOOO worth it.  The fish was freshly sauteed in white wine, butter, and herbs and it had much more flavor than the grilled fish at Nick's.  They also gave a good 0.5 lb of fish split between the two tacos (or maybe I just got lucky).  The crisp lettuce, onions, and tomatoes topping the tacos also tasted fresh and gave a nice cool contrast relative to the warm, buttery fish.

Oh yea, and I've gotta agree with every salsa - it's probably the best I've ever had.

excerpts: The tofu mole is freaking delicious, if a little pricey ($11.50, I believe), and they have a wide variety of options for the meat lover.
The salsa is delicious, the mole is delicious.
They have tofu mole tacos too!
mole.author: Ashley M.
mole.review:
I've only been here once, but any Mexican restaurant that actually caters to vegetarians and vegans while maintaining some degree of "authenticity" is a winner in my book. The tofu mole is freaking delicious, if a little pricey ($11.50, I believe), and they have a wide variety of options for the meat lover.

The salsa was also freakin' delicious, although perhaps not the most "authentic." But, then, isn't the word authentic sometimes a little condescending--not to mention overrated? I think so. The salsa is delicious, the mole is delicious. What more do you need?

I'll be going back. They have tofu mole tacos too!

excerpts: Best ever mole chicken tacos in all of the bay area for sure.
If you are searching mole on Yelp then I hope you opened this post!!!!
mole.author: Naureen H.
mole.review:
I am totally dreaming of this place right now. Best ever mole chicken tacos in all of the bay area for sure. If you are searching mole on Yelp then I hope you opened this post!!!! They serve you warm chips and salsa at your table and you don't feel bad asking for refills. The staff is friendly and its fine with kids too. 

Its clean and doesnt have the greasy smell. Its seriously busy all the time and parking can be a bia but its so totally worth it.

excerpts: I will absolutely go here again, especially to try that tofu mole burrito.
mole.author: Natalie R.
mole.review:
I live about a mile from here so I was waiting for a nice evening to take a walk over and for some reason I chose last night which made little to no sense considering I was debilitated by a lack of sleep and an out of character hangover that left my limbs drooping all day , but I guess I was inspired or I just really needed the sustenance provided by a burrito. 

And I'm glad I chose last night because the soyrizo burrito that I had was pretty-pretty brilliant AND HUGE! I almost ate the whole thing which is f'ed up just because.

 It was very busy inside and though I did have to wait, it wasn't an unreasonable amount of time. I am vegan and the fact that I could not make up my mind on what to get made me kind of happy, considering sometimes I'm just left to eat the one or two things available to tweak on the menu. I will absolutely go here again, especially to try that tofu mole burrito. Sounds like a win.

Cons: place is cramped (though I was there at dinner hour) and my scale told me I weighed 2 more pounds than normal this morning. Coincidence?

excerpts:
The roasted salsa is amazing, as is their mole sauce, and their marinated tofu, and the soyrizo...

tags: vegetarian
mole.author: Nithin R.
mole.review:
The most veg-friendly taqueria I've been to. They have so many veg options, which is good, because we come here at least twice a month. 

The roasted salsa is amazing, as is their mole sauce, and their marinated tofu, and the soyrizo...

tags: vegetarian

excerpts: My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.
mole.author: Mark Y.
mole.review:
When I want a real gourmet sit down burrito in a colorful place with Mexican bug kites on the ceiling, I'll put up with circling around a few times in the Mission to find parking when I come here. I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
 
The fresh and not too salty chipotle salsa, whole wheat tortilla options and ginger soft drinks are also a nice touch.

My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.

excerpts: I had chicken Mole tacos.
Really good mole.
I haven't had good Mole since I moved from L.A.
The third was an order of chicken tacos.
mole.author: Otis D.
mole.review:
In the interest of full disclosure, I went to high school with the owners more than two decades ago.  I'm in the city for a bit and I haven't been in the Mission in a long time and hey, what was that place those guys own?  That's when a Google told me about the Food Network thing so it must be pretty decent.

There were three of us.  I had chicken Mole tacos.  Really good mole. I haven't had good Mole since I moved from L.A.  One Chile Verde Burrito, also really good.  Juicy tender meat with tangy sauce.  The third was an order of chicken tacos. 

I see others on here have mentioned the Salsa.  That stuff may haunt me between visits to S.F. that will hopefully include time to swing by again.   Starts off tomato with roasty smoked flavor and finishes with a good chile spice.  Not a fire eater spice but not for "mild please" weenies either.  And somehow it manages to seem creamy.  I'd like to buy it by the gallon jar.

Congratulations Miguel.  I dig your place and wish you continued success.  And the beer geek in me likes that you have Chimay Rouge in the cooler.

excerpts: I know that when I order a chicken mole burrito sans rice, I should expect, essentially, pollo asada with a hint of earth.
And when I get surprised by what tasted like God & chocolate got together and made roast chicken, I can't really be bothered to give a shit about authenticity.
mole.author: jason l.
mole.review:
What? Five stars for the whitest Mexican food this side of Taco Bell?

You're goddamn right. I earned my Mission Merit Badge back when YOU had no idea what San Francisco looked like after midnight because BART stopped heading to El Cerrito at 11. I had bacon wrapped hot dogs back when you were first hearing about The Tamale Lady (they USED TO BE $2, kids). So don't get pissy with me.

And I love the flavor of lard mixed with unwashed hands as much as the next guy. I've written love notes to taco trucks, and I've gotten ring sting from overzealous jalapenos that've soaked in pepper brine since the Carter Administration. I am more than immune to salmonella. I use it  like a sorority girl uses ranch dressing. 

So I KNOW, see, I know. I know that when I order a chicken mole burrito sans rice, I should expect, essentially, pollo asada with a hint of earth. And when I get surprised by what tasted like God & chocolate got together and made roast chicken, I can't really be bothered to give a shit about authenticity. When the salsa tastes like concentrated Mexican bullion, I'd be a fool to eschew it in favor of the onion & tomato afterthought that comes with thick chips and a hateful attitude at many of the nearby tacotoriums.

These aren't food socks, these are food stockings.

excerpts: This included stopping in to Papalote - whose name just sincerely rrrrolls off the tongue - and ordering a Mole Chicken quesadilla.
I had heard of people liking this place immensely, saying GO, GO, GO!
But I was like "I've been to taquerias, ya'll.
Just chill.
But THIS taqueria IS different.
mole.author: Kelly H.
mole.review:
Dolores Park is maddening on sunny weekends.  I feel that I would rather skin both knees than go to Dolores Park on a sunny Saturday with friends.  With that said, I have been known to give in to peer pressure when there is beer or hookers involved.  In this case, it involved beer and good friends with beards.  And if you know me, you know that I will do almost anything for a fine man with a beard and the chicken fajitas from Chili's. 

Dolores Park, Coors Lights, PBR, temperature drops 20 degrees, smoke something, and so begins my Saturday evening of mystery.  This included stopping in to Papalote - whose name just sincerely rrrrolls off the tongue - and ordering a Mole Chicken quesadilla.  I had heard of people liking this place immensely, saying GO, GO, GO!  But I was like "I've been to taquerias, ya'll.  Just chill."  But THIS taqueria IS different.  It gives you about 12 choices of meat and veggie combos and sorts them in a taco, quesadilla, and burrito menu, making it SUPER EASY to order if you're at all fucked up or stupid.  I cannot wait to go back - seriously the menu is so organized and beautiful it's plain disgusting.  But really, Papalote is plaing GO-OOO-OOD, mang.

excerpts: My friend got the chicken mole, and that was delicious too.
They have amazingly fresh and tasty guac.
mole.author: Xavier G.
mole.review:
This food was amazing! I got the shrimp burrito and it was the most delicious shrimp burrito I've ever had. My friend got the chicken mole, and that was delicious too. They have amazingly fresh and tasty guac. And lots of Mexican drink choices to choose from.

They even messed up on my burrito and forgot to make it. So I was waiting for 30 minutes for no reason whatsoever. I told them about it, and they told me they'd make it right away, and I got it in 5 minutes, which was nice. They were super apologetic, apologized to me 3 times even as we were leaving, which was pretty nice. But it was well worth waiting 35 minutes because it tasted heavenly, haha. I kind of wish they gave me a free drink or something to make up for it, but oh well...

excerpts: I believe I had mole sauce before but not knowing that Chocolate was one of the main ingredients.
Thanks to all those food traveling shows
I was anxious to test out their mole sauce with Tofu.
BTW, you can also order the mole sauce with chicken.
I know this is weird
but I don't like to have rice or beans in my burrito
On my first bite i was pleasantly surprised by the sweet taste of the mole sauce.
You can taste the chocolate!
The sour cream and guacamole did not overwhelm the mole sauce at all.
I actually finished the burrito since I kept wanting the taste of the mole sauce.
Now I'm going to try mole sauce at different restaurant to see if what I had was the real thing.
mole.author: Morgan L.
mole.review:
Second visit to Papalote and still happy with their quality and taste.   On my first try I had the Soyrizo Burrito per my bf's suggestion.  It was filling, tasty and I was surprised how Soyrizo tasted like Chorizo.  On this trip, I wanted to try something new and different.   I believe I had mole sauce before but not knowing that Chocolate was one of the main ingredients.   Thanks to all those food traveling shows I was anxious to test out their mole sauce with Tofu.  BTW, you can also order the mole sauce with chicken.  I know this is weird but I don't like to have rice or beans in my burrito (I guess I'm more of a fajita girl) so I usually add sour cream and guacamole instead. 

On my first bite i was pleasantly surprised by the sweet taste of the mole sauce.  You can taste the chocolate!   The sour cream and guacamole did not overwhelm the mole sauce at all.   I actually finished the burrito since I kept wanting the taste of the mole sauce.  Now I'm going to try mole sauce at different restaurant to see if what I had was the real thing.   

The homemade salsa was not too spicy but complimented the chips and burritos very well.   You can even buy a jar of the salsa for $5.99.   It's that good.

excerpts: Said friend is vegan, so I suggested Papalote, since they have tofu options, soyrizo, and vegan mole.
We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.
So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!
Without drinks.
But whatever.
I tell her it's really good
and I fork over some money.
So the food is brought out and I get the shrip
and I say FUCK--
what I really wanted was Prawns.
mole.author: Biggie M.
mole.review:
Once upon a time I wrote a glowing review for Papalote.  You can read it.   I once gave Papalote 4 stars.  It's beneath the astrix.

Here is my updated review for Papalote.

I took a good friend of mine who lives in Oakland, has a kid and never gets out of the house to the Mission.  We had an erreand to run but she was craving a good Mission Burrito.  Said friend is vegan, so I suggested Papalote, since they have tofu options, soyrizo, and vegan mole. 

We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.  So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!  Without drinks.  But whatever.  I tell her it's really good and I fork over some money.  So the food is brought out and I get the shrip and I say FUCK--what I really wanted was Prawns.  
Maybe it's due to me being an unsophisticted Mid-westerner, but I ordered shrimp not expecting them to be those tiney nasty thing but the big jumbo ones.  

I went to the counter and told the manager and he said tough luck.  I was kind of incredulous.  You think if someone has just spent a shitload of money--22 BUCKS for ONE MEAL at a fucking taqueria you could throw three prawns at them.  he was just an asshole and said you ordered wrong too bad.  So I walked back and spit out my WINE AND BUTTER soaked nasty ass shrimp that had no flavor.  

Then they brought the fajitas out and they gave us ONE tortilla and I was so pissed by then I couldn't even complain for fear they guy would be like--"well it only comes with one tortilla--tough."

So I left the place so pissed because I really wanted my FAVORITE taqueria to be my friend's favorite new place and maybe she would like it enough to come into the city more.

I was so upset that I decided to call the manager--who was the rude guy to complain--and guess what he was a dick then too.  I even told him that it was my favorite taqueria and instead of eating near my school in Potrero Hill sometimes--there are porbably 20 taqueria between it and Papalote I truck there.  

I was a regular customer--but that's what shitty customer service can do.  I'll miss you Papalote--or at least your PRAWNS.

I

**************************************************************************



At Papalote i like to order a plate with shrimp (STRIKE THIS APPARANTLY THEY ARE PRAWNS), beans, rice and guac.

That's it.

It's really good and filling.  It ends up being more expensive than an acutal burrito which is annoying.    However I keep ordering it like that, because that's how I like to eat it.

Their beans are the best--and vegan too which pleases many of my picky picky friends.  I like to take out and eat on the steps of the scary church with the big neon cross across Valencia Street.

excerpts: I was mildly surprised by the interesting 'Mexicant' menu, including healthy options like soyrizo and vegan mole.
I was even more surprised after having a burrito there, that I not only liked it...
mole.author: Satoru Y.
mole.review:
A white-washed tacqueria owned and run by Mexicans; go figure...it's still great.

If other taquerias in the city, like El Castillito, were home-slobs sporting a greasy wife-beater, then Papalote would be their alluring and demure cousin.  I remember the first time I stumbled upon this modern-looking, hipster tacqueria on a night roaming the Outer Mission.  Hipster places springing up in the Mission is akin to pissing on gremlins: I guess only children of the 80's may get this reference.  I was mildly surprised by the interesting 'Mexicant' menu, including healthy options like soyrizo and vegan mole. I was even more surprised after having a burrito there, that I not only liked it...I loved it.

Myself, being a carnivore, love all of the meaty servings that they have to offer.  I personally love their Carne Asada and Chile Verde Burritos.  They are very flavorful, and not heavy at all: A combination in a burrito that you would think would cause a paradox that would unravel space-time.  However, it all works to me, and it doesn't feel I ate a truck when I leave.  Also, their Salsa is deserving of all the accolodates that it receives.

Delicious and health-conscious food, reminds me of what I miss about the city the most.

excerpts: & Tofu Mole!
It is a vegetarian/vegan dream.
It is not authentic Mexican food but it is the next best thing.
The salsa is wonderful & creamy, a nice change to the standard salsa.
The downfall...
I have seen a cockroach crawling around on the inside of the window, while I ate (but that is why 3 stars only).
But lets get real for a  second,  aren't cockroaches everywhere?
mole.author: Shannon Z.
mole.review:
Soyrizo!!!  & Tofu Mole! It is a vegetarian/vegan dream. It is not authentic Mexican food but it is the next best thing.  The salsa is wonderful & creamy, a nice change to the standard salsa. The downfall...I have seen a cockroach crawling around on the inside of the window, while I ate (but that is why 3 stars only). But lets get real for a  second,  aren't cockroaches everywhere? Also sometimes the line is long or there is a lack of seating.

in summary:
healthy,
tasty,
veg friendly,
cheap, 
and worth your visit (and sometimes wait)

excerpts: But our soyrizo, pollo asado, and chicken mole quesadillas were taking an eternity.
The soyrizo quesadilla was excellent.
The chicken mole fantastic.
But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night.
The chicken mole fantastic.
But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night.
mole.author: Jenny K.
mole.review:
Hm. This is a tough one for me. The food is so fresh and tasty and the salsa insanely good, but the service, incomprehensibly long wait and nickel-and-diming are absurd.

We came here to grab some food  to-go before Dolores Park Movie Night. Little did we know that it would take 30 MINUTES for our order to be ready. Does it really take that long to make three quesadillas? Really? 

The lady at the cash register is also not friendly. She is the Mexican Food Nazi with scary eyebrows to match. We adore the salsa (shit, I could drink the stuff it's so freakin' good!) and asked for extra chips to go with the jar we were buying. She shook her head, "No extra chips," and told us each little scoop cost $1. $1!!! 

We stood around and watched order after order (by people who ordered AFTER us, by the way) go out the door. But our soyrizo, pollo asado, and chicken mole quesadillas were taking an eternity. 

When we finally got our food 30 minutes later, it was almost worth the wait. ALMOST. The soyrizo quesadilla was excellent. The chicken mole fantastic. But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night. And let's not forget that the food is over-priced. 

I am going to have to try the one on Fulton. It's closer to where I live and I am hoping the service and wait are better than the Mission location.

excerpts: I was never thrilled with their mole, and their breakfast burrito was way too salty for my tastes--possibly worse than Chipotle, which says a lot.
mole.author: Marsha Z.
mole.review:
I was never thrilled with their mole, and their breakfast burrito was way too salty for my tastes--possibly worse than Chipotle, which says a lot.  Still, they're unique in their offerings; the chips are great, as is their in-house salsa; and not counting the usual beans, rice and salsa burrito, there are just too few mexican joints with such a large menu for the veggie crowd.  

I've always considered Mariachi's, just a BART stop away, the place to satiate any vegetarian burrito craving in the Mission.  But Papalote is a close second.

excerpts: My favorite dish here is the chicken mole burrito, super.
I'm a fan of ordering ahead and taking a jar of their salsa back with me.
Enjoy!
mole.author: Deborah E.
mole.review: There are so many options in this city for great burritos, but Papalote is the best!  Their amazing salsa sets them apart from every other place out there.  My favorite dish here is the chicken mole burrito, super.  I'm a fan of ordering ahead and taking a jar of their salsa back with me.  Enjoy!

excerpts: As for the good, vegans can eat here (which seems to make them happy at least), they make a tasty mole chicken/tofu filling and the meat grilled to order is a fine touch(though marinating the beef would improve it greatly), the salsa is good (not the amazing miracle
mole.author: Gustie L.
mole.review:
Some may disrespect Papalote 'cause it's "inauthentic" -- I don't care, nor do I even know what that means in the context of a bastardized hybrid such as the Burrito.  Papalote should offer a great burrito, it wins "burrito of the year" in the weeklies all the time, and there's a line out the door most nights.  Sadly though, it offers only a middling burrito, elements of which are excellent, but which overall fails to hold together (literally if you order in house and the unwrapped log is served to you on a plate).

What do I mean, how can I blaspheme so?  What I mean is that the rice is often clumpy and unspiced, the beans mediocre at best, there's sometimes odd "salt strata" in the filling, the lines are murder - cramped, endless murder, the prices are a bit dear, and worst of all, I've been given stale chips of several occasions [ the stale chip problem seems to have vanished as of 8/1/07].   As for the good, vegans can eat here (which seems to make them happy at least), they make a tasty mole chicken/tofu filling and the meat grilled to order is a fine touch(though marinating the beef would improve it greatly), the salsa is good (not the amazing miracle some claim, but tasty).

Thus, I approve on principle and like some touches (the owner is a nice guy as well), but since they don't really need my approval, or my burrito dollar, and there are some intolerable inconsistencies at Papalote, I'm going elsewhere these days.

excerpts: I am not a fan of the chicken mole burrito.
It lacks flavor.
The time I had one, my beans were a bit under cooked, the rice mushy, and the mole flavor not present at all.
mole.author: Angelica S.
mole.review: I have been to El Papalote a few times. If you order grilled chicken or beef burritos, this place is clearly a 4/5. I like that you can make it super for 99 cents, which includes guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. The complementary chips and salsa are great. I am not a fan of the chicken mole burrito. It lacks flavor. The time I had one, my beans were a bit under cooked, the rice mushy, and the mole flavor not present at all.

excerpts: Mole sauce is the way to my heart.
mole.author: Laura F.
mole.review:
I have eaten approximately 300 burritos in my life.  These are consistently the best ones.

Salsa has been one of my top 5 favorite condiments of all time for about 15 years.  This is the best salsa I have ever had.

Mole sauce is the way to my heart.  I am waiting for Papalote to propose.

Also, they have beer.

I have nothing more to say, really.

excerpts: After perusing the menu board, I settled on the chicken mole burrito with black refried beans on a whole wheat tortilla.
It was tasty but didn't have the distinct mole flavor I was expecting.
I will say that their burritos are the perfect size.
mole.author: Z. M.
mole.review:
I heard about this burrito joint by word of mouth. I stopped by after school one day around five o'clock. The line that I read about in other Yelpers' reviews was non-existant, probably owing to fact that I went around 'tain't time ('tain't lunch, 'tain't dinner).

The lady who greeted me and took my order was extremely friendly and patient while I made up my mind.

After perusing the menu board, I settled on the chicken mole burrito with black refried beans on a whole wheat tortilla. It was tasty but didn't have the distinct mole flavor I was expecting. I will say that their burritos are the perfect size. Not too small, and not too huge as to put one into an instant burrito coma.

The salsa is outstanding - creamy and packing a spicy kick. I only wish the chips were better. They tasted like mass market tortilla chips. I much prefer the freshly fried tortilla chips some other burrito joints serve.

I look forward to trying a different kind of burrito and ordering extra salsa on my next visit.

excerpts: My favorite thing to order is the Chicken Mole.
Now, I'm no mole-expert, but I enjoy the hell out of this one.
The salsa is pretty much the best salsa I've ever had.
I even tried to mail myself a few jars
(Goddamn you, FedEx!).
I am to understand that the soy-rizo is excellent, also, but I'm stuck on the mole.
mole.author: Matt C.
mole.review:
God do I love Papalote. To the extent that I sometimes have to stop myself from flying to SFO to lunch. I was pointed here by a dear friend months ago, and her suggestion was bolstered - deservingly so - by the reviews here.  Boy am I glad that I made that trip!

 My favorite thing to order is the Chicken Mole. Now, I'm no mole-expert, but I enjoy the hell out of this one. The salsa is pretty much the best salsa I've ever had. I even tried to mail myself a few jars (Goddamn you, FedEx!). I am to understand that the soy-rizo is excellent, also, but I'm stuck on the mole. Add a mexican Coke to the mix, and it's perfect.

Atmosphere wise, I really dig the place, too. it's small, but clean and comfortable. It doesn't feel super-hip inside, nor is it some filthy shithole. It's also very conveniently located to my favorite mode of mass-transport, BART.

If you can't tell, I love Papalote. I think it's reputation is well-deserved, and you should at least check it out once.

excerpts: The burritos are good too, although I got a chicken mole quesadilla
a couple of weeks ago
and I think it was a mistake.
I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.
I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.
mole.author: Melanie B.
mole.review:
Best salsa everrrrrrrrrrr (*sings*)!

The fish tacos are a-ma-zing.  I went here with a friend and thought a burrito would be too much so I opted for the tacos instead... So.  Much.  Food.  So yummy!  The last time I had fish tacos this good was in San Felipe (apparently the home of the fish taco...)!

Nom-nom-nom-full-full-full.

The burritos are good too, although I got a chicken mole quesadilla a couple of weeks ago and I think it was a mistake.  I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.  Either way, I have liked everything else I have eaten here.

The prices are perhaps a couple of dollars more than I would want to pay in an ideal world, but it doesn't stop me going back again and again because I loves it!  Oh and remember, if you have some of that salsa left by the time your food comes, throw some of it on those fish tacos, it's too good to waste!

excerpts: I had the chicken mole burrito, which was not only outstanding, but came to the table
MAYBE ten minutes after we ordered at the counter.
The mole is chocolaty and fantastic, but the real discovery of the day was...
ba ba ba baaaaa.....
the roasted salsa.
wow.
Probably the best salsa I've ever had, and kids, I grew up here.
I've had a bazillion types of salsa.
I'm a fan, maybe an aficionado.
This wins, hands down, as most perfectly spiced / roasted / blended salsa this side of...
well....anywhere.
We picked up an extra jar of it to take home and nibble with chips for dinner.
mole.author: Emily H.
mole.review:
On a recommendation, we stopped in for a late lunch after a long day in the city.  

We managed to get a parking spot right in front, which proved to be an omen of even better fortune inside.

I had the chicken mole burrito, which was not only outstanding, but came to the table MAYBE ten minutes after we ordered at the counter.  The mole is chocolaty and fantastic, but the real discovery of the day was...ba ba ba baaaaa.....the roasted salsa.  wow.  Probably the best salsa I've ever had, and kids, I grew up here.  I've had a bazillion types of salsa.  I'm a fan, maybe an aficionado.  This wins, hands down, as most perfectly spiced / roasted / blended salsa this side of...well....anywhere.

We picked up an extra jar of it to take home and nibble with chips for dinner.

excerpts: The Mole is overcooked and has a strong basic taste in it.
mole.author: Matthew F.
mole.review:
I fucking hate vegetarian "wannabe" food with a passion.
Veggie Burgers, Veggie Dogs, Soy Bacon; you can go fuck yourselves.

So I see and hear people rave about the soyrizo, and I am forced to try it.

Holy. Shit.

Better than any chorizo I've ever had. 
The Camarones (Shrimp) is light, blends nicely with the spices and rice, and just feels enjoyable to eat, perfect for not feeling like a sweaty piece of shit afterwards like most other Mexican places, which will keep you on the toilet so long you'll get new honeycombs on your jeans.

In fact, none of these burritos is going to weigh you down. 

The Mole is overcooked and has a strong basic taste in it. Meh.

They sell salsa by the pint in mason jars for $5.95, and I keep it constantly stocked in my fridge. It varies in spice from day to day, but no matter how hot it is, it's a crazy, unique, amazing salsa that I can't figure out the contents of.  Perfect for snacking, and can hold up it's own as a condiment against sriricha.

excerpts:
if it wasnt so pricey and they were more consistent about how many chips you get with take out orders i would give them 5 stars
the chicken mole burritos are out of this world
and i dont even really like chicken!!!!!!!!!
mole.author: beth m.
mole.review:
if it wasnt so pricey and they were more consistent about how many chips you get with take out orders i would give them 5 stars
the chicken mole burritos are out of this world
and i dont even really like chicken!!!!!!!!!

excerpts: Mole chicken tacos are damn good.
Great mole sauce that leaves the essence of chocolate in your mouth.
mole.author: Mona M.
mole.review:
I've been meaning to drop in here but there's always a line and I'm always in a hurry.  Finally had lunch here. Mole chicken tacos are damn good. Great mole sauce that leaves the essence of chocolate in your mouth.  Wonderfully ripe produce in the tacos. 

Super pleased with the flavor, the quantity and the price. And it's so close to my flat.

excerpts: I am a HUGE fan of the vegan mole burrito with guac.
Srsly.
Get it.
I don't care if you're vegan, you will LOVE it.
mole.author: Jennifer L.
mole.review:
Holy Vegan Deliciousness Batman!  

I am a HUGE fan of the vegan mole burrito with guac.  Srsly.  Get it.  I don't care if you're vegan, you will LOVE it.  *wow*  

Reasonably priced, ridiculously tasty food, and generally friendly service.  The only downside?  It gets SUPER crowded at dinner time, and it's hard to find a place to stand to wait to get your food, and the dining room is so small the wait is quite a while for a table.  Still, I heart Papalote.

excerpts: A TOFU MOLE BURRITO.
Miguel's mole has to be some of the best I have had outside of my friend's grandma in LA.
The salsa is bomb!
The service is quick and I have yet to try something on their menu that is not to my liking.
Local artists hang their stuff here--
it is
a must go to when in the mission (or near fullton)
mole.author: Vicky T.
mole.review: When I go to the mission (or near Masonic) when I am in SF I HAVE TO GET A TOFU MOLE BURRITO. Miguel's mole has to be some of the best I have had outside of my friend's grandma in LA. The salsa is bomb! The service is quick and I have yet to try something on their menu that is not to my liking. Local artists hang their stuff here-- it is a must go to when in the mission (or near fullton)

excerpts: i have to say i was impressed with the mole's.
very good.
I'd go back.
the place itself was small and did think it was a tad pricey for the location/size/ambiance.
sevice could've been better.
our table was barely wiped before we sat down.
close quarters with your neighbors.
all good.
i'd go back though, fo sho.
mole.author: Nichole D.
mole.review:
I'd have to say that this place isn't THE best Mexican ever, but i feel that it's one the best Mexican restaurants in San Fran.
my friend who lives in the hood took me there..i have to say i was impressed with the mole's. very good. I'd go back. the place itself was small and did think it was a tad pricey for the location/size/ambiance. sevice could've been better. our table was barely wiped before we sat down.  close quarters with your neighbors. all good.
i'd go back though, fo sho.

excerpts: the chicken mole.
it was good, but I can't help but think I chose my own adventure
and I chose wrong.
mole is very difficult to pull off especially at $6.95.
mole.author: Gabe b.
mole.review:
sometimes I get a little too adventurous when deep down I know sticking to the basics is the way to go. 
In this case, I went w/ the chicken mole. it was good, but I can't help but think I chose my own adventure and I chose wrong. mole is very difficult to pull off especially at $6.95. 

That being said the salsa is legit as most folks have pointed out and the other dishes that my dining companions ate where delicious. 
definitely coming back here for a 2nd chance.

excerpts: The salsa is in fact fantastic (I thought of mole more than salsa) and almost worth the whole visit.
mole.author: Arwen O.
mole.review:
The salsa is in fact fantastic (I thought of mole more than salsa) and almost worth the whole visit. Apparently the shrimp quesadillas are amazing (none for me, thank you!) and the carne asada was drool-worthy. I had no idea this place was so famous, and I'm glad I didn't, because I was able to relish my meal without the hype leering around the corner.

The 2nd grade class' architectural drawings decorating the walls like gallery art were also a highlight. AND they have Dos Equis on tap.

excerpts: I had the tofu mole
but I thought the mole sauce was a bit overbearing.
However, I like how "light and healthy" I felt after eating the entire burrito.
mole.author: Tiffany L.
mole.review:
The place was packed and lines were out of the door.  I was lucky since my friends already got seats by the time I got there.

I had the tofu mole but I thought the mole sauce was a bit overbearing. However, I like how "light and healthy" I felt after eating the entire burrito.   Also, the chips and salsa were warm and spicy.

My friends had chicken quesadillas and loved it.

An eclectic Mexican joint for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike!

excerpts: I ordered the mole chicken burrito since it looked different.
mole.author: Vivian L.
mole.review:
We came to pick up our orders then go to my friend's house nearby for dinner. I'm not sure if it's normal, but after placing our order, we waited an hour for our take out food. I get that they make each order when ordered, but still, we were freaking starving. It didn't help that it was during that heat wave last month so it was freaking hot in there like summertime in Mexico.

Anyways, onto the food. I ordered the mole chicken burrito since it looked different. During my hour wait, I read articles talking about the fake chorizo which I would try next time I went, if I go again.

The chips and salsa were good, but not worth the hour wait. 

Since I don't live in the Mission, I probably wouldn't come back here next time since there are so many Mexican places to try. But there were lots of locals in there that day, so I can see how it can be a neighborhood favorite, just not mine.

excerpts: Did not like mole chicken
Was not happy about the hype of this place =(
mole.author: Tiff W.
mole.review: Did not like mole chicken :/ Was not happy about the hype of this place =(

excerpts: Had a great soyrizo burrito (and half of my friend's mole burrito) and it was really delicious!
mole.author: Susan D.
mole.review: Had a great soyrizo burrito (and half of my friend's mole burrito) and it was really delicious! Loved the chips and salsa that's made from fire roasted tomatoes which comes with your burrito. It's a little pricier than your average taqueria but worth it since their vegan options are incredibly tasty.

excerpts: i had the chicken mole burrito and literally couldn't stop eating until it was all gone...
and it's a big sucker!
i liked the radish (i think?)
mole.author: Andrey C.
mole.review:
a solid four stars for the food and for trying their best to manage the crowds... the staff really tries to make sure everything's orderly. the only thing they can't always control is how long people decide to dilly-dally at the table after their food has been eaten and plates practically cleared away, oblivious to others who are waiting. come on now, people!

the food was very fulfilling with lots of meat and flavor. i had the chicken mole burrito and literally couldn't stop eating until it was all gone... and it's a big sucker! i liked the radish (i think?) condiment they and of course those famous chips and salsa... it's more along the lines of a creamy looking spicy sauce than a pico de gallo but so nice!

anyway, next time around i'll probably just do pick-up and go home.

excerpts: Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.)
mole.author: Sharon G.
mole.review:
