This is my favorite Mexican restaurant ever.  The salsa is fabulous.  Too bad they give it to you in teeny tiny little containers and then charge you for more--  but hey, it's worth it.  I would probably sit there all day and eat chips and salsa if it was free.

I love the veggie tacos (potatoes, carrots, mushrooms in a corn tortilla).  Everything always tastes fresh.  I love that everything isn't smothered in cheese, either.  Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.) I even brought my mom here and she loved it, too!

And parking sucks, but that's to be expected.

excerpts: I had a mole which was delicious and my friend had a soy/veggie one which was spiced really well.
It was a decent price but a little more expensive
mole.author: Michelle S.
mole.review:
EXCELLENT burritos.  I had a mole which was delicious and my friend had a soy/veggie one which was spiced really well.  It was a decent price but a little more expensive then i am use to for a burrito.

Nice atmosphere, little space to sit and enjoy the meal.  It was PACKED when i was there.  I recommend this place especially if you like mexican food!

excerpts: Every bite of my tofu mole burrito was hot and delicious with those amazing Papalote black refried beans!
mole.author: Britt M.
mole.review:
You have to wait here for your burrito on most nights, sometimes for quite awhile....but it's worth it for that flaky grilled tortilla filled with perfection!

Every bite of my tofu mole burrito was hot and delicious with those amazing Papalote black refried beans!

The salsa here will ROCK your world...there's something in it for everyone...heat, flavor, and spice!

excerpts: Their mole is awesome!
I just wish the place was bigger as it can get crowded and hard to find a seat.
mole.author: J R.
mole.review: One of the best taquerias in SF.  Their mole is awesome!  I just wish the place was bigger as it can get crowded and hard to find a seat.

excerpts: The vegan mole with tofu is pretty good too.
The atmosphere is pretty much your typical Mission hole with a casual vibe.
The only thing I'd improve on is the order first and wait for something to open up style of self seating .
I don't like eating and watching a half dozen people
stare me down in the hope of making me swallow my food faster.
mole.author: P.J. D.
mole.review: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, never have been, but this place is pretty good.  Great grilled vegetable fajitas with grilled chicken.  I've had most of the quesadillas on the menu and liked them all.  The vegan mole with tofu is pretty good too.  The atmosphere is pretty much your typical Mission hole with a casual vibe.  The only thing I'd improve on is the order first and wait for something to open up style of self seating .  I don't like eating and watching a half dozen people stare me down in the hope of making me swallow my food faster.

excerpts: Got chicken mole tacos, churizo/cheese dipping appetizer thingy and guacamole.
mole.author: Sarah G.
mole.review:
Delicioso! Wanted a good burrito place where we could sit down and not feel like we're in one of the in-n-out, i'm probably drunk, burrito places all over the mission. 

Got chicken mole tacos, churizo/cheese dipping appetizer thingy and guacamole. Highly recommend all 3! 

seating can be a pain, the whole stalking people eating and jumping on a table when they're getting up, but it's worth it.

excerpts: I have also tried the vegan mole tacos which were a tad salty but super yummy and the mole burrito which was a little drippy but good also.
mole.author: Linda L.
mole.review:
Papalote is in my speed dial.

I am sure that there are many tasty tasty things that they make at Papalote.  But the Super Soyrizo Burrito is SO good that I can't bring myself to order anything else.  

I always have a really hard time because the salsa is also SO good... and I want to fill up on chips and salsa before the burrito comes and then it's even harder to finish the whole thing.  If I go alone next time, and no one's looking, perhaps I'll just drink the salsa and skip the chips... 

Seriously though, it is often distressing to me because I wish I could eat a whole super burrito without getting to the pants unbuttoning level of stuffed-ness.  Don't get me wrong, I still eat the whole thing, it's hard to stop, I just deal with the consequences.

I have also tried the vegan mole tacos which were a tad salty but super yummy and the mole burrito which was a little drippy but good also.

I wish it were open later than 10.

excerpts: On this particular occasion I chose the chicken mole, a nice blend of salt and spice, mixed in well with healthy black beans and really good rice, some of the best black rice I've had around the Bay Area and that says a lot.
My buddy swears by the griilled chicken, and rates this as one of the top burrito places in the Mission.
mole.author: Hubert H.
mole.review:
Excellent choice for a 'higher-end' burrito, just one block down from the 24th Street BART station for about $5-6. On this particular occasion I chose the chicken mole, a nice blend of salt and spice, mixed in well with healthy black beans and really good rice, some of the best black rice I've had around the Bay Area and that says a lot. My buddy swears by the griilled chicken, and rates this as one of the top burrito places in the Mission.

I reserved inserting that '5th star' just because, I don't know, a 5-star place should be really really awesome, and this probably is a really awesome, but I can't say that I was blown away, but then again, I don't know how a burrito could blow me away.

The place is colorful and filled with young idealists, the type who read Kant and look like they want to make a difference in the world. Oh wait, that was me. S***.

The only thing that bothered me was the water cooler, whose knob you had to turn 10 times, only to get it to spout  water at a flow rate slower than the Mississippi, or perhaps like a guy who has a hard time peeing. Perhaps it's a ruse to get you to buy a drink there. Sorry, I'm a cheapo.

excerpts: They do make fresh and comparatively healthier Mexican fare with interesting burrito options like chili verde and mole with chicken or tofu.
mole.author: Kathryn M.
mole.review: Known within my household as Papa-slo-te, because they must be some kind of union at the rate they out put a burrito.  They do make fresh and comparatively healthier Mexican fare with interesting burrito options like chili verde and mole with chicken or tofu.  Also, pretty good fish tacos, a rarity of the Mission, but not Baja style. Helpful hints:  at lunch time the strollers descend from the hilltop of Noe Valley and fill up the room, it will take you about 20-30 min. after ordering to get your food, and they will charge you something crazy for a side of guacamole.  Lastly, I feel like you kind of deserve it if you feel ripped off after dropping $20 on a burrito, even if you saw it on the TV, so stick to the menu that doesn't sound crazy and you should be fine.

excerpts: I got the chicken mole burrito.
Definitely go there again.
My friend got the breakfast burrito and said it wasn't that good.
mole.author: josh m.
mole.review: awesome food. I got the chicken mole burrito. Definitely go there again. My friend got the breakfast burrito and said it wasn't that good.

excerpts: TOFU MOLE TACOS!!!
mole.author: JC R.
mole.review:
Yum. Yum. YUM!!!

Hey you could probably find a more "authentic" taqueria in the mission, but they probably don't have delicious roasted habanero salsa. And Soyrizo tacos. And most importantly...TOFU MOLE TACOS!!!

2 taco's are 4 bucks, and you get the tortilla chips and habenero salsa gratis. Plus like most of the taqueria's in the mission they have other delicious things...like real sugar-cane coke in a glass bottle.

Love it.

excerpts: Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling.
mole.author: Danielle M.
mole.review: The chips and salsa are everything they are hyped to be! Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling. You even have the option of plain, whole wheat or spinach tortillas. Make sure to order extra salsa!

excerpts: david got my favorite (mole)..
mole.author: Art A.
mole.review:
went here for lunch yesterday and had chilaquiles which were pretty good. i made the mistake of getting my second favorite dish that my mom makes (chilaquiles) and david got my favorite (mole).. of course im always underwhelmed when i try these dishes cuz my moms is soooo bomb!

but still good, AMAZING salsa, would def go back.

excerpts: Pork roasted to perfection, Mole sauce which is both tangy and sweet.
mole.author: Jai D.
mole.review:
So I tell my friends and family they are the reasons why I came back to live in SF, but this place just might be the REAL reason.  What is the REAL reason, moist, spicy, firm burritos which I found to be darn near perfect at Papalote.

Oh ya, you all know where to get the best burrito, but do you know where to get the perfect burrito?  Oh ya, that is what I am talking about.  Pork roasted to perfection, Mole sauce which is both tangy and sweet.  Oh yes, my friend, we have here a culinary delight of epic perorations just around the corner from where I live and aint it sweet.

When love has failed me and the job is causing me to look fondly at my neglected Passport, I saunter down to Papalote for a feast that tantalizes the eye as well as the soul.

Oh, don't forget to try their Mexican sodas as they actually complement the burrito with its sweetness and over the top flavor.

excerpts: It's not the cheapest place for Mexican vittles, but the chicken mole burrito can totally get it.
mole.author: Charlotte M.
mole.review:
It's not the cheapest place for Mexican vittles, but the chicken mole burrito can totally get it.  

And the salsa.  

I'm not coming here again, though, to do take out.  Screw the 20 minute wait.  Dining with friends?  For sure.

excerpts: Mole was decent.
mole.author: Blanco N.
mole.review: Cafeteria-style ordering. Large portions. Pretty good food. Mole was decent.

excerpts: The most amazing chicken mole burrito.
(If you prefer you can get tofu mole instead.)
I always get Super Chicken Mole burrito with black beans.
It is my Go-
To favorite burrito in the entire bay area.
To me, this burrito is addictive as crack.
I always get Super Chicken Mole burrito with black beans.
It is my Go-
To favorite burrito in the entire bay area.
To me, this burrito is addictive as crack.
After tax, I think it ends up being around 9 bucks for a Super Mole Chicken Burrito.
After tax, I think it ends up being around 9 bucks for a Super Mole Chicken Burrito.
mole.author: P. D.
mole.review:
From reading some of the other reviews I see that Papalote was on the Food Network or something. I didn't see the show and don't go there because of it.

I've been eating at Papalote for the past 1.5 years and eat there at least once every other week. 

Pros: 

1) The most amazing chicken mole burrito. (If you prefer you can get tofu mole instead.) I always get Super Chicken Mole burrito with black beans. It is my Go-To favorite burrito in the entire bay area. To me, this burrito is addictive as crack. I drive from Burlingame to San Francisco sometimes just to eat this burrito.

2) The orange salsa that comes with your chips. They are pretty famous for this salsa. It's pretty hot but not enough to be super uncomfortable. It almost tastes creamy but there are no dairy products in it. Just pumpkin seeds or something like that.

3) Well located, just a 2 block walk west on 24th Street from the 24th Street Bart, right across the street from the gas station at Valencia and 24th Street. Hard to miss since I think it is currently painted orange.

Cons: 

1) Really small and waits of around 30 minutes during busy times until you actually are eating your food. Hard to get a table. Best thing to do is order on the phone about 20 minutes ahead of time and then go 'cut' in line by picking up your food at the right-most register. It's so satisfying to pseudo cut in line and get your food to go.

2) Crowd seems a little too trendy for my tastes. 

3) Price is a little high for a burrito, but you get what you pay for. After tax, I think it ends up being around 9 bucks for a Super Mole Chicken Burrito.

4) AFAIK, no delivery, which would be awesome.

excerpts: My friend got the mole chicken quesadilla which was super delicious.
mole.author: Lindsay E.
mole.review:
My boyfriend and I knew we had to get some Mexican food when we were visiting since it's the one culinary category we are really lacking good restaurants in in Boston. We trusted our friend from Palo Alto who had read good reviews about this place and she did not disappoint us. 

The place was crowded,  a good sign for 7 on a Saturday night. We ordered at the cash register and were seated rather quickly, though slightly awkwardly as we had to share table space with another group of 3. They had real Mexican Coke which the bf and friend were super hyped about. They brought us out yummy fresh chips and salsa to start. I got an aguas frescas which was pretty good, though a little too sweet. My friend got the mole chicken quesadilla which was super delicious. I got the amazing fish tacos which were too stuffed to pick up and eat, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. The fish was sautéed with white wine and butter, a pleasant change from the fried I am used to. The bf got a fish burrito, probably the biggest burrito I have ever seen and it was delicious to boot. He definitely paid a little bit later for eating the whole thing.

excerpts: I'll stick with Pancho Villa's Super Burrito, or head to San Jalisco for their awesome mole, and go to El Metate for some great fish tacos.
mole.author: R.B. W.
mole.review: Not sure what all the fuss is about.  The place is cramped, not so clean, and devoid of personality.  I've heard people raving about the place, and finally had dinner there.  But wow...totally and completely underwhelmed.  I head out for Mex at least a couple times a week, but won't be revisiting Paplote.  Perhaps the buzz is because they offer vegan or soyrizo alternatives?  Even the much-vaunted salsa?  Meh. The food was okay, but way too much rice in the burrito, and perhaps three shrimp.  For a $11 burrito, I felt rooked.  I'll stick with Pancho Villa's Super Burrito, or head to San Jalisco for their awesome mole, and go to El Metate for some great fish tacos.

excerpts: Tofu mole burritos are super yummy , and the Soyrizo is delicious !
Both are my fav's !
Yes it's a tiny place and can be pretty crowded , and
yes you'll have to wait abit , they aren't the fastest around !
It's all about the taste !
PS - you can buy that salsa to go to in a quart jar , supreme !
mole.author: Michael B.
mole.review: Really love this place.  Like everyone else say's about the salsa , it's pretty awesome ! Tofu mole burritos are super yummy , and the Soyrizo is delicious !  Both are my fav's ! Yes it's a tiny place and can be pretty crowded , and yes you'll have to wait abit , they aren't the fastest around ! It's all about the taste ! A+ !  PS - you can buy that salsa to go to in a quart jar , supreme !

excerpts: I LOVE their chicken mole.
mole.author: Bethany C.
mole.review:
I LOVE their chicken mole. Sometimes I wake up in the middle of the night craving it!

Best in the city by far. The owner is super nice and always remembers me.

Thanks!

excerpts: More interesting, however, is the non-traditional stuff like soy-rizo and tofu mole, put into quesadillas and burritos and other great foods.
mole.author: G J J.
mole.review:
Very cool Mex food in the Mission District. 

Great mainstream options, all made fresh. More interesting, however, is the non-traditional stuff like soy-rizo and tofu mole, put into quesadillas and burritos and other great foods.

A wide beer selection as well. Seating is limited, so better to get stuff to go. Chips and salsa are great...but the nachos are even better. Everything made to order, so expect some wait...but it's worth it.

excerpts: There's only 1 thing I haven't loved, and that's the mole.
It's not the rich, dark, chocolately variety that I love.
It's lighter and less intense.
Some people like that.
mole.author: cindy p.
mole.review:
Hello awesome good time food. I will put you in my face now.

This place serves as one of my SF staples.  I've eaten here well over 30 times and never, NEVER, left with less than a smile on my face and a happy belly.

We call it the "fresh mex" place because it's kind of a californian mexican... you know, less grease, probably less authentic too, but who cares?

Their salsa is amazing, their staff is always friendly, and their burritos and quesadillas divine.  

There's only 1 thing I haven't loved, and that's the mole. It's not the rich, dark, chocolately variety that I love. It's lighter and less intense.  Some people like that.

excerpts: I love the vegan selections and I enjoyed my tofu mole burrito.
Each meal comes with a small bowl of chips and their delicious salsa.
mole.author: Hannah S.
mole.review: Very good! I love the vegan selections and I enjoyed my tofu mole burrito. Each meal comes with a small bowl of chips and their delicious salsa. The vegetarian burrito and carne asada were delicious as well. We will be back on our next visit to San Francisco.

excerpts: When I was a meat eater, I loved the Chicken mole, it is pretty yumm.
But as far as vegetarian/vegan options, this is a great place!
mole.author: Kimberly H.
mole.review:
Fresh ingredients, good solid menu, and reasonable price!!! I love this place.

The salsa is the bomb-diggity-bomb-bomb!!!! as for the chips.....they suck just like all chips in San Francisco.....I like homeade chips ok, not bagged! sorry. 

It is my favorite burrito in the city. 
The soyrizo burrito that is.....!!!! So good, don't forget to make it "super!"

When I was a meat eater, I loved the Chicken mole, it is pretty yumm. But as far as vegetarian/vegan options, this is a great place! They have fresh vegetables, and the black beans taste good. 

It is nice atmosphere too, and I know you gotta wait a little, but it's so worth it. Beside, they play reggae in there!! What's not to love?

excerpts: I ordered the mole chicken tacos which were tough, dry and lacking in ANY flavor whatsoever.
In addition, the chips were beyond stale- booo.
mole.author: NaNa M.
mole.review: After all they hype about this place- and the fact that it is blocks from my apartment...I had to give it a shot. I was sorely disappointed: what am I missing here? I ordered the mole chicken tacos which were tough, dry and lacking in ANY flavor whatsoever. In addition, the chips were beyond stale- booo.

excerpts: The chicken mole burrito was a heavenly experience.
I came back to New York and told my bay area friends the places that I went on my recent trip to SF and they were like, "yeah, papalote is awesome.
Why did I not know about this place before?!?!
Indeed, it is awesome.
mole.author: Carlie D.
mole.review:
This is seriously the best burrito that I have ever had in my life. 

The chicken mole burrito was a heavenly experience. I came back to New York and told my bay area friends the places that I went on my recent trip to SF and they were like, "yeah, papalote is awesome." Why did I not know about this place before?!?! Indeed, it is awesome. I love it. 

The burritos are a little pricey for other local Mexican prices but the burritos are gigantic and completely worth it. 

I'm already dreaming of my next trip to San Francisco. Sigh.

excerpts: I ordered the mole quesadilla!
It is really flavorful, I don't know what mole tastes like
but I enjoyed munching on the quesadilla.
Of course I'm gonna come back to order me
some adobo burrito
and I can't wait to try their other dishes!
mole.author: Anette N.
mole.review: Since we didn't want to spend hella $$$ for bar food, we navigated the craziness that is SF traffic  (mind you, during pride weekend) to get a taste of their "ADOBO BURRITO," a part of their secret menu! It is not listed on their menu yet because they have only been experimenting with the recipe for just a couple of months. If you like Filipino food, you must try this! Although I didn't order the adobo burrito, my friends passed it around. A bit gross but I'd rather feel loved (sharing is caring). I ordered the mole quesadilla! It is really flavorful, I don't know what mole tastes like but I enjoyed munching on the quesadilla. Of course I'm gonna come back to order me some adobo burrito and I can't wait to try their other dishes!

excerpts: Their chicken quesadillas are also amazing...try the mole style.
I really enjoy the ambiance, the people, and graffiti art outside.
Papalote is just a chill place to hang out and eat some good (and inexpensive) food.
My only tip is to eat there because the one time I did take my food to Muddy's Cafe
a block or so down, my food just didn't taste as good
oh, and they're salsa
is just muahhh!
mole.author: Jany X.
mole.review:
Best guacamole ever!  Their chicken quesadillas are also amazing...try the mole style.  I really enjoy the ambiance, the people, and graffiti art outside.  Papalote is just a chill place to hang out and eat some good (and inexpensive) food. 
My only tip is to eat there because the one time I did take my food to Muddy's Cafe a block or so down, my food just didn't taste as good :)... oh, and they're salsa is just muahhh!

excerpts: The salsa is awesome, and I LOVE the CHICKEN MOLE and the FISH TACOS!
mole.author: J K.
mole.review:
Changed from 3 stars to 4.

I've been back a few times recently, and loved everything I tried. I don't know why I didn't think it was "all-that" before. 

The salsa is awesome, and I LOVE the CHICKEN MOLE and the FISH TACOS!

excerpts: Glad they served Mole because it's hard to find.
I had the mole tacos and enjoyed them.
I had a satifying and fulfilling meal.
can't complain.
It's a pick what you feel like kinda place and deceide how you want it dressed up as either tacos, burritos or quesadilla.
mole.author: Daphne A.
mole.review: simple.  straight to the point.  Good fresh mexican food.  Glad they served Mole because it's hard to find.  I had the mole tacos and enjoyed them.  I had a satifying and fulfilling meal.  can't complain.  It's a pick what you feel like kinda place and deceide how you want it dressed up as either tacos, burritos or quesadilla.

excerpts: but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito.
However, the prices are a bit steep
mole.author: Grace S.
mole.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: The Carne Asada and Chicken are great, but for a special treat, try their mole or Pork Chile Verde.
Tres Bien.
mole.author: Andy T.
mole.review:
As a child growing up in San Diego (15 minutes north of the border), I was practically weaned on good Mexican food. I have to admit, I was definitely skeptical reading menu items like "Tofu Soy-Rizo", but my fears melted away when I dipped my first chip into the salsa - oh, that glorious salsa, as man has never made it before.

People will argue that this is Yuppified Mexican, and it probably is since there is no brain or head on the menu - in my mind though, this is actually a good thing. They only serve the freshest ingredients, the best cuts of meat in all of their dishes, and I could go there for every meal.

The Carne Asada and Chicken are great, but for a special treat, try their mole or Pork Chile Verde. Tres Bien.

excerpts: I agree with Pookie W. in that the mole sauce isn't made in the classic sense, so if you're expecting that, you might be disappointed.
That said, their "mole" sauce is great.
They might please more people if they called it something else though.
Can't speak on the tofu mole, I've only had the pollo.
mole.author: Kyle P.
mole.review:
The roasted red pepper-standard issue-house salsa is good enough for me to drink as a shot. Problem is, that's all you seem to get without paying for some more. I have a problem with that. It reminds me of paying for bread at restaurants in Lisbon, and I wasn't a fan of that either. If you're traveling in Portugal, beware of the bread hustle. It's placed on your table like it comp, but it's not. Back to P...

I agree with Pookie W. in that the mole sauce isn't made in the classic sense, so if you're expecting that, you might be disappointed. That said, their "mole" sauce is great. They might please more people if they called it something else though. Can't speak on the tofu mole, I've only had the pollo. 

It's great for pick -up orders, especially being a rider of the iron horse. Just 1 1/2 blocks from 24th st. BART. If your order isn't quite ready, you can always have a beer while you wait. Bottle or Draught.

excerpts: So skip the regular burrito and try the mole its by far the best I have had.
mole.author: Brian S.
mole.review:
This is not your average SF Mexican food restaurant, so if you like dirty greasy burritos this is not for you.  You can find that type at El Farolito or Can Cun which I also love.  

But this is a level above, it fresh and veg friendly.  So skip the regular burrito and try the mole its by far the best I have had.  The veggie burrito is also unique and tastes great with black beans.

And as everyone mentioned the salsa is great and they DO sell it by the jar.

excerpts:
HOLY MOLE!!! 

eat mole here and you will not be unhappy, quite the contrary.
mole.author: Sean W.
mole.review:
HOLY MOLE!!! 

sorry, I couldn't resist.

eat mole here and you will not be unhappy, quite the contrary.

DO IT!

excerpts: They have vegan mole--damn...
she's been looking for that her whole life.
It's really good, too.
And mole could be really bad.
mole.author: Nicole and Kayvon B.
mole.review:
it's totally a five for a taqueria--everything's really fresh and a lot of care is put into it.  And damn you love that salsa.  But they're too stingy with it, because they know they can sell it to us.  If they gave out more with the order, we'd be there for hours just drinking it and smearing it on ourselves.  I usually like a variety of salsas, but the one variety they have needs no siblings.

This place really stands out in the vast sea of San Francisco taquerias.  They have vegan mole--damn...  she's been looking for that her whole life.  It's really good, too.  And mole could be really bad.  But never get it in the quesadilla, because it just oozes all out the sides and onto everything around you, making it impossible to eat.

The chicken is marinated and grilled fresh, so you can avoid bin chickens.  I'll spend extra to get shrimp at other taquerias simply to have freshly cook meat, so it's nice to have some more options here.  The lettuce is fresh and green, the guacamole is brilliant, the beans are  perfectly textured and the options include refried black--good stuff.

About the only thing I could think to improve (other than giving MORE SALSA) is that the corn tortillas could be fresher instead of the standard packaged variety.

The price is good, too.

excerpts: (Pass on the tofu mole)
Fresh ingredients and complex flavors.
And their salsa, don't get me started...
it's delicious.
mole.author: Maria L.
mole.review:
Heavenly tacos for vegans.
I drool for the soyrizo and grilled veggies, even dream about them. (Pass on the tofu mole) Fresh ingredients and complex flavors.  And their salsa, don't get me started... it's delicious. However this is the reason I give them 4 stars and not 5: why do they have to be so darn skimpy about their chips and salsa. They give you a small bowl while you wait for your food, but if you want more it costs extra........ for chips? Are you kidding me?!?
The service is good. The line to order is generally the longest wait. They have good beer in the cooler (others on tap) and art in the dinning room is always changing.

excerpts: Between the prices and the wait, I have to be really inspired to eat some mole before I head here over El Toro or El Metate.
mole.author: Gabby G.
mole.review: The food is good and the salsa is especially amazing but the prices are totally outrageous, especially after this last hike.  Between the prices and the wait, I have to be really inspired to eat some mole before I head here over El Toro or El Metate.

excerpts: The salsa is some of the best salsa you will have in The Mission by far and the mole burritos are the best.
mole.author: Jay B.
mole.review:
Three words:

Get the salsa.

The salsa is some of the best salsa you will have in The Mission by far and the mole burritos are the best. Top it all off with a mexican (sugar!) coke for all under $7. 

Count me in.

excerpts: For the meats my personal favorites are the prawns (nice smokey addition to the burrito), chile verde (good size chunks of pork and tasty sauce) and chicken mole (I hate chicken breast, but
the mole sauce is so nommiful that it covers the dryness of the chicken).
the mole sauce is so nommiful that it covers the dryness of the chicken).
mole.author: Kelly C.
mole.review: Papalote's has ruined me for burritos anywhere else. Theirs are, by far, the best I've encountered in the Bay Area. I thought La Bamba in Mountain View did an awesome burrito; I was wrong. Papalote's super burrito is at least twice as tasty and all kinds of nommilicious. Their salsa is a little spicy by my standards (which are average-ish), but it's so delicious that you don't mind the burn. For the meats my personal favorites are the prawns (nice smokey addition to the burrito), chile verde (good size chunks of pork and tasty sauce) and chicken mole (I hate chicken breast, but the mole sauce is so nommiful that it covers the dryness of the chicken).

excerpts: The food tastes fresh and I love the chicken mole super burrito.
mole.author: Quinn S.
mole.review: Papalote is probably my favorite burrito joint in the Mission.  The staff is nice, quick and clean.  The food tastes fresh and I love the chicken mole super burrito. The chips and salsa that they drop by the table as you wait for your food are the best, and you rarely have to wait more than a couple of minutes.  Above all else, this is the cleanest taquera that I have found in the city.

excerpts: I tend to like Oaxacan style -- heavy on the veggies, mole, and cotija cheese.
I'm not a burrito fan like my boyfriend (who initially rejected Papalote as being inauthentic, but has since come around.)
If you order vegetable dishes here, they are full of lots of veggies, not just onions, lettuce, and tomato like most SF taquerias.
This place is awesome for vegetarians- veggies and meatless meats abound.
Flavors are awesome.
Good drink selection, too.
mole.author: Kely G.
mole.review: This is my favorite Mexican eatery in SF. I tend to like Oaxacan style -- heavy on the veggies, mole, and cotija cheese. I'm not a burrito fan like my boyfriend (who initially rejected Papalote as being inauthentic, but has since come around.) If you order vegetable dishes here, they are full of lots of veggies, not just onions, lettuce, and tomato like most SF taquerias. This place is awesome for vegetarians- veggies and meatless meats abound. Flavors are awesome. Good drink selection, too.

excerpts: tofu mole, you yellow bellied land lubbers!
such an odd concoction, so zesty.
so, so right.
and yes, their salsa is "ingest-fest" endorsed by me.
i also really like the verde habanero salsa at the table, really exemplifies the desirable "my nose is a resevoir" pain that i crave at each and every meal.
i mean, i have to use the 1/3 of the bottle in each bite for that effect.
that merely makes me a jaded soul who should be fixating on other avenues in life.
but i say HIJO DE SIETE CHIGANDAS!
i hope i said that right..... anyway, the aloof hipster gringos love this place, if you like carcass you should venture down the road apiece.
VIVA LA MUERTE elsewhere, id say.
mole.author: Christopher J.
mole.review: of course, right? i make vegan selection, so rare to find such a vast array, i must therefore support, right? RIGHT. tofu mole, you yellow bellied land lubbers! such an odd concoction, so zesty. so, so right. and yes, their salsa is "ingest-fest" endorsed by me. i also really like the verde habanero salsa at the table, really exemplifies the desirable "my nose is a resevoir" pain that i crave at each and every meal. i mean, i have to use the 1/3 of the bottle in each bite for that effect. that merely makes me a jaded soul who should be fixating on other avenues in life. but i say HIJO DE SIETE CHIGANDAS! i hope i said that right..... anyway, the aloof hipster gringos love this place, if you like carcass you should venture down the road apiece. VIVA LA MUERTE elsewhere, id say.

excerpts: I had the Mole burrito.
My boyfriend was grossed out once he found out Mole is Chocolate.
Ive
had better burritos tho.
Sorry!
This place was featured in a Food Network show called Throwdown with Bobby Flay
mole.author: kate b.
mole.review: Authentic burittos, the chef is cool, he is a DJ. Great adobo buritto idea. I had the Mole burrito. My boyfriend was grossed out once he found out Mole is Chocolate.  Ive had better burritos tho. Sorry! This place was featured in a Food Network show called Throwdown with Bobby Flay

excerpts: My friend had the mole burrito and he said that it wasn't that great.
But for being a vegetarian, they had a lot of options there.
I would go again to try the other dishes.
Oh yeah,
mole.author: Janice D.
mole.review: This place was referred to me from a few people who live in the city, so of course I had to try it! They raved about how the chips and salsa, and burritos are bomb-diggity here. First time I came here, they closed the door on us because they were closing. That's my bad for not checking what time they close. So I went there again for dinner sometime this week, and ordered a vegetarian tofu burrito. This was my first time eating a burrito with tofu in it. It was aaaaaaal-right. My friend had the mole burrito and he said that it wasn't that great. But for being a vegetarian, they had a lot of options there. I would go again to try the other dishes. Oh yeah, and the infamous chips and salsa... Chips were good, but the salsa on the other hand tasted better with the burrito. I am not a fan of dipping chips in creamy sauce. I am more into pico de gallo when it comes to chips.

excerpts: Chicken mole with black beans, super style (cheese, guac, slip of sour cream), was a humongous newborn-baby-sized thing of creation.
Everything was perfectly balanced: not too sour cream-y,
no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.
I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.
Gracias, Papalote.
no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.
I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.
Gracias, Papalote.
mole.author: Lauren J.
mole.review: A dream.  A beaut.  I'm an out of towner and begged my sister to take me to an awesome taqueria during a recent trip to SF.  She took me here, and I died.  Mexican Coke (tee hee).  Some sort of smoky, pureed chipotle salsa with fresh chips.  And the burrito.  Words cannot describe my happiness.  Chicken mole with black beans, super style (cheese, guac, slip of sour cream), was a humongous newborn-baby-sized thing of creation.  Everything was perfectly balanced: not too sour cream-y, no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.  I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.  Gracias, Papalote.

excerpts: Tofu Mole burrito rocks my world.
mole.author: Brieana E.
mole.review: Tofu Mole burrito rocks my world. Always order extra salsa on the side. It's amazing. This is one scenario where I never try other things on the menu because the first thing I tried was so awesome I crave it every time.  This is a Mexican heaven where everyone can be happy together. Good for vegans, good for everyone.

excerpts: WOWOW Super chicken mole burrito.......mmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It is so good.
The mole is nice and not overly sweet.
It has that nice cocoa taste with a bit of smoky flavor.
OOO lala!!
Their salsa is amazing.
It's very creamy roasted tomato.
I love it.
Not unbearably spicy; just perfect.
And, they serve it with warm chips.
YUMMY BURRITOS!!
Better than my old favorite, Taqueria Cancun.
mole.author: O K.
mole.review: WOWOW Super chicken mole burrito.......mmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so good. The mole is nice and not overly sweet. It has that nice cocoa taste with a bit of smoky flavor. OOO lala!! Their salsa is amazing. It's very creamy roasted tomato. I love it. Not unbearably spicy; just perfect. And, they serve it with warm chips.  YUMMY BURRITOS!! Better than my old favorite, Taqueria Cancun.

excerpts: You wish it weren't quite so clean-cut but are pleased with the crisp fresh vegetables and zesty mole, you feel a little ridiculous for eating soyrizo
but then you remember that soyrizo is really nice and treats you well, you sort of feel bad for not going for Benicio Del Toro/La Tacqueria down the street
and you know you like Benicio better
but there's something both annoying and comforting about Toby.
The horchata ladle will always be sparkling like his semi-bovine smile
and you'll get what you expect.
All I know is that I dream of soyrizo quesadillas, and if that makes me a frippie then I can stand that for an hour or so.
mole.author: Tory S.
mole.review: If Papalote were a celebrity, it might be Tobey Maguire.  You sort of hate it for not being something else and then grudgingly appreciate it for always being just what it is and nothing more.  You wish it weren't quite so clean-cut but are pleased with the crisp fresh vegetables and zesty mole, you feel a little ridiculous for eating soyrizo but then you remember that soyrizo is really nice and treats you well, you sort of feel bad for not going for Benicio Del Toro/La Tacqueria down the street and you know you like Benicio better but there's something both annoying and comforting about Toby.  The horchata ladle will always be sparkling like his semi-bovine smile and you'll get what you expect.  All I know is that I dream of soyrizo quesadillas, and if that makes me a frippie then I can stand that for an hour or so.

excerpts: Usually you might get a rice and beans, but at papalote you can get two kinds of grilled veges, soyrizo, tofu con achiote and tofu mole.
Amazing.
Everything is incredibly fresh and grilled to order - no vats of food cooked hours ago here.
Salsa is amazing, i could drink it i think.
you just can't go wrong - not a typical burrito, go to another one of the millions of burrito joints in the mission for that - but a damn good burrito...
mole.author: amy b.
mole.review: This is the best burrito, especially for thoseof us that don't eat meat.  Usually you might get a rice and beans, but at papalote you can get two kinds of grilled veges, soyrizo, tofu con achiote and tofu mole.  Amazing.  Everything is incredibly fresh and grilled to order - no vats of food cooked hours ago here.  Salsa is amazing, i could drink it i think.  you just can't go wrong - not a typical burrito, go to another one of the millions of burrito joints in the mission for that - but a damn good burrito...

excerpts: Think you can get Vegan Tofu Mole anywhere in Mexico?
But that's one more reason I love living in SF.
Their service is a little slow, but worth the wait.
The Chicken Mole burrito rocked my world and the salsa
truly is the best I've ever had.
mole.author: Jimmy C.
mole.review: Total yuppie burrito.  Think you can get Vegan Tofu Mole anywhere in Mexico?  But that's one more reason I love living in SF.  Their service is a little slow, but worth the wait.  The Chicken Mole burrito rocked my world and the salsa truly is the best I've ever had.

excerpts: Tofu mole...
My first apartment in the city was on Haight between Fillmore and Webster, right above a club called The Top.
Every night my floor shook.
And there were drive by shootings on a pretty regular basis.
But the upside was a wonderful burrito joint called Botana.
Authentic?
Probably not.
But they had this AMAZING roasted veggie and tofu mole burrito that I still dream about 6 years later.
Botano is no longer, but Papalote is as close as I'll get until Cynthia and Tony open up a new place.
mole.author: Lauren D.
mole.review: Tofu mole...  My first apartment in the city was on Haight between Fillmore and Webster, right above a club called The Top.  Every night my floor shook.  And there were drive by shootings on a pretty regular basis.  But the upside was a wonderful burrito joint called Botana.  Authentic?  Probably not.  But they had this AMAZING roasted veggie and tofu mole burrito that I still dream about 6 years later.  Botano is no longer, but Papalote is as close as I'll get until Cynthia and Tony open up a new place.

excerpts: The mole is only passable but the burritos and tacos are fab.
mole.author: Paul C.
mole.review: Great, fresh healthy mexican. And the roasted salsa is the shiznit. The mole is only passable but the burritos and tacos are fab.

excerpts:
for five bux after yoga a mole tofu taco is all you need.
you do need the yoga before hand to put up with the long wait.
but it's all good, patience, right...?
mole.author: Today Y.
mole.review:
for five bux after yoga a mole tofu taco is all you need.
you do need the yoga before hand to put up with the long wait.
but it's all good, patience, right...?

excerpts: Go for the vegan tofu mole burrito.
Stay for the best salsa in SF.
This is a smooth, blended, just spicy enough orange colored thin salsa.
The above mentioned tofu mole burrito is sweet and delicious and doesn't ever leave me with that "
oh god did I just eat that whole thing" feeling.
mole.author: Emily N.
mole.review: Go for the vegan tofu mole burrito.  Stay for the best salsa in SF. This is a smooth, blended, just spicy enough orange colored thin salsa.  The above mentioned tofu mole burrito is sweet and delicious and doesn't ever leave me with that "oh god did I just eat that whole thing" feeling.  Friends swear by the fish tacos and burritos, but I prefer a classic deep-fried fish taco to Papalote's sauteed fish version.  There is beer in bottles and on tap here.  It is a tad (just a tad) more upscale than the average Mission burrito joint.  It is also very excellent to watch all the boys and girls walk by the large picture window on their way to and from BART.  Eye candy goes well with any meal.

excerpts: The mole tacos are pretty tasty as well.
Go here, why not?
mole.author: Roxane S.
mole.review: Yeah! I love prawn tacos, I love hipsters, I love Reggae Djs, I love watermelon agua fresca, and I love the smokey delicious salsa. The mole tacos are pretty tasty as well. Go here, why not?

excerpts: Vegetarian mole, soyrizo, and the famous Papalote salsa.
mole.author: kellan e.
mole.review: Least authentic burrito in the Mission, but oh so good.  Vegetarian mole, soyrizo, and the famous Papalote salsa.

excerpts: My regulars are the soyrizo burrito and the tofu mole burrito.
The only downsides are (1) the soyrizo is super salty and makes me really freakin thirsty (2) they charge $1 for extra chips
mole.author: Jennifer C.
mole.review: Living a 1/2 block from Papalote is dangerous, very dangerous. I've got my intake down to about twice a week.  My regulars are the soyrizo burrito and the tofu mole burrito.  It's awesome to finally have a good Mexican restaurant with some veggie food other than the ole "vegetarian burrito".  And of course, the salsa is amazing. It's like velvet.  The only downsides are (1) the soyrizo is super salty and makes me really freakin thirsty (2) they charge $1 for extra chips (3) $.50 for extra salsa (4) the long lines (5) the front door doesn't close and its always freezing.  But other than that !!!  its pretty amazing.

excerpts: A friend from Phoenix had recommended that I swing by Papalote to get some assuredly delicious vegan mole.
I ended up going here twice, and forgoing some of the other places that were recommended to me.
The second time, I had the vegan mole burro with a side of guacamole.
mole.author: Nathan M.
mole.review:
I visited San Francisco to run the marathon in August.  A friend from Phoenix had recommended that I swing by Papalote to get some assuredly delicious vegan mole.  I ended up going here twice, and forgoing some of the other places that were recommended to me.  In other words, the food was so good that I skipped out on seeing some places that I may not ever get a chance to see again.

The first time I went, I got a veggie potato burro thing with soyrizo.  This was amazing.  Period.  Super delicious.

The second time, I had the vegan mole burro with a side of guacamole.  The burro was great (I liked the veggie burro with soyrizo more though), but the guacamole was kind of lame.  I mean, it wasn't bad, but it didn't taste freshly prepared.

So, the food was delicious, but the store itself sucks.  It was packed out the door both times we went, preventing any possibility of actually sitting down to eat.  The first time we went, it was like 3pm on a Saturday, and the second time was abour 1pm on a Monday.  Weird times to be so completely busy.  It was really loud as well, and I could barely hear the server girl who was very frustrating to work with anyways.  She was just sort of rude, and kept turning around and joking with the grill guys while I was trying to order, then gave me attitude when I corrected her inaccurate record of my order.  I don't know, it just added stress to something that should be delicious and stress free (mexican food).  Oh, also, the bathroom is sort of gross, and they keep all of their produce in the common area where a thousand dirty hipsters assuredly wipe their gross hands all over my delicious cucumbers and tomatoes.  It HAS to be against some sort of health code to store produce in the area where people stand in line to order.  Right?  

So, four stars because the food was excellent.  Would have been five if the girl wasn't such a biatch, or if the place was like one square foot larger.

Go here, but get take out.

excerpts: I could have cared less for the mole burrito, but only because I don't really like my burrito to taste like chocolate.
mole.author: Jeanne C.
mole.review: I give Papalote 3.5 stars because it's the Chipotle of SF. Doesn't feel as authentic as other places in the Mission. But I will give them props for their fish burrito which was soaked in buttery goodness. I could have cared less for the mole burrito, but only because I don't really like my burrito to taste like chocolate. The fish burrito was almost $10 so it's not cheap. I would only go back if I were hungry and needed something to eat. But I will say the salsa and chips is amazing - wish I could take a big jar of it home. Never tasted anything like it.

excerpts: That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo.
I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago.
That's how amazing the Chile Verde is.
It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh.
The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.
mole.author: Lawrence S.
mole.review:
I've always considered the burrito to be the perfect culinary invention: every food group delightfully wrapped in a tight, nutritional envelope. And even though Burritos and Tacos and Quesadillas don't really showcase the true sophistication of Mexican cuisine, sometimes you just want that massive hunk of goodness in your belly. That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo. I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago. That's how amazing the Chile Verde is. It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh. And unlike other "healthy" burrito options, like those found at Whole Foods, Papalote doesn't try to foist a dry tortilla sandwich off on you.

n.b. The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.

excerpts: They make a five star mole, even when combined with grilled and marinated tofu.
This sounded suspicioud but tasted surprisingly good.
These guys also make a stellar salsa, hot and spicy, but so different from anything else I've tried.
mole.author: Purnima M.
mole.review: They make a five star mole, even when combined with grilled and marinated tofu. This sounded suspicioud but tasted surprisingly good. These guys also make a stellar salsa, hot and spicy, but so different from anything else I've tried. Minus one star for the veggie tacos which had no toppings save the vegetables. Later saw that the menu said we could add the sour cream and guac if we wanted. But you woulda thought the cashier would have mentioned this to us when we ordered? Will be back to try these again, and the nachos as well. But still not completely sold.

excerpts: Chicken mole is pretty good, though prone to "off" nights.
Oh and get the chips with guacamole--ooohwhee.
They've got freshness on lockdown yo.
mole.author: Genevieve R.
mole.review: Love their chile verde! Especially on the tacos--make it a super. Chicken mole is pretty good, though prone to "off" nights. Oh and get the chips with guacamole--ooohwhee. They've got freshness on lockdown yo.

excerpts: I absolutely adore the Chicken burritos, the quesadillas, and omg the MOLE!!
The owners are FANTABULOUS!!
So nice and friendly, Im blessed to have found such great food and friends!!
mole.author: Keagan M.
mole.review: Papalote so nice they gotta do it twice!  LOVE this location though Fulton is nice as well, depends on your mood really...same great food, two different spots!!  I absolutely adore the Chicken burritos, the quesadillas, and omg the MOLE!!  The owners are FANTABULOUS!!  So nice and friendly, Im blessed to have found such great food and friends!!

excerpts: Great salsa, good mole, not to bad, and even better when you don't feel like cooking...
to bad the cashier is sooo sassy!
Also a little crowed since bofsf and all the scensters found out about it.
And you have to fight with cases of beverages for standing room.
Best bet, call in your order.
mole.author: j s.
mole.review: Great salsa, good mole, not to bad, and even better when you don't feel like cooking... to bad the cashier is sooo sassy! Also a little crowed since bofsf and all the scensters found out about it. And you have to fight with cases of beverages for standing room. Best bet, call in your order.

excerpts: Ordered a mole burrito to go, so I can't really comment on the atmosphere of the restaurant, but I found the burrito itself to be quite tasty.
The mole had a nice zing to it, and all the flavors came together nicely.
Sure, it isn't an "authentic taqueria" in the true sense of the term, but sometimes I'm just a lazy SOB
and I don't feel like driving halfway across town for a burrito that is only marginally better than one I could have eaten locally.
mole.author: Chris B.
mole.review: Ordered a mole burrito to go, so I can't really comment on the atmosphere of the restaurant, but I found the burrito itself to be quite tasty. The mole had a nice zing to it, and all the flavors came together nicely. Sure, it isn't an "authentic taqueria" in the true sense of the term, but sometimes I'm just a lazy SOB and I don't feel like driving halfway across town for a burrito that is only marginally better than one I could have eaten locally.

excerpts: And tofu mole tacos are decent.
mole.author: M K.
mole.review: Back in the day when I worked at Buffalo Exchange I would go here about twice a month. It's a favorite for two reasons- non greasy mex and great vegetarian menu. The soyrizo burrito is awesome! And tofu mole tacos are decent. I recommend the prawn burrito as well from when I was a carnivore. Nacho experiences here vary: I have had burned chips a few times. Also They must put crack in the salsa cuz I crave it baaaddd!! and the guac is good too. Always a line out the door so it helps to call ahead and they have great photography on the walls. Good for family, date, take out, and hangovers.

excerpts: I had MOLE burrito (chicken) and while the chicken was a little dry, the creaminess of refried black beans made up for the dryness.
I also tried a burrito with marinated chicken breast --- grilled to order.
It was so juicy.
I highly recommend any SF locals and tourists to check out this place!
It won't disappoint.
mole.author: Jessica N.
mole.review: This restaurant reminds me so much of La Vic in San Jose.  OK their special sauce isn't as good as La Vic's infamous "orange sauce" but it's probably the closest thing you can find in SF.  Every order comes with a small cup of special sauce and tortilla chips which are so good as well.  The sauce is great with chips and over the burrito.  It was spicy but not overpowering to me.  I was also happy with the selection on the menu.  They have items that you don't normally find in a mexican restaurant in SF.  I had MOLE burrito (chicken) and while the chicken was a little dry, the creaminess of refried black beans made up for the dryness.  I also tried a burrito with marinated chicken breast --- grilled to order.  It was so juicy.  I highly recommend any SF locals and tourists to check out this place!  It won't disappoint.

excerpts: I love me the chapotole with chips and the chicken mole burrito.
This is by far the best burrito/gourmet mexican food in the city.
Seriously.
I shit you not.
mole.author: Christopher C.
mole.review: I love me the chapotole with chips and the chicken mole burrito. This is by far the best burrito/gourmet mexican food in the city.  Seriously. I shit you not.

excerpts: MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.
The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.
Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy.
There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper)
Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.
mole.author: Miss Information X.
mole.review: I didn't think that the food was that great.  It's clean and bright and the serivice is just fine.  I just fail to understand how there could be lines out the door of this place. Perhaps because it is veggie friendly?  Maybe I should have ordered something vegetarian?  MD and I each ordered a quesadilla.  MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.  The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.  Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy. There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper) Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.

excerpts: sweet mole tofu?
mole.author: Jade P.
mole.review:
attention vegetarians & vegans: love burritos but tired of only getting rice, beans, & salsa?

attention hipsters: looking for a fusion of east & west mission?

enter: papalote. many many choices, many many vegan (tho you can add dairy, and there are some meats too), all freakishly funky. sweet mole tofu? grilled eggplant? fill your stomach as eclectically as you fill your wardrobe. 

natural & made from scratch. very nice pricing. & don't forget to enjoy the kites on the ceiling. wee!

excerpts: Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for.
mole.author: B V.
mole.review: My wife and I LOVE this place. We won't eat burritos anywhere else. 'Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for. The wonderful thing is that puppies aren't 80% rice and beans, so it's taste heaven. We live on the other side of the Mission, while there are many places closer than Papalote's, in 4 years we haven't yet found a replacement...

excerpts: (-) tofu mole is crap.
mole is too rich to eat a serving this big
.. it makes you sick afterwards.
this dish (which costs $10 by the way) needs a better combination of sides.
perhaps some calabacitas, more jicama salad, some greens and maybe some fruit.
(-) limited agua frescas.
straight up: i need limonada available every fucking day.
(-) "please wait to be seated" in a burrito shop?
puh-lease.
there are some good things too:
(+) vegan friendly.
(+) chips are top notch.
overall, i wouldn't complain if friends wanted to eat here and i was out-voted (i'd just stick to nachos or tacos), but otherwise i think i'm avoiding this modern bogosity.
mole.author: Clarence B.
mole.review:
welllll.... Papalote had come so highly recommended and so pumped up by Yelpers that me and my girl were fucking dying to eat it... and this shit is not all it's cracked up to be.

(-) No salsa bar. this is a crime in the Mission. and then they have the balls to charge you for another little tiny shot glass if you need more (they give you ONE tiny serving for two people with two meals and your chips). it's fucking good salsa, but being cheap with it is wack as hell.

(-) fuck up your order. make SURE you specify that you don't want the fucking "super" burrito when you only want the "regular". and i don't really know how to do this cuz when you specifically say "i would like the REGULAR" and they say "okay" and then still give you the super, you may have to make it yourself to get the regular.

(-) refried beans are black beans. look, i'm from the southwest. we rock PINTO beans. pinto beans taste better to us. if you are from southern mexico or central america, you go black. two different worlds. i don't want refried black beans dude.

(-) tofu mole is crap. not that it is inedible, but it is so fucking plain. the tofu seems like cubed tofu straight outta the box dumped into a vat of the sauce. and they give you way too much of this stuff. mole is too rich to eat a serving this big.. it makes you sick afterwards. this dish (which costs $10 by the way) needs a better combination of sides. perhaps some calabacitas, more jicama salad, some greens and maybe some fruit. 

(-) limited agua frescas. straight up: i need limonada available every fucking day.

(-) "please wait to be seated" in a burrito shop? puh-lease.

there are some good things too:
(+) vegan friendly.
(+) chips are top notch.

overall, i wouldn't complain if friends wanted to eat here and i was out-voted (i'd just stick to nachos or tacos), but otherwise i think i'm avoiding this modern bogosity.

excerpts: I almost always go for the chicken mole
burrito
- it has just the right balance of heat and sweetness.
Their roasted salsa is the best I have had anywhere.
Super-friendly owners, super-fresh ingredients, and rotating installations by local artists.
mole.author: Tyler N.
mole.review: A great Mexican joint and neighborhood hang-out.  I almost always go for the chicken mole burrito - it has just the right balance of heat and sweetness. Their roasted salsa is the best I have had anywhere.  Super-friendly owners, super-fresh ingredients, and rotating installations by local artists.

excerpts: mole is good.
mole.author: Nicholas C.
mole.review:
fresh!!

chicken plate is breast, but not so flavorful

is it really organic???  I'm not so sure...

mole is good.

people are friendly ish   ( the non mission locale)  

the burritos do no seem so flavorful.. but i like them anyway  its ALL ABOUT THE SALSA

excerpts: Anyway, it weirds me out, so I behave very nicely and if it takes half an hour for me to get some chicken mole tacos, that's cool.
At least their food actually exists in three dimensions, unlike the invisible burritos they serve down the street at Farolito's.
Damn, I hate invisible burritos.
mole.author: Millie S.
mole.review:
Be advised: if you get take-out from Papalote's you should bring a gameboy or a newspaper or something because even if you call in advance you will still have to wait, guaranteed.

If you see a guy there playing Nintendo, that's me, and I will laugh at you as you wait twenty minutes with the boxes of tomatoes and the windy-swinging door as your only friends. I am playing Metroid Pinball, probably enjoying a gunship multiball round or something, and my food can take as long as it needs to. In fact, if you want to tell them to put your order ahead of mine, that's cool. I see you're getting a bit twitchy. It's my fault for taking the only perch space I suppose.

Just don't rush them - see, the thing is, I secretly suspect it's not a good idea to irritate these folks. Ever hung out on this block on Sunday nights? Creepiest thing - there's this weird buzzing noise comes from out back around nine or ten o'clock. It's the kind of sound you'd hear if they were carving up all the customer who pissed them off with a meatcutter. Maybe that's the secret ingredient that keeps winning them Best Burrito readers awards.

Anyway, it weirds me out, so I behave very nicely and if it takes half an hour for me to get some chicken mole tacos, that's cool. At least their food actually exists in three dimensions, unlike the invisible burritos they serve down the street at Farolito's. Damn, I hate invisible burritos.

excerpts: The only thing that sucked about my last experience here was that I ordered "extras" (guacomole and mole i think were $1 each) and the portions were WEAK.
Whoever made these burritos was hella stingy and when the extras are a dollar that is f$cked up.
mole.author: Matt B.
mole.review: Food here is generally good. Its no El Farolito but its the only place that has actually made a burrito with "vegetables" in it eatable. The only thing that sucked about my last experience here was that I ordered "extras" (guacomole and mole i think were $1 each) and the portions were WEAK. Whoever made these burritos was hella stingy and when the extras are a dollar that is f$cked up.

excerpts: chicken mole super burrito is bigger than my head, and it's quite tasty.
mole.author: Terri J.
mole.review:
the horchata is excellent! chicken mole super burrito is bigger than my head, and it's quite tasty.  the salsa everyone has been raving about is pretty yummy, but it's a little reminiscent of Doritos.

be prepared to wait a while.  it's been crazy busy every time i've gone, and the seating is limited.  if it's a pretty day, take a walk to dolores park and enjoy your head-sized burrito in the sun!

excerpts: The tofu mole is interesting and quite good, but the fish tacos are a home run every time.
Their guac is excellent, the chips are fresh and hot, they have a good horchata, and enough vegetarian and vegan options to keep things interesting for the food geeks.
mole.author: A B.
mole.review: Best quality for the price, hands down.  If you really love Pancho Villa or Cancun, you might find this up (or down?) to your usual standards.  I'm vegetarian, so I can't speak to the quality of their meat offerings.  The tofu mole is interesting and quite good, but the fish tacos are a home run every time.  Their guac is excellent, the chips are fresh and hot, they have a good horchata, and enough vegetarian and vegan options to keep things interesting for the food geeks.

excerpts: no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water...
I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!
mole.author: Kevin D.
mole.review: A spinach super tofu quesadilla please... no, a spinach super carne asada quesadilla with grilled mushrooms... no, a super tofu burrito on spinach tortilla with no rice, grilled veggies, and a Negra Modelo... no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water... I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!

excerpts: I really like what they do with their mole sauce as well as their variety of tortilla.
mole.author: Rahul T.
mole.review:
This is the place for the best salsa in town! Oh wow, the stuff is excellent. Yeah, that's right you know what I'm talking about ... the red stuff! 

The meat is very high quality and succulent on all acounts. I really like what they do with their mole sauce as well as their variety of tortilla. 

For vegetarians, they have a very hearty veggie burrito that properly utilizes potatoes.

excerpts: Tacos Mole with Chicken.....
You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt.
The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy.
I gave them 2 out of 5.
The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy.
I gave them 2 out of 5.
The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!
mole.author: Miguel V.
mole.review:
Papalote- 
The chips are just ok, the salsa is very good. The salsa has a nice flavor, fluidity and color. You can pour it over anything! Oh yeah, it's served in little black containers opposed to the clear Solo cup every other Taqueira uses; it added a little piazzas. We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom. Very good, I give it 4 out of 5. Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff. Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos....... Absolutely awesome! One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time. The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste. Excellent blend! I'd go back just for this dish. Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5. These guys set the bar on tofu. Tacos Mole with Chicken.....You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt. The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy. I gave them 2 out of 5. Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good. They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro. Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes. I gave them 4 out of 5. Friend had a carne asada burrito.......Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt. Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about. I gave the burrito 3 out of 5. 
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait. It was an order as you pay type place. I really like the grates they use on their grills opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses. The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!

excerpts: Mole fried-tofu burrito  and a Speakeasy beer?
Yes please.
mole.author: Jon B.
mole.review: Mole fried-tofu burrito  and a Speakeasy beer?  Yes please.

excerpts: The burrito of choice por moi, is the chicken mole burrito, the mole is fresh, a tad bit too salty, but perfect with una cerveza.
The atmosphere is nice; small lively restaurant with indoor seating.
There is usually very cool wall art that changes to feature different local artists.
Its location is prime: a block from the 24th st.
Mission bart station.
You must eat here at least once.

I would not say the best taqueria in the mission as there are many different types and styles of taquerias in the Mission, but I will say this place has some of the more healthy cusine for a mexican restaurant.
mole.author: Michael M.
mole.review: Fresh Mexican food, not the greasy late night variety. The burrito of choice por moi, is the chicken mole burrito, the mole is fresh, a tad bit too salty, but perfect with una cerveza. The atmosphere is nice; small lively restaurant with indoor seating. There is usually very cool wall art that changes to feature different local artists. Its location is prime: a block from the 24th st. Mission bart station. You must eat here at least once. I would not say the best taqueria in the mission as there are many different types and styles of taquerias in the Mission, but I will say this place has some of the more healthy cusine for a mexican restaurant.

excerpts: I must admit, I've ONLY had the chicken mole burrito here.
But Papalote has the best mole I've ever tasted.
I ordered it the first time I visited Papalote a few years ago and I haven't ever wanted to try anything new.
Also, be sure to get their guacamole and salsa.
I normally get extra because they are both so yummy.
There can often be a wait if you order in-person, but you can call your order in and it'll be ready when you arrive.
Try the mole!
mole.author: Gregory G.
mole.review: I must admit, I've ONLY had the chicken mole burrito here. But Papalote has the best mole I've ever tasted. I ordered it the first time I visited Papalote a few years ago and I haven't ever wanted to try anything new. Also, be sure to get their guacamole and salsa. I normally get extra because they are both so yummy. There can often be a wait if you order in-person, but you can call your order in and it'll be ready when you arrive. Try the mole!

excerpts: Delicious enough to daydream about - the chicken mole and the veggie (potato & mushroom)
burritos are highly recommended!
mole.author: J R.
mole.review: Delicious enough to daydream about - the chicken mole and the veggie (potato & mushroom) burritos are highly recommended!

excerpts: The mole is unique and makes for a delicious burrito
mole.author: Jon W.
mole.review: Papalote manages to be something of a mild hipster joint without completely losing the character of an authentic taqueria. The mole is unique and makes for a delicious burrito [I've only tried the chicken, not the tofu], and the homemade salsa is an especially tasty surprise. Beer on tap and a cozy, clean seating area make it a good dine-in experience, too.

excerpts: I'm addicted to the chicken mole burrito, which I eat at least twice per week.
I know the other items on the menu are good, but I can't tear myself away from my standard.
mole.author: David M.
mole.review: I'm addicted to the chicken mole burrito, which I eat at least twice per week. I know the other items on the menu are good, but I can't tear myself away from my standard.

excerpts: I love the tofu or chicken mole burrito, and the chicken quesadillas.
HOWEVER, I have one complaint.
On multiple occasions I have ordered take-out, and my dish has been missing guacamole even though I ordered it.
This is incredibly frustrating since by the time I get home
there's no way I am going to walk back to get it.
Other than that, I love this place.
mole.author: Amy M.
mole.review:
This is great reasonably priced Mexican food and healthier/ lighter than most taquerias in the Mission.  I love the tofu or chicken mole burrito, and the chicken quesadillas.  
HOWEVER, I have one complaint.  On multiple occasions I have ordered take-out, and my dish has been missing guacamole even though I ordered it.  This is incredibly frustrating since by the time I get home there's no way I am going to walk back to get it.  Other than that, I love this place.

excerpts: I was pleasantly surprised by the size of my chicken mole burrito, and it tasted fantastic.
I then asked if I could have some more of the salsa I had eaten with my chips and was told it would be an extra charge.
The food was good, but not good enough to justify the price and extra charge for salsa.
Clearly the owners are trying to milk as much money as possible out of their positive press.
It is too bad, because their food is worth buying again, just not at the current prices.
mole.author: Lucas M.
mole.review: The line was long (a good sign?), and the service was friendly.  I was surprised by how much more expensive their burritos were than every other place I have ever been in the mission, but figured they were worth trying.  I sat down and ate some chips and salsa while I waited 15-20 minutes for my food to be prepared.  I was pleasantly surprised by the size of my chicken mole burrito, and it tasted fantastic.  I then asked if I could have some more of the salsa I had eaten with my chips and was told it would be an extra charge.  The food was good, but not good enough to justify the price and extra charge for salsa.  Clearly the owners are trying to milk as much money as possible out of their positive press.  It is too bad, because their food is worth buying again, just not at the current prices.

excerpts: The chicken mole burrito is superb and perfectly (who does mole better?)
balanced, especially eaten with lots of the habanero sauce provided on the table.

I ate a burrito a day in the mission for 10 years straight ( have approached about 5,000 recently) and have to say that these guys are consistent --which cannot be said about any other taqueria in the city.
The salsa which is a blend of two different dried chiles and pumpkin seeds (guessing here)
rocks and is only rivaled by Cancun's green (the remarkable landmark in salsa history).
mole.author: chris r.
mole.review: The chicken mole burrito is superb and perfectly (who does mole better?) balanced, especially eaten with lots of the habanero sauce provided on the table. I ate a burrito a day in the mission for 10 years straight ( have approached about 5,000 recently) and have to say that these guys are consistent --which cannot be said about any other taqueria in the city. The salsa which is a blend of two different dried chiles and pumpkin seeds (guessing here) rocks and is only rivaled by Cancun's green (the remarkable landmark in salsa history).

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good.
mole.author: Willy c.
mole.review: This place is pretty damn good.  The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good. The shrimp isn't as good as La Corneta, but this is a great place for burrito diversity if you're sick of the same old ricy overstuff in the mission. It 's also nice when you don't feel like falling into the mexi-coma before you even get home  (aka reasonable portions)...

excerpts: Nothing we ordered was good, from the guac to the mole sauce, i.e. the easy to the hard.
I mean it was bad enough that I don't think we just ordered the wrong things.
Worst mexican food I've ever had at a place authentic enough to serve Jarritos and have aqua fresca tanks.
mole.author: A. W.
mole.review: Biggest disappointment of our SF trip.   Nothing we ordered was good, from the guac to the mole sauce, i.e. the easy to the hard.  I mean it was bad enough that I don't think we just ordered the wrong things.    Worst mexican food I've ever had at a place authentic enough to serve Jarritos and have aqua fresca tanks.

excerpts: oh it had to be love, discovering your vegan beans, addictive salsa and mole with tofu and that glorious soyrizo.
Then there was my year long boycott because of
"Blondie," who on more than one occasion hung up on me, yelled at me and just gave off a generally sour and bummed out vibe that I don't really want in my life.
But, apparently, after months of visits again, Blondie is gone and there is nothing but warm love and yumminess in my belly.

But I feel that it's a bittersweet reunion, you see, a reunion that reminds me of some of my less ruling characteristics--I've reached this new plateau in the banal and repetitive exercise that is my existence on this planet.
I walk in to Papa Lote, and the nice shorter girl smiles, says "Super Soyrizo?
I nod, and my food arrives a couple minutes later.
This means I'm probably mere weeks, maybe days, from going in and reaching the ultimate and ultimately revealing plateau--walking in and asking for, gulp, "The Usual."
Due to my work schedule, I've reached this plateau at Love N Haight, and this
, I'm fine with.
But, alas, with Papa Lote, it's just sheer and utter laziness.
I mean, with food this good two blocks from your house, how often would you cook?
mole.author: Ben V.
mole.review: Oh Papa Lote, the times we've shared.  "Yuppie Burrito" and I have had our ups and downs.  It was love, oh it had to be love, discovering your vegan beans, addictive salsa and mole with tofu and that glorious soyrizo.  Then there was my year long boycott because of "Blondie," who on more than one occasion hung up on me, yelled at me and just gave off a generally sour and bummed out vibe that I don't really want in my life.  But, apparently, after months of visits again, Blondie is gone and there is nothing but warm love and yumminess in my belly.  But I feel that it's a bittersweet reunion, you see, a reunion that reminds me of some of my less ruling characteristics--I've reached this new plateau in the banal and repetitive exercise that is my existence on this planet.  I walk in to Papa Lote, and the nice shorter girl smiles, says "Super Soyrizo?" I nod, and my food arrives a couple minutes later.  This means I'm probably mere weeks, maybe days, from going in and reaching the ultimate and ultimately revealing plateau--walking in and asking for, gulp, "The Usual."  Due to my work schedule, I've reached this plateau at Love N Haight, and this, I'm fine with.  But, alas, with Papa Lote, it's just sheer and utter laziness.  I mean, with food this good two blocks from your house, how often would you cook?

excerpts: while i was blissfully enjoying my soyrizo, guacamole and tofu mole burrito
, i blurted out, "five stars" in between moans of pleasure.
a friend i was with asked me, "are you always such a positive yelp reviewer?
to which i laughed because i've had a few people comment on my superfluous 1 and 2 star reviews (which, i think, is not a reflection of my own negativity but a product of south orange county living).
the salsa was AMAZING!
and creamy and delicious.
even the pickled jicama spiced with chile was delicious.
the prices are even decent and if i hadn't decided to fix it up so much it would have been under $5.
of course, with all my fixin's it ended up being $8.
still not terrible for a big burrito with plenty of heart and soul.
i was full enough to be happy the entire hour and a half
that bryan
and i spent walking around the mission looking for our lost car.
mole.author: Laura V.
