Ok, so here's where I give credit; the salsa was good. It was nice and spicy. The chile verde pork was very tender. There was Yucatan hot sauce, which is always a plus. And there was spiced up jicama served as the side, which was deliciously refreshing.
Basically, overrated white washed Mexican food, which is fine as long as you know what you're in for.

excerpts: That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo.
I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago.
That's how amazing the Chile Verde is.
It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh.
The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.
chile verde.author: Lawrence S.
chile verde.review:
I've always considered the burrito to be the perfect culinary invention: every food group delightfully wrapped in a tight, nutritional envelope. And even though Burritos and Tacos and Quesadillas don't really showcase the true sophistication of Mexican cuisine, sometimes you just want that massive hunk of goodness in your belly. That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo. I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago. That's how amazing the Chile Verde is. It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh. And unlike other "healthy" burrito options, like those found at Whole Foods, Papalote doesn't try to foist a dry tortilla sandwich off on you.

n.b. The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.

excerpts: Love their chile verde!
Especially on the tacos--make it a super.
chile verde.author: Genevieve R.
chile verde.review: Love their chile verde! Especially on the tacos--make it a super. Chicken mole is pretty good, though prone to "off" nights. Oh and get the chips with guacamole--ooohwhee. They've got freshness on lockdown yo.

excerpts: The Chile Verde Burrito is the best one in the city.
chile verde.author: Nick L.
chile verde.review: Quick service and great food.  This place got me through a rough December last year.  I love that you can call in your order and pick it up.  This place gets packed so I suggest calling ahead.  The Chile Verde Burrito is the best one in the city.

excerpts: Nevertheless, I always get the shrimp (super) tacos and my husband always gets the chile verde tacos and those keep us perfectly satisfied, though the service can be somewhat cold.
I don't care for the decor or the crowded atmosphere so we usually get it to go.
chile verde.author: Terry M.
chile verde.review: Papalote is very good for certain things... the salsa being one of them. I do, however believe that it has gotten increasingly hotter over the last few years and therefore isn't as good to my taste. I too read the article in Chow and have been making that version of the salsa for years and actually prefer it. Nevertheless, I always get the shrimp (super) tacos and my husband always gets the chile verde tacos and those keep us perfectly satisfied, though the service can be somewhat cold. I don't care for the decor or the crowded atmosphere so we usually get it to go.

excerpts: Went with the chile verde instead.
not the same and not very tasty.
I don't care if what I wanted was bad for me ...
it's tasty badness.
chile verde.author: Greg G.
chile verde.review: No carnita's? WTF? I was full don't get me wrong, but it left something to be desired in my tastebuds. It might have been because I had to choose a runner up burrito with the lack of carnitas. Went with the chile verde instead. not the same and not very tasty. I don't care if what I wanted was bad for me ... it's tasty badness.

excerpts: My pork chile verde was tangy and yummy but the best part was the jicama side salad was the bomb...
i wanted to take a bowl home with me!
I believe it only comes with the entrees, so i would definitely recommend all you burrito and taco eaters to order it on the side and try it out.
chile verde.author: Erick A.
chile verde.review: I knew coming in here  that this wouldn't be a typical mission taqueria and it definitely wouldn't come close to san diego taquerias.   My pork chile verde was tangy and yummy but the best part was the jicama side salad was the bomb... i wanted to take a bowl home with me!   I believe it only comes with the entrees, so i would definitely recommend all you burrito and taco eaters to order it on the side and try it out.

excerpts: you can't go wrong with their Chile Verde entree.
I would like them to have salted tortilla chips
but i guess that's a personal preference.
chile verde.author: Casey W.
chile verde.review:
Good breakfast burritos and you can't go wrong with their Chile Verde entree.  I would like them to have salted tortilla chips but i guess that's a personal preference.  Salsa is great.

I would give them 4 stars but they get an extra one for being right next to my apartment.

excerpts: and I had the chile verde burrito!
Delicious (and much cheaper, about $8).
Love it!
chile verde.author: julie q.
chile verde.review: This place is great. Your typical California Mexican burritos and other food BUT their homemade salsa is delicious! I just pour it over everything but it makes everything really good. My husband had the triple threat burrito (which he thought was well worth the $20, yes just on his burrito alone!) and I had the chile verde burrito! Delicious (and much cheaper, about $8). Love it!

excerpts: Chile verde burrito smothered in the salsa is not only scrumptious but will last you a couple meals.
Love the horchata too, not too sweet or gritty at the bottom.
Dude, the fact that you can buy a jar of their salsa is enough to keep me coming back even though I live 3 hours away.
chile verde.author: E. Alicia P.
chile verde.review: I'm in love with Papalote.  The salsa is some of the most exquisite I've had.   Chile verde burrito smothered in the salsa is not only scrumptious but will last you a couple meals.  Love the horchata too, not too sweet or gritty at the bottom.  Dude, the fact that you can buy a jar of their salsa is enough to keep me coming back even though I live 3 hours away.

excerpts: chile verde burrito.
super.
refried beans.
really bland.
really wet inside.
everything was in one place.
there was a blob of guacamole at one point in the burrito.
a blob of beans somewhere else.
weird.
i expected better.
it was certainly filling!
chile verde.author: Wangston P.
chile verde.review: chile verde burrito. super. refried beans. really bland. really wet inside. everything was in one place. there was a blob of guacamole at one point in the burrito. a blob of beans somewhere else. weird. i expected better. it was certainly filling!

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
chile verde.author: Cindy L.
chile verde.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: Chile verde is incredible.
I buy a jar of the salsa weekly to use at home too.
chile verde.author: Amy F.
chile verde.review: Wonderful burritos.  Chile verde is incredible.  I buy a jar of the salsa weekly to use at home too.

excerpts: Try the chile verde - I would walk miles uphill in the rain for this stuff.
chile verde.author: A R.
chile verde.review: The burritos here are head and shoulders above the rest. Cheap, and friendly service too.  Try the chile verde - I would walk miles uphill in the rain for this stuff.

excerpts: Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole.
chile verde.author: Eugene P.
chile verde.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts: My husbands carne asada burrito was super salty.
carne asada.author: Alyssa A.
carne asada.review:
We were looking for a quick bite in the neighborhood. This place also accepts American Express which is a rare thing around here. We ordered takeout and our food took a long time because we didn't realize you had to stand in the front for takeout. They gave us a number and were delivering the rest of the foods --- we apparently missed the memo.

We ordered a chicken burrito supreme and carne Asad's quesadilla. When I got home, my burrito was supposed to have sour cream and guacamole and unfortunately all those things were missing. The flavors were still good, but it was really lacking those Ingredients. My husbands carne asada burrito was super salty.

I like that the food comes with free chips and salsa but that's pretty standard around the mission.

There are so many wonderful options for burritos in the area, try elsewhere. They seemed busy and had happy seeming customers, so maybe the dine in experience would have been better. 

$26.00 for a burrito and quesadilla - not crazy cheap but not crazy expensive either.

excerpts: My carne asada burrito cost about $12 and was meh.
carne asada.author: Hana S.
carne asada.review: My carne asada burrito cost about $12 and was meh. Maybe this place is good if you don't eat meat since they have multiple veggie options. There are SO MANY taquerias in this area that do a great job of both, more affordably, so I'm confused. I'm personally sad they didn't have the mexican-filipino fusion burrito I had heard about :(

excerpts: We got the chorizo con queso which was amazing, and the carne asada which melted in our mouths.
The vibe here super cool, chill... and down to earth.
The service was great!
If I lived in the bay area this place would definitely be one that I would regularly frequent!
Highly recommend!
carne asada.author: Chelsea V.
carne asada.review: If you like delicious, authentic Mexican food- this is a great place to try! I came  this past weekend while in town visiting. My fiance and I were craving Mexican food, so some friends of ours suggested we check this place out. We got the chorizo con queso which was amazing, and the carne asada which melted in our mouths. The vibe here super cool, chill... and down to earth. The service was great! If I lived in the bay area this place would definitely be one that I would regularly frequent! Highly recommend!

excerpts: Triple Threat - chicken breast, carne asada, prawns:
It's loaded with 3 types of proteins, but I don't feel threatened.
The taste and quality is on par with most burritos, so in comparison, the price tag sure is steep.
The grilled prawns were the best part.
They're tender and springy with a nice char.
Plus, the prawns are left whole instead of chopped up beyond recognition.
The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too.
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals.
The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too.
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals.
The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp.
The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey.
carne asada.author: Joy W.
carne asada.review:
About six years ago, Flay challenged Papalote to a burrito contest and the triple threat burrito triumphed. I wish I knew what Papalote was like before it was featured on Throwdown. Was the triple threat always $20? Back then, $20 was a lot of cash for a burrito and it still is now, but at least that burrito hasn't been affected by inflation in these past few years. Also, the hype has calmed down compared to those crowds after the episode first aired. 

Triple Threat - chicken breast, carne asada, prawns:
It's loaded with 3 types of proteins, but I don't feel threatened. The taste and quality is on par with most burritos, so in comparison, the price tag sure is steep. The grilled prawns were the best part. They're tender and springy with a nice char. Plus, the prawns are left whole instead of chopped up beyond recognition. The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too. 
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals. It's also a good decision if you have a tough time choosing between poultry, beef, & seafood, or if you're just curious to try it, but it is not a must have.

The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp. The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey. Adding cheese, guac, or sour cream are each $1. Kind of a bummer, since burritos usually include cheese. If you're going to add one, you might as well add all 3 for $2, resulting in a very creamy burrito. 

Of course the roasted tomato salsa is excellent. It is the true threat here. This thick & creamy, robust, orange sauce is like a flavor explosion of smokey, sweet, savory, spicy, and slightly tart. This salsa is excellent on their thin, warm chips, as well as on everything else. Jars of Papalote's various salsas are available for purchase in various local markets. 
Overall, I'm satisfied with the food, but the prices are high relative to other Mexican joints in the Mission, so I give it a 7.25/10.

excerpts: I ordered a carne asada quesadilla.
You can supersize any meal and add sour cream and guac for just a $1.50.
I can't eat anything without sour cream, so I did that
and it was so worth it.
carne asada.author: Vasiliy M.
carne asada.review:
"papalote" is just a fun word to say - that's at least 3 stars just for a dope name. BUT, the food is also amazing! Every meal you order comes with chips and salsa--but not just any salsa. Papalote (man, I love saying that..) has a special secret recipe home-made salsa that has a hint of chipotle who know what else. You just NEED to try it for yourself!

I ordered a carne asada quesadilla. You can supersize any meal and add sour cream and guac for just a $1.50. I can't eat anything without sour cream, so I did that and it was so worth it. Do it!

Papalote is a small space with tight seating, so get to know thy neighbors and bond over some good food! Highly recommended!

excerpts: Ordered a carne asada burrito and the meat was gross - fatty, tough, ....
every bite.
Needless to say, I threw most of it away & never went back.
If you want great Mexican food, go to LaTaqueria at 2889 Mission St.
carne asada.author: S P.
carne asada.review: Our first time to San Francisco & this place was recommended to us.  Also reviews looked pretty good so it must be good.  Wrong!  Boy were we disappointed.  I can honestly say it's the worst Mexican restaurant I've ever eaten at.  Ordered a carne asada burrito and the meat was gross - fatty, tough, .... every bite.  Needless to say, I threw most of it away & never went back.  If you want great Mexican food, go to LaTaqueria at 2889 Mission St.

excerpts: The carne asada was tender and seasoned very well.
Additionally, their famous salsa was also delicious - spicy, sweet, great flavor, and just a tad creamy...
I could eat this all day!
carne asada.author: Elaine Y.
carne asada.review:
Whoa whoa whoa...now I've been to most of the major burrito establishments claiming to be the best of the best, but Papalote Mexican Grill was still an amazing surprise. It certainly isn't the cheapest nor the quickest (so places like El Farlito will continue to have a place in my taco/burrito loving heart)...but the food is superb!

My friend and I shared the carne asade super burrito. The burrito was certainly substantial and I was very glad to find that it wasn't a squishy mess. The carne asada was tender and seasoned very well. Additionally, their famous salsa was also delicious - spicy, sweet, great flavor, and just a tad creamy...I could eat this all day!

excerpts: I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with whole wheat tortilla.
The price is definitely not considered cheap but it's SF
carne asada.author: Milton F.
carne asada.review:
I just have one word to describe this place: LEGIT. 

I love burritos and have heard countless times from friends that the Mission is the place to go. I was meeting a friend in SF for lunch and he asked what I wanted. I said I found this burrito place on a website that was named one of the best burrito joints so I was dying to try it out.

He confirmed that he had been papalote's before and said it was pretty damn good. 
That got me even more excited than I already was... The day came and I walk in the restaurant. I forgot to mention, I went to the Mission location. The place is pretty small and very casual. 
I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with whole wheat tortilla. The price is definitely not considered cheap but it's SF so I wasn't surprised... about $10+ for a burrito and chips/salsa.

I just have to say this first.. but the salsa was bomb!! It's not like any salsa I've ever had before... it's not chunky and does not have the consistency of your average salsa. It's very much like a sauce almost and is pretty oily. I can't describe it, but I just couldn't get enough of it.
Now on to the burrito... it was delicious and nicely grilled which was a nice touch. 

My only minor complaint is the size... it could've been a bit bigger for the price. 

Hint: They sell the salsa they serve in the restaurant. There are many different salsas they sell, but be sure to ask for the fresh one they sell. Unfortunately for me, they were sold out of that one so I got what they said was the next closest thing... At $7 a jar, it's the most expensive salsa I've ever bought, but damn it was worth every drop. 

I'll savor every last drop until the next time I visit Papalotes again.

excerpts: I ordered a carne asada burrito.
To be honest, it tasted like Chipotle.
It was also a bit salty.
The salsa they have here is made in house.
It tastes good on the burrito, especially since the burrito is kinda bland by itself.
The burrito is humongous.
It can last me two meals.
carne asada.author: Shu T.
carne asada.review: I ordered a carne asada burrito. To be honest, it tasted like Chipotle. It was also a bit salty. The salsa they have here is made in house. It tastes good on the burrito, especially since the burrito is kinda bland by itself. The burrito is humongous. It can last me two meals.

excerpts: The black beans were fantastic, tortilla was soft to the bite, tender, warm, and the carne asada was cooked perfectly.
As soon as I took my first bite, I just had to stop and look at the Burrito for a moment - a standard for me
anytime I taste something so delicious, I just have to take a moment to appreciate it.
carne asada.author: Alex S.
carne asada.review:
When I told my friends I was driving up to SF and looking for some great food, they immediately recommended Papalote. I told them if it was as good as they're hyping it up to be, I'd buy them lunch here. 

Safe to say lunch will definitely be on me! 

This place is fantastic, the salsa they served with the chips was the best I've ever had. My buddy and I had a hard time properly describing its taste. Had a chipotle-like flavor to it, it was just great! 
I had one of their well-renowned Burritos (Asada for me), and it was phenomenal. The black beans were fantastic, tortilla was soft to the bite, tender, warm, and the carne asada was cooked perfectly. As soon as I took my first bite, I just had to stop and look at the Burrito for a moment - a standard for me anytime I taste something so delicious, I just have to take a moment to appreciate it. Also, staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was quite pleasant and relaxing.

No complaints on my end, this place definitely lived up to the hype for me, and I will certainly be returning VERY soon!

excerpts: He loves pouring that creamy salsa on each bite of his carne asada while convincing us that Papalote is actually the best burrito place in Mission.
But we can't trust this guy to give an unbiased opinion.
carne asada.author: Ringo M.
carne asada.review:
I'm gonna say something really snobbish. Ready? Here goes.

I don't like Papalolte because it's a hipster-infested burrito place.

Oops i mean hipster-invested.

Oh you know it's hipster because: 

One, everything in the restaurant is spanking clean. 

Two, they have this signature creamy salsa that all silicon techies like to irrationally rave about in their work patios. 

Three, you always see these Postmates/Grubhub/UberEats/Eat24 people hanging around, waiting to pick up a Pork Chile Verde no sour cream extra guac spinach wrap for some techie who does the software programming for Postmates/Grubhub/Uber. 

Four, remember that delicious salsa mentioned above? Yeah they sell it separately in a jar. 

Five, and probably the most evident indicator of Papalolte's hipster affiliation, a burrito costs like $10 to $11 #damndaniel

My good friend, Salty P, swears by this place though. He loves pouring that creamy salsa on each bite of his carne asada while convincing us that Papalote is actually the best burrito place in Mission. But we can't trust this guy to give an unbiased opinion. Salty P. wears a beard, rocks an expensive vest, and has like, 5 hydroflask bottles ("i need it").

Although i might not like Papalote, i do recommend it to my vegetarian friends though. I know other burrito places offer vegetarian options, too, but Papalote takes their vegetarian menu seriously. Unlike other places, you can be sure that the oil used for the veggie options is kept separately from the meat. You can sleep easy knowing that a piece of meat may not have snuck its way into your Soyrizo Burrito. How can we be so sure? Because unlike other burrito places, Papalote actually has something to lose. They got a chain store down at Fulton.

So yeah, if you don't have any dietary restrictions and/or if you're not a hipster, then i would go Cancun and El Faro instead. But if you are a vegetarian and/or keeps a leather notebook in your butt pocket, then Papalote is the place for you :)

excerpts: I've also tried their carne asada burrito and breakfast burrito, both of which are bomb.
carne asada.author: Adele F.
carne asada.review:
Holy. Guacamole. Papalote now has a "buy 10 burritos get 1 free" frequent rewards card.

This is new! As of a few weeks ago! I could have gotten so many free burritos by now!

Aside from free burritos, what makes this place great?

1) Convenient. I live a block from this location. And when my friends and I are feeling like lazy bums...sorry, since we ARE lazy bums, we call in bulk to-go orders, wait 15 minutes, and send over volunteer tributes to pick up our stash.

2) Quality. Their meat is GOOD. Tender. Moist. And they are so generous. One of my girls swears by two menu items: the mole and the chile verde. I've tried both, and I'm a much bigger fan of the CHILE VERDE because the pork makes my taste buds dance a happy dance. I get it as a salad to cut down on carbs and because the jicama and fresh salsa pair so well with the salty pork and the awesome green serrano sauce, which I drizzle errywhere. I've also tried their carne asada burrito and breakfast burrito, both of which are bomb. Oh, when they say scrambled eggs, they really mean pulverized eggs--it's pretty awesome.

3) Customizable. Tacos, burritos, naked burritos, quesadillas, salads--meat/tofu vehicles of all types. Last I checked, their "make it super" option, which adds sour cream, cheese, and guacamole was only $1. Seems like the prices now are more expensive per online source?

4) Crack sauce. When I first tried it, I wasn't a big fan because it's spicy. It's still spicy, but I've learned to better ignore my screaming pain receptors. There's something about eating crunchy tortilla chips with a creamy sauce that makes everything taste way better. I love this combination so much that I always save my leftover chips and sauce for future snacking. I even save my friends' leftover chips and sauce. My boyfriend thinks I'm crazy, squirreling away all of those mini sauce containers in our fridge. I think I'm GENIUS. They sell jars of this stuff, and I'm getting it FO' FREE.

5) REWARDS CARD. This perk deserves to be repeated. FYI: valid for burrito purchases only.

Downside: seating. It looks like a seat-yourself situation, but one of the waitstaff will usually be around the dining room entrance to keep an eye out for tables. The room holds about 20 people, so you might have to wait for a bit during rush hours.

But srsly, Papalote is dope-alote. Time to reap some free burritos.

excerpts: The super carne asada burrito was a bit of a let down for me.
The carne asada was chewy & dry.
carne asada.author: Veronica M.
carne asada.review:
This is the best salsa in SF.
Of all the taquerias in town, authentic, hip, or trendy...this is the salsa.

Not like pico de gallo.  No no no.  Usually pico de gallo is way too chunky & bland for tortilla chip dipping or using as a topping for me.  This is smooth, creamy, rich, & deep.  It has perfect consistency.  And even in just their regular salsa, the heat is there.  If you don't pick up a jar, you can be confident that you're missing out.

It's fantastic w everything.  I've used it to make chilaquiles & no other salsa has been better.

Now, the food.

The super carne asada burrito was a bit of a let down for me.  The carne asada was chewy & dry.  And the only flavor punches were at the ends of the burrito, meaning the distribution was all whacked.  

No bueno.  

But I'll still be back.  I need to try the mexipino.  And of course, the triple threat.

The cashier was sweet.  Actually, all the staff was.

Their salsa is available all over town.  Bi-Rite, Safeway, Whole Foods, etc.

Lucky us.

It was a 3 star burrito.  But their salsas are totally 5 stars.

4 stars.

excerpts: Carne asada is good because it's grilled and kinda crispy.
Sauce is of course good, but they give you so little and you have to pay for extra.
And $10.50 for a burrito is a little pricey.
carne asada.author: Eddie E.
carne asada.review: Carne asada is good because it's grilled and kinda crispy. Sauce is of course good, but they give you so little and you have to pay for extra. And $10.50 for a burrito is a little pricey.

excerpts: Larger than my forearm, this creation included chunks of tender carne asada, smoked prawns, succulent achiote chicken, rice, beans and slightly piquant papalote salsa.

I basically built myself a super healthy burrito (brown rice, wheat tortilla, black beans, chicken), however it was still ridiculously delicious and better than anything Chiptole could ever manufacture for me.
carne asada.author: Astrid Z.
carne asada.review:
Thank you, Food Network for leading me here!

Food: My boyfriend was so cool and decided to order the Triple Threat Burrito. Larger than my forearm, this creation included chunks of tender carne asada, smoked prawns, succulent achiote chicken, rice, beans and slightly piquant papalote salsa. He made it super by adding fresh guacamole, cheese and  sour cream. The marriage between all of the ingredients worked magically, I wouldn't change a single thing about this burrito. Though the price is fairly steep ($19.99), it can easily be shared among two people and the quality and taste alone are enough for me to pay the whooping fee each and every time. The papalote salsa is pretty epic, though not as spicy as I'd like it to be. The roasted tomatoes and chili provide a bit of a smokey flavor, the salsa is a full-bodied/robust work of art boasting in both flavor and aroma. I purchased one to take home and finished it in three days. I built my own burrito as well and the menu allows for optimal customization if you don't want one of their signature burritos. I was able to chose between the type of beans, rice, meat and tortilla I wanted. I basically built myself a super healthy burrito (brown rice, wheat tortilla, black beans, chicken), however it was still ridiculously delicious and better than anything Chiptole could ever manufacture for me. I highly recommend any of their burritos, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Price: On the pricier end and they'll tack on more for adding any extra ingredients. However, the food here is certainly worth the price every time. 

Ambiance: Small, simple and clean. I saw a ton of people waiting outside to either get a table
or pick up carry-out orders.

Service: Quick and friendly servers, limited interaction with employees.

Overall: Authentic, fresh and ridiculously appetizing Mexican eats. I approve and can't wait
to come back for more!

excerpts: de carne asada which was super bomb.
I prefer the way the meat is prepared a little more at La Taqueria but their lack of rice in the burritos takes it down a peg.
carne asada.author: Janette M.
carne asada.review:
My boyfriend and I decided to go here after attempting to call to place an order at La Taqueria down the street on cinco de Mayo. I must say that I preferred this taqueria over my usual spot mostly because the wait time was way shorter and that sauce is the absolute best. I got a burrito de carne asada which was super bomb. I prefer the way the meat is prepared a little more at La Taqueria but their lack of rice in the burritos takes it down a peg. I don't like sloppy food and their burritos and tacos get pretty sloppy.

I'm over waiting in line with a bunch of yuppies at La Taqueria so it looks like Papalote will be my new go to :)

excerpts: Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.
Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado.
carne asada.author: Mark O.
carne asada.review:
Mexican restaurant on 24th & Valencia. On the 2014 and 2015 7x7 list for their chips and salsa.

Although you order at the counter your food gets brought to you. Limited meat selection. No chorizo or carnitas. 

Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.

Triple threat burrito - 3/5 - Massive. Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado. Not really impressed.

Chips and salsa - 5/5 - WOW. I very much expected to be disappointed by another overhyped dish but this absolutely lived up to it's reputation. The salsa is so damn good. This is easily my favorite salsa in the city and I even bought an extra jar to take home. It is creamy, spicy and delicious. It certainly deserves the spot it has held on the 7x7 list for the past two years.

Overall, this is without a doubt my new go to option for salsa. Unfortunately the rest of their items are passable so I think I will likely be getting the salsa to go and getting my burrito/taco/quesadilla elsewhere in the future. Regardless, this salsa is absolutely "as good as it gets" and I will probably always have some on hand in my fridge.

excerpts: My carne asada burrito was really salty and the chips were a bit stale.
I'm sad because this used to be one of my fave Mexican spots.
The sauce used to be amazing
and it's whatever now.
Where has the quality gone???
carne asada.author: Ryan C.
carne asada.review: My carne asada burrito was really salty and the chips were a bit stale. I'm sad because this used to be one of my fave Mexican spots. The sauce used to be amazing and it's whatever now. Where has the quality gone???

excerpts: My wife had the Carne asada burrito, it was good nothing to write home about.
carne asada.author: Manny G.
carne asada.review: The prawn burrito was excellent, I had every intention of eating half and taking home the remainder. Well let's just say that idea went out the window after the first bite. Did I forget to mention that I had Wolfed down more than my share of the delicious guacamole. My wife had the Carne asada burrito, it was good nothing to write home about. The dude next to me was eating the mole burrito and that will be my next item I try.  Parking can be a challenge and the seating area is tight during the lunch rush. Be patient it is worth it.

excerpts: I ordered a veggie burrito to go tonight and it turned out to be a carne asada burrito.
Seriously not cool..
carne asada.author: Elena K.
carne asada.review: I am so sad to write this.. I always loved Papalote for your veggie options. I ordered a veggie burrito to go tonight and it turned out to be a carne asada burrito. Seriously not cool..

excerpts: $14 for a large heavy carne asada burrito with lots of rice, beans, guacamole but had to hunt for the meat.
In fact, I had to unwrap the burrito to be sure there was even any meat in it.
What I found were a few tiny diced squares of beef that looked like someone's skimpy night-before leftovers.
carne asada.author: Bob J.
carne asada.review: $14 for a large heavy carne asada burrito with lots of rice, beans, guacamole but had to hunt for the meat. In fact, I had to unwrap the burrito to be sure there was even any meat in it. What I found were a few tiny diced squares of beef that looked like someone's skimpy night-before leftovers. At best maybe they ran out of beef and thought they could make it up with extra rice and beans. The place is way overrated. I feel ripped off. I took the food to go, and only realized it was all rice and beans after I arrived home, and did not feel like driving back to return it. Maybe they would have put some meat in the burrito if they knew I was eating there in the restaurant. Either way, El Papelote is obviously just looking to charge as much as they can for the lowest cost possible. I live in the neighborhood and will not be back.

excerpts: The carne asada here is BOMB.
carne asada.author: Angela D.
carne asada.review:
5 stars for the salsa.
Buy it and buy it in bulk! :)
I have seen the salsa at Bi-Rite Market if you can't go to the restaurant itself.

The carne asada here is BOMB. Get that and you will be a happy camper.

Wait is a bit unbearable at times for a seat but only because you come starving and all that chip and salsa smell makes you salivate and hangry. Yes, I lack patience.

On another note, the horchata I thought was horrible. It was chalky. I say AVOID and get a mexican soda or even better, a beer.

excerpts: It's unique, creamy and has a load of taste to it-- I ended up stuffing myself with chips and the salsa (comes with every order) to the point where I got too full to finish the carne asada
burrito
I ordered, which by the way, was good too.
I got the smaller of the two burrito sizes but found it too be a hefty amount.
carne asada.author: Janelle S.
carne asada.review:
Came here for a quick fix of the sudden Mexican food cravings... Friendly service and the food was delicious! The place itself is pretty small so I could see it on peak time getting crowded but we came here on a Sunday evening for dinner and found a spot to sit with no problem-- not crowded but most tables were occupied. They offer ordering to go ahead of time so that's a good alternative if you don't want to stay or want to do pick up. 

I really enjoyed their salsa! It's unique, creamy and has a load of taste to it-- I ended up stuffing myself with chips and the salsa (comes with every order) to the point where I got too full to finish the carne asada burrito I ordered, which by the way, was good too. I got the smaller of the two burrito sizes but found it too be a hefty amount. My friend had the chicken mole burrito and thought it was really great, granted, it was her first time trying mole. Only thing I didn't like was the Horchata. Personally, it was too grainy for me and had some floral aftertaste but maybe I'm not used to it? Despite that, I'll definitely be returning here!

excerpts: The carne asada quesadilla was OK, the cheese was a little too gritty for my taste.
but it was 25% prawns, 75% tortilla and cheese.
I would recommend the carne asada burrito and douse that baby with their famous salsa (ask for easy on the beans).
carne asada.author: Jess C.
carne asada.review:
Papalote drew much of its fame from winning the throwdown against Bobby Flay on Food Network. Their salsa was so famous that they decided to bottle and sell it; and I have to admit it was good and very unique because it's heavy on the creamy side, thick, and completely blended through.

The food was good.... depending on what you order. The carne asada quesadilla was OK, the cheese was a little too gritty for my taste. The prawn quesadilla was tasty but it was 25% prawns, 75% tortilla and cheese. 

I would recommend the carne asada burrito and douse that baby with their famous salsa (ask for easy on the beans). The rice-meat-beans proportion is perfect (unlike the heavy on the rice/beans at Cancun or Farrolito), and the serving size is generous. 

Note: Not a fan of the stale chips.

excerpts: Got a naked carne asada "burrito" which is basically a chipotle bowl but not as flavorful.
carne asada.author: Emma M.
carne asada.review:
Got a naked carne asada "burrito" which is basically a chipotle bowl but not as flavorful. the meal was very chewy and even though I got a "super" which is an extra $2 for guac, sour cream, and cheese, it was somehow bland. 

Salsa is amazing. 

BF's chicken burrito on the tomato tortilla was good.

excerpts: Carne Asada burrito was also delicious, but I wish it was wrapped tighter; contents were loose in the tortilla.
carne asada.author: Bonnie L.
carne asada.review:
MMM! Good food and friendly service.

Nachos were delicious with their special salsa. Very creamy.

Carne Asada burrito was also delicious, but I wish it was wrapped tighter; contents were loose in the tortilla.

excerpts: Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito.
I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid.
Burrito can't be beat!
Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!
carne asada.author: Suzanne P.
carne asada.review: This place is the reason that The Mission is famed for burritos! We stopped in on a Sunday evening, a little before your typical dinner rush. We were able to order quickly and got a small table with no wait. Go here with an appetite b/c no matter how much you want to stop eating, you just can't! We had the house made salsa (OMG! So good!), chicken and grilled veggie nachos (Again... OMG!) to start. Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito. I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid. Burrito can't be beat! Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!

excerpts: I would gladly go back for their carne asada burrito.

Overall Thoughts

Salsa is delicious and well worth trying as well as the carne asada but be warned Papalote isn't a cheap grab and go burrito kind of place
carne asada.author: Eddie W.
carne asada.review:
7x7 100 Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2012

#46 Chips and Salsa at Papalote

My first question to myself was how good can the chips and salsa really be or was this just another fill in item. Well I finally was able to have my answer this past week. 

After deliberating where to go, we decided to go to Papalote for their chips and salsa. While browsing their menu online I noticed something odd. Everyone on Yelp kept posting pictures of the Triple Threat Burrito however I saw it no where on the menu. Turns out it is their signature item that was featured on Bobby Flay's show Throwdown. 

Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super. To me it is weird that isn't included in the price but ok. My friend and I agreed to split the burrito plus get chips, extra salsa and two beers. We both ended up paying $18 for just that so keep that in mind. 

For what its worth, the salsa is unlike any other salsa I have had. From color, consistency and all the way down to flavor there is a complexity to their salsa that is well worth trying. The chips did not appear to be anything out of the ordinary but I would recommend trying the salsa at least one time. 

The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant. It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender. I would gladly go back for their carne asada burrito. 

Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.

As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with. The quality was good and cooked well but didn't find it be a valid "threat".

Overall Thoughts

Salsa is delicious and well worth trying as well as the carne asada but be warned Papalote isn't a cheap grab and go burrito kind of place

excerpts:
3 stars for the Triple Threat
4 stars for the carne asada tacos
5 stars for the salsa
The carne asada taco had all the fixings and the steak was distinct and tasted great!
The salsa...forget about it...
I'll be back to try a normal carne asada burrito so that I can make a better comparison of the other taqueria spots I've already tried.
I'll be back for sure!
carne asada.author: Andrew S.
carne asada.review:
3 stars for the Triple Threat
4 stars for the carne asada tacos
5 stars for the salsa

Maybe the pictures got the best of me and it looked better than it tasted. The TT was a little overhyped in my opinion. The idea/concept is legit and the thing is enormous, but the flavors are a little muddled because there's just too much going on. I couldn't really taste the steak or the chicken although I know it's there. The carne asada taco had all the fixings and the steak was distinct and tasted great! The salsa...forget about it...it's hands down addicting like crack! 

I'll be back to try a normal carne asada burrito so that I can make a better comparison of the other taqueria spots I've already tried. I'll be back for sure!

excerpts: I ordered Super Carne Asada Burrito Togo and it was delicious and friendly chef actually brought it out
carne asada.author: Daniel H.
carne asada.review:
I ordered Super Carne Asada Burrito Togo and it was delicious and friendly chef actually brought it out :)

Their jalapenos are really good too and it's not too  spicy. I think their unique selling point is definitely the salsa.

excerpts: I've been here so many times and was just let down once (my carne asada burrito with garlic rice was for some reason wayyyy too salty) but other than that, love this place!
carne asada.author: Mauna T.
carne asada.review: Definitely my favorite burrito place in San Francisco. I've been here so many times and was just let down once (my carne asada burrito with garlic rice was for some reason wayyyy too salty) but other than that, love this place!

excerpts: Excellent carne asada tacos.
The meat is high quality.
The taco fixings are perfect and generous.
OMG and that salsa though?!!?!!!!
No wonder they bottle it...
It's life changing :)
carne asada.author: Lajuanda A.
carne asada.review: Excellent carne asada tacos. The meat is high quality. The taco fixings are perfect and generous. OMG and that salsa though?!!?!!!! No wonder they bottle it... It's life changing :)

excerpts: Papalote gets points on fresh ingredients, a juicy carne asada (which should never be dry, dammit why is it always dry), and griddled burritos by default (think dorado style at La Taq).
carne asada.author: Zach M.
carne asada.review:
Hipstered burritos? In MY Mission?
It's more likely than you think.

Papalote gets points on fresh ingredients, a juicy carne asada (which should never be dry, dammit why is it always dry), and griddled burritos by default (think dorado style at La Taq).

They lose points, however, on the orange-colored salsa. It's more like an aioli honestly, and it had very little flavor. I'm surprised the Yelp literati raves about it because we were not impressed.

The chips and guac were fine, and pickled jalapeños you grab out of a jar were a nice touch. If a friend really wanted to come here, I wouldn't complain. But the SO and I both agree, we'll stick to the tried and true burrito corridor on Mission Street.

excerpts:
I ordered the fish tacos & my boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito.  
Each order comes with side of tortilla chips & salsa. 
This salsa was DELICIOUS - very unique, not too spicy, not bland & very creamy. 
My fish tacos came out & they were amazing!
There were nicely cut chunks of fresh fish in there & they didn't skimp out at all. 
I have to say these fish tacos are the best that I've tried in SF thus far!
carne asada.author: Sylvia N.
carne asada.review:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to try Papalote!

My boyfriend & I were craving really good salsa so I checked on Yelp & saw that I had bookmarked Papalote for years - perfect!
It was a beautiful day in San Francisco. 
We found parking almost immediately & was welcomed with upbeat Mexican music when we walked in. 
I ordered the fish tacos & my boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito.  
Each order comes with side of tortilla chips & salsa. 
This salsa was DELICIOUS - very unique, not too spicy, not bland & very creamy. 
My boyfriend wished it had a little more tomato-ness to it, but I thought it was great.

My fish tacos came out & they were amazing!
There were nicely cut chunks of fresh fish in there & they didn't skimp out at all. 
I think they might put a TEENY bit too much shredded cheese but I guess it just depends on your taste. 
I have to say these fish tacos are the best that I've tried in SF thus far!

My boyfriend really enjoyed his burrito. 
I tried it out & I thought it had a really good grilled flavor to it. 
The meat was tender - not dry at all (which surprised me because it looks dry at first glance).  
The one thing I would say is that I think they put too much rice. 

Overall great experience at Papalote. 
As other reviewers have mentioned, it IS a bit pricey - so don't go in there thinking you'll have a cheap meal. 
We paid $23 for the tacos (which comes in two), the burrito, & one horchata.

excerpts: There Carne asada is delicious and same goes for the salsa!
carne asada.author: Karla V.
carne asada.review: Great food and good price! There Carne asada is delicious and same goes for the salsa!

excerpts: I ordered the carne asada regular.
They bring out chips and dip.
The chips are fine, but not my preference as they are thick.
The salsa has a nice flavor, but a bit different, not your normal red/green.
The blueprint for the burrito, carne asada, pintos, rice, wheat tortilla, and salsa.
Tortilla good, other ingredients standard flavors , but the carne asada is fantastic and they are generous with the helpings!
All of this comes together in a perfect mix.
Throw off the shackles of corporate greed and try an original in the Mission District.....
carne asada.author: Paul V.
carne asada.review: So you like the generic Chipotle burrito?  Why not whilst in San Francisco try the real deal?  First order at the counter, ask for a table or to go.  Simple menu.  I ordered the carne asada regular.  They bring out chips and dip.  The chips are fine, but not my preference as they are thick.  The salsa has a nice flavor, but a bit different, not your normal red/green.  The blueprint for the burrito, carne asada, pintos, rice, wheat tortilla, and salsa.  Tortilla good, other ingredients standard flavors , but the carne asada is fantastic and they are generous with the helpings!  All of this comes together in a perfect mix.  Throw off the shackles of corporate greed and try an original in the Mission District.....

excerpts: I had the carne asada burrito with refried beans and nachos.
carne asada.author: TOY A.
carne asada.review:
I had the carne asada burrito with refried beans and nachos. Both with guoc sour cream and cheese. The beef was really tender, surprisingly good. A friend of ours recc'd the place and had no idea it had so many reviews. Must be all the out of town yelpers like myself peeping it.
 
The food is good, jarritos is a plus and cant go wrong with a cerveza to chase it down.

  The bathroom is like a high school one, all tagged up but is clean. Too close to the dining area though.

Parking is tricky so good luck. We found meter street parking

excerpts: I ordered the carne asada super burrito
and it was one of the best burritos I've ever had!
The meat was nice and juicy and very flavorful.
It also comes with chips and this orange sauce which is a little bit spicy but bearable.
I would definitely come again!
carne asada.author: Bailey L.
carne asada.review: I ordered the carne asada super burrito and it was one of the best burritos I've ever had! The meat was nice and juicy and very flavorful. It also comes with chips and this orange sauce which is a little bit spicy but bearable. I would definitely come again!

excerpts: I had the carne asada burrito, it's my go to.
The taste is definitely there.
It's packed full of flavor, the vegetables were fresh, the meat tender and cooked to perfection, the service was blazing fast (which mexican place isn't?).
However, the portions left me wanting more.
Or maybe it's my huge appetite.
Other places give you a giant burrito that can fill an ogre.
The burritos here were moderate sized, not enough for your average (read:
carne asada.author: Phan H.
carne asada.review:
The hype about this place is as high as ever. But there are so many great options in the area, does this one hold up to its reputation? I'm going to say no. It's getting a high rating from me because I generally love Mexican food, especially if it's in the Mission. If I say it's in my top ten, that's got to be a good thing right?

I had the carne asada burrito, it's my go to. The taste is definitely there. It's packed full of flavor, the vegetables were fresh, the meat tender and cooked to perfection, the service was blazing fast (which mexican place isn't?). However, the portions left me wanting more. Or maybe it's my huge appetite. Other places give you a giant burrito that can fill an ogre. The burritos here were moderate sized, not enough for your average (read: fat) american. 

I had a jamaica aka hibiscus drink as well, but found it too sugary.

Still, it's a good location, and the food was delicious. The portions were average size, but for the price, the value is missing. I'd also like to complain about the lack of seating, but I came in at a very busy time, so that's probably my own fault.

excerpts: For example, you go to El Farolito for their carne asada.
carne asada.author: Jonathan S.
carne asada.review: When visitors come to SF, they're often familiar with mission-style burritos.  What they DON'T know is that different taquerias have different specialties.  For example, you go to El Farolito for their carne asada.  Personally, I love the chicken tikka masala burrito from Curry Up Now.  But you go to Papalote for their shrimp burrito.  It's huge and delightful.  Plus their creamy salsa?  Two thumbs up.

excerpts: Had carne asada tacos and a side of achiote chicken.
carne asada.author: Dahlia S.
carne asada.review:
Bottom line at the top: really yummy!!
--
The sauce here is to die for. Had carne asada tacos and a side of achiote chicken. Service is great but they are weirdly stingy about extra sauce. 

La Taqueria is still my favorite joint in SF but this is still a great spot.

excerpts: The carne asada burrito was off the chain, with tender beef and rich flavor and the burrito was not overly salted.
carne asada.author: Angel S.
carne asada.review:
[Featured:  Throwdown with Bobby Flay, Food Network, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gSciXC-jO8I]

Pop Quiz:  What SF burrito joint absolutely pwned Chef Bobby Flay in a salsa and burrito throwdown on national TV?  If you responded "Papalote" ... ding ding ding!

Seriously, as much as I like El Farolito (of which I am also a fan), Papalote will likely be in the mix for my go to spots for Mexican fare, even though I have mixed feelings.  As far as authenticity and value, Papalote is lacking, so I can see where others are coming from when they reduce Papalote as merely a fancy Chipotle, though I don't agree.  Also, Papalote's burritos are slightly smaller and pricier than its Mission counterparts.  

On the other hand.  It's hard to argue with the quality, especially the famed roasted tomato salsa. 

Overrated?  Nope, I don't think so.  Papalote's burrito and quesadilla were simply delicious, no exaggerated flavors.  In my view, Papalote deserves all the pub that comes with being named as SF Weekly's "best burrito" every year since 2007.  Now the Food Network has taken notice.

The carne asada burrito was off the chain, with tender beef and rich flavor and the burrito was not overly salted.  Plus it was just the right size that it wont leave you stuffed and bloated after the meal.

However, the highlight of my meal was the camarones quesadilla, which features shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter with delicious melted cheese...seriously, this is very very good stuff.  Add to that the flavor of the roasted peppers, with a dab of roasted tomato salsa and a bottle of coke on the side...I'd say that's a winning combo.

Unfortunately, the only damper was that the chips we got were too hard and they might have been a little stale.  It didn't matter too much in the end.  The roasted tomato salsa was so good that I could have dipped cardboard in it and I would have enjoyed the meal.

Thank you; Chef Escobedo.  I now have my sights set on the adobo buritto (off menu) and, maybe the triple threat.  Yet another reason to love the Mission District.

excerpts: I got it with carne asada, refried beans, white rice, housemade salsa (bought an extra jar of the fresh-made stuff), sour cream, cheese.
Just divine and cannot wait to return.
I would take the BART into the City just for this burrito.
carne asada.author: Sara R.
carne asada.review: Best burrito I've had in the Bay Area. I got it with carne asada, refried beans, white rice, housemade salsa (bought an extra jar of the fresh-made stuff), sour cream, cheese. Just divine and cannot wait to return. I would take the BART into the City just for this burrito.

excerpts: Carne asada was well seasoned.
Very good locally owned neighborhood place.
carne asada.author: CS W.
carne asada.review: Friendly service, casual atmosphere and very good food (and generous portions). Carne asada was well seasoned. Very good locally owned neighborhood place.

excerpts: Really good carne asada.
I got the carne asada tacos, which was two tacos with carne asada, salsa, and lettuce.
Really simple but great-tasting.
carne asada.author: Cindy B.
carne asada.review:
Really good carne asada. The horchata wasn't bad either. 

I got the carne asada tacos, which was two tacos with carne asada, salsa, and lettuce. Really simple but great-tasting. My order also came with complimentary chips. 

Kind of a small spot, but I was able to find a small table to sit at. Service was ok.

excerpts: I had a veggie burrito and my boyfriend had carne asada nachos.
We ate everything lol
carne asada.author: Mihaela P.
carne asada.review:
I saw this place on TV and decided to give it a try. Not gonna lie, the place itself was not the cleanest and there was not enough room to move around. I definitely felt a bit claustrophobic when it got full. 
The chips and salsa they serve prior to bringing your food were not that great. The chips were very hard (almost stale) so I just assume that they don't make their own chips but take them out of a bag. 
The food was really good, though. That's why I'm giving this place 4 stars despite the ambience. I had a veggie burrito and my boyfriend had carne asada nachos. We ate everything lol

excerpts:
- carne asada - solid
- you get an extra side of their signature orange salsa
- it comes with this jicama?

slaw
-

you choose what type of beans you want (black, refried)
- then the kicker, it's $20 and it's the same size of a regular super burrito.
carne asada.author: Earl G.
carne asada.review:
Much respect to Team Papalote who represented SF well and handed Iron Chef Bobby Flay his ass on Food Network's "Throwdown - Burrito edition." 

I came here for lunch with some coworkers. The semi-long line moves fairly quickly, you place your order, take a seat, a person brings you chips with their signature orange salsa, and then your order. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=mhg77Sztnk2avL-lcA-sxg) 

Here's the breakdown for the champion "Triple Threat Burrito". 

- It's made to order since it took about 20 minutes to come out.
- 3 different types of meat, 
          - 4 grilled prawns - very juicy. 
          - marinated and grilled, white meat chicken - juicy 
          - carne asada - solid
- you get an extra side of their signature orange salsa
- it comes with this jicama? slaw
- you choose what type of beans you want (black, refried)
- then the kicker, it's $20 and it's the same size of a regular super burrito. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=eKBq5WSoQVZabdWyZf25qQ)

I did a doubletake on the $20 price tag but, it is, what it is and halved it with a coworker. This is what food history tastes like.

Overall, it's good, probably a 3 star burrito with 1 star value but I'll give them 4 stars because Bobby Flay is an arrogant SOB. Oh yeah, Iron Chef Flay always loses ethnic eats. 

Are you ready for a throwdown?

excerpts: I had the carne asada burrito with whole black beans, and I appreciate their  mission of providing healthier burritos.
That being said, I am a fan of the very large, unhealthy greasy burritos and so I am very biased.
Their location is awesome, and their dining room is lively and communal which is cool.
Their was a pretty long wait for my food
so as I wasn't really happy to stand there and wait 10 minutes, I know its because they ere cooking up or order fresh, so
it was.
I would for sure recommend to call in your order ahead of time if you want to get in and out quickly.
carne asada.author: Jack W.
carne asada.review:
SO I am going to say that this seemed to me to be a very eel put together and healthy tasting burrito. Not greasy, very fresh, great options. I had the carne asada burrito with whole black beans, and I appreciate their  mission of providing healthier burritos. 
That being said, I am a fan of the very large, unhealthy greasy burritos and so I am very biased.
Their location is awesome, and their dining room is lively and communal which is cool. Their was a pretty long wait for my food so as I wasn't really happy to stand there and wait 10 minutes, I know its because they ere cooking up or order fresh, so it was. 
I would for sure recommend to call in your order ahead of time if you want to get in and out quickly.

excerpts: I went with the carne asada super burrito in the spinach tortilla.
Despite its size I finished the entire burrito because it was that delicious.
carne asada.author: William C.
carne asada.review: This more than met my craving for an authentic California Burritto. I went with the carne asada super burrito in the spinach tortilla. Despite its size I finished the entire burrito because it was that delicious.

excerpts: The Carne Asada and the Mexipino Burritos are 2 really good Burritos here.
I can't explain on how good both are.
The Mexipino combines a Filipino twist with a Mexican taste.
TRY IT!!
Also Try the Salsa!!!
As for the Carne Asada, I have had alot of Carne Asada burritos in my time and this place is on the top of my list.
The meat wasn't dry or tough to eat.
It was perfect.
carne asada.author: Aryan O.
carne asada.review:
The Carne Asada and the Mexipino Burritos are 2 really good Burritos here. I can't explain on how good both are. The Mexipino combines a Filipino twist with a Mexican taste. TRY IT!! Also Try the Salsa!!! Too Good!!!!

As for the Carne Asada, I have had alot of Carne Asada burritos in my time and this place is on the top of my list. The meat wasn't dry or tough to eat. It was perfect. Somewhat tender yet still kept all the flavors. 

The place is pretty small, so good luck if you want to eat there. Really tight spaces so if you're claustrophobic of any means, than I would suggest taking your food to go and take a stroll to Dolores Park and eat there.

Parking isn't a problem too much, I would first look residential first then meter.

excerpts: My girlfriend and I shared the carne asada plate.
Let's talk for a moment about carne asada.
The carne asada at this place is devoid of all of the qualities I've just described.
carne asada.author: Brad T.
carne asada.review:
Let's get this out of the way. I've spent the majority of my life in Southern California, where we all know there is an overabundance of fantastic Mexican food. Yes, I'm sometimes snobby about it. That works in your favor, because I'll help you avoid eating at places like Papalote.

Let's start with the food, of course. It sucked. My girlfriend and I shared the carne asada plate. Let's talk for a moment about carne asada. Typically, but not always, made from skirt steak, prized for it's flavor, not it's tenderness. It's for this reason that they usually marinate the shit out of it to break it down a bit prior to searing it to impart some additional flavorful goodness and then cutting it across the grain to make it easy to eat. Did that make you hungry? Well then don't go to Papalote. The carne asada at this place is devoid of all of the qualities I've just described.

And I suppose I shouldn't have been surprised that all of the accompanying sides (with the exception of the refried black beans; those were surprisingly tasty) were mediocre at best. The worst thing you can ever say about Mexican food is that it tastes bland. And this was soul-suckingly bland trash, served piping hot to people who don't know any better. As of this writing, Papalote has 4 stars on Yelp... I'm actually angry.

To add insult to injury, this plate of junk cost 16 bucks, plus 3-something for a side of guac... So just over 21 bucks with tax for ONE plate of food... Fuck. That.

excerpts: get the carne asada super burrito with a  whole wheat tortilla
and you'll never regret it.
super fast take out service, standard speed sit down service, frenziedly people and friendly atmosphere.
i recommend this place to all incoming visitors and friends.
carne asada.author: Kyle H.
carne asada.review: This place is the bomb. such good burritos. get the carne asada super burrito with a  whole wheat tortilla and you'll never regret it. super fast take out service, standard speed sit down service, frenziedly people and friendly atmosphere. i recommend this place to all incoming visitors and friends.

excerpts: The carne asada was so salty and cut into these large unappetizing chunks.
The thing was overloaded in rice and barely any of the add-ons were detectable.
It really needed the sour cream to neutralize the crazy amount of salt.
I'll continue to buy the salsa because it's amazing
but I'll get my burrito fix elsewhere.
PS - cut back on the salt!
carne asada.author: Kari F.
carne asada.review: Bummer. I ordered a burrito and beverage - $15-16. Ouch. I come home cradling my precious burrito and was so sad when I could barely eat it. The carne asada was so salty and cut into these large unappetizing chunks. The thing was overloaded in rice and barely any of the add-ons were detectable. It really needed the sour cream to neutralize the crazy amount of salt. I'll continue to buy the salsa because it's amazing but I'll get my burrito fix elsewhere. PS - cut back on the salt!

excerpts:
good, but not authentic
- Salsa is unique, love that they give you chips/salsa with your order - worth trying this place for this only
- Pollo asado, carne asada are both "good", not amazing or authentic tasting
- I've only done takeout so never had to wait
carne asada.author: Melody T.
carne asada.review:
Another 3.5 rating - went for the 4 stars as the salsa deserves that extra 1/2 star.

- "Americanized" Mexican food (imo)
- Tastes good, but not authentic
- Salsa is unique, love that they give you chips/salsa with your order - worth trying this place for this only
- Pollo asado, carne asada are both "good", not amazing or authentic tasting
- I've only done takeout so never had to wait

excerpts: My girlfriend and I visited this nice cozy place, and really enjoyed the Carne Asada Burrito.
carne asada.author: A.J. T.
carne asada.review:
Delicious Authentic Mexican Burrito. 

My girlfriend and I visited this nice cozy place, and really enjoyed the Carne Asada Burrito.  The salsa has nice spice and tastes excellent.  

The prices are a bit on the higher end, but other than that it was an awesome place to grab delicious food.

excerpts: and you really can taste each distinctive type of meat (carne asada, chicken, shrimp) inside the burrito... while they all somehow taste well together.
carne asada.author: Chris P.
carne asada.review:
Quick qualification, full disclosure: I worked the Food Network/Bobby Flay "Throwdown" production gig that featured the Triple Threat Burrito.

My rating really is closer to a 4.9 star rating buuuuut I still can't quite get passed the $20 price tag on the Triple Threat burrito, which happens to be my favorite thing here... that and their secret sauce salsa of course.

I, like a few others, without a doubt suggest you order 1 Triple Threat and split it with someone. It's large and awesome. It's always cooked just right and you really can taste each distinctive type of meat (carne asada, chicken, shrimp) inside the burrito... while they all somehow taste well together. Everything seems to be in just right the place.

I also usually order a quesadilla or something like that and spilt it with my fellow grubber.

P.S.- Totally nice staff, including the bros/owners that were featured on Bobby Flay's show.

excerpts: I remember that I really liked the carne asada burrito last year more than the chicken adobo burrito.
But my coworker said he really liked the adobo one better.
So my wily side came out
and I convinced him to half his adobo burrito with me
and I'll half my carne asada with him.
The chicken adobo burrito came out first.
I remember the last time I had it, it was kinda dry.
That wasn't the case this time.
It was actually pretty juicy.
The adobo flavor is definitely not the typical Filipino adobo flavor.
There's something different about it.
Maybe a Mexican touch?
I'm no chef
so I can't really say what it is.
Either way, it still tastes good.
I'd get it again.
On a side note, my coworker ordered it with no beans
and I think this was a genius decision.
I think beans would have messed up the harmony of the burrito overall.
The carne asada was just like I remembered it.
Juicy and tasty all around.
You can really taste the grill flavor in the meat.
It was actually a little more saltier than before, but I'm going to overlook that cuz I still enjoyed it.
Overall, I was thoroughly full.
Afterwards, I felt like my stomach was bulging and wished I could lay down and take a fat-ass nap.
I think there must be a school close by because the younger gen started to filter in as we were finishing our meal.
And that meant it was time to go back to work.
carne asada.author: Joe M.
carne asada.review:
I know what you're thinking...Come on, Joe.  Papalote was so last year.  Nah, man.  It's still hella good.  I hadn't been here since all the hype last year made the lines insanely long.  But I came here yesterday with my coworker around 1pm and the line was practically non-existent.  I remember that I really liked the carne asada burrito last year more than the chicken adobo burrito.  But my coworker said he really liked the adobo one better.  So my wily side came out and I convinced him to half his adobo burrito with me and I'll half my carne asada with him.  The best of both worlds!

I started my meal off with their nachos and signature salsa.  The spiciness of the salsa has a nice little kick to it that makes your mouth say, "Feed me another....and another.....one more......aw hell, just keep going."  I balanced it out with their freshly squeezed cantaloupe drink.  I frikkin' love freshly squeezed cantaloupe drinks! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=Tk-JVGQ-oTYVcHBMxuxG5Q)

The chicken adobo burrito came out first.  I remember the last time I had it, it was kinda dry.  That wasn't the case this time.  It was actually pretty juicy.  The adobo flavor is definitely not the typical Filipino adobo flavor.  There's something different about it.  Maybe a Mexican touch?  I'm no chef so I can't really say what it is.  Either way, it still tastes good.  I'd get it again.  On a side note, my coworker ordered it with no beans and I think this was a genius decision.  I think beans would have messed up the harmony of the burrito overall. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=F-QEBmUZwDW3MJ-y1suNvg)

The carne asada was just like I remembered it.  Juicy and tasty all around.  You can really taste the grill flavor in the meat.  It was actually a little more saltier than before, but I'm going to overlook that cuz I still enjoyed it.  Overall, I was thoroughly full.  Afterwards, I felt like my stomach was bulging and wished I could lay down and take a fat-ass nap.  I think there must be a school close by because the younger gen started to filter in as we were finishing our meal.  And that meant it was time to go back to work.

excerpts: Carne asada is too salty and low quality cuts and the chili verde too dry.
carne asada.author: Drew W.
carne asada.review:
Been coming here for years because of the superior salsa and veggie options.  But now that I'm eating meat once again, I have to say the meat burritos are rather meh.

Carne asada is too salty and low quality cuts and the chili verde too dry.  And now that the prices have been raised sky high, what's with still charging for extra salsa?!  You can't just give one extra for fux sake?!

Still the best for veggie options, and yes...their precious salsa, but i'll hit up the plethora of better and cheaper options for my meat burritos from now on. Sigh....

excerpts: I had a carne asada super burrito which I thought was quite tasty.
On the other hand I felt as though I received a healthy amount of carne asada and enjoyed my burrito well enough.
carne asada.author: Pizzle D.
carne asada.review:
Well I felt a little duped after eating here. 

I had located this little hole in the wall using yelps reviews and photos of the food. I ran across Dungeness crab enchiladas and was sold. Upon looking over the menu board there was no crab or enchiladas any where in sight. Oh well, must have been a special, no big deal. I had a carne asada super burrito which I thought was quite tasty. My girl on the other hand who ended up getting the prawn super burrito ($12.95), received only 4 small very over cooked prawns in her burrito, she was pissed. It was a lot of rice and beans for $13.
On the other hand I felt as though I received a healthy amount of carne asada and enjoyed my burrito well enough.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken burrito and my husband got a carne asada burrito.
They have whole wheat tortillas which is nice and the burrito has tons of flavor.
Make sure you get their signature sauce to dip your burrito in.
Don't get your food to go, doesn't do it justice.
carne asada.author: Melissa S.
carne asada.review: It's my second time here but I must say this experience was much better than the first time. The first time we took burritos to Dolores Park. Eating at the restaurant while you food is still piping hot is a much better option. We got the nachos which were delicious. Comes with Refried black beans and the cheese is melted perfectly. I ordered a chicken burrito and my husband got a carne asada burrito. They have whole wheat tortillas which is nice and the burrito has tons of flavor. Make sure you get their signature sauce to dip your burrito in. Don't get your food to go, doesn't do it justice.

excerpts: I just ate the best carne asada burrito I've ever had in my life.
Kudos to the team at Papalote!
carne asada.author: Chris C.
carne asada.review: I just ate the best carne asada burrito I've ever had in my life. Kudos to the team at Papalote!

excerpts: So, I got close to my standard burrito; carne asada, pinto beans, super, no rice.
It was damn good.
This whole time, I was comparing each burrito to my favorite burrito of all time, the carne asada burrito at Mondo in Santa Clara.
And I decided that I'd rather have that burrito than a Mission
burrito.
It was fun while it lasted, and
I'm sure I'll be back for a Mission burrito again!
carne asada.author: Nadeem A.
carne asada.review:
In what turned out to be the last installment of The Mission Burrito Experiment, I visited Papalote Mexican Grill. I was new to the Mission burrito scene and needed to decide if I like Mission burritos or not by visiting a few of the burrito joints in the Mission.  Some may argue that Papalote's burritos aren't quite Mission burritos, but I decided to give them a chance as part of my experiment.

So, I got close to my standard burrito; carne asada, pinto beans, super, no rice. It was damn good.  It was very similar in flavor to the previous Mission burritos.

As mentioned, this was the last installment of The Mission Burrito Experiment.  This whole time, I was comparing each burrito to my favorite burrito of all time, the carne asada burrito at Mondo in Santa Clara.  And I decided that I'd rather have that burrito than a Mission burrito.  It was fun while it lasted, and I'm sure I'll be back for a Mission burrito again!

excerpts: it has carne asada, chicken, prawns, Mexican rice, and of course sour cream and guacamole.
To be real
I don't even know if I went to the one from the show but cuuuh so dank. if you're in SF or just a tourist, I would definitely recommend coming here.
Sure $19.99 is pretty pricy for food
and it's probably a lot cheaper if you make it yourself but for the experience it's well worth it.
With that being said, I'm sure their other burritos are pretty dank as well
I think you could custom make your burritos too.
Also their sauce is pretty dank too like
it's not too spicy but not too mild.
I don't even really know if that made sense
but hey super good food!
shout outs to taco trip
carne asada.author: Jaspur P.
carne asada.review: so I was here in SF for the weekend with some homies and we decided to eat here because of this show called taco trips. the show itself is pretty freaking corny if you ask me but hey they do show some pretty good looking food. Anyways, DANK yo triple threat burrito for $19.99 i think $23 after tax. Definitely worth it. The burrito is pretty large in size. it has carne asada, chicken, prawns, Mexican rice, and of course sour cream and guacamole. To be real I don't even know if I went to the one from the show but cuuuh so dank. if you're in SF or just a tourist, I would definitely recommend coming here. Sure $19.99 is pretty pricy for food and it's probably a lot cheaper if you make it yourself but for the experience it's well worth it. With that being said, I'm sure their other burritos are pretty dank as well I think you could custom make your burritos too. Also their sauce is pretty dank too like it's not too spicy but not too mild. I don't even really know if that made sense but hey super good food! shout outs to taco trip

excerpts: The carne asada is amongst the best I have ever had - ever.
So flavorful and tender, clearly not the cheapest cut of meat.
The servers, although a bit flustered during busy hours, are very friendly and helpful in getting you a table.
My only complaint is that you definitely cannot eat this burrito with your hands - it's wrapped pretty loosely so everything starts leaking/falling out the bottom halfway through.
carne asada.author: Amy Y.
carne asada.review: As everyone else says, the salsa is a must. It's kind of like a spicy creamy tomato/marinara sauce, which might sound odd but is actually really delicious on your burrito of choice. The carne asada is amongst the best I have ever had - ever. So flavorful and tender, clearly not the cheapest cut of meat. The servers, although a bit flustered during busy hours, are very friendly and helpful in getting you a table. My only complaint is that you definitely cannot eat this burrito with your hands - it's wrapped pretty loosely so everything starts leaking/falling out the bottom halfway through.

excerpts: I ordered a carne asada platter.
It was a pretty good plate but it was nothing that would stand out.
I've had many other carne asada platters that were just as good and a fair number that were better.
carne asada.author: Mark D.
carne asada.review:
First up, I am sure I am not the first to end up here because they were on Throwdown with Bobby Flay.

I had high expectations.  The place was super busy.  I ordered.  Time karma was with me and I was able to land a table.  Figuring there would be a wait, I had gotten a couple of beers.
