And there was a wait.  It was about twenty minutes.  Not horrible but Mexican food is usually fast.

I ordered a carne asada platter.  It was a pretty good plate but it was nothing that would stand out.  I've had many other carne asada platters that were just as good and a fair number that were better.

If I was in the neighborhood, I would go back.  But I would not go out of my way to return.

excerpts: I had the carne asada, twice.
Just amazing.
If I moved to SF, I'd take Papalote into account when considering location.
Seriously.
carne asada.author: Eric B.
carne asada.review:
This is what I was most looking forward to, and it didn't disappoint. It was described as a notch above the traditional Mission burrito as far as ingredients and presentation, yet still classic and delicious.

That sauce is definitely fantastic. Really great on everything - I could drink it.

I had the carne asada, twice. Just amazing. If I moved to SF, I'd take Papalote into account when considering location. Seriously.

excerpts: I got the carne asada super burrito, and including being more expensive than El Farolito or La Taqueria, it was also much more subpar.
The meat was tender, but it was lukewarm.
In fact, everything was just lukewarm.
The rice tasted strangely old.
I mean, it was okay,
carne asada.author: Roy C.
carne asada.review:
*2.5 stars*

Papalote is really ALL about the salsa. When it comes to Mexican food, however, great salsa is awesome, but it's definitely not the make-or-break factor. Papalote has amazing salsa, but that's pretty much all it has going for it.

When you're a hole-in-the-wall Mexican restaurant in the Mission, then you've got to have some pretty incredible food to even be in the competition. Papalote is okay, but definitely not even close to what's available in the Mission.

I got the carne asada super burrito, and including being more expensive than El Farolito or La Taqueria, it was also much more subpar. The meat was tender, but it was lukewarm. In fact, everything was just lukewarm. The rice tasted strangely old. I mean, it was okay, but definitely nothing special.

The chips they provide are horrible. Overly crunchy and overly fried, they were pretty bad for a Mexican joint in the Mission. The guacamole was flavorless -- just a bowl of avocados mushed together.

I did get a jar of their salsa to go (yeah it's really THAT awesome) but the food itself was just lackluster all the way through. Unfortunate.

excerpts: I got the carne asada burrito, and the meat was just amazing.
There was a perfect balance of lean and fat, and the flavors were so embedded in the meat that I was taken aback.
Next time I'll probably just get a quesadilla
so I can taste more of the meat!
carne asada.author: Sherry L.
carne asada.review: For a 15-minute wait, this burrito better be amazing, I thought. It was pretty delicious, but I probably won't wait for 15 minutes for it again. What set it apart from other burritos I've had is the meat. I got the carne asada burrito, and the meat was just amazing. There was a perfect balance of lean and fat, and the flavors were so embedded in the meat that I was taken aback. Next time I'll probably just get a quesadilla so I can taste more of the meat!

excerpts: we order one carne asada burrito and one soyrizo burrito
the soyrizo tasted an awful lot like the frozen chorizo breakfast
burrito
you can buy at trader joes for 4 dollars,
im being serious.
the carne asada was good, the meat was fresh and probably one of the better carne asada meats i've seen in a burrito

, i can see if they justified charging 7.50 for their chips and salsa, since that is what its known for, but burrito for almost 8 bucks, no way

2) got our order wrong, we made it clear, one carne and one soyrizo, said it twice.

what the waiter brought us was two soyrizos, then had the audacity to show us the receipt, which clearly stated 2 soyrizo (but come on, are you telling me that the lady who punched it into the computer didnt make any mistake?)
carne asada.author: Long C.
carne asada.review:
I came here for 2 reasons, 1) after reading about it on the paper (or was it yahoo, i forget), and 2) because my friend recommended it

I know this place is known for there salsa, and yes they get props for their salsa, it was quite delicious, though personally i'd still prefer the fresh stuff over the "processed" salsa (i dont know if its processed or if they just intentionally make it into a mush/mash consistency)

Yes this place makes solid burritos, but then again, i don't think i've ever eaten a bad burrito, actually, i dont think i've ever eaten bad mexican food, its just one thing that is hard to mess up

we order one carne asada burrito and one soyrizo burrito

the soyrizo tasted an awful lot like the frozen chorizo breakfast burrito you can buy at trader joes for 4 dollars, im being serious. the carne asada was good, the meat was fresh and probably one of the better carne asada meats i've seen in a burrito 

so why do they only get 3 stars?

1) 7.50 for a burrito, too expensive, i can see if they justified charging 7.50 for their chips and salsa, since that is what its known for, but burrito for almost 8 bucks, no way

2) got our order wrong, we made it clear, one carne and one soyrizo, said it twice. what the waiter brought us was two soyrizos, then had the audacity to show us the receipt, which clearly stated 2 soyrizo (but come on, are you telling me that the lady who punched it into the computer didnt make any mistake?) 

3) salsa and chip portion was alright, but when i asked for a bit more salsa for my burrito, and the waiter said an extra 50 cents, sorry, thats 50 cents im not willing to pay for something that other restaurants give out for free in unlimited portions

in summation, this is san francisco, where burrito joints and food trucks litter almost every street corner, i have definitely had better burritos elsewhere, dont know what the hype is all about

excerpts: Also the carne asada nachos was really delicious.
That's a
carne asada.author: Ivadine M.
carne asada.review:
One of the best Mexican foods I have ever tried. I was shocked when there was a picture of Bobby Flay on the wall, b/c apparently he had a throwdown there, and apparently he lost, so had to go try that place. 

This place was kind of small, it's kind of packed, but it's packed because it was really good. I had the chicken burrito, I really liked it, I'm more of a chicken person than steak person. My sister tried the 'mexipino' it's mexican and filipino food mixed together in a burrito. All I know it had chicken, but adobo style. It was really good, trust me. That's a must try when you go there. 
Also the carne asada nachos was really delicious. That's a must try also.

Service was friendly. 
Parking was pretty tough.
And finding a seat for 6 people was pretty difficult.
Food was great though. 

Go here if you're ever in San Francisco.

excerpts: I decided to get the carne asada entree that came with beans and rice.
Also I got extra tortillas.
All of it was really good.
We did order the salsa and chips.
That salsa is AWESOME!
My friend decided to buy a jar of it.
I could only eat half of my meal and got the rest to go because I was full, but I couldn't stop eating the salsa and chips.
carne asada.author: Rhoda G.
carne asada.review:
46. Chips and salsa at Papalote on the Big Eat list.

I came with a friend and we were pretty hungry. I decided to get the carne asada entree that came with beans and rice. Also I got extra tortillas. All of it was really good. We did order the salsa and chips. That salsa is AWESOME! My friend decided to buy a jar of it. I could only eat half of my meal and got the rest to go because I was full, but I couldn't stop eating the salsa and chips.

excerpts: See the Mission is sprawled with great Taqueria spots, but if you're willing to pay ~$3 more you can get a quality carne asada burrito..
carne asada.author: Neil I.
carne asada.review: Although El Farolito may have been my go-to, simply because it's cheaper, Papalote was my change of pace burrito treat. See the Mission is sprawled with great Taqueria spots, but if you're willing to pay ~$3 more you can get a quality carne asada burrito.. And you know what I mean by quality steak, not thin strips but tender juicy chunks. And to top it off, their orange sauce is amazing

excerpts: Two complaints about the extremely expensive $12 carne asada burrito
I just had: the whole thing is utterly flavorless, and the carne asada was chewy--a surefire indication that it was not cooked correctly.
The salsa that came with the burrito looked like orange salsa but was so bland
I couldn't even tell any difference in taste with- or without the sauce on the burrito.
All in all I'd say there's nothing particularly horrible about the burrito, but it didn't even live up to the flavor expectations I'd have of a $5 burrito much less a $12 one.
Papalote is a great demonstration that even with the freshest and best ingredients your food will still suck if you don't put any soul into it.
Save your money and get a burrito somewhere else.
carne asada.author: Max S.
carne asada.review: Two complaints about the extremely expensive $12 carne asada burrito I just had: the whole thing is utterly flavorless, and the carne asada was chewy--a surefire indication that it was not cooked correctly. The salsa that came with the burrito looked like orange salsa but was so bland I couldn't even tell any difference in taste with- or without the sauce on the burrito. All in all I'd say there's nothing particularly horrible about the burrito, but it didn't even live up to the flavor expectations I'd have of a $5 burrito much less a $12 one. Papalote is a great demonstration that even with the freshest and best ingredients your food will still suck if you don't put any soul into it. Save your money and get a burrito somewhere else.

excerpts: Simply because the carne asada burrito needed about 3-4x more meat.
The flavors were excellent.
The salsa was really good.
Even the roasted tomato habanero salsa, which I bought too, was delicious.
I will go back, but order a 3x meat, 1/2 portion beans, 1/2 portion rice burrito.
Probably cost me $30 as the 'bean' burrito was $9.
Soo disappointing.
La Taqueria around the corner does supply 3x the carne at the $9 or better price.
carne asada.author: Joe D.
carne asada.review: Three stars only. Simply because the carne asada burrito needed about 3-4x more meat. The flavors were excellent. The salsa was really good. Even the roasted tomato habanero salsa, which I bought too, was delicious. I will go back, but order a 3x meat, 1/2 portion beans, 1/2 portion rice burrito. Probably cost me $30 as the 'bean' burrito was $9. Soo disappointing. La Taqueria around the corner does supply 3x the carne at the $9 or better price.

excerpts: I tried both a Carne Asada and a Camarones
burrito, super'ed.
The carne asada was a hit or miss depending on the piece I got.
I had initially picked out a piece and that was dry but when eating it with the burrito, it tastes pretty tender and fresh.
I like that
carne asada.author: Shannon L.
carne asada.review:
Please don't throw tomatoes at me, I'm just being honest.

There has been hype around Papalote for a really long time in my mind.  With the 7x7's best burritos in SF article to my coworker constantly dipping his broccoli in their salsa, I was just aching to eat here.

I tried both a Carne Asada and a Camarones burrito, super'ed.  The shrimp pieces were small and really fresh.  The carne asada was a hit or miss depending on the piece I got.  I had initially picked out a piece and that was dry but when eating it with the burrito, it tastes pretty tender and fresh.  I like that even though the pieces are big, they rip apart easily.  

Unfortunately, by super-ing it, you get grilled veggies (bell peppers?) in it and it doesn't really go.  Also, the flavor in the burrito was weak so the salsa is quite necessary.  Now the hype about the salsa is interesting because it is good and it is really spicy but the texture is weird.  It's very blended and not quite smooth but not quite chunky... a strange in between.

Salsa comes from two places:
1. Made in this restaurant - $5.99 
2. Made somewhere else but still the Papalote recipe - $6.99

I've had both and I would say #2 wins the initial taste test.  #1 still isn't bad though.

Similar to traditional Mexican restaurants, you can help yourself to pickled jalapenos but they have WHOLE pickled jalapenos here.  Total highlight for me.  I can see how this place can be frustrating if you're trying to dine in and it's packed.  There isn't much room to stand in line to order and there isn't much room to sit. All the tables are also close together but it's a clean joint at least.

The best part is that they give each person their own little basket of chips and cup of salsa!

excerpts: The boy got the standard carne asada burrito, but was able to pick it up and eat it the proper way; he said it was excellent.
carne asada.author: Adena B.
carne asada.review:
The boy and I were craving a burrito, so we stopped at the first place that had parking nearby (can you blame us? Damn you, Mission!)

PAPALOTAY! I just like saying it. It means "kite," right? Awesome.

We sat down in the cramped joint (make friends with your table neighbors!) with our respective Mexican beers and were immediately served up with some chips and creamy salsa. We each got burritos in a whole wheat tortilla and it completely changed the dynamic of what I'm used to, but not in a bad way: it was delicious!

I got the prawn super burrito (with guacamole, cheese, sour cream) and rice, black beans, and salsa. Since I let it sit for a minute, the bottom got all soggy* (tee hee), so I had to fork-n-knife it; it felt so, so wrong. The boy got the standard carne asada burrito, but was able to pick it up and eat it the proper way; he said it was excellent. 

All in all, very pleased with the quality of the food, but not really with the prices; with tip, I think I dropped a little less than $20 for a burrito and a beer. Worth it though, since the service was great, too.


*Most people came in to pick-up since they had called in. With the soggy-bottom debacle, I'm not sure if I'd be comfortable doing that. Besides, the line moved pretty quickly.

excerpts: The first burrito I had was at Papalote and I ordered the carne asada.
Wow is the only thought that crossed my mind.
I have since tried all the carne asada, pescado and pollo meals here.
They are fantastic!
The menu is limited to mainly burritos, quesadillas and tacos.
The ones I've tried are all amazing.
carne asada.author: Coy W.
carne asada.review:
I miss the days when my friend lived in the Mission.  There were so many great places for Mexican food!  This was the first place I found and wow did it not disappoint at all!

The first burrito I had was at Papalote and I ordered the carne asada.  Wow is the only thought that crossed my mind.  I have since tried all the carne asada, pescado and pollo meals here.  They are fantastic!  The menu is limited to mainly burritos, quesadillas and tacos.  The ones I've tried are all amazing.  The appetizers I had were all good as well.

I can't wait to come back!

excerpts: I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with no beans and made it super.
The rice was mushy and the filling was not evenly distributed throughout the burrito.
like I do the Carne Asada San Francisco style at Tacko.
carne asada.author: Angela C.
carne asada.review: I had high expectations for Papalote given the 1800+ reviews. However, I was pretty underwhelmed with my burrito. I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with no beans and made it super. The rice was mushy and the filling was not evenly distributed throughout the burrito. Some bites were all rice, some bites were all steak, some were all guac. The burrito came with chips and salsa. The chips were a little bland and the salsa was too mild for this spice-loving girl. Given that Papalote is right down the street from me I will probably give it another try, but I can't say I'll be craving this burrito like I do the Carne Asada San Francisco style at Tacko.

excerpts: there is no taste, they got 3 types of meats carne asada which was tender and juicy, shredded chicken decent size
cut not dry but
carne asada.author: Clarence A.
carne asada.review:
I've read the reviews, I've tried there food, honestly I don't even know how this spot got such a high star rating, I give this place a bare 3 stars only reason I didn't give it 2 stars was there sauce they offered, that orange spicy sauce you sprinkle or dip on everything.

Ok here is what we tried:
Ultimate Burrito also know as the Triple Threat i was told- grade D+ there is no taste, they got 3 types of meats carne asada which was tender and juicy, shredded chicken decent size cut not dry but no flavor, the shrimp I think there were like 4 or 5 in it but they pile them all on one side so when you whatever side you start on if you get the shrimp enjoy it you will probably get maybe 4-5 bites in then no more shrimp haha.

we also tried there shrimp quesidilla- super oily, dipping it in the orange sauce gives it some flavor eating it alone you will need salt

The Chorizo Nacho Plate - this plate had to say is kinda what saved face for the restuarant for me but there was some dislikes, shady on the guac, sourcream, and even cheese camon now folks you get lets just say it is about maybe 3tsp of each sourcream & guac if you ask for more it is $1 more, condiments $1 more horrible but taste wise of the nachos with the chorizo and beans all good.

next time your out there just get the chorizo nachos don't spend $20+ for a burrito, there are plenty other mexican restuarants in the bay area you can go to and get 2 of the meats added for about $5-$8 same price but not 3meats.

Only reason I visited this place was due to Bobby Flay and his throwdown sad to say folks been to Bobby Flay's resturant in Vegas food there is blah literally bland and expensive, there are several other spots you can get a decent burrito in the city, this unfortunately is not one of them, if you do go stick with the chorizo nachos and try to get some of that togo orange sauce

ultimate burrito/ triple threat - FAIL ** at best only 2 stars
quesidilla ** super oily no taste drench it in the orange sauce then it makes it *** 1/2
chorizo nachos **** only thing i liked that i tried but it does have its flaws
service *** they are kinda fast
price $ moderate all around the board all $8 except for the triple threat/ultimate burrito $20+
ambiance *** small but clean, tiles on everything

excerpts: Carne asada super tacos are amazing.
carne asada.author: Steve J.
carne asada.review:
One of the best in SF.

Carne asada super tacos are amazing.

If you don't agree it's a 5 star (hole in the wall kind of place) meal, you just might be a communist born without a sense of taste.

excerpts: My husband and I got carne asada super burritos and my sister got the mexipino super burrito.
carne asada.author: Charlene P.
carne asada.review: We were going over to my sister's place in SF for lunch and she picked up some food from here for us to try.  I've always heard this place was really good and I couldn't wait to try it.  My husband and I got carne asada super burritos and my sister got the mexipino super burrito.  She also brought back some chips and salsa.  The burritos have lots of good flavor with a good amount of meat.  The salsa is soooo good!  My sister said it was made with habanero peppers but it wasn't too too spicy for me.  Next time I'm definitely going to buy a jar.

excerpts: I got the carne asada burrito after seeing the award for "best burrito in SF".
I haven't had many other burritos in SF
so it's hard for me to judge this.
I will say I was a little disappointed by the lack of food in my burrito.
It was a huge burrito but mostly tortilla and rice and not much meat.
Luckily the salsa and guacamole made the whole meal more enjoyable.
Maybe I'll try tacos next time.
carne asada.author: Kim Le P.
carne asada.review: This place has delicious salsa and guacamole - although I wish both were spicier. I am from LA so I am use to flavorful, authentic Mexican food. I got the carne asada burrito after seeing the award for "best burrito in SF". I haven't had many other burritos in SF so it's hard for me to judge this. I will say I was a little disappointed by the lack of food in my burrito. It was a huge burrito but mostly tortilla and rice and not much meat. Luckily the salsa and guacamole made the whole meal more enjoyable. Maybe I'll try tacos next time.

excerpts: Had the carne asada burrito - low on flavor, too much rice, not enough beans.
carne asada.author: Jack M.
carne asada.review:
I can't tell what the excitement is about. Had the carne asada burrito - low on flavor, too much rice, not enough beans. I left full and unsatisfied - the worst :-(

One star for just burrito. Two stars because the salsa *is* really good.

excerpts: The bf & I ordered: 2 prawn tacos, 2 carne asada tacos (.99 cents extra to make them "super), & two bottled drinks.
carne asada.author: Fancypants X.
carne asada.review:
When I first heard about Papalote's $19.95 burrito, I was like, "we should be running them outta the Mission instead of blowin' them up with 1000's of reviews." I get it, we're in America & the owners are well within their rights to embrace a little American greed & capitalism, but not at my expense.

So, after a little internal struggle ("Don't patronize them, there's better two blocks away & they don't rape you with their prices! But it could be oh-so-good. Why would Bobby Flay challenge them if it wasn't? Don't do it! DO IT!") I finally went  *hangs head in shame*

The bf & I ordered: 2 prawn tacos, 2 carne asada tacos (.99 cents extra to make them "super), & two bottled drinks. Total: under $21--well that wasn't too painful at all! 

The salsa is definitely unique--it is creamy without chunks of tomato. I tasted a lot of heat but not a lot of real, tomatoey flavor. It's a nice change from regular salsa. When the tacos arrived, we were surprised (not to mention disappointed) at how it is Fresh Mex instead of authentic Mexican. Zero grease, zero salt. It's very similar to La Salsa (maybe the lack of Latino patrons should have tipped us off...) There was nothing wrong with the flavors but it's obvious that this place caters to a specific demographic who's palates are not ready for some dirty, real, greasy Mexican goodness. Papalote is definitely a non-offensive, very polished version of Mexican food & no me gusta.

excerpts: I like carne asada anything probably, so plumped for the burrito.
The tacos also looked extremely tasty.
My burrito was pretty good and I finished it without issue.
carne asada.author: Nick L.
carne asada.review:
We came to this place when some friends from out of town came visiting and mentioned that they would like to eat at this place. Sure, always up for some Mexican!

There's a small counter where you order your meal and the rest is dedicated to seating. There's not much space so you may have to wait to find an open table as this place gets busy. It's a colorful interior.

I like carne asada anything probably, so plumped for the burrito. The tacos also looked extremely tasty. My burrito was pretty good and I finished it without issue.
I think the hold back for me is that you can get equally good food in the Mission without having to wait so long.

Perhaps due to it's popularity, it's also on the pricier side.

excerpts: The girl didn't even know what carne asada was.. Fail.
We ordered a carne asada burrito and  a coke, for two people it was $26.00.
When we got our ordered we were surprised, we got chips w/ some type of sauce..
What happened to the salsa?
And the burrito?
Well it was big, not wrapped in a foil
so it was hard to eat...
And no I am not about to eat a burrito with a fork & a knife.
The meat?
Well it didn't taste anything, it was dry and hard to chew.
I could only taste the avocado.
The burrito tasted too bland, I had to put hot sauce and mix it with the sauce they gave me to have some flavor into the burrito, but still it didn't taste any good either.
I wasn't even able to finish it.
Honestly this place reminds me of Chipotle-
Americanized Mexican food.
I rather go to Chipotle since their meat has more flavor.
Never am I going back to this place.
It's truly a hipster place.
So if you really want authentic Mexican food, go to La Taqueria or El Farolito.
carne asada.author: Shay C.
carne asada.review:
This restaurant & the review for this place is misleading. My bf and I decided to try this place out since it has a lot of good reviews. As soon as we got there and saw how the place looked we should've turned around and just went to another taqueria we always go. Once we ordered the girl wasn't even listening to what we were trying to order and looked lost. The girl didn't even know what carne asada was.. Fail. 

We ordered a carne asada burrito and  a coke, for two people it was $26.00. When we got our ordered we were surprised, we got chips w/ some type of sauce.. What happened to the salsa? And the burrito? Well it was big, not wrapped in a foil so it was hard to eat... And no I am not about to eat a burrito with a fork & a knife. The meat? Well it didn't taste anything, it was dry and hard to chew. I could only taste the avocado. The burrito tasted too bland, I had to put hot sauce and mix it with the sauce they gave me to have some flavor into the burrito, but still it didn't taste any good either. I wasn't even able to finish it. Honestly this place reminds me of Chipotle- Americanized Mexican food. I rather go to Chipotle since their meat has more flavor. Never am I going back to this place. It's truly a hipster place. So if you really want authentic Mexican food, go to La Taqueria or El Farolito.

excerpts: It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned.
Errr, where was the garlic friend rice?
The rice used was the standard burrito rice.
The tortilla was the only thing that stood out.
It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky.
I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.
carne asada.author: Cherylynn N.
carne asada.review:
My sleep cycle is all messed up...I get more rest on the weekends sleeping for 3 hours than on the weeknights sleeping for 6 hours. Erm, must be the alkie? :X  

It's 1 AM on Thursday Morning and while I should be "attempting" to sleep, my eyes are glued to  an episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay". For 26 minutes, my mouth was salivating at the thought of meeting the "Triple Threat" one day; needless to say, it was another sleepless night. *sigh*

My friends and I came here yesterday at 12ish and luckily, we came at just the right time before it started getting busy.

FOOD:
*Chips & Salsa (#46 on the 7x7 list): The chips were slightly warm, thin, and crisp with just the right amount of salt. Ahhhhh, the salsa....the BEST freaking salsa EVER! The salsa was emulsified to perfect creamy consistency. As it hits your palette and moves around your mouth, you can taste all the fresh ingredients (the charred tomatoes, garlic, onion, chilies, and cilantro) sink into your taste buds. It had the perfect blend of savory, smokiness, acidity, and fiery kick to it! This is the ONLY thing that lives up to the HYPE!

*Triple Threat (super w/ sour cream & guac): HOLY MOLEY! $20 for a freaking burrito?!?!? The burrito was a regular size burrito that you would find from any taqueria. It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp. The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender. The sour cream and guac are a must as it added a slight tartness and creaminess to balance out all the flavors.

*Ode to Poleng Adobe Burrito: FAIL! If you're expecting the garlicy, peppery soysauce vinegary taste that makes your lips pucker type of Adobo, you will be sadly disappointed. The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned. Errr, where was the garlic friend rice? The rice used was the standard burrito rice. The tortilla was the only thing that stood out. It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky. All in all, the burrito lacked any real flavor and was quite dry b/c there was no sauce or salsa in it).

DRINKS:
Papalote has a selection of sodas, juices, and Mexican beer. I have to note that their refrigeration system was not working properly yesterday as our drinks were room temperature.

PRICES:
WAY OVERPRICED! A regular burrito is about $8 and an extra $1 to make it super (sour cream and guac). The size of their regular burritos are quite small (approx 7' and 2.5' in diameter) compared to other taquerias in The Mission.

Although the Triple Threat was good; it was NO where near a $20 good! To me, Mexican food is just like Chinese food; you shouldn't have to pay much to get good-tasting food. And, I really think the "hype" has allowed Papalote to capitalize on its customers by charging such ludicrous prices. 

SERVICE:
Order your food at the counter, grab a number, and the server will being you your order when it's ready. The chips and salsa came first and it took about 15 minutes to get our burritos.    

AMBIANCE: 
Very funky hipster type feel with the bright red walls with colorful panting and reggae music playing in the background. 

PARKING: 
Difficult street parking around Valencia and Mission streets. However, Guerrero street seemed to have some available non-metered spots. 

Would I return? I would only return for the chips and salsa. Other than that, Papalote is WAY OVERYHYPED and OVERPRICED. I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.

excerpts: Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.
Awesome!
Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
(and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...
carne asada.author: Alice C.
carne asada.review:
From the "That's what she said" joke potential to the succulent flavor, I love [almost] everything about meat.

So you can imagine what I'm about to say is very difficult, but it's also a testimony to how skilled Papalote is at making a healthier alternative not taste like feet.

That being said, the best thing I've tried on this menu is actually the soyrizo (soy chorizo)!  I tried a piece of the soyrizo quesadilla, and was very pleasantly surprised.  It was well seasoned, and the texture was not weird.  I think this dish will be my go-to from now on!

OTHER DISHES I'VE TRIED:
1. Chips and salsa - this is on the 7x7 100 things to try list.  The salsa was really good and different than any other salsa I've tasted, but I still think the soyrizo was more stand-out.
2. Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.  Awesome!
3. Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
4. Jicama salad - usually comes on the side with your meal, and refreshingly delicious!  

LIKES:
1. Large portions 
2. Leftovers still tasty 2 days later
3. Lots of veggie alternatives
4. Seems more health conscious than the average taqueria

DISLIKES:
1. Dine in was crowded...you'd probably be annoyed/displeased if you're claustrophobic.  You can phone in orders though.
2. Prices are a bit higher than what you'd expect to find at other Mexican places in the Mission - the steak fajitas were $13.95!  (and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...but then you can just get the soyrizo!)

excerpts: I ordered a carne asada burrito with beans and rice.
The burrito was about average in size, but that's ok because I don't like overeating these days.
carne asada.author: Jason W.
carne asada.review:
Oh man, that orange salsa.... SO GOOD! I buy it by the jarful at Whole Foods and dump it on everything at home. Sure it's expensive, but it's way better than Frontera or any of that other hoity-toity stuff that tries to pass for gourmet salsa. Based on the quality of their salsa, I was very excited to try the Papalote restaurant in the Mission today!

Papalote is a small restaurant on a largely residential block of 24th street. It's conveniently located a couple of blocks from the 24th & Mission BART stop and also a block away from a good friend's house. If I'd known it was this close, I would have gone numerous times already! Inside the restaurant are a handful of tables next to a large window which offers a good people watching view of the street outside. You order at the counter up front and then take a number and sit down.

I ordered a carne asada burrito with beans and rice. The burrito was about average in size, but that's ok because I don't like overeating these days. The contents were very tasty with plenty of grilled beef and flavorful rice and beans. I only had one funny bit of gristle in the burrito, so I would call that a rousing success for the Bay Area. They also give you tasty chips and a cup of their salsa before the meal. HOWEVER, if you want more salsa to go with your meal, it costs an additional fifty cents for each refill. WTF?! Most places load you up on salsa without an additional charge. This is something they really should consider since it seems a little chintzy of them.

My two lunch friends had the pork chile verde tacos and the fish burrito. The tacos looked good, but seemed to be piled high with garnish which seemed a little weird. If I order the tacos in future, I'll get them with just meat and tortilla. The fish burrito looked like a winner and my friend swears by it, so I'm either getting that next time or trying the machaca which is hard to find in the Bay Area!

Papalote is a very clean, stylish restaurant. Food gets delivered quickly and the staff are all super nice. I'll definitely come back again, but maybe I'll bring my own Papalote salsa from home if they're going to charge me for salsa!

excerpts: My friend was happy with his carne asada tacos and promptly devoured them.
carne asada.author: Michelle K.
carne asada.review:
A friend suggested Papalote to me, claiming they were some of the best tacos in the Mission.  Since I was meeting a friend for lunch, I decided we would check them out.  The place is cute, small, and very clean.  You walk in and are immediately in front of a large wall mounted menu and the registers. 

For lunch I decided to try the grilled tofu tacos.  I was surprised when they came out and there was only one tortilla underneath.  It was difficult to eat as a taco since they were loaded up with vegetables and tofu.   Overall they were good but the tofu was a bit odd (I've never had grilled tofu before).  My friend was happy with his carne asada tacos and promptly devoured them.

We ordered the guacamole appetizer which was far too large for two people.  If you have four it would be more appropriate.  We left about half of our guac in the bowl (I hate letting deliciousness go to waste).

The price was appropriate for tacos ($6.25 for two).  We were fortunate to find a table with a nice family on the other end so the communal tables wasn't an issue  I'll probably return to Papalote, although I'll avoid the tofu and go for another of their meat selections.

excerpts: Had a carne asada burrito with the works.
The salsa is amazing too
carne asada.author: Benny B.
carne asada.review: Wow that was delicious. Had a carne asada burrito with the works. The salsa is amazing too

excerpts: The first inklings came when we tried the carne asada burrito at Papalote.
This was one of the burrito-eater's top-rated burritos, consistently scoring over 8.5 mustaches on each review
carne asada.author: James Y.
carne asada.review:
After some deep self-reflection, I've decided that I'm not really a fan of traditional burritos. 

The first inklings came when we tried the carne asada burrito at Papalote. This was one of the burrito-eater's top-rated burritos, consistently scoring over 8.5 mustaches on each review but I didn't think it was anything special. 

I had the same experience again at El Farolito and again at Taqueria Cancun, two of the other Mission burrito heavyweights. They were good burritos, but not something I'd actively covet.

Why wasn't I impressed by any of these burritos? It kind of bothered me. 

I started to think about burritos that I liked in the past: the chicken tinga and al pastor burritos from Maya's (RIP) and the burritos from La Vic's in San Jose and Los Morenos in San Mateo. I remembered that the Maya's burritos were special because they were juicy and had unique sweet and spicy flavor combinations. La Vic's and Los Morenos had average burritos but both places provided amazing orange sauce that you could slather on in between each bite. 

Then I understood why even the best traditional burritos don't offer enough to keep me interested: I like my burritos to be sweet, spicy, and moist and cheesy enough to keep everything together. 

Sorry, Papalote. You're good, but I think I'm in a place where I need a sauced up burrito.

If anyone has any recommendations, send them over!

excerpts: I ordered the carne asada super burrito.
The meat was so tough I had to spit it out into my napkin.
It was very difficult to chew.
Their chips were complementary but were stale.
Their salsa was ok.
I probably will not be returning to this spot.
I should have gone to El Farlito instead.
carne asada.author: Leen B.
carne asada.review: Happened to catch the feature of Papalote on the Food Network so I thought I would give it a try.  I have to say I'm pretty disappointed in their burrito.  I ordered the carne asada super burrito.  The meat was so tough I had to spit it out into my napkin.  It was very difficult to chew.  Their chips were complementary but were stale. Their salsa was ok.  I probably will not be returning to this spot. I should have gone to El Farlito instead.

excerpts: My only complaint is I can't try anything else on the menu b/c the Carne Asada Super Burrito is so damn good.
That
carne asada.author: Phillip W.
carne asada.review:
My only complaint is I can't try anything else on the menu b/c the Carne Asada Super Burrito is so damn good.  That and I always forget my burrito club card.

But seriously, at the risk of losing my cred: best non Chipotle burrito I've had. And thats after 4 years in SD and 1 in the Mission in SF.

excerpts: I was a regular at Papalote for years - I came here specifically for the carne asada burrito (walking past numerous other burrito places) and gladly (well maybe gladly is a bit strong) handed over $12 for a burrito with actual steak in it.
I hoped they'd finally realize how inadequate  there carne asada now is, but no luck - the low-quality meat seems to be here to stay.
So disappointing.
carne asada.author: Jon C.
carne asada.review:
I was a regular at Papalote for years - I came here specifically for the carne asada burrito (walking past numerous other burrito places) and gladly (well maybe gladly is a bit strong) handed over $12 for a burrito with actual steak in it. And I'm talking about a quality cut of meat, charred with epic flavor.

About a month or so ago they changed the cut they use and how they prepare it, so now it's just another typical burrito with questionable meat - very grizzly with mediocre  flavor. I can get the equivalent for $7 elsewhere. 

The change was immediately apparent but I continued to go there for my weekly burrito. After about month or so of this, no more I say.  I hoped they'd finally realize how inadequate  there carne asada now is, but no luck - the low-quality meat seems to be here to stay. So disappointing. I'll just have to find my new favorite elsewhere.

Also, on a side note: what's the deal with piling all the meat on one end of the burrito? I know they're really busy back there but spreading it out would take about 0.5 extra seconds per order.

Again, so disappointed to give up Papalote. I'm going to miss what it once was.

excerpts: Dude, this thing is jam packed with carne asada, chicken AND shrimp!
Oh yeah, and this thing is drenched in Papalote's amazing salsa...
(I'm not really a salsa person, but I must say...
carne asada.author: Tim L.
carne asada.review:
Go here with a mindset prepared to wait a little bit.  It's a pretty popular place and can get kinda crowded.  I always get my food to go because it seems hella cramped in there.  Now for the food.....

All the food here is good, BUT..... if you have 20 bucks in your pocket and aren't afraid to waste it all on one burrito... you MUST get the "Triple Threat Burrito"!!  Really though.  Dude, this thing is jam packed with carne asada, chicken AND shrimp!  Oh yeah, and this thing is drenched in Papalote's amazing salsa... (I'm not really a salsa person, but I must say...Papalote has got some BOMB ASS salsa.)

Although it's an almost guaranteed heart attack, this monstrous burrito is an amazingly delicious explosion that creates an unmatched tastebud utopia with every bite!

...wash it down with a Mexican Coke and call it a day.

Your welcome, Tim.

excerpts: I visit the Papalote on Fulton every few weeks and it is great every time - usually order a carne asada burrito with everything and the sauce they make keeps me coming back.
You can order over the phone for pick-up (usually 15 minutes) and they are pretty good with timing.
They also deliver via Postmates and you can try the promo code "FRIENDS" or "GETPLUS" for free delivery.
carne asada.author: H C.
carne asada.review: I visit the Papalote on Fulton every few weeks and it is great every time - usually order a carne asada burrito with everything and the sauce they make keeps me coming back. You can order over the phone for pick-up (usually 15 minutes) and they are pretty good with timing. They also deliver via Postmates and you can try the promo code "FRIENDS" or "GETPLUS" for free delivery.

excerpts: Now, I know prawn burritos are always more expensive than say Carne asada but at $11.25 for a prawn super, it should be pretty darn good.
carne asada.author: Aaron B.
carne asada.review:
Ok, this is sad to write but here goes. 

Part of me wants to give three stars but this is more of a 2.5. However, when you miss the basics, you get dinged. 

Papalote had great reviews so we went for a burrito. The space is clean and comfortable. I liked the creamy salsa but had issues with our burrito. 

We ordered a prawn burrito to share. Now, I know prawn burritos are always more expensive than say Carne asada but at $11.25 for a prawn super, it should be pretty darn good. 

Papalote got right what many places don't - flavor.  The ingredients and recipes were good. What didn't work for me was composition. They were nice and offered to cut the burrito in half because the cashier realized we were sharing. When the burrito came out it looked great. 

It was the right size, had been toasted after rolled (good call!) but something was missing. Prawns for me, rice for my wife. 

In my half of the burrito, there were no prawns. I took it to the counter (after unrolling on a search for shrimp) and told them there was nothing there. My wife had found three inside her half. I asked them how many prawns come on a prawn burrito and the said 4. Now, if these were true jumbo prawns (8-10 count/lbs), that would have made sense. They seemed like regular size shrimp to me.  Plus they were put in whole instead of being cut in half which would have helped the composition. 

My wife's half had primarily beans and prawns but no rice. 

A burrito is like a sandwich - very simple. But simple foods require precision to be REALLY good. It was sad that they skimped on the prawns and that the ingredients weren't balanced. They had a 4 star burrito in the making. The staff was genuinely apologetic however there was no recovery. I didn't make a big stink about it but I certainly left rather disappointed. I'd try them again but would probably go for tacos where composition isn't an issue. If you want a burrito, don't get prawns.

excerpts: MANAGEMENT, did I really just wait 15 minutes for a  $9 CARNE ASADA burrito for it to have literally 4 PIECES of carne asada and a dash of salsa!?!?!?!?!
TOGETHER, you will LOSE CUSTOMERS this way to other nearby authentic taquerias that dont SKIMP on the carne asada for the pricepoint!!!
carne asada.author: Ferdinand B.
carne asada.review:
I would given 1 star, but the house salsa bumped it up to 2 stars.

MANAGEMENT, did I really just wait 15 minutes for a  $9 CARNE ASADA burrito for it to have literally 4 PIECES of carne asada and a dash of salsa!?!?!?!?!
 If I wanted to eat rice and a cr@pload of beans, I could of made it myself.

A PRIMARILY rice and bean burrito for $9 dollars.!

CMON  Papalote.  GET IT TOGETHER, you will LOSE CUSTOMERS this way to other nearby authentic taquerias that dont SKIMP on the carne asada for the pricepoint!!!

excerpts: We got the carne asada burrito with black beans.
It was delicious and there was plenty for my husband and I to split.
The staff was helpful but not overbearing.
Great place to catch a quick bite in the Mission!
carne asada.author: Emily S.
carne asada.review:
The location for this restaurant is amazing, right off the 24th and Mission Bart stop. The food is fresh and there are always a few people waiting for their to-go orders. 

We got the carne asada burrito with black beans. It was delicious and there was plenty for my husband and I to split. The staff was helpful but not overbearing. Great place to catch a quick bite in the Mission!

excerpts: Not wanting to shell out $20+ for a burrito, I'm munching on a normal carne asada burrito.
I was really happy with how the carne asada came out.
carne asada.author: Jonathan L.
carne asada.review:
My friend was watching the Throwdown Challenge on the Food Network and saw the Triple Threat being put on the spotlight. To make a long story short, I'm sitting there, watching two of my buddies take on the Triple Threat. Not wanting to shell out $20+ for a burrito, I'm munching on a normal carne asada burrito.

I was really happy with how the carne asada came out. The meat is so tender and juicy and the steak marinade is fantastic. I wish it wasn't $9 but the quality speaks for itself. 

From my friends' comments, I'd say that the chicken in the Triple Threat is not so great. A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain. The shrimp is stir fried with garlic and is great. 

Great burritos but too pricey. I don't recommend the Triple Threat unless you're doing it for the sake of doing it. The normal burritos are sufficient.

excerpts: Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty.
carne asada.author: Tony B.
carne asada.review:
Love me my papalote and have for years. Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty. 

On those rare times you have the space and minutes to sit down and dine in a civilized manner, the pollo al achiote and the fish tacos are the way to go.

The salsa is so good I buy it in the fresh jars in their fridge and have it as an after-work snack with some local casa sanchez chips. 

I just wish they had a bigger space so it wasn't always so crowded! And I suspect their burritos have gotten slightly smaller in the 8 years I've been coming here.

excerpts: I had the carne asada tacos which I HIGHLY recommend, and spent the rest of dinner eyeing burritos at the next table.
carne asada.author: Annie L.
carne asada.review:
Affordable, high quality mexican food. Ingredients were super fresh and possibly the best homemade salsa ever.

I had the carne asada tacos which I HIGHLY recommend, and spent the rest of dinner eyeing burritos at the next table.

A new regular, yay!

excerpts: Awesome carne asada - really tender, moist, and flavorful.
carne asada.author: Lily C.
carne asada.review: Awesome carne asada - really tender, moist, and flavorful. We also had shrimp tacos... those were good but not as good as the burrito. The ingredients seem really fresh, so the only real criticism I can give is that the restaurant is a little small and it gets crowded around lunch.

excerpts: I got the carne asada burrito.
carne asada.author: Jarrod S.
carne asada.review: I got the carne asada burrito. The crispness of the tortilla was very nice, and the fillings were okay, but the steak tasted cheap cheap and it was just a little bland. It's a burrito, ok? Nothing more. Nothing less.

excerpts: The basic carne asada for almost 9 bucks?
carne asada.author: Sean H.
carne asada.review:
Heard rave reviews about the burrito for years but just never have ended up there.  Finally did.  It's alright.  Not the best burrito I've had, and not the worst.  I have to knock off a star for the price though.  The basic carne asada for almost 9 bucks?  Sorry, but no.  

I know burrito alliances are borderline religious here in SF, but go to El Farolito and get a better burrito for less.  

The salsa at Papalote is good though.

excerpts: I went with the super Carne Asada burrito
and it was NO BUENO.
I actually put tasty under my 'quick tip' while checking in but that was only after the first bite.
Their salsa is actually pretty good.
When I got to the meat, OMG - no flavor!
carne asada.author: Augusto L.
carne asada.review:
Seriously, people that don't know Mexican food rate this place as 4 stars and above but coming from the Central Valley and being raised in a Mexican household, I will tell you that this place is EXTREMELY overrated. 

I rejected the 20 something dollar burrito because I don't care what you put in a burrito, a 20 dollar price tag is insane and a no go for me! 

I went with the super Carne Asada burrito and it was NO BUENO. I actually put tasty under my 'quick tip' while checking in but that was only after the first bite. Their salsa is actually pretty good. When I got to the meat, OMG - no flavor! This thing needed to be knocked upside the head or tortilla with a pound of salt because it was so flavorless! 

The rice and beans were mediocre. 

After more than 4 years of living in the Bay Area, I am still not satisfied with the Mexican food joints in the area. This is just another Mexican food joint that is seriously over-hyped by people.

If your taste buds are satisfied because you're paying a fortune for your food, then kudos to you but some of the best burrito's I have had costed me no more than 6 dollars. 

1 star for the service and the decor but that's all this place will get from me (actually Yelp does not allow me to assign 0 stars). 

If you want great Mexican food, hit the Central Valley for it. Hell, I will make you something if you wish! Haha.

excerpts: One set had pollo (grilled chicken breast), the other carne asada (grilled steak).
For some reason they don't let you mix and match your meats.
The carne asada was a little chewy but had good flavor -
did I detect lime and garlic?
The chicken on the other hand looked like it was good quality, but it was bland.
carne asada.author: Kathleen M.
carne asada.review:
Someone brought Papalote's salsa into my husband's work, and it was so good my husband wanted to seek out the mythical land of milk and honey, or rather, *salsa*, from which it came.

We arrived at Papalote at 2:30 on a Saturday afternoon and were lucky enough to only have to wait 3 minutes for a table. There was a line afterwards. The place is on the small side, and it's unclear if you're supposed to claim your own table or follow the "please wait to be seated" sign. There are pretty dragonfly artworks on the ceiling.

We started with the $1.50 chips and salsa. Unlike other places these aren't bottomless. The amount we were given was just under what we needed, especially given how great the salsa was. (The chips are pretty standard issue.) 

The salsa had a nice roasted flavor and was unlike any other salsa I've ever had. It was a light orange color and looked slightly creamy, though I can't imagine them adding cream to it. (Do they?) It was so good we went back a few hours later for some salsa to take home. For $6.50 you can get a full jar. Even though it's in a jar it's fresh salsa and it'll only last a few days.

We each got a pair of tacos for $4.95. One set had pollo (grilled chicken breast), the other carne asada (grilled steak). For some reason they don't let you mix and match your meats. The carne asada was a little chewy but had good flavor - did I detect lime and garlic? The chicken on the other hand looked like it was good quality, but it was bland. I regretted not paying the extra 99 cents to make it a "super" with guac, sour cream, and cheese. I asked at the counter if I could have the super accoutrements on the side. Initially they balked and wanted me to pay the $2.99 for a whole side of guacamole, but I talked them into giving me just a small side of guac for the 99 cents. Guac makes everything better.

Epilogue: The salsa was just as good at home. Still eating it...

excerpts: My carne asada was dry but my tortilla was hella on hit.
I ran out of hot sauce, I requested more they charged me $1.10 for two small ass portions.
WTF?
lol
oh ya and the decor is awesome, the atmosphere feels mexican.
There is mexican music blaring and dragon kites to match their red walls.
I bet this place was one a chinese food take out and all they did was keep the loud red feng shui walls and flying dragon kites and call it tex mex.
My horchata was ok a little sweet.
They charged me for fucking salsa
it's a spiced up taco bell trying to be a La Vics and a La Vics, it is not.
Eh...
In ADDITION the $22.50 was not worth the two burritos and one drink we purchased.
carne asada.author: Julie N.
carne asada.review:
I was so excited for a burrito. Oh si, que rico me voy a tragar un burrito. The menu is pretty plain, choice of meat and 99 cents extra for "super" which seems worth it.  It adds cheese, sour cream and guac. I would get slapped if my mother heard me say "guac" she'd thing "guacala" and that don't sound too appetizing. I was eager and saw they bottled and sold their own tomato salse, hmmm must be guud. Chips and salsa was good, crunchy chips and mildly spiced sauce. Then the burrito came.. dun dun dun. 

Ay caramba, guacala!

The rice was dry as hell, ni de fiesta. "Arroz de fiesta" is spanish for party rice. Where people make big batches of tasteless, dry packed rice to serve at weddings and quincianeras. This wasn't even at their level. My carne asada was dry but my tortilla was hella on hit. I ran out of hot sauce, I requested more they charged me $1.10 for two small ass portions. WTF?! lol oh ya and the decor is awesome, the atmosphere feels mexican. There is mexican music blaring and dragon kites to match their red walls. I bet this place was one a chinese food take out and all they did was keep the loud red feng shui walls and flying dragon kites and call it tex mex. My horchata was ok a little sweet. They charged me for fucking salsa it's a spiced up taco bell trying to be a La Vics and a La Vics, it is not. Eh... In ADDITION the $22.50 was not worth the two burritos and one drink we purchased.

excerpts: And the carne asada if my favorite meat burrito, great stuff!
Sitting there with a  beer and a burrito...
can't be beat.
carne asada.author: Joel S.
carne asada.review: This is the best place in the Mission for burritos.  I bet the rest of the menu is amazing, but I've only had the burritos because they're so good!  The soy burrito is good because of the sauce/marinade they have it in, makes a great 'rito!  And the carne asada if my favorite meat burrito, great stuff!  Sitting there with a  beer and a burrito...can't be beat.

excerpts: " yet but the Carne Asada Burrito made me forget about how hard it is to find parking in the City let alone the shortage of seats they have...
carne asada.author: Tony R.
carne asada.review:
Once you try a Burrito from Papalote it's hard to have one anywhere else! I didn't try the "Triple Threat Burrito" yet but the Carne Asada Burrito made me forget about how hard it is to find parking in the City let alone the shortage of seats they have... I'll be happy to stand up and eat it on the sidewalk!

The steak portions are thick and meaty as hell with chunky, flavorful slices spread all out the burrito. Portion wise... man, it's just right with an even amount of rice beans and all the good stuff that makes a Burrito taste so heavenly! I walked out feeling satisfied! Not lazy and bloated like other Burrito joints! Their orange sauce is great! I've only had the pleasure of trying one similar in San Jose. (La Vics) 

Overall, it was a great 1st experience I am willing to try again! (this time the Triple Threat is on my hit list!)

excerpts: Our seven year old (raised on Mission burritos) refused to eat the carne asada from Papalote.
This tastes Americano," he said.
carne asada.author: Franz T.
carne asada.review: Our seven year old (raised on Mission burritos) refused to eat the carne asada from Papalote. "This tastes Americano," he said.

excerpts: Burrito=smoky/juicy chunks of carne asada.
super flavorful.
all the ingredients are fresh.
carne asada.author: Jang David K.
carne asada.review:
El Farolito, move out the way.  Your PAPA is here to give you a smackdown on your burrito and show you how it is done.  People say this is one the best burrito place in northern california. i think so. 

free Chips and and homemade salsa=descent chips and AMAZING salsa.
Burrito=smoky/juicy chunks of carne asada. super flavorful.  all the ingredients are fresh.
I think I just had the best fish burrito ever here.....oh man.

it's a bit pricier than most burrito joints but huge portions make up for it.  4.5 stars for sure.

it's so good that sometimes, after a bite, i just want to get up and start shaking my body.  but then again, it may traumatize the people i'm eating with.

excerpts: I ordered a carne asada burrito and a ginger beer.
I really wanted a horchata instead, but didn't see it on the menu until I looked behind the counter and noticed they DID have it.
I asked to switch my unopened bottle of ginger beer for the horchata
but I was denied because I had already paid
carne asada.author: Jeff G.
carne asada.review:
I went to this place expecting really great authentic Mexican food. 
The first attempt was thwarted when they were closed for a special event, so I went to La Taqueria instead..

I came back the following day and what I found disappointed me.
I ordered a carne asada burrito and a ginger beer.
I really wanted a horchata instead, but didn't see it on the menu until I looked behind the counter and noticed they DID have it. I asked to switch my unopened bottle of ginger beer for the horchata but I was denied because I had already paid.. what sort of crap is that?

Obviously off to a bad start, I hoped my burrito would make up for it.
It didn't. I was unimpressed. I should have realized it after noticing that there were no locals in the joint.. just nicely dressed white people (like myself) and prices that were a little high for the area to boot.

It wasn't taco bell quality, but it definitely not worth the praise I read about in reviews like Citysearch. I only put 1 star because I think the ratings need to drop on this place to help ward off any would-be explorers like myself who are expecting real flavor in the mission district.

My only consolation: finally a place worse than stuff I find in Miami! YAY!

excerpts: but still might get it some day (shrimp, carne asada, chicken, in a giant burrito).
carne asada.author: Truman S.
carne asada.review:
OK. so the only thing you have to know about papalote is...the SALSA! man o man, this salsa is quite possibly the best creation to be married with a burrito...chips...quesadilla..wait, actually i could eat this salsa on anything. rice..pizza..hot dog. yea, its that good. 

After seeing this place on throw down with bobby flay, i've always wanted to hit this place up. unfortunately, the TRIPLE THREAT burrito is TWENTY bucks? yea insane...but still might get it some day (shrimp, carne asada, chicken, in a giant burrito). 

I ended up getting a regular pollo asada burrito in a spinach tortilla, made it super (guac, sour cream). After waiting for about 10 minutes, the burrito had arrived! The burrito was well sized...and piping hot. Bite after bite, i enjoyed the burrito until it was no more. I found the flavors to be great, ingredients fresh, and with the AMAZING salsa - it was almost the perfect burrito. I would have liked the avocados to be sliced freshly (taqueria cancun!), and perhaps a something else to mix up the burrito texturally (fresh salsa..onions?). 

Overall, i thoroughly enjoyed the burrito - the price was fair at about $9 (not cheap but great quality). Lastly, I would consider buying the salsa by the jar, which they sell at the shop also. I can see why bobby flay lost his throw down to the Papalote bros!

excerpts: Also tried the carne asada salad, which was easily the best Mexican salad I've had as well.
I'll definitely be back!
carne asada.author: Rajesh S.
carne asada.review: Delicious! This place has the tastiest salsa I've ever had. Also tried the carne asada salad, which was easily the best Mexican salad I've had as well. I'll definitely be back!

excerpts: Everything else in my Carne Asada Super Burrito was just ok.
One thing was that the avocado and sour cream was not evenly spread out in the burrito.
Also, not enough sour cream..
carne asada.author: AhLin C.
carne asada.review:
The sauce/salsa is great.  Everything else in my Carne Asada Super Burrito was just ok.  One thing was that the avocado and sour cream was not evenly spread out in the burrito.  Also, not enough sour cream.. tsk tsk.. 

Anyway, the wait for a table can get quite long.   Not sure if it's worth the wait and price.  
Also tried their fish taco and that was not bad, but not awesome either. Think I'll stick to El Farolito to supply my burrito fix.

excerpts: Most recently had a carne asada burrito that was flavorful, but incredibly salty.
Papalote is usually pretty decent, but given that it's pricier than its neighbors (La Taqueria and el Farolito), probably won't be rushing back anytime soon.
carne asada.author: Andrew C.
carne asada.review: Most recently had a carne asada burrito that was flavorful, but incredibly salty. Papalote is usually pretty decent, but given that it's pricier than its neighbors (La Taqueria and el Farolito), probably won't be rushing back anytime soon.

excerpts: Probably the best carne asada around.
They grill it up right there and then with fresh ingredients and of course you gotta get it super!!!
Burrito or taco = yum yum...
carne asada.author: Minh V.
carne asada.review:
Probably the best carne asada around. They grill it up right there and then with fresh ingredients and of course you gotta get it super!!! Burrito or taco = yum yum... Add a little of that amazing orange sauce and OMG goodness!!!

Pending on time of day, parking is a biatch...  and good luck getting a table...

excerpts: I got the Carne Asada super burrito, and I'd say the burrito itself was a 3.
The burrito was as flat as a pancake, and it was empty and soft inside.
I like my burritos dense, not sagging in my hands like its a chore to feed me.
The only thing that redeems this place to a 4 star rating is their salsa.
I wouldn't call it salsa, I'd call it sauce.
carne asada.author: Samantha R.
carne asada.review:
I'm teetering between a 3 and a 4.....I feel like I only review Mexican places and liquor holes (bars. get your mind out of the gutter), but I guess that means those two things are what I know best. Coming from South Bay, I admit I'm kind of a Mexi-snob. Well Papalote...I gave you a chance with the hype, salsa, and big burrito on my plate ready to take in bite by bite.

I got the Carne Asada super burrito, and I'd say the burrito itself was a 3. The burrito was as flat as a pancake, and it was empty and soft inside. I like my burritos dense, not sagging in my hands like its a chore to feed me. The only thing that redeems this place to a 4 star rating is their salsa. I wouldn't call it salsa, I'd call it sauce. The flavor completes any burrito, just try it to understand how they can get away with charging several dollars for a mason jar full.

NOTE: for those of you out there who know what 'Orange Sauce' is from San Jose, this is the closest thing you're gonna get in the city. Hell, I think this sauce might even be better than La Vic.

Anyway, props to Papalote for keeping the Mission charm. Dig the vibes from the art in there. Nice location in the Mission near BART. I'd go back after drinking. But if it were up to me for getting Mexican in the Mission, I'd hit up El Farolito for a suiza instead.

excerpts: My fiance claims it's the best carne asada she's ever had.
The sauce is good too but they shouldn't charge for extra.
If you buy a bottle tho, get the home made stuff in the mason jar, not the factory jars as they do not even compare.
carne asada.author: Mike T.
carne asada.review: Pretty hyped up but the food is good. It's one of those taquerias where you could eat the food blindfolded and be able to guess it correctly. My fiance claims it's the best carne asada she's ever had. The sauce is good too but they shouldn't charge for extra. If you buy a bottle tho, get the home made stuff in the mason jar, not the factory jars as they do not even compare.

excerpts: Came in here with my boy AA and ordered a Carne Asada Quesadilla for $7.25.
It had jicama, guacamole, salsa, and pico de gallo.
carne asada.author: Brian C.
carne asada.review: Came in here with my boy AA and ordered a Carne Asada Quesadilla for $7.25. It had jicama, guacamole, salsa, and pico de gallo. The meat was freshly grilled and the cheese was melted perfectly. High quality stuff. It was served to us on our table but previous to that there was a legit orange sauce and chips. I say legit because you could see the crushed tomatoes and pimentos in there. Did I say this place was ZAGAT rated? now it's BRIAN rated as well.

excerpts: He competed on who can make the best burrito against the 2 owners of the restaurant and at the end Papalote won with its Triple Threat Burrito which has chicken, prawns, carne asada and the usual rice, beans, Etc.
So after watching the show a few days later we decide to give it a try
so my husband hops on Bart and takes off for S.F.
When he gets there he calls me and tells me that the Triple Threat Burrito is $ 20 buckz each...
I said fuck it
you went all the way out there
we might as well get it!
When he gets back I couldnt wait to tear it up...
lol OMG
it was so fuckn gooooood!
carne asada.author: Johanna G.
carne asada.review:
We decided to give this place a try after watching the show on Food Network Bobby Flay's Throwdown. He competed on who can make the best burrito against the 2 owners of the restaurant and at the end Papalote won with its Triple Threat Burrito which has chicken, prawns, carne asada and the usual rice, beans, Etc. So after watching the show a few days later we decide to give it a try so my husband hops on Bart and takes off for S.F. When he gets there he calls me and tells me that the Triple Threat Burrito is $ 20 buckz each...I said fuck it you went all the way out there we might as well get it! When he gets back I couldnt wait to tear it up...lol OMG it was so fuckn gooooood! The tortilla was not steamed but kinda crunchy but not hard at all it was just perfect and their salsa was delish too!  

I still haven't gone back till this day to try anything else but pics I've seen on here look delish I will have to go back n try something different....I hope cuz I might just end up with another Triple Threat lol

excerpts: I get the "naked burrito", and have had chicken, carne asada, and prawn.
The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).
Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.
I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.
I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.
Everyone who works there is really nice!
carne asada.author: Rachel A.
carne asada.review: I like Papalote a lot because of its convenience, but it is on the expensive side.  I get the "naked burrito", and have had chicken, carne asada, and prawn.  The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).  Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.  I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.  I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.  Everyone who works there is really nice!

excerpts:
Simple spot to eat, nothing fancy, just a killer Carne Asada and Salsa!
by far my favorite Burrito in Mission!
carne asada.author: David W.
carne asada.review:
Simple spot to eat, nothing fancy, just a killer Carne Asada and Salsa!
by far my favorite Burrito in Mission!

excerpts: I had the Carne asada that was voted and rated highly on 7 x 7 list of best Carne asada burritos in the city.
The Carne asada was actually very good, tender and tasty but the mush that they called rice ruined the burrito for me.
It just became this mix of poor textures.
If I could take the Carne asada from papalote and put it into a el farolito burrito, I would be in heaven.
Since I can't, I'll have to settle for the dry meat at el farrolito because I definitely can't deal with the mushy rice at papalote
carne asada.author: Brian C.
carne asada.review:
Papalote in the heart of the Mission on 24th near the Bart station is a small place.  They do a pretty big takeout business because of their small dine in space and their dedicated register for those takeout customers.  Menu is pretty straightforward, either burrito, taco, quesadilla, all with a healthy choice of different meats, tortillas and sides.

I had the Carne asada that was voted and rated highly on 7 x 7 list of best Carne asada burritos in the city.  K had the shrimp burrito.  When we sat down, they brought us chips and salsa.  The salsa is this creamy roasted tomato salsa with a kick.  It was very different than I've tasted and was def a fan.  The burrito was a large size, mine was the "super" with guacamole, sour cream and cheese.  The Carne asada was actually very good, tender and tasty but the mush that they called rice ruined the burrito for me.  It just became this mix of poor textures. K was happy with her shrimp burrito and said it was flavorful, she didn't mind the rice as much as I did.

If I could take the Carne asada from papalote and put it into a el farolito burrito, I would be in heaven.  Since I can't, I'll have to settle for the dry meat at el farrolito because I definitely can't deal with the mushy rice at papalote

excerpts: So I ordered the carne asada burrito.
It was pretty good.
All meat and no fat.
(which is what i love).
The salsa was really tasty
carne asada.author: Fran N.
carne asada.review:
So me and my coworkers were on our way back to Bart from the SF Carnaval (congrats Carmen for winning the Queen title by the way) and we were starving. I wasn't trying to pay 10 dollars for street vendor food that was cooked in the scorching sun plus the fact that I didnt have cash anyways.

So we headed here. Wasn't as crowded as I expected it to be. So I ordered the carne asada burrito. It was pretty good. All meat and no fat. (which is what i love). The salsa was really tasty but they barely gave any chips. 

The DOWNSIDE - the customer service is AWFUL. The asian girl behind the register was really straightfaced. I ordered my food and sat down. When I got my burrito, I asked the person who served us if they can give me a fork and knife (which they should have gave in the first place) he says "what?" and i go "can i have a FORK!" and gives me a weird look. 5 mins later, still no utensils. So I go up to the cashier and ask for one, (same girl from earlier) and she just hands me the fork in a rude manner even tho I said "thank you."

ANOTHER THING - i also ordered horchata. I thought they would have given it to me along with the burrito or when i paid but NOPE, nothing. So i went to the register AGAIN and asked the same server guy who DIDNT give me the fork for my horchata and he gave me the same weird look and spoke to other girl in spanish. The other server girl goes "what do you want?" and i said "i ordered horchata and i never got it." So she leaves randomnly and the guy just hands it to me as if its the worst thing in the world. 

All in all, TERRIBLE customer service. I dont know if the servers understood english or not but c'mon, I'm a paying customer. Have some effin decency.

Good food, bad service. Might as well go to Chipotle. Or the other Papalote location.

excerpts: I had the carne asada and chili verde tacos.
They come in litle corn tortillas with pico de gallo, lettuce, and meat.
Both were OK...
I just felt like something was missing.
My friends ordered their chicken and carne asada burritos.
Again, nothing special.
carne asada.author: Tim B.
carne asada.review:
The salsa here is quite good - its more like a creamy spicy sauce that you eat with your chips, very unique and tasty.
 
Otherwise, I don't really feel like it's anything special. I've definitely had better mexican food. I had the carne asada and chili verde tacos. They come in litle corn tortillas with pico de gallo, lettuce, and meat. Both were OK... I just felt like something was missing. Adding the salsa made it better, but maybe I wanted cheese or something. My friends ordered their chicken and carne asada burritos. Again, nothing special. I tasted it and it didn't really have any outstanding flavor. 

I think the reason why its so liked is because it has interesting vegan options like soy chorizo and eggplant quesadillas. They also offer wheat tortillas.

excerpts: I had the soyrizo burrito (husband had the carne asada
and he was
it was absolutely delicious).
I love that you can have a choice of beans at this place (all of which are vegan).
carne asada.author: Carrie T.
carne asada.review:
I recently went here for the first time and I fell in LOVE with the salsa. I am pretty I would drink a large glass of it if I could. 

This place is super vegan friendly, they have quite a few different options. I had the soyrizo burrito (husband had the carne asada and he was it was absolutely delicious). I love that you can have a choice of beans at this place (all of which are vegan). I had the black refried. 

I think I could say this is the BEST burrito I have EVER had. 

The reason for four stars instead of five: Our burritos came with chips and salsa, and while the salsa is heaven, I thought the chips were just "okay."  Also, this location is pretty tiny with limited seating and customers were packed in there like sardines. We arrived just in time to grab the last two seats. 

I'm still dreaming about that salsa.

excerpts: My favorite item to get is the nachos with carne asada
carne asada.author: Crystel A.
carne asada.review:
My favorite thing about this place would have to be their salsa.... i keep going back because of it. 
You can even buy some in jars so you can take home! It's so good you will want to! 

Their known for their awesome burritos which I think are really good when they don't overcook the meet. And if it's your first time you should get a burrito! 

My favorite item to get is the nachos with carne asada and I get an extra salsa cup ...so good! one time I even shared with this guy sitting near me. He thought it looked so good and dam right it was!

excerpts: Interestingly, my friend's machaca wasn't actually machaca at all, but chopped up carne asada.
carne asada.author: Joe S.
carne asada.review:
Ok - so I gave Papalote one more chance.  This time, I tried the Triple threat burrito, while my friend ordered the machaca.

I had recalled on Food Network that the brothers who own Papalote entered their Triple Threat burrito into some competition and it won, so I figured - if I am going to give them one more shot, I might as well give them their best chance.

For $20, the burrito was ok.  It kind of laid there and acted bored.  For $20 for a burrito, I want a little more action - I just need a little more lovin' for that price ... for a burrito.

I don't think they sell very many of them, because the shrimp actually had no flavor.  Yes - it was large - but size isn't everything in this case.
Interestingly, my friend's machaca wasn't actually machaca at all, but chopped up carne asada.

His theory (he's Mexican) is that Papalote is for people who don't know what Mexican food is.  Frankly, I see the line outside the restaurant every day, and I am still perplexed why these folks don't go down one street to Taqueria or a place where you can get much better Mexican food a lot cheaper.

excerpts: But if you do, my go-to burrito is a super carne asada burrito.
The salsa is AMAZING.
Calling ahead and picking up is also great if you don't want to wait in line.
carne asada.author: Stephanie A.
carne asada.review: The soyrizo is so good. Making your taco order "super" will totally fill you up if you don't want a burrito. But if you do, my go-to burrito is a super carne asada burrito. The salsa is AMAZING. Calling ahead and picking up is also great if you don't want to wait in line.

excerpts: The carne asada burrito definitely lives up to the hype.
carne asada.author: Caroline W.
carne asada.review: The carne asada burrito definitely lives up to the hype. We're talking good sized chunks of steak (NOT ground beef), good ratio of rice/beans/meat/, and a smoky, flavorful salsa to pour on top. I'm not a fan of the jicama salad that comes on the side, mostly cause I'm not a fan of jicama, but the burrito does not disappoint!

excerpts: I've had the super carne asada burrito here before and it was pretty good.
The triple threat was a complete dud.
It was relatively small considering the amount of meat it contained.
A normal El Faralito burrito is bigger.
Also the triple threat is WAY overpriced, $19.95 and that is without the super upgrade.
carne asada.author: Mike I.
carne asada.review:
I walked more than two miles in the pouring rain to enjoy the triple threat burrito here. I was sadly disappointed. I've had the super carne asada burrito here before and it was pretty good. The triple threat was a complete dud. It was relatively small considering the amount of meat it contained. A normal El Faralito burrito is bigger. Also the triple threat is WAY overpriced, $19.95 and that is without the super upgrade. RIP OFF. 

Finally the biggest rip is the .55 you have to pay for extra salsa.
