El Faralito is better if you eat meat. If you want a soyrizo tofu bastardized burrito papalote is still your spot.

excerpts: i appreciate good carne asada in a burrito but the beef was a bit chewy and too greasy for my taste.
carne asada.author: L M.
carne asada.review:
i couldnt bring myself to give more than 2 stars. HOW DID THIS PLACE EVER BEAT BOBBY FLAY? like many others, i was interested in trying this place out when i found out that this place beat bobby flay's throwdown. 

my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and boy do i feel cheated! i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that. the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and rubbery but i did like that it tasted grilled. i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito. and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy. i appreciate good carne asada in a burrito but the beef was a bit chewy and too greasy for my taste. (boyfriend agrees with all this by the way)

however, i do like that the chips and salsa came free with the burrito. and i appreciate the cashier for telling me they come with the burrito so i didnt have to pay for an extra one. the salsa was delicious too. if it wasnt for the chips and salsa, i dont think i would even give 2 stars.

excerpts: Most of the carne asada had to be spit out due to the gristle and the 3 prawns inside were over cooked and chewy.
carne asada.author: Stacey B.
carne asada.review:
Came here after my husband saw Throw Down With Bobby Flay.  I'm a Bobby Flay fan and we were kind of having a fun "food network" adventure during our weekend in SF.

How did my Bobby Flay lose, I'll never know...

My husband got the triple threat burrito.  Most of the carne asada had to be spit out due to the gristle and the 3 prawns inside were over cooked and chewy.  The chicken, however, had a great flavor and left us wishing we'd just gotten the chicken burrito.  However, we were essentially there to try this particular burrito.

I ordered the fish tacos and they were alright.  Nothing special.  Oh well.

The chips were good and the salsa was fantastic.  The salsa was the only impressive thing about the place.  

If you decide to try Papalote, don't waste your time with the triple threat.  It's over-priced and over-rated.

excerpts: I think it might be less to just buy a prawn burrito, add chicken & carne asada, and make it a super though I'm not sure.
carne asada.author: John D.
carne asada.review:
It's obvious that the 'comedian' brother came up with the price for the Triple Threat because that was funny as hell!  But hey, I'll go along with the absurd price and fall into the tourist trap.  Turns out it's the customers who are the joke since it's not even that good...

Like many others, I came to this place after watching Throwdown a couple days ago.  For those who want to come here for the Triple Threat burrito, the 1st thing you will notice is the $19.95 price which might be worth it if it used Kobe beef though I just wanted to try it once.  I think it might be less to just buy a prawn burrito, add chicken & carne asada, and make it a super though I'm not sure.

I really do think this Triple Threat burrito is overrated, especially because of its price.  I found myself eating each of the meat separately because together it is over-seasoned with each of the marinade and sauce getting lost within each other.  Individually, the meat tastes great: perfectly grilled and marinated so well.  But together, there is just too much going on.  The secret sauce is good (maybe a rip off of La Vic's orange sauce) though, with some heat and tangy.  So it may be that it's better to just get a burrito with just 1 type of meat and hope it's not bland.  The food here is fresh though.

There are other places in the Mission where you can get just as good of a tasting, fresh burrito that's more authentic for half the price.. so I won't be coming back here.

small dining area, so might not get a seat
service is good, but phone your order in so you don't have to wait a while
parking isn't too hard to find, metered

excerpts: Instead I got the carne asada burrito to-go.
The burrito is good.
Big chunks of meat and a good balance of ingredients.
They also pack your bag with chips and some killer good orange hot sauce.
For some reason the sauce tastes better this time around.
carne asada.author: Michael H.
carne asada.review:
I still don't know understand the hype of this place. I had tried this place a while ago for their chicken mole tacos and found it alright. Then I saw Papalote beat Bobby Flay with their Triple Threat Burrito. Since I couldn't find the bakery I was looking for I decided to give it another shot.

I didn't realize that the Triple Threat Burrito is $20! Instead I got the carne asada burrito to-go. The burrito is good. Big chunks of meat and a good balance of ingredients. They also pack your bag with chips and some killer good orange hot sauce. For some reason the sauce tastes better this time around. I think the sauce is better suited for hefty savory burritos.

Considering that Papalote is as busy as a liquor store on New Year's Eve, I would rather go somewhere less congested, cheaper, and just as good. The wait isn't worth the food. If it's not that crazy packed, give it a shot.

excerpts: Shrimp, chicken and carne asada in a single burrito that's no bigger than a regular burrito.
carne asada.author: Rick C.
carne asada.review:
Ever eat a $20 burrito? That's what the the Triple Threat burrito will cost you. Shrimp, chicken and carne asada in a single burrito that's no bigger than a regular burrito. I normally get the Chile Verde burrito which is excellent ($7.50) until I saw an episode of Throwdown with Bobby Flay. Now I've been eating here for awhile and was never aware of the Triple Threat until the episode with Flay. Told myself that I was gonna try it next time around instead of my usual Chile Verde. Looked at the online menu and there was no Triple Threat. Had the little lady call in an order for us. One TT and one Chile Verde. 25 mins later, I show up to pick up my order and the nice young lady at the counter tells me the total is $32. I looked up at the menu board and there's a small plastic sign taped to it that reads Triple Threat Burrito $19.99. WTF? 

It was a Wednesday night and the place was unusually packed...alot more than usual. All of the staff members were wearing Throwndown shirts and they looked really overwhelmed by the crowds of people coming in and the telephone ringing off the hook. Even after calling the order in 25 minutes ago, I still had to wait another 15 minutes to get my food. 

The TT was good and the different meats in it had a nice balance that worked together. Maybe $10-$12 would have been a reasonable price. But $20...gonna stay with the Chile Verde. 

My beloved Papalote is now a rerun on the Food Network. Great for the owners (well deserved) but sucks for the regulars who now have to deal with the crazy crowds (not that it wasn't crowded before). At least, I can tell people I had a $20 burrito...once.

excerpts: I ordered the carne asada super burrito and came away full but not completely satisfied.
carne asada.author: Greg G.
carne asada.review:
Good - not great - but certainly not "the best".

I ordered the carne asada super burrito and came away full but not completely satisfied.  The steak was very good, but the rest of the ingredients (Rice, beans, pico, guacamole) were bland by comparison.  I found that I had to load the salsa up on the burrito to compensate for the generic taste.  I'm glad to have tried a new place, but will stick to La Taqueria for a more authentic and flavorful experience.

excerpts: Anyway, I got the carne asada burrito
and it was full of flavor.
I'm not sure how else to describe it.
and I got nachos with carne asada, cheese, guacamole, and sour cream.
carne asada.author: Therese M.
carne asada.review:
Papalote's was featured on the Food Network on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay," me and the boyfriend wanted to check it out because it was local. We went there with his family and it's a small restaurant, it was the weekend, so it was really crowded but we waited for a table.

When we sat down they served chips and salsa. OMG that salsa. It's not the kind of salsa you're used to with chopped tomatoes, cilantro, and what not. The salsa at papalote's is more like a sauce, but a HELLA good sauce. We spent like 20 minutes tasting it and trying to figure out what was in it. The way I describe it is: it tastes like spicy nacho cheese doritos but in liquid form. Haha.

Anyway, I got the carne asada burrito and it was full of flavor. I'm not sure how else to describe it. Everything is made to order and it tastes like all the ingredients are fresh.

One time I came here with my co-worker and I got nachos with carne asada, cheese, guacamole, and sour cream. They had the perfect cheese to nachos ratio. They didn't put too much cheese and the chips stayed crunchy. It was a huge plate though, so if you get the nachos make sure you're with a friend. =)

What sucks is that after you finish the free chips and salsa, you have to pay for more. It's not much, but I usually think that chips and salsa are free.

excerpts: My partner ordered the carne asada (beef) taquitos and I ordered the chicken.
What we received were huge chunks of meat (we are used to shredded meat) and long strands of lettuce and huge chunks of tomato.
There was no flavor at all in the meat or chicken and the abundance of watery tomato and lettuce made the taquitos
I am used to taquitos that have double tortillas with shredded chicken or beef and topped with salsa and chopped cilantro and onion.
carne asada.author: Deb J.
carne asada.review:
I went to Papalote in the Mission District on a recent weekend visit.  It was recommended by the owner of the B&B where I was staying.  As this is San Francisco, I expected the food to be a bit more authentic and I was sorely disappointed.

The staff was friendly enough and the menu was readable.  My complaint?  First, we ordered taquitos and a side of rice and beans.  My partner ordered the carne asada (beef) taquitos and I ordered the chicken.  What we received were huge chunks of meat (we are used to shredded meat) and long strands of lettuce and huge chunks of tomato.  There was no flavor at all in the meat or chicken and the abundance of watery tomato and lettuce made the taquitos so watery that they dissolved the tortilla.

The horchata and strawberry drinks were watery and not at all flavorful.  I am used to taquitos that have double tortillas with shredded chicken or beef and topped with salsa and chopped cilantro and onion.  Not here.

I would not recommend this place, and when I told my friend who we were visiting, she said that the place was always full and that there were way better taquerias to be had along Mission Street.

So, to not be too mean, I gave this place two stars, but really would have given it one.  Oh, and the huge burrito (which by the way, is an American invention) at the table next to me was burried under a mountain of mozzarella cheese.  Yech.

excerpts: Orange sauce and carne asada is what makes this place.
The decor is cute and clean.
I got the carne asada tacos and my friend got the carne asada burrito.
Fresh ingredients with the super.
It's a little more expensive then your average taqueria.
Expect to be lined out the door if you come during the prime time.
carne asada.author: Jennifer B.
carne asada.review: Orange sauce and carne asada is what makes this place. The decor is cute and clean. I got the carne asada tacos and my friend got the carne asada burrito. Fresh ingredients with the super. It's a little more expensive then your average taqueria. Expect to be lined out the door if you come during the prime time.

excerpts: I had the carne asada...yum...love the carne asada.
I was surprised by the Noe Valley weekday dinner rush last week, but I guess if I lived in Noe, I'd be there all the time too....
carne asada.author: Wendy L.
carne asada.review:
Oh, yeah, come to papa...  

I'd heard a ton about Paplote and how great it is....and it is great.  Where else can you get a great, 3 lb. super burrito for so little?  I had the carne asada...yum...love the carne asada.  I was surprised by the Noe Valley weekday dinner rush last week, but I guess if I lived in Noe, I'd be there all the time too....  I was a little disappointed with the amount of guacamole you get with a side order, but otherwise, fantastic!

It was so tasty that I may even consider the tofu mole...

excerpts: Carne Asada burritos, on the other hand....
carne asada.author: Adam G.
carne asada.review:
The sibbies were in town and had seen the episode of Throwdown, of course.  I'd been curious to try out the famous burrito also, but knew I wasn't going to spend the $ on it on my own.  Cue Papalote for dinner tonight.  

First off, the place is tiny.  Not in a bad way, but just in the way that you need to know before going there assuming you can just sit down.  Even fewer seats than El Farolito around the corner.  

Foodwise, first we got the chips and salsa.  Off to a great start.  Good chips, tasty and complex salsa.  Nice and spicy, too, but maybe a touch too much for the average person.  Also not impressed they charge for another bowl of corn chips.  Boo for that one.

Next up: the Triple Threat.  Of course that's what we had to try.  It arrives taking up more of a plate than is reasonable for a burrito.  But that's what it should do for $20.  And yes, it did take ~15 minutes to arrive, but that's ok in my book, since it was clear everything was freshly cooked.  Again, not your average burrito.  We had to taste each element independently, and each was fantastic on its own.  The shrimp were nicely spiced and well cooked.  The chicken was not too salty (a frequent problem I've noticed with seasoned chicken), and the steak was simple but awesome.  Guacamole was also very good, as were the refried beans.

So on the whole, we enjoyed the food, were astounded at the size of the portion, and would likely come back again.  We would likely not be getting the Triple Threat, though...especially not for $20.  Carne Asada burritos, on the other hand....

excerpts: My boyfriend said his carne asada burrito was good
but he liked El Faro/El Farolito better and its $3 cheaper.
Overall a good place to eat
but I think there are other places just as good and a little cheaper just down 24th.
carne asada.author: Nicole W.
carne asada.review: Good food, great salsa and chips.  The price seemed a little high considering there are about a thousand great taco/burrito places within a mile of here.  I enjoyed my fish taco but I have a hard time giving it 4 stars.  My boyfriend said his carne asada burrito was good but he liked El Faro/El Farolito better and its $3 cheaper.   Overall a good place to eat but I think there are other places just as good and a little cheaper just down 24th.

excerpts: After waiting 15 minutes for my carne asada burrito + the 99 cent extras, I was disappointed with the lack of flavor from this 'Mission' burrito.
carne asada.author: shaun l.
carne asada.review:
Like what others have said, don't believe the hype.

After waiting 15 minutes for my carne asada burrito + the 99 cent extras, I was disappointed with the lack of flavor from this 'Mission' burrito.  The meat was tough, the tortilla seemed a bit off, and there just wasn't any flavor in there.  

El Farolito is miles better, and is just down the street.

excerpts: Looking forward to going back to try their carne asada and others.
carne asada.author: Anna C.
carne asada.review:
I recently moved to Bernal Heights and walk through the Mission everyday to get to and from BART.  The smell of grilled meats is enough to make me want to try every single mexican restaurant in the mission.  

I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.  YUMMMY fish!  Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.  Ok on the chicken mole. I love that place.  Looking forward to going back to try their carne asada and others.

excerpts: I got the carne asada burrito
and it's everything a burrito should be - meaty, hearty, devilishly delicious, and messy (if not eaten with a fork).
arrived at around 7pm on a Saturday night.
carne asada.author: valerie t.
carne asada.review:
Believe the hype - the chips and salsa are both amazing.  

I got the carne asada burrito and it's everything a burrito should be - meaty, hearty, devilishly delicious, and messy (if not eaten with a fork).  arrived at around 7pm on a Saturday night.  It was busy, but we were able to get a small table for two.  

The place is small but fun (and pretty clean), and the music was hip and upbeat.  There were some pretty cool artwork that hung around as well.  

Definitely worth a second visit.  If I can get someone to split with me, I'd like to try the triple threat burrito.

excerpts: It's not often that you get shrimp, chicken, and carne asada all on one burrito.
The orange sauce was excellent as well.
carne asada.author: John C.
carne asada.review:
I wanted to try this place badly after seeing it on Throwdown with Bobby Flay. The burrito featured on the show was the Triple Threat. The night that the episode originally aired, we tried to place a phone order to pick it up. After ordering 2 of these burritos with a couple minor add-ons, the lady said "it'll be ready in 45 minutes and it'll be $45." What?!?! Seriously? We thought she heard our order wrong, like we ordered 5-10 burritos. But no, she was serious; that was the price for 2. We were so shocked that we ended up cancelling the order.

After doing some research on Yelp, we found out that as soon as the show aired, they jacked the price up by $5. Pretty messed up, but apparently there was high enough demand.

A few months later, we finally decided to give it a try. My girlfriend and I split one of the Triple Threat burritos. I must say, it was pretty good. It's not often that you get shrimp, chicken, and carne asada all on one burrito. The orange sauce was excellent as well. Lots of flavor, and we also had some with our chips.

But in the end, I cannot justify paying $20+ for a burrito, especially in the Mission, where there is seemingly a taqueria every other store. I'm glad that you guys got the publicity that Bobby Flay gave you, but how do you plan to have repeat customers? Sure, people will try it once out of curiosity, but I don't imagine many returning for the same $20 burrito.

excerpts: We had a super fish burrito, two carne asada tacos, and two beers.
carne asada.author: Lucius M.
carne asada.review:
I don't want to get hung up on money, but we went to Papalote for dinner last night and spent $30!  That's a ton of money at a Mexican joint.  I was shocked when the guy at the cash register told me the amount we owed.  We had a super fish burrito, two carne asada tacos, and two beers.  It should be noted that the menu prices listed on the photo at this time on Yelp are really out of date.

As for the food, it was really good.  Unique, tasty sauce for the chips is a great way to start the dinner and everyone gets their own bowl of chips.  Because it's a smaller space, it can get packed quickly.

excerpts: I usually get the carne asada burrito
and it's never failed to impress.
carne asada.author: Niki V.
carne asada.review: The sauce! The sauce is worth writing a million words for. You can also buy the jar of sauce which makes it that much better. I usually get the carne asada burrito and it's never failed to impress. I have also tried the grilled veggie burrito (not that great as it had no guac, cheese, salsa or sour cream). You can't go wrong with the quesadillas either! Cute little spot

excerpts: Went down with a friend of mine, and he had the carne asada quesadilla, while I had the carne asada burrito.
The carne asada was well-cooked, and they didn't skimp like other places do.
The cooks are working overtime and we could smell and see the other tables' dishes as they were brought out, with a lot of "What is that?
I gotta get some of that!" comments.
All of the other patrons were equally impressed.
And if you're in the Mission, you better be authentic or you'll be exposed for the fraud you are.
carne asada.author: Jerry M.
carne asada.review:
After reading 40 million reviews, thought I'd give it a try. Went down with a friend of mine, and he had the carne asada quesadilla, while I had the carne asada burrito. We also shared some chorizo and melted cheese---all of it fantastic! The carne asada was well-cooked, and they didn't skimp like other places do. The cooks are working overtime and we could smell and see the other tables' dishes as they were brought out, with a lot of "What is that? I gotta get some of that!" comments. All of the other patrons were equally impressed. And if you're in the Mission, you better be authentic or you'll be exposed for the fraud you are. This place is the real deal.

If this is your first time there, on each table there is a bottle of salsa picante (the red) and salsa verde (the green). OMG. Warning: whatever drink you get, if you put the verde on your food, get two drinks. I put some serious water away washing that down. It was one of those types of meals where you know you'll pay for it later and you just don't care. It's that good. We'll definitely be back again.

excerpts: so I went with the Carne Asada burrito.
It was perfect, not too big, not too small...just right.
The meat was perfectly cooked and flavored, not loaded with gristle like so many carne asada burrito's
can be.
carne asada.author: frederick a.
carne asada.review:
After seeing the Bobby Flay Throwdown episode where he challenged these guys and lost, we went out of our way (on a road trip from Seattle to LA) to check this place out.  Boy am I glad we did!! 

I wanted to try the Triple Threat, but we had other places to try just down the street so I went with the Carne Asada burrito.  It was perfect, not too big, not too small...just right.  The meat was perfectly cooked and flavored, not loaded with gristle like so many carne asada burrito's can be.  My wife had the shrimp burrito which was also very good, although the shrimp was a little overcooked and over-blackened.

Where they really shine though is their salsa.  It's amazingly good.  Not super hot, just spicy enough.  We brought a jar home with us and it's getting dangerously close to empty.  Will they ship to Seattle?

Definetly will go again on our next Cali trip.

excerpts: Try the nachos (drizzled w/ guac and sour cream), refried black bean dip, and the carne asada super tacos.
carne asada.author: devo m.
carne asada.review:
my go-to mexican joint for the past 5 years. by far, the best mexican food within the 24th/Mission/Noe corridor. Try the nachos (drizzled w/ guac and sour cream), refried black bean dip, and the carne asada super tacos. 

papalote even sells their own homemade salsa; I think a bottle runs ~10 bucks. You can buy extra 'lil salsas for 50 cents/ea. 

if that doesn't convince you then how about this: this is the 1,000th review on yelp in a very crowded mexican market.

check out youtube for their foodtv appearance and various founder/co-founder sketch vids.

excerpts: The prices were way too expensive for burritos which consisted of mostly beans and rice, with very little carne asada or shrimp.
We are from Southern California where a carne asada burrito is less expensive, just as big, and has plenty of flavorful beef.
Plus, the beans and rice are side items, not the main component of the burrito.
So, we now know not to eat Mexican food in Northern California.
carne asada.author: Raquel A.
carne asada.review: My daughter and I really looked forward to eating at this restaurant after seeing it featured on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay".  It was a BIG disappointment.  The prices were way too expensive for burritos which consisted of mostly beans and rice, with very little carne asada or shrimp.  We are from Southern California where a carne asada burrito is less expensive, just as big, and has plenty of flavorful beef.  Plus, the beans and rice are side items, not the main component of the burrito.  So, we now know not to eat Mexican food in Northern California.

excerpts: The rice was undercooked and hard....and the carne asada was not chopped very well.
Big hunks of meat like a fajita.
Meats should be chopped more finely....
carne asada.author: Mario W.
carne asada.review: This place does NOT have the best burritos in SF at all. I had a steak and shrimp burrito today. The rice was undercooked and hard....and the carne asada was not chopped very well. Big hunks of meat like a fajita. Meats should be chopped more finely....I wanted extra salsa for my chips and they charge u extra ? I actually have to pay the waiter at our table and do a seperate transaction for salsa ??? Doesn't that sound ridiculous to you ? I take my burritos very seriously...the burrito wasn't horrible, but not by any means the best in sf. I will not give into the hype.

excerpts: I like how their Carne Asada is grilled fresh and not chopped into little ity-bitty pieces.
They grill the tortillas causing the outside to have a nice crunch.
I like their rice and how cheesy the burrito was, the Pinto beans seemed standard.
The Burrito price was high (@ $9.97 with chips and tax) especially compared to other establishments.
The size was not what I consider a super burrito and was on the small side comparatively.
However the burrito was fresh, tasty, and great!
carne asada.author: Trev D.
carne asada.review:
Good food but overpriced and on the small side regarding quantity. Parking is  tricky to find, depending on the day and time.The place is small and can be tricky to find a table when packed. Excellent for takeout as you order just inside the door. I am not a fan of salsa so I did not try it. I did notice they have their salsa for sale in glass jars,

Papalote Super CarneAsada burrito definitely hit the spot and the taste buds. I like how their Carne Asada is grilled fresh and not chopped into little ity-bitty pieces. They grill the tortillas causing the outside to have a nice crunch. I like their rice and how cheesy the burrito was, the Pinto beans seemed standard. The Burrito price was high (@ $9.97 with chips and tax) especially compared to other establishments. The size was not what I consider a super burrito and was on the small side comparatively. However the burrito was fresh, tasty, and great!

excerpts: 5 stars for grilled veggies in my shrimp burrito and the charbroiled taste of the carne asada
carne asada.author: Jennifer H.
carne asada.review:
5 stars for grilled veggies in my shrimp burrito and the charbroiled taste of the carne asada

-1 star for store bought chips

-1 star for powder made horchata

-1 star for unhappy, low energy staff who shrug their shoulders when you ask about your order 30 min. after you place it or reply 'i guess' when you ask for a cup of ice to go with your $3 soda

-1 for yelling 'HEY HEY HEY' when we stepped right outside the door with your plastic cup of ice b/c it was too darn hot to wait inside

+1 for the sauce you provide with the chips

2 stars, but I'll happily spend my $8 at a taqueria with the same quality of food, but less attitude.

excerpts: Carne asada?
carne asada.author: Chuck N.
carne asada.review:
Wednesday, 8:45PM.

To enter Mission's Mexican food market, folks best be bringing their A-game or find some way to distinguish themselves from the competition. 

Papalote does both and is establishing a spicy niche in the area. 

Stuffed our faces in:
1. Soyrizo
     +Spicy, chunky soy pieces won over this omnivore
2. Mole, tofu taco
     +Cocoa pepper and chili concoction goes great with the hard shell
3. Triple threat
     +Chicken? Carne asada? Shrimp? Dig the combo man!
     - Only four prawns? Put a little more than that, c'mon now!
4. Salsa
     +Spicy kick without overwhelming the rest of the mix
     - Staff is stingy with this goodness

And then...?
The Triple Threat wasn't enough for my raging hunger, which is a testament to me being a PHATTTTY. Still paying a return visit though, I've got the seafood burritos and nachos to try!

excerpts: I ended up having a carne asada burrito.
It was good, but definitely not the best I've ever had.
It just lacked a lot of flavor and authenticity, in my opinion.
I thought it was just okay (aside from the salsa, the salsa was excellent).
It gets pretty crowded here, since the place is so small.
Its cute though and they play good music
, so I guess thats a plus.
I'll come back again soon and if I have a better experience I'll update my review, but other than that
, I think I'll stick to the hole in the wall burrito spots that are better priced and have tastier food.
carne asada.author: Cat M.
carne asada.review: My roommate brought me here after ranting and raving about it for a while and after all that hype I was a little disappointed. I ended up having a carne asada burrito.  It was good, but definitely not the best I've ever had. It just lacked a lot of flavor and authenticity, in my opinion. I thought it was just okay (aside from the salsa, the salsa was excellent).  It gets pretty crowded here, since the place is so small. Its cute though and they play good music, so I guess thats a plus. I'll come back again soon and if I have a better experience I'll update my review, but other than that, I think I'll stick to the hole in the wall burrito spots that are better priced and have tastier food.

excerpts: Best Carne Asada in the Mission.
carne asada.author: Quags M.
carne asada.review:
Best Carne Asada in the Mission.  You basically get a steak in your burrito.  Amazing salsa.  Really high quality, fresh ingredients.

I think just loses out to Pancho Villa for best burrito in the Mission, but it's really close.  You can't go wrong here.

excerpts: You can have your carne asada, chicken, and whatever other type of burrito.
carne asada.author: Rohan D.
carne asada.review:
Two things to note: This place has DELICIOUS fish burritos and phone in because the wait can be super long. 

Papalote is great high quality mexican food.  You can have your carne asada, chicken, and whatever other type of burrito. I love my fish burritos. And this place has them. They have the most delicious fish burritos I've had in a while, this is the place. Other places in the mission won't serve fish. 

While I myself love this place for the fish burritos, they have a wide selection of other delicious goods. The chips and salsa are pretty good.

Beware the wait. You can wait anywhere from 5 minutes to 45 minutes (dead serious, 45 minutes for a burrito is not acceptable) but I assumed that was a strange night.

excerpts: My brother got the carne asada burrito, and the meat was thick, tender, well-seasoned, and ABUNDANT.
I love a restaurant that can bowl over its customers with its portions and flavor.
(Note:
carne asada.author: Lucia C.
carne asada.review:
If anyone in Mission heard a loud asian girl squawking "I'm SO FULL!" yesterday afternoon, that was me.  And I apologize for any disturbance/annoyance I might have caused you on your peaceful Saturday. 

I was drunk off of mole.

My brother and I went, but didn't get the famed 20 dollar burrito. I was afraid a burrito that costs that much would never live up to expectations, although it is supposed to feed two.

We opted instead to get different things, so we could taste more of what Pa Pa Lo Te has to offer, and it definitely didn't disappoint.

My brother got the carne asada burrito, and the meat was thick, tender, well-seasoned, and ABUNDANT. I love a restaurant that can bowl over its customers with its portions and flavor. (Note: I think my family's stomachs are smaller when it comes to some things, so what I think is a huge portion may be normal for others.)

I got the chicken mole quesadilla, and I loved the flour tortilla. It was light and crisp, with an almost translucent, shiny quality. I don't know how, but it managed to contain the mass of mole and chicken that was inside. The meat was steeped in gooey goodness and kept me well-satisfied for the rest of the day.

The roasted tomato salsa actually didn't do much for me. The heat was nice, but otherwise all I tasted was salt and a bit of garlic. Guacamole was good, but nothing supreme.  Fresh tomato salsa had a bit of jicama in it, i think, which was a very thoughtful, refreshing touch - cooled off my mouth nicely. It was fun to get the Mexican bottled Coke, which does taste different from the American stuff.

Service was quick, polite and friendly.  The staff kept the small dining area clean and tidy.

All in all a delicious experience, though since I don't live in the area, I'll probably be trying out all of the surrounding taquerias. 

Suggestions, anyone?

excerpts: I've had the carne asada super tacos, carne asada super burrito and the nachos.
All great.
Orchata isn't half bad--
I've had it on multiple occassions.
The water melon drink is a little watery
so I wouldn't recommend that.
The salsa is probably the best thing here.
Do yourself a favor and just purchase a jar of salsa.
The first time it's 6 bucks but bring back the jar
and it'll be 5 bucks :)
carne asada.author: Karen N.
carne asada.review:
AWESOME food.  I've had the carne asada super tacos, carne asada super burrito and the nachos.  All great.  Orchata isn't half bad--I've had it on multiple occassions.  The water melon drink is a little watery so I wouldn't recommend that.  The salsa is probably the best thing here.  Do yourself a favor and just purchase a jar of salsa.  The first time it's 6 bucks but bring back the jar and it'll be 5 bucks :)  Good to reuse.  

As for service, don't expect 5 star service with smile.  There's a lot of traffic in this little place so they work fast and do what they need to do.  The food is good so I don't mind the sass.  

Tip for those of you that like to order to go, please call ahead and plan to get there in 15 minutes otherwise you'll be waiting FOREVER.

excerpts: I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with black beans, guac, salsa - the works.
carne asada.author: Thu V.
carne asada.review:
3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up for this baby because it was still quite tasty.  After spending 3 days in San Fran and hearing about how Cali's mexican was SO much better than anything you can find in the east coast, I was craving a burrito BIG TIME.  Specifically, one from the mission.  We were recommended to come here to Papalote Mexican Grill.  

I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with black beans, guac, salsa - the works.  We sat down in the dining area and they came out with chips and salsa for each of us.  The salsa was awesome and hot hot HOT - I started getting really excited about this burrito.  It came out, nicely on a plate.  I picked it up and sunk my teeth in for my first bite.  GOO-OOOD = 4 stars, but where are rest of the rice & beans, guac, sour cream?  I only got to taste some meat, lettuce, and a little rice, beans..  I soon found out where they were.. all at the bottom-end of my burrito, thus giving me a soggy bottom and tearing my burrito apart at the end :(  That's why I took half a star away, for my soggy bottom.  Rather than that, it was a solid tasting burrito!

I asked my brother (local in SF) what he thought.  He said that he prefers the burritos that you get from the trucks in the mission better, but this place was good.  All in all, I was happy with this burrito, but as the best I've had?  I can't honestly give you that.  I'm sure there are better burrito places in SF, I just haven't had time to take a whirl-wind tour of burritos in SF.. next time...

excerpts: Pork is a staple of mine, so I switched to the carne asada burrito.
carne asada.author: Mike H.
carne asada.review:
On our weekend in the city, my friend Tron said we had to eat here. He said it was on the food network, I was in.

We waited 30 min for it to open, and to my surprise they did not serve Carnitas! Pork is a staple of mine, so I switched to the carne asada burrito.

The food was delicious, but what I really liked about the place was that you could get the 99 cent upgrade which loads the burrito with Guac, sour cream, and cheese. I have paid over two dollars for avocado at other places before.

The orange salsa was the other wild card - it was unique with a lot of different levels of flavors. Other early birds there were coming in just to buy orders of the salsa - check it out!

excerpts: My girlfriend had a carne asada and grilled shrimp burrito which she devoured (all 100 pounds of her).
carne asada.author: erica c.
carne asada.review:
First off, let me just say that the "salsa," or whatever their creamy hot sauce is called, was AMAZING.  It was spicy, creamy and loaded with flavor.  I damn near ate my whole basket of chips to get to the last drop of that sauce.  :-)

Second, while I DO eat meat, I was a vegetarian for 10 years.  That inspired me to try the soyrizo burrito (with cheese and grilled mushrooms).  I have one word for you..  DAMN.  That was THE best non-meat burrito I've ever had and I love Pancho Villa's tofu.

My girlfriend had a carne asada and grilled shrimp burrito which she devoured (all 100 pounds of her).  Needless to say, she enjoyed hers, too.

We met the owner, Miguel,  who also gave us a sample of his chicken adobo (over rice), which is a burrito meat option (and quite popular, I hear).  While I thought that to be somehow wrong, I have to admit that the adobo was absolutely delicious.   It was SO tender.

The eating area is small but the tables do clear quickly.  And while their prices may be on the high side, I'm definitely one who believes in getting what you pay for... and we certainly did.

Miguel, thank you for your hospitality.  You'll definitely be seeing me again.

P.S.  My 9-year old son proclaims Papalote to be his favorite  - and he's eaten a quite a few burritos, living in South City.  :-)

excerpts: I've only had the carne asada burrito here
and it's really good too.
I'm sure anything else is good too
and if it's not just pour !
SALSA!
carne asada.author: Wes K.
carne asada.review:
!SALSA! Yep, it's so good, it's incased in exclamation points! I've only had the carne asada burrito here and it's really good too. I'm sure anything else is good too and if it's not just pour !SALSA! all over it.

I bought a jar of their !SALSA! and took it to a little gathering I went to. I should of bought two more jars. It was gone in about ten minutes. 

oh ya...

!SALSA!

excerpts: The carne asada was burnt.
Not just bits and pieces, but the whole slab they threw into it.
I could taste the residue from their grill, and every bite I took was crunchy from the meat.
On the other hand, I've never had a crunchy burrito?
It was very....
Different?
carne asada.author: Charmaine A.
carne asada.review:
3 stars for....

1. Their secret house sauce/salsa that was so delicious I probably would've drank it if no one was looking.

2. Extremely friendly service and putting up with customers that I would punch in the nose if they talked to me like that.

3. The extra sides of pico de gallo for the free nachos.

BUT... 

-2 stars for..

1. A horrific meal. =( The carne asada was burnt. Not just bits and pieces, but the whole slab they threw into it. I could taste the residue from their grill, and every bite I took was crunchy from the meat. On the other hand, I've never had a crunchy burrito? It was very.... Different? Good thing they stocked us up pretty well on the house sauce because I used that stuff to drown out the taste of the burnt meat.

Did not enjoy my food at all, but this place still deserves 3 stars. I'll probably give it another go, but maybe consider a vegetarian burrito next time?

3 stars, and maybe a follow up review. =)

excerpts: Carne asada and pork were yummy.
Would come back if we were eating in.
Wouldn't get take-out - though the burritos held well on the plane
Would order jars of that sauce to Brooklyn.
carne asada.author: Fede O.
carne asada.review: Service was pretty slow. Prices are oh-kay. But, as Oleg H. said, "DAT SAUCE!" 4 stars. Carne asada and pork were yummy. Would come back if we were eating in. Wouldn't get take-out - though the burritos held well on the plane :) Would order jars of that sauce to Brooklyn.

excerpts: Carne asada is great and the salsa goes perfect with it.
carne asada.author: Mark K.
carne asada.review:
A little pricey but the burrito is big enough to share with your girl.

Carne asada is great and the salsa goes perfect with it.  Pretty good burrito.  

Wish they gave more salsa and you didn't have to pay so much for so little.  Oh well, c'est la vie.

excerpts: Amazing carne asada, sooooo frickin good!
Wow!
Too bad they charge 55 cents for salsa, wtf?
carne asada.author: Chaz N.
carne asada.review:
Amazing carne asada, sooooo frickin good!  Wow!
Too bad they charge 55 cents for salsa, wtf?

excerpts: A massive MexAm masterpiece with carne asada steak, chicken and jumbo prawns.
carne asada.author: Francisco H S.
carne asada.review:
The wife and I went here after watching Throwdown With Bobby Flay. Delighted to find that it was a cute, cozy place and not at all pretentious. All food was moderately priced, but extraordinarily delicious. I had the triple threat burrito -- had to after the feature on TV. A massive MexAm masterpiece with carne asada steak, chicken and jumbo prawns. 

The best part is their secret Papalote salsa. It was all in the triple threat. But, I was surprised to see them selling it by the jar. YOU MUST BUY YOURSELF A JAR BEFORE LEAVING THIS PLACE. You will scoff at other salsas once you try it.

excerpts: I ordered the Prawn, chicken adobo, and carne asada burritos for my family.
Me and my family members all agreed they were dry - rice and meat..
The burritos were ok, but I've definitely had better, like Castillo's (civil center).
Disappointed and not worth the $8 - $10 for each burrito.
You can definitely do better elsewhere.
carne asada.author: Les Y.
carne asada.review:
I had to check out Papalote because I saw them on Bobby Flay's throwdown. I ordered the Prawn, chicken adobo, and carne asada burritos for my family. Me and my family members all agreed they were dry - rice and meat.. The burritos were ok, but I've definitely had better, like Castillo's (civil center). Disappointed and not worth the $8 - $10 for each burrito. You can definitely do better elsewhere. 
However, I will say the salsa was very  good.

Sorry Papalote. Overpriced and over-rated.

excerpts: Carne Asada Tacos & the Chips & Salsa!
The place is very clean and not too big
so it gets filled up during lunch hours pretty quick!
Their menu says  "fresh & healthy... and from scratch!
You can taste the cleanliness of their ingredients from your food.
Their bathroom is also very interesting!
carne asada.author: Yumi H.
carne asada.review: Carne Asada Tacos & the Chips & Salsa! The place is very clean and not too big so it gets filled up during lunch hours pretty quick! Their menu says  "fresh & healthy... and from scratch!" You can taste the cleanliness of their ingredients from your food. Their bathroom is also very interesting!

excerpts: Had a carne asada burrito there, and honestly it wasn't anything earth-shattering.
carne asada.author: Kyonne I.
carne asada.review:
Had a carne asada burrito there, and honestly it wasn't anything earth-shattering. In fact, I would go as far as to say that it was a little dry and the meat a little too chewy.

BUT what I will rave about is the red salsa. Its a must-try. I can see why they have literally bottled that stuff up to sell. ITS FANTASTIC. Spicy, savory and just the right amount of smokiness from the chilies. YUM. I'd come back just for a big serving of chips in salsa the next time I'm in the Mission.

excerpts: It was delicious, all of the meat was tender (pollo, carne asada, prawns), flavorful and perfectly seasoned - a definite highlight, and the black bleans, rice, cheese and guacamole were extremely complementary.
carne asada.author: Burrito M.
carne asada.review:
Dinner at Papalote for Cinco de Mayo.

We ordered the famous Triple Threat Burrito ($20!) and it did not disappoint.  It was delicious, all of the meat was tender (pollo, carne asada, prawns), flavorful and perfectly seasoned - a definite highlight, and the black bleans, rice, cheese and guacamole were extremely complementary.  I thought it was kind of expensive for a burrito, but this is a must try - at least once - especially since they whooped Booby Flay's ass at his own genre on Throwdown with this burrito.

We also ordered the chips and salsa - the salsa was REALLY good, very spicy, but the chips - meh, not so much.  I like my chips thick and bursting with roasted corn flavor,  these were thin and kinda pathetic, most were broken into small pieces by the time we got home with our meal.

By the way, one of the brother/owners was in the house while we were there and the guy really cares about customer service.  It was literally a madhouse inside and he was really diligent about keeping people calm and the line moving.

Tip: Order ahead on the phone and drop by for pickup, we ordered take out in the restaurant and ended up waiting 20-30 minutes before our food was ready.  Not sure if the crowd was due to Cinco d Mayo, or if it's normally like this.  In any case, they have a separate and shorter line for phone orders.

excerpts: I had a shrimp burrito and a carne asada quesadilla.
Everyone thought I was crazy, but I was so hungry that I devoured both of those items in the time everyone took to eat their burritos!
The salsa in the bag is delicious too.
Will recommend!
Next time, I'll have to get some horchata to wash it all down.
carne asada.author: Ralph N.
carne asada.review:
I was hanging out with a bunch of redditors in the Mission when I asked, "hey guys, what's a Mission-style burrito?"

Next minute, we're at Papalote. I had a shrimp burrito and a carne asada quesadilla. Everyone thought I was crazy, but I was so hungry that I devoured both of those items in the time everyone took to eat their burritos! The salsa in the bag is delicious too. Will recommend! Next time, I'll have to get some horchata to wash it all down.

excerpts: I was very eager to eat my Super carne asada burrito, unfortunately it tasted more vegetarian than anything when I only tasted about 4 pieces of carne asada.
They are not as generous as when they first opened, I guess now that they have the attention
it's different
carne asada.author: Doris V.
carne asada.review:
I was very eager to eat my Super carne asada burrito, unfortunately it tasted more vegetarian than anything when I only tasted about 4 pieces of carne asada.
They are not as generous as when they first opened, I guess now that they have the attention it's different

excerpts: So far  the carne asada tacos are decent.
But without the salsa, they are nothing.
carne asada.author: Monica L.
carne asada.review:
Five stars just for the salsa!  I just found out you can buy a jar for $5.95.  Why would I ever want to make salsa again?   It has the perfect combination and ratios of garlic, smoke, heat that makes my tongue tingle.  

However, I haven't found anything yet that I can't live without.  So far  the carne asada tacos are decent.  But without the salsa, they are nothing.

excerpts: I had the Carne Asada Burrito.
The meat was really good
but unfortunately it was the predominant flavor.
carne asada.author: Blake E.
carne asada.review: I had the Carne Asada Burrito. The meat was really good but unfortunately it was the predominant flavor. To me, it tasted like the grilled steak stuffed burrito from taco bell only with quality ingredients (which is good but boring). I much prefer La Taqueria for a much more balanced and flavorful burrito.

excerpts: The food took about 15 minutes to get to us and we ordered 2 burritos: Carne Asada and their Adobo burrito.
I would have loved to try the triple threat, but I wasn't prepared to shell out $20, so maybe next time.
The burritos were just like any other you can get at the next taqueria but their adobo burrito was very flavorful.
carne asada.author: Raymond L.
carne asada.review:
Date of Visit: 05/01/2010

Came here on a Saturday night around 9pm thinking it would be too crowded and hard to grab a seat but it was very easy to get a table because I guess many people just eat and go, so the turn around time is pretty quick.  
The food took about 15 minutes to get to us and we ordered 2 burritos: Carne Asada and their Adobo burrito.  I would have loved to try the triple threat, but I wasn't prepared to shell out $20, so maybe next time.  The burritos were just like any other you can get at the next taqueria but their adobo burrito was very flavorful.  I thought there would be more rice in it, but it was packed with flavorful meat.  

Aside from the burritos, I would definitely go back for that salsa.  I would give this place 3 stars, but that damn good ass salsa definitely bumps it up another star.  If there wasn't somebody sitting at the table next to us, I would have taken a shot of that salsa from that little silver cup they give it in.

excerpts: We tried the carne asada tacos ( 2 for $5.95) and Veggie grilled burrito ($6.50).
The carne asada tacos had huge cube chunks of marinated meat.
carne asada.author: Shirley W.
carne asada.review:
If you're expecting big chunks of tomatoes, onions and cilantro in their famous salsa, you'll be disappointed.  In essence, the salsa is made with roasted tomatoes and pureed into a smooth consistence but packed with flavor.  Their salsa is different but I personally like my chunks of tomatoes in my salsa. However their avocado dip ($2.75) was chunky and delish!

At Papalote, you have the option of making your burrito as healthy as you'd like.  From your choice of wheat, spinach and tomato tortillas to tofu and veggie options, a burrito does not have to be heavy and give you food coma!!  Once you order food, you'll be seated by one of the friendly workers.

The bathroom is kinda cool. Almost every inch of the wall space and the ceiling is covered in graffiti.  They've used graffiti as an art and it brings in a cool vibe.  

Parking is kinda hard especially in the Mission but if you bike to Papalote, you can park your bike at the bike racks in front and watch

We tried the carne asada tacos ( 2 for $5.95) and Veggie grilled burrito ($6.50).  The carne asada tacos had huge cube chunks of marinated meat. The veggie burrito was definitely not as great as the burritos from El Farolito.

excerpts: TWWICMT suggested that I try some black beans in my carne asada burrito with beans and cheese only (#2) and ya know what, it was a wonderful suggestion.
carne asada.author: Jason B.
carne asada.review:
This place is good. A friend of mine who lives in San Fran (Warren, who plays drums for Tussle and probably a bunch of other lame bands - just kidding!) took me (and The Woman Who I'm Currently Married To) to this joint. The burritos were pretty damn good. TWWICMT suggested that I try some black beans in my carne asada burrito with beans and cheese only (#2) and ya know what, it was a wonderful suggestion. I think Warren had a veggie burrito because he's one of "those kind." You know what I mean: they don't eat meat because Jesus told him not to via a text message while he was watching Goonies on DVD three years ago. It wasn't even the special edition, just the crappy pan and scan version!

I'm hitting this place up when I come back. You hear that Warren?

excerpts: he is torn between the Triple Threat and Carne Asada burrito!
Oh the choices...actually the choice was pretty easy...
haha...
considering we would never pay $20 for a burrito unless it was maybe stuffed with some top notch Kobe beef!
He settled for the super Carne Asada burrito
the Carne Asada burrito that my bf ate wasn't all that tasty.
carne asada.author: Michelle Y.
carne asada.review:
All day the bf and I have been messaging each other that we want to try this so called Best burrito in San Francisco...he is torn between the Triple Threat and Carne Asada burrito! Oh the choices...actually the choice was pretty easy...haha...considering we would never pay $20 for a burrito unless it was maybe stuffed with some top notch Kobe beef! :P

He settled for the super Carne Asada burrito and I had the Chicken Adobo burrito with whole black beans. So it takes me a while to actually start eating I like to cut my burrito in half...make sure I have a drink beside me...utensils too! I'm about to take a bite of of my burrito and realize that the bf has mine...he's already 3 bites into it! How rude! So we do the switch and I can tell his eyes are focused on mine now! Let's just say the Chicken was so moist and so flavorful! It was delicious just wish it was a little bigger...too bad the Carne Asada burrito that my bf ate wasn't all that tasty. 

I really wanted to try their Triple Threat but was not going to shell out the money for it. :( bummer!

excerpts: I was completely stuffed after eating the 2 overly stuffed carne asada tacos loaded with sour cream, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado.
The salsa was just hot enough and had a great creamy texture.
yum.
carne asada.author: Jackie L.
carne asada.review:
You only get 2 tacos? That was my question to my friend upon arrival. 
As a petite girl - I do love Mexican food..and quantity is important. 

I was completely stuffed after eating the 2 overly stuffed carne asada tacos loaded with sour cream, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado. The salsa was just hot enough and had a great creamy texture. yum.

excerpts: I'd been avoiding coming here because I thought it seemed too "trendy," but my carne asada burrito was pretty good.
I didn't like it as much as El Toro
, it was a little blander than most burritos.
Super crowded and a small space, not always the best!
carne asada.author: Julia D.
carne asada.review: I'd been avoiding coming here because I thought it seemed too "trendy," but my carne asada burrito was pretty good.  I didn't like it as much as El Toro, it was a little blander than most burritos.  Super crowded and a small space, not always the best!

excerpts: the carne asada in my burrito was dryer than the arizona desert.
carne asada.author: Bee B.
carne asada.review:
this place is an absolute FAIL.

i've tried this place before because of all the hype. the carne asada in my burrito was dryer than the arizona desert. i had sworn off this place forever because not every place this is buzzworthy is actually worthy.

then came the adobo burrito. interesting because i love filipino food and it has really come up in san francisco. so about a year later, we return to this establishment, to find it as usual--crowded--with a small makeover.

so i grab a table because we had intentions of eating there while my boyfriend ordered the burrito. shortly after, i was approached by one of the employees that works there. this is how the conversation unravels:

employee: did u order food?
me: not yet, he is still in line.
employee: are u sure?
me(with a confused look on my face): he is in line!

so she walks away only to return and tell me that the single man standing over there had a number already so he was ntitled to the table I was sitting at. (people and their entitlements. i thought it was first come, first serve.)

as i look over to see where my boyfriend is in line, he is about 4 people away from ordering. (is taking an order really that serious? he was in line for about 15 minutes.)

so after telling her that we had intentions of ordering food and i wasnt just sitting in here waiting for a bus, i decided to throw a wrench in the conversation. i asked her, "is it because he is white and i am Latina?
keeping in mind that i had never heard of such a policy unless it pertained to a standby seat on a plane or bus.
both times her response to the same question was, "Yes."

so I got up and went to line to tell me boyfriend. as she approached he asked her again about this store policy and I asked her my entitlement question again, this time in Spanish.
and sure enough, her answer was "yes."

while im not completely naive to think racism doesnt exist anymore, i am also not accustomed to hearing that people of one race have a priority over another in a restaurant, at least not in san francisco.
while she was probably a messenger for the coward that didnt want to fight his own battle, i think she made a huge mistake in getting involved.

usually when i go to a taqueria, one or two people stand in line while the rest of the people grab a table. whats the point of congesting an area when u dont need to? and a persons money that just bought something is just as valuable  as the person who will be buying something, maybe even more, because the person in line still has the opportunity of walking out and not spending money there. 

the food is crap and the service is tacky. stop pretending to be something you arent. the people at el farolito, cancun, el buen sabor, and la cumbre know how to treat their customers, while also making better tasting food.

excerpts: I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
carne asada.author: Mark Y.
carne asada.review:
When I want a real gourmet sit down burrito in a colorful place with Mexican bug kites on the ceiling, I'll put up with circling around a few times in the Mission to find parking when I come here. I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
 
The fresh and not too salty chipotle salsa, whole wheat tortilla options and ginger soft drinks are also a nice touch.

My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.

excerpts: What really makes the quesadilla is the meat of choice (I get carne asada) and their special salsa.
The carne asada is cooked just right!
Not chewy or tough, but juicy and tender.
Plus, the amount they put in their quesadilla is good for the portion.
Not too much (but would I really complain??)
Tasting it alone I couldn't really pinpoint anything special about it, but I love how it tastes with my carne asada.
I didn't actually enjoy eating it with the chips.
It was too substantial for the chips, which were thin and kind of papery.
carne asada.author: Donna K.
carne asada.review:
I am only speaking from the quesadilla perspective... and yea their super quesadillas are very very delish. What really makes the quesadilla is the meat of choice (I get carne asada) and their special salsa.

The carne asada is cooked just right! Not chewy or tough, but juicy and tender. Plus, the amount they put in their quesadilla is good for the portion. Not too much (but would I really complain??) or too little.

I loved how the quesadilla wasn't too cheesy and the outside was nice and crisp. I like to load mine up with guacamole, sour cream, and salsa for every bite. I don't know how you can eat it any other way! The guacamole makes the meat not too smokey, the sour cream gives it a little tang, and the salsa brings out the juiciness of the meat.

That's right... the salsa is yummy! I just wish it had more of a kick or was spicy in some way. Tasting it alone I couldn't really pinpoint anything special about it, but I love how it tastes with my carne asada. I didn't actually enjoy eating it with the chips. It was too substantial for the chips, which were thin and kind of papery. Not a fan.

What I am really interested in... is their veggie options! I will drop in again and try something. It's just going to be difficult because once I find something good, I can't help ordering it. It's a good thing I work in this neighborhood....

excerpts: Don't get carne asada with no rice.
carne asada.author: L B.
carne asada.review:
Their veggie burritos are good, but...

1. Don't get carne asada with no rice. It's 89% black beans, 10% steak, and 1% salsa.  Bleh.

2. The "Mkt Price" for a side of guac was $3.25 for about two tablespoons. That's insane.

excerpts:
carne asada burrito 
2. fish taco. 

fish taco- plain, but the fish was marinated well.
chips and salsa- chips were the thick kind, and salsa was liquidy, quite tasty, but left me craving the usual fresh, chunky salsa 
im used to.
price- higher than others. 
~7.15 burrito, $6.75 fish taco.
carne asada.author: Lina C.
carne asada.review:
BIG price, SMALL burrito. not as good as expected, based on the 100s of reviews. we ordered: 

1. carne asada burrito 
2. fish taco. 

burrito- wrap to stuffing ratio was off- too much wrap. mid-sized burrito, not the juicy fat type with thin skin.
fish taco- plain, but the fish was marinated well.
chips and salsa- chips were the thick kind, and salsa was liquidy, quite tasty, but left me craving the usual fresh, chunky salsa im used to.
price- higher than others. ~7.15 burrito, $6.75 fish taco.

this place is above average, but i enjoy El Farolito much more, or El Gruyense in Redwood City

excerpts: We tried the chicken burrito and the carne asada burrito.
It's really...
Meh - not bad but very average burrito.
Definitely not a $9, 10 burrito though.
Nothing compared to SoCal burritos.
Second, the orange sauce - pretty good.
It's different
, it's spicy, and it's tiny.
You only get one little cup of sauce for your your burrito and your chips.
It costs you extra if you want more.
Speaking of chips - not that great, had better.
Third, the wait - probably got more popular after the tv show.
but this place is pretty small, hence the wait is definitely long.
I highly recommend trying other taquirias - esp if the wait is long.
This place is over-rated.
carne asada.author: MissJ J.
carne asada.review:
Really can't figure out why this place is highly rated.
First, let's start with the food. We tried the chicken burrito and the carne asada burrito. It's really...Meh - not bad but very average burrito.  Definitely not a $9, 10 burrito though. Nothing compared to SoCal burritos.   
Second, the orange sauce - pretty good. It's different, it's spicy, and it's tiny. You only get one little cup of sauce for your your burrito and your chips. It costs you extra if you want more. Speaking of chips - not that great, had better.  
Third, the wait - probably got more popular after the tv show. but this place is pretty small, hence the wait is definitely long. I highly recommend trying other taquirias - esp if the wait is long. 
This place is over-rated.

excerpts: I was going to get the carne asada, just because I can roll my 'R' like nobody's business, but decided to go on the healthy's side.
It was not disappointing
let me tell
u.
Get the super burrito.
Or the fact I can say "I would like one caRne asada, please.
carne asada.author: Perry S.
carne asada.review:
Papalote is the perfect joint for the hungry. The burrito is humongous! I got the marinated tofu burrito and it lasted for 2 days! It was good cold too ;). 

I was going to get the carne asada, just because I can roll my 'R' like nobody's business, but decided to go on the healthy's side. It was not disappointing let me tell u. Get the super burrito. It's worth it. 

They give u the chips and salsa for appetizer. The salsa was hot!! Really hot. Me likie long time ;).

The place a bit on the small size but it wasn't busy when I was there. Next time I'm totally gonna try the soyrizo. Oh, did I tell u the burrito is huuuge?! Or the fact I can say "I would like one caRne asada, please."

excerpts: The Carne Asada, Chile Verde, and Pollo were all very tasty.
Put a dollop of the salsa and you'll be in purgatory.
carne asada.author: Hebert J.
carne asada.review:
They definitely lived up with the hype of Awesome Burrito and Salsa. It's no wonder this place is always crowded. Don't be fooled by the lack of Latino customers in the resto, because they will still please your craving. 

Burrito - The Carne Asada, Chile Verde, and Pollo were all very tasty. Put a dollop of the salsa and you'll be in purgatory. I love it! 

Shrimp Taco - the shrimp were not fresh and this taco creation with bell peppers just didn't please my palate at all. (the only turn off)

Salsa - You can taste the freshness of the roasted tomatoes and the spiciness of the pepper. It has a great kick. The only salsa that can top this is La Vics in San Jose. I love it! 

Chicken Adobo meat - one of the staff gave me a small sample taste of their secret choice of meat. It tasted more like Paksiw to my Filipino tongue than Adobo. It's still pretty tasty but I'd rather have white rice with it. 

Price - It's more expensive than other taquerias in the Mission but it's worth it. (They need to be more generous on their salsa!) 

Staff - The owners were mingling with the people in line and all the staff members were genuinely nice!

excerpts: I personally love their Carne Asada and Chile Verde Burritos.
They are very flavorful, and not heavy at all:
A combination in a burrito that you would think would cause a paradox that would unravel space-time.
However, it all works to me, and it doesn't feel I ate a truck when I leave.
carne asada.author: Satoru Y.
carne asada.review:
A white-washed tacqueria owned and run by Mexicans; go figure...it's still great.

If other taquerias in the city, like El Castillito, were home-slobs sporting a greasy wife-beater, then Papalote would be their alluring and demure cousin.  I remember the first time I stumbled upon this modern-looking, hipster tacqueria on a night roaming the Outer Mission.  Hipster places springing up in the Mission is akin to pissing on gremlins: I guess only children of the 80's may get this reference.  I was mildly surprised by the interesting 'Mexicant' menu, including healthy options like soyrizo and vegan mole. I was even more surprised after having a burrito there, that I not only liked it...I loved it.

Myself, being a carnivore, love all of the meaty servings that they have to offer.  I personally love their Carne Asada and Chile Verde Burritos.  They are very flavorful, and not heavy at all: A combination in a burrito that you would think would cause a paradox that would unravel space-time.  However, it all works to me, and it doesn't feel I ate a truck when I leave.  Also, their Salsa is deserving of all the accolodates that it receives.

Delicious and health-conscious food, reminds me of what I miss about the city the most.

excerpts: First we tried to get to some spot that supposedly features bomb ass carne asada burritos, but alas, they are only open for lunch.
carne asada.author: Karen T.
carne asada.review:
I hail from a city which borders East Los Angeles.  What does this mean?  It means I eat a shitload of Mexican food.  I like all of it, including the somewhat more obscure fare like menudo and lengua (tongue).  My best friend who is Mexican won't even eat lengua.  She claims I am browner than she is (I am yellow).

On a recent weekend jaunt to the bay area, the aforementioned friend and her bf asked me what I wanted for dinner Saturday night.  After a couple days of light meals, I was ready for something that would leave me full for the rest of the week.  Thus, I suggested Mexican food.  First we tried to get to some spot that supposedly features bomb ass carne asada burritos, but alas, they are only open for lunch.  So we traipsed on over to Papalote, which they assured would be just as good.

Upon arriving, the place was way packed.  Albeit a small space, that shit was pretty ridiculous.  The way it works is, you order at the counter.  As my friends and I were dining in, we proceeded to wait in the doorway, watching like hawks at people who are taking their sweet ass time eating, finally scrambling when a couple leave only to sit down at their dirty table.  Btw, it took us roughly 30 minutes after ordering to get a table.  And apparently, if you're dining in and aren't seated, they won't bring out your food (which means it was probably ready a while ago and is now getting cold).  However, this is hearsay, and as Lavar Burton would say, "you don't have to take my word for it".

Wow, I haven't even reviewed the food yet.  It's subpar and the best way to describe it is glorified Baja Fresh.  I'll even say that BF is tastier, and without the gaggle of hipsters and long ass wait.  I had shrimp marinated in butter and something else tacos and a side of rice.  The shrimp was so disappointing, lacking flavor and spice.  The side of rice could feed four people.  Too bad it was super dry and needed a load of lime and salsa to punch it up. 

I'll agree with everyone else that the salsa was good, but that was the only thing remotely noteworthy.

excerpts: The serving was very meager: barely any carne asada.
And what's with the no guacamole and sour cream?
$7.75 Nachos would give me ALL the fixins at another taqueria
AND it would taste better.
carne asada.author: Geralyn Y.
carne asada.review:
Wow. I guess I've got it kinda off compared to the majority of reviews, but when I want taqueria food, I want the flavorful, tasty, heavy, good stuff. If you want a healthy quality burrito then go to a tex-mex place like Rubios.

First off, they don't have AC! Which restaurant would do that in the mission? Their service is okay. They kept skipping our table and giving comp chips and salsa to people who walked in after us. When we finally got our order, they gave it to us in a to-go box when we ordered dine-in.  The serving was very meager: barely any carne asada. And what's with the no guacamole and sour cream? $7.75 Nachos would give me ALL the fixins at another taqueria AND it would taste better. Their water cups are TINY. 

Not impressed at all.

excerpts: Had the Carne Asada Super Burrito...and I would get it again!
carne asada.author: Timothy G.
carne asada.review: Great burritos and lots of choices (salsa, tortilla, meat, etc.).  Haven't had good Mexican food for quite a while since I just relocated back to the US, but Papalote is a must!  Had the Carne Asada Super Burrito...and I would get it again!

excerpts: A Chile Verde burrito and a Carne Asada quesadilla.
The pork in the burrito was incredible!
carne asada.author: Gabriel R.
carne asada.review:
This is my first experience here and this is how it went:

Short wait in the cold. No problem though as it reminded me of home. Read the easy menu and went for it. A Chile Verde burrito and a Carne Asada quesadilla. The pork in the burrito was incredible! Seriously, not like shredded chicken at other places in town, but big tasty moist pieces that were fantastic for a $5 meal. The steak in the quesadilla (a little on the small side) was done extremely well. Typically, strips of steak tend to get overcooked and tough but these folks did it right with every piece. 

The salsa that was brought to the table was different. Incredibly tasty and just enough spice. I had never had anything like it and would buy the stuff by the jar...better yet, by the case! 

Can't wait to go back again.

excerpts: I guess its normal for SF carne asada burritos to not come with guacamole, but where i come from, that is an integral part of the burrito!
To get a carne asada burrito with guacamole will cost you near 8 bucks... for that i would rather buy 15 frozen burritos at Lucky's, they're almost as good!
carne asada.author: John B R.
carne asada.review:
P-lote is a good burrito, but by no means is it great.  For SF, this is definitely one of the top three burritos i have had (i made the two burritos that were better), but it is in no way worth the money you will spend on it.  I guess its normal for SF carne asada burritos to not come with guacamole, but where i come from, that is an integral part of the burrito!  To get a carne asada burrito with guacamole will cost you near 8 bucks... for that i would rather buy 15 frozen burritos at Lucky's, they're almost as good! P-lote does have very good salsa, congrats...

"Son of a bitch Riggs!"
Danny Glover

excerpts: The carne asada is bland and tough.
carne asada.author: Liz P.
carne asada.review:
Everyone raves about the salsa and rightfully so.  Others bitch that  if you want extra, you pay extra.  Please, it's fifty cents more and worth every penny.  Unlike any other salsa I've tasted.  Hotness varies each visit.

I find the food hit or miss.  The carne asada is bland and tough.  Shrimp tacos are the same.  Tortillas are the stiff, packaged variety.

The chile verde is delicious and now my favorite item on the menu.  I've tasted the fish tacos and not a fishy taste or smell about them.  A friend gives raves to the veggie burrito.  The chilaquiles are divine.

Papalote is located in what I call N'mission -- on the edge of Noe and the Mission.  If you're not into kids, then beware of the Noe Stroller Set.  They can overtake the place with often times not so well-behaved children.  Or clueless parents.  And why oh why can't they leave their strollers on the sidewalk?  The place is tiny enough.

Only a few tables in the joint, so you usually have to hover over diners like a vulture and swoop in as soon as one is free.

excerpts: It's spicy and delightful, and whether you're putting it on chips, a veggie burrito, fish tacos, or carne asada, it's the bomb.
carne asada.author: Lisa F.
carne asada.review:
Who your papa? 

Say what? 

Who your papa?

PAPALOTE!!!! 

No, I wasn't a cheerleader in my past (or current life), but if eating at Paplote's somehow came down to cheerleading for a burrito, I would do it. Somehow I don't think one will ever have to don short skirts to eat here, but just for the record, I would. In a heartbeat. But anyway...

This is my favorite spot in the Mission (SF, for that matter) for a burrito. When I have visitors seeking culinary delights I take 'em here. The veggie burrito, loaded with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots, is ama-to-the-zing. Add a little Paplote original spicy sauce, and you've got yourself a tastebud explosion! I love, love the sauce. It's spicy and delightful, and whether you're putting it on chips, a veggie burrito, fish tacos, or carne asada, it's the bomb. 

Don't be put off by the line or the small size of the restaurant. I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to place my order, and believe you me, it's worth it no matter how long you wait. A little insider advice: call ahead and place your order to go. They make call-in orders quick snap. Before you know it,  you'll be lickin your paws clean after scarfing that delicious Papalote's treat.

excerpts: My husband liked that his carne asada was freshly made and piping hot.
carne asada.author: angela n.
carne asada.review:
Yesterday our burritos were tightly wrapped and a bit thin.  So they were less messy to eat, but also less filling, than your average Mission burritos.  I also found Papalote's tortilla chips too hard, and the soyrizo's texture wasn't as meaty as Mariachi's.

But when it comes to flavor, Papalote might have the edge, for three reasons:
- the smokey red salsa, speckled with black chilis -- Its makes your heart skip a beat (from the joy as well as the spiciness).
- refried black beans. what's better than fried? refried!
- the brownish red soyrizo, which has an intense salty (almost bacony) flavor that I just lurrved.

My husband liked that his carne asada was freshly made and piping hot.  

Horchata was creamy and sweet.  I asked for no ice so as to get more horchata. Thumbs up.

excerpts: Al contrario, the genius of Papalote is that they keep it real with carne asada while infusing new flavors into the mix.
carne asada.author: David K.
carne asada.review:
When it comes to burritos, I can talk smack.  I used to live near "the mish" and ate burritos almost daily.

Papalote rocks the best combination of authentic Me-hee-can-o flava with the health food fresh-mex scene.  My burrito-loving friends are sometimes offended: "no self-respecting burrito place should have soy-rizo burritos".  Al contrario, the genius of Papalote is that they keep it real with carne asada while infusing new flavors into the mix.  And of course it's all from scratch!

Note that I'm not some vegetarian hippy-dude.  Still my burrito of choice: soyrizo, whole wheat tortilla, black beans, extra veggies.

If Mexico were alive today, this is how he'd be making burritos.

Always order an extra salsa or two.  Sure, they charge you $.50, but go half-sies with your amigos.  It's just that good.

I first learned about this place from a girl I met on a bus.  You first learned about this place from me.  Play it on the playa, player!

excerpts: I had the carne asada burrito and my wife had the Chile Verde (pork).
Excellent burrito, great size, perfect makeup of ingredients.
I preferred my wife's to mine but both were of the highest order.
Their salsa is so good I would eat it on a shoe.
carne asada.author: Ross H.
carne asada.review: Seen it on TV and was hyped about going here (even walked 4 miles to get there) and it didn't disappoint. I had the carne asada burrito and my wife had the Chile Verde (pork). Excellent burrito, great size, perfect makeup of ingredients. I preferred my wife's to mine but both were of the highest order. Their salsa is so good I would eat it on a shoe.

excerpts: I enjoy the carne asada burrito with refried black beans...
carne asada.author: David L.
carne asada.review:
Bottled Coke? Check
Delicious and unique salsa? Check
Guacamole that can save a marriage? Check
Cool decor and cooler plates? Check

Did I mention Bottled Coke?????!

Oh yeah and this place makes mexican food! 

I cannot say enough about this place. I tell all my friends about it who think that mexican food has to be dingy and greasy. This place makes mexican food healthy (ish) with premium ingredients. 

I enjoy the carne asada burrito with refried black beans...

excerpts: There is a sharp, burning line dividing the standard and super carne asada burritos served here - the former tastes like a mouthful of vinegar served on bald cats, the latter has a brilliant balance of flavours and textures (mainly due to the slices of avocado).
Neither is particularly firm, so be prepared for some sloppiness.
carne asada.author: Glen M.
carne asada.review:
There is a sharp, burning line dividing the standard and super carne asada burritos served here - the former tastes like a mouthful of vinegar served on bald cats, the latter has a brilliant balance of flavours and textures (mainly due to the slices of avocado). Neither is particularly firm, so be prepared for some sloppiness. Service can be a little slower than other places, but it's usually worth the wait.

Update: After having been here on and off over the past year, I've come to the realization that Papalote burritos get repetitive, very quickly - they have a very distinctive flavor, so if you have a burrito craving, it can't be sated by a Papalote burrito (and consequently, a Papalote Burrito craving can't be resolved by eating a normal burrito). Downgrading from four stars.

excerpts: Loved the carne asada tacos.
carne asada.author: Sara G.
carne asada.review: Recommended by two people in the span of 2 days so I had to check it out while in town.   Loved the carne asada tacos.   The steak was cooked just perfect.   Very fresh tasty and good portion size.   As plenty of other reviewers mentioned the salsa is fantastic.  Will be back.
