excerpts: They are best filled with carne asada, though less tasty vegetable and fake meat options are available.
carne asada.author: Mike H.
carne asada.review:
As a Mission local and burrito snob, I was originally skeptical of Papalote's brightly-painted interiors and vanity windows, not to mention its location just west of the Valencia gentrification line.  However, the quality of the food has eventually won me over, and though it may not be as rich in primal satisfaction as a Farolito carnage asada super burrito, it provides a slightly healthier and tasty alternative, perhaps more suitable to frequent consumption.    

The high point of their fare is surely the salsa, probably the best complimentary sauce in the city, doled out in conservative portions along with fairly fresh tortilla chips.  Their burritos are smallish and lean, but ultimately a tasty combination of fresh, lard-less ingredients.  They are best filled with carne asada, though less tasty vegetable and fake meat options are available.  Their tacos, perhaps reflecting their proximity to Noe Valley, lack the guts of their greasier contemporaries on Mission street, and are filled with lettuce, of all things.

I've found the employees to be uniformly rude, and their attitude does not seem to improve with frequent patronage, friendliness or tipping, but given that it takes about 30 seconds of interaction to procure my food, I'm inclined to not care.

excerpts: i will say, 7x7 never lets me down, and they claim that the carne asada burrito here is one of the best.
maybe i'll come back for the salsa and give papalote's another chance and try the carne asada burrito.
carne asada.author: Sharon T.
carne asada.review:
ummm, i'm gonna throw it out there. the burrito was seriously one of the worst burritos i've ever had. and i've eaten a lot of them!  i had the veggie burrito and the hubby had the shrimp burrito.  it lacked flavor and it was dry! the rice and beans were a bit crunchy. i mean c'mon....crunchy? dry? that's definitely how you f-up a burrito.

the only thing they have going for them is their sauces.  the salsa is super yummy and i can drink that stuff.  2 stars for the sauce....

i will say, 7x7 never lets me down, and they claim that the carne asada burrito here is one of the best. maybe i'll come back for the salsa and give papalote's another chance and try the carne asada burrito.

maybe it was an off day? either way, for now... thumbs down.

excerpts: I usually get the carne asada here.
carne asada.author: chad n.
carne asada.review:
Papalote's could have the best salsa ever.  But they only give you one thing for free, then you must buy more (like my crack dealer).

Don't compare this to every other burrito and taco joint in the mission.  It's a slightly nicer version, a few more bucks, cleaner inside, with fresher ingredients, smaller portions, and they bring the food to your table.  

Tacos fall apart too easily, i recommend the burro's or a plate.  
I usually get the carne asada here.

excerpts: Apparently the shrimp quesadillas are amazing (none for me, thank you!) and the carne asada was drool-worthy.
I had no idea
this place was so famous, and I'm glad I didn't, because I was able to relish my meal without the hype leering around the corner.
The 2nd grade class' architectural drawings decorating the walls like gallery art were also a highlight.
AND they have Dos Equis on tap.
carne asada.author: Arwen O.
carne asada.review:
The salsa is in fact fantastic (I thought of mole more than salsa) and almost worth the whole visit. Apparently the shrimp quesadillas are amazing (none for me, thank you!) and the carne asada was drool-worthy. I had no idea this place was so famous, and I'm glad I didn't, because I was able to relish my meal without the hype leering around the corner.

The 2nd grade class' architectural drawings decorating the walls like gallery art were also a highlight. AND they have Dos Equis on tap.

excerpts: I ordered a carne asada burrito.
carne asada.author: Eric M.
carne asada.review:
Their salsa is like straight crack!  I could eat five baskets of their chips and salsa and be perfectly content with my accomplishments for the day.

I ordered a carne asada burrito.  Very fresh ingredients, flavorful, and prepared in a fairly short amount of time.  

Has a local hangout / neighborhood feel to it.  Great for a casual lunch or dinner.

excerpts: The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin...
3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.
carne asada.author: Avery G.
carne asada.review:
After hearing so many good things from friends, colleagues and even sources like Chow Magazine, I was excited to give Papalote a shot when my co-workers decided to head there for lunch. Finally, I would have a chance to sample their "practically-orgasmic" salsa!

Papalote is a taqueria with partial table service. You order your food at the counter, grab a drink, pay your way, take a number and head over to a table in the side room and eagerly await the server with your taco, burrito, quesadilla or other standard taqueria fare... which is exactly what I did. 

The chips (still warm) and salsa were brought almost immediately - and for all intents and purposes, they were the highlight of the meal. The rich orange salsa was spicy, sweet and had a complexity of flavor not commonly found in the condiment. The texture was smooth with black flecks - possibly from black pepper or from the skin of roasted pumpkin or peppers (yep - the secret ingredient, I have been told, is pumpkin seeds). This salsa's only competition for #1 in San Francisco is by Orale Orale.

The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin... and though I didn't sample it, the meat certainly looked good: appropriately charred and tender.

The pork Chile Verde was also quite good, with distinct flavors of tomatillo, cilantro and citrus in the sauce. Unfortunately, this filling, when combined with refried beans, cheese, rice and guacamole and wrapped in a tortilla, didn't meld into that cheesy-goopy goodness that makes an excellent burrito. It was good, but not great. Certainly not on par with Victor's or Mexico au Parc - which just goes to show you: even if every component of a dish is excellent, sometimes it doesn't come together properly to make something amazing. This time, the components were better than the sum of its parts.

$8.89 for a super burrito, chips, salsa and a bottle of grapefruit soda. 3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.

excerpts: I was disappointed by the Carne asada.
It didn't have any seasoning on it and did not seem marinated.
It was dry and had a burnt taste.
carne asada.author: DTronics T.
carne asada.review: This place is okay. The burritos are large and filled. The salsa is a thick paste rather than a traditional salsa. The salsa has a smoky flavor but is not very spicy. I was disappointed by the Carne asada. It didn't have any seasoning on it and did not seem marinated. It was dry and had a burnt taste.

excerpts:
no carnitas, al pastor, etc.
took away 2 carne asada tacos here, $7 topped with guac.
and all the americanized toppings.
carne asada.author: Rob C.
carne asada.review:
2.5 like a fancy chipotle in taste.  quintessential sf.  look at the menu.  vegan soyrizo, marinated tofu, etc.  no carnitas, al pastor, etc.
took away 2 carne asada tacos here, $7 topped with guac. and all the americanized toppings.  steak cooked to order at least, otherwise not my style.  as a side note, the salsa with the chips was very nice and hearty.

excerpts: They used to have really good burritos but the last time I came here my carne asada was dry.
carne asada.author: Ruby O.
carne asada.review: They used to have really good burritos but the last time I came here my carne asada was dry. I'm a bit disappointed but their chips and salsa is still the same. Maybe it's a hit or a miss with this place. Oh well there's more burrito places around.

excerpts: The carne asada quesadilla
I had way really, really salty.
carne asada.author: dana l.
carne asada.review:
The food is ok. I mean, it averages out to OK, overall. The salsa, like everyone says, is fantastic. The carne asada quesadilla I had way really, really salty. And then, I wanted more tortilla chips to munch, and when they charge $1.00 for more chips, it doesn't include more salsa. 

Which brings me to the last point I'll make: this place is really expensive for what you get.

excerpts: The carne asada was really flavorful and I especially liked how they put the burrito on the grill so that it'd be toasty instead of the mushy tortilla you get at other taquerias that put their tortillas in that steam thingy.
carne asada.author: Norm U.
carne asada.review:
This morning I woke up and knew that if I did not consume a burrito before the end of the day, all would not be right with the world.  But where should I procure said burrito?  Do I go with the tried and true El Farolito deliciousness, or do I try something new and branch out?  Felt a bit adventurous today, so figured I'd try something new.  I heard about Papalote from my sister and she couldn't stop raving about it, so bring it on.

As the other reviewers have noted, their food is definitely more fresh than your standard taqueria fare.  Bonus points for feeling good about eating "healthy" while indulging in my burrito.  The carne asada was really flavorful and I especially liked how they put the burrito on the grill so that it'd be toasty instead of the mushy tortilla you get at other taquerias that put their tortillas in that steam thingy.  

Last, but definitely not least, their salsa is insane good.  I've always been partial to Zona Rosa's red sauce, but this salsa could possibly be my new favorite.  The only negative about this place is that they know how good their salsa is and ration it out.  They only give you a set amount of salsa, and if you want more, they may charge you $0.50.  Seriously?  Charging for what amounts to be a condiment?  But honestly, I thought about paying up...it's THAT good.

excerpts: I got a carne asada burrito plus a water...
11.00 bones.
This review is only for their carne asada burrito....
the meat was SUPER CHEWY and TOUGH!!!
At a place like this, that was the last thing I would expect.
I got a few laughs though..
a table next to me ordered a super threat burritto cut in half... they attempted to hold it
and it fell all over the place!
They had to eat the thing with a fork.
All in all, Papalote is not my kind of taqueria.
I will say that it does a great job in attracting customers.
carne asada.author: Demanding T.
carne asada.review: Well, I checked out this location. I told myself I would never come check out this location (parking and time dictated this decision).  trust me... this is the last nail on the coffin!    Their clientele is definately "unique"... I got a carne asada burrito plus a water... 11.00 bones.  This review is only for their carne asada burrito.... the meat was SUPER CHEWY and TOUGH!!!  At a place like this, that was the last thing I would expect.  I got a few laughs though.. a table next to me ordered a super threat burritto cut in half... they attempted to hold it and it fell all over the place!  They had to eat the thing with a fork.  All in all, Papalote is not my kind of taqueria.  I will say that it does a great job in attracting customers.

excerpts:
paplote -

i am huge fan of super burritos and i've gone all around the bay trying my share of carne asada super's.
carne asada.author: Shadi N.
carne asada.review:
i'm down like a clown with paplote -

i am huge fan of super burritos and i've gone all around the bay trying my share of carne asada super's. Papalote reached TOP on my list for the bay - but definitely not number one on my pallet.

Their meat is delicious and there's huge chunks, i almost wish they would chop them one more time to be more bite sized. Their super burrito was almost perfect - except that there wasn't any gauc ( or such a small amount that u couldnt even tell.
\
Salsa = awesome. - and adds a lot to the burrito - i was dipping the huge chunks of meat that were falling out in it - mmmmm

I will say however, that if El Farolito's burrito's were a little...a lot bigger, they'd give this place a run for their money.

excerpts: The carne asada is great- tender and tasty chunks of meat.
carne asada.author: Steph C.
carne asada.review: I think everything about this place has already been said. Stick with the burritos and you'll be in good shape. The carne asada is great- tender and tasty chunks of meat. But have to say that the chile verde left much to be desired. Atmosphere is nothing great- your typical mission hole. often hard to get a table- with a weird system of having to order first- so you don't actually know if you're going to get a table. The service is quick enough, but not friendly, etc. Still worth checking out!

excerpts: Good burritos - particularly the carne asada, shrimp and fish ones and great salsa and chips.
You can get a  burrito card and receive your 11th burrito free!
Staff is super friendly, ingredients are super fresh and location is super close to Bart.
Super!
carne asada.author: Kamael S.
carne asada.review: It saddens me greatly that I have moved further away from Papalote.   Good burritos - particularly the carne asada, shrimp and fish ones and great salsa and chips. You can get a  burrito card and receive your 11th burrito free!  Staff is super friendly, ingredients are super fresh and location is super close to Bart. Super!

excerpts: We get to the place and place our order and it comes out to 25$ for regular carne asada tacos,pollo quesadilla, and
carne asada nachos.
So far this is the most ive ever spent for a hole in the wall spot.
Ok, whatever right.
Its suppose to be amazing.
We end up waiting about 30-40 minutes because all these damn phone orders are coming in.
If we would have known we would have left.
Well its suppose to be great and great food sometimes takes time.
Get the food and go home.
Definitely fresh, but wheres the flavor?
ve had on the mission(never had a bad one yet), and the Carne Asada Nachos literally Suck besides the thick carne asada meat.
I prefer smaller cuts of the meat
but
oh well.
The nacho chips were less than spectacular and the salsa was bland and tasteless.
Now i lived in San Diego for 7 years.
And so far some mexican spots here in SF can come close.
But Papalote's fails in taste/price and service.
carne asada.author: Benjamin B.
carne asada.review: So all the hype from Yelp reviews to the Throwdown Challenge and the Tripple Threat burrito. I try not to drive too far from where i live over on Ocean Ave. I can just drive down to mission and hit up some very descent taco/burrito joints. Well the GF wanted to try this place, and i felt like some mexican food. We get to the place and place our order and it comes out to 25$ for regular carne asada tacos,pollo quesadilla, and carne asada nachos. So far this is the most ive ever spent for a hole in the wall spot. Ok, whatever right. Its suppose to be amazing. We end up waiting about 30-40 minutes because all these damn phone orders are coming in. If we would have known we would have left. Well its suppose to be great and great food sometimes takes time. Get the food and go home. Definitely fresh, but wheres the flavor? The Tacos are just "ok", the chicken quesadilla is the worst ive had on the mission(never had a bad one yet), and the Carne Asada Nachos literally Suck besides the thick carne asada meat. I prefer smaller cuts of the meat but oh well. The nacho chips were less than spectacular and the salsa was bland and tasteless. Now i lived in San Diego for 7 years. And so far some mexican spots here in SF can come close. But Papalote's fails in taste/price and service.

excerpts: I had a standard burrito with carne asada, nothing to write home about.
carne asada.author: Phuong T.
carne asada.review:
I gotta be honest: the first time I came here, I wasn't that impressed.  I had a standard burrito with carne asada, nothing to write home about.  

However, as a USF student, it's damn close to campus, so I made a second trip.  And I wasn't in the mood for anything too heavy this time around, so I had the eggplant and zucchini tacos.  DAMN.  Tastiest thing I've ever had in a tortilla.  I had it to go, so when I finally sat down to eat, the juices had split my tacos in half, making it impossible to hold, and I had no fork available.  However, it was so flavorful that I very quickly forgave the cooks at Papalote.

(I'm not vegetarian, btw.  I was thinking that perhaps they were making the veggie stuff taste so good to make up for not having meat... you know, to sell it to the carnivores, too.)

I got a little wiser by visit #3.  I ordered the eggplant and zucchini BURRITO this time.  And damn, that was satisfying.  Lasted me two meals!  And I didn't need a fork this time. :)  

Prices range from about $3-$7 for various items (thank god they accommodate for students).  I'm planning to make regular trips out there between classes.  Trip #4 will involve the marinated tofu at my classmate's suggestion.  

Oh yeah, and parking might be a pain.  Recommend the 1-hour street parking on Masonic or the Albertson's parking across the street (but you'll have to buy something from Albertson's to get it validated there, I think).

excerpts: Carne Asada burrito was tasty, and the steak was not at all fatty or gristly, which is rare and fantastic, but the small quantity of meat in the burrito was entirely overwhelmed by the comparatively large quantities of beans & rice.
This was very disappointing.
The salsa (of which I think they only have one kind) is fantastic though.
Horchata was pretty good.
Nicely toasted tortilla on the burrito.
They also have a couple beers on tap.
On a second visit, the steak quantity was larger, but the arrangement of ingredients was very poor, with the top half all rice, and the bottom half all beans, and little salsa to be found.
carne asada.author: Don H.
carne asada.review:
Carne Asada burrito was tasty, and the steak was not at all fatty or gristly, which is rare and fantastic, but the small quantity of meat in the burrito was entirely overwhelmed by the comparatively large quantities of beans & rice. This was very disappointing. The salsa (of which I think they only have one kind) is fantastic though. Horchata was pretty good. Nicely toasted tortilla on the burrito. They also have a couple beers on tap.
On a second visit, the steak quantity was larger, but the arrangement of ingredients was very poor, with the top half all rice, and the bottom half all beans, and little salsa to be found.

excerpts: I was glad to see that the overpriced carne asada burrito actually had nice grill marks on the carne, but it certainly lacked everywhere else.
The rest of the burrito was just boring and they skimped on the guacamole, which makes for a somewhat dry and lonely burrito.
carne asada.author: Wil M.
carne asada.review: What's the hype with this place??? I guess maybe it's me, but when I go to taquerias, I intend to overeat or hear myself gain weight. I felt like the complete opposite here. I was glad to see that the overpriced carne asada burrito actually had nice grill marks on the carne, but it certainly lacked everywhere else. The rest of the burrito was just boring and they skimped on the guacamole, which makes for a somewhat dry and lonely burrito.

excerpts: Carne Asada?
carne asada.author: Thadd L.
carne asada.review:
Not the best buritto in the Mission bust most likely the freshest.  All of the meat is raw when you order it.

You want chicken?

They get out a big piece of chicken breast and thow it on the grill.

Carne Asada?

Get that 12-hour marinated piece of steak out of that vat of flavor goodness and cook it up.

ect. ect.

The roasted salsa is great as everyone else has said.  There are more hipsters here becuase the food isn't as greasy.  In fact I think that I would call this place a "california" burrito place.  I know that sounds lame but, sometimes you want something that doesn't bomb your stomach like an El Farolito burrito.
Know what I mean?

excerpts: There are many yummy filling options, e.g. carne asada, chile verde, pescado, vegetarian, gambas, etc., that you can apply towards burritos, tacos and quesadillas.
You can also order entrees that come on a plate and are accompanied by rice, beans and tortillas.
Today I had the carne asada entree plate for lunch.

And said lunch companion was gleefully happy with his chile verde super burrito, which he said was one of the best burritos he'd ever had, due to the tasty and tender pork concoction that I regretably forewent.
carne asada.author: Kimberly Q.
carne asada.review:
There are a ton of reviews that I don't need to rehash.  You walk in and, though the counter service is friendly, you should know pretty quickly what you want to order, as there is usually a line of hungry people behind you.  

There are many yummy filling options, e.g. carne asada, chile verde, pescado, vegetarian, gambas, etc., that you can apply towards burritos, tacos and quesadillas.  You can also order entrees that come on a plate and are accompanied by rice, beans and tortillas.  Today I had the carne asada entree plate for lunch.  It came with two good-sized pieces of steak that were grilled to order.  They were, in my opinion somewhat dry due to overcooking but were admittedly tasty.  They were accentuated by the guacamole that came with my lunch companion's super burrito that he did not want.  And said lunch companion was gleefully happy with his chile verde super burrito, which he said was one of the best burritos he'd ever had, due to the tasty and tender pork concoction that I regretably forewent.  

The place was pretty clean and comfy.  I'd come back, but I did not leave the place dreaming of my next venture in.

excerpts: I ordered a Carne Asada burrito.
Had to wait about 20 minutes for my food - when the place wasn't even that full!
When my burrito finally came, guess what?
NO MEAT!
WTF!?
Are you kidding me?
At first i just thought that the meat was in the middle and patiently worked my way to it, but was very disappointed to find nothing there.
carne asada.author: Tallulah J.
carne asada.review: This place is a rip-off. I ordered a Carne Asada burrito. Had to wait about 20 minutes for my food - when the place wasn't even that full! When my burrito finally came, guess what? NO MEAT! WTF!? Are you kidding me? At first i just thought that the meat was in the middle and patiently worked my way to it, but was very disappointed to find nothing there. My now "veggie" burrito was very mediocre with all beans and rice, even though I ordered the "super" - which supposedly comes with cheese and guacamole. Very disappointed. And definitely NOT worth $10!! Don't see what all the fuss is about. Do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks to another Mexican joint. There are plenty of them!

excerpts: I love the carne asada quesadilla!
It's my favorite on the menu!
The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is just awesome!
carne asada.author: Bernadette B.
carne asada.review:
I love the carne asada quesadilla! It's my favorite on the menu! The staff is very friendly and the atmosphere is just awesome! They have artwork that catches your eye all around the restaurant and the music is good!

It's also decently priced. It's so worth it to come here! It gets really crowded during dinner time, so arrive early!!! :)

excerpts: I'm a little bit of a Carne Asada snob.
It's got to be juicy.
Seared.
Flavorful.
Big enough pieces to taste it separately.
carne asada.author: Rhiannon C.
carne asada.review:
I'm a little bit of a Carne Asada snob. It's got to be juicy. Seared. Flavorful. Big enough pieces to taste it separately. Small enough that it's not a steak with a tortilla blanket. A little salty. 

Papalote delivers.

Their burritos are big and tasty, all of the ingredients are fresh and flavorful, their tortillas are just the right kind of crispy-soft, and they're not too full of rice.

I've now gone there twice, and it's for the best that it's just a few too many blocks out of my way, or else They'd know my name and I'd have a special seat by the window.

My gripes: 
-I know, I know, everyone wants their damned coke-in-a-bottle when they get their taqueria on, but I really love a good fountain coke with a burrito, because of all the sweet-fizzy with the salt.
-Not enough chips. For delicious, fresh, hot chips, there are simply not enough of them, *especially* with that salsa, that's too hot for me, but too tasty for me not to eat.
-Bathroom location. Sometimes, it stinks up the whole place. And if it's full, Murphy's law dictates you will be stuck in that seat right by the bathroom with the double punch of having to smell it every time the door's open AND having to move so people can walk by. I'd rather walk through the kitchen.

excerpts: its also not the Mamcitas or the Tres Agaves kind of expensive, the $22 carne asada plate expensive.
ya feel me?
It's worth it just to go there for the salsa.
which is completely unique and only given out in small quantities.
carne asada.author: Lawrence A.
carne asada.review:
What the hell is in that salsa that makes it so good? 
I want to buy a 50 gallon drum of this stuff and slather it on everything I eat (including dessert). 

Papalote isgood mexican food in the higher end, low end kinda price range. You feel me? Basically, it's not the great East oakland spots that are delicious and super affordable, but, its also not the Mamcitas or the Tres Agaves kind of expensive, the $22 carne asada plate expensive. ya feel me? It's worth it just to go there for the salsa. which is completely unique and only given out in small quantities. yafeelme?The chicken was kinda dry, but the shrimp quesdilla was off the chain. yfelme? I will definitely be back, but only for take out becuase there aint no parking round there. yflme?

excerpts: I've had every version they have -- chicken carne asada, soyrizo, triple threat -- I have to say the grilled tofu is the best.
Guac, sour cream, black beans.
carne asada.author: Jeff G.
carne asada.review:
Best burrito in the city? I think it might be. Apologies to Gordo's, El Farolito, and Taq Cancun.

Lets see...

I get a super burrito, tomato tortilla, and the grilled tofu. Grilled tofu is something I would only get here. I've had every version they have -- chicken carne asada, soyrizo, triple threat -- I have to say the grilled tofu is the best. Guac, sour cream, black beans. Ahh, the simple pleasures in life. 

That fucking salsa. Its not fair how good that shit is. Its not runny, you dip a chip, and it comes out covered, no drip. Yeah. Exactly. Ive bought it by the mason jar, put it on everything. 

The bottled salsa on the table is a, dare I say, GREAT change of pace. Habenero El Yucateco? Yes. 

The apps are good too. The black bean dip with some chips is the ultimate ice breaker. Or something.

If you want to have a delicious burrito that uses fresh ingredients, or if you just want to mingle with the hipster fixed-gear crowd, Papalote is the spot.

excerpts: Ah yeah, anyhow, I ordered my standard test: the carne asada!
Master that, and I'll come back and try more.
carne asada.author: Erick K.
carne asada.review:
Normally, I would be skeptical about a local burrito joint if 1) it's overrun by hipsters 2) it has a tofu burrito on the menu 3) It was featured in a Food Network show (Bobby Flay's Throwdown show) - not that I'm anti-Food Network, it's just that they don't always seem to choose the "best" places, just the ones that will accommodate for the tv cameras and crowd. 

Despite making the foolish attempt to order the burrito on site... what's up with all the places around here? It's like anyplace with some kind of buzz requires a 20 minute wait!  Ah yeah, anyhow, I ordered my standard test: the carne asada! Master that, and I'll come back and try more. Good cuts of meat, tasty rice and beans, solid coma inducing size, and great hot sauce! Just be sure to call in your order or prepare to eat at senior citizen friendly hours.

excerpts: I love this place because everything is made fresh and the carne asada doesn't resemble sisig (Filipino dish of little Pork bits).
Nice big chunks of meat.
And like everyone else says, the salsa is awesome!!!!!!!!!
I take a jar home every time I eat there.
carne asada.author: Segue P.
carne asada.review: I love this place because everything is made fresh and the carne asada doesn't resemble sisig (Filipino dish of little Pork bits).  Nice big chunks of meat. And like everyone else says, the salsa is awesome!!!!!!!!!  I take a jar home every time I eat there.

excerpts: it is true that the carne asada burrito with guacamole is very good, and it is true that their salsa is very good.
as one other reviewer mentioned, you order and pay when you first walk in,
and then they bring your food to you at your table.
the male cashier who took my order was very sweet and cheerful.
i liked this place lots.
carne asada.author: barbara r.
carne asada.review: it is true that the carne asada burrito with guacamole is very good, and it is true that their salsa is very good.  as one other reviewer mentioned, you order and pay when you first walk in,  and then they bring your food to you at your table. the male cashier who took my order was very sweet and cheerful. i liked this place lots.

excerpts: The vegetarian burrito and carne asada were delicious as well.
We will be back on our next visit to San Francisco.
carne asada.author: Hannah S.
carne asada.review: Very good! I love the vegan selections and I enjoyed my tofu mole burrito. Each meal comes with a small bowl of chips and their delicious salsa. The vegetarian burrito and carne asada were delicious as well. We will be back on our next visit to San Francisco.

excerpts: Burritos are delicious (both the chicken and carne asada are prepared very well) but the real superstar here is the SALSA!!
I would inject it into my veins if I could.
They also sell jars at the front to take home, score!!
The two brothers that own the place (also seen on Bobby Flay's Throwdown) can often be found at the register or in the kitchen which is cute.
If you are ever looking for good mexican in the Mission, check this place out!!
carne asada.author: Kadie B.
carne asada.review: Burritos are delicious (both the chicken and carne asada are prepared very well) but the real superstar here is the SALSA!! I would inject it into my veins if I could. They also sell jars at the front to take home, score!! The two brothers that own the place (also seen on Bobby Flay's Throwdown) can often be found at the register or in the kitchen which is cute. If you are ever looking for good mexican in the Mission, check this place out!!

excerpts: When my two (not so hot) carne asada tacos arrived, there was some diced tomatoes atop
but I like salsa on my tacos
so I headed back up to the counter for salsa
and they wanted 55 cents (my pockets only held only 12 cents) they would not give me any salsa, if I had know about the salsa rations I would not of wasted my 1 ration on the stale chips.
I left them holding the plate after only 1 bite headed to the ATM and went to get my favorite tacos at 25th and Mission.
carne asada.author: Su E.
carne asada.review: So my chips were not so fresh but the salsa was excellent. When my two (not so hot) carne asada tacos arrived, there was some diced tomatoes atop but I like salsa on my tacos so I headed back up to the counter for salsa and they wanted 55 cents (my pockets only held only 12 cents) they would not give me any salsa, if I had know about the salsa rations I would not of wasted my 1 ration on the stale chips. I left them holding the plate after only 1 bite headed to the ATM and went to get my favorite tacos at 25th and Mission.

excerpts: Solid, good quality beef (carne asada) - no fatty parts like El Farolito.
And better meat than La Taqueria.
Loved my 2 tacos, and cute ambiance to boot!
Win, for sure.
carne asada.author: Sally M.
carne asada.review: Seriously better than La Taqueria - in food quality AND price. Solid, good quality beef (carne asada) - no fatty parts like El Farolito. And better meat than La Taqueria. Loved my 2 tacos, and cute ambiance to boot! Win, for sure.

excerpts: The carne asada is my favorite.
The meat is always tender and juicy.
The salsa is awesome.
If you're vegetarian or not papalote has something for you.
carne asada.author: Jessica L.
carne asada.review:
I love these guys.  You can't say that about a lot of places but Papalote's definitely deserves it. 

Their super burritos are the best especially for the price. The carne asada is my favorite. The meat is always tender and juicy. The salsa is awesome. If you're vegetarian or not papalote has something for you. Their Tofu burrito is also very yummy. 

I highly recommend this place because you great service, great food, and a great atmosphere without burning a hole in your pocket. 

Cheers!

excerpts: I'd stick to the carne asada.
carne asada.author: Ricky M.
carne asada.review: Hands down...they have one of the best salsas I've ever tasted.  Now that deserves five stars.  Everyone keeps telling me to try the chicken adobo burrito, so I did.  Nice try but it was okay. I'd stick to the carne asada.

excerpts: We ordered the carne asada tacos, carne asade quesadilla, and chicken adobo burrito.
The carne asada is quality meat and tasted fresh.
The chicken adobo burrito was ok, but I usually judge mexican food by the carne asada.
I'd definitely go back for more.
The chicken adobo burrito was ok, but I usually judge mexican food by the carne asada.
I'd definitely go back for more.
carne asada.author: Kathy and Mark D.
carne asada.review: We ordered the carne asada tacos, carne asade quesadilla, and chicken adobo burrito.  The carne asada is quality meat and tasted fresh.  The chicken adobo burrito was ok, but I usually judge mexican food by the carne asada.  I'd definitely go back for more.

excerpts: The Carne Asada and Chicken are great, but for a special treat, try their mole or Pork Chile Verde.
Tres Bien.
carne asada.author: Andy T.
carne asada.review:
As a child growing up in San Diego (15 minutes north of the border), I was practically weaned on good Mexican food. I have to admit, I was definitely skeptical reading menu items like "Tofu Soy-Rizo", but my fears melted away when I dipped my first chip into the salsa - oh, that glorious salsa, as man has never made it before.

People will argue that this is Yuppified Mexican, and it probably is since there is no brain or head on the menu - in my mind though, this is actually a good thing. They only serve the freshest ingredients, the best cuts of meat in all of their dishes, and I could go there for every meal.

The Carne Asada and Chicken are great, but for a special treat, try their mole or Pork Chile Verde. Tres Bien.

excerpts: My roommate order the carne asada plate, her response - ehhh.
carne asada.author: D C.
carne asada.review: Orange salsa was slightly off putting, but tasted alright once you got used to it.  Completely turned off by the barbaric girl sitting close to me...close your mouth when you eat chips so the remnants don't keep flying into my food biatch!  My roommate order the carne asada plate, her response - ehhh.  I had the prawn burriton...my fave, but here it was dry, bland, and not even remotely memorable.  Love me sum dirty,  hole in the wall "Mission" mexi place...this ain't it.

excerpts: I love the carne asada burritos and tacos (make it Super!), but everything I've tried has been fantastic.
They offer lots of choices and it can be difficult to make up your mind.
carne asada.author: Leslie T.
carne asada.review:
A local favorite, I find myself eating here about once a week or so. The food is always fresh and delicious, whether you eat in the dining room or take it home. The taqueria is clean, busy and cheerful. They also do a great job of advertising the local art/music scene.

I love the carne asada burritos and tacos (make it Super!), but everything I've tried has been fantastic. They offer lots of choices and it can be difficult to make up your mind. The food isn't greasy or overly heavy and you can make things even more healthy by choosing black beans, etc.

I'm also a sucker for their guacamole, and would eat it by the gallon if I could.

Be sure to take a menu home so you can call-ahead when a craving hits!

excerpts: I got the carne asada.
Overall, the burrito was delicious!
The carne asada was very flavorful and it was pretty "clean" to eat.
La Taqueria is  messier and felt a little more authentic and the flavors were just different.
carne asada.author: Michael S.
carne asada.review:
I'm on the great burrito tour and stopped at Papalote for my second burrito (La Taqueria being the first).  Papalote is a little trendier place with a nice dining area and cool music in the background (which some old guy was actually dancing to whilst eating his burrito...free entertainment, I guess).  Service was friendly.  This place seems like more of a sit-down type place as opposed to the plain burrito joint of La Taqueria.

They bring you chips and salsa to start.  The salsa was amazing!  Somehow they mixed creamy into the salsa vernacular and it works!  The burrito came a little later (the wait was a little long, but it takes time for good food) looking delicious with a little side of fruit compote of some sort.

Comparing the actual burrito next to La Taqueria's is a little difficult....I would describe is as "nicer."  I'm not sure what that really means, but it is what it is.  I got the carne asada.  Overall, the burrito was delicious!  The carne asada was very flavorful and it was pretty "clean" to eat.  La Taqueria is  messier and felt a little more authentic and the flavors were just different.  I preferred La Taqueria's carnitas, but that's not to say Papalote isn't very good.

This is a great place to come with friends and enjoy a beer and burrito.  Or, as were 3 other customers, a great place to come and read a book and enjoy some tasty food.

I'll definitely be coming back!

excerpts: The sauce is yummy and the way they prepare the carne asada is authentic.
The service staff is not very helpful but it you place your order and stay out of their way you're fine-
just enjoy the food.
carne asada.author: Lissette R.
carne asada.review: Great food.  The sauce is yummy and the way they prepare the carne asada is authentic.  The service staff is not very helpful but it you place your order and stay out of their way you're fine- just enjoy the food.

excerpts:
my GF ordered steak nachos: 
the plate came and you could see the steam coming off the carne asada.
its a flank cut, marinated and seasoned to perfection.
she's a bit particular when it comes to taquerias, so to impress her
was a big win.
the plate was fresh, hot, and all ingredients were very tasty.
carne asada.author: Ruben G.
carne asada.review:
*yeah, we fed into the hype and swung by to see what the hoopla was all about....... 
 
i used to live in the city. i have my good-n-trusty taquerias that I MUST have whenever i'm up in SF - Pancho Villa, Cancun, El Farolito, but i never cared to break in another spot and be disappointed that i wasted my time when i coulda had a great burrito.

yes, parking is tough in the mission.  that's nothing new, so be prepared to circle the block.

ordering was a breeze.  Getting a table looked like it was going to be tough, but were actually seated pretty quickly. they bring you chips and their homemade salsa to nosh on while you wait.  the salsa is very very good - unlike the red/green salsas you see everywhere else, this salsa was rich, smokey, and very very flavoful (for those from SJ, think La Victoria salsa, but less creamy, and the raw ingredients dont get lost in the whip)

The meats are grilled FRESH.  not pre-grilled, chopped, and thrown in a tin in advance.  and cuz of this - and the size of this place (small), getting your order will take a while.  this is what separates it from other taquerias (or is it a grill?), that they do this as you order, unlike other places that take less than 5 mins to throw your ingredients in a tortilla, wrap it, and get it to your hands/table.  so be prepared to wait about 15- 20 mins (this was when it was very busy, probably less when its not)

my GF ordered steak nachos: 
the plate came and you could see the steam coming off the carne asada.  its a flank cut, marinated and seasoned to perfection.  she's a bit particular when it comes to taquerias, so to impress her was a big win.  the plate was fresh, hot, and all ingredients were very tasty.  refried black beans, ftw!

i had the chicken burrito + cheese & guacamole: 
not your run-of-mill burrito.  great size, its not HUGE, nor is it wimpy either.  the chicken is marinated very nicely; smokey & spicy, and it doesnt over power everything else.  refried blackbeans were nice consistency, not runny at all.  the salsa is awesome and the rice was nice and steamed, not al dente, or mushy.

the service is great.  one of the owners made sure the dining area was in check and that you were attended in adequate time.  kudos.

excerpts:
good
chile verde ques is very good
carne asada super burrito is good
carne asada.author: Christopher L.
carne asada.review:
horchata is GREAT
guac is bleh, chips are awesome
chicken is crazy dry and gross
shrimp tacos are good
chile verde ques is very good
carne asada super burrito is good

excerpts: I started out with the Fish Tacos, but haven't been able to order anything other than the Carne Asada entree lately.
carne asada.author: Chris R.
carne asada.review: Another one of my frequent haunts. I started out with the Fish Tacos, but haven't been able to order anything other than the Carne Asada entree lately. The black refried beans and the jicama pico goes great with the with the thin cut steak. Also have to recommend the Machaca when you're feeling a bit partied-out the morning after. A bit hard to get into sometimes, but the staff is always on the ball getting tables ready.

excerpts: We orderd the carne asada tacos, and they didn't disappoint.
carne asada.author: Ann G.
carne asada.review: A great lunch place!   The chorizo queso was really good.  Gooey and spicy.  We were disappointed that they only gave us one (large) tortilla to share for it, however.   The salsa they give you with the chips was fabulous, not your usual salsa - couldn't put my finger on it.  We orderd the carne asada tacos, and they didn't disappoint.  Meat was tender and juicy, and the "grande" version with cheese, sour cream and guacamole made it better.   Would go again.   We heard about the "Triple Threat" burrito on a food network show, but looking at it in real life doesn't seem worth the $20. I'm sure it's good, but for that much money, we'd expect to feed two easily - not that large.

excerpts: The prices are also equivalent to our favorite taquerias, without the unhealthy extras, with two carne asada tacos coming in at $4.15.
All in all pretty good, minus the unhappy woman at the cash register doling out helpings of attitude with everyone's tacos.
carne asada.author: Tara R.
carne asada.review: I loved Mission taquerias, then, one expanded waistline later, I didn't so much. I've come to think of Pancho Villa and Taqueria Can-Cun as now-and-then treats, while Papalote is a place you can eat regularly and not feel like you just did yourself horribly wrong. Papalote earns most of its points for health, adding ample vegetables to accompany their well-cooked meats. The prices are also equivalent to our favorite taquerias, without the unhealthy extras, with two carne asada tacos coming in at $4.15. All in all pretty good, minus the unhappy woman at the cash register doling out helpings of attitude with everyone's tacos.

excerpts: so? and the carne asada burrito that cost $10 or close to it?
wasn't that great either.
nothing in that burrito was tasty.
the meat tasted very meaty.
and not in a good way.
it was just bad!
and so was everything else that accompanied it.
it just seemed like a giant mess.
i've had way better and for a lot less!
yes, like el farolito a few blocks away on mission.
but hey, if you feel like dropping $10 for a burrito that's not even that great (in my opinion at least), then sure, come here.
otherwise, i suggest walking down a few blocks and get a giant oh-so-heavy-you-can use-it-as-weights super carne asada burrito from el farolito.
trust me, you'll be so glad you did.
carne asada.author: mai c.
carne asada.review: ummm.. not sure what the big deal is, but their chips and salsa aren't that great. i get it, it's tomato-saucy-heavy. yeah, so? and the carne asada burrito that cost $10 or close to it? wasn't that great either. nothing in that burrito was tasty. the meat tasted very meaty. and not in a good way. it was just bad! and so was everything else that accompanied it. it just seemed like a giant mess. i've had way better and for a lot less! yes, like el farolito a few blocks away on mission. but hey, if you feel like dropping $10 for a burrito that's not even that great (in my opinion at least), then sure, come here. otherwise, i suggest walking down a few blocks and get a giant oh-so-heavy-you-can use-it-as-weights super carne asada burrito from el farolito. trust me, you'll be so glad you did. ;)

excerpts: Clean, cheap and decent looking indeed, but carne asada burrito was just no match to Pancho Villa's, for example:

meat was clearly burnt (you could smell the burnt meat/dirty grill? - as soon as you walk in) and definitely worse quality (lots of non-chewable pieces), and it totally fell apart all over the plate midway through.
It was also really lacking in sauces/moisture, despite being "super"!
Sticking with Pancho's for now.
carne asada.author: Sasha M.
carne asada.review: Clean, cheap and decent looking indeed, but carne asada burrito was just no match to Pancho Villa's, for example: meat was clearly burnt (you could smell the burnt meat/dirty grill? - as soon as you walk in) and definitely worse quality (lots of non-chewable pieces), and it totally fell apart all over the plate midway through. It was also really lacking in sauces/moisture, despite being "super"!  Sticking with Pancho's for now.

excerpts: I ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito.
Do you mind waiting 20 minutes?
she asks.
What?
For a burrito?!
But they are supposed to be good...
Uhm, OK...
So I walked around the corner to my house and waited patiently for the 20 minutes to pass then went back, waited five minutes more, and headed home.
I tried a chip on the way (the best tell tale sign of a good burrito spot!)
and... god damn it.
Fresh, crunchy, delicious.
I get home and open up the fancy little salsa tub...
oh no!
It's delicious too.
carne asada.author: Jeff S.
carne asada.review:
I wanted to not like it, I really did. I heard about the elitist attitude the people who work here have. I walk by every day and see the ridiculously long lines and tons of people ALWAYS waiting, but in my quest to find the best burrito spot in the mission I had to try it. When I walked by and the front door wasn't overflowing with hungry San Franciscans I knew it was now or never. I ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito. "Do you mind waiting 20 minutes?" she asks. What? For a burrito?! But they are supposed to be good... "Uhm, OK..." So I walked around the corner to my house and waited patiently for the 20 minutes to pass then went back, waited five minutes more, and headed home. I tried a chip on the way (the best tell tale sign of a good burrito spot!) and... god damn it. Fresh, crunchy, delicious. I get home and open up the fancy little salsa tub... oh no! It's delicious too. I intrepidly peel back the foil and take a bite of the burrito, and my worst fears are realized: hot, flavorful, juicy steak. Wonderfully grilled tortilla... tasty rice and beans. Its good... its really good. 

I don't think the attitude or ridiculously long wait time was excusable, but these people have a hot commodity on their hands and everybody wants some. I noticed a lot of people had called in their orders and didn't have to wait at all, which would be perfect for, oh I dunno, someone whos back door is about 40 yards away from Papalote? I'll be back. God damn it... I'll be back...

excerpts: when my friend was up getting more water, i snuck a bite of his carne asada burrito (i'm a pseudo-vegetarian, shhh).
carne asada.author: jean w.
carne asada.review:
eh. maybe i ordered the wrong thing. i got a black bean burrito, "poco arroz," with cheese and guac. it was very beany, and very light on the guac. 

when my friend was up getting more water, i snuck a bite of his carne asada burrito (i'm a pseudo-vegetarian, shhh). it was average, too. 

i used to like papalote but i forgot why...

excerpts: My soyrizo egg burrito and bf's carne asada burrito was just okay.
Expensive for the mediocrity.
We won't be back.
carne asada.author: Presto G.
carne asada.review: I don't understand the rave reviews. The roasted tomato salsa was good, although the 50 cent charge for extra was not appreciated. My soyrizo egg burrito and bf's carne asada burrito was just okay. Expensive for the mediocrity. We won't be back.

excerpts: That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo.
I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago.
That's how amazing the Chile Verde is.
It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh.
The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.
carne asada.author: Lawrence S.
carne asada.review:
I've always considered the burrito to be the perfect culinary invention: every food group delightfully wrapped in a tight, nutritional envelope. And even though Burritos and Tacos and Quesadillas don't really showcase the true sophistication of Mexican cuisine, sometimes you just want that massive hunk of goodness in your belly. That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo. I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago. That's how amazing the Chile Verde is. It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh. And unlike other "healthy" burrito options, like those found at Whole Foods, Papalote doesn't try to foist a dry tortilla sandwich off on you.

n.b. The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.

excerpts: i got the carne asada super burrito...
carne asada.author: Kimberly S.
carne asada.review: thus far, my favorite burrito place in the city (maybe even the world!!). i had it  in february 2008 and it was amazing.. went back a few days ago and it was still amazing. i got the carne asada super burrito... it came loaded with avocado and the best flank steak ever! that salsa is amazing too! two beers, two super burritos, and chips and salsa came out to $23.

excerpts: delicious, zestful fillings of grilled chicken and carne asada satisfied our cravings.
carne asada.author: Nelle A.

excerpts: A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.
The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.
Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.
My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.
carne asada.author: Jason M.
carne asada.review:
Like a lemming, i joined the masses checking out Papalote after their Throwdown win over Bobby Flay.  And I will say it more than lived up to the hype.

I ordered the triple threat burrito made famous on the show and a side of guacamole.  Hold up, $20 for a burrito!  This better be an amazing burrito especially since every other burrito on the menu is only $8 or so!  Needless to say, I was not disappointed.  A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.  The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.  Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.  My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.

And for those concerned about portion sizes, this was one of the biggest burrito's I've eaten in a long time.  Unless you're Adam Richman, this should be plenty of food for anyone.

Separately, the guacamole is good - though I wish it had a bit more of a kick and the fish tacos are also very tasty.  The fish is perfectly cooked and not dry like you typically find in fish tacos.

excerpts: They'd get 5 stars if all they served was the carne asada super burrito and their salsa.
Everything else is in the three to four stars range.
And they aren't greasy like most of the other gut-bomb factories in the Mission.
So if you're nursing a wicked hangover and all you can think of is grease to settle your stomach, you should probably go somewhere else.
Or you should just quit being a baby and work on bringing up your tolerance level.
I believe we're called "functional alcoholics".
carne asada.author: mcmalaprop ..
carne asada.review: I've eaten here about once a week for lunch since it opened.  They'd get 5 stars if all they served was the carne asada super burrito and their salsa.  Everything else is in the three to four stars range.  And they aren't greasy like most of the other gut-bomb factories in the Mission.  So if you're nursing a wicked hangover and all you can think of is grease to settle your stomach, you should probably go somewhere else.  Or you should just quit being a baby and work on bringing up your tolerance level.  I believe we're called "functional alcoholics".

excerpts: I thought the carne asada burrito was yum-
my!
carne asada.author: Allison A.
carne asada.review: I thought the carne asada burrito was yum-my! Price was a bit pricey for the burrito and chicken tacos, I think it was about $13....a bit expensive for mexican take out....but i'd saw worth the price. the house salsa has a kick to it, but very good too!

excerpts: the carne asada meat was so tough and hard to chew.
carne asada.author: Debbie Chiou S.
carne asada.review: what? bobby flay's burrito must have really sucked for this burrito to have beat it on food network's throwdown challenge. the carne asada meat was so tough and hard to chew. the chicken was dry. the shrimp was the only decent part of the burrito. beans were good too, but when are they not? the extra guacamole seemed non-existent under all the other ingredients, yet the flavors left me wanting... so i doused the burrito in hot sauce... not what i expected from all the hype.

excerpts: the carne asada is large, hearty chunks of steak and you won't regret super-ing it.
carne asada.author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.
carne asada.review:
1st stop on my day of eating in the mission...

tasty tasty tacos! 2 per order. the corn tortillas are big for... well corn tortillas.  the carne asada is large, hearty chunks of steak and you won't regret super-ing it.

the salsa is so good, calling it salsa doesn't do it justice. 

my new favorite taco place. and it doesn't make me feel too unhealthy though it's drowned in sour cream, guac, and cheese.

excerpts: The carne asada quesadilla is amazing.
The wait took FOREVER, but to be fair there were about a bazillion orders before mine.
carne asada.author: Liz L.
carne asada.review: Two random people I met on the N line recommended this place (hey, the N might be good for something after all). The carne asada quesadilla is amazing. The wait took FOREVER, but to be fair there were about a bazillion orders before mine. Chips and salsa were good. I might venture out to the Mission more often, now that I've been exposed to some decent Mexican food.

excerpts: The Carne Asada is hit or miss depending on the day.
Sometimes they screw up orders and sometimes there's a long wait
but overall nice people, great crowded atmosphere.
If you want authentic SF slab experience head down one more block to Mission St. and hit up El Farlito or El Taco Loco.
carne asada.author: Jeff C.
carne asada.review: Definitely not as authentic as most San Francisco Taqueria's but they do cook your meat or tofu to order. The super Nachos are yummy and you can't go wrong with the smokey chicken. The Carne Asada is hit or miss depending on the day. Sometimes they screw up orders and sometimes there's a long wait but overall nice people, great crowded atmosphere. If you want authentic SF slab experience head down one more block to Mission St. and hit up El Farlito or El Taco Loco.

excerpts: Those he was talking about was a triple threat burrito with Carne Asada, Grilled Shrimp and Grilled chicken
and then all the condiments of a burrito beans, rice etc..
OH
and of course the secret sauce...
Now mind you
I had been to papalote's before and like their burritos
they are good not too heavy  ebough to get you through the day and don't leave that depressed feeling after.
I ordered by phone and by the time I got there the place was PACKED
I couldn't find parking, but then again anywhere you go in the mission is a rubik's cube trying to find parking.
I finally get  parking and my order which was simple because they have an area for phone pick ups... as the girl starts to ring me up
I start to pull out a $20 I figured 2 burritos and all the hype this place has gotten...
I was thrown back when she rang up $31.
I asked how much each burrito costed my grilled chicken burrito costed  around $7 and change
then she said the Triple Threat costed $ 19.95????????????
I could not believe it
I ended up
just takin it home
could not think of my son not eating his burrito ahaha I thought for that price it HAS to be good
and it HAS to have ton of SHRIMP
and HUGE when I got home
pulled it out and my burrito was small and his was big compared to mine
I took a bite and thought ehh
it's ok....
my son enjoyed it in the end
I asked how many shrimp he said I counted 3
...3 shrimp ???
For 3 SHRIMP they charged $20????
They have gone mad
then I thought about t and realized I had been bamboozled NEVER again sad to say
but this place is OVERRATED OVERPRICED...
So what Bobby Flay did a show on this joint I should have known when I saw the episode
the only latinos in the show was the 2 owners the crowd was not LATINO?
AND it took place at the Mission Cultural Center in the Mission
there were no native mission ppl BAMBOOZLED
I tell you never again I will stick to El Zocalo, El Farolito and pay $30 for 2 ppl including drinks and maybe even a quesadilla suiza...
this place needs to lower their prices didn't they get the memo RECESSION?
carne asada.author: Ines F.
carne asada.review: After listening to my son as he watched the Bobby Flay Throwdown episode with Papalote he kept saying OMG mom you have to get me one of those!!!! Those he was talking about was a triple threat burrito with Carne Asada, Grilled Shrimp and Grilled chicken and then all the condiments of a burrito beans, rice etc.. OH and of course the secret sauce...Now mind you I had been to papalote's before and like their burritos they are good not too heavy  ebough to get you through the day and don't leave that depressed feeling after. I ordered by phone and by the time I got there the place was PACKED I couldn't find parking, but then again anywhere you go in the mission is a rubik's cube trying to find parking. I finally get  parking and my order which was simple because they have an area for phone pick ups... as the girl starts to ring me up I start to pull out a $20 I figured 2 burritos and all the hype this place has gotten... I was thrown back when she rang up $31. I asked how much each burrito costed my grilled chicken burrito costed  around $7 and change then she said the Triple Threat costed $ 19.95???????????? I could not believe it I ended up just takin it home could not think of my son not eating his burrito ahaha I thought for that price it HAS to be good and it HAS to have ton of SHRIMP and HUGE when I got home pulled it out and my burrito was small and his was big compared to mine I took a bite and thought ehh it's ok.... my son enjoyed it in the end I asked how many shrimp he said I counted 3...3 shrimp ??? For 3 SHRIMP they charged $20???? They have gone mad then I thought about t and realized I had been bamboozled NEVER again sad to say but this place is OVERRATED OVERPRICED... So what Bobby Flay did a show on this joint I should have known when I saw the episode the only latinos in the show was the 2 owners the crowd was not LATINO? AND it took place at the Mission Cultural Center in the Mission there were no native mission ppl BAMBOOZLED I tell you never again I will stick to El Zocalo, El Farolito and pay $30 for 2 ppl including drinks and maybe even a quesadilla suiza... this place needs to lower their prices didn't they get the memo RECESSION?

excerpts: I can't say I've tried the vegetarian dishes but my carne asada super burrito always hits the spot.
carne asada.author: Nikki W.
carne asada.review: Granted I have not explored the city to its fullest...but my vote is #1 for this place! I love, did I say LOVE, their food. Fresh, flavorful, not greasy and relatively fast! I've frequented a couple other places that are supposed to be the best Mexican in the Mission but I was sadly led astray, this place is my favorite thus far. I can't say I've tried the vegetarian dishes but my carne asada super burrito always hits the spot. Yes you have to pay an extra .50 for extra salsa but when you are talking about a $6 burrito why complain.

excerpts: The Carne asada is fine but a little bland.
carne asada.author: Stuart J.
carne asada.review: This was my local regular burrito place for 6 months or so, and I really wanted to like it, but somehow I never was totally blown away. The Carne asada is fine but a little bland. The fish tacos are good though. Gets pretty jammed at times, it always makes me feel a little harried. I wish they wouldn't leave all those drinks pallettes blocking the doorway. There is never anywhere to stand while you are waiting for your food. If you live nearby it is best to call in your order and avoid the lines.

excerpts: But I have to stay, the carne asada in my burrito was absolutely sublime.
Maybe I hit them on a particularly good day, I dunno.
But I'm used to burrito joints having dry, marginally flavorless
carne asada.author: Jess L.
carne asada.review: Everyone talks about the salsa, and it was indeed awesome.  But I have to stay, the carne asada in my burrito was absolutely sublime.  Maybe I hit them on a particularly good day, I dunno.  But I'm used to burrito joints having dry, marginally flavorless steak - Papalote's was juicy and flavorful and way more than just a vehicle for protein.  Yum.  Another visit is indicated for further research, clearly.

excerpts: My husband got the carne asada burrito which wasn't as good as the shrimp.
carne asada.author: Wendy V.
carne asada.review: Yum.  I got a shrimp burrito  on a spinach tortilla.  Decent price and big burrito....very yum!  An added bonus is the fact that they have bottled coke.  mmm.....yummy!  My husband got the carne asada burrito which wasn't as good as the shrimp.

excerpts: The carne asada, again, nothing to write home about, and the shrimp, totally lacking and overcooked, didn't taste very good at all, I picked them all out and set them aside.
I did enjoy the salsa that everyone is boasting about but the chips weren't great and that's half the experience when you're eating salsa.
Overall, I don't think I'd go back.
Bummer, I had such high hopes.
carne asada.author: Jnzl D.
carne asada.review: I would say 2.5. Like many others, I saw this on Food Network and decided to go give it a try. I don't know if I went on an off day but it seriously did not live up to the hype I had built up in my mind about how amazing this burrito experience was going to be. I ordered the Triple Threat, mind you...a $20+ burrito...yes I agreed to pay this much because I believed it was going to be phenomenal. I've had $5 burritos that blew my mind, this $20+ one did not. Seriously disappointed. It was all meat, mind you, which wouldn't be a bad thing, except there was nothing in it to make it spectacular. A good burrito to me has a balance between the meat, cheese, salsa, rice, and beans. This was mainly just a tortilla of meat. the chicken was probably the best of the three types of meat in it. The carne asada, again, nothing to write home about, and the shrimp, totally lacking and overcooked, didn't taste very good at all, I picked them all out and set them aside.  I did enjoy the salsa that everyone is boasting about but the chips weren't great and that's half the experience when you're eating salsa. Overall, I don't think I'd go back. Bummer, I had such high hopes.

excerpts: Oh yes .... tasty carne asada and service was quick too.
Nice clean small space.
carne asada.author: Teddy d.
carne asada.review: Oh yes .... tasty carne asada and service was quick too. Nice clean small space.

excerpts: Had the carne asada burrito and the meat was so tender and tasty.
The decor is a bit kitschy but who the hell cares when the food is this good.
La Taq still has my vote for best carnitas
but I must come back here a second time to see if they rival La Taq's.
carne asada.author: Emily C.
carne asada.review: I honestly wish I could bottle up that salsa and take it home, it is so damn good.  Had the carne asada burrito and the meat was so tender and tasty.  The decor is a bit kitschy but who the hell cares when the food is this good.  La Taq still has my vote for best carnitas but I must come back here a second time to see if they rival La Taq's.

excerpts: It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options.
It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for -
it's spicy and creamy and complex
-- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice.
The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried.
I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.
carne asada.author: Jennifer C.
carne asada.review: Papalote is my local burrito joint. It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options. It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for - it's spicy and creamy and complex -- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice. The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried. I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.

excerpts: I got the carne asada tacos and felt that it could have used some seasoning and maybe an extra corn tortilla underneath so that it wouldn't get all soppy when I had to squeeze lime on it to give it flavor.
I will probably be back to try more things, but yea, I wouldn't order the nachos ever again.
carne asada.author: Trinh N.
carne asada.review: Okay.  Came back for their nachos and tacos and now I wish I had not written that other stellar review.  Their nachos were NOT very good.  They were bland and the chicken tasted dry.  I got the carne asada tacos and felt that it could have used some seasoning and maybe an extra corn tortilla underneath so that it wouldn't get all soppy when I had to squeeze lime on it to give it flavor.  I will probably be back to try more things, but yea, I wouldn't order the nachos ever again.

excerpts: The burrito was pretty good, but lacking carne asada.
I expected more from the burrito for it to be considered a front runner in the Mission.
carne asada.author: J. M.
carne asada.review: Delicious free chip & Salsa, The burrito was pretty good, but lacking carne asada. I expected more from the burrito for it to be considered a front runner in the Mission.

excerpts: but the carne asada
super burrito
I ordered was damn good, but not up to the farolito level of excellence that I had grown accustomed to....
Still a killer Taqueria in the mission
oh yeahhhhhhhhhh kool aid man!
carne asada.author: Francis K.
carne asada.review: This place is a tale of two cities.  I worked up the street for a while and I have certainly pledged my burrito allegiance to farolito....but I read about the awesome and award winning salsa y chips at this place so I thought I would give them a shot....The salsa is mind blowing!  and the chips are really f'ingood!  but the carne asada super burrito I ordered was damn good, but not up to the farolito level of excellence that I had grown accustomed to....Still a killer Taqueria in the mission....oh yeahhhhhhhhhh kool aid man!

excerpts: The burritos are fine, Ive tried the carne asada, shrimp and the veggie.
That's with pinto beans and guacamole.
carne asada.author: Roger W.
carne asada.review:
The best thing about this place is that it feels really good to be in there. I love Mexican food, but there aren't many Mexican restaurants in the Mission that I enjoy spending any real time in. The restaurant is cute and nicely designed. Its colorful and small, but feels more cozy then crammed. The place is clean and, though it has the elements of other burrito spots around here-- you order at the counter, no servers, small place with a community vibe, it doesn't feel thrown together like other places. Its more of a spot I would go with a date I wanted to impress or didn't know very well, then the place I seek out late night when I want to stuff my face with a group of also drunk friends. 

The food is good but, like a lot of Mexican restaurants, it lacks anything really distinguishing. EXCEPT, the salsa is super good. I feel the urge to repeat that last sentence. I live really close to Papalote and, on the day I moved in, two separate friends brought up the Mexican restaurant near by with the awesome salsa. The shrimp tacos were nice. The shrimp grilled in white wine and garlic. They are plated on a couple of open soft tacos with crunchy lettuce and pico de gallo, and taste very fresh. They were even better when I dumped the salsa all over them. The burritos are fine, Ive tried the carne asada, shrimp and the veggie. That's with pinto beans and guacamole. All were good, but not wet enough for my taste. 

The staff are friendly. I came in with a group of friends the other night, and one of the guys put himself out for a little bit trying to reorganize tables so we could sit. 

The place is pricier than its competitors, but you pay for the package. Or maybe you pay for the salsa (which, on a side note, I'm pretty sure you can buy on its own to carry out).

excerpts: no, a spinach super carne asada quesadilla with grilled mushrooms...
carne asada.author: Kevin D.
carne asada.review: A spinach super tofu quesadilla please... no, a spinach super carne asada quesadilla with grilled mushrooms... no, a super tofu burrito on spinach tortilla with no rice, grilled veggies, and a Negra Modelo... no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water... I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!

excerpts: Friend had a carne asada burrito.......
Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt.
Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about.
I gave the burrito 3 out of 5.
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait.
It was an order as you pay type place.
I really like the grates they use on their grills
opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses.
carne asada.author: Miguel V.
carne asada.review:
Papalote- 
The chips are just ok, the salsa is very good. The salsa has a nice flavor, fluidity and color. You can pour it over anything! Oh yeah, it's served in little black containers opposed to the clear Solo cup every other Taqueira uses; it added a little piazzas. We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom. Very good, I give it 4 out of 5. Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff. Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos....... Absolutely awesome! One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time. The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste. Excellent blend! I'd go back just for this dish. Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5. These guys set the bar on tofu. Tacos Mole with Chicken.....You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt. The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy. I gave them 2 out of 5. Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good. They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro. Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes. I gave them 4 out of 5. Friend had a carne asada burrito.......Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt. Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about. I gave the burrito 3 out of 5. 
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait. It was an order as you pay type place. I really like the grates they use on their grills opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses. The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!

excerpts: i'm not a vegetarian, though, so i ordered the carne asada burrito with black beans.
carne asada.author: Kayla K.
carne asada.review:
i like it... it doesn't necessarily give off that "authentic" mexican food/taqueria vibe... in fact it doesn't at all, but it does serve up some good food. and they are conscious of vegetarian needs. 

i'm not a vegetarian, though, so i ordered the carne asada burrito with black beans. it was enjoyable and the steak was great. their salsa is quite unique. normally, i look for chunks and LOTS of spice in my salsa [i have still yet to find a winning salsa that meets those requirements in this city, if you have any tips, please let me know] and it met neither of these expectations but still managed to get my attention.

i would go back.

excerpts: The carne asada burrito was the weakest example of mexican I had seen here outside of the hard shell tacos at the school lunchroom.
They had something on the menu called "soy-rizo
" I guess a sub for chorizo?
No people from south of the border in this place except behind the counter.
Hipster crowd w/ ironic tee-shirt and unique shoes abound....
carne asada.author: Ross J.
carne asada.review: Ok, ok, people love the  salsa. It is true that the salsa is good. I even bought a jar, but ya gotta have somethng worthy of putting it on. The carne asada burrito was the weakest example of mexican I had seen here outside of the hard shell tacos at the school lunchroom.  They had something on the menu called "soy-rizo" I guess a sub for chorizo? No people from south of the border in this place except behind the counter. Hipster crowd w/ ironic tee-shirt and unique shoes abound....

excerpts: Try the carne asada tacos.
Yum!
carne asada.author: Miss Purr fec t.
carne asada.review: Healthy and delicious mexican food.  Quick , friendly service.  Low-key setting.  Reasonably priced.  Try the carne asada tacos.  Yum!

excerpts: Nearly every time I come here, I get the same thing--a carne asada super burrito.
carne asada.author: Steven W.
carne asada.review:
Nearly every time I come here, I get the same thing--a carne asada super burrito. Invariably, the burrito is so good that it makes me never want to eat any other burrito, and possibly never eat any other food.

The meat here is always cooked perfectly, and clearly starts out as pretty high-grade stuff, and everything in the burrito always tastes fresh--the flavors are all distinguishable from each other, all very good, always well-balanced. Plus they have refried black beans, which automatically earn them an extra star (can I give them 6?)

excerpts: My order was half of the triple threat burrito: full serving of tender grilled chicken, full serving of tangy carne asada, four succulent grilled prawns, rice, beans and cheese - made it into a super triple threat and it also included sour cream and guacamole!
Sounds pretty hefty, aye?
That's why I only had half
and I was good for the night.
The meat was a little chewy and the rice - dry, but the grilled chicken was juicy and the prawns were flavorful!

I could've used a side of fresh salsa but all they offered was a reddish orange hot sauce that kind of reminded me of the orange sauce La Vic's is famous for but sure enough, it didn't taste anything like it.
1.5 thumbs out 2, ain't bad at all.
carne asada.author: Ai Q.
carne asada.review: This little hole in the wall gets a 1.25 thumbs up from me. Although Bobby McFlay wasn't able to throw down on this joint or burrito or whatever so maybe a 1.5 instead for it being pretty good but not perfect. The ambiance is very hip and chill, a bit packed but the walls are red and covered in dope art pieces. You order your food at the register and wait to be seated while you're order is being cooked up. My order was half of the triple threat burrito: full serving of tender grilled chicken, full serving of tangy carne asada, four succulent grilled prawns, rice, beans and cheese - made it into a super triple threat and it also included sour cream and guacamole! Sounds pretty hefty, aye? That's why I only had half and I was good for the night. The meat was a little chewy and the rice - dry, but the grilled chicken was juicy and the prawns were flavorful! I could've used a side of fresh salsa but all they offered was a reddish orange hot sauce that kind of reminded me of the orange sauce La Vic's is famous for but sure enough, it didn't taste anything like it. 1.5 thumbs out 2, ain't bad at all.

excerpts: Based on a Bay Area DJ group, this is goodness X3 with the incorporation of carne asada, shrimp, and chicken.
Only thing I couldn't believe was the price.
It costs under $20.
Holy shh..!
My friend and I decided to split one, and also ordered some super nachos.
carne asada.author: Rhia R.
carne asada.review: I had to come and see for myself what all the hype was about with this place. It's already been crazy busy way before they were featured in Throwdown.
