Food: The fish tacos are fantastic, and I love the prawn quesadilla, rice and bean taco, fish quesadille (seriously the only time fish and cheese can be used together) and nachos. I recently tried the chile verde quesadilla and it was soooo good. It would be my new favorite except that it's pork, and I don't really eat pork. The pork pieces were tender and delicious though. Maybe next time I'll ask if they can leave out the pork pieces and just heap on that yummy green sauce.

For 99 cents, I always "super" my order because the guacamole rocks. You can't even get an avocado at the market for 99cents, and they give a generous portion. The salsa is smoky and just the right amount of kick to it. It's worth the 50 cent charge to get another helping! The chips are thin, crisp and always served warm. Yum. 

Service:  awesome. "Perdito", who flashes his ever cheerful silver accented smile, is already filling my "pepsi regular" when I walk in the door. When the owner Miguel is there he always takes a moment to say hello.  Update: the Pepsi machine is "out of order" apparently because of a tiff with an incompetent supplies. Miguel refuses to do business with the guy and as a result, I'm going through some kind of Pepsi withdrawal. The homemade horchata is good, but sometimes I want that chemical kick of Pepsi. Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrr. Judith, the girl at the counter is always friendly and polite and acts like it's totally normal that I eat there every day.

excerpts: I ordered the prawn burrito- $10 of worthlessness for a rice and bean burrito that only had 4 prawns.
prawn.author: Theresa P.
prawn.review:
Crap! If you pay the extra to get a "super" and still end up with a rice and bean burrito and don't mind, go here! You can tell this is the type of place that used to be good and the got a little popular- simply put; it's popularity got to it's head, like a high school girl who finally made the varsity cheerleading team.

I ordered the prawn burrito- $10 of worthlessness for a rice and bean burrito that only had 4 prawns.

Red flag- a Mexican restaurant with no mexicans- not a good sign.

The only thing good about this place is the salsa.

excerpts: Prawn tacos was not bad.
prawn.author: Maitai N.
prawn.review: Cheers for the great salsa:) Veggie burrito is awesome with lots of taste. Prawn tacos was not bad.

excerpts: Burritos at Papalote always satisfy, but for some reason on this particular visit, I went with the prawn quesadilla.
prawn.author: Audrey E.
prawn.review:
I should know by now that it's best to go with my gut (not my stomach, but my intuition).  Burritos at Papalote always satisfy, but for some reason on this particular visit, I went with the prawn quesadilla.  I was almost in shock at my plate: my quesadilla was cut up in four pieces, with one piece of shrimp for each slice.  It looked so sparse, I was ready to complain.  But instead I dug in, and I have to say I didn't think about complaining because there was so much flavor in that shrimp, anything else would've been a waste.

But I was hungry afterwards...  So maybe I should ask for a quesadilla w/ the works and extra shrimp?

excerpts: The salsa is awsome and I enjoyed everything I tried (carnitas tacos, prawn quesadilla and a bit of my friend's veggie burrito).
I will definitely go back.
prawn.author: Nicole M.
prawn.review: This place is absolutely delicious and it bustles. If you aren't too hungry, it worth the time you spend in line (and quite possibly waiting for a table). The salsa is awsome and I enjoyed everything I tried (carnitas tacos, prawn quesadilla and a bit of my friend's veggie burrito). I will definitely go back.

excerpts: 1 star: Prawn Tacos...
yes my friends, that's all I have to say!
1 star: My friends liked their dishes too, nachos, burrito.
1 star: The style and flavors aren't generic, must be the grillz!
prawn.author: Venatius P.
prawn.review:
1 star: It's colorful and well lite and a happening joint compared to many other taquerias in the mission. Line out the door...
1 star: Prawn Tacos...yes my friends, that's all I have to say!
1 star: My friends liked their dishes too, nachos, burrito.
1 star: The style and flavors aren't generic, must be the grillz!

excerpts: This time I purchased a Prawn Super Burrito for $12.50 and of course I was still hungry.
Why?
prawn.author: jay m.
prawn.review:
$12 burrito what a joke!!!!! Two years later I gave this place a second chance and it was more disappointing this time around. Before I go any furher....I must tell you I decided to become a member of Yelp just to post this review tonight. Last time, I ordered a Triple Threat Burrito and paid close to $30 and was still hungry. Triple Threat doesn't mean triple the size or triple the meat/shrimp. This time I purchased a Prawn Super Burrito for $12.50 and of course I was still hungry. Why? There was only 4 shrimp inside. The only reason this place is still in business is because it was featured on The Food Network with Bobby Flay's showdown. It was because the salsa is good and on that episode the burrito was much larger. Please if you don't believe me; look it up on the web. 

The employees have attitude like they work at Gary Danko's except they don't! The chips are horrible and they couldn't more frugal with the amount of salsa and chips they provide.  I will never go back again!!!!! 

If you want something good and filling even though not Mexican go to Phat Philly's around the corner. It was delicious although still pricey...worth the $12 for a large. 

If you want real Mexican food or for that matter a delicous  burrito; go to La Cumbre, La Morena or La Tapatia. The last  two options are in South San Francisco.

Please don't support this establishment unless you think a shrimp is worth $3. 

Good Luck in your search and don't believe the hype on the reviews. 

Jay

excerpts: I got the grilled prawn burrito (on a plate without the tortilla).....with guac, sour cream and black beans.....
absolutely HEAVENLY with their famous sauce.....and probably 1000 calories less without that tortilla!
Also has the watermelon Agua Fresca.....and which I loved so much that I got it to go.......YUM!
prawn.author: Lee M.
prawn.review: After becoming Gluten Free (by choice).....I still have LOVE for my papalote! I got the grilled prawn burrito (on a plate without the tortilla).....with guac, sour cream and black beans.....absolutely HEAVENLY with their famous sauce.....and probably 1000 calories less without that tortilla! Also has the watermelon Agua Fresca.....and which I loved so much that I got it to go.......YUM!

excerpts: There are a good two prawns in their prawn tacos and the rest of the pico de gallo and lettuce they use, while it's quality and I do like that
prawn.author: Lauren G.
prawn.review:
Their smokey tasting salsa really is the shit and I can never get enough.  It is, that good.

I'm a big fan of choosing seafood options when going out for Mexican dining.  This is definitely where Papalote is lacking.  There are a good two prawns in their prawn tacos and the rest of the pico de gallo and lettuce they use, while it's quality and I do like that, it's just that it is basically what you end up getting full on, not shrimp.

Don't get me wrong, I do like this place - a lot, it's very good.

My only other complaint is that they use enough garlic in their veggie and seafood dishes it's practically sacrilegious.

However, this could be a great arsenal against an unwanted admirer/stalker . . . 

The burritos are good and the quesadilla are also, ask for their house salsa on everything, it really takes it up a notch.

excerpts: My girlfriend and I split a gigantic prawn burrito that was awesome.
prawn.author: Augie S.
prawn.review:
Oh gawd, this place was good.  Many have rated this place on yelp and very few have rated less than 4 stars.  They definitely deserve the high ratings.

The menu was a little pricey I thought at first until I took the first bite.  My girlfriend and I split a gigantic prawn burrito that was awesome.  Between that and the chips and salsa, it was a very filling, delicious meal.

I have not been back yet but I would definitely recommend this place to friends.  Very good stuff!!

excerpts: I've had the prawn tacos and the veggie burrito...
both very good.
I've also tried the tofu and it was delicious (my beef eating friends order it!).
Be careful if ordering a side of beans....
it's a whole plate!
And their guacamole is dang good if you just add a lil salt.
Also, the prices are ridiculously affordable.
Makes me not feel so bad for eating out instead of making my own dinner!
prawn.author: Shantal M.
prawn.review: The salsa alone deserves all the stars.  I ask for extra so I can bring it home and add it to my own dishes.  I've had the prawn tacos and the veggie burrito...both very good.  I've also tried the tofu and it was delicious (my beef eating friends order it!).  Be careful if ordering a side of beans....it's a whole plate! And their guacamole is dang good if you just add a lil salt.  Also, the prices are ridiculously affordable.  Makes me not feel so bad for eating out instead of making my own dinner!

excerpts: I almost always get the prawn burrito or taco's
and they are basically perfect...
I've also had a quesadilla there too...
but...what makes this place so uber delicious is their sauce/salsa or
whatever you want to call it...
it's sooo spicy...yet sooo good
prawn.author: Tony A.
prawn.review: Seriously, this place is one of the best Mexican joints I've been to...I almost always get the prawn burrito or taco's and they are basically perfect...I've also had a quesadilla there too...but...what makes this place so uber delicious is their sauce/salsa or whatever you want to call it...it's sooo spicy...yet sooo good :)

excerpts: I had the prawn burriton...
my fave, but here it was dry, bland, and not even remotely memorable.
Love me sum dirty,  hole in the wall "Mission" mexi place...
this ain't it.
prawn.author: D C.
prawn.review: Orange salsa was slightly off putting, but tasted alright once you got used to it.  Completely turned off by the barbaric girl sitting close to me...close your mouth when you eat chips so the remnants don't keep flying into my food biatch!  My roommate order the carne asada plate, her response - ehhh.  I had the prawn burriton...my fave, but here it was dry, bland, and not even remotely memorable.  Love me sum dirty,  hole in the wall "Mission" mexi place...this ain't it.

excerpts: The grilled prawn tacos are ridic, too, it's one of my faves.
prawn.author: Emily T.
prawn.review: Fantastic!  This is one of my favorite mission spots.  I really love the guac here, I could eat bowls of it.  The fajitas are great if you're looking for something other than the standard, a burrito.  One thing, ask for extra tortillas, they only give you one.  The grilled prawn tacos are ridic, too, it's one of my faves.

excerpts: The prawn burrito is my favorite, but the veggie fajitas (eggplant, zucchini, carrots, etc.) are satisfying if you're really hungry.
The only downside about this place is the wait, because sometimes the lines are out-
the- door, which really sucks when you make the commute
and there's no where to sit.
So plan accordingly if you go at night.
prawn.author: Leah E.
prawn.review:
Best salsa I've ever had in my life, and TRUST, I have had many a salsa to compare, being a San Diegan and a Mexican food enthusiast. 
Papalote is healthy, fresh, flavorful, and unique. They offer black beans and whole wheat tortillas for crying out loud! Plus their veggie burritos come with carrots and potatoes in replacement of sour cream and cheese. But of course you can add the fats if you want... just ask to "super" your meal. The prawn burrito is my favorite, but the veggie fajitas (eggplant, zucchini, carrots, etc.) are satisfying if you're really hungry.
The only downside about this place is the wait, because sometimes the lines are out- the- door, which really sucks when you make the commute and there's no where to sit. So plan accordingly if you go at night.

excerpts: Like my prawn burrito with hardly any prawns in it.
And yes, that creamy orange salsa is awesome, but you have to pay extra for chips & salsa, and even then you only get a tiny bowl of chips.
I could get the same delicious sauce by ordering the fajitas at El Toreador in West Portal.
prawn.author: Wes M.
prawn.review: Papalote, a hipsterized taqueria with colorful walls and an impressive array of veggie options (mmm...soyrizo), is clearly a darling of the Mission scene.  Even in the middle of the afternoon with half the tables empty, there was a takeout line going out the door.  But I have to go with Maria D on this one:    you're paying for this trendiness with small portions.  Like my prawn burrito with hardly any prawns in it.  And yes, that creamy orange salsa is awesome, but you have to pay extra for chips & salsa, and even then you only get a tiny bowl of chips.  I could get the same delicious sauce by ordering the fajitas at El Toreador in West Portal.  Otherwise, I'll stick to the authentic taquerias for my burrito fix--soyrizo or no.

excerpts: I always get the super prawn burrito with no pico de gallo and extra roasted salsa.
prawn.author: Nisha M.
prawn.review: When I went to college on the east coast I had my friends ship me jars and jars of this salsa. I always get the super prawn burrito with no pico de gallo and extra roasted salsa. The shrimp burrito is good too.

excerpts: my favorite is the prawn burrito.
only four stars because my burritos could always use an extra prawn or two.
prawn.author: maggie m.
prawn.review:
at first, i really didn't want to like this place because of the lines and sometimes annoying customers (you know, the dudes with skinny jeans and 80s style haircuts). but they've never disappointed me.  my favorite is the prawn burrito.  also, i love their refried black beans and they have plenty of veggie options.  only four stars because my burritos could always use an extra prawn or two.  plus, i don't think they need to charge for an extra side of hot sauce- considering, its about 3 tablespoons of sauce. 

the best times to go are before or after the lunch/dinner rush.  you will easily find a place to sit and maybe your food will be prepared with an extra amount of tlc.

excerpts: The super Prawn buritto really satisfied me.
My wife and I likey likey.
prawn.author: William M.
prawn.review: This is definately a SF gem. The food is authentic and the atmosphere is friendly. The super Prawn buritto really satisfied me. My wife and I likey likey.

excerpts: I love prawn tacos
, I love hipsters, I love Reggae Djs, I love watermelon agua fresca, and I love the smokey delicious salsa.
prawn.author: Roxane S.
prawn.review: Yeah! I love prawn tacos, I love hipsters, I love Reggae Djs, I love watermelon agua fresca, and I love the smokey delicious salsa. The mole tacos are pretty tasty as well. Go here, why not?

excerpts: The husband and I were still full from Dynamo Donuts (health nuts we are not), so we decided to be good and split a prawn burrito.
Yet again, I was amazed by how something that can be quite heavy seemed so light.
prawn.author: Rachel G.
prawn.review: I love me a good burrito, and Papalote delivers and then some! The husband and I were still full from Dynamo Donuts (health nuts we are not), so we decided to be good and split a prawn burrito. Yet again, I was amazed by how something that can be quite heavy seemed so light. Such a delicious burrito - shrimp were cooked to perfection, and the veggies inside were uber tasty! The tortilla chips could have used a wee bit more salt (and seemed a bit stale), but that phenomenal salsa that came with them (probably the best I've ever had) more than made up for that.

excerpts: I recommend the prawn burrito as well from when I was a carnivore.
Nacho experiences here vary: I have had burned chips a few times.
Also They must put crack in the salsa
cuz I crave it baaaddd!!
and the guac is good too.
Always a line out the door so it helps to call ahead and they have great photography on the walls.
Good for family, date, take out, and hangovers.
prawn.author: M K.
prawn.review: Back in the day when I worked at Buffalo Exchange I would go here about twice a month. It's a favorite for two reasons- non greasy mex and great vegetarian menu. The soyrizo burrito is awesome! And tofu mole tacos are decent. I recommend the prawn burrito as well from when I was a carnivore. Nacho experiences here vary: I have had burned chips a few times. Also They must put crack in the salsa cuz I crave it baaaddd!! and the guac is good too. Always a line out the door so it helps to call ahead and they have great photography on the walls. Good for family, date, take out, and hangovers.

excerpts: The prawn tacos are the absolute best.
I could eat them everyday.
The decor is great although they could use a little more room.
It's always crowded so get there when they open.
prawn.author: Molly W.
prawn.review: The best Mexican food in San Francisco. Period.  Their salsa is the best I've ever tasted. The prawn tacos are the absolute best. I could eat them everyday.  The decor is great although they could use a little more room. It's always crowded so get there when they open.

excerpts: MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.
The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.
Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy.
There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper)
Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.
prawn.author: Miss Information X.
prawn.review: I didn't think that the food was that great.  It's clean and bright and the serivice is just fine.  I just fail to understand how there could be lines out the door of this place. Perhaps because it is veggie friendly?  Maybe I should have ordered something vegetarian?  MD and I each ordered a quesadilla.  MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.  The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.  Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy. There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper) Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.

excerpts: The steak and prawn burrito will go down as one of my favorite burritos in the history of me eating burritos.
They've also got a great selection of beverages.
prawn.author: Kevin L.
prawn.review: The sun-dried tomato salsa they make is fantastic. The steak and prawn burrito will go down as one of my favorite burritos in the history of me eating burritos. They've also got a great selection of beverages.

excerpts: Ordered Prawn burrito which had waaaayyy too much garlic-but not enough prawns -that
I couldn't taste anything else in the burrito.
prawn.author: Chuck T.
prawn.review:
Looked forward to the advertised "flaky" tortilla -- which it was not. Ordered Prawn burrito which had waaaayyy too much garlic-but not enough prawns -that I couldn't taste anything else in the burrito.  Btw, size of burrito is smaller than other places. 

Chips are not memorable. Salsa was good. Thought it stingy when another customer asked for chips refill and was given a response of, "$1" (for a small bowl!!!).  Is it true they buy the chips hence the fee? With all the hype, in real life, it was a let down. Would rather go to Taqueria Cancun or Pancho Villa. 

p.s. yes, I agree with the lack of "energy" staff members had -- or didn't have. And also agree that I was additionally put off with the bathroom.

excerpts: Their prawn tacos used to be two big prawns
but now it's little shrimps...
they should really bring back the prawns, they are so damn good.
Also 2 tacos for under $5 is a pretty good deal considering how gentrified Valencia Street has become.
prawn.author: Gina R.
prawn.review: It's really good and healthy, but lately the tortillas for the tacos are falling apart as you eat them, so if I could give this 3 and a half stars, I would. In the past, the tacos were SO GOOD with the delicious lettuce and super tasty and not too spicy salsa. Nachos are delish as well. Burritos are good too. If you have a strong stomach you should try the soyrizo burrito, it's pretty good. I have foresaken that one, gave me gas. Their prawn tacos used to be two big prawns but now it's little shrimps...they should really bring back the prawns, they are so damn good. Also 2 tacos for under $5 is a pretty good deal considering how gentrified Valencia Street has become.

excerpts: Had the Prawn burrito.
The prawns tasted like they had been left in oil all day and never rinsed.
The taste of oil was overwhelming!
Not good.
I had a bite of my wife's burrito pescado, and it was decent, but nothing to rave about.
prawn.author: Scott M.
prawn.review: Had the Prawn burrito. The prawns tasted like they had been left in oil all day and never rinsed. The taste of oil was overwhelming! Not good. I had a bite of my wife's burrito pescado, and it was decent, but nothing to rave about. Asked for extra salsa (the salsa was good), and even though they only gave us one tiny cup for two people, another cost us 50 cents. Not good. No horchata, no melon drink. Not good. Overall, Papalote costs more on a pretension for being a high quality "mexican grill" when in reality it's just a so-so taqueria dressed up in bright colors.

excerpts: i had the prawn burrito.
not many prawns in there, but they were tasty.
prawn.author: reza n.
prawn.review:
yummy food, servers weren't so nice.  though it could have been from the heat and the crowds or something.  and bugs everywhere.  kept jumping on my leg and in the water.  not sure what type of bugs they were.  one was fried onto a corn chip.  good salsa too.

p.s. i had the prawn burrito.  not many prawns in there, but they were tasty.

excerpts: My favorite thing to order are the Prawn Burritos
( They are so good ).
Miguelito, ( El Jefe ) is also one of the sweetest men I know.
He's also a fabulous D.J.!
You'll be seeing me soon mister...
Anywho,
before I get off track i wanna end this by saying...
Your gonna fall in love with this place if you just try it.
prawn.author: Aurita U.
prawn.review: Papalotes is THE SHIT! Mmmmmm... Just thinking about it makes my mouth water. I would have to say that its a must to eat here! Its healthy, tasty, and like everybody knows... The salsa is deeee-licious!  My favorite thing to order are the Prawn Burritos ( They are so good ). Miguelito, ( El Jefe ) is also one of the sweetest men I know. He's also a fabulous D.J.! You'll be seeing me soon mister... =0) Anywho, before I get off track i wanna end this by saying... Your gonna fall in love with this place if you just try it.

excerpts: nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn.
what!), food with integrity.
prawn.author: mark c.
prawn.review:
frreeessssshhhhh. thats the version here. remixed with health conscious ingredients. no LARD. vegan friendly. 

nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn. what!), food with integrity. fresh fresas and horchata made daily.

the salsa. if you know, then i need not go any further.
if you dont, well, thats your fault. 

soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla. 
i mean c'mon, can you say that about another burrito joint? 

the staff is friendly, fast, and efficient.

party flyers, community events, and awards plaster the walls and counter, i mean does your burrito joint have a write up in the 
WALL ST JOURNAL? 
didnt think so.

but hey, dont take my word for it. peep game yo.
you wont be sad, unless the grease, lard, and oil is your thing.

excerpts: I ordered a prawn burrito and the prawns were bad.
That was the last straw for me with Papalote.
Such a shame :(
prawn.author: Stephanie K.
prawn.review: In the past, I did enjoy the huge burritos and special salsa at Papalote.  Then, one unfortunate day, I was eating in and a cockroach crawled down the wall beside me while I was eating.  When I notified the staff, they didn't seem to care.  Needless to say, I couldn't finish eating anything after that.  Still, I gave Papalote a second chance after it appeared on Food Network.  I ordered a prawn burrito and the prawns were bad.  That was the last straw for me with Papalote.  Such a shame :(

excerpts: I haven't tried much of the menu because as soon as I got to the Prawn burrito, I stopped right there and haven't moved.
prawn.author: Rachelle M.
prawn.review:
Oh man. I haven't tried much of the menu because as soon as I got to the Prawn burrito, I stopped right there and haven't moved. Mmmmm perfectly blackened, big ol shrimp, fresh vegetables, great beans etc.

Also, great secret-recipe salsa. Sort of smoky and creamy, their salsa is...

excerpts: I love the prawn burrito.
I've tried other burritos --
but I always come back to this one....
prawn.author: Sara O.
prawn.review: The salsa is so good that I buy an extra jar every time I go to take home with me!  I love the prawn burrito.  I've tried other burritos -- but I always come back to this one....

excerpts: basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos.
and to super size it
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
their grilled veggie tacos are devine.
i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste.
overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again.
also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful.
the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area.
i will recommend it!
also it is close to 24th street mission bart.
prawn.author: Cindy L.
prawn.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: and they're like cheese less?!?
Disappointing.
I called the restaurant and I am now getting a credit for the new nachos next time.
I actually did check them before I left just to make sure I got the right order
but I should've looked a little bit longer.
Bummed, I live like 20 minutes out.
Oh yeah and look how messy I got them.
cheese.author: Tere C.
cheese.review:
So I was in the mission and decided to get my nachos that I so love from this place. I get home and they're like cheese less?!? Disappointing. I called the restaurant and I am now getting a credit for the new nachos next time. 
I actually did check them before I left just to make sure I got the right order but I should've looked a little bit longer.  
Bummed, I live like 20 minutes out.
*Oh yeah and look how messy I got them.

excerpts: They also come with beans, salsa, and cheese.
The house chips are excellent and they also threw in an app of chips with papalote dipping sauce.
I came hungry and barely finished it
you can easily split it with 2 people and its delicious.
cheese.author: Sean G.
cheese.review: Quaint little spot by the 24th bart with great mexican food. Iv been having a nacho craving and heard these maybe the best and they didn't disapoint. I ordered the chicken nachos and added guac and sour cream. They also come with beans, salsa, and cheese. The house chips are excellent and they also threw in an app of chips with papalote dipping sauce. I came hungry and barely finished it you can easily split it with 2 people and its delicious.

excerpts: Get a burrito and pack it full of veggies and refried black beans, order it with sour cream, guacamole, and cheese.
Devour it with the free side of salsa and the delicately crunch chips.
Add hot sauce if you're into that.
You'll be so happy and y'all want to come back every time you're in the Mission.
If you're in a rush, order it to go because there is likely to be a wait for seating.
Get even more salsa because it is so good!
cheese.author: Adam H.
cheese.review: I'll keep it short and sweet! Go here if you want a big, good, Cali-Mex meal. Get a burrito and pack it full of veggies and refried black beans, order it with sour cream, guacamole, and cheese. Devour it with the free side of salsa and the delicately crunch chips. Add hot sauce if you're into that. You'll be so happy and y'all want to come back every time you're in the Mission. If you're in a rush, order it to go because there is likely to be a wait for seating. Get even more salsa because it is so good!

excerpts: Adding cheese, guac, or sour cream are each $1.
Kind of a bummer, since burritos usually include cheese.
cheese.author: Joy W.
cheese.review:
About six years ago, Flay challenged Papalote to a burrito contest and the triple threat burrito triumphed. I wish I knew what Papalote was like before it was featured on Throwdown. Was the triple threat always $20? Back then, $20 was a lot of cash for a burrito and it still is now, but at least that burrito hasn't been affected by inflation in these past few years. Also, the hype has calmed down compared to those crowds after the episode first aired. 

Triple Threat - chicken breast, carne asada, prawns:
It's loaded with 3 types of proteins, but I don't feel threatened. The taste and quality is on par with most burritos, so in comparison, the price tag sure is steep. The grilled prawns were the best part. They're tender and springy with a nice char. Plus, the prawns are left whole instead of chopped up beyond recognition. The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too. 
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals. It's also a good decision if you have a tough time choosing between poultry, beef, & seafood, or if you're just curious to try it, but it is not a must have.

The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp. The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey. Adding cheese, guac, or sour cream are each $1. Kind of a bummer, since burritos usually include cheese. If you're going to add one, you might as well add all 3 for $2, resulting in a very creamy burrito. 

Of course the roasted tomato salsa is excellent. It is the true threat here. This thick & creamy, robust, orange sauce is like a flavor explosion of smokey, sweet, savory, spicy, and slightly tart. This salsa is excellent on their thin, warm chips, as well as on everything else. Jars of Papalote's various salsas are available for purchase in various local markets. 
Overall, I'm satisfied with the food, but the prices are high relative to other Mexican joints in the Mission, so I give it a 7.25/10.

excerpts: Last I checked, their "make it super" option, which adds sour cream, cheese, and guacamole was only $1.
cheese.author: Adele F.
cheese.review:
Holy. Guacamole. Papalote now has a "buy 10 burritos get 1 free" frequent rewards card.

This is new! As of a few weeks ago! I could have gotten so many free burritos by now!

Aside from free burritos, what makes this place great?

1) Convenient. I live a block from this location. And when my friends and I are feeling like lazy bums...sorry, since we ARE lazy bums, we call in bulk to-go orders, wait 15 minutes, and send over volunteer tributes to pick up our stash.

2) Quality. Their meat is GOOD. Tender. Moist. And they are so generous. One of my girls swears by two menu items: the mole and the chile verde. I've tried both, and I'm a much bigger fan of the CHILE VERDE because the pork makes my taste buds dance a happy dance. I get it as a salad to cut down on carbs and because the jicama and fresh salsa pair so well with the salty pork and the awesome green serrano sauce, which I drizzle errywhere. I've also tried their carne asada burrito and breakfast burrito, both of which are bomb. Oh, when they say scrambled eggs, they really mean pulverized eggs--it's pretty awesome.

3) Customizable. Tacos, burritos, naked burritos, quesadillas, salads--meat/tofu vehicles of all types. Last I checked, their "make it super" option, which adds sour cream, cheese, and guacamole was only $1. Seems like the prices now are more expensive per online source?

4) Crack sauce. When I first tried it, I wasn't a big fan because it's spicy. It's still spicy, but I've learned to better ignore my screaming pain receptors. There's something about eating crunchy tortilla chips with a creamy sauce that makes everything taste way better. I love this combination so much that I always save my leftover chips and sauce for future snacking. I even save my friends' leftover chips and sauce. My boyfriend thinks I'm crazy, squirreling away all of those mini sauce containers in our fridge. I think I'm GENIUS. They sell jars of this stuff, and I'm getting it FO' FREE.

5) REWARDS CARD. This perk deserves to be repeated. FYI: valid for burrito purchases only.

Downside: seating. It looks like a seat-yourself situation, but one of the waitstaff will usually be around the dining room entrance to keep an eye out for tables. The room holds about 20 people, so you might have to wait for a bit during rush hours.

But srsly, Papalote is dope-alote. Time to reap some free burritos.

excerpts: The actual food I ordered were the nachos with shrimp, and personally I wasn't blown away -- the nachos were topped with a lot of melted shredded cheese, tomatoes, and beans, but not much else

and they were somewhat skimpy on the shrimp (i.e. I can get more shrimp for half the price from a cheapo taqueria in the same part of town, or in Redwood CIty where I live within a mile from about 5 Mexican restaurants).
cheese.author: Anita T.
cheese.review:
Cute place with a decent amount of seating for a food establishment in the city, and some REEEEEEEALLY amazing salsa. The 3 stars here are mostly for that salsa, which is made of pureed roasted tomato and chipotle peppers, blended until its creamy without dairy added in. IT IS AMAZING. You get a cup of the salsa and complimentary chips while waiting for your order, which was the highlight of the meal. They also sell the salsa at the cash register and I've actually seen it at some supermarkets on the peninsula. 

The actual food I ordered were the nachos with shrimp, and personally I wasn't blown away -- the nachos were topped with a lot of melted shredded cheese, tomatoes, and beans, but not much else and they were somewhat skimpy on the shrimp (i.e. I can get more shrimp for half the price from a cheapo taqueria in the same part of town, or in Redwood CIty where I live within a mile from about 5 Mexican restaurants). The overall effect was kind of bland, which was unfortunate since the salsa we got at the start was so good. 

Verdict: Come here for that damn salsa.

excerpts: He made it super by adding fresh guacamole, cheese and  sour cream.
The marriage between all of the ingredients worked magically, I wouldn't change a single thing about this burrito.
Though the price is fairly steep ($19.99), it can easily be shared among two people and the quality and taste alone are enough for me to pay the whooping fee each and every time.
The papalote salsa is pretty epic, though not as spicy as I'd like it to be.
The roasted tomatoes and chili provide a bit of a smokey flavor, the salsa is a full-bodied/robust work of art boasting in both flavor and aroma.
I purchased one to take home and finished it in three days.
I built my own burrito as well and the menu allows for optimal customization if you don't want one of their signature burritos.
I was able to chose between the type of beans, rice, meat and tortilla I wanted.
cheese.author: Astrid Z.
cheese.review:
Thank you, Food Network for leading me here!

Food: My boyfriend was so cool and decided to order the Triple Threat Burrito. Larger than my forearm, this creation included chunks of tender carne asada, smoked prawns, succulent achiote chicken, rice, beans and slightly piquant papalote salsa. He made it super by adding fresh guacamole, cheese and  sour cream. The marriage between all of the ingredients worked magically, I wouldn't change a single thing about this burrito. Though the price is fairly steep ($19.99), it can easily be shared among two people and the quality and taste alone are enough for me to pay the whooping fee each and every time. The papalote salsa is pretty epic, though not as spicy as I'd like it to be. The roasted tomatoes and chili provide a bit of a smokey flavor, the salsa is a full-bodied/robust work of art boasting in both flavor and aroma. I purchased one to take home and finished it in three days. I built my own burrito as well and the menu allows for optimal customization if you don't want one of their signature burritos. I was able to chose between the type of beans, rice, meat and tortilla I wanted. I basically built myself a super healthy burrito (brown rice, wheat tortilla, black beans, chicken), however it was still ridiculously delicious and better than anything Chiptole could ever manufacture for me. I highly recommend any of their burritos, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Price: On the pricier end and they'll tack on more for adding any extra ingredients. However, the food here is certainly worth the price every time. 

Ambiance: Small, simple and clean. I saw a ton of people waiting outside to either get a table
or pick up carry-out orders.

Service: Quick and friendly servers, limited interaction with employees.

Overall: Authentic, fresh and ridiculously appetizing Mexican eats. I approve and can't wait
to come back for more!

excerpts: I upgrade it to a Super Burrito to add sour cream, cheese, and guacamole for 99 cents AKA the best purchase I've made for 99 cents.
cheese.author: Kristal D.
cheese.review:
Breakfast is the most important meal of the day, so it's important to treat yourself with Papalote's breakfast burrito. 

The Chorizo Breakfast Burrito is heaven on a plate - savory and authentic! I upgrade it to a Super Burrito to add sour cream, cheese, and guacamole for 99 cents AKA the best purchase I've made for 99 cents. 

The burrito is massive, so I cut it into two massive halves. Everything is perfectly warm inside the burrito and the scrambled eggs meshes well with the rest of the ingredients. I've never had a breakfast burrito like it! 

Each order comes with side of tortilla chips and orange sauce. Their orange sauce is highly addictive with just the right kick. I'm such a weak *sauce* to anything spicy, but when it comes to their orange sauce...I'm willing to sacrifice some sweat and tears. 

I've only tried the breakfast burritos, but I know Papalote Mexican Grill was voted as one of the best places to eat a burrito in San Francisco. I'd love to come back and try their other ones. 

Definitely worth it to grab a bite here!

excerpts: I really enjoyed my "naked" chicken burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guac on the side.
cheese.author: Sarah Z.
cheese.review:
Wow, their house salsa/sauce is awesome! I've never had anything like it. It's soo good! 

I really enjoyed my "naked" chicken burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guac on the side. They load it up! 

My man was not super impressed with his Mexipino burrito. It was good, just not what you'd expect a burrito to be. The flavors were more subtle and vinegar-based (hence the nod to Filipino food) and less about the spices of Mexican food. He will try a regular burrito the next time we go, and hopefully this will one day become a 5 star review. Looking forward to next time!

excerpts: (This review about food is only for Mole tofu burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.)

Bad:
- Mole was super salty!
(It was about 7 PM.
So it might be cooked down and concentrated?
(PLEASE TASTE IT FROM TIME
TO TIME!!!)
- Horchata was thin and waterly...
I should avoid mole next time.
cheese.author: Mariko H.
cheese.review:
I heard good things about Papalote Mexican Grill but I have a mixed feeling about it on my first visit... (This review about food is only for Mole tofu burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.)

Good:
- friendly stuff
- fast service
- reasonable price
- variety of choices for tortilla, beans, and ingredients
- tasty Papalote salsa that comes with chips! (I want to buy a bottle next time.)

Bad:
- Mole was super salty! (It was about 7 PM. So it might be cooked down and concentrated? (PLEASE TASTE IT FROM TIME TO TIME!!!)
- Horchata was thin and waterly... (Maybe it has been sitting there for a long time and diluted...?)

This place is extremely popular. People are constantly making a long line. It's supposed to be good. I should avoid mole next time.

excerpts:
Boring Nachos with very little cheese. 
I have guacamole and their sauce on the side. 
Won't order this again.
cheese.author: cheryl R.
cheese.review:
Boring Nachos with very little cheese. 
I have guacamole and their sauce on the side. 
Won't order this again.

excerpts: Always get the chicken burrito with everything (you pay extra $2 for sour cream, cheese and guac).
cheese.author: Jatin M.
cheese.review: I love Papalote! I make sure I go there to eat if I am in SF (not often - hate the traffic!). I love their salsa. Always get the chicken burrito with everything (you pay extra $2 for sour cream, cheese and guac). My friend had shrimp nachos one time and they were awesome too. It's not cheap though. You can expect $12/person here. Small tight space inside.

excerpts: The carne asada quesadilla was OK, the cheese was a little too gritty for my taste.
but it was 25% prawns, 75% tortilla and cheese.
I would recommend the carne asada burrito and douse that baby with their famous salsa (ask for easy on the beans).
cheese.author: Jess C.
cheese.review:
Papalote drew much of its fame from winning the throwdown against Bobby Flay on Food Network. Their salsa was so famous that they decided to bottle and sell it; and I have to admit it was good and very unique because it's heavy on the creamy side, thick, and completely blended through.

The food was good.... depending on what you order. The carne asada quesadilla was OK, the cheese was a little too gritty for my taste. The prawn quesadilla was tasty but it was 25% prawns, 75% tortilla and cheese. 

I would recommend the carne asada burrito and douse that baby with their famous salsa (ask for easy on the beans). The rice-meat-beans proportion is perfect (unlike the heavy on the rice/beans at Cancun or Farrolito), and the serving size is generous. 

Note: Not a fan of the stale chips.

excerpts: the meal was very chewy and even though I got a "super" which is an extra $2 for guac, sour cream, and cheese, it was somehow bland.
cheese.author: Emma M.
cheese.review:
Got a naked carne asada "burrito" which is basically a chipotle bowl but not as flavorful. the meal was very chewy and even though I got a "super" which is an extra $2 for guac, sour cream, and cheese, it was somehow bland. 

Salsa is amazing. 

BF's chicken burrito on the tomato tortilla was good.

excerpts: It had beans, cheese and rice and the smallest amount of salsa.
It tasted as boring as it sounds.
cheese.author: Carissa B.
cheese.review:
I was pretty disappointed with this place, given the great reviews. We ordered delivery. The food came pretty quickly. 

The food was alright, but definitely not worth 5 stars. I will definitely be searching around for other options the next time I am craving Mexican food. I got a burrito and it was just okay. It had beans, cheese and rice and the smallest amount of salsa. It tasted as boring as it sounds. My boyfriend got a chicken quesadilla and he felt very neutral about it and said he was not a fan of the spicing of the chicken. 

The biggest issue we had may or may not be the restaurant's fault. However, we ordered using Order Ahead and we did not have the options it seemed other customers had on the menu. For example, there was no option to get a "super burrito". If I wanted to add sour cream to the order it was $2.00 extra, etc. If you wanted extra chicken, it was something like  $6.50! Maybe there is a mistake with the menu within this app but this seems to be way too much for add ons.

excerpts: Really love the appetizer that's cheese and chorizo.
A little greasy
but it's delicious.
I had a super vegetarian quesadilla that was really good as well.
I don't agree with everyone about them having the best salsa , but I will say they pretty much make everything good
.It's a solid place to get food
cheese.author: Lauren V.
cheese.review: Really love the appetizer that's cheese and chorizo. A little greasy but it's delicious. I had a super vegetarian quesadilla that was really good as well. I don't agree with everyone about them having the best salsa , but I will say they pretty much make everything good .It's a solid place to get food

excerpts: Our kids got a cheese quesadilla ($5.15) and 4 chicken tacos ($19).
cheese.author: R A.
cheese.review:
I was not impressed. At all. My friend and I split the chicken mole burrito. Meh. Our kids got a cheese quesadilla ($5.15) and 4 chicken tacos ($19). The chicken was nicely seasoned but the taco tortillas were kinda stiff. 

The guacamole was good but $9.75??   The service was excellent.

I would give the food 3 stars cuz it wasn't "bad" but the prices were too high for what you got, so I gave it 2 stars.

excerpts: The guacamole was mashed up avocado w no favor, the pico de gallo was chopped tomatoes with no flavor, the cheese wasn't melted & the steak was super dry & tasted like Taco Bell steak
(sorry Taco Bell).
The horchata was the worst!
It tasted like lemonade!
cheese.author: Rosie D.
cheese.review:
Why in God's name would "Mexican" be included in the name of this establishment?  I've walked by this place for the past year on my way to work in Noe Valley & always wanted to get it.  Today I left work early & thought I would treat myself to some steak nachos. What a mistake that was.  $13+ for a bowl of chips with less than 1/2 cup of toppings combined.  What's that 1000% mark up? The guacamole was mashed up avocado w no favor, the pico de gallo was chopped tomatoes with no flavor, the cheese wasn't melted & the steak was super dry & tasted like Taco Bell steak (sorry Taco Bell).  The horchata was the worst!  It tasted like lemonade!  I was so disappointed.  

Gone are the days when you could go to the Mission for cheap burritos & nacho plates.  Considering who now lives in the Mission I'm not surprised.  I'm sure this place will continue to be packed by transplant hipsters that don't know any better.  As for me I'll stick to La Tapatia in SSF where you can get nachos for half the price that you can share w 2 or 3 friends.

excerpts: Adding sour cream, cheese and guacamole on my mexican /filipino burrito, the price came up quite a bit more compared to other mexican places.
cheese.author: K. G.
cheese.review: Based on other yelp reviews, I expected way better food.  The salsa wasn't what I expected, it was creamy, not chunky.  Adding sour cream, cheese and guacamole on my mexican /filipino burrito, the price came up quite a bit more compared to other mexican places.  Someone else had the fish burrito bowl and it was fine. The cashier didn't bother giving me a receipt and the restaurant has a very small seating area.  Overall, kinda disappointed.

excerpts: I think they might put a TEENY bit too much shredded cheese
but I guess it just depends on your taste.
cheese.author: Sylvia N.
cheese.review:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to try Papalote!

My boyfriend & I were craving really good salsa so I checked on Yelp & saw that I had bookmarked Papalote for years - perfect!
It was a beautiful day in San Francisco. 
We found parking almost immediately & was welcomed with upbeat Mexican music when we walked in. 
I ordered the fish tacos & my boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito.  
Each order comes with side of tortilla chips & salsa. 
This salsa was DELICIOUS - very unique, not too spicy, not bland & very creamy. 
My boyfriend wished it had a little more tomato-ness to it, but I thought it was great.

My fish tacos came out & they were amazing!
There were nicely cut chunks of fresh fish in there & they didn't skimp out at all. 
I think they might put a TEENY bit too much shredded cheese but I guess it just depends on your taste. 
I have to say these fish tacos are the best that I've tried in SF thus far!

My boyfriend really enjoyed his burrito. 
I tried it out & I thought it had a really good grilled flavor to it. 
The meat was tender - not dry at all (which surprised me because it looks dry at first glance).  
The one thing I would say is that I think they put too much rice. 

Overall great experience at Papalote. 
As other reviewers have mentioned, it IS a bit pricey - so don't go in there thinking you'll have a cheap meal. 
We paid $23 for the tacos (which comes in two), the burrito, & one horchata.

excerpts: If you get a burrito, make it super so you can get sour cream, guac and cheese!
I've heard to tofu is very good as well
cheese.author: Malika R.
cheese.review:
All I can say about Papalote is I love the salsa!! Everytime I've gone, I've wanted to buy a bottle of it but I always resist. They have very interesting combinations for their entrees. You can choose between tacos, quesadillas, salads or burritos and then pick whatever protein you want. They have a bunch of different veggie options so it's exciting to keep coming here and try different things. 

I think my favorite would be the potato, carrot, mushroom. They put a lot of these veggies in there so you get some in every bite. If you get a burrito, make it super so you can get sour cream, guac and cheese! I've heard to tofu is very good as well so I'll be back to try that!

It gets kind of crowded at dinner time (6:30-8:30) and the place is pretty small so I would recommend pick up if you're going around that time.

excerpts: I always ask for no sour cream and extra cheese.
They never get either right.
cheese.author: William O.
cheese.review: Most overrated place in San Francisco.  People always say but the "salsa is so good" so it got one star for salsa.  My boyfriend loves it because Postmates delivers it for cheap (there's a reason it sucks).  Chicken was somehow burnt lacking in flavor and charred at the same time.  I always ask for no sour cream and extra cheese.  They never get either right.  This time got tomatoes and horrible chicken with no rice.  And beans that would could pass for beans in Nebraska, maybe.  Please please please please go to one of the hundred other burrito places in SF!!!!

excerpts: Both with guoc sour cream and cheese.
The beef was really tender, surprisingly good.
A friend of ours recc'd the place and had no idea it had so many reviews.
Must be all the out of town yelpers like myself peeping it.
cheese.author: TOY A.
cheese.review:
I had the carne asada burrito with refried beans and nachos. Both with guoc sour cream and cheese. The beef was really tender, surprisingly good. A friend of ours recc'd the place and had no idea it had so many reviews. Must be all the out of town yelpers like myself peeping it.
 
The food is good, jarritos is a plus and cant go wrong with a cerveza to chase it down.

  The bathroom is like a high school one, all tagged up but is clean. Too close to the dining area though.

Parking is tricky so good luck. We found meter street parking

excerpts: They charge a dollar for sour cream, cheese or guac...
Burrito was not good with crunchy undercooked rice.
The salsa is awesome.
Buy the salsa and leave.
I'll buy the salsa in the jar but won't be back for the burrito.
cheese.author: Patrick P.
cheese.review: I went here twice. First time I didn't enjoy it but because it was close to my apartment I went back a second time. Just as bad as the first... Too expensive for what you get. They charge a dollar for sour cream, cheese or guac... Burrito was not good with crunchy undercooked rice. The salsa is awesome. Buy the salsa and leave. I'll buy the salsa in the jar but won't be back for the burrito.

excerpts: It makes sure i confirm that there is good tortillas, fresh vegetables, and a good cheese:bean:rice ratio without the meat seasoning distractions.
cheese.author: Kate T.
cheese.review:
i always judge a burrito place on its vegetarian burritos. why?

a) it's cheaper. and if i eat a bad burrito, i don't want to spend a lot.

b) It makes sure i confirm that there is good tortillas, fresh vegetables, and a good cheese:bean:rice ratio without the meat seasoning distractions.

c) if i like it, it will be even better when i come back and get a meat burrito.

but papalote broke these rules and made my favorite vegetarian burrito- it has so many good vegetables and potatoes!! so good. 

also has A+ chips and salsa.

excerpts: Super means they add sour cream, guacamole and cheese.
I got mine without the sour cream.
The burrito was delicious!
cheese.author: Delani D.
cheese.review:
Salsa!!!!! Oh my!!!! Soooooo good.

I was just watching on the travel channel the other day  a show about the best burritos in the country and Papalote was in it. I kept thinking about how bad I wanted to try their burritos. Well, it just so happen that we went up to the bay this weekend for my bf's DJ gigs and one of them was at the mission district. Since we were in the area, I couldn't pass up the chance. 

We got there around 8pm, an hour before closing time. It was nice to get free chips and salsa while waiting for our food. As I've already mentioned, the salsa is bomb!!! The chips, on the other hand, I didn't really care for. They were kinda stale. Then burritos came. I had the tofu mole burrito with refried black beans, wrapped in spinach tortilla and upgraded to super for just 99 cents! Super means they add sour cream, guacamole and cheese. I got mine without the sour cream. The burrito was delicious! That mole sauce was one of the best I've ever tried. Although, I wish I would've gotten whole black beans instead of refried because everything in my burrito was mushy. 

Burrito was devoured and I couldn't move for half an hour. Will definitely be back here next time I'm in SF.

excerpts: The chicken nachos were very good - nice big serving with lots of grilled chicken and cheese.
cheese.author: Brent C.
cheese.review:
Meh.  Not hatin', but I'm not sure I understand why people stand in line here for 30 minutes at 2 pm on a Wednesday... (but then again city people can be funny that way... )    Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing  (the chicken and garlic rice burrito with tomatoes) but there really wasn't anything special about it or any of the tacos the rest of the people in my party of 7 were having.   Yes, the salsa is very unique - creamy as though it is an emulsion of oil and tomato with chiles and a nice spicy kick. (almost like a spicy aioli).    The chicken nachos were very good - nice big serving with lots of grilled chicken and cheese.  But at the end of the day, there was nothing remarkable about this place other than the long line.

I will say this - the staff is super helpful. The seating is very limited, so they will time your order if you tell them that you are eating "in".  They make sure you have a table first, then they sit you down and THEN they bring your food.  They won't prepare the food until you have a spot to sit.  This means that you get hot food and a place to sit, but it also means that if you order your food for "dine-in" then you won't get your food until there is a spot to sit.  They are very good about monitoring the small dining area and making sure no one grabs your spot, however.  +1 star for the service.

excerpts: I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!)
with a spinach tortilla.
I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!!
Would get it again for sure.
It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick.
I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good
but I like the soyrizo add-on more!
The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us.
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!
cheese.author: Pooja S.
cheese.review:
Went here for dinner and really loved it! I think it's hard to be creative / differentiated with Mexican food, and Papalote managed to be. It's a small place and I would not pick coming here for the ambiance / if you want an intimate setting. Also really difficult if you have a large group because it's so small, and usually pretty crowded. I got pretty lucky and got a table in under 10 minutes. 

Sat down after ordering food, and the waiter immediately came with chips and salsa. Chips were a bit stale, and while their salsa was good, I don't think it was as amazing as it's hyped up to be. Don't get me wrong - I did still really like it, just think it is as good as other salsas I've tried. 

The burritos are HUGE and super filling!! Portion size is great, and I thought the price was pretty good! I wasn't feeling adventurous enough to try the veggie burrito (has carrots, potatoes and mushroom), so I got the soyrizo burrito (rice and beans with soy chorizo) and made it a super (add guacamole, sour cream and cheese for just $0.99 more!) with a spinach tortilla. I'm not usually a fan of fake meat, but I loved the soyrizo!! Would get it again for sure. It's a little spicy, so difficult to eat with their salsa which also has a bit of a kick. I came with someone who got the same thing without the soyrizo, which was still really good but I like the soyrizo add-on more! The waiter was also really great; we didn't realize that water was self-serve (oops) and we asked him for water, and he still went to get it for us. 
One of my favorite burritos in the city for sure!

excerpts: However, the highlight of my meal was the camarones quesadilla, which features shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter with delicious melted cheese...seriously, this is very very good stuff.
Add to that the flavor of the roasted peppers, with a dab of roasted tomato salsa and a bottle of coke on the side...
cheese.author: Angel S.
cheese.review:
[Featured:  Throwdown with Bobby Flay, Food Network, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gSciXC-jO8I]

Pop Quiz:  What SF burrito joint absolutely pwned Chef Bobby Flay in a salsa and burrito throwdown on national TV?  If you responded "Papalote" ... ding ding ding!

Seriously, as much as I like El Farolito (of which I am also a fan), Papalote will likely be in the mix for my go to spots for Mexican fare, even though I have mixed feelings.  As far as authenticity and value, Papalote is lacking, so I can see where others are coming from when they reduce Papalote as merely a fancy Chipotle, though I don't agree.  Also, Papalote's burritos are slightly smaller and pricier than its Mission counterparts.  

On the other hand.  It's hard to argue with the quality, especially the famed roasted tomato salsa. 

Overrated?  Nope, I don't think so.  Papalote's burrito and quesadilla were simply delicious, no exaggerated flavors.  In my view, Papalote deserves all the pub that comes with being named as SF Weekly's "best burrito" every year since 2007.  Now the Food Network has taken notice.

The carne asada burrito was off the chain, with tender beef and rich flavor and the burrito was not overly salted.  Plus it was just the right size that it wont leave you stuffed and bloated after the meal.

However, the highlight of my meal was the camarones quesadilla, which features shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter with delicious melted cheese...seriously, this is very very good stuff.  Add to that the flavor of the roasted peppers, with a dab of roasted tomato salsa and a bottle of coke on the side...I'd say that's a winning combo.

Unfortunately, the only damper was that the chips we got were too hard and they might have been a little stale.  It didn't matter too much in the end.  The roasted tomato salsa was so good that I could have dipped cardboard in it and I would have enjoyed the meal.

Thank you; Chef Escobedo.  I now have my sights set on the adobo buritto (off menu) and, maybe the triple threat.  Yet another reason to love the Mission District.

excerpts: Get the cheese!
cheese.author: Tuwie N.
cheese.review:
So, a classy burrito place is not an oxymoron! haha burritos here will set you a back a couple more bucks than your average mexican joint, but it is definitely delicious and worth it if you order right. That said, the chicken mole burrito was sensational. 
Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken). You don't even have to try! Get the guac! Get the cheese! 

The salsa that came with the chips (pretty sure it's free when you order, they just set it down on our table as we sat down after ordering) was unique and unlike any other salsa I've ever tasted. It looks and has the consistency of vodka sauce, but it is just the right amounts of creamy, spicy, tomato-y and tasty. amazing!

excerpts: It also had sour cream, guacamole and fresh cheese.
It was the perfect amount of beans and other ingredients.
cheese.author: Alicia R.
cheese.review: One of my co-workers wanted to try this place after he heard they had the best burritos in town. Actually, Papalote Mexican Grill is known for its amazing super burritos. We arrived at 11:45am on a Friday and we had to wait about 10 minutes for our burritos. I had the Super Burrito and it was perfect!. The tortilla was toasted after it is made. It also had sour cream, guacamole and fresh cheese. It was the perfect amount of beans and other ingredients. Most burritos I have had before this one had rice, beans and a very small amount of chicken or beef. Papalote Mexican Grill's burrito was perfect and full of flavor.

excerpts: I got it with carne asada, refried beans, white rice, housemade salsa (bought an extra jar of the fresh-made stuff), sour cream, cheese.
Just divine and cannot wait to return.
I would take the BART into the City just for this burrito.
cheese.author: Sara R.
cheese.review: Best burrito I've had in the Bay Area. I got it with carne asada, refried beans, white rice, housemade salsa (bought an extra jar of the fresh-made stuff), sour cream, cheese. Just divine and cannot wait to return. I would take the BART into the City just for this burrito.

excerpts: The "super" is a killer deal - cheese, guac and sour cream for just 99 cents - you can't go wrong!
cheese.author: Stephanie M.
cheese.review:
Great burritos!

This place is pretty delicious - and not TOO heavy! The "super" is a killer deal - cheese, guac and sour cream for just 99 cents - you can't go wrong! They also have burrito bowls to save on some carbs. 

Planning to make it my go to burrito spot.

excerpts: There isn't any cheese or guacamole, but the burrito gets plenty of flavor from the adobo and garlic rice.
cheese.author: Neal C.
cheese.review:
Really good, inventive burritos. I would not suggest coming here expecting a traditional mission-style burrito. This is more creative and expensive than your El Farolito or La Taqueria. You are also getting a different experience. 

I opted for the Mexipino Burrito-- adobo chicken, garlicky rice, and a tomato-ey pico salsa. There isn't any cheese or guacamole, but the burrito gets plenty of flavor from the adobo and garlic rice. The rice was really a nice changeup from your typical white or Mexican rice as it added a lot of flavor-- not just filler and texture. 

The spot is pretty trendy and attracts more of a hipster crowd but it is a cool spot. The service is slow but this is mainly due to the demand and also the care they take in putting everything together.

excerpts: Not here), of course, super (cheese and double guac, hold the sour cream), spinach tortilla, and refried black beans.
First off, the burrito (super!) was huge.
It took all my fatty power and a lot of time to finish it.
Come here hungry.
Secondly, it's all about the guac.
Like I mentioned earlier, the meat tasted great alone but pair it up with that guacamole?
Goodness gracious.
Delicious.
cheese.author: Johnny T.
cheese.review:
Beyond being an incredibly fun name to say,* the fine folks at Papalote are churning out tasty fare that may not be 100% authentic but it's mighty tasty to gringo tongues throughout the Bay area. I ate my burrito whilst sitting on a couch and drinking wine. No, that's not their set up (although, it's a winning idea; give me some commission on it), I ate from (my friends' home). Take out is the way to avoid the crazy lines and unwashed masses.

You'll also need time to prepare for the order because there are many options available to you: meat, super or not, type of tortilla, beans... this ain't your average slop-it-together-burrito joint. As for me: chicken (the mole version is very nicely seasoned; oftentimes the meat of a burrito is an afterthought. Not here), of course, super (cheese and double guac, hold the sour cream), spinach tortilla, and refried black beans. First off, the burrito (super!) was huge. It took all my fatty power and a lot of time to finish it. Come here hungry. Secondly, it's all about the guac. Like I mentioned earlier, the meat tasted great alone but pair it up with that guacamole? Goodness gracious. Delicious. I could have eaten that guac with a spoon... and I did because we ordered sides of guac, chips and salsa. All were magically delicious. My spinach tortilla wasn't as pronounced in flavor as I expected/hoped for, but there was so much going on on my plate that it wasn't that big of a deal. In a city that hypes its burrito prowess, Papalote is legit. I'd, gladly, come here again. I just made myself hungry writing this review.

*You just said it, didn't you?

excerpts: The super burrito comes with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole in addition to the regular burrito filling (meat, rice, beans).
And it usually comes with a small side of radish salad.
cheese.author: Monica T.
cheese.review:
Papalote is known for their amazing orange salsa! I'd like to confirm that the amazing orange salsa is truly amazing. It's savory, flavorful, and has a spicy kick to it! They sell their sauce in packaged jars, I will probably pick up a bottle during my next visit

Every order comes with complimentary tortilla chips and the yummy salsa.

I usually order the super burrito with chicken and it's always more food than I could handle. The super burrito comes with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole in addition to the regular burrito filling (meat, rice, beans). And it usually comes with a small side of radish salad. My bf orders 2 chicken tacos and that comes with heaps of lettuce and fresh tomatoes. I'll be sure to order tacos the next time I visit - it looked fresh and delicious!

The restaurant is quite small and has limited seating, but it is overall clean and welcoming. 

Papalote is located in the Mission District and is just 1 block away from the 24th St and Mission St BART station. 

Papalote's delicious orange salsa is reason enough to give this place a try. It's soo gooood... YOU NEED TO TRY THE SALSA!

excerpts: My wife and I were craving just a few plain ole bean and cheese burritos...nothing else.
No rice, no meat, no fixins, just BEANS AND CHEESE.
Mine with refried black, hers with pinto (per their choices).
Easy, right?
Wrong.
Super wrong.
We get our order, excited and hungry, go home and what do I find?
Rice.
Everywhere.
And this time after I explicitly explained JUST refried black BEANS AND CHEESE.
I even watched her write it down.
So, I called back AGAIN and what does the woman on the other end say?
She repeats back "Oh, sorry, so you wanted rice, beans, and cheese??
I almost lost it.
I said NO, just beans and cheese.
I then just asked for a refund instead for the overpriced burritos I didn't even order.
Hopefully that actually happens, but knowing what had just transpired, I'm not holding my breath.
cheese.author: A S.
cheese.review:
My experience at this place was so ridiculously annoying it's really comedic. The food is standard Mission Mexican hole in the wall fare, nothing amazing. The one star is for the complete lack of listening skills. I mean like talking to a wall, literally.

My wife and I were craving just a few plain ole bean and cheese burritos...nothing else. No rice, no meat, no fixins, just BEANS AND CHEESE. Mine with refried black, hers with pinto (per their choices). Easy, right? Wrong. Super wrong. We get our order, excited and hungry, go home and what do I find? Rice. Everywhere. Awesome.

My wife was too hungry to care so ate away, but I was annoyed so I called back and they graciously agreed to make me another. So I biked back there, get my order and come home and guess what...RICE AGAIN! And the wrong kind of beans. And this time after I explicitly explained JUST refried black BEANS AND CHEESE. I even watched her write it down. So, I called back AGAIN and what does the woman on the other end say? She repeats back "Oh, sorry, so you wanted rice, beans, and cheese??" I almost lost it. I said NO, just beans and cheese. I then just asked for a refund instead for the overpriced burritos I didn't even order. Hopefully that actually happens, but knowing what had just transpired, I'm not holding my breath.

excerpts: (That extra $0.99 is actually for cheese, sour cream and guacamole
but I don't eat cheese or sour cream)
cheese.author: Gaby C.
cheese.review:
*I would actually rate this place 3.5 stars if I could, but since I can't, I'm going to have to round down in this instance*

So, I've been wanting to try this place since it was featured and won on a Throwdown with Bobby Flay episode years ago... Then, I wanted to try it even more when I read an article recently that named this place the Best Burrito in America.... I can't tell you the excitement I had inside- it was overwhelming.

Of course, the place was packed inside. It's a very small, cozy place with only a few tables... The seating is somewhat communal style, where you may or may not have to share the same table with other parties... It has a cool, vibe to it- fits right in in the Mission neighborhood.

You order at the front counter and then are asked to wait outside until they are able to seat your party. 

Obviously I ordered the $19.95 Triple Threat Burrito (Don't worry- I shared this with one other person) as that's the very burrito that beat out Bobby Flay and was mentioned in the article... P.s. It's an extra $0.99 for guacamole ... Why wouldn't a $20 burrito already have guacamole in it? (That extra $0.99 is actually for cheese, sour cream and guacamole but I don't eat cheese or sour cream) 

Once seated, they will bring you chips and salsa (it more looks like a slightly thick, smooth orangey sauce)... The chips are mediocre, but the salsa is really unique tasting and really yummy! 

The burrito was served very shortly after. It's huge! Thank goodness we decided to share.  So the burrito was really good... Really, really good... Probably the best meat I've ever had in a burrito- the pieces of steak and chicken are lean and big and juicy and flavorful; very different from many Mexican food places where the meat is always greasy, minced to an oblivion and full of weird, chewy and fatty bites where you aren't quite sure what you just put in your mouth (icky)... The shrimp is grilled to perfection and also bursting with flavor... All the meats are cooked to order and you really could taste the freshness in the cooking- it keeps you excited for each and every bite that you take.

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal... The high quality of the meat is definitely the highlight of this place.... But to me, they really need to improve their chip recipe and the fact that this place isn't what you would consider to be typical "Mexican taqueria style" food threw me off a little from what I was expecting... Also, in my opinion, America's best burrito is definitely not going to have black beans inside it. 

Okay, so maybe it's not the best burrito in my book, but I would say this place is definitely worth a try if you're in the area. 

Note: This place has tons of vegetarian options which was really cool to me.

excerpts: I ordered nachos - mushy black beans in gravy, and lots of cheese.
Very tasty.
Definitely coming back here another time.
cheese.author: Sandeep R.
cheese.review: Best salsa I've ever had! I ordered nachos - mushy black beans in gravy, and lots of cheese. Very tasty. Definitely coming back here another time.

excerpts: I upgraded to get cheese/sour cream/guac
and it was the perfect combo.
cheese.author: Kristi P.
cheese.review: Suprisingly good veggie burrito here. I got the standard veggie one, with potatoes, carrots, and mushrooms. I love mushrooms and have never seen them in a burrito so I got this one. I'm often skeptical of potatoes in a burrito, but these were fresh cut, as were the carrots, and large chunks full of flavor. I love that you can pick what kind of rice, beans and wrap that you want. The papalote's salsa is amazing! I upgraded to get cheese/sour cream/guac and it was the perfect combo. Comes with a small bowl of chips and salsa on side.  I would definitely come back here next time I am in the Mission. Also, not at all crowded at 3pm on a Monday! Seems reasonably priced for what you are getting (granted bc it's SF, when you add tax tip and a beer the prices get high).

excerpts: When I want the standard veggie burrito and we opt for Papalote, I get the bean and cheese and add the other toppings to build to my liking.
Their version of the veggie has potatoes and carrots which I really don't care for.
cheese.author: Esther A.
cheese.review:
When I want the standard veggie burrito and we opt for Papalote, I get the bean and cheese and add the other toppings to build to my liking. Their version of the veggie has potatoes and carrots which I really don't care for. 

Definitely call in your order. We were in and out in two minutes flat which was great because we parked nearby which was not even a legit parking spot. Our first visit to Papalote we waited a good 20 minutes or so for take out as we were unaware how busy this place was. 

Prices are a bit higher than your average taqueria but the ingredients are also higher in quality. I say it's worth it. 

I've tried many taquerias in my days although far from a personal favorite, their claim to fame is their salsa. And for me, it's justified.

excerpts: On the other hand, they were generous with the chicken and the cheese was nicely melted.
It was also pretty big
cheese.author: Shelly P.
cheese.review:
Completely over-hyped. I couldn't be more puzzled as to how this place has been able to achieve its status as some of the best burritos and salsa in the Mission. I found both to be very mediocre and expensive.

You have to order something before you can sit down here. I arrived a little earlier than her and they wouldn't let me sit at a table while I waited for her even though there was space. Not a big deal, but worth noting. Ordering was painless enough, but boy were the prices high! I ordered a super chicken burrito and a horchata. I had heard people rave about their salsa/secret sauce so I also got an extra cup of it for 50 cents extra. My total was $16! My friend ordered guacamole and a naked burrito and her total was over $20. 

The food came, and to their credit, they got it out to us incredibly fast! I tried some of my friend's guacamole and it was very good and fresh, but still not $8.50-good. The salsa was definitely not anything to write home about, but it was kind of unique compared to most salsas and tasted fine. The chips on the other hand were pretty bad. Not inedible, but bad enough to where I abandoned them after the first three or four. But they were also free, so I guess that's forgivable. 

Then came the burrito and honestly, there just wasn't whole lot going on flavor-wise. It had everything I usually like, but for some reason I just felt like it was missing something, like there was no depth to the flavor. On the other hand, they were generous with the chicken and the cheese was nicely melted. It was also pretty big so I was able to bring some home. 

+1 star for having extra pieces of tin foil out for the customers to wrap their leftover burrito up in. I think this should be a standard at burrito places, but not enough of them do it.

excerpts: Comes with Refried black beans and the cheese is melted perfectly.
cheese.author: Melissa S.
cheese.review: It's my second time here but I must say this experience was much better than the first time. The first time we took burritos to Dolores Park. Eating at the restaurant while you food is still piping hot is a much better option. We got the nachos which were delicious. Comes with Refried black beans and the cheese is melted perfectly. I ordered a chicken burrito and my husband got a carne asada burrito. They have whole wheat tortillas which is nice and the burrito has tons of flavor. Make sure you get their signature sauce to dip your burrito in. Don't get your food to go, doesn't do it justice.

excerpts: It's hard to find a good bean and cheese burrito, but they have perfected the art.
cheese.author: Tiffany K.
cheese.review:
The Chilaquiles - enough said!

Okay - but actually, there's so much more. On top of the totally-killer, absolutely-supreme chilaquiles, Papalote has some bomb burritos. It's hard to find a good bean and cheese burrito, but they have perfected the art. 

Their in-house made salsa is also out of this world. Unique and creamy with a smokey base, I always ask for extra. Plus, you can buy it in-store for friends who may also be Papalote-fans. 

Tips: 
+ Looking to eat your burrito at home? Call ahead and pick it up. They're timely and have a register dedicated solely to phone orders. 
+ Only bummer is that they open late on weekends. Sometimes I need breakfast before 11am...

excerpts: You have to ask for "super" to get  the sour cream, cheese, and guac goodness.
cheese.author: Tiffany E.
cheese.review:
I've been hearing about the Mexi-Pino burrito for quite some time now. This creation, made with Filipino style chicken adobo (meat simmered in vinegar and soy with garlic), garlic rice, and tomatoes, generously wrapped in a flour tortilla is deeelocious! At the recommendation of a friend/Papalote patron, I ordered the burrito "classic." You have to ask for "super" to get  the sour cream, cheese, and guac goodness. I'm usually a super burrito gal, so this plain version was new to me. The Mexi-Pino was still so tasty and I venture to say better as a "classic" because you can taste the flavor of the adobo.
