- Chips and Salsa - I thought the chips were just average - I've had better. The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. A generous serving of chips topped w/ cheese, sauce, and egg and served w/ beans and rice on the side
- Chile Verde burrito - a fat burrito, enough for two people. Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over. I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
- Chicken tacos - the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain. Served on two flour tortillas w/ lettuce and tomatoes.

I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.

One last note - the service is great and the staff was so friendly. With crowded tables and a 20 minute line out the door they could have easily been stressed out. But they all had a great attitude, were attentive, and thanked us with smiles on our way out.

excerpts: Still the most amazing salsa, and I still love the black bean and cheese dip, and I still just generally think the place is awesome, but when I went last Saturday for lunch it was completely packed and the only empty table was next to Super Star Elite Yelper Stephan W.
"  Excuse me while I go vomit some of the tastiest chips, salsa, and black-bean-and-cheese dip
I've ever eaten.]
cheese.author: Joe C.
cheese.review:
Still the most amazing salsa, and I still love the black bean and cheese dip, and I still just generally think the place is awesome, but when I went last Saturday for lunch it was completely packed and the only empty table was next to Super Star Elite Yelper Stephan W.

Eating tasty Mexican food is always fun, but eating tasty Mexican food with Stephan is a 5-star experience every time.

[Equally entertaining was the psuedo-semi-hippy-neo-hipster dude on the other side of me who spent at least 35 minutes telling his friend (over, and over, and over) why his last relationship didn't work out because he thinks that talking and sharing and emotional intimacy are the essences of a relationship and his GF didn't share, and kept it all inside . . . dude, if you're reading this, I bet she would've shared endlessly with anybody else you annoying twit!  

I can just imagine the guy getting home every day and hounding the poor woman with questions about every stupid thing that happened during her day and -- drum roll -- how it made her **feel**, and then he'd look her longingly in the eyes and say "I love you so much!"  Excuse me while I go vomit some of the tastiest chips, salsa, and black-bean-and-cheese dip I've ever eaten.]

excerpts: Hold the cheese.
cheese.author: Rachel G.
cheese.review:
If I ate food, which I don't, and I wanted some Mexican, which I rarely do, and I didn't want to gain 6,000lbs. for the impending winter, which I wouldn't -- well, then I would come to Papalote and order some Soyrizo in my burrito.

Hold the beans.  Hold the tortilla.  Hold the cheese.  Hold the sour cream.

Cause what's better and lower in fat than fake innards made of soy on a plate?

Delish.

excerpts: Yesterday I decided to try the bean and cheese dip which turns out to be refried black beans with melted cheese.
I asked if it came with a large bowl of chips and the gal at the counter ensured it did.
So by my calculations we ordered two items for two people, one of which was supposed to have lots of chips.
We got one bowl before the tacos and another bowl, same size with the dip.
I kept asking the busser for another bowl but he knows the rules so he ignored my pleas.
When I went to the counter the gal said they only have one size bowl.
I reminded her she had said it came with a large serving of chips
but that went right past her.
She gave me another bowl
but I could see contempt in her eyes as she handed it to me.
Here's the thing, what is dip for if not chips?
Secondly, the price for beans and cheese with a small bowl of chips would be fair at $3.50, still a huge mark-up.
The actual price of $6.50 is just dumb, especially considering you don't get any type of garnish or extra chips.
It's literally a plate of beans with melted cheese.
cheese.author: Maria G.
cheese.review:
Chip Stingy!

So you know, each person gets 1 bowl of chips and 1 cup of their wildly delicious salsa per order. If you want more you have to pay $1.50. 

I love the super fish tacos (no sour cream) from Papalote. My husb and I share one order and are both full after. Yesterday I decided to try the bean and cheese dip which turns out to be refried black beans with melted cheese. I asked if it came with a large bowl of chips and the gal at the counter ensured it did. So by my calculations we ordered two items for two people, one of which was supposed to have lots of chips. We got one bowl before the tacos and another bowl, same size with the dip. I kept asking the busser for another bowl but he knows the rules so he ignored my pleas. When I went to the counter the gal said they only have one size bowl. I reminded her she had said it came with a large serving of chips but that went right past her. She gave me another bowl but I could see contempt in her eyes as she handed it to me. Here's the thing, what is dip for if not chips? Secondly, the price for beans and cheese with a small bowl of chips would be fair at $3.50, still a huge mark-up. The actual price of $6.50 is just dumb, especially considering you don't get any type of garnish or extra chips. It's literally a plate of beans with melted cheese. Don't bother with this menu item. 

I'm giving this place 4 stars because the tacos and salsa are so good. They loose a star for being stingy.

excerpts: The pork was so juicy and tender and the cheese was melted with the sour cream and avocado (I hate places that serve it cold and not melted).
Love papalote burritos!
cheese.author: Irene L.
cheese.review: Can you say AMAZING?! First off, I love love love their salsa! Though it is inconsistent with the texture and the level of spicyness, I still give it a two thumbs up because its perfect with my chips and burrito!  I had the super carnitas burrito with a tomato wrap and it was delicious. The pork was so juicy and tender and the cheese was melted with the sour cream and avocado (I hate places that serve it cold and not melted). Love papalote burritos!

excerpts: -Vegetarians, like myself, have more than a cheese quesadilla from which to choose.
cheese.author: Christine M.
cheese.review:
I'm spoiled.  This shrine to all food Mexican is less than a block from my apartment.  But the reasons other than proximity for my praise are simple:
-The food is fresh and healthy, void of the "grease sheen" that accompanies other fast-serving Mexican eateries.
-Cheap!  
-Vegetarians, like myself, have more than a cheese quesadilla from which to choose.  In fact, we have a whole smorgasbord of choices!

mmmmmm.........

excerpts: I will tell you this - this place charges extra for cheese, sour cream, and guac, so
cheese.author: Heather G.
cheese.review:
On the recommendation of a local, we headed to Papalote to sample what I've always heard to be superior Mexican food to what we have here in Boston.  

Can I just interject and describe to you how completely obnoxious it is to live in Boston and, on a regular basis, hear San Fransisco transplants berate me about the low quality and in-authenticity of Mexican food in the Northeast?  It seems like every person who has ever even step foot within a 500 mile radius of the Mission district feels obligated to chime in and remind me that, yes, Mexican food in Boston sucks, and Mission burritos are tastier.  After years of this, I began to think that this was, in fact, a fact (yeah, intentional), and that my trip to San Fransisco would give me an epiphany and a fantastic culinary experience to boot.

Back to the task at hand.  I went to the Mission and chose Papalote for my field research, as it seemed to be widely accepted as the "best burrito."  

I should have known that something was awry when the guy at the counter told me they had just whooped Bobby Flay in a Throwdown.  I call this the Flay phenomenon - The inevitable inflow of traffic post-TV-debut brings crowds to a Throwdown winner's establishment that the restaurant perhaps wasn't ready for (or ill-equipped to handle).  I fear this, as a once-fabulous place could go downhill quickly, choosing to ride the popularity wave.

Needless to say, I did not have such a great experience here, and whether it's the show's fault or the restaurant's, I left a bit let down.

The prices are steep - $5.50 for an order of two tacos, and this "famous" burrito now costs $20. WHAT?  What do you put in a burrito to make it $20.  I will tell you this - this place charges extra for cheese, sour cream, and guac, so I'm not sure what's left.

We did not go for the $20 burrito, but we had a more modest $9 version, but did not opt to pay the extra for the dairy and guac.  The burrito (chicken) was, as a result, a bit bland and very dry.  If the burrito only tastes good with these extra-charge add-ons, then why bother making the burrito at all? 

We also had an order of fish tacos, an order of chicken, and an order of beef.  The fish tacos were the only ones that were double-wrapped with two tortillas each, and the other two orders were only single-wrapped.  Is this "authentic"?  I am not sure, as I am not well-versed in corn tortilla etiquette, but I thought the customary-two was the standard.

The sole-double-wrapped fish taco was really wet and drippy, but I enjoyed that the fish wasn't battered and deep fried to the point of nonrecognition.  Rather, the fish in the tacos was abundant, moist, and juicy.  The other two tacos tasted just like each other, and were both very dry.

The best thing about this place was definitely the creamy, spicy salsa that accompanied the chips.  Perhaps this has always been the practice, or maybe it was due to the new-found extreme popularity, but after the first complimentary order, the restaurant charges for refills.  I don't necessarily think that this is a bad practice, just an interesting one I'd not seen before.  Because we bought so much food, however, we were able to get 4 orders of these for free, and I opted to ditch the tacos and make a meal out of chips and salsa.

You can buy this salsa by the jar to go, and had we not been from out of town, I would certainly take advantage of that.

I will say that the employees are ALL extremely friendly.  Everyone is kind, courteous, and polite.  We must have gone at a bizarre hour, because there was no line whatsoever.   Food came out hot and prompt, and I was very pleased with the experience aside from the taste of the food.

I don't think I'd go back, but one great thing did come from the experience.  Now, back at home, when people launch a tirade about how much New England Mexican sucks compared to the beloved Mission Burritos, I am able to smile, nod, and smirk knowingly (and perhaps a bit judgmentally) as they ramble on, while silently thinking that Olecito is better Mexican food than what I found in SF.

excerpts: I like that you can make it super for 99 cents, which includes guacamole, cheese, and sour cream.
cheese.author: Angelica S.
cheese.review: I have been to El Papalote a few times. If you order grilled chicken or beef burritos, this place is clearly a 4/5. I like that you can make it super for 99 cents, which includes guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. The complementary chips and salsa are great. I am not a fan of the chicken mole burrito. It lacks flavor. The time I had one, my beans were a bit under cooked, the rice mushy, and the mole flavor not present at all.

excerpts: As a vegetarian burritos can be bland but even their bean and cheese burritos are far from bland.
My only complaint is that they grill the tortillas but maybe that's too much to ask.
Their salsa is extraordinary.
I think this place survives off of the sheer awesomeness of it's salsa(chips are good too).
cheese.author: Joni S.
cheese.review:
I started going to Papalote over a year ago and loved it so much I ate here once a week.  As a vegetarian burritos can be bland but even their bean and cheese burritos are far from bland.  My only complaint is that they grill the tortillas but maybe that's too much to ask.  Their salsa is extraordinary.  I think this place survives off of the sheer awesomeness of it's salsa(chips are good too).  I totally love that they have vegan options like their beans(all of which are vegan), soyrizo, and tofu.  The downside is waiting in line in the cold and their curmudgeonly staff.  

p.s.  I usually order it to go and they have always gotten my order right on.  But if you're eating there the burritos come unwrapped(no foil) so you eat them with a knife and fork.  I prefer a hand held burrito.

excerpts: + $.99 for sour cream, cheese, and guac.
cheese.author: Breanne B.
cheese.review:
After seeing the Triple Threat Burrito on Throw Down w/Bobby Flay...

The burrito is good but, I don't know if it's worth $19.95 + $.99 for sour cream, cheese, and guac.

excerpts: When I told one of the owners about it, he brought me sour cream, guac, and cheese on a plate on the side.
I didn't know this was build your own burrito.
Would definitely check it out again and if it beat Bobby Flay, there must be something right about this place...
I just haven't discovered it yet.
cheese.author: Emily L.
cheese.review:
Salsa was gooood.  Served a little warm and has a different kick and tang to it like I've never tasted before.  But when I asked for more chips, they wanted to charge me an extra $1.  Maybe I'm spoiled but at most Mexican restaurants where the burritos cost as much as they do here, it's FREE.

Ordered the adobo chicken burrito, not cuz I'm Filipino, but cuz all of my people were ranting and raving about it.  Chicken was good and juicy and flavored "ok."  Maybe they all just got excited b/c they got their country's dish in a mexican wrap and they thought it was neat.  Who knows.  On top of that, I ordered it super and they gave me plain.  When I told one of the owners about it, he brought me sour cream, guac, and cheese on a plate on the side.  I didn't know this was build your own burrito.  Would definitely check it out again and if it beat Bobby Flay, there must be something right about this place...I just haven't discovered it yet.

excerpts: The fish tacos are fantastic, and I love the prawn quesadilla, rice and bean taco, fish quesadille (seriously the only time fish and cheese can be used together) and nachos.
cheese.author: Darcy V.
cheese.review:
I go here at least 3 times a week and as Nish pointed out, probably much more than that. Papalote means kite, and the restaurant (you can sit down) is cheerfully painted and hung with beautiful elaborate handmade kits that look like frogs, bugs, etc... and a world class collection of Latin and other music is playing at all times.

Food: The fish tacos are fantastic, and I love the prawn quesadilla, rice and bean taco, fish quesadille (seriously the only time fish and cheese can be used together) and nachos. I recently tried the chile verde quesadilla and it was soooo good. It would be my new favorite except that it's pork, and I don't really eat pork. The pork pieces were tender and delicious though. Maybe next time I'll ask if they can leave out the pork pieces and just heap on that yummy green sauce.

For 99 cents, I always "super" my order because the guacamole rocks. You can't even get an avocado at the market for 99cents, and they give a generous portion. The salsa is smoky and just the right amount of kick to it. It's worth the 50 cent charge to get another helping! The chips are thin, crisp and always served warm. Yum. 

Service:  awesome. "Perdito", who flashes his ever cheerful silver accented smile, is already filling my "pepsi regular" when I walk in the door. When the owner Miguel is there he always takes a moment to say hello.  Update: the Pepsi machine is "out of order" apparently because of a tiff with an incompetent supplies. Miguel refuses to do business with the guy and as a result, I'm going through some kind of Pepsi withdrawal. The homemade horchata is good, but sometimes I want that chemical kick of Pepsi. Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrr. Judith, the girl at the counter is always friendly and polite and acts like it's totally normal that I eat there every day.

excerpts:
A Papalote Haiku:

Black beans and cheese, please,
Tomato, lettuce and rice - 
Organic delight!
cheese.author: Katelin H.
cheese.review:
A Papalote Haiku:

Black beans and cheese, please,
Tomato, lettuce and rice - 
Organic delight!

excerpts: It was VERY salty, and I would have liked it to have cheese in it.
cheese.author: Jasmine F.
cheese.review:
Meh. 

One star for being healthy
One star for good prices
One star for the salsa

I wasn't particularly thrilled by my burrito. It was VERY salty, and I would have liked it to have cheese in it. But I appreciate that it's healthier without it, and I also dug the fact that they use boneless, skinless chicken breast. Salsa is definitely tasty, but the chips weren't that great, so it kinda ruined it for me.

excerpts: Any place with vegan menu items immediately becomes health food even if I ordered a double bacon cheese burger.
Only complaint is last night I went to pick up my to go and the place was jammed with white people.
Damn I hate crackers.
cheese.author: Melissa H.
cheese.review:
Delicious. 
Oh Papalote you so good I can't stop thinking about you. You don't make me feel too bad about myself when I have nachos for dinner bc my teeny tiny brain has decided you are health food. Any place with vegan menu items immediately becomes health food even if I ordered a double bacon cheese burger. 
Only complaint is last night I went to pick up my to go and the place was jammed with white people. Damn I hate crackers.

excerpts: You do have to pay extra for cheese which makes me sad, because cheese should be an essential part of a burrito.
Otherwise the food itself was pretty good, not to die for, but nice and tasty with the right bit of spice.
cheese.author: Stephanie C.
cheese.review:
The salsa here rocks!

A bit overpriced compared to other mission burrito places, and the food is comparable. You do have to pay extra for cheese which makes me sad, because cheese should be an essential part of a burrito. Otherwise the food itself was pretty good, not to die for, but nice and tasty with the right bit of spice.

excerpts: Saute it in wine and butter, throw it in a tortilla with a bunch of cheese,  then add a little more grease to toast it up, that's how.
Papalote calls this a pescado quesadilla.
cheese.author: LeSLiE W.
cheese.review:
How do you make fish really bad for you?  

Saute it in wine and butter, throw it in a tortilla with a bunch of cheese,  then add a little more grease to toast it up, that's how.  Papalote calls this a pescado quesadilla.  I call it evil.

Holy crap.   This thing is freaking delicious.  I'm usually more of a burrito kind of girl but my boyfriend brought one of these evil pescado thingys home recently. Soon he was annoyed with himself that he asked me if I wanted a bite because after that he couldn't' get rid of me.

Fortunately I live nowhere near this place and they don't deliver.  Because if either of those two realities existed, I would have quesadilla butt in about 2 weeks.

So... my advice: Give up the burrito for a meal and try some fish.  But do so with extreme caution.

excerpts: The cheese is nice too.
cheese.author: TeTeDaMouse C.
cheese.review:
Papalote is up there when it comes to delicious Mexican food.  It's definitely in the top three and funny, for the life of me, I don't know remember the names of the other two because I'm hazy from the glow of Papalote's deliciousness.  While the proximity of my next job location to Papalote wouldn't be the deciding factor in picking one job over the other, it would definitely be a perk.

Papalote is a restaurant where I don't miss meat as part of my meal.  Their vegan and vegetarian burritos are delicious.  I usually order my burrito with black beans, a whole wheat tortilla, and make it a super so I can have their delicious guacamole.  The cheese is nice too. I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.  The rice and bean burrito.  It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.  Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.  It's hard to describe; it's a bit smoky.  

I love me some Papalote!  If I was vegan or vegetarian, it wouldn't be hard because of Papalote.  I firmly believe the restaurant would get me through the hard times.

excerpts: The beans were amazing, the cheese was great, and the chips were crispy.
cheese.author: Margee B.
cheese.review:
Today is Thursday.  Tuesday was my first introduction of Papalote, and I've already gone back.  It's that good.  And that cheap.  Unsurprisingly, it's in the Mission, where you'll find some of the best culture and food of the city.  

Both times I have been it's been packed with hipsters.  The diversity here is sorely lacking, which is a polite way of saying that it was all white people being served by people who (I assume) are Hispanic.  Which bugs me, but the food is too good to pass up.

Both times the boyfriend and I shared a burrito and nachos.  The chips and salsa that come while you wait (and you do wait - it's packed), is so delicious.  I just want to eat that all day.  We shared a chicken burrito, where you could taste the freshness of all the ingredients.  We also had nachos.  The beans were amazing, the cheese was great, and the chips were crispy.  Oh goodness, it was so good.

The seating is limited, so don't bring a big crowd.  And if you have to wait for a table, well, you have to wait.  A lot of people do take-out, or order ahead.  But it's worth it.

While the price of a burrito is pretty average in SF, their prices are generally cheaper than most.  Sometimes only by about 30 cents, but sometimes by a few dollars.  A bean, rice, and salsa burrito is $3.75 (I believe).  Nachos & super chicken burrito was $14.

excerpts: Don't forget to get it "SUPER". for $1 extra you can get guac, sour cream, lettuce and yummy cheese.
cheese.author: Anne K.
cheese.review:
I love this place! It is great for vegetarians, and offers Mexican cuisine that is not as greasy and fattening as somewhere like Puerto Alegre. This place has delicious food. I especially like the rice and bean tacos. They are relatively healthy and you get a lot of protein. Don't forget to get it "SUPER". for $1 extra you can get guac, sour cream, lettuce and yummy cheese. 

I usually get my orders to go from here, but they do have a dining area. 

This place gets crowded, so call your order ahead, and you can pick up and pay when you get there.

excerpts: So I asked for the Denver (onions, bell pepps, shrooms and cheese) and asked to add Soyrizo.
Was going to be $4.50!!
Sorry
but I'm willing to pay for quality and for food
I can't easily make at home.
I can make a Soyrizo burrito at home easy.
cheese.author: Steven M.
cheese.review:
Will start by saying I "grew up" loving Papalote. Been in the mission for 12 years. It was cool when the brothers were around more and caring for the place. I really like their food BUT they've gone too far. Went for a breakfast burrito...they have 4 choices, all pretty basic without anything special and they are all $9-10. So I asked for the Denver (onions, bell pepps, shrooms and cheese) and asked to add Soyrizo. Was going to be $4.50!! Sorry but I'm willing to pay for quality and for food I can't easily make at home. I can make a Soyrizo burrito at home easy. 

So I said no thanks and left. Funny how blatantly overcharging can put a bad taste in ur mouth. Had to run errands up in Noe, so stopped at a cool, sustainable little Mex place on 24th past Castro. Bfast burrito with roasted potatoes, poblanos, etc was $6.50 and added carnitas for $2.50. It was huge and delicious.

Not sure if I'm going back to papalote for reg burritos or not. Hope u guys are paying attention and adjust your pricing. I might pay $15 for a really interesting, more gourmet bfast burrito...but not your basic one.

excerpts: Unfortunately, this filling, when combined with refried beans, cheese, rice and guacamole and wrapped in a tortilla, didn't meld into that cheesy-goopy goodness that makes an excellent burrito.
It was good, but not great.
Certainly not on par with Victor's or Mexico au Parc - which just goes to show you:
even if every component of a dish is excellent, sometimes it doesn't come together properly to make something amazing.
cheese.author: Avery G.
cheese.review:
After hearing so many good things from friends, colleagues and even sources like Chow Magazine, I was excited to give Papalote a shot when my co-workers decided to head there for lunch. Finally, I would have a chance to sample their "practically-orgasmic" salsa!

Papalote is a taqueria with partial table service. You order your food at the counter, grab a drink, pay your way, take a number and head over to a table in the side room and eagerly await the server with your taco, burrito, quesadilla or other standard taqueria fare... which is exactly what I did. 

The chips (still warm) and salsa were brought almost immediately - and for all intents and purposes, they were the highlight of the meal. The rich orange salsa was spicy, sweet and had a complexity of flavor not commonly found in the condiment. The texture was smooth with black flecks - possibly from black pepper or from the skin of roasted pumpkin or peppers (yep - the secret ingredient, I have been told, is pumpkin seeds). This salsa's only competition for #1 in San Francisco is by Orale Orale.

The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin... and though I didn't sample it, the meat certainly looked good: appropriately charred and tender.

The pork Chile Verde was also quite good, with distinct flavors of tomatillo, cilantro and citrus in the sauce. Unfortunately, this filling, when combined with refried beans, cheese, rice and guacamole and wrapped in a tortilla, didn't meld into that cheesy-goopy goodness that makes an excellent burrito. It was good, but not great. Certainly not on par with Victor's or Mexico au Parc - which just goes to show you: even if every component of a dish is excellent, sometimes it doesn't come together properly to make something amazing. This time, the components were better than the sum of its parts.

$8.89 for a super burrito, chips, salsa and a bottle of grapefruit soda. 3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.

excerpts: The chicken was grilled perfectly and the cheese was completely melted in the beans.
cheese.author: Michelle L.
cheese.review:
I went to try the Salsa that I've heard so much about. My personal preference is for fresh, chunky salsa. This one was more of a spicy, tomato soup consistency. 

Despite the disappointment with the salsa, I had a Chicken Super Burrito and absolutely loved it.   The chicken was grilled perfectly and the cheese was completely melted in the beans.  I also appreciated the option of Tortilla (wheat, white, spinach & one more I forgot) and also the choice of beans.

I will be back for sure.

excerpts: Grilled chicken super burrito (sour cream, guac, rice, beans, cheese and salsa) is da bomb.
cheese.author: Kathleen N.
cheese.review:
Hnads down, Papalotes has the best salsa. Whenever I come here, I can't help but dip everything I order here in the salsa. The chips that come with your order are warm and delicious. A big plus!

Grilled chicken super burrito (sour cream, guac, rice, beans, cheese and salsa) is da bomb.

Call in your order ahead so you don't have to wait in the long line once you arrive. The dining room here looks cute, but I always get my food to go.

excerpts: I love that everything isn't smothered in cheese, either.
cheese.author: Sharon G.
cheese.review:
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant ever.  The salsa is fabulous.  Too bad they give it to you in teeny tiny little containers and then charge you for more--  but hey, it's worth it.  I would probably sit there all day and eat chips and salsa if it was free.

I love the veggie tacos (potatoes, carrots, mushrooms in a corn tortilla).  Everything always tastes fresh.  I love that everything isn't smothered in cheese, either.  Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.) I even brought my mom here and she loved it, too!

And parking sucks, but that's to be expected.

excerpts: I had the worst quesadilla possible there, like a microwaved castrophe with barely any cheese and dried out tortilla, everything piled to one side.
If you want to go veg, go to Little Chihuahua.
Less money, better variety and fresher ingredients.
cheese.author: Katie R.
cheese.review:
The good: The salsa. The fish tacos. 
The awful: Crappy vegetarian options. Just a little eggplant here or some potato there. I had the worst quesadilla possible there, like a microwaved castrophe with barely any cheese and dried out tortilla, everything piled to one side. If you want to go veg, go to Little Chihuahua. Less money, better variety and fresher ingredients.

excerpts: oh, there's the cheese (you get the idea).
cheese.author: Christy L.
cheese.review:
The first time I went to Papalote's, I tried the Super Pollo burrito, and it was so good it made my toes curl.  

Okay, toe curling aside...this burrito was, by far, one of the best burritos here in the city that I had tasted.  The size was perfect, not Godzilla sized  and overflowing with rice and beans, and not too tiny to leave me wanting more.  It was like a perfect little package of burrito love that I could hold in my hands!

When I took my first bite, I was in heaven.  The flavors were savory and every bite contained an equal part of all the yummy ingredients.  Nothing is more annoying than biting into a burrito and eating all rice, then all beans then your meat and...oh, there's the cheese (you get the idea).  The tortilla was nicely grilled prior to being assembled, giving it a nice crispy texture.

The salsa is so friggin good you'll want more (and they take this into consideration because they charge you extra if you go back for more).  For those who just can't get enough, I believe you can purchase their salsa to take home.

The only reason I didn't give Papalote's 5 stars was because on a few recent occasions that I went in, the burrito just wasn't up to par.  I'm not sure if the burrito assembly line in the back was having an off day, but the taste and quality just wasn't there.  

All in all, a great burrito for a good price with salsa that'll knock your shoes off and curl your toes.

excerpts: Got chicken mole tacos, churizo/cheese dipping appetizer thingy and guacamole.
cheese.author: Sarah G.
cheese.review:
Delicioso! Wanted a good burrito place where we could sit down and not feel like we're in one of the in-n-out, i'm probably drunk, burrito places all over the mission. 

Got chicken mole tacos, churizo/cheese dipping appetizer thingy and guacamole. Highly recommend all 3! 

seating can be a pain, the whole stalking people eating and jumping on a table when they're getting up, but it's worth it.

excerpts: I was just upset when I asked for a small side of sour cream and they charged me $1.50 - then I looked on the menu, and a side of sour cream, guacamole and Cheese was listed as $.99, WTF?
Whatever, I'm sure I'll be back because it was healthy and tasty, but they need to get their prices in order!!!
cheese.author: meagan m.
cheese.review:
Honestly, the food was really good. I had the grilled veggie - eggplant and zucchini burrito, which was really yummy. Also, the salsa that they give you for your chips is amazing. I was just upset when I asked for a small side of sour cream and they charged me $1.50 - then I looked on the menu, and a side of sour cream, guacamole and Cheese was listed as $.99, WTF? Whatever, I'm sure I'll be back because it was healthy and tasty, but they need to get their prices in order!!! Oh yeah, and get some larger water cups while you're at it. 

Thank you.

excerpts: I liked the cheese.
cheese.author: Andrew Y.
cheese.review:
I had high hopes for this place because it was a mexcian place in the Mission. Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak. It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart. After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts but I didn't think that all came together. 

I was told that this place was more of a vegetarian place. I'm willing to try this place again, but we'll see the end result next time. For now, 3 stars. 

Oh, we also had nachos, they were pretty good. I liked the cheese.

excerpts: My now "veggie" burrito was very mediocre with all beans and rice, even though I ordered the "super" - which supposedly comes with cheese and guacamole.
Very disappointed.
And definitely NOT worth $10!!
Don't see what all the fuss is about.
Do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks to another Mexican joint.
There are plenty of them!
cheese.author: Tallulah J.
cheese.review: This place is a rip-off. I ordered a Carne Asada burrito. Had to wait about 20 minutes for my food - when the place wasn't even that full! When my burrito finally came, guess what? NO MEAT! WTF!? Are you kidding me? At first i just thought that the meat was in the middle and patiently worked my way to it, but was very disappointed to find nothing there. My now "veggie" burrito was very mediocre with all beans and rice, even though I ordered the "super" - which supposedly comes with cheese and guacamole. Very disappointed. And definitely NOT worth $10!! Don't see what all the fuss is about. Do yourself a favor and walk a few blocks to another Mexican joint. There are plenty of them!

excerpts: Great food, but they raised their prices a few months ago and now to get a veggie burrito with tofu and made super (guacamole, sour cream & cheese-an additional $.99)
I'm sorry, but I can't pay that for a burrito.
I used to get out the door for $11.
and that was doable,
but $15. for a medium sized burrito is just ridiculous.
Haven't gone back since.
If price is not an issue to you though, the food is very tasty.
cheese.author: Gaea W.
cheese.review: Great food, but they raised their prices a few months ago and now to get a veggie burrito with tofu and made super (guacamole, sour cream & cheese-an additional $.99) it's $15 ! I'm sorry, but I can't pay that for a burrito. I used to get out the door for $11. and that was doable, but $15. for a medium sized burrito is just ridiculous. Haven't gone back since. If price is not an issue to you though, the food is very tasty.

excerpts: Excellent salsa and a wonderful cheese and chorizo dip to start.
Cleanse palate with Modelo.
cheese.author: Tony A.
cheese.review:
Excellent salsa and a wonderful cheese and chorizo dip to start.  Cleanse palate with Modelo.  Shrimp tacos, two times.  More beer.  

Gourmet Mexican, something lighter and fresher then your average Mission taco joint.  

This place is worth a trip.

excerpts: The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.
The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings.
cheese.author: Spoon G.
cheese.review:
++UPDATE 10/29: Last time I went in to pick up some food I spent some time reading their SF inspection report. Let's just say they failed the inspection - things like storing food on the floor, the refrigerator temperature was not low enough...basically they didn't get a score because they had to fix so many things. Should you be afraid? I haven't gotten sick, but it was a bit off putting so I am lowering my score to 3 stars.++

Why do I love Papalote in the Mission? A few good reasons. I am not a vegetarian but I have to admit that the soyrizo tacos are pretty tasty but my alltime favorite is the fish burrito - straight up, don't go super.

Why do I love the fish burrito? It's is sauted in white wine with your choice of beans. The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.  The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings. You can usually share a fish burrito, and maybe get a quesadilla in case one of you gets a bit hungry.

The chips and salsa are also acclaimed. I do like the salsa, but I have to say it is a touch too spice for my taste.

They also do a great takeout - they are on my speed dial.

excerpts: I decided to the get the chorizo and cheese nacho deal.
Well, we sat down at the table and were brought the most delicious chips and the salsa which is fucking divine.
There's no other way to describe it.
But I could drink the stuff.
So, I got my nachos.
Well apparently I was supposed to hold out and wait with my chips because it was just dip?
Kind of irked me
but oh well, now I know!
I will definitely be back
but I think I might go to the other location-
it's a little more convenient for me!
cheese.author: Lauren S.
cheese.review: Went here finally for the first time yesterday. I wasn't really super hungry but definitely knew I needed something to tide me over. I decided to the get the chorizo and cheese nacho deal. Well, we sat down at the table and were brought the most delicious chips and the salsa which is fucking divine. There's no other way to describe it. But I could drink the stuff. So, I got my nachos. Well apparently I was supposed to hold out and wait with my chips because it was just dip? Kind of irked me but oh well, now I know! I will definitely be back but I think I might go to the other location- it's a little more convenient for me!

excerpts: I always get their steak burrito with cheese.
Veyy  scrumptious.
And those radishes and melons along the side? not just for show.
They actually cool my mouth down a bit after the salsa.
Though not my thing, I was happily surprised to see how much they had for vegans.
cheese.author: Sascha B.
cheese.review:
I love this place.  I know it isn't really authenntic but itt s so satisfing.  The salsa is pretty addictive.  I always get their steak burrito with cheese.  Veyy  scrumptious.  And those radishes and melons along the side? not just for show.  They actually cool my mouth down a bit after the salsa.  Though not my thing, I was happily surprised to see how much they had for vegans.  Also they place may be trendy but the staff seem pretty cool. 

I have not gotten big crowds, since I have come close to opening time.   After the second time they seemed to know my order.  And I said no drink but they gave me a little water annyway.  Much much needed as the salsa has a kick.:)  A person in a wheelchair can get in but it is a bit cramped, so be aware. (I have eavesdropped on many interesting conversations, lol.)  Also I tend not to linger here as by the time I leave there are people waitng.

excerpts: Plus their veggie burritos come with carrots and potatoes in replacement of sour cream and cheese.
But of course you can add the fats if you want...
just ask to "super" your meal.
The prawn burrito is my favorite, but the veggie fajitas (eggplant, zucchini, carrots, etc.) are satisfying if you're really hungry.
The only downside about this place is the wait, because sometimes the lines are out-
the- door, which really sucks when you make the commute
and there's no where to sit.
So plan accordingly if you go at night.
cheese.author: Leah E.
cheese.review:
Best salsa I've ever had in my life, and TRUST, I have had many a salsa to compare, being a San Diegan and a Mexican food enthusiast. 
Papalote is healthy, fresh, flavorful, and unique. They offer black beans and whole wheat tortillas for crying out loud! Plus their veggie burritos come with carrots and potatoes in replacement of sour cream and cheese. But of course you can add the fats if you want... just ask to "super" your meal. The prawn burrito is my favorite, but the veggie fajitas (eggplant, zucchini, carrots, etc.) are satisfying if you're really hungry.
The only downside about this place is the wait, because sometimes the lines are out- the- door, which really sucks when you make the commute and there's no where to sit. So plan accordingly if you go at night.

excerpts:
i had the chicken burrito + cheese & guacamole: 
not your run-of-mill burrito.
great size, its not HUGE, nor is it wimpy either.
the chicken is marinated very nicely; smokey & spicy, and it doesnt over power everything else.
refried blackbeans were nice consistency, not runny at all.
cheese.author: Ruben G.
cheese.review:
*yeah, we fed into the hype and swung by to see what the hoopla was all about....... 
 
i used to live in the city. i have my good-n-trusty taquerias that I MUST have whenever i'm up in SF - Pancho Villa, Cancun, El Farolito, but i never cared to break in another spot and be disappointed that i wasted my time when i coulda had a great burrito.

yes, parking is tough in the mission.  that's nothing new, so be prepared to circle the block.

ordering was a breeze.  Getting a table looked like it was going to be tough, but were actually seated pretty quickly. they bring you chips and their homemade salsa to nosh on while you wait.  the salsa is very very good - unlike the red/green salsas you see everywhere else, this salsa was rich, smokey, and very very flavoful (for those from SJ, think La Victoria salsa, but less creamy, and the raw ingredients dont get lost in the whip)

The meats are grilled FRESH.  not pre-grilled, chopped, and thrown in a tin in advance.  and cuz of this - and the size of this place (small), getting your order will take a while.  this is what separates it from other taquerias (or is it a grill?), that they do this as you order, unlike other places that take less than 5 mins to throw your ingredients in a tortilla, wrap it, and get it to your hands/table.  so be prepared to wait about 15- 20 mins (this was when it was very busy, probably less when its not)

my GF ordered steak nachos: 
the plate came and you could see the steam coming off the carne asada.  its a flank cut, marinated and seasoned to perfection.  she's a bit particular when it comes to taquerias, so to impress her was a big win.  the plate was fresh, hot, and all ingredients were very tasty.  refried black beans, ftw!

i had the chicken burrito + cheese & guacamole: 
not your run-of-mill burrito.  great size, its not HUGE, nor is it wimpy either.  the chicken is marinated very nicely; smokey & spicy, and it doesnt over power everything else.  refried blackbeans were nice consistency, not runny at all.  the salsa is awesome and the rice was nice and steamed, not al dente, or mushy.

the service is great.  one of the owners made sure the dining area was in check and that you were attended in adequate time.  kudos.

excerpts: I tend to like Oaxacan style -- heavy on the veggies, mole, and cotija cheese.
I'm not a burrito fan like my boyfriend (who initially rejected Papalote as being inauthentic, but has since come around.)
If you order vegetable dishes here, they are full of lots of veggies, not just onions, lettuce, and tomato like most SF taquerias.
This place is awesome for vegetarians- veggies and meatless meats abound.
Flavors are awesome.
Good drink selection, too.
cheese.author: Kely G.
cheese.review: This is my favorite Mexican eatery in SF. I tend to like Oaxacan style -- heavy on the veggies, mole, and cotija cheese. I'm not a burrito fan like my boyfriend (who initially rejected Papalote as being inauthentic, but has since come around.) If you order vegetable dishes here, they are full of lots of veggies, not just onions, lettuce, and tomato like most SF taquerias. This place is awesome for vegetarians- veggies and meatless meats abound. Flavors are awesome. Good drink selection, too.

excerpts: Chicken mole with black beans, super style (cheese, guac, slip of sour cream), was a humongous newborn-baby-sized thing of creation.
Everything was perfectly balanced: not too sour cream-y,
no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.
I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.
Gracias, Papalote.
no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.
I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.
Gracias, Papalote.
cheese.author: Lauren J.
cheese.review: A dream.  A beaut.  I'm an out of towner and begged my sister to take me to an awesome taqueria during a recent trip to SF.  She took me here, and I died.  Mexican Coke (tee hee).  Some sort of smoky, pureed chipotle salsa with fresh chips.  And the burrito.  Words cannot describe my happiness.  Chicken mole with black beans, super style (cheese, guac, slip of sour cream), was a humongous newborn-baby-sized thing of creation.  Everything was perfectly balanced: not too sour cream-y, no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.  I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.  Gracias, Papalote.

excerpts: Catering included 30 burritos (each cut in half) (10 beef, 10 chicken, 10 veg), chicken nachos, cheese quesadillas, and chips & quacamole.
Food was great, more than enough was provided and at a great value.
My guests loved it!
Thank you Papalote!
cheese.author: Leah S.
cheese.review: I've eaten here before (I love their salsa) and recently ordered catering from here for an outdoor party with 25 - 30 people.  Catering included 30 burritos (each cut in half) (10 beef, 10 chicken, 10 veg), chicken nachos, cheese quesadillas, and chips & quacamole.  Food was great, more than enough was provided and at a great value.  My guests loved it!  Thank you Papalote!

excerpts: Meat was tender and juicy, and the "grande" version with cheese, sour cream and guacamole made it better.
Would go again.
We heard about the "Triple Threat" burrito on a food network show, but looking at it in real life doesn't seem worth the $20.
I'm sure it's good, but for that much money, we'd expect to feed two easily - not that large.
cheese.author: Ann G.
cheese.review: A great lunch place!   The chorizo queso was really good.  Gooey and spicy.  We were disappointed that they only gave us one (large) tortilla to share for it, however.   The salsa they give you with the chips was fabulous, not your usual salsa - couldn't put my finger on it.  We orderd the carne asada tacos, and they didn't disappoint.  Meat was tender and juicy, and the "grande" version with cheese, sour cream and guacamole made it better.   Would go again.   We heard about the "Triple Threat" burrito on a food network show, but looking at it in real life doesn't seem worth the $20. I'm sure it's good, but for that much money, we'd expect to feed two easily - not that large.

excerpts: The rice, beans, and cheese, all got along swimmingly and never created any kind of ruckus.
There were not as many annoying, skinny-jean-wearing, hoodied, trucker hat "hipsters" as others have indicated.
The beer was cold.
Life could be worse.
cheese.author: LosAngelenoguy L.
cheese.review: Just had the best burrito here. ever. the tortilla was grilled, flaky, and amazing. The chicken was grilled and tasty. The rice, beans, and cheese, all got along swimmingly and never created any kind of ruckus. There were not as many annoying, skinny-jean-wearing, hoodied, trucker hat "hipsters" as others have indicated. The beer was cold. Life could be worse.

excerpts: i got a black bean burrito, "poco arroz," with cheese and guac.
cheese.author: jean w.
cheese.review:
eh. maybe i ordered the wrong thing. i got a black bean burrito, "poco arroz," with cheese and guac. it was very beany, and very light on the guac. 

when my friend was up getting more water, i snuck a bite of his carne asada burrito (i'm a pseudo-vegetarian, shhh). it was average, too. 

i used to like papalote but i forgot why...

excerpts: They also put cheese, sour cream, and guacamole on it if you'd like.
It was so good
, I can't wait to try other things on the menu.
The wait for a table and food was pretty long, but it was cinco de mayo, so it was probably abnormally long.
I have a feeling this place is generally pretty busy, and for good reason.
cheese.author: Julie F.
cheese.review: The grilled veggie tacos where delicious. I had never had grilled eggplant and zucchini in a taco before, but I will be coming back here for more! They also put cheese, sour cream, and guacamole on it if you'd like. It was so good, I can't wait to try other things on the menu. The wait for a table and food was pretty long, but it was cinco de mayo, so it was probably abnormally long. I have a feeling this place is generally pretty busy, and for good reason.

excerpts: and it doesn't make me feel too unhealthy though it's drowned in sour cream, guac, and cheese.
cheese.author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.
cheese.review:
1st stop on my day of eating in the mission...

tasty tasty tacos! 2 per order. the corn tortillas are big for... well corn tortillas.  the carne asada is large, hearty chunks of steak and you won't regret super-ing it.

the salsa is so good, calling it salsa doesn't do it justice. 

my new favorite taco place. and it doesn't make me feel too unhealthy though it's drowned in sour cream, guac, and cheese.

excerpts: I even got the "super" side of cheese, guac and sour cream on the side.
cheese.author: Cyrus S.
cheese.review:
unimpressed.  flew into town from DC area and was told that i HAD TO HAVE a burrito in the mission area ... um.. I'm sorry, i was not impressed.

Now, the Nachos that someone else got looked really good.  But i've never met a plate of nachos i didnt like.

The burrito i had was just a ton of tortilla, beans and minimal chicken.

I even got the "super" side of cheese, guac and sour cream on the side.  thats what made it palatable.

Maybe others are better.. but this wasn't that special.

Sorry, not trying to hate!
not that cheap either.

excerpts: (I'm a pinto bean guy, myself) and charge you extra for cheese (not cool).
Their salsa is easily one of the tastiest I've been able to find.
It's not spicy, though, so
if you're into the burning tongue thing, it's best to look elsewhere.
If you love it, you can buy it by the jar, just be sure to bring back your old jar for a discount off your next refill.
cheese.author: Aldo K.
cheese.review: I came to frequent Papalote because it was the only serviceable burrito in the entire Noe Valley area.  Their burritos are solid, though they only use black beans (I'm a pinto bean guy, myself) and charge you extra for cheese (not cool).  Their salsa is easily one of the tastiest I've been able to find.  It's not spicy, though, so if you're into the burning tongue thing, it's best to look elsewhere.  If you love it, you can buy it by the jar, just be sure to bring back your old jar for a discount off your next refill.

excerpts: A good burrito to me has a balance between the meat, cheese, salsa, rice, and beans.
This was mainly just a tortilla of meat.
cheese.author: Jnzl D.
cheese.review: I would say 2.5. Like many others, I saw this on Food Network and decided to go give it a try. I don't know if I went on an off day but it seriously did not live up to the hype I had built up in my mind about how amazing this burrito experience was going to be. I ordered the Triple Threat, mind you...a $20+ burrito...yes I agreed to pay this much because I believed it was going to be phenomenal. I've had $5 burritos that blew my mind, this $20+ one did not. Seriously disappointed. It was all meat, mind you, which wouldn't be a bad thing, except there was nothing in it to make it spectacular. A good burrito to me has a balance between the meat, cheese, salsa, rice, and beans. This was mainly just a tortilla of meat. the chicken was probably the best of the three types of meat in it. The carne asada, again, nothing to write home about, and the shrimp, totally lacking and overcooked, didn't taste very good at all, I picked them all out and set them aside.  I did enjoy the salsa that everyone is boasting about but the chips weren't great and that's half the experience when you're eating salsa. Overall, I don't think I'd go back. Bummer, I had such high hopes.

excerpts: While I agree that some of their dishes are "drier" than other neighboring spots, in my opinion it's because this is one of few places that doesn't coat your food in sloppy sour cream and too much cheese.
I love this place!
cheese.author: Sara W.
cheese.review: I use to live right next to Papalotes and come 2+ times per week. What I love is that you can get delicious soyrizo tacos with amazing vegan salsa for cheap. While I agree that some of their dishes are "drier" than other neighboring spots, in my opinion it's because this is one of few places that doesn't coat your food in sloppy sour cream and too much cheese. I love this place!

excerpts: The nachos were good, not too much cheese, not too little just enough... good food, will definitely come back!!
cheese.author: Shelley N.
cheese.review: Gotta give this place 5 stars for the awesome Marinated tofu burrito!! Yummy!! The hubby got the nachos and quesadia (sp?) and those were good as well. THe thing i liked the most is that the plates were not drenched with grease like some of the other mexican restaurants i have been to, esp. on the quesadia plate.  The nachos were good, not too much cheese, not too little just enough... good food, will definitely come back!!

excerpts: first of all, i didn't know their burritos came with no cheese.
however, that was probably more my fault considering i was a little slow and hungover to really read the fine print and ask any questions.
cheese.author: James J.
cheese.review:
not too sure if this place is as cracked up as people say it is. BUT i think i didn't order the right things though. it was my first time here on Sunday and my expectations were high - considering all of my friends rave about this place. first of all, i didn't know their burritos came with no cheese. however, that was probably more my fault considering i was a little slow and hungover to really read the fine print and ask any questions. anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito. bad move on my part. the burrito was dry and had no flavour. to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go? i was very confused - considering i JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant. so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream. REALLY? 

so anyways my gf got soyrizo tacos and they were ok, but she actually makes a better one than they do. i enjoyed the "complimentary" side of chips and salsa, but i agree with some other reviewers on here, why are you so stingy on the salsa? if i go back and ask for more, are you gonna charge me $2? the salsa isn't your typical chunky tomato-wee cilantro type - it's more like a tomato-wee creamy kind. not much zip to it, but still good.

anyways, i'm thinking i didn't order the right thing from here because my friends seem to know good food. i'm thinking i need to quit being a pussy and order a burrito with meat in it - most probably carnitas! mmm ...

excerpts: What kind of Mexican restaurant doesn't understand that an order for a breakfast burrito with chorizo and cheese means you do want EGG as well???
Seriously - a chorizo burrito?
With super condiments added?
DISGUSTING.
I don't know why people go there.
We got it to go so
didn't realize until we were home.
NEVER going back to this place.
What in the world is all the hype about???
cheese.author: Andrea S.
cheese.review: What kind of Mexican restaurant doesn't understand that an order for a breakfast burrito with chorizo and cheese means you do want EGG as well??? Seriously - a chorizo burrito? With super condiments added? DISGUSTING. I don't know why people go there. We got it to go so didn't realize until we were home. NEVER going back to this place. What in the world is all the hype about???

excerpts: i had a black bean/JOOCY meat/cheese/sour cream/rice burrito.
cheese.author: Adela K.
cheese.review:
i had a black bean/JOOCY meat/cheese/sour cream/rice burrito.  yes, i made my own burrito (doesn't have a name on the menu) and yes, i made sure there were absolutely no veggies in it and yes...i gained 5 pounds.  

that tender meat will keep me coming back.

excerpts: The burritos are excellent, although maybe a little dry if you don't get them made with cheese & sour cream, which I always do...
It may be a crime against Mexican cuisine and deeply inauthentic
cheese.author: Jacob D.
cheese.review:
My favourite Mexican restaurant bar none. A whole other class to every other burrito place in the Mission - fresh fresh vegetables, really great grilled meat, and the best salsa on the planet.

The burritos are excellent, although maybe a little dry if you don't get them made with cheese & sour cream, which I always do... It may be a crime against Mexican cuisine and deeply inauthentic but I LOVE the nachos there, especially with grilled steak. Dear lord I think I may have to go there right now and get some.

Downsides - noisy as hell but what do you expect in a Mexican restaurant that's about the size of your bathroom? It's always busy, but I've always been able to find a table when I needed to. OK, the lines out the door can be a bit of a pain and the kitchen staff seem overstretched, but that's popularity for you...

excerpts: Since I am mostly vegetarian, I think it all comes down to the greatness of their beans (black beans in particular) that makes the simplicity of the bean and cheese burrito super style unbeatable.
I have since gotten my entire office on Papalote as we use the services of TCB courier to deliver to our office on a weekly basis.
cheese.author: Manan M.
cheese.review: Been going to Papalote since 2007 and have yet to go to a burrito joint in SF as good as this one is. I have been challenged by a number of friends to try all sorts of Taquerias, Taco Trucks, and various home style burrito places.That all said, all have fallen short. Since I am mostly vegetarian, I think it all comes down to the greatness of their beans (black beans in particular) that makes the simplicity of the bean and cheese burrito super style unbeatable. I have since gotten my entire office on Papalote as we use the services of TCB courier to deliver to our office on a weekly basis.

excerpts: I went for the "super" burrito because why even bother without the soar cream/cheese/guac?
cheese.author: e w.
cheese.review: I really hate to be a downer here, seriously, because I've been looking forward to trying this place.  Finally happened today.  I went for the "super" burrito because why even bother without the soar cream/cheese/guac?  The chicken burrito came with barely 1/4 oz of the extras combined.  I know the chicken is supposed to be fab, but I really prefer the regular taqueria style rather than a pounded out flattened breast.  I had to buy an extra salsa (which lived up to its rad reputation) to pour over the rest of my burrito just to make it interesting.  And 50c for more salsa?  Come on.

excerpts: My order was half of the triple threat burrito: full serving of tender grilled chicken, full serving of tangy carne asada, four succulent grilled prawns, rice, beans and cheese - made it into a super triple threat and it also included sour cream and guacamole!
Sounds pretty hefty, aye?
That's why I only had half
and I was good for the night.
The meat was a little chewy and the rice - dry, but the grilled chicken was juicy and the prawns were flavorful!

I could've used a side of fresh salsa but all they offered was a reddish orange hot sauce that kind of reminded me of the orange sauce La Vic's is famous for but sure enough, it didn't taste anything like it.
1.5 thumbs out 2, ain't bad at all.
cheese.author: Ai Q.
cheese.review: This little hole in the wall gets a 1.25 thumbs up from me. Although Bobby McFlay wasn't able to throw down on this joint or burrito or whatever so maybe a 1.5 instead for it being pretty good but not perfect. The ambiance is very hip and chill, a bit packed but the walls are red and covered in dope art pieces. You order your food at the register and wait to be seated while you're order is being cooked up. My order was half of the triple threat burrito: full serving of tender grilled chicken, full serving of tangy carne asada, four succulent grilled prawns, rice, beans and cheese - made it into a super triple threat and it also included sour cream and guacamole! Sounds pretty hefty, aye? That's why I only had half and I was good for the night. The meat was a little chewy and the rice - dry, but the grilled chicken was juicy and the prawns were flavorful! I could've used a side of fresh salsa but all they offered was a reddish orange hot sauce that kind of reminded me of the orange sauce La Vic's is famous for but sure enough, it didn't taste anything like it. 1.5 thumbs out 2, ain't bad at all.

excerpts: We drove back over there and picked it up & got home & my vegan tacos were COVERED in sour cream and cheese!!!
I'm only visiting
so I have no intention of ever returning.
If you like getting your order correct and avoiding the waste of food by having to send it back
I suggest going elsewhere.
There are so many Mexican food places in SF that are capable of getting order correct and their food is equally as good, if not better.
I suggest skipping Papalote unless you want to check your order thoroughly before heading home.
But, like I said, they have never gotten my order correct the first time, and
more than just this weekend have they gotten it wrong the second.
Plus, most of the staff are VERY rude.
The food is good, but not good enough to deal with this.
As far as their salsa: it has always been gross to me so I never eat it.
The location is good.
I really wish they'd train the staff to be kind or fire everyone and hire nice people.
cheese.author: Marie F.
cheese.review: I used to live in San Francisco & I would get food from Papalote often. I have never gone there and had my correct order handed to me. Not once have they gotten it right, and I went there roughly 20+ times. I'm visiting now and my friend & I decided to get take out. We got home and both of our orders were wrong. I was meant to have two tacos and I only received one, and my friend didn't get her chips and guacamole. So I called to complain. The girl I spoke with reluctantly said she would give it to us next time we came in. I called ahead the following day and talked with the manager. She wasn't very nice & kept stating "it's not possible to only get one taco when it comes with two." She also wasn't really answering my questions. But she said she'd get it ready for us and give it to us. We drove back over there and picked it up & got home & my vegan tacos were COVERED in sour cream and cheese!!! I'm only visiting so I have no intention of ever returning. If you like getting your order correct and avoiding the waste of food by having to send it back I suggest going elsewhere. There are so many Mexican food places in SF that are capable of getting order correct and their food is equally as good, if not better. I suggest skipping Papalote unless you want to check your order thoroughly before heading home. But, like I said, they have never gotten my order correct the first time, and more than just this weekend have they gotten it wrong the second. Plus, most of the staff are VERY rude. The food is good, but not good enough to deal with this. As far as their salsa: it has always been gross to me so I never eat it. The location is good. I really wish they'd train the staff to be kind or fire everyone and hire nice people.

excerpts: The fish tacos are spectacular - I am a big cheese lover and usually have buyer's remorse if my plate of Mexican food doesn't include cheese but
the flavors in the fish tacos were so good
, I didn't feel like I missed out on a thing.
cheese.author: Catherine H.
cheese.review: SO GOOD!  The salsa is amazing.  If they sold it to take home, it would be worth the trip and the search for parking just to pick up a bottle.  That being said, everything else I've tried is incredible as well!  The fish tacos are spectacular - I am a big cheese lover and usually have buyer's remorse if my plate of Mexican food doesn't include cheese but the flavors in the fish tacos were so good, I didn't feel like I missed out on a thing.  The grilled veggie burrito is to die for - I've been thinking about it all week.  My husband is wild for their nachos and is even starting to suggest going to Papalote himself - this, from a die hard La Taqueria fan!  Keep it up Papalote, and I'll keep coming back for more!

excerpts: But then again I also asked her if the vegan quesadilla had cheese in it, and she said yes
so I knew she was not completely with the program.
After a few unsuccessful attempted inquiries as to why the guacamole was more expensive than advertised,  I decided to just let it go, as I was getting rather hungry.
The food came relatively quickly- in the meantime we snacked on chips and some very spicy salsa.
Again, I don't see what the hype is about.
The salsa was just that- salsa.
Nothing extraordinary.
In fact, I prefer fresh salsa, if anything.
The cheese was relatively light-
a white cheese (quesa fresca perhaps?) and the roasted vegetables were a delicious compliment.
I much enjoyed dipping the crispy cheesy confection in the oh so expensive guacamole.
I'll probably visit this place again if I happen to be in the Mission, and look forward to trying their soy products.
cheese.author: Kate A.
cheese.review: While Papalote is probably one of the more gourmet Mexican cafes in the Mission, I am not sure I see what all the hype is about. I came here for an early dinner and the place was not terribly crowded- we were able to get a table without any wait. I ordered a quesadilla with grilled zucchini and eggplant. I also spent quite a bit extra ($2.75 to be exact) to have a side of guacamole with this quesadilla. Why so much  money for a little dollop of mashed avocado? Can't answer that one. The waitress was clearly confused when I placed my order, since the the overhead board said that additional sides were only a dollar. But then again I also asked her if the vegan quesadilla had cheese in it, and she said yes so I knew she was not completely with the program. After a few unsuccessful attempted inquiries as to why the guacamole was more expensive than advertised,  I decided to just let it go, as I was getting rather hungry. The food came relatively quickly- in the meantime we snacked on chips and some very spicy salsa. Again, I don't see what the hype is about. The salsa was just that- salsa. Nothing extraordinary. In fact, I prefer fresh salsa, if anything. In any event, when the much awaited quesadilla finally arrived I was very excited to see that it was chock full of roasted veggies and not overly greasy or soggy. The cheese was relatively light- a white cheese (quesa fresca perhaps?) and the roasted vegetables were a delicious compliment. I much enjoyed dipping the crispy cheesy confection in the oh so expensive guacamole. I'll probably visit this place again if I happen to be in the Mission, and look forward to trying their soy products.

excerpts: imagine being drunk, starving, and then biting into the perfect mix of cheese, tortilla, and potato.
worth the wait in line!
cheese.author: Oleya P.
cheese.review: papalote! i think i want to rename this place yummylote. i love how they have so many vegetarian options. i had their potato/tomato quesadilla, and i have never tasted something so good. imagine being drunk, starving, and then biting into the perfect mix of cheese, tortilla, and potato. worth the wait in line!

excerpts: if you are craving grease, try the chorizo & cheese....slap your moma good.
cheese.author: kelly M.
cheese.review: frtesh, fresh, fresh....i will go to el farolito at 2 am when i am drunk and it'll be greasy and great. but the rest of the time and when i am sober, papalote is the spot! always tastes fresh, tasty and i never feel gross or guilty after i eat b/c it is so not greasy here. if you are craving grease, try the chorizo & cheese....slap your moma good. i go with chicken or shrimp...tacos or burrito. everything is good here. and they always have good fliers to peek at while you are waiting for takeout. fast, good, nice people working here, clean, bottled coke...yum, great food.

excerpts: , you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents!
woo wee!
cheese.author: Cindy L.
cheese.review: oh my can i give it a 6 stars? i am so addicted to this place. i always come here after steph snyder's class at yoga tree valencia. it's pretty much a ritual. the price is unbeatable. 2 tacos for 3 bucks? it's fabulous. basically there are plain, arroz y frijoles, veggie, grilled veggie, marinated tofu, soyrizo, mole, chile verde, carne asada, pollo, camarones, prawn and prescado choices for either burritos, quesadillas and 2 tacos. and to super size it, you can add sour cream, cheese and guacamole for 99 cents! woo wee! their grilled veggie tacos are devine. i also tried the mole, which was a bit watery for my taste. overall, it is pretty good and i will definitely visit again. also, the salsa is really fabulous and flavorful. the decor is nice and clean, unlike a lot of similar places in sf mission area. i will recommend it! also it is close to 24th street mission bart.

excerpts: I got cheese which brought it up to $9.30.
$1.50 extra?
Guacamole is even more.
Then I waited close to ten minutes, and it wasn't busy at all.
So it's twice as expensive and takes more than twice as long as any number of place within a couple blocks.
This is real BS.
I've had time to make a phone call, log on to Yelp to write this review up to here, and still no food.
Still waiting...
And here it is, now 15 minutes after ordering.
How is it?
Not so good.
Pretty bland and dry, heavy on the rice.
And they didn't put on the cheese.
I'd been here before with similar results but gave it another chance because of convenience and good reviews.
I could have walked down to La Cornetta or, even better, La Tacqeria, and had my food faster
and it would have been tasty and reasonably priced.
I just don't understand the good reviews.
cheese.author: Matthew T.
cheese.review: I went here because it was on the way to where i was going and and it had good reciews. I wish i hadn't. Regular burrito $7.50. I got cheese which brought it up to $9.30. $1.50 extra? Guacamole is even more. Then I waited close to ten minutes, and it wasn't busy at all. So it's twice as expensive and takes more than twice as long as any number of place within a couple blocks. This is real BS. I've had time to make a phone call, log on to Yelp to write this review up to here, and still no food. Still waiting... And here it is, now 15 minutes after ordering. How is it? Not so good. Pretty bland and dry, heavy on the rice. I got chicken and it's dry and bland also. And they didn't put on the cheese. I'd been here before with similar results but gave it another chance because of convenience and good reviews. I could have walked down to La Cornetta or, even better, La Tacqeria, and had my food faster and it would have been tasty and reasonably priced. I just don't understand the good reviews.

excerpts: Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole.
cheese.author: Eugene P.
cheese.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts: I like that the food comes with free chips and salsa
chips and salsa.author: Alyssa A.
chips and salsa.review:
We were looking for a quick bite in the neighborhood. This place also accepts American Express which is a rare thing around here. We ordered takeout and our food took a long time because we didn't realize you had to stand in the front for takeout. They gave us a number and were delivering the rest of the foods --- we apparently missed the memo.

We ordered a chicken burrito supreme and carne Asad's quesadilla. When I got home, my burrito was supposed to have sour cream and guacamole and unfortunately all those things were missing. The flavors were still good, but it was really lacking those Ingredients. My husbands carne asada burrito was super salty.

I like that the food comes with free chips and salsa but that's pretty standard around the mission.

There are so many wonderful options for burritos in the area, try elsewhere. They seemed busy and had happy seeming customers, so maybe the dine in experience would have been better. 

$26.00 for a burrito and quesadilla - not crazy cheap but not crazy expensive either.

excerpts: Every meal you order comes with chips and salsa--but not just any salsa.
Papalote
(man, I love saying that..)
has a special secret recipe home-made salsa that has a hint of chipotle who know what else.
chips and salsa.author: Vasiliy M.
chips and salsa.review:
"papalote" is just a fun word to say - that's at least 3 stars just for a dope name. BUT, the food is also amazing! Every meal you order comes with chips and salsa--but not just any salsa. Papalote (man, I love saying that..) has a special secret recipe home-made salsa that has a hint of chipotle who know what else. You just NEED to try it for yourself!

I ordered a carne asada quesadilla. You can supersize any meal and add sour cream and guac for just a $1.50. I can't eat anything without sour cream, so I did that and it was so worth it. Do it!

Papalote is a small space with tight seating, so get to know thy neighbors and bond over some good food! Highly recommended!

excerpts: On the 2014 and 2015 7x7 list for their chips and salsa.
Chips and salsa - 5/5
- WOW.
I very much expected to be disappointed by another overhyped dish but this absolutely lived up to it's reputation.
The salsa is so damn good.
This is easily my favorite salsa in the city
and I even bought an extra jar to take home.
It is creamy, spicy and delicious.
chips and salsa.author: Mark O.
chips and salsa.review:
Mexican restaurant on 24th & Valencia. On the 2014 and 2015 7x7 list for their chips and salsa.

Although you order at the counter your food gets brought to you. Limited meat selection. No chorizo or carnitas. 

Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.

Triple threat burrito - 3/5 - Massive. Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado. Not really impressed.

Chips and salsa - 5/5 - WOW. I very much expected to be disappointed by another overhyped dish but this absolutely lived up to it's reputation. The salsa is so damn good. This is easily my favorite salsa in the city and I even bought an extra jar to take home. It is creamy, spicy and delicious. It certainly deserves the spot it has held on the 7x7 list for the past two years.

Overall, this is without a doubt my new go to option for salsa. Unfortunately the rest of their items are passable so I think I will likely be getting the salsa to go and getting my burrito/taco/quesadilla elsewhere in the future. Regardless, this salsa is absolutely "as good as it gets" and I will probably always have some on hand in my fridge.

excerpts: I love the chips and salsa here too!
It can get crowded sometimes so I like to just order ahead and pick up.
chips and salsa.author: Jacqui C.
chips and salsa.review: The veggie burrito is delicious here! It's all fresh ingredients in generous portions. I love the chips and salsa here too! It can get crowded sometimes so I like to just order ahead and pick up.

excerpts: All orders come with chips and salsa.
Their salsa was delicious!
It was my favorite part of the meal.
It's probably a favorite of a lot of their customers since they sell it by the bottle.
I'd probably come back to buy a bottle of salsa
but I will pass on the food.
chips and salsa.author: Michelle T.
chips and salsa.review: Came here and ordered an overpriced quesadilla. I can probably get something with the same quality for a more affordable price at another spot in the Mission. All orders come with chips and salsa. Their salsa was delicious! It was my favorite part of the meal. It's probably a favorite of a lot of their customers since they sell it by the bottle. I'd probably come back to buy a bottle of salsa but I will pass on the food.

excerpts: To start with some chips and salsa u get two flavors roster to mates and roster habanero both off the hook and the famous triple threat award winning burrito u can't go wrong
chips and salsa.author: Samuel N.
chips and salsa.review: To start with some chips and salsa u get two flavors roster to mates and roster habanero both off the hook and the famous triple threat award winning burrito u can't go wrong

excerpts: People rave about the chips and salsa (yes the burritos come with it)
and yeah the salsa is like crack.
The chips have been hit or miss.
chips and salsa.author: Traci H.
chips and salsa.review:
Ok now I understand the craze that is Papalote.

For hipster Mission, it's reasonably priced (e.g., 2 people can eat for $20), but yeah it's just a burrito.  But it's a good one.  

People rave about the chips and salsa (yes the burritos come with it) and yeah the salsa is like crack.  The chips have been hit or miss.  Sometimes it feels hard and tasteless, but it's just a shovel to get the salsa in my mouth.

I made a big mistake...I ordered a steak naked bowl with no beans.  It was dry and tasteless.  The steak is meh.  Skip it.
