It was really good, but I do wish there had been more mushrooms in there. The potatoes and carrots had been cooked nice and soft but not mushy and seasoned well. I also tried the soyrizo which was also awesome. 

If you want some guacamole, sour cream,, and cheese in your burrito, you got to pay an extra 99 cents to get it super. The burritos here are a little pricier than other places in the Mission (around $6.50 -$9 for a burrito) and they are not as big either... BUT they are delicious...

excerpts:
*Awesome*.

Not to mention the customary free chips and salsa, and to reiterate what everyone else already said - it's almost worth visiting just for the salsa (which does have plenty of kick, contrary to someone's bogus assertion
chips and salsa.author: Bryan M.
chips and salsa.review:
Ok, we need to get a few things straight.  Papalote won all those Best Salsa/Best Upscale Tacqueria/Best Burrito awards for a reason.  Some of these reviews have it ass backwards - it's not made for the masses, it's just that the masses have spoken, and the verdict is DELICIOUS.  There's always a line out the door for a reason.

I just moved away from SF, and this is one of the spots I am missing the most. It's not "white people food", ffs, it's just not the most authentic Mexican in the area....but so what?  It's not like you can't score that if you really want it - but you come here for a reason, and that reason is the bomb-ass burritos.

And they are far from "flavorless", trust me.  The cheese is good, the fresh salsa adds nice saltiness and acidity, the beans are tasty and the meat is cooked to order.  Quite simply, they are just awesome burritos.  *Awesome*.

Not to mention the customary free chips and salsa, and to reiterate what everyone else already said - it's almost worth visiting just for the salsa (which does have plenty of kick, contrary to someone's bogus assertion that it's lacking...if you really want *any* Mexican food to be spicy, you have to add hot sauce, so that is kind of irrelevant anyways).

*Note:  the salsa does not, I repeat NOT taste anything like "liquid Doritos".  Good God.  The unique consistency in the "orange sauce" salsas in California are due to the addition of sour cream.

I'd usually be a bit more judicious with the stars and give this 4, but the service is always friendly and they never messed up an order in 2 years of constant high-volume take out.

excerpts: But first they give everyone their own bowl of chips and salsa.
Because everyone is obsessed with the salsa, I'm just going to reiterate the fanatic declarations and agree: It is probably the best salsa I've had yet.
chips and salsa.author: Brett W.
chips and salsa.review:
Ladies. Gentlemen. I have been defeated.

In one corner you've got B: A vertically challenged underweight, but with years of burrito-eating experience.

In the other corner you've got Papalote: A Mexican grill that packs an unassumingly heavy punch.

This was the talk of the group for my San Fran veteran friends*. Luckily, I have a really smart morning routine: I oversleep, shower eventually, and drink my breakfast in the form of coffee. So by the time Papalote rolled around, Papa was storving!

I went for a classic grilled chicken burrito. Did I make it SUPER for $0.99 and add sour cream, cheese, and guacamole inside? DUH. As if that was even a legitimate question.

But first they give everyone their own bowl of chips and salsa. Because everyone is obsessed with the salsa, I'm just going to reiterate the fanatic declarations and agree: It is probably the best salsa I've had yet. I wanted to pick-pocket it and douse a little on all of my meals. 

Then, the burrito the size of my torso was set in front of me. My eyes said, "YES. YES. YES. GO!" Halfway through my stomach said, "Boo, you've got to give it a rest." 

I got about 3/4ths of the way finished with the appearance of my coaches--fork and knife--but not even they could help me with the big win.

Yet it has never felt so good to lose. 
__________

* I was a newbie. But I really did leave my heart in San Francisco . . . My appetite too.

excerpts: The chips and salsa are pretty good.
chips and salsa.author: Rohan D.
chips and salsa.review:
Two things to note: This place has DELICIOUS fish burritos and phone in because the wait can be super long. 

Papalote is great high quality mexican food.  You can have your carne asada, chicken, and whatever other type of burrito. I love my fish burritos. And this place has them. They have the most delicious fish burritos I've had in a while, this is the place. Other places in the mission won't serve fish. 

While I myself love this place for the fish burritos, they have a wide selection of other delicious goods. The chips and salsa are pretty good.

Beware the wait. You can wait anywhere from 5 minutes to 45 minutes (dead serious, 45 minutes for a burrito is not acceptable) but I assumed that was a strange night.

excerpts: (Honestly, I could go back and eat the chips and salsa and be happy!)
If they bottled it, I'd buy it....unique and VERY spicy :
-)....UPDATE
I guess they sell the salsa in bottles....
so you CAN buy it!!!!!!!
chips and salsa.author: sohail s.
chips and salsa.review:
I've tried most Mexican spots in the Mission, but had never tried this one, let alone even heard of the joint!!!  If I had to sum it up, I'd call it "healthy Mexican food in the Mission"....which is rare.

I had the pollo super burrito which was delicious but not very filling.  It also felt clean and healthy, as opposed to the typical sloppy style I like at my usual Mexican watering holes (El Farolito, Taqueria Cancun and Taqueria Vallarta....yum yum!!!!!)  They also offer multiple tortilla choices (spinach, tomato, flour or wheat) which I loved.

The salsa was awesome!  Definitely unique, like a variation of Pakistani chutney my mom makes. (Honestly, I could go back and eat the chips and salsa and be happy!)  If they bottled it, I'd buy it....unique and VERY spicy :-)....UPDATE....I guess they sell the salsa in bottles....so you CAN buy it!!!!!!!  My life is now complete....

The overall cleanliness was nice and the ambiance in general is welcoming and relaxing.  I'd go here again if I had the urge for "healthy" mexican and was in the area.  Can't eat lard-packed greasy burritos everyday...right????

excerpts: They have the best chips and salsa in the city!
I did try their adobo burrito and it was a tad bit too salty for my liking, but other than that, I don't have any complaints about this place AT ALL!
chips and salsa.author: Fallon P.
chips and salsa.review: I absolutely love their soyrizo burrito! They have the best chips and salsa in the city! I did try their adobo burrito and it was a tad bit too salty for my liking, but other than that, I don't have any complaints about this place AT ALL!

excerpts: We sat down in the dining area and they came out with chips and salsa for each of us.
The salsa was awesome and hot hot HOT - I started getting really excited about this burrito.
It came out, nicely on a plate.
I picked it up and sunk my teeth in for my first bite.
GOO-OOOD =
4 stars, but where are rest of the rice & beans, guac, sour cream?
I only got to taste some meat, lettuce, and a little rice, beans..
I soon found out where they were.. all at the bottom-end of my burrito, thus giving me a soggy bottom and tearing my burrito apart at the end :(
That's why I took half a star away, for my soggy bottom.
chips and salsa.author: Thu V.
chips and salsa.review:
3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up for this baby because it was still quite tasty.  After spending 3 days in San Fran and hearing about how Cali's mexican was SO much better than anything you can find in the east coast, I was craving a burrito BIG TIME.  Specifically, one from the mission.  We were recommended to come here to Papalote Mexican Grill.  

I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with black beans, guac, salsa - the works.  We sat down in the dining area and they came out with chips and salsa for each of us.  The salsa was awesome and hot hot HOT - I started getting really excited about this burrito.  It came out, nicely on a plate.  I picked it up and sunk my teeth in for my first bite.  GOO-OOOD = 4 stars, but where are rest of the rice & beans, guac, sour cream?  I only got to taste some meat, lettuce, and a little rice, beans..  I soon found out where they were.. all at the bottom-end of my burrito, thus giving me a soggy bottom and tearing my burrito apart at the end :(  That's why I took half a star away, for my soggy bottom.  Rather than that, it was a solid tasting burrito!

I asked my brother (local in SF) what he thought.  He said that he prefers the burritos that you get from the trucks in the mission better, but this place was good.  All in all, I was happy with this burrito, but as the best I've had?  I can't honestly give you that.  I'm sure there are better burrito places in SF, I just haven't had time to take a whirl-wind tour of burritos in SF.. next time...

excerpts: Gotta love free chips and salsa, and the creamy spicy salsa is delicious.
chips and salsa.author: Will A.
chips and salsa.review: A bit less traditional than the other taqueria's in the mission, but a nice variation. I always order the chicken mole burrito and it's unique and delicious. Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission? The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy. Gotta love free chips and salsa, and the creamy spicy salsa is delicious.

excerpts: We also ordered the chips and salsa - the salsa was REALLY good, very spicy, but the chips - meh, not so much.
I like my chips thick and bursting with roasted corn flavor
chips and salsa.author: Burrito M.
chips and salsa.review:
Dinner at Papalote for Cinco de Mayo.

We ordered the famous Triple Threat Burrito ($20!) and it did not disappoint.  It was delicious, all of the meat was tender (pollo, carne asada, prawns), flavorful and perfectly seasoned - a definite highlight, and the black bleans, rice, cheese and guacamole were extremely complementary.  I thought it was kind of expensive for a burrito, but this is a must try - at least once - especially since they whooped Booby Flay's ass at his own genre on Throwdown with this burrito.

We also ordered the chips and salsa - the salsa was REALLY good, very spicy, but the chips - meh, not so much.  I like my chips thick and bursting with roasted corn flavor,  these were thin and kinda pathetic, most were broken into small pieces by the time we got home with our meal.

By the way, one of the brother/owners was in the house while we were there and the guy really cares about customer service.  It was literally a madhouse inside and he was really diligent about keeping people calm and the line moving.

Tip: Order ahead on the phone and drop by for pickup, we ordered take out in the restaurant and ended up waiting 20-30 minutes before our food was ready.  Not sure if the crowd was due to Cinco d Mayo, or if it's normally like this.  In any case, they have a separate and shorter line for phone orders.

excerpts: The chicken tacos are to Die for so its a good thing they serve the chips and salsa while you wait....
chips and salsa.author: Raeleen D.
chips and salsa.review:
I love Papalotes!  The chicken tacos are to Die for so its a good thing they serve the chips and salsa while you wait.... :)

Miguels smile makes it worth the drive to the city from San Jose-

excerpts: Them chips and salsa be good.
That triple threat...
wow.
I split it with my boyfriend... but sheeeeeeeesh
I haven't had so much meat stuffed into a burrito like that before.
Delicious.
I would, someday, try another plate and not the triple threat.
chips and salsa.author: Angelica D.
chips and salsa.review: Them chips and salsa be good.  That triple threat... wow.  I split it with my boyfriend... but sheeeeeeeesh I haven't had so much meat stuffed into a burrito like that before.  Delicious.  I would, someday, try another plate and not the triple threat.

excerpts: $1.50 for chips and salsa (very much like orange sauce at La Victoria's in SJ).
Awesome food, very fast, limited sitting space.
Chips were not greasy like many Mexican places.
chips and salsa.author: Oliver L.
chips and salsa.review:
$1.50 for chips and salsa (very much like orange sauce at La Victoria's in SJ). Awesome food, very fast, limited sitting space. Chips were not greasy like many Mexican places. The salsa was the best part, spicy and fiery. 

One of the few 7x7 dishes that lives up to the hype. Only giving it 3 stars pending eating there more try out other dishes.

excerpts: We also ordered chips and salsa to start and the salsa is definitely one of the best salsas I've ever had.
I was glad I had some extra to pour on my burrito as it made it that much more enjoyable.
chips and salsa.author: Blake B.
chips and salsa.review: I'm sure we weren't the only ones that hadn't heard too much about Papalote before they were on Throwdown and listed in 7x7 but I was so glad I checked both of those out as Papalote is legit.  We ordered the triple threat burrito and it was great.  I thought that the shrimp was the best part of the burrito although everything was delicious.  We also ordered chips and salsa to start and the salsa is definitely one of the best salsas I've ever had.  I was glad I had some extra to pour on my burrito as it made it that much more enjoyable.

excerpts: On top of all this you get free chips and salsa.
There salsa is world class.
If you near mission street and 24th do not pass this place up
chips and salsa.author: Tmo457 W.
chips and salsa.review: I ordered the camarones (shrimp) super burrito. I had recently ate at el-ferrollito on mission street because of there $6 prices and 2200 reviews and i thought they had good burritos. But anyway i had the shrimp burrito with black beans. Talk about heaven this burrito (about $11.50) is hands down the BEST burrito I have ever had. The different tastes of it make my mouth water. It was perfectly cooked in every way. I was not impressed with my el-ferrolitto experience but I have no complaints about my papalote burrito. This burrito was superb. I highly recommend it. I cannot wait to go back and try their asada and chicken burritos. On top of all this you get free chips and salsa. There salsa is world class. If you near mission street and 24th do not pass this place up

excerpts: They serve you warm chips and salsa at your table and you don't feel bad asking for refills.
chips and salsa.author: Naureen H.
chips and salsa.review:
I am totally dreaming of this place right now. Best ever mole chicken tacos in all of the bay area for sure. If you are searching mole on Yelp then I hope you opened this post!!!! They serve you warm chips and salsa at your table and you don't feel bad asking for refills. The staff is friendly and its fine with kids too. 

Its clean and doesnt have the greasy smell. Its seriously busy all the time and parking can be a bia but its so totally worth it.

excerpts: Free chips and salsa.
Limited seating.
chips and salsa.author: Sean M.
chips and salsa.review:
Awesome!

Great food. Not too expensive. Huge portions. Free chips and salsa. Limited seating. Coke made with cane sugar in a bottle. 

Verdict: Dankmunch

excerpts: - Chips and Salsa -
I thought the chips were just average - I've had better.
The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
chips and salsa.author: Amy H.
chips and salsa.review:
Chilaquiles!

After walking by a few months ago and seeing someone chow down on a huge plate of nachos through the window, I knew I had to come back and check this place out sometime. I actually had no idea it was featured on Throwdown until the day before we went.

We arrived at 11:45am and it was totally dead. But our friends weren't here yet so we walked around the corner for a cup of coffee. 20 minutes later we walked back and there was a huge line out the door. 

So it's definitely not worth all the hype but the food is still pretty decent, and it's not your typical greasy Mexican joint like one would expect.

- Chips and Salsa - I thought the chips were just average - I've had better. The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. A generous serving of chips topped w/ cheese, sauce, and egg and served w/ beans and rice on the side
- Chile Verde burrito - a fat burrito, enough for two people. Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over. I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
- Chicken tacos - the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain. Served on two flour tortillas w/ lettuce and tomatoes.

I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.

One last note - the service is great and the staff was so friendly. With crowded tables and a 20 minute line out the door they could have easily been stressed out. But they all had a great attitude, were attentive, and thanked us with smiles on our way out.

excerpts: Chips and Salsa?
Yum
Burrito?

Yum
Mexican Coca-Cola?
chips and salsa.author: Liz M.
chips and salsa.review:
Chips and Salsa? Yum
Burrito? Yum
Mexican Coca-Cola? YUM YUM! 

The food is great and the price is so right.

excerpts: They give u the chips and salsa for appetizer.
The salsa was hot!!
Really hot.
chips and salsa.author: Perry S.
chips and salsa.review:
Papalote is the perfect joint for the hungry. The burrito is humongous! I got the marinated tofu burrito and it lasted for 2 days! It was good cold too ;). 

I was going to get the carne asada, just because I can roll my 'R' like nobody's business, but decided to go on the healthy's side. It was not disappointing let me tell u. Get the super burrito. It's worth it. 

They give u the chips and salsa for appetizer. The salsa was hot!! Really hot. Me likie long time ;).

The place a bit on the small size but it wasn't busy when I was there. Next time I'm totally gonna try the soyrizo. Oh, did I tell u the burrito is huuuge?! Or the fact I can say "I would like one caRne asada, please."

excerpts: Should you dare go there with 2-3 friends, you'll get the same one piddle-fart of chips and salsa.
, I'm damn sure getting my own chips and salsa.
chips and salsa.author: Jeremy W.
chips and salsa.review:
Insane waits sometimes. Cramped. Yeah, the food can be good. But here's my bitch: They are chip nazis. And salsa skinflints. 

Should you dine there by yourself you're served a smallish bowl of quite good home-made chips and a sidecar of their own salsa roja, which is delicious and tastes of creamy roasted pepper. If you want more of these inexpensive staples (and who eats mexican food without a liberal serving of both? Not me.) Should you dare go there with 2-3 friends, you'll get the same one piddle-fart of chips and salsa. Now if I go there with a group, we say nothing to each other in line and get seperate numbers. 

$7 for a burrito, I'm damn sure getting my own chips and salsa.

excerpts: They kept skipping our table and giving comp chips and salsa to people who walked in after us.
When we finally got our order, they gave it to us in a to-go box when we ordered dine-in.
chips and salsa.author: Geralyn Y.
chips and salsa.review:
Wow. I guess I've got it kinda off compared to the majority of reviews, but when I want taqueria food, I want the flavorful, tasty, heavy, good stuff. If you want a healthy quality burrito then go to a tex-mex place like Rubios.

First off, they don't have AC! Which restaurant would do that in the mission? Their service is okay. They kept skipping our table and giving comp chips and salsa to people who walked in after us. When we finally got our order, they gave it to us in a to-go box when we ordered dine-in.  The serving was very meager: barely any carne asada. And what's with the no guacamole and sour cream? $7.75 Nachos would give me ALL the fixins at another taqueria AND it would taste better. Their water cups are TINY. 

Not impressed at all.

excerpts: Because we bought so much food, however, we were able to get 4 orders of these for free, and I opted to ditch the tacos and make a meal out of chips and salsa.
chips and salsa.author: Heather G.
chips and salsa.review:
On the recommendation of a local, we headed to Papalote to sample what I've always heard to be superior Mexican food to what we have here in Boston.  

Can I just interject and describe to you how completely obnoxious it is to live in Boston and, on a regular basis, hear San Fransisco transplants berate me about the low quality and in-authenticity of Mexican food in the Northeast?  It seems like every person who has ever even step foot within a 500 mile radius of the Mission district feels obligated to chime in and remind me that, yes, Mexican food in Boston sucks, and Mission burritos are tastier.  After years of this, I began to think that this was, in fact, a fact (yeah, intentional), and that my trip to San Fransisco would give me an epiphany and a fantastic culinary experience to boot.

Back to the task at hand.  I went to the Mission and chose Papalote for my field research, as it seemed to be widely accepted as the "best burrito."  

I should have known that something was awry when the guy at the counter told me they had just whooped Bobby Flay in a Throwdown.  I call this the Flay phenomenon - The inevitable inflow of traffic post-TV-debut brings crowds to a Throwdown winner's establishment that the restaurant perhaps wasn't ready for (or ill-equipped to handle).  I fear this, as a once-fabulous place could go downhill quickly, choosing to ride the popularity wave.

Needless to say, I did not have such a great experience here, and whether it's the show's fault or the restaurant's, I left a bit let down.

The prices are steep - $5.50 for an order of two tacos, and this "famous" burrito now costs $20. WHAT?  What do you put in a burrito to make it $20.  I will tell you this - this place charges extra for cheese, sour cream, and guac, so I'm not sure what's left.

We did not go for the $20 burrito, but we had a more modest $9 version, but did not opt to pay the extra for the dairy and guac.  The burrito (chicken) was, as a result, a bit bland and very dry.  If the burrito only tastes good with these extra-charge add-ons, then why bother making the burrito at all? 

We also had an order of fish tacos, an order of chicken, and an order of beef.  The fish tacos were the only ones that were double-wrapped with two tortillas each, and the other two orders were only single-wrapped.  Is this "authentic"?  I am not sure, as I am not well-versed in corn tortilla etiquette, but I thought the customary-two was the standard.

The sole-double-wrapped fish taco was really wet and drippy, but I enjoyed that the fish wasn't battered and deep fried to the point of nonrecognition.  Rather, the fish in the tacos was abundant, moist, and juicy.  The other two tacos tasted just like each other, and were both very dry.

The best thing about this place was definitely the creamy, spicy salsa that accompanied the chips.  Perhaps this has always been the practice, or maybe it was due to the new-found extreme popularity, but after the first complimentary order, the restaurant charges for refills.  I don't necessarily think that this is a bad practice, just an interesting one I'd not seen before.  Because we bought so much food, however, we were able to get 4 orders of these for free, and I opted to ditch the tacos and make a meal out of chips and salsa.

You can buy this salsa by the jar to go, and had we not been from out of town, I would certainly take advantage of that.

I will say that the employees are ALL extremely friendly.  Everyone is kind, courteous, and polite.  We must have gone at a bizarre hour, because there was no line whatsoever.   Food came out hot and prompt, and I was very pleased with the experience aside from the taste of the food.

I don't think I'd go back, but one great thing did come from the experience.  Now, back at home, when people launch a tirade about how much New England Mexican sucks compared to the beloved Mission Burritos, I am able to smile, nod, and smirk knowingly (and perhaps a bit judgmentally) as they ramble on, while silently thinking that Olecito is better Mexican food than what I found in SF.

excerpts: I love the free chips and salsa and all the usual suspects (tacos, burritos and quesadillas) are very good.
I try to get something
new everytime as they have a nicely varied selection of ingredients.
Wish they would open more stores.
chips and salsa.author: Dave B.
chips and salsa.review: This is my go-to Mexican restaurant. Always crowded and pretty small but worth it. I love the free chips and salsa and all the usual suspects (tacos, burritos and quesadillas) are very good. I try to get something new everytime as they have a nicely varied selection of ingredients. Wish they would open more stores.

excerpts: Then you each get chips and salsa.
Boom Boom Boom !!!
Leave some cash on the table for the fellas running food.
They work their asses off.
chips and salsa.author: Joe G.
chips and salsa.review:
This place is the bomb for all the right reasons. BUT how come  whether I show up alone or with 2 friends we get 1 salsa and 1 bowl of chips ?  If we ask for more we get charged. The only way around this is to order seperatly and pretend you are alone. Then you each get chips and salsa. Boom Boom Boom !!!

Leave some cash on the table for the fellas running food. They work their asses off.

excerpts: The complementary chips and salsa are great.
chips and salsa.author: Angelica S.
chips and salsa.review: I have been to El Papalote a few times. If you order grilled chicken or beef burritos, this place is clearly a 4/5. I like that you can make it super for 99 cents, which includes guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. The complementary chips and salsa are great. I am not a fan of the chicken mole burrito. It lacks flavor. The time I had one, my beans were a bit under cooked, the rice mushy, and the mole flavor not present at all.

excerpts: Great vegan/vegetarian options help make this an awesome taqueria - the chips and salsa are wonderful, although its an itty-bitty annoyance that you have to pay for additional servings of either items considering other places don't charge...
But I will say its worth it!
Cute interior make it cozy to dine in.
The key is to get there early, it's not unusual to see a line out the door during peak hours...
chips and salsa.author: Sean G.
chips and salsa.review: Great vegan/vegetarian options help make this an awesome taqueria - the chips and salsa are wonderful, although its an itty-bitty annoyance that you have to pay for additional servings of either items considering other places don't charge... But I will say its worth it! Cute interior make it cozy to dine in. The key is to get there early, it's not unusual to see a line out the door during peak hours...

excerpts: Their chips and salsa really live up to the hype.
Not that many mexican places have this kind of salsa.
It's not pico de gallo (fresh salsa), but the fiery orange kind that doesn't have any chunks.
They bottle this stuff
it's so good.
But yeah, it's kind of expensive, which sucks since the flavor is so addictive.
I didn't even try anything else, I just ate the chips.
chips and salsa.author: Anna T.
chips and salsa.review: Their chips and salsa really live up to the hype.  Not that many mexican places have this kind of salsa.  It's not pico de gallo (fresh salsa), but the fiery orange kind that doesn't have any chunks.  They bottle this stuff it's so good.  But yeah, it's kind of expensive, which sucks since the flavor is so addictive. I didn't even try anything else, I just ate the chips.

excerpts: My friend was already seated with his chips and salsa when I sat down.

One of the waiters came out from the kitchen almost immediately afterward with some guacamole and a small bowl of chips, and when he got to my table he unloaded the guac but turned right around with my chips still on the tray!
When I asked the cashier, she told me that it's restaurant policy.
To only serve one bowl of chips regardless of the number of diners and what they've ordered, such as CHIPS and guacamole?
chips and salsa.author: Amy Z.
chips and salsa.review:
The first time I came here, to the Mission location, I had kind of a bad experience.

I had ordered the grilled veggie burrito (great, by the way) and a side of chips and guacamole. My friend was already seated with his chips and salsa when I sat down. One of the waiters came out from the kitchen almost immediately afterward with some guacamole and a small bowl of chips, and when he got to my table he unloaded the guac but turned right around with my chips still on the tray! When I asked the cashier, she told me that it's restaurant policy. To only serve one bowl of chips regardless of the number of diners and what they've ordered, such as CHIPS and guacamole? They give way too few chips per table. 

The salsa's amazing, though. Kind of like enchilada sauce.

The burritos are great: moist yet not drippy.

I still come here, I just don't order side dishes.

excerpts: I recommend to hold off on the salsa when they give you chips and salsa.
Save it for your burrito.
It is delish.
chips and salsa.author: Sonlay V.
chips and salsa.review: Love their salsa! I recommend to hold off on the salsa when they give you chips and salsa. Save it for your burrito. It is delish.

excerpts: Also, the chips and salsa were warm and spicy.
chips and salsa.author: Tiffany L.
chips and salsa.review:
The place was packed and lines were out of the door.  I was lucky since my friends already got seats by the time I got there.

I had the tofu mole but I thought the mole sauce was a bit overbearing. However, I like how "light and healthy" I felt after eating the entire burrito.   Also, the chips and salsa were warm and spicy.

My friends had chicken quesadillas and loved it.

An eclectic Mexican joint for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike!

excerpts: Oh and the chips and salsa are off the hook!
chips and salsa.author: eileen r.
chips and salsa.review:
I've only been here once and had their Fish Tacos and Watermelon horchata - good stuff. Oh and the chips and salsa are off the hook!

The decor is definitely hipper than most Taquerias in the Mission, but don't let that fool you.  This place is definitely a contender.

I can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu

excerpts: The chips and salsa were good, but not worth the hour
chips and salsa.author: Vivian L.
chips and salsa.review:
We came to pick up our orders then go to my friend's house nearby for dinner. I'm not sure if it's normal, but after placing our order, we waited an hour for our take out food. I get that they make each order when ordered, but still, we were freaking starving. It didn't help that it was during that heat wave last month so it was freaking hot in there like summertime in Mexico.

Anyways, onto the food. I ordered the mole chicken burrito since it looked different. During my hour wait, I read articles talking about the fake chorizo which I would try next time I went, if I go again.

The chips and salsa were good, but not worth the hour wait. 

Since I don't live in the Mission, I probably wouldn't come back here next time since there are so many Mexican places to try. But there were lots of locals in there that day, so I can see how it can be a neighborhood favorite, just not mine.

excerpts: I could eat five baskets of their chips and salsa and be perfectly content with my accomplishments for the day.
chips and salsa.author: Eric M.
chips and salsa.review:
Their salsa is like straight crack!  I could eat five baskets of their chips and salsa and be perfectly content with my accomplishments for the day.

I ordered a carne asada burrito.  Very fresh ingredients, flavorful, and prepared in a fairly short amount of time.  

Has a local hangout / neighborhood feel to it.  Great for a casual lunch or dinner.

excerpts: The chips and salsa that come while you wait
(and you do wait -
it's packed), is so delicious.
I just want to eat that all day.
chips and salsa.author: Margee B.
chips and salsa.review:
Today is Thursday.  Tuesday was my first introduction of Papalote, and I've already gone back.  It's that good.  And that cheap.  Unsurprisingly, it's in the Mission, where you'll find some of the best culture and food of the city.  

Both times I have been it's been packed with hipsters.  The diversity here is sorely lacking, which is a polite way of saying that it was all white people being served by people who (I assume) are Hispanic.  Which bugs me, but the food is too good to pass up.

Both times the boyfriend and I shared a burrito and nachos.  The chips and salsa that come while you wait (and you do wait - it's packed), is so delicious.  I just want to eat that all day.  We shared a chicken burrito, where you could taste the freshness of all the ingredients.  We also had nachos.  The beans were amazing, the cheese was great, and the chips were crispy.  Oh goodness, it was so good.

The seating is limited, so don't bring a big crowd.  And if you have to wait for a table, well, you have to wait.  A lot of people do take-out, or order ahead.  But it's worth it.

While the price of a burrito is pretty average in SF, their prices are generally cheaper than most.  Sometimes only by about 30 cents, but sometimes by a few dollars.  A bean, rice, and salsa burrito is $3.75 (I believe).  Nachos & super chicken burrito was $14.

excerpts: Loved the chips and salsa that's made from fire roasted tomatoes which comes with your burrito.
It's a little pricier than your average taqueria but worth it since their vegan options are incredibly tasty.
chips and salsa.author: Susan D.
chips and salsa.review: Had a great soyrizo burrito (and half of my friend's mole burrito) and it was really delicious! Loved the chips and salsa that's made from fire roasted tomatoes which comes with your burrito. It's a little pricier than your average taqueria but worth it since their vegan options are incredibly tasty.

excerpts: condiment they and of course those famous chips and salsa...
chips and salsa.author: Andrey C.
chips and salsa.review:
a solid four stars for the food and for trying their best to manage the crowds... the staff really tries to make sure everything's orderly. the only thing they can't always control is how long people decide to dilly-dally at the table after their food has been eaten and plates practically cleared away, oblivious to others who are waiting. come on now, people!

the food was very fulfilling with lots of meat and flavor. i had the chicken mole burrito and literally couldn't stop eating until it was all gone... and it's a big sucker! i liked the radish (i think?) condiment they and of course those famous chips and salsa... it's more along the lines of a creamy looking spicy sauce than a pico de gallo but so nice!

anyway, next time around i'll probably just do pick-up and go home.

excerpts: I'm a bit disappointed but their chips and salsa is still the same.
Maybe it's a hit or a miss with this place.
Oh well there's more burrito places around.
chips and salsa.author: Ruby O.
chips and salsa.review: They used to have really good burritos but the last time I came here my carne asada was dry. I'm a bit disappointed but their chips and salsa is still the same. Maybe it's a hit or a miss with this place. Oh well there's more burrito places around.

excerpts: I would probably sit there all day and eat chips and salsa if it was free.
chips and salsa.author: Sharon G.
chips and salsa.review:
This is my favorite Mexican restaurant ever.  The salsa is fabulous.  Too bad they give it to you in teeny tiny little containers and then charge you for more--  but hey, it's worth it.  I would probably sit there all day and eat chips and salsa if it was free.

I love the veggie tacos (potatoes, carrots, mushrooms in a corn tortilla).  Everything always tastes fresh.  I love that everything isn't smothered in cheese, either.  Lots of vegetarian options (tofu mole, soyrizo and tons of others.) I even brought my mom here and she loved it, too!

And parking sucks, but that's to be expected.

excerpts: Great chips and salsa, especially compared to a lot of the taquerias in San Francisco that, for some god awful reason do not make their chips fresh, or if they do, consistently end up stale (I'm looking at you, El Farolito).
Delicious burrito as well, though not the best in town.
chips and salsa.author: Richa A.
chips and salsa.review: Great chips and salsa, especially compared to a lot of the taquerias in San Francisco that, for some god awful reason do not make their chips fresh, or if they do, consistently end up stale (I'm looking at you, El Farolito). Delicious burrito as well, though not the best in town.

excerpts: Oh, and don't forget the chips and salsa!
chips and salsa.author: Laura P.
chips and salsa.review: Scrum-didily-yum!  A little more expensive than other places in the mission, but totally worth it! The taco's are huge, and have tons of fresh ingredients.  Oh, and don't forget the chips and salsa!

excerpts: I always have a really hard time because the salsa is also SO good... and I want to fill up on chips and salsa before the burrito comes
and then it's even harder to finish the whole thing.
chips and salsa.author: Linda L.
chips and salsa.review:
Papalote is in my speed dial.

I am sure that there are many tasty tasty things that they make at Papalote.  But the Super Soyrizo Burrito is SO good that I can't bring myself to order anything else.  

I always have a really hard time because the salsa is also SO good... and I want to fill up on chips and salsa before the burrito comes and then it's even harder to finish the whole thing.  If I go alone next time, and no one's looking, perhaps I'll just drink the salsa and skip the chips... 

Seriously though, it is often distressing to me because I wish I could eat a whole super burrito without getting to the pants unbuttoning level of stuffed-ness.  Don't get me wrong, I still eat the whole thing, it's hard to stop, I just deal with the consequences.

I have also tried the vegan mole tacos which were a tad salty but super yummy and the mole burrito which was a little drippy but good also.

I wish it were open later than 10.

excerpts: second, you cant just get a table here and enjoy your chips and salsa (and agua fresca) while you wait for your burrito.
by the time you sit down, they pretty much come out at the same time.
chips and salsa.author: Robert S.
chips and salsa.review:
meh!  this is my second or third visit, and it was supposed to be the redemption visit, but i was disappointed in almost every way.

first, theres a HUGE line at this place now cause of some bobby flay throwdown smackdown WWE whatever.  who cares?  hipsters care apparently.

second, you cant just get a table here and enjoy your chips and salsa (and agua fresca) while you wait for your burrito.  by the time you sit down, they pretty much come out at the same time.  if you cant see a problem with this, dont speak to me.

third, the 7x7 list thinks very highly of the orange salsa, which is above average, but not stellar.  this might anger some, but rubio's smoky chili salsa is far superior.  also, whats with the little tiny shot of it?  not nearly enough.

fourth, i get my burrito and its pretty freakin small for a super that costs $8.50.  also, its not wrapped in foil WHICH IS A REQUIREMENT.  the tortilla itself is not very chewy, and there is barely a DROP of sour cream in the whole thing.  overall, pretty dry, and a little below average.  that's right, i said it.

fifth, there was some different salsa garnish on the plate...mine had barely any at all.  whats the point of putting any on?  this was seriously a joke.

sixth, still hungry, i want more salsa, but i was told this costs $.55.  are you freaking kidding me??  the tiniest amount of salsa to begin with, and a refill is $.55?  its not all that, mmkay?

seventh...naw thats it.  you are not that great, papalote.  i actually saw people in here eating the $20 burrito and looking very disappointed.  and i could see why!  its not big, and theres nothing special about it...it just has three kinds of meat.  what a freakin joke.

dont get suckered in!  gordos, el farolito, el toyanense, and CHIPOTLE are far superior.  believe me...i know burritos.

excerpts: and you're so starving that you shove an entire burrito and platter of chips and salsa in your mouth and then 10 minutes later you like,
totally HATE mexican food and the thought of a taco makes you feel like vomiting?
Yes?
chips and salsa.author: Claire C.
chips and salsa.review:
You know how you go somewhere to eat and the food is so good and you're so starving that you shove an entire burrito and platter of chips and salsa in your mouth and then 10 minutes later you like, totally HATE mexican food and the thought of a taco makes you feel like vomiting? Yes?  Well, that's how I feel right now at this exact moment.  

I am, however, an extremely sophisticated human being and am able to distinguish between the "hatred coma" and my "true feelings" about a restaurant, and my true feelings about Papalote are this, "HOLY CRAP THAT'S SOME GOOD SALSA."  I had a green chile verde burrito and I ATE THE ENTIRE BURRITO, auhghghahghghghg, blah blah blah...vomitous, etc.  The burrito was good, you know, like average for mexican food but holy crapola was that salsa that I drowned my slab of lard in tasty, mmmhhhh, my lunch date wasn't lying when she said she sometimes ponders slathering it all over her body to attract men....now, if you'll excuse me I need to go to the bathroom and throw up, and then apply this wonder tonic...

excerpts: Came here JUST for the chips and salsa ($1.50).
The chips are just ok...
taste store bought, not salty enough.
But dude.
the salsa.
SPICY.
Its pretty damn good.
Totally addicting, each time you take a bite of it, your mouth burns just a bit more.
Its pretty good.
chips and salsa.author: Carol L.
chips and salsa.review: Came here JUST for the chips and salsa ($1.50). The chips are just ok...taste store bought, not salty enough. But dude. the salsa. SPICY. Its pretty damn good. Totally addicting, each time you take a bite of it, your mouth burns just a bit more. Its pretty good. :)

excerpts: Chile Verde burrito, chips and salsa and a diet coke for under $10!
But not sure is worth waiting 15 mins outside in the cold for a table...darn food network hype.
kudos to papalote however!
a must visit as a sampling of the mission for tourists or locals!
chips and salsa.author: Michael K.
chips and salsa.review: Yum! Chile Verde burrito, chips and salsa and a diet coke for under $10! But not sure is worth waiting 15 mins outside in the cold for a table...darn food network hype. kudos to papalote however! a must visit as a sampling of the mission for tourists or locals!

excerpts: The chips and salsa are everything they are hyped to be!
chips and salsa.author: Danielle M.
chips and salsa.review: The chips and salsa are everything they are hyped to be! Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling. You even have the option of plain, whole wheat or spinach tortillas. Make sure to order extra salsa!

excerpts: Between that and the chips and salsa, it was a very filling, delicious meal.
chips and salsa.author: Augie S.
chips and salsa.review:
Oh gawd, this place was good.  Many have rated this place on yelp and very few have rated less than 4 stars.  They definitely deserve the high ratings.

The menu was a little pricey I thought at first until I took the first bite.  My girlfriend and I split a gigantic prawn burrito that was awesome.  Between that and the chips and salsa, it was a very filling, delicious meal.

I have not been back yet but I would definitely recommend this place to friends.  Very good stuff!!

excerpts: They brought us out yummy fresh chips and salsa to start.
I got an aguas frescas which was pretty good, though a little too sweet.
chips and salsa.author: Lindsay E.
chips and salsa.review:
My boyfriend and I knew we had to get some Mexican food when we were visiting since it's the one culinary category we are really lacking good restaurants in in Boston. We trusted our friend from Palo Alto who had read good reviews about this place and she did not disappoint us. 

The place was crowded,  a good sign for 7 on a Saturday night. We ordered at the cash register and were seated rather quickly, though slightly awkwardly as we had to share table space with another group of 3. They had real Mexican Coke which the bf and friend were super hyped about. They brought us out yummy fresh chips and salsa to start. I got an aguas frescas which was pretty good, though a little too sweet. My friend got the mole chicken quesadilla which was super delicious. I got the amazing fish tacos which were too stuffed to pick up and eat, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. The fish was sautéed with white wine and butter, a pleasant change from the fried I am used to. The bf got a fish burrito, probably the biggest burrito I have ever seen and it was delicious to boot. He definitely paid a little bit later for eating the whole thing.

excerpts: Chips and salsa are great...but the nachos are even better.
Everything made to order, so expect some wait...
but it's worth it.
chips and salsa.author: G J J.
chips and salsa.review:
Very cool Mex food in the Mission District. 

Great mainstream options, all made fresh. More interesting, however, is the non-traditional stuff like soy-rizo and tofu mole, put into quesadillas and burritos and other great foods.

A wide beer selection as well. Seating is limited, so better to get stuff to go. Chips and salsa are great...but the nachos are even better. Everything made to order, so expect some wait...but it's worth it.

excerpts: I just wish they would serve more chips and salsa =
( oh well, I can live with a small portion.
chips and salsa.author: Anabelle B.
chips and salsa.review:
Yeah, I know, they are just nachos, but damn! Papalote's veggie nachos are fantastic. 

When I recommend this place to my co-workers, I say it's Mexican with a "twist", Potatoes and carrots in my burrito, wtf? But it works and I love it! I just wish they would serve more chips and salsa = ( oh well, I can live with a small portion.

excerpts: Yes, the salsa is great, so maybe I would go here and just get chips and salsa.
chips and salsa.author: Ryan C.
chips and salsa.review: All right, but I'd rather have a $3 taco truck veggie burrito than one of these. Yes, the salsa is great, so maybe I would go here and just get chips and salsa. We got the chile verde burrito and the soyrizo burrito. I suppose they deserve props for offering lots of vegetarian options to wean people off meat. The chile verde was just all right--big hunks of slightly dry and stringy meat in a not very flavorful sauce; the soyrizo spicy and as you might expect; both burritos running over with no structural integrity--the kind of SF burrito that ordinarily is wrapped in foil, but perhaps they are trying to avoid the foil here and so you eat it with knife and fork.

excerpts: I didn't like the chips and salsa
, they tasted like Doritos.
Also, the restroom here is disgusting!
I'd rather go elsewhere.
chips and salsa.author: H. A.
chips and salsa.review: I don't know what all the hype is about this place!  The food was just ok.  Nothing really stood out to me. We had the tacos and quesadilla, and it was a disappointment. I didn't like the chips and salsa, they tasted like Doritos.  Also, the restroom here is disgusting! I'd rather go elsewhere.

excerpts: Their chips and salsa are awesome if you like a litte spice, Chicken adobo Burrito is my fav and tacos are great as well.
You will not be disappointed if you go here!
Only bad thing is the place is a little small and can get get crowded pretty fast.
Besides that it's great!
chips and salsa.author: Rio J.
chips and salsa.review: This Is my favorite taqueria in SF.. Their chips and salsa are awesome if you like a litte spice, Chicken adobo Burrito is my fav and tacos are great as well. You will not be disappointed if you go here! Only bad thing is the place is a little small and can get get crowded pretty fast. Besides that it's great!

excerpts: The chips and salsa are also acclaimed.
chips and salsa.author: Spoon G.
chips and salsa.review:
++UPDATE 10/29: Last time I went in to pick up some food I spent some time reading their SF inspection report. Let's just say they failed the inspection - things like storing food on the floor, the refrigerator temperature was not low enough...basically they didn't get a score because they had to fix so many things. Should you be afraid? I haven't gotten sick, but it was a bit off putting so I am lowering my score to 3 stars.++

Why do I love Papalote in the Mission? A few good reasons. I am not a vegetarian but I have to admit that the soyrizo tacos are pretty tasty but my alltime favorite is the fish burrito - straight up, don't go super.

Why do I love the fish burrito? It's is sauted in white wine with your choice of beans. The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.  The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings. You can usually share a fish burrito, and maybe get a quesadilla in case one of you gets a bit hungry.

The chips and salsa are also acclaimed. I do like the salsa, but I have to say it is a touch too spice for my taste.

They also do a great takeout - they are on my speed dial.

excerpts: Go here to have the Chips and Salsa and don't order anything else.
Then walk a block to EL FAROLITO and then eat a super suiza Quesadilla.
If you are still hungry (which I doubt you will be) then go get a Torta at TOrtas Los Picudos down the street on 24th or walk to 19th and Mission and get a Super Burrito at Cancuns.
That will be my Mission Mexican food information for y'all.
chips and salsa.author: Nir B.
chips and salsa.review:
So I have decided to finally try this place out. I know that this plae was on the "THROW DOWN" food channel show with Bobby Flay. I thought the salsa was great! Out of all the places in the city I think this place has by far the best salsa. Unfortunately, I had a Burrito and shared a quesadilla and it did not blow me away at all. Plus I didn't like that the burrito was not in foil like what all the other taqueria places do. Burritos are meant to be eaten with your hands and not with a knife or a fork. 
So what it comes down to, here's what I would do if you guys go on 24th street to venture. Go here to have the Chips and Salsa and don't order anything else. Then walk a block to EL FAROLITO and then eat a super suiza Quesadilla. If you are still hungry (which I doubt you will be) then go get a Torta at TOrtas Los Picudos down the street on 24th or walk to 19th and Mission and get a Super Burrito at Cancuns. That will be my Mission Mexican food information for y'all.

excerpts: The best part is the Barbie size portion of chips and salsa they bring for you and and your four friends to share.
Its tiny, but the salsa is the best ever.
The first time I tasted it
I was like, "Dang.

Thats a good salsa"  
Minus one star because seating here sucks ass, and pretentious assholes won't move their chairs over an inch to make room.
chips and salsa.author: Devon L.
chips and salsa.review:
Papalote is awesome to the core.  They give you your choice of beans and tortillas for burritos, which I enjoy because I'm not partial to the typical, "flour tortilla brown pinto beans" burrito persuasion.  My friend says the vegetarian options are awesome, he likes soyrizo, and I guess some people look for that in their food, a vegetarian option that is.  
The chicken and beef are grilled fresh to order, its always tender without gristle or fat.  I love their burritos, yo.  
The best part is the Barbie size portion of chips and salsa they bring for you and and your four friends to share.  Its tiny, but the salsa is the best ever.  The first time I tasted it I was like, "Dang.  Thats a good salsa"  
Minus one star because seating here sucks ass, and pretentious assholes won't move their chairs over an inch to make room.

excerpts: However this is the reason I give them 4 stars and not 5: why do they have to be so darn skimpy about their chips and salsa.
They give you a small bowl while you wait for your food, but if you want more it costs extra........ for chips?
Are you kidding me?!?
The service is good.
The line to order is generally the longest wait.
They have good beer in the cooler (others on tap) and art in the dinning room is always changing.
chips and salsa.author: Maria L.
chips and salsa.review:
Heavenly tacos for vegans.
I drool for the soyrizo and grilled veggies, even dream about them. (Pass on the tofu mole) Fresh ingredients and complex flavors.  And their salsa, don't get me started... it's delicious. However this is the reason I give them 4 stars and not 5: why do they have to be so darn skimpy about their chips and salsa. They give you a small bowl while you wait for your food, but if you want more it costs extra........ for chips? Are you kidding me?!?
The service is good. The line to order is generally the longest wait. They have good beer in the cooler (others on tap) and art in the dinning room is always changing.

excerpts: They bring you chips and salsa to start.
The salsa was amazing!
Somehow they mixed creamy into the salsa vernacular and it works!
chips and salsa.author: Michael S.
chips and salsa.review:
I'm on the great burrito tour and stopped at Papalote for my second burrito (La Taqueria being the first).  Papalote is a little trendier place with a nice dining area and cool music in the background (which some old guy was actually dancing to whilst eating his burrito...free entertainment, I guess).  Service was friendly.  This place seems like more of a sit-down type place as opposed to the plain burrito joint of La Taqueria.

They bring you chips and salsa to start.  The salsa was amazing!  Somehow they mixed creamy into the salsa vernacular and it works!  The burrito came a little later (the wait was a little long, but it takes time for good food) looking delicious with a little side of fruit compote of some sort.

Comparing the actual burrito next to La Taqueria's is a little difficult....I would describe is as "nicer."  I'm not sure what that really means, but it is what it is.  I got the carne asada.  Overall, the burrito was delicious!  The carne asada was very flavorful and it was pretty "clean" to eat.  La Taqueria is  messier and felt a little more authentic and the flavors were just different.  I preferred La Taqueria's carnitas, but that's not to say Papalote isn't very good.

This is a great place to come with friends and enjoy a beer and burrito.  Or, as were 3 other customers, a great place to come and read a book and enjoy some tasty food.

I'll definitely be coming back!

excerpts: Great chips and salsa.
I like their "plates" rather than burritos.
Great beans.
Nice spot before or after braving Lucky across the street, because there's parking.
chips and salsa.author: Andrea R.
chips and salsa.review: Great chips and salsa.  I like their "plates" rather than burritos.  Great beans.  Nice spot before or after braving Lucky across the street, because there's parking.

excerpts: The chips and salsa that they drop by the table as you wait for your food are the best, and you rarely have to wait more than a couple of minutes.
Above all else, this is the cleanest taquera that I have found in the city.
chips and salsa.author: Quinn S.
chips and salsa.review: Papalote is probably my favorite burrito joint in the Mission.  The staff is nice, quick and clean.  The food tastes fresh and I love the chicken mole super burrito. The chips and salsa that they drop by the table as you wait for your food are the best, and you rarely have to wait more than a couple of minutes.  Above all else, this is the cleanest taquera that I have found in the city.

excerpts: They raved about how the chips and salsa, and burritos are bomb-diggity here.
First time I came here, they closed the door on us because they were closing.
That's my bad for not checking what time they close.
So I went there again for dinner sometime this week, and ordered a vegetarian tofu burrito.
This was my first time eating a burrito with tofu in it.
It was aaaaaaal-right.
and the infamous chips and salsa...
Chips were good, but the salsa on the other hand tasted better with the burrito.
I am not a fan of dipping chips in creamy sauce.
I am more into pico de gallo when it comes to chips.
chips and salsa.author: Janice D.
chips and salsa.review: This place was referred to me from a few people who live in the city, so of course I had to try it! They raved about how the chips and salsa, and burritos are bomb-diggity here. First time I came here, they closed the door on us because they were closing. That's my bad for not checking what time they close. So I went there again for dinner sometime this week, and ordered a vegetarian tofu burrito. This was my first time eating a burrito with tofu in it. It was aaaaaaal-right. My friend had the mole burrito and he said that it wasn't that great. But for being a vegetarian, they had a lot of options there. I would go again to try the other dishes. Oh yeah, and the infamous chips and salsa... Chips were good, but the salsa on the other hand tasted better with the burrito. I am not a fan of dipping chips in creamy sauce. I am more into pico de gallo when it comes to chips.

excerpts: Free chips and salsa and the salsa is tasty with a little spicy kick.
chips and salsa.author: Dee R.
chips and salsa.review: Heard about the adobo burrito from a friend of mine and she was not lying! A delicious chicken rice tomato garlicy flavored burrito.  Literally the first bite into it gave me a Man Vs. Food reaction of joy! lol It's a must try if you visit the place.  Brought some of my friends there and they have to order that every time we visit now. Free chips and salsa and the salsa is tasty with a little spicy kick.

excerpts: Free chips and salsa too.
Chips weren't that great
but the salsa...
Holy smokes...that was hot!
chips and salsa.author: ITesh J.
chips and salsa.review: This is one of my fav hole-in-wall Mexican place in the City.  I liked the soyrizo veg burrito.  Parking is always a problem in the area (best to take bart to 24th) and be ready for long lines. Free chips and salsa too.  Chips weren't that great but the salsa... Holy smokes...that was hot!

excerpts: They serve free chips and salsa too!
chips and salsa.author: Shannon B.
chips and salsa.review: Fresh ingredients, table service and good beer. This place can't be beat. They serve free chips and salsa too!

excerpts: ummm.. not sure what the big deal is, but their chips and salsa aren't that great.
i get it
, it's tomato-saucy-heavy.
yeah,
chips and salsa.author: mai c.
chips and salsa.review: ummm.. not sure what the big deal is, but their chips and salsa aren't that great. i get it, it's tomato-saucy-heavy. yeah, so? and the carne asada burrito that cost $10 or close to it? wasn't that great either. nothing in that burrito was tasty. the meat tasted very meaty. and not in a good way. it was just bad! and so was everything else that accompanied it. it just seemed like a giant mess. i've had way better and for a lot less! yes, like el farolito a few blocks away on mission. but hey, if you feel like dropping $10 for a burrito that's not even that great (in my opinion at least), then sure, come here. otherwise, i suggest walking down a few blocks and get a giant oh-so-heavy-you-can use-it-as-weights super carne asada burrito from el farolito. trust me, you'll be so glad you did. ;)

excerpts: Never disappointed, yummy chips and salsa.
If you're not a vegetarian, you should still try the quesadilla with carrots and potatos.
Jeezus!
chips and salsa.author: Kim G.
chips and salsa.review: Never disappointed, yummy chips and salsa. If you're not a vegetarian, you should still try the quesadilla with carrots and potatos. Jeezus!

excerpts: SUPER amazing chips and salsa (not your typical chunky salsa,
chips and salsa.author: beth l.
chips and salsa.review: this is no ordinary taqueria. SUPER amazing chips and salsa (not your typical chunky salsa, though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

excerpts: You also get free chips and salsa.
There salsa is super tasty too.
chips and salsa.author: reena p.
chips and salsa.review: Papalote is a great taqueria for vegetarians and healthful eaters! You can order burritos, quesadillas, and tacos with grilled veggies or tofu.  I ordered the super veggie burritos which comes with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots.  I thought putting potatoes in a burrito was unusual until I tried it.  There veggies are not bland at all! There was some serious garlic action in their veggies!  You also get free chips and salsa.  There salsa is super tasty too.

excerpts: two beers, two super burritos, and chips and salsa came out to $23.
chips and salsa.author: Kimberly S.
chips and salsa.review: thus far, my favorite burrito place in the city (maybe even the world!!). i had it  in february 2008 and it was amazing.. went back a few days ago and it was still amazing. i got the carne asada super burrito... it came loaded with avocado and the best flank steak ever! that salsa is amazing too! two beers, two super burritos, and chips and salsa came out to $23.

excerpts: The chips and salsa is SOOOO good that I have a hard time not getting full off of it before my burrito even gets here.
But even still, I'd finish my burrito until I have to stand up
so my stomach can expand some more.
Free water is a plus, walking distance from USF is a plus, fast and great service is a plus.
Only minus are the chairs.
Not quite comfy.
chips and salsa.author: Chrisy C.
chips and salsa.review: I love the crispiness of the tortilla around my burrito!!  The chips and salsa is SOOOO good that I have a hard time not getting full off of it before my burrito even gets here.  But even still, I'd finish my burrito until I have to stand up so my stomach can expand some more.  Free water is a plus, walking distance from USF is a plus, fast and great service is a plus.  Only minus are the chairs. Not quite comfy.

excerpts: We had to wait forever after we ordered to get our food, but they give you free chips and salsa to tidy you over while you wait.
The salsa was a bit spicy for me
but I'm not the best with spicy food.
The burrito was grubbing.
Not all sloppy either.
It's one that you can actually pick up and eat.
Certainly a good place, but I will most likely call ahead next time to avoid the wait.
chips and salsa.author: Brian L.
chips and salsa.review: The burritos definitely redeemed this place.  We had to wait forever after we ordered to get our food, but they give you free chips and salsa to tidy you over while you wait.  The salsa was a bit spicy for me but I'm not the best with spicy food.  The burrito was grubbing.  Not all sloppy either.  It's one that you can actually pick up and eat.  Certainly a good place, but I will most likely call ahead next time to avoid the wait.

excerpts: Chips and salsa were good.
I might venture out to the Mission more often, now that I've been exposed to some decent Mexican food.
chips and salsa.author: Liz L.
chips and salsa.review: Two random people I met on the N line recommended this place (hey, the N might be good for something after all). The carne asada quesadilla is amazing. The wait took FOREVER, but to be fair there were about a bazillion orders before mine. Chips and salsa were good. I might venture out to the Mission more often, now that I've been exposed to some decent Mexican food.

excerpts: I think I filled myself off the chips and salsa before I got to the burrito
Good prices, fast and easy and tastes good...
couldn't really ask for more.
chips and salsa.author: shadi m.
chips and salsa.review: I really needed this last night. My stomach was so mad at me and I wanted a yummy, filling burrito. Well, it was delicious and the salsa was incredible. A little spicy for me but still, incredible. I think I filled myself off the chips and salsa before I got to the burrito :) Good prices, fast and easy and tastes good...couldn't really ask for more.

excerpts: The prices are reasonable, the service is great and always comes with a smile, the chips and salsa are amazing, and the food is so fresh!
I love this place and of course I'll be back!
chips and salsa.author: Jo M.
chips and salsa.review: I love this place!  Great chicken quesadilla and awesome burritos!  The prices are reasonable, the service is great and always comes with a smile, the chips and salsa are amazing, and the food is so fresh!  I love this place and of course I'll be back!

excerpts: And when I see him come home with that brown paper bag full o burrito and chips and salsa
I get a huge smile on my face

I'm not sure what this says about me 
(well, I guess I do know what it says
but whatever- shove it!)

But when I returned from a trip to Austin last week-
 I was happy to find that instead of flowers...

I was greeted with a familiar brown bag full chips and salsa and a marinated tofu burrito (tastes good even reheated!) 
such a nice welcome home
Soooooooooo goooooooood
(oh and apparently the meat choices are also super awesome...tasty enough that the boy will gladly wait in line on a regular basis to bring home takeout)
chips and salsa.author: Maxine M.
chips and salsa.review:
So...I crave the marinated tofu burrito on a regular basis
The grilled vegetable burrito is crazy good-
But that freaking marinated tofu is just incredible
The chips are awesome and the salsa totally lives up to the hype
(oh and 50 cents for extra salsa is so not a big deal)
My husband works down the street from this location
And when I see him come home with that brown paper bag full o burrito and chips and salsa
I get a huge smile on my face 
 I'm not sure what this says about me 
(well, I guess I do know what it says but whatever- shove it!)
But when I returned from a trip to Austin last week-
 I was happy to find that instead of flowers...I was greeted with a familiar brown bag full chips and salsa and a marinated tofu burrito (tastes good even reheated!) 
such a nice welcome home
Soooooooooo goooooooood
  (oh and apparently the meat choices are also super awesome...tasty enough that the boy will gladly wait in line on a regular basis to bring home takeout)

excerpts: i enjoyed the "complimentary" side of chips and salsa, but i agree with some other reviewers on here, why are you so stingy on the salsa?
if i go back and ask for more, are you gonna charge me $2?
the salsa isn't your typical chunky tomato-wee cilantro type - it's more like a tomato-wee creamy kind.
chips and salsa.author: James J.
chips and salsa.review:
not too sure if this place is as cracked up as people say it is. BUT i think i didn't order the right things though. it was my first time here on Sunday and my expectations were high - considering all of my friends rave about this place. first of all, i didn't know their burritos came with no cheese. however, that was probably more my fault considering i was a little slow and hungover to really read the fine print and ask any questions. anyways, i ordered the grilled veggie burrito. bad move on my part. the burrito was dry and had no flavour. to fix that problem i ran up to the cash with my mouth full of food and order a side of sour cream and she asks me if i want it for here or to go? i was very confused - considering i JUST ordered food "for here" from her a few minutes ago and i had a mouth full of food , which mean't i was eating inside the restaurant. so anyways, she charges me $2 for a side of sour cream. REALLY? 

so anyways my gf got soyrizo tacos and they were ok, but she actually makes a better one than they do. i enjoyed the "complimentary" side of chips and salsa, but i agree with some other reviewers on here, why are you so stingy on the salsa? if i go back and ask for more, are you gonna charge me $2? the salsa isn't your typical chunky tomato-wee cilantro type - it's more like a tomato-wee creamy kind. not much zip to it, but still good.

anyways, i'm thinking i didn't order the right thing from here because my friends seem to know good food. i'm thinking i need to quit being a pussy and order a burrito with meat in it - most probably carnitas! mmm ...

excerpts: Chips and salsa are brought to your table after you place your order and take a number at this fresh, organic and altogether amazing Mexican eatery on 24th street.
It rivals El Farrolito for quality, location and price but the two destinations are seperate and unique.
El Farrolito is a superb traditional taqueria: you get fresh food made with whole avocados fast and efficiently.
Your chips soak through the white paper bag but they are salted and delicious.

Papalote is more like a cafe- the prices are slightly higher and the guacamole and sour cream aren't as authentic as EF but with warm chips, table service, and home made salsa you can purchase by the jar
this is definately a destination to try.
Be prepared to wait to order and to get a table
but it goes by fast.
chips and salsa.author: Jessica M.
chips and salsa.review: Chips and salsa are brought to your table after you place your order and take a number at this fresh, organic and altogether amazing Mexican eatery on 24th street. It rivals El Farrolito for quality, location and price but the two destinations are seperate and unique.  El Farrolito is a superb traditional taqueria: you get fresh food made with whole avocados fast and efficiently. Your chips soak through the white paper bag but they are salted and delicious. Papalote is more like a cafe- the prices are slightly higher and the guacamole and sour cream aren't as authentic as EF but with warm chips, table service, and home made salsa you can purchase by the jar this is definately a destination to try. Be prepared to wait to order and to get a table but it goes by fast.

excerpts: That was already plenty, yet they threw in some chips and salsa with our order.
I was able to get a bit of everything with each bite.
The nachos were awesome as well.
We barely got through half of it because of the Triple Threat.
Once finished, I washed it all down with a horchata.
I can honestly say that theirs is excellent; not watered down and has just the right amount of cinnamon.
It was nice to taste a bit of history, but I think I'll try something different, and cheaper, next time.
chips and salsa.author: Rhia R.
chips and salsa.review: I had to come and see for myself what all the hype was about with this place. It's already been crazy busy way before they were featured in Throwdown. I had heard about their adobo burrito, but I was more curious to see if the Triple Threat lived up to its name. Based on a Bay Area DJ group, this is goodness X3 with the incorporation of carne asada, shrimp, and chicken. Only thing I couldn't believe was the price. It costs under $20. Holy shh..! My friend and I decided to split one, and also ordered some super nachos. That was already plenty, yet they threw in some chips and salsa with our order. I was able to get a bit of everything with each bite. The nachos were awesome as well. We barely got through half of it because of the Triple Threat. Once finished, I washed it all down with a horchata. I can honestly say that theirs is excellent; not watered down and has just the right amount of cinnamon. It was nice to taste a bit of history, but I think I'll try something different, and cheaper, next time.

excerpts: AND they serve you chips and salsa, which is right on in my broke book.
chips and salsa.author: Elizabeth J.
chips and salsa.review:
I had eaten a most gigantic rice and beans burrito (super-style) before I even knew what was happening... it was that delicioso.  AND they serve you chips and salsa, which is right on in my broke book.

Definitely a great place for veggies and vegans.  Didn't try the vegan delights, but I sure will next time!  

Oh yes, there will be a next time.

excerpts: I sat down and ate some chips and salsa while I waited 15-20 minutes for my food to be prepared.
chips and salsa.author: Lucas M.
chips and salsa.review: The line was long (a good sign?), and the service was friendly.  I was surprised by how much more expensive their burritos were than every other place I have ever been in the mission, but figured they were worth trying.  I sat down and ate some chips and salsa while I waited 15-20 minutes for my food to be prepared.  I was pleasantly surprised by the size of my chicken mole burrito, and it tasted fantastic.  I then asked if I could have some more of the salsa I had eaten with my chips and was told it would be an extra charge.  The food was good, but not good enough to justify the price and extra charge for salsa.  Clearly the owners are trying to milk as much money as possible out of their positive press.  It is too bad, because their food is worth buying again, just not at the current prices.

excerpts: The staff is super quick at bringing chips and salsa to your table so you don't sit there starving.
Their salsa really is amazing.
I have no idea what they do to it, but it is the perfect amount of spiciness for me, and I love the smokiness of the chilies in there.
I usually pour more of the salsa onto my burrito, which is so huge
I eat it with a knife and fork.
I have yet to order them, but the nachos look amazing.
Definitely a two-person order, they look like a huge mound of cheesy deliciousness.
When I'm in the area, this is my spot for a burrito.
chips and salsa.author: Lindsay B.
chips and salsa.review: A friend of mine lives around the corner from this place, and I am so glad she turned me on to Papalote.  It is certainly American-ized, but I'm okay with that.  Both times I've had a grilled chicken burrito, and both times I have thoroughly enjoyed my meal and left completely stuffed.  I like their system, where you walk in and order, then take a number and sit at a table.  They have a small selection of agua frescas as well as sodas and Mexican beer.  The staff is super quick at bringing chips and salsa to your table so you don't sit there starving.  Their salsa really is amazing.  I have no idea what they do to it, but it is the perfect amount of spiciness for me, and I love the smokiness of the chilies in there.  I usually pour more of the salsa onto my burrito, which is so huge I eat it with a knife and fork.  I have yet to order them, but the nachos look amazing.  Definitely a two-person order, they look like a huge mound of cheesy deliciousness.  When I'm in the area, this is my spot for a burrito.

excerpts: Chips and salsa.
chips and salsa.author: Sarah J.
chips and salsa.review: Veggie taco and soyrizo taco. Chips and salsa. The veggie taco was bland and the soyrizo taco was over seasoned and small. Salsa was fantastic but not enough to keep me coming.

excerpts: They give you chips and salsa too with your order!
Completely affordable and plentiful.
Everything seemed so fresh and was very well-seasoned as well.
Definitely a return place for me!!!
chips and salsa.author: E M.
chips and salsa.review: Fish tacos were SOOOOOOOO good. They give you chips and salsa too with your order! Completely affordable and plentiful. Everything seemed so fresh and was very well-seasoned as well. Definitely a return place for me!!!

excerpts: My friend and I agreed to split the burrito plus get chips, extra salsa and two beers.
We both ended up paying $18 for just that
extra salsa.author: Eddie W.
extra salsa.review:
7x7 100 Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2012

#46 Chips and Salsa at Papalote

My first question to myself was how good can the chips and salsa really be or was this just another fill in item. Well I finally was able to have my answer this past week. 

After deliberating where to go, we decided to go to Papalote for their chips and salsa. While browsing their menu online I noticed something odd. Everyone on Yelp kept posting pictures of the Triple Threat Burrito however I saw it no where on the menu. Turns out it is their signature item that was featured on Bobby Flay's show Throwdown. 

Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super. To me it is weird that isn't included in the price but ok. My friend and I agreed to split the burrito plus get chips, extra salsa and two beers. We both ended up paying $18 for just that so keep that in mind. 

For what its worth, the salsa is unlike any other salsa I have had. From color, consistency and all the way down to flavor there is a complexity to their salsa that is well worth trying. The chips did not appear to be anything out of the ordinary but I would recommend trying the salsa at least one time. 

The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant. It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender. I would gladly go back for their carne asada burrito. 

Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.

As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with. The quality was good and cooked well but didn't find it be a valid "threat".

Overall Thoughts

Salsa is delicious and well worth trying as well as the carne asada but be warned Papalote isn't a cheap grab and go burrito kind of place

excerpts: I regretted not asking for extra salsa.
extra salsa.author: Sofia R.
extra salsa.review:
I stopped by here before leaving for class because I was really curious about their Mexipino burrito.

Mexipino burrito is supposed to be a fusion of Mexican and Filipino food. Chicken adobo, garlic rice, and tomatoes in a burrito. I was very curious about this because I like that kind of food and I wanted to see if Papalote would be able to make it right.

The burrito itself was okay. The fillings were great. They made the chicken adobo really well and it was tasty with the garlic rice and everything (as it should be). I didn't see anything particularly dazzling about it though. You get exactly what you ordered. 

I found that eating it with their famous salsa made it taste way better. I regretted not asking for extra salsa. 

Overall, pretty good burrito. Make sure you eat it with the salsa!

excerpts: And now that the prices have been raised sky high, what's with still charging for extra salsa?!
extra salsa.author: Drew W.
extra salsa.review:
Been coming here for years because of the superior salsa and veggie options.  But now that I'm eating meat once again, I have to say the meat burritos are rather meh.

Carne asada is too salty and low quality cuts and the chili verde too dry.  And now that the prices have been raised sky high, what's with still charging for extra salsa?!  You can't just give one extra for fux sake?!
