Still the best for veggie options, and yes...their precious salsa, but i'll hit up the plethora of better and cheaper options for my meat burritos from now on. Sigh....

excerpts: You only get one little cup of salsa and extra salsa will cost you.
extra salsa.author: Christian W.
extra salsa.review:
That creamy smoky salsa is perfect.  There's almost nothing else like it. In fact, it's a closely guarded treasure. You only get one little cup of salsa and extra salsa will cost you.  The guacamole is average, the marinated chicken is fantastically tender.  Slightly more costly than your typical grullenese. 

I'm tempted to buy their prepacked salsa, however, I'm not sure if its the same stuff.  Overall, a great burrito.

excerpts: each if you want any extra salsa.
Other places are free!
extra salsa.author: Fred O.
extra salsa.review: Paid $14.68 for two Pacifico beers. A little over priced especially since the microbrew down the block charged $12 for 2 higher quality brews . $.50 each if you want any extra salsa. Other places are free! Chicken Burrito was ok but had better down the block. Got the other burrito wrong too. Nickel and dime customers. Lady behind the customer had attitude.

excerpts: ....they charge for extra salsa, too....meh.
But dang good burrito's.
extra salsa.author: Kat C.
extra salsa.review:
WOW Salsa owns.

Spicy, THICK, and SO delicious.

THICK, juicy, nicely charred, chunky pieces of prawns tighlty wrapped in my whole wheat tortilla burrito ... smothered in that amazing salsa = MM MM GOOOOOOD!!  We got there around 6ish and beat the crazy lines that started forming around 7.  Small but cozy restaurant with friendly and fast service.  They have the classic bottled cokes :) yay  

Don't sit at the table next to the bathroom.....everytime someone opened the door and it closed, the stanky air was forced in our faces.  Def had to hold my breath...boo.  Perhaps getting to-go is the best option for this place on busy nights.  Call in.  

STILL LOVE TLALOC'S SALSA, THO!  This place doesn't have a salsa bar...nor do they have pitchers of ice water like Tlaloc does...just tiny ass cups.....that you have to refill by going to the cash rep area....they charge for extra salsa, too....meh.  But dang good burrito's.

excerpts: they charge you for extra salsa (lame), and without the salsa, their food is super bland, and...
extra salsa.author: Osh J.
extra salsa.review:
salsa is good. everything else is overrated and their prices are out of control. they charge you for extra salsa (lame), and without the salsa, their food is super bland, and...I've tried MOST things on the menu and nothing ever sticks out as "I want that again"

 it's the name and the salsa.

excerpts: and unlike most places that give you free extra salsa you charge a dollar??
extra salsa.author: Christopher H.
extra salsa.review:
I love you and your food is amazing but I am giving you 2 stars b/c you are so damn stingy with your salsa..

it is amazing but here's my 2 cents.. give enough of it for the amount of chips you give us!! i mean there isn't enough salsa for the bowl of chips let alone the burrito.. and unlike most places that give you free extra salsa you charge a dollar??

lame...

excerpts: Thanks for making me feel stupid for not knowing it cost $0.50 for extra salsa.
Next time I will buy my own jar so that I wouldn't have to bother you again.
extra salsa.author: Sop S.
extra salsa.review: Wow! My very first Yelp review and I am very excited to write about this place. I love Mexican food and this place is authentic and legit as it gets. Food/Ingredients were fresh, service was fast and they have THE BEST salsa in the world. So good that I had to go back to the counter to ask for one more cup and the cashier gave me a stink-eyed attitude about the cost being $0.50 more if I wanted it. I walked away because I didn't have cash on me and didn't feel like pulling out my debit card just for a $0.50 transaction, even though I kind of thought about doing it. Then 30 seconds later here comes the server (who overheard our conversation) with a complimentary cup of salsa in hand just for me. He made my night and became part of the reason why I am going to go back. If there was a 1/2 star rating I'd give this place 4 1/2 stars. Unfortunately I had to deduct 1/2 a star because of the rude cashier. Thanks for making me feel stupid for not knowing it cost $0.50 for extra salsa. Next time I will buy my own jar so that I wouldn't have to bother you again.

excerpts: I went with the steak burrito "super" with an extra salsa.
extra salsa.author: Jeff M.
extra salsa.review: Had never had a mission burrito before coming here and holy cow it was next level. While I still have love for chipotle, 9 times out of 10 I'll head to papalote to get a burrito. I went with the steak burrito "super" with an extra salsa.

excerpts: and I get an extra salsa cup
...so good!
one time I even shared with this guy sitting near me.
He thought it looked so good and dam
right it was!
extra salsa.author: Crystel A.
extra salsa.review:
My favorite thing about this place would have to be their salsa.... i keep going back because of it. 
You can even buy some in jars so you can take home! It's so good you will want to! 

Their known for their awesome burritos which I think are really good when they don't overcook the meet. And if it's your first time you should get a burrito! 

My favorite item to get is the nachos with carne asada and I get an extra salsa cup ...so good! one time I even shared with this guy sitting near me. He thought it looked so good and dam right it was!

excerpts: Finally the biggest rip is the .55 you have to pay for extra salsa.
extra salsa.author: Mike I.
extra salsa.review:
I walked more than two miles in the pouring rain to enjoy the triple threat burrito here. I was sadly disappointed. I've had the super carne asada burrito here before and it was pretty good. The triple threat was a complete dud. It was relatively small considering the amount of meat it contained. A normal El Faralito burrito is bigger. Also the triple threat is WAY overpriced, $19.95 and that is without the super upgrade. RIP OFF. 

Finally the biggest rip is the .55 you have to pay for extra salsa. 

El Faralito is better if you eat meat. If you want a soyrizo tofu bastardized burrito papalote is still your spot.

excerpts: I wanted extra salsa for my chips and they charge u extra ?
I actually have to pay the waiter at our table and do a seperate transaction for salsa ???
Doesn't that sound ridiculous to you ?
I take my burritos very seriously...
the burrito wasn't horrible, but not by any means the best in sf.
I will not give into the hype.
extra salsa.author: Mario W.
extra salsa.review: This place does NOT have the best burritos in SF at all. I had a steak and shrimp burrito today. The rice was undercooked and hard....and the carne asada was not chopped very well. Big hunks of meat like a fajita. Meats should be chopped more finely....I wanted extra salsa for my chips and they charge u extra ? I actually have to pay the waiter at our table and do a seperate transaction for salsa ??? Doesn't that sound ridiculous to you ? I take my burritos very seriously...the burrito wasn't horrible, but not by any means the best in sf. I will not give into the hype.

excerpts: Order extra salsa for sure...
extra salsa.author: Mel A.
extra salsa.review:
Prawn burrito  w/ black beans was AWESOME. Definitely order it "super."

Order extra salsa for sure...it has a smoked kick to it that makes it's very tasty!

I'm excited to try some of their other burritos & have heard the mole is killer.

excerpts: They charge for extra salsa which is annoying but their house salsa is one of the best I've every had.
extra salsa.author: Phillip K.
extra salsa.review:
As a vegetarian, good Mexican food is few and far between.  Papalote is a GREAT exception.  They have several delicious vegetarian options that are all amazing from grilled veggies to soyrizo meat substitutions.  

They also have plenty of real meat options if you are with a group of meat-eaters.  

They charge for extra salsa which is annoying but their house salsa is one of the best I've every had.

excerpts: Papalote is just a smaller, slower (it takes FOREVER to get your food here), more expensive (they charge 50 cents for extra salsa!) version of Chevy's ...
minus the unreasonably large watered down margaritas and the birthday song/sombrero.
extra salsa.author: Lara O.
extra salsa.review: Papalote is just a smaller, slower (it takes FOREVER to get your food here), more expensive (they charge 50 cents for extra salsa!) version of Chevy's ... minus the unreasonably large watered down margaritas and the birthday song/sombrero.

excerpts:
: I would like to order fish taco's  with extra salsa.
Papalote: Anything else?
Me: Yes, I didn't get my extra salsa yesterday 
so I'd like you to not charge me for it today.
Papalote: We can't do that, sir.
Me: 
Wha? 
I still have the receipt from yesterday.
Papalote: You have to bring the bag back so we can check.
extra salsa.author: iko o.
extra salsa.review:
After a year I came back. Friendly, well prepared, tasty. During a pickup, I saw a server disinfect her hands - nice touch!

Papalote: You have to bring the bag back so we can check.
Me: Cancel my order, then.

In fact, cancel my next 100 orders. That is how many time's I've eaten there in the last couple years. There is a kid there who always - and I mean *always* comes up short on my orders. I guess he doesn't like me. Oh well. 

Papalote. Decent food. But, be on your best behavior, or they won't let you eat it

excerpts: I look forward to trying a different kind of burrito and ordering extra salsa on my next visit.
extra salsa.author: Z. M.
extra salsa.review:
I heard about this burrito joint by word of mouth. I stopped by after school one day around five o'clock. The line that I read about in other Yelpers' reviews was non-existant, probably owing to fact that I went around 'tain't time ('tain't lunch, 'tain't dinner).

The lady who greeted me and took my order was extremely friendly and patient while I made up my mind.

After perusing the menu board, I settled on the chicken mole burrito with black refried beans on a whole wheat tortilla. It was tasty but didn't have the distinct mole flavor I was expecting. I will say that their burritos are the perfect size. Not too small, and not too huge as to put one into an instant burrito coma.

The salsa is outstanding - creamy and packing a spicy kick. I only wish the chips were better. They tasted like mass market tortilla chips. I much prefer the freshly fried tortilla chips some other burrito joints serve.

I look forward to trying a different kind of burrito and ordering extra salsa on my next visit.

excerpts: Always order an extra salsa or two.
Sure, they charge you $.50, but go half-sies with your amigos.
extra salsa.author: David K.
extra salsa.review:
When it comes to burritos, I can talk smack.  I used to live near "the mish" and ate burritos almost daily.

Papalote rocks the best combination of authentic Me-hee-can-o flava with the health food fresh-mex scene.  My burrito-loving friends are sometimes offended: "no self-respecting burrito place should have soy-rizo burritos".  Al contrario, the genius of Papalote is that they keep it real with carne asada while infusing new flavors into the mix.  And of course it's all from scratch!

Note that I'm not some vegetarian hippy-dude.  Still my burrito of choice: soyrizo, whole wheat tortilla, black beans, extra veggies.

If Mexico were alive today, this is how he'd be making burritos.

Always order an extra salsa or two.  Sure, they charge you $.50, but go half-sies with your amigos.  It's just that good.

I first learned about this place from a girl I met on a bus.  You first learned about this place from me.  Play it on the playa, player!

excerpts: Order extra salsa.
It's worth the token charge.
And try to hit it on off-hours
so you don't have to wait so long.
Burrito, beer, and tip for around 10.00; with extra salsa, 11.00.  !!
Super-extra perfectisimo!!
extra salsa.author: Randy F.
extra salsa.review:
The roasted salsa is enough for the five star rating.  Then you get to gleefully dump it into your burrito, which is stuffed with juicy-fresh delicious ingredients.  Ooh, mmmmmm; oh, rrrrr--oh; I, nnngggggg---I mean, em......oh, man, it's good.

Order extra salsa.  It's worth the token charge.  And try to hit it on off-hours so you don't have to wait so long.  Burrito, beer, and tip for around 10.00; with extra salsa, 11.00.  !!Super-extra perfectisimo!!

excerpts: Make sure to order extra salsa!
extra salsa.author: Danielle M.
extra salsa.review: The chips and salsa are everything they are hyped to be! Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling. You even have the option of plain, whole wheat or spinach tortillas. Make sure to order extra salsa!

excerpts: I did not buy any extra salsa that night.
extra salsa.author: vanessa f.
extra salsa.review:
I have been a fan of Papalotes bottled salsa for the last year.  I had never visited an actual restaurant and was very excited to bring family from out of town to enjoy your tasty variety of salsas at the 24th and Valencia location. 

We are disappointed that Papalote does not proudly serve more than one measly dixie sized cup of salsa to their PAYING customers.  You have to purchase each extra measly little cup.  When we asked for the habanero salsa the busboy said they only sold it by the jar and only the mild salsa was sold in .50 cent size. He then pointed to a non-papalote bottled salsa that is worth $2 at safeway as an option.   It is very strange for a business who is proud of their salsa to make it so inaccessible.  I could feel the employees discomfort in having to enforce this nickel and diming business strategy, and could see that they deal with constant confusion and frustration.  You could walk all 47 square miles of this amazing city and not find one other restaurant that serves "Mexican" food but limits the salsa distribution to one small dixie cup that our chips do not even fit into.  This experience made Papalote look amateurish and suggested that they cater only to the yuppie community who do not know good salsa and therefore do not complain about being served only enough salsa for two bites. I did not buy any extra salsa that night.  After having spent $70 on dinner, I wasn't going to be forced into buying a whole jar of salsa and perpetuate this ridiculous business strategy.


PAPALOTE, SET YOUR SALSA FREE!

Don't come between a Mexican and their salsa.

excerpts: and then you're going to charge me for extra salsa.
OK, but it had better blow my fuhking mind.
And Papalote, you didn't.
Your burrito was bland and your salsa sucks.
Plenty of other places to get a better burrito (or two, for the same price).
extra salsa.author: jesus g.
extra salsa.review: Would have been three stars, but $10 for a burrito and then you're going to charge me for extra salsa. OK, but it had better blow my fuhking mind. And Papalote, you didn't. Your burrito was bland and your salsa sucks. Plenty of other places to get a better burrito (or two, for the same price).

excerpts: Always order extra salsa on the side.
It's amazing.
This is one scenario where I never try other things on the menu because the first thing I tried was so awesome
I crave it every time.
This is a Mexican heaven where everyone can be happy together.
Good for vegans, good for everyone.
extra salsa.author: Brieana E.
extra salsa.review: Tofu Mole burrito rocks my world. Always order extra salsa on the side. It's amazing. This is one scenario where I never try other things on the menu because the first thing I tried was so awesome I crave it every time.  This is a Mexican heaven where everyone can be happy together. Good for vegans, good for everyone.

excerpts: (3) $.50 for extra salsa (4) the long lines (5) the front door doesn't close and its always freezing.
But other than that !!!
its pretty amazing.
extra salsa.author: Jennifer C.
extra salsa.review: Living a 1/2 block from Papalote is dangerous, very dangerous. I've got my intake down to about twice a week.  My regulars are the soyrizo burrito and the tofu mole burrito.  It's awesome to finally have a good Mexican restaurant with some veggie food other than the ole "vegetarian burrito".  And of course, the salsa is amazing. It's like velvet.  The only downsides are (1) the soyrizo is super salty and makes me really freakin thirsty (2) they charge $1 for extra chips (3) $.50 for extra salsa (4) the long lines (5) the front door doesn't close and its always freezing.  But other than that !!!  its pretty amazing.

excerpts: And it's annoying they now charge for extra salsa.
But frankly, the salsa is worth it.
And it's fairly expensive.
extra salsa.author: Rusty H.
extra salsa.review:
OK. So it's really crowded at peak times.  And it's annoying they now charge for extra salsa.  But frankly, the salsa is worth it.  And it's fairly expensive. But it is SO GOOD that I rarely remember the annoying things about the place.

I suggest you go there somewhat off hours.  And complain about how they charge extra for salsa.  And then just enjoy the food.

Because this is a fresh-mex gourmet taqueria. I hear the owner comes from a long line of bay-area restaurateurs so he knows how to create a good establishment.

Did I mention how deliciously original this taqueria is? Sure, it's the same tacos, burritos and quesadillas that 100 other places have on their menus in SF, but it's done so nicely.  You don't feel like you got a gut bomb after eating here.  The beans are delicious, the salsa incredible, the fish and prawns so so so tasty.

Man. I wish I went there today instead of letting my friends drag me to El Metate (which is OK but not great, but usually costs a couple bucks less).

I'll have to try their new location. I never see the owner/founder at the original location any more.

excerpts: Yes you have to pay an extra .50 for extra salsa
but when you are talking about a $6 burrito why complain.
extra salsa.author: Nikki W.
extra salsa.review: Granted I have not explored the city to its fullest...but my vote is #1 for this place! I love, did I say LOVE, their food. Fresh, flavorful, not greasy and relatively fast! I've frequented a couple other places that are supposed to be the best Mexican in the Mission but I was sadly led astray, this place is my favorite thus far. I can't say I've tried the vegetarian dishes but my carne asada super burrito always hits the spot. Yes you have to pay an extra .50 for extra salsa but when you are talking about a $6 burrito why complain.

excerpts:
(oh and 50 cents for extra salsa is so not a big deal)
My husband works down the street from this location
extra salsa.author: Maxine M.
extra salsa.review:
So...I crave the marinated tofu burrito on a regular basis
The grilled vegetable burrito is crazy good-
But that freaking marinated tofu is just incredible
The chips are awesome and the salsa totally lives up to the hype
(oh and 50 cents for extra salsa is so not a big deal)
My husband works down the street from this location
And when I see him come home with that brown paper bag full o burrito and chips and salsa
I get a huge smile on my face 
 I'm not sure what this says about me 
(well, I guess I do know what it says but whatever- shove it!)
But when I returned from a trip to Austin last week-
 I was happy to find that instead of flowers...I was greeted with a familiar brown bag full chips and salsa and a marinated tofu burrito (tastes good even reheated!) 
such a nice welcome home
Soooooooooo goooooooood
  (oh and apparently the meat choices are also super awesome...tasty enough that the boy will gladly wait in line on a regular basis to bring home takeout)

excerpts: Asked for extra salsa (the salsa was good), and even though they only gave us one tiny cup for two people, another cost us 50 cents.
Not good.
No horchata, no melon drink.
Not good.
Overall, Papalote costs more on a pretension for being a high quality "mexican grill" when in reality it's just a so-so taqueria dressed up in bright colors.
extra salsa.author: Scott M.
extra salsa.review: Had the Prawn burrito. The prawns tasted like they had been left in oil all day and never rinsed. The taste of oil was overwhelming! Not good. I had a bite of my wife's burrito pescado, and it was decent, but nothing to rave about. Asked for extra salsa (the salsa was good), and even though they only gave us one tiny cup for two people, another cost us 50 cents. Not good. No horchata, no melon drink. Not good. Overall, Papalote costs more on a pretension for being a high quality "mexican grill" when in reality it's just a so-so taqueria dressed up in bright colors.

excerpts: I had to buy an extra salsa (which lived up to its rad reputation) to pour over the rest of my burrito just to make it interesting.
And 50c for more salsa?
Come on.
extra salsa.author: e w.
extra salsa.review: I really hate to be a downer here, seriously, because I've been looking forward to trying this place.  Finally happened today.  I went for the "super" burrito because why even bother without the soar cream/cheese/guac?  The chicken burrito came with barely 1/4 oz of the extras combined.  I know the chicken is supposed to be fab, but I really prefer the regular taqueria style rather than a pounded out flattened breast.  I had to buy an extra salsa (which lived up to its rad reputation) to pour over the rest of my burrito just to make it interesting.  And 50c for more salsa?  Come on.

excerpts: this place rules, make sure you get extra salsa though because without it you are lost
extra salsa.author: Matthew R.
extra salsa.review: this place rules, make sure you get extra salsa though because without it you are lost

excerpts: Ordered take-out burritos - along with extra salsa - from the Mission location.
extra salsa.author: Cecilia B.
extra salsa.review: Ordered take-out burritos - along with extra salsa - from the Mission location.  The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).  The shrimp super was excellent.  Everything was fresh and made-to-order.  No choice of salsa but the house version is amazing - blended rather than chunky but very tasty and spicy.  Definitely worth the visit and a return trip!

excerpts: the burritos are great - and i like the fact that you can get refried beans - which is awesome - also, they have coke in a glass bottle, which is always awesome - unfortunately, the service is pretty awful - you can't get extra salsa upon request (its good but not worth gold) and you cant really get any service except 'can i take your order?'

- its also really small and seems dingy considering the price you pay for the food, its not really worth it - but still, if you want a good burrito, this is a good place to check out (get it to go and buy some salsa on the side since they don't give you enough) - like many other places, the quality of the food is overshadowed by the non-existent customer service
extra salsa.author: AARISH P.
extra salsa.review: the burritos are great - and i like the fact that you can get refried beans - which is awesome - also, they have coke in a glass bottle, which is always awesome - unfortunately, the service is pretty awful - you can't get extra salsa upon request (its good but not worth gold) and you cant really get any service except 'can i take your order?' - its also really small and seems dingy considering the price you pay for the food, its not really worth it - but still, if you want a good burrito, this is a good place to check out (get it to go and buy some salsa on the side since they don't give you enough) - like many other places, the quality of the food is overshadowed by the non-existent customer service

excerpts: HATE the fact that I have to pay for extra salsa!
extra salsa.author: Shabnam A.
extra salsa.review: LOVE the food...HATE the fact that I have to pay for extra salsa!

excerpts: Get a burrito and pack it full of veggies and refried black beans, order it with sour cream, guacamole, and cheese.
Devour it with the free side of salsa and the delicately crunch chips.
Add hot sauce if you're into that.
You'll be so happy and y'all want to come back every time you're in the Mission.
If you're in a rush, order it to go because there is likely to be a wait for seating.
Get even more salsa because it is so good!
veggies.author: Adam H.
veggies.review: I'll keep it short and sweet! Go here if you want a big, good, Cali-Mex meal. Get a burrito and pack it full of veggies and refried black beans, order it with sour cream, guacamole, and cheese. Devour it with the free side of salsa and the delicately crunch chips. Add hot sauce if you're into that. You'll be so happy and y'all want to come back every time you're in the Mission. If you're in a rush, order it to go because there is likely to be a wait for seating. Get even more salsa because it is so good!

excerpts: It was packed with rice and veggies and cost $12?!
veggies.author: Ann L.
veggies.review: Are you serious now? I been to a few taquerias and this one takes the cake in skimpy as fck in their portions. I had a shrimp burrito... which only had 4 pieces of shrimp. It was packed with rice and veggies and cost $12?! I thought I had ordered a veggie burrito with those portions...My friend had the steak burrito and there was barely any steak. Stop cheating your customers.

excerpts: A little too much of these raw veggies, so much that it hides the meat at first and tends to overpower the tacos.
You have to add their free salsa, which is creamy and pretty spicy.
veggies.author: Ziyan C.
veggies.review:
We came at about 9pm on a Friday; they were busy but not crowded. We did get the last 4 seats free. No line at the counter, and maybe 5-10 minutes later our food came out. 

* Fish Taco - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw
Large chunks of fish filet. Pretty fresh, good texture. They're not breaded or fried though. 

* Shrimp Taco - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#z-j-9B6z9JdvI7LfEo_Cpw
The shrimp is a bit small, crunchy but not quite fresh-tasting. 

Overall on the tacos: a little too au-naturel, no salsas or sauces drizzled on top, but lots of chopped lettuce, tomatoes, onions. A little too much of these raw veggies, so much that it hides the meat at first and tends to overpower the tacos. You have to add their free salsa, which is creamy and pretty spicy. Makes a world of difference.

* Triple Threat Burrito - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#_dyP1DyvOS9TPp_ljhC1lQ
Yes! So much good meat. Even better with their salsa drizzled on top.

excerpts: Loved the charred flavor of the veggies.
veggies.author: Pamela M.
veggies.review:
Really delicious burrito and that salsa that comes with is both unique and out of this world! 

They don't serve ground  beef or pulled meats, however my friend had the pork and it was just about as close as you can get o pulled pork it was so nicely cooked, tender, moist and came apart easily.

I tried the veggie with carrot, potato, mushroom - it was fantastic!!! Loved the charred flavor of the veggies. 

Great place to stop for a filling, yummy bite!

excerpts: It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ...
this was the opposite, which I like).
I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa.
It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious.
The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride.
Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.
veggies.author: Linda S.
veggies.review: Best burrito I've had, ever. Had the grilled veggie burrito with guacamole. It had lots of veggies (usually veggie burrito's have loads of rice and beans, with some veggies ... this was the opposite, which I like). I came here because I heard about their amazing salsa. It's as good as everyone says it is, absolutely delicious. The place is quite far from where I am, but worth the 30min bus ride. Will definitely come back and get a jar of their homemade salsa.

excerpts: They put a lot of these veggies in there
so you get some in every bite.
veggies.author: Malika R.
veggies.review:
All I can say about Papalote is I love the salsa!! Everytime I've gone, I've wanted to buy a bottle of it but I always resist. They have very interesting combinations for their entrees. You can choose between tacos, quesadillas, salads or burritos and then pick whatever protein you want. They have a bunch of different veggie options so it's exciting to keep coming here and try different things. 

I think my favorite would be the potato, carrot, mushroom. They put a lot of these veggies in there so you get some in every bite. If you get a burrito, make it super so you can get sour cream, guac and cheese! I've heard to tofu is very good as well so I'll be back to try that!

It gets kind of crowded at dinner time (6:30-8:30) and the place is pretty small so I would recommend pick up if you're going around that time.

excerpts: The veggies are delicious and the vegan black refried beans are awesome!
veggies.author: Stephanie L.
veggies.review:
Grabbed a veggie burrito (potatoes, mushrooms, carrots) with guacamole to go. The veggies are delicious and the vegan black refried beans are awesome! The papalote roasted tomato salsa is kind of amazing. 

I love that they have such a great vegetarian and vegan selection. Definitely worth checking out.

excerpts: If you're still used to the high fats, stringy meat, cloned veggies, guacamole from a bag and sugary hfcs gmo tortillas heated with a steamer, skip this place.
veggies.author: Fredo L.
veggies.review:
Come here if you like quality: My favorite steak burrito in town! That's pretty much all i get here. All meat, no chewy weird stuff you won't swallow. 3 types of tortillas, spinach, tomato and regular so you can switch it up here and there. They're also heated in the skillet, extra crispy please! They have mild and hot salsa. If you don't ask, you will get mild. 

If you like hip hop and reggae, that's all you will hear from the speakers. They owner is a DJ and bad ass favorite! 

You also love art. Hip hop culture and Mexican culture up on the walls and all art is for sale. 

Also, Papalote means kite. Find cool kites in here 

Don't come here: If you like cheap food don't eat here. If you're still used to the high fats, stringy meat, cloned veggies, guacamole from a bag and sugary hfcs gmo tortillas heated with a steamer, skip this place. 

Out of 100 burritos, 1 sucked. New cook I guess. "Even the best chef burns the beans" they say.

excerpts: Debatable fact: Yes, this place is good and has a lot of options for veggies.
Is it the best in The Mission?
Nope.
The salsa is worth a trip but the burritos are meh.
I prefer El Metate over Papalote and Taqueria Cancun over El Metate.
veggies.author: Katey W.
veggies.review:
Fact: Being a transplant from SoCal, I am a burrito snob. 
Fact: Since moving to SF, I've lived in the Mission and visited a plethora of burrito joints. 
Debatable fact: Yes, this place is good and has a lot of options for veggies. Is it the best in The Mission? Nope. The salsa is worth a trip but the burritos are meh. I prefer El Metate over Papalote and Taqueria Cancun over El Metate.

excerpts: I appreciate wanting to promote eating veggies and all, but I came here to eat a taco - with meat.
veggies.author: Naoko M.
veggies.review:
I was looking forward to finally going to Papalote and I have to say the hype is not worth it. Is the salsa delicious? Absolutely. That's about all I can say.

My gripes:
1) You can't "mix and match" your tacos - meaning, if you want to try two kinds of meat, you have to end up with 4 tacos. See, typically I go to taquerias and get 2 or 3 tacos, each with a different protein so I can sample. Much to my dismay, when I asked about this the nice lady said I have to get the 2 tacos.  That's kind of crappy.

2) The chile verde was pretty bad.  Despite having some heat, it was otherwise bland from the flavor side.  The pork was fake-tender. By that I mean, you could break of pieces easiily with a fork, but it was still dry. Clearly it had been simmering for too long in too high of heat. Even I, the home cook, know this - poor technique in the kitchen.  The scary part? I asked the cashier if she recommended the chile verde or the chicken mole, and she said chile verde. I'm terrified of how crappy the mole might be.

3) The tacos come covered in lettuce and tomatoes. What?  Why? There's so much of it too. I appreciate wanting to promote eating veggies and all, but I came here to eat a taco - with meat.  Not ok.

4) Guacamole - was also bland. I had to add some salt. There was no limey zip, and I'm not even sure how but I didn't really get the flavor of avocado. 

5) Service - When the gentleman brought out my tacos, I asked about my side of guac. He looked at the ticket in his hand, which I also saw, and it clear said "Chile Verde, Guacamole." He seemed very confused. My friend also pointed out that on her (separate) order, she had asked and paid for 2 extra salsas and those were not brought out either. He seemed confused and flustered. Eventually we got everything we needed but it wasn't like he was bringing out multiple plates of food at once. He literally was only carrying my tacos in one hand and the ticket that clearly stated "Guacamole" in the other.  Also, on an unrelated note - flies in the air. Not ideal.

This place is probably great for vegetarians/vegans who otherwise can't get Mexican food, but for us meat eaters, don't bother.  

2 stars for the salsa. Good news is you can buy jars of that stuff and never eat anything else here. That's probably my go-to plan from now on.

excerpts: The Grilled Veggies Burrito is a misnomer as it barely had any zucchini.
veggies.author: Amy C.
veggies.review:
Why You Gotta RESPECT Papalote:

1)  The Salsa

It is one of my favorites.  Made with smoked tomatoes and with enough heat to make your nose sweat a little, this orangey sauce is great any which way.  Go ahead and buy a jar to take home ($7) because that itty bitty container of SALSA with your CHIPS ain't gonna cut it.   

2)  They kicked some Food Network challenge booty.

While I like a Bobby Flay schooling as much as the next person, I'm actually not a Papalote burrito fan.  The Grilled Chicken Burrito (with black beans, rice, and "salsa") is pretty bland.  Instead of their signature salsa, inexplicably you'll find a disappointing stand in of watery diced tomatoes and onions.  The Grilled Veggies Burrito is a misnomer as it barely had any zucchini.  Next time, I'll get my salsa at Papalote and my burrito at El Farolito.

With some Bobby Flay schadenfreude on the side.

excerpts: Our favorites are grilled veggies (eggplant and zucchini) with whole black beans and marinated tofu (which has a perfectly firm texture) and whole pintos.
veggies.author: Jessica L.
veggies.review:
This restaurant has great vegetarian and vegan options.  The beans and rice are made vegan and they have 2 vegetable options and 3 tofu options.  The burritos are large and they do cross the $10 threshold but it is a lot of food.  

My boyfriend and I have a tradition of splitting a burrito once per week and earning a punch on our loyalty card for a free burrito.  Our favorites are grilled veggies (eggplant and zucchini) with whole black beans and marinated tofu (which has a perfectly firm texture) and whole pintos.  Make it a super with sour cream, guac, and cheese for only $1.  

The salsa is BOMB so we always get an extra side and sometimes a jar to take home!

excerpts: Unfortunately, by super-ing it, you get grilled veggies (bell peppers?) in it
and it doesn't really go.
Also, the flavor in the burrito was weak so the salsa is quite necessary.
Now the hype about the salsa is interesting because it is good and it is really spicy but the texture is weird.
It's very blended and not quite smooth but not quite chunky...
veggies.author: Shannon L.
veggies.review:
Please don't throw tomatoes at me, I'm just being honest.

There has been hype around Papalote for a really long time in my mind.  With the 7x7's best burritos in SF article to my coworker constantly dipping his broccoli in their salsa, I was just aching to eat here.

I tried both a Carne Asada and a Camarones burrito, super'ed.  The shrimp pieces were small and really fresh.  The carne asada was a hit or miss depending on the piece I got.  I had initially picked out a piece and that was dry but when eating it with the burrito, it tastes pretty tender and fresh.  I like that even though the pieces are big, they rip apart easily.  

Unfortunately, by super-ing it, you get grilled veggies (bell peppers?) in it and it doesn't really go.  Also, the flavor in the burrito was weak so the salsa is quite necessary.  Now the hype about the salsa is interesting because it is good and it is really spicy but the texture is weird.  It's very blended and not quite smooth but not quite chunky... a strange in between.

Salsa comes from two places:
1. Made in this restaurant - $5.99 
2. Made somewhere else but still the Papalote recipe - $6.99

I've had both and I would say #2 wins the initial taste test.  #1 still isn't bad though.

Similar to traditional Mexican restaurants, you can help yourself to pickled jalapenos but they have WHOLE pickled jalapenos here.  Total highlight for me.  I can see how this place can be frustrating if you're trying to dine in and it's packed.  There isn't much room to stand in line to order and there isn't much room to sit. All the tables are also close together but it's a clean joint at least.

The best part is that they give each person their own little basket of chips and cup of salsa!

excerpts: If only there was a way to get tofu/soyrizo AND veggies without it costing so much!
No matter what I order I end up overspending.
veggies.author: J K.
veggies.review:
This is probably my favorite burrito place, due to their vegetarian friendliness.  (I wish that 90% of "vegetarian" burritos in this city weren't filled with lard and chicken stock.)  Sure, I liked it better before it was overflowing with Mission hipsters, but what can you do...

The salsa is awesome and those teeny tiny containers aren't nearly big enough.  I really hope I don't find out that its secret ingredient isn't beef or something, cause I do love it. 

The only downside is its priciness.  If only there was a way to get tofu/soyrizo AND veggies without it costing so much!  No matter what I order I end up overspending.  And if I'm getting really nit-picky, I have noticed the burritos have been pretty rice-heavy lately.

Tip: If you eat in, your burrito won't be wrapped in foil, so you'll be risking the always embarrassing burrito "spill-out" all over your plate.

excerpts: Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.
Awesome!
Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
(and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...
veggies.author: Alice C.
veggies.review:
From the "That's what she said" joke potential to the succulent flavor, I love [almost] everything about meat.

So you can imagine what I'm about to say is very difficult, but it's also a testimony to how skilled Papalote is at making a healthier alternative not taste like feet.

That being said, the best thing I've tried on this menu is actually the soyrizo (soy chorizo)!  I tried a piece of the soyrizo quesadilla, and was very pleasantly surprised.  It was well seasoned, and the texture was not weird.  I think this dish will be my go-to from now on!

OTHER DISHES I'VE TRIED:
1. Chips and salsa - this is on the 7x7 100 things to try list.  The salsa was really good and different than any other salsa I've tasted, but I still think the soyrizo was more stand-out.
2. Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.  Awesome!
3. Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
4. Jicama salad - usually comes on the side with your meal, and refreshingly delicious!  

LIKES:
1. Large portions 
2. Leftovers still tasty 2 days later
3. Lots of veggie alternatives
4. Seems more health conscious than the average taqueria

DISLIKES:
1. Dine in was crowded...you'd probably be annoyed/displeased if you're claustrophobic.  You can phone in orders though.
2. Prices are a bit higher than what you'd expect to find at other Mexican places in the Mission - the steak fajitas were $13.95!  (and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...but then you can just get the soyrizo!)

excerpts: Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies.
Can't go wrong!
Their homemade salsas are so good too.
veggies.author: Jessica G.
veggies.review: Love love love this place! Terrific vegan options-mole, soyrizo, marinated tofu, grilled veggies. Can't go wrong!  Their homemade salsas are so good too.

excerpts: The veggies.
The meat.
The beans.
The meat.
The salsa.
The veggies.
I'm rambling.
I'm drooling.
veggies.author: Greg G.
veggies.review:
Papalote has won SF Weekly's 'Best Burrito' in 07, 08, 09, and 10.  

And I can't disagree.

The flavor. The quality. The quality. The freshness. The flavor. The flavor in these burritos truly stands alone. True flavor. Real quality flavor. There are millions of burrito spots in the Bay Area, taco trucks, taquerias, restaurants; I've honestly never had such a uniquely flavored burrito that you can truly, TRULY taste the quality in- maybe in all of my 'foodie' experiences. 

The meat. The rice. The salsa. None of these ingredients get lost in the burrito- you can clearly taste distinct flavors in every bite. No flavor is hidden. Everything tastes fresh. Everything tastes well seasoned. Everything has pop. The veggies. The meat. The beans. The meat. The salsa. The veggies. I'm rambling. I'm drooling. I'm hungry.

The tacos are good, but they're a bit sloppy. If you're eating here, swoop on the first available seat that opens up. Most importantly, whatever you do, get the burrito.

excerpts: I always get the prawn burrito with grilled veggies and its amazing!
Writing this review is making me want to drive there right now and get one!   2 hr drive for a burrito!
Haha
veggies.author: Michaela T.
veggies.review: Salsa here is a little creamy, so delicious so different!   The triple threat is huge and soooooooooooo good but a bit expensive,  almost $20 for a burrito!   I always get the prawn burrito with grilled veggies and its amazing!  Writing this review is making me want to drive there right now and get one!   2 hr drive for a burrito!  Haha

excerpts: They have a big jar of picked peppers and veggies as a nice condiment, and they stock every table with Yucateca green habanero hot sauce.
veggies.author: Jordan Z.
veggies.review:
I've been to Papalote twice, and both times were fantastic. Their veggie burrito is great, with the tortilla expertly grilled and stuffed with goodness. Like most people who've tried their house salsa, I love it,. It tastes vaguely like Doritos chip seasoning (and I mean that in the best way possible). 

They have a big jar of picked peppers and veggies as a nice condiment, and they stock every table with Yucateca green habanero hot sauce.

excerpts: grilled veggies?
veggies.author: Sue A.
veggies.review:
Best burrito ever. TONS of delicious vegan options. Soyrizo? Tofu mole? grilled veggies? 

I nearly always get the soyrizo, sometimes with guacamole. Always AMAZING. And enormous for super-cheap. I work in the Financial District and have spent entire lunch breaks trekking to and from papalote to get an excellent burrito and get back in time to sit at my desk and eat while working -it's totally worth it. 

And the salsa. Did I mention the salsa? SO DELICIOUS. You can buy it by the jar at the store, or you can now buy it on-line for delivery. When I found this out, I sent the link to everyone I know, and they all reacted "This is the best day of my life". It's that good. 

While i've only ever gotten vegan burritos here, I've been told the non-vegan ones are also good. But can't really comment. 

Their other location is also good. So good that when our office was in the Presidio, we would regularly drive over and get burritos for the whole office (~25 people). 

Go here!!

excerpts: My grilled veggies were cut up in tiny pieces like baby food.
That was odd.
It tasted fresh and nicely grilled but a little bland.
veggies.author: Lorissa W.
veggies.review:
My friend enjoyed her grilled  veggie burrito. For about 5 bucks, it was a good size and had nice presentation.

My grilled veggies were cut up in tiny pieces like baby food. That was odd. It tasted fresh and nicely grilled but a little bland. I added their salsa and that made it better.

Papolotte has excellent salsa. 

The downsides: LOUD music blasting from two speakers at their highest volume in a small dining room (this isn't a club!) It was hard to hear my friend talk and the loud music was hurting my ears.

The cashier was rude to me. I asked her to lower the volume of the music since I was the only person there waiting for my friend, she didn't do anything about it. The second time I asked her to turn down the music, she finally did something. When I tried to order food, she pretended not to see me and basicly had trouble hiding her dislike of me.  She ruined the ambience of the place.  What happened to good customer service?

excerpts: Since I wanted both meat and veggies in it, they charged me close to $13.
It was enough for two meals, but still...$13 for a burrito of any sort seems a bit excessive, no matter how delicious.
veggies.author: Sydney H.
veggies.review:
3.5 stars, rounded down because of how long it takes to get a burrito to go on a Tuesday night.  Apparently, you can call ahead and pick it up right away, which is what I should have done.  It's pretty tiny, you have to wait even longer for a table.

My theory about Papalote's excellent ratings:  Roughly half of San Francisco is vegetarian, if not vegan.  The vast majority of burrito places, even here, seem to think that a vegetarian burrito means "beans and cheese only" (recipe for an evening of stink if I ever heard one).  Therefore, Papalote gets amazing ratings from half of the city purely for using vegetables.  Like, real, fresh vegetables, which is nice, but not as nice as the reviews make it out to be.

That said, their mole burrito is delicious, and it was almost worth the wait.  Since I wanted both meat and veggies in it, they charged me close to $13.  It was enough for two meals, but still...$13 for a burrito of any sort seems a bit excessive, no matter how delicious.

excerpts: I still think it's really good, but the last time I visited I noticed the veggies in my veggie tacos were drenched in butter, and the salsa I usually love just felt thick and heavy.
And I just have to say...
it was kind of too much.
Obviously I'll give it another try; but for now I'm going to have to take off a star.
veggies.author: Amber K.
veggies.review: Papalote used to be one of my favorite white-ican restaurants (yup, Mexican food for white people). I still think it's really good, but the last time I visited I noticed the veggies in my veggie tacos were drenched in butter, and the salsa I usually love just felt thick and heavy. And I just have to say... it was kind of too much.  Obviously I'll give it another try; but for now I'm going to have to take off a star. :(

excerpts:
loved the soyrizo tacos

lots of options for veggies and vegans

chips were a lil hard

staff was super friendly, okay prices.
veggies.author: Coco J.
veggies.review:
loved the soyrizo tacos

lots of options for veggies and vegans

chips were a lil hard

staff was super friendly, okay prices.

I'd like to go back and try more , mmmmm

excerpts: 5 stars for grilled veggies in my shrimp burrito and the charbroiled taste of the carne asada
veggies.author: Jennifer H.
veggies.review:
5 stars for grilled veggies in my shrimp burrito and the charbroiled taste of the carne asada

-1 star for store bought chips

-1 star for powder made horchata

-1 star for unhappy, low energy staff who shrug their shoulders when you ask about your order 30 min. after you place it or reply 'i guess' when you ask for a cup of ice to go with your $3 soda

-1 for yelling 'HEY HEY HEY' when we stepped right outside the door with your plastic cup of ice b/c it was too darn hot to wait inside

+1 for the sauce you provide with the chips

2 stars, but I'll happily spend my $8 at a taqueria with the same quality of food, but less attitude.

excerpts: They have several delicious vegetarian options that are all amazing from grilled veggies to soyrizo meat substitutions.
veggies.author: Phillip K.
veggies.review:
As a vegetarian, good Mexican food is few and far between.  Papalote is a GREAT exception.  They have several delicious vegetarian options that are all amazing from grilled veggies to soyrizo meat substitutions.  

They also have plenty of real meat options if you are with a group of meat-eaters.  

They charge for extra salsa which is annoying but their house salsa is one of the best I've every had.

excerpts: It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo).
veggies.author: Danny S.
veggies.review:
Ever since i became a vegetarian it has been difficult to find a good legitimate burrito place, that is until i found this place! 
It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo). Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican. Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste! worth the visit!

excerpts: The tacos are also nice because they come with a lot of lettuce and tomatoes--yay more veggies!
veggies.author: Joyce L.
veggies.review:
LOVE this PLACE! 

The homemade salsa is something I randomly will crave. It is good. 

I recommend the chile verde chicken burrito and the mole chicken burrito. I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here. It is not overpowering or too thick. The tacos are also nice because they come with a lot of lettuce and tomatoes--yay more veggies!

The Triple Threat, which won in Bobby Flay's recent throwdown, is close to $20. I personally don't like eating that much meat in a burrito--so I don't think it's worth it.

excerpts: I had the Tacos with Prawns; crunchy lettuce and veggies with tasty sea friends.

Granted it can be quite difficult to find icky Mexican in the Mission, but if you are looking for fun, light and yummy place (with larger than life Dragonfly and Frog hanging from the Ceiling - dont see THAT every day) that check out popopole -
i mean papeelite - wait its papa
...just go there okay.
veggies.author: Melissa H.
veggies.review:
Yummy fresh and Delish Dishes!

Great ambiance at this wonderful! Mission spot - 
Food is fresh and light meaning you can down an entire burrito and not have to be rolled out the door.  You can walk, or even skip out, as I often do.

I had the Tacos with Prawns; crunchy lettuce and veggies with tasty sea friends.  Granted it can be quite difficult to find icky Mexican in the Mission, but if you are looking for fun, light and yummy place (with larger than life Dragonfly and Frog hanging from the Ceiling - dont see THAT every day) that check out popopole - i mean papeelite - wait its papa...just go there okay.

excerpts: As for the veggie fajitas, the eggplant was not completely cooked and the veggies being marinated in the salsa made no difference to the taste of the vegetables at all.
veggies.author: Manjesh N.
veggies.review:
The best thing about this place - the salsa. It was spicy and very tasty. The rest of the food was average.

Ordered the gaucamole and marinated veggie fajitas. The guac was not that good - it needed more lime. 

As for the veggie fajitas, the eggplant was not completely cooked and the veggies being marinated in the salsa made no difference to the taste of the vegetables at all.

excerpts: Still my burrito of choice: soyrizo, whole wheat tortilla, black beans, extra veggies.
veggies.author: David K.
veggies.review:
When it comes to burritos, I can talk smack.  I used to live near "the mish" and ate burritos almost daily.

Papalote rocks the best combination of authentic Me-hee-can-o flava with the health food fresh-mex scene.  My burrito-loving friends are sometimes offended: "no self-respecting burrito place should have soy-rizo burritos".  Al contrario, the genius of Papalote is that they keep it real with carne asada while infusing new flavors into the mix.  And of course it's all from scratch!

Note that I'm not some vegetarian hippy-dude.  Still my burrito of choice: soyrizo, whole wheat tortilla, black beans, extra veggies.

If Mexico were alive today, this is how he'd be making burritos.

Always order an extra salsa or two.  Sure, they charge you $.50, but go half-sies with your amigos.  It's just that good.

I first learned about this place from a girl I met on a bus.  You first learned about this place from me.  Play it on the playa, player!

excerpts: Their grilled chicken and grilled veggies are so delicious.
veggies.author: Romeo And Lola K.
veggies.review:
We've had great burritos at Papalote. Their grilled chicken and grilled veggies are so delicious. 

The salsa is great!

excerpts: Very fresh Mexican food with vegan beans and organic veggies and meat.
Word is already out about this place so the lines are super long.
They do always include good veggies like zucchini and eggplant tho!
And i LOOOOOOOVE their salsa.
veggies.author: Sid D.
veggies.review:
Very fresh Mexican food with vegan beans and organic veggies and meat.  Word is already out about this place so the lines are super long.  Make sure to call ahead of time w/ your order and beat the crowd...

One time I forgot to make my veggie burrito "super" and it kinda sucked w/o the sour cream and guac.  They do always include good veggies like zucchini and eggplant tho!  And i LOOOOOOOVE their salsa.

excerpts: Not too jazzed about the fact that a burrito with rice beans, veggies, ad guac has to cost $10 when I can get the same thing at that groovy little place on Mission right around the corner for $5.
Even worse is waiting twenty minutes for said vegan burrito.
And the kicker is getting home and halfway through it and in my hasty hunger, realizing I just ate half a chicken breast and  there indeed are no veggies in my burrito....
Not so cool.
Will never risk that happening again.
I just hope I don't get sick tonight...
veggies.author: Avi K.
veggies.review: Hey guys, love that you have vegan options on the menu. Not too jazzed about the fact that a burrito with rice beans, veggies, ad guac has to cost $10 when I can get the same thing at that groovy little place on Mission right around the corner for $5. Even worse is waiting twenty minutes for said vegan burrito. And the kicker is getting home and halfway through it and in my hasty hunger, realizing I just ate half a chicken breast and  there indeed are no veggies in my burrito....Not so cool. Will never risk that happening again. I just hope I don't get sick tonight...

excerpts: Papalote has it all....spinach tortillas, guacamole OR regular avocado, soyrizo, marinated tofu, perfectly seasoned grilled veggies, and beer.
Don't even get me started on the salsa.
Fuck, my mouth is already watering.....
no joke!
The salsa is amazing and definitely what sets this place apart from other spots in the mission.
Delicious and spicy in all the right ways [insert sexual joke
here].
On the real though.....
Papalote is on top of their flavor game.
I always bring my out-of town guests here...
everyone loves it.
Thank you thank you thank you.
veggies.author: Emily S.
veggies.review: Sometimes I daydream about eating burritos. Papalote makes those dreams come true. Papalote has it all....spinach tortillas, guacamole OR regular avocado, soyrizo, marinated tofu, perfectly seasoned grilled veggies, and beer. Don't even get me started on the salsa. Fuck, my mouth is already watering.....no joke! The salsa is amazing and definitely what sets this place apart from other spots in the mission. Delicious and spicy in all the right ways [insert sexual joke here]. On the real though.....Papalote is on top of their flavor game. I always bring my out-of town guests here... everyone loves it. Thank you thank you thank you.

excerpts: I drool for the soyrizo and grilled veggies, even dream about them.
veggies.author: Maria L.
veggies.review:
Heavenly tacos for vegans.
I drool for the soyrizo and grilled veggies, even dream about them. (Pass on the tofu mole) Fresh ingredients and complex flavors.  And their salsa, don't get me started... it's delicious. However this is the reason I give them 4 stars and not 5: why do they have to be so darn skimpy about their chips and salsa. They give you a small bowl while you wait for your food, but if you want more it costs extra........ for chips? Are you kidding me?!?
The service is good. The line to order is generally the longest wait. They have good beer in the cooler (others on tap) and art in the dinning room is always changing.

excerpts: fresh grilled veggies.
vegetarian beans.
amazing salsa.
delicious rice.
crispy chips.
veggies.author: Laura B.
veggies.review:
marinated tofu.  fresh grilled veggies.  vegetarian beans.  amazing salsa.  delicious rice.  crispy chips.  MOTHERFUCKING SOYRIZO.

it's like all my little vegan pig dreams came true.  i've always said that the only cusine that's hard to do vegan is the burrito (yes, i consider the burrito to be a cuisine) and papalote has revolutionized my burrito eating life.  if you are vegetarian or vegan, go here NOW!

excerpts: I tend to like Oaxacan style -- heavy on the veggies, mole, and cotija cheese.
I'm not a burrito fan like my boyfriend (who initially rejected Papalote as being inauthentic, but has since come around.)
If you order vegetable dishes here, they are full of lots of veggies, not just onions, lettuce, and tomato like most SF taquerias.
This place is awesome for vegetarians- veggies and meatless meats abound.
Flavors are awesome.
Good drink selection, too.
veggies.author: Kely G.
veggies.review: This is my favorite Mexican eatery in SF. I tend to like Oaxacan style -- heavy on the veggies, mole, and cotija cheese. I'm not a burrito fan like my boyfriend (who initially rejected Papalote as being inauthentic, but has since come around.) If you order vegetable dishes here, they are full of lots of veggies, not just onions, lettuce, and tomato like most SF taquerias. This place is awesome for vegetarians- veggies and meatless meats abound. Flavors are awesome. Good drink selection, too.

excerpts: Salsa is great and the nachos w/roasted veggies are delcious.
Service was a bit slow for 3pm on a weekday, but we weren't in a rush.
veggies.author: Kristen S.
veggies.review: Saw a chef from Papalote on "Chopped" (on the Food Network.) Decided to try it while vacationing in SF. Salsa is great and the nachos w/roasted veggies are delcious. Service was a bit slow for 3pm on a weekday, but we weren't in a rush.

excerpts: Such a delicious burrito - shrimp were cooked to perfection, and the veggies inside were uber tasty!
The tortilla chips could have used a wee bit more salt (and seemed a bit stale), but that phenomenal salsa that came with them (probably the best I've ever had) more than made up for that.
veggies.author: Rachel G.
veggies.review: I love me a good burrito, and Papalote delivers and then some! The husband and I were still full from Dynamo Donuts (health nuts we are not), so we decided to be good and split a prawn burrito. Yet again, I was amazed by how something that can be quite heavy seemed so light. Such a delicious burrito - shrimp were cooked to perfection, and the veggies inside were uber tasty! The tortilla chips could have used a wee bit more salt (and seemed a bit stale), but that phenomenal salsa that came with them (probably the best I've ever had) more than made up for that.

excerpts: It's a lot cleaner than a lot of the Mexican taqueria's in the Mission with organic veggies and meat to make you feel good.
A buritto with black refried beans is so worth trying and the roasted tomato salsa is totally unique and a nice change from your average tortilla chip appetizer.
The space is pretty funky as well and makes for a great dinner spot on a Sunday.
Man, too bad
I'm so lazy and don't hike down here near enough...
veggies.author: Michael E.
veggies.review: Whoa, wait. I haven't reviewed Papalote? Oh man. It's been awhile but this place sure is tasty. It's a lot cleaner than a lot of the Mexican taqueria's in the Mission with organic veggies and meat to make you feel good. A buritto with black refried beans is so worth trying and the roasted tomato salsa is totally unique and a nice change from your average tortilla chip appetizer. The space is pretty funky as well and makes for a great dinner spot on a Sunday. Man, too bad I'm so lazy and don't hike down here near enough...

excerpts: You can order burritos, quesadillas, and tacos with grilled veggies or tofu.
There veggies are not bland at all!
There was some serious garlic action in their veggies!
veggies.author: reena p.
veggies.review: Papalote is a great taqueria for vegetarians and healthful eaters! You can order burritos, quesadillas, and tacos with grilled veggies or tofu.  I ordered the super veggie burritos which comes with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots.  I thought putting potatoes in a burrito was unusual until I tried it.  There veggies are not bland at all! There was some serious garlic action in their veggies!  You also get free chips and salsa.  There salsa is super tasty too.

excerpts: And since I can't give up the delicious seasoning in the soyrizo burrito, I order the soyrizo with all veggies.
I get the best of both.
And no, I am not a vegetarian by any means...
I just don't do meat in my burritos.
It's one of my many food oddities.
I haven't tried anything else but the burritos, however, I know I don't need to to give them the 5 stars they deserve.
They are always friendly and quick with my orders (I order to-go with my co-workers just about every other Sunday) and they always get them right.
Their chips aren't greasy, like many other taqueria chips are, and although they don't have chunky salsa, their hot sauce is so delicious and has a great spice to it.
They have a different style to how they make their food: Their menu is not as typical as most taquerias.
It is very unique and special.
Oh, and one more thing....
they have refried black beans!
veggies.author: Amber Y.
veggies.review: I just absolutely love this place! Their burritos are so damn good, there are no words that can describe the ecstasy that my mouth goes through when I'm eating one. I started off getting their veggie burritos, which come with carrots, potatoes and mushrooms. I was a little indifferent about the thought of eating a burrito with carrots, but OMG!!! And since I can't give up the delicious seasoning in the soyrizo burrito, I order the soyrizo with all veggies. I get the best of both. And no, I am not a vegetarian by any means... I just don't do meat in my burritos. It's one of my many food oddities. I haven't tried anything else but the burritos, however, I know I don't need to to give them the 5 stars they deserve. They are always friendly and quick with my orders (I order to-go with my co-workers just about every other Sunday) and they always get them right. Their chips aren't greasy, like many other taqueria chips are, and although they don't have chunky salsa, their hot sauce is so delicious and has a great spice to it. They have a different style to how they make their food: Their menu is not as typical as most taquerias. It is very unique and special. Oh, and one more thing....they have refried black beans!

excerpts: I always find a way to incorporate the grilled veggies in my meal in one way or another.
veggies.author: Jessica L.
veggies.review: So DAMN good!  The salsa is incredible and unique.  It's a great place for a quick bite and is vegan/vegetarian friendly, which makes it easy for anyone.  The guacamole is always super fresh and the horchata is perfectly flavored.  I always find a way to incorporate the grilled veggies in my meal in one way or another.

excerpts: On the downside: I think they put waaay too much soyrizo in my burrito -it has a really strong flavor and can easily overpower the veggies/beans/salsa/tortilla/etc.
Next time I go
I'm going to ask them to keep the soyrizo to a minimum and put in more beans/other veggies.
I really like that salsa too, and fresh tortilla chip service, damn good! = )
I'm going to ask them to keep the soyrizo to a minimum and put in more beans/other veggies.
I really like that salsa too, and fresh tortilla chip service, damn good! = )
veggies.author: Michael C.
veggies.review: Went there for the first time today, and I'm sure I'll be back!  Good prices, and lots of vegan options.  On the downside: I think they put waaay too much soyrizo in my burrito -it has a really strong flavor and can easily overpower the veggies/beans/salsa/tortilla/etc.  Next time I go I'm going to ask them to keep the soyrizo to a minimum and put in more beans/other veggies.  I really like that salsa too, and fresh tortilla chip service, damn good! = )

excerpts: They have a variety of unique burritos, with fish, prawns, and grilled veggies among those offered.
Their salsa is different (where is the brown tint from? beans?)
but really yummy.
A little expensive, but worth it.
veggies.author: Cyrelle D.
veggies.review: A healthy and Americanized, but still delicious, provider of yummy Mexican food. They have a variety of unique burritos, with fish, prawns, and grilled veggies among those offered. Their salsa is different (where is the brown tint from? beans?) but really yummy. A little expensive, but worth it.

excerpts: I enjoy the vegetarian options (tofu, soyrizo, mixed veggies) and I do find myself craving their salsa.
veggies.author: Kerry D.
veggies.review: Definitely one of my top 3 favorite burrito joints.  I enjoy the vegetarian options (tofu, soyrizo, mixed veggies) and I do find myself craving their salsa.  I've also tried their steak and chicken options and I'm subtracting a star for just a little something missing....not sure what it is....but I find their food lacks that extra flavor that makes it "out of this world."   And the fact that they cheap you on the salsa.  A shot-glass of salsa for multiple people and a $1 for a refill does NOT suffice.

excerpts: no, a super tofu burrito on spinach tortilla with no rice, grilled veggies, and a Negra Modelo...
no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water...
I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!
veggies.author: Kevin D.
veggies.review: A spinach super tofu quesadilla please... no, a spinach super carne asada quesadilla with grilled mushrooms... no, a super tofu burrito on spinach tortilla with no rice, grilled veggies, and a Negra Modelo... no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water... I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!

excerpts: yes, i made my own burrito (doesn't have a name on the menu) and yes, i made sure there were absolutely no veggies in it
veggies.author: Adela K.
veggies.review:
i had a black bean/JOOCY meat/cheese/sour cream/rice burrito.  yes, i made my own burrito (doesn't have a name on the menu) and yes, i made sure there were absolutely no veggies in it and yes...i gained 5 pounds.  

that tender meat will keep me coming back.

excerpts: They make everything fresh to order and the veggies have life and crunch.
Yum.
veggies.author: Mer S.
veggies.review: That salsa they make is like nothing I've ever had before. They make everything fresh to order and the veggies have life and crunch. Yum.

excerpts: soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla.
veggies.author: mark c.
veggies.review:
frreeessssshhhhh. thats the version here. remixed with health conscious ingredients. no LARD. vegan friendly. 

nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn. what!), food with integrity. fresh fresas and horchata made daily.

the salsa. if you know, then i need not go any further.
if you dont, well, thats your fault. 

soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla. 
i mean c'mon, can you say that about another burrito joint? 

the staff is friendly, fast, and efficient.

party flyers, community events, and awards plaster the walls and counter, i mean does your burrito joint have a write up in the 
WALL ST JOURNAL? 
didnt think so.

but hey, dont take my word for it. peep game yo.
you wont be sad, unless the grease, lard, and oil is your thing.

excerpts: I may give it another go since I enjoyed the plentiful grilled veggies and black beans.
veggies.author: Celeste A.
veggies.review: The salsa was definately exquisite.  My burrito...so so.  I requested and paid for sour cream but received none.  I may give it another go since I enjoyed the plentiful grilled veggies and black beans.

excerpts: Definitely a great place for veggies and vegans.
veggies.author: Elizabeth J.
veggies.review:
I had eaten a most gigantic rice and beans burrito (super-style) before I even knew what was happening... it was that delicioso.  AND they serve you chips and salsa, which is right on in my broke book.

Definitely a great place for veggies and vegans.  Didn't try the vegan delights, but I sure will next time!  

Oh yes, there will be a next time.

excerpts: The tacos were huge, overflowing with fresh veggies and plenty of chunks of fish.
The salsa was great, fairly spicy (be forewarned!), the chips were a little greasy for my taste, but obviously freshly fried in house.
The crowd was a mixed group of people who clearly know this place has great food at budget prices.
I'm definitely going to eat here again.
veggies.author: Zephyr A.
veggies.review: Had dinner with a friend recently. What a value! This place is great, we shared fish tacos and a chicken quesadilla. The tacos were huge, overflowing with fresh veggies and plenty of chunks of fish. The salsa was great, fairly spicy (be forewarned!), the chips were a little greasy for my taste, but obviously freshly fried in house. The crowd was a mixed group of people who clearly know this place has great food at budget prices. I'm definitely going to eat here again.

excerpts: Quality ingredients are the foundation behind this excellent Mission burrito joint, including hormone-free meats (Niman Ranch) and fresh veggies.
Salsa?
Outtathisworld and without peer.
My favorite's the chili verde pork--better on some days than others, but that only means the place has real personality.
I could eat here every day
but I try not to.
veggies.author: Geddy L.
veggies.review: Quality ingredients are the foundation behind this excellent Mission burrito joint, including hormone-free meats (Niman Ranch) and fresh veggies. Salsa? Outtathisworld and without peer. My favorite's the chili verde pork--better on some days than others, but that only means the place has real personality. I could eat here every day but I try not to.

excerpts: this place takes it up a notch and keeps the spice right for the veggies!
veggies.author: Liz S.
veggies.review: soyrizo heaven and inventive veggie burritos. love and love. many of the mission style burrito places leave the veggie option bland and basic. this place takes it up a notch and keeps the spice right for the veggies!

excerpts: In any event, when the much awaited quesadilla finally arrived I was very excited to see that it was chock full of roasted veggies and not overly greasy or soggy.
veggies.author: Kate A.
veggies.review: While Papalote is probably one of the more gourmet Mexican cafes in the Mission, I am not sure I see what all the hype is about. I came here for an early dinner and the place was not terribly crowded- we were able to get a table without any wait. I ordered a quesadilla with grilled zucchini and eggplant. I also spent quite a bit extra ($2.75 to be exact) to have a side of guacamole with this quesadilla. Why so much  money for a little dollop of mashed avocado? Can't answer that one. The waitress was clearly confused when I placed my order, since the the overhead board said that additional sides were only a dollar. But then again I also asked her if the vegan quesadilla had cheese in it, and she said yes so I knew she was not completely with the program. After a few unsuccessful attempted inquiries as to why the guacamole was more expensive than advertised,  I decided to just let it go, as I was getting rather hungry. The food came relatively quickly- in the meantime we snacked on chips and some very spicy salsa. Again, I don't see what the hype is about. The salsa was just that- salsa. Nothing extraordinary. In fact, I prefer fresh salsa, if anything. In any event, when the much awaited quesadilla finally arrived I was very excited to see that it was chock full of roasted veggies and not overly greasy or soggy. The cheese was relatively light- a white cheese (quesa fresca perhaps?) and the roasted vegetables were a delicious compliment. I much enjoyed dipping the crispy cheesy confection in the oh so expensive guacamole. I'll probably visit this place again if I happen to be in the Mission, and look forward to trying their soy products.

excerpts: For those veggies and vegans out there, this place is also the spot.
The only down side is it can get pretty busy and the line can sometimes be out the door.
I've called a few times to place an order and they've screwed it up more than once.
But they're food
is still damn good.
veggies.author: Adrian N.
veggies.review: I go to this place often, as i live a block away.  ever heard of a taqueria where you're tacos, burritos and quesadillas are MADE TO ORDER?  Really.  I am not talking about a scoop of pre-cooked meat from a bucket and onto the grill.  We're talkin' about a fresh raw piece of carne asada or chicken put on the grill especially for your burrito.  That's what Papalote is about.   Some people prefer McDonalds french fries over real freshly sliced potato french fries.  So if you wan't McDonalds, go to the taqueria down the street.  They're food is clearly fresh and delicious and some people aren't used to that.  They're salsa is also incredible.  For those veggies and vegans out there, this place is also the spot.  The only down side is it can get pretty busy and the line can sometimes be out the door.    I've called a few times to place an order and they've screwed it up more than once.  But they're food is still damn good.

excerpts: I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.
veggies.author: Jessica T.
veggies.review: Papalote, I really do love you.  I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.  Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie, how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?  Yuck.  The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.  My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.  Thank you very much.

excerpts: The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).
veggies.author: Cecilia B.
veggies.review: Ordered take-out burritos - along with extra salsa - from the Mission location.  The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).  The shrimp super was excellent.  Everything was fresh and made-to-order.  No choice of salsa but the house version is amazing - blended rather than chunky but very tasty and spicy.  Definitely worth the visit and a return trip!

excerpts: I get the veggie burrito and am always happy to find big chunks of fresh veggies in there.
Squash, carrots, eggplant, they dont mess around at Papalote.
Nothing's too greasy or heavy, and the salsa is really great.
Sometimes the ordering area can be a little hectic, but take a deep breath....
you're about to get some quality, well-priced Mexican food.
Yum.
veggies.author: Muffin F.
veggies.review: Papalote probably doesn't need my praise, but I love it so much that I am writing a glowing review any way. It's usually pretty busy in there, and with good reason. The food is just good. I get the veggie burrito and am always happy to find big chunks of fresh veggies in there. Squash, carrots, eggplant, they dont mess around at Papalote. Nothing's too greasy or heavy, and the salsa is really great. Sometimes the ordering area can be a little hectic, but take a deep breath....you're about to get some quality, well-priced Mexican food. Yum.

excerpts: My friend had the steak burrito and there was barely any steak.
Stop cheating your customers.
steak.author: Ann L.
steak.review: Are you serious now? I been to a few taquerias and this one takes the cake in skimpy as fck in their portions. I had a shrimp burrito... which only had 4 pieces of shrimp. It was packed with rice and veggies and cost $12?! I thought I had ordered a veggie burrito with those portions...My friend had the steak burrito and there was barely any steak. Stop cheating your customers.

excerpts: The grilled steak burrito is very good.
Authentic Mexican food and
I like how the chips and the salsa were free.
I always wanted to eat here
and I glad that I did.
Only problem is that it is over priced.
steak.author: Kangaroo K.
steak.review: The grilled steak burrito is very good. Authentic Mexican food and I like how the chips and the salsa were free. I always wanted to eat here and I glad that I did. Only problem is that it is over priced.

excerpts: I had an amazing steak salad with jicama.
They have excellent fresh  ingredients which perfectly complement their unique sauces and dressings, which I've been meaning to buy by the bottle.
You will not be disappointed.
steak.author: May C.
steak.review: One of my favorite places in the Mission. This restaurant goes above and beyond the typical tacos and burritos. I had an amazing steak salad with jicama.
