They have excellent fresh  ingredients which perfectly complement their unique sauces and dressings, which I've been meaning to buy by the bottle. You will not be disappointed.

excerpts: Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.
Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado.
steak.author: Mark O.
steak.review:
Mexican restaurant on 24th & Valencia. On the 2014 and 2015 7x7 list for their chips and salsa.

Although you order at the counter your food gets brought to you. Limited meat selection. No chorizo or carnitas. 

Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.

Triple threat burrito - 3/5 - Massive. Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado. Not really impressed.

Chips and salsa - 5/5 - WOW. I very much expected to be disappointed by another overhyped dish but this absolutely lived up to it's reputation. The salsa is so damn good. This is easily my favorite salsa in the city and I even bought an extra jar to take home. It is creamy, spicy and delicious. It certainly deserves the spot it has held on the 7x7 list for the past two years.

Overall, this is without a doubt my new go to option for salsa. Unfortunately the rest of their items are passable so I think I will likely be getting the salsa to go and getting my burrito/taco/quesadilla elsewhere in the future. Regardless, this salsa is absolutely "as good as it gets" and I will probably always have some on hand in my fridge.

excerpts: I got the super "Triple Threat Burrito" -- chicken, steak, and shrimp.
I should have known it was going to be a discombobulated flavor mess.
First of all, among the three proteins, I only enjoyed the steak.
The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked.
The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked.
I was burping up bad shrimp all night long.
Don't get the shrimp.
Or chicken.
2) Don't get the refried beans.
Just trust me on this.
Park on the residential streets nearby.
Actually, nevermind all that.
Skip this spot and go to La Taqueria instead.
steak.author: Jennifer B.
steak.review:
Wow. What a major disappointment. Major.

USA Today ranked Papalote Mexican Grill as the #1 burrito in the country. I've eaten quite a few excellent burritos and a lot of "meh" burritos, but actually not a lot of terrible burritos. The one I had today would fall into that last category. I'm pretty sure I actually enjoy Chipotle's burritos more, and that's saying something.

I got the super "Triple Threat Burrito" -- chicken, steak, and shrimp. I should have known it was going to be a discombobulated flavor mess. First of all, among the three proteins, I only enjoyed the steak. The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked. I was burping up bad shrimp all night long.

As for the rest of the burrito, it could be that I just ordered wrong by getting the refried beans. They advertise the refried beans as being vegan, which should have been a red flag. Ask your abuela if she ever made vegan refried beans. She'd laugh at you. But aside from the poor taste, the texture was... saucy. Not goopy, not gloppy, not bean-y. Saucy. And these beans, which made up far too much of the burrito, melded together with the salsa, watery guacamole, and who knows what else to become a really drippy, nasty sauce. Burritos are meant to have all of the components stay separate while being wrapped together, not seem like they've gone through a blender together to become homogenized. It was really, really bad. I regretted buying this $22 burrito (Yes! $22!!!) two bites into it.

On another note, the salsa that comes with their chips is very unique. Very Romesco-y. The chips were stale.

Tips and tricks for if you go to Papalote:
1) Don't get the shrimp. Or chicken. 
2) Don't get the refried beans. Just trust me on this.
3) Park on the residential streets nearby.
4) Actually, nevermind all that. Skip this spot and go to La Taqueria instead.

excerpts: I ordered a steak naked bowl with no beans.
It was dry and tasteless.
The steak is meh.
steak.author: Traci H.
steak.review:
Ok now I understand the craze that is Papalote.

For hipster Mission, it's reasonably priced (e.g., 2 people can eat for $20), but yeah it's just a burrito.  But it's a good one.  

People rave about the chips and salsa (yes the burritos come with it) and yeah the salsa is like crack.  The chips have been hit or miss.  Sometimes it feels hard and tasteless, but it's just a shovel to get the salsa in my mouth.

I made a big mistake...I ordered a steak naked bowl with no beans.  It was dry and tasteless.  The steak is meh.  Skip it.

But the chile verde burrito with refried beans. OH MY GOODNESS.  Flavorful and addictive.  Even the leftovers tasted wonderful.  It is really messy because the chile verde is really wet so I just dug right in with a fork and knife instead.

Frequent burrito card so why not come back more.

Order and pay at the cash register and then you sit with a number and they bring your food.  One of the cash registers is for phone orders only so if you're doing takeout, it's pretty easy.

Bathroom on the far side of the restaurant.

And head down the street to Arizemendi for a little after meal scone ;-)

excerpts: Stuffed with steak, chicken, and shrimp --
steak.author: Tony V.
steak.review:
What I got:
Triple threat burrito

What I thought:
So the Mission is known to have a bunch of great Mexican food spots to eat and to say that this is definitely top 3 is saying something!

The triple threat burrito is something else. I don't think I've ever had a burrito quite like it. Stuffed with steak, chicken, and shrimp -- what better combination could you ask for!?

Flavors were amazing and the meats were seasoned perfectly. The combination of everything blended very well. I ended up wanting more after I finished my half!

We arrived a little bit late before closing time so we didn't get to enjoy our burrito in the actual restaurant, but the employees were so kind and asked us if we wanted to cut our burrito is half since we were on the go. They even individually wrapped each one. Even by cutting it in half, it still looked like two regular burritos. That's how gigantic this puppy is.

One of the best places to eat in the Mission -- no doubt! Craving Mexican food? This is the place for you!

excerpts: I ordered 2 steak tacos and a triple threat burrito ( made super ) to share.
Unfortunately they were closing soon
so we had to get it to go --
although it was quite a long wait, it was so worth it.
The meal came with nachos and their award winning papalote sauce.
It was AMAZING!
The triple threat burrito had all three meats -- chicken, steak, and garlic shrimp.
The tacos were alright, a tad bit on the dry side
but it is because we didn't get any guac or sour cream with it.
Despite the wait and the fact we couldnt be seated, overall it was a good experience.
I will be coming back again.
steak.author: Peter W.
steak.review: A hearty burrito after a long week's work is exactly what I needed -- I have heard amazing things about papalote from friends and colleagues; it was true. I ordered 2 steak tacos and a triple threat burrito ( made super ) to share. Unfortunately they were closing soon so we had to get it to go -- although it was quite a long wait, it was so worth it. The meal came with nachos and their award winning papalote sauce. It was AMAZING! The triple threat burrito had all three meats -- chicken, steak, and garlic shrimp. The tacos were alright, a tad bit on the dry side but it is because we didn't get any guac or sour cream with it. Despite the wait and the fact we couldnt be seated, overall it was a good experience. I will be coming back again.

excerpts: Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super.
To me it is weird that isn't included in the price
but ok.
The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant.
It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender.
Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.
As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with.
steak.author: Eddie W.
steak.review:
7x7 100 Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2012

#46 Chips and Salsa at Papalote

My first question to myself was how good can the chips and salsa really be or was this just another fill in item. Well I finally was able to have my answer this past week. 

After deliberating where to go, we decided to go to Papalote for their chips and salsa. While browsing their menu online I noticed something odd. Everyone on Yelp kept posting pictures of the Triple Threat Burrito however I saw it no where on the menu. Turns out it is their signature item that was featured on Bobby Flay's show Throwdown. 

Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super. To me it is weird that isn't included in the price but ok. My friend and I agreed to split the burrito plus get chips, extra salsa and two beers. We both ended up paying $18 for just that so keep that in mind. 

For what its worth, the salsa is unlike any other salsa I have had. From color, consistency and all the way down to flavor there is a complexity to their salsa that is well worth trying. The chips did not appear to be anything out of the ordinary but I would recommend trying the salsa at least one time. 

The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant. It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender. I would gladly go back for their carne asada burrito. 

Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.

As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with. The quality was good and cooked well but didn't find it be a valid "threat".

Overall Thoughts

Salsa is delicious and well worth trying as well as the carne asada but be warned Papalote isn't a cheap grab and go burrito kind of place

excerpts: I couldn't really taste the steak or the chicken although I know it's there.
The carne asada taco had all the fixings and the steak was distinct and tasted great!
The salsa...forget about it...
steak.author: Andrew S.
steak.review:
3 stars for the Triple Threat
4 stars for the carne asada tacos
5 stars for the salsa

Maybe the pictures got the best of me and it looked better than it tasted. The TT was a little overhyped in my opinion. The idea/concept is legit and the thing is enormous, but the flavors are a little muddled because there's just too much going on. I couldn't really taste the steak or the chicken although I know it's there. The carne asada taco had all the fixings and the steak was distinct and tasted great! The salsa...forget about it...it's hands down addicting like crack! 

I'll be back to try a normal carne asada burrito so that I can make a better comparison of the other taqueria spots I've already tried. I'll be back for sure!

excerpts: I always get the steak burrito with everything in it.
I usually don't like guac in burritos but the put the right amount of it
and it tastes perfect.
steak.author: Hemza S.
steak.review:
Every time I'm in San Francisco I make my to this place for a burrito! Located in the mission area across from the 76 gas station. It goes get very busy and tends to be annoying when there's a lot of customers. On the other hand, the food is delicious however it is a little pricey but it's SF :) 

I always get the steak burrito with everything in it. I usually don't like guac in burritos but the put the right amount of it and it tastes perfect. The meat inside is extra crispy and tastes well cooked. 

After ordering they bring you salsa which is by far the best salsa you'll ever taste. Im not sure what's in it but maybe a tomato salsa? They don't have extra for free but it's a 1$ charge. 

Overall, I will continue getting my Mexican fix from here and recommend it to anyone that loves authentic Mexican food.

excerpts: Today I left work early & thought I would treat myself to some steak nachos.
What a mistake that was.
+ for a bowl of chips with less than 1/2 cup of toppings combined.
What's that 1000% mark up?
The guacamole was mashed up avocado w no favor, the pico de gallo was chopped tomatoes with no flavor, the cheese wasn't melted & the steak was super dry & tasted like Taco Bell steak
(sorry Taco Bell).
The horchata was the worst!
It tasted like lemonade!
steak.author: Rosie D.
steak.review:
Why in God's name would "Mexican" be included in the name of this establishment?  I've walked by this place for the past year on my way to work in Noe Valley & always wanted to get it.  Today I left work early & thought I would treat myself to some steak nachos. What a mistake that was.  $13+ for a bowl of chips with less than 1/2 cup of toppings combined.  What's that 1000% mark up? The guacamole was mashed up avocado w no favor, the pico de gallo was chopped tomatoes with no flavor, the cheese wasn't melted & the steak was super dry & tasted like Taco Bell steak (sorry Taco Bell).  The horchata was the worst!  It tasted like lemonade!  I was so disappointed.  

Gone are the days when you could go to the Mission for cheap burritos & nacho plates.  Considering who now lives in the Mission I'm not surprised.  I'm sure this place will continue to be packed by transplant hipsters that don't know any better.  As for me I'll stick to La Tapatia in SSF where you can get nachos for half the price that you can share w 2 or 3 friends.

excerpts: I ended up taking the whole thing apart and only eating the steak pieces.
steak.author: Ashley Z.
steak.review:
The salsa was good - very creamy with a kick to it. 

However, my burrito was dry, dry, dry, with so much beans and rice filling. I ended up taking the whole thing apart and only eating the steak pieces.

excerpts: The salsa is a must have and so is the steak burrito.
Taking off one star as I'm an avid fountain drink lover and this was lacking here.
Other than that good neighborhood Mexican restaurant.
steak.author: Katie C.
steak.review: This place was recommended to me by a friend who lives in the Mission. After seeing the 2000 reviews and 4 star rating I knew I was in. Definitely lives up to the reviews! The super nachos were HUGE, ended up getting a box to go. The salsa is a must have and so is the steak burrito. Taking off one star as I'm an avid fountain drink lover and this was lacking here. Other than that good neighborhood Mexican restaurant.

excerpts: The vegetarian options can't be beat for my wife, and I'm a meat-eater looking for their delicious steak.
When we are tired and lazy after work and can't be bothered with deciding what to eat, Papalote is always the go-to... like twice a week.
Awesome spot.
steak.author: Jake K.
steak.review: THAT SALSA!!!!!! But also the food is amazing haha. The vegetarian options can't be beat for my wife, and I'm a meat-eater looking for their delicious steak. When we are tired and lazy after work and can't be bothered with deciding what to eat, Papalote is always the go-to... like twice a week. Awesome spot.

excerpts: Today I ordered two Super Steak Burritos with everything.
Me and my boy sit down, and in 5 minutes we get our burrito.
I'm eating through my burrito and wtf.....
there's no steak.
No sour cream.
I told the lady about it and she gave me a plate with steak expecting me to stuff it in my burrito.
But I ordered Steak Burrito...
steak.author: Leo J.
steak.review:
An experience like never before. O.o

Dear Yelpers, 

Please proceed with caution when entering a despised Mexican joint like PapaShittay....

Today I ordered two Super Steak Burritos with everything. Me and my boy sit down, and in 5 minutes we get our burrito. I'm eating through my burrito and wtf..... there's no steak. No sour cream.  I told the lady about it and she gave me a plate with steak expecting me to stuff it in my burrito. But I ordered Steak Burrito... 

#ButIOrderedASteakBurrito 

Never again... This is how you treat a loyal customer?

excerpts: We got the super burritos, one with steak, one with chicken and another rice and three kinds of beans (black, pinto and refried).
They are all incredibly yummy.
steak.author: Shou-cheng L.
steak.review:
Super delicious burritos. We got the super burritos, one with steak, one with chicken and another rice and three kinds of beans (black, pinto and refried). They are all incredibly yummy. Now I believe burritos don't actually have to be spicy to be tasty. 

Btw, their salsa and chips are crazy good too. I am hooked.

excerpts: i dont know how everything totaled out to $16 for a burrito and a drink but yea the best thing about the burrito was the steak it was perfect grilled chunks
but im not sure if it was the rice or too much seasoning
but it was pretty salty
and i really wish the salsa was actually spicy
but i feel like i can get a better burrito  back across the bridge
steak.author: Antonio R.
steak.review: Yea this spot was alright i came from oakland cus the reviews and not only that but they're supposed to be one of the best in th i dont know how everything totaled out to $16 for a burrito and a drink but yea the best thing about the burrito was the steak it was perfect grilled chunks but im not sure if it was the rice or too much seasoning but it was pretty salty and i really wish the salsa was actually spicy but i feel like i can get a better burrito  back across the bridge

excerpts: Come here if you like quality: My favorite steak burrito in town!
That's pretty much all i get here.
All meat, no chewy weird stuff you won't swallow.
3 types of tortillas, spinach, tomato and regular
so you can switch it up here and there.
They're also heated in the skillet, extra crispy please!
They have mild and hot salsa.
steak.author: Fredo L.
steak.review:
Come here if you like quality: My favorite steak burrito in town! That's pretty much all i get here. All meat, no chewy weird stuff you won't swallow. 3 types of tortillas, spinach, tomato and regular so you can switch it up here and there. They're also heated in the skillet, extra crispy please! They have mild and hot salsa. If you don't ask, you will get mild. 

If you like hip hop and reggae, that's all you will hear from the speakers. They owner is a DJ and bad ass favorite! 

You also love art. Hip hop culture and Mexican culture up on the walls and all art is for sale. 

Also, Papalote means kite. Find cool kites in here 

Don't come here: If you like cheap food don't eat here. If you're still used to the high fats, stringy meat, cloned veggies, guacamole from a bag and sugary hfcs gmo tortillas heated with a steamer, skip this place. 

Out of 100 burritos, 1 sucked. New cook I guess. "Even the best chef burns the beans" they say.

excerpts: I usually go with a super steak burrito or a shrimp quesadilla though
WITH EXTRA SAUCE.
steak.author: Jessie L.
steak.review:
The best Mexican in SF. I don't know why La Taquiera gets so much buzz. This place is so much better. 

I don't know what's in their "special sauce" but I literally want to put it on everything I eat from now on. 

I don't have "recommendations" because everything you order is good. I usually go with a super steak burrito or a shrimp quesadilla though WITH EXTRA SAUCE.

excerpts: Lunch today: Regular nachos, chile verde tacos, steak burrito, two diet cokes, free chips and their signature
roasted chili salsa, $36.
Two people.
I took one taco home- a lot of food.
My son raved about the food and he is picky.
I liked that the pork in my chile verde was tender and NO GRISTLE.
Hate gristle.
Also really like the heat on the chile verde.
Their roasted chile salsa is yummy, too.
So, yes, go and enjoy!
steak.author: Carol E.
steak.review: Lunch today: Regular nachos, chile verde tacos, steak burrito, two diet cokes, free chips and their signature roasted chili salsa, $36. Two people. I took one taco home- a lot of food. My son raved about the food and he is picky. I liked that the pork in my chile verde was tender and NO GRISTLE. Hate gristle. Also really like the heat on the chile verde. Their roasted chile salsa is yummy, too. So, yes, go and enjoy!

excerpts: Sadly, the two burritios we split (chicken and steak) where a bit underwhelming and just didn't have the flavor we were hoping it would.
I mean, the steak one was still decent
but it wasn't "wow" or "amazing" in anyway to me, not to mention a bit over priced for a burrito in the Mission.
steak.author: Petra S.
steak.review:
I saw this place listed on 7X7 magazien's as being the # 1 burritio place winner a few years back and never really attempted to try it until I was doing a pet sit in the area last week. 

My husband was with me and we're both fans of thier salsa, which we buy at Whole Foods. Sadly, the two burritios we split (chicken and steak) where a bit underwhelming and just didn't have the flavor we were hoping it would. I mean, the steak one was still decent but it wasn't "wow" or "amazing" in anyway to me, not to mention a bit over priced for a burrito in the Mission. I think I still prefer El Farolito and so does my husband. 

I think we'll just stick with buying thier salsa but perhaps you might like them so do give them at least one try.

excerpts: Probably the best meat I've ever had in a burrito- the pieces of steak and chicken are lean and big and juicy and flavorful; very different from many Mexican food places where the meat is always greasy, minced to an oblivion and full of weird, chewy and fatty bites where you aren't quite sure what you just put in your mouth (icky)...
steak.author: Gaby C.
steak.review:
*I would actually rate this place 3.5 stars if I could, but since I can't, I'm going to have to round down in this instance*

So, I've been wanting to try this place since it was featured and won on a Throwdown with Bobby Flay episode years ago... Then, I wanted to try it even more when I read an article recently that named this place the Best Burrito in America.... I can't tell you the excitement I had inside- it was overwhelming.

Of course, the place was packed inside. It's a very small, cozy place with only a few tables... The seating is somewhat communal style, where you may or may not have to share the same table with other parties... It has a cool, vibe to it- fits right in in the Mission neighborhood.

You order at the front counter and then are asked to wait outside until they are able to seat your party. 

Obviously I ordered the $19.95 Triple Threat Burrito (Don't worry- I shared this with one other person) as that's the very burrito that beat out Bobby Flay and was mentioned in the article... P.s. It's an extra $0.99 for guacamole ... Why wouldn't a $20 burrito already have guacamole in it? (That extra $0.99 is actually for cheese, sour cream and guacamole but I don't eat cheese or sour cream) 

Once seated, they will bring you chips and salsa (it more looks like a slightly thick, smooth orangey sauce)... The chips are mediocre, but the salsa is really unique tasting and really yummy! 

The burrito was served very shortly after. It's huge! Thank goodness we decided to share.  So the burrito was really good... Really, really good... Probably the best meat I've ever had in a burrito- the pieces of steak and chicken are lean and big and juicy and flavorful; very different from many Mexican food places where the meat is always greasy, minced to an oblivion and full of weird, chewy and fatty bites where you aren't quite sure what you just put in your mouth (icky)... The shrimp is grilled to perfection and also bursting with flavor... All the meats are cooked to order and you really could taste the freshness in the cooking- it keeps you excited for each and every bite that you take.

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal... The high quality of the meat is definitely the highlight of this place.... But to me, they really need to improve their chip recipe and the fact that this place isn't what you would consider to be typical "Mexican taqueria style" food threw me off a little from what I was expecting... Also, in my opinion, America's best burrito is definitely not going to have black beans inside it. 

Okay, so maybe it's not the best burrito in my book, but I would say this place is definitely worth a try if you're in the area. 

Note: This place has tons of vegetarian options which was really cool to me.

excerpts: Got a breakfast burrito with steak, after two bites the whole thing fell apart.
The eggs were soggy and the meat portion was super stingy.
The eating space was small, but functional.
The bathroom was completely destroyed with nonsensical graffiti.
steak.author: Sean C.
steak.review: Good space, pretty meh food. Got a breakfast burrito with steak, after two bites the whole thing fell apart. The eggs were soggy and the meat portion was super stingy. The eating space was small, but functional. The bathroom was completely destroyed with nonsensical graffiti.

excerpts: burrito of steak, chicken adobo, and shrimp, for $20!
Which is only missing their vegan items to be the whole menu.
Bobby Flay should just stick to barbeques.
Oh Papalote made a better burrito than Boby Flay on Throwdown?
Have you seen the show?
steak.author: Leo M.
steak.review:
Tastes alright. Really pricy for what me and my 7 other latino friends consider and rate as a "mediocre burrito". Just see who is sitting at the tables. Latinos? Nope.

Extremely limited meats for a mexican food place. look at the menu, the only worthwhile item is the Triple Threata burrito of steak, chicken adobo, and shrimp, for $20! Which is only missing their vegan items to be the whole menu. Bobby Flay should just stick to barbeques. Oh Papalote made a better burrito than Boby Flay on Throwdown? Have you seen the show? He never wins.

The jicama sample-size salad is ridiculous. The stale table chips a joke. The only thing ok is the salsa they sell and offer with the chips. Also the mexican coke and 7up.

Regardless, I wish this little restaurant well, I wont be coming back. But I hope they prosper in their own way.

excerpts: Hmmm,$48 for two steak tacos, two shrimp tacos, a steak burrito, and a couple of sodas.
The place should really be listed as $$ or $$$ ...
steak.author: Colleen M.
steak.review: Hmmm,$48 for two steak tacos, two shrimp tacos, a steak burrito, and a couple of sodas. The place should really be listed as $$ or $$$ ...

excerpts: Typically, but not always, made from skirt steak, prized for it's flavor, not it's tenderness.

It's for this reason that they usually marinate the shit out of it to break it down a bit prior to searing it to impart some additional flavorful goodness and then cutting it across the grain to make it easy to eat.
Did that make you hungry?
Well then don't go to Papalote.
steak.author: Brad T.
steak.review:
Let's get this out of the way. I've spent the majority of my life in Southern California, where we all know there is an overabundance of fantastic Mexican food. Yes, I'm sometimes snobby about it. That works in your favor, because I'll help you avoid eating at places like Papalote.

Let's start with the food, of course. It sucked. My girlfriend and I shared the carne asada plate. Let's talk for a moment about carne asada. Typically, but not always, made from skirt steak, prized for it's flavor, not it's tenderness. It's for this reason that they usually marinate the shit out of it to break it down a bit prior to searing it to impart some additional flavorful goodness and then cutting it across the grain to make it easy to eat. Did that make you hungry? Well then don't go to Papalote. The carne asada at this place is devoid of all of the qualities I've just described.

And I suppose I shouldn't have been surprised that all of the accompanying sides (with the exception of the refried black beans; those were surprisingly tasty) were mediocre at best. The worst thing you can ever say about Mexican food is that it tastes bland. And this was soul-suckingly bland trash, served piping hot to people who don't know any better. As of this writing, Papalote has 4 stars on Yelp... I'm actually angry.

To add insult to injury, this plate of junk cost 16 bucks, plus 3-something for a side of guac... So just over 21 bucks with tax for ONE plate of food... Fuck. That.

excerpts: I had the steak burrito and it was one of the best I've had in the mission.
Nice little location with very friendly staff.
steak.author: Nicholas F.
steak.review: This place has delicious Mexican food and they're known for their salsa which they also sell in stores ,its that good! I had the steak burrito and it was one of the best I've had in the mission. Nice little location with very friendly staff.

excerpts: I decided to opt for a steak burrito.
After ordering and grabbing a seat, a server comes around and hands me a bowl of chips along with their amazing, amazing salsa.
steak.author: George Z.
steak.review:
Rated one of the best burritos in San Francisco, Papalote attracts many people each day. I decided to deviate from my normal taqueria choices and step inside. You'll be greeted with the menu and, most of the time, a line.

Price wise it's a step up from regular Mexican restaurants, but this isn't just any restaurant. This place has been featured on Bobby Flay's short run show, Throwdown. They also have the feature that similar with Chipotle where you sub the rice for lettuce.

I decided to opt for a steak burrito. After ordering and grabbing a seat, a server comes around and hands me a bowl of chips along with their amazing, amazing salsa. I could go on about the salsa, but the fact that they sell it by the jar speaks for itself.

The burrito was absolutely massive. You get what you paid for and then some. Luckily, they provide you a knife and fork seeing as I don't have NBA player sized hands. Everything seemed standard, but the refried beans were something else... Very savory and creamy, the perfect compliment to any great burrito. 

I'll be back again and again if I decide to pay a bit more for a burrito when I stop by. They should have a loyalty program here!

excerpts: Papalote is REALLY proud of the fact that their "Triple Threat" (steak, chicken, shrimp) burrito beat
Iron Chef Bobby Flay's.
It's prominently advertised and mentioned by Papalote groupies.
And they charge $20.
I asked a friend who is a Papalote devotee if she wanted to split it, but was told it's not really that big.
But still $20?
I ordered the chicken burrito and got a Horchata too.
The chicken seemed shredded.
A little dry.
As I continued to eat it, it was good, but it did not wow me or fill me up at the end of the meal.
A good burrito.
Add a little salsa as you eat the burrito and it's better.
But this experience has inspired me to try other joints in the Mission for my next visit.
Maybe find some friends to go on a Mission burrito crawl.
steak.author: Corey C.
steak.review:
My first burrito in the Mission District!  Papalote was the first recommendation given to me when venturing into this mecca of big burrito lovers.  I'm not going to just meekly accept the assumption that all burritos from this area are better than anywhere else without validating this myself though.    

Going on a picturesque Sunday evening in August, it was surprisingly not too packed.  I have had longer waits at Chipotle.  The clientele here included mainly tourists and hipsters, here because of their devotion to a good burrito.  

Papalote is REALLY proud of the fact that their "Triple Threat" (steak, chicken, shrimp) burrito beat Iron Chef Bobby Flay's.  It's prominently advertised and mentioned by Papalote groupies.  And they charge $20.  I asked a friend who is a Papalote devotee if she wanted to split it, but was told it's not really that big.  But still $20?  Yeah, no thanks.

So you order at Papalote by telling them what you want, getting a number, taking it to your table, and waiting for them to bring it out.  I ordered the chicken burrito and got a Horchata too.  On to the chips and salsa.  The salsa is pretty awesome.  It tasted like a fire-roasted tomato-based red salsa, but is a little creamy too.  The chips were standard.  The horchata was a tad sweet for my taste.

The burrito came out after roughly 10 minutes.  Time to dig in!  Wait . . . no foil and it's on a plate?  Surely I don't have to eat this burrito with knife and fork? That's a little too formal for me, so I used my hands and picked it up.  First bite and I liked the flavor of the burrito.  The chicken seemed shredded.  A little dry.  As I continued to eat it, it was good, but it did not wow me or fill me up at the end of the meal.  A good burrito.  Add a little salsa as you eat the burrito and it's better.  But this experience has inspired me to try other joints in the Mission for my next visit.  Maybe find some friends to go on a Mission burrito crawl.

excerpts: I usually go with the steak or chicken super burrito with black beans.
The tacos are not good here.
steak.author: Aaron L.
steak.review: Consistently reliable and delicious, but way to expensive. I usually go with the steak or chicken super burrito with black beans. The tacos are not good here.

excerpts: , I really liked it, I'm more of a chicken person than steak person.
My sister tried the 'mexipino' it's mexican and filipino food mixed together in a burrito.
steak.author: Ivadine M.
steak.review:
One of the best Mexican foods I have ever tried. I was shocked when there was a picture of Bobby Flay on the wall, b/c apparently he had a throwdown there, and apparently he lost, so had to go try that place. 

This place was kind of small, it's kind of packed, but it's packed because it was really good. I had the chicken burrito, I really liked it, I'm more of a chicken person than steak person. My sister tried the 'mexipino' it's mexican and filipino food mixed together in a burrito. All I know it had chicken, but adobo style. It was really good, trust me. That's a must try when you go there. 
Also the carne asada nachos was really delicious. That's a must try also.

Service was friendly. 
Parking was pretty tough.
And finding a seat for 6 people was pretty difficult.
Food was great though. 

Go here if you're ever in San Francisco.

excerpts: so it wasn't too hard to go for the steak burrito to go.
I don't live too far from here
so I figured I'd rather eat it at home.
steak.author: Mayank G.
steak.review:
I found this place while just walking by it, something that's a little bit of a rarity for me to go in without checking yelp. The first thing I noticed was that the door only opens halfway since the sidewalk is on a slant, and for whatever reason that made me really excited to eat there.

LIke any good place, this place was full and had free water. Thank god for free water! It was nice and cold too. They take orders ridiculously fast and the cashier was very nice, so there wasn't much waiting in line time to decide what to get.

Thankfully this place was pretty standard Mexican so it wasn't too hard to go for the steak burrito to go. I don't live too far from here so I figured I'd rather eat it at home. The price point was pretty standard, although a lot of places like Taqueria Cancún are cheaper and (spoiler) better.

When I opened the bag and took out the well sized burrito I was pretty happy, but still nothing out of the ordinary so far. Underneath the burrito I realized that the nacho chips (which are complementary like many burrito places in SF) were just lying out at the bottom of the paper bag, which was kind of disappointing. After a struggle to tear the paper bag in a way that would make it a suitable plate for the chips, I was only disappointed to find their spicy rendition of nacho cheese dip to be... well, mediocre. But complaining about a complementary side, maybe I'm just spoilt.

The burrito, this is where my still to be four star rating for the place dropped to three. It wasn't bad by any regard, but since burritos are quite the large food to tackle, I like them to be good to the very last bite. Unfortunately the first of this one told me this was going to be a challenge, albeit not a hardest one. It was rolled somewhat loosely, I didn't how ridiculously thin the tortilla was, and the ingredients weren't causing the orgasm in my mouth that other burritos have caused me to expect. I actually even payed the extra dollar or two it takes to get a super burrito with the guac, something I usually love, but something was just missing.

Being in the mission, unless you're ridiculously hungry and right outside this place, I'd reccomend going to one of the many other burritos around.

excerpts: Amidst my mountains of rice and beans, though, I found maybe only a couple pieces of steak.
It was kinda small and, while tasty, was not exactly memorable.
A good burrito, and I wouldn't mind going to this place again.
I definitely won't be seeking it out, though...
especially given how bad the parking situation is around it, even on Sunday...
steak.author: Brian B.
steak.review: Far too Chipotle-esaue for my liking.  It's fresh, pretty tasty, and has some good salsa to put on top.  Amidst my mountains of rice and beans, though, I found maybe only a couple pieces of steak.  It was kinda small and, while tasty, was not exactly memorable.  A good burrito, and I wouldn't mind going to this place again.  I definitely won't be seeking it out, though...especially given how bad the parking situation is around it, even on Sunday...

excerpts: And you know what I mean by quality steak, not thin strips but tender juicy chunks.
And to top it off, their orange sauce is amazing
steak.author: Neil I.
steak.review: Although El Farolito may have been my go-to, simply because it's cheaper, Papalote was my change of pace burrito treat. See the Mission is sprawled with great Taqueria spots, but if you're willing to pay ~$3 more you can get a quality carne asada burrito.. And you know what I mean by quality steak, not thin strips but tender juicy chunks. And to top it off, their orange sauce is amazing

excerpts: " (steak, shrimp, & chicken).
A lil pricy at $20, but I think it's worth it.
It's one of those
"you gotta try it once" kinda things.
steak.author: Juno M.
steak.review:
Finally had this yesterday, and it was definitely worth the Bart trip from Union City to the Mission district.

First off, their homemade salsa tops everything I've had in my Mexican dining experience. It's a must-have when you visit.

Next, being that I'm Filipino, I specifically came here for the "Mexipino" (chicken adobo burrito) and boy did it live up to the hype. Very light and flavorful.

AIso had some of my fiancee's "Triple Threat" (steak, shrimp, & chicken). A lil pricy at $20, but I think it's worth it. It's one of those "you gotta try it once" kinda things. Just as flavorful as the Mexipino, but I can't say better.

Have their horchata too!

excerpts: Some bites were all rice, some bites were all steak, some were all guac.
steak.author: Angela C.
steak.review: I had high expectations for Papalote given the 1800+ reviews. However, I was pretty underwhelmed with my burrito. I ordered the Carne Asada burrito with no beans and made it super. The rice was mushy and the filling was not evenly distributed throughout the burrito. Some bites were all rice, some bites were all steak, some were all guac. The burrito came with chips and salsa. The chips were a little bland and the salsa was too mild for this spice-loving girl. Given that Papalote is right down the street from me I will probably give it another try, but I can't say I'll be craving this burrito like I do the Carne Asada San Francisco style at Tacko.

excerpts: The steak was perfectly med cooked.
It was like every time I took a bite.
The burrito was giving me a hug.
Didn't get that "oh shit
I ate too much' feeling.
Seems like their burrito was made with not so greasy ingredients.
Really solid burrito.
Seen most people share the burrito for lunch.
steak.author: Sun Y.
steak.review: Hell of a good burrito. The beans were delish. The rice was delish. The steak was perfectly med cooked. It was like every time I took a bite. The burrito was giving me a hug. Didn't get that "oh shit I ate too much' feeling. Seems like their burrito was made with not so greasy ingredients. Really solid burrito. Seen most people share the burrito for lunch.

excerpts: My friends got steak tacos.
They said they were decent but not excellent.
This is a great place for out of towners and hipsters.
steak.author: Joseph W.
steak.review: Another hipster touristy taqueria. I got the mole plate. It was as if it was stored for weeks. It was so dry. Not tasty. The meat was nearly a "powder" when I chewed it. My friends got steak tacos. They said they were decent but not excellent. This is a great place for out of towners and hipsters. I wrote this review because I spent nearly $20 on a mole plate and felt it was a complete waste. Do the cooks even taste what they are serving? How can you serve that? I'm positive it is not what the intent of a mole dish is supposed to be.

excerpts: I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.
steak.author: Cherylynn N.
steak.review:
My sleep cycle is all messed up...I get more rest on the weekends sleeping for 3 hours than on the weeknights sleeping for 6 hours. Erm, must be the alkie? :X  

It's 1 AM on Thursday Morning and while I should be "attempting" to sleep, my eyes are glued to  an episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay". For 26 minutes, my mouth was salivating at the thought of meeting the "Triple Threat" one day; needless to say, it was another sleepless night. *sigh*

My friends and I came here yesterday at 12ish and luckily, we came at just the right time before it started getting busy.

FOOD:
*Chips & Salsa (#46 on the 7x7 list): The chips were slightly warm, thin, and crisp with just the right amount of salt. Ahhhhh, the salsa....the BEST freaking salsa EVER! The salsa was emulsified to perfect creamy consistency. As it hits your palette and moves around your mouth, you can taste all the fresh ingredients (the charred tomatoes, garlic, onion, chilies, and cilantro) sink into your taste buds. It had the perfect blend of savory, smokiness, acidity, and fiery kick to it! This is the ONLY thing that lives up to the HYPE!

*Triple Threat (super w/ sour cream & guac): HOLY MOLEY! $20 for a freaking burrito?!?!? The burrito was a regular size burrito that you would find from any taqueria. It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp. The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender. The sour cream and guac are a must as it added a slight tartness and creaminess to balance out all the flavors.

*Ode to Poleng Adobe Burrito: FAIL! If you're expecting the garlicy, peppery soysauce vinegary taste that makes your lips pucker type of Adobo, you will be sadly disappointed. The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned. Errr, where was the garlic friend rice? The rice used was the standard burrito rice. The tortilla was the only thing that stood out. It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky. All in all, the burrito lacked any real flavor and was quite dry b/c there was no sauce or salsa in it).

DRINKS:
Papalote has a selection of sodas, juices, and Mexican beer. I have to note that their refrigeration system was not working properly yesterday as our drinks were room temperature.

PRICES:
WAY OVERPRICED! A regular burrito is about $8 and an extra $1 to make it super (sour cream and guac). The size of their regular burritos are quite small (approx 7' and 2.5' in diameter) compared to other taquerias in The Mission.

Although the Triple Threat was good; it was NO where near a $20 good! To me, Mexican food is just like Chinese food; you shouldn't have to pay much to get good-tasting food. And, I really think the "hype" has allowed Papalote to capitalize on its customers by charging such ludicrous prices. 

SERVICE:
Order your food at the counter, grab a number, and the server will being you your order when it's ready. The chips and salsa came first and it took about 15 minutes to get our burritos.    

AMBIANCE: 
Very funky hipster type feel with the bright red walls with colorful panting and reggae music playing in the background. 

PARKING: 
Difficult street parking around Valencia and Mission streets. However, Guerrero street seemed to have some available non-metered spots. 

Would I return? I would only return for the chips and salsa. Other than that, Papalote is WAY OVERYHYPED and OVERPRICED. I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.

excerpts: Prices are a bit higher than what you'd expect to find at other Mexican places in the Mission - the steak fajitas were $13.95!
steak.author: Alice C.
steak.review:
From the "That's what she said" joke potential to the succulent flavor, I love [almost] everything about meat.

So you can imagine what I'm about to say is very difficult, but it's also a testimony to how skilled Papalote is at making a healthier alternative not taste like feet.

That being said, the best thing I've tried on this menu is actually the soyrizo (soy chorizo)!  I tried a piece of the soyrizo quesadilla, and was very pleasantly surprised.  It was well seasoned, and the texture was not weird.  I think this dish will be my go-to from now on!

OTHER DISHES I'VE TRIED:
1. Chips and salsa - this is on the 7x7 100 things to try list.  The salsa was really good and different than any other salsa I've tasted, but I still think the soyrizo was more stand-out.
2. Carne asada fajitas - huge portion, and came with lots of veggies including eggplant.  Awesome!
3. Carne asada burrito - 2 days later and reheated via microwave...and STILL tasty!
4. Jicama salad - usually comes on the side with your meal, and refreshingly delicious!  

LIKES:
1. Large portions 
2. Leftovers still tasty 2 days later
3. Lots of veggie alternatives
4. Seems more health conscious than the average taqueria

DISLIKES:
1. Dine in was crowded...you'd probably be annoyed/displeased if you're claustrophobic.  You can phone in orders though.
2. Prices are a bit higher than what you'd expect to find at other Mexican places in the Mission - the steak fajitas were $13.95!  (and I think the carne asada at both El Farolitos is tastier...but then you can just get the soyrizo!)

excerpts: Found a whole side of avocado inside steak burrito, oddly enough it was not ripe and impossible to bite or cut with knife as it was very hard.
steak.author: Sabrina B.
steak.review: Average and expensive burrito, no flavorful nor traditional like La Taqueria on mission st. Found a whole side of avocado inside steak burrito, oddly enough it was not ripe and impossible to bite or cut with knife as it was very hard. Lots of rice and beans but not a fair amount of meat, which was also prepared in a way that it dry out, taking away flavor and texture. White fish tacos...will simply put; blend, no seasoned and not worthy the high pricey tag!  The only bright side is; they have great friendly customer service. Anyhow! I'm Walking to La Taqueria now to get the real deal! Yay

excerpts: The steak and chicken isn't made in mass quantities and dumped into containers to be heated under a lamp or in hot water.
steak.author: Ed C.
steak.review:
This ain't your run-of-the-mill taqueria ova here.

Papalote kicked Bobby Flay's ass on Throwdown and for good reason, their burritos are the bomb yo!

Everything is made to order. That's right, made to order. Grilled fresh in front of yo face! The steak and chicken isn't made in mass quantities and dumped into containers to be heated under a lamp or in hot water.  Everything is flame grilled when you order it and you can taste it.

To top everything off is Papalote's world famous salsa. The salsa is so good that it has it's own Twitter page (http://twitter.com/papalotesalsa) and it has more followers than me! The salsa is a taste of pure evilness with a side of quintessential bliss.

I heart burritos.

excerpts: Sat by the window on  a hot day, let the cold breeze in, and sucked down a cold corona with my steak tacos.
One meal is two tacos and they are bulky.
steak.author: Tim L.
steak.review: Meals comes with free chips and a unique salsa. Sat by the window on  a hot day, let the cold breeze in, and sucked down a cold corona with my steak tacos. One meal is two tacos and they are bulky. I recommend paying the extra dollar for cheese, guac, and sour cream. Fast service, cool vibe and clean. Thanks, I'll be coming again.

excerpts: I ordered a super steak burrito..
I mean cmon!
A super determines if the burrito is good or not!
Let me tell you, probably the BEST burrtio..
actually no, the 2nd BEST burrito I've tried in San Francisco.
Like the comment below, it definitely is not as authentic as El Farlito
steak.author: Lianne D.
steak.review:
Ohhh Papalote! The burrito you serve is ahhh-mazing!  

I ordered a super steak burrito.. I mean cmon! A super determines if the burrito is good or not! Let me tell you, probably the BEST burrtio.. actually no, the 2nd BEST burrito I've tried in San Francisco. Like the comment below, it definitely is not as authentic as El Farlito but this places has their own bars! 

The sauce they have.. simply just makes the burrito even better! And the Salsa for their chips.. perfect. Definitely recommend this place if you love burritos!

excerpts: I was a regular at Papalote for years - I came here specifically for the carne asada burrito (walking past numerous other burrito places) and gladly (well maybe gladly is a bit strong) handed over $12 for a burrito with actual steak in it.
I hoped they'd finally realize how inadequate  there carne asada now is, but no luck - the low-quality meat seems to be here to stay.
So disappointing.
steak.author: Jon C.
steak.review:
I was a regular at Papalote for years - I came here specifically for the carne asada burrito (walking past numerous other burrito places) and gladly (well maybe gladly is a bit strong) handed over $12 for a burrito with actual steak in it. And I'm talking about a quality cut of meat, charred with epic flavor.

About a month or so ago they changed the cut they use and how they prepare it, so now it's just another typical burrito with questionable meat - very grizzly with mediocre  flavor. I can get the equivalent for $7 elsewhere. 

The change was immediately apparent but I continued to go there for my weekly burrito. After about month or so of this, no more I say.  I hoped they'd finally realize how inadequate  there carne asada now is, but no luck - the low-quality meat seems to be here to stay. So disappointing. I'll just have to find my new favorite elsewhere.

Also, on a side note: what's the deal with piling all the meat on one end of the burrito? I know they're really busy back there but spreading it out would take about 0.5 extra seconds per order.

Again, so disappointed to give up Papalote. I'm going to miss what it once was.

excerpts: I got the steak nachos and a burrito......
It was bomb!
I had food coma after all of this.
I would def come back..... there are other places that are delish and don't put a dent in your pocket.
But this place is good.
steak.author: Irma R.
steak.review:
I've been here once..... ordered over the phone and picked it up. It's in a good location, parking isn't too hard. 
The food: Is expensive!!! I got the steak nachos and a burrito...... It was bomb! I had food coma after all of this. I would def come back..... there are other places that are delish and don't put a dent in your pocket. But this place is good.

excerpts: I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it.
It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned.
It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal.
That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.
steak.author: Alex O.
steak.review:
CILANTRO HATERS: This one gets complicated since they have it in their salsa and guac. I usually go for the super shrimp burrito with avocado instead of guac, and with the roasted salsa instead of pico de gallo. Yeah, I'm that annoying dude in front of you with an order like that. But seriously, you need to try this, and this is your ticket to happiness.

Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp or fish burrito/quesadilla here. I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it. It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned. It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal. That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.

excerpts: The meat is so tender and juicy and the steak marinade is fantastic.
A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain.
steak.author: Jonathan L.
steak.review:
My friend was watching the Throwdown Challenge on the Food Network and saw the Triple Threat being put on the spotlight. To make a long story short, I'm sitting there, watching two of my buddies take on the Triple Threat. Not wanting to shell out $20+ for a burrito, I'm munching on a normal carne asada burrito.

I was really happy with how the carne asada came out. The meat is so tender and juicy and the steak marinade is fantastic. I wish it wasn't $9 but the quality speaks for itself. 

From my friends' comments, I'd say that the chicken in the Triple Threat is not so great. A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain. The shrimp is stir fried with garlic and is great. 

Great burritos but too pricey. I don't recommend the Triple Threat unless you're doing it for the sake of doing it. The normal burritos are sufficient.

excerpts: The crispness of the tortilla was very nice, and the fillings were okay, but the steak tasted cheap cheap and it was just a little bland.
It's a burrito, ok?
Nothing more.
Nothing less.
steak.author: Jarrod S.
steak.review: I got the carne asada burrito. The crispness of the tortilla was very nice, and the fillings were okay, but the steak tasted cheap cheap and it was just a little bland. It's a burrito, ok? Nothing more. Nothing less.

excerpts: The super steak burrito was ginormous and delicious, and the man who took my order was quite friendly for how busy they were.
The horchata was great, and yes - just as everyone says - the salsa is pretty amazing.
Mainly, though, because it's such an original flavor (oh,
and it's spicy!
yay!)
steak.author: Sarah C.
steak.review:
A friend of mine totally hyped this place up to me.  Honestly, it wasn't much better than a lot of other mexican food I've had in SF, however, the bar is pretty high around here and Papalote surely meets it.

The service is a little strange - you have to order your food before they'll put you on the list for a table, and the place is relatively small.  In retrospect, not really the place to go when you're a group of 7 and half of you are 45 minutes late due to cab difficulty.

But, I digress.  The super steak burrito was ginormous and delicious, and the man who took my order was quite friendly for how busy they were.  The horchata was great, and yes - just as everyone says - the salsa is pretty amazing.  Mainly, though, because it's such an original flavor (oh, and it's spicy!  yay!) - I doubt you've had a salsa with chips anything like this.

So, a good place to grab some grub, perhaps on a regular basis if you live in the area.  Not so great for large groups - max it at 4 and you'll be happy indeed.

excerpts: One set had pollo (grilled chicken breast), the other carne asada (grilled steak).
For some reason they don't let you mix and match your meats.
The carne asada was a little chewy but had good flavor -
did I detect lime and garlic?
The chicken on the other hand looked like it was good quality, but it was bland.
steak.author: Kathleen M.
steak.review:
Someone brought Papalote's salsa into my husband's work, and it was so good my husband wanted to seek out the mythical land of milk and honey, or rather, *salsa*, from which it came.

We arrived at Papalote at 2:30 on a Saturday afternoon and were lucky enough to only have to wait 3 minutes for a table. There was a line afterwards. The place is on the small side, and it's unclear if you're supposed to claim your own table or follow the "please wait to be seated" sign. There are pretty dragonfly artworks on the ceiling.

We started with the $1.50 chips and salsa. Unlike other places these aren't bottomless. The amount we were given was just under what we needed, especially given how great the salsa was. (The chips are pretty standard issue.) 

The salsa had a nice roasted flavor and was unlike any other salsa I've ever had. It was a light orange color and looked slightly creamy, though I can't imagine them adding cream to it. (Do they?) It was so good we went back a few hours later for some salsa to take home. For $6.50 you can get a full jar. Even though it's in a jar it's fresh salsa and it'll only last a few days.

We each got a pair of tacos for $4.95. One set had pollo (grilled chicken breast), the other carne asada (grilled steak). For some reason they don't let you mix and match your meats. The carne asada was a little chewy but had good flavor - did I detect lime and garlic? The chicken on the other hand looked like it was good quality, but it was bland. I regretted not paying the extra 99 cents to make it a "super" with guac, sour cream, and cheese. I asked at the counter if I could have the super accoutrements on the side. Initially they balked and wanted me to pay the $2.99 for a whole side of guacamole, but I talked them into giving me just a small side of guac for the 99 cents. Guac makes everything better.

Epilogue: The salsa was just as good at home. Still eating it...

excerpts: The steak portions are thick and meaty as hell with chunky, flavorful slices spread all out the burrito.
Portion wise...
man, it's just right with an even amount of rice beans and all the good stuff that makes a Burrito taste so heavenly!
I walked out feeling satisfied!
Not lazy and bloated like other Burrito joints!
Their orange sauce is great!
I've only had the pleasure of trying one similar in San Jose.
steak.author: Tony R.
steak.review:
Once you try a Burrito from Papalote it's hard to have one anywhere else! I didn't try the "Triple Threat Burrito" yet but the Carne Asada Burrito made me forget about how hard it is to find parking in the City let alone the shortage of seats they have... I'll be happy to stand up and eat it on the sidewalk!

The steak portions are thick and meaty as hell with chunky, flavorful slices spread all out the burrito. Portion wise... man, it's just right with an even amount of rice beans and all the good stuff that makes a Burrito taste so heavenly! I walked out feeling satisfied! Not lazy and bloated like other Burrito joints! Their orange sauce is great! I've only had the pleasure of trying one similar in San Jose. (La Vics) 

Overall, it was a great 1st experience I am willing to try again! (this time the Triple Threat is on my hit list!)

excerpts: I ordered a steak taco and it came out cold and with huge chunks of lettuce and tomatoes on top like a salad.
I was like where is my taco
oh wait
it's under this pile of poorly chopped lettuce that was hurried and thrown on top of my steak taco.
Mind boggling to me is why was there signs of hurrying the lettuce (the easiest part) and my steak is cold?
steak.author: R J.
steak.review:
Papalote, the Spanish word for kite, explains why these folks' culinary style is not well grounded. In fact it is an overly hyped mess. Maybe I had the bad chef or maybe San Franciscans are high as a Papalote when they come here so their memory is in the clouds as to whether it really was so great *staring into distance scratching head* or was it even this place at all *nodding in recollection* maybe it was that other Mexican place you know in the Mission full of gringos you know that one...Freaking Mission you've failed this Tejano again. 

3 reasons that had me saying Mehhhhhhh: 

3) I ordered a steak taco and it came out cold and with huge chunks of lettuce and tomatoes on top like a salad. I was like where is my taco oh wait it's under this pile of poorly chopped lettuce that was hurried and thrown on top of my steak taco. Mind boggling to me is why was there signs of hurrying the lettuce (the easiest part) and my steak is cold?

2) Beans were so runny wet and thin that they could have been mistaken for Montezuma's revenge. Safeway brand tin can beans could put these to shame. 

1) Corn tortilla was store bought and still COLD!! It cracked when I folded it. WTF Come On Man, my 5yr old Mexican niece can throw down a better tortilla on top of her easy bake grill.

Papalote No Gracias Guey.

excerpts: I ordered the steak burrito
and I must say, overall, it was very good.
Fresh ingredients and made with love
I'd give the burrito an overall 8.5 out if 10.
Have I had better?
Probably.
But the burrito was great
and I would highly recommend it, at least so you can say you had the best burrito America has to offer.
steak.author: Edgar D.
steak.review: It's billed as the having the best burrito the the United States, and being a Bay Area native and Mexican food connoisseur, I had to check it out.  I ordered the steak burrito and I must say, overall, it was very good.  Fresh ingredients and made with love I'd give the burrito an overall 8.5 out if 10.  Have I had better?  Probably.  But the burrito was great and I would highly recommend it, at least so you can say you had the best burrito America has to offer.

excerpts: I ordered the Triple Threat which is a burrito filled with grilled shrimp, chicken, steak and also loaded with sour cream, guacamole, rice and black beans, absolutely FANTASTIC!
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
steak.author: Shawn S.
steak.review:
The salsa at this restaurant is DYNAMITE! I could out it on just about anything . I ordered the Triple Threat which is a burrito filled with grilled shrimp, chicken, steak and also loaded with sour cream, guacamole, rice and black beans, absolutely FANTASTIC!
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy. 
 I can't wait to go back :)

excerpts: I went with the steak burrito "super" with an extra salsa.
steak.author: Jeff M.
steak.review: Had never had a mission burrito before coming here and holy cow it was next level. While I still have love for chipotle, 9 times out of 10 I'll head to papalote to get a burrito. I went with the steak burrito "super" with an extra salsa.

excerpts: The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).
Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.
steak.author: Rachel A.
steak.review: I like Papalote a lot because of its convenience, but it is on the expensive side.  I get the "naked burrito", and have had chicken, carne asada, and prawn.  The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).  Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.  I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.  I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.  Everyone who works there is really nice!

excerpts: Then we shared both a prawn and a steak quesadilla.
steak.author: Lesly S.
steak.review:
My husband moved to SF to pave the way for us to live out our California dreams, and when I finally got to town he went out of his way to take me to Papalote. It was across town from our apartment, but he assured me the Zipcar trip was completely justified. This coming from a man who didn't touch Mexican food with a 10-ft pole before we met. Luckily my years of quesadilla indoctrinations worked, and now I love it here as much as he does.

The salsa rocks. I demolished a bowl without really noticing. Then we shared both a prawn and a steak quesadilla. Again, simple, and delicious.

The bathroom... it looks like it would be disgusting thanks to the dark paint ahd the insane asylum looking scrawls on the walls, but its actually quite clean.

excerpts: We're talking good sized chunks of steak (NOT ground beef), good ratio of rice/beans/meat/, and a smoky, flavorful salsa to pour on top.
I'm not a fan of the jicama salad that comes on the side, mostly cause I'm not a fan of jicama, but the burrito does not disappoint!
steak.author: Caroline W.
steak.review: The carne asada burrito definitely lives up to the hype. We're talking good sized chunks of steak (NOT ground beef), good ratio of rice/beans/meat/, and a smoky, flavorful salsa to pour on top. I'm not a fan of the jicama salad that comes on the side, mostly cause I'm not a fan of jicama, but the burrito does not disappoint!

excerpts: my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and
boy do
i feel cheated!
i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that.
the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and
rubbery
but i did like that it tasted grilled.
i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito.
and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy.
steak.author: L M.
steak.review:
i couldnt bring myself to give more than 2 stars. HOW DID THIS PLACE EVER BEAT BOBBY FLAY? like many others, i was interested in trying this place out when i found out that this place beat bobby flay's throwdown. 

my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and boy do i feel cheated! i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that. the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and rubbery but i did like that it tasted grilled. i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito. and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy. i appreciate good carne asada in a burrito but the beef was a bit chewy and too greasy for my taste. (boyfriend agrees with all this by the way)

however, i do like that the chips and salsa came free with the burrito. and i appreciate the cashier for telling me they come with the burrito so i didnt have to pay for an extra one. the salsa was delicious too. if it wasnt for the chips and salsa, i dont think i would even give 2 stars.

excerpts: jam packed w/ flavorful shrimp, chicken, and steak.
It was really good, but I have to question it costing $20!!??
For that price, it should have been GYYY-normous, but wasn't.
(3) I give it up to them for having a mix-breed type of BURRITO: half Filipino/half Mexican.
Was it good?
Sure it was, but I wonder why it appeared "off-menu".
steak.author: Joy A.
steak.review:
THREE reasons why I walked into Papalote:
(1) The SF 7x7 listed their "chips and salsa" as a place to try before you die. Hmmmmm!!???!
(2) According to the Food Network, their "Triple Threat" burrito beat out Bobby Flay's burrito.  Bobby Flay??? Quite impressive!!!  
(3) They serve "Chicken Adobo" burritos. Huh, really???!!!!

How do they measure up???
(1) Chips and salsa- BIG THUMBS UP!!!  I really liked it. I couldn't stop munchin' on them.  The salsa was fresh & chunky, and the orange color reminded me of La Vic's delicious salsa. (Try La Vic's orange sauce; buy the bottle even!)
(2) The "Triple Threat" burrito was jam packed w/ flavorful shrimp, chicken, and steak. It was really good, but I have to question it costing $20!!??  For that price, it should have been GYYY-normous, but wasn't.  
(3) I give it up to them for having a mix-breed type of BURRITO: half Filipino/half Mexican. Was it good? Sure it was, but I wonder why it appeared "off-menu". (I'm glad my girlfriend told me about it.)

TIP for those doing the 7x7 list: Anthony's cookies & Mitchell's Ice Cream are a hop, skip, jump away. =)

excerpts: The 'mexapino' and steak and shrimp!
Both are equally amazing to the point that my roommate and I like to get both and split them because deciding on one is too difficult.
Aside from that, I'm stuck on their sauce which you can purchase by the jar if you love it as much as I do.
Really if you've never been here you need to...
5 stars is not an exaggeration.
steak.author: Michelle D.
steak.review: I LOVE papalote burritos! Have to admit, for the many visits I've had to Papalote's I can't seem to get past the 2 most delicious burritos I have had in my lifetime. The 'mexapino' and steak and shrimp! Both are equally amazing to the point that my roommate and I like to get both and split them because deciding on one is too difficult. Aside from that, I'm stuck on their sauce which you can purchase by the jar if you love it as much as I do. Really if you've never been here you need to... 5 stars is not an exaggeration.

excerpts: Went in ordered a steak burrito and left.
It was mediocre.
The restaurant is actually quite small, and attempting to seat a large group would be difficult.
Nor were the employees very friendly.
steak.author: J K.
steak.review: This review is long overdue. Not sure what all the hype is about over this place. Went in ordered a steak burrito and left. It was mediocre.The restaurant is actually quite small, and attempting to seat a large group would be difficult. Nor were the employees very friendly.

excerpts: The steak was very good, but the rest of the ingredients (Rice, beans, pico, guacamole) were bland by comparison.
I found that I had to load the salsa up on the burrito to compensate for the generic taste.
I'm glad to have tried a new place, but will stick to La Taqueria for a more authentic and flavorful experience.
steak.author: Greg G.
steak.review:
Good - not great - but certainly not "the best".

I ordered the carne asada super burrito and came away full but not completely satisfied.  The steak was very good, but the rest of the ingredients (Rice, beans, pico, guacamole) were bland by comparison.  I found that I had to load the salsa up on the burrito to compensate for the generic taste.  I'm glad to have tried a new place, but will stick to La Taqueria for a more authentic and flavorful experience.

excerpts: I'm an uber carnivore, so I thought the steak would be my favorite, but the shrimp was major yummers!
steak.author: Roselina R.
steak.review:
Had to come here after seeing the restaurant on Throw Down w/ Bobby Flay!

It was crowded, and the wait was a little long, but the food was fab.  Purchased the Triple Threat Burrito and it was good.  I'm an uber carnivore, so I thought the steak would be my favorite, but the shrimp was major yummers!

Love it!

excerpts: It was filled with a good amount of chicken, steak, and shrimp, so I definitely feel like they didn't cheat us out of the good stuff.
Miguel also came by to say hi and dropped off a plate of the adobo burrito filling, which is more down my ally!
OMG, it was so tender and delicious.
I will definitely get the chicken adobo burrito next time.

I liked the triple threat, but I don't wanna fight big pieces to eat my way through the burrito, which makes the adobo one perfect because the chicken is so tender that you don't need a fork and knife to eat it!
steak.author: Diana Lyn Z.
steak.review:
Been wanting to try their triple threat for quite some time now and was able to do so the other night on a spur of the moment decision for dinner.

The boyfriend and I were driving down Potrero and I said, "Hey! Let's try Papalote tonight!" Of course, he agreed.

We got there thinking we'd just grab our burrito to go and cut out, but we were invited to sit and eat inside the restaurant since there were a couple open tables.

We ordered the triple threat burrito and horchata. I was a little taken aback by the price! But, alas, that's what you get for paying for a good burrito. My boyfriend even commended them. He used to work at SF General and tried a bunch of places in The Mission, but said Papalote was the best.

We got our burrito pretty quickly and we split it. Oh! I forgot to mention! The salsa that came with the chips was good! Albeit, spicy for my liking, but still good! Anyway, back to the burrito. It was filled with a good amount of chicken, steak, and shrimp, so I definitely feel like they didn't cheat us out of the good stuff. Miguel also came by to say hi and dropped off a plate of the adobo burrito filling, which is more down my ally! OMG, it was so tender and delicious. Better than most Filipino adobo I have tried!!!

I will definitely get the chicken adobo burrito next time. I liked the triple threat, but I don't wanna fight big pieces to eat my way through the burrito, which makes the adobo one perfect because the chicken is so tender that you don't need a fork and knife to eat it!

Mmm...just thinking about it makes me wanna go back and have one RIGHT NOW!

excerpts: The chicken was not too salty (a frequent problem I've noticed with seasoned chicken), and the steak was simple but awesome.
steak.author: Adam G.
steak.review:
The sibbies were in town and had seen the episode of Throwdown, of course.  I'd been curious to try out the famous burrito also, but knew I wasn't going to spend the $ on it on my own.  Cue Papalote for dinner tonight.  

First off, the place is tiny.  Not in a bad way, but just in the way that you need to know before going there assuming you can just sit down.  Even fewer seats than El Farolito around the corner.  

Foodwise, first we got the chips and salsa.  Off to a great start.  Good chips, tasty and complex salsa.  Nice and spicy, too, but maybe a touch too much for the average person.  Also not impressed they charge for another bowl of corn chips.  Boo for that one.

Next up: the Triple Threat.  Of course that's what we had to try.  It arrives taking up more of a plate than is reasonable for a burrito.  But that's what it should do for $20.  And yes, it did take ~15 minutes to arrive, but that's ok in my book, since it was clear everything was freshly cooked.  Again, not your average burrito.  We had to taste each element independently, and each was fantastic on its own.  The shrimp were nicely spiced and well cooked.  The chicken was not too salty (a frequent problem I've noticed with seasoned chicken), and the steak was simple but awesome.  Guacamole was also very good, as were the refried beans.

So on the whole, we enjoyed the food, were astounded at the size of the portion, and would likely come back again.  We would likely not be getting the Triple Threat, though...especially not for $20.  Carne Asada burritos, on the other hand....

excerpts: I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.
steak.author: Amy N.
steak.review:
I ordered the Adobo burrito (off menu). It's mildly-spiced chicken, rice, and tomatoes (no beans). I was expecting something more vinegar-y, more reminiscent of Filipino food, but it was just OK. I wanted the flavor to be more pronounced.

The mole burrito was pretty tasty, but somehow I thought it would taste stronger. It wasn't bland, just milder than I expected.

The salsa was excellent, though.

I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.

One day I'll return to try their fish burrito. Sauteed in white wine and butter? In a burrito? I am skeptical as to the taste (white wine flavor in a burrito?) but intrigued.

excerpts: I had a steak and shrimp burrito today.
steak.author: Mario W.
steak.review: This place does NOT have the best burritos in SF at all. I had a steak and shrimp burrito today. The rice was undercooked and hard....and the carne asada was not chopped very well. Big hunks of meat like a fajita. Meats should be chopped more finely....I wanted extra salsa for my chips and they charge u extra ? I actually have to pay the waiter at our table and do a seperate transaction for salsa ??? Doesn't that sound ridiculous to you ? I take my burritos very seriously...the burrito wasn't horrible, but not by any means the best in sf. I will not give into the hype.

excerpts: You basically get a steak in your burrito.
Amazing salsa.
steak.author: Quags M.
steak.review:
Best Carne Asada in the Mission.  You basically get a steak in your burrito.  Amazing salsa.  Really high quality, fresh ingredients.

I think just loses out to Pancho Villa for best burrito in the Mission, but it's really close.  You can't go wrong here.

excerpts: The steak was reallly good, but a little large (pieces).
Lack of guac is what kept me from giving them 5 stars, i need to ask for extra.
ALso it seemed a little light on the sour cream.
but overall a MUST TRY.
steak.author: Shawn A.
steak.review:
This place was pretty delicious.  The Salsa alone is amazing, something really tasty.  But beware, it is diff than traditional salsa in my opinion.  

The burritos were reallly good, perfect size and they had a nice toasted crunch to them.  The steak was reallly good, but a little large (pieces).  Lack of guac is what kept me from giving them 5 stars, i need to ask for extra.  ALso it seemed a little light on the sour cream.  but overall a MUST TRY.

excerpts: $16 dollars for 2 steak
tacos?????I think absolutely not.
I could of gotten 2 huge burritos.
Nothing even remotely spectacular about this place.
Ive definitely had better right up the street.
I am a SF native.
You can't fool me.
It was a regular taco.
The Food Network did me dirty on this one.
steak.author: Sophie P.
steak.review: $16 dollars for 2 steak tacos?????I think absolutely not. I could of gotten 2 huge burritos. Nothing even remotely spectacular about this place. Ive definitely had better right up the street. I am a SF native. You can't fool me. It was a regular taco. The Food Network did me dirty on this one.

excerpts: A massive MexAm masterpiece with carne asada steak, chicken and jumbo prawns.
steak.author: Francisco H S.
steak.review:
The wife and I went here after watching Throwdown With Bobby Flay. Delighted to find that it was a cute, cozy place and not at all pretentious. All food was moderately priced, but extraordinarily delicious. I had the triple threat burrito -- had to after the feature on TV. A massive MexAm masterpiece with carne asada steak, chicken and jumbo prawns. 

The best part is their secret Papalote salsa. It was all in the triple threat. But, I was surprised to see them selling it by the jar. YOU MUST BUY YOURSELF A JAR BEFORE LEAVING THIS PLACE. You will scoff at other salsas once you try it.

excerpts: The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices.
