There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect.
steak.author: Langdon N.
steak.review:
Bobby Flay lost for a reason!

I came here to eat lunch today after hearing that Bobby Flay had lost a "Throwdown" here. The Triple Threat Burrito was the challenge, and boy was it also a challenge to finish. 

First off, the free chips as an appetizer are delicious! I don't know what's so different about them but they have a natural crunch to them that make them irresistible to turn away. Also, the salsa served with the chips is probably as close to perfect salsa I have ever tasted in my life. The salsa is sweet, yet not too sweet, and spicy enough to have a kick in it but not too much where you can only eat a bit. There's also none of that burnt pepper taste in it. 

I also split an order of fish tacos with my brother. The fish tacos were a lot bigger than other taquerias I've been to and they are extremely hot (temperature wise) when they come out. The fish tacos were recommended to us by the staff as their best tacos, and they were correct!

Now on to the Triple Threat Burrito. This burrito is definitely not for the faint at heart. The sheer size of the burrito is comparable to other taquerias as maybe 1.2 to 1.5 times larger. They also recommend that the burrito be shared by two or more people, which I recommend as well. The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices. There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect. The only downside to the burrito was the price, for $20 I could get 4 burritos at other taquerias, but I had to try this burrito at least once. 

On another note, this place is probably the closest thing to a temple for those with hangovers!

excerpts: To me, it tasted like the grilled steak stuffed burrito from taco bell only with quality ingredients (which is good but boring).
I much prefer La Taqueria for a much more balanced and flavorful burrito.
steak.author: Blake E.
steak.review: I had the Carne Asada Burrito. The meat was really good but unfortunately it was the predominant flavor. To me, it tasted like the grilled steak stuffed burrito from taco bell only with quality ingredients (which is good but boring). I much prefer La Taqueria for a much more balanced and flavorful burrito.

excerpts: Steak burrito
= perfect consistency, slightly grilled, amazing.
steak.author: May A.
steak.review: I've been coming to Papalote for years because it is so consistent and delicious.  We ate there today...and it was not consistent this time because it was EVEN MORE DELICIOUS than usual.  Steak burrito = perfect consistency, slightly grilled, amazing.  Chicken tacos = fresh, crunchy, bright avocado.  And don't get me started on the salsa - I could eat it as soup.

excerpts: I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
steak.author: Mark Y.
steak.review:
When I want a real gourmet sit down burrito in a colorful place with Mexican bug kites on the ceiling, I'll put up with circling around a few times in the Mission to find parking when I come here. I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
 
The fresh and not too salty chipotle salsa, whole wheat tortilla options and ginger soft drinks are also a nice touch.

My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.

excerpts: It's 89% black beans, 10% steak, and 1% salsa.
steak.author: L B.
steak.review:
Their veggie burritos are good, but...

1. Don't get carne asada with no rice. It's 89% black beans, 10% steak, and 1% salsa.  Bleh.

2. The "Mkt Price" for a side of guac was $3.25 for about two tablespoons. That's insane.

excerpts: The steak in the quesadilla (a little on the small side) was done extremely well.
Typically, strips of steak tend to get overcooked and tough but these folks did it right with every piece.
steak.author: Gabriel R.
steak.review:
This is my first experience here and this is how it went:

Short wait in the cold. No problem though as it reminded me of home. Read the easy menu and went for it. A Chile Verde burrito and a Carne Asada quesadilla. The pork in the burrito was incredible! Seriously, not like shredded chicken at other places in town, but big tasty moist pieces that were fantastic for a $5 meal. The steak in the quesadilla (a little on the small side) was done extremely well. Typically, strips of steak tend to get overcooked and tough but these folks did it right with every piece. 

The salsa that was brought to the table was different. Incredibly tasty and just enough spice. I had never had anything like it and would buy the stuff by the jar...better yet, by the case! 

Can't wait to go back again.

excerpts:
We got 2 orders of tacos with chicken and steak:

Extremely dry overcooked chewy meat ( yuck )
I ate steak ( which was also very dry ) and beans, since I was very hungry and we already dropped $$ on the beer.
steak.author: farid a.
steak.review:
Dont buy into the hype. This place is straight up disgusting.. 

We got 2 orders of tacos with chicken and steak:

Extremely dry overcooked chewy meat ( yuck )
Tacos basically come with lettuce and tomatoes, whats mexican about that? Sounds more like Mexican McDonalds. Lettuce was wilted and wet. Tomatoes smelled like they were sitting for a couple of days in a half cool fridge..
 Ordered a side of beans, waited for about 10 min while tacos got cold. On top of that they put some watery red crap on the plate, which made tacos soggy and looking red ( double yuck !! )

I ate steak ( which was also very dry ) and beans, since I was very hungry and we already dropped $$ on the beer.

If you want good mexican food go to either Regalito, Napolito or Chilango.

 Papalote is putrid..

excerpts:
I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  
On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  
I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.
steak.author: Cory C.
steak.review:
So looking through the reviews for this restaurant, I do realize that the food is ok, and most of the time the service is good.

I called papolote to order some food for my boyfriend and I.  I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

We walked on down to the store a few minutes later to pick up the order.

"Hi, Im just here to pick up an Order for Cory"
"Oh Yes" she replies...
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

She begins to tell me that she didnt hear me on the phone say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

I was extremely confused.  Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  She was extremely rude and unappologetic, all the while rolling her eyes and talking to me like i was the iddiot.  

I work in the service industry, and if the order comes out wrong, whether or not it was the customers fault, you get them a new order no questions asked.  

I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

She turned to the woman working the other register and said something to her in Spanish, and the woman looked at her and said... JUST VOID IT.

I dont care about the price, it was all about principal.  ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

Over all a bad experience.  Maybe the woman was having a bad day, but for some reason i got the impression that she always acts like that.

THe food wasnt that great.  Ive had better from El Farolito down the street on Mission and 24th.

Watch out for the woman who works the register and doesnt wear a uniform.  Shes Crazy!

excerpts: The steak was cooked just perfect.
Very fresh tasty and good portion size.
As plenty of other reviewers mentioned the salsa is fantastic.
Will be back.
steak.author: Sara G.
steak.review: Recommended by two people in the span of 2 days so I had to check it out while in town.   Loved the carne asada tacos.   The steak was cooked just perfect.   Very fresh tasty and good portion size.   As plenty of other reviewers mentioned the salsa is fantastic.  Will be back.

excerpts: I was telling him about the Triple Threat Burrito and how there's steak, chicken and shrimp inside
and he said "What are you waiting for, let's go!
We pulled up, got a parking spot right in front and walked in knowing exactly what we wanted.
Ordered the $20!
burrito and took our seats.
We got our burrito and started to chow down.
Every bite say "Ohhh - Ahhh - Yummm
- This is the best salsa - Yumm...
" this went on for about 15 minutes and then we both were stuffed.
Couldn't take one more bite.
I think the best part on the burrito was the chicken, nice big chunks and very good seasoning.
I'm not much of a red meat eater
so I actually picked out some of the steak
but that doesn't mean it was good.
steak.author: Katie J.
steak.review:
We both we were starving when we got to the city on Sunday so I went onto my Yelp! application on my iPhone, then to my bookmarks, sorted them to 'Distance from Me' and Papalote came up as the closet (so did Humphry's but that's another review.) I was telling him about the Triple Threat Burrito and how there's steak, chicken and shrimp inside and he said "What are you waiting for, let's go!" We pulled up, got a parking spot right in front and walked in knowing exactly what we wanted. Ordered the $20! burrito and took our seats. We got our burrito and started to chow down. Every bite say "Ohhh - Ahhh - Yummm - This is the best salsa - Yumm..." this went on for about 15 minutes and then we both were stuffed. Couldn't take one more bite. I think the best part on the burrito was the chicken, nice big chunks and very good seasoning. I'm not much of a red meat eater so I actually picked out some of the steak but that doesn't mean it was good. And the shrimps were big! 

We both agreed that this was the best burrito we have ever eaten but for $20 it better be.

excerpts: The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin...
3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.
steak.author: Avery G.
steak.review:
After hearing so many good things from friends, colleagues and even sources like Chow Magazine, I was excited to give Papalote a shot when my co-workers decided to head there for lunch. Finally, I would have a chance to sample their "practically-orgasmic" salsa!

Papalote is a taqueria with partial table service. You order your food at the counter, grab a drink, pay your way, take a number and head over to a table in the side room and eagerly await the server with your taco, burrito, quesadilla or other standard taqueria fare... which is exactly what I did. 

The chips (still warm) and salsa were brought almost immediately - and for all intents and purposes, they were the highlight of the meal. The rich orange salsa was spicy, sweet and had a complexity of flavor not commonly found in the condiment. The texture was smooth with black flecks - possibly from black pepper or from the skin of roasted pumpkin or peppers (yep - the secret ingredient, I have been told, is pumpkin seeds). This salsa's only competition for #1 in San Francisco is by Orale Orale.

The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin... and though I didn't sample it, the meat certainly looked good: appropriately charred and tender.

The pork Chile Verde was also quite good, with distinct flavors of tomatillo, cilantro and citrus in the sauce. Unfortunately, this filling, when combined with refried beans, cheese, rice and guacamole and wrapped in a tortilla, didn't meld into that cheesy-goopy goodness that makes an excellent burrito. It was good, but not great. Certainly not on par with Victor's or Mexico au Parc - which just goes to show you: even if every component of a dish is excellent, sometimes it doesn't come together properly to make something amazing. This time, the components were better than the sum of its parts.

$8.89 for a super burrito, chips, salsa and a bottle of grapefruit soda. 3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.

excerpts: steak cooked to order at least, otherwise not my style.
as a side note, the salsa with the chips was very nice and hearty.
steak.author: Rob C.
steak.review:
2.5 like a fancy chipotle in taste.  quintessential sf.  look at the menu.  vegan soyrizo, marinated tofu, etc.  no carnitas, al pastor, etc.
took away 2 carne asada tacos here, $7 topped with guac. and all the americanized toppings.  steak cooked to order at least, otherwise not my style.  as a side note, the salsa with the chips was very nice and hearty.

excerpts: Steak burrito, black beans, grilled mushrooms.
steak.author: Rusty S.
steak.review:
Upscale, yuppy burritos.  But totally worth it.  And the fire-roasted salsa is awesome.   I've gone here many times just for the salsa.

Recommended selection: Steak burrito, black beans, grilled mushrooms.  The mushrooms are a little extra, but worth every penny.

Only downside is that it's so popular that it's often difficult to find seating.  But I still love my 'lote.

excerpts: Grilled chicken and grilled steak are both fabulous.
The best salsa ever.
I love going here.
The burritos are big-
so I usually save half.
The second half is still good hours later.
They serve beer too.
steak.author: Madhuri K.
steak.review: My favorite burrito place in San Francisco.  Grilled chicken and grilled steak are both fabulous.  The best salsa ever.  I love going here.  The burritos are big- so I usually save half.  The second half is still good hours later.   They serve beer too.

excerpts: Carne Asada burrito was tasty, and the steak was not at all fatty or gristly, which is rare and fantastic, but the small quantity of meat in the burrito was entirely overwhelmed by the comparatively large quantities of beans & rice.
This was very disappointing.
The salsa (of which I think they only have one kind) is fantastic though.
Horchata was pretty good.
Nicely toasted tortilla on the burrito.
They also have a couple beers on tap.
On a second visit, the steak quantity was larger, but the arrangement of ingredients was very poor, with the top half all rice, and the bottom half all beans, and little salsa to be found.
steak.author: Don H.
steak.review:
Carne Asada burrito was tasty, and the steak was not at all fatty or gristly, which is rare and fantastic, but the small quantity of meat in the burrito was entirely overwhelmed by the comparatively large quantities of beans & rice. This was very disappointing. The salsa (of which I think they only have one kind) is fantastic though. Horchata was pretty good. Nicely toasted tortilla on the burrito. They also have a couple beers on tap.
On a second visit, the steak quantity was larger, but the arrangement of ingredients was very poor, with the top half all rice, and the bottom half all beans, and little salsa to be found.

excerpts: My friend turned me into a burrito explorer after introducing me to the steak burrito here, and I was impressed that the meat remained juicy.
I had to do a double take to make sure the food was consistent before I wrote a review, and the steak burrito nailed the flavors again and again.
steak.author: Cathy H.
steak.review:
The salsa rocks my socks off!

My friend turned me into a burrito explorer after introducing me to the steak burrito here, and I was impressed that the meat remained juicy. I had to do a double take to make sure the food was consistent before I wrote a review, and the steak burrito nailed the flavors again and again.

I kept raving about the wonderful kick in the tasty salsa, and my friend brings over this hilarious and informative Chow article written by Helena Echlin: http://www.chow.com/stories/10111. Max La Rivire-Hedrick reverse engineers the recipe. All the other ingredients  are likely, besides the secret controversial ingredient of pumpkin seeds. The author probably put out this one ingredient to lead people to believe that is the closest they could come to the Papalote's salsa: http://www.chow.com/recipes/10646. I think the author actually knows better and did not publish the true last ingredient. It is a conspiracy, I say!

So I brought my food connoisseur friend to challenge her to deconstruct the recipe from scratch. She thought that there was some cream for the thick texture. But online comments adamantly state the salsa is all vegan. Well process of elimination helps our cause, one major food group down, more to explore! We are on a mission to figure out the REAL recipe. 

Until then, I will have to savor every drop of the legendary salsa in the first tiny vat that comes with the meal. I feel robbed to have to pay an additional $0.50 for another tiny vat of salsa. Definitely taints the true burrito experience. But I won't dock stars because of that...

excerpts: Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak.
It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart.
After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts
steak.author: Andrew Y.
steak.review:
I had high hopes for this place because it was a mexcian place in the Mission. Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak. It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart. After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts but I didn't think that all came together. 

I was told that this place was more of a vegetarian place. I'm willing to try this place again, but we'll see the end result next time. For now, 3 stars. 

Oh, we also had nachos, they were pretty good. I liked the cheese.

excerpts: Get that 12-hour marinated piece of steak out of that vat of flavor goodness and cook it up.
steak.author: Thadd L.
steak.review:
Not the best buritto in the Mission bust most likely the freshest.  All of the meat is raw when you order it.

You want chicken?

They get out a big piece of chicken breast and thow it on the grill.

Carne Asada?

Get that 12-hour marinated piece of steak out of that vat of flavor goodness and cook it up.

ect. ect.

The roasted salsa is great as everyone else has said.  There are more hipsters here becuase the food isn't as greasy.  In fact I think that I would call this place a "california" burrito place.  I know that sounds lame but, sometimes you want something that doesn't bomb your stomach like an El Farolito burrito.
Know what I mean?

excerpts: It came with two good-sized pieces of steak that were grilled to order.
They were, in my opinion somewhat dry due to overcooking but were admittedly tasty.
They were accentuated by the guacamole that came with my lunch companion's super burrito that he did not want.
steak.author: Kimberly Q.
steak.review:
There are a ton of reviews that I don't need to rehash.  You walk in and, though the counter service is friendly, you should know pretty quickly what you want to order, as there is usually a line of hungry people behind you.  

There are many yummy filling options, e.g. carne asada, chile verde, pescado, vegetarian, gambas, etc., that you can apply towards burritos, tacos and quesadillas.  You can also order entrees that come on a plate and are accompanied by rice, beans and tortillas.  Today I had the carne asada entree plate for lunch.  It came with two good-sized pieces of steak that were grilled to order.  They were, in my opinion somewhat dry due to overcooking but were admittedly tasty.  They were accentuated by the guacamole that came with my lunch companion's super burrito that he did not want.  And said lunch companion was gleefully happy with his chile verde super burrito, which he said was one of the best burritos he'd ever had, due to the tasty and tender pork concoction that I regretably forewent.  

The place was pretty clean and comfy.  I'd come back, but I did not leave the place dreaming of my next venture in.

excerpts: Small enough that it's not a steak with a tortilla blanket.
steak.author: Rhiannon C.
steak.review:
I'm a little bit of a Carne Asada snob. It's got to be juicy. Seared. Flavorful. Big enough pieces to taste it separately. Small enough that it's not a steak with a tortilla blanket. A little salty. 

Papalote delivers.

Their burritos are big and tasty, all of the ingredients are fresh and flavorful, their tortillas are just the right kind of crispy-soft, and they're not too full of rice.

I've now gone there twice, and it's for the best that it's just a few too many blocks out of my way, or else They'd know my name and I'd have a special seat by the window.

My gripes: 
-I know, I know, everyone wants their damned coke-in-a-bottle when they get their taqueria on, but I really love a good fountain coke with a burrito, because of all the sweet-fizzy with the salt.
-Not enough chips. For delicious, fresh, hot chips, there are simply not enough of them, *especially* with that salsa, that's too hot for me, but too tasty for me not to eat.
-Bathroom location. Sometimes, it stinks up the whole place. And if it's full, Murphy's law dictates you will be stuck in that seat right by the bathroom with the double punch of having to smell it every time the door's open AND having to move so people can walk by. I'd rather walk through the kitchen.

excerpts: i had shrimp and steak burritos on different days and it was really bad.
how could you not know how to wrap a burrito???
i wouldn't go back.
service was good though.
steak.author: emukka y.
steak.review:
food was tastless. i had shrimp and steak burritos on different days and it was really bad. how could you not know how to wrap a burrito??? i wouldn't go back.
   service was good though.

excerpts: I always get their steak burrito with cheese.
Veyy  scrumptious.
And those radishes and melons along the side? not just for show.
They actually cool my mouth down a bit after the salsa.
Though not my thing, I was happily surprised to see how much they had for vegans.
steak.author: Sascha B.
steak.review:
I love this place.  I know it isn't really authenntic but itt s so satisfing.  The salsa is pretty addictive.  I always get their steak burrito with cheese.  Veyy  scrumptious.  And those radishes and melons along the side? not just for show.  They actually cool my mouth down a bit after the salsa.  Though not my thing, I was happily surprised to see how much they had for vegans.  Also they place may be trendy but the staff seem pretty cool. 

I have not gotten big crowds, since I have come close to opening time.   After the second time they seemed to know my order.  And I said no drink but they gave me a little water annyway.  Much much needed as the salsa has a kick.:)  A person in a wheelchair can get in but it is a bit cramped, so be aware. (I have eavesdropped on many interesting conversations, lol.)  Also I tend not to linger here as by the time I leave there are people waitng.

excerpts: I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly
they are-
but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito.
However, the prices are a bit steep
steak.author: Grace S.
steak.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: Something about blending chicken, shrimp, and steak into one concoction did it for me.
steak.author: Bijon R.
steak.review: I ate here a few months ago. Of course I had to order their 20 dollar burrito. A bit expensive but well worth it! Something about blending chicken, shrimp, and steak into one concoction did it for me.

excerpts: We just got the steak burrito.
If you don't "super" it you miss out on guac, sour cream and something else.
The line was kind of ridiculous for this food item
and it's because they are so slow there.
While the food was decent, I wouldn't come back to wait in line.
The steak buritto was slightly above Chipolte to me and a little more costly.
Too many beans as filler and they weren't that tasty/flavorful either.
I would only come back if the line was shorter and the services was faster.
It also seemed very loud in the dining area.
steak.author: reviewer m.
steak.review: Another over advertised/hyped place. We just got the steak burrito. If you don't "super" it you miss out on guac, sour cream and something else. The line was kind of ridiculous for this food item and it's because they are so slow there.  While the food was decent, I wouldn't come back to wait in line.  The steak buritto was slightly above Chipolte to me and a little more costly.  Too many beans as filler and they weren't that tasty/flavorful either.  I would only come back if the line was shorter and the services was faster.  It also seemed very loud in the dining area.

excerpts: We had the "cooked to order" grilled steak burritto and "cooked to order" grilled chicken tacos.
Both were fresh and the meats were tender and juicy.
The spot is small, when you walk in, you place your order and seat yourself in the small seating area...
other than that, yumo!!
Also, it is near bart which is a plus in my book!
steak.author: Amy C.
steak.review: This was a yummy mexican grill. We had the "cooked to order" grilled steak burritto and "cooked to order" grilled chicken tacos.  Both were fresh and the meats were tender and juicy.  The spot is small, when you walk in, you place your order and seat yourself in the small seating area... other than that, yumo!! Also, it is near bart which is a plus in my book!

excerpts:
my GF ordered steak nachos: 
the plate came and you could see the steam coming off the carne asada.
its a flank cut, marinated and seasoned to perfection.
she's a bit particular when it comes to taquerias, so to impress her
was a big win.
the plate was fresh, hot, and all ingredients were very tasty.
steak.author: Ruben G.
steak.review:
*yeah, we fed into the hype and swung by to see what the hoopla was all about....... 
 
i used to live in the city. i have my good-n-trusty taquerias that I MUST have whenever i'm up in SF - Pancho Villa, Cancun, El Farolito, but i never cared to break in another spot and be disappointed that i wasted my time when i coulda had a great burrito.

yes, parking is tough in the mission.  that's nothing new, so be prepared to circle the block.

ordering was a breeze.  Getting a table looked like it was going to be tough, but were actually seated pretty quickly. they bring you chips and their homemade salsa to nosh on while you wait.  the salsa is very very good - unlike the red/green salsas you see everywhere else, this salsa was rich, smokey, and very very flavoful (for those from SJ, think La Victoria salsa, but less creamy, and the raw ingredients dont get lost in the whip)

The meats are grilled FRESH.  not pre-grilled, chopped, and thrown in a tin in advance.  and cuz of this - and the size of this place (small), getting your order will take a while.  this is what separates it from other taquerias (or is it a grill?), that they do this as you order, unlike other places that take less than 5 mins to throw your ingredients in a tortilla, wrap it, and get it to your hands/table.  so be prepared to wait about 15- 20 mins (this was when it was very busy, probably less when its not)

my GF ordered steak nachos: 
the plate came and you could see the steam coming off the carne asada.  its a flank cut, marinated and seasoned to perfection.  she's a bit particular when it comes to taquerias, so to impress her was a big win.  the plate was fresh, hot, and all ingredients were very tasty.  refried black beans, ftw!

i had the chicken burrito + cheese & guacamole: 
not your run-of-mill burrito.  great size, its not HUGE, nor is it wimpy either.  the chicken is marinated very nicely; smokey & spicy, and it doesnt over power everything else.  refried blackbeans were nice consistency, not runny at all.  the salsa is awesome and the rice was nice and steamed, not al dente, or mushy.

the service is great.  one of the owners made sure the dining area was in check and that you were attended in adequate time.  kudos.

excerpts: The black refried beans and the jicama pico goes great with the with the thin cut steak.
Also have to recommend the Machaca when you're feeling a bit partied-out the morning after.
A bit hard to get into sometimes, but the staff is always on the ball getting tables ready.
steak.author: Chris R.
steak.review: Another one of my frequent haunts. I started out with the Fish Tacos, but haven't been able to order anything other than the Carne Asada entree lately. The black refried beans and the jicama pico goes great with the with the thin cut steak. Also have to recommend the Machaca when you're feeling a bit partied-out the morning after. A bit hard to get into sometimes, but the staff is always on the ball getting tables ready.

excerpts: I intrepidly peel back the foil and take a bite of the burrito, and my worst fears are realized: hot, flavorful, juicy steak.
steak.author: Jeff S.
steak.review:
I wanted to not like it, I really did. I heard about the elitist attitude the people who work here have. I walk by every day and see the ridiculously long lines and tons of people ALWAYS waiting, but in my quest to find the best burrito spot in the mission I had to try it. When I walked by and the front door wasn't overflowing with hungry San Franciscans I knew it was now or never. I ordered a Carne Asada Super Burrito. "Do you mind waiting 20 minutes?" she asks. What? For a burrito?! But they are supposed to be good... "Uhm, OK..." So I walked around the corner to my house and waited patiently for the 20 minutes to pass then went back, waited five minutes more, and headed home. I tried a chip on the way (the best tell tale sign of a good burrito spot!) and... god damn it. Fresh, crunchy, delicious. I get home and open up the fancy little salsa tub... oh no! It's delicious too. I intrepidly peel back the foil and take a bite of the burrito, and my worst fears are realized: hot, flavorful, juicy steak. Wonderfully grilled tortilla... tasty rice and beans. Its good... its really good. 

I don't think the attitude or ridiculously long wait time was excusable, but these people have a hot commodity on their hands and everybody wants some. I noticed a lot of people had called in their orders and didn't have to wait at all, which would be perfect for, oh I dunno, someone whos back door is about 40 yards away from Papalote? I'll be back. God damn it... I'll be back...

excerpts: though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos.
my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
steak.author: beth l.
steak.review: this is no ordinary taqueria. SUPER amazing chips and salsa (not your typical chunky salsa, though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

excerpts: it came loaded with avocado and the best flank steak ever!
that salsa is amazing too!
steak.author: Kimberly S.
steak.review: thus far, my favorite burrito place in the city (maybe even the world!!). i had it  in february 2008 and it was amazing.. went back a few days ago and it was still amazing. i got the carne asada super burrito... it came loaded with avocado and the best flank steak ever! that salsa is amazing too! two beers, two super burritos, and chips and salsa came out to $23.

excerpts: It's hard to stray from the fish tacos, but I also enjoy the steak entree.
Lots of good memories.
steak.author: Roxanne L.
steak.review: I heart papalote! I used to live right around the corner and would dine on the fish tacos regularly. Their salsa is out of control good! And the sell it separately. Great gift. It's hard to stray from the fish tacos, but I also enjoy the steak entree. Lots of good memories.

excerpts: the carne asada is large, hearty chunks of steak and you won't regret super-ing it.
steak.author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.
steak.review:
1st stop on my day of eating in the mission...

tasty tasty tacos! 2 per order. the corn tortillas are big for... well corn tortillas.  the carne asada is large, hearty chunks of steak and you won't regret super-ing it.

the salsa is so good, calling it salsa doesn't do it justice. 

my new favorite taco place. and it doesn't make me feel too unhealthy though it's drowned in sour cream, guac, and cheese.

excerpts: I've also tried their steak and chicken options and I'm subtracting a star for just a little something missing....
not sure what it is....
but I find their food lacks that extra flavor that makes it "out of this world.
And the fact that they cheap you on the salsa.
A shot-glass of salsa for multiple people and a $1 for a refill does NOT suffice.
steak.author: Kerry D.
steak.review: Definitely one of my top 3 favorite burrito joints.  I enjoy the vegetarian options (tofu, soyrizo, mixed veggies) and I do find myself craving their salsa.  I've also tried their steak and chicken options and I'm subtracting a star for just a little something missing....not sure what it is....but I find their food lacks that extra flavor that makes it "out of this world."   And the fact that they cheap you on the salsa.  A shot-glass of salsa for multiple people and a $1 for a refill does NOT suffice.

excerpts: steak - Papalote's was juicy and flavorful and way more than just a vehicle for protein.
Yum.
Another visit is indicated for further research, clearly.
steak.author: Jess L.
steak.review: Everyone talks about the salsa, and it was indeed awesome.  But I have to stay, the carne asada in my burrito was absolutely sublime.  Maybe I hit them on a particularly good day, I dunno.  But I'm used to burrito joints having dry, marginally flavorless steak - Papalote's was juicy and flavorful and way more than just a vehicle for protein.  Yum.  Another visit is indicated for further research, clearly.

excerpts: The steak and prawn burrito will go down as one of my favorite burritos in the history of me eating burritos.
They've also got a great selection of beverages.
steak.author: Kevin L.
steak.review: The sun-dried tomato salsa they make is fantastic. The steak and prawn burrito will go down as one of my favorite burritos in the history of me eating burritos. They've also got a great selection of beverages.

excerpts: it was enjoyable and the steak was great.
their salsa is quite unique.
normally, i look for chunks and LOTS of spice in my salsa
steak.author: Kayla K.
steak.review:
i like it... it doesn't necessarily give off that "authentic" mexican food/taqueria vibe... in fact it doesn't at all, but it does serve up some good food. and they are conscious of vegetarian needs. 

i'm not a vegetarian, though, so i ordered the carne asada burrito with black beans. it was enjoyable and the steak was great. their salsa is quite unique. normally, i look for chunks and LOTS of spice in my salsa [i have still yet to find a winning salsa that meets those requirements in this city, if you have any tips, please let me know] and it met neither of these expectations but still managed to get my attention.

i would go back.

excerpts: but I LOVE the nachos there, especially with grilled steak.
steak.author: Jacob D.
steak.review:
My favourite Mexican restaurant bar none. A whole other class to every other burrito place in the Mission - fresh fresh vegetables, really great grilled meat, and the best salsa on the planet.

The burritos are excellent, although maybe a little dry if you don't get them made with cheese & sour cream, which I always do... It may be a crime against Mexican cuisine and deeply inauthentic but I LOVE the nachos there, especially with grilled steak. Dear lord I think I may have to go there right now and get some.

Downsides - noisy as hell but what do you expect in a Mexican restaurant that's about the size of your bathroom? It's always busy, but I've always been able to find a table when I needed to. OK, the lines out the door can be a bit of a pain and the kitchen staff seem overstretched, but that's popularity for you...

excerpts: nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn.
what!), food with integrity.
steak.author: mark c.
steak.review:
frreeessssshhhhh. thats the version here. remixed with health conscious ingredients. no LARD. vegan friendly. 

nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn. what!), food with integrity. fresh fresas and horchata made daily.

the salsa. if you know, then i need not go any further.
if you dont, well, thats your fault. 

soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla. 
i mean c'mon, can you say that about another burrito joint? 

the staff is friendly, fast, and efficient.

party flyers, community events, and awards plaster the walls and counter, i mean does your burrito joint have a write up in the 
WALL ST JOURNAL? 
didnt think so.

but hey, dont take my word for it. peep game yo.
you wont be sad, unless the grease, lard, and oil is your thing.

excerpts: For some reason the steak always tastes like its burnt and like they've been grilling the meat over a super charred surface.
However, I do like that they offer different types of tortillas (wheat, spinach,tomatoe,
steak.author: fancy-schmancy S.
steak.review:
For some reason the steak always tastes like its burnt and like they've been grilling the meat over a super charred surface. However, I do like that they offer different types of tortillas (wheat, spinach,tomatoe,etc),which definitely helps the diet.

Not the best burrito place in the area,but what gives them an edge is that they offer different types of burritos to satisfy everyones taste buds.

excerpts: The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good.
steak.author: Willy c.
steak.review: This place is pretty damn good.  The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good. The shrimp isn't as good as La Corneta, but this is a great place for burrito diversity if you're sick of the same old ricy overstuff in the mission. It 's also nice when you don't feel like falling into the mexi-coma before you even get home  (aka reasonable portions)...

excerpts: The popular $20 burrito, chicken dilla, and steak nacho.
I loved all of them!
Most especially the fresh grilled steaks and the smokiness and flavors of it.
Then lets not forget that special sauce...excellent and different!
This place is so close to my work...
so Papalote...
you shall see me again!
steak.author: Dimps I.
steak.review: The lovely cuzzins treated us out here over the weekend after spending the afternoon exploring the De Young museum.  They've been wanting to try this place out after many recommendations by close friends who are what you would call "the usual customers".  Not to mention that they reminded me that this was the place that beat Bobby Flay for the ultimate burrito throw down.  The place was packed when we arrived but never the less we got seated after we ordered and paid at the counter.  They had a variety of beers so each of the 4 of us decided to get a taste of different ones.  Good selections! The owner Manuel was very friendly, chatted and joked with us as if he had known us before.  This was our first time here.  Now the food...we ordered a little of everything but the taco.  The popular $20 burrito, chicken dilla, and steak nacho.  I loved all of them!  Most especially the fresh grilled steaks and the smokiness and flavors of it.  Then lets not forget that special sauce...excellent and different!  This place is so close to my work...so Papalote...you shall see me again!

excerpts: Yes, a triple threat is $20.00, but like what has been written about here before,they are the same size as the steak burrito.
I will never order the triple threat again.
It is really a rip.
It tasted good, but not worth the price.
steak.author: C. W.
steak.review: A friend and I made the mistake of going to Papalotes the day after the throwdown with Bobby Flay. There were only 2 or 3 people ahead of us. We arrived at 2:00pm. I place our order to go(by now there was a line of about 25 people behind us): 2 triple threats and a shrimp burrito. I really hadn't looked at the prices, but when the cashier ran up the total to 42.00 I about had a heart attack. I paid it. Then we waited, and waited and waited and waited some more. Finally got our order. It was now 3:00. We had an appointment, so I did not check our order. Enroute to the appointment my friend ate his "shrimp burrito"-oops, in checking the order we in fact got 2 carne asada burritos and one triple threat. Don't know how our original order translated to this...but to be fair we checked the reciept and we paid for what we got. We just did not get what I asked for. Yes, a triple threat is $20.00, but like what has been written about here before,they are the same size as the steak burrito. I will never order the triple threat again. It is really a rip. It tasted good, but not worth the price.

excerpts: Go for the steak super burrito - you will be converted.
Gotta love that house sauce!
steak.author: Eric O.
steak.review: Best in the Mission, hands down. Go for the steak super burrito - you will be converted. Gotta love that house sauce!

excerpts: We ordered a chicken burrito supreme and carne Asad's quesadilla.
When I got home, my burrito was supposed to have sour cream and guacamole and unfortunately all those things were missing.
The flavors were still good, but it was really lacking those Ingredients.
chicken.author: Alyssa A.
chicken.review:
We were looking for a quick bite in the neighborhood. This place also accepts American Express which is a rare thing around here. We ordered takeout and our food took a long time because we didn't realize you had to stand in the front for takeout. They gave us a number and were delivering the rest of the foods --- we apparently missed the memo.

We ordered a chicken burrito supreme and carne Asad's quesadilla. When I got home, my burrito was supposed to have sour cream and guacamole and unfortunately all those things were missing. The flavors were still good, but it was really lacking those Ingredients. My husbands carne asada burrito was super salty.

I like that the food comes with free chips and salsa but that's pretty standard around the mission.

There are so many wonderful options for burritos in the area, try elsewhere. They seemed busy and had happy seeming customers, so maybe the dine in experience would have been better. 

$26.00 for a burrito and quesadilla - not crazy cheap but not crazy expensive either.

excerpts: I always get the chicken mole burrito, with Spanish rice, and a spinach tortilla.
You can pick the rice, beans and tortilla.
Plus you get some of their amazing salsa (also available at Whole Foods) with the chips.
My friends liked the grilled chicken burrito as well with the sour cream, guacamole etc.
We often get the guacamole and chips, although we never finish.
chicken.author: Vivian W.
chicken.review: I love this place.  I always get the chicken mole burrito, with Spanish rice, and a spinach tortilla.  You can pick the rice, beans and tortilla.  Plus you get some of their amazing salsa (also available at Whole Foods) with the chips.  My friends liked the grilled chicken burrito as well with the sour cream, guacamole etc.  We often get the guacamole and chips, although we never finish.

excerpts: My friend ordered their veggie burrito, I ordered a chicken burrito.
Barely any chicken inside and the amount of guacamole and sour cream
chicken.author: Don K.
chicken.review:
Was driving around the mission last night trying to find a place to park, intending on going somewhere completely different. Rounded the corner on 24th and Papalote caught my eye. Parked a few blocks away (lucky at that!) and walked back down to restaurant. Had a vegan friend with me who was aware of their vegan mole, which he had read on line. 

Walked inside, smaller place with some family style seating on one side and a few single tables along walls. Very colorful and fun vibe, loved the large dragonflies suspended from ceiling. Waited in line for a bit and ordered at the counter. My friend ordered their veggie burrito, I ordered a chicken burrito. Was asked if I wanted guacamole and sour cream and I said sure, thinking I'd have a t least a scoop of each. 

Free chips and mole arrived at table, the mole was the best part of the dinner! If I were just there for the mole, then 4 stars. Burritos arrived, nothing on the side, everything wrapped up. The flavor was decent, ingredients fresh....but the price $14+ did not seem justified for what I got. Barely any chicken inside and the amount of guacamole and sour cream I paid the extra $1.99 for seemed like a rip off. 

In short, I feel good food but way overpriced. Would I go back again? No, sadly not.

excerpts: We got the chicken mole and a chicken verde and the house salsa and chips.
If they had a liquor license it would be the best place ever for a Mexican dinner night!!
That being said, it was a perfect first lunch in San Francisco.
The salsa is puréed and creamy like a mole and absolutely delicious!
That was my favorite part of the meal.
Nice kick of spice but not too spicy that you can't eat it all
The food was all very fresh and I liked the mole but could have used a little spicy kick
(I added hot sauce).
I wasn't as keen on the verse sauce
but it was all still good and
that salsa is just awesome.
chicken.author: Heather B.
chicken.review:
3.5 stars. This was our first meal in San Francisco during this most recent trip. My fiancé and I each ordered a taco order since you get 2 of the same and we wanted to mix and match. We got the chicken mole and a chicken verde and the house salsa and chips. If they had a liquor license it would be the best place ever for a Mexican dinner night!! That being said, it was a perfect first lunch in San Francisco. The salsa is puréed and creamy like a mole and absolutely delicious! That was my favorite part of the meal. Nice kick of spice but not too spicy that you can't eat it all 
The food was all very fresh and I liked the mole but could have used a little spicy kick (I added hot sauce). I wasn't as keen on the verse sauce but it was all still good and that salsa is just awesome.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken nachos and added guac and sour cream.
chicken.author: Sean G.
chicken.review: Quaint little spot by the 24th bart with great mexican food. Iv been having a nacho craving and heard these maybe the best and they didn't disapoint. I ordered the chicken nachos and added guac and sour cream. They also come with beans, salsa, and cheese. The house chips are excellent and they also threw in an app of chips with papalote dipping sauce. I came hungry and barely finished it you can easily split it with 2 people and its delicious.

excerpts: My husband ordered his usual--a prawn and chicken quesadilla, and I ordered my usual--a veggie burrito.
Our total came out to be around $29!
What's even worse is that my husband's quesadilla was so tiny (only two pieces) and barely any prawns in there.
They didn't even put his quesadilla in a box, they just wrapped it in foil, which caused the food to get all messed up and sloppy.
We typically don't mind paying extra for top quality food,
chicken.author: Cin W.
chicken.review:
I've been a longtime customer of Papalote; however, they're really going downhill.  Their food is just ok, but extremely overpriced.  I get it..that they supposedly use fresh ingredients and all that but, come on.  We hadn't been there for a while, but finally decided to order for pick-up a few weeks back.

My husband ordered his usual--a prawn and chicken quesadilla, and I ordered my usual--a veggie burrito.  Our total came out to be around $29! What's even worse is that my husband's quesadilla was so tiny (only two pieces) and barely any prawns in there.  They didn't even put his quesadilla in a box, they just wrapped it in foil, which caused the food to get all messed up and sloppy.  We typically don't mind paying extra for top quality food, but like I said, the quality is not even that great anymore. 

I really like the owners--Miguel and Judy (I think), so I feel bad writing this review.  But I feel really ripped off and I feel like they totally just jacked up their prices while diminishing their quality.  Also, this place is always filled with damn hipsters and techies (who are extremely annoying).

excerpts: As first-timers, the hubs and I shared a Triple Threat burrito - 3 proteins: chicken, beef, and shrimp.
The shrimp was the star!
chicken.author: Janis A.
chicken.review:
As first-timers, the hubs and I shared a Triple Threat burrito - 3 proteins: chicken, beef, and shrimp. The shrimp was the star!

Tacos are mediocre. I expected more. I thought these would be like street tacos, but the tortillas weren't even warm/toasted. They were very dry and fell apart.

Lastly, I just want to point out that the housemade salsa is DELICIOUS. This is the fresh salsa they give to you when you order. But the jarred salsas they sell, are just... BLAND, for some reason. These are the same jars they sell at Safeway for like $8 a pop, I think. What a rip off.

excerpts: but I personally loved Papalote because of its naked burrito with adobo chicken.
When you get the chicken burrito or deconstructed bowl, be sure to ask for the adobo chicken, not the pollo asado...
the adobo is shredded and so tender, while the pollo asado I believe is just diced roasted chicken.
chicken.author: Janet H.
chicken.review:
Not quite sure why this place only has 3.5 stars, but I've learned to overlook Yelp ratings once in awhile. There are many Mexican restaurants in the area, so reviewers are probably just comparing to the classics like El Farolito and La Taqueria... but I personally loved Papalote because of its naked burrito with adobo chicken. 

I seriously would've never known of this place until a yoga friend of mine was eating it before class. It looked so tasty that I got it the next day before yoga class (slightly bad idea)... yes, it is on the pricier side and added up to $13 but it is a meal for 3 days. I had it for lunch yesterday, and then lunch today... and I still have a good amount of rice and beans left that I can pair with other protein for dinner tonight. 

Papalote was also featured on Bobby Flay's show, which is pretty cool. The food is flavorful and I enjoyed every bite. It even comes with a generous serving of guacamole! Bonus points for their amazing complimentary salsa for their chips!

When you get the chicken burrito or deconstructed bowl, be sure to ask for the adobo chicken, not the pollo asado... the adobo is shredded and so tender, while the pollo asado I believe is just diced roasted chicken. Luckily they were able to change my order last minute when I realized there was a difference. 

I'm going to yoga again on Tuesday and I'm planning on getting another naked burrito. It's that good!

excerpts: Triple Threat - chicken breast, carne asada, prawns:
It's loaded with 3 types of proteins, but I don't feel threatened.
The taste and quality is on par with most burritos, so in comparison, the price tag sure is steep.
The grilled prawns were the best part.
They're tender and springy with a nice char.
Plus, the prawns are left whole instead of chopped up beyond recognition.
The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too.
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals.
The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too.
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals.
The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp.
The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey.
chicken.author: Joy W.
chicken.review:
About six years ago, Flay challenged Papalote to a burrito contest and the triple threat burrito triumphed. I wish I knew what Papalote was like before it was featured on Throwdown. Was the triple threat always $20? Back then, $20 was a lot of cash for a burrito and it still is now, but at least that burrito hasn't been affected by inflation in these past few years. Also, the hype has calmed down compared to those crowds after the episode first aired. 

Triple Threat - chicken breast, carne asada, prawns:
It's loaded with 3 types of proteins, but I don't feel threatened. The taste and quality is on par with most burritos, so in comparison, the price tag sure is steep. The grilled prawns were the best part. They're tender and springy with a nice char. Plus, the prawns are left whole instead of chopped up beyond recognition. The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too. 
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals. It's also a good decision if you have a tough time choosing between poultry, beef, & seafood, or if you're just curious to try it, but it is not a must have.

The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp. The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey. Adding cheese, guac, or sour cream are each $1. Kind of a bummer, since burritos usually include cheese. If you're going to add one, you might as well add all 3 for $2, resulting in a very creamy burrito. 

Of course the roasted tomato salsa is excellent. It is the true threat here. This thick & creamy, robust, orange sauce is like a flavor explosion of smokey, sweet, savory, spicy, and slightly tart. This salsa is excellent on their thin, warm chips, as well as on everything else. Jars of Papalote's various salsas are available for purchase in various local markets. 
Overall, I'm satisfied with the food, but the prices are high relative to other Mexican joints in the Mission, so I give it a 7.25/10.

excerpts: I guess I could have tried to ask for more pico, chicken, or rice.
The was not enough chicken or pico de gallo in the burrito.
It just seemed like a tortilla with Spanish rice, and a little of the other toppings.
I have had many better burritos than this one.
This one was overpriced at $11.50 or so.
Nick's Crispy serves up good burritos.
Chipotle even does the trick.
El Castillito on Church is really good.
I don't know what happened, but I am not the chef, so he can figure out how to whip up a satisfying burrito sans beans.
chicken.author: Denise C.
chicken.review: Zane raves about Papalote. I know Papalote is popular for on demand food delivery. However, my burrito today was a big fail. I do not like paying .99 for some sour cream. I don't like beans, so those had to be left out(Zane wanted them on the side). The chef did not think about how he could fill up the burrito to fill the void of no beans. I guess I could have tried to ask for more pico, chicken, or rice. The was not enough chicken or pico de gallo in the burrito. It just seemed like a tortilla with Spanish rice, and a little of the other toppings. I have had many better burritos than this one. This one was overpriced at $11.50 or so. Nick's Crispy serves up good burritos. Chipotle even does the trick. El Castillito on Church is really good. I don't know what happened, but I am not the chef, so he can figure out how to whip up a satisfying burrito sans beans.

excerpts: They no longer carry the legendary Mexipino burrito (Mexican-Filipino with garlic fried rice and chicken adobo).
They have dethroned themselves!
None of their other options are even remotely worth the prices they charge, try one of the many other shops in the area instead.
chicken.author: Derek R.
chicken.review: They no longer carry the legendary Mexipino burrito (Mexican-Filipino with garlic fried rice and chicken adobo). They have dethroned themselves! None of their other options are even remotely worth the prices they charge, try one of the many other shops in the area instead.

excerpts: The chicken mole is to die for, along with the salsa they bring out in the beginning.
Not to mention that the burritos are as big as my forearm.
This is one of the pricier taquerias in the mission, but still i the 10-17 dollar range.
Definitely recommend checking Papalote out, and getting the chicken mole if that is your thing!
Definitely recommend checking Papalote out, and getting the chicken mole if that is your thing!
chicken.author: Ross S.
chicken.review: With so many great Mexican restaurants in the mission, which do you choose?! Papa life is a solid choice, with a few standout items on the menu. The chicken mole is to die for, along with the salsa they bring out in the beginning. Not to mention that the burritos are as big as my forearm. This is one of the pricier taquerias in the mission, but still i the 10-17 dollar range. Definitely recommend checking Papalote out, and getting the chicken mole if that is your thing!

excerpts: I had the chicken mole burrito and lord was it succulent.
Held me the rest of the day and clearly delayed how quickly the post-work wine bar outing landed on me.
I'd go again :)
chicken.author: Anne G.
chicken.review:
So, I went here today with a friend.  Turned out it's like her hands-down favorite place.  Ordered catering for them for her wedding rehearsal.  Had her husband pick up burritos for her each time she'd delivered a baby (3x).  Begged him to take her here before they went to see Hamilton.  My friend's name is Kegan and I told her she should post a review!!!

I had the chicken mole burrito and lord was it succulent.  Held me the rest of the day and clearly delayed how quickly the post-work wine bar outing landed on me.  I'd go again :)

excerpts: Larger than my forearm, this creation included chunks of tender carne asada, smoked prawns, succulent achiote chicken, rice, beans and slightly piquant papalote salsa.

I basically built myself a super healthy burrito (brown rice, wheat tortilla, black beans, chicken), however it was still ridiculously delicious and better than anything Chiptole could ever manufacture for me.
chicken.author: Astrid Z.
chicken.review:
Thank you, Food Network for leading me here!

Food: My boyfriend was so cool and decided to order the Triple Threat Burrito. Larger than my forearm, this creation included chunks of tender carne asada, smoked prawns, succulent achiote chicken, rice, beans and slightly piquant papalote salsa. He made it super by adding fresh guacamole, cheese and  sour cream. The marriage between all of the ingredients worked magically, I wouldn't change a single thing about this burrito. Though the price is fairly steep ($19.99), it can easily be shared among two people and the quality and taste alone are enough for me to pay the whooping fee each and every time. The papalote salsa is pretty epic, though not as spicy as I'd like it to be. The roasted tomatoes and chili provide a bit of a smokey flavor, the salsa is a full-bodied/robust work of art boasting in both flavor and aroma. I purchased one to take home and finished it in three days. I built my own burrito as well and the menu allows for optimal customization if you don't want one of their signature burritos. I was able to chose between the type of beans, rice, meat and tortilla I wanted. I basically built myself a super healthy burrito (brown rice, wheat tortilla, black beans, chicken), however it was still ridiculously delicious and better than anything Chiptole could ever manufacture for me. I highly recommend any of their burritos, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

Price: On the pricier end and they'll tack on more for adding any extra ingredients. However, the food here is certainly worth the price every time. 

Ambiance: Small, simple and clean. I saw a ton of people waiting outside to either get a table
or pick up carry-out orders.

Service: Quick and friendly servers, limited interaction with employees.

Overall: Authentic, fresh and ridiculously appetizing Mexican eats. I approve and can't wait
to come back for more!

excerpts: I had the chicken mole tacos and my friend had a bean and rice burrito and they both were great.
They also had this insane sauce to eat with the nacho chips they give out for free and it was the most amazing sauce I've had.
I'd buy it in a bottle if I could.
Definitely a must try!
chicken.author: Raksha M.
chicken.review: We didn't know what to expect coming in, and we're blown away by how good the food was. It's not the cheapest on mission, but it's just so damn good. I had the chicken mole tacos and my friend had a bean and rice burrito and they both were great. They also had this insane sauce to eat with the nacho chips they give out for free and it was the most amazing sauce I've had. I'd buy it in a bottle if I could. Definitely a must try!

excerpts: Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado.
chicken.author: Mark O.
chicken.review:
Mexican restaurant on 24th & Valencia. On the 2014 and 2015 7x7 list for their chips and salsa.

Although you order at the counter your food gets brought to you. Limited meat selection. No chorizo or carnitas. 

Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.

Triple threat burrito - 3/5 - Massive. Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado. Not really impressed.

Chips and salsa - 5/5 - WOW. I very much expected to be disappointed by another overhyped dish but this absolutely lived up to it's reputation. The salsa is so damn good. This is easily my favorite salsa in the city and I even bought an extra jar to take home. It is creamy, spicy and delicious. It certainly deserves the spot it has held on the 7x7 list for the past two years.

Overall, this is without a doubt my new go to option for salsa. Unfortunately the rest of their items are passable so I think I will likely be getting the salsa to go and getting my burrito/taco/quesadilla elsewhere in the future. Regardless, this salsa is absolutely "as good as it gets" and I will probably always have some on hand in my fridge.

excerpts: I tried the grilled chicken burrito and the size was very decent aside from being delicious.
Probably one one the best burritos I had in SF so far.
chicken.author: Arash E.
chicken.review: Nice food. I tried the grilled chicken burrito and the size was very decent aside from being delicious. Probably one one the best burritos I had in SF so far.

excerpts: I really enjoyed my "naked" chicken burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guac on the side.
chicken.author: Sarah Z.
chicken.review:
Wow, their house salsa/sauce is awesome! I've never had anything like it. It's soo good! 

I really enjoyed my "naked" chicken burrito with sour cream, cheese, and guac on the side. They load it up! 

My man was not super impressed with his Mexipino burrito. It was good, just not what you'd expect a burrito to be. The flavors were more subtle and vinegar-based (hence the nod to Filipino food) and less about the spices of Mexican food. He will try a regular burrito the next time we go, and hopefully this will one day become a 5 star review. Looking forward to next time!

excerpts: I had a chicken burrito and it sucked.
The only thing worse was the woman behind the counter.
First of all, my burrito was cold, not warm...yes, cold.
Second, it also contained some beef, of which I did not order.
Finally, they were incapable of making my burrito spicy.
It was seriously too much to ask from Alma B. because she treated me like I was some total asshole disturbing her while she was at the spa...
oh,
yeah
she was at work...
my bad.
Finally, after I realized that my cold disgusting burrito had no heat, I asked the gentleman for spicy salsa.
His reply, you need to buy an entire jar at the register.
Really, I just want hot salsa for my cold overpriced burrito
and I have to buy an entire jar...
Why are there pieces of beef in my chicken?
chicken.author: Kiki I.
chicken.review:
I had a chicken burrito and it sucked.  The only thing worse was the woman behind the counter.  First of all, my burrito was cold, not warm...yes, cold.  Second, it also contained some beef, of which I did not order.  Finally, they were incapable of making my burrito spicy.  It was seriously too much to ask from Alma B. because she treated me like I was some total asshole disturbing her while she was at the spa...oh, yeah she was at work...my bad.  Finally, after I realized that my cold disgusting burrito had no heat, I asked the gentleman for spicy salsa.  His reply, you need to buy an entire jar at the register.  Really, I just want hot salsa for my cold overpriced burrito and I have to buy an entire jar...wtf?

There are much better places to go in the City and obviously within the immediate area.  This place has gone way down hill and I will not return to any location.

PS. Does management exist? Is there quality control?  Why does Alma B. work in customer service?  Really not jalapeños or spicy salsa? Why are there pieces of beef in my chicken?

Gross!

excerpts: The Mexipino Burrito with Adobo Chicken and Garlic Rice --
http://bit.ly/Ud1cNi
Yeah, the Mexipino Burrito is really good.
So flavorful!
Takes one of my favorite Filipino comfort foods and wraps it all up in a Burrito.
And the Burrito is loaded with chicken as you can see in the pic.
chicken.author: Rodney H.
chicken.review:
I only went to Papalote during this visit mainly to try the Mexipino Burrito that all my friends have been raving about.  And it did not disappoint!

The Mexipino Burrito with Adobo Chicken and Garlic Rice --  http://bit.ly/Ud1cNi
Yeah, the Mexipino Burrito is really good.  So flavorful!  Takes one of my favorite Filipino comfort foods and wraps it all up in a Burrito.  And the Burrito is loaded with chicken as you can see in the pic.  It's awesome when taquerias don't skimp on the meat.  

Although Papalote wouldn't be my first choice to get a burrito in the mission, it still holds it own with their Famous Salsa and late hours.  I'll probably stop by again to get another Mexipino Burrito in the near future!

excerpts: I got the super "Triple Threat Burrito" -- chicken, steak, and shrimp.
I should have known it was going to be a discombobulated flavor mess.
First of all, among the three proteins, I only enjoyed the steak.
The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked.
The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked.
I was burping up bad shrimp all night long.
Don't get the shrimp.
Or chicken.
2) Don't get the refried beans.
Just trust me on this.
Park on the residential streets nearby.
Actually, nevermind all that.
Skip this spot and go to La Taqueria instead.
chicken.author: Jennifer B.
chicken.review:
Wow. What a major disappointment. Major.

USA Today ranked Papalote Mexican Grill as the #1 burrito in the country. I've eaten quite a few excellent burritos and a lot of "meh" burritos, but actually not a lot of terrible burritos. The one I had today would fall into that last category. I'm pretty sure I actually enjoy Chipotle's burritos more, and that's saying something.

I got the super "Triple Threat Burrito" -- chicken, steak, and shrimp. I should have known it was going to be a discombobulated flavor mess. First of all, among the three proteins, I only enjoyed the steak. The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked. I was burping up bad shrimp all night long.

As for the rest of the burrito, it could be that I just ordered wrong by getting the refried beans. They advertise the refried beans as being vegan, which should have been a red flag. Ask your abuela if she ever made vegan refried beans. She'd laugh at you. But aside from the poor taste, the texture was... saucy. Not goopy, not gloppy, not bean-y. Saucy. And these beans, which made up far too much of the burrito, melded together with the salsa, watery guacamole, and who knows what else to become a really drippy, nasty sauce. Burritos are meant to have all of the components stay separate while being wrapped together, not seem like they've gone through a blender together to become homogenized. It was really, really bad. I regretted buying this $22 burrito (Yes! $22!!!) two bites into it.

On another note, the salsa that comes with their chips is very unique. Very Romesco-y. The chips were stale.

Tips and tricks for if you go to Papalote:
1) Don't get the shrimp. Or chicken. 
2) Don't get the refried beans. Just trust me on this.
3) Park on the residential streets nearby.
4) Actually, nevermind all that. Skip this spot and go to La Taqueria instead.

excerpts: Stuffed with steak, chicken, and shrimp --
chicken.author: Tony V.
chicken.review:
What I got:
Triple threat burrito

What I thought:
So the Mission is known to have a bunch of great Mexican food spots to eat and to say that this is definitely top 3 is saying something!

The triple threat burrito is something else. I don't think I've ever had a burrito quite like it. Stuffed with steak, chicken, and shrimp -- what better combination could you ask for!?

Flavors were amazing and the meats were seasoned perfectly. The combination of everything blended very well. I ended up wanting more after I finished my half!

We arrived a little bit late before closing time so we didn't get to enjoy our burrito in the actual restaurant, but the employees were so kind and asked us if we wanted to cut our burrito is half since we were on the go. They even individually wrapped each one. Even by cutting it in half, it still looked like two regular burritos. That's how gigantic this puppy is.

One of the best places to eat in the Mission -- no doubt! Craving Mexican food? This is the place for you!

excerpts: Always get the chicken burrito with everything (you pay extra $2 for sour cream, cheese and guac).
chicken.author: Jatin M.
chicken.review: I love Papalote! I make sure I go there to eat if I am in SF (not often - hate the traffic!). I love their salsa. Always get the chicken burrito with everything (you pay extra $2 for sour cream, cheese and guac). My friend had shrimp nachos one time and they were awesome too. It's not cheap though. You can expect $12/person here. Small tight space inside.

excerpts: I got the super chicken burrito
and it was delicious and quite flavorful.
My pallet was a fan of the orange sauce!
However, I do have to gripe about the chips to sauce ratio ( more chips, less sauce).
chicken.author: Jezz P.
chicken.review:
I got the super chicken burrito and it was delicious and quite flavorful. My pallet was a fan of the orange sauce! However, I do have to gripe about the chips to sauce ratio ( more chips, less sauce). No Bueno. 

Living a non-domesticated (can't cook for sh%*) life in Eastside San Jose, with a significant portion spent in San Francisco and San Leandro, has lead me to consume large amounts of tacos and burritos. I would say this place is comparable to the awesome spots I've dined in the past. 

This place may be a hit or miss judging from the negative reviews. It was definitely a hit for me and I will be returning when I'm in the area for grad school bussiness.

excerpts: My friend had the chicken mole burrito and thought it was really great, granted, it was her first time trying mole.
Only thing I didn't like was the Horchata.
Personally, it was too grainy for me and had some floral aftertaste
but maybe I'm not used to it?
Despite that, I'll definitely be returning here!
chicken.author: Janelle S.
chicken.review:
Came here for a quick fix of the sudden Mexican food cravings... Friendly service and the food was delicious! The place itself is pretty small so I could see it on peak time getting crowded but we came here on a Sunday evening for dinner and found a spot to sit with no problem-- not crowded but most tables were occupied. They offer ordering to go ahead of time so that's a good alternative if you don't want to stay or want to do pick up. 

I really enjoyed their salsa! It's unique, creamy and has a load of taste to it-- I ended up stuffing myself with chips and the salsa (comes with every order) to the point where I got too full to finish the carne asada burrito I ordered, which by the way, was good too. I got the smaller of the two burrito sizes but found it too be a hefty amount. My friend had the chicken mole burrito and thought it was really great, granted, it was her first time trying mole. Only thing I didn't like was the Horchata. Personally, it was too grainy for me and had some floral aftertaste but maybe I'm not used to it? Despite that, I'll definitely be returning here!

excerpts: I ordered a grilled chicken burrito.
It's was good but over priced considering there are a lot of other good burrito spots in the mission.
chicken.author: Frank A.
chicken.review:
Regular meat burritos 9.95
Tacos order of 2 meat $8.75

I ordered a grilled chicken burrito. It's was good but over priced considering there are a lot of other good burrito spots in the mission.

excerpts: My boyfriend and I ordered two chicken burritos, each being over $12.
The amount of chicken in our "chicken" burritos was laughable.
I thought they had forgotten the chicken completely but
after opening my burrito, I counted three, yes three tiny pieces of chicken.
This was also the case for my boyfriend.
After paying over $12 for a burrito, you would expect some substance, not three tiny pea-sized pieces of chicken.
What a joke.
Sadly, I will not be returning after having frequented this spot for so many years.
Not worth what you pay.
If you want to pay over $12 for a stingy burrito, this is your spot, if not, go somewhere else to get your money's worth.
chicken.author: Claudette V.
chicken.review: I've been coming to Papalote for over a decade because the food has always been tasty, but within the past few years, the quality and portions have completely deteriorated. The past handful of times I have left feeling ripped off, but given my history with this place, I didn't want to write it off just yet, thinking that they were maybe just having an off night. But this last experience was my last straw. My boyfriend and I ordered two chicken burritos, each being over $12. The amount of chicken in our "chicken" burritos was laughable. I thought they had forgotten the chicken completely but after opening my burrito, I counted three, yes three tiny pieces of chicken. This was also the case for my boyfriend. After paying over $12 for a burrito, you would expect some substance, not three tiny pea-sized pieces of chicken. What a joke. Sadly, I will not be returning after having frequented this spot for so many years. Not worth what you pay. If you want to pay over $12 for a stingy burrito, this is your spot, if not, go somewhere else to get your money's worth.

excerpts: BF's chicken burrito on the tomato tortilla
was good.
chicken.author: Emma M.
chicken.review:
Got a naked carne asada "burrito" which is basically a chipotle bowl but not as flavorful. the meal was very chewy and even though I got a "super" which is an extra $2 for guac, sour cream, and cheese, it was somehow bland. 

Salsa is amazing. 

BF's chicken burrito on the tomato tortilla was good.

excerpts: My naked burrito with chicken mole - brown rice and super - was UNREAL.
And the portion was huge.
(SHARE!)
That salsa is amazing.
I'm older now.
I love the cleaner environment.
Worth the extra $.
chicken.author: Andrew K.
chicken.review: My naked burrito with chicken mole - brown rice and super - was UNREAL. And the portion was huge. (SHARE!) That salsa is amazing. I'm older now. I love the cleaner environment. Worth the extra $.

excerpts: I tend to get the fish salad with cilantro dressing and my husband gets the chicken burrito and both are super delicious.
chicken.author: Hello G.
chicken.review: How does this not have a higher review? Their salsa alone should be a 5 star. The place is small but the food is consistently delicious. I love everything here from the burritos, plates, or salad. I tend to get the fish salad with cilantro dressing and my husband gets the chicken burrito and both are super delicious.

excerpts: My boyfriend got a chicken quesadilla and he felt very neutral about it and said he was not a fan of the spicing of the chicken.
If you wanted extra chicken, it was something like  $6.50!
Maybe there is a mistake with the menu within this app but this seems to be way too much for add ons.
chicken.author: Carissa B.
chicken.review:
I was pretty disappointed with this place, given the great reviews. We ordered delivery. The food came pretty quickly.
