The food was alright, but definitely not worth 5 stars. I will definitely be searching around for other options the next time I am craving Mexican food. I got a burrito and it was just okay. It had beans, cheese and rice and the smallest amount of salsa. It tasted as boring as it sounds. My boyfriend got a chicken quesadilla and he felt very neutral about it and said he was not a fan of the spicing of the chicken. 

The biggest issue we had may or may not be the restaurant's fault. However, we ordered using Order Ahead and we did not have the options it seemed other customers had on the menu. For example, there was no option to get a "super burrito". If I wanted to add sour cream to the order it was $2.00 extra, etc. If you wanted extra chicken, it was something like  $6.50! Maybe there is a mistake with the menu within this app but this seems to be way too much for add ons.

excerpts: The triple threat burrito had all three meats -- chicken, steak, and garlic shrimp.
The tacos were alright, a tad bit on the dry side
but it is because we didn't get any guac or sour cream with it.
Despite the wait and the fact we couldnt be seated, overall it was a good experience.
I will be coming back again.
chicken.author: Peter W.
chicken.review: A hearty burrito after a long week's work is exactly what I needed -- I have heard amazing things about papalote from friends and colleagues; it was true. I ordered 2 steak tacos and a triple threat burrito ( made super ) to share. Unfortunately they were closing soon so we had to get it to go -- although it was quite a long wait, it was so worth it. The meal came with nachos and their award winning papalote sauce. It was AMAZING! The triple threat burrito had all three meats -- chicken, steak, and garlic shrimp. The tacos were alright, a tad bit on the dry side but it is because we didn't get any guac or sour cream with it. Despite the wait and the fact we couldnt be seated, overall it was a good experience. I will be coming back again.

excerpts: , chicken and grilled veggie nachos
(Again... OMG!)
to start.
chicken.author: Suzanne P.
chicken.review: This place is the reason that The Mission is famed for burritos! We stopped in on a Sunday evening, a little before your typical dinner rush. We were able to order quickly and got a small table with no wait. Go here with an appetite b/c no matter how much you want to stop eating, you just can't! We had the house made salsa (OMG! So good!), chicken and grilled veggie nachos (Again... OMG!) to start. Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito. I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid. Burrito can't be beat! Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!

excerpts: I'm sure if you get chicken, beef, or whatever you see the meat everywhere.
You take one bite and this guck just starts pouring out.
chicken.author: Daanyaal K.
chicken.review:
Not a place to get a shrimp burrito. They charge around $12 which is expected but in this huge burrito of just fillings, you'd be lucky to find 6 "medium sized" shrimps. I'm sure if you get chicken, beef, or whatever you see the meat everywhere. You take one bite and this guck just starts pouring out. I got sick for a from this place and that salsa is more like lard than anything. 

The only good thing I had was the chips but the overall experience wasn't good enough to come back. I emailed the restaurant about a refund after the poor meal and sickness but I got no response.

excerpts: Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super.
To me it is weird that isn't included in the price
but ok.
The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant.
It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender.
Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.
As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with.
chicken.author: Eddie W.
chicken.review:
7x7 100 Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2012

#46 Chips and Salsa at Papalote

My first question to myself was how good can the chips and salsa really be or was this just another fill in item. Well I finally was able to have my answer this past week. 

After deliberating where to go, we decided to go to Papalote for their chips and salsa. While browsing their menu online I noticed something odd. Everyone on Yelp kept posting pictures of the Triple Threat Burrito however I saw it no where on the menu. Turns out it is their signature item that was featured on Bobby Flay's show Throwdown. 

Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super. To me it is weird that isn't included in the price but ok. My friend and I agreed to split the burrito plus get chips, extra salsa and two beers. We both ended up paying $18 for just that so keep that in mind. 

For what its worth, the salsa is unlike any other salsa I have had. From color, consistency and all the way down to flavor there is a complexity to their salsa that is well worth trying. The chips did not appear to be anything out of the ordinary but I would recommend trying the salsa at least one time. 

The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant. It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender. I would gladly go back for their carne asada burrito. 

Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.

As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with. The quality was good and cooked well but didn't find it be a valid "threat".

Overall Thoughts

Salsa is delicious and well worth trying as well as the carne asada but be warned Papalote isn't a cheap grab and go burrito kind of place

excerpts: I couldn't really taste the steak or the chicken although I know it's there.
The carne asada taco had all the fixings and the steak was distinct and tasted great!
The salsa...forget about it...
chicken.author: Andrew S.
chicken.review:
3 stars for the Triple Threat
4 stars for the carne asada tacos
5 stars for the salsa

Maybe the pictures got the best of me and it looked better than it tasted. The TT was a little overhyped in my opinion. The idea/concept is legit and the thing is enormous, but the flavors are a little muddled because there's just too much going on. I couldn't really taste the steak or the chicken although I know it's there. The carne asada taco had all the fixings and the steak was distinct and tasted great! The salsa...forget about it...it's hands down addicting like crack! 

I'll be back to try a normal carne asada burrito so that I can make a better comparison of the other taqueria spots I've already tried. I'll be back for sure!

excerpts: BUT, I got a chicken burrito and was disappointed with it.
The high rating really got my expectations high, but the burrito lacked all the flavors I expect from a good burrito.
chicken.author: Hema R.
chicken.review:
I am really confused on how to rate Papalote. 

I would give their bottled salsa 5 stars, best I have ever had, including in Mexico itself! I plan to stock up on the salsa for taco nights at home. Its delicious and everyone in my household loves it!

BUT, I got a chicken burrito and was disappointed with it. The high rating really got my expectations high, but the burrito lacked all the flavors I expect from a good burrito. I have had much better in several other places.

I might still go back to try their tacos (and to buy more salsa, ofcourse). But I'll pass on the burrito.

excerpts: No words can describe the sweaty combination of chicken and rice wit a sprinkle of "Filipino" seasoning that has likely been on the shelf since Duterte was born.
chicken.author: Walter M.
chicken.review: Been going here on and off for the last 8 years. That ends today after trying the Mexipino burrito. This is likely one of the most vile food products I have purchased and am seriously wondering if I'm making it to work tomorrow. No words can describe the sweaty combination of chicken and rice wit a sprinkle of "Filipino" seasoning that has likely been on the shelf since Duterte was born.

excerpts: My friend and I split the chicken mole burrito.
Meh.
Our kids got a cheese quesadilla ($5.15) and 4 chicken tacos ($19).
The chicken was nicely seasoned but the taco tortillas were kinda stiff.
chicken.author: R A.
chicken.review:
I was not impressed. At all. My friend and I split the chicken mole burrito. Meh. Our kids got a cheese quesadilla ($5.15) and 4 chicken tacos ($19). The chicken was nicely seasoned but the taco tortillas were kinda stiff. 

The guacamole was good but $9.75??   The service was excellent.

I would give the food 3 stars cuz it wasn't "bad" but the prices were too high for what you got, so I gave it 2 stars.

excerpts: I had the chicken nachos.
We left with a jar of salsa that we bought there.
You can never go wrong at Papalote!
chicken.author: Mika D.
chicken.review: We stopped in for lunch here; I told my homeboy about their award winning burritos and he ordered one. I had the chicken nachos. We left with a jar of salsa that we bought there. You can never go wrong at Papalote!

excerpts: My bf had the chicken adobo burrito with everything on it.
It was both our first time trying it
and it was pretty good and hefty, until he was finishing the first half...piece of hair.
chicken.author: Georgina G.
chicken.review:
I looove their orange sauce/salsa that comes with their chips. It makes anything you order from the menu even better!

My bf had the chicken adobo burrito with everything on it. It was both our first time trying it and it was pretty good and hefty, until he was finishing the first half...piece of hair. *gag* instantly looses appetite.

I immediately bring the plate back to one of the servers and show him what we found. Another worker came to us at our table to apologize for the incident and offered us the option of getting a refund or another one to-go, which I appreciated. But still disgusted...like why can't instances like that be avoided? I hate that ugh makes me cringe.

It's tough to not let my view of this spot to be tainted by that mishap. I really enjoyed their orange sauce and burritos...whyyyyy me?! I guess it'll just take some time to come back and give the place another chance without questioning if there's a piece of hair in my burrito =(

excerpts: I had the super size buritto chicken mole the first time
and I had it again on this visit.
This is the best mole sauce I have ever had.
BAM!
Get it!!!
chicken.author: Scott C.
chicken.review: Second time here and both times the venue was selected by my dinner date as their respective favorite - so there is that. I am reasonably I had the super size buritto chicken mole the first time and I had it again on this visit. This is the best mole sauce I have ever had. BAM! Get it!!! Before digging into that bad boy, we shared a large chorizo con queso apetizer which comes with choice of hot tortilla or chips. If you use up the tortilla, they will give you chips - no losing there. On this visit, my date had the fish tacos and was thoroughly please with her selection as well. We will keep coming back. See ya!

excerpts: We also ordered the chicken super nacho.
Yummy!!!
If you like fresh ingredients, this is the place for you.
Not the best tacos/nachos I've ever had but decent.
We were also served chips and their signature Papalote dip which was very good.
Consistency of ranch but very flavorful.
chicken.author: Ya Y.
chicken.review: I ordered the prawn tacos (comes with 2 prawns in each with lettuce/tomatoes/jicama). Ingredients were made fresh with not a lot of fuss. We also ordered the chicken super nacho. Yummy!!! If you like fresh ingredients, this is the place for you. Not the best tacos/nachos I've ever had but decent. We were also served chips and their signature Papalote dip which was very good. Consistency of ranch but very flavorful.

excerpts: Chicken was somehow burnt lacking in flavor and charred at the same time.
This time got tomatoes and horrible chicken with no rice.
And beans that would could pass for beans in Nebraska, maybe.  Please please please please go to one of the hundred other burrito places in SF!!!!
chicken.author: William O.
chicken.review: Most overrated place in San Francisco.  People always say but the "salsa is so good" so it got one star for salsa.  My boyfriend loves it because Postmates delivers it for cheap (there's a reason it sucks).  Chicken was somehow burnt lacking in flavor and charred at the same time.  I always ask for no sour cream and extra cheese.  They never get either right.  This time got tomatoes and horrible chicken with no rice.  And beans that would could pass for beans in Nebraska, maybe.  Please please please please go to one of the hundred other burrito places in SF!!!!

excerpts: Chicken is some of the best in any burrito I have ever had.
The salsa is incredible (I always order 2 extra on top of the 1 they give you).
Its a Filipino style burrito which is a nice contrast to the traditional burritos you will find at a Mission spot like Farolito .
chicken.author: Tom F.
chicken.review:
People always ask what my favorite burrito is, and I always answer that it depends on my mood.  If i absolutely could only choose one, regardless of my mood, it would be Papalote.  This place is especially dangerous because i live a couple short blocks away.

Ingredients are all A+.  The garlic rice is very good.  Chicken is some of the best in any burrito I have ever had.  The salsa is incredible (I always order 2 extra on top of the 1 they give you).  Its a Filipino style burrito which is a nice contrast to the traditional burritos you will find at a Mission spot like Farolito .  They sell beer too so its always good to enjoy a tall can while you eat your burrito.

I also recommend buying a couple of their salsa jars to go because it is so good on everything.

excerpts: We got the super burritos, one with steak, one with chicken and another rice and three kinds of beans (black, pinto and refried).
They are all incredibly yummy.
chicken.author: Shou-cheng L.
chicken.review:
Super delicious burritos. We got the super burritos, one with steak, one with chicken and another rice and three kinds of beans (black, pinto and refried). They are all incredibly yummy. Now I believe burritos don't actually have to be spicy to be tasty. 

Btw, their salsa and chips are crazy good too. I am hooked.

excerpts: Personally, I love the chicken tikka masala burrito from Curry
Up Now.
chicken.author: Jonathan S.
chicken.review: When visitors come to SF, they're often familiar with mission-style burritos.  What they DON'T know is that different taquerias have different specialties.  For example, you go to El Farolito for their carne asada.  Personally, I love the chicken tikka masala burrito from Curry Up Now.  But you go to Papalote for their shrimp burrito.  It's huge and delightful.  Plus their creamy salsa?  Two thumbs up.

excerpts: I got the super chicken burrito with refried black beans and no rice.
We sat there and there was a ton of seating.
I didn't even know what was coming with that amazing salsa.
I knew it must be good since they sell it at the register, but wow is it good.
I have considered going back just to buy some
so I can put it on every future meal!
The burrito's are massive.
I cut it in half and it made out to be two decent meals.
I liked how the tortilla was grilled and that they put a lot of meat in there.
Only drawback was that there were way too many beans.
I hardly got any guacamole, hence the four stars.
I would definitely go back to try something else here!
I am sure they do breakfast burritos really well.
They have one person dedicated just to phone orders, so they seem pretty efficient.
chicken.author: Alisha K.
chicken.review:
This was such a great burrito! No line at 5:30pm on a Saturday. I got the super chicken burrito with refried black beans and no rice. We sat there and there was a ton of seating. I didn't even know what was coming with that amazing salsa. I knew it must be good since they sell it at the register, but wow is it good. I have considered going back just to buy some so I can put it on every future meal!
The burrito's are massive. I cut it in half and it made out to be two decent meals. I liked how the tortilla was grilled and that they put a lot of meat in there. Only drawback was that there were way too many beans. I hardly got any guacamole, hence the four stars. I would definitely go back to try something else here! I am sure they do breakfast burritos really well. They have one person dedicated just to phone orders, so they seem pretty efficient.

excerpts: Chicken adobo burrito.
Chicken adobo, garlic rice, egg, secret herbs and spices, all wrapped up in a tortilla.
chicken.author: Jimmy N.
chicken.review:
Chicken adobo burrito. Chicken adobo, garlic rice, egg, secret herbs and spices, all wrapped up in a tortilla. What red-blooded Filipino or ANY foodie worth their salt, for that matter, wouldn't want this? 

-1 star for being all the way up in the City and for me being all the way down here in LA. ;)

excerpts: Had carne asada tacos and a side of achiote chicken.
chicken.author: Dahlia S.
chicken.review:
Bottom line at the top: really yummy!!
--
The sauce here is to die for. Had carne asada tacos and a side of achiote chicken. Service is great but they are weirdly stingy about extra sauce. 

La Taqueria is still my favorite joint in SF but this is still a great spot.

excerpts: As I was eating, I was actually enjoying my chicken burrito... until I found not one, not two, but three strands of hair in the burrito.
Had to throw most of the burrito away.
Super big disappointment!
chicken.author: Rupa A.
chicken.review: I got Papalotes through postmates. At first I was pleasantly surprised. It was a good size burrito with some fresh chips. As I was eating, I was actually enjoying my chicken burrito... until I found not one, not two, but three strands of hair in the burrito. Had to throw most of the burrito away. Super big disappointment!

excerpts: I ordered the Chicken Adobo Burrito.
This was one of the best burritos I ever ate.
The chicken was moist and flavorful.
Everything in the burrito worked well with the chicken.
I ate the whole thing
and I normally can never finish my food.
chicken.author: Kevin W.
chicken.review:
Saw this place on the Food Network and yelped it and saw all the reviews and its rating. Usually Food Network places suck but this was a surprise.

Street parking.

I ordered the Chicken Adobo Burrito. This was one of the best burritos I ever ate. The chicken was moist and flavorful. Everything in the burrito worked well with the chicken. I ate the whole thing and I normally can never finish my food. It was that damn good.

Must eat again!

excerpts: We were pretty excited to dig into the chicken mole (mine) and chicken asado burrito (the boyfriend's).
My boyfriend's burrito was pretty good, but my chicken mole was terrible.
I am not the type of girl that leaves food on the plate, but I felt the dish was pretty much inedible.
The rice was way under cooked -- totally raw in the middle.
My boyfriend's burrito was pretty good, but my chicken mole was terrible.
I am not the type of girl that leaves food on the plate, but I felt the dish was pretty much inedible.
The rice was way under cooked -- totally raw in the middle.
The chicken was overcooked -- stringy and tough.
The mole sauce didn't taste all that multi-dimensional or complex.
chicken.author: Alice W.
chicken.review:
My boyfriend's coworker raves about the place so we decided to give it a try when we were in the neighborhood. The place was pretty happening and the cashier girl was super sweet. We were pretty excited to dig into the chicken mole (mine) and chicken asado burrito (the boyfriend's). 

Unfortunately, the place really fell flat. My boyfriend's burrito was pretty good, but my chicken mole was terrible. I am not the type of girl that leaves food on the plate, but I felt the dish was pretty much inedible. The rice was way under cooked -- totally raw in the middle. The chicken was overcooked -- stringy and tough. The mole sauce didn't taste all that multi-dimensional or complex. I did, however, love the small bit of jicama salad on the plate. 

The burrito here is worth a try and the rice is probably not normally that terrible. I'm willing to give the place another try, but will definitely get the burrito and avoid any of the entree plates.

excerpts: The beef, chicken and prawns were perfectly seasoned.
Everything inside that monstrous burrito is delicious.
The meat pieces were so juicy and tender.
He brought us FREE chicken adobo burritos!
chicken.author: Shirleyanne A.
chicken.review:
Papalote is one of the best burrito places I have been to. I've been to this place a couple times and I have never been disappointed.
 
Here's why I gave them FIVE stars:

Plus one star for the portion size.  I was looking around the restaurant and the portions that they give patrons are pretty hefty.  I'm such a piggy that I love big portion sizes (but of course without sacrificing quality!) We got the Triple Threat Burrito which is so ginormous that Loverboy and I were full after splitting one. You can even split that burrito into three and still be full afterwards.  You can save some of it for the next day.  It tastes amazing just sitting in the fridge overnight.  It's like the flavors magnified while marinating in the fridge. $20 for one burrito is not expensive if you can split that into three or four meals.  

Plus one star for flavor. The beef, chicken and prawns were perfectly seasoned.  Everything inside that monstrous burrito is delicious. The meat pieces were so juicy and tender. The flavors of the three different kinds of meats really complemented each other.

Another star for beating that douche Bobby Flay. I just can't stand his show and how he goes around America telling people he can cook better.  Papalote really deserved that win and they were heroes for showing B. Flay that he ain't all that!

Another star for the sauce.  It is sooooogood!  I want to drink a whole jar of it. I am so happy that they sell jars of that yummy sauce. I just want to slather that sauce all over rice and you could even put that in a quesadilla or a sandwich.

The last star goes to the owners and the staff.  The cashiers were super nice and they had big smiles on their face when we ordered.  The owners are socially responsible and are good people. I went to a volunteer event for Project Pearls where we collected clothes and non-perishable goods for victims of Typhoon Sendong in the Philippines.  Around lunch time, one of the owners of Papalote came with a big box full of burritos which he donated to feed the volunteers. He brought us FREE chicken adobo burritos! They were so delicious! 

Check them out.  You won't be disappointed.

excerpts: Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing  (the chicken and garlic rice burrito with tomatoes) but there really wasn't anything special about it or any of the tacos the rest of the people in my party of 7 were having.
Yes, the salsa is very unique - creamy as though it is an emulsion of oil and tomato with chiles and a nice spicy kick.
(almost like a spicy aioli).
The chicken nachos were very good - nice big serving with lots of grilled chicken and cheese.
chicken.author: Brent C.
chicken.review:
Meh.  Not hatin', but I'm not sure I understand why people stand in line here for 30 minutes at 2 pm on a Wednesday... (but then again city people can be funny that way... )    Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing  (the chicken and garlic rice burrito with tomatoes) but there really wasn't anything special about it or any of the tacos the rest of the people in my party of 7 were having.   Yes, the salsa is very unique - creamy as though it is an emulsion of oil and tomato with chiles and a nice spicy kick. (almost like a spicy aioli).    The chicken nachos were very good - nice big serving with lots of grilled chicken and cheese.  But at the end of the day, there was nothing remarkable about this place other than the long line.

I will say this - the staff is super helpful. The seating is very limited, so they will time your order if you tell them that you are eating "in".  They make sure you have a table first, then they sit you down and THEN they bring your food.  They won't prepare the food until you have a spot to sit.  This means that you get hot food and a place to sit, but it also means that if you order your food for "dine-in" then you won't get your food until there is a spot to sit.  They are very good about monitoring the small dining area and making sure no one grabs your spot, however.  +1 star for the service.

excerpts: Chicken adobo, garlic rice, and tomatoes in a burrito.
I was very curious about this because I like that kind of food
They made the chicken adobo really well
and it was tasty with the garlic rice and everything (as it should be).
I didn't see anything particularly dazzling about it though.
chicken.author: Sofia R.
chicken.review:
I stopped by here before leaving for class because I was really curious about their Mexipino burrito.

Mexipino burrito is supposed to be a fusion of Mexican and Filipino food. Chicken adobo, garlic rice, and tomatoes in a burrito. I was very curious about this because I like that kind of food and I wanted to see if Papalote would be able to make it right.

The burrito itself was okay. The fillings were great. They made the chicken adobo really well and it was tasty with the garlic rice and everything (as it should be). I didn't see anything particularly dazzling about it though. You get exactly what you ordered. 

I found that eating it with their famous salsa made it taste way better. I regretted not asking for extra salsa. 

Overall, pretty good burrito. Make sure you eat it with the salsa!

excerpts: That said, the chicken mole burrito was sensational.

Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken).
You don't even have to try!
Get the guac!

Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken).
You don't even have to try!
Get the guac!
chicken.author: Tuwie N.
chicken.review:
So, a classy burrito place is not an oxymoron! haha burritos here will set you a back a couple more bucks than your average mexican joint, but it is definitely delicious and worth it if you order right. That said, the chicken mole burrito was sensational. 
Chicken was tender to perfection, perfect blend of flavors in the mole sauce, and it was all wrapped and expertly melded together in such a way that every bite yielded ingredients in an appropriately proportional manner (i.e. you won't get a bite that's all rice/beans and no chicken). You don't even have to try! Get the guac! Get the cheese! 

The salsa that came with the chips (pretty sure it's free when you order, they just set it down on our table as we sat down after ordering) was unique and unlike any other salsa I've ever tasted. It looks and has the consistency of vodka sauce, but it is just the right amounts of creamy, spicy, tomato-y and tasty. amazing!

excerpts: Most burritos I have had before this one had rice, beans and a very small amount of chicken or beef.
Papalote Mexican Grill's burrito was perfect and full of flavor.
chicken.author: Alicia R.
chicken.review: One of my co-workers wanted to try this place after he heard they had the best burritos in town. Actually, Papalote Mexican Grill is known for its amazing super burritos. We arrived at 11:45am on a Friday and we had to wait about 10 minutes for our burritos. I had the Super Burrito and it was perfect!. The tortilla was toasted after it is made. It also had sour cream, guacamole and fresh cheese. It was the perfect amount of beans and other ingredients. Most burritos I have had before this one had rice, beans and a very small amount of chicken or beef. Papalote Mexican Grill's burrito was perfect and full of flavor.

excerpts: Don't get the pechuga en axiote, as the chicken is dry and what should be a complex blend of seasonings amounted to just salty and orange.
The chicken was accompanied by rice that was also salty, dry and orange
(oh, it's a theme!)
This is the kind of rice one might get served on an airplane flying from Toledo (Ohio) to Salt Lake City.
chicken.author: Ant C.
chicken.review:
First time here and maybe the food next time (never) will be better. Or maybe my standards for Mexican food have been set by the often amazing food available in Southern California. (Didn't mean for this to
turn into regional turf war, but this kind of mediocrity pisses me off.)

Don't get the pechuga en axiote, as the chicken is dry and what should be a complex blend of seasonings amounted to just salty and orange. 

The chicken was accompanied by rice that was also salty, dry and orange (oh, it's a theme!) This is the kind of rice one might get served on an airplane flying from Toledo (Ohio) to Salt Lake City.  Average beans.

My buddy ordered two burritos (he's an eater) and mid conversation, he said, "You know what? This food just isn't very good."

The guys who run the food to the tables were very nice.

This is also not a $ taqueria but a $$ restaurant that needs to better their food to make it worth their prices.

excerpts: I opted for the Mexipino Burrito-- adobo chicken, garlicky rice, and a tomato-ey pico salsa.
chicken.author: Neal C.
chicken.review:
Really good, inventive burritos. I would not suggest coming here expecting a traditional mission-style burrito. This is more creative and expensive than your El Farolito or La Taqueria. You are also getting a different experience. 

I opted for the Mexipino Burrito-- adobo chicken, garlicky rice, and a tomato-ey pico salsa. There isn't any cheese or guacamole, but the burrito gets plenty of flavor from the adobo and garlic rice. The rice was really a nice changeup from your typical white or Mexican rice as it added a lot of flavor-- not just filler and texture. 

The spot is pretty trendy and attracts more of a hipster crowd but it is a cool spot. The service is slow but this is mainly due to the demand and also the care they take in putting everything together.

excerpts: My chicken tacos consisted of lettuce and dry  grilled chicken.
I ate it
but it was boring
and I will not go back for tacos
, that is for sure.
chicken.author: J A.
chicken.review: I will agree the salsa is the best. My chicken tacos consisted of lettuce and dry  grilled chicken. I ate it but it was boring and I will not go back for tacos, that is for sure.

excerpts: As for me: chicken (the mole version is very nicely seasoned; oftentimes the meat of a burrito is an afterthought.
chicken.author: Johnny T.
chicken.review:
Beyond being an incredibly fun name to say,* the fine folks at Papalote are churning out tasty fare that may not be 100% authentic but it's mighty tasty to gringo tongues throughout the Bay area. I ate my burrito whilst sitting on a couch and drinking wine. No, that's not their set up (although, it's a winning idea; give me some commission on it), I ate from (my friends' home). Take out is the way to avoid the crazy lines and unwashed masses.

You'll also need time to prepare for the order because there are many options available to you: meat, super or not, type of tortilla, beans... this ain't your average slop-it-together-burrito joint. As for me: chicken (the mole version is very nicely seasoned; oftentimes the meat of a burrito is an afterthought. Not here), of course, super (cheese and double guac, hold the sour cream), spinach tortilla, and refried black beans. First off, the burrito (super!) was huge. It took all my fatty power and a lot of time to finish it. Come here hungry. Secondly, it's all about the guac. Like I mentioned earlier, the meat tasted great alone but pair it up with that guacamole? Goodness gracious. Delicious. I could have eaten that guac with a spoon... and I did because we ordered sides of guac, chips and salsa. All were magically delicious. My spinach tortilla wasn't as pronounced in flavor as I expected/hoped for, but there was so much going on on my plate that it wasn't that big of a deal. In a city that hypes its burrito prowess, Papalote is legit. I'd, gladly, come here again. I just made myself hungry writing this review.

*You just said it, didn't you?

excerpts: Anyway, after reading yelp reviews I ordered the chicken mole burrito.
The chicken was in huge hunks, rather than being properly shredded, and was BONE DRY.
We're talking difficult to chew dry.
The mole was bland.
The chips were stale.
All of that said, the salsa was delicious.
I think from now on I'll limit my purchases to the jars of salsa they sell at the cash register.
chicken.author: Becca F.
chicken.review: I really wanted to love this place but was disappointed.  Personally, I think this place is overhyped.  I'm a carnitas fan, which is not an option here.  What kind of taqueria doesn't have carnitas?  Anyway, after reading yelp reviews I ordered the chicken mole burrito.  The chicken was in huge hunks, rather than being properly shredded, and was BONE DRY.  We're talking difficult to chew dry.  The mole was bland.  The chips were stale.  All of that said, the salsa was delicious.  I think from now on I'll limit my purchases to the jars of salsa they sell at the cash register.

excerpts: I usually order the super burrito with chicken and it's always more food than I could handle.
My bf orders 2 chicken tacos and that comes with heaps of lettuce and fresh tomatoes.
I'll be sure to order tacos the next time I visit
chicken.author: Monica T.
chicken.review:
Papalote is known for their amazing orange salsa! I'd like to confirm that the amazing orange salsa is truly amazing. It's savory, flavorful, and has a spicy kick to it! They sell their sauce in packaged jars, I will probably pick up a bottle during my next visit

Every order comes with complimentary tortilla chips and the yummy salsa.

I usually order the super burrito with chicken and it's always more food than I could handle. The super burrito comes with sour cream, cheese, and guacamole in addition to the regular burrito filling (meat, rice, beans). And it usually comes with a small side of radish salad. My bf orders 2 chicken tacos and that comes with heaps of lettuce and fresh tomatoes. I'll be sure to order tacos the next time I visit - it looked fresh and delicious!

The restaurant is quite small and has limited seating, but it is overall clean and welcoming. 

Papalote is located in the Mission District and is just 1 block away from the 24th St and Mission St BART station. 

Papalote's delicious orange salsa is reason enough to give this place a try. It's soo gooood... YOU NEED TO TRY THE SALSA!

excerpts: If you are weakling when it comes to spice, get a chicken burrito and stick to the basic salsa they serve
and you'll be fine.
chicken.author: Alanna R.
chicken.review:
GREAT FOOD AND YUMMY BURRITOS 

BUT HOLY CRAP THE HABANERO RED LABEL SALSA IS SPICY! 

I occasionally buy a bottle of this salsa at Whole Foods and it gets my every time! I must be a complete masochist because it burns my tongue, mouth and stomach every time and yet I go back for more! 

The flavors are so complex and good that despite the burn, I love it. 

Try the restaurant and try the salsas. You won't be disappointed. However, not for the faint of heart. If you are weakling when it comes to spice, get a chicken burrito and stick to the basic salsa they serve and you'll be fine.

excerpts: The chicken is so tender!!
I'm pretty sure everyone watched the challenge between Bobby Flay VS PAPALOTE, so that's
enough said!
The salsa dip to the chips is great!!
chicken.author: Kathy V.
chicken.review:
This is the first place I experienced eating my first burrito!! LOL I've heard so many people rave about the Adobo Burrito, I decided I have to try it out. I ended up loving the burrito!! People may think that adobo is saucy and may drip, but not this one. It is very filling and has a kick to it! 

I've also tried the Triple Threat burrito! The chicken is so tender!! I'm pretty sure everyone watched the challenge between Bobby Flay VS PAPALOTE, so that's enough said! The salsa dip to the chips is great!!

excerpts: - marinated and grilled, white meat chicken - juicy
chicken.author: Earl G.
chicken.review:
Much respect to Team Papalote who represented SF well and handed Iron Chef Bobby Flay his ass on Food Network's "Throwdown - Burrito edition." 

I came here for lunch with some coworkers. The semi-long line moves fairly quickly, you place your order, take a seat, a person brings you chips with their signature orange salsa, and then your order. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=mhg77Sztnk2avL-lcA-sxg) 

Here's the breakdown for the champion "Triple Threat Burrito". 

- It's made to order since it took about 20 minutes to come out.
- 3 different types of meat, 
          - 4 grilled prawns - very juicy. 
          - marinated and grilled, white meat chicken - juicy 
          - carne asada - solid
- you get an extra side of their signature orange salsa
- it comes with this jicama? slaw
- you choose what type of beans you want (black, refried)
- then the kicker, it's $20 and it's the same size of a regular super burrito. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=eKBq5WSoQVZabdWyZf25qQ)

I did a doubletake on the $20 price tag but, it is, what it is and halved it with a coworker. This is what food history tastes like.

Overall, it's good, probably a 3 star burrito with 1 star value but I'll give them 4 stars because Bobby Flay is an arrogant SOB. Oh yeah, Iron Chef Flay always loses ethnic eats. 

Are you ready for a throwdown?

excerpts: Chicken was grilled to perfection, super juicy and not over cooked.
Highly recommended
chicken.author: Chris K.
chicken.review: Toasted tomato salsa is worth the trip alone! Chicken was grilled to perfection, super juicy and not over cooked. Highly recommended

excerpts: Sadly, the two burritios we split (chicken and steak) where a bit underwhelming and just didn't have the flavor we were hoping it would.
I mean, the steak one was still decent
but it wasn't "wow" or "amazing" in anyway to me, not to mention a bit over priced for a burrito in the Mission.
chicken.author: Petra S.
chicken.review:
I saw this place listed on 7X7 magazien's as being the # 1 burritio place winner a few years back and never really attempted to try it until I was doing a pet sit in the area last week. 

My husband was with me and we're both fans of thier salsa, which we buy at Whole Foods. Sadly, the two burritios we split (chicken and steak) where a bit underwhelming and just didn't have the flavor we were hoping it would. I mean, the steak one was still decent but it wasn't "wow" or "amazing" in anyway to me, not to mention a bit over priced for a burrito in the Mission. I think I still prefer El Farolito and so does my husband. 

I think we'll just stick with buying thier salsa but perhaps you might like them so do give them at least one try.

excerpts: Probably the best meat I've ever had in a burrito- the pieces of steak and chicken are lean and big and juicy and flavorful; very different from many Mexican food places where the meat is always greasy, minced to an oblivion and full of weird, chewy and fatty bites where you aren't quite sure what you just put in your mouth (icky)...
chicken.author: Gaby C.
chicken.review:
*I would actually rate this place 3.5 stars if I could, but since I can't, I'm going to have to round down in this instance*

So, I've been wanting to try this place since it was featured and won on a Throwdown with Bobby Flay episode years ago... Then, I wanted to try it even more when I read an article recently that named this place the Best Burrito in America.... I can't tell you the excitement I had inside- it was overwhelming.

Of course, the place was packed inside. It's a very small, cozy place with only a few tables... The seating is somewhat communal style, where you may or may not have to share the same table with other parties... It has a cool, vibe to it- fits right in in the Mission neighborhood.

You order at the front counter and then are asked to wait outside until they are able to seat your party. 

Obviously I ordered the $19.95 Triple Threat Burrito (Don't worry- I shared this with one other person) as that's the very burrito that beat out Bobby Flay and was mentioned in the article... P.s. It's an extra $0.99 for guacamole ... Why wouldn't a $20 burrito already have guacamole in it? (That extra $0.99 is actually for cheese, sour cream and guacamole but I don't eat cheese or sour cream) 

Once seated, they will bring you chips and salsa (it more looks like a slightly thick, smooth orangey sauce)... The chips are mediocre, but the salsa is really unique tasting and really yummy! 

The burrito was served very shortly after. It's huge! Thank goodness we decided to share.  So the burrito was really good... Really, really good... Probably the best meat I've ever had in a burrito- the pieces of steak and chicken are lean and big and juicy and flavorful; very different from many Mexican food places where the meat is always greasy, minced to an oblivion and full of weird, chewy and fatty bites where you aren't quite sure what you just put in your mouth (icky)... The shrimp is grilled to perfection and also bursting with flavor... All the meats are cooked to order and you really could taste the freshness in the cooking- it keeps you excited for each and every bite that you take.

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal... The high quality of the meat is definitely the highlight of this place.... But to me, they really need to improve their chip recipe and the fact that this place isn't what you would consider to be typical "Mexican taqueria style" food threw me off a little from what I was expecting... Also, in my opinion, America's best burrito is definitely not going to have black beans inside it. 

Okay, so maybe it's not the best burrito in my book, but I would say this place is definitely worth a try if you're in the area. 

Note: This place has tons of vegetarian options which was really cool to me.

excerpts: burrito of steak, chicken adobo, and shrimp, for $20!
Which is only missing their vegan items to be the whole menu.
Bobby Flay should just stick to barbeques.
Oh Papalote made a better burrito than Boby Flay on Throwdown?
Have you seen the show?
chicken.author: Leo M.
chicken.review:
Tastes alright. Really pricy for what me and my 7 other latino friends consider and rate as a "mediocre burrito". Just see who is sitting at the tables. Latinos? Nope.

Extremely limited meats for a mexican food place. look at the menu, the only worthwhile item is the Triple Threata burrito of steak, chicken adobo, and shrimp, for $20! Which is only missing their vegan items to be the whole menu. Bobby Flay should just stick to barbeques. Oh Papalote made a better burrito than Boby Flay on Throwdown? Have you seen the show? He never wins.

The jicama sample-size salad is ridiculous. The stale table chips a joke. The only thing ok is the salsa they sell and offer with the chips. Also the mexican coke and 7up.

Regardless, I wish this little restaurant well, I wont be coming back. But I hope they prosper in their own way.

excerpts: I love getting either the chicken burrito or the chicken tacos.
chicken.author: Jax B.
chicken.review:
Our go to place for good mexican food.  We usually end up there at least a few times a month.  I love getting either the chicken burrito or the chicken tacos.  Food is always fresh and very good tasting.

Love the salsa and it is nice you can buy a jar of fresh salsa there.  The jarred stuff in the stores doesn't taste quite the same to me.

Also, they are convenient to pick-up from;  I recommend calling your order in so you don't have to wait because they can get quite busy at peak times.

excerpts: : Came back here for dinner and have to say that garlic rice-chicken burrito special they have is the stuff of dreams.
Pure deliciousness served in a way-too-big portion.
chicken.author: Josephine L.
chicken.review:
LATIN-AMERICAN FOOD CRAWL IN THE MISSION: Creamy salsa


Update: Came back here for dinner and have to say that garlic rice-chicken burrito special they have is the stuff of dreams. Pure deliciousness served in a way-too-big portion. Mmmm!

...............................................

We stopped by here only to try the famous "creamy" salsa, which Papalote thankfully sells in a nice little container with plenty of homemade chips for under $2. I know it's hip to hate on the popular thing, but I loved the salsa (guess this is why I can never be a hipster). It had a delicious tomato base reminiscent of tomato sauce, but with lots of thick, rich creaminess mixed in. The usual flavors of cilantro and onions were missing, but I hardly noticed. If marinara sauce and alfredo sauce ever had a baby and added garlic to it, I imagine this is what it would taste like.

excerpts: $10 for a chicken burrito!
chicken.author: Zk K.
chicken.review:
$10 for a chicken burrito!  

I remember when this used to cost $6, so now feel like the owners are gouging their customers because of their current fame.

Also this place is 40% to 50% more expensive than other tacquerias 2 blocks away..

3.5 stars for the Burrito
Minus 1 star for jacking up their prices by 40%
Minus .5 stars for losing the original feel of a once great place. 

This Place is now for tourists and the Guy Fieri Food Network Types...
-------------------
2 Stars total

excerpts: We got a table right away and ordered marinated tofu tacos for me and mole chicken burrito for him.
chicken.author: Q D.
chicken.review:
Cute little place with good food. My boyfriend and I aren't locals so we were surprised at how packed everywhere in the Mission was on a Wednesday night. There was a line spilling onto the street when we first passed by so we looked for another place we heard about. That place was also full so we walked back up to Papalote and the line was basically gone. We got a table right away and ordered marinated tofu tacos for me and mole chicken burrito for him.

I liked my tacos even though they fell apart. The marinade was tasty so I definitely recommend anything with that but I think I would have enjoyed a burrito a little more. My boyfriend destroyed his burrito in no time, so I take it that it was delicious too. The salsa was awesome and I wish we bought some jars of it but we rushed out of there when another long line formed. I'm kind of sad that I'm back home already, cause I really would have liked to have tried their other stuff, as they are very vegetarian friendly and had more interesting flavors, unlike most Mexican places near me.

excerpts: and you really can taste each distinctive type of meat (carne asada, chicken, shrimp) inside the burrito... while they all somehow taste well together.
chicken.author: Chris P.
chicken.review:
Quick qualification, full disclosure: I worked the Food Network/Bobby Flay "Throwdown" production gig that featured the Triple Threat Burrito.

My rating really is closer to a 4.9 star rating buuuuut I still can't quite get passed the $20 price tag on the Triple Threat burrito, which happens to be my favorite thing here... that and their secret sauce salsa of course.

I, like a few others, without a doubt suggest you order 1 Triple Threat and split it with someone. It's large and awesome. It's always cooked just right and you really can taste each distinctive type of meat (carne asada, chicken, shrimp) inside the burrito... while they all somehow taste well together. Everything seems to be in just right the place.

I also usually order a quesadilla or something like that and spilt it with my fellow grubber.

P.S.- Totally nice staff, including the bros/owners that were featured on Bobby Flay's show.

excerpts: I remember that I really liked the carne asada burrito last year more than the chicken adobo burrito.
But my coworker said he really liked the adobo one better.
So my wily side came out
and I convinced him to half his adobo burrito with me
and I'll half my carne asada with him.
The chicken adobo burrito came out first.
I remember the last time I had it, it was kinda dry.
That wasn't the case this time.
It was actually pretty juicy.
The adobo flavor is definitely not the typical Filipino adobo flavor.
There's something different about it.
Maybe a Mexican touch?
I'm no chef
so I can't really say what it is.
Either way, it still tastes good.
I'd get it again.
On a side note, my coworker ordered it with no beans
and I think this was a genius decision.
I think beans would have messed up the harmony of the burrito overall.
The carne asada was just like I remembered it.
Juicy and tasty all around.
You can really taste the grill flavor in the meat.
It was actually a little more saltier than before, but I'm going to overlook that cuz I still enjoyed it.
Overall, I was thoroughly full.
Afterwards, I felt like my stomach was bulging and wished I could lay down and take a fat-ass nap.
I think there must be a school close by because the younger gen started to filter in as we were finishing our meal.
And that meant it was time to go back to work.
chicken.author: Joe M.
chicken.review:
I know what you're thinking...Come on, Joe.  Papalote was so last year.  Nah, man.  It's still hella good.  I hadn't been here since all the hype last year made the lines insanely long.  But I came here yesterday with my coworker around 1pm and the line was practically non-existent.  I remember that I really liked the carne asada burrito last year more than the chicken adobo burrito.  But my coworker said he really liked the adobo one better.  So my wily side came out and I convinced him to half his adobo burrito with me and I'll half my carne asada with him.  The best of both worlds!

I started my meal off with their nachos and signature salsa.  The spiciness of the salsa has a nice little kick to it that makes your mouth say, "Feed me another....and another.....one more......aw hell, just keep going."  I balanced it out with their freshly squeezed cantaloupe drink.  I frikkin' love freshly squeezed cantaloupe drinks! (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=Tk-JVGQ-oTYVcHBMxuxG5Q)

The chicken adobo burrito came out first.  I remember the last time I had it, it was kinda dry.  That wasn't the case this time.  It was actually pretty juicy.  The adobo flavor is definitely not the typical Filipino adobo flavor.  There's something different about it.  Maybe a Mexican touch?  I'm no chef so I can't really say what it is.  Either way, it still tastes good.  I'd get it again.  On a side note, my coworker ordered it with no beans and I think this was a genius decision.  I think beans would have messed up the harmony of the burrito overall. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/jwb3vTh8rn3OsN9wlI56-Q?select=F-QEBmUZwDW3MJ-y1suNvg)

The carne asada was just like I remembered it.  Juicy and tasty all around.  You can really taste the grill flavor in the meat.  It was actually a little more saltier than before, but I'm going to overlook that cuz I still enjoyed it.  Overall, I was thoroughly full.  Afterwards, I felt like my stomach was bulging and wished I could lay down and take a fat-ass nap.  I think there must be a school close by because the younger gen started to filter in as we were finishing our meal.  And that meant it was time to go back to work.

excerpts: I ordered a super chicken burrito and a horchata.
I had heard people rave about their salsa/secret sauce
so I also got an extra cup of it for 50 cents extra.
My total was $16!
On the other hand, they were generous with the chicken and the cheese was nicely melted.
It was also pretty big
chicken.author: Shelly P.
chicken.review:
Completely over-hyped. I couldn't be more puzzled as to how this place has been able to achieve its status as some of the best burritos and salsa in the Mission. I found both to be very mediocre and expensive.

You have to order something before you can sit down here. I arrived a little earlier than her and they wouldn't let me sit at a table while I waited for her even though there was space. Not a big deal, but worth noting. Ordering was painless enough, but boy were the prices high! I ordered a super chicken burrito and a horchata. I had heard people rave about their salsa/secret sauce so I also got an extra cup of it for 50 cents extra. My total was $16! My friend ordered guacamole and a naked burrito and her total was over $20. 

The food came, and to their credit, they got it out to us incredibly fast! I tried some of my friend's guacamole and it was very good and fresh, but still not $8.50-good. The salsa was definitely not anything to write home about, but it was kind of unique compared to most salsas and tasted fine. The chips on the other hand were pretty bad. Not inedible, but bad enough to where I abandoned them after the first three or four. But they were also free, so I guess that's forgivable. 

Then came the burrito and honestly, there just wasn't whole lot going on flavor-wise. It had everything I usually like, but for some reason I just felt like it was missing something, like there was no depth to the flavor. On the other hand, they were generous with the chicken and the cheese was nicely melted. It was also pretty big so I was able to bring some home. 

+1 star for having extra pieces of tin foil out for the customers to wrap their leftover burrito up in. I think this should be a standard at burrito places, but not enough of them do it.

excerpts: When I ordered the Chicken Mole plate the cashier asked me if I wanted to make it super.
I asked what that entailed and she said, "sour cream salsa and guacamole for $.99
" Uhhhhh como-what?
For SIXTEEN GOD DAMN DOLLARS
you guys aren't gonna slap some condiments on my plate?
I should have turned around and left at that moment or at least changed my order
but I just declined the super-cision and moved on.
Oh and if Papalote wants a lesson on how to make Mole I'd be happy to oblige.
I mean, on Mondays you can get the nectar of the Gods at Los Compadre's in South City on Grand Ave, but not even comparing it to that, Paplote's sucked.
Lay off the crunched up bran flakes!
Overall we spent almost $40 on 2 crappy skimpy plates, mine-bad mole his huevos
(his huevos machaca was pretty good tho) mushy over-cooked, over-stirred, cheapy-bought rice, really good refried beans, an insulting scoop of jicama salad and no god-damn condiments.
chicken.author: Emma H.
chicken.review:
I wish I could turn back time and never have chosen to go to this place for lunch yesterday. With the plethora of amazing food in sf, scratch that- in the area, scratch tha-t ON THAT ONE DAMN STREET! whhhyyy oh why did I chose a place with mediocre food and insane prices? 

Ok so their confusing weird menu offers 79 types of burritos or tacos at sort of decent prices or if you don't want a burrito you can choose an egg dish or a plate. When I ordered the Chicken Mole plate the cashier asked me if I wanted to make it super. I asked what that entailed and she said, "sour cream salsa and guacamole for $.99" Uhhhhh como-what? For SIXTEEN GOD DAMN DOLLARS you guys aren't gonna slap some condiments on my plate? I should have turned around and left at that moment or at least changed my order but I just declined the super-cision and moved on. Next we sat at a table and were brought a sugar bowl of chips and a salad-dressing cup of salsa which held 3 tablespoons of their overly-salty-not-as-good-as-pancho-villa salsa. 

My husband and I inhaled the salsa on 2 chips each and waited about 30 mins, drank all of our drinks then finally received our skimpy lame-ass non-condiment-having plates. I asked the food runner "can we have more salsa with our food?" and she said "yes but that's 50 cents" UM COMO WHAT? Are you people insane? You give out 2 tsp of salsa and then charge if somebody consumes it in 5.2 seconds? There should be disclaimers galore on those little shot glasses of sauce! We paid the stupid 50 cents because we basically had to, for we had no condiments on our stupid, un-super plate. We were given either 4 or 6 tortillas for 2 plates, my man eats minimum 6 tortillas so I had 1 and he the rest and we just packaged our food up to-go since we knew we'd be in for another up-charge if god forbid we want more of their crappy hard chewy tortillas. Oh and if Papalote wants a lesson on how to make Mole I'd be happy to oblige. I mean, on Mondays you can get the nectar of the Gods at Los Compadre's in South City on Grand Ave, but not even comparing it to that, Paplote's sucked.  Lay off the crunched up bran flakes! Wtf is that about? 

Overall we spent almost $40 on 2 crappy skimpy plates, mine-bad mole his huevos (his huevos machaca was pretty good tho) mushy over-cooked, over-stirred, cheapy-bought rice, really good refried beans, an insulting scoop of jicama salad and no god-damn condiments.

excerpts: My wife loves the Chicken Mole quesadilla (it's great).
I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito.
I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito.
chicken.author: Marcus C.
chicken.review:
Papolote has become a go-to for takeout Mexican. Tip top burritos and quesadillas with excellent house-made salsa/sauce and mediocre tortilla chips. My wife loves the Chicken Mole quesadilla (it's great). I tried the Chicken Mole burrito recently and felt like it was too runny/soupy for a burrito. It tastes great, but I prefer the more classic burrito offerings (from them and everyone else). 

If you haven't checked Papolote off your list of Mexican stops in the Mission, it's about time that you do.

excerpts: Papalote is REALLY proud of the fact that their "Triple Threat" (steak, chicken, shrimp) burrito beat
Iron Chef Bobby Flay's.
It's prominently advertised and mentioned by Papalote groupies.
And they charge $20.
I asked a friend who is a Papalote devotee if she wanted to split it, but was told it's not really that big.
But still $20?
I ordered the chicken burrito and got a Horchata too.
The chicken seemed shredded.
A little dry.
As I continued to eat it, it was good, but it did not wow me or fill me up at the end of the meal.
A good burrito.
Add a little salsa as you eat the burrito and it's better.
But this experience has inspired me to try other joints in the Mission for my next visit.
Maybe find some friends to go on a Mission burrito crawl.
chicken.author: Corey C.
chicken.review:
My first burrito in the Mission District!  Papalote was the first recommendation given to me when venturing into this mecca of big burrito lovers.  I'm not going to just meekly accept the assumption that all burritos from this area are better than anywhere else without validating this myself though.    

Going on a picturesque Sunday evening in August, it was surprisingly not too packed.  I have had longer waits at Chipotle.  The clientele here included mainly tourists and hipsters, here because of their devotion to a good burrito.  

Papalote is REALLY proud of the fact that their "Triple Threat" (steak, chicken, shrimp) burrito beat Iron Chef Bobby Flay's.  It's prominently advertised and mentioned by Papalote groupies.  And they charge $20.  I asked a friend who is a Papalote devotee if she wanted to split it, but was told it's not really that big.  But still $20?  Yeah, no thanks.

So you order at Papalote by telling them what you want, getting a number, taking it to your table, and waiting for them to bring it out.  I ordered the chicken burrito and got a Horchata too.  On to the chips and salsa.  The salsa is pretty awesome.  It tasted like a fire-roasted tomato-based red salsa, but is a little creamy too.  The chips were standard.  The horchata was a tad sweet for my taste.

The burrito came out after roughly 10 minutes.  Time to dig in!  Wait . . . no foil and it's on a plate?  Surely I don't have to eat this burrito with knife and fork? That's a little too formal for me, so I used my hands and picked it up.  First bite and I liked the flavor of the burrito.  The chicken seemed shredded.  A little dry.  As I continued to eat it, it was good, but it did not wow me or fill me up at the end of the meal.  A good burrito.  Add a little salsa as you eat the burrito and it's better.  But this experience has inspired me to try other joints in the Mission for my next visit.  Maybe find some friends to go on a Mission burrito crawl.

excerpts: Epic chicken mole tacos and roasted pepper salsa!!
chicken.author: Diana S.
chicken.review:
Epic chicken mole tacos and roasted pepper salsa!! Wish there was something that came close to the quality and deliciousness out here in NYC.

Tip: You can buy their salsa there, both fresh and bottled. I snagged a bottled jar and it made it through TSA just fine (in my checked luggage and wrapped up in clothes).

excerpts: I usually go with the steak or chicken super burrito with black beans.
The tacos are not good here.
chicken.author: Aaron L.
chicken.review: Consistently reliable and delicious, but way to expensive. I usually go with the steak or chicken super burrito with black beans. The tacos are not good here.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken burrito and my husband got a carne asada burrito.
They have whole wheat tortillas which is nice and the burrito has tons of flavor.
Make sure you get their signature sauce to dip your burrito in.
Don't get your food to go, doesn't do it justice.
chicken.author: Melissa S.
chicken.review: It's my second time here but I must say this experience was much better than the first time. The first time we took burritos to Dolores Park. Eating at the restaurant while you food is still piping hot is a much better option. We got the nachos which were delicious. Comes with Refried black beans and the cheese is melted perfectly. I ordered a chicken burrito and my husband got a carne asada burrito. They have whole wheat tortillas which is nice and the burrito has tons of flavor. Make sure you get their signature sauce to dip your burrito in. Don't get your food to go, doesn't do it justice.

excerpts: it has carne asada, chicken, prawns, Mexican rice, and of course sour cream and guacamole.
To be real
I don't even know if I went to the one from the show but cuuuh so dank. if you're in SF or just a tourist, I would definitely recommend coming here.
Sure $19.99 is pretty pricy for food
and it's probably a lot cheaper if you make it yourself but for the experience it's well worth it.
With that being said, I'm sure their other burritos are pretty dank as well
I think you could custom make your burritos too.
Also their sauce is pretty dank too like
it's not too spicy but not too mild.
I don't even really know if that made sense
but hey super good food!
shout outs to taco trip
chicken.author: Jaspur P.
chicken.review: so I was here in SF for the weekend with some homies and we decided to eat here because of this show called taco trips. the show itself is pretty freaking corny if you ask me but hey they do show some pretty good looking food. Anyways, DANK yo triple threat burrito for $19.99 i think $23 after tax. Definitely worth it. The burrito is pretty large in size. it has carne asada, chicken, prawns, Mexican rice, and of course sour cream and guacamole. To be real I don't even know if I went to the one from the show but cuuuh so dank. if you're in SF or just a tourist, I would definitely recommend coming here. Sure $19.99 is pretty pricy for food and it's probably a lot cheaper if you make it yourself but for the experience it's well worth it. With that being said, I'm sure their other burritos are pretty dank as well I think you could custom make your burritos too. Also their sauce is pretty dank too like it's not too spicy but not too mild. I don't even really know if that made sense but hey super good food! shout outs to taco trip

excerpts: The pollo asada (chicken) burrito I had was bland and tasteless.
Chicken had some sort of dry (emphasis on DRY)
rub on it to give it "flavor.
chicken.author: dude m.
chicken.review:
2 stars for the salsa (which is good) and the service, which was fine.

The answer to the question that many of you are wondering after eating here and wondering how this place gets voted the best burrito in SF may lie somewhere in the clientele that frequents the place and the people who do things like vote for best burrito.
 
I have a general rule when eating in an ethnic eatery in SF: if there are not people of that ethnicity eating at the establishment, it most likely isn't authentic, is usually pricey, and is not typically good. 

I imagine (just my observation as a native Californian of Mexican decent) that Papalote is popular among people who are a) not from California/San Francisco or any state that borders Mexico b) have never had good Mexican food or c) lack taste buds.

My observation and 2 cents below: 

1. Papalote does one thing well: salsa.

2. The chips are store bought dry and stale.  Fried tortilla strips = not that hard to make. But hey they are free. (But are they really at $9 for a burrito?)

3. The pollo asada (chicken) burrito I had was bland and tasteless. Chicken had some sort of dry (emphasis on DRY) rub on it to give it "flavor." I ordered my burrito with no rice (because that's how you do it) so I had a chance to get some beans which were ok when drenched in the house salsa.

4. My girlfriend ordered a VEGETARIAN burrito which was MOSTLY RICE and even included some grill CHUNKS OF BURNED MEAT. Obviously, this Mission establishment caters to mostly non-Latinos, many of whom (just a stretch since this is San Francisco we are talking about) are vegetarian. However, they do not separate or clear their grill for vegetarian orders. Minor to me since I eat meat but the GF, not so happy.

To bring it back around to the "best burrito in SF," Papalote is what I call a "gentrification joint."  With the influx of non-Latinos into a traditionally Latino neighborhood, we see more and more places pop up that water down the "tradicional," you know, to keep the neighborhood "authentico" and "diverse" with its new inhabitants. In come things like "voting for best you fill in the blank."

I have no advice for Paplote because they have found a niche and have even expanded into--surprise!--the NoPa neighborhood. 

The best burrito in SF they are not. To get that, you now have to venture way past the "best of" signs further out in the Mission and find that little place where meat is still slow cooked, beans are painstakingly prepared for days, tortillas come fresh off the grill, peppers marinate forever, and the abuelita behind the counter has trouble understanding you when you make you order in English.

excerpts: I asked the cashier if she recommended the chile verde or the chicken mole, and she said chile verde.
I'm terrified of how crappy the mole might be.
chicken.author: Naoko M.
chicken.review:
I was looking forward to finally going to Papalote and I have to say the hype is not worth it. Is the salsa delicious? Absolutely. That's about all I can say.

My gripes:
1) You can't "mix and match" your tacos - meaning, if you want to try two kinds of meat, you have to end up with 4 tacos. See, typically I go to taquerias and get 2 or 3 tacos, each with a different protein so I can sample. Much to my dismay, when I asked about this the nice lady said I have to get the 2 tacos.  That's kind of crappy.

2) The chile verde was pretty bad.  Despite having some heat, it was otherwise bland from the flavor side.  The pork was fake-tender. By that I mean, you could break of pieces easiily with a fork, but it was still dry. Clearly it had been simmering for too long in too high of heat. Even I, the home cook, know this - poor technique in the kitchen.  The scary part? I asked the cashier if she recommended the chile verde or the chicken mole, and she said chile verde. I'm terrified of how crappy the mole might be.

3) The tacos come covered in lettuce and tomatoes. What?  Why? There's so much of it too. I appreciate wanting to promote eating veggies and all, but I came here to eat a taco - with meat.  Not ok.

4) Guacamole - was also bland. I had to add some salt. There was no limey zip, and I'm not even sure how but I didn't really get the flavor of avocado. 

5) Service - When the gentleman brought out my tacos, I asked about my side of guac. He looked at the ticket in his hand, which I also saw, and it clear said "Chile Verde, Guacamole." He seemed very confused. My friend also pointed out that on her (separate) order, she had asked and paid for 2 extra salsas and those were not brought out either. He seemed confused and flustered. Eventually we got everything we needed but it wasn't like he was bringing out multiple plates of food at once. He literally was only carrying my tacos in one hand and the ticket that clearly stated "Guacamole" in the other.  Also, on an unrelated note - flies in the air. Not ideal.

This place is probably great for vegetarians/vegans who otherwise can't get Mexican food, but for us meat eaters, don't bother.  

2 stars for the salsa. Good news is you can buy jars of that stuff and never eat anything else here. That's probably my go-to plan from now on.

excerpts: The Grilled Chicken Burrito (with black beans, rice, and "salsa") is pretty bland.
Instead of their signature salsa, inexplicably you'll find a disappointing stand in of watery diced tomatoes and onions.
chicken.author: Amy C.
chicken.review:
Why You Gotta RESPECT Papalote:

1)  The Salsa

It is one of my favorites.  Made with smoked tomatoes and with enough heat to make your nose sweat a little, this orangey sauce is great any which way.  Go ahead and buy a jar to take home ($7) because that itty bitty container of SALSA with your CHIPS ain't gonna cut it.   

2)  They kicked some Food Network challenge booty.

While I like a Bobby Flay schooling as much as the next person, I'm actually not a Papalote burrito fan.  The Grilled Chicken Burrito (with black beans, rice, and "salsa") is pretty bland.  Instead of their signature salsa, inexplicably you'll find a disappointing stand in of watery diced tomatoes and onions.  The Grilled Veggies Burrito is a misnomer as it barely had any zucchini.  Next time, I'll get my salsa at Papalote and my burrito at El Farolito.

With some Bobby Flay schadenfreude on the side.

excerpts: it was the soyrizo burrito and the flavors were great, left the west for a while came back and now in 2014 had the super chicken burrito.
This place still has the consistently great flavor that it did 10 years ago.
chicken.author: Marc R.
chicken.review:
Had my first burrito of Papalote in 2004 it was the soyrizo burrito and the flavors were great, left the west for a while came back and now in 2014 had the super chicken burrito. This place still has the consistently great flavor that it did 10 years ago. Salsa is really good and chips are crisp and fresh. 

Only downside to this place is that it is cramped with very little seating when its busy also the line can get overwhelming for my likes. 

Pop in give it a try and see WHY they beat Bobby Flay at Salsa Cook Off!

excerpts: This creation, made with Filipino style chicken adobo (meat simmered in vinegar and soy with garlic), garlic rice, and tomatoes, generously wrapped in a flour tortilla is deeelocious!
At the recommendation of a friend/Papalote patron, I ordered the burrito "classic.
chicken.author: Tiffany E.
chicken.review:
I've been hearing about the Mexi-Pino burrito for quite some time now. This creation, made with Filipino style chicken adobo (meat simmered in vinegar and soy with garlic), garlic rice, and tomatoes, generously wrapped in a flour tortilla is deeelocious! At the recommendation of a friend/Papalote patron, I ordered the burrito "classic." You have to ask for "super" to get  the sour cream, cheese, and guac goodness. I'm usually a super burrito gal, so this plain version was new to me. The Mexi-Pino was still so tasty and I venture to say better as a "classic" because you can taste the flavor of the adobo. It was filling, yet not too heavy, and I walked out feeling muy feliz. 

Also, their salsa is pretty tasty with a little bite to it. I bought a jar of fresh made salsa and 2 extra burritos (for the husband and parentals) to bring home. The guy at the counter was really nice. He recommended the fresh salsa vs. the jars on the counter. He also hooked it up with a frequent customer card and marked off 3 burritos because he knew my sis and I had also just shared one in the dining area.

excerpts: Dried out chicken molé with almost no flavor, undercooked black beans, and dried out brown rice that tasted like cigarettes.
I threw most of it in the compost, complete waste of food, time, and money.
chicken.author: Matt O.
chicken.review: Dried out chicken molé with almost no flavor, undercooked black beans, and dried out brown rice that tasted like cigarettes. I threw most of it in the compost, complete waste of food, time, and money.

excerpts: The adobo chicken burrito, I think it's called the Mexipino.
Really delicious chicken, plus garlic rice.
It's perfect.
chicken.author: Marlena F.
chicken.review:
This is my favorite burrito spot in the Mission for 2 reasons:
1. The salsa is incredible! I think it's some kind of garlic emulsion or I don't know... I could eat it by the spoonful
2. The adobo chicken burrito, I think it's called the Mexipino. Really delicious chicken, plus garlic rice. It's perfect.

excerpts: They have one called the mexipino which has chicken adobo.
Never heard of anything like that so
, I want  to try it :].
The prices are good, service is normal, pretty small dining area, so the wait depends on how busy it is, but you can always take it to go.
chicken.author: Monica M.
chicken.review:
This place is pretty darn good. Tried it because of all the yelp reviews and was not disappointed. When I first walked in, I saw all these newspaper clippings and what not about their amazing food, so that was a big plus. Their burritos are even mentioned in being one of the best in CA. Shared the food, so I was able to try both the super nachos and super quesadilla. Both were very good! They also have some sort of special salsa (that they make I guess), it's pretty tastey and I haven't had any salsa like it before. They gave us a lot of chips too :).
I want to come back and try their burritos. They have one called the mexipino which has chicken adobo. Never heard of anything like that so, I want  to try it :].
The prices are good, service is normal, pretty small dining area, so the wait depends on how busy it is, but you can always take it to go.

excerpts: I had the chicken burrito
, I really liked it, I'm more of a chicken person than steak person.
My sister tried the 'mexipino' it's mexican and filipino food mixed together in a burrito.
All I know it had chicken, but adobo style.
It was really good, trust me.
That's a must try when you go there.
chicken.author: Ivadine M.
chicken.review:
One of the best Mexican foods I have ever tried. I was shocked when there was a picture of Bobby Flay on the wall, b/c apparently he had a throwdown there, and apparently he lost, so had to go try that place. 

This place was kind of small, it's kind of packed, but it's packed because it was really good. I had the chicken burrito, I really liked it, I'm more of a chicken person than steak person. My sister tried the 'mexipino' it's mexican and filipino food mixed together in a burrito. All I know it had chicken, but adobo style. It was really good, trust me. That's a must try when you go there. 
Also the carne asada nachos was really delicious. That's a must try also.

Service was friendly. 
Parking was pretty tough.
And finding a seat for 6 people was pretty difficult.
Food was great though. 

Go here if you're ever in San Francisco.

excerpts: $13.31 for a chicken burrito....
No thanks, never again...
Better places in the Mission that's half the price....
chicken.author: Captain C.
chicken.review: $13.31 for a chicken burrito....No thanks, never again...Better places in the Mission that's half the price....

excerpts: My friend and I waited patiently and ordered a Chile Verde Super Burrito (chicken simmered in chile verde with rice, black beans, guacamole, cheese and sour cream).
chicken.author: Lauren B.
chicken.review:
You can Papalome any day!

Ahem...moving on.  This place came highly recommended by many people.  So I went with high expectations.  The place already had a pretty good line at 6pm on a Thursday.  My friend and I waited patiently and ordered a Chile Verde Super Burrito (chicken simmered in chile verde with rice, black beans, guacamole, cheese and sour cream).

The burrito itself was fantastic, the guac tasted like it was whipped or something and the overall flavors of the burrito itself were delicious and filling, while using a minimal amount of oil so I didn't feel gross afterwards.

However - I did take away one star since my friend and I waited for 40 minutes and after we kept seeing others get their food, I went in to inquire about the burrito status since my hanger   pains were setting in. The guy at the counter laughed and was like "It looks like they lost your slip, no worries - ok?"

While it was not an issue per say, I was pissed because I was hungry and after all was said it done it took us 50 minutes to order and get our food. Not to mention the guy just laughed about it - not cool. Next time I will be calling ahead - since their burritos are too delicious to ignore.

excerpts: Next, being that I'm Filipino, I specifically came here for the "Mexipino" (chicken adobo burrito) and
boy did it live up to the hype.
" (steak, shrimp, & chicken).
A lil pricy at $20, but I think it's worth it.
It's one of those
"you gotta try it once" kinda things.
chicken.author: Juno M.
chicken.review:
Finally had this yesterday, and it was definitely worth the Bart trip from Union City to the Mission district.

First off, their homemade salsa tops everything I've had in my Mexican dining experience. It's a must-have when you visit.

Next, being that I'm Filipino, I specifically came here for the "Mexipino" (chicken adobo burrito) and boy did it live up to the hype. Very light and flavorful.

AIso had some of my fiancee's "Triple Threat" (steak, shrimp, & chicken). A lil pricy at $20, but I think it's worth it. It's one of those "you gotta try it once" kinda things. Just as flavorful as the Mexipino, but I can't say better.

Have their horchata too!

excerpts:
Such a disappointment ;(

I was looking forward to this place because I saw that they had the chicken adobo burrito, but it was such a fail.
chicken.author: Camila A.
chicken.review:
Such a disappointment ;(

I was looking forward to this place because I saw that they had the chicken adobo burrito, but it was such a fail.
