You'd think since they were on the food network, they'd hold up to standards but there was no adobo flavor to it! My bf had the crane Asada burrito and honestly the two tasted the same. Meat was dry and they put too much rice. Nothing spectacular. 

I wouldn't go back here again, there are probably better Mexican joints around so save yourself the trip.

excerpts: The burrito was good, but it wasn't as good as the regular chicken burritos that I have had elsewhere.
It feels like it's missing some sauce.
chicken.author: Elaine Y.
chicken.review:
After hearing all the reviews about this place and seeing it on Bobby Flay's show, thought it was time to give this place a try. I might have hyped this place up too much and I was a little bit disappointed. One mistake I made was to order something that the reviews were suggesting. Papalote is known for their Triple Threat Burrito and have high reviews on the prawn burrito, but I went with the Marinated Tofu. Typical me for always doing something different from the general population. The burrito was good, but it wasn't as good as the regular chicken burritos that I have had elsewhere. It feels like it's missing some sauce. It was really nice that Papalote is so generous with their ingredients and packed the burrito with beans, rice, sour cream, gracamole, and meat, but it tasted a bit on the dry side.

Their chips and salsa is good. Their house salsa is definitely their specialty. They sell them in jars at the restaurant. If I were to return, I will stick with what people like and try the prawn burrito.

excerpts: the other burritos that are good are soy riso and chicken.
so so so safe and such a solid meal for about $8.
if you're not a big eater, you can always save half of it for later, which makes an amazing meal or even better - amazing drunk food!
chicken.author: Priya G.
chicken.review:
Can I say BEST BURRITO in san francisco? this place is so delicious i don't even know what to say about it. 

my go-to burrito here is the grilled veggie one - i just love the fresh vegetables that they use and it's good to always make it SUPER (guac, sour cream, and cheese) and i usually get black beans and throw it into a spinach tortilla. nomtastic. the other burritos that are good are soy riso and chicken. so so so safe and such a solid meal for about $8. if you're not a big eater, you can always save half of it for later, which makes an amazing meal or even better - amazing drunk food! (haha)

their special sauce is tasty and if you want more, i believe its $0.50 for each extra cup of it. i would get more - i usually have a cup for just the chips, and another cup just for my burrito.

thank you sf for the best burrito in the world!!!!!! love you.

excerpts: there is no taste, they got 3 types of meats carne asada which was tender and juicy, shredded chicken decent size
cut not dry but
chicken.author: Clarence A.
chicken.review:
I've read the reviews, I've tried there food, honestly I don't even know how this spot got such a high star rating, I give this place a bare 3 stars only reason I didn't give it 2 stars was there sauce they offered, that orange spicy sauce you sprinkle or dip on everything.

Ok here is what we tried:
Ultimate Burrito also know as the Triple Threat i was told- grade D+ there is no taste, they got 3 types of meats carne asada which was tender and juicy, shredded chicken decent size cut not dry but no flavor, the shrimp I think there were like 4 or 5 in it but they pile them all on one side so when you whatever side you start on if you get the shrimp enjoy it you will probably get maybe 4-5 bites in then no more shrimp haha.

we also tried there shrimp quesidilla- super oily, dipping it in the orange sauce gives it some flavor eating it alone you will need salt

The Chorizo Nacho Plate - this plate had to say is kinda what saved face for the restuarant for me but there was some dislikes, shady on the guac, sourcream, and even cheese camon now folks you get lets just say it is about maybe 3tsp of each sourcream & guac if you ask for more it is $1 more, condiments $1 more horrible but taste wise of the nachos with the chorizo and beans all good.

next time your out there just get the chorizo nachos don't spend $20+ for a burrito, there are plenty other mexican restuarants in the bay area you can go to and get 2 of the meats added for about $5-$8 same price but not 3meats.

Only reason I visited this place was due to Bobby Flay and his throwdown sad to say folks been to Bobby Flay's resturant in Vegas food there is blah literally bland and expensive, there are several other spots you can get a decent burrito in the city, this unfortunately is not one of them, if you do go stick with the chorizo nachos and try to get some of that togo orange sauce

ultimate burrito/ triple threat - FAIL ** at best only 2 stars
quesidilla ** super oily no taste drench it in the orange sauce then it makes it *** 1/2
chorizo nachos **** only thing i liked that i tried but it does have its flaws
service *** they are kinda fast
price $ moderate all around the board all $8 except for the triple threat/ultimate burrito $20+
ambiance *** small but clean, tiles on everything

excerpts: Whoevers idea it was to put Chicken Adobo in a burrito is quite amazing in my book.
The Chicken Adobo Burrito is not on the menu but was recommended by friends who've been to Papalote before and boy I'm glad they did.
I can seriously eat Chicken Adobo plain and having it in my burrito was perfect.
The portions here kinda big for a small girl like myself
so I split half a burrito- great advice for those sharing a meal.
Plus you get chips and dip complimentary before your meal!
chicken.author: Janet N.
chicken.review:
Working with Korean and Mexican fusion food really has taken a toll on my view on burritos, quesadillas and the like. Don't get me wrong I love Mexican food with a passion. 

It was refreshing to come to a place that had everything right going on with their food, but somewhat unexpected. Hello? Whoevers idea it was to put Chicken Adobo in a burrito is quite amazing in my book.

The Chicken Adobo Burrito is not on the menu but was recommended by friends who've been to Papalote before and boy I'm glad they did. I can seriously eat Chicken Adobo plain and having it in my burrito was perfect. The portions here kinda big for a small girl like myself so I split half a burrito- great advice for those sharing a meal. Plus you get chips and dip complimentary before your meal! Be careful the dip is a bit spicy, but addicting.

Pair your meal with a Jarritos or Pure Cane Sugar Cola!

Though the food was delicious, our service kinda sucked to be honest. Half of the table got their food and decided to wait for the other half to receive their food. Probably 10 minutes later we asked 2 waiters about our food and said they'd check the kitchen only to come back saying it was coming out. The other half the table was famished beyond words to wait longer and finished. Then our food finally came out ... with no apology either. Huh? I guess so ... 4 stars for the food itself, service that's another question.

excerpts: The guacamole is average, the marinated chicken is fantastically tender.
chicken.author: Christian W.
chicken.review:
That creamy smoky salsa is perfect.  There's almost nothing else like it. In fact, it's a closely guarded treasure. You only get one little cup of salsa and extra salsa will cost you.  The guacamole is average, the marinated chicken is fantastically tender.  Slightly more costly than your typical grullenese. 

I'm tempted to buy their prepacked salsa, however, I'm not sure if its the same stuff.  Overall, a great burrito.

excerpts: (I wish that 90% of "vegetarian" burritos in this city weren't filled with lard and chicken stock.)
chicken.author: J K.
chicken.review:
This is probably my favorite burrito place, due to their vegetarian friendliness.  (I wish that 90% of "vegetarian" burritos in this city weren't filled with lard and chicken stock.)  Sure, I liked it better before it was overflowing with Mission hipsters, but what can you do...

The salsa is awesome and those teeny tiny containers aren't nearly big enough.  I really hope I don't find out that its secret ingredient isn't beef or something, cause I do love it. 

The only downside is its priciness.  If only there was a way to get tofu/soyrizo AND veggies without it costing so much!  No matter what I order I end up overspending.  And if I'm getting really nit-picky, I have noticed the burritos have been pretty rice-heavy lately.

Tip: If you eat in, your burrito won't be wrapped in foil, so you'll be risking the always embarrassing burrito "spill-out" all over your plate.

excerpts: It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned.
Errr, where was the garlic friend rice?
The rice used was the standard burrito rice.
The tortilla was the only thing that stood out.
It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky.
I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.
chicken.author: Cherylynn N.
chicken.review:
My sleep cycle is all messed up...I get more rest on the weekends sleeping for 3 hours than on the weeknights sleeping for 6 hours. Erm, must be the alkie? :X  

It's 1 AM on Thursday Morning and while I should be "attempting" to sleep, my eyes are glued to  an episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay". For 26 minutes, my mouth was salivating at the thought of meeting the "Triple Threat" one day; needless to say, it was another sleepless night. *sigh*

My friends and I came here yesterday at 12ish and luckily, we came at just the right time before it started getting busy.

FOOD:
*Chips & Salsa (#46 on the 7x7 list): The chips were slightly warm, thin, and crisp with just the right amount of salt. Ahhhhh, the salsa....the BEST freaking salsa EVER! The salsa was emulsified to perfect creamy consistency. As it hits your palette and moves around your mouth, you can taste all the fresh ingredients (the charred tomatoes, garlic, onion, chilies, and cilantro) sink into your taste buds. It had the perfect blend of savory, smokiness, acidity, and fiery kick to it! This is the ONLY thing that lives up to the HYPE!

*Triple Threat (super w/ sour cream & guac): HOLY MOLEY! $20 for a freaking burrito?!?!? The burrito was a regular size burrito that you would find from any taqueria. It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp. The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender. The sour cream and guac are a must as it added a slight tartness and creaminess to balance out all the flavors.

*Ode to Poleng Adobe Burrito: FAIL! If you're expecting the garlicy, peppery soysauce vinegary taste that makes your lips pucker type of Adobo, you will be sadly disappointed. The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned. Errr, where was the garlic friend rice? The rice used was the standard burrito rice. The tortilla was the only thing that stood out. It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky. All in all, the burrito lacked any real flavor and was quite dry b/c there was no sauce or salsa in it).

DRINKS:
Papalote has a selection of sodas, juices, and Mexican beer. I have to note that their refrigeration system was not working properly yesterday as our drinks were room temperature.

PRICES:
WAY OVERPRICED! A regular burrito is about $8 and an extra $1 to make it super (sour cream and guac). The size of their regular burritos are quite small (approx 7' and 2.5' in diameter) compared to other taquerias in The Mission.

Although the Triple Threat was good; it was NO where near a $20 good! To me, Mexican food is just like Chinese food; you shouldn't have to pay much to get good-tasting food. And, I really think the "hype" has allowed Papalote to capitalize on its customers by charging such ludicrous prices. 

SERVICE:
Order your food at the counter, grab a number, and the server will being you your order when it's ready. The chips and salsa came first and it took about 15 minutes to get our burritos.    

AMBIANCE: 
Very funky hipster type feel with the bright red walls with colorful panting and reggae music playing in the background. 

PARKING: 
Difficult street parking around Valencia and Mission streets. However, Guerrero street seemed to have some available non-metered spots. 

Would I return? I would only return for the chips and salsa. Other than that, Papalote is WAY OVERYHYPED and OVERPRICED. I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.

excerpts: Chicken Burrito was ok but had better down the block.
Got the other burrito wrong too.
Nickel and dime customers.
Lady behind the customer had attitude.
chicken.author: Fred O.
chicken.review: Paid $14.68 for two Pacifico beers. A little over priced especially since the microbrew down the block charged $12 for 2 higher quality brews . $.50 each if you want any extra salsa. Other places are free! Chicken Burrito was ok but had better down the block. Got the other burrito wrong too. Nickel and dime customers. Lady behind the customer had attitude.

excerpts: It combines magically with the Filipino style Adobo Chicken and guacomole.
Absolutely, mouth wateringly delicious.
chicken.author: Serena Q.
chicken.review:
Two words: Mexipino burrito. 

Quite possibly the best burrito I have ever had. The secret ingredient is Garlic Fried Rice. It is sticky and soft and SO flavorful. It combines magically with the Filipino style Adobo Chicken and guacomole. Absolutely, mouth wateringly delicious.

excerpts: The adobo chicken in it was flavorful and moist and the burrito overall wasn't bland by any means.
chicken.author: Adlyn S.
chicken.review:
Came at the perfect time...2:30ish on a Tuesday. Found FREE parking right around the corner and it wasn't crowded at all. 

To put it simply, I am burrito-skeptic. I feel like there is no such thing as an AMAZING burrito. I've tried La Taqueria's but I still found it to be a "non-craving" burrito...so I usually stick to tacos or quesedillas. I decided to give Papalote's burrito a chance since I saw all these awards for it in the restaurant. I ordered the Mexipino since i LOOOOVE Filipino food. The adobo chicken in it was flavorful and moist and the burrito overall wasn't bland by any means. The garlic rice in it wasn't too garlicy either, but in a good way. 

Thank you Papalote for being my go to burrito spot! Finally!

excerpts: We ordered the mole chicken tacos and chile verde with pork.
The tortillas were super soft and not dried out.
The tomatoes and lettuce on top were very fresh.
The chile verde was just YUMMY!
The mole was a bit over powering and thick.
This is the best taco in town!
Will come back again for sure!
chicken.author: Irene C.
chicken.review:
Order at front and get seated.  They'll bring you warm tortilla chips and "salsa" to your table.  The "salsa" isn't your typical chopped tomatoes and onion but very spicy roasted tomato dip.

We ordered the mole chicken tacos and chile verde with pork.  The tortillas were super soft and not dried out.  The tomatoes and lettuce on top were very fresh.  The chile verde was just YUMMY!  The mole was a bit over powering and thick.  This is the best taco in town!  Will come back again for sure!

excerpts: The steak and chicken isn't made in mass quantities and dumped into containers to be heated under a lamp or in hot water.
chicken.author: Ed C.
chicken.review:
This ain't your run-of-the-mill taqueria ova here.

Papalote kicked Bobby Flay's ass on Throwdown and for good reason, their burritos are the bomb yo!

Everything is made to order. That's right, made to order. Grilled fresh in front of yo face! The steak and chicken isn't made in mass quantities and dumped into containers to be heated under a lamp or in hot water.  Everything is flame grilled when you order it and you can taste it.

To top everything off is Papalote's world famous salsa. The salsa is so good that it has it's own Twitter page (http://twitter.com/papalotesalsa) and it has more followers than me! The salsa is a taste of pure evilness with a side of quintessential bliss.

I heart burritos.

excerpts: It was a Chicken Asada Burrito with Cheese and Guacamole, practically a super no less.
chicken.author: Rebekah T.
chicken.review:
I'm not going to say it was the best burrito I've had, but I ate the whole damn thing! 

That's an not only a sign of a great burrito, it's also accomplishment. I never eat a whole burrito, not even on my hungriest day. It was a Chicken Asada Burrito with Cheese and Guacamole, practically a super no less. 

So I was told to get an "extra"salsa, which they will change extra for. I wish I would have known that it was going to be that great - I would have doubled up that order.

The wait was not long at all. I'm not bothered to wait for a few minutes to get hot, freshly prepared food - after all, I'd like to think of this as a healthier alternative to fast food joints.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken salad with the cilantro sauce.
Yummy!
It is one of the hardiest salads I have ever eaten.
You'll be full guaranteed.
chicken.author: Lauren H.
chicken.review: First off, their sauce is aweeesome.. I was sweating. Free chips and salsa which is a plus in my book. I ordered the chicken salad with the cilantro sauce. Yummy! It is one of the hardiest salads I have ever eaten. You'll be full guaranteed. We ordered the shrimp and streak super burrrito. Delicious! Its large. Massive food coma afterwards no doubt. Last note, the triple threat is not made for 1!

excerpts: Pollo Burrito (grilled to order chicken breast) for about $8.50 plus tax.
It was a hefty size.
Not huge not small (maybe 6 or 7 in long, 4 in thick).
The chicken wasn't too dry (which is good for me) and the extras were somewhat adequate, but for my personal taste I would've wanted more guacamole and cheese
:p
The tortilla itself was slightly crispy, not too soft at all which is what I'm used to.
chicken.author: Geraldine T.
chicken.review:
My bf was craving burritos ever since he moved to the east coast, so when we were visiting SF this past month, he wanted to check this place out. I ordered the Super (which is sour cream, cheese, guacamole for 99 cents extra) Pollo Burrito (grilled to order chicken breast) for about $8.50 plus tax. It was a hefty size. Not huge not small (maybe 6 or 7 in long, 4 in thick). The chicken wasn't too dry (which is good for me) and the extras were somewhat adequate, but for my personal taste I would've wanted more guacamole and cheese :p The tortilla itself was slightly crispy, not too soft at all which is what I'm used to. And the burrito was wrapped nicely, but if you aren't in the mood to pig out in public, they provide you with knife and fork to eat it more in a more domesticated fashion :p 

The ambiance: almost cramped. The ordering space is quite small. You walk in, and the registers are right there. There's a sign saying wait to be seated, but I don't think that should be there because you actually look for seating and seat yourself. It's cafeteria style seating. We went around 2-3pm ish and it was busy. We were lucky to find three spots open. 

When you sit, someone serves you and each of your party with yummy homemade? tortillas and spicy salsa. And if you don't feel like spending extra money on a soda, they offer "get it yourself" water and small washable cups in the corner. I can vouch that they're clean. And if you want your burrito to go, there's foil wrap next to the water. The service was nice. Friendly.

If I wasn't already full I would've devoured my burrito T_T

excerpts: I got a chicken mole super burrito for $7.93.

The mole was pretty good, as was all the other fillings:
+
+ Chicken = Shredded and tender perfect chompos for me to eats!
+ Guac
= Mush!
Texture, flavor, aesthetically pleasing.
Who doesn't like avocados?
chicken.author: Vivian C.
chicken.review:
My first excursion to Papalote today was pretty good.

This is actually 3.5 stars, rounded down because, well, 4 stars means it's got to be really solid, and Papalote's kind of there, but just not quite. 

Some observations, aite here we goes:

1. They take card.  Woot! For a moment, after I stepped in, I panicked because I thought I wouldn't be able to get a burrito since I hardly ever carry around cash.  But phew!  They do!  And then I said to myself, "Oh silly, of COURSE they take card!  Gringo burrito place, duh!"  

2. I got a chicken mole super burrito for $7.93.  The mole was pretty good, as was all the other fillings:
+ Cheese = MELTED, I approve.
+ Black Beans = Soft and flavorful, good job there!
+ Chicken = Shredded and tender perfect chompos for me to eats!  
+ Guac = Mush! Texture, flavor, aesthetically pleasing.  Who doesn't like avocados?
+ Rice = Soft, just right. 

3.  Good location, close to the 24th/Mission BART.  Even though I work in the FiDi, I can easily BART here and back during a lunch break and still have time to spare.  

4.  Hipster paradise indeed.  There were two very nice girls in front of me, with cute bags and flowy skirts and interesting hair.  Such a nice, appropriate place for the hipsters, hippies, and happy white people.  

5.  So, I tried their chips and salsa finally.  It's on that 7x7 "100 Things to Eat in SF" list.  There must be something wrong with my taste buds.  The chips were not that great, nothing special.  You want awesome chips?  Tropisueno's got awesome chips!  The salsa, however, was bangin'.  Unfortunately, I can't take the heat, and one tiny taste set my entire mouth on fire.  It was good, yes, but painful.  

So, why the 3.5 stars?  This review seems to suggest a solid 4, maybe more, right?  Well, I mean, I definitely LIKED my burrito, but it was just...not totally 100% there. . .  

You know what I mean?  Imagine meeting a person, or attending a class, and even though he/she/it is perfectly fine and nice and all, you're just not blown away.  

And you could go either way, go with it, or not.  That's kind of how I felt about Papalote after my meal.  Certainly a decent meal, but I'm not about to jump around recommending it to everyone I know.  

No, no, that shameless plugging is still reserved for my all-time favorite, El Farolito. 

But Papalote?  Eh, she's alright.

excerpts: I started to think about burritos that I liked in the past: the chicken tinga and al pastor burritos from Maya's (RIP) and the burritos from La Vic's in San Jose and Los Morenos in San Mateo.
I remembered that the Maya's burritos were special because they were juicy and had unique sweet and spicy flavor combinations.
chicken.author: James Y.
chicken.review:
After some deep self-reflection, I've decided that I'm not really a fan of traditional burritos. 

The first inklings came when we tried the carne asada burrito at Papalote. This was one of the burrito-eater's top-rated burritos, consistently scoring over 8.5 mustaches on each review but I didn't think it was anything special. 

I had the same experience again at El Farolito and again at Taqueria Cancun, two of the other Mission burrito heavyweights. They were good burritos, but not something I'd actively covet.

Why wasn't I impressed by any of these burritos? It kind of bothered me. 

I started to think about burritos that I liked in the past: the chicken tinga and al pastor burritos from Maya's (RIP) and the burritos from La Vic's in San Jose and Los Morenos in San Mateo. I remembered that the Maya's burritos were special because they were juicy and had unique sweet and spicy flavor combinations. La Vic's and Los Morenos had average burritos but both places provided amazing orange sauce that you could slather on in between each bite. 

Then I understood why even the best traditional burritos don't offer enough to keep me interested: I like my burritos to be sweet, spicy, and moist and cheesy enough to keep everything together. 

Sorry, Papalote. You're good, but I think I'm in a place where I need a sauced up burrito.

If anyone has any recommendations, send them over!

excerpts: The chicken was even more fall apart tender than the traditional Mexican options.
The adobo flavor was thankfully high on the garlic, soy and pepper while not getting overly vinegary.
No beans because that would have been weird.
The garlic rice was a nice touch to add an extra bit of zing.
What a great, portable way to enjoy Filipino food!
Chicken Mole: Chocolatey and pasty
The chicken was a tad firm, perhaps they should stew it longer?
chicken.author: Adam B.
chicken.review:
The best (and only) Adobo Burrito I've ever had is from Papalote's secret menu!  I thought I was over Mexican food since Mexican food is so overexposed in the Mission, but Filipino fusion helps breath new vida into it.  The non-Filipino fusion food is good, but not by as large a margin.

Adobo Burrito: This was my reason for coming here and it did not disappoint.  The chicken was even more fall apart tender than the traditional Mexican options.  The adobo flavor was thankfully high on the garlic, soy and pepper while not getting overly vinegary.  No beans because that would have been weird.  The garlic rice was a nice touch to add an extra bit of zing.  What a great, portable way to enjoy Filipino food!  Now if only they'd do pork adobo...

Chicken Mole: Chocolatey and pasty, this is pretty decent mole.  The chicken was a tad firm, perhaps they should stew it longer?

Refried Beans: I liked the concept of refried black beans because pintos usually get all the refrying action.  Heavier than the pinto though.

Rice: Standard.  Was disappointed with my side since the garlic rice in the adobo burrito was way better!

Chips & Salsa: Pretty nice for free (with purchase of a meal).  The chips were standard, but the salsa was great!  Smoky and creamy.  No wonder why people rave about this compared to the more standard varieties all over the Mission.

excerpts: My buddy and I both ordered the Vegan Adobo burrito (tofu substitute for chicken).
chicken.author: Cipriano G.
chicken.review:
Only been here once (so far) and it was two nights after the premiere of the Bobby Flay's Throwdown episode last week for their "Triple Threat" burrito, which I am waiting to devour in the near future.

My buddy and I both ordered the Vegan Adobo burrito (tofu substitute for chicken). I forgot to make it a super burrito, but later thankful for not doing so because I was able to enjoy the burrito in all its natural glory, adobo. 

We both engulfed our burritos in a matter of minutes, and their special sauce didn't help!!! IT'S SO GOOD. There's a hint of spice to it, which I enjoyed!

I haven't seen the one on Fulton yet, although it's not too far from my own place, versus this one on 24th Street. This place is a little on the small side, but if you're just going to order a burrito, you don't need a table. You might need a chair to hold you up after nearly dying from the deliciousness of the first bite. :D

The pricing is pretty "standard" especially around here in the mission.

excerpts: THEIR ADOBO CHICKEN BURRITO IS BOMB! =]
because I've had better burritos and quesadillas at other places in Mission, but I gotta give props for their adobo chicken
burrito because it's damn delicious and unforgettable for sure.
Who would've thought Filipino food and Mexican food is such a good match?
chicken.author: Arika I.
chicken.review:
I'll keep this simple and short but..

THEIR ADOBO CHICKEN BURRITO IS BOMB! =] 

I can't give this place a 5-star because I've had better burritos and quesadillas at other places in Mission, but I gotta give props for their adobo chicken burrito because it's damn delicious and unforgettable for sure. Who would've thought Filipino food and Mexican food is such a good match?

excerpts: The chicken that was covered by the mole was DRY DRY DRY.
Biting into it wasn't soft and juicy
, rather it was hard and chewy.
Last thing was I asked for no lettuce (lettuce is a cheap way to 'fill').
chicken.author: Mark M.
chicken.review:
I know I know...it's supposed to be better. I've heard for years how great the food was. I (sadly) won't be going back.

MY GO-TO TAQUERIA
Zapata - 18th/Collingwood

I ordered two tacos and went for the Mole. Woman at the counter couldn't recommend because she doesn't like mole, well, I should have gone with her "no like". I LOVE mole, and this was bad; watery, thin, blach. The chicken that was covered by the mole was DRY DRY DRY. Biting into it wasn't soft and juicy, rather it was hard and chewy. Last thing was I asked for no lettuce (lettuce is a cheap way to 'fill'). Unfortunately lettuce was on my mole, which made it worse(r).

: - (

Chips & Salsa (*****)

I know, this place is supposed to be great.

Sorry...

excerpts: So I ordered the Mexipino Burrito because it sounded interesting but either they fucked up and gave me a regular chicken burrito or
their Mexipino Burrito is just not that good.
chicken.author: RJ S.
chicken.review:
So I ordered the Mexipino Burrito because it sounded interesting but either they fucked up and gave me a regular chicken burrito or their Mexipino Burrito is just not that good.  I found no hint of adobo flavors or garlic rice but dousing the meal in their remarkable hot sauce made it edible.

I'll probably just stick with Taqueria Cancun or El Farolito next time.

excerpts: Dude, this thing is jam packed with carne asada, chicken AND shrimp!
Oh yeah, and this thing is drenched in Papalote's amazing salsa...
(I'm not really a salsa person, but I must say...
chicken.author: Tim L.
chicken.review:
Go here with a mindset prepared to wait a little bit.  It's a pretty popular place and can get kinda crowded.  I always get my food to go because it seems hella cramped in there.  Now for the food.....

All the food here is good, BUT..... if you have 20 bucks in your pocket and aren't afraid to waste it all on one burrito... you MUST get the "Triple Threat Burrito"!!  Really though.  Dude, this thing is jam packed with carne asada, chicken AND shrimp!  Oh yeah, and this thing is drenched in Papalote's amazing salsa... (I'm not really a salsa person, but I must say...Papalote has got some BOMB ASS salsa.)

Although it's an almost guaranteed heart attack, this monstrous burrito is an amazingly delicious explosion that creates an unmatched tastebud utopia with every bite!

...wash it down with a Mexican Coke and call it a day.

Your welcome, Tim.

excerpts: CHICKEN QUESADILLA ($7.25):
Chicken reminded me of tandoori (vibrant red color, dry-ish but still moist & tender), and was the saving grace of an otherwise lopsided quesadilla....
chicken.author: Amy K.
chicken.review:
OVERALL: 3.9

FOOD: 4
SERVICE: 4
AMBIANCE: 4
VALUE: 3.5

Got me a seat on the Throw-Down bandwagon, and it was glorious.

Didn't know about the Triple Threat bomb of a burrito--all I knew was Bobby got flayed, so I had to check it out for myself.  Definitely a more Americanized & polished taqueria...I'd say along the lines of In-n-Out of burritos, but edgier.  Cool urban artwork, bright walls, ornate kites strung up on the ceilings...fun & festive.

Menu is gringo-friendly with very standard and less adventurous options (i.e., no lengua or other head-parts)....and DELICIOUS.  Sure, it may not be so-called authentic, but it's definitely its own unique brand of Mexican flavor...your mouth and belly will know when it's Papalote, and they'll thank you.

FISH TACOS (2 for $6.75): Generous mound of grilled fish, chopped romaine, tomatoes, onions, & famous salsa--best grilled fish tacos so far!  Super fresh!

CHICKEN QUESADILLA ($7.25): Chicken reminded me of tandoori (vibrant red color, dry-ish but still moist & tender), and was the saving grace of an otherwise lopsided quesadilla....jicama salad/salsa was also a nice addition, though the portion was barely a biteful.

Next time I have food-baby pangs, I just might consider the $19.95 Triple Threat....til then, I'll stick to my fish tacos & salsa!

excerpts: Chicken adobo with garlic fried rice, avocado, cheese and sour cream.
Yes, please.
chicken.author: Jay F.
chicken.review: The Mexipino burrito is pretty damn good. Chicken adobo with garlic fried rice, avocado, cheese and sour cream. Yes, please.

excerpts:
Burritos avg around $7-9.

Chicken Adobo burrito is muy deliciouso - love the garlic rice in it that really adds a good hint of flavor.
the adobo chicken is not as vinegary as authentic adobo
but you can still taste it.
Filipino inspire -
It's
chicken.author: Tiffany N.
chicken.review:
THE CHIPS & SALSA - BOMB.COM!
When I first had it, I wasn't used to the fact that it wasn't chunky salsa but thennnn I tried it and the flavor just blew me away! It's SO good - I can't even describe it aside from the fact that it is spicy. Bottled sauce is available for purchase.

My go-to when I want a burrito WITHOUT feeling heavy/disgusting after
IE.) the "I should go and work out after eating this but really, I'm gonna take my lazy ass to sleep"

Anyways, on to the burritos -
Not the hugest I've seen (hahaha) but it's filling and ingredients taste fresh. Burritos avg around $7-9.

Chicken Adobo burrito is muy deliciouso - love the garlic rice in it that really adds a good hint of flavor. the adobo chicken is not as vinegary as authentic adobo but you can still taste it. 
Filipino inspire - It's a must try when ambitious to step outside of a carna asada burrito (there's nothing wrong because I like carna asada too!)

They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork so you really do have A LOT to choose from. 

+Not your late night burrito joint - closes at 10pm!
+accepts credit card
+ small, colorful and clean eating area with cool local flyers for events around the Bay scattered everywhere

excerpts: I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it.
It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned.
It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal.
That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.
chicken.author: Alex O.
chicken.review:
CILANTRO HATERS: This one gets complicated since they have it in their salsa and guac. I usually go for the super shrimp burrito with avocado instead of guac, and with the roasted salsa instead of pico de gallo. Yeah, I'm that annoying dude in front of you with an order like that. But seriously, you need to try this, and this is your ticket to happiness.

Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp or fish burrito/quesadilla here. I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it. It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned. It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal. That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.

excerpts: My wife and spent over $20 on chicken fajitas that were roughly equivalent in flavor to what one might get at Chevy's.
chicken.author: Bitter J.
chicken.review:
Papalote is the go-to spot for trendy conformists who want bland, overpriced nuevo Mexicano food. My wife and spent over $20 on chicken fajitas that were roughly equivalent in flavor to what one might get at Chevy's. Our previous experiences have been equally bad, and why we bothered to return is too long a story to bother with, but it's not a mistake we'll be making again.

Papalote's popularity is utterly incomprehensible given how many really good Mexican places exist a stone's throw away. I guess they've found their niche in the category of "Stuff White People Like," though, so good for them.

excerpts: I got a chicken burrito, and it was flavored so well.
The chicken was great.
My brother got the adobo burrito, and I definitely want to get that next time!
The adobo chicken was seasoned perfectly, and it was a great combination.
Definitely coming back here!
chicken.author: Kae O.
chicken.review: Probably now one of my most favorite burrito places in the city. I got a chicken burrito, and it was flavored so well. The chicken was great. My brother got the adobo burrito, and I definitely want to get that next time! The adobo chicken was seasoned perfectly, and it was a great combination. Definitely coming back here!

excerpts: Got a chicken burrito with black beans and gauc to go.
Call it in because it does take 10 minutes or so to make.
I first tried the salsa and chips -- excellent queso/salsa mix and with a nice little kick to it.
Tons of chips to go with it (standard, unsalted).
My first bite into the burrito was heaven.
Very high quality tortillas!
It really give the tortilla a fresh, light taste.
Guac was excellent.
Ingredients were also very tasty spun together.
Really nice salsa inside the burrito.
There was maybe just a little something about the salsa that makes me prefer the guac to pull everything together.
Is it pepper or peppercorn, perhaps?
This is a meal and a half.
Great value!
chicken.author: James C.
chicken.review: Mmm! Got a chicken burrito with black beans and gauc to go. Call it in because it does take 10 minutes or so to make. I first tried the salsa and chips -- excellent queso/salsa mix and with a nice little kick to it. Tons of chips to go with it (standard, unsalted). My first bite into the burrito was heaven. Very high quality tortillas! It really give the tortilla a fresh, light taste. Guac was excellent. Ingredients were also very tasty spun together. Really nice salsa inside the burrito. There was maybe just a little something about the salsa that makes me prefer the guac to pull everything together. Is it pepper or peppercorn, perhaps? This is a meal and a half. Great value!

excerpts: From my friends' comments, I'd say that the chicken in the Triple Threat is not so great.
chicken.author: Jonathan L.
chicken.review:
My friend was watching the Throwdown Challenge on the Food Network and saw the Triple Threat being put on the spotlight. To make a long story short, I'm sitting there, watching two of my buddies take on the Triple Threat. Not wanting to shell out $20+ for a burrito, I'm munching on a normal carne asada burrito.

I was really happy with how the carne asada came out. The meat is so tender and juicy and the steak marinade is fantastic. I wish it wasn't $9 but the quality speaks for itself. 

From my friends' comments, I'd say that the chicken in the Triple Threat is not so great. A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain. The shrimp is stir fried with garlic and is great. 

Great burritos but too pricey. I don't recommend the Triple Threat unless you're doing it for the sake of doing it. The normal burritos are sufficient.

excerpts: Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty.
chicken.author: Tony B.
chicken.review:
Love me my papalote and have for years. Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty. 

On those rare times you have the space and minutes to sit down and dine in a civilized manner, the pollo al achiote and the fish tacos are the way to go.

The salsa is so good I buy it in the fresh jars in their fridge and have it as an after-work snack with some local casa sanchez chips. 

I just wish they had a bigger space so it wasn't always so crowded! And I suspect their burritos have gotten slightly smaller in the 8 years I've been coming here.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken burrito both times.
The portion was generous but the chicken lacked flavor.
The whole burrito lacked kick and seemed very flat.
chicken.author: Zachary S.
chicken.review:
I don't know what all the buzz is about.

I've come twice and both times I walked away disappointed. The space is cute but a bit cramped and gets very crowded if there are just a few people eating.  I ordered a chicken burrito both times. The portion was generous but the chicken lacked flavor. The whole burrito lacked kick and seemed very flat. I appreciate the complimentary chips and salsa. The prices aren't that cheap for food that isn't that good. For the same price/type of food I'd just go to Chipotle and leave the restaurant a happy camper.

excerpts: Stan ordered the Fish tacos, Thomas and I ordered the crab special, and Monica opted for the chicken burrito.
chicken.author: Chrysantha C.
chicken.review:
"Good Friday" was definitely upgraded to "Amazing Friday" after I got my crack - I mean - Salsa fix at Papalate... but yo    it definitely didn't stop there!  Because of the Lenten season, (well I am assuming) they had a Dungeness Crab Enchilada special along with complimetary Sangria that I definitely could not turn down...

I spread the word and wether or not anyone wanted to tag along, I knew I was going to enjoy my lunch there REGARDLESS!  BUT I KNEW once I said FREE SANGRIA at least MONICA would be hooked! Monica, Stan, Thomas, and eventually Brian was sold on my advertisement and our Sunny Friday was set...

Stan ordered the Fish tacos, Thomas and I ordered the crab special, and Monica opted for the chicken burrito.  Everyone definitely agreed with me about the flavor, quality of fresh ingredients, and of course THE SALSA!

The sangria itself was delicious... being the "cheap date" that I am now, I was buzzing off of my first half glass... but it made my dining experience even better!

I really should have walked away with a bottle of salsa! ::kiking myself in the butt:: NOW!

There is nothing better than sharing amazing food with amazing friends!

excerpts: Just tried the chicken tacos here - delicious!
The chicken was soft, juicy and flavorful.
My friend tried the chicken burrito and declared it the "best in the city".
I like their decor too.
Highly recommended.
chicken.author: ubaid d.
chicken.review:
Just tried the chicken tacos here - delicious! The chicken was soft, juicy and flavorful. My friend tried the chicken burrito and declared it the "best in the city". I like their decor too. 
Highly recommended.

excerpts: One set had pollo (grilled chicken breast), the other carne asada (grilled steak).
For some reason they don't let you mix and match your meats.
The carne asada was a little chewy but had good flavor -
did I detect lime and garlic?
The chicken on the other hand looked like it was good quality, but it was bland.
chicken.author: Kathleen M.
chicken.review:
Someone brought Papalote's salsa into my husband's work, and it was so good my husband wanted to seek out the mythical land of milk and honey, or rather, *salsa*, from which it came.

We arrived at Papalote at 2:30 on a Saturday afternoon and were lucky enough to only have to wait 3 minutes for a table. There was a line afterwards. The place is on the small side, and it's unclear if you're supposed to claim your own table or follow the "please wait to be seated" sign. There are pretty dragonfly artworks on the ceiling.

We started with the $1.50 chips and salsa. Unlike other places these aren't bottomless. The amount we were given was just under what we needed, especially given how great the salsa was. (The chips are pretty standard issue.) 

The salsa had a nice roasted flavor and was unlike any other salsa I've ever had. It was a light orange color and looked slightly creamy, though I can't imagine them adding cream to it. (Do they?) It was so good we went back a few hours later for some salsa to take home. For $6.50 you can get a full jar. Even though it's in a jar it's fresh salsa and it'll only last a few days.

We each got a pair of tacos for $4.95. One set had pollo (grilled chicken breast), the other carne asada (grilled steak). For some reason they don't let you mix and match your meats. The carne asada was a little chewy but had good flavor - did I detect lime and garlic? The chicken on the other hand looked like it was good quality, but it was bland. I regretted not paying the extra 99 cents to make it a "super" with guac, sour cream, and cheese. I asked at the counter if I could have the super accoutrements on the side. Initially they balked and wanted me to pay the $2.99 for a whole side of guacamole, but I talked them into giving me just a small side of guac for the 99 cents. Guac makes everything better.

Epilogue: The salsa was just as good at home. Still eating it...

excerpts: Grilled chicken - fresh tomatoes and garlic rice.
chicken.author: Sara D.
chicken.review:
One Word: MEXIPINO.

This burrito is made from Mayan Gods, I swear.
Grilled chicken - fresh tomatoes and garlic rice.

HEAVEN IN MY MOUTH.
So much so...I've convinced my coworkers and we're going today!!

excerpts: My chicken looked like cat food.
It had rounded edges similar to that of pre-cooked bulk meat that had been soaking in some sort of gravy.
It reminded me of a burrito I once ate in Amsterdam cooked by a Spanish guy who poured velveeta all over it.
chicken.author: Julie H.
chicken.review:
My chicken looked like cat food. It had rounded edges similar to that of pre-cooked bulk meat that had been soaking in some sort of gravy. It reminded me of a burrito I once ate in Amsterdam cooked by a Spanish guy who poured velveeta all over it. I had a stomach ache half way into my burrito and it lasted well into the next day. 

With all the amazing Mexican food in the Mission, there is absolutely no reason to go here again.

excerpts: Adobo chicken with garlic rice.
Slammin!
Much better than I would have though.
Garlicky sauce, chicken adobo good, everything else mixed in really well.
chicken.author: David G.
chicken.review:
Dinner 02/04/2012

Mexipino Burrito = Adobo chicken with garlic rice. Slammin! Much better than I would have though. Garlicky sauce, chicken adobo good, everything else mixed in really well. 

VERDICT = Would order again next time here, although that won't be for a while.

excerpts: I got the chicken mole- so good!
Fresh and plenty of food!
chicken.author: Laura D.
chicken.review: Their salsas are the best- have been wanting to try the restaurant. It does not disappoint. I got the chicken mole- so good! Fresh and plenty of food!

excerpts: Get the chicken adobo.
Yum!
The sauce is amazing too.
Big fan!
chicken.author: Eme C.
chicken.review: Best burrito ever! Get the chicken adobo. Yum! The sauce is amazing too. Big fan!

excerpts: For the really adventurous ones, you can opt for the chicken/beef/shrimp super burrito.
That shit cray!
chicken.author: Dennis L.
chicken.review:
The closest thing to La Victoria's orange sauce! Although I think they call it a chipotle salsa, every time I take a bite, it still reminds me of the orange goodness from SJ.

Parking at both locations can be rather difficult but the proximity of bars makes this location my favorite of the two. Seating can be limited, but customer turnover is fast so you can usually count on having a seat by the time you've ordered and your food is ready. The tables are stacked next to each other so different combinations of group sizes feel like a game of Diner Dash. Occasionally, other diners may overhear or eavesdrop your conversation and chime in. 

Usually, I go with the Pollo Asado Super Burrito. Although a little bland on its own, but the salsa definitely kicks it up a notch. Combine that with Reed's ginger ale and that's a wonderful meal. For the really adventurous ones, you can opt for the chicken/beef/shrimp super burrito. That shit cray!

excerpts: My chicken burrito was really dry-the beans were a bit undercooked and had no sauce--they must have just rinsed them off in water after cooking.
There was a small pile of pico
de gallo at the very END of my burrito!
Clearly this place doesn't care and seem to just be trying to ride out their past glory with bare minimum effort.
chicken.author: Tom H.
chicken.review: Pretty dissapointing entrees after enjoying the one-of-a-kind chips and salsa.  My chicken burrito was really dry-the beans were a bit undercooked and had no sauce--they must have just rinsed them off in water after cooking.  There was a small pile of pico de gallo at the very END of my burrito!  Clearly this place doesn't care and seem to just be trying to ride out their past glory with bare minimum effort.

excerpts: Ok, this review is for the mole chicken burrito.
Straight up edible crack rocks.
Delicious.
Easily the best burrito I've ever had.
The mole sauce is perfectly seasoned and it just rocks.
It's the downfall of my near-vegetarianism.
They do have a tofu mole burrito
chicken.author: Faith S.
chicken.review:
Ok, this review is for the mole chicken burrito. Straight up edible crack rocks. Delicious. Easily the best burrito I've ever had. The mole sauce is perfectly seasoned and it just rocks. It's the downfall of my near-vegetarianism. They do have a tofu mole burrito but I just can't imagine it being as scrumptious.

The salsa is also extremely fresh-tasting and delicious. Love, love Papalote.

excerpts: My friends also enjoyed the Chicken Burritos.
chicken.author: Anurag S.
chicken.review:
2 words - THAT SAUCE. The salsa provided with your meal has a taste you will not find anywhere else - makes anything taste good. 

Being a vegetarian I had the Tofu Burrito and absolutely loved it. Definitely recommend lunch with a small crowd not a lot of space for seating. My friends also enjoyed the Chicken Burritos.

excerpts: Even if you're going for the somewhat generic sounding "Chicken Burrito", the result is pretty amazing.
Beyond tasting fresh, you can actually taste all of the ingredients in the burrito and they're big enough to satisfy the hungriest kids (me).
chicken.author: Steven R.
chicken.review:
I'm torn over how exactly to solve the Papalote Conundrum.

The burritos are top notch.  Even if you're going for the somewhat generic sounding "Chicken Burrito", the result is pretty amazing.  Beyond tasting fresh, you can actually taste all of the ingredients in the burrito and they're big enough to satisfy the hungriest kids (me).  I think this alone merits a fairly high rating.

The bad is that the cost of coming here is high.  Between walking in and waiting (seriously about 15-20 minutes from order to walk out) and dropping nearly $10 for a super burrito, I figured I should've just taken myself to brunch somewhere.  

If the dedicated "Phone Order" register isn't a clue, I'd definitely make calling ahead part of your plan if you are coming here to grab a burrito to go.

excerpts: Ordered the super chicken quesadilla.
It was just OK.
There wasn't a whole lot of chicken in it.
I can't really explain but
it was really just OK.
chicken.author: Sandy B.
chicken.review:
Came here while visiting SF during Memorial Day weekend.  Been hearing a lot of hype about this place so since I was in the Mission, we decided to give this place a try.

Ordered the super chicken quesadilla.  It was just OK.  There wasn't a whole lot of chicken in it.  I can't really explain but it was really just OK.  In my own opinion, I've had better.

I've heard a lot of rave about the salsa, so much that I was even thinking of buying a bottle of it.  Tried it when it came out with my meal, and it was spicy.  Spicier than usual (is what the people next to us said).  

I'm willing to give this place another try next time I'm in town, and maybe split a triple threat with someone!

excerpts: but still might get it some day (shrimp, carne asada, chicken, in a giant burrito).
chicken.author: Truman S.
chicken.review:
OK. so the only thing you have to know about papalote is...the SALSA! man o man, this salsa is quite possibly the best creation to be married with a burrito...chips...quesadilla..wait, actually i could eat this salsa on anything. rice..pizza..hot dog. yea, its that good. 

After seeing this place on throw down with bobby flay, i've always wanted to hit this place up. unfortunately, the TRIPLE THREAT burrito is TWENTY bucks? yea insane...but still might get it some day (shrimp, carne asada, chicken, in a giant burrito). 

I ended up getting a regular pollo asada burrito in a spinach tortilla, made it super (guac, sour cream). After waiting for about 10 minutes, the burrito had arrived! The burrito was well sized...and piping hot. Bite after bite, i enjoyed the burrito until it was no more. I found the flavors to be great, ingredients fresh, and with the AMAZING salsa - it was almost the perfect burrito. I would have liked the avocados to be sliced freshly (taqueria cancun!), and perhaps a something else to mix up the burrito texturally (fresh salsa..onions?). 

Overall, i thoroughly enjoyed the burrito - the price was fair at about $9 (not cheap but great quality). Lastly, I would consider buying the salsa by the jar, which they sell at the shop also. I can see why bobby flay lost his throw down to the Papalote bros!

excerpts:
* for not getting enough chicken on my burrito
-1
* for the nasty messy tables they had with gross food that you know had to be seating out for a while.
chicken.author: Char K.
chicken.review:
one word : Overrated!!

I know the many folks love this place, but i feel that the service was awful!!! not too add that there are plenty of place on mission that offer the same quality of food for half the price.!!


1-* for the salsa!! it was amazing..

-1 * for charging $ 4.50 for small amount guacamole!! 
-1 * for the bad service from the Cashier, after asking why it was so expensive.
-1 * for not getting enough chicken on my burrito
-1 * for the nasty messy tables they had with gross food that you know had to be seating out for a while.

excerpts: Didn't eat anything else all day, had a chicken mole burrito
then later that night had to leave my own birthday party to go home and hang out in the bathroom all night.
I'll never live down having friends show up to my party and I not be there.
Thankfully it passed (ahem) within 24 hrs but the timing could not be worse.
I urge you to pass as well on Papalote.
chicken.author: Alex A.
chicken.review: I got food poisoning from a burrito here on my birthday. Didn't eat anything else all day, had a chicken mole burrito then later that night had to leave my own birthday party to go home and hang out in the bathroom all night. I'll never live down having friends show up to my party and I not be there. Thankfully it passed (ahem) within 24 hrs but the timing could not be worse. I urge you to pass as well on Papalote.

excerpts: Grilled fish, shrimp and chicken were our choice
and we were delighted with the results.
chicken.author: Lynn S.
chicken.review:
This storefront could be mistaken for a dive...delightfully, it is anything but.  Wonderful burritos, tacos and quesadillas with fresh, fresh, fresh ingredients are here in a simple store front with limited seating in the middle of a neighborhood where only authentic Mexican food can survive.  Grilled fish, shrimp and chicken were our choice and we were delighted with the results. I was sorry the salsa wasn't filled with tomato pieces instead of  simply a thick sauce, but nonetheless it was spicy and tasty.

This is another example of what the Mission does best, present ethnic cuisine without frills or fuss at a reasonable price.

Order at the front counter and they will bring your food  to the table when it is ready. (Try not to notice that no one wiped down the table after the last customer....he didn't leave any crumbs anyway). Think of  a visit here as a cultural immersion experience and take note of the colorful photographs on the cheerful, red walls.

excerpts: I know nothing of the chicken adobo, or whether the carnitas (if they even have it) stacks up against El Farolito's or Taquieria Cancun's.
That can't matter to me
chicken.author: Ory P.
chicken.review:
Two words: Mole Tofu. This place is the answer to every vegetarian's dreams. I know nothing of the chicken adobo, or whether the carnitas (if they even have it) stacks up against El Farolito's or Taquieria Cancun's. That can't matter to me cause I'm stuck with the veggie (really beans, or at best chile relleno) options over there. Papalote gives the treatment veggie options deserve. 
Also, there salsa is not only better than any other, it is a redefinition of the category 'salsa'. It's more like a mole or adobo, but creamier, that decided it wanted to be served cold on chips instead of used as a marinage/grilling sauce on proteins.
Another place there game is on another level are the prints of famous singers (done as two-tones that make them surreal and pop) covering the walls. Go there because Prince (and apparently the Mexican National Team:http://sfist.com/2014/07/07/mexican_world_cup_players_return_fr.php) sent you.

excerpts: I ordered the Triple Threat which is a burrito filled with grilled shrimp, chicken, steak and also loaded with sour cream, guacamole, rice and black beans, absolutely FANTASTIC!
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
chicken.author: Shawn S.
chicken.review:
The salsa at this restaurant is DYNAMITE! I could out it on just about anything . I ordered the Triple Threat which is a burrito filled with grilled shrimp, chicken, steak and also loaded with sour cream, guacamole, rice and black beans, absolutely FANTASTIC!
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy. 
 I can't wait to go back :)

excerpts: I have to say I liked my cousin dish because it had a little heat to it, some spice, but the chicken mole was pretty good too.
chicken.author: Helen P.
chicken.review:
Look. I love Mexican food. I'm from Southern California, it's part of the culture here. So my cousin and I couldn't help but eat some more mexican food while we were up in SF, especially as our last meal.  We were dragging our luggage all over the streets of Mission looking for this restaurant, which is some what difficult to find when you are obviously not familiar with the area and when its kind off the street without a large sign. But we found it finally and when I walked in I knew we were in a good place. 

Lots of sizzling and delicious smells and lots of people grubbing, those are always good signs. I didn't feel like eating tacos (I always eat them in LA so I wanted something a little different) and I saw the mole and I knew I wanted it immediately. I love mole, I love the sauce, sweet, salty and delicious. And I got a nice hochata, I love horchata (although I wish they gave me a little more ice since it was pretty hot in the restaurant!). My cousin got the carnitas verde (I think- well it certainly had the verde sauce). 

I didn't realize how big the portions were until they gave us the plates, but it was huge and it came with rice and beans, mmmmm. They also gave us generous portions of warm tortillas. My cousin and I immediately dug in, things were bursting out of our tacos and the couple who just sat down next to us, waiting for their food were staring at us. I have to say I liked my cousin dish because it had a little heat to it, some spice, but the chicken mole was pretty good too. I wish I had more room in my stomach to finish it all or could take it to go if I was staying longer, but unfortunately I couldn't finish it all (yes I was disappointed in myself).

I highly recommend people to grub here if they get a chance. I do have a warning about the bathroom, it was a little frightening in there (and quite nesty) so I would use it for washing up. But nonetheless I loved the food and that was the most important part of the experience!

excerpts: Took my nephews yesterday and was pleased we could dabble in the menu (bean and cheese burritos for the adventurous nephews, chicken al achiote with jicama salad for me).
And yes, the salsa is amazing!
Just spicy enough and clearly NOT from a jar.
So yes, will be going back to Papalote now that it's on my radar...
also while the place looks packed upon approach, there is someone helping seat people so even with our group of 5, it didn't take more than 5 minutes to get a table.
A good thing to remember...
chicken.author: Erin W.
chicken.review: Very fresh + fast Mexican food. Usually that's an oxymoron, not when it comes to Papalote. Took my nephews yesterday and was pleased we could dabble in the menu (bean and cheese burritos for the adventurous nephews, chicken al achiote with jicama salad for me). And yes, the salsa is amazing! Just spicy enough and clearly NOT from a jar. So yes, will be going back to Papalote now that it's on my radar...also while the place looks packed upon approach, there is someone helping seat people so even with our group of 5, it didn't take more than 5 minutes to get a table. A good thing to remember...

excerpts: Chicken mole burrito, no rice, black beans, tomato tortilla - outta sight!
The best burrito EVER.
Homemade roasted red pepper salsa is undeniably the best salsa I have ever, ever, ever, ever, ever had.
chicken.author: Evan G.
chicken.review:
HOLY FRICKIN COW!  Chicken mole burrito, no rice, black beans, tomato tortilla - outta sight!  The best burrito EVER.  Homemade roasted red pepper salsa is undeniably the best salsa I have ever, ever, ever, ever, ever had.  And the homemade chips are delicious.

I can't even tell you how many "Buy 10 Burritos, get the 11th free" cards I've filled up here.  

Usually best to call ahead if you want something for take-away, as the line (and the wait) can be a bit long.  And it's not really that the wait is that long, it's just that there's not a lot of space to wait.  

Fresh ingredients, and I like the respectful menu options for vegetarians and vegans.

excerpts: my girlfriend had the chicken burrito and she compared the fowl niblets to dog food...
chicken.author: Sgtslut F.
chicken.review:
Absolutely awful...the most overrated burrito joint i have ever been to...talk about neutralizing Mexican food!...

I had the soyrizo super burrito and it was a mess...my girlfriend had the chicken burrito and she compared the fowl niblets to dog food...

overpriced and generally disgusting....

imagine the cuisine at Chevy's accompanied by PBR guzzling hipsters and you have a fraction of an idea of what this place is like...

with a plethora of great burrito joints within a five block radius, who would eat here?

excerpts: I had the Chicken Adobo Burrito and that was just delicious.
But what truly made it taste so much better was their special sauce they give you with your chips.
I poured some of that on my burrito and it was....
OMG...
AMAZING!
I can honestly say, you can go anywhere, make anything, pick something off the ground, whatever.
You pour that sauce on it and it will taste PHENOMENAL!!!
chicken.author: Gajan K.
chicken.review:
I almost feel spoiled going to all these establishments worthy of 5 stars. My buddy from work keeps taking me to hit up these places and every time, I leave there wanting more. Fortunately with Papalote, I got to take some of that goodness home with me.

Let me start by saying their food is great. I had the Chicken Adobo Burrito and that was just delicious. But what truly made it taste so much better was their special sauce they give you with your chips. I poured some of that on my burrito and it was....OMG...AMAZING! I can honestly say, you can go anywhere, make anything, pick something off the ground, whatever. You pour that sauce on it and it will taste PHENOMENAL!!! La Vic's sauce in SJ was once my favorite but it has just been officially replaced by Papalote!

For the sauce alone, I give this place 5 stars. Then when you add awesome service, great atmosphere, and great people, this place deserves even higher than that.

excerpts: I had their burrito with the asada,chicken, shrimp, and chile sauce.
It was not worth the $20.
The Chile sauce is good

but i think they took
a page from La victoria in San Jose.
I would take La victoria Chile Sauce over Papalotes any day.
chicken.author: Mario M.
chicken.review:
I had their burrito with the asada,chicken, shrimp, and chile sauce. It was not worth the $20. The Chile sauce is good but i think they took
a page from La victoria in San Jose. I would take La victoria Chile Sauce over Papalotes any day.

excerpts: I freaking LOVE meat, particularly chicken (when it comes to burritos), but I never need to even go there at Papalote.
chicken.author: Jessie H.
chicken.review:
Papalote is slightly miraculous in that I never even feel the need to eat their meat options.  I freaking LOVE meat, particularly chicken (when it comes to burritos), but I never need to even go there at Papalote.  The soyrizo burrito will cure all meat-cravings.

Soyrizo! Soyrizooooooooo! I love you SO! It is so perfectly spicy, and the burritos here are huge! I'm talking the size of my face.  Face-sized burritos for the win!

Sorry, got a little excited there.  I'm trying to say that Papalote's vegetarian options are amazing (this coming from a girl that doesn't even like vegetables, haaa).  And then there's the salsa.  Is there cream in that salsa? I can't figure it out.  At any rate, the salsa is the crack.  Crackalacking salsa.  I need you all the time. Like right now.  Salsa.  I NEED YOU.

excerpts: Chicken Mole:  was rich as mole negro should be.
The sauce is deeply flavored BUT
way over-chocolate-y, covering up practically all the chili pepper flavors.
The chicken breast was tough, overcooked to the point in which it required earnest effort to cut with a fork.
chicken.author: Ben S.
chicken.review:
2.5 stars

The pollo asado burrito remains delicious on account of their special marinade and the grill flavor.  Every bite yum.  
But what if I came in one day with the family and we tried something different... perhaps one of their plates?

Pork chile verde:  should've been named Green Pork in Garlic Sauce cause that's all we could taste.  Not the tangy, intangible yum of tomatillos. Not the zing of chili.  Hell, not even pork-flavored. Care to guess what you COULD taste?  Fail.

Chicken Mole:  was rich as mole negro should be.  The sauce is deeply flavored BUT way over-chocolate-y, covering up practically all the chili pepper flavors.  The chicken breast was tough, overcooked to the point in which it required earnest effort to cut with a fork. 

Spanish omelet:  good cheesy goodness with mushrooms and bell peppers throughout but it suffered from overcooked eggs.  Browned scrambled egg has a particularly strong flavor and if you dig it, you'll be pleased.  I find it just short of revolting.

Conclusion:  stick with the burrito at $7.50 and pass on the $13 plates.

excerpts: I just discovered the chicken mole burrito.
chicken.author: Julia G.
chicken.review:
I just discovered the chicken mole burrito. If you need a change from the classics, this is it.

Papalote ingredients are definitely above average quality. Salsa, obviously quite outstanding as many before have stated. They are really milking the Bobby Flay throwdown thing these days, but I guess who can blame them.

Call in your order or be prepared to wait.

excerpts: The chicken mole kind of stunk.
The sauce was pretty heavy on the sweetness; it could have used more chiles.
The chicken was not super moist, and it was $13.
The chicken burrito was a bit dry, but the chile verde pork was better.
chicken.author: Solomon W.
chicken.review:
Yes, I took friends here just because I saw it on Throwdown.  I knew I had to get the salsa here, but we also tried some of their various dishes.  This place is cool for not over-advertising their fame, and also keeping their restaurant very local and quaint.  We had to wait a few minutes to even sit down for some quick-paced Mexican grub.

The food here is served in large portions, but the prices are quite up there.  They are known for their sun-dried tomato salsa, but it is somewhat one-dimensional in my opinion.  It lacks the freshness of salsa (they sell it by the bottle), and it has too much American jazziness to it.

The best thing by far is the fish, in any form.  The white wine and butter sauce is exquisite, and the fish is extremely moist and tender.  The quesadilla option is a bit pricey, though.

The chicken mole kind of stunk.  The sauce was pretty heavy on the sweetness; it could have used more chiles.  The chicken was not super moist, and it was $13.  The chicken burrito was a bit dry, but the chile verde pork was better.  The CV had a tangy, hearty sauce that paired well with the tender pork.

There is nothing to really rave about here, but I guess it is worth a shot if you are into unique salsas and stuff.  The food is a little pricier than normal, but it does the job, and there are offerings to satisfy everyone.

excerpts: He competed on who can make the best burrito against the 2 owners of the restaurant and at the end Papalote won with its Triple Threat Burrito which has chicken, prawns, carne asada and the usual rice, beans, Etc.
So after watching the show a few days later we decide to give it a try
so my husband hops on Bart and takes off for S.F.
When he gets there he calls me and tells me that the Triple Threat Burrito is $ 20 buckz each...
I said fuck it
you went all the way out there
we might as well get it!
When he gets back I couldnt wait to tear it up...
lol OMG
it was so fuckn gooooood!
chicken.author: Johanna G.
chicken.review:
We decided to give this place a try after watching the show on Food Network Bobby Flay's Throwdown. He competed on who can make the best burrito against the 2 owners of the restaurant and at the end Papalote won with its Triple Threat Burrito which has chicken, prawns, carne asada and the usual rice, beans, Etc. So after watching the show a few days later we decide to give it a try so my husband hops on Bart and takes off for S.F. When he gets there he calls me and tells me that the Triple Threat Burrito is $ 20 buckz each...I said fuck it you went all the way out there we might as well get it! When he gets back I couldnt wait to tear it up...lol OMG it was so fuckn gooooood! The tortilla was not steamed but kinda crunchy but not hard at all it was just perfect and their salsa was delish too!  

I still haven't gone back till this day to try anything else but pics I've seen on here look delish I will have to go back n try something different....I hope cuz I might just end up with another Triple Threat lol

excerpts: The chicken in the chicken mole was overcooked and dry; a waste of good mole sauce.
chicken.author: Elben S.
chicken.review:
Overrated, much? Their famous salsa was a good surprise, but it was nothing extraordinary. The chicken in the chicken mole was overcooked and dry; a waste of good mole sauce. The burrito was nothing special (again, the meat was overcooked and very dry), and neither were the rice and beans.

Oh well.

excerpts: I get the "naked burrito", and have had chicken, carne asada, and prawn.
The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).
Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.
I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.
I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.
Everyone who works there is really nice!
chicken.author: Rachel A.
chicken.review: I like Papalote a lot because of its convenience, but it is on the expensive side.  I get the "naked burrito", and have had chicken, carne asada, and prawn.  The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).  Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.  I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.  I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.  Everyone who works there is really nice!

excerpts: My chicken burrito was filled with lots of rice and a hint of chicken.
chicken.author: Jak K.
chicken.review:
This used to be my most frequent stop in the Mission for burritos, before the recent renovation.  I don't know if someone else bought the place or what but the changes are not good.

The new counter help isn't very helpful.  They've always been brusque, which is fine but we had to stand there, in front of three employees who wouldn't make eye contact, for a full minute before anyone would say anything.  Then the young man was bothered that he had to help us.

They have significantly reduced their beverage offering and my beloved pear cider will not be returning.  

The interior decor is stripped of some of the old art and in over a week nothing has been found to replace it.  

My chicken burrito was filled with lots of rice and a hint of chicken.

I hope the online salsa sales will sustain them because the customer service and quality of their storefront isn't going to win them many fans.

excerpts: My friends ordered their chicken and carne asada burritos.
Again, nothing special.
chicken.author: Tim B.
chicken.review:
The salsa here is quite good - its more like a creamy spicy sauce that you eat with your chips, very unique and tasty.
 
Otherwise, I don't really feel like it's anything special. I've definitely had better mexican food. I had the carne asada and chili verde tacos. They come in litle corn tortillas with pico de gallo, lettuce, and meat. Both were OK... I just felt like something was missing. Adding the salsa made it better, but maybe I wanted cheese or something. My friends ordered their chicken and carne asada burritos. Again, nothing special. I tasted it and it didn't really have any outstanding flavor. 

I think the reason why its so liked is because it has interesting vegan options like soy chorizo and eggplant quesadillas. They also offer wheat tortillas.

excerpts: The chicken adobo was soooo tendah!
Hands down
chicken.author: Christina Y.
chicken.review:
Man...... Bobby Flay jacked up the hype and the prices! It was such a crazy wait to get a table, and paying 20 bucks for a burrito is just cruel and unusual punishment. 

It was a plus that I could drink my chilly Red Stripe in line, but once I finally got the triple threat burrito, I did not get the heartbubbles. It tasted like any other burrito in the MIssion just ten times the price. 

The adobo burrito however, was just a perfect cross cultural combo. The chicken adobo was soooo tendah! Hands down I had plate envy as my best friend got to enjoy that perfect tortilla pillow of awesome. 

I would definitely go back just for the adobo burrito, but the triple threat is not worth the ridiculous price. Unless the animals in this burrito were massaged by golden hands there is no reason why it should cost twenty dollars.

excerpts: I finally got to try the much-hyped chicken adobo burrito, but the overall experience I had could have been waaaaay better.
chicken.author: Loren John B.
chicken.review:
Oh Papalote, if you weren't so flawed I'd go with a higher score. I finally got to try the much-hyped chicken adobo burrito, but the overall experience I had could have been waaaaay better.

Let's get the bad out of the way. What the hell was up with the wait? I think I easily spent over half an hour waiting for just one burrito. Then again, others that ordered ahead of us experienced just as long of a wait. I'm guessing they do put a genuine effort into their burritos, but takes a little too much time. With that said, called way ahead, like you would do when ordering a sandwich at Ike's Place. 

Another thing is the price. It's more expensive than La Cumbre or el Farolito, which is a couple blocks away. The burrito itself was 7.50, then when I got rung up it jumps to a little over 9 bucks? Fine whatever, I just want to try the damn burrito at this point.This place could also benefit from being open later, but I'm guessing all the drunken crowds will flock thus causing a wait until the sun comes back up. 

Now the burrito itself is pretty good. You can definitely taste the adobo flavor, but its not as strong as I had hoped it would be. I guess thats the beauty of the burrito by not overwhelming the consumer with the flavor. The burrito wasn't dry or anything either, I just expected a little more taste. 

I'll come back to give it another try. I need to go here anyway because my parents want to try it themselves. Not bad, but I think I'll be going back to my regular options.

excerpts: It's $20 and has carne asade, prawns, and chicken, but is no larger than a normal burrito and not worth the premium price.
I suppose I'd pay a few bucks extra for the combination of meats, but it doesn't make sense to charge a ridiculous amount of money for a regular-sized burrito.
Maybe I ordered it on an off day, but it was the one and only time I've been disappointed with Papalote.
chicken.author: Jeffrey H.
chicken.review:
Hands down my favorite burrito joint in the city, and I have eaten my fair share of bean, rice, and meat in a tortilla.

Employing the golden ratio of guacamole to sour cream, Papalote combines fresh ingredients to create a superior taste experience. Unlike other taquerias whose burritos flavors are mushy and muddled, Papalote's burritos are flavorful and delicious - each ingredient stands out on it's own. 

A few tips:

1) My fav is the prawn burrito. Get it super with cheese, guac, and sour cream. 

2) The salsa is totes amazeballs. You can even buy a jar of it to take home. 

3) Call in your order 10 minutes in advance to have your order ready when you get there!

4) Even though it sounds enticing and delicious, forget the Triple Threat burrito on the menu.  It's $20 and has carne asade, prawns, and chicken, but is no larger than a normal burrito and not worth the premium price.  I suppose I'd pay a few bucks extra for the combination of meats, but it doesn't make sense to charge a ridiculous amount of money for a regular-sized burrito.  Maybe I ordered it on an off day, but it was the one and only time I've been disappointed with Papalote.

excerpts: Being from LA, I didn't find this place spectacularly different or extremely to-die-for but the chicken molé quesadilla was pretty good
but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
chicken.author: Alyssa A.
chicken.review:
Being an out-of-towner, a local recommended we check out the Mission district of San Francisco. Taking the BART was a convenient way to get there. We happen to be in town during Cinco de Mayo so it was quite packed.

After you order your food, you're given a number and they eventually find a table for you and your food comes out soon after.

Seating is quite cramped but it's nothing too crazy.Being from LA, I didn't find this place spectacularly different or extremely to-die-for but the chicken molé quesadilla was pretty good but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here.
