excerpts: I was shocked that my side of chicken cost $7 when it arrived it was about 2 thirds of a cup of cold meat.
What a rip off
chicken.author: Brian S.
chicken.review: I was shocked that my side of chicken cost $7 when it arrived it was about 2 thirds of a cup of cold meat. What a rip off

excerpts: I unwrapped the foil, on which someone had written "shrimp," and took a nice big bite of CHICKEN!
I HATE chicken.
(I have a video of this burrito, and wonder if I can upload it here.)
I told the manager, Cecilia, about it, and she was NOT gracious about it at all.
chicken.author: Amy D.
chicken.review:
I don't get the high reviews.  Are they getting YOUR orders right?  

Love the idea of fresh avocado on your burrito?  Me too, and Papalote will certainly charge me for it, which is a good sign that they heard me, but so rarely actually put it in my burrito.  Are you a pescaterian who likes the idea of vegan refried beans?  I unwrapped the foil, on which someone had written "shrimp," and took a nice big bite of CHICKEN!  I HATE chicken.  (I have a video of this burrito, and wonder if I can upload it here.)  I told the manager, Cecilia, about it, and she was NOT gracious about it at all.  She had the cashier take my order again, which came out on a white instead of wheat tortilla.  

These people obviously don't need my business, or yours, not that I am telling you what to do.  But have you heard of Taqueria San Jose?  Those people are nice, their food is fabulous, and while they don't have wheat tortillas, at least they won't promise you one.  

Had their $8.50 nachos.  They were SO stingy with the beans.  It was a plate of burnt chips with no salsa even though we requested hot.  

I'm done here.

excerpts: Felt like I was eating over cooked chicken.
chicken.author: Anthony D.
chicken.review:
excited to check this place out after finding out it beat out bobby flaw on throwdown, i made the journey to experience 'the best burrito' in san francisco last sunday. BAD IDEA!

what a waste of time and hype. First off, the 'triple threat' cost $20, seriously, 20 bucks for a damn burrito, not in this life time. 

So, instead i was torn between the mole burrito or the chile verde. Per the cashiers recommendation, i chose the chili verde. While waiting i was brought some chips and salsa. 

Heard the salsa was great, what a disappointment. It is the better type, i think habanero; however, it just wasnt anything special. If you want a real good orange salsa, try Iguana in SJ, definitely the best. I mean my friends mom could make a better one in her sleep, and she probably has.

Back to the point. well i was given the salsa with some chips, which were store bought (not the great house made ones at REAL mexican restaurants). Once my burrito arrived I asked for some more salsa, since I used the other on the chips they gave me. The worker told me I only get 1 salsa per order and I would have to pay if I wanted any more!! ARE YOU SERIOUS?!? Youre telling me the salsa that came with my chips was the only salsa I got to use for both my super burrito and my dipping my chips? WAT A JOKE! 

any other legitimate mexican restaurant usually hands salsa out like its halloween or even keeps them in self serve so you can basically dip your burrito in before you eat, lol. Not this place, their are like the salsa nazis for some bland lame duck salsa. 

Havent even gotten to the burrito. So, i could barely even taste the green chili and the pork was rather dry and cut too large. I mean i have had chili verde cut that large before but usually its been simmered in sauce so long that it just melts in your mouth, not this one. Felt like I was eating over cooked chicken. 

Only good marking this place gets is they allow the option of getting spinach tortillas and whole black beans. Although, DEFINITELY NOT worth $9 PLUS, the extra cost of salsa!!

BOOOO!

excerpts: Same size - 1/3 portion of beef, chicken and shrimp....
Once seated, we just paid $30 for a plate of fish tacos and a beef/chicken burrito, with a beer and a diet coke.
Examining the receipt, it became clear that we had been charged for fish tacos, a beef burrito AND a chicken burrito.
Took a bite of the chicken/beef burrito - and the only noteworthy thing was the chicken was well marinaded/seasoned.
The rest?
Unimpressive.
chicken.author: Grace K.
chicken.review:
Give me a break!

On a perfectly nice Sunday - we were chilling out at Revolution Cafe w/ some beers indulging in nice conversation, a great live band, and "people-watching" the most interesting, odd folks who thought it normal to shush people at a cafe.  The three of us all being foodies - talk of food was inevitable as dinner time approached us.

JB mentioned a burrito place that had recently been featured on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay".  Now, I like Bobby as a person more than a chef, and I do enjoy this show from time to time but I had missed this episode.  But my interest was piqued in learning that Bobby had lost to the "triple threat burrito" at Papalote, so we started walking to check the place out for dinner.

Well, as we expected, there was a massive line of people wanting to try the place that had beaten the Iron Chef.  As it turned out, there were more people waiting for their placed order than wanting to order, so we were able to squeeze right through to the counter.

All three of us wanted the Triple Threat.  
All three of us gawked at the price: $20.

TWENTY DOLLARS?
The first natural question was: how big is it?
Answer:  same size as the other burritos... that average out at about $7.50 in cost.

*(looking around the room to make sure I'm on earth)*

ON WHAT PLANET DOES THAT MAKE SENSE?????????

Same size - 1/3 portion of beef, chicken and shrimp....
Almost 3X in cost.

FOR WHAT?

Forget that!  Do I have "IDIOT" written on my forehead?

We scored seating in the restaurant within 10 minutes, and that was good since our wait for the regular burritos would be over 30 minutes.

Once seated, we just paid $30 for a plate of fish tacos and a beef/chicken burrito, with a beer and a diet coke.  Examining the receipt, it became clear that we had been charged for fish tacos, a beef burrito AND a chicken burrito.

(Annoying.)

The chips were decent, and their "special secret sauce" (salsa) was pretty good in concept but overly salted, and not quite what *I* want from "salsa".  Nonetheless, it was tasty.

The burritos arrive.
Regular size.
I was SO not a fan of the Monterey Jack cheese - in cold state, not melted - that they sprinkle on everything.  Yuck.  Took a bite of the chicken/beef burrito - and the only noteworthy thing was the chicken was well marinaded/seasoned.  The rest?  Unimpressive.  Overall, for the burrito, I'd have given it three stars.

I tried the fish taco - and the fish was fresh and not deep-fried, the lettuce was crisp - but the cheese, as much as I tried to take it all off, ruined it for me.  If I had asked for no cheese - I would have given it three stars too.

There's a MUCH better burrito to be had at El Metate for a fraction of the cost and even better ambiance with better drinks and service, too.  ($5 for a burrito there - try it!)

The experience of eating at Papalote, due to the hype, was worth it.  The company made the whole night fun.  Perhaps, if we had been insane enough to splurge $20 to eat a burrito - my assessment would be higher.  But for a $20 burrito, I expect it to give me wings, and based on other reviews - nobody sprouted wings and took off.  It's unfortunate for the owners as they'd be making a WHOLE lot more money off the recent coverage if they charged $10 for the Triple Threat instead of attempting to price gouge their customers for $20.  Whatever number of Triple Threats they are selling right now for $20, they could sell 10X that amount had they charged $10.  Do the math.

Coincidentally - upon arriving home later in the evening, the very episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay" came on TV and I watched it with the remnants of Papalote's burrito and fish taco in my stomach.

Bobby was as cute as ever, and based on ingredients alone, I'd have preferred his "green burrito".  That said, the two brothers were funny and seemed like nice guys.

They just happen to be out of their freakin' minds.

$20 for a BURRITO?
That's just insulting.

excerpts: I tried the mole chicken burrito which was delicious.
My two other friends had the $20 burrito (I had a small taste).
Nothing spectacular, just lots of different types of meat but the exact same size as mine which I didn't expect--- thought it was going to be huge.
Yes, their salsa is unique and yummy, but nothing to go ga-ga over.
And it was nice that the owner was out to mingle, but I'm sure he's just ride out the 15-minute fame wave as long as possible.
I couldn't have phrased it better than yelp does with my two-star rating:
"Meh.
I've experienced better.
chicken.author: Christine Y.
chicken.review:
Of COURSE my friends and I went here after hearing about that throwndown bobby flay thing triple threat burrito thing. Sooo... we waddled down to the mission and found parking right away which, according to my friend, was probably the most positive thing about this whole experience. 
I tried the mole chicken burrito which was delicious. My two other friends had the $20 burrito (I had a small taste). Nothing spectacular, just lots of different types of meat but the exact same size as mine which I didn't expect--- thought it was going to be huge. 
Yes, their salsa is unique and yummy, but nothing to go ga-ga over. And it was nice that the owner was out to mingle, but I'm sure he's just ride out the 15-minute fame wave as long as possible. 
I couldn't have phrased it better than yelp does with my two-star rating: "Meh. I've experienced better."

excerpts: my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and
boy do
i feel cheated!
i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that.
the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and
rubbery
but i did like that it tasted grilled.
i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito.
and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy.
chicken.author: L M.
chicken.review:
i couldnt bring myself to give more than 2 stars. HOW DID THIS PLACE EVER BEAT BOBBY FLAY? like many others, i was interested in trying this place out when i found out that this place beat bobby flay's throwdown. 

my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and boy do i feel cheated! i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that. the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and rubbery but i did like that it tasted grilled. i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito. and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy. i appreciate good carne asada in a burrito but the beef was a bit chewy and too greasy for my taste. (boyfriend agrees with all this by the way)

however, i do like that the chips and salsa came free with the burrito. and i appreciate the cashier for telling me they come with the burrito so i didnt have to pay for an extra one. the salsa was delicious too. if it wasnt for the chips and salsa, i dont think i would even give 2 stars.

excerpts: The chicken, however, had a great flavor and left us wishing we'd just gotten the chicken burrito.
chicken.author: Stacey B.
chicken.review:
Came here after my husband saw Throw Down With Bobby Flay.  I'm a Bobby Flay fan and we were kind of having a fun "food network" adventure during our weekend in SF.

How did my Bobby Flay lose, I'll never know...

My husband got the triple threat burrito.  Most of the carne asada had to be spit out due to the gristle and the 3 prawns inside were over cooked and chewy.  The chicken, however, had a great flavor and left us wishing we'd just gotten the chicken burrito.  However, we were essentially there to try this particular burrito.

I ordered the fish tacos and they were alright.  Nothing special.  Oh well.

The chips were good and the salsa was fantastic.  The salsa was the only impressive thing about the place.  

If you decide to try Papalote, don't waste your time with the triple threat.  It's over-priced and over-rated.

excerpts: I got a less than desirable plate of nachos with nothing but some cheese melted on top, a scattering of tomatoes, a smear of beans and overcooked shabby looking chicken pieces on top.
Oh, the triple-threat burrito, the one that was featured on the show, $20.
I asked how big it was because I was considering getting it.
It's the same size as a regular burrito.
Can anyone tell me if ANY regular sized burrito is worth that much money?
chicken.author: Blu n.
chicken.review:
I have a theory that when the food network visits a restaurant, they inevitably ruin the experience for everyone else because not only are your expectations higher, the restaurant gets a bloated ego and goes downhill.  

The food was overpriced.  I got a less than desirable plate of nachos with nothing but some cheese melted on top, a scattering of tomatoes, a smear of beans and overcooked shabby looking chicken pieces on top.  Oh, the triple-threat burrito, the one that was featured on the show, $20.  I asked how big it was because I was considering getting it.  It's the same size as a regular burrito.  Can anyone tell me if ANY regular sized burrito is worth that much money?  Me thinks not!

The wait staff left a sour taste in my mouth.  Apparently they've become so crowded a hostess needs to seat you.  Fast food or restaurant, they can't decide.  Someone brings out chips and salsa and the food to your table.  The salsa wasn't very fresh tasting.  The worst part, the food took about a half hour to come out.  I get faster service at legitimate sit down restaurants.  What's going on back there in the kitchen?

For an actual burrito experience, go to Farolito, or even Pancho Villa for crying out loud.  You'll spend half as much as come out with a feeling of satisfaction!

excerpts: They serve "Chicken Adobo" burritos.
jam packed w/ flavorful shrimp, chicken, and steak.
It was really good, but I have to question it costing $20!!??
For that price, it should have been GYYY-normous, but wasn't.
(3) I give it up to them for having a mix-breed type of BURRITO: half Filipino/half Mexican.
Was it good?
Sure it was, but I wonder why it appeared "off-menu".
chicken.author: Joy A.
chicken.review:
THREE reasons why I walked into Papalote:
(1) The SF 7x7 listed their "chips and salsa" as a place to try before you die. Hmmmmm!!???!
(2) According to the Food Network, their "Triple Threat" burrito beat out Bobby Flay's burrito.  Bobby Flay??? Quite impressive!!!  
(3) They serve "Chicken Adobo" burritos. Huh, really???!!!!

How do they measure up???
(1) Chips and salsa- BIG THUMBS UP!!!  I really liked it. I couldn't stop munchin' on them.  The salsa was fresh & chunky, and the orange color reminded me of La Vic's delicious salsa. (Try La Vic's orange sauce; buy the bottle even!)
(2) The "Triple Threat" burrito was jam packed w/ flavorful shrimp, chicken, and steak. It was really good, but I have to question it costing $20!!??  For that price, it should have been GYYY-normous, but wasn't.  
(3) I give it up to them for having a mix-breed type of BURRITO: half Filipino/half Mexican. Was it good? Sure it was, but I wonder why it appeared "off-menu". (I'm glad my girlfriend told me about it.)

TIP for those doing the 7x7 list: Anthony's cookies & Mitchell's Ice Cream are a hop, skip, jump away. =)

excerpts: The food is incredible in  this place is on  my favorite list I love Achiote chicken plate
Simply superb.!!!!!!
chicken.author: Claudia Q.
chicken.review: The food is incredible in  this place is on  my favorite list I love Achiote chicken plate Simply superb.!!!!!!

excerpts: I think it might be less to just buy a prawn burrito, add chicken & carne asada, and make it a super though I'm not sure.
chicken.author: John D.
chicken.review:
It's obvious that the 'comedian' brother came up with the price for the Triple Threat because that was funny as hell!  But hey, I'll go along with the absurd price and fall into the tourist trap.  Turns out it's the customers who are the joke since it's not even that good...

Like many others, I came to this place after watching Throwdown a couple days ago.  For those who want to come here for the Triple Threat burrito, the 1st thing you will notice is the $19.95 price which might be worth it if it used Kobe beef though I just wanted to try it once.  I think it might be less to just buy a prawn burrito, add chicken & carne asada, and make it a super though I'm not sure.

I really do think this Triple Threat burrito is overrated, especially because of its price.  I found myself eating each of the meat separately because together it is over-seasoned with each of the marinade and sauce getting lost within each other.  Individually, the meat tastes great: perfectly grilled and marinated so well.  But together, there is just too much going on.  The secret sauce is good (maybe a rip off of La Vic's orange sauce) though, with some heat and tangy.  So it may be that it's better to just get a burrito with just 1 type of meat and hope it's not bland.  The food here is fresh though.

There are other places in the Mission where you can get just as good of a tasting, fresh burrito that's more authentic for half the price.. so I won't be coming back here.

small dining area, so might not get a seat
service is good, but phone your order in so you don't have to wait a while
parking isn't too hard to find, metered

excerpts: Tried the Triple Threat burrito and, on a another occasion, the chicken mole.
Would come back for take out.
Seats are hard to get to dine in and so is parking.
chicken.author: November C.
chicken.review: The food is undoubtedly great here! Tried the Triple Threat burrito and, on a another occasion, the chicken mole. Would come back for take out. Seats are hard to get to dine in and so is parking.

excerpts: The chicken mole was whack... avoid it.
chicken.author: Ricky H.
chicken.review:
Cheesy cheesy goodness...

The cheesy fish quesadilla revisits me in my dreams sometimes and I'm a fan of the sauce. Although I don't see what all the fuss is about it is still really good. 

The burritos were pleasing, not too fancy. 
The chicken mole was whack... avoid it. 

If you're going to Papalote, send me a fish quesadilla please.

excerpts: I had tried this place a while ago for their chicken mole tacos and found it alright.
Then I saw Papalote beat Bobby Flay with their Triple Threat Burrito.
chicken.author: Michael H.
chicken.review:
I still don't know understand the hype of this place. I had tried this place a while ago for their chicken mole tacos and found it alright. Then I saw Papalote beat Bobby Flay with their Triple Threat Burrito. Since I couldn't find the bakery I was looking for I decided to give it another shot.

I didn't realize that the Triple Threat Burrito is $20! Instead I got the carne asada burrito to-go. The burrito is good. Big chunks of meat and a good balance of ingredients. They also pack your bag with chips and some killer good orange hot sauce. For some reason the sauce tastes better this time around. I think the sauce is better suited for hefty savory burritos.

Considering that Papalote is as busy as a liquor store on New Year's Eve, I would rather go somewhere less congested, cheaper, and just as good. The wait isn't worth the food. If it's not that crazy packed, give it a shot.

excerpts: I thought their chicken was dry, prices high, and tortilla not fresh.
I was also shocked that there were no mexican customers.
( i think a good taquería should have mexican customers... have you ever seen a good asian restaurant without asian customers?
chicken.author: Dave N.
chicken.review:
overrated! I was not impressed... 

I thought their chicken was dry, prices high, and tortilla not fresh. I was also shocked that there were no mexican customers. ( i think a good taquería should have mexican customers... have you ever seen a good asian restaurant without asian customers? didnt think so..) 

i'll be going to the taquería's on mission street next time...

excerpts: I came to Papalote specifically because I'd never had mole negro before, and a friend recommended the chicken mole at this place.
After hearing how crowded and crazy it is, we almost didn't go -- but I'm glad we tried it.
It came with more chicken that I could eat at one sitting, partly because it was pieces of white meat that had gotten very dried out during the cooking process.
The mole sauce was amazing -- rich, complexly flavored, chocolaty and just slightly sweet.
However, it wasn't enough to moisten the chicken, and the dry meat combined with the uber-rich sauce made the dish hard to finish (and I didn't).
I could have used a lot more greens on my plate to offset the rich/dryness of the mole.
chicken.author: Beth W.
chicken.review:
I came to Papalote specifically because I'd never had mole negro before, and a friend recommended the chicken mole at this place. After hearing how crowded and crazy it is, we almost didn't go -- but I'm glad we tried it. Despite the crowds, we were able to sit down at a table and (semi) enjoy our meal, although we were crammed in close with other diners and the servers kept banging into my chair. 

Anyway, where was I? Oh yes. The food. 

The salsa, as others have said, is unique and tasty. It's on the spicy side, blended, and a little bit creamy. I almost ate all of it with chips while waiting for my meal, but saved some. That turned out to be a good thing. 

My portion was huge. It came with more chicken that I could eat at one sitting, partly because it was pieces of white meat that had gotten very dried out during the cooking process. The mole sauce was amazing -- rich, complexly flavored, chocolaty and just slightly sweet. However, it wasn't enough to moisten the chicken, and the dry meat combined with the uber-rich sauce made the dish hard to finish (and I didn't). 

The house-made pinto beans were very bland -- and adding the leftover salsa helped, but only a little bit. Their tortillas are store-bought; I was a little disappointed by that. And the jicama salad was teeny-tiny. I could have used a lot more greens on my plate to offset the rich/dryness of the mole. 

My date had the pork salsa verde; he said it was "just OK" and had similar blandness issues with his black beans. 

The service was friendly and fast. 

So, a few stars for tasty sauces, but several stars taken away for crowds, dry meat, and bland beans. We probably won't be back.

excerpts: But if you want something a bit smaller you can go with any of the plates chili verde , Carne and even chicken.
Can't go wrong here
chicken.author: John J.
chicken.review: Triple Threat Burrito is the bomb. Some times you finish sometimes you don't . But if you want something a bit smaller you can go with any of the plates chili verde , Carne and even chicken. Can't go wrong here

excerpts: Shrimp, chicken and carne asada in a single burrito that's no bigger than a regular burrito.
chicken.author: Rick C.
chicken.review:
Ever eat a $20 burrito? That's what the the Triple Threat burrito will cost you. Shrimp, chicken and carne asada in a single burrito that's no bigger than a regular burrito. I normally get the Chile Verde burrito which is excellent ($7.50) until I saw an episode of Throwdown with Bobby Flay. Now I've been eating here for awhile and was never aware of the Triple Threat until the episode with Flay. Told myself that I was gonna try it next time around instead of my usual Chile Verde. Looked at the online menu and there was no Triple Threat. Had the little lady call in an order for us. One TT and one Chile Verde. 25 mins later, I show up to pick up my order and the nice young lady at the counter tells me the total is $32. I looked up at the menu board and there's a small plastic sign taped to it that reads Triple Threat Burrito $19.99. WTF? 

It was a Wednesday night and the place was unusually packed...alot more than usual. All of the staff members were wearing Throwndown shirts and they looked really overwhelmed by the crowds of people coming in and the telephone ringing off the hook. Even after calling the order in 25 minutes ago, I still had to wait another 15 minutes to get my food. 

The TT was good and the different meats in it had a nice balance that worked together. Maybe $10-$12 would have been a reasonable price. But $20...gonna stay with the Chile Verde. 

My beloved Papalote is now a rerun on the Food Network. Great for the owners (well deserved) but sucks for the regulars who now have to deal with the crazy crowds (not that it wasn't crowded before). At least, I can tell people I had a $20 burrito...once.

excerpts: Super Chicken Burrito was fantastic!
chicken.author: SF M.
chicken.review:
I just had Papalote takeout for dinner and the experience was great.

Price: Reasonable
Service: Quick and Friendly
Food: Super Chicken Burrito was fantastic! 

I'm definitely a fan and will come here again!

excerpts: My partner ordered the carne asada (beef) taquitos and I ordered the chicken.
What we received were huge chunks of meat (we are used to shredded meat) and long strands of lettuce and huge chunks of tomato.
There was no flavor at all in the meat or chicken and the abundance of watery tomato and lettuce made the taquitos
I am used to taquitos that have double tortillas with shredded chicken or beef and topped with salsa and chopped cilantro and onion.
chicken.author: Deb J.
chicken.review:
I went to Papalote in the Mission District on a recent weekend visit.  It was recommended by the owner of the B&B where I was staying.  As this is San Francisco, I expected the food to be a bit more authentic and I was sorely disappointed.

The staff was friendly enough and the menu was readable.  My complaint?  First, we ordered taquitos and a side of rice and beans.  My partner ordered the carne asada (beef) taquitos and I ordered the chicken.  What we received were huge chunks of meat (we are used to shredded meat) and long strands of lettuce and huge chunks of tomato.  There was no flavor at all in the meat or chicken and the abundance of watery tomato and lettuce made the taquitos so watery that they dissolved the tortilla.

The horchata and strawberry drinks were watery and not at all flavorful.  I am used to taquitos that have double tortillas with shredded chicken or beef and topped with salsa and chopped cilantro and onion.  Not here.

I would not recommend this place, and when I told my friend who we were visiting, she said that the place was always full and that there were way better taquerias to be had along Mission Street.

So, to not be too mean, I gave this place two stars, but really would have given it one.  Oh, and the huge burrito (which by the way, is an American invention) at the table next to me was burried under a mountain of mozzarella cheese.  Yech.

excerpts: My friend had the Mole/chicken burrito and she also enjoyed it...
Although I think she enjoyed the strangely orange free salsa more.
It WAS good after all.
We left stuffed and pleased.
Especially since when we arrived at 4 we walked right in and up to the cashier.
Then when we left at 5ish there was a line out the door.
We had the right burritos at the right time...with drinks for the right price...
chicken.author: L P.
chicken.review:
I waltzed in with a friend early one Sunday evening. We went for a walk, saw Papalote, and thought sure, let's try it. 

AND WE DID. 

I had the grilled veggie burrito. I LOVE zucchini in my mexican food and this included it....And not just a few slices but it was STUFFED with zucchini...and a side of pinto beans, rice, eggplant, sourcream and cheese. My friend had the Mole/chicken burrito and she also enjoyed it...Although I think she enjoyed the strangely orange free salsa more. It WAS good after all. We left stuffed and pleased. Especially since when we arrived at 4 we walked right in and up to the cashier. Then when we left at 5ish there was a line out the door. We had the right burritos at the right time...with drinks for the right price...20 bucks. 

(By the way, this story took place approximately 5 hours ago. I decided to write this review promptly bc I also decided to promptly eat my burrito leftovers as soon as I got home....which is now....Also, it's even better cold. Yesssssss)

Go here and go early.

excerpts: The super chicken burrito is my taqueria control food and they blew the competition out of the water.
With all the fresh ingredients (and yes, really fresh and good quality - there's no "mystery chicken" in there!)
and the salsa....
oh, the salsa... likened to crack cocaine, mixed dangerously with those fresh chips....
oh my.
I think i am beginning to blush.
Go and order whatever you normally order from your local greaseria and it will be infinitely better at Papalote.
I promise!
chicken.author: Holly C.
chicken.review:
Whoever reviewed Papalote and gave it 2 stars, noted bad service and incorrect orders probably only went there once and had an off night. The salsa alone is a reason to eat there or take out. The super chicken burrito is my taqueria control food and they blew the competition out of the water. With all the fresh ingredients (and yes, really fresh and good quality - there's no "mystery chicken" in there!) and the salsa.... oh, the salsa... likened to crack cocaine, mixed dangerously with those fresh chips.... oh my. I think i am beginning to blush.
Go and order whatever you normally order from your local greaseria and it will be infinitely better at Papalote. I promise!

excerpts: I love adobo...chicken, pork, whatever.
I love adobo and my mom's adobo is hard to match.
I love Mexican rice...
chicken.author: Clarisse C.
chicken.review:
Rub-A-Dub-Dub thanks for the grub!

Adobo Burrito is now available all day, every day! Holla!!

Parking can be a bit of a b*tch, but if anything you can call ahead for an order and leave someone in the car with the hazards on.

If you insist on eating there, you'll have to be willing to wait. Fortunately for us, we didn't have to wait very long at all. The line was long itself, but the seating process went smooth because they actually seat you! Unlike many other places that make you fight for seats and don't even wipe down the tables!

Anyways, the owner was there the night we came and I think he was doing more interviews, especially because the Throwdown with Bobby Flay will be airing soon.

On to the food, the chips and salsa are addictive. I don't usually go for spicy anything, but these are addictive. Unfortunately, they don't have bottomless chips and kind of give a dinky serving, but that's OK, I didn't want to fill up on chips anyway....

We waited maybe 15 minutes after ordering to finally get our Adobo Burrito. 1. I love adobo...chicken, pork, whatever. I love adobo and my mom's adobo is hard to match. 2. I love Mexican rice...but I only love it when it has the right amount of flavor to it.

So what does that mean? This burrito is delicious! It's neither overwhelming in each category and they compliment each other well. Then again I could have scorched my tongue from not being able to wait to bite in and the meat was still freshly hot-tot-tot.

The rice is flavorful, I half expected it to be straight up white garlic rice for some reason. The chunks of meat aren't too adobo-ey, but still taste good. If anything, it can have more flavor.

I took half of my burrito home, although they aren't too big in size, but I ended up eating it as soon as I got home and it tasted a bit better because I let the juices soak in.

There's not a doubt in my mind that the other burritos/dishes here are really good.

Sidenote: This is not a drunk food establishment, they close @ 9 or 10.

excerpts: It was filled with a good amount of chicken, steak, and shrimp, so I definitely feel like they didn't cheat us out of the good stuff.
Miguel also came by to say hi and dropped off a plate of the adobo burrito filling, which is more down my ally!
OMG, it was so tender and delicious.
I will definitely get the chicken adobo burrito next time.

I liked the triple threat, but I don't wanna fight big pieces to eat my way through the burrito, which makes the adobo one perfect because the chicken is so tender that you don't need a fork and knife to eat it!
chicken.author: Diana Lyn Z.
chicken.review:
Been wanting to try their triple threat for quite some time now and was able to do so the other night on a spur of the moment decision for dinner.

The boyfriend and I were driving down Potrero and I said, "Hey! Let's try Papalote tonight!" Of course, he agreed.

We got there thinking we'd just grab our burrito to go and cut out, but we were invited to sit and eat inside the restaurant since there were a couple open tables.

We ordered the triple threat burrito and horchata. I was a little taken aback by the price! But, alas, that's what you get for paying for a good burrito. My boyfriend even commended them. He used to work at SF General and tried a bunch of places in The Mission, but said Papalote was the best.

We got our burrito pretty quickly and we split it. Oh! I forgot to mention! The salsa that came with the chips was good! Albeit, spicy for my liking, but still good! Anyway, back to the burrito. It was filled with a good amount of chicken, steak, and shrimp, so I definitely feel like they didn't cheat us out of the good stuff. Miguel also came by to say hi and dropped off a plate of the adobo burrito filling, which is more down my ally! OMG, it was so tender and delicious. Better than most Filipino adobo I have tried!!!

I will definitely get the chicken adobo burrito next time. I liked the triple threat, but I don't wanna fight big pieces to eat my way through the burrito, which makes the adobo one perfect because the chicken is so tender that you don't need a fork and knife to eat it!

Mmm...just thinking about it makes me wanna go back and have one RIGHT NOW!

excerpts: The chicken was not too salty (a frequent problem I've noticed with seasoned chicken), and the steak was simple but awesome.
chicken.author: Adam G.
chicken.review:
The sibbies were in town and had seen the episode of Throwdown, of course.  I'd been curious to try out the famous burrito also, but knew I wasn't going to spend the $ on it on my own.  Cue Papalote for dinner tonight.  

First off, the place is tiny.  Not in a bad way, but just in the way that you need to know before going there assuming you can just sit down.  Even fewer seats than El Farolito around the corner.  

Foodwise, first we got the chips and salsa.  Off to a great start.  Good chips, tasty and complex salsa.  Nice and spicy, too, but maybe a touch too much for the average person.  Also not impressed they charge for another bowl of corn chips.  Boo for that one.

Next up: the Triple Threat.  Of course that's what we had to try.  It arrives taking up more of a plate than is reasonable for a burrito.  But that's what it should do for $20.  And yes, it did take ~15 minutes to arrive, but that's ok in my book, since it was clear everything was freshly cooked.  Again, not your average burrito.  We had to taste each element independently, and each was fantastic on its own.  The shrimp were nicely spiced and well cooked.  The chicken was not too salty (a frequent problem I've noticed with seasoned chicken), and the steak was simple but awesome.  Guacamole was also very good, as were the refried beans.

So on the whole, we enjoyed the food, were astounded at the size of the portion, and would likely come back again.  We would likely not be getting the Triple Threat, though...especially not for $20.  Carne Asada burritos, on the other hand....

excerpts: The chicken is much more flavorful, giving you a full blast of the adobo flavor you've come to know and love.
Not like the first time when I went, the chicken was dry and it only had a little hint of adobo flavor.
chicken.author: Jeffrey L.
chicken.review:
They have greatly stepped up their game on the Adobo Burrito. The chicken is much more flavorful, giving you a full blast of the adobo flavor you've come to know and love. Not like the first time when I went, the chicken was dry and it only had a little hint of adobo flavor. Definitely check it out and only try it at the 24th street location.

They also include chips and salsa now with the burrito so that's a double win!

excerpts: It's mildly-spiced chicken, rice, and tomatoes (no beans).
I was expecting something more vinegar-y, more reminiscent of Filipino food, but it was just OK.
I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.
chicken.author: Amy N.
chicken.review:
I ordered the Adobo burrito (off menu). It's mildly-spiced chicken, rice, and tomatoes (no beans). I was expecting something more vinegar-y, more reminiscent of Filipino food, but it was just OK. I wanted the flavor to be more pronounced.

The mole burrito was pretty tasty, but somehow I thought it would taste stronger. It wasn't bland, just milder than I expected.

The salsa was excellent, though.

I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.

One day I'll return to try their fish burrito. Sauteed in white wine and butter? In a burrito? I am skeptical as to the taste (white wine flavor in a burrito?) but intrigued.

excerpts: I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.
YUMMMY fish!
Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.
Ok on the chicken mole.
I love that place.
Ok on the chicken mole.
I love that place.
chicken.author: Anna C.
chicken.review:
I recently moved to Bernal Heights and walk through the Mission everyday to get to and from BART.  The smell of grilled meats is enough to make me want to try every single mexican restaurant in the mission.  

I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.  YUMMMY fish!  Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.  Ok on the chicken mole. I love that place.  Looking forward to going back to try their carne asada and others.

excerpts: It's not often that you get shrimp, chicken, and carne asada all on one burrito.
The orange sauce was excellent as well.
chicken.author: John C.
chicken.review:
I wanted to try this place badly after seeing it on Throwdown with Bobby Flay. The burrito featured on the show was the Triple Threat. The night that the episode originally aired, we tried to place a phone order to pick it up. After ordering 2 of these burritos with a couple minor add-ons, the lady said "it'll be ready in 45 minutes and it'll be $45." What?!?! Seriously? We thought she heard our order wrong, like we ordered 5-10 burritos. But no, she was serious; that was the price for 2. We were so shocked that we ended up cancelling the order.

After doing some research on Yelp, we found out that as soon as the show aired, they jacked the price up by $5. Pretty messed up, but apparently there was high enough demand.

A few months later, we finally decided to give it a try. My girlfriend and I split one of the Triple Threat burritos. I must say, it was pretty good. It's not often that you get shrimp, chicken, and carne asada all on one burrito. The orange sauce was excellent as well. Lots of flavor, and we also had some with our chips.

But in the end, I cannot justify paying $20+ for a burrito, especially in the Mission, where there is seemingly a taqueria every other store. I'm glad that you guys got the publicity that Bobby Flay gave you, but how do you plan to have repeat customers? Sure, people will try it once out of curiosity, but I don't imagine many returning for the same $20 burrito.

excerpts: It has prawns, chicken and beef in it.
I was hesitant when I saw the chicken and I assumed it would be dry.
chicken.author: Desiree L.
chicken.review:
I'm seriously pretty upset right now that I do not live in the city. I was hungover at my friends apartment and was way too lazy to even get up off the couch let alone leave the apartment to get food. 

We were watching Throwdown with Bobby Flay and this delicious looking burrito came up on the TV--The Triple Threat. I was hooked. I watched the entire show and was pumped when I found out these guys were based in San Francisco. 

I left the apartment immediately to find this place. The Triple Threat is HUGE (I think it should have been split among 3-4 people) and is $19.95. Sad. $20 burritos are always disappointing, but I couldn't not order it. It has prawns, chicken and beef in it. I was hesitant when I saw the chicken and I assumed it would be dry. It was not dry -- it was amazing instead.  

The salsa is amazing and I had to ask for my own because I didn't want to share anymore. It's spicy and is great on chips, the burrito, a plain flour tortilla....by the end I was just spooning it into my mouth. 

Their other burritos are very reasonably priced ($6-8) and the portions are also very large. And it's only 99 cents to add sour cream, guacamole, and cheese!  The staff is really friendly despite how busy they are and always wipe down the tables between guests. yay. 

Bobby Flay definitely has nothing on this place. I'm excited to go back.

excerpts: It was the first time I had heard of a Chicken Mole option for a burrito - and it did not disappoint!
chicken.author: Amanda D.
chicken.review:
The ingredients are fresh, and the options come by the dozen. Meat options are plentiful and unique. The menu has so many different options for any vegan, vegetarian, or good 'ole meat eater like myself. I personally loved the whole wheat tortilla option for no extra charge. It was the first time I had heard of a Chicken Mole option for a burrito - and it did not disappoint! 

However, the best part of the meal cannot be overlooked. The chips and salsa, which is served by the bowl to each person, is unmissable. Easily one of the best salsas I've had. It's smokey, garlicy and has enough kick to leave a little warmth in the back of the throat. So good.

The only downside I saw was the Triple Threat's price. Why, El Papalote, do you have a $20 burrito on your menu if it is roughly the same size as your other normal priced ones? I get that is filled with good meat, but damn! You better get a whole pound of shrimp in there for that price. 

I'd def. come back to El Papalote! Especially after beating Bobby Flay.

excerpts: Came here once, tried the Chicken Adobo burrito, or Mexipino burrito.
SO GOOD!
Garlic rice (already "game over"), chicken adobo, tomatoes.
you can also make it a "super" with sour cream and guacamole.
You gotta try it!
chicken.author: Kevin S.
chicken.review: Came here once, tried the Chicken Adobo burrito, or Mexipino burrito. SO GOOD! Garlic rice (already "game over"), chicken adobo, tomatoes. you can also make it a "super" with sour cream and guacamole. You gotta try it!

excerpts: ordered the chicken adobo burrito and split it with my boyprend.
the flavor was pretty good, chicken was juicy, and the chips weren't bad, but $10 for a burrito??
chicken.author: Tiffany S.
chicken.review:
ordered the chicken adobo burrito and split it with my boyprend. 

just ordering one burrito came out to $10, super pricey.  Overall, yeah the flavor was pretty good, chicken was juicy, and the chips weren't bad, but $10 for a burrito?? I think that you could find a better burrito for half the price somewhere else.  

not really feelin' the papalote hype.

excerpts: Chicken mole tacos and chile verde burrito pleeeeeaaase!
chicken.author: Keika L.
chicken.review:
I feel so fortunate that I live on the same block as this restaurant. 

Chicken mole tacos and chile verde burrito pleeeeeaaase!

excerpts: I ordered the chicken mole burrito.
I am a big fan of mole sauce and almost always order mole when eating Mexican food.
It is a legit mole sauce, rich and well balanced.
I was visiting from Seattle and this was my favorite burrito on my visit.
chicken.author: Joel W.
chicken.review: Great salsa!  I ordered the chicken mole burrito.  I am a big fan of mole sauce and almost always order mole when eating Mexican food.  It is a legit mole sauce, rich and well balanced.  I was visiting from Seattle and this was my favorite burrito on my visit.

excerpts:
Triple threat
     +Chicken?
chicken.author: Chuck N.
chicken.review:
Wednesday, 8:45PM.

To enter Mission's Mexican food market, folks best be bringing their A-game or find some way to distinguish themselves from the competition. 

Papalote does both and is establishing a spicy niche in the area. 

Stuffed our faces in:
1. Soyrizo
     +Spicy, chunky soy pieces won over this omnivore
2. Mole, tofu taco
     +Cocoa pepper and chili concoction goes great with the hard shell
3. Triple threat
     +Chicken? Carne asada? Shrimp? Dig the combo man!
     - Only four prawns? Put a little more than that, c'mon now!
4. Salsa
     +Spicy kick without overwhelming the rest of the mix
     - Staff is stingy with this goodness

And then...?
The Triple Threat wasn't enough for my raging hunger, which is a testament to me being a PHATTTTY. Still paying a return visit though, I've got the seafood burritos and nachos to try!

excerpts: Somebody call 911 because I just murdered the chicken adobo burrito at Papalote.
Seriously, I love the idea of putting chicken adobo into a burrito.
The chicken was so damn tender and the adobo flavor was present but not overpowering.
The whole time I was eating it, I felt confused.
Tastes like Filipino food yet tastes like Mexican food.
chicken.author: Joshua C.
chicken.review:
Somebody call 911 because I just murdered the chicken adobo burrito at Papalote. 

Seriously, I love the idea of putting chicken adobo into a burrito. Effing genius. 

The chicken was so damn tender and the adobo flavor was present but not overpowering. The whole time I was eating it, I felt confused. Tastes like Filipino food yet tastes like Mexican food. Either way, I ate the whole damn thing. 

The horchata was good but I prefer a little more cinnamon in mines. I love that they have soyrizo and tofu as meat options. 

Papalote was definitely worth the journey from Oakland. I just hop on BART and walk a few blocks and I'm in the Mission. I don't venture out here much, but I'd make the trip for Papalote again.

P.S. If you have room, Anthony's Cookies is a couple blocks away.

P.P.S. Their chips are not that great. Best tortilla chips in SF? Velvet Cantina. No question about it.

excerpts: I ordered a regular chicken mole burrito and since I don't like pico de gallo, I asked if there was another salsa they could put into the burrito
chicken.author: Patrick H.
chicken.review:
Oh man it was warm last night even at 9PM in the Mission, but inside Papalote it was about 100°F. I don't know how the people were eating in the dining room. There were boxes of produce by the door and the poor bell peppers were suffering too.  I ordered a regular chicken mole burrito and since I don't like pico de gallo, I asked if there was another salsa they could put into the burrito but they did not offer to put the orange salsa in :(.  

And then I waited....and waited...it took 20-25 minutes to finally get my burrito.

The verdict? The burrito was pretty good and so was the orange salsa that comes w/ the side of chips. But for the above average price and the long wait, I'd try other tacquerias in the area before venturing back to Papalote. They could use a new location w/ a larger kitchen to help the orders go through more quickly, and so the cooks aren't stepping on each others' toes as much.

One last note...like buying yogurt, I like to order 2-3 tacos each w/ different meats, but they only come in pairs here.

excerpts: The good: Their salsa is pretty good, although it seems to have lost some of its fire lately, and their chicken mole is delicious.
chicken.author: Steve B.
chicken.review:
The good: Their salsa is pretty good, although it seems to have lost some of its fire lately, and their chicken mole is delicious.  The veggie burritos are also pretty tasty.  The portions are quite large and a burrito will easily make two meals.  You can call ahead and order food to-go and avoid the ridiculous line that often develops. 

The bad: I think the food is overpriced, especially given the volume of sales and the fact that their service can be mediocre.  But, they keep a line out the door so the market seems to say otherwise.  I've had orders messed up repeatedly -- from getting the wrong dish entirely to minor things like missing salsa or not getting a whole wheat tortilla -- especially when I order to-go.

The bottom line: Worth checking out, but not my go-to taqueria.

excerpts: and waiting twenty minutes for a burrito is never fun, but I dig that they grill the meat to order rather than just scooping up a mound of lukewarm chicken from a serving tray.
It's the sort of taqueria that I know I'll be returning to time and time again -
chicken.author: Devon S.
chicken.review:
My boyfriend's friend called me Skeletor the other day. Although I loved 80s cartoons, I'm a chick so He-Man is pretty much out of my reference zone. But I get it. I'm skinny. Scrawny. Gangly. It comes with the territory and there's very little I can do. 

Except, of course, for setting up camp at Papalote. I've been exactly twice - once after a hard workout in the pool, and once after a long night of boozing that ended with a straight male friend kissing a guy at the Mint. Both times I was starving, my body shaking from the lack of sustenance, and their food delivered. 

Between the complimentary chips and bomb salsa and the big ass super pollo burrito, I probably packed on a good five pounds that I had lost the night/workout before. I'm rather impatient (great trait for a teacher, right?) and waiting twenty minutes for a burrito is never fun, but I dig that they grill the meat to order rather than just scooping up a mound of lukewarm chicken from a serving tray. It's the sort of taqueria that I know I'll be returning to time and time again - and probably when my body REALLY doesn't need the calories. 

With Papalote, I can continue the transition from an awkward hungry baby giraffe to a jolly chubby bunny. Something tells me that I'm gonna hate being called Ms. Staypuft Marshmallow just as much as Skeletor, though.

excerpts: i am so addicted to the grilled chicken super burritos and grilled chicken nachos.
i came here a couple of months ago and going back last night brought back all the taste bud memory.
SO DELICIOUS!
the super is an additional 99 cents which includes sour cream and guacamole.
the boyfriend and
i usually share one burrito and can tackle half of the nachos and leave completely full.
i think my favorite is the chipotle salsa.
it starts off sweet and then as it sits in your mouth you start to feel a slow burn and your taste buds go wild with yummy taste.
i basically pour it over everything!!!
all of their burrito has fresh ingredients and the food comes out hot and well prepared.
this is definitely a quick in and out joint so don't freak out if the second you twitch to get up and leave that someone is right behind you swooping in to take your seat.
they always have a full restaurant!
chicken.author: Sandy L.
chicken.review: i am so addicted to the grilled chicken super burritos and grilled chicken nachos.  i came here a couple of months ago and going back last night brought back all the taste bud memory.  SO DELICIOUS!  the super is an additional 99 cents which includes sour cream and guacamole.  the boyfriend and i usually share one burrito and can tackle half of the nachos and leave completely full.  i think my favorite is the chipotle salsa.  it starts off sweet and then as it sits in your mouth you start to feel a slow burn and your taste buds go wild with yummy taste.  i basically pour it over everything!!!  all of their burrito has fresh ingredients and the food comes out hot and well prepared.  this is definitely a quick in and out joint so don't freak out if the second you twitch to get up and leave that someone is right behind you swooping in to take your seat.  they always have a full restaurant!

excerpts: I went for a classic grilled chicken burrito.
chicken.author: Brett W.
chicken.review:
Ladies. Gentlemen. I have been defeated.

In one corner you've got B: A vertically challenged underweight, but with years of burrito-eating experience.

In the other corner you've got Papalote: A Mexican grill that packs an unassumingly heavy punch.

This was the talk of the group for my San Fran veteran friends*. Luckily, I have a really smart morning routine: I oversleep, shower eventually, and drink my breakfast in the form of coffee. So by the time Papalote rolled around, Papa was storving!

I went for a classic grilled chicken burrito. Did I make it SUPER for $0.99 and add sour cream, cheese, and guacamole inside? DUH. As if that was even a legitimate question.

But first they give everyone their own bowl of chips and salsa. Because everyone is obsessed with the salsa, I'm just going to reiterate the fanatic declarations and agree: It is probably the best salsa I've had yet. I wanted to pick-pocket it and douse a little on all of my meals. 

Then, the burrito the size of my torso was set in front of me. My eyes said, "YES. YES. YES. GO!" Halfway through my stomach said, "Boo, you've got to give it a rest." 

I got about 3/4ths of the way finished with the appearance of my coaches--fork and knife--but not even they could help me with the big win.

Yet it has never felt so good to lose. 
__________

* I was a newbie. But I really did leave my heart in San Francisco . . . My appetite too.

excerpts: This is a review for the "secret" adobo chicken burrito.
I agree with other Filipinos who grew up on chix adobo (and otherwise) that this specialty burrito us tasty and passable, but it needs a little help from Lolo to bring the magic.
The burrito is served with chicken adobo, rice and tomato and you can even get beans or make it "super.
The chix adobo itself is tender and has just enough tangy Filipino (not Mexican!)
adobo flavor.
However, one vital component that is a bit weak is garlic.
As everyone says a garlic rice is mighty tasty with chix adobo...
As well you could throw in some caramelized onion.
Perhaps, they could lightly paint a hot, garlic oil on the inside of the tortilla?
chicken.author: E L.
chicken.review:
This is a review for the "secret" adobo chicken burrito. I agree with other Filipinos who grew up on chix adobo (and otherwise) that this specialty burrito us tasty and passable, but it needs a little help from Lolo to bring the magic. The burrito is served with chicken adobo, rice and tomato and you can even get beans or make it "super." The chix adobo itself is tender and has just enough tangy Filipino (not Mexican!) adobo flavor. However, one vital component that is a bit weak is garlic. As everyone says a garlic rice is mighty tasty with chix adobo... As well you could throw in some caramelized onion. Perhaps, they could lightly paint a hot, garlic oil on the inside of the tortilla? A previous reviewer substituted a garden tomato tortilla with this burrito and that hit the spot.

Overall this spot still gets 4 stars any day of the week. They're the "healthful" taqueria which means no mystery meat, inventive plates and fresh, fresh, fresh food--even if it's infrequently in the face of authenticity. This is now my first choice taqueria--even to take the out of towners. Papalote is now a San Francisco tradition!

excerpts: You can have your carne asada, chicken, and whatever other type of burrito.
chicken.author: Rohan D.
chicken.review:
Two things to note: This place has DELICIOUS fish burritos and phone in because the wait can be super long. 

Papalote is great high quality mexican food.  You can have your carne asada, chicken, and whatever other type of burrito. I love my fish burritos. And this place has them. They have the most delicious fish burritos I've had in a while, this is the place. Other places in the mission won't serve fish. 

While I myself love this place for the fish burritos, they have a wide selection of other delicious goods. The chips and salsa are pretty good.

Beware the wait. You can wait anywhere from 5 minutes to 45 minutes (dead serious, 45 minutes for a burrito is not acceptable) but I assumed that was a strange night.

excerpts: The burrito was hugh, could easily feed 2-3 people, and it was loaded (e.g., packed full) with grilled beef, grilled chicken, & large grilled prawns.
I loved their roasted tomato salsa, and really liked that the burrito wasn't filled with rice & beans like other places do.
It was good, but nothing amazing.
The meat, chicken, & fish wasn't seasoned, just grilled.
chicken.author: SFer O.
chicken.review:
Had lunch with a friend visiting from the UK, who was continuing on to NYC after SF.  Given the Bobby Flay Throwdown, we decided to have lunch here. Had to walk by it a couple times, as there's no signage. Look for blue tiles. We ordered a Champion Burrito with black beans, guac, salsa, sour cream for each of us. My friend got a Negra Modelo and I got a water =$52 before tip.

The burrito was hugh, could easily feed 2-3 people, and it was loaded (e.g., packed full) with grilled beef, grilled chicken, & large grilled prawns. I loved their roasted tomato salsa, and really liked that the burrito wasn't filled with rice & beans like other places do. It was good, but nothing amazing. The meat, chicken, & fish wasn't seasoned, just grilled. The Champion Burrito would be a goner w/o the salsa.

We got there about 1:30p and the restaurant was full - and this place is tiny(!). You eat elbow-to-elbow with the next table, tables lined up next to one another. Pulling your chair out means bumping the people behind you. If you've got long legs or are a big person, good luck. The staff move things along fast b/c people are waiting to be seated. You're still eating and are asked if you'd like foil to take your food with you.

I can say that I've tried Papalote's - and am over it. Too expensive, okay food, and a really uncomfortable place to eat (on a several levels). If Bobby Flay couldn't beat this burrito in a Throwdown, there's no hope.

excerpts: I got the chicken mole quesadilla, and I loved the flour tortilla.
It was light and crisp, with an almost translucent, shiny quality.
I don't know how, but it managed to contain the mass of mole and chicken that was inside.
chicken.author: Lucia C.
chicken.review:
If anyone in Mission heard a loud asian girl squawking "I'm SO FULL!" yesterday afternoon, that was me.  And I apologize for any disturbance/annoyance I might have caused you on your peaceful Saturday. 

I was drunk off of mole.

My brother and I went, but didn't get the famed 20 dollar burrito. I was afraid a burrito that costs that much would never live up to expectations, although it is supposed to feed two.

We opted instead to get different things, so we could taste more of what Pa Pa Lo Te has to offer, and it definitely didn't disappoint.

My brother got the carne asada burrito, and the meat was thick, tender, well-seasoned, and ABUNDANT. I love a restaurant that can bowl over its customers with its portions and flavor. (Note: I think my family's stomachs are smaller when it comes to some things, so what I think is a huge portion may be normal for others.)

I got the chicken mole quesadilla, and I loved the flour tortilla. It was light and crisp, with an almost translucent, shiny quality. I don't know how, but it managed to contain the mass of mole and chicken that was inside. The meat was steeped in gooey goodness and kept me well-satisfied for the rest of the day.

The roasted tomato salsa actually didn't do much for me. The heat was nice, but otherwise all I tasted was salt and a bit of garlic. Guacamole was good, but nothing supreme.  Fresh tomato salsa had a bit of jicama in it, i think, which was a very thoughtful, refreshing touch - cooled off my mouth nicely. It was fun to get the Mexican bottled Coke, which does taste different from the American stuff.

Service was quick, polite and friendly.  The staff kept the small dining area clean and tidy.

All in all a delicious experience, though since I don't live in the area, I'll probably be trying out all of the surrounding taquerias. 

Suggestions, anyone?

excerpts: We met the owner, Miguel,  who also gave us a sample of his chicken adobo (over rice), which is a burrito meat option (and quite popular, I hear).
While I thought that to be somehow wrong, I have to admit that the adobo was absolutely delicious.
chicken.author: erica c.
chicken.review:
First off, let me just say that the "salsa," or whatever their creamy hot sauce is called, was AMAZING.  It was spicy, creamy and loaded with flavor.  I damn near ate my whole basket of chips to get to the last drop of that sauce.  :-)

Second, while I DO eat meat, I was a vegetarian for 10 years.  That inspired me to try the soyrizo burrito (with cheese and grilled mushrooms).  I have one word for you..  DAMN.  That was THE best non-meat burrito I've ever had and I love Pancho Villa's tofu.

My girlfriend had a carne asada and grilled shrimp burrito which she devoured (all 100 pounds of her).  Needless to say, she enjoyed hers, too.

We met the owner, Miguel,  who also gave us a sample of his chicken adobo (over rice), which is a burrito meat option (and quite popular, I hear).  While I thought that to be somehow wrong, I have to admit that the adobo was absolutely delicious.   It was SO tender.

The eating area is small but the tables do clear quickly.  And while their prices may be on the high side, I'm definitely one who believes in getting what you pay for... and we certainly did.

Miguel, thank you for your hospitality.  You'll definitely be seeing me again.

P.S.  My 9-year old son proclaims Papalote to be his favorite  - and he's eaten a quite a few burritos, living in South City.  :-)

excerpts: A massive MexAm masterpiece with carne asada steak, chicken and jumbo prawns.
chicken.author: Francisco H S.
chicken.review:
The wife and I went here after watching Throwdown With Bobby Flay. Delighted to find that it was a cute, cozy place and not at all pretentious. All food was moderately priced, but extraordinarily delicious. I had the triple threat burrito -- had to after the feature on TV. A massive MexAm masterpiece with carne asada steak, chicken and jumbo prawns. 

The best part is their secret Papalote salsa. It was all in the triple threat. But, I was surprised to see them selling it by the jar. YOU MUST BUY YOURSELF A JAR BEFORE LEAVING THIS PLACE. You will scoff at other salsas once you try it.

excerpts: I ordered the Prawn, chicken adobo, and carne asada burritos for my family.
Me and my family members all agreed they were dry - rice and meat..
The burritos were ok, but I've definitely had better, like Castillo's (civil center).
Disappointed and not worth the $8 - $10 for each burrito.
You can definitely do better elsewhere.
chicken.author: Les Y.
chicken.review:
I had to check out Papalote because I saw them on Bobby Flay's throwdown. I ordered the Prawn, chicken adobo, and carne asada burritos for my family. Me and my family members all agreed they were dry - rice and meat.. The burritos were ok, but I've definitely had better, like Castillo's (civil center). Disappointed and not worth the $8 - $10 for each burrito. You can definitely do better elsewhere. 
However, I will say the salsa was very  good.

Sorry Papalote. Overpriced and over-rated.

excerpts: I always order the chicken mole burrito
and it's unique and delicious.
Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission?
chicken.author: Will A.
chicken.review: A bit less traditional than the other taqueria's in the mission, but a nice variation. I always order the chicken mole burrito and it's unique and delicious. Where else can you find mole in a burrito in the mission? The grilled veggie burrito is great too-- not overseasoned or too greasy. Gotta love free chips and salsa, and the creamy spicy salsa is delicious.

excerpts: Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican.
Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste!
worth the visit!
chicken.author: Danny S.
chicken.review:
Ever since i became a vegetarian it has been difficult to find a good legitimate burrito place, that is until i found this place! 
It has about 4 different burrito and taco options for vegans/vegetarians (grilled veggies, or marinated tofu, or tofu with a mole sauce, or soy chorizo). Their rice and beans are vegan so you dont have to worry about whether they use chicken broth or anything like that.
And the taste of their food is really top notch, and is legitimate mexican. Its a small place and may be difficult to spot on the street, but has great taste! worth the visit!

excerpts: The chicken tacos are to Die for so its a good thing they serve the chips and salsa while you wait....
chicken.author: Raeleen D.
chicken.review:
I love Papalotes!  The chicken tacos are to Die for so its a good thing they serve the chips and salsa while you wait.... :)

Miguels smile makes it worth the drive to the city from San Jose-

excerpts: I recommend the chile verde chicken burrito and the mole chicken burrito.
I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here.
It is not overpowering or too thick.
I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here.
It is not overpowering or too thick.
chicken.author: Joyce L.
chicken.review:
LOVE this PLACE! 

The homemade salsa is something I randomly will crave. It is good. 

I recommend the chile verde chicken burrito and the mole chicken burrito. I like the way the mole chicken is prepared here. It is not overpowering or too thick. The tacos are also nice because they come with a lot of lettuce and tomatoes--yay more veggies!

The Triple Threat, which won in Bobby Flay's recent throwdown, is close to $20. I personally don't like eating that much meat in a burrito--so I don't think it's worth it.

excerpts: Don't be put off by the lack of latinos in this place because the mole chicken burrito is legit.
chicken.author: Roger H.
chicken.review:
Don't be put off by the lack of latinos in this place because the mole chicken burrito is legit. 

Not the best burrito I've had but the healthiest burrio I've ever had because I didn't feel gross afterwards.

excerpts: The beans had flavor and it's nice to have a place that uses veggie instead of chicken broth
so vegetarians have more options.
chicken.author: Jackie K.
chicken.review: Great tofu burrito.  Fresh and delicious albeit it expensive for a burrito.  Still cheaper than any sit down dinner and thus, worth it.  The beans had flavor and it's nice to have a place that uses veggie instead of chicken broth so vegetarians have more options.

excerpts: I don't like to order chicken burritos as most places tend to have overcooked white chicken, but not this place.
The chicken is juicy and flavorfull.
chicken.author: Evan W.
chicken.review:
I don't ever recall seeing any Mexican customers eat here. But don't fret, the food is tasty and cooked to order.

I don't like to order chicken burritos as most places tend to have overcooked white chicken, but not this place. The chicken is juicy and flavorfull.

The food can take awhile to get to you and the price is expensive for Mexican.


The $20 dollar burrito is a rip off. You can buy two regular burritos for the same price but you won't have that 3rd meat selection.

Don't leave there without buying a jar of their tomato based salsa.

excerpts: that orange salsa and chicken mole!!!
its so good
i bought a jar of the salsa to take home...
and you know what it's better than la vic's orange sauce!
chicken.author: Mara G.
chicken.review: that orange salsa and chicken mole!!! its so good i bought a jar of the salsa to take home... and you know what it's better than la vic's orange sauce!

excerpts: damn good chicken burrito.
I have to get one every time I'm in town!
The house salsa (orange stuff) is amazing as well.
I heard they sell it by the jar now which means next time
I'm up in SF visiting friends
I'll be picking a few up for home.
chicken.author: V N.
chicken.review: damn good chicken burrito. I have to get one every time I'm in town! The house salsa (orange stuff) is amazing as well. I heard they sell it by the jar now which means next time I'm up in SF visiting friends I'll be picking a few up for home.

excerpts: So I've been here previously and found the mole chicken burrito to be meh.
Maybe mole isn't my thing.
chicken.author: Bipasha M.
chicken.review:
Get the pescado tacos!!  Do it now!

So I've been here previously and found the mole chicken burrito to be meh.  Maybe mole isn't my thing.

Today I decided to be fair and give them another shot.  At $6.75 for two pescado tacos, I was a bit hesitant since I'm trying out that whole "staying on a budget" thing.  But it was SOOOOO worth it.  The fish was freshly sauteed in white wine, butter, and herbs and it had much more flavor than the grilled fish at Nick's.  They also gave a good 0.5 lb of fish split between the two tacos (or maybe I just got lucky).  The crisp lettuce, onions, and tomatoes topping the tacos also tasted fresh and gave a nice cool contrast relative to the warm, buttery fish.

Oh yea, and I've gotta agree with every salsa - it's probably the best I've ever had.

excerpts: The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices.
There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect.
chicken.author: Langdon N.
chicken.review:
Bobby Flay lost for a reason!

I came here to eat lunch today after hearing that Bobby Flay had lost a "Throwdown" here. The Triple Threat Burrito was the challenge, and boy was it also a challenge to finish. 

First off, the free chips as an appetizer are delicious! I don't know what's so different about them but they have a natural crunch to them that make them irresistible to turn away. Also, the salsa served with the chips is probably as close to perfect salsa I have ever tasted in my life. The salsa is sweet, yet not too sweet, and spicy enough to have a kick in it but not too much where you can only eat a bit. There's also none of that burnt pepper taste in it. 

I also split an order of fish tacos with my brother. The fish tacos were a lot bigger than other taquerias I've been to and they are extremely hot (temperature wise) when they come out. The fish tacos were recommended to us by the staff as their best tacos, and they were correct!

Now on to the Triple Threat Burrito. This burrito is definitely not for the faint at heart. The sheer size of the burrito is comparable to other taquerias as maybe 1.2 to 1.5 times larger. They also recommend that the burrito be shared by two or more people, which I recommend as well. The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices. There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect. The only downside to the burrito was the price, for $20 I could get 4 burritos at other taquerias, but I had to try this burrito at least once. 

On another note, this place is probably the closest thing to a temple for those with hangovers!

excerpts: I cannot wait to go back and try their asada and chicken burritos.
chicken.author: Tmo457 W.
chicken.review: I ordered the camarones (shrimp) super burrito. I had recently ate at el-ferrollito on mission street because of there $6 prices and 2200 reviews and i thought they had good burritos. But anyway i had the shrimp burrito with black beans. Talk about heaven this burrito (about $11.50) is hands down the BEST burrito I have ever had. The different tastes of it make my mouth water. It was perfectly cooked in every way. I was not impressed with my el-ferrolitto experience but I have no complaints about my papalote burrito. This burrito was superb. I highly recommend it. I cannot wait to go back and try their asada and chicken burritos. On top of all this you get free chips and salsa. There salsa is world class. If you near mission street and 24th do not pass this place up

excerpts: Apparently they have chicken adobo with garlic rice burritos (that's not on the menu).
What?!
I love burritos and love chicken adobo....
so they put them together like a freak experiment.
The chicken was good but both my wife and myself agreed it was missing something: either more adobo sauce or onion/garlic pieces or even sour cream that could've kicked it up a notch.
chicken.author: Ezduzit S.
chicken.review:
Saw them on TFC news segment. I was at my in-laws and had to have my wife translate. Apparently they have chicken adobo with garlic rice burritos (that's not on the menu). What?! I love burritos and love chicken adobo....so they put them together like a freak experiment. Gotta check it out. 

The verdict? It was pretty good. Wasn't sure if it was garlic rice (it was weak if it was) or just drippings from the adobo (mixed with their regular rice). The chicken was good but both my wife and myself agreed it was missing something: either more adobo sauce or onion/garlic pieces or even sour cream that could've kicked it up a notch. 

Regardless, it was good eats. Warrants another try. You can tell they put effort in their food. 

p.s. I hope you kicked Bobby Flay's ass in the throwdown challenge. He's full of sh*t and full of himself.

excerpts: Best ever mole chicken tacos in all of the bay area for sure.
If you are searching mole on Yelp then I hope you opened this post!!!!
chicken.author: Naureen H.
chicken.review:
I am totally dreaming of this place right now. Best ever mole chicken tacos in all of the bay area for sure. If you are searching mole on Yelp then I hope you opened this post!!!! They serve you warm chips and salsa at your table and you don't feel bad asking for refills. The staff is friendly and its fine with kids too. 

Its clean and doesnt have the greasy smell. Its seriously busy all the time and parking can be a bia but its so totally worth it.

excerpts: I am in love with the buttery tasty goodness that is the chicken adobo with garlic fried rice burrito.
the first time my friend
and I ordered it, we forgot to get super - this we thought would be a terrible mistake.
sour cream is one of my favorite things in the entire world.
turns out the burrito is
chicken.author: Niki B.
chicken.review:
I am in love with the buttery tasty goodness that is the chicken adobo with garlic fried rice burrito.  the first time my friend and I ordered it, we forgot to get super - this we thought would be a terrible mistake.  sour cream is one of my favorite things in the entire world.  turns out the burrito is just sooo delicious it didn't matter at all. 

I realllllly want to try the triple threat, but it just wouldn't feel right spending 20 bucks on a burrito. sad. at least I've got my adobo burrito!

oh also it's a very cute place.

excerpts: I was there Tuesday and it took OVERa half an hour to get a standard chicken burrito (which was delicious
chicken.author: Veronica Y.
chicken.review:
Papalote hurts my soul. Deciding whether to go to Papalote is a dilemma that is probably experienced by many San Franciscans due to the fact that their burritos are damn tasty but getting one takes for-f*cking-EVER. 

Be warned, friends - if you are starving and need immediate gratification do NOT walk in to Papalote and order a burrito.  Your sorry ass will be waiting for at least 15 minutes.  I was there Tuesday and it took OVERa half an hour to get a standard chicken burrito (which was delicious - I ate the entire thing and would've eaten a second if I could).

Ordering by phone seems to be the smart way to go about getting your food fast.  It kind of takes the spontaneity out of the experience but it'll save you frustration.  Case in point: I was silently cussing out the 20-30 peeps that were able to saunter straight up up to the phone order line and get their burrito immediately while I sat there, stomach growling, drinking my saliva and chewing my tongue.

So, three stars - five stars for the quality of the food, one star for the time suck and physical anguish.

excerpts: and I had the Chicken Adobo burrito with whole black beans.
So it takes me a while to actually start eating I like to cut my burrito in half...make sure I have a drink beside me...utensils too!
I'm about to take a bite of of my burrito and realize that the bf has mine...
he's already 3 bites into it!
How rude!
So we do the switch and I can tell his eyes are focused on mine now!
Let's just say the Chicken was so moist and so flavorful!
It was delicious just wish it was a little bigger...too bad
chicken.author: Michelle Y.
chicken.review:
All day the bf and I have been messaging each other that we want to try this so called Best burrito in San Francisco...he is torn between the Triple Threat and Carne Asada burrito! Oh the choices...actually the choice was pretty easy...haha...considering we would never pay $20 for a burrito unless it was maybe stuffed with some top notch Kobe beef! :P

He settled for the super Carne Asada burrito and I had the Chicken Adobo burrito with whole black beans. So it takes me a while to actually start eating I like to cut my burrito in half...make sure I have a drink beside me...utensils too! I'm about to take a bite of of my burrito and realize that the bf has mine...he's already 3 bites into it! How rude! So we do the switch and I can tell his eyes are focused on mine now! Let's just say the Chicken was so moist and so flavorful! It was delicious just wish it was a little bigger...too bad the Carne Asada burrito that my bf ate wasn't all that tasty. 

I really wanted to try their Triple Threat but was not going to shell out the money for it. :( bummer!

excerpts: Chicken tacos = fresh, crunchy, bright avocado.
And don't get me started on the salsa
- I could eat it as soup.
chicken.author: May A.
chicken.review: I've been coming to Papalote for years because it is so consistent and delicious.  We ate there today...and it was not consistent this time because it was EVEN MORE DELICIOUS than usual.  Steak burrito = perfect consistency, slightly grilled, amazing.  Chicken tacos = fresh, crunchy, bright avocado.  And don't get me started on the salsa - I could eat it as soup.

excerpts: Undercooked beans, underseasoned chicken, and don't think about lingering at your table for even a few minutes after they clear your plate
or they'll ask you to leave.
I understand turnover is important to their business, especially during lunch.
But shuffling people out the door less than 5 minutes after they finish their meal is kind of rude.
This is what I get for paying $9 for a burrito?
Give me a break.
If only La Taq weren't closed for remodeling.
chicken.author: Andrew K.
chicken.review: Undercooked beans, underseasoned chicken, and don't think about lingering at your table for even a few minutes after they clear your plate or they'll ask you to leave. I understand turnover is important to their business, especially during lunch. But shuffling people out the door less than 5 minutes after they finish their meal is kind of rude.
