This is what I get for paying $9 for a burrito? Give me a break. If only La Taq weren't closed for remodeling.

excerpts: My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.
chicken.author: Mark Y.
chicken.review:
When I want a real gourmet sit down burrito in a colorful place with Mexican bug kites on the ceiling, I'll put up with circling around a few times in the Mission to find parking when I come here. I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
 
The fresh and not too salty chipotle salsa, whole wheat tortilla options and ginger soft drinks are also a nice touch.

My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.

excerpts: - Chicken tacos -
the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain.
chicken.author: Amy H.
chicken.review:
Chilaquiles!

After walking by a few months ago and seeing someone chow down on a huge plate of nachos through the window, I knew I had to come back and check this place out sometime. I actually had no idea it was featured on Throwdown until the day before we went.

We arrived at 11:45am and it was totally dead. But our friends weren't here yet so we walked around the corner for a cup of coffee. 20 minutes later we walked back and there was a huge line out the door. 

So it's definitely not worth all the hype but the food is still pretty decent, and it's not your typical greasy Mexican joint like one would expect.

- Chips and Salsa - I thought the chips were just average - I've had better. The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. A generous serving of chips topped w/ cheese, sauce, and egg and served w/ beans and rice on the side
- Chile Verde burrito - a fat burrito, enough for two people. Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over. I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
- Chicken tacos - the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain. Served on two flour tortillas w/ lettuce and tomatoes.

I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.

One last note - the service is great and the staff was so friendly. With crowded tables and a 20 minute line out the door they could have easily been stressed out. But they all had a great attitude, were attentive, and thanked us with smiles on our way out.

excerpts: I had chicken Mole tacos.
Really good mole.
I haven't had good Mole since I moved from L.A.
The third was an order of chicken tacos.
chicken.author: Otis D.
chicken.review:
In the interest of full disclosure, I went to high school with the owners more than two decades ago.  I'm in the city for a bit and I haven't been in the Mission in a long time and hey, what was that place those guys own?  That's when a Google told me about the Food Network thing so it must be pretty decent.

There were three of us.  I had chicken Mole tacos.  Really good mole. I haven't had good Mole since I moved from L.A.  One Chile Verde Burrito, also really good.  Juicy tender meat with tangy sauce.  The third was an order of chicken tacos. 

I see others on here have mentioned the Salsa.  That stuff may haunt me between visits to S.F. that will hopefully include time to swing by again.   Starts off tomato with roasty smoked flavor and finishes with a good chile spice.  Not a fire eater spice but not for "mild please" weenies either.  And somehow it manages to seem creamy.  I'd like to buy it by the gallon jar.

Congratulations Miguel.  I dig your place and wish you continued success.  And the beer geek in me likes that you have Chimay Rouge in the cooler.

excerpts: I know that when I order a chicken mole burrito sans rice, I should expect, essentially, pollo asada with a hint of earth.
And when I get surprised by what tasted like God & chocolate got together and made roast chicken, I can't really be bothered to give a shit about authenticity.
chicken.author: jason l.
chicken.review:
What? Five stars for the whitest Mexican food this side of Taco Bell?

You're goddamn right. I earned my Mission Merit Badge back when YOU had no idea what San Francisco looked like after midnight because BART stopped heading to El Cerrito at 11. I had bacon wrapped hot dogs back when you were first hearing about The Tamale Lady (they USED TO BE $2, kids). So don't get pissy with me.

And I love the flavor of lard mixed with unwashed hands as much as the next guy. I've written love notes to taco trucks, and I've gotten ring sting from overzealous jalapenos that've soaked in pepper brine since the Carter Administration. I am more than immune to salmonella. I use it  like a sorority girl uses ranch dressing. 

So I KNOW, see, I know. I know that when I order a chicken mole burrito sans rice, I should expect, essentially, pollo asada with a hint of earth. And when I get surprised by what tasted like God & chocolate got together and made roast chicken, I can't really be bothered to give a shit about authenticity. When the salsa tastes like concentrated Mexican bullion, I'd be a fool to eschew it in favor of the onion & tomato afterthought that comes with thick chips and a hateful attitude at many of the nearby tacotoriums.

These aren't food socks, these are food stockings.

excerpts: And if you know me, you know that I will do almost anything for a fine man with a beard and the chicken fajitas from Chili's.
This included stopping in to Papalote - whose name just sincerely rrrrolls off the tongue - and ordering a Mole Chicken quesadilla.
I had heard of people liking this place immensely, saying GO, GO, GO!
But I was like "I've been to taquerias, ya'll.
Just chill.
But THIS taqueria IS different.
chicken.author: Kelly H.
chicken.review:
Dolores Park is maddening on sunny weekends.  I feel that I would rather skin both knees than go to Dolores Park on a sunny Saturday with friends.  With that said, I have been known to give in to peer pressure when there is beer or hookers involved.  In this case, it involved beer and good friends with beards.  And if you know me, you know that I will do almost anything for a fine man with a beard and the chicken fajitas from Chili's. 

Dolores Park, Coors Lights, PBR, temperature drops 20 degrees, smoke something, and so begins my Saturday evening of mystery.  This included stopping in to Papalote - whose name just sincerely rrrrolls off the tongue - and ordering a Mole Chicken quesadilla.  I had heard of people liking this place immensely, saying GO, GO, GO!  But I was like "I've been to taquerias, ya'll.  Just chill."  But THIS taqueria IS different.  It gives you about 12 choices of meat and veggie combos and sorts them in a taco, quesadilla, and burrito menu, making it SUPER EASY to order if you're at all fucked up or stupid.  I cannot wait to go back - seriously the menu is so organized and beautiful it's plain disgusting.  But really, Papalote is plaing GO-OOO-OOD, mang.

excerpts: Take the grilled chicken - tasteless and dry, except for the burnt bits.
Really subpar.
chicken.author: Justin W.
chicken.review:
Salsa is pureed and spicy - satisfying with lots of umami. Like a sauce at an Indian buffet. Not really Mexican, but fine. Not worth $7 per jar by any means.

Menu is absurdly, ridiculously, outlandishly overpriced. $9 plain burrito. Enough said.

Food itself never, ever rises above mediocre. Ever. Take the grilled chicken - tasteless and dry, except for the burnt bits. Really subpar. I've had better at airport Chilis.

For Marina tourists only.

excerpts: We tried the chicken burrito and the carne asada burrito.
It's really...
Meh - not bad but very average burrito.
Definitely not a $9, 10 burrito though.
Nothing compared to SoCal burritos.
Second, the orange sauce - pretty good.
It's different
, it's spicy, and it's tiny.
You only get one little cup of sauce for your your burrito and your chips.
It costs you extra if you want more.
Speaking of chips - not that great, had better.
Third, the wait - probably got more popular after the tv show.
but this place is pretty small, hence the wait is definitely long.
I highly recommend trying other taquirias - esp if the wait is long.
This place is over-rated.
chicken.author: MissJ J.
chicken.review:
Really can't figure out why this place is highly rated.
First, let's start with the food. We tried the chicken burrito and the carne asada burrito. It's really...Meh - not bad but very average burrito.  Definitely not a $9, 10 burrito though. Nothing compared to SoCal burritos.   
Second, the orange sauce - pretty good. It's different, it's spicy, and it's tiny. You only get one little cup of sauce for your your burrito and your chips. It costs you extra if you want more. Speaking of chips - not that great, had better.  
Third, the wait - probably got more popular after the tv show. but this place is pretty small, hence the wait is definitely long. I highly recommend trying other taquirias - esp if the wait is long. 
This place is over-rated.

excerpts: My friend got the chicken mole, and that was delicious too.
They have amazingly fresh and tasty guac.
chicken.author: Xavier G.
chicken.review:
This food was amazing! I got the shrimp burrito and it was the most delicious shrimp burrito I've ever had. My friend got the chicken mole, and that was delicious too. They have amazingly fresh and tasty guac. And lots of Mexican drink choices to choose from.

They even messed up on my burrito and forgot to make it. So I was waiting for 30 minutes for no reason whatsoever. I told them about it, and they told me they'd make it right away, and I got it in 5 minutes, which was nice. They were super apologetic, apologized to me 3 times even as we were leaving, which was pretty nice. But it was well worth waiting 35 minutes because it tasted heavenly, haha. I kind of wish they gave me a free drink or something to make up for it, but oh well...

excerpts: But today I wanted, no NEEDED, a super chicken burrito from Papalote.
And I didn't know it would be part of the deal, but the burrito maker was smiling and dancing as he one after another assembly-lined those delicious (and massive) bits of goodness.
The chicken is grilled to perfection with
I don't know what kinds of spices, but I'm not questioning, just keep up the good work.
The guacamole actually tastes like avocados, so you know it's got to be fresh.
chicken.author: Rachel F.
chicken.review:
So my mission for today was to somehow take my stink-ass rotten-for-a-personal-day mood and turn it around.

First step: Retail therapy at H&M.
Second step: Burrito as big as my head from Papalote.
Third step: Drink until I can't remember my name at DYL.

Papalote is deliciosa. I miss living by it, because parking tends to be trying around there. But today I wanted, no NEEDED, a super chicken burrito from Papalote. And I didn't know it would be part of the deal, but the burrito maker was smiling and dancing as he one after another assembly-lined those delicious (and massive) bits of goodness. Watching him completely enjoying his job totally turned my stink-ass mood around. 

The chicken is grilled to perfection with I don't know what kinds of spices, but I'm not questioning, just keep up the good work. The guacamole actually tastes like avocados, so you know it's got to be fresh. The homemade chips never seem to make it home with me, I eat them all up in the car on the way back.

And the roasted red pepper salsa is better than sex.

excerpts: BTW, you can also order the mole sauce with chicken.
I know this is weird
but I don't like to have rice or beans in my burrito
chicken.author: Morgan L.
chicken.review:
Second visit to Papalote and still happy with their quality and taste.   On my first try I had the Soyrizo Burrito per my bf's suggestion.  It was filling, tasty and I was surprised how Soyrizo tasted like Chorizo.  On this trip, I wanted to try something new and different.   I believe I had mole sauce before but not knowing that Chocolate was one of the main ingredients.   Thanks to all those food traveling shows I was anxious to test out their mole sauce with Tofu.  BTW, you can also order the mole sauce with chicken.  I know this is weird but I don't like to have rice or beans in my burrito (I guess I'm more of a fajita girl) so I usually add sour cream and guacamole instead. 

On my first bite i was pleasantly surprised by the sweet taste of the mole sauce.  You can taste the chocolate!   The sour cream and guacamole did not overwhelm the mole sauce at all.   I actually finished the burrito since I kept wanting the taste of the mole sauce.  Now I'm going to try mole sauce at different restaurant to see if what I had was the real thing.   

The homemade salsa was not too spicy but complimented the chips and burritos very well.   You can even buy a jar of the salsa for $5.99.   It's that good.

excerpts: Chicken Adobo meat - one of the staff gave me a small sample taste of their secret choice of meat.
It tasted more like Paksiw to my Filipino tongue than Adobo.
It's still pretty tasty
chicken.author: Hebert J.
chicken.review:
They definitely lived up with the hype of Awesome Burrito and Salsa. It's no wonder this place is always crowded. Don't be fooled by the lack of Latino customers in the resto, because they will still please your craving. 

Burrito - The Carne Asada, Chile Verde, and Pollo were all very tasty. Put a dollop of the salsa and you'll be in purgatory. I love it! 

Shrimp Taco - the shrimp were not fresh and this taco creation with bell peppers just didn't please my palate at all. (the only turn off)

Salsa - You can taste the freshness of the roasted tomatoes and the spiciness of the pepper. It has a great kick. The only salsa that can top this is La Vics in San Jose. I love it! 

Chicken Adobo meat - one of the staff gave me a small sample taste of their secret choice of meat. It tasted more like Paksiw to my Filipino tongue than Adobo. It's still pretty tasty but I'd rather have white rice with it. 

Price - It's more expensive than other taquerias in the Mission but it's worth it. (They need to be more generous on their salsa!) 

Staff - The owners were mingling with the people in line and all the staff members were genuinely nice!

excerpts: In addition to my fish tacos, I had bites of a quesadilla, burrito, and chicken taco, so I got pretty good sampling of the menu.
chicken.author: Stephanie P.
chicken.review:
Ohhhh baby I had some delish fish tacos for dinner last night. Sauteed in butter and wine, wrapped in soft corn tortillas with salsa fresca, sour cream and guacamole on top... hmm... I think I'm ready for Round 2.

I've been meaning to hit up Papalote for a while now, because it looked so damn cute. Forget cute - this place is scrumptious! The food tastes fresh, not heavy and greasy. In addition to my fish tacos, I had bites of a quesadilla, burrito, and chicken taco, so I got pretty good sampling of the menu. Now I just need to try some of their veggie/vegan options like tofu tacos or a soyrizo burrito (how awesome is it that they offer these things!?). As a self-proclaimed breakfast burrito connoisseur, breakfast offerings all day are also highly appreciated.

A definite new favorite for Mexican food in San Francisco.

excerpts: The burrito (chicken) was, as a result, a bit bland and very dry.
We also had an order of fish tacos, an order of chicken, and an order of beef.
chicken.author: Heather G.
chicken.review:
On the recommendation of a local, we headed to Papalote to sample what I've always heard to be superior Mexican food to what we have here in Boston.  

Can I just interject and describe to you how completely obnoxious it is to live in Boston and, on a regular basis, hear San Fransisco transplants berate me about the low quality and in-authenticity of Mexican food in the Northeast?  It seems like every person who has ever even step foot within a 500 mile radius of the Mission district feels obligated to chime in and remind me that, yes, Mexican food in Boston sucks, and Mission burritos are tastier.  After years of this, I began to think that this was, in fact, a fact (yeah, intentional), and that my trip to San Fransisco would give me an epiphany and a fantastic culinary experience to boot.

Back to the task at hand.  I went to the Mission and chose Papalote for my field research, as it seemed to be widely accepted as the "best burrito."  

I should have known that something was awry when the guy at the counter told me they had just whooped Bobby Flay in a Throwdown.  I call this the Flay phenomenon - The inevitable inflow of traffic post-TV-debut brings crowds to a Throwdown winner's establishment that the restaurant perhaps wasn't ready for (or ill-equipped to handle).  I fear this, as a once-fabulous place could go downhill quickly, choosing to ride the popularity wave.

Needless to say, I did not have such a great experience here, and whether it's the show's fault or the restaurant's, I left a bit let down.

The prices are steep - $5.50 for an order of two tacos, and this "famous" burrito now costs $20. WHAT?  What do you put in a burrito to make it $20.  I will tell you this - this place charges extra for cheese, sour cream, and guac, so I'm not sure what's left.

We did not go for the $20 burrito, but we had a more modest $9 version, but did not opt to pay the extra for the dairy and guac.  The burrito (chicken) was, as a result, a bit bland and very dry.  If the burrito only tastes good with these extra-charge add-ons, then why bother making the burrito at all? 

We also had an order of fish tacos, an order of chicken, and an order of beef.  The fish tacos were the only ones that were double-wrapped with two tortillas each, and the other two orders were only single-wrapped.  Is this "authentic"?  I am not sure, as I am not well-versed in corn tortilla etiquette, but I thought the customary-two was the standard.

The sole-double-wrapped fish taco was really wet and drippy, but I enjoyed that the fish wasn't battered and deep fried to the point of nonrecognition.  Rather, the fish in the tacos was abundant, moist, and juicy.  The other two tacos tasted just like each other, and were both very dry.

The best thing about this place was definitely the creamy, spicy salsa that accompanied the chips.  Perhaps this has always been the practice, or maybe it was due to the new-found extreme popularity, but after the first complimentary order, the restaurant charges for refills.  I don't necessarily think that this is a bad practice, just an interesting one I'd not seen before.  Because we bought so much food, however, we were able to get 4 orders of these for free, and I opted to ditch the tacos and make a meal out of chips and salsa.

You can buy this salsa by the jar to go, and had we not been from out of town, I would certainly take advantage of that.

I will say that the employees are ALL extremely friendly.  Everyone is kind, courteous, and polite.  We must have gone at a bizarre hour, because there was no line whatsoever.   Food came out hot and prompt, and I was very pleased with the experience aside from the taste of the food.

I don't think I'd go back, but one great thing did come from the experience.  Now, back at home, when people launch a tirade about how much New England Mexican sucks compared to the beloved Mission Burritos, I am able to smile, nod, and smirk knowingly (and perhaps a bit judgmentally) as they ramble on, while silently thinking that Olecito is better Mexican food than what I found in SF.

excerpts: But our soyrizo, pollo asado, and chicken mole quesadillas were taking an eternity.
The soyrizo quesadilla was excellent.
The chicken mole fantastic.
But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night.
The chicken mole fantastic.
But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night.
chicken.author: Jenny K.
chicken.review:
Hm. This is a tough one for me. The food is so fresh and tasty and the salsa insanely good, but the service, incomprehensibly long wait and nickel-and-diming are absurd.

We came here to grab some food  to-go before Dolores Park Movie Night. Little did we know that it would take 30 MINUTES for our order to be ready. Does it really take that long to make three quesadillas? Really? 

The lady at the cash register is also not friendly. She is the Mexican Food Nazi with scary eyebrows to match. We adore the salsa (shit, I could drink the stuff it's so freakin' good!) and asked for extra chips to go with the jar we were buying. She shook her head, "No extra chips," and told us each little scoop cost $1. $1!!! 

We stood around and watched order after order (by people who ordered AFTER us, by the way) go out the door. But our soyrizo, pollo asado, and chicken mole quesadillas were taking an eternity. 

When we finally got our food 30 minutes later, it was almost worth the wait. ALMOST. The soyrizo quesadilla was excellent. The chicken mole fantastic. But again, the wait cost us better seats for movie night. And let's not forget that the food is over-priced. 

I am going to have to try the one on Fulton. It's closer to where I live and I am hoping the service and wait are better than the Mission location.

excerpts:
beef, chicken, soyrizo, veggie...

i liked the veggie the best.
chicken.author: Susy C.
chicken.review:
mad props for feeding my department on e-day.
the food was yummy, and not to mention we had a huge variety of it!
it was like a plethora of quesdillas, i was so happy.
beef, chicken, soyrizo, veggie...

i liked the veggie the best.
i haven't actually been inside the restaurant itself, my co-worker picked up the food and brought it back to work.

Papalote's, I SALUTE YOU! Thank you for supporting our hardworking department. =)

excerpts: Seriously, not like shredded chicken at other places in town, but big tasty moist pieces that were fantastic for a $5 meal.
chicken.author: Gabriel R.
chicken.review:
This is my first experience here and this is how it went:

Short wait in the cold. No problem though as it reminded me of home. Read the easy menu and went for it. A Chile Verde burrito and a Carne Asada quesadilla. The pork in the burrito was incredible! Seriously, not like shredded chicken at other places in town, but big tasty moist pieces that were fantastic for a $5 meal. The steak in the quesadilla (a little on the small side) was done extremely well. Typically, strips of steak tend to get overcooked and tough but these folks did it right with every piece. 

The salsa that was brought to the table was different. Incredibly tasty and just enough spice. I had never had anything like it and would buy the stuff by the jar...better yet, by the case! 

Can't wait to go back again.

excerpts: My favorite dish here is the chicken mole burrito, super.
I'm a fan of ordering ahead and taking a jar of their salsa back with me.
Enjoy!
chicken.author: Deborah E.
chicken.review: There are so many options in this city for great burritos, but Papalote is the best!  Their amazing salsa sets them apart from every other place out there.  My favorite dish here is the chicken mole burrito, super.  I'm a fan of ordering ahead and taking a jar of their salsa back with me.  Enjoy!

excerpts: As for the good, vegans can eat here (which seems to make them happy at least), they make a tasty mole chicken/tofu filling and the meat grilled to order is a fine touch(though marinating the beef would improve it greatly), the salsa is good (not the amazing miracle
chicken.author: Gustie L.
chicken.review:
Some may disrespect Papalote 'cause it's "inauthentic" -- I don't care, nor do I even know what that means in the context of a bastardized hybrid such as the Burrito.  Papalote should offer a great burrito, it wins "burrito of the year" in the weeklies all the time, and there's a line out the door most nights.  Sadly though, it offers only a middling burrito, elements of which are excellent, but which overall fails to hold together (literally if you order in house and the unwrapped log is served to you on a plate).

What do I mean, how can I blaspheme so?  What I mean is that the rice is often clumpy and unspiced, the beans mediocre at best, there's sometimes odd "salt strata" in the filling, the lines are murder - cramped, endless murder, the prices are a bit dear, and worst of all, I've been given stale chips of several occasions [ the stale chip problem seems to have vanished as of 8/1/07].   As for the good, vegans can eat here (which seems to make them happy at least), they make a tasty mole chicken/tofu filling and the meat grilled to order is a fine touch(though marinating the beef would improve it greatly), the salsa is good (not the amazing miracle some claim, but tasty).

Thus, I approve on principle and like some touches (the owner is a nice guy as well), but since they don't really need my approval, or my burrito dollar, and there are some intolerable inconsistencies at Papalote, I'm going elsewhere these days.

excerpts: If you order grilled chicken or beef burritos, this place is clearly a 4/5.
I am not a fan of the chicken mole burrito.
It lacks flavor.
chicken.author: Angelica S.
chicken.review: I have been to El Papalote a few times. If you order grilled chicken or beef burritos, this place is clearly a 4/5. I like that you can make it super for 99 cents, which includes guacamole, cheese, and sour cream. The complementary chips and salsa are great. I am not a fan of the chicken mole burrito. It lacks flavor. The time I had one, my beans were a bit under cooked, the rice mushy, and the mole flavor not present at all.

excerpts:
We got 2 orders of tacos with chicken and steak:

Extremely dry overcooked chewy meat ( yuck )
I ate steak ( which was also very dry ) and beans, since I was very hungry and we already dropped $$ on the beer.
chicken.author: farid a.
chicken.review:
Dont buy into the hype. This place is straight up disgusting.. 

We got 2 orders of tacos with chicken and steak:

Extremely dry overcooked chewy meat ( yuck )
Tacos basically come with lettuce and tomatoes, whats mexican about that? Sounds more like Mexican McDonalds. Lettuce was wilted and wet. Tomatoes smelled like they were sitting for a couple of days in a half cool fridge..
 Ordered a side of beans, waited for about 10 min while tacos got cold. On top of that they put some watery red crap on the plate, which made tacos soggy and looking red ( double yuck !! )

I ate steak ( which was also very dry ) and beans, since I was very hungry and we already dropped $$ on the beer.

If you want good mexican food go to either Regalito, Napolito or Chilango.

 Papalote is putrid..

excerpts: After perusing the menu board, I settled on the chicken mole burrito with black refried beans on a whole wheat tortilla.
It was tasty but didn't have the distinct mole flavor I was expecting.
I will say that their burritos are the perfect size.
chicken.author: Z. M.
chicken.review:
I heard about this burrito joint by word of mouth. I stopped by after school one day around five o'clock. The line that I read about in other Yelpers' reviews was non-existant, probably owing to fact that I went around 'tain't time ('tain't lunch, 'tain't dinner).

The lady who greeted me and took my order was extremely friendly and patient while I made up my mind.

After perusing the menu board, I settled on the chicken mole burrito with black refried beans on a whole wheat tortilla. It was tasty but didn't have the distinct mole flavor I was expecting. I will say that their burritos are the perfect size. Not too small, and not too huge as to put one into an instant burrito coma.

The salsa is outstanding - creamy and packing a spicy kick. I only wish the chips were better. They tasted like mass market tortilla chips. I much prefer the freshly fried tortilla chips some other burrito joints serve.

I look forward to trying a different kind of burrito and ordering extra salsa on my next visit.

excerpts: Not to mention the latest and greatest idea:  CHICKEN ADOBO & GARLIC FRIED RICE burritos.
This isn't officially on the menu as a regular item but if you're in the know, via Twitter, they announce at least a month in advance when they'll be serving it and at which location.
The next one is jumpin' off February 6, 2010 at the Masonic restaurant.
chicken.author: Ivan F.
chicken.review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said about this place??? Good ass food!! Not to mention the latest and greatest idea:  CHICKEN ADOBO & GARLIC FRIED RICE burritos. This isn't officially on the menu as a regular item but if you're in the know, via Twitter, they announce at least a month in advance when they'll be serving it and at which location. The next one is jumpin' off February 6, 2010 at the Masonic restaurant. Don't sleep!

NEWSFLASH! Don't forget to watch 'Bobby Flay vs. Papalote' in a burrito throwdown on the Food Network on Wednesday, February 17, 2010. Check your local listings!

excerpts: My favorite thing to order is the Chicken Mole.
Now, I'm no mole-expert, but I enjoy the hell out of this one.
The salsa is pretty much the best salsa I've ever had.
I even tried to mail myself a few jars
(Goddamn you, FedEx!).
I am to understand that the soy-rizo is excellent, also, but I'm stuck on the mole.
chicken.author: Matt C.
chicken.review:
God do I love Papalote. To the extent that I sometimes have to stop myself from flying to SFO to lunch. I was pointed here by a dear friend months ago, and her suggestion was bolstered - deservingly so - by the reviews here.  Boy am I glad that I made that trip!

 My favorite thing to order is the Chicken Mole. Now, I'm no mole-expert, but I enjoy the hell out of this one. The salsa is pretty much the best salsa I've ever had. I even tried to mail myself a few jars (Goddamn you, FedEx!). I am to understand that the soy-rizo is excellent, also, but I'm stuck on the mole. Add a mexican Coke to the mix, and it's perfect.

Atmosphere wise, I really dig the place, too. it's small, but clean and comfortable. It doesn't feel super-hip inside, nor is it some filthy shithole. It's also very conveniently located to my favorite mode of mass-transport, BART.

If you can't tell, I love Papalote. I think it's reputation is well-deserved, and you should at least check it out once.

excerpts: The burritos are good too, although I got a chicken mole quesadilla
a couple of weeks ago
and I think it was a mistake.
I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.
I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.
chicken.author: Melanie B.
chicken.review:
Best salsa everrrrrrrrrrr (*sings*)!

The fish tacos are a-ma-zing.  I went here with a friend and thought a burrito would be too much so I opted for the tacos instead... So.  Much.  Food.  So yummy!  The last time I had fish tacos this good was in San Felipe (apparently the home of the fish taco...)!

Nom-nom-nom-full-full-full.

The burritos are good too, although I got a chicken mole quesadilla a couple of weeks ago and I think it was a mistake.  I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.  Either way, I have liked everything else I have eaten here.

The prices are perhaps a couple of dollars more than I would want to pay in an ideal world, but it doesn't stop me going back again and again because I loves it!  Oh and remember, if you have some of that salsa left by the time your food comes, throw some of it on those fish tacos, it's too good to waste!

excerpts: I've tried pretty much everything on the menu, but the chicken is still my favorite.
chicken.author: Samantha M.
chicken.review:
Best. burritos. in. SF. I've tried pretty much everything on the menu, but the chicken is still my favorite.

And I'm pretty sure the roasted tomato salsa is the closest thing to heaven on earth.

excerpts:
-the chicken was damn tasty.. this is why I can never go vegetarian
-whole wheat tortilla, so I can be somewhat healthy

needless to say, I destroyed the whole burrito in one sitting.
chicken.author: Jennie L.
chicken.review:
I heard a lot about this place and finally tried it myself and papalote did NOT disappoint. there's like almost 600 reviews so nothing I'm saying is probably new but,
-they take cards!!!!! hallefuckinglujah for ppl like me who dont carry cash 
-the salsa is seriously THE shit, looked a lil weird but tasted like it was handmade by jesus or something. def on the spicy side which I love
-the chicken was damn tasty.. this is why I can never go vegetarian
-whole wheat tortilla, so I can be somewhat healthy

needless to say, I destroyed the whole burrito in one sitting. whatever, it was too good to save for leftovers. papalote... you will be seeing a lot of me..

excerpts: I had the chicken mole burrito, which was not only outstanding, but came to the table
MAYBE ten minutes after we ordered at the counter.
The mole is chocolaty and fantastic, but the real discovery of the day was...
ba ba ba baaaaa.....
the roasted salsa.
wow.
Probably the best salsa I've ever had, and kids, I grew up here.
I've had a bazillion types of salsa.
I'm a fan, maybe an aficionado.
This wins, hands down, as most perfectly spiced / roasted / blended salsa this side of...
well....anywhere.
We picked up an extra jar of it to take home and nibble with chips for dinner.
chicken.author: Emily H.
chicken.review:
On a recommendation, we stopped in for a late lunch after a long day in the city.  

We managed to get a parking spot right in front, which proved to be an omen of even better fortune inside.

I had the chicken mole burrito, which was not only outstanding, but came to the table MAYBE ten minutes after we ordered at the counter.  The mole is chocolaty and fantastic, but the real discovery of the day was...ba ba ba baaaaa.....the roasted salsa.  wow.  Probably the best salsa I've ever had, and kids, I grew up here.  I've had a bazillion types of salsa.  I'm a fan, maybe an aficionado.  This wins, hands down, as most perfectly spiced / roasted / blended salsa this side of...well....anywhere.

We picked up an extra jar of it to take home and nibble with chips for dinner.

excerpts: Ordered the adobo chicken
burrito,
not cuz I'm Filipino, but cuz all of my people were ranting and raving about it.
Chicken was good and juicy and flavored "ok."
Maybe they all just got excited b
/c they got their country's dish in a mexican wrap and they thought it was neat.
Who knows.
chicken.author: Emily L.
chicken.review:
Salsa was gooood.  Served a little warm and has a different kick and tang to it like I've never tasted before.  But when I asked for more chips, they wanted to charge me an extra $1.  Maybe I'm spoiled but at most Mexican restaurants where the burritos cost as much as they do here, it's FREE.

Ordered the adobo chicken burrito, not cuz I'm Filipino, but cuz all of my people were ranting and raving about it.  Chicken was good and juicy and flavored "ok."  Maybe they all just got excited b/c they got their country's dish in a mexican wrap and they thought it was neat.  Who knows.  On top of that, I ordered it super and they gave me plain.  When I told one of the owners about it, he brought me sour cream, guac, and cheese on a plate on the side.  I didn't know this was build your own burrito.  Would definitely check it out again and if it beat Bobby Flay, there must be something right about this place...I just haven't discovered it yet.

excerpts: Prawns for the taco were burned, super condiments were very sparse, chicken in burrito was dry.
chicken.author: Marina N.
chicken.review: Saw a huge crowd here so we had to try it. The best part of the meal is the reddish sauce they serve complimentary with the chips. Prawns for the taco were burned, super condiments were very sparse, chicken in burrito was dry.

excerpts: Week two, the burrito labeled "VEGGIE" was actually the chicken burrito.
Additionally, the chicken burrito was supposed to be super (which was on the receipt so we were charged) but was not.
Sorry, Papalote, don't care if you beat Bobby Flay in throwdown.
Tighten it up.
chicken.author: Sig N.
chicken.review: Here's the deal...if the service sucks, it doesn't matter how good the food is. Don't get me wrong, I think Papalote makes a quality product but two weeks in a row they've messed up the take out order. Week one, we ordered the regular veggie but got the grilled veggie burrito. Week two, the burrito labeled "VEGGIE" was actually the chicken burrito. Additionally, the chicken burrito was supposed to be super (which was on the receipt so we were charged) but was not. Sorry, Papalote, don't care if you beat Bobby Flay in throwdown. Tighten it up.

excerpts: I was telling him about the Triple Threat Burrito and how there's steak, chicken and shrimp inside
and he said "What are you waiting for, let's go!
We pulled up, got a parking spot right in front and walked in knowing exactly what we wanted.
Ordered the $20!
burrito and took our seats.
We got our burrito and started to chow down.
Every bite say "Ohhh - Ahhh - Yummm
- This is the best salsa - Yumm...
" this went on for about 15 minutes and then we both were stuffed.
Couldn't take one more bite.
I think the best part on the burrito was the chicken, nice big chunks and very good seasoning.
I'm not much of a red meat eater
so I actually picked out some of the steak
but that doesn't mean it was good.
chicken.author: Katie J.
chicken.review:
We both we were starving when we got to the city on Sunday so I went onto my Yelp! application on my iPhone, then to my bookmarks, sorted them to 'Distance from Me' and Papalote came up as the closet (so did Humphry's but that's another review.) I was telling him about the Triple Threat Burrito and how there's steak, chicken and shrimp inside and he said "What are you waiting for, let's go!" We pulled up, got a parking spot right in front and walked in knowing exactly what we wanted. Ordered the $20! burrito and took our seats. We got our burrito and started to chow down. Every bite say "Ohhh - Ahhh - Yummm - This is the best salsa - Yumm..." this went on for about 15 minutes and then we both were stuffed. Couldn't take one more bite. I think the best part on the burrito was the chicken, nice big chunks and very good seasoning. I'm not much of a red meat eater so I actually picked out some of the steak but that doesn't mean it was good. And the shrimps were big! 

We both agreed that this was the best burrito we have ever eaten but for $20 it better be.

excerpts:
if it wasnt so pricey and they were more consistent about how many chips you get with take out orders i would give them 5 stars
the chicken mole burritos are out of this world
and i dont even really like chicken!!!!!!!!!
chicken.author: beth m.
chicken.review:
if it wasnt so pricey and they were more consistent about how many chips you get with take out orders i would give them 5 stars
the chicken mole burritos are out of this world
and i dont even really like chicken!!!!!!!!!

excerpts: Mole chicken tacos are damn good.
Great mole sauce that leaves the essence of chocolate in your mouth.
chicken.author: Mona M.
chicken.review:
I've been meaning to drop in here but there's always a line and I'm always in a hurry.  Finally had lunch here. Mole chicken tacos are damn good. Great mole sauce that leaves the essence of chocolate in your mouth.  Wonderfully ripe produce in the tacos. 

Super pleased with the flavor, the quantity and the price. And it's so close to my flat.

excerpts: But I appreciate that it's healthier without it, and I also dug the fact that they use boneless, skinless chicken breast.
Salsa is definitely tasty, but the chips weren't that great, so it kinda ruined it for me.
chicken.author: Jasmine F.
chicken.review:
Meh. 

One star for being healthy
One star for good prices
One star for the salsa

I wasn't particularly thrilled by my burrito. It was VERY salty, and I would have liked it to have cheese in it. But I appreciate that it's healthier without it, and I also dug the fact that they use boneless, skinless chicken breast. Salsa is definitely tasty, but the chips weren't that great, so it kinda ruined it for me.

excerpts: Their grilled chicken and grilled veggies are so delicious.
chicken.author: Romeo And Lola K.
chicken.review:
We've had great burritos at Papalote. Their grilled chicken and grilled veggies are so delicious. 

The salsa is great!

excerpts: the chicken mole.
it was good, but I can't help but think I chose my own adventure
and I chose wrong.
mole is very difficult to pull off especially at $6.95.
chicken.author: Gabe b.
chicken.review:
sometimes I get a little too adventurous when deep down I know sticking to the basics is the way to go. 
In this case, I went w/ the chicken mole. it was good, but I can't help but think I chose my own adventure and I chose wrong. mole is very difficult to pull off especially at $6.95. 

That being said the salsa is legit as most folks have pointed out and the other dishes that my dining companions ate where delicious. 
definitely coming back here for a 2nd chance.

excerpts: My friends had chicken quesadillas and loved it.
chicken.author: Tiffany L.
chicken.review:
The place was packed and lines were out of the door.  I was lucky since my friends already got seats by the time I got there.

I had the tofu mole but I thought the mole sauce was a bit overbearing. However, I like how "light and healthy" I felt after eating the entire burrito.   Also, the chips and salsa were warm and spicy.

My friends had chicken quesadillas and loved it.

An eclectic Mexican joint for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike!

excerpts: I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore
so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.
The rice and bean burrito.
It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.
Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.
chicken.author: TeTeDaMouse C.
chicken.review:
Papalote is up there when it comes to delicious Mexican food.  It's definitely in the top three and funny, for the life of me, I don't know remember the names of the other two because I'm hazy from the glow of Papalote's deliciousness.  While the proximity of my next job location to Papalote wouldn't be the deciding factor in picking one job over the other, it would definitely be a perk.

Papalote is a restaurant where I don't miss meat as part of my meal.  Their vegan and vegetarian burritos are delicious.  I usually order my burrito with black beans, a whole wheat tortilla, and make it a super so I can have their delicious guacamole.  The cheese is nice too. I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.  The rice and bean burrito.  It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.  Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.  It's hard to describe; it's a bit smoky.  

I love me some Papalote!  If I was vegan or vegetarian, it wouldn't be hard because of Papalote.  I firmly believe the restaurant would get me through the hard times.

excerpts: I ordered the mole chicken burrito since it looked different.
chicken.author: Vivian L.
chicken.review:
We came to pick up our orders then go to my friend's house nearby for dinner. I'm not sure if it's normal, but after placing our order, we waited an hour for our take out food. I get that they make each order when ordered, but still, we were freaking starving. It didn't help that it was during that heat wave last month so it was freaking hot in there like summertime in Mexico.

Anyways, onto the food. I ordered the mole chicken burrito since it looked different. During my hour wait, I read articles talking about the fake chorizo which I would try next time I went, if I go again.

The chips and salsa were good, but not worth the hour wait. 

Since I don't live in the Mission, I probably wouldn't come back here next time since there are so many Mexican places to try. But there were lots of locals in there that day, so I can see how it can be a neighborhood favorite, just not mine.

excerpts: , when you order grilled chicken, they grill it right then.
That means there are no metal tins of grilled chicken or carne just sitting there all day being heated.
chicken.author: Jackie O.
chicken.review:
I was skeptical at first but now I'm really into this place! They make your food as you order it--That's right, when you order grilled chicken, they grill it right then. That means there are no metal tins of grilled chicken or carne just sitting there all day being heated. Good vegetarian options too (grilled, marinated tofu!). Good salsa. Free chips. They bring the food to your table too!
Sure it may take a little longer than most taquerias but its worth the wait knowing that what you ordered is fresh.
Oh, did I mention how good the prices are?!

excerpts: We shared a chicken burrito, where you could taste the freshness of all the ingredients.
We also had nachos.
Nachos & super chicken burrito was $14.
chicken.author: Margee B.
chicken.review:
Today is Thursday.  Tuesday was my first introduction of Papalote, and I've already gone back.  It's that good.  And that cheap.  Unsurprisingly, it's in the Mission, where you'll find some of the best culture and food of the city.  

Both times I have been it's been packed with hipsters.  The diversity here is sorely lacking, which is a polite way of saying that it was all white people being served by people who (I assume) are Hispanic.  Which bugs me, but the food is too good to pass up.

Both times the boyfriend and I shared a burrito and nachos.  The chips and salsa that come while you wait (and you do wait - it's packed), is so delicious.  I just want to eat that all day.  We shared a chicken burrito, where you could taste the freshness of all the ingredients.  We also had nachos.  The beans were amazing, the cheese was great, and the chips were crispy.  Oh goodness, it was so good.

The seating is limited, so don't bring a big crowd.  And if you have to wait for a table, well, you have to wait.  A lot of people do take-out, or order ahead.  But it's worth it.

While the price of a burrito is pretty average in SF, their prices are generally cheaper than most.  Sometimes only by about 30 cents, but sometimes by a few dollars.  A bean, rice, and salsa burrito is $3.75 (I believe).  Nachos & super chicken burrito was $14.

excerpts: and I love to dump the stuff on the chicken burrito.
The pescado tacos are scrumptious and on the lighter side if you're not in the mood for a carbo coma.
chicken.author: James M.
chicken.review:
A caveat in advance: this is NOT traditional Mexican fare, or even the traditional California interpretation of Mexican fare.  This is healthy and yupp-ified.  

Which, when you want it, and can appreciate it as something separate is AMAZING here.  Their salsa is really really good and I love to dump the stuff on the chicken burrito.  The pescado tacos are scrumptious and on the lighter side if you're not in the mood for a carbo coma.

excerpts: The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin...
3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.
chicken.author: Avery G.
chicken.review:
After hearing so many good things from friends, colleagues and even sources like Chow Magazine, I was excited to give Papalote a shot when my co-workers decided to head there for lunch. Finally, I would have a chance to sample their "practically-orgasmic" salsa!

Papalote is a taqueria with partial table service. You order your food at the counter, grab a drink, pay your way, take a number and head over to a table in the side room and eagerly await the server with your taco, burrito, quesadilla or other standard taqueria fare... which is exactly what I did. 

The chips (still warm) and salsa were brought almost immediately - and for all intents and purposes, they were the highlight of the meal. The rich orange salsa was spicy, sweet and had a complexity of flavor not commonly found in the condiment. The texture was smooth with black flecks - possibly from black pepper or from the skin of roasted pumpkin or peppers (yep - the secret ingredient, I have been told, is pumpkin seeds). This salsa's only competition for #1 in San Francisco is by Orale Orale.

The steak for the Carne Asada (which got very high marks from my co-workers), as well as the chicken, is cooked to order on a grill instead of scooped out of a steam table bin... and though I didn't sample it, the meat certainly looked good: appropriately charred and tender.

The pork Chile Verde was also quite good, with distinct flavors of tomatillo, cilantro and citrus in the sauce. Unfortunately, this filling, when combined with refried beans, cheese, rice and guacamole and wrapped in a tortilla, didn't meld into that cheesy-goopy goodness that makes an excellent burrito. It was good, but not great. Certainly not on par with Victor's or Mexico au Parc - which just goes to show you: even if every component of a dish is excellent, sometimes it doesn't come together properly to make something amazing. This time, the components were better than the sum of its parts.

$8.89 for a super burrito, chips, salsa and a bottle of grapefruit soda. 3 stars for now, but I will certainly be back to try a carne asada quesadilla.

excerpts: Despite the disappointment with the salsa, I had a Chicken Super Burrito and absolutely loved it.
The chicken was grilled perfectly and the cheese was completely melted in the beans.
chicken.author: Michelle L.
chicken.review:
I went to try the Salsa that I've heard so much about. My personal preference is for fresh, chunky salsa. This one was more of a spicy, tomato soup consistency. 

Despite the disappointment with the salsa, I had a Chicken Super Burrito and absolutely loved it.   The chicken was grilled perfectly and the cheese was completely melted in the beans.  I also appreciated the option of Tortilla (wheat, white, spinach & one more I forgot) and also the choice of beans.

I will be back for sure.

excerpts: Did not like mole chicken
Was not happy about the hype of this place =(
chicken.author: Tiff W.
chicken.review: Did not like mole chicken :/ Was not happy about the hype of this place =(

excerpts: i had the chicken mole burrito and literally couldn't stop eating until it was all gone...
and it's a big sucker!
i liked the radish (i think?)
chicken.author: Andrey C.
chicken.review:
a solid four stars for the food and for trying their best to manage the crowds... the staff really tries to make sure everything's orderly. the only thing they can't always control is how long people decide to dilly-dally at the table after their food has been eaten and plates practically cleared away, oblivious to others who are waiting. come on now, people!

the food was very fulfilling with lots of meat and flavor. i had the chicken mole burrito and literally couldn't stop eating until it was all gone... and it's a big sucker! i liked the radish (i think?) condiment they and of course those famous chips and salsa... it's more along the lines of a creamy looking spicy sauce than a pico de gallo but so nice!

anyway, next time around i'll probably just do pick-up and go home.

excerpts: Grilled chicken super burrito (sour cream, guac, rice, beans, cheese and salsa) is da bomb.
chicken.author: Kathleen N.
chicken.review:
Hnads down, Papalotes has the best salsa. Whenever I come here, I can't help but dip everything I order here in the salsa. The chips that come with your order are warm and delicious. A big plus!

Grilled chicken super burrito (sour cream, guac, rice, beans, cheese and salsa) is da bomb.

Call in your order ahead so you don't have to wait in the long line once you arrive. The dining room here looks cute, but I always get my food to go.

excerpts: Great grilled vegetable fajitas with grilled chicken.
I've had most of the quesadillas on the menu and liked them all.
chicken.author: P.J. D.
chicken.review: I'm not a big fan of Mexican food, never have been, but this place is pretty good.  Great grilled vegetable fajitas with grilled chicken.  I've had most of the quesadillas on the menu and liked them all.  The vegan mole with tofu is pretty good too.  The atmosphere is pretty much your typical Mission hole with a casual vibe.  The only thing I'd improve on is the order first and wait for something to open up style of self seating .  I don't like eating and watching a half dozen people stare me down in the hope of making me swallow my food faster.

excerpts: Got chicken mole tacos, churizo/cheese dipping appetizer thingy and guacamole.
chicken.author: Sarah G.
chicken.review:
Delicioso! Wanted a good burrito place where we could sit down and not feel like we're in one of the in-n-out, i'm probably drunk, burrito places all over the mission. 

Got chicken mole tacos, churizo/cheese dipping appetizer thingy and guacamole. Highly recommend all 3! 

seating can be a pain, the whole stalking people eating and jumping on a table when they're getting up, but it's worth it.

excerpts: On this particular occasion I chose the chicken mole, a nice blend of salt and spice, mixed in well with healthy black beans and really good rice, some of the best black rice I've had around the Bay Area and that says a lot.
My buddy swears by the griilled chicken, and rates this as one of the top burrito places in the Mission.
chicken.author: Hubert H.
chicken.review:
Excellent choice for a 'higher-end' burrito, just one block down from the 24th Street BART station for about $5-6. On this particular occasion I chose the chicken mole, a nice blend of salt and spice, mixed in well with healthy black beans and really good rice, some of the best black rice I've had around the Bay Area and that says a lot. My buddy swears by the griilled chicken, and rates this as one of the top burrito places in the Mission.

I reserved inserting that '5th star' just because, I don't know, a 5-star place should be really really awesome, and this probably is a really awesome, but I can't say that I was blown away, but then again, I don't know how a burrito could blow me away.

The place is colorful and filled with young idealists, the type who read Kant and look like they want to make a difference in the world. Oh wait, that was me. S***.

The only thing that bothered me was the water cooler, whose knob you had to turn 10 times, only to get it to spout  water at a flow rate slower than the Mississippi, or perhaps like a guy who has a hard time peeing. Perhaps it's a ruse to get you to buy a drink there. Sorry, I'm a cheapo.

excerpts: They do make fresh and comparatively healthier Mexican fare with interesting burrito options like chili verde and mole with chicken or tofu.
chicken.author: Kathryn M.
chicken.review: Known within my household as Papa-slo-te, because they must be some kind of union at the rate they out put a burrito.  They do make fresh and comparatively healthier Mexican fare with interesting burrito options like chili verde and mole with chicken or tofu.  Also, pretty good fish tacos, a rarity of the Mission, but not Baja style. Helpful hints:  at lunch time the strollers descend from the hilltop of Noe Valley and fill up the room, it will take you about 20-30 min. after ordering to get your food, and they will charge you something crazy for a side of guacamole.  Lastly, I feel like you kind of deserve it if you feel ripped off after dropping $20 on a burrito, even if you saw it on the TV, so stick to the menu that doesn't sound crazy and you should be fine.

excerpts: The chicken was grilled in some type of orange marinade which looked cool but did not do much for the flavor.
Taquerias are not worth a damn if they don't give large portions and for 8 dollars I better not be able to finish my plate.
I left full and satisfied
so I'll go back but probably for something in the vegi category.
Conclusions: It definitely had the "we are catering to the gringos" vibe.
chicken.author: ray M.
chicken.review:
This would have been a 3 star rating had there not been bottles of Prohibition on the premises.  Although not terrible by any means the food is not exactly worth the price you pay.  

It was nacho day for me, a friend of mine recommended the joint and it was within jogging distance.    Re-fried black beans are always a nice surprise for me but I'm not sure if you get the lard options.  The chicken was grilled in some type of orange marinade which looked cool but did not do much for the flavor.  Taquerias are not worth a damn if they don't give large portions and for 8 dollars I better not be able to finish my plate.  I left full and satisfied so I'll go back but probably for something in the vegi category.

Conclusions: It definitely had the "we are catering to the gringos" vibe.

excerpts: I got the chicken mole burrito.
Definitely go there again.
My friend got the breakfast burrito and said it wasn't that good.
chicken.author: josh m.
chicken.review: awesome food. I got the chicken mole burrito. Definitely go there again. My friend got the breakfast burrito and said it wasn't that good.

excerpts: Grilled chicken and grilled steak are both fabulous.
The best salsa ever.
I love going here.
The burritos are big-
so I usually save half.
The second half is still good hours later.
They serve beer too.
chicken.author: Madhuri K.
chicken.review: My favorite burrito place in San Francisco.  Grilled chicken and grilled steak are both fabulous.  The best salsa ever.  I love going here.  The burritos are big- so I usually save half.  The second half is still good hours later.   They serve beer too.

excerpts: The Tacos are just "ok", the chicken quesadilla is the worst i
chicken.author: Benjamin B.
chicken.review: So all the hype from Yelp reviews to the Throwdown Challenge and the Tripple Threat burrito. I try not to drive too far from where i live over on Ocean Ave. I can just drive down to mission and hit up some very descent taco/burrito joints. Well the GF wanted to try this place, and i felt like some mexican food. We get to the place and place our order and it comes out to 25$ for regular carne asada tacos,pollo quesadilla, and carne asada nachos. So far this is the most ive ever spent for a hole in the wall spot. Ok, whatever right. Its suppose to be amazing. We end up waiting about 30-40 minutes because all these damn phone orders are coming in. If we would have known we would have left. Well its suppose to be great and great food sometimes takes time. Get the food and go home. Definitely fresh, but wheres the flavor? The Tacos are just "ok", the chicken quesadilla is the worst ive had on the mission(never had a bad one yet), and the Carne Asada Nachos literally Suck besides the thick carne asada meat. I prefer smaller cuts of the meat but oh well. The nacho chips were less than spectacular and the salsa was bland and tasteless. Now i lived in San Diego for 7 years. And so far some mexican spots here in SF can come close. But Papalote's fails in taste/price and service.

excerpts: And the kicker is getting home and halfway through it and in my hasty hunger, realizing I just ate half a chicken breast and  there indeed are no veggies in my burrito....
Not so cool.
Will never risk that happening again.
I just hope I don't get sick tonight...
chicken.author: Avi K.
chicken.review: Hey guys, love that you have vegan options on the menu. Not too jazzed about the fact that a burrito with rice beans, veggies, ad guac has to cost $10 when I can get the same thing at that groovy little place on Mission right around the corner for $5. Even worse is waiting twenty minutes for said vegan burrito. And the kicker is getting home and halfway through it and in my hasty hunger, realizing I just ate half a chicken breast and  there indeed are no veggies in my burrito....Not so cool. Will never risk that happening again. I just hope I don't get sick tonight...

excerpts: Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling.
chicken.author: Danielle M.
chicken.review: The chips and salsa are everything they are hyped to be! Chicken mole burrito (super without sour cream)  with refried (vegetarian) beans is fresh, delicious and filling. You even have the option of plain, whole wheat or spinach tortillas. Make sure to order extra salsa!

excerpts: I'm currently sitting at home battling a hideous sore throat/headache combo, and I am DEVASTATED because all I want to do right now is get myself a goddamn delicious chicken burrito with special Papalote secret salsa.
I unfortunately don't think my current state of health will tolerate me waiting in line with all the other people who are copying my burrito idea.
With that, I'm only willing to bump my rating up to 5 stars when the good people of Papalote are willing to pack up their grills and come feed me in my own kitchen.
chicken.author: Rebecca P.
chicken.review: I'm currently sitting at home battling a hideous sore throat/headache combo, and I am DEVASTATED because all I want to do right now is get myself a goddamn delicious chicken burrito with special Papalote secret salsa. I unfortunately don't think my current state of health will tolerate me waiting in line with all the other people who are copying my burrito idea. With that, I'm only willing to bump my rating up to 5 stars when the good people of Papalote are willing to pack up their grills and come feed me in my own kitchen.

excerpts: I get the grilled chicken and it's always fresh and never dried out.
And those refried black beans are simply to die for.
Not exactly convenient for me, but always worth the trip.
chicken.author: Aaron L.
chicken.review:
Was turned on to Papalote a couple of years ago and keep finding my way back like a blindfolded crack baby. This place is freakishly good. 
Lines out the door all the time... even in the freezing (well freezing for San Francisco) cold. Salsa that must have ambrosia as a secret ingredient--full of smoky goodness that's neither bland nor too spicy. Their almost unique practice of cooking your burrito meat to order (versus the more common pre-cooked steam try variety) really does equal a better product. I get the grilled chicken and it's always fresh and never dried out. And those refried black beans are simply to die for. Not exactly convenient for me, but always worth the trip.

excerpts: I ordered a grilled chicken burrito, which wasn't the cheapest in the Mission, but provided a lot of food for a decent price.
I think that I still have half left in my fridge - maybe I'll eat it for dinner tonight.
chicken.author: Dana L.
chicken.review:
Good mexican food. Not fancy, but everything is very solid. The place isn't much to look at - you order at the counter and they deliver the food to your table.

We chose this place for our Cinco de Mayo dinner, and weren't disappointed. I ordered a grilled chicken burrito, which wasn't the cheapest in the Mission, but provided a lot of food for a decent price. I think that I still have half left in my fridge - maybe I'll eat it for dinner tonight. The chips were solid, and the hot sauce was definitely hot.

Some of the tables in the back have chairs that are too low for them, so you might want to avoid those.

excerpts: Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak.
It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart.
After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts
chicken.author: Andrew Y.
chicken.review:
I had high hopes for this place because it was a mexcian place in the Mission. Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak. It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart. After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts but I didn't think that all came together. 

I was told that this place was more of a vegetarian place. I'm willing to try this place again, but we'll see the end result next time. For now, 3 stars. 

Oh, we also had nachos, they were pretty good. I liked the cheese.

excerpts: Really really good Chile Verde chicken burrito.
Their  tortillas are great, thick, lovely pancakes of goodness.
The chipolte salsa is addictive.
Sure, its not the run down place that you expect from one of the best burritos in the mission, but then again...
chicken.author: Matt C.
chicken.review:
Really really good Chile Verde chicken burrito. Their  tortillas are great, thick, lovely pancakes of goodness. The chipolte salsa is addictive. Sure, its not the run down place that you expect from one of the best burritos in the mission, but then again... Why's that a bad thing?

-1 for the crowding, lack of table sitations, that can occur.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken burrito with some extra goodness and paid up.
I took the little numbered placard they gave me...and then I turned into Rip Van Winkle because it took SO FREAKING LONG to get my burrito.
Over 15 minutes to get one burrito!
(All while some tourist and his awful screaming kids inflicted holy terror on the waiting area, but that's neither here nor there.
Well, actually, it *was* there.
And it was obnoxious!
chicken.author: Ana C.
chicken.review:
Once upon a time, I was hungry and decided to stop into Papalote to pick up lunch. I ordered a chicken burrito with some extra goodness and paid up. I took the little numbered placard they gave me...and then I turned into Rip Van Winkle because it took SO FREAKING LONG to get my burrito. Over 15 minutes to get one burrito! (All while some tourist and his awful screaming kids inflicted holy terror on the waiting area, but that's neither here nor there. Well, actually, it *was* there. And it was obnoxious! And I had to endure 15 minute of it!!)

Ahem...where was I? Oh, yes. The burrito was good. The chips were "meh". My friend recommends phoning ahead the next time I'm in the mood for Papalote. Thanks, friend!

excerpts:
You want chicken?

They get out a big piece of chicken breast and thow it on the grill.
chicken.author: Thadd L.
chicken.review:
Not the best buritto in the Mission bust most likely the freshest.  All of the meat is raw when you order it.

You want chicken?

They get out a big piece of chicken breast and thow it on the grill.

Carne Asada?

Get that 12-hour marinated piece of steak out of that vat of flavor goodness and cook it up.

ect. ect.

The roasted salsa is great as everyone else has said.  There are more hipsters here becuase the food isn't as greasy.  In fact I think that I would call this place a "california" burrito place.  I know that sounds lame but, sometimes you want something that doesn't bomb your stomach like an El Farolito burrito.
Know what I mean?

excerpts: I just had the achiote chicken plate, it had a grilled, spiced flavor, so delicious.
The grilled vegetable quesadilla kicks ass-
it has grilled eggplant and summer squash- full of flavor.
Also, the fresh hot sauce is so tasty, and sort of a unique style that I haven't seen at other places.
chicken.author: Professor H.
chicken.review:
Papalote serves fresh, consistent Mexican food basics in a comfortable, fun setting.  It's a great cheap, reliable fast food spot.  Although it's not the absolute best Mexican food in the city, it's very very very tasty.  Although it's not healthy health food, it's much fresher and healthier than most Mexican dining.

I just had the achiote chicken plate, it had a grilled, spiced flavor, so delicious.  The grilled vegetable quesadilla kicks ass- it has grilled eggplant and summer squash- full of flavor.  Also, the fresh hot sauce is so tasty, and sort of a unique style that I haven't seen at other places.

excerpts: but i've had better.. my fiancee had their chicken burrito which was pretty good.. but nothing spectacular..
my pork burrito with salsa verde was not bad.. it would have been better if they deep fried their meat though
chicken.author: Stan L.
chicken.review:
solid burrito.. huge portion.. but i've had better.. my fiancee had their chicken burrito which was pretty good.. but nothing spectacular.. my pork burrito with salsa verde was not bad.. it would have been better if they deep fried their meat though (e.g. crispy carnitas).. 

the salsa that came with their chips is too salty..

excerpts: yafeelme?The chicken was kinda dry, but the shrimp quesdilla was off the chain.
yfelme?
I will definitely be back, but only for take out becuase there aint no parking round there.
yflme?
chicken.author: Lawrence A.
chicken.review:
What the hell is in that salsa that makes it so good? 
I want to buy a 50 gallon drum of this stuff and slather it on everything I eat (including dessert). 

Papalote isgood mexican food in the higher end, low end kinda price range. You feel me? Basically, it's not the great East oakland spots that are delicious and super affordable, but, its also not the Mamcitas or the Tres Agaves kind of expensive, the $22 carne asada plate expensive. ya feel me? It's worth it just to go there for the salsa. which is completely unique and only given out in small quantities. yafeelme?The chicken was kinda dry, but the shrimp quesdilla was off the chain. yfelme? I will definitely be back, but only for take out becuase there aint no parking round there. yflme?

excerpts: It's not the cheapest place for Mexican vittles, but the chicken mole burrito can totally get it.
chicken.author: Charlotte M.
chicken.review:
It's not the cheapest place for Mexican vittles, but the chicken mole burrito can totally get it.  

And the salsa.  

I'm not coming here again, though, to do take out.  Screw the 20 minute wait.  Dining with friends?  For sure.

excerpts: I do have one gripe.... i recently tried the Chicken Adobo burrito
and it was kinda blah.
Needs work Mr. E.
Perhaps some soy type sauce.
Other than that this place rocks.
I wish I lived closer.
Big Ups Mr. E and Papalote.
chicken.author: Dave C.
chicken.review: I love papalote. Not only cuz Mr. E owns this great place but because the food is great. The secret sauce is ridiculously good! Triple threat burrito is awesome. I do have one gripe.... i recently tried the Chicken Adobo burrito and it was kinda blah. Needs work Mr. E. Perhaps some soy type sauce. Other than that this place rocks. I wish I lived closer. Big Ups Mr. E and Papalote.

excerpts: The most amazing chicken mole burrito.
(If you prefer you can get tofu mole instead.)
I always get Super Chicken Mole burrito with black beans.
It is my Go-
To favorite burrito in the entire bay area.
To me, this burrito is addictive as crack.
I always get Super Chicken Mole burrito with black beans.
It is my Go-
To favorite burrito in the entire bay area.
To me, this burrito is addictive as crack.
After tax, I think it ends up being around 9 bucks for a Super Mole Chicken Burrito.
After tax, I think it ends up being around 9 bucks for a Super Mole Chicken Burrito.
chicken.author: P. D.
chicken.review:
From reading some of the other reviews I see that Papalote was on the Food Network or something. I didn't see the show and don't go there because of it.

I've been eating at Papalote for the past 1.5 years and eat there at least once every other week. 

Pros: 

1) The most amazing chicken mole burrito. (If you prefer you can get tofu mole instead.) I always get Super Chicken Mole burrito with black beans. It is my Go-To favorite burrito in the entire bay area. To me, this burrito is addictive as crack. I drive from Burlingame to San Francisco sometimes just to eat this burrito.

2) The orange salsa that comes with your chips. They are pretty famous for this salsa. It's pretty hot but not enough to be super uncomfortable. It almost tastes creamy but there are no dairy products in it. Just pumpkin seeds or something like that.

3) Well located, just a 2 block walk west on 24th Street from the 24th Street Bart, right across the street from the gas station at Valencia and 24th Street. Hard to miss since I think it is currently painted orange.

Cons: 

1) Really small and waits of around 30 minutes during busy times until you actually are eating your food. Hard to get a table. Best thing to do is order on the phone about 20 minutes ahead of time and then go 'cut' in line by picking up your food at the right-most register. It's so satisfying to pseudo cut in line and get your food to go.

2) Crowd seems a little too trendy for my tastes. 

3) Price is a little high for a burrito, but you get what you pay for. After tax, I think it ends up being around 9 bucks for a Super Mole Chicken Burrito.

4) AFAIK, no delivery, which would be awesome.

excerpts: My friend got the mole chicken quesadilla which was super delicious.
chicken.author: Lindsay E.
chicken.review:
My boyfriend and I knew we had to get some Mexican food when we were visiting since it's the one culinary category we are really lacking good restaurants in in Boston. We trusted our friend from Palo Alto who had read good reviews about this place and she did not disappoint us. 

The place was crowded,  a good sign for 7 on a Saturday night. We ordered at the cash register and were seated rather quickly, though slightly awkwardly as we had to share table space with another group of 3. They had real Mexican Coke which the bf and friend were super hyped about. They brought us out yummy fresh chips and salsa to start. I got an aguas frescas which was pretty good, though a little too sweet. My friend got the mole chicken quesadilla which was super delicious. I got the amazing fish tacos which were too stuffed to pick up and eat, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. The fish was sautéed with white wine and butter, a pleasant change from the fried I am used to. The bf got a fish burrito, probably the biggest burrito I have ever seen and it was delicious to boot. He definitely paid a little bit later for eating the whole thing.

excerpts: Went here  for the first time after watching a video on Twitter about the chicken adobo burrito....
I heart chicken adobo!
And when I saw there was a chicken adobo burrito
I HAD to have one.
And well no regrets.
It was flavorful, tasty and yummy!
It had  a hint of roasted chili flavor...
so yummy!
And the salsa that they serve with the chips...
OMG...a burst of yumminess in my mouth!!
chicken.author: Mao K.
chicken.review: Went here  for the first time after watching a video on Twitter about the chicken adobo burrito....I heart chicken adobo!  And when I saw there was a chicken adobo burrito I HAD to have one.  And well no regrets.  It was flavorful, tasty and yummy!   It had  a hint of roasted chili flavor...so yummy!  And the salsa that they serve with the chips...OMG...a burst of yumminess in my mouth!!

excerpts: I LOVE their chicken mole.
chicken.author: Bethany C.
chicken.review:
I LOVE their chicken mole. Sometimes I wake up in the middle of the night craving it!

Best in the city by far. The owner is super nice and always remembers me.

Thanks!

excerpts: I've had every version they have -- chicken carne asada, soyrizo, triple threat -- I have to say the grilled tofu is the best.
Guac, sour cream, black beans.
chicken.author: Jeff G.
chicken.review:
Best burrito in the city? I think it might be. Apologies to Gordo's, El Farolito, and Taq Cancun.

Lets see...

I get a super burrito, tomato tortilla, and the grilled tofu. Grilled tofu is something I would only get here. I've had every version they have -- chicken carne asada, soyrizo, triple threat -- I have to say the grilled tofu is the best. Guac, sour cream, black beans. Ahh, the simple pleasures in life. 

That fucking salsa. Its not fair how good that shit is. Its not runny, you dip a chip, and it comes out covered, no drip. Yeah. Exactly. Ive bought it by the mason jar, put it on everything. 

The bottled salsa on the table is a, dare I say, GREAT change of pace. Habenero El Yucateco? Yes. 

The apps are good too. The black bean dip with some chips is the ultimate ice breaker. Or something.

If you want to have a delicious burrito that uses fresh ingredients, or if you just want to mingle with the hipster fixed-gear crowd, Papalote is the spot.

excerpts: Burritos are delicious (both the chicken and carne asada are prepared very well) but the real superstar here is the SALSA!!
I would inject it into my veins if I could.
They also sell jars at the front to take home, score!!
The two brothers that own the place (also seen on Bobby Flay's Throwdown) can often be found at the register or in the kitchen which is cute.
If you are ever looking for good mexican in the Mission, check this place out!!
chicken.author: Kadie B.
chicken.review: Burritos are delicious (both the chicken and carne asada are prepared very well) but the real superstar here is the SALSA!! I would inject it into my veins if I could. They also sell jars at the front to take home, score!! The two brothers that own the place (also seen on Bobby Flay's Throwdown) can often be found at the register or in the kitchen which is cute. If you are ever looking for good mexican in the Mission, check this place out!!

excerpts: What: I ordered the Veggie Super Burrito, they ordered chicken fajitas, veggie burrito, and fish tacos.
When: Friday night.
Line was a little long and seating limited, but it went fast....
Eat fast as well as people are waiting and watching you eat.
Why: I guess my expectations were a little high for this place, since Bobby Flay lost!
I didnt expect it to be as fast food-ish and fast eating!
I thought it was a sit down, and order type of place, but turned out to be order at the counter and if you want to eat there, wait for a seat.
Besides that point, the food was great.
The salsa was definitely worth talking about after as well as
the size of the portions- huge!
4 stars only because ambiance was more of a to-go place, vs eat there place.
chicken.author: R P.
chicken.review:
Who: Double date.
What: I ordered the Veggie Super Burrito, they ordered chicken fajitas, veggie burrito, and fish tacos.
When: Friday night. Line was a little long and seating limited, but it went fast....Eat fast as well as people are waiting and watching you eat.
Why: I guess my expectations were a little high for this place, since Bobby Flay lost! I didnt expect it to be as fast food-ish and fast eating! I thought it was a sit down, and order type of place, but turned out to be order at the counter and if you want to eat there, wait for a seat. Besides that point, the food was great.
