The salsa was definitely worth talking about after as well as the size of the portions- huge! 4 stars only because ambiance was more of a to-go place, vs eat there place.

excerpts: When I was a meat eater, I loved the Chicken mole, it is pretty yumm.
But as far as vegetarian/vegan options, this is a great place!
chicken.author: Kimberly H.
chicken.review:
Fresh ingredients, good solid menu, and reasonable price!!! I love this place.

The salsa is the bomb-diggity-bomb-bomb!!!! as for the chips.....they suck just like all chips in San Francisco.....I like homeade chips ok, not bagged! sorry. 

It is my favorite burrito in the city. 
The soyrizo burrito that is.....!!!! So good, don't forget to make it "super!"

When I was a meat eater, I loved the Chicken mole, it is pretty yumm. But as far as vegetarian/vegan options, this is a great place! They have fresh vegetables, and the black beans taste good. 

It is nice atmosphere too, and I know you gotta wait a little, but it's so worth it. Beside, they play reggae in there!! What's not to love?

excerpts: I ordered the mole chicken tacos which were tough, dry and lacking in ANY flavor whatsoever.
In addition, the chips were beyond stale- booo.
chicken.author: NaNa M.
chicken.review: After all they hype about this place- and the fact that it is blocks from my apartment...I had to give it a shot. I was sorely disappointed: what am I missing here? I ordered the mole chicken tacos which were tough, dry and lacking in ANY flavor whatsoever. In addition, the chips were beyond stale- booo.

excerpts: I got a chicken burrito, and all I can say is I've definitely had better.
chicken.author: Amanda B.
chicken.review: Maybe I just got the wrong thing here? I guess there was a lot of hype or something, because this was on the boyfriend's list of places to try during a recent bay trip. I got a chicken burrito, and all I can say is I've definitely had better. It was just kind of dry and plain-ish. It wasn't bad by any stretch of the imagination, but I expected spectacular from the birthplace of the mission-style burrito. I think we do burritos better down here in LA. If I ever go back maybe I'll try the carne asada- that would be harder to dry out. All in all, I think if there wasn't hype I wouldn't feel a kind of let-down from this burrito place.

excerpts: I think that Papalote has the best quality meat and chicken in the mission.
chicken.author: Justin C.
chicken.review:
I think that Papalote has the best quality meat and chicken in the mission.  

I just don't crave the burritos as much as La Taqueria.  Also, don't waste your time in that tiny place, order to go.

excerpts: The chicken mole burrito was a heavenly experience.
I came back to New York and told my bay area friends the places that I went on my recent trip to SF and they were like, "yeah, papalote is awesome.
Why did I not know about this place before?!?!
Indeed, it is awesome.
chicken.author: Carlie D.
chicken.review:
This is seriously the best burrito that I have ever had in my life. 

The chicken mole burrito was a heavenly experience. I came back to New York and told my bay area friends the places that I went on my recent trip to SF and they were like, "yeah, papalote is awesome." Why did I not know about this place before?!?! Indeed, it is awesome. I love it. 

The burritos are a little pricey for other local Mexican prices but the burritos are gigantic and completely worth it. 

I'm already dreaming of my next trip to San Francisco. Sigh.

excerpts: Their chips and salsa are awesome if you like a litte spice, Chicken adobo Burrito is my fav and tacos are great as well.
You will not be disappointed if you go here!
Only bad thing is the place is a little small and can get get crowded pretty fast.
Besides that it's great!
chicken.author: Rio J.
chicken.review: This Is my favorite taqueria in SF.. Their chips and salsa are awesome if you like a litte spice, Chicken adobo Burrito is my fav and tacos are great as well. You will not be disappointed if you go here! Only bad thing is the place is a little small and can get get crowded pretty fast. Besides that it's great!

excerpts: I had the regular chicken burrito -not
the super-
but the basic burrito should be able to stand on its own, right?
chicken.author: Heather P.
chicken.review:
I came here in 2006 on a burrito crawl through the Mission (I know...it seemed like a good idea?!) and after stalking this place via Burritoeater.com and Burritophile.com for two years I was ready to try it again. Granted I had the regular chicken burrito -not the super- but the basic burrito should be able to stand on its own, right?  It had way too many rice and beans, not enough salsa, and was really dry. I would recommend adding the extras in to make it a little tastier.

I might be back to try something a little more adventurous but will have to concur with my burrito blogs for menu options :) Asfor the basic burrito...i've had better!

excerpts: i also wish the food were less salty, the chicken was a little less dry, that it was a little cleaner, and that i could buy just one taco at a time instead of having to buy 2.
chicken.author: J W.
chicken.review:
i'm salivating just thinking about the fish tacos and that salsa.  if the gods eat mexican, i'll bet they throw that sauce on their tacos.

I wish it were closer, and that there was more room to sit down (it gets pretty crowded, apparently the deliciousness of their secret salsa is no secret)
i also wish the food were less salty, the chicken was a little less dry, that it was a little cleaner, and that i could buy just one taco at a time instead of having to buy 2.  

that being said, i'm sure we'll keep going, probably at least once a week.

excerpts: Their chicken quesadillas are also amazing...try the mole style.
I really enjoy the ambiance, the people, and graffiti art outside.
Papalote is just a chill place to hang out and eat some good (and inexpensive) food.
My only tip is to eat there because the one time I did take my food to Muddy's Cafe
a block or so down, my food just didn't taste as good
oh, and they're salsa
is just muahhh!
chicken.author: Jany X.
chicken.review:
Best guacamole ever!  Their chicken quesadillas are also amazing...try the mole style.  I really enjoy the ambiance, the people, and graffiti art outside.  Papalote is just a chill place to hang out and eat some good (and inexpensive) food. 
My only tip is to eat there because the one time I did take my food to Muddy's Cafe a block or so down, my food just didn't taste as good :)... oh, and they're salsa is just muahhh!

excerpts: The salsa is awesome, and I LOVE the CHICKEN MOLE and the FISH TACOS!
chicken.author: J K.
chicken.review:
Changed from 3 stars to 4.

I've been back a few times recently, and loved everything I tried. I don't know why I didn't think it was "all-that" before. 

The salsa is awesome, and I LOVE the CHICKEN MOLE and the FISH TACOS!

excerpts: Everyone keeps telling me to try the chicken adobo burrito, so I did.
Nice try
but it was okay.
chicken.author: Ricky M.
chicken.review: Hands down...they have one of the best salsas I've ever tasted.  Now that deserves five stars.  Everyone keeps telling me to try the chicken adobo burrito, so I did.  Nice try but it was okay. I'd stick to the carne asada.

excerpts: AND, I waited well over 33 minutes for my order of a Chicken Burrito, this after, 6 minutes in line.
The worst part was seeing many people get their food before me even though they ordered well after I did!!!
They need to work on this - very unprofessional in my opinion.
I have eaten there 4 times - two times in and twice on take out...if Bob did a Throw Down and this; he'd win easily...
chicken.author: Spidey P.
chicken.review:
Okay, Bobby Flay and all the thousands of fans of this place can't be wrong.  It's small,  but the food is great and the salsa makes all dishes better.  The Triple Threat Burrito is great, but a bit TOO pricey (Can you say $20 bucks for a burrito?).    The good news is that all other burritos and dishes are much more reasonable and just as good and tasty.
Their main fault as I see it is their order taking (and the help) - I don't know if they are mainly family members, but the girl taking my order at the counter could have been less friendly or interested in taking my order.   AND, I waited well over 33 minutes for my order of a Chicken Burrito, this after, 6 minutes in line.    The worst part was seeing many people get their food before me even though they ordered well after I did!!!      They need to work on this - very unprofessional in my opinion.   I have eaten there 4 times - two times in and twice on take out...if Bob did a Throw Down and this; he'd win easily...

excerpts: We ordered the carne asada tacos, carne asade quesadilla, and chicken adobo burrito.
The carne asada is quality meat and tasted fresh.
The chicken adobo burrito was ok, but I usually judge mexican food by the carne asada.
I'd definitely go back for more.
The chicken adobo burrito was ok, but I usually judge mexican food by the carne asada.
I'd definitely go back for more.
chicken.author: Kathy and Mark D.
chicken.review: We ordered the carne asada tacos, carne asade quesadilla, and chicken adobo burrito.  The carne asada is quality meat and tasted fresh.  The chicken adobo burrito was ok, but I usually judge mexican food by the carne asada.  I'd definitely go back for more.

excerpts: I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly
they are-
but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito.
However, the prices are a bit steep
chicken.author: Grace S.
chicken.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: Something about blending chicken, shrimp, and steak into one concoction did it for me.
chicken.author: Bijon R.
chicken.review: I ate here a few months ago. Of course I had to order their 20 dollar burrito. A bit expensive but well worth it! Something about blending chicken, shrimp, and steak into one concoction did it for me.

excerpts: The Carne Asada and Chicken are great, but for a special treat, try their mole or Pork Chile Verde.
Tres Bien.
chicken.author: Andy T.
chicken.review:
As a child growing up in San Diego (15 minutes north of the border), I was practically weaned on good Mexican food. I have to admit, I was definitely skeptical reading menu items like "Tofu Soy-Rizo", but my fears melted away when I dipped my first chip into the salsa - oh, that glorious salsa, as man has never made it before.

People will argue that this is Yuppified Mexican, and it probably is since there is no brain or head on the menu - in my mind though, this is actually a good thing. They only serve the freshest ingredients, the best cuts of meat in all of their dishes, and I could go there for every meal.

The Carne Asada and Chicken are great, but for a special treat, try their mole or Pork Chile Verde. Tres Bien.

excerpts: Really delicious, with generous chunks of grilled chicken.
I need to go get a burrito there since I've only had the Tacos!
chicken.author: Brent D.
chicken.review: Fresh tasting healthy seeming upwardly scaling Tacos and more. Really delicious, with generous chunks of grilled chicken. I need to go get a burrito there since I've only had the Tacos!

excerpts: my gf's chicken burrito also meh.
chicken.author: Ellen S.
chicken.review:
underwhelmed!

my fish tacos were muy bland. my gf's chicken burrito also meh. not sure what all the fuss is about this place, unless it's just that some folks would rather only dine with other white people? 

thankfully we didn't have to wait too long as it was raining last night. don't think i'll be headed back here anytime soon...

excerpts: The chicken is marinated and grilled fresh, so you can avoid bin chickens.
chicken.author: Nicole and Kayvon B.
chicken.review:
it's totally a five for a taqueria--everything's really fresh and a lot of care is put into it.  And damn you love that salsa.  But they're too stingy with it, because they know they can sell it to us.  If they gave out more with the order, we'd be there for hours just drinking it and smearing it on ourselves.  I usually like a variety of salsas, but the one variety they have needs no siblings.

This place really stands out in the vast sea of San Francisco taquerias.  They have vegan mole--damn...  she's been looking for that her whole life.  It's really good, too.  And mole could be really bad.  But never get it in the quesadilla, because it just oozes all out the sides and onto everything around you, making it impossible to eat.

The chicken is marinated and grilled fresh, so you can avoid bin chickens.  I'll spend extra to get shrimp at other taquerias simply to have freshly cook meat, so it's nice to have some more options here.  The lettuce is fresh and green, the guacamole is brilliant, the beans are  perfectly textured and the options include refried black--good stuff.

About the only thing I could think to improve (other than giving MORE SALSA) is that the corn tortillas could be fresher instead of the standard packaged variety.

The price is good, too.

excerpts: The chicken and beef are grilled fresh to order, its always tender without gristle or fat.
I love their burritos, yo.
chicken.author: Devon L.
chicken.review:
Papalote is awesome to the core.  They give you your choice of beans and tortillas for burritos, which I enjoy because I'm not partial to the typical, "flour tortilla brown pinto beans" burrito persuasion.  My friend says the vegetarian options are awesome, he likes soyrizo, and I guess some people look for that in their food, a vegetarian option that is.  
The chicken and beef are grilled fresh to order, its always tender without gristle or fat.  I love their burritos, yo.  
The best part is the Barbie size portion of chips and salsa they bring for you and and your four friends to share.  Its tiny, but the salsa is the best ever.  The first time I tasted it I was like, "Dang.  Thats a good salsa"  
Minus one star because seating here sucks ass, and pretentious assholes won't move their chairs over an inch to make room.

excerpts: I am so enthused about this place, but I will temper my review: the chicken burrito is the best I've had in SF, and possibly ever!
The salsa is noteworthy--excellent with chips, although I prefer a vinegar-based sauce like Tapatio on my burrito.
chicken.author: Mehul P.
chicken.review: I am so enthused about this place, but I will temper my review: the chicken burrito is the best I've had in SF, and possibly ever! The salsa is noteworthy--excellent with chips, although I prefer a vinegar-based sauce like Tapatio on my burrito.

excerpts: We ordered the Triple Threat Burrito and Chicken Adobo Burrito.
The Triple Threat was good
but i think the Chicken Adobo Burrito is the Winner Burrito.
I am pinay and his Adobo passed the Adobo test with flying colors, I should say the Adobo Burrito is a pretty good idea,i love it!
chicken.author: Ces T.
chicken.review: We ordered the Triple Threat Burrito and Chicken Adobo Burrito.The Triple Threat was good but i think the Chicken Adobo Burrito is the Winner Burrito.I am pinay and his Adobo passed the Adobo test with flying colors, I should say the Adobo Burrito is a pretty good idea,i love it! My friend ordered the Veggie Burrito, which was okay. The owner is very nice.I am definitely coming back to this place : )

excerpts: We had the "cooked to order" grilled steak burritto and "cooked to order" grilled chicken tacos.
Both were fresh and the meats were tender and juicy.
The spot is small, when you walk in, you place your order and seat yourself in the small seating area...
other than that, yumo!!
Also, it is near bart which is a plus in my book!
chicken.author: Amy C.
chicken.review: This was a yummy mexican grill. We had the "cooked to order" grilled steak burritto and "cooked to order" grilled chicken tacos.  Both were fresh and the meats were tender and juicy.  The spot is small, when you walk in, you place your order and seat yourself in the small seating area... other than that, yumo!! Also, it is near bart which is a plus in my book!

excerpts: The chicken burrito is still my favorite (particularly when slathered with that amazing salsa!).
chicken.author: Melinda C.
chicken.review: Casual place to grab dinner.  The chicken burrito is still my favorite (particularly when slathered with that amazing salsa!).  I wasn't as much a fan of the shrimp burrito (I didn't feel like there was enough shrimp there), but the guacamole is also a must-have.

excerpts: Papalote serves the best quality mexican food in the mission and flavor is up there too, great service and friendly staff , achiote chicken is amazing give it a try .
chicken.author: NAEL K.
chicken.review: Papalote serves the best quality mexican food in the mission and flavor is up there too, great service and friendly staff , achiote chicken is amazing give it a try .

excerpts: For the meats my personal favorites are the prawns (nice smokey addition to the burrito), chile verde (good size chunks of pork and tasty sauce) and chicken mole (I hate chicken breast, but
the mole sauce is so nommiful that it covers the dryness of the chicken).
the mole sauce is so nommiful that it covers the dryness of the chicken).
chicken.author: Kelly C.
chicken.review: Papalote's has ruined me for burritos anywhere else. Theirs are, by far, the best I've encountered in the Bay Area. I thought La Bamba in Mountain View did an awesome burrito; I was wrong. Papalote's super burrito is at least twice as tasty and all kinds of nommilicious. Their salsa is a little spicy by my standards (which are average-ish), but it's so delicious that you don't mind the burn. For the meats my personal favorites are the prawns (nice smokey addition to the burrito), chile verde (good size chunks of pork and tasty sauce) and chicken mole (I hate chicken breast, but the mole sauce is so nommiful that it covers the dryness of the chicken).

excerpts: Got the chicken fajitas - no onions or bell peppers, WTF?!
Not good.
Everyone at the table was unimpressed with what they got.
I will not be returning.
chicken.author: Brittney B.
chicken.review: Went back (driver of the car made me go).  Got the chicken fajitas - no onions or bell peppers, WTF?!  Not good.  Everyone at the table was unimpressed with what they got.  I will not be returning.

excerpts: The food tastes fresh and I love the chicken mole super burrito.
chicken.author: Quinn S.
chicken.review: Papalote is probably my favorite burrito joint in the Mission.  The staff is nice, quick and clean.  The food tastes fresh and I love the chicken mole super burrito. The chips and salsa that they drop by the table as you wait for your food are the best, and you rarely have to wait more than a couple of minutes.  Above all else, this is the cleanest taquera that I have found in the city.

excerpts:
i had the chicken burrito + cheese & guacamole: 
not your run-of-mill burrito.
great size, its not HUGE, nor is it wimpy either.
the chicken is marinated very nicely; smokey & spicy, and it doesnt over power everything else.
refried blackbeans were nice consistency, not runny at all.
chicken.author: Ruben G.
chicken.review:
*yeah, we fed into the hype and swung by to see what the hoopla was all about....... 
 
i used to live in the city. i have my good-n-trusty taquerias that I MUST have whenever i'm up in SF - Pancho Villa, Cancun, El Farolito, but i never cared to break in another spot and be disappointed that i wasted my time when i coulda had a great burrito.

yes, parking is tough in the mission.  that's nothing new, so be prepared to circle the block.

ordering was a breeze.  Getting a table looked like it was going to be tough, but were actually seated pretty quickly. they bring you chips and their homemade salsa to nosh on while you wait.  the salsa is very very good - unlike the red/green salsas you see everywhere else, this salsa was rich, smokey, and very very flavoful (for those from SJ, think La Victoria salsa, but less creamy, and the raw ingredients dont get lost in the whip)

The meats are grilled FRESH.  not pre-grilled, chopped, and thrown in a tin in advance.  and cuz of this - and the size of this place (small), getting your order will take a while.  this is what separates it from other taquerias (or is it a grill?), that they do this as you order, unlike other places that take less than 5 mins to throw your ingredients in a tortilla, wrap it, and get it to your hands/table.  so be prepared to wait about 15- 20 mins (this was when it was very busy, probably less when its not)

my GF ordered steak nachos: 
the plate came and you could see the steam coming off the carne asada.  its a flank cut, marinated and seasoned to perfection.  she's a bit particular when it comes to taquerias, so to impress her was a big win.  the plate was fresh, hot, and all ingredients were very tasty.  refried black beans, ftw!

i had the chicken burrito + cheese & guacamole: 
not your run-of-mill burrito.  great size, its not HUGE, nor is it wimpy either.  the chicken is marinated very nicely; smokey & spicy, and it doesnt over power everything else.  refried blackbeans were nice consistency, not runny at all.  the salsa is awesome and the rice was nice and steamed, not al dente, or mushy.

the service is great.  one of the owners made sure the dining area was in check and that you were attended in adequate time.  kudos.

excerpts:
horchata is GREAT
guac is bleh, chips are awesome
chicken is crazy dry and gross
shrimp tacos are
chicken.author: Christopher L.
chicken.review:
horchata is GREAT
guac is bleh, chips are awesome
chicken is crazy dry and gross
shrimp tacos are good
chile verde ques is very good
carne asada super burrito is good

excerpts: Chicken mole with black beans, super style (cheese, guac, slip of sour cream), was a humongous newborn-baby-sized thing of creation.
Everything was perfectly balanced: not too sour cream-y,
no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.
I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.
Gracias, Papalote.
no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.
I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.
Gracias, Papalote.
chicken.author: Lauren J.
chicken.review: A dream.  A beaut.  I'm an out of towner and begged my sister to take me to an awesome taqueria during a recent trip to SF.  She took me here, and I died.  Mexican Coke (tee hee).  Some sort of smoky, pureed chipotle salsa with fresh chips.  And the burrito.  Words cannot describe my happiness.  Chicken mole with black beans, super style (cheese, guac, slip of sour cream), was a humongous newborn-baby-sized thing of creation.  Everything was perfectly balanced: not too sour cream-y, no skimping on cheese or chicken, fabulous taste.  I would gladly eat one of these once a week, every week...sigh...if I were local.  Gracias, Papalote.

excerpts: WOWOW Super chicken mole burrito.......mmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It is so good.
The mole is nice and not overly sweet.
It has that nice cocoa taste with a bit of smoky flavor.
OOO lala!!
Their salsa is amazing.
It's very creamy roasted tomato.
I love it.
Not unbearably spicy; just perfect.
And, they serve it with warm chips.
YUMMY BURRITOS!!
Better than my old favorite, Taqueria Cancun.
chicken.author: O K.
chicken.review: WOWOW Super chicken mole burrito.......mmm!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It is so good. The mole is nice and not overly sweet. It has that nice cocoa taste with a bit of smoky flavor. OOO lala!! Their salsa is amazing. It's very creamy roasted tomato. I love it. Not unbearably spicy; just perfect. And, they serve it with warm chips.  YUMMY BURRITOS!! Better than my old favorite, Taqueria Cancun.

excerpts: Their grilled chicken burrito is fantastic.
They are a couple of bucks more than your average taqueria
but it's worth it.
chicken.author: anne m.
chicken.review: This place is good because it's healthy mexican, not too greasy and not overly salty. Overseasoned Mexican is NOT good!  I really like their salsa but to me it's more like a sauce or sofrito.  Good and spicey.  I discovered today if you ask for a veggie burrito it comes with potatoes and carrots as well as rice and beans.  It was just too much and I won't order it again.  But for the most part I've had excellent luck here.  Their grilled chicken burrito is fantastic.  They are a couple of bucks more than your average taqueria but it's worth it.

excerpts: Great chicken burrito, simple and easy, fast service, they have Mexican coca-cola and beer also, we took our food to go and when we got home
we were super stoked.
My buddy got the $20 Triple Threat Burrito, a bit pricey
but he loved it.
I am a picky chicken eater and I was very happy with the quality of the chicken that they had in my burrito.
Thanks.
We will be back for sure....
chicken.author: Aaron L.
chicken.review: Great chicken burrito, simple and easy, fast service, they have Mexican coca-cola and beer also, we took our food to go and when we got home we were super stoked. My buddy got the $20 Triple Threat Burrito, a bit pricey but he loved it. I am a picky chicken eater and I was very happy with the quality of the chicken that they had in my burrito. Thanks. We will be back for sure....

excerpts: Catering included 30 burritos (each cut in half) (10 beef, 10 chicken, 10 veg), chicken nachos, cheese quesadillas, and chips & quacamole.
Food was great, more than enough was provided and at a great value.
My guests loved it!
Thank you Papalote!
chicken.author: Leah S.
chicken.review: I've eaten here before (I love their salsa) and recently ordered catering from here for an outdoor party with 25 - 30 people.  Catering included 30 burritos (each cut in half) (10 beef, 10 chicken, 10 veg), chicken nachos, cheese quesadillas, and chips & quacamole.  Food was great, more than enough was provided and at a great value.  My guests loved it!  Thank you Papalote!

excerpts: The Chicken Mole burrito rocked my world and the salsa
truly is the best I've ever had.
chicken.author: Jimmy C.
chicken.review: Total yuppie burrito.  Think you can get Vegan Tofu Mole anywhere in Mexico?  But that's one more reason I love living in SF.  Their service is a little slow, but worth the wait.  The Chicken Mole burrito rocked my world and the salsa truly is the best I've ever had.

excerpts: The chicken was grilled and tasty.
chicken.author: LosAngelenoguy L.
chicken.review: Just had the best burrito here. ever. the tortilla was grilled, flaky, and amazing. The chicken was grilled and tasty. The rice, beans, and cheese, all got along swimmingly and never created any kind of ruckus. There were not as many annoying, skinny-jean-wearing, hoodied, trucker hat "hipsters" as others have indicated. The beer was cold. Life could be worse.

excerpts: A delicious chicken rice tomato garlicy flavored burrito.
Literally the first bite into it gave me a Man Vs.
Food reaction of joy!
lol
It's
a must try if you visit the place.
Brought some of my friends there and they have to order that every time we visit now.
chicken.author: Dee R.
chicken.review: Heard about the adobo burrito from a friend of mine and she was not lying! A delicious chicken rice tomato garlicy flavored burrito.  Literally the first bite into it gave me a Man Vs. Food reaction of joy! lol It's a must try if you visit the place.  Brought some of my friends there and they have to order that every time we visit now. Free chips and salsa and the salsa is tasty with a little spicy kick.

excerpts: I go there all the time for chicken burritos.
Also, note that you can call ahead to pick up if you're on the go.
chicken.author: Mark H.
chicken.review: This place is the dankness for burritos. I go there all the time for chicken burritos. Also, note that you can call ahead to pick up if you're on the go.

excerpts: Wow, the black refried beans, grilled chicken and salsa are unreal.
This is my new favorite Mexican spot in the Mission.
chicken.author: A D.
chicken.review: Wow, the black refried beans, grilled chicken and salsa are unreal. This is my new favorite Mexican spot in the Mission.

excerpts: Next time im trying the triple threat burrito with chicken beef, and shrimp.
Everyone there is also super friendly and totally easy access to 24th bart station!
chicken.author: jorge d.
chicken.review: Want a darn good carne azada..well this is the place. Full of flavor and great portions.. man Im comin back. Just recently found out they beat out that Bobby Flay Chef.. (no wonder they got quality stuff) Next time im trying the triple threat burrito with chicken beef, and shrimp.  Everyone there is also super friendly and totally easy access to 24th bart station!

excerpts: i'm crazy about their chicken burrito, but my friends love the fish and vegan dishes.
chicken.author: frisco j.
chicken.review:
let's start a burrito fight. i declare that papalote has the best burrito in the city! it's fresh, tasty, healthy and that sauce- what the heck is in that sauce? it's so yummy. i'm crazy about their chicken burrito, but my friends love the fish and vegan dishes. anyway, i'm so happy that papalote is in my hood...

the only caveat is that the traveling mariachi band doesn't make it down to papalote. perhaps it's too gringo for them? well, they're missing out.

excerpts: The grilled chicken, cooked to order, is crazy delicious.
If Papalote were a single entity instead of a combination of people, inventory, recipes and real estate, I'd high-five it.
chicken.author: jessica s.
chicken.review: This place is pretty much perfect. It's inauthentic enough to be healthy, clean and full of varied, quality ingredients but authentic enough to be really really freakin good and easy on the wallet. The salsa may be atypical, but it's seriously the best salsa-esque stuff in a cup I've ever had. The grilled chicken, cooked to order, is crazy delicious. If Papalote were a single entity instead of a combination of people, inventory, recipes and real estate, I'd high-five it.

excerpts: The 3-threat is shrimp, chicken and beef.
All burritos come with chips and their special hot sauce (which is good and hot!).
I have to say that the burrito was pretty good.
The beef was probably the best beef I have ever had in a burrito.
If I went back I'd probably just get a super beef burrito for about ten bucks and be very happy.
Worth checking out if only for the super yummy beef and the high quality ingredients.
Gourmet meets burritos.
Check it out.
chicken.author: Richard H.
chicken.review: I saw this place on the Food Network (along with 50 million other people) so i decided to check it out. A friend and I split the $20 (Yikes!) Triple Threat Burrito. The place is small but the line was not too long. The wait for the burrito was very long, though. When it came It was a little smaller than I thought it would be for a $20 burrito, but it was enough. The 3-threat is shrimp, chicken and beef. All burritos come with chips and their special hot sauce (which is good and hot!). I have to say that the burrito was pretty good. The beef was probably the best beef I have ever had in a burrito. If I went back I'd probably just get a super beef burrito for about ten bucks and be very happy. Worth checking out if only for the super yummy beef and the high quality ingredients. Gourmet meets burritos. Check it out.

excerpts: Chicken quesadilla and some amazing strawberry juice.
That was my regular meal for the time I lived around the corner.
Since moving to another area I now only have tacos when ever I make it up that way.
I have never been let down here especially with the sauce they serve.
Also, I picked up a great reggae mix here once possibly related to the triple threat affiliation they have.
Still loyal to the Coyotes though:)
chicken.author: David H.
chicken.review: I used to eat here in my lazier days once almost every day. Chicken quesadilla and some amazing strawberry juice. That was my regular meal for the time I lived around the corner. Since moving to another area I now only have tacos when ever I make it up that way. I have never been let down here especially with the sauce they serve. Also, I picked up a great reggae mix here once possibly related to the triple threat affiliation they have. Still loyal to the Coyotes though:)

excerpts: That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo.
I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago.
That's how amazing the Chile Verde is.
It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh.
The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.
chicken.author: Lawrence S.
chicken.review:
I've always considered the burrito to be the perfect culinary invention: every food group delightfully wrapped in a tight, nutritional envelope. And even though Burritos and Tacos and Quesadillas don't really showcase the true sophistication of Mexican cuisine, sometimes you just want that massive hunk of goodness in your belly. That's why Papalote offers the best of both worlds: authentic Mexican standards like Chile Verde, Carne Asada, and Chicken Mole; but without the lard, and with veggie friendly options like Tofu and Soyrizo. I've always been a devotee of the Carnitas at La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but I've only been back once since I discovered Papalote more than a year ago. That's how amazing the Chile Verde is. It's the perfect combination of spicy, simmered, and fresh. And unlike other "healthy" burrito options, like those found at Whole Foods, Papalote doesn't try to foist a dry tortilla sandwich off on you.

n.b. The atmosphere and Chile Verde are better at the Mission location.

excerpts: Chicken mole is pretty good, though prone to "off" nights.
Oh and get the chips with guacamole--ooohwhee.
They've got freshness on lockdown yo.
chicken.author: Genevieve R.
chicken.review: Love their chile verde! Especially on the tacos--make it a super. Chicken mole is pretty good, though prone to "off" nights. Oh and get the chips with guacamole--ooohwhee. They've got freshness on lockdown yo.

excerpts: I absolutely adore the Chicken burritos, the quesadillas, and omg the MOLE!!
The owners are FANTABULOUS!!
So nice and friendly, Im blessed to have found such great food and friends!!
chicken.author: Keagan M.
chicken.review: Papalote so nice they gotta do it twice!  LOVE this location though Fulton is nice as well, depends on your mood really...same great food, two different spots!!  I absolutely adore the Chicken burritos, the quesadillas, and omg the MOLE!!  The owners are FANTABULOUS!!  So nice and friendly, Im blessed to have found such great food and friends!!

excerpts: I've only ordered the chicken dishes, but it is succulent and tender.
The only sorta sucky thing is that tables are hard to come by sometimes, and the tables in the back have chairs that are too short.
chicken.author: A E.
chicken.review: Healthy and delcious taqueria food.  I could bathe in their salsa.  I've only ordered the chicken dishes, but it is succulent and tender.  The only sorta sucky thing is that tables are hard to come by sometimes, and the tables in the back have chairs that are too short.

excerpts: delicious, zestful fillings of grilled chicken and carne asada satisfied our cravings.
chicken.author: Nelle A.

excerpts: Can't decide between shrimp, beef, or chicken?
Try the Triple Threat Burrito.
chicken.author: sonia m.
chicken.review: What I haven't reviewed this spot yet? Is it that I want all that crack they call salsa to myself? And those perfect chips. Or do I not want to share my pleasantly plump and buttery shrimp super burrito with black re-fried beans and all the love inside wrapped in a spinach tortilla perfectly paired with a fresh strawberry fresca? This IS my favorite Mexican taquoria. Everything here is fresh and believe it or not light. Here's a tip... Can't decide between shrimp, beef, or chicken? Try the Triple Threat Burrito. Also there are two choices of how they prepare the shrimp. Shrimp will be sauted in butter, prawns are kinds BBQish. Great service too!

excerpts: Best burrito in SF....grilled chicken with black refried beans is the way to go!
chicken.author: Lisa D.
chicken.review: Best burrito in SF....grilled chicken with black refried beans is the way to go!

excerpts: i went cheap (~$6) with the chicken quesadilla but it was just what i wanted and so tasty!
had to wait kind of a while for our food (although maybe that's a little tainted by how hungry i was)
and there was an obnoxious trantrum-y child that ruined the atmosphere a little..
but nothing to keep me from coming back.
and i will!
chicken.author: Lily B.
chicken.review:
yay!  i'm a fan!
good selection of burritos, tacos, quesadillas, etc.  
and for pretty good prices too!
my friend got the spanish omelet burrito that was huge (took it home to be a second meal) and looked delicious.  i went cheap (~$6) with the chicken quesadilla but it was just what i wanted and so tasty!
had to wait kind of a while for our food (although maybe that's a little tainted by how hungry i was) and there was an obnoxious trantrum-y child that ruined the atmosphere a little..  but nothing to keep me from coming back.
and i will!

excerpts: A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.
The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.
Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.
My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.
chicken.author: Jason M.
chicken.review:
Like a lemming, i joined the masses checking out Papalote after their Throwdown win over Bobby Flay.  And I will say it more than lived up to the hype.

I ordered the triple threat burrito made famous on the show and a side of guacamole.  Hold up, $20 for a burrito!  This better be an amazing burrito especially since every other burrito on the menu is only $8 or so!  Needless to say, I was not disappointed.  A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.  The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.  Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.  My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.

And for those concerned about portion sizes, this was one of the biggest burrito's I've eaten in a long time.  Unless you're Adam Richman, this should be plenty of food for anyone.

Separately, the guacamole is good - though I wish it had a bit more of a kick and the fish tacos are also very tasty.  The fish is perfectly cooked and not dry like you typically find in fish tacos.

excerpts: I had MOLE burrito (chicken) and while the chicken was a little dry, the creaminess of refried black beans made up for the dryness.
I also tried a burrito with marinated chicken breast --- grilled to order.
It was so juicy.
I highly recommend any SF locals and tourists to check out this place!
It won't disappoint.
chicken.author: Jessica N.
chicken.review: This restaurant reminds me so much of La Vic in San Jose.  OK their special sauce isn't as good as La Vic's infamous "orange sauce" but it's probably the closest thing you can find in SF.  Every order comes with a small cup of special sauce and tortilla chips which are so good as well.  The sauce is great with chips and over the burrito.  It was spicy but not overpowering to me.  I was also happy with the selection on the menu.  They have items that you don't normally find in a mexican restaurant in SF.  I had MOLE burrito (chicken) and while the chicken was a little dry, the creaminess of refried black beans made up for the dryness.  I also tried a burrito with marinated chicken breast --- grilled to order.  It was so juicy.  I highly recommend any SF locals and tourists to check out this place!  It won't disappoint.

excerpts: The salsa and the grilled chicken are my favorites.
It gets incredibly crowded after yoga tree lets out in the evening.
Also I live dangerously close which has led suspicious bulging in key areas of my body, and I'm not saying a boner.
Well maybe.
chicken.author: Jesse S.
chicken.review: The salsa and the grilled chicken are my favorites. It gets incredibly crowded after yoga tree lets out in the evening. Also I live dangerously close which has led suspicious bulging in key areas of my body, and I'm not saying a boner. Well maybe.

excerpts: I love me the chapotole with chips and the chicken mole burrito.
This is by far the best burrito/gourmet mexican food in the city.
Seriously.
I shit you not.
chicken.author: Christopher C.
chicken.review: I love me the chapotole with chips and the chicken mole burrito. This is by far the best burrito/gourmet mexican food in the city.  Seriously. I shit you not.

excerpts: Price was a bit pricey for the burrito and chicken tacos, I think it was about $13....a bit expensive for mexican take out....
but i'd saw worth the price.
the house salsa has a kick to it, but very good too!
chicken.author: Allison A.
chicken.review: I thought the carne asada burrito was yum-my! Price was a bit pricey for the burrito and chicken tacos, I think it was about $13....a bit expensive for mexican take out....but i'd saw worth the price. the house salsa has a kick to it, but very good too!

excerpts: the chicken was dry.
chicken.author: Debbie Chiou S.
chicken.review: what? bobby flay's burrito must have really sucked for this burrito to have beat it on food network's throwdown challenge. the carne asada meat was so tough and hard to chew. the chicken was dry. the shrimp was the only decent part of the burrito. beans were good too, but when are they not? the extra guacamole seemed non-existent under all the other ingredients, yet the flavors left me wanting... so i doused the burrito in hot sauce... not what i expected from all the hype.

excerpts: The super Nachos are yummy and you can't go wrong with the smokey chicken.
chicken.author: Jeff C.
chicken.review: Definitely not as authentic as most San Francisco Taqueria's but they do cook your meat or tofu to order. The super Nachos are yummy and you can't go wrong with the smokey chicken. The Carne Asada is hit or miss depending on the day. Sometimes they screw up orders and sometimes there's a long wait but overall nice people, great crowded atmosphere. If you want authentic SF slab experience head down one more block to Mission St. and hit up El Farlito or El Taco Loco.

excerpts: MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.
The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.
Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy.
There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper)
Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.
chicken.author: Miss Information X.
chicken.review: I didn't think that the food was that great.  It's clean and bright and the serivice is just fine.  I just fail to understand how there could be lines out the door of this place. Perhaps because it is veggie friendly?  Maybe I should have ordered something vegetarian?  MD and I each ordered a quesadilla.  MD got the prawn, I got the chicken mole.  The outstanding factor of our meal was how salty everything was.  Even the supposedly amazing red salsa was extra salty, and not all that spicy. There are so many other great (less crowded, cheaper) Mexican places in that 'hood that I see no reason to give Papalote a second chance.

excerpts: Those he was talking about was a triple threat burrito with Carne Asada, Grilled Shrimp and Grilled chicken
and then all the condiments of a burrito beans, rice etc..
OH
and of course the secret sauce...
Now mind you
I had been to papalote's before and like their burritos
they are good not too heavy  ebough to get you through the day and don't leave that depressed feeling after.
I ordered by phone and by the time I got there the place was PACKED
I couldn't find parking, but then again anywhere you go in the mission is a rubik's cube trying to find parking.
I finally get  parking and my order which was simple because they have an area for phone pick ups... as the girl starts to ring me up
I start to pull out a $20 I figured 2 burritos and all the hype this place has gotten...
I was thrown back when she rang up $31.
I asked how much each burrito costed my grilled chicken burrito costed  around $7 and change
then she said the Triple Threat costed $ 19.95????????????

I ended up

could not think of my son not eating his burrito ahaha I thought for that price it HAS to be good

there were no native mission ppl BAMBOOZLED
I tell you never again I will stick to El Zocalo, El Farolito and pay $30 for 2 ppl including drinks and maybe even a quesadilla suiza...
this place needs to lower their prices didn't they get the memo RECESSION?
