excerpts: The burrito i had was just a ton of tortilla, beans and minimal chicken.
chicken.author: Cyrus S.
chicken.review:
unimpressed.  flew into town from DC area and was told that i HAD TO HAVE a burrito in the mission area ... um.. I'm sorry, i was not impressed.

Now, the Nachos that someone else got looked really good.  But i've never met a plate of nachos i didnt like.

The burrito i had was just a ton of tortilla, beans and minimal chicken.

I even got the "super" side of cheese, guac and sour cream on the side.  thats what made it palatable.

Maybe others are better.. but this wasn't that special.

Sorry, not trying to hate!
not that cheap either.

excerpts: Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for.
chicken.author: B V.
chicken.review: My wife and I LOVE this place. We won't eat burritos anywhere else. 'Super' Chicken mole and grilled veggie burritos (pinto beans and spinach tortillas) to-go are our staple, and the salsa is to die for. The wonderful thing is that puppies aren't 80% rice and beans, so it's taste heaven. We live on the other side of the Mission, while there are many places closer than Papalote's, in 4 years we haven't yet found a replacement...

excerpts: but we ordered right away (plain quesadilla, triple threat burrito, guacamole, & chicken tacos).
I know that's alot of food, but we're a family of three and we shared everything.
$50 for dinner...seems a little much, especially since the triple threat was $20.
got a table fairly quick
but we were then trapped there by all the people waiting for pickup.
Got our food after about 20 minutes.
It was good, but not great.
the triple threat burrito was again good, but not $20 good.
chicken.author: Theresa S.
chicken.review:
sorry to the papalote faithful out there, but i was pretty underwhelmed/disappointed.  we went to the fulton/masonic location.  super crowded but we ordered right away (plain quesadilla, triple threat burrito, guacamole, & chicken tacos).  I know that's alot of food, but we're a family of three and we shared everything.  $50 for dinner...seems a little much, especially since the triple threat was $20.  got a table fairly quick but we were then trapped there by all the people waiting for pickup.  Got our food after about 20 minutes.  It was good, but not great.  the triple threat burrito was again good, but not $20 good.  Plus it was missing the prawns/shrimp.  would have gotten up to complain but one i couldn't get up (again was trapped by everyone waiting) and two i didn't really want to wait another 20 minutes for a new burrito.

if we were in the area, might stop in and try the nachos...they did look good!  but all in all won't go out of my way for this one.  I'll stick with our close to home favorites:)

excerpts: I've also tried their steak and chicken options and I'm subtracting a star for just a little something missing....
not sure what it is....
but I find their food lacks that extra flavor that makes it "out of this world.
And the fact that they cheap you on the salsa.
A shot-glass of salsa for multiple people and a $1 for a refill does NOT suffice.
chicken.author: Kerry D.
chicken.review: Definitely one of my top 3 favorite burrito joints.  I enjoy the vegetarian options (tofu, soyrizo, mixed veggies) and I do find myself craving their salsa.  I've also tried their steak and chicken options and I'm subtracting a star for just a little something missing....not sure what it is....but I find their food lacks that extra flavor that makes it "out of this world."   And the fact that they cheap you on the salsa.  A shot-glass of salsa for multiple people and a $1 for a refill does NOT suffice.

excerpts: I just dropped $14 for a chicken burrito and one beer!
chicken.author: Aaron C.
chicken.review: Fantastically overrated. Fresh, but bland and boring mexican food.  They do make a mean salsa, but by itself, it can't make up for the otherwise uninspired fare.  And why only one dollar-sign?  I just dropped $14 for a chicken burrito and one beer!

excerpts: youtube "the lonely island - jizz in my pants" if you want to know how i feel about their chicken burritos
chicken.author: Paran Y.
chicken.review: youtube "the lonely island - jizz in my pants" if you want to know how i feel about their chicken burritos

excerpts: the chicken was probably the best of the three types of meat in it.
chicken.author: Jnzl D.
chicken.review: I would say 2.5. Like many others, I saw this on Food Network and decided to go give it a try. I don't know if I went on an off day but it seriously did not live up to the hype I had built up in my mind about how amazing this burrito experience was going to be. I ordered the Triple Threat, mind you...a $20+ burrito...yes I agreed to pay this much because I believed it was going to be phenomenal. I've had $5 burritos that blew my mind, this $20+ one did not. Seriously disappointed. It was all meat, mind you, which wouldn't be a bad thing, except there was nothing in it to make it spectacular. A good burrito to me has a balance between the meat, cheese, salsa, rice, and beans. This was mainly just a tortilla of meat. the chicken was probably the best of the three types of meat in it. The carne asada, again, nothing to write home about, and the shrimp, totally lacking and overcooked, didn't taste very good at all, I picked them all out and set them aside.  I did enjoy the salsa that everyone is boasting about but the chips weren't great and that's half the experience when you're eating salsa. Overall, I don't think I'd go back. Bummer, I had such high hopes.

excerpts: I almost always go for the chicken mole
burrito
- it has just the right balance of heat and sweetness.
Their roasted salsa is the best I have had anywhere.
Super-friendly owners, super-fresh ingredients, and rotating installations by local artists.
chicken.author: Tyler N.
chicken.review: A great Mexican joint and neighborhood hang-out.  I almost always go for the chicken mole burrito - it has just the right balance of heat and sweetness. Their roasted salsa is the best I have had anywhere.  Super-friendly owners, super-fresh ingredients, and rotating installations by local artists.

excerpts: Great chicken quesadilla and awesome burritos!
chicken.author: Jo M.
chicken.review: I love this place!  Great chicken quesadilla and awesome burritos!  The prices are reasonable, the service is great and always comes with a smile, the chips and salsa are amazing, and the food is so fresh!  I love this place and of course I'll be back!

excerpts:
chicken plate is breast, but not so flavorful

is it really organic???
chicken.author: Nicholas C.
chicken.review:
fresh!!

chicken plate is breast, but not so flavorful

is it really organic???  I'm not so sure...

mole is good.

people are friendly ish   ( the non mission locale)  

the burritos do no seem so flavorful.. but i like them anyway  its ALL ABOUT THE SALSA

excerpts: Anyway, it weirds me out, so I behave very nicely and if it takes half an hour for me to get some chicken mole tacos, that's cool.
At least their food actually exists in three dimensions, unlike the invisible burritos they serve down the street at Farolito's.
Damn, I hate invisible burritos.
chicken.author: Millie S.
chicken.review:
Be advised: if you get take-out from Papalote's you should bring a gameboy or a newspaper or something because even if you call in advance you will still have to wait, guaranteed.

If you see a guy there playing Nintendo, that's me, and I will laugh at you as you wait twenty minutes with the boxes of tomatoes and the windy-swinging door as your only friends. I am playing Metroid Pinball, probably enjoying a gunship multiball round or something, and my food can take as long as it needs to. In fact, if you want to tell them to put your order ahead of mine, that's cool. I see you're getting a bit twitchy. It's my fault for taking the only perch space I suppose.

Just don't rush them - see, the thing is, I secretly suspect it's not a good idea to irritate these folks. Ever hung out on this block on Sunday nights? Creepiest thing - there's this weird buzzing noise comes from out back around nine or ten o'clock. It's the kind of sound you'd hear if they were carving up all the customer who pissed them off with a meatcutter. Maybe that's the secret ingredient that keeps winning them Best Burrito readers awards.

Anyway, it weirds me out, so I behave very nicely and if it takes half an hour for me to get some chicken mole tacos, that's cool. At least their food actually exists in three dimensions, unlike the invisible burritos they serve down the street at Farolito's. Damn, I hate invisible burritos.

excerpts: They serve chicken that is grilled to perfection and among the best quality I could have hoped for.
The kicker here is the homemade salsa.
I know you're thinking Salsa?!
But, this is special and you have to try it to know how awesome it is.
They do charge a little more than your normal burrito shack.
But, it is worth every penny.
It is too bad that they do not deliver.
Other than the wait to order this place has no down sides.
chicken.author: Matthew T.
chicken.review: This place is simply great!  Awesome veggie burritos.  They have a veggie SoyRIZO burrito that is too good for words.  They serve chicken that is grilled to perfection and among the best quality I could have hoped for.  The kicker here is the homemade salsa.  I know you're thinking Salsa?!  But, this is special and you have to try it to know how awesome it is.  They do charge a little more than your normal burrito shack.  But, it is worth every penny.  It is too bad that they do not deliver.  Other than the wait to order this place has no down sides.

excerpts: It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options.
It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for -
it's spicy and creamy and complex
-- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice.
The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried.
I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.
chicken.author: Jennifer C.
chicken.review: Papalote is my local burrito joint. It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options. It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for - it's spicy and creamy and complex -- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice. The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried. I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.

excerpts: They were bland and the chicken tasted dry.
chicken.author: Trinh N.
chicken.review: Okay.  Came back for their nachos and tacos and now I wish I had not written that other stellar review.  Their nachos were NOT very good.  They were bland and the chicken tasted dry.  I got the carne asada tacos and felt that it could have used some seasoning and maybe an extra corn tortilla underneath so that it wouldn't get all soppy when I had to squeeze lime on it to give it flavor.  I will probably be back to try more things, but yea, I wouldn't order the nachos ever again.

excerpts: chicken mole super burrito is bigger than my head, and it's quite tasty.
chicken.author: Terri J.
chicken.review:
the horchata is excellent! chicken mole super burrito is bigger than my head, and it's quite tasty.  the salsa everyone has been raving about is pretty yummy, but it's a little reminiscent of Doritos.

be prepared to wait a while.  it's been crazy busy every time i've gone, and the seating is limited.  if it's a pretty day, take a walk to dolores park and enjoy your head-sized burrito in the sun!

excerpts: no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water...
I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!
chicken.author: Kevin D.
chicken.review: A spinach super tofu quesadilla please... no, a spinach super carne asada quesadilla with grilled mushrooms... no, a super tofu burrito on spinach tortilla with no rice, grilled veggies, and a Negra Modelo... no, chicken mole dried tomato quesadilla with grilled veggies on the side and a vitamin water... I can never make up my mind because it's all so good!

excerpts: Tacos Mole with Chicken.....
You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt.
The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy.
I gave them 2 out of 5.
The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy.
I gave them 2 out of 5.
The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!
chicken.author: Miguel V.
chicken.review:
Papalote- 
The chips are just ok, the salsa is very good. The salsa has a nice flavor, fluidity and color. You can pour it over anything! Oh yeah, it's served in little black containers opposed to the clear Solo cup every other Taqueira uses; it added a little piazzas. We had the Veggie Tacos..... with potato, carrot and mushroom. Very good, I give it 4 out of 5. Nice big corn tortillas filled to the gills with good stuff. Same goes for the Marinated Tofu Tacos....... Absolutely awesome! One of the best tasting achiote paste/sauces I've had in a long time. The Tofu was grilled then sauted with the achiote paste. Excellent blend! I'd go back just for this dish. Tofu gets my best rating of 5 out of 5. These guys set the bar on tofu. Tacos Mole with Chicken.....You can tell they didn't use the achiote paste here, the mole they used was in need of (never thought I'd say this) salt. The chicken was dry and not simmered in the mole to make it moist and yummy. I gave them 2 out of 5. Soyrizo tacos....were pretty good. They tasted like store bought Soyrizo with crispy chopped Romaine, tomato salsa with light onion and cilantro. Actually all the tacos had the same garnishes. I gave them 4 out of 5. Friend had a carne asada burrito.......Good Quality Meat but was tasting burnt. Beans and rice were okay, tortilla was good but a little flaky and tender, nothing to write home about. I gave the burrito 3 out of 5. 
The food was great overall, a little slow but worth the wait. It was an order as you pay type place. I really like the grates they use on their grills opposed the single direction grates everyone else uses. The chicken looks like it was cooked at a western BBQ because of the little square marks it left, really cool!

excerpts: i had the chicken tacos and quesadillas.
i would order both again.
chicken.author: Eli A.
chicken.review:
very good.
the food took a little while to come out, but it was well worth the wait. 
ample seating for a mexican place in the mission.
i had the chicken tacos and quesadillas. i would order both again.

excerpts: The salsa is to die for as is the chicken tacos and the camerones
super burrito.
The ambience is far better than most burrito spots in the Mission and the prices will definately not break the bank.
Best of all, it's easy to do take out.
Simply call in your order, double park
and they'll whisk you straight to the front of the line to pick up your food.
chicken.author: Suzanne D.
chicken.review: The salsa is to die for as is the chicken tacos and the camerones super burrito.  The ambience is far better than most burrito spots in the Mission and the prices will definately not break the bank.  Best of all, it's easy to do take out.  Simply call in your order, double park and they'll whisk you straight to the front of the line to pick up your food.

excerpts: The burrito of choice por moi, is the chicken mole burrito, the mole is fresh, a tad bit too salty, but perfect with una cerveza.
The atmosphere is nice; small lively restaurant with indoor seating.
There is usually very cool wall art that changes to feature different local artists.
Its location is prime: a block from the 24th st.
Mission bart station.
You must eat here at least once.

I would not say the best taqueria in the mission as there are many different types and styles of taquerias in the Mission, but I will say this place has some of the more healthy cusine for a mexican restaurant.
chicken.author: Michael M.
chicken.review: Fresh Mexican food, not the greasy late night variety. The burrito of choice por moi, is the chicken mole burrito, the mole is fresh, a tad bit too salty, but perfect with una cerveza. The atmosphere is nice; small lively restaurant with indoor seating. There is usually very cool wall art that changes to feature different local artists. Its location is prime: a block from the 24th st. Mission bart station. You must eat here at least once. I would not say the best taqueria in the mission as there are many different types and styles of taquerias in the Mission, but I will say this place has some of the more healthy cusine for a mexican restaurant.

excerpts: I must admit, I've ONLY had the chicken mole burrito here.
But Papalote has the best mole I've ever tasted.
I ordered it the first time I visited Papalote a few years ago and I haven't ever wanted to try anything new.
Also, be sure to get their guacamole and salsa.
I normally get extra because they are both so yummy.
There can often be a wait if you order in-person, but you can call your order in and it'll be ready when you arrive.
Try the mole!
chicken.author: Gregory G.
chicken.review: I must admit, I've ONLY had the chicken mole burrito here. But Papalote has the best mole I've ever tasted. I ordered it the first time I visited Papalote a few years ago and I haven't ever wanted to try anything new. Also, be sure to get their guacamole and salsa. I normally get extra because they are both so yummy. There can often be a wait if you order in-person, but you can call your order in and it'll be ready when you arrive. Try the mole!

excerpts: Delicious enough to daydream about - the chicken mole and the veggie (potato & mushroom)
burritos are highly recommended!
chicken.author: J R.
chicken.review: Delicious enough to daydream about - the chicken mole and the veggie (potato & mushroom) burritos are highly recommended!

excerpts: [I've only tried the chicken, not the tofu], and the homemade salsa is an especially tasty surprise.
Beer on tap and a cozy, clean seating area make it a good dine-in experience, too.
chicken.author: Jon W.
chicken.review: Papalote manages to be something of a mild hipster joint without completely losing the character of an authentic taqueria. The mole is unique and makes for a delicious burrito [I've only tried the chicken, not the tofu], and the homemade salsa is an especially tasty surprise. Beer on tap and a cozy, clean seating area make it a good dine-in experience, too.

excerpts: nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn.
what!), food with integrity.
chicken.author: mark c.
chicken.review:
frreeessssshhhhh. thats the version here. remixed with health conscious ingredients. no LARD. vegan friendly. 

nothing fancy (well except the triple threat burrito of course, chicken, steak and prawn. what!), food with integrity. fresh fresas and horchata made daily.

the salsa. if you know, then i need not go any further.
if you dont, well, thats your fault. 

soyrizo quesadilla with grilled veggies in a tomato tortilla. 
i mean c'mon, can you say that about another burrito joint? 

the staff is friendly, fast, and efficient.

party flyers, community events, and awards plaster the walls and counter, i mean does your burrito joint have a write up in the 
WALL ST JOURNAL? 
didnt think so.

but hey, dont take my word for it. peep game yo.
you wont be sad, unless the grease, lard, and oil is your thing.

excerpts: The marinated chicken is especially good - I'll drive across town (now that I'm no longer local) to get a chicken quesadilla.
chicken.author: David G.
chicken.review: Excellent taqueria.  Takes a little while to get your food - not your usual takeout Pancho Villa experience.  But the ingredients all have a unique and delicious flavor.  The marinated chicken is especially good - I'll drive across town (now that I'm no longer local) to get a chicken quesadilla.

excerpts: The chicken burrito came with barely 1/4 oz of the extras combined.
I know the chicken is supposed to be fab, but I really prefer the regular taqueria style rather than a pounded out flattened breast.
chicken.author: e w.
chicken.review: I really hate to be a downer here, seriously, because I've been looking forward to trying this place.  Finally happened today.  I went for the "super" burrito because why even bother without the soar cream/cheese/guac?  The chicken burrito came with barely 1/4 oz of the extras combined.  I know the chicken is supposed to be fab, but I really prefer the regular taqueria style rather than a pounded out flattened breast.  I had to buy an extra salsa (which lived up to its rad reputation) to pour over the rest of my burrito just to make it interesting.  And 50c for more salsa?  Come on.

excerpts: I had the grilled chicken burrito.
They grill the chicken to order.
It takes awhile if you are doing take out, but it is worth the wait.
Very good guacamole and hot sauce.
chicken.author: Dave P.
chicken.review: Very Good Burrito. Fresh. I had the grilled chicken burrito. They grill the chicken to order. It takes awhile if you are doing take out, but it is worth the wait. Very good guacamole and hot sauce.

excerpts: My order was half of the triple threat burrito: full serving of tender grilled chicken, full serving of tangy carne asada, four succulent grilled prawns, rice, beans and cheese - made it into a super triple threat and it also included sour cream and guacamole!
Sounds pretty hefty, aye?
That's why I only had half
and I was good for the night.
The meat was a little chewy and the rice - dry, but the grilled chicken was juicy and the prawns were flavorful!

I could've used a side of fresh salsa but all they offered was a reddish orange hot sauce that kind of reminded me of the orange sauce La Vic's is famous for but sure enough, it didn't taste anything like it.
1.5 thumbs out 2, ain't bad at all.
chicken.author: Ai Q.
chicken.review: This little hole in the wall gets a 1.25 thumbs up from me. Although Bobby McFlay wasn't able to throw down on this joint or burrito or whatever so maybe a 1.5 instead for it being pretty good but not perfect. The ambiance is very hip and chill, a bit packed but the walls are red and covered in dope art pieces. You order your food at the register and wait to be seated while you're order is being cooked up. My order was half of the triple threat burrito: full serving of tender grilled chicken, full serving of tangy carne asada, four succulent grilled prawns, rice, beans and cheese - made it into a super triple threat and it also included sour cream and guacamole! Sounds pretty hefty, aye? That's why I only had half and I was good for the night. The meat was a little chewy and the rice - dry, but the grilled chicken was juicy and the prawns were flavorful! I could've used a side of fresh salsa but all they offered was a reddish orange hot sauce that kind of reminded me of the orange sauce La Vic's is famous for but sure enough, it didn't taste anything like it. 1.5 thumbs out 2, ain't bad at all.

excerpts: a chicken burrito maybe.
It was so one dimensional in flavors.
The salsa was AMAZING though, which they sell in mason jars.
I wont be back for their burritos but would be back to purchase a jar of their salsa.
chicken.author: LT B.
chicken.review: Have you ever heard of a mexican place that sells burritos w/ no carnitas on the menu?  Papalote.  I don't even remember what I ordered instead...a chicken burrito maybe.  It was so one dimensional in flavors.  The salsa was AMAZING though, which they sell in mason jars.   I wont be back for their burritos but would be back to purchase a jar of their salsa.

excerpts: Based on a Bay Area DJ group, this is goodness X3 with the incorporation of carne asada, shrimp, and chicken.
Only thing I couldn't believe was the price.
It costs under $20.
Holy shh..!
My friend and I decided to split one, and also ordered some super nachos.
chicken.author: Rhia R.
chicken.review: I had to come and see for myself what all the hype was about with this place. It's already been crazy busy way before they were featured in Throwdown. I had heard about their adobo burrito, but I was more curious to see if the Triple Threat lived up to its name. Based on a Bay Area DJ group, this is goodness X3 with the incorporation of carne asada, shrimp, and chicken. Only thing I couldn't believe was the price. It costs under $20. Holy shh..! My friend and I decided to split one, and also ordered some super nachos. That was already plenty, yet they threw in some chips and salsa with our order. I was able to get a bit of everything with each bite. The nachos were awesome as well. We barely got through half of it because of the Triple Threat. Once finished, I washed it all down with a horchata. I can honestly say that theirs is excellent; not watered down and has just the right amount of cinnamon. It was nice to taste a bit of history, but I think I'll try something different, and cheaper, next time.

excerpts: we ordered the pescado burrito, carne asada entree plate, carne asada burrito, chicken nachos and a couple of tacos.
the burrito have a toasted flour tortilla that does not hold shape and fell apart all over the plate.
the meats were decent with not much flavor.
ive had way better at many other places.
chicken.author: Toby F.
chicken.review: I went here with my family after reading all the good reviews on yelp. sorry to say, the yelpers have let me down. this place is very popular with an endless supply of customers, but i am baffled to why. my experience was that the food was satisfactory at best. we ordered the pescado burrito, carne asada entree plate, carne asada burrito, chicken nachos and a couple of tacos. the burrito have a toasted flour tortilla that does not hold shape and fell apart all over the plate. the meats were decent with not much flavor. ive had way better at many other places. the fish was not very well seasoned and the beans were bland. too much rice was used as stuffing the burrito so they wouldnt have to complement it with as much meat/fish. the staff was nice but rushed and spread very thin. this place is probably so popular because of its appearance with bobby flays show throwdown and their awards. they probably lean on those credentials and with its high demand dont put out the quality they used to at one point. oh yeah, very expensive for taqueria food, even for san francisco!

excerpts: I'm addicted to the chicken mole burrito, which I eat at least twice per week.
I know the other items on the menu are good, but I can't tear myself away from my standard.
chicken.author: David M.
chicken.review: I'm addicted to the chicken mole burrito, which I eat at least twice per week. I know the other items on the menu are good, but I can't tear myself away from my standard.

excerpts: You cannot go wrong with the plain old rice and bean burrito, but if you can have meat the chicken and carne asada burritos
should be your choice.
chicken.author: Aamir V.
chicken.review:
Papalote is the be-all, end-all of burritos in the Mission.  Fresh?  You bet.  Tasty?  Of course.  Salsa worthy of a pligrimage?  Absolutely.

You cannot go wrong with the plain old rice and bean burrito, but if you can have meat the chicken and carne asada burritos should be your choice.  They also have some other intriguing options like soyrizo, so make sure you schedule multiple visits.

The nachos are mediocre - pass on those.

I hate that they ration the salsa, but it's understandable.  That stuff is truly amazing.

excerpts: Well, finally picked up a chicken burrito supreme here today, and my god
it was good!
Chicken was seasoned and cooked perfectly.
Seemed a little small for $7 bucks, but was filling.
First place I've seen with refried BLACK beans.
chicken.author: Zen T.
chicken.review:
Whoa. I've avoided this place for over a year because any place with so much hype (even by a vegetarian friend who lives next door) has to be crap, right?

Well, finally picked up a chicken burrito supreme here today, and my god it was good! Chicken was seasoned and cooked perfectly. Seemed a little small for $7 bucks, but was filling. First place I've seen with refried BLACK beans. Nice.

Had to kill a star for the guac (seemed like the frozen stuff from Costco) and the chips (far too oil-laden), but overall a mighty tasty and unique burrito. Also - delicious (and skimpy portion) salsa. Will definitely be back for more review research.

excerpts: I love the tofu or chicken mole burrito, and the chicken quesadillas.
HOWEVER, I have one complaint.
On multiple occasions I have ordered take-out, and my dish has been missing guacamole even though I ordered it.
This is incredibly frustrating since by the time I get home
there's no way I am going to walk back to get it.
Other than that, I love this place.
chicken.author: Amy M.
chicken.review:
This is great reasonably priced Mexican food and healthier/ lighter than most taquerias in the Mission.  I love the tofu or chicken mole burrito, and the chicken quesadillas.  
HOWEVER, I have one complaint.  On multiple occasions I have ordered take-out, and my dish has been missing guacamole even though I ordered it.  This is incredibly frustrating since by the time I get home there's no way I am going to walk back to get it.  Other than that, I love this place.

excerpts: Burrito was fresh and the chicken was very "roasted" tasting.
I have eaten here a few times and it is always very good, sometimes great.
chicken.author: Webber B.
chicken.review: Not the intensity of my favorite tacos stands or the scrumptiousness of my favorite burrito places. Excellent salsa. Burrito was fresh and the chicken was very "roasted" tasting. I have eaten here a few times and it is always very good, sometimes great.

excerpts: I was pleasantly surprised by the size of my chicken mole burrito, and it tasted fantastic.
I then asked if I could have some more of the salsa I had eaten with my chips and was told it would be an extra charge.
The food was good, but not good enough to justify the price and extra charge for salsa.
Clearly the owners are trying to milk as much money as possible out of their positive press.
It is too bad, because their food is worth buying again, just not at the current prices.
chicken.author: Lucas M.
chicken.review: The line was long (a good sign?), and the service was friendly.  I was surprised by how much more expensive their burritos were than every other place I have ever been in the mission, but figured they were worth trying.  I sat down and ate some chips and salsa while I waited 15-20 minutes for my food to be prepared.  I was pleasantly surprised by the size of my chicken mole burrito, and it tasted fantastic.  I then asked if I could have some more of the salsa I had eaten with my chips and was told it would be an extra charge.  The food was good, but not good enough to justify the price and extra charge for salsa.  Clearly the owners are trying to milk as much money as possible out of their positive press.  It is too bad, because their food is worth buying again, just not at the current prices.

excerpts: The chicken mole burrito is superb and perfectly (who does mole better?)
balanced, especially eaten with lots of the habanero sauce provided on the table.

I ate a burrito a day in the mission for 10 years straight ( have approached about 5,000 recently) and have to say that these guys are consistent --which cannot be said about any other taqueria in the city.
The salsa which is a blend of two different dried chiles and pumpkin seeds (guessing here)
rocks and is only rivaled by Cancun's green (the remarkable landmark in salsa history).
chicken.author: chris r.
chicken.review: The chicken mole burrito is superb and perfectly (who does mole better?) balanced, especially eaten with lots of the habanero sauce provided on the table. I ate a burrito a day in the mission for 10 years straight ( have approached about 5,000 recently) and have to say that these guys are consistent --which cannot be said about any other taqueria in the city. The salsa which is a blend of two different dried chiles and pumpkin seeds (guessing here) rocks and is only rivaled by Cancun's green (the remarkable landmark in salsa history).

excerpts: This place is great, we shared fish tacos and a chicken quesadilla.
The tacos were huge, overflowing with fresh veggies and plenty of chunks of fish.
The salsa was great, fairly spicy (be forewarned!), the chips were a little greasy for my taste, but obviously freshly fried in house.
The crowd was a mixed group of people who clearly know this place has great food at budget prices.
I'm definitely going to eat here again.
chicken.author: Zephyr A.
chicken.review: Had dinner with a friend recently. What a value! This place is great, we shared fish tacos and a chicken quesadilla. The tacos were huge, overflowing with fresh veggies and plenty of chunks of fish. The salsa was great, fairly spicy (be forewarned!), the chips were a little greasy for my taste, but obviously freshly fried in house. The crowd was a mixed group of people who clearly know this place has great food at budget prices. I'm definitely going to eat here again.

excerpts: The popular $20 burrito, chicken dilla, and steak nacho.
I loved all of them!
Most especially the fresh grilled steaks and the smokiness and flavors of it.
Then lets not forget that special sauce...excellent and different!
This place is so close to my work...
so Papalote...
you shall see me again!
chicken.author: Dimps I.
chicken.review: The lovely cuzzins treated us out here over the weekend after spending the afternoon exploring the De Young museum.  They've been wanting to try this place out after many recommendations by close friends who are what you would call "the usual customers".  Not to mention that they reminded me that this was the place that beat Bobby Flay for the ultimate burrito throw down.  The place was packed when we arrived but never the less we got seated after we ordered and paid at the counter.  They had a variety of beers so each of the 4 of us decided to get a taste of different ones.  Good selections! The owner Manuel was very friendly, chatted and joked with us as if he had known us before.  This was our first time here.  Now the food...we ordered a little of everything but the taco.  The popular $20 burrito, chicken dilla, and steak nacho.  I loved all of them!  Most especially the fresh grilled steaks and the smokiness and flavors of it.  Then lets not forget that special sauce...excellent and different!  This place is so close to my work...so Papalote...you shall see me again!

excerpts: We're talkin' about a fresh raw piece of carne asada or chicken put on the grill especially for your burrito.
That's what Papalote is about.
Some people prefer McDonalds french fries over real freshly sliced potato french fries.
So if you wan't McDonalds, go to the taqueria down the street.
They're food is clearly fresh and delicious and some people aren't used to that.
They're salsa is also incredible.
chicken.author: Adrian N.
chicken.review: I go to this place often, as i live a block away.  ever heard of a taqueria where you're tacos, burritos and quesadillas are MADE TO ORDER?  Really.  I am not talking about a scoop of pre-cooked meat from a bucket and onto the grill.  We're talkin' about a fresh raw piece of carne asada or chicken put on the grill especially for your burrito.  That's what Papalote is about.   Some people prefer McDonalds french fries over real freshly sliced potato french fries.  So if you wan't McDonalds, go to the taqueria down the street.  They're food is clearly fresh and delicious and some people aren't used to that.  They're salsa is also incredible.  For those veggies and vegans out there, this place is also the spot.  The only down side is it can get pretty busy and the line can sometimes be out the door.    I've called a few times to place an order and they've screwed it up more than once.  But they're food is still damn good.

excerpts: i go with chicken or shrimp...tacos or burrito.
everything is good here.
and they always have good fliers to peek at while you are waiting for takeout.
fast, good, nice people working here, clean, bottled coke...yum, great food.
chicken.author: kelly M.
chicken.review: frtesh, fresh, fresh....i will go to el farolito at 2 am when i am drunk and it'll be greasy and great. but the rest of the time and when i am sober, papalote is the spot! always tastes fresh, tasty and i never feel gross or guilty after i eat b/c it is so not greasy here. if you are craving grease, try the chorizo & cheese....slap your moma good. i go with chicken or shrimp...tacos or burrito. everything is good here. and they always have good fliers to peek at while you are waiting for takeout. fast, good, nice people working here, clean, bottled coke...yum, great food.

excerpts: Both times I've had a grilled chicken burrito, and both times I have thoroughly enjoyed my meal and left completely stuffed.
I like their system, where you walk in and order, then take a number and sit at a table.
They have a small selection of agua frescas as well as sodas and Mexican beer.
chicken.author: Lindsay B.
chicken.review: A friend of mine lives around the corner from this place, and I am so glad she turned me on to Papalote.  It is certainly American-ized, but I'm okay with that.  Both times I've had a grilled chicken burrito, and both times I have thoroughly enjoyed my meal and left completely stuffed.  I like their system, where you walk in and order, then take a number and sit at a table.  They have a small selection of agua frescas as well as sodas and Mexican beer.  The staff is super quick at bringing chips and salsa to your table so you don't sit there starving.  Their salsa really is amazing.  I have no idea what they do to it, but it is the perfect amount of spiciness for me, and I love the smokiness of the chilies in there.  I usually pour more of the salsa onto my burrito, which is so huge I eat it with a knife and fork.  I have yet to order them, but the nachos look amazing.  Definitely a two-person order, they look like a huge mound of cheesy deliciousness.  When I'm in the area, this is my spot for a burrito.

excerpts: the chicken overcooked, the filling skimpy on the "super" ingredients, or once, there was a disturbing surfeit of beans!
i recommend the chicken or rice and bean super burrito.
i'm not a fan of the tofu.
chicken.author: wendy p.
chicken.review:
recently papalote bumped out cancun as my favorite burrito in the city.  it probably helps that it's the most convenient taqueria to me...  but also it's a lot fresher and less greasy than the other taquerias in the area.   as much as i love it, i can't give them 5 stars because of the occasional lapses in greatness.  once in a while something is off - the chicken overcooked, the filling skimpy on the "super" ingredients, or once, there was a disturbing surfeit of beans!  it's still a good burrito, but not always consistent.  

there is usually a long wait, but that's easily avoided by calling in ahead of time.  

i recommend the chicken or rice and bean super burrito.  i'm not a fan of the tofu.

excerpts: i had a chicken burrito.
it was good, but i feel burritos are generally good and hard to screw up.
chicken.author: Kan L.
chicken.review:
i like that their salsa is different than your usual salsa. it's saucier in every way. 
my friend's fish tacos were very good. they did a great job cooking the fish. i gladly and shamelessly ate the rest of her fish when she was done. i had a chicken burrito. it was good, but i feel burritos are generally good and hard to screw up.

excerpts: I got chicken
and it's dry and bland also.
chicken.author: Matthew T.
chicken.review: I went here because it was on the way to where i was going and and it had good reciews. I wish i hadn't. Regular burrito $7.50. I got cheese which brought it up to $9.30. $1.50 extra? Guacamole is even more. Then I waited close to ten minutes, and it wasn't busy at all. So it's twice as expensive and takes more than twice as long as any number of place within a couple blocks. This is real BS. I've had time to make a phone call, log on to Yelp to write this review up to here, and still no food. Still waiting... And here it is, now 15 minutes after ordering. How is it? Not so good. Pretty bland and dry, heavy on the rice. I got chicken and it's dry and bland also. And they didn't put on the cheese. I'd been here before with similar results but gave it another chance because of convenience and good reviews. I could have walked down to La Cornetta or, even better, La Tacqeria, and had my food faster and it would have been tasty and reasonably priced. I just don't understand the good reviews.

excerpts: the super fish burrito is amazing, and the super chicken is also very good.
while i have never personally experienced it, i have heard underwhelming opinions of the burritos from friends and roommates.
when i ask if they got it super, they say "no," which is a fatal mistake.
Always get it SUPER.
chicken.author: Pete A.
chicken.review: my favorite burrito.  the super fish burrito is amazing, and the super chicken is also very good.  while i have never personally experienced it, i have heard underwhelming opinions of the burritos from friends and roommates.  when i ask if they got it super, they say "no," which is a fatal mistake.  Always get it SUPER.

excerpts: Super grilled chicken burrito with refried beans and both kinds of salsa" = best burrito in the city.
Call ahead, though, and take it home.
chicken.author: M A.
chicken.review: "Super grilled chicken burrito with refried beans and both kinds of salsa" = best burrito in the city.  Call ahead, though, and take it home.

excerpts: Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole.
chicken.author: Eugene P.
chicken.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts: had the chicken mole burrito which was juicy, and flavorful, and took away any doubts i had about mole in a burrito outfit.
the salsa alone is worth a trip, it is creamy with rosted (tomato?) pieces.
i found myself going back a few days later, and sampled the chili verde tacos.
the meat was a little dry, but a healthy addition of the salsa made the taco perfect.
i couldn't tell for sure if the tortillas were fresh, but i would bet that they are.
the jicama salad with orange garnish is a fantastic touch on each plate.
decent prices as well, and a nice mexican beer selection.
chicken.author: Lesley S.
chicken.review: only been here twice, but so far this is a three star taqueria. had the chicken mole burrito which was juicy, and flavorful, and took away any doubts i had about mole in a burrito outfit.  the salsa alone is worth a trip, it is creamy with rosted (tomato?) pieces. i found myself going back a few days later, and sampled the chili verde tacos. the meat was a little dry, but a healthy addition of the salsa made the taco perfect. i couldn't tell for sure if the tortillas were fresh, but i would bet that they are. the jicama salad with orange garnish is a fantastic touch on each plate. decent prices as well, and a nice mexican beer selection.

excerpts: As first-timers, the hubs and I shared a Triple Threat burrito - 3 proteins: chicken, beef, and shrimp.
The shrimp was the star!
shrimp.author: Janis A.
shrimp.review:
As first-timers, the hubs and I shared a Triple Threat burrito - 3 proteins: chicken, beef, and shrimp. The shrimp was the star!

Tacos are mediocre. I expected more. I thought these would be like street tacos, but the tortillas weren't even warm/toasted. They were very dry and fell apart.

Lastly, I just want to point out that the housemade salsa is DELICIOUS. This is the fresh salsa they give to you when you order. But the jarred salsas they sell, are just... BLAND, for some reason. These are the same jars they sell at Safeway for like $8 a pop, I think. What a rip off.

excerpts: The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp.
The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey.
shrimp.author: Joy W.
shrimp.review:
About six years ago, Flay challenged Papalote to a burrito contest and the triple threat burrito triumphed. I wish I knew what Papalote was like before it was featured on Throwdown. Was the triple threat always $20? Back then, $20 was a lot of cash for a burrito and it still is now, but at least that burrito hasn't been affected by inflation in these past few years. Also, the hype has calmed down compared to those crowds after the episode first aired. 

Triple Threat - chicken breast, carne asada, prawns:
It's loaded with 3 types of proteins, but I don't feel threatened. The taste and quality is on par with most burritos, so in comparison, the price tag sure is steep. The grilled prawns were the best part. They're tender and springy with a nice char. Plus, the prawns are left whole instead of chopped up beyond recognition. The chicken and carne asada are nicely seasoned, too. 
It is a very large burrito, so if you need a reason to justify spending $20, you can share it or split it between two meals. It's also a good decision if you have a tough time choosing between poultry, beef, & seafood, or if you're just curious to try it, but it is not a must have.

The Carne Asada & Pollo Asado burritos are pretty good too, sans shrimp. The single meat burritos are about $10, which is a little pricey. Adding cheese, guac, or sour cream are each $1. Kind of a bummer, since burritos usually include cheese. If you're going to add one, you might as well add all 3 for $2, resulting in a very creamy burrito. 

Of course the roasted tomato salsa is excellent. It is the true threat here. This thick & creamy, robust, orange sauce is like a flavor explosion of smokey, sweet, savory, spicy, and slightly tart. This salsa is excellent on their thin, warm chips, as well as on everything else. Jars of Papalote's various salsas are available for purchase in various local markets. 
Overall, I'm satisfied with the food, but the prices are high relative to other Mexican joints in the Mission, so I give it a 7.25/10.

excerpts: I had a shrimp burrito... which only had 4 pieces of shrimp.
shrimp.author: Ann L.
shrimp.review: Are you serious now? I been to a few taquerias and this one takes the cake in skimpy as fck in their portions. I had a shrimp burrito... which only had 4 pieces of shrimp. It was packed with rice and veggies and cost $12?! I thought I had ordered a veggie burrito with those portions...My friend had the steak burrito and there was barely any steak. Stop cheating your customers.

excerpts: The actual food I ordered were the nachos with shrimp, and personally I wasn't blown away -- the nachos were topped with a lot of melted shredded cheese, tomatoes, and beans, but not much else

and they were somewhat skimpy on the shrimp (i.e. I can get more shrimp for half the price from a cheapo taqueria in the same part of town, or in Redwood CIty where I live within a mile from about 5 Mexican restaurants).
shrimp.author: Anita T.
shrimp.review:
Cute place with a decent amount of seating for a food establishment in the city, and some REEEEEEEALLY amazing salsa. The 3 stars here are mostly for that salsa, which is made of pureed roasted tomato and chipotle peppers, blended until its creamy without dairy added in. IT IS AMAZING. You get a cup of the salsa and complimentary chips while waiting for your order, which was the highlight of the meal. They also sell the salsa at the cash register and I've actually seen it at some supermarkets on the peninsula. 

The actual food I ordered were the nachos with shrimp, and personally I wasn't blown away -- the nachos were topped with a lot of melted shredded cheese, tomatoes, and beans, but not much else and they were somewhat skimpy on the shrimp (i.e. I can get more shrimp for half the price from a cheapo taqueria in the same part of town, or in Redwood CIty where I live within a mile from about 5 Mexican restaurants). The overall effect was kind of bland, which was unfortunate since the salsa we got at the start was so good. 

Verdict: Come here for that damn salsa.

excerpts: Only got 4 to 5 pieces of shrimp.
Paid extra for sour cream and guacamole, but barely tasted it.
Not worth $25.
shrimp.author: M C.
shrimp.review: Food was tasteful; however, very small tight spot.  Barely any room to stand and put your order in.  Place was extremely cramped.  Bathroom had graffiti all over,  even the toilet.  Got the tripple threat burrito, taste good, but don't believe the hype.  Only got 4 to 5 pieces of shrimp.  Paid extra for sour cream and guacamole, but barely tasted it.  Not worth $25.

excerpts: Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado.
shrimp.author: Mark O.
shrimp.review:
Mexican restaurant on 24th & Valencia. On the 2014 and 2015 7x7 list for their chips and salsa.

Although you order at the counter your food gets brought to you. Limited meat selection. No chorizo or carnitas. 

Carne Asada quesadilla - 2/5 - Steak is rather bland and a bit too chewy.

Triple threat burrito - 3/5 - Massive. Shrimp/Steak/Chicken with rice/pico/avacado. Not really impressed.

Chips and salsa - 5/5 - WOW. I very much expected to be disappointed by another overhyped dish but this absolutely lived up to it's reputation. The salsa is so damn good. This is easily my favorite salsa in the city and I even bought an extra jar to take home. It is creamy, spicy and delicious. It certainly deserves the spot it has held on the 7x7 list for the past two years.

Overall, this is without a doubt my new go to option for salsa. Unfortunately the rest of their items are passable so I think I will likely be getting the salsa to go and getting my burrito/taco/quesadilla elsewhere in the future. Regardless, this salsa is absolutely "as good as it gets" and I will probably always have some on hand in my fridge.

excerpts:
* Shrimp Taco - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#z-j-9B6z9JdvI7LfEo_Cpw
The shrimp is a bit small, crunchy but not quite fresh-tasting.
shrimp.author: Ziyan C.
shrimp.review:
We came at about 9pm on a Friday; they were busy but not crowded. We did get the last 4 seats free. No line at the counter, and maybe 5-10 minutes later our food came out. 

* Fish Taco - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw
Large chunks of fish filet. Pretty fresh, good texture. They're not breaded or fried though. 

* Shrimp Taco - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#z-j-9B6z9JdvI7LfEo_Cpw
The shrimp is a bit small, crunchy but not quite fresh-tasting. 

Overall on the tacos: a little too au-naturel, no salsas or sauces drizzled on top, but lots of chopped lettuce, tomatoes, onions. A little too much of these raw veggies, so much that it hides the meat at first and tends to overpower the tacos. You have to add their free salsa, which is creamy and pretty spicy. Makes a world of difference.

* Triple Threat Burrito - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#_dyP1DyvOS9TPp_ljhC1lQ
Yes! So much good meat. Even better with their salsa drizzled on top.

excerpts: I got the super "Triple Threat Burrito" -- chicken, steak, and shrimp.
I should have known it was going to be a discombobulated flavor mess.
First of all, among the three proteins, I only enjoyed the steak.
The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked.
The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked.
I was burping up bad shrimp all night long.
Don't get the shrimp.
Or chicken.
2) Don't get the refried beans.
Just trust me on this.
Park on the residential streets nearby.
Actually, nevermind all that.
Skip this spot and go to La Taqueria instead.
shrimp.author: Jennifer B.
shrimp.review:
Wow. What a major disappointment. Major.

USA Today ranked Papalote Mexican Grill as the #1 burrito in the country. I've eaten quite a few excellent burritos and a lot of "meh" burritos, but actually not a lot of terrible burritos. The one I had today would fall into that last category. I'm pretty sure I actually enjoy Chipotle's burritos more, and that's saying something.

I got the super "Triple Threat Burrito" -- chicken, steak, and shrimp. I should have known it was going to be a discombobulated flavor mess. First of all, among the three proteins, I only enjoyed the steak. The chicken, although obviously dusted in some spice mixture, was incredibly bland, and the shrimp was very fishy AND overcooked. I was burping up bad shrimp all night long.

As for the rest of the burrito, it could be that I just ordered wrong by getting the refried beans. They advertise the refried beans as being vegan, which should have been a red flag. Ask your abuela if she ever made vegan refried beans. She'd laugh at you. But aside from the poor taste, the texture was... saucy. Not goopy, not gloppy, not bean-y. Saucy. And these beans, which made up far too much of the burrito, melded together with the salsa, watery guacamole, and who knows what else to become a really drippy, nasty sauce. Burritos are meant to have all of the components stay separate while being wrapped together, not seem like they've gone through a blender together to become homogenized. It was really, really bad. I regretted buying this $22 burrito (Yes! $22!!!) two bites into it.

On another note, the salsa that comes with their chips is very unique. Very Romesco-y. The chips were stale.

Tips and tricks for if you go to Papalote:
1) Don't get the shrimp. Or chicken. 
2) Don't get the refried beans. Just trust me on this.
3) Park on the residential streets nearby.
4) Actually, nevermind all that. Skip this spot and go to La Taqueria instead.

excerpts: Don't get the shrimp burrito.
You won't be able to find the shrimp.
shrimp.author: Marlene T.
shrimp.review:
Don't get the shrimp burrito. You won't be able to find the shrimp. What a disappointment.

This place is all hyped up. Please don't be fooled. The food was ok. The portions were a lot smaller than we expected for the price we paid. They don't have lengua or tripa here. This place is more like a Mexican fusion. 

I will have to say that this place is probably loved by vegetarians and frowned upon by the meat lovers. If you're looking for some real good Mexican food, just head to El Farolito. You'll get your meat fixing and authentic foods there.

excerpts: Stuffed with steak, chicken, and shrimp --
shrimp.author: Tony V.
shrimp.review:
What I got:
Triple threat burrito

What I thought:
So the Mission is known to have a bunch of great Mexican food spots to eat and to say that this is definitely top 3 is saying something!

The triple threat burrito is something else. I don't think I've ever had a burrito quite like it. Stuffed with steak, chicken, and shrimp -- what better combination could you ask for!?

Flavors were amazing and the meats were seasoned perfectly. The combination of everything blended very well. I ended up wanting more after I finished my half!

We arrived a little bit late before closing time so we didn't get to enjoy our burrito in the actual restaurant, but the employees were so kind and asked us if we wanted to cut our burrito is half since we were on the go. They even individually wrapped each one. Even by cutting it in half, it still looked like two regular burritos. That's how gigantic this puppy is.

One of the best places to eat in the Mission -- no doubt! Craving Mexican food? This is the place for you!

excerpts: My friend had shrimp nachos one time and they were awesome too.
It's not cheap though.
You can expect $12/person here.
Small tight space inside.
shrimp.author: Jatin M.
shrimp.review: I love Papalote! I make sure I go there to eat if I am in SF (not often - hate the traffic!). I love their salsa. Always get the chicken burrito with everything (you pay extra $2 for sour cream, cheese and guac). My friend had shrimp nachos one time and they were awesome too. It's not cheap though. You can expect $12/person here. Small tight space inside.

excerpts: The triple threat burrito had all three meats -- chicken, steak, and garlic shrimp.
The tacos were alright, a tad bit on the dry side
but it is because we didn't get any guac or sour cream with it.
Despite the wait and the fact we couldnt be seated, overall it was a good experience.
I will be coming back again.
shrimp.author: Peter W.
shrimp.review: A hearty burrito after a long week's work is exactly what I needed -- I have heard amazing things about papalote from friends and colleagues; it was true. I ordered 2 steak tacos and a triple threat burrito ( made super ) to share. Unfortunately they were closing soon so we had to get it to go -- although it was quite a long wait, it was so worth it. The meal came with nachos and their award winning papalote sauce. It was AMAZING! The triple threat burrito had all three meats -- chicken, steak, and garlic shrimp. The tacos were alright, a tad bit on the dry side but it is because we didn't get any guac or sour cream with it. Despite the wait and the fact we couldnt be seated, overall it was a good experience. I will be coming back again.

excerpts: Not a place to get a shrimp burrito.
They charge around $12 which is expected but in this huge burrito of just fillings, you'd be lucky to find 6 "medium sized" shrimps.
shrimp.author: Daanyaal K.
shrimp.review:
Not a place to get a shrimp burrito. They charge around $12 which is expected but in this huge burrito of just fillings, you'd be lucky to find 6 "medium sized" shrimps. I'm sure if you get chicken, beef, or whatever you see the meat everywhere. You take one bite and this guck just starts pouring out. I got sick for a from this place and that salsa is more like lard than anything. 

The only good thing I had was the chips but the overall experience wasn't good enough to come back. I emailed the restaurant about a refund after the poor meal and sickness but I got no response.

excerpts: Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super.
To me it is weird that isn't included in the price
but ok.
The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant.
It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender.
Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.
As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with.
shrimp.author: Eddie W.
shrimp.review:
7x7 100 Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2012

#46 Chips and Salsa at Papalote

My first question to myself was how good can the chips and salsa really be or was this just another fill in item. Well I finally was able to have my answer this past week. 

After deliberating where to go, we decided to go to Papalote for their chips and salsa. While browsing their menu online I noticed something odd. Everyone on Yelp kept posting pictures of the Triple Threat Burrito however I saw it no where on the menu. Turns out it is their signature item that was featured on Bobby Flay's show Throwdown. 

Basically its a huge burrito stuffed with steak, chicken and shrimp however you do need to pay $1 extra to make it super. To me it is weird that isn't included in the price but ok. My friend and I agreed to split the burrito plus get chips, extra salsa and two beers. We both ended up paying $18 for just that so keep that in mind. 

For what its worth, the salsa is unlike any other salsa I have had. From color, consistency and all the way down to flavor there is a complexity to their salsa that is well worth trying. The chips did not appear to be anything out of the ordinary but I would recommend trying the salsa at least one time. 

The steak was sensational, the best I have had so far from any mexican restaurant. It was juicy, flavorful and fork tender. I would gladly go back for their carne asada burrito. 

Chicken was fine, good portion and seasoned adequately but no real highs or lows.

As for the shrimp, the addition of the 4 pieces felt a little underwhelming, and left me wondering why was it even in there to begin with. The quality was good and cooked well but didn't find it be a valid "threat".

Overall Thoughts

Salsa is delicious and well worth trying as well as the carne asada but be warned Papalote isn't a cheap grab and go burrito kind of place

excerpts: Shrimp Burrito.
SUPERRRR salty.
I ended up forgoing half of it, and fishing out the shrimp to eat.
I can tell ingredients are fresh.
shrimp.author: Em F.
shrimp.review:
I finally got to try this place after hearing so much about it from friends and Bobby Flays throw down.

Overall this place has pretty decent burritos, chips, and quesadilla. However nothing special enough to warrant my return. I will stick with El Farolito from now on and NEVER stray again.

Chips and sauce were ok. Chips were a bit thick. Sauce was pretty good, albeit a bit on the heavy side.

Shrimp Burrito. SUPERRRR salty. I ended up forgoing half of it, and fishing out the shrimp to eat. I can tell ingredients are fresh. However it was a bit plain, and the bell peppers were in large chunks dispersed unevenly in the burrito.

Beef quesadilla. It's very small for how much your pay, but pretty good. 4 pieces of quesadilla and beef that was flavorful. However the beef was on the dry and chewy side. (El Farolito is 20000000% better. ARguably they have the best quesadillas in town.)

Breakfast Burrito.  SOOO salty and greasy, that I was honestly not even sure what I was eating. I would definitely stay far away from this.

All in all...not bad by any means. However it would be a disappointment if you are expecting it to live up to its hype.

excerpts: But you go to Papalote for their shrimp burrito.
It's huge and delightful.
Plus their creamy salsa?
Two thumbs up.
shrimp.author: Jonathan S.
shrimp.review: When visitors come to SF, they're often familiar with mission-style burritos.  What they DON'T know is that different taquerias have different specialties.  For example, you go to El Farolito for their carne asada.  Personally, I love the chicken tikka masala burrito from Curry Up Now.  But you go to Papalote for their shrimp burrito.  It's huge and delightful.  Plus their creamy salsa?  Two thumbs up.

excerpts: However, the highlight of my meal was the camarones quesadilla, which features shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter with delicious melted cheese...seriously, this is very very good stuff.
Add to that the flavor of the roasted peppers, with a dab of roasted tomato salsa and a bottle of coke on the side...
shrimp.author: Angel S.
shrimp.review:
[Featured:  Throwdown with Bobby Flay, Food Network, http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gSciXC-jO8I]

Pop Quiz:  What SF burrito joint absolutely pwned Chef Bobby Flay in a salsa and burrito throwdown on national TV?  If you responded "Papalote" ... ding ding ding!

Seriously, as much as I like El Farolito (of which I am also a fan), Papalote will likely be in the mix for my go to spots for Mexican fare, even though I have mixed feelings.  As far as authenticity and value, Papalote is lacking, so I can see where others are coming from when they reduce Papalote as merely a fancy Chipotle, though I don't agree.  Also, Papalote's burritos are slightly smaller and pricier than its Mission counterparts.  

On the other hand.  It's hard to argue with the quality, especially the famed roasted tomato salsa. 

Overrated?  Nope, I don't think so.  Papalote's burrito and quesadilla were simply delicious, no exaggerated flavors.  In my view, Papalote deserves all the pub that comes with being named as SF Weekly's "best burrito" every year since 2007.  Now the Food Network has taken notice.

The carne asada burrito was off the chain, with tender beef and rich flavor and the burrito was not overly salted.  Plus it was just the right size that it wont leave you stuffed and bloated after the meal.

However, the highlight of my meal was the camarones quesadilla, which features shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter with delicious melted cheese...seriously, this is very very good stuff.  Add to that the flavor of the roasted peppers, with a dab of roasted tomato salsa and a bottle of coke on the side...I'd say that's a winning combo.

Unfortunately, the only damper was that the chips we got were too hard and they might have been a little stale.  It didn't matter too much in the end.  The roasted tomato salsa was so good that I could have dipped cardboard in it and I would have enjoyed the meal.

Thank you; Chef Escobedo.  I now have my sights set on the adobo buritto (off menu) and, maybe the triple threat.  Yet another reason to love the Mission District.

excerpts: $12 for an order of shrimp tacos, take away.
You get about 6 shrimp, slightly burned and some sad amount of salad.
$6 per taco!!!
Are you guys nuts?
shrimp.author: James G.
shrimp.review: Rip off. $12 for an order of shrimp tacos, take away. You get about 6 shrimp, slightly burned and some sad amount of salad. $6 per taco!!! Are you guys nuts?

excerpts: The shrimp tacos were delicious but the fish tacos could have been better.
The fish was a bit soggy.
shrimp.author: Aimee W.
shrimp.review: The shrimp tacos were delicious but the fish tacos could have been better. The fish was a bit soggy. Other than that I enjoyed the complementary chips and salsa and horchata!

excerpts: The grilled prawn and lime tacos on soft corn tortillas, camarones (shrimp tacos cooked in butter and wine), chilaquiles and Papalote's incomparable salsa

(I've gingerly transported jars of Papalote salsa, bubble wrapped for good measure, to the East Coast to distribute amongst lucky friends but nothing beats fresh salsa at the Mission location) are all killer.
Add a strawberry agua fresca and I'm good to go.
shrimp.author: Cheryl L.
shrimp.review:
I love Papalote and always make sure to bring out-of-towners whenever friends come to visit.

The grilled prawn and lime tacos on soft corn tortillas, camarones (shrimp tacos cooked in butter and wine), chilaquiles and Papalote's incomparable salsa (I've gingerly transported jars of Papalote salsa, bubble wrapped for good measure, to the East Coast to distribute amongst lucky friends but nothing beats fresh salsa at the Mission location) are all killer. Add a strawberry agua fresca and I'm good to go.

excerpts: I usually go with a super steak burrito or a shrimp quesadilla though
WITH EXTRA SAUCE.
shrimp.author: Jessie L.
shrimp.review:
The best Mexican in SF. I don't know why La Taquiera gets so much buzz. This place is so much better. 

I don't know what's in their "special sauce" but I literally want to put it on everything I eat from now on. 

I don't have "recommendations" because everything you order is good. I usually go with a super steak burrito or a shrimp quesadilla though WITH EXTRA SAUCE.

excerpts: The shrimp is grilled to perfection and also bursting with flavor...
All the meats are cooked to order and you really could taste the freshness in the cooking-
shrimp.author: Gaby C.
shrimp.review:
*I would actually rate this place 3.5 stars if I could, but since I can't, I'm going to have to round down in this instance*

So, I've been wanting to try this place since it was featured and won on a Throwdown with Bobby Flay episode years ago... Then, I wanted to try it even more when I read an article recently that named this place the Best Burrito in America.... I can't tell you the excitement I had inside- it was overwhelming.

Of course, the place was packed inside. It's a very small, cozy place with only a few tables... The seating is somewhat communal style, where you may or may not have to share the same table with other parties... It has a cool, vibe to it- fits right in in the Mission neighborhood.

You order at the front counter and then are asked to wait outside until they are able to seat your party. 

Obviously I ordered the $19.95 Triple Threat Burrito (Don't worry- I shared this with one other person) as that's the very burrito that beat out Bobby Flay and was mentioned in the article... P.s. It's an extra $0.99 for guacamole ... Why wouldn't a $20 burrito already have guacamole in it? (That extra $0.99 is actually for cheese, sour cream and guacamole but I don't eat cheese or sour cream) 

Once seated, they will bring you chips and salsa (it more looks like a slightly thick, smooth orangey sauce)... The chips are mediocre, but the salsa is really unique tasting and really yummy! 

The burrito was served very shortly after. It's huge! Thank goodness we decided to share.  So the burrito was really good... Really, really good... Probably the best meat I've ever had in a burrito- the pieces of steak and chicken are lean and big and juicy and flavorful; very different from many Mexican food places where the meat is always greasy, minced to an oblivion and full of weird, chewy and fatty bites where you aren't quite sure what you just put in your mouth (icky)... The shrimp is grilled to perfection and also bursting with flavor... All the meats are cooked to order and you really could taste the freshness in the cooking- it keeps you excited for each and every bite that you take.

Overall, I really enjoyed my meal... The high quality of the meat is definitely the highlight of this place.... But to me, they really need to improve their chip recipe and the fact that this place isn't what you would consider to be typical "Mexican taqueria style" food threw me off a little from what I was expecting... Also, in my opinion, America's best burrito is definitely not going to have black beans inside it. 

Okay, so maybe it's not the best burrito in my book, but I would say this place is definitely worth a try if you're in the area. 

Note: This place has tons of vegetarian options which was really cool to me.

excerpts: burrito of steak, chicken adobo, and shrimp, for $20!
Which is only missing their vegan items to be the whole menu.
Bobby Flay should just stick to barbeques.
Oh Papalote made a better burrito than Boby Flay on Throwdown?
Have you seen the show?
shrimp.author: Leo M.
shrimp.review:
Tastes alright. Really pricy for what me and my 7 other latino friends consider and rate as a "mediocre burrito". Just see who is sitting at the tables. Latinos? Nope.

Extremely limited meats for a mexican food place. look at the menu, the only worthwhile item is the Triple Threata burrito of steak, chicken adobo, and shrimp, for $20! Which is only missing their vegan items to be the whole menu. Bobby Flay should just stick to barbeques. Oh Papalote made a better burrito than Boby Flay on Throwdown? Have you seen the show? He never wins.

The jicama sample-size salad is ridiculous. The stale table chips a joke. The only thing ok is the salsa they sell and offer with the chips. Also the mexican coke and 7up.

Regardless, I wish this little restaurant well, I wont be coming back. But I hope they prosper in their own way.

excerpts: Hmmm,$48 for two steak tacos, two shrimp tacos, a steak burrito, and a couple of sodas.
The place should really be listed as $$ or $$$ ...
shrimp.author: Colleen M.
shrimp.review: Hmmm,$48 for two steak tacos, two shrimp tacos, a steak burrito, and a couple of sodas. The place should really be listed as $$ or $$$ ...

excerpts: and you really can taste each distinctive type of meat (carne asada, chicken, shrimp) inside the burrito... while they all somehow taste well together.
shrimp.author: Chris P.
shrimp.review:
Quick qualification, full disclosure: I worked the Food Network/Bobby Flay "Throwdown" production gig that featured the Triple Threat Burrito.

My rating really is closer to a 4.9 star rating buuuuut I still can't quite get passed the $20 price tag on the Triple Threat burrito, which happens to be my favorite thing here... that and their secret sauce salsa of course.

I, like a few others, without a doubt suggest you order 1 Triple Threat and split it with someone. It's large and awesome. It's always cooked just right and you really can taste each distinctive type of meat (carne asada, chicken, shrimp) inside the burrito... while they all somehow taste well together. Everything seems to be in just right the place.

I also usually order a quesadilla or something like that and spilt it with my fellow grubber.

P.S.- Totally nice staff, including the bros/owners that were featured on Bobby Flay's show.

excerpts: A few shrimp, tons of rice, just a poorly sculpted piece of art.
I live in that hood and there are so many better places.
Great salsa, but that's really not enough.
I prefer salsa bars with more variety and hotter.
I need hotter!
shrimp.author: Jon S.
shrimp.review:
13 bucks for a burrito?  That better be twice as good as every other burrito for that price, but that is by far not the case.  A few shrimp, tons of rice, just a poorly sculpted piece of art.  I live in that hood and there are so many better places. Great salsa, but that's really not enough. I prefer salsa bars with more variety and hotter.  I need hotter!  But that's just me.

 I can't get over the pricing, I feel a bit robbed, but never again!

excerpts: Papalote is REALLY proud of the fact that their "Triple Threat" (steak, chicken, shrimp) burrito beat
Iron Chef Bobby Flay's.
It's prominently advertised and mentioned by Papalote groupies.
And they charge $20.
I asked a friend who is a Papalote devotee if she wanted to split it, but was told it's not really that big.
But still $20?
I ordered the chicken burrito and got a Horchata too.
The chicken seemed shredded.
A little dry.
As I continued to eat it, it was good, but it did not wow me or fill me up at the end of the meal.
A good burrito.
Add a little salsa as you eat the burrito and it's better.
But this experience has inspired me to try other joints in the Mission for my next visit.
Maybe find some friends to go on a Mission burrito crawl.
shrimp.author: Corey C.
shrimp.review:
My first burrito in the Mission District!  Papalote was the first recommendation given to me when venturing into this mecca of big burrito lovers.  I'm not going to just meekly accept the assumption that all burritos from this area are better than anywhere else without validating this myself though.    

Going on a picturesque Sunday evening in August, it was surprisingly not too packed.  I have had longer waits at Chipotle.  The clientele here included mainly tourists and hipsters, here because of their devotion to a good burrito.  

Papalote is REALLY proud of the fact that their "Triple Threat" (steak, chicken, shrimp) burrito beat Iron Chef Bobby Flay's.  It's prominently advertised and mentioned by Papalote groupies.  And they charge $20.  I asked a friend who is a Papalote devotee if she wanted to split it, but was told it's not really that big.  But still $20?  Yeah, no thanks.

So you order at Papalote by telling them what you want, getting a number, taking it to your table, and waiting for them to bring it out.  I ordered the chicken burrito and got a Horchata too.  On to the chips and salsa.  The salsa is pretty awesome.  It tasted like a fire-roasted tomato-based red salsa, but is a little creamy too.  The chips were standard.  The horchata was a tad sweet for my taste.

The burrito came out after roughly 10 minutes.  Time to dig in!  Wait . . . no foil and it's on a plate?  Surely I don't have to eat this burrito with knife and fork? That's a little too formal for me, so I used my hands and picked it up.  First bite and I liked the flavor of the burrito.  The chicken seemed shredded.  A little dry.  As I continued to eat it, it was good, but it did not wow me or fill me up at the end of the meal.  A good burrito.  Add a little salsa as you eat the burrito and it's better.  But this experience has inspired me to try other joints in the Mission for my next visit.  Maybe find some friends to go on a Mission burrito crawl.

excerpts: I got the shrimp burrito
it was pleasantly DELISH...
Can I say that word again?
DELISH!!!!!
Next time on a cheat day I will go back and go big or go home and get the triple threat?
It looks like death but
I'm sure it's to die for!!!!!!

shrimp.review:
SUPER delish!!! Okay so I have a friend name Victor that said he had a restaurant in SF. Then I seen his clip on food network and still didn't go. HAHAAH Finally,
my besties and myself decided to go out and spend the weekend in SF for Cinco De Mayo! In Honor of Cinco De Mayo we ate mexican food of course!!!! SOOOO the sauce is sooo tasty!!! DELISH I must buy the jar when I go shopping next! I got the shrimp burrito it was pleasantly DELISH... Can I say that word again? DELISH!!!!! Next time on a cheat day I will go back and go big or go home and get the triple threat? It looks like death but I'm sure it's to die for!!!!!! I'll be paying for it at the gym!!! hahaha

SO the place is small but who doesn't like small places? If the food is good who cares right? I love the photography work on the wall. I am quite intrigued by the photoes!! I love ART!!! Very pretty! Good job EH!

excerpts: Shrimp tacos are hands down the best sautéed in white wine sauce and butter.
shrimp.author: Lisa L.
