shrimp.review: Love the food chips and salsa are great. Shrimp tacos are hands down the best sautéed in white wine sauce and butter.

excerpts: I usually order either tacos or naked burrito with shrimp or Chile Verde.
Consistent, fast, and delicious whether you're ordering out or eating there.
Best salsa EVER!
shrimp.author: Sophie S.
shrimp.review: Favorite Mexican restaurant by far! I usually order either tacos or naked burrito with shrimp or Chile Verde. Consistent, fast, and delicious whether you're ordering out or eating there. Best salsa EVER!

excerpts: " (steak, shrimp, & chicken).
A lil pricy at $20, but I think it's worth it.
It's one of those
"you gotta try it once" kinda things.
shrimp.author: Juno M.
shrimp.review:
Finally had this yesterday, and it was definitely worth the Bart trip from Union City to the Mission district.

First off, their homemade salsa tops everything I've had in my Mexican dining experience. It's a must-have when you visit.

Next, being that I'm Filipino, I specifically came here for the "Mexipino" (chicken adobo burrito) and boy did it live up to the hype. Very light and flavorful.

AIso had some of my fiancee's "Triple Threat" (steak, shrimp, & chicken). A lil pricy at $20, but I think it's worth it. It's one of those "you gotta try it once" kinda things. Just as flavorful as the Mexipino, but I can't say better.

Have their horchata too!

excerpts: The shrimp pieces were small and really fresh.
shrimp.author: Shannon L.
shrimp.review:
Please don't throw tomatoes at me, I'm just being honest.

There has been hype around Papalote for a really long time in my mind.  With the 7x7's best burritos in SF article to my coworker constantly dipping his broccoli in their salsa, I was just aching to eat here.

I tried both a Carne Asada and a Camarones burrito, super'ed.  The shrimp pieces were small and really fresh.  The carne asada was a hit or miss depending on the piece I got.  I had initially picked out a piece and that was dry but when eating it with the burrito, it tastes pretty tender and fresh.  I like that even though the pieces are big, they rip apart easily.  

Unfortunately, by super-ing it, you get grilled veggies (bell peppers?) in it and it doesn't really go.  Also, the flavor in the burrito was weak so the salsa is quite necessary.  Now the hype about the salsa is interesting because it is good and it is really spicy but the texture is weird.  It's very blended and not quite smooth but not quite chunky... a strange in between.

Salsa comes from two places:
1. Made in this restaurant - $5.99 
2. Made somewhere else but still the Papalote recipe - $6.99

I've had both and I would say #2 wins the initial taste test.  #1 still isn't bad though.

Similar to traditional Mexican restaurants, you can help yourself to pickled jalapenos but they have WHOLE pickled jalapenos here.  Total highlight for me.  I can see how this place can be frustrating if you're trying to dine in and it's packed.  There isn't much room to stand in line to order and there isn't much room to sit. All the tables are also close together but it's a clean joint at least.

The best part is that they give each person their own little basket of chips and cup of salsa!

excerpts: As if that weren't enough, three of the four shrimp were at the bottom of the burrito, leaving me to navigate through five shrimpless bites of burrito nothingness.
shrimp.author: Brian W.
shrimp.review:
This used to be my favorite Mexican place in the city. It is now my least favorite. My prawn burrito had 4 prawns. Not enormous lobster like jumbo prawns. Just medium to regular sized prawns. As if that weren't enough, three of the four shrimp were at the bottom of the burrito, leaving me to navigate through five shrimpless bites of burrito nothingness.

After this experience I feel like this guy was talking about Papalote: https://medium.com/comedy-corner/fd08c0babb57

I want my money back.

excerpts: I always get the shrimp super burrito
and I have no idea why since I'm usually not a fan of them, but this place just makes one DAMN GOOD shrimp Burrito.
shrimp.author: Michael F.
shrimp.review:
I've been to this establishment twice and I have not been disappointed by any means. The food is always fresh and cooked perfectly, the ambiance is that of a tex-mex style restaurant, but the food is clearly in spirit of traditional Mexican style.  I always get the shrimp super burrito and I have no idea why since I'm usually not a fan of them, but this place just makes one DAMN GOOD shrimp Burrito.

The only draw back is that the place is small and the seating is so closely packed together that you're practically eating on top of the people seated next to you!! 

Still though,  I would definitely recommend anyone in the Bay Area to try this place out!!!

excerpts: no flavor, the shrimp I think there were like 4 or 5 in it
but they pile them all on one side
so when you whatever side you start on
if you get the shrimp enjoy it you will probably get maybe 4-5 bites in then no more shrimp haha.
we also tried there shrimp quesidilla- super oily, dipping it in the orange sauce
shrimp.author: Clarence A.
shrimp.review:
I've read the reviews, I've tried there food, honestly I don't even know how this spot got such a high star rating, I give this place a bare 3 stars only reason I didn't give it 2 stars was there sauce they offered, that orange spicy sauce you sprinkle or dip on everything.

Ok here is what we tried:
Ultimate Burrito also know as the Triple Threat i was told- grade D+ there is no taste, they got 3 types of meats carne asada which was tender and juicy, shredded chicken decent size cut not dry but no flavor, the shrimp I think there were like 4 or 5 in it but they pile them all on one side so when you whatever side you start on if you get the shrimp enjoy it you will probably get maybe 4-5 bites in then no more shrimp haha.

we also tried there shrimp quesidilla- super oily, dipping it in the orange sauce gives it some flavor eating it alone you will need salt

The Chorizo Nacho Plate - this plate had to say is kinda what saved face for the restuarant for me but there was some dislikes, shady on the guac, sourcream, and even cheese camon now folks you get lets just say it is about maybe 3tsp of each sourcream & guac if you ask for more it is $1 more, condiments $1 more horrible but taste wise of the nachos with the chorizo and beans all good.

next time your out there just get the chorizo nachos don't spend $20+ for a burrito, there are plenty other mexican restuarants in the bay area you can go to and get 2 of the meats added for about $5-$8 same price but not 3meats.

Only reason I visited this place was due to Bobby Flay and his throwdown sad to say folks been to Bobby Flay's resturant in Vegas food there is blah literally bland and expensive, there are several other spots you can get a decent burrito in the city, this unfortunately is not one of them, if you do go stick with the chorizo nachos and try to get some of that togo orange sauce

ultimate burrito/ triple threat - FAIL ** at best only 2 stars
quesidilla ** super oily no taste drench it in the orange sauce then it makes it *** 1/2
chorizo nachos **** only thing i liked that i tried but it does have its flaws
service *** they are kinda fast
price $ moderate all around the board all $8 except for the triple threat/ultimate burrito $20+
ambiance *** small but clean, tiles on everything

excerpts: It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender.
The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned.
Errr, where was the garlic friend rice?
The rice used was the standard burrito rice.
The tortilla was the only thing that stood out.
It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky.
I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.
shrimp.author: Cherylynn N.
shrimp.review:
My sleep cycle is all messed up...I get more rest on the weekends sleeping for 3 hours than on the weeknights sleeping for 6 hours. Erm, must be the alkie? :X  

It's 1 AM on Thursday Morning and while I should be "attempting" to sleep, my eyes are glued to  an episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay". For 26 minutes, my mouth was salivating at the thought of meeting the "Triple Threat" one day; needless to say, it was another sleepless night. *sigh*

My friends and I came here yesterday at 12ish and luckily, we came at just the right time before it started getting busy.

FOOD:
*Chips & Salsa (#46 on the 7x7 list): The chips were slightly warm, thin, and crisp with just the right amount of salt. Ahhhhh, the salsa....the BEST freaking salsa EVER! The salsa was emulsified to perfect creamy consistency. As it hits your palette and moves around your mouth, you can taste all the fresh ingredients (the charred tomatoes, garlic, onion, chilies, and cilantro) sink into your taste buds. It had the perfect blend of savory, smokiness, acidity, and fiery kick to it! This is the ONLY thing that lives up to the HYPE!

*Triple Threat (super w/ sour cream & guac): HOLY MOLEY! $20 for a freaking burrito?!?!? The burrito was a regular size burrito that you would find from any taqueria. It was generously filled with rice, chicken, carne asada, and shrimp. The rice was al-dente and the chicken breast, carne asada, and shrimp were perfectly grilled, well-seasoned, and tender. The sour cream and guac are a must as it added a slight tartness and creaminess to balance out all the flavors.

*Ode to Poleng Adobe Burrito: FAIL! If you're expecting the garlicy, peppery soysauce vinegary taste that makes your lips pucker type of Adobo, you will be sadly disappointed. The chicken lacked all the components of what an adobo should be and was not well-seasoned. Errr, where was the garlic friend rice? The rice used was the standard burrito rice. The tortilla was the only thing that stood out. It was different from the typical tortilla used; it was crisp and flaky. All in all, the burrito lacked any real flavor and was quite dry b/c there was no sauce or salsa in it).

DRINKS:
Papalote has a selection of sodas, juices, and Mexican beer. I have to note that their refrigeration system was not working properly yesterday as our drinks were room temperature.

PRICES:
WAY OVERPRICED! A regular burrito is about $8 and an extra $1 to make it super (sour cream and guac). The size of their regular burritos are quite small (approx 7' and 2.5' in diameter) compared to other taquerias in The Mission.

Although the Triple Threat was good; it was NO where near a $20 good! To me, Mexican food is just like Chinese food; you shouldn't have to pay much to get good-tasting food. And, I really think the "hype" has allowed Papalote to capitalize on its customers by charging such ludicrous prices. 

SERVICE:
Order your food at the counter, grab a number, and the server will being you your order when it's ready. The chips and salsa came first and it took about 15 minutes to get our burritos.    

AMBIANCE: 
Very funky hipster type feel with the bright red walls with colorful panting and reggae music playing in the background. 

PARKING: 
Difficult street parking around Valencia and Mission streets. However, Guerrero street seemed to have some available non-metered spots. 

Would I return? I would only return for the chips and salsa. Other than that, Papalote is WAY OVERYHYPED and OVERPRICED. I say bottle the salsa and bring it with you to the other taquerias like Pancho Villa or El Toro where you can get a freshly grilled steak and shrimp burrito for 2/3 of the price.

excerpts: We ordered the shrimp and streak
super burrrito.
Delicious!
Its large.
Massive food coma afterwards no doubt.
Last note, the triple threat is not made for 1!
shrimp.author: Lauren H.
shrimp.review: First off, their sauce is aweeesome.. I was sweating. Free chips and salsa which is a plus in my book. I ordered the chicken salad with the cilantro sauce. Yummy! It is one of the hardiest salads I have ever eaten. You'll be full guaranteed. We ordered the shrimp and streak super burrrito. Delicious! Its large. Massive food coma afterwards no doubt. Last note, the triple threat is not made for 1!

excerpts: They'll charge you $7 for extra meat/shrimp in a burrito or taco-
why so $$?
shrimp.author: Alex J.
shrimp.review:
Eh... I think it's okay.  I fail to see the "wow factor" that so many other reviewers rave about.  I think there are a bunch of better burrito shops in the city- for example Little Chihuahua on Divisadero.  To me the salsa is bland and mushy.  Where is the texture?  It's just like... red glop.  

They get your order wrong quite a bit, seem ill-equipt to handle the crowds.  Also, sometimes harried and/or rude service.  

They'll charge you $7 for extra meat/shrimp in a burrito or taco- why so $$?  Might as well get a whole extra order in that case.  

If we didn't live almost right next door we would never go here.

excerpts: Dude, this thing is jam packed with carne asada, chicken AND shrimp!
Oh yeah, and this thing is drenched in Papalote's amazing salsa...
(I'm not really a salsa person, but I must say...
shrimp.author: Tim L.
shrimp.review:
Go here with a mindset prepared to wait a little bit.  It's a pretty popular place and can get kinda crowded.  I always get my food to go because it seems hella cramped in there.  Now for the food.....

All the food here is good, BUT..... if you have 20 bucks in your pocket and aren't afraid to waste it all on one burrito... you MUST get the "Triple Threat Burrito"!!  Really though.  Dude, this thing is jam packed with carne asada, chicken AND shrimp!  Oh yeah, and this thing is drenched in Papalote's amazing salsa... (I'm not really a salsa person, but I must say...Papalote has got some BOMB ASS salsa.)

Although it's an almost guaranteed heart attack, this monstrous burrito is an amazingly delicious explosion that creates an unmatched tastebud utopia with every bite!

...wash it down with a Mexican Coke and call it a day.

Your welcome, Tim.

excerpts: I took it to the counter (after unrolling on a search for shrimp) and told them there was nothing there.
My wife had found three inside her half.
They seemed like regular size shrimp to me.
shrimp.author: Aaron B.
shrimp.review:
Ok, this is sad to write but here goes. 

Part of me wants to give three stars but this is more of a 2.5. However, when you miss the basics, you get dinged. 

Papalote had great reviews so we went for a burrito. The space is clean and comfortable. I liked the creamy salsa but had issues with our burrito. 

We ordered a prawn burrito to share. Now, I know prawn burritos are always more expensive than say Carne asada but at $11.25 for a prawn super, it should be pretty darn good. 

Papalote got right what many places don't - flavor.  The ingredients and recipes were good. What didn't work for me was composition. They were nice and offered to cut the burrito in half because the cashier realized we were sharing. When the burrito came out it looked great. 

It was the right size, had been toasted after rolled (good call!) but something was missing. Prawns for me, rice for my wife. 

In my half of the burrito, there were no prawns. I took it to the counter (after unrolling on a search for shrimp) and told them there was nothing there. My wife had found three inside her half. I asked them how many prawns come on a prawn burrito and the said 4. Now, if these were true jumbo prawns (8-10 count/lbs), that would have made sense. They seemed like regular size shrimp to me.  Plus they were put in whole instead of being cut in half which would have helped the composition. 

My wife's half had primarily beans and prawns but no rice. 

A burrito is like a sandwich - very simple. But simple foods require precision to be REALLY good. It was sad that they skimped on the prawns and that the ingredients weren't balanced. They had a 4 star burrito in the making. The staff was genuinely apologetic however there was no recovery. I didn't make a big stink about it but I certainly left rather disappointed. I'd try them again but would probably go for tacos where composition isn't an issue. If you want a burrito, don't get prawns.

excerpts: They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork
shrimp.author: Tiffany N.
shrimp.review:
THE CHIPS & SALSA - BOMB.COM!
When I first had it, I wasn't used to the fact that it wasn't chunky salsa but thennnn I tried it and the flavor just blew me away! It's SO good - I can't even describe it aside from the fact that it is spicy. Bottled sauce is available for purchase.

My go-to when I want a burrito WITHOUT feeling heavy/disgusting after
IE.) the "I should go and work out after eating this but really, I'm gonna take my lazy ass to sleep"

Anyways, on to the burritos -
Not the hugest I've seen (hahaha) but it's filling and ingredients taste fresh. Burritos avg around $7-9.

Chicken Adobo burrito is muy deliciouso - love the garlic rice in it that really adds a good hint of flavor. the adobo chicken is not as vinegary as authentic adobo but you can still taste it. 
Filipino inspire - It's a must try when ambitious to step outside of a carna asada burrito (there's nothing wrong because I like carna asada too!)

They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork so you really do have A LOT to choose from. 

+Not your late night burrito joint - closes at 10pm!
+accepts credit card
+ small, colorful and clean eating area with cool local flyers for events around the Bay scattered everywhere

excerpts: I usually go for the super shrimp burrito with avocado instead of guac, and with the roasted salsa instead of pico de gallo.
Yeah, I'm that annoying dude in front of you with an order like that.
Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp or fish
burrito/quesadilla here.
I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it.
It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned.
It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal.
That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.
shrimp.author: Alex O.
shrimp.review:
CILANTRO HATERS: This one gets complicated since they have it in their salsa and guac. I usually go for the super shrimp burrito with avocado instead of guac, and with the roasted salsa instead of pico de gallo. Yeah, I'm that annoying dude in front of you with an order like that. But seriously, you need to try this, and this is your ticket to happiness.

Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp or fish burrito/quesadilla here. I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it. It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned. It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal. That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.

excerpts: The shrimp is stir fried with garlic and is great.
shrimp.author: Jonathan L.
shrimp.review:
My friend was watching the Throwdown Challenge on the Food Network and saw the Triple Threat being put on the spotlight. To make a long story short, I'm sitting there, watching two of my buddies take on the Triple Threat. Not wanting to shell out $20+ for a burrito, I'm munching on a normal carne asada burrito.

I was really happy with how the carne asada came out. The meat is so tender and juicy and the steak marinade is fantastic. I wish it wasn't $9 but the quality speaks for itself. 

From my friends' comments, I'd say that the chicken in the Triple Threat is not so great. A bit too dry and when compared to the steak, very plain. The shrimp is stir fried with garlic and is great. 

Great burritos but too pricey. I don't recommend the Triple Threat unless you're doing it for the sake of doing it. The normal burritos are sufficient.

excerpts: We also had shrimp tacos...
those were good but not as good as the burrito.
The ingredients seem really fresh, so the only real criticism I can give is that the restaurant is a little small and it gets crowded around lunch.
shrimp.author: Lily C.
shrimp.review: Awesome carne asada - really tender, moist, and flavorful. We also had shrimp tacos... those were good but not as good as the burrito. The ingredients seem really fresh, so the only real criticism I can give is that the restaurant is a little small and it gets crowded around lunch.

excerpts: my bf wanted to eat there, got home (dumb me) and for my shrimp super burrito there was no shrimp, no cheese, no guacamole, and no sour cream.
shrimp.author: Ali G.
shrimp.review:
Been here a couple of times and
Problems:
1. First visit screwed up my order
2. Next visit screwed up my order
3. Tonight I had to get takeout bc my bf wanted to eat there, got home (dumb me) and for my shrimp super burrito there was no shrimp, no cheese, no guacamole, and no sour cream. 13 bucks for rice and beans?! FAIL

Done

excerpts: But when your server comes over and asks you if you want Guacamole and ceviche with your chips but doesn't tell you the PRICE, I wasn't expecting $17 dollars for some avocados and shrimp!!
Outrageous!
shrimp.author: Jocelyn J.
shrimp.review:
OMG! 71$ for lunch! are you kidding me!

Now, when you have a glass of wine with your food I understand the elevated price. But when your server comes over and asks you if you want Guacamole and ceviche with your chips but doesn't tell you the PRICE, I wasn't expecting $17 dollars for some avocados and shrimp!! Outrageous! I wouldn't have minded if i was WARNED ahead of time!

The portions are fine but WAY expensive for what it is. $9 for carne asado tacos....really?!?!? You can dress up Mexican all you want, but it is still street food! And this wasn't even dressed to impress. Come on!!!

excerpts: Everything is super yummy here... their shrimp quesadillas are the best in the city.
shrimp.author: Liliana C.
shrimp.review:
Amazing food!!! I used to work her for a couple of years and years later I'm still a fan and a regular. 

Everything is super yummy here... their shrimp quesadillas are the best in the city. 

But let's not leave the salsa behind, the salsa is amazing too!! 

Family owned... owners are great and so is the staff. 

Love my Papalote...

excerpts: For the really adventurous ones, you can opt for the chicken/beef/shrimp super burrito.
That shit cray!
shrimp.author: Dennis L.
shrimp.review:
The closest thing to La Victoria's orange sauce! Although I think they call it a chipotle salsa, every time I take a bite, it still reminds me of the orange goodness from SJ.

Parking at both locations can be rather difficult but the proximity of bars makes this location my favorite of the two. Seating can be limited, but customer turnover is fast so you can usually count on having a seat by the time you've ordered and your food is ready. The tables are stacked next to each other so different combinations of group sizes feel like a game of Diner Dash. Occasionally, other diners may overhear or eavesdrop your conversation and chime in. 

Usually, I go with the Pollo Asado Super Burrito. Although a little bland on its own, but the salsa definitely kicks it up a notch. Combine that with Reed's ginger ale and that's a wonderful meal. For the really adventurous ones, you can opt for the chicken/beef/shrimp super burrito. That shit cray!

excerpts: but still might get it some day (shrimp, carne asada, chicken, in a giant burrito).
shrimp.author: Truman S.
shrimp.review:
OK. so the only thing you have to know about papalote is...the SALSA! man o man, this salsa is quite possibly the best creation to be married with a burrito...chips...quesadilla..wait, actually i could eat this salsa on anything. rice..pizza..hot dog. yea, its that good. 

After seeing this place on throw down with bobby flay, i've always wanted to hit this place up. unfortunately, the TRIPLE THREAT burrito is TWENTY bucks? yea insane...but still might get it some day (shrimp, carne asada, chicken, in a giant burrito). 

I ended up getting a regular pollo asada burrito in a spinach tortilla, made it super (guac, sour cream). After waiting for about 10 minutes, the burrito had arrived! The burrito was well sized...and piping hot. Bite after bite, i enjoyed the burrito until it was no more. I found the flavors to be great, ingredients fresh, and with the AMAZING salsa - it was almost the perfect burrito. I would have liked the avocados to be sliced freshly (taqueria cancun!), and perhaps a something else to mix up the burrito texturally (fresh salsa..onions?). 

Overall, i thoroughly enjoyed the burrito - the price was fair at about $9 (not cheap but great quality). Lastly, I would consider buying the salsa by the jar, which they sell at the shop also. I can see why bobby flay lost his throw down to the Papalote bros!

excerpts: Grilled fish, shrimp and chicken were our choice
and we were delighted with the results.
shrimp.author: Lynn S.
shrimp.review:
This storefront could be mistaken for a dive...delightfully, it is anything but.  Wonderful burritos, tacos and quesadillas with fresh, fresh, fresh ingredients are here in a simple store front with limited seating in the middle of a neighborhood where only authentic Mexican food can survive.  Grilled fish, shrimp and chicken were our choice and we were delighted with the results. I was sorry the salsa wasn't filled with tomato pieces instead of  simply a thick sauce, but nonetheless it was spicy and tasty.

This is another example of what the Mission does best, present ethnic cuisine without frills or fuss at a reasonable price.

Order at the front counter and they will bring your food  to the table when it is ready. (Try not to notice that no one wiped down the table after the last customer....he didn't leave any crumbs anyway). Think of  a visit here as a cultural immersion experience and take note of the colorful photographs on the cheerful, red walls.

excerpts: I ordered the Triple Threat which is a burrito filled with grilled shrimp, chicken, steak and also loaded with sour cream, guacamole, rice and black beans, absolutely FANTASTIC!
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy.
I can't wait to go back :)
shrimp.author: Shawn S.
shrimp.review:
The salsa at this restaurant is DYNAMITE! I could out it on just about anything . I ordered the Triple Threat which is a burrito filled with grilled shrimp, chicken, steak and also loaded with sour cream, guacamole, rice and black beans, absolutely FANTASTIC!
The chicken, steak and shrimp were seasoned just right, full of flavor and juicy. 
 I can't wait to go back :)

excerpts: and I saw unmelted shredded cheese on a shrimp burrito - questionable.
shrimp.author: Kiristen R.
shrimp.review:
The hype monster lives.

Hubs and I first heard about this place on the Bobby Flay showdown show. Hubs thinks that Bobby Flay is the biggest douche-bag that ever walked the earth so he definitely wanted to try the Triple Threat burrito since it beat Bobby Flay's green burrito.

After tasting for myself Papalote's famed Triple Threat burrito, I seriously doubt either:

Bobby Flay's cred as an Iron Chef 

or 

the crediblity of the judges

because that burrito was hella average.

The meats were nicely grilled but as a total burrito, it was average

AND

at $20, I expect to pay for quality, not quantity. The burrito is huge but if I wanted a large amount of average tasting burrito, I'd order 2 regular sized burritos.

The salsa is really good. The burrito is not worth a 2nd visit.

Oh and I saw unmelted shredded cheese on a shrimp burrito - questionable.

What the hell Bobby Flay?

excerpts: I had their burrito with the asada,chicken, shrimp, and chile sauce.
It was not worth the $20.
The Chile sauce is good

but i think they took
a page from La victoria in San Jose.
I would take La victoria Chile Sauce over Papalotes any day.
shrimp.author: Mario M.
shrimp.review:
I had their burrito with the asada,chicken, shrimp, and chile sauce. It was not worth the $20. The Chile sauce is good but i think they took
a page from La victoria in San Jose. I would take La victoria Chile Sauce over Papalotes any day.

excerpts: I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.
I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.
Everyone who works there is really nice!
shrimp.author: Rachel A.
shrimp.review: I like Papalote a lot because of its convenience, but it is on the expensive side.  I get the "naked burrito", and have had chicken, carne asada, and prawn.  The carne asada was the best, with lots of steak and a generous portion of guacamole (but they charge quite a bit to add it).  Their signature salsa is fantastic, spicy, and unique.  I was disappointed that the prawn only had 4 pieces of shrimp, but it was delicious.  I'm somewhere between 3 and 4 stars on this one, but I'm giving them an extra for good service.  Everyone who works there is really nice!

excerpts: K had the shrimp burrito.
K was happy with her shrimp burrito and said it was flavorful, she didn't mind the rice as much as I did.
shrimp.author: Brian C.
shrimp.review:
Papalote in the heart of the Mission on 24th near the Bart station is a small place.  They do a pretty big takeout business because of their small dine in space and their dedicated register for those takeout customers.  Menu is pretty straightforward, either burrito, taco, quesadilla, all with a healthy choice of different meats, tortillas and sides.

I had the Carne asada that was voted and rated highly on 7 x 7 list of best Carne asada burritos in the city.  K had the shrimp burrito.  When we sat down, they brought us chips and salsa.  The salsa is this creamy roasted tomato salsa with a kick.  It was very different than I've tasted and was def a fan.  The burrito was a large size, mine was the "super" with guacamole, sour cream and cheese.  The Carne asada was actually very good, tender and tasty but the mush that they called rice ruined the burrito for me.  It just became this mix of poor textures. K was happy with her shrimp burrito and said it was flavorful, she didn't mind the rice as much as I did.

If I could take the Carne asada from papalote and put it into a el farolito burrito, I would be in heaven.  Since I can't, I'll have to settle for the dry meat at el farrolito because I definitely can't deal with the mushy rice at papalote

excerpts: Go here if you like paying $10 for 2 shrimp tacos that had 2 shrimp in each taco...
Rip off!!!!!
My $10 salad was tasty but not worth $10.
Somewhere down the line the owners got high on their briches, they are  getting away with over charging unknowing gringos and hipsters that do not know any better!
A whole lotta moola is being wasted for food you can get down the street for less.
I am an S.F. native born and raised in the Mission district.
(I am also 100% El Salvadorean)
Go to Pancho Villa on 16th or La Coroneta on Mission St instead!
The portions and salsas are bigger and better!!!!!
shrimp.author: ada l.
shrimp.review: Don't waste your time and $ on an over hyped and super over priced taqueria.  Go here if you like paying $10 for 2 shrimp tacos that had 2 shrimp in each taco...Rip off!!!!!  My $10 salad was tasty but not worth $10.  Somewhere down the line the owners got high on their briches, they are  getting away with over charging unknowing gringos and hipsters that do not know any better! A whole lotta moola is being wasted for food you can get down the street for less.  I am an S.F. native born and raised in the Mission district. (I am also 100% El Salvadorean)  Go to Pancho Villa on 16th or La Coroneta on Mission St instead!  The portions and salsas are bigger and better!!!!!

excerpts: I don't think they sell very many of them, because the shrimp actually had no flavor.
Yes - it was large - but size isn't everything in this case.
shrimp.author: Joe S.
shrimp.review:
Ok - so I gave Papalote one more chance.  This time, I tried the Triple threat burrito, while my friend ordered the machaca.

I had recalled on Food Network that the brothers who own Papalote entered their Triple Threat burrito into some competition and it won, so I figured - if I am going to give them one more shot, I might as well give them their best chance.

For $20, the burrito was ok.  It kind of laid there and acted bored.  For $20 for a burrito, I want a little more action - I just need a little more lovin' for that price ... for a burrito.

I don't think they sell very many of them, because the shrimp actually had no flavor.  Yes - it was large - but size isn't everything in this case.
Interestingly, my friend's machaca wasn't actually machaca at all, but chopped up carne asada.

His theory (he's Mexican) is that Papalote is for people who don't know what Mexican food is.  Frankly, I see the line outside the restaurant every day, and I am still perplexed why these folks don't go down one street to Taqueria or a place where you can get much better Mexican food a lot cheaper.

excerpts: I unwrapped the foil, on which someone had written "shrimp," and took a nice big bite of CHICKEN!
I HATE chicken.
(I have a video of this burrito, and wonder if I can upload it here.)
I told the manager, Cecilia, about it, and she was NOT gracious about it at all.
shrimp.author: Amy D.
shrimp.review:
I don't get the high reviews.  Are they getting YOUR orders right?  

Love the idea of fresh avocado on your burrito?  Me too, and Papalote will certainly charge me for it, which is a good sign that they heard me, but so rarely actually put it in my burrito.  Are you a pescaterian who likes the idea of vegan refried beans?  I unwrapped the foil, on which someone had written "shrimp," and took a nice big bite of CHICKEN!  I HATE chicken.  (I have a video of this burrito, and wonder if I can upload it here.)  I told the manager, Cecilia, about it, and she was NOT gracious about it at all.  She had the cashier take my order again, which came out on a white instead of wheat tortilla.  

These people obviously don't need my business, or yours, not that I am telling you what to do.  But have you heard of Taqueria San Jose?  Those people are nice, their food is fabulous, and while they don't have wheat tortillas, at least they won't promise you one.  

Had their $8.50 nachos.  They were SO stingy with the beans.  It was a plate of burnt chips with no salsa even though we requested hot.  

I'm done here.

excerpts: Same size - 1/3 portion of beef, chicken and shrimp....
Once seated, we just paid $30 for a plate of fish tacos and a beef/chicken burrito, with a beer and a diet coke.
Examining the receipt, it became clear that we had been charged for fish tacos, a beef burrito AND a chicken burrito.
Took a bite of the chicken/beef burrito - and the only noteworthy thing was the chicken was well marinaded/seasoned.
The rest?
Unimpressive.
shrimp.author: Grace K.
shrimp.review:
Give me a break!

On a perfectly nice Sunday - we were chilling out at Revolution Cafe w/ some beers indulging in nice conversation, a great live band, and "people-watching" the most interesting, odd folks who thought it normal to shush people at a cafe.  The three of us all being foodies - talk of food was inevitable as dinner time approached us.

JB mentioned a burrito place that had recently been featured on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay".  Now, I like Bobby as a person more than a chef, and I do enjoy this show from time to time but I had missed this episode.  But my interest was piqued in learning that Bobby had lost to the "triple threat burrito" at Papalote, so we started walking to check the place out for dinner.

Well, as we expected, there was a massive line of people wanting to try the place that had beaten the Iron Chef.  As it turned out, there were more people waiting for their placed order than wanting to order, so we were able to squeeze right through to the counter.

All three of us wanted the Triple Threat.  
All three of us gawked at the price: $20.

TWENTY DOLLARS?
The first natural question was: how big is it?
Answer:  same size as the other burritos... that average out at about $7.50 in cost.

*(looking around the room to make sure I'm on earth)*

ON WHAT PLANET DOES THAT MAKE SENSE?????????

Same size - 1/3 portion of beef, chicken and shrimp....
Almost 3X in cost.

FOR WHAT?

Forget that!  Do I have "IDIOT" written on my forehead?

We scored seating in the restaurant within 10 minutes, and that was good since our wait for the regular burritos would be over 30 minutes.

Once seated, we just paid $30 for a plate of fish tacos and a beef/chicken burrito, with a beer and a diet coke.  Examining the receipt, it became clear that we had been charged for fish tacos, a beef burrito AND a chicken burrito.

(Annoying.)

The chips were decent, and their "special secret sauce" (salsa) was pretty good in concept but overly salted, and not quite what *I* want from "salsa".  Nonetheless, it was tasty.

The burritos arrive.
Regular size.
I was SO not a fan of the Monterey Jack cheese - in cold state, not melted - that they sprinkle on everything.  Yuck.  Took a bite of the chicken/beef burrito - and the only noteworthy thing was the chicken was well marinaded/seasoned.  The rest?  Unimpressive.  Overall, for the burrito, I'd have given it three stars.

I tried the fish taco - and the fish was fresh and not deep-fried, the lettuce was crisp - but the cheese, as much as I tried to take it all off, ruined it for me.  If I had asked for no cheese - I would have given it three stars too.

There's a MUCH better burrito to be had at El Metate for a fraction of the cost and even better ambiance with better drinks and service, too.  ($5 for a burrito there - try it!)

The experience of eating at Papalote, due to the hype, was worth it.  The company made the whole night fun.  Perhaps, if we had been insane enough to splurge $20 to eat a burrito - my assessment would be higher.  But for a $20 burrito, I expect it to give me wings, and based on other reviews - nobody sprouted wings and took off.  It's unfortunate for the owners as they'd be making a WHOLE lot more money off the recent coverage if they charged $10 for the Triple Threat instead of attempting to price gouge their customers for $20.  Whatever number of Triple Threats they are selling right now for $20, they could sell 10X that amount had they charged $10.  Do the math.

Coincidentally - upon arriving home later in the evening, the very episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay" came on TV and I watched it with the remnants of Papalote's burrito and fish taco in my stomach.

Bobby was as cute as ever, and based on ingredients alone, I'd have preferred his "green burrito".  That said, the two brothers were funny and seemed like nice guys.

They just happen to be out of their freakin' minds.

$20 for a BURRITO?
That's just insulting.

excerpts: my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and
boy do
i feel cheated!
i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that.
the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and
rubbery
but i did like that it tasted grilled.
i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito.
and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy.
shrimp.author: L M.
shrimp.review:
i couldnt bring myself to give more than 2 stars. HOW DID THIS PLACE EVER BEAT BOBBY FLAY? like many others, i was interested in trying this place out when i found out that this place beat bobby flay's throwdown. 

my boyfriend and i shared the triple threat burrito which has steak, chicken, and shrimp for $19.95 and boy do i feel cheated! i've had much better burritos elsewhere for less than half of that. the shrimp was overcooked so it was a little tough and rubbery but i did like that it tasted grilled. i didnt have any chicken in my half of the burrito. and the steak had me feeling a bit greasy. i appreciate good carne asada in a burrito but the beef was a bit chewy and too greasy for my taste. (boyfriend agrees with all this by the way)

however, i do like that the chips and salsa came free with the burrito. and i appreciate the cashier for telling me they come with the burrito so i didnt have to pay for an extra one. the salsa was delicious too. if it wasnt for the chips and salsa, i dont think i would even give 2 stars.

excerpts: jam packed w/ flavorful shrimp, chicken, and steak.
It was really good, but I have to question it costing $20!!??
For that price, it should have been GYYY-normous, but wasn't.
(3) I give it up to them for having a mix-breed type of BURRITO: half Filipino/half Mexican.
Was it good?
Sure it was, but I wonder why it appeared "off-menu".
shrimp.author: Joy A.
shrimp.review:
THREE reasons why I walked into Papalote:
(1) The SF 7x7 listed their "chips and salsa" as a place to try before you die. Hmmmmm!!???!
(2) According to the Food Network, their "Triple Threat" burrito beat out Bobby Flay's burrito.  Bobby Flay??? Quite impressive!!!  
(3) They serve "Chicken Adobo" burritos. Huh, really???!!!!

How do they measure up???
(1) Chips and salsa- BIG THUMBS UP!!!  I really liked it. I couldn't stop munchin' on them.  The salsa was fresh & chunky, and the orange color reminded me of La Vic's delicious salsa. (Try La Vic's orange sauce; buy the bottle even!)
(2) The "Triple Threat" burrito was jam packed w/ flavorful shrimp, chicken, and steak. It was really good, but I have to question it costing $20!!??  For that price, it should have been GYYY-normous, but wasn't.  
(3) I give it up to them for having a mix-breed type of BURRITO: half Filipino/half Mexican. Was it good? Sure it was, but I wonder why it appeared "off-menu". (I'm glad my girlfriend told me about it.)

TIP for those doing the 7x7 list: Anthony's cookies & Mitchell's Ice Cream are a hop, skip, jump away. =)

excerpts: The 'mexapino' and steak and shrimp!
Both are equally amazing to the point that my roommate and I like to get both and split them because deciding on one is too difficult.
Aside from that, I'm stuck on their sauce which you can purchase by the jar if you love it as much as I do.
Really if you've never been here you need to...
5 stars is not an exaggeration.
shrimp.author: Michelle D.
shrimp.review: I LOVE papalote burritos! Have to admit, for the many visits I've had to Papalote's I can't seem to get past the 2 most delicious burritos I have had in my lifetime. The 'mexapino' and steak and shrimp! Both are equally amazing to the point that my roommate and I like to get both and split them because deciding on one is too difficult. Aside from that, I'm stuck on their sauce which you can purchase by the jar if you love it as much as I do. Really if you've never been here you need to... 5 stars is not an exaggeration.

excerpts: Shrimp, chicken and carne asada in a single burrito that's no bigger than a regular burrito.
shrimp.author: Rick C.
shrimp.review:
Ever eat a $20 burrito? That's what the the Triple Threat burrito will cost you. Shrimp, chicken and carne asada in a single burrito that's no bigger than a regular burrito. I normally get the Chile Verde burrito which is excellent ($7.50) until I saw an episode of Throwdown with Bobby Flay. Now I've been eating here for awhile and was never aware of the Triple Threat until the episode with Flay. Told myself that I was gonna try it next time around instead of my usual Chile Verde. Looked at the online menu and there was no Triple Threat. Had the little lady call in an order for us. One TT and one Chile Verde. 25 mins later, I show up to pick up my order and the nice young lady at the counter tells me the total is $32. I looked up at the menu board and there's a small plastic sign taped to it that reads Triple Threat Burrito $19.99. WTF? 

It was a Wednesday night and the place was unusually packed...alot more than usual. All of the staff members were wearing Throwndown shirts and they looked really overwhelmed by the crowds of people coming in and the telephone ringing off the hook. Even after calling the order in 25 minutes ago, I still had to wait another 15 minutes to get my food. 

The TT was good and the different meats in it had a nice balance that worked together. Maybe $10-$12 would have been a reasonable price. But $20...gonna stay with the Chile Verde. 

My beloved Papalote is now a rerun on the Food Network. Great for the owners (well deserved) but sucks for the regulars who now have to deal with the crazy crowds (not that it wasn't crowded before). At least, I can tell people I had a $20 burrito...once.

excerpts: I'm an uber carnivore, so I thought the steak would be my favorite, but the shrimp was major yummers!
shrimp.author: Roselina R.
shrimp.review:
Had to come here after seeing the restaurant on Throw Down w/ Bobby Flay!

It was crowded, and the wait was a little long, but the food was fab.  Purchased the Triple Threat Burrito and it was good.  I'm an uber carnivore, so I thought the steak would be my favorite, but the shrimp was major yummers!

Love it!

excerpts: The veggie burrito I ordered was almost identical to the shrimp
burrito my friend got.
She really didn't get many shrimp for the price.
shrimp.author: Leeann M.
shrimp.review:
Average. I know that they beat Bobby Flay in a throwdown but I am really not sure how. The veggie burrito I ordered was almost identical to the shrimp burrito my friend got. She really didn't get many shrimp for the price.

Maybe it was an off day. I will say the play was packed so maybe what they ordered was better.

excerpts: It was filled with a good amount of chicken, steak, and shrimp, so I definitely feel like they didn't cheat us out of the good stuff.
Miguel also came by to say hi and dropped off a plate of the adobo burrito filling, which is more down my ally!
OMG, it was so tender and delicious.
I will definitely get the chicken adobo burrito next time.

I liked the triple threat, but I don't wanna fight big pieces to eat my way through the burrito, which makes the adobo one perfect because the chicken is so tender that you don't need a fork and knife to eat it!
shrimp.author: Diana Lyn Z.
shrimp.review:
Been wanting to try their triple threat for quite some time now and was able to do so the other night on a spur of the moment decision for dinner.

The boyfriend and I were driving down Potrero and I said, "Hey! Let's try Papalote tonight!" Of course, he agreed.

We got there thinking we'd just grab our burrito to go and cut out, but we were invited to sit and eat inside the restaurant since there were a couple open tables.

We ordered the triple threat burrito and horchata. I was a little taken aback by the price! But, alas, that's what you get for paying for a good burrito. My boyfriend even commended them. He used to work at SF General and tried a bunch of places in The Mission, but said Papalote was the best.

We got our burrito pretty quickly and we split it. Oh! I forgot to mention! The salsa that came with the chips was good! Albeit, spicy for my liking, but still good! Anyway, back to the burrito. It was filled with a good amount of chicken, steak, and shrimp, so I definitely feel like they didn't cheat us out of the good stuff. Miguel also came by to say hi and dropped off a plate of the adobo burrito filling, which is more down my ally! OMG, it was so tender and delicious. Better than most Filipino adobo I have tried!!!

I will definitely get the chicken adobo burrito next time. I liked the triple threat, but I don't wanna fight big pieces to eat my way through the burrito, which makes the adobo one perfect because the chicken is so tender that you don't need a fork and knife to eat it!

Mmm...just thinking about it makes me wanna go back and have one RIGHT NOW!

excerpts: The shrimp were nicely spiced and well cooked.
shrimp.author: Adam G.
shrimp.review:
The sibbies were in town and had seen the episode of Throwdown, of course.  I'd been curious to try out the famous burrito also, but knew I wasn't going to spend the $ on it on my own.  Cue Papalote for dinner tonight.  

First off, the place is tiny.  Not in a bad way, but just in the way that you need to know before going there assuming you can just sit down.  Even fewer seats than El Farolito around the corner.  

Foodwise, first we got the chips and salsa.  Off to a great start.  Good chips, tasty and complex salsa.  Nice and spicy, too, but maybe a touch too much for the average person.  Also not impressed they charge for another bowl of corn chips.  Boo for that one.

Next up: the Triple Threat.  Of course that's what we had to try.  It arrives taking up more of a plate than is reasonable for a burrito.  But that's what it should do for $20.  And yes, it did take ~15 minutes to arrive, but that's ok in my book, since it was clear everything was freshly cooked.  Again, not your average burrito.  We had to taste each element independently, and each was fantastic on its own.  The shrimp were nicely spiced and well cooked.  The chicken was not too salty (a frequent problem I've noticed with seasoned chicken), and the steak was simple but awesome.  Guacamole was also very good, as were the refried beans.

So on the whole, we enjoyed the food, were astounded at the size of the portion, and would likely come back again.  We would likely not be getting the Triple Threat, though...especially not for $20.  Carne Asada burritos, on the other hand....

excerpts: I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.
shrimp.author: Amy N.
shrimp.review:
I ordered the Adobo burrito (off menu). It's mildly-spiced chicken, rice, and tomatoes (no beans). I was expecting something more vinegar-y, more reminiscent of Filipino food, but it was just OK. I wanted the flavor to be more pronounced.

The mole burrito was pretty tasty, but somehow I thought it would taste stronger. It wasn't bland, just milder than I expected.

The salsa was excellent, though.

I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.

One day I'll return to try their fish burrito. Sauteed in white wine and butter? In a burrito? I am skeptical as to the taste (white wine flavor in a burrito?) but intrigued.

excerpts: My friend ordered the fajitas with shrimp and though she said it was tasty, they only gave her three shrimps and it was the most expensive fajita option.
shrimp.author: Casf K.
shrimp.review:
My friend and I stopped by here for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon after perusing the vintage shops in the mission. I ordered the beef fajitas and they were very tasty. It was a huge portion, so huge that I took it to go and ate it for lunch the next day. My friend ordered the fajitas with shrimp and though she said it was tasty, they only gave her three shrimps and it was the most expensive fajita option. 

The place is small so at any given time, there could be a long wait. And I must comment on the bathroom-it was DISGUSTING. In fact, that is why I only gave this place three stars. 

All in all, I if I lived close by this would be a great place to order take out from ...but I don't so that's not an option for me. If I was in the neighborhood, I'd maybe eat here again. But I wouldn't step foot in that bathroom.

excerpts: It's not often that you get shrimp, chicken, and carne asada all on one burrito.
The orange sauce was excellent as well.
shrimp.author: John C.
shrimp.review:
I wanted to try this place badly after seeing it on Throwdown with Bobby Flay. The burrito featured on the show was the Triple Threat. The night that the episode originally aired, we tried to place a phone order to pick it up. After ordering 2 of these burritos with a couple minor add-ons, the lady said "it'll be ready in 45 minutes and it'll be $45." What?!?! Seriously? We thought she heard our order wrong, like we ordered 5-10 burritos. But no, she was serious; that was the price for 2. We were so shocked that we ended up cancelling the order.

After doing some research on Yelp, we found out that as soon as the show aired, they jacked the price up by $5. Pretty messed up, but apparently there was high enough demand.

A few months later, we finally decided to give it a try. My girlfriend and I split one of the Triple Threat burritos. I must say, it was pretty good. It's not often that you get shrimp, chicken, and carne asada all on one burrito. The orange sauce was excellent as well. Lots of flavor, and we also had some with our chips.

But in the end, I cannot justify paying $20+ for a burrito, especially in the Mission, where there is seemingly a taqueria every other store. I'm glad that you guys got the publicity that Bobby Flay gave you, but how do you plan to have repeat customers? Sure, people will try it once out of curiosity, but I don't imagine many returning for the same $20 burrito.

excerpts: You better get a whole pound of shrimp in there for that price.
shrimp.author: Amanda D.
shrimp.review:
The ingredients are fresh, and the options come by the dozen. Meat options are plentiful and unique. The menu has so many different options for any vegan, vegetarian, or good 'ole meat eater like myself. I personally loved the whole wheat tortilla option for no extra charge. It was the first time I had heard of a Chicken Mole option for a burrito - and it did not disappoint! 

However, the best part of the meal cannot be overlooked. The chips and salsa, which is served by the bowl to each person, is unmissable. Easily one of the best salsas I've had. It's smokey, garlicy and has enough kick to leave a little warmth in the back of the throat. So good.

The only downside I saw was the Triple Threat's price. Why, El Papalote, do you have a $20 burrito on your menu if it is roughly the same size as your other normal priced ones? I get that is filled with good meat, but damn! You better get a whole pound of shrimp in there for that price. 

I'd def. come back to El Papalote! Especially after beating Bobby Flay.

excerpts: My wife had the shrimp burrito which was also very good, although the shrimp was a little overcooked and over-blackened.
shrimp.author: frederick a.
shrimp.review:
After seeing the Bobby Flay Throwdown episode where he challenged these guys and lost, we went out of our way (on a road trip from Seattle to LA) to check this place out.  Boy am I glad we did!! 

I wanted to try the Triple Threat, but we had other places to try just down the street so I went with the Carne Asada burrito.  It was perfect, not too big, not too small...just right.  The meat was perfectly cooked and flavored, not loaded with gristle like so many carne asada burrito's can be.  My wife had the shrimp burrito which was also very good, although the shrimp was a little overcooked and over-blackened.

Where they really shine though is their salsa.  It's amazingly good.  Not super hot, just spicy enough.  We brought a jar home with us and it's getting dangerously close to empty.  Will they ship to Seattle?

Definetly will go again on our next Cali trip.

excerpts: Everything I've had here is DELICIOUS, from the chilaquiles to the breakfast omelet burrito, to the shrimp tacos, etc!
shrimp.author: Michele Z.
shrimp.review:
Everything I've had here is DELICIOUS, from the chilaquiles to the breakfast omelet burrito, to the shrimp tacos, etc!  And every once in a while they'll throw in a special/seasonal item, like the Adobo Burrito =) 

I also love that they're *green* about their yummy House Sauce (my fave salsa dip on the planet) ~ You can buy a refrigerated unlabeled one and bring it back for $1 off your next refill.  There are also labeled ones along the front of the cash register if you're a label whore like that  :) 

I usually walk here so can't complain about the parking.  But it's the Mission, so notorious for tricky parking.  Also have never had a problem with a long wait, except for once I had to stand in the doorjamb for a few minutes, no biggie.  Service is always fast and the tables are always cleaned pretty swiftly!

excerpts: Check out the pork n shrimp burrito.
I was grumpy as usual at 11am on a Sunday when I don't eat (sorry love).
My GF went out on a trek to find me some food...and what a find!
It took a little while, but the wait was all worth it.
I eat lots and lots and lotsa Mexican food - sometimes my GF hates me for it ; ) hahaha - but this place seemed to stand out.
shrimp.author: Derik P.
shrimp.review:
Check out the pork n shrimp burrito.  I was grumpy as usual at 11am on a Sunday when I don't eat (sorry love).  My GF went out on a trek to find me some food...and what a find!  It took a little while, but the wait was all worth it.  I eat lots and lots and lotsa Mexican food - sometimes my GF hates me for it ; ) hahaha - but this place seemed to stand out.  The taste was less typical and definitely unique.

If my FAVORITE burrito place wasn't in the same city - I might have even gave this place a 5.  lets count this one as a 4.5  Check em out!

excerpts: The prices were way too expensive for burritos which consisted of mostly beans and rice, with very little carne asada or shrimp.
We are from Southern California where a carne asada burrito is less expensive, just as big, and has plenty of flavorful beef.
Plus, the beans and rice are side items, not the main component of the burrito.
So, we now know not to eat Mexican food in Northern California.
shrimp.author: Raquel A.
shrimp.review: My daughter and I really looked forward to eating at this restaurant after seeing it featured on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay".  It was a BIG disappointment.  The prices were way too expensive for burritos which consisted of mostly beans and rice, with very little carne asada or shrimp.  We are from Southern California where a carne asada burrito is less expensive, just as big, and has plenty of flavorful beef.  Plus, the beans and rice are side items, not the main component of the burrito.  So, we now know not to eat Mexican food in Northern California.

excerpts: I had a steak and shrimp burrito today.
shrimp.author: Mario W.
shrimp.review: This place does NOT have the best burritos in SF at all. I had a steak and shrimp burrito today. The rice was undercooked and hard....and the carne asada was not chopped very well. Big hunks of meat like a fajita. Meats should be chopped more finely....I wanted extra salsa for my chips and they charge u extra ? I actually have to pay the waiter at our table and do a seperate transaction for salsa ??? Doesn't that sound ridiculous to you ? I take my burritos very seriously...the burrito wasn't horrible, but not by any means the best in sf. I will not give into the hype.

excerpts: I asked the (very polite and attentive) waitress if perhaps they'd prepared her the shrimp burrito with the butter-wine sauce by mistake, but it turns out it was the right burrito, just not a very good one.
I don't expect it to be loaded up like a shrimp burrito, but I eat a lot of Mexican food
and I know what $11 should buy me.
I am not a diner with a sense of entitlement, I just don't want to feel ripped off.
4 tiny prawns just isn't gonna cut it in a huge burrito.
shrimp.author: Jay S.
shrimp.review:
An experience that has shaken my faith in the taste of my fellow San Franciscans. I just cannot understand the hype around this place. It wasn't bad, but I don't think I'd come back here- it's just not a good value.

I've tried Papalote's food before. I have vague memories of eating there before I lived in SF and I'd had their takeout at a friend's house before. I don't remember being blown away by it, but I don't remember hating it either. Then again, I'm from Socal, so Mexican food is one category in which SF tends to let me down.

Fast forward to last night. We get there and, though the wait was somewhat long, the staff was so friendly and attentive that it wasn't a bother at all. 

I ordered the soyrizo burrito (not particularly adventurous, but it's what I was in the mood for). It was just okay, not any better or worse than what I might make at home using store-bought soyrizo. I wasn't unhappy with my meal, but I wasn't impressed. I'd rate it 3 stars on its own. 

My girlfriend's burrito was a different story. She orded the lime-seasoned prawn burrito, but the seasoning was so bland that she actually thought they'd given her the wrong burrito! I asked the (very polite and attentive) waitress if perhaps they'd prepared her the shrimp burrito with the butter-wine sauce by mistake, but it turns out it was the right burrito, just not a very good one.*

The other problem, besides flavor, was the number of prawns. This was an $11 burrito that had 4 smallish prawns in it. I don't expect it to be loaded up like a shrimp burrito, but I eat a lot of Mexican food and I know what $11 should buy me. I am not a diner with a sense of entitlement, I just don't want to feel ripped off. 4 tiny prawns just isn't gonna cut it in a huge burrito. It was basically a beans, rice and cheese burrito w/ a cameo appearance by some prawns.

The biggest surprise though, was the salsa. Papalote is renowned for their salsa. So I found it surprising that a Mexican place famous for its salsa DOESN'T GIVE YOU ANY SALSA WITH YOUR FOOD.... YOU HAVE TO BUY IT. **

I am, as my obnoxious use of capital letters might indicate, dead serious: Salsa with your chips is free, but you have to pay to have salsa with your food. 

You get a small (maybe 2 oz) cup of salsa with your chips. The place is popular, so you wait with that basket of chips for quite a while before your food comes. When your food arrives, it does not come with salsa. As it turns out, if you want salsa with your food you have two choices:

(1) Eat your chips without salsa, so you can save the salsa for your food. C'mon son. This might not be objectively unreasonable, but it's unreasonable in light of custom: what Mexican restaurant expects you to eat chips without salsa?

(2) Purchase more salsa to go with your food, at the rate of $0.50 per small cup.

Admittedly, $0.50 is not a big deal, but the idea that the only way to enjoy salsa with your food at this Mexican restaurant is to either pay extra or eat your chips without salsa just reeks of, dare I say it, arrogance. It's like they're so gassed up over people telling them how dope their salsa is that they think they're doing us a favor by letting us eat there. 

I get it. You're world-famous for your salsa. You sell the salsa separately in a jar. People would probably consume insane amounts of the salsa if you didn't regulate it somehow.... but is it going to kill you to give me one cup of salsa with my chips and one cup of salsa with my food? I mean, seriously, that just comes off as really, really cheap. I purchase a $30 fast-Mexican meal for two and have to pay extra to get the salsa? How is that cost not built into my $10 burrito?? 

This is the kind of disregard for customer perspective that causes once-great businesses to fail. Not saying I see Papalote failing anytime soon, but it was a *huge* turnoff for me and I probably won't eat there again because of that last straw. Two people can eat at Rubio's (which actually has very good food for fast-Mexican), spend $20 and enjoy several cups of their delicious salsas or free! The mind boggles.

Also, the salsa is tasty, but not something I would have thought to rave about if Papalote wasn't already well-hyped for its salsa. Despite really wanting to love my dining experience at Papalote, I walked away not understanding what the fuss is about. So disappointed.

______________

* I love my girlfriend, but I'm not the type to give a place a shitty review just because she had a bad experience (see my review of Sushi Raw if you have any doubts). That being said, her burrito was so skimpy on prawns that I was disappointed just *watching* her eat it. It was like watching someone pick the wrong door on a game show over and over again: bite after bite with not a prawn in sight.

** I KNOW!!

excerpts: 5 stars for grilled veggies in my shrimp burrito and the charbroiled taste of the carne asada
shrimp.author: Jennifer H.
shrimp.review:
5 stars for grilled veggies in my shrimp burrito and the charbroiled taste of the carne asada

-1 star for store bought chips

-1 star for powder made horchata

-1 star for unhappy, low energy staff who shrug their shoulders when you ask about your order 30 min. after you place it or reply 'i guess' when you ask for a cup of ice to go with your $3 soda

-1 for yelling 'HEY HEY HEY' when we stepped right outside the door with your plastic cup of ice b/c it was too darn hot to wait inside

+1 for the sauce you provide with the chips

2 stars, but I'll happily spend my $8 at a taqueria with the same quality of food, but less attitude.

excerpts: Shrimp?

Dig the combo man!
     - Only four prawns?
Put a little more than that, c'mon now!

Salsa
     +Spicy kick without overwhelming the rest of the mix
shrimp.author: Chuck N.
shrimp.review:
Wednesday, 8:45PM.

To enter Mission's Mexican food market, folks best be bringing their A-game or find some way to distinguish themselves from the competition. 

Papalote does both and is establishing a spicy niche in the area. 

Stuffed our faces in:
1. Soyrizo
     +Spicy, chunky soy pieces won over this omnivore
2. Mole, tofu taco
     +Cocoa pepper and chili concoction goes great with the hard shell
3. Triple threat
     +Chicken? Carne asada? Shrimp? Dig the combo man!
     - Only four prawns? Put a little more than that, c'mon now!
4. Salsa
     +Spicy kick without overwhelming the rest of the mix
     - Staff is stingy with this goodness

And then...?
The Triple Threat wasn't enough for my raging hunger, which is a testament to me being a PHATTTTY. Still paying a return visit though, I've got the seafood burritos and nachos to try!

excerpts: The super shrimp burritos are amazing.
Nice spot for dine in
but I usually phone ahead for my to go order, it's quick and easy.
Best Salsa ever!
Taking a  star off as my bf got sick last time
we got take away from there.
shrimp.author: Claire R.
shrimp.review:
This place is great, friendly staff and delicious food. The super shrimp burritos are amazing. Nice spot for dine in but I usually phone ahead for my to go order, it's quick and easy.
Best Salsa ever!
Taking a  star off as my bf got sick last time we got take away from there.

excerpts: Because of the shrimp and tilapia filling options and unique decor, Papalote rises just a step above chains like Willy's.
shrimp.author: Bobbin W.
shrimp.review:
I sifted through a bunch of hipster reviews during my SF research and noticed consistent high ratings for Papalote, adding it to my list of Mission Musts. After a rousing show at the Make-Out Room, my beau and I decided to grab a bite in the vicinity. And since it was dark, finding the San Buena Taco Truck was out of the question. So we booked it to Papalote and earned a spot as the last lucky party to score a table in the small dining area. A staff member brought us each our own handful of chips in two bowls, along with little containers of orange, creamy, spicy salsa--quite different from the tomato chunks I'm used to. 

I ordered a prawn burrito, making it a super for only 99 cents. I appreciated the tortilla choices (spinach, flour, whole wheat and Roma tomato), opting for the spinach, as well as the bean options (pinto, refried and black). I chose pinto, of course. 

I mean, the burrito was okay but not worth $10. The prawns, generously doled and flavorfully grilled, added a unique texture to the sour cream, guac and cheese. 

The atmosphere set Papalote apart. The artwork, a fuse between Picasso and Rivera, adorned the bright red walls. Flying frogs and dragons kept watch from the ceiling. The arched entryway between the ordering and dining area added architectural pizazz. Plus, the bathroom, covered in blue paint and graffiti, reminded me of a catwalk per its long, narrow shape and mirror in front of the commode above the sink. 

Because of the shrimp and tilapia filling options and unique decor, Papalote rises just a step above chains like Willy's.

excerpts: I was expecting the grilled prawn burrito to be like the shrimp burrito at Chronic Tacos, which is BOMB.
Alas, that burrito cannot be replicated.
shrimp.author: Tori Q.
shrimp.review: This place is busy but there's a high turnover rate.  When we ordered the food, we didn't have any seats but by the time we got it, we were seated promptly.  My friend and I both got the burritos, which are huge.  I got the grilled prawns with a spinach tortilla.  It  was good when I ate it but now that I'm thinking back on it, there was way too much rice and not enough prawns.  I was expecting a prawn in every bite but that big burrito was filled with other stuff. The insides were not evenly separated either because I ended up eating a ton of rice in the beginning and then all the wet ingredients at the tailend.  I was expecting the grilled prawn burrito to be like the shrimp burrito at Chronic Tacos, which is BOMB.  Alas, that burrito cannot be replicated.

excerpts: My girlfriend had a carne asada and grilled shrimp burrito which she devoured (all 100 pounds of her).
shrimp.author: erica c.
shrimp.review:
First off, let me just say that the "salsa," or whatever their creamy hot sauce is called, was AMAZING.  It was spicy, creamy and loaded with flavor.  I damn near ate my whole basket of chips to get to the last drop of that sauce.  :-)

Second, while I DO eat meat, I was a vegetarian for 10 years.  That inspired me to try the soyrizo burrito (with cheese and grilled mushrooms).  I have one word for you..  DAMN.  That was THE best non-meat burrito I've ever had and I love Pancho Villa's tofu.

My girlfriend had a carne asada and grilled shrimp burrito which she devoured (all 100 pounds of her).  Needless to say, she enjoyed hers, too.

We met the owner, Miguel,  who also gave us a sample of his chicken adobo (over rice), which is a burrito meat option (and quite popular, I hear).  While I thought that to be somehow wrong, I have to admit that the adobo was absolutely delicious.   It was SO tender.

The eating area is small but the tables do clear quickly.  And while their prices may be on the high side, I'm definitely one who believes in getting what you pay for... and we certainly did.

Miguel, thank you for your hospitality.  You'll definitely be seeing me again.

P.S.  My 9-year old son proclaims Papalote to be his favorite  - and he's eaten a quite a few burritos, living in South City.  :-)

excerpts: The prices are crazy, the "salsa" tastes like spicy marinara, the tacos are more like a salad sitting on a tortilla, the shrimp are charred and dry.
It's just bad.
Really, really bad.
How is this place so well reviewed?
I blame the transplants.
Yes, this is probably better than the Mexican food you have in Wisconsin.
However, it's absolute crap compared to actual Mexican food.
For god's sake, run screaming from this place.
shrimp.author: Nick G.
shrimp.review: Just...just awful. Where to start? The prices are crazy, the "salsa" tastes like spicy marinara, the tacos are more like a salad sitting on a tortilla, the shrimp are charred and dry. It's just bad. Really, really bad. How is this place so well reviewed? I blame the transplants. Yes, this is probably better than the Mexican food you have in Wisconsin. However, it's absolute crap compared to actual Mexican food. For god's sake, run screaming from this place.

excerpts: I had the shrimp burrito with black beans, peppers and rice.
shrimp.author: Marissa P.
shrimp.review:
After six years in Phoenix, it's a relief to find all the wonderful taquerias in the Mission.  I had the shrimp burrito with black beans, peppers and rice. It was very good. 

Pros:
Good Portions
Fast Take Out
Take Credit Cards

Cons
The only salsa option is Pico
Chips were a little stale
No dessert options

excerpts: I had a shrimp burrito and a carne asada quesadilla.
Everyone thought I was crazy, but I was so hungry that I devoured both of those items in the time everyone took to eat their burritos!
The salsa in the bag is delicious too.
Will recommend!
Next time, I'll have to get some horchata to wash it all down.
shrimp.author: Ralph N.
shrimp.review:
I was hanging out with a bunch of redditors in the Mission when I asked, "hey guys, what's a Mission-style burrito?"

Next minute, we're at Papalote. I had a shrimp burrito and a carne asada quesadilla. Everyone thought I was crazy, but I was so hungry that I devoured both of those items in the time everyone took to eat their burritos! The salsa in the bag is delicious too. Will recommend! Next time, I'll have to get some horchata to wash it all down.

excerpts: I thought that the shrimp was the best part of the burrito although everything was delicious.
shrimp.author: Blake B.
shrimp.review: I'm sure we weren't the only ones that hadn't heard too much about Papalote before they were on Throwdown and listed in 7x7 but I was so glad I checked both of those out as Papalote is legit.  We ordered the triple threat burrito and it was great.  I thought that the shrimp was the best part of the burrito although everything was delicious.  We also ordered chips and salsa to start and the salsa is definitely one of the best salsas I've ever had.  I was glad I had some extra to pour on my burrito as it made it that much more enjoyable.

excerpts: The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices.
There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect.
shrimp.author: Langdon N.
shrimp.review:
Bobby Flay lost for a reason!

I came here to eat lunch today after hearing that Bobby Flay had lost a "Throwdown" here. The Triple Threat Burrito was the challenge, and boy was it also a challenge to finish. 

First off, the free chips as an appetizer are delicious! I don't know what's so different about them but they have a natural crunch to them that make them irresistible to turn away. Also, the salsa served with the chips is probably as close to perfect salsa I have ever tasted in my life. The salsa is sweet, yet not too sweet, and spicy enough to have a kick in it but not too much where you can only eat a bit. There's also none of that burnt pepper taste in it. 

I also split an order of fish tacos with my brother. The fish tacos were a lot bigger than other taquerias I've been to and they are extremely hot (temperature wise) when they come out. The fish tacos were recommended to us by the staff as their best tacos, and they were correct!

Now on to the Triple Threat Burrito. This burrito is definitely not for the faint at heart. The sheer size of the burrito is comparable to other taquerias as maybe 1.2 to 1.5 times larger. They also recommend that the burrito be shared by two or more people, which I recommend as well. The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices. There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect. The only downside to the burrito was the price, for $20 I could get 4 burritos at other taquerias, but I had to try this burrito at least once. 

On another note, this place is probably the closest thing to a temple for those with hangovers!

excerpts: I ordered the camarones (shrimp) super burrito.
I had recently ate at el-ferrollito on mission street because of there $6 prices and 2200 reviews
and i thought they had good burritos.
But anyway i had the shrimp burrito with black beans.
Talk about heaven this burrito (about $11.50) is hands down the BEST burrito I have ever had.
The different tastes of it make my mouth water.
It was perfectly cooked in every way.
I was not impressed with my el-ferrolitto experience
but I have no complaints about my papalote
burrito.
This burrito was superb.
I highly recommend it.
shrimp.author: Tmo457 W.
shrimp.review: I ordered the camarones (shrimp) super burrito. I had recently ate at el-ferrollito on mission street because of there $6 prices and 2200 reviews and i thought they had good burritos. But anyway i had the shrimp burrito with black beans. Talk about heaven this burrito (about $11.50) is hands down the BEST burrito I have ever had. The different tastes of it make my mouth water. It was perfectly cooked in every way. I was not impressed with my el-ferrolitto experience but I have no complaints about my papalote burrito. This burrito was superb. I highly recommend it. I cannot wait to go back and try their asada and chicken burritos. On top of all this you get free chips and salsa. There salsa is world class. If you near mission street and 24th do not pass this place up

excerpts: I got the shrimp burrito and it was the most delicious shrimp
burrito
I've ever had.
shrimp.author: Xavier G.
shrimp.review:
This food was amazing! I got the shrimp burrito and it was the most delicious shrimp burrito I've ever had. My friend got the chicken mole, and that was delicious too. They have amazingly fresh and tasty guac. And lots of Mexican drink choices to choose from.

They even messed up on my burrito and forgot to make it. So I was waiting for 30 minutes for no reason whatsoever. I told them about it, and they told me they'd make it right away, and I got it in 5 minutes, which was nice. They were super apologetic, apologized to me 3 times even as we were leaving, which was pretty nice. But it was well worth waiting 35 minutes because it tasted heavenly, haha. I kind of wish they gave me a free drink or something to make up for it, but oh well...

excerpts: We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.
So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!
Without drinks.
But whatever.
I tell her it's really good
and I fork over some money.
So the food is brought out and I get the shrip
and I say FUCK--
what I really wanted was Prawns.
Maybe it's due to me being an unsophisticted Mid-westerner, but I ordered shrimp not expecting them to be those tiney nasty thing but the big jumbo ones.
So I walked back and spit out my WINE AND BUTTER soaked nasty ass shrimp that had no flavor.
At Papalote i like to order a plate with shrimp
shrimp.author: Biggie M.
shrimp.review:
Once upon a time I wrote a glowing review for Papalote.  You can read it.   I once gave Papalote 4 stars.  It's beneath the astrix.

Here is my updated review for Papalote.

I took a good friend of mine who lives in Oakland, has a kid and never gets out of the house to the Mission.  We had an erreand to run but she was craving a good Mission Burrito.  Said friend is vegan, so I suggested Papalote, since they have tofu options, soyrizo, and vegan mole.
