We get there and decide to split the veggie fajitas with a side of guac, a side of soyrizo (for her) and some shrimp for me.  So I order and the total comes to 22 BUCKS!  Without drinks.  But whatever.  I tell her it's really good and I fork over some money.  So the food is brought out and I get the shrip and I say FUCK--what I really wanted was Prawns.  
Maybe it's due to me being an unsophisticted Mid-westerner, but I ordered shrimp not expecting them to be those tiney nasty thing but the big jumbo ones.  

I went to the counter and told the manager and he said tough luck.  I was kind of incredulous.  You think if someone has just spent a shitload of money--22 BUCKS for ONE MEAL at a fucking taqueria you could throw three prawns at them.  he was just an asshole and said you ordered wrong too bad.  So I walked back and spit out my WINE AND BUTTER soaked nasty ass shrimp that had no flavor.  

Then they brought the fajitas out and they gave us ONE tortilla and I was so pissed by then I couldn't even complain for fear they guy would be like--"well it only comes with one tortilla--tough."

So I left the place so pissed because I really wanted my FAVORITE taqueria to be my friend's favorite new place and maybe she would like it enough to come into the city more.

I was so upset that I decided to call the manager--who was the rude guy to complain--and guess what he was a dick then too.  I even told him that it was my favorite taqueria and instead of eating near my school in Potrero Hill sometimes--there are porbably 20 taqueria between it and Papalote I truck there.  

I was a regular customer--but that's what shitty customer service can do.  I'll miss you Papalote--or at least your PRAWNS.

I

**************************************************************************



At Papalote i like to order a plate with shrimp (STRIKE THIS APPARANTLY THEY ARE PRAWNS), beans, rice and guac.

That's it.

It's really good and filling.  It ends up being more expensive than an acutal burrito which is annoying.    However I keep ordering it like that, because that's how I like to eat it.

Their beans are the best--and vegan too which pleases many of my picky picky friends.  I like to take out and eat on the steps of the scary church with the big neon cross across Valencia Street.

excerpts: Shrimp Taco - the shrimp were not fresh and this taco creation with bell peppers just didn't please my palate at all.
shrimp.author: Hebert J.
shrimp.review:
They definitely lived up with the hype of Awesome Burrito and Salsa. It's no wonder this place is always crowded. Don't be fooled by the lack of Latino customers in the resto, because they will still please your craving. 

Burrito - The Carne Asada, Chile Verde, and Pollo were all very tasty. Put a dollop of the salsa and you'll be in purgatory. I love it! 

Shrimp Taco - the shrimp were not fresh and this taco creation with bell peppers just didn't please my palate at all. (the only turn off)

Salsa - You can taste the freshness of the roasted tomatoes and the spiciness of the pepper. It has a great kick. The only salsa that can top this is La Vics in San Jose. I love it! 

Chicken Adobo meat - one of the staff gave me a small sample taste of their secret choice of meat. It tasted more like Paksiw to my Filipino tongue than Adobo. It's still pretty tasty but I'd rather have white rice with it. 

Price - It's more expensive than other taquerias in the Mission but it's worth it. (They need to be more generous on their salsa!) 

Staff - The owners were mingling with the people in line and all the staff members were genuinely nice!

excerpts: I had shrimp marinated in butter and something else tacos and a side of rice.
The shrimp was so disappointing, lacking flavor and spice.
The side of rice could feed four people.
shrimp.author: Karen T.
shrimp.review:
I hail from a city which borders East Los Angeles.  What does this mean?  It means I eat a shitload of Mexican food.  I like all of it, including the somewhat more obscure fare like menudo and lengua (tongue).  My best friend who is Mexican won't even eat lengua.  She claims I am browner than she is (I am yellow).

On a recent weekend jaunt to the bay area, the aforementioned friend and her bf asked me what I wanted for dinner Saturday night.  After a couple days of light meals, I was ready for something that would leave me full for the rest of the week.  Thus, I suggested Mexican food.  First we tried to get to some spot that supposedly features bomb ass carne asada burritos, but alas, they are only open for lunch.  So we traipsed on over to Papalote, which they assured would be just as good.

Upon arriving, the place was way packed.  Albeit a small space, that shit was pretty ridiculous.  The way it works is, you order at the counter.  As my friends and I were dining in, we proceeded to wait in the doorway, watching like hawks at people who are taking their sweet ass time eating, finally scrambling when a couple leave only to sit down at their dirty table.  Btw, it took us roughly 30 minutes after ordering to get a table.  And apparently, if you're dining in and aren't seated, they won't bring out your food (which means it was probably ready a while ago and is now getting cold).  However, this is hearsay, and as Lavar Burton would say, "you don't have to take my word for it".

Wow, I haven't even reviewed the food yet.  It's subpar and the best way to describe it is glorified Baja Fresh.  I'll even say that BF is tastier, and without the gaggle of hipsters and long ass wait.  I had shrimp marinated in butter and something else tacos and a side of rice.  The shrimp was so disappointing, lacking flavor and spice.  The side of rice could feed four people.  Too bad it was super dry and needed a load of lime and salsa to punch it up. 

I'll agree with everyone else that the salsa was good, but that was the only thing remotely noteworthy.

excerpts: Shrimp tacos are the same.
shrimp.author: Liz P.
shrimp.review:
Everyone raves about the salsa and rightfully so.  Others bitch that  if you want extra, you pay extra.  Please, it's fifty cents more and worth every penny.  Unlike any other salsa I've tasted.  Hotness varies each visit.

I find the food hit or miss.  The carne asada is bland and tough.  Shrimp tacos are the same.  Tortillas are the stiff, packaged variety.

The chile verde is delicious and now my favorite item on the menu.  I've tasted the fish tacos and not a fishy taste or smell about them.  A friend gives raves to the veggie burrito.  The chilaquiles are divine.

Papalote is located in what I call N'mission -- on the edge of Noe and the Mission.  If you're not into kids, then beware of the Noe Stroller Set.  They can overtake the place with often times not so well-behaved children.  Or clueless parents.  And why oh why can't they leave their strollers on the sidewalk?  The place is tiny enough.

Only a few tables in the joint, so you usually have to hover over diners like a vulture and swoop in as soon as one is free.

excerpts: might I add,but maybe they left out a few shrimp that I feel it lacked).
shrimp.author: Catherine O.
shrimp.review:
It's nice sometimes to not feel like I just ate a tub of whale lard! 

With reasonable prices..roughly $6 for a burrito...the place wasn't bad! I wouldn't say it's to DIE for ...but definitely delicious and I will return! 

Most of the time I will shove my face with food, and walk out feeling gross from the grease, but after completing my entire burrito I felt very content. No greasiness, and an over sized belly! The salsa was good as well. I ordered the camarone burrito (which was quite yummy might I add,but maybe they left out a few shrimp that I feel it lacked). 
I'm not a huge fan of beans, but I found their black beans to be yummy! 

Not far from the bart station...a good place to stop in and eat on the way home. It cleaner than most mexican restaurants. Although I didn't find it appealing sitting near the bathroom door...so i veered away from it. I think I  smelled a whif of the delicious flavor of the bathroom..which probably wouldnt go well with my dish. 

I'll be coming back occasionally on my walk home from the bart.

excerpts: We ordered the bean dip, shrimp quesadilla, and veggie fajita, and besides the servings being on the skimpy side, there was just not much seasoning to any of it.
shrimp.author: Kirsten L.
shrimp.review:
Papalote is over rated and over priced. The small space, which otherwise is well decorated, quickly gets really loud. Also, for some odd reason I've been cold both time I've visited and kept my jacket on, which is always anti-relaxing to me. It enhances the in-and-out mode, but with those prices and the wait on the food we've had, it's seems like a paradox. Considering the decor too, I'd like to feel like sticking around and hanging out. 

The food is bland. We ordered the bean dip, shrimp quesadilla, and veggie fajita, and besides the servings being on the skimpy side, there was just not much seasoning to any of it.

It's the second time I'm back, and the second time I again got annoyed with the rushed service at the counter.

Next time, I'll remember to disagree on going to Papalote's...

excerpts: I am usually waiting outside (because there are so many people waiting inside) for at least 20 minutes to get my shrimp burrito.
shrimp.author: Ali K.
shrimp.review:
I would like to give these guys a higher rating because I do frequent them but the wait just kills me. Granted it is on a weeknight as a last minute meal, more of a "holy crap I have not eaten yet and it's 8:30!" before I head out for the evening... but still. They could be a bit more efficient. I am usually waiting outside (because there are so many people waiting inside) for at least 20 minutes to get my shrimp burrito.

Food is not too bad. I like the fresh ingredients. What more can I say? Weeknight haunt perhaps, but that is it.

excerpts: The Camarones (Shrimp) is light, blends nicely with the spices and rice, and just feels enjoyable to eat, perfect for not feeling like a sweaty piece of shit afterwards like most other Mexican places, which will keep you on the toilet
shrimp.author: Matthew F.
shrimp.review:
I fucking hate vegetarian "wannabe" food with a passion.
Veggie Burgers, Veggie Dogs, Soy Bacon; you can go fuck yourselves.

So I see and hear people rave about the soyrizo, and I am forced to try it.

Holy. Shit.

Better than any chorizo I've ever had. 
The Camarones (Shrimp) is light, blends nicely with the spices and rice, and just feels enjoyable to eat, perfect for not feeling like a sweaty piece of shit afterwards like most other Mexican places, which will keep you on the toilet so long you'll get new honeycombs on your jeans.

In fact, none of these burritos is going to weigh you down. 

The Mole is overcooked and has a strong basic taste in it. Meh.

They sell salsa by the pint in mason jars for $5.95, and I keep it constantly stocked in my fridge. It varies in spice from day to day, but no matter how hot it is, it's a crazy, unique, amazing salsa that I can't figure out the contents of.  Perfect for snacking, and can hold up it's own as a condiment against sriricha.

excerpts: I was telling him about the Triple Threat Burrito and how there's steak, chicken and shrimp inside
and he said "What are you waiting for, let's go!
We pulled up, got a parking spot right in front and walked in knowing exactly what we wanted.
Ordered the $20!
burrito and took our seats.
We got our burrito and started to chow down.
Every bite say "Ohhh - Ahhh - Yummm
- This is the best salsa - Yumm...
" this went on for about 15 minutes and then we both were stuffed.
Couldn't take one more bite.
I think the best part on the burrito was the chicken, nice big chunks and very good seasoning.
I'm not much of a red meat eater
so I actually picked out some of the steak
but that doesn't mean it was good.
shrimp.author: Katie J.
shrimp.review:
We both we were starving when we got to the city on Sunday so I went onto my Yelp! application on my iPhone, then to my bookmarks, sorted them to 'Distance from Me' and Papalote came up as the closet (so did Humphry's but that's another review.) I was telling him about the Triple Threat Burrito and how there's steak, chicken and shrimp inside and he said "What are you waiting for, let's go!" We pulled up, got a parking spot right in front and walked in knowing exactly what we wanted. Ordered the $20! burrito and took our seats. We got our burrito and started to chow down. Every bite say "Ohhh - Ahhh - Yummm - This is the best salsa - Yumm..." this went on for about 15 minutes and then we both were stuffed. Couldn't take one more bite. I think the best part on the burrito was the chicken, nice big chunks and very good seasoning. I'm not much of a red meat eater so I actually picked out some of the steak but that doesn't mean it was good. And the shrimps were big! 

We both agreed that this was the best burrito we have ever eaten but for $20 it better be.

excerpts: i had the veggie burrito and the hubby had the shrimp burrito.
it lacked flavor and it was dry!
shrimp.author: Sharon T.
shrimp.review:
ummm, i'm gonna throw it out there. the burrito was seriously one of the worst burritos i've ever had. and i've eaten a lot of them!  i had the veggie burrito and the hubby had the shrimp burrito.  it lacked flavor and it was dry! the rice and beans were a bit crunchy. i mean c'mon....crunchy? dry? that's definitely how you f-up a burrito.

the only thing they have going for them is their sauces.  the salsa is super yummy and i can drink that stuff.  2 stars for the sauce....

i will say, 7x7 never lets me down, and they claim that the carne asada burrito here is one of the best. maybe i'll come back for the salsa and give papalote's another chance and try the carne asada burrito.

maybe it was an off day? either way, for now... thumbs down.

excerpts: I think the last thing I got there was a camerones burrito, and I couldn't taste any of the butter or white wine in which the shrimp was supposedly sauteed.
shrimp.author: daphne w.
shrimp.review:
Definitely overrated.  I had high hopes for this place, but it came nowhere close to all the hype.  Even discounting the fact that it's not authentic Mexican food, just about every menu option sounded intriguing to me.  However, everything I've tried has turned out to be rather bland.  I think the last thing I got there was a camerones burrito, and I couldn't taste any of the butter or white wine in which the shrimp was supposedly sauteed.  I had to pour tablespoons of salsa on each bite to give it some flavor.  

It does get a couple of points, though, for being a  quasi-healthy-Cal-exican alternative -- if that's what you're after.  And I can definitely see why vegetarians and vegans are thrilled with it, which is maybe why SF loves it so much...?

excerpts: I was almost in shock at my plate: my quesadilla was cut up in four pieces, with one piece of shrimp for each slice.
It looked so sparse
, I was ready to complain.
But instead I dug in, and I have to say I didn't think about complaining because there was so much flavor in that shrimp, anything else would've been a waste.
So maybe I should ask for a quesadilla w/ the works and extra shrimp?
shrimp.author: Audrey E.
shrimp.review:
I should know by now that it's best to go with my gut (not my stomach, but my intuition).  Burritos at Papalote always satisfy, but for some reason on this particular visit, I went with the prawn quesadilla.  I was almost in shock at my plate: my quesadilla was cut up in four pieces, with one piece of shrimp for each slice.  It looked so sparse, I was ready to complain.  But instead I dug in, and I have to say I didn't think about complaining because there was so much flavor in that shrimp, anything else would've been a waste.

But I was hungry afterwards...  So maybe I should ask for a quesadilla w/ the works and extra shrimp?

excerpts: Apparently the shrimp quesadillas are amazing (none for me, thank you!) and the carne asada was drool-worthy.
I had no idea
this place was so famous, and I'm glad I didn't, because I was able to relish my meal without the hype leering around the corner.
The 2nd grade class' architectural drawings decorating the walls like gallery art were also a highlight.
AND they have Dos Equis on tap.
shrimp.author: Arwen O.
shrimp.review:
The salsa is in fact fantastic (I thought of mole more than salsa) and almost worth the whole visit. Apparently the shrimp quesadillas are amazing (none for me, thank you!) and the carne asada was drool-worthy. I had no idea this place was so famous, and I'm glad I didn't, because I was able to relish my meal without the hype leering around the corner.

The 2nd grade class' architectural drawings decorating the walls like gallery art were also a highlight. AND they have Dos Equis on tap.

excerpts: i know they are famous for their triple threat, but my love is for their shrimp burrito.
shrimp.author: Amy S.
shrimp.review:
my must stop-by place in the bay.

i know they are famous for their triple threat, but my love is for their shrimp burrito. yum!!

i love how you can pick the flavor of the tortillas for the burrito. i go for sun dried tomatoes : D

o i miss papalote : (

excerpts: I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore
so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.
The rice and bean burrito.
It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.
Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.
shrimp.author: TeTeDaMouse C.
shrimp.review:
Papalote is up there when it comes to delicious Mexican food.  It's definitely in the top three and funny, for the life of me, I don't know remember the names of the other two because I'm hazy from the glow of Papalote's deliciousness.  While the proximity of my next job location to Papalote wouldn't be the deciding factor in picking one job over the other, it would definitely be a perk.

Papalote is a restaurant where I don't miss meat as part of my meal.  Their vegan and vegetarian burritos are delicious.  I usually order my burrito with black beans, a whole wheat tortilla, and make it a super so I can have their delicious guacamole.  The cheese is nice too. I've eaten their grilled veggie burrito, chicken burrito, and grilled shrimp burrito (it's not on the menu anymore so maybe it was a special), but I always come back to my one true love.  The rice and bean burrito.  It's simple, tasty, and will keep you going for the day.  Their salsa is fantastic as well and unlike any I've ever tried before.  It's hard to describe; it's a bit smoky.  

I love me some Papalote!  If I was vegan or vegetarian, it wouldn't be hard because of Papalote.  I firmly believe the restaurant would get me through the hard times.

excerpts: And shrimp cooked in white wine burrito - niiiiiice.
shrimp.author: Dusty R.
shrimp.review:
Well whatever I may as well toss my hat into the ring here. I've lived in the Mission for 20 years now, on and off (the 1989 quake celebrations reminded me of that - I moved here 2 months before it, god I got an earful from my freaked-out Midwestern relatives for years afterwards. As if a tornado hadn't wiped a town right off the map 10 miles away from where I grew up. Hell-o).

At first when Papalote came around, I snubbed it. I admit it. I thought it was a dumb-assed idea. Healthy, gourmet-esque, burritos? With roasted vegetables? Posers.

But then I got older and started to not really want to feel kinda sick every time I ate a burrito. I'm not knockin' the more traditional (yes, yes, I know, burritos are not really from Mexico - but there is a burrito standard nonetheless, at least here in SF) burrito joints. I still go to them, they're awesome, but sometimes I'm craving a burrito but still want to sleep at night without feeling like I'm about to explode.

So I went to Papalote, just a few years back. Yummy chips, very fresh. Definitely a plus. Tasty jicama salad - unusual. Roasted salsa - a bit cheeky, but I gotta admit, pretty damn good. And shrimp cooked in white wine burrito - niiiiiice.

So now I work Papalote into my burrito rotation. Everything is yummy and fresh, and the lettuce here (used on tacos, not burritos) is real green lettuce, not iceburg crap.

A nice addition to the neighborhood.

excerpts: Triple Threat doesn't mean triple the size or triple the meat/shrimp.
There was only 4 shrimp inside.
The only reason this place is still in business is because it was featured on The Food Network with Bobby Flay's showdown.
It was because the salsa is good and on that episode the burrito was much larger.
Please don't support this establishment unless you think a shrimp is worth $3.
shrimp.author: jay m.
shrimp.review:
$12 burrito what a joke!!!!! Two years later I gave this place a second chance and it was more disappointing this time around. Before I go any furher....I must tell you I decided to become a member of Yelp just to post this review tonight. Last time, I ordered a Triple Threat Burrito and paid close to $30 and was still hungry. Triple Threat doesn't mean triple the size or triple the meat/shrimp. This time I purchased a Prawn Super Burrito for $12.50 and of course I was still hungry. Why? There was only 4 shrimp inside. The only reason this place is still in business is because it was featured on The Food Network with Bobby Flay's showdown. It was because the salsa is good and on that episode the burrito was much larger. Please if you don't believe me; look it up on the web. 

The employees have attitude like they work at Gary Danko's except they don't! The chips are horrible and they couldn't more frugal with the amount of salsa and chips they provide.  I will never go back again!!!!! 

If you want something good and filling even though not Mexican go to Phat Philly's around the corner. It was delicious although still pricey...worth the $12 for a large. 

If you want real Mexican food or for that matter a delicous  burrito; go to La Cumbre, La Morena or La Tapatia. The last  two options are in South San Francisco.

Please don't support this establishment unless you think a shrimp is worth $3. 

Good Luck in your search and don't believe the hype on the reviews. 

Jay

excerpts: Shrimp Quesadillas, I'm missing you.
shrimp.author: Macelle A.
shrimp.review:
This place used to be a great little find. Now it's an institution in SF. All because of that magic salsa. I think they get that smokey flavor from using roasted tomatoes Or something! It's different, that's for sure and damn delicious! 
Shrimp Quesadillas, I'm missing you.

excerpts: Good burritos - particularly the carne asada, shrimp and fish ones and great salsa and chips.
You can get a  burrito card and receive your 11th burrito free!
Staff is super friendly, ingredients are super fresh and location is super close to Bart.
Super!
shrimp.author: Kamael S.
shrimp.review: It saddens me greatly that I have moved further away from Papalote.   Good burritos - particularly the carne asada, shrimp and fish ones and great salsa and chips. You can get a  burrito card and receive your 11th burrito free!  Staff is super friendly, ingredients are super fresh and location is super close to Bart. Super!

excerpts: , it's just that it is basically what you end up getting full on, not shrimp.
shrimp.author: Lauren G.
shrimp.review:
Their smokey tasting salsa really is the shit and I can never get enough.  It is, that good.

I'm a big fan of choosing seafood options when going out for Mexican dining.  This is definitely where Papalote is lacking.  There are a good two prawns in their prawn tacos and the rest of the pico de gallo and lettuce they use, while it's quality and I do like that, it's just that it is basically what you end up getting full on, not shrimp.

Don't get me wrong, I do like this place - a lot, it's very good.

My only other complaint is that they use enough garlic in their veggie and seafood dishes it's practically sacrilegious.

However, this could be a great arsenal against an unwanted admirer/stalker . . . 

The burritos are good and the quesadilla are also, ask for their house salsa on everything, it really takes it up a notch.

excerpts: Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak.
It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart.
After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts
shrimp.author: Andrew Y.
shrimp.review:
I had high hopes for this place because it was a mexcian place in the Mission. Anyway, there was a Triple Threat burrito with shrimp, chicken and steak. It was shaping up to be something big, but then it fell apart. After I had reconstructed the burrito, it had all the parts but I didn't think that all came together. 

I was told that this place was more of a vegetarian place. I'm willing to try this place again, but we'll see the end result next time. For now, 3 stars. 

Oh, we also had nachos, they were pretty good. I liked the cheese.

excerpts: yafeelme?The chicken was kinda dry, but the shrimp quesdilla was off the chain.
yfelme?
I will definitely be back, but only for take out becuase there aint no parking round there.
yflme?
shrimp.author: Lawrence A.
shrimp.review:
What the hell is in that salsa that makes it so good? 
I want to buy a 50 gallon drum of this stuff and slather it on everything I eat (including dessert). 

Papalote isgood mexican food in the higher end, low end kinda price range. You feel me? Basically, it's not the great East oakland spots that are delicious and super affordable, but, its also not the Mamcitas or the Tres Agaves kind of expensive, the $22 carne asada plate expensive. ya feel me? It's worth it just to go there for the salsa. which is completely unique and only given out in small quantities. yafeelme?The chicken was kinda dry, but the shrimp quesdilla was off the chain. yfelme? I will definitely be back, but only for take out becuase there aint no parking round there. yflme?

excerpts: I went there for lunch today with some friends and everyone was extremely pleased with their seafoody selections: a shrimp quesadilla; fish burrito, and two of us ordered fish tacos.
shrimp.author: Deborah S.
shrimp.review:
Fish tacos were awesome. I went there for lunch today with some friends and everyone was extremely pleased with their seafoody selections: a shrimp quesadilla; fish burrito, and two of us ordered fish tacos. I actually split mine with a friend and one was totally satisfying. 

Salsa was great and we had a good time--I will definitely remember to stop by again and maybe bring some salsa home.

excerpts: i had shrimp and steak burritos on different days and it was really bad.
how could you not know how to wrap a burrito???
i wouldn't go back.
service was good though.
shrimp.author: emukka y.
shrimp.review:
food was tastless. i had shrimp and steak burritos on different days and it was really bad. how could you not know how to wrap a burrito??? i wouldn't go back.
   service was good though.

excerpts: The food was okay, but way too much rice in the burrito, and perhaps three shrimp.
For a $11 burrito, I felt rooked.
shrimp.author: R.B. W.
shrimp.review: Not sure what all the fuss is about.  The place is cramped, not so clean, and devoid of personality.  I've heard people raving about the place, and finally had dinner there.  But wow...totally and completely underwhelmed.  I head out for Mex at least a couple times a week, but won't be revisiting Paplote.  Perhaps the buzz is because they offer vegan or soyrizo alternatives?  Even the much-vaunted salsa?  Meh. The food was okay, but way too much rice in the burrito, and perhaps three shrimp.  For a $11 burrito, I felt rooked.  I'll stick with Pancho Villa's Super Burrito, or head to San Jalisco for their awesome mole, and go to El Metate for some great fish tacos.

excerpts: Shrimp tacos, two times.
shrimp.author: Tony A.
shrimp.review:
Excellent salsa and a wonderful cheese and chorizo dip to start.  Cleanse palate with Modelo.  Shrimp tacos, two times.  More beer.  

Gourmet Mexican, something lighter and fresher then your average Mission taco joint.  

This place is worth a trip.

excerpts: I paid $8.25 for shrimp nachos, which for exceptional ingredients, I can handle.
Their salsa, however, is the only thing exceptional left about this place.
They skimped on the shrimp, and I forgot that if you want guacamole and sour cream, you gotta pay for it here.
On nachos this seems pretty cheap.
I really hope they get their act back together, this place used to be worth the extra money, but now it is definitely not.
shrimp.author: Kaya d.
shrimp.review:
I used to really love Papalote, but it's definitely been heading downhill lately. My guess is that it started when they opened the Fulton Street location. Now you don't see the owners anymore, who used to be around all the time when I first started going ~4 years ago. 
I think they're counting on all the mission hipsters to keep coming here, but I think they're treading on thin ice. I paid $8.25 for shrimp nachos, which for exceptional ingredients, I can handle. Their salsa, however, is the only thing exceptional left about this place. They skimped on the shrimp, and I forgot that if you want guacamole and sour cream, you gotta pay for it here. On nachos this seems pretty cheap. 
I really hope they get their act back together, this place used to be worth the extra money, but now it is definitely not.

excerpts: I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly
they are-
but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito.
However, the prices are a bit steep
shrimp.author: Grace S.
shrimp.review:
You know you're in the Bay Area when you find a taqueria serving soyrizo and tofu burritos. At kind of ridiculous prices.

As everyone else has noted, the salsa here is awesome and definitely worth buying a jar of for later. I appreciate all the different options (chicken, steak, shrimp, tofu; tacos, burritos, fajitas, etc) and how vegetarian/vegan friendly they are- I am partial to the grilled veggie tacos myself. Have never had a burrito here but my friends love the chicken mole tacos and soyrizo burrito. However, the prices are a bit steep so it's not exactly the best bang for your buck.

I've been to the locations in the mission and on 24th and have to say, the one in the mission served tastier/more flavorful food and there's a little more going there (the chairs at both locations however are super uncomfortable).

excerpts: Something about blending chicken, shrimp, and steak into one concoction did it for me.
shrimp.author: Bijon R.
shrimp.review: I ate here a few months ago. Of course I had to order their 20 dollar burrito. A bit expensive but well worth it! Something about blending chicken, shrimp, and steak into one concoction did it for me.

excerpts: I'll spend extra to get shrimp at other taquerias simply to have freshly cook meat, so
it's nice to have some more options here.
shrimp.author: Nicole and Kayvon B.
shrimp.review:
it's totally a five for a taqueria--everything's really fresh and a lot of care is put into it.  And damn you love that salsa.  But they're too stingy with it, because they know they can sell it to us.  If they gave out more with the order, we'd be there for hours just drinking it and smearing it on ourselves.  I usually like a variety of salsas, but the one variety they have needs no siblings.

This place really stands out in the vast sea of San Francisco taquerias.  They have vegan mole--damn...  she's been looking for that her whole life.  It's really good, too.  And mole could be really bad.  But never get it in the quesadilla, because it just oozes all out the sides and onto everything around you, making it impossible to eat.

The chicken is marinated and grilled fresh, so you can avoid bin chickens.  I'll spend extra to get shrimp at other taquerias simply to have freshly cook meat, so it's nice to have some more options here.  The lettuce is fresh and green, the guacamole is brilliant, the beans are  perfectly textured and the options include refried black--good stuff.

About the only thing I could think to improve (other than giving MORE SALSA) is that the corn tortillas could be fresher instead of the standard packaged variety.

The price is good, too.

excerpts: I wasn't as much a fan of the shrimp burrito
(I didn't feel like there was enough shrimp there), but the guacamole is also a must-have.
shrimp.author: Melinda C.
shrimp.review: Casual place to grab dinner.  The chicken burrito is still my favorite (particularly when slathered with that amazing salsa!).  I wasn't as much a fan of the shrimp burrito (I didn't feel like there was enough shrimp there), but the guacamole is also a must-have.

excerpts: I enjoy the veggie or shrimp burritos/ tacos.
The salsa/chips are perfect.
They serve beer.
It;s usually crowded but worth the wait.
shrimp.author: Heidi L.
shrimp.review: This place is fantastic!! I enjoy the veggie or shrimp burritos/ tacos. The salsa/chips are perfect. They serve beer. It;s usually crowded but worth the wait.

excerpts:
horchata is GREAT
guac is bleh, chips are awesome
chicken is crazy dry and gross
shrimp tacos are
shrimp.author: Christopher L.
shrimp.review:
horchata is GREAT
guac is bleh, chips are awesome
chicken is crazy dry and gross
shrimp tacos are good
chile verde ques is very good
carne asada super burrito is good

excerpts: The shrimp burrito is good too.
shrimp.author: Nisha M.
shrimp.review: When I went to college on the east coast I had my friends ship me jars and jars of this salsa. I always get the super prawn burrito with no pico de gallo and extra roasted salsa. The shrimp burrito is good too.

excerpts: Such a delicious burrito - shrimp were cooked to perfection, and the veggies inside were uber tasty!
The tortilla chips could have used a wee bit more salt (and seemed a bit stale), but that phenomenal salsa that came with them (probably the best I've ever had) more than made up for that.
shrimp.author: Rachel G.
shrimp.review: I love me a good burrito, and Papalote delivers and then some! The husband and I were still full from Dynamo Donuts (health nuts we are not), so we decided to be good and split a prawn burrito. Yet again, I was amazed by how something that can be quite heavy seemed so light. Such a delicious burrito - shrimp were cooked to perfection, and the veggies inside were uber tasty! The tortilla chips could have used a wee bit more salt (and seemed a bit stale), but that phenomenal salsa that came with them (probably the best I've ever had) more than made up for that.

excerpts: Next time im trying the triple threat burrito with chicken beef, and shrimp.
Everyone there is also super friendly and totally easy access to 24th bart station!
shrimp.author: jorge d.
shrimp.review: Want a darn good carne azada..well this is the place. Full of flavor and great portions.. man Im comin back. Just recently found out they beat out that Bobby Flay Chef.. (no wonder they got quality stuff) Next time im trying the triple threat burrito with chicken beef, and shrimp.  Everyone there is also super friendly and totally easy access to 24th bart station!

excerpts: The 3-threat is shrimp, chicken and beef.
All burritos come with chips and their special hot sauce (which is good and hot!).
I have to say that the burrito was pretty good.
The beef was probably the best beef I have ever had in a burrito.
If I went back I'd probably just get a super beef burrito for about ten bucks and be very happy.
Worth checking out if only for the super yummy beef and the high quality ingredients.
Gourmet meets burritos.
Check it out.
shrimp.author: Richard H.
shrimp.review: I saw this place on the Food Network (along with 50 million other people) so i decided to check it out. A friend and I split the $20 (Yikes!) Triple Threat Burrito. The place is small but the line was not too long. The wait for the burrito was very long, though. When it came It was a little smaller than I thought it would be for a $20 burrito, but it was enough. The 3-threat is shrimp, chicken and beef. All burritos come with chips and their special hot sauce (which is good and hot!). I have to say that the burrito was pretty good. The beef was probably the best beef I have ever had in a burrito. If I went back I'd probably just get a super beef burrito for about ten bucks and be very happy. Worth checking out if only for the super yummy beef and the high quality ingredients. Gourmet meets burritos. Check it out.

excerpts: I'm not first generation, Lily, but I'm fairly certain that authentic Mexican food does not include shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter.
shrimp.author: Daniella C.
shrimp.review:
There's something really off about this place for me. Maybe it's the soyrizo burrito on the menu, or maybe it's because the people who rave about it are usually vegetarians or hipsters. Those are two groups you generally can't trust in regards to good Mexican food. And yeah, I know, I know I'm not first generation, Lily, but I'm fairly certain that authentic Mexican food does not include shrimp sauteed in white wine and butter. And where do they get off charging three dollars for a plain taco? Maybe I'm being harsh because I think seafood tacos are a waste of time and stomach space, but white wine? Oh, and they have tofu on the menu. I like tofu as much as the next gal, but man... And I've only seen the place packed with white people, the kind with dreads or people who look like they just got out of yoga class.
Ok, so here's where I give credit; the salsa was good. It was nice and spicy. The chile verde pork was very tender. There was Yucatan hot sauce, which is always a plus. And there was spiced up jicama served as the side, which was deliciously refreshing.
Basically, overrated white washed Mexican food, which is fine as long as you know what you're in for.

excerpts: I get the shrimp burrito with wine sauce so good.
shrimp.author: kristi g.
shrimp.review: Best burritos in the mission.  This place is always busy and always has a line.  The salsa is the best. I get the shrimp burrito with wine sauce so good.

excerpts: though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos.
my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
shrimp.author: beth l.
shrimp.review: this is no ordinary taqueria. SUPER amazing chips and salsa (not your typical chunky salsa, though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

excerpts: Or do I not want to share my pleasantly plump and buttery shrimp super burrito with black re-fried beans and all the love inside wrapped in a spinach tortilla perfectly paired with a fresh strawberry fresca?
This IS my favorite Mexican taquoria.
Everything here is fresh and believe it or not light.
Here's a tip...
Can't decide between shrimp, beef, or chicken?
Try the Triple Threat Burrito.
Also there are two choices of how they prepare the shrimp.
Shrimp will be sauted in butter, prawns are kinds BBQish.
Great service too!
shrimp.author: sonia m.
shrimp.review: What I haven't reviewed this spot yet? Is it that I want all that crack they call salsa to myself? And those perfect chips. Or do I not want to share my pleasantly plump and buttery shrimp super burrito with black re-fried beans and all the love inside wrapped in a spinach tortilla perfectly paired with a fresh strawberry fresca? This IS my favorite Mexican taquoria. Everything here is fresh and believe it or not light. Here's a tip... Can't decide between shrimp, beef, or chicken? Try the Triple Threat Burrito. Also there are two choices of how they prepare the shrimp. Shrimp will be sauted in butter, prawns are kinds BBQish. Great service too!

excerpts: I picked a grilled shrimp burrito for myself and a fish burrito for Abby.
We both opted to make them "super" for an extra 99 cents, but my burrito especially had very little guacamole or sour cream (is there ever enough sour cream in a burrito anywhere?
Please do tell).
Both were super flavorful and had a very acceptable ratio of fillings, the shrimp were all nicely charred and the wine/butter sauce on the fish was pretty solid.
The icing on the cake at this place is their roasted tomato salsa.
While they don't have a salsa bar this one salsa makes up for it.
It's pureed, almost more of a sauce really, and must have some kind of oil in it because it was too good not to have a fat content.
shrimp.author: Alex D.
shrimp.review:
Headed home from work I stopped off here to pick up some take out. Parking was surprisingly easy for the Mission and I quickly found a spot. The menu is very vegetarian friendly, with only two real meat options and a few fish choices to boot. I picked a grilled shrimp burrito for myself and a fish burrito for Abby. We both opted to make them "super" for an extra 99 cents, but my burrito especially had very little guacamole or sour cream (is there ever enough sour cream in a burrito anywhere? Please do tell). Both were super flavorful and had a very acceptable ratio of fillings, the shrimp were all nicely charred and the wine/butter sauce on the fish was pretty solid. The icing on the cake at this place is their roasted tomato salsa. While they don't have a salsa bar this one salsa makes up for it. It's pureed, almost more of a sauce really, and must have some kind of oil in it because it was too good not to have a fat content. We will definitely try this place again (plus they have tall cans of PBR!).

FYI - Try calling ahead if you are in a hurry as the wait is a bit longer than you might expect it too be.

excerpts: A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.
The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.
Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.
My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.
shrimp.author: Jason M.
shrimp.review:
Like a lemming, i joined the masses checking out Papalote after their Throwdown win over Bobby Flay.  And I will say it more than lived up to the hype.

I ordered the triple threat burrito made famous on the show and a side of guacamole.  Hold up, $20 for a burrito!  This better be an amazing burrito especially since every other burrito on the menu is only $8 or so!  Needless to say, I was not disappointed.  A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.  The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.  Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.  My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.

And for those concerned about portion sizes, this was one of the biggest burrito's I've eaten in a long time.  Unless you're Adam Richman, this should be plenty of food for anyone.

Separately, the guacamole is good - though I wish it had a bit more of a kick and the fish tacos are also very tasty.  The fish is perfectly cooked and not dry like you typically find in fish tacos.

excerpts: They have great shrimp tacos!
Their ingredients taste fresh and yummy.
The lines aren't usually TOO bad and there's a clean dining area for you to sit if you choose.
They are a little pricey, considering all the other great & cheap Mexican places just a few yards away, but it's pretty damn good, so
I'll pay.
Oh and their salsa is spicy and delicious.
shrimp.author: Pet O.
shrimp.review: They have great shrimp tacos! Their ingredients taste fresh and yummy. The lines aren't usually TOO bad and there's a clean dining area for you to sit if you choose. They are a little pricey, considering all the other great & cheap Mexican places just a few yards away, but it's pretty damn good, so I'll pay. Oh and their salsa is spicy and delicious.

excerpts: Another favorite is the shrimp quesadilla with sauteed mushrooms.
Best time to eat here is during lunch or weekend dinner - much calmer and better service too.
A testament to how fresh it is:
I walk by in the mornings and see crates of vegetables delivered that day, with the tireless employees chopping them well before they're open.
Hats off to Miguel, Victor and team!
shrimp.author: Esther K.
shrimp.review: I live around the corner, so eat here at least once a week (and have also watched it evolve).  Agree with the salsa and fish taco assessment.  Did you know you can get all the different flavor flour tortillas with tacos too?  Plus they're bigger than the corn ones!  Another favorite is the shrimp quesadilla with sauteed mushrooms.  Best time to eat here is during lunch or weekend dinner - much calmer and better service too.  A testament to how fresh it is:  I walk by in the mornings and see crates of vegetables delivered that day, with the tireless employees chopping them well before they're open.  Hats off to Miguel, Victor and team!

excerpts: Nevertheless, I always get the shrimp (super) tacos and my husband always gets the chile verde tacos and those keep us perfectly satisfied, though the service can be somewhat cold.
I don't care for the decor or the crowded atmosphere so we usually get it to go.
shrimp.author: Terry M.
shrimp.review: Papalote is very good for certain things... the salsa being one of them. I do, however believe that it has gotten increasingly hotter over the last few years and therefore isn't as good to my taste. I too read the article in Chow and have been making that version of the salsa for years and actually prefer it. Nevertheless, I always get the shrimp (super) tacos and my husband always gets the chile verde tacos and those keep us perfectly satisfied, though the service can be somewhat cold. I don't care for the decor or the crowded atmosphere so we usually get it to go.

excerpts: Great place for snacking on shrimp tacos...
shrimp.author: Jackie G.
shrimp.review: Great place for snacking on shrimp tacos...

excerpts: the shrimp was the only decent part of the burrito.
beans were good too, but when are they not?
the extra guacamole seemed non-existent under all the other ingredients, yet the flavors left me wanting...
so i doused the burrito in hot sauce... not what i expected from all the hype.
shrimp.author: Debbie Chiou S.
shrimp.review: what? bobby flay's burrito must have really sucked for this burrito to have beat it on food network's throwdown challenge. the carne asada meat was so tough and hard to chew. the chicken was dry. the shrimp was the only decent part of the burrito. beans were good too, but when are they not? the extra guacamole seemed non-existent under all the other ingredients, yet the flavors left me wanting... so i doused the burrito in hot sauce... not what i expected from all the hype.

excerpts: After  shelling out a hefty $14.50 for a shrimp quesadilla with rice and beans on the side, I was expecting a solid meal.
I got the opposite, the quesadilla looked like an apple turnover, upon further inspection contained 4 shrimp?
the rice and beans were portioned for an infant, and the "platter" itself represented nothing of a platter.

the side of jicama and tomato salad I had mistaken as a garnish and the teaspoon of sour cream was only useful for adding some flavor to the beans.. which by the way cost $1.75 EACH rice AND beans totaling $ 3.50!
oh and the waiter there wouldn't let us get another round of salsa..
1.00 extra!

I'm not sure how this place gets away charging airport prices and serving Uno Mas quality Mexican food only 2 blocks away from Mission st, but next time I will stick to a place like Taqueria Cancun, get fresh authentic Mexican fare for half the price..
this place should check it out and take some notes....
shrimp.author: Derek S.
shrimp.review: this is worse Mexican food then I got at the Houston airport on my layover to Miami,. Not only is the food way overpriced and sub par at best, but you have to deal with a cluster fuck of scrambling yuppies attempting to scrap up a table, not to mention the sweaty line you have to wait in to order. After  shelling out a hefty $14.50 for a shrimp quesadilla with rice and beans on the side, I was expecting a solid meal. I got the opposite, the quesadilla looked like an apple turnover, upon further inspection contained 4 shrimp? the rice and beans were portioned for an infant, and the "platter" itself represented nothing of a platter. the side of jicama and tomato salad I had mistaken as a garnish and the teaspoon of sour cream was only useful for adding some flavor to the beans.. which by the way cost $1.75 EACH rice AND beans totaling $ 3.50!.. oh and the waiter there wouldn't let us get another round of salsa.. 1.00 extra!  I'm not sure how this place gets away charging airport prices and serving Uno Mas quality Mexican food only 2 blocks away from Mission st, but next time I will stick to a place like Taqueria Cancun, get fresh authentic Mexican fare for half the price.. this place should check it out and take some notes....

I finally get  parking and my order which was simple because they have an area for phone pick ups... as the girl starts to ring me up I start to pull out a $20 I figured 2 burritos and all the hype this place has gotten... I was thrown back when she rang up $31. I asked how much each burrito costed my grilled chicken burrito costed  around $7 and change then she said the Triple Threat costed $ 19.95???????????? I could not believe it I ended up just takin it home could not think of my son not eating his burrito ahaha I thought for that price it HAS to be good and it HAS to have ton of SHRIMP and HUGE when I got home pulled it out and my burrito was small and his was big compared to mine I took a bite and thought ehh it's ok.... my son enjoyed it in the end I asked how many shrimp he said I counted 3...3 shrimp ??? For 3 SHRIMP they charged $20???? They have gone mad then I thought about t and realized I had been bamboozled NEVER again sad to say but this place is OVERRATED OVERPRICED... So what Bobby Flay did a show on this joint I should have known when I saw the episode the only latinos in the show was the 2 owners the crowd was not LATINO? AND it took place at the Mission Cultural Center in the Mission there were no native mission ppl BAMBOOZLED I tell you never again I will stick to El Zocalo, El Farolito and pay $30 for 2 ppl including drinks and maybe even a quesadilla suiza... this place needs to lower their prices didn't they get the memo RECESSION?

excerpts: Plus it was missing the prawns/shrimp.
would have gotten up to complain
but one i couldn't get up (again was trapped by everyone waiting)
shrimp.author: Theresa S.
shrimp.review:
sorry to the papalote faithful out there, but i was pretty underwhelmed/disappointed.  we went to the fulton/masonic location.  super crowded but we ordered right away (plain quesadilla, triple threat burrito, guacamole, & chicken tacos).  I know that's alot of food, but we're a family of three and we shared everything.  $50 for dinner...seems a little much, especially since the triple threat was $20.  got a table fairly quick but we were then trapped there by all the people waiting for pickup.  Got our food after about 20 minutes.  It was good, but not great.  the triple threat burrito was again good, but not $20 good.  Plus it was missing the prawns/shrimp.  would have gotten up to complain but one i couldn't get up (again was trapped by everyone waiting) and two i didn't really want to wait another 20 minutes for a new burrito.

if we were in the area, might stop in and try the nachos...they did look good!  but all in all won't go out of my way for this one.  I'll stick with our close to home favorites:)

excerpts: I got a shrimp burrito  on a spinach tortilla.
Decent price and big burrito....very yum!
An added bonus is the fact that they have bottled coke.
mmm.....yummy!
My husband got the carne asada burrito which wasn't as good as the shrimp.
shrimp.author: Wendy V.
shrimp.review: Yum.  I got a shrimp burrito  on a spinach tortilla.  Decent price and big burrito....very yum!  An added bonus is the fact that they have bottled coke.  mmm.....yummy!  My husband got the carne asada burrito which wasn't as good as the shrimp.

excerpts: The carne asada, again, nothing to write home about, and the shrimp, totally lacking and overcooked, didn't taste very good at all, I picked them all out and set them aside.
I did enjoy the salsa that everyone is boasting about but the chips weren't great and that's half the experience when you're eating salsa.
Overall, I don't think I'd go back.
Bummer, I had such high hopes.
shrimp.author: Jnzl D.
shrimp.review: I would say 2.5. Like many others, I saw this on Food Network and decided to go give it a try. I don't know if I went on an off day but it seriously did not live up to the hype I had built up in my mind about how amazing this burrito experience was going to be. I ordered the Triple Threat, mind you...a $20+ burrito...yes I agreed to pay this much because I believed it was going to be phenomenal. I've had $5 burritos that blew my mind, this $20+ one did not. Seriously disappointed. It was all meat, mind you, which wouldn't be a bad thing, except there was nothing in it to make it spectacular. A good burrito to me has a balance between the meat, cheese, salsa, rice, and beans. This was mainly just a tortilla of meat. the chicken was probably the best of the three types of meat in it. The carne asada, again, nothing to write home about, and the shrimp, totally lacking and overcooked, didn't taste very good at all, I picked them all out and set them aside.  I did enjoy the salsa that everyone is boasting about but the chips weren't great and that's half the experience when you're eating salsa. Overall, I don't think I'd go back. Bummer, I had such high hopes.

excerpts: Had the shrimp burrito and managed to finish it!
Really, really tasty.
We ate around 6:45 on a Thursday night and didn't have to wait.
The meal definitely hit the spot.
shrimp.author: Lily Y.
shrimp.review: Salsa was really good. Had the shrimp burrito and managed to finish it! Really, really tasty. We ate around 6:45 on a Thursday night and didn't have to wait. The meal definitely hit the spot.

excerpts: I probably should have ordered that, because my shrimp tacos were shameful.
I got a measly four pieces of shrimp in each taco that I could barely see since it covered in a pile of lettuce and tomato.
I got a salad, basically, hugged inside a folded tortilla.
I grew up with TACOS: loaded with meat, dripping with pico de gallo and salsa.
shrimp.author: Christine S.
shrimp.review:
I used to walk by this place every day when I went to work and there was just something about it that repelled me from ever eating there.  Well, my sister decided to drag my dad and I there for lunch yesterday and I can't really say it was entirely worth it but it could be worse (like Chipotle, for example).  

The moment we got in, we ordered our food but guess what?  No seating.   I found this a little frustrating and sort of an unusual situation, since most taquerias I go to have at least some seating available.  Anyway, we finally got a table and sat down to some *delicious* salsa and chips.  I've never tasted anything like it and enjoyed it immensely.  Of course, I find out after I leave that they sell it behind the counter but oh well.  We finally got our meals.  My dad had the chilaquiles and seemed pretty satisfied about them.  I probably should have ordered that, because my shrimp tacos were shameful.  I got a measly four pieces of shrimp in each taco that I could barely see since it covered in a pile of lettuce and tomato.  I got a salad, basically, hugged inside a folded tortilla.  I grew up with TACOS: loaded with meat, dripping with pico de gallo and salsa.  These weren't tacos, not to me, at least.  

I am still not convinced this place is worth all the hullabaloo, but you never know.  I might have to make a second trip.  For now, I wish we had gone to La Santaneca or El Farolito instead.

excerpts: It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options.
It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for -
it's spicy and creamy and complex
-- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice.
The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried.
I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.
shrimp.author: Jennifer C.
shrimp.review: Papalote is my local burrito joint. It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options. It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for - it's spicy and creamy and complex -- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice. The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried. I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.

excerpts: The meat and shrimp were cooked dry and tasteless, and the item had no salsa or sauce to make it juicy or to give it some semblance of flavor.
We have tried a half dozen of the Mexican Restaurants in the Mission, and Papalote failed to impress (or even satisfy) us in any way.
We would suggest "Picante" in Berkeley as a better substitute.
shrimp.author: Carl B.
shrimp.review: After watching Bobby Flay lose to the owners of this restaurant in a throwdown, my wife and I plus two friends drove 35 miles from the East Bay to have lunch.   Although the service was friendly and timely, we were disappointed with their specialty  "Triple Threat Burrito".  The meat and shrimp were cooked dry and tasteless, and the item had no salsa or sauce to make it juicy or to give it some semblance of flavor.  We have tried a half dozen of the Mexican Restaurants in the Mission, and Papalote failed to impress (or even satisfy) us in any way.  We would suggest "Picante" in Berkeley as a better substitute.

excerpts: The shrimp tacos were nice.
The shrimp grilled in white wine and garlic.
They are plated on a couple of open soft tacos with crunchy lettuce and pico de gallo, and taste very fresh.
They were even better when I dumped the salsa all over them.
The burritos are fine, Ive tried the carne asada, shrimp and the veggie.
That's with pinto beans and guacamole.
shrimp.author: Roger W.
shrimp.review:
The best thing about this place is that it feels really good to be in there. I love Mexican food, but there aren't many Mexican restaurants in the Mission that I enjoy spending any real time in. The restaurant is cute and nicely designed. Its colorful and small, but feels more cozy then crammed. The place is clean and, though it has the elements of other burrito spots around here-- you order at the counter, no servers, small place with a community vibe, it doesn't feel thrown together like other places. Its more of a spot I would go with a date I wanted to impress or didn't know very well, then the place I seek out late night when I want to stuff my face with a group of also drunk friends. 

The food is good but, like a lot of Mexican restaurants, it lacks anything really distinguishing. EXCEPT, the salsa is super good. I feel the urge to repeat that last sentence. I live really close to Papalote and, on the day I moved in, two separate friends brought up the Mexican restaurant near by with the awesome salsa. The shrimp tacos were nice. The shrimp grilled in white wine and garlic. They are plated on a couple of open soft tacos with crunchy lettuce and pico de gallo, and taste very fresh. They were even better when I dumped the salsa all over them. The burritos are fine, Ive tried the carne asada, shrimp and the veggie. That's with pinto beans and guacamole. All were good, but not wet enough for my taste. 

The staff are friendly. I came in with a group of friends the other night, and one of the guys put himself out for a little bit trying to reorganize tables so we could sit. 

The place is pricier than its competitors, but you pay for the package. Or maybe you pay for the salsa (which, on a side note, I'm pretty sure you can buy on its own to carry out).

excerpts: i love the grilled shrimp super burrito with black beans.
it is delicious!
and they have amazing hot sauce...one of a kind.
shrimp.author: Jenny B.
shrimp.review:
they have the best tortillas....they are so fresh. 

i love the grilled shrimp super burrito with black beans. it is delicious! and they have amazing hot sauce...one of a kind.

excerpts:
i've been there once & looking forward to going again soon b/c:
-the shrimp tacos are killer.
very smokey grilled flavor
w/ incredibly GREAT salsa - of the liquified variety - which sounds not that good,-
but is like crack.
i can't do 5 stars b
/c
the lighting is so bad.
i don't mind fluorescent even, but the spotlight thing isn't good for my skin.
how it looks to others that is.
so i'll do takeout next time.
shrimp.author: Kim Y.
shrimp.review:
i've been there once & looking forward to going again soon b/c:
-the shrimp tacos are killer. very smokey grilled flavor w/ incredibly GREAT salsa - of the liquified variety - which sounds not that good,- but is like crack.
i can't do 5 stars b/c the lighting is so bad. i don't mind fluorescent even, but the spotlight thing isn't good for my skin. how it looks to others that is.
so i'll do takeout next time.

excerpts: Based on a Bay Area DJ group, this is goodness X3 with the incorporation of carne asada, shrimp, and chicken.
Only thing I couldn't believe was the price.
It costs under $20.
Holy shh..!
My friend and I decided to split one, and also ordered some super nachos.
shrimp.author: Rhia R.
shrimp.review: I had to come and see for myself what all the hype was about with this place. It's already been crazy busy way before they were featured in Throwdown. I had heard about their adobo burrito, but I was more curious to see if the Triple Threat lived up to its name. Based on a Bay Area DJ group, this is goodness X3 with the incorporation of carne asada, shrimp, and chicken. Only thing I couldn't believe was the price. It costs under $20. Holy shh..! My friend and I decided to split one, and also ordered some super nachos. That was already plenty, yet they threw in some chips and salsa with our order. I was able to get a bit of everything with each bite. The nachos were awesome as well. We barely got through half of it because of the Triple Threat. Once finished, I washed it all down with a horchata. I can honestly say that theirs is excellent; not watered down and has just the right amount of cinnamon. It was nice to taste a bit of history, but I think I'll try something different, and cheaper, next time.

excerpts: Mmmmm perfectly blackened, big ol shrimp, fresh vegetables, great beans etc.
shrimp.author: Rachelle M.
shrimp.review:
Oh man. I haven't tried much of the menu because as soon as I got to the Prawn burrito, I stopped right there and haven't moved. Mmmmm perfectly blackened, big ol shrimp, fresh vegetables, great beans etc.

Also, great secret-recipe salsa. Sort of smoky and creamy, their salsa is...

excerpts: The shrimp isn't as good as La Corneta, but this is a great place for burrito diversity if you're sick of the same old ricy overstuff in the mission.
It 's also nice when you don't feel like falling into the mexi-coma before you even get home  (aka reasonable portions)...
shrimp.author: Willy c.
shrimp.review: This place is pretty damn good.  The soyrizo burrito is great (and I'm not veggie), the mole is great, and steak is good. The shrimp isn't as good as La Corneta, but this is a great place for burrito diversity if you're sick of the same old ricy overstuff in the mission. It 's also nice when you don't feel like falling into the mexi-coma before you even get home  (aka reasonable portions)...

excerpts: To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three".
I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy.

I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos.
Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it
but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa".
I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips.
Great place and good value.
shrimp.author: Abheek G.
shrimp.review: I have eaten here so many times that I feel obliged to write a review. Any time I tell people where I live, they say "Oh you're so close to Papalote, I've always wanted to eat there". To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three". I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy. I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos. Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa". I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips. Great place and good value.

excerpts: shrimp tacos were ok but not creative.

I am still looking for the best  taco/burrito place in SF.
of all the places in the Mission, Bobby Flay chose this place?
shrimp.author: c c.
shrimp.review:
good but not great.  simple and healthy but won't rush back.
shrimp tacos were ok but not creative.
I am still looking for the best  taco/burrito place in SF.
of all the places in the Mission, Bobby Flay chose this place?

excerpts: you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter.
i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something.
it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.
shrimp.author: Angi C.
shrimp.review: located on the noe/mission border, this taqueria is definitely fancier than the others on 24th. you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter. i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something. it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.

excerpts: i go with chicken or shrimp...tacos or burrito.
everything is good here.
and they always have good fliers to peek at while you are waiting for takeout.
fast, good, nice people working here, clean, bottled coke...yum, great food.
shrimp.author: kelly M.
shrimp.review: frtesh, fresh, fresh....i will go to el farolito at 2 am when i am drunk and it'll be greasy and great. but the rest of the time and when i am sober, papalote is the spot! always tastes fresh, tasty and i never feel gross or guilty after i eat b/c it is so not greasy here. if you are craving grease, try the chorizo & cheese....slap your moma good. i go with chicken or shrimp...tacos or burrito. everything is good here. and they always have good fliers to peek at while you are waiting for takeout. fast, good, nice people working here, clean, bottled coke...yum, great food.

excerpts: The shrimp super was excellent.
Everything was fresh and made-to-order.
No choice of salsa but the house version is amazing - blended rather than chunky but very tasty and spicy.
Definitely worth the visit and a return trip!
shrimp.author: Cecilia B.
shrimp.review: Ordered take-out burritos - along with extra salsa - from the Mission location.  The veggie burritos with potato and mushrooms were delicious - they kindly added chunks of avocado (which was ordered for the arroz y frijoles burrito but even better with the veggies!).  The shrimp super was excellent.  Everything was fresh and made-to-order.  No choice of salsa but the house version is amazing - blended rather than chunky but very tasty and spicy.  Definitely worth the visit and a return trip!

excerpts: Here are the facts: I walked up to the counter and ordered 1 shrimp burrito.
There were 3 people who had already ordered and were standing around waiting for their food.
The time recorded on my receipt was 7:04pm.
I waited.....and waited....and waited....and waited...then waited some more....one of the people who were waiting at the time I ordered had already eaten their burrito and left!
Finally at 7:35pm I received a tiny shrimp burrito.
After this long wait I discover the shrimp in the burrito
was rubbery and overcooked.
I will never come here again..........
Plus the bathroom reeks of urine.
shrimp.author: Tennis F.
shrimp.review: Here are the facts: I walked up to the counter and ordered 1 shrimp burrito. There were 3 people who had already ordered and were standing around waiting for their food. The time recorded on my receipt was 7:04pm. I waited.....and waited....and waited....and waited...then waited some more....one of the people who were waiting at the time I ordered had already eaten their burrito and left! Finally at 7:35pm I received a tiny shrimp burrito. After this long wait I discover the shrimp in the burrito was rubbery and overcooked. I will never come here again..........Plus the bathroom reeks of urine.

excerpts: now there was a line of about 25 people behind us): 2 triple threats and a shrimp burrito.
I really hadn't looked at the prices, but when the cashier ran up the total to 42.00 I about had a heart attack.
I paid it.
Then we waited, and waited and waited and waited some more.
Finally got our order.
It was now 3:00.
We had an appointment, so I did not check our order.
Enroute to the appointment my friend ate his "shrimp burrito"-oops, in checking the order we in fact got 2 carne asada burritos and one triple threat.
Don't know how our original order translated to this...but to be fair we checked the reciept and we paid for what we got.
We just did not get what I asked for.
shrimp.author: C. W.
shrimp.review: A friend and I made the mistake of going to Papalotes the day after the throwdown with Bobby Flay. There were only 2 or 3 people ahead of us. We arrived at 2:00pm. I place our order to go(by now there was a line of about 25 people behind us): 2 triple threats and a shrimp burrito. I really hadn't looked at the prices, but when the cashier ran up the total to 42.00 I about had a heart attack. I paid it. Then we waited, and waited and waited and waited some more. Finally got our order. It was now 3:00. We had an appointment, so I did not check our order. Enroute to the appointment my friend ate his "shrimp burrito"-oops, in checking the order we in fact got 2 carne asada burritos and one triple threat. Don't know how our original order translated to this...but to be fair we checked the reciept and we paid for what we got. We just did not get what I asked for. Yes, a triple threat is $20.00, but like what has been written about here before,they are the same size as the steak burrito. I will never order the triple threat again. It is really a rip. It tasted good, but not worth the price.

excerpts: Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish.
Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.
shrimp.author: Eugene P.
shrimp.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts:
* Fish Taco - 3.5 stars
pic:

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw
Large chunks of fish filet.
Pretty fresh, good texture.
fish.author: Ziyan C.
fish.review:
We came at about 9pm on a Friday; they were busy but not crowded. We did get the last 4 seats free. No line at the counter, and maybe 5-10 minutes later our food came out. 

* Fish Taco - 3.5 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw
Large chunks of fish filet. Pretty fresh, good texture. They're not breaded or fried though. 

* Shrimp Taco - 3 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#z-j-9B6z9JdvI7LfEo_Cpw
The shrimp is a bit small, crunchy but not quite fresh-tasting. 

Overall on the tacos: a little too au-naturel, no salsas or sauces drizzled on top, but lots of chopped lettuce, tomatoes, onions. A little too much of these raw veggies, so much that it hides the meat at first and tends to overpower the tacos. You have to add their free salsa, which is creamy and pretty spicy. Makes a world of difference.

* Triple Threat Burrito - 4 stars
pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/papalote-mexican-grill-san-francisco?select=wjDWHeUEau0cj063ExVBdw#_dyP1DyvOS9TPp_ljhC1lQ
Yes! So much good meat. Even better with their salsa drizzled on top.

excerpts: My Personal favorite is the fish tacos.
It comes with a medium tomato based hot sauce.
It is so popular they are now selling it at the super markets.
The burritos are also very good.
Parking is difficult but worth it.
fish.author: Kylie P.
fish.review: This place is great!!! Everything is fantastic. My Personal favorite is the fish tacos. It comes with a medium tomato based hot sauce. It is so popular they are now selling it at the super markets. The burritos are also very good. Parking is difficult but worth it.

excerpts: I tend to get the fish salad with cilantro dressing and my husband gets the chicken burrito and both are super delicious.
fish.author: Hello G.
fish.review: How does this not have a higher review? Their salsa alone should be a 5 star. The place is small but the food is consistently delicious. I love everything here from the burritos, plates, or salad. I tend to get the fish salad with cilantro dressing and my husband gets the chicken burrito and both are super delicious.

excerpts: I obsessed with the super fish burrito here.
For years now.
I get one every time I'm in the lower mission.
If you want a California-inspired uplift on the plentiful Mexican fare in the Mission, this is your place.
The dinning room is small so you might want to take your food to go.
fish.author: Jazmin H.
fish.review: I obsessed with the super fish burrito here. For years now. I get one every time I'm in the lower mission. If you want a California-inspired uplift on the plentiful Mexican fare in the Mission, this is your place. The dinning room is small so you might want to take your food to go.

excerpts: Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito.
I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid.
Burrito can't be beat!
Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!
fish.author: Suzanne P.
fish.review: This place is the reason that The Mission is famed for burritos! We stopped in on a Sunday evening, a little before your typical dinner rush. We were able to order quickly and got a small table with no wait. Go here with an appetite b/c no matter how much you want to stop eating, you just can't! We had the house made salsa (OMG! So good!), chicken and grilled veggie nachos (Again... OMG!) to start. Our entrees were the fish tacos and carne asada super burrito. I'm more of a fried fish taco person, but these were really solid. Burrito can't be beat! Will definitely come back on our next visit to the city!

excerpts: Someone else had the fish burrito bowl and it was fine.
The cashier didn't bother giving me a receipt and the restaurant has a very small seating area.
Overall, kinda disappointed.
fish.author: K. G.
fish.review: Based on other yelp reviews, I expected way better food.  The salsa wasn't what I expected, it was creamy, not chunky.  Adding sour cream, cheese and guacamole on my mexican /filipino burrito, the price came up quite a bit more compared to other mexican places.  Someone else had the fish burrito bowl and it was fine. The cashier didn't bother giving me a receipt and the restaurant has a very small seating area.  Overall, kinda disappointed.

excerpts: On this visit, my date had the fish tacos and was thoroughly please with her selection as well.
We will keep coming back.
See ya!
fish.author: Scott C.
fish.review: Second time here and both times the venue was selected by my dinner date as their respective favorite - so there is that. I am reasonably I had the super size buritto chicken mole the first time and I had it again on this visit. This is the best mole sauce I have ever had. BAM! Get it!!! Before digging into that bad boy, we shared a large chorizo con queso apetizer which comes with choice of hot tortilla or chips. If you use up the tortilla, they will give you chips - no losing there. On this visit, my date had the fish tacos and was thoroughly please with her selection as well. We will keep coming back. See ya!

excerpts:
I ordered the fish tacos & my boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito.  
Each order comes with side of tortilla chips & salsa. 
This salsa was DELICIOUS - very unique, not too spicy, not bland & very creamy. 
My fish tacos came out & they were amazing!
There were nicely cut chunks of fresh fish in there & they didn't skimp out at all. 
I have to say these fish tacos are the best that I've tried in SF thus far!
