fish.author: Sylvia N.
fish.review:
I can't believe it's taken me this long to try Papalote!

My boyfriend & I were craving really good salsa so I checked on Yelp & saw that I had bookmarked Papalote for years - perfect!
It was a beautiful day in San Francisco. 
We found parking almost immediately & was welcomed with upbeat Mexican music when we walked in. 
I ordered the fish tacos & my boyfriend ordered the carne asada burrito.  
Each order comes with side of tortilla chips & salsa. 
This salsa was DELICIOUS - very unique, not too spicy, not bland & very creamy. 
My boyfriend wished it had a little more tomato-ness to it, but I thought it was great.

My fish tacos came out & they were amazing!
There were nicely cut chunks of fresh fish in there & they didn't skimp out at all. 
I think they might put a TEENY bit too much shredded cheese but I guess it just depends on your taste. 
I have to say these fish tacos are the best that I've tried in SF thus far!

My boyfriend really enjoyed his burrito. 
I tried it out & I thought it had a really good grilled flavor to it. 
The meat was tender - not dry at all (which surprised me because it looks dry at first glance).  
The one thing I would say is that I think they put too much rice. 

Overall great experience at Papalote. 
As other reviewers have mentioned, it IS a bit pricey - so don't go in there thinking you'll have a cheap meal. 
We paid $23 for the tacos (which comes in two), the burrito, & one horchata.

excerpts: This place has the best fish burrito I've ever tasted!
A friend suggested this place before and my other friends
I crave the fish burrito sometimes because it's just THAT good.
fish.author: Vanessa M.
fish.review:
This place has the best fish burrito I've ever tasted! A friend suggested this place before and my other friends and I decided to give it a try because we were craving Mexican food, but wanted to try a new place. 

They're pretty pricey, but hey, it's good food! I crave the fish burrito sometimes because it's just THAT good.

excerpts: I got the fish burrito, very soggy and tasteless.
fish.author: Danielle S.
fish.review: If it weren't for the salsa this place wouldn't be good. I got the fish burrito, very soggy and tasteless.

excerpts: While I ordered a fish burrito, my colleagues were ordering almost every thing off the menu along with a couple rounds of beer.
The food here is relatively "clean," however c'mon
if you're in the Mission you want a REAL Mission burrito...
Btw, the salsa they provide is worth the visit and maybe can overlook the yuppie foods
I'd still come back.
fish.author: Tracy C.
fish.review: Came here for a work event recently. I'm talking 15 of us crammed in to Papalote during prime dinner hour. While I ordered a fish burrito, my colleagues were ordering almost every thing off the menu along with a couple rounds of beer. The food here is relatively "clean," however c'mon if you're in the Mission you want a REAL Mission burrito... Btw, the salsa they provide is worth the visit and maybe can overlook the yuppie foods... I'd still come back.

excerpts: The fish taco here is probably the best I've ever had.
maybe it's because they say they cook the fish in butter, but the flaky white fish is SO perfectly cooked, it just melts in your mouth.
My boyfriend
and I ordered some other meat taco
and it was also scrumptious, but paled in comparison to the fish.
fish.author: Kelsey H.
fish.review:
The fish taco here is probably the best I've ever had.

maybe it's because they say they cook the fish in butter, but the flaky white fish is SO perfectly cooked, it just melts in your mouth.  My boyfriend and I ordered some other meat taco and it was also scrumptious, but paled in comparison to the fish.

Also, the SALSA here is the BOMB!!!  I almost bought a jar but I was scared I'd drink it on the way home.  It's so creamy that you think there's dairy in it, but it's just oil (no dairy!  so it might even be vegan..)

They could definitely charge boatloads more for their food.  Now I just need to find a way to sneak back on a taco gorge...

excerpts: The shrimp tacos were delicious but the fish tacos could have been better.
The fish was a bit soggy.
fish.author: Aimee W.
fish.review: The shrimp tacos were delicious but the fish tacos could have been better. The fish was a bit soggy. Other than that I enjoyed the complementary chips and salsa and horchata!

excerpts: fish - lots of fish in each taco
and it adds to the taco when you take each bite.
you don't have to search for where each piece of fish is cuz it's in your mouth every time you take a bite!
fish.author: Kapo T.
fish.review:
not a big burrito fan, coming here, i ordered the tacos. i shared two orders with a friend so we can each try different ones. 

prawn - not much prawn (maybe 3 in each taco?)  but the flavor on the prawn was all there. it didn't add much to the taco. can skip next time. 

fish - lots of fish in each taco and it adds to the taco when you take each bite. you don't have to search for where each piece of fish is cuz it's in your mouth every time you take a bite! will definitely order this again next time i am here! 

salsa - my friend comes here for salsa and make sure she gets extra. i can see why. the salsa is available for purchase by jar also. this salsa has enough kick in spiciness and it's more blended than chunks of tomatoes, etc. Maybe i'll buy a jar next time so i can enjoy it at home! 

Will definitely try other tacos next time around!

excerpts: I had to ask for another bowl to fish out the salad, which was of course still drenched.
fish.author: Jessica F.
fish.review:
Maybe they're losing their touch? Went in today and ordered a salad with the tofu mole. As a vegetarian, I get excited for veg mole dishes! Well...I got mole, all right. I really should've taken a picture, but suffice to say my salad was absolutely soupy with the sauce. I had to ask for another bowl to fish out the salad, which was of course still drenched. I could have drank the mole left in the old bowl. But I didn't. Because it wasn't particularly flavorful, unfortunately.

Of course the cashier knew why I'd asked for the new bowl, but I figured I'd just say something after. I ate it because I didn't want to waste, but I thought it would be worth letting them know that someone had a bit of a heavy sauce hand. All I got was kickback, even as I pointed to my bowl of mole soup that the busser walked by with. First, I was told what it was. Like telling me it's mole explains the mess. Then it was that nobody else had a problem with it. Like it might not have been an accident/new guy dumping the sauce on? Like they'd pour that much sauce in a burrito-??!!

I hate crappy service even more than I hate bland mole soup.

excerpts: The ingredients in my fish tacos seemed fresh and were delicious, the chips were - within acceptable parameters of crunchiness, thiness, and tastiness - but like myself and seemingly everyone else has already said - this place is all about the salsa.
fish.author: Oleg H.
fish.review:
DAT SAUCE!!!


A hip mission spot featuring ok food, and excellent EXCELLENT SALSA. The ingredients in my fish tacos seemed fresh and were delicious, the chips were - within acceptable parameters of crunchiness, thiness, and tastiness - but like myself and seemingly everyone else has already said - this place is all about the salsa.

excerpts: She mentioned Papalote and I had heard it of it, plus she recommended the fish burrito -
I was totally intrigued so I wandered over.
I decided to get one to eat there and one to go to take home for my bf to try.
The burrito was big, and packed with black beans, tomatoes, fish, etc.
- yum!!
I could only eat half of it
so I went home with 1-1/2 fish burritos for me and my bf to share, plus more of those yummy chips and *salsa*!
Either way, we are definitely going to go back to have more fish burritos and to try their other items.
Gracias!!
fish.author: Maile N.
fish.review:
***500th review written by Maile N***

:)  YUM!!  I was in the area and asked my facialist for lunch recommendations nearby after my appointment.  She mentioned Papalote and I had heard it of it, plus she recommended the fish burrito - I was totally intrigued so I wandered over.  I decided to get one to eat there and one to go to take home for my bf to try.  I had a feeling he would totally love me for it!  

I got a Mexican Coke - love!!  The chips and that salsa they bring over (and they also pack it in your to-go order) ROCKS!!!   I'm not sure what's in it, tomatoes, other vegetables mixed in and spices all blended together.  They should bottle it and sell it because I want more!!  The burrito was big, and packed with black beans, tomatoes, fish, etc. - yum!!  I could only eat half of it so I went home with 1-1/2 fish burritos for me and my bf to share, plus more of those yummy chips and *salsa*!  We sure enjoyed our burrito, chips and salsa!!  

We live clear across town from the Mission location and really wish a Papalote was closer - maybe the other location is closer.  Either way, we are definitely going to go back to have more fish burritos and to try their other items.  Gracias!!

excerpts: I arrived and got out my eleven bucks for the fish
burrito
I ordered.
Eleven bucks, I think, is a high-end burrito.
But I get it, good quality fish is expensive.
Are you farming that fish in an urban aquacultural environment on the premises?
Because THAT would be badass.
fish.author: X-topher B.
fish.review:
BUMMER.  This was formerly a 5-star rating, holding strong for years.  How could they fall so far so fast, you ask?  Has the food changed?  Nope, it's equally bomb.  Well then what the...?!  Well, having (had) Papalote on speed dial, I called in a burrito on my way to the park.  I arrived and got out my eleven bucks for the fish burrito I ordered.  Eleven bucks, I think, is a high-end burrito.  But I get it, good quality fish is expensive.  

Cashier:  "That'll be fourteen dollars please."  
Me:  "Oh, no I just ordered one burrito." 
Cashier:  "Our prices went up; it's fourteen dollars."

FOURTEEN DOLLARS FOR A BURRITO?!  

We've been in an open relationship for 6+ years, San Francisco, and I've grown beautifully with you. But fourteen dollaz for a burrito? Baby I feel like I don't know you anymore.  

Are you farming that fish in an urban aquacultural environment on the premises?  Because THAT would be badass.  That I would pay fourteen dollars for.  

Otherwise, you just lost a long-time customer, Papalote.  Dude, I didn't even get it super.

excerpts: The Super Fish Tacos are so fresh and tasty.
fish.author: Luis D.
fish.review:
Lets pretend for a second that astoundoing and delicious had intercourse. Then you know what Papalote is- as-licious! 

The Super Fish Tacos are so fresh and tasty.

The staff is nice, and the food came out fast enough too. A pretty darn good spot.

excerpts: Really tasty fish burrito with fresh grilled fish.
fish.author: Jingo Django J.
fish.review:
Really tasty fish burrito with fresh grilled fish. 

Try the Mexipino burrito- Filipino-Mex burrito

excerpts: Lol I've had their fish burrito and mmm mmm!!!
fish.author: Julia C.
fish.review:
Doooood!!! I can't believe I forgot to rate this place. Smh this spot is the bomb! 

Although I haven't been in a while, I do often catch myself thinking of your luscious burritos. Lol I've had their fish burrito and mmm mmm!!! 

If you're looking for a taqueria in the mission, you'll notice that they come dime a dozen. Unfortunately, not all of them are any good. 

Papalote is great for several reasons. For one- the owner is super cool. Papalote is one of the only businesses in the community, where the owners actually make appearances lol 
Two- they make amazing food. Prepared with some culinary pride.
Three- THEY ARE CLEAN! I can't tell you how many dirty taquerias their are in the mish. 

Papalote not only has great food, but an awesome ambiance and nice staff. Check em out! It's worth it. :)

excerpts: I used to live across the street and would eat Papalote at least 2-3x times a week (super fish burrito with extra guacamole) and it was by far my favorite go-to burrito place.
Recently however, it seems as though they've changed their recipes.
fish.author: Jahan D.
fish.review:
I used to live across the street and would eat Papalote at least 2-3x times a week (super fish burrito with extra guacamole) and it was by far my favorite go-to burrito place. Recently however, it seems as though they've changed their recipes. Not sure if anyone else has noticed but their seasonings taste off and not as good as before and the ratio between beans, meat, and sauce is not quite right.

Scrolling through the recent Yelp reviews it looks like other long time customers have noticed the same drop in quality.

excerpts: I came here with my husband and ordered the fish tacos.
The place is small and seating is limited.
Everything was fresh and well seasoned.
I love that they give you chips and a side of salsa.
But if you want more salsa, they do charge you extra.
fish.author: Kim C.
fish.review:
I first heard of this place when my friend brought their salsa to a potluck, and I was hooked. If I could drink it, I would, but alas my waistline would not thank me for it. 

I came here with my husband and ordered the fish tacos. The place is small and seating is limited. Everything was fresh and well seasoned. I love that they give you chips and a side of salsa. But if you want more salsa, they do charge you extra.

excerpts: I also ordered two fish tacos.
They were massive!
fish.author: Julie J.
fish.review:
Busy on a Wednesday, so I assume it is always busy! Beer only. 

We ordered the Chorizo con Queso to start! AMAZING...a must try! This dish comes with a lot of cheese melted on top of well marinated, spicy and juicy chorizo.  It was exceptional. 

The chips come salty, warm and crispy. It doesn't get better than that! 

I also ordered two fish tacos. They were massive! The flavor was subtle but fresh. 

Wished  I lived closer becuase I would come here more often!

excerpts: I recommend this restaurant and my favorite dish is the fish Pescado  which is a fried fish
I think the fried in butter and make fish tacos out of it a burrito and spectacular I would definitely recommend that
and you have to try the hot sauce
it's a tomato-based hot sauce that is unbelievable
fish.author: Louise M.
fish.review: I recommend this restaurant and my favorite dish is the fish Pescado  which is a fried fish I think the fried in butter and make fish tacos out of it a burrito and spectacular I would definitely recommend that and you have to try the hot sauce it's a tomato-based hot sauce that is unbelievable

excerpts: Also, their fish is buttery and scrumptious and their burritos make me hate burritos less.
fish.author: Christina S.
fish.review:
What can I say that hasn't already been said? Well, "I could drink a bathtub full of their trademark salsa" may not be original, but that doesn't make it less true.

Also, their fish is buttery and scrumptious and their burritos make me hate burritos less.

excerpts: They had fish and I had veggie.
We all thought the food was fresh and excellent.
Amazing.
And no lard or animal fats in anything, I really trust them.
fish.author: Cynthia B.
fish.review:
I went here yesterday with my mom and aunt for the first time.  We all got burritos.  They had fish and I had veggie.  We all thought the food was fresh and excellent.  Amazing.  And no lard or animal fats in anything, I really trust them.  The place was super busy, but had a fun vibe to it.  

So why only 4 stars?  We all agreed that we thought the prices were too high.  but then again, if I was the owner of a place that was that popular I would raise the prices too.  So I will go back here anytime, food was great.  But only if I don't have to pay.

excerpts: My two lunch friends had the pork chile verde tacos and the fish burrito.
The tacos looked good, but seemed to be piled high with garnish which seemed a little weird.
If I order the tacos in future, I'll get them with just meat and tortilla.
The fish burrito looked like a winner and my friend swears by it, so I'm either getting that next time or trying the machaca which is hard to find in the Bay Area!
fish.author: Jason W.
fish.review:
Oh man, that orange salsa.... SO GOOD! I buy it by the jarful at Whole Foods and dump it on everything at home. Sure it's expensive, but it's way better than Frontera or any of that other hoity-toity stuff that tries to pass for gourmet salsa. Based on the quality of their salsa, I was very excited to try the Papalote restaurant in the Mission today!

Papalote is a small restaurant on a largely residential block of 24th street. It's conveniently located a couple of blocks from the 24th & Mission BART stop and also a block away from a good friend's house. If I'd known it was this close, I would have gone numerous times already! Inside the restaurant are a handful of tables next to a large window which offers a good people watching view of the street outside. You order at the counter up front and then take a number and sit down.

I ordered a carne asada burrito with beans and rice. The burrito was about average in size, but that's ok because I don't like overeating these days. The contents were very tasty with plenty of grilled beef and flavorful rice and beans. I only had one funny bit of gristle in the burrito, so I would call that a rousing success for the Bay Area. They also give you tasty chips and a cup of their salsa before the meal. HOWEVER, if you want more salsa to go with your meal, it costs an additional fifty cents for each refill. WTF?! Most places load you up on salsa without an additional charge. This is something they really should consider since it seems a little chintzy of them.

My two lunch friends had the pork chile verde tacos and the fish burrito. The tacos looked good, but seemed to be piled high with garnish which seemed a little weird. If I order the tacos in future, I'll get them with just meat and tortilla. The fish burrito looked like a winner and my friend swears by it, so I'm either getting that next time or trying the machaca which is hard to find in the Bay Area!

Papalote is a very clean, stylish restaurant. Food gets delivered quickly and the staff are all super nice. I'll definitely come back again, but maybe I'll bring my own Papalote salsa from home if they're going to charge me for salsa!

excerpts: All I can say it Fish Tacos!!!
fish.author: Rondi J.
fish.review:
All I can say it Fish Tacos!!!

Wow they were amazing. The sauce is pretty good too. I am not one for big burritos and such but looking at peoples plates they looked like a handful. Unfortunately, I went on the day that they closed the street down, I think Sunday at 12. 

Great food. Go there.

excerpts: White fish tacos...will simply put; blend, no seasoned and not worthy the high pricey tag!
The only bright side is; they have great friendly customer service.
Anyhow!
I'm Walking to La Taqueria now to get the real deal!
Yay
fish.author: Sabrina B.
fish.review: Average and expensive burrito, no flavorful nor traditional like La Taqueria on mission st. Found a whole side of avocado inside steak burrito, oddly enough it was not ripe and impossible to bite or cut with knife as it was very hard. Lots of rice and beans but not a fair amount of meat, which was also prepared in a way that it dry out, taking away flavor and texture. White fish tacos...will simply put; blend, no seasoned and not worthy the high pricey tag!  The only bright side is; they have great friendly customer service. Anyhow! I'm Walking to La Taqueria now to get the real deal! Yay

excerpts: Fish burrito is delicious, not fried or breaded.
fish.author: Daniel C.
fish.review:
Can I have that salsa with every meal I have? It's smoky, got a kick but not too much, full flavor on the tongue. The food doesn't come out right away, but that's because they're making your burrito fresh to go. Fish burrito is delicious, not fried or breaded.

I'm not sure about the 1 tortilla per taco as said by other reviewers but if so, I agree with the atrocity. 2 tortillas man!!

excerpts: FISH TACOS (2 for $6.75):
Generous mound of grilled fish, chopped romaine, tomatoes, onions, & famous salsa--best grilled fish tacos so far!
til then, I'll stick to my fish tacos & salsa!
fish.author: Amy K.
fish.review:
OVERALL: 3.9

FOOD: 4
SERVICE: 4
AMBIANCE: 4
VALUE: 3.5

Got me a seat on the Throw-Down bandwagon, and it was glorious.

Didn't know about the Triple Threat bomb of a burrito--all I knew was Bobby got flayed, so I had to check it out for myself.  Definitely a more Americanized & polished taqueria...I'd say along the lines of In-n-Out of burritos, but edgier.  Cool urban artwork, bright walls, ornate kites strung up on the ceilings...fun & festive.

Menu is gringo-friendly with very standard and less adventurous options (i.e., no lengua or other head-parts)....and DELICIOUS.  Sure, it may not be so-called authentic, but it's definitely its own unique brand of Mexican flavor...your mouth and belly will know when it's Papalote, and they'll thank you.

FISH TACOS (2 for $6.75): Generous mound of grilled fish, chopped romaine, tomatoes, onions, & famous salsa--best grilled fish tacos so far!  Super fresh!

CHICKEN QUESADILLA ($7.25): Chicken reminded me of tandoori (vibrant red color, dry-ish but still moist & tender), and was the saving grace of an otherwise lopsided quesadilla....jicama salad/salsa was also a nice addition, though the portion was barely a biteful.

Next time I have food-baby pangs, I just might consider the $19.95 Triple Threat....til then, I'll stick to my fish tacos & salsa!

excerpts: I've been hiding this place from all my friends just to make sure I don't have to wait in the line to get my favorite fish salad.
The salsa there is so delicious from day one that I have to get a bottle to keep at home from time to time!
Great place to go if you just want to have something simple, fresh and tasty!
A great place for budget eating!!
fish.author: Yina M.
fish.review: Oh I have a secret sin to confess! I've been hiding this place from all my friends just to make sure I don't have to wait in the line to get my favorite fish salad. The salsa there is so delicious from day one that I have to get a bottle to keep at home from time to time! Great place to go if you just want to have something simple, fresh and tasty! A great place for budget eating!!

excerpts: They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork
fish.author: Tiffany N.
fish.review:
THE CHIPS & SALSA - BOMB.COM!
When I first had it, I wasn't used to the fact that it wasn't chunky salsa but thennnn I tried it and the flavor just blew me away! It's SO good - I can't even describe it aside from the fact that it is spicy. Bottled sauce is available for purchase.

My go-to when I want a burrito WITHOUT feeling heavy/disgusting after
IE.) the "I should go and work out after eating this but really, I'm gonna take my lazy ass to sleep"

Anyways, on to the burritos -
Not the hugest I've seen (hahaha) but it's filling and ingredients taste fresh. Burritos avg around $7-9.

Chicken Adobo burrito is muy deliciouso - love the garlic rice in it that really adds a good hint of flavor. the adobo chicken is not as vinegary as authentic adobo but you can still taste it. 
Filipino inspire - It's a must try when ambitious to step outside of a carna asada burrito (there's nothing wrong because I like carna asada too!)

They also have variety of different burritos from tofu, veggie, shrimp, fish, beef, pork so you really do have A LOT to choose from. 

+Not your late night burrito joint - closes at 10pm!
+accepts credit card
+ small, colorful and clean eating area with cool local flyers for events around the Bay scattered everywhere

excerpts: Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp or fish
burrito/quesadilla here.
I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it.
It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned.
It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal.
That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.
fish.author: Alex O.
fish.review:
CILANTRO HATERS: This one gets complicated since they have it in their salsa and guac. I usually go for the super shrimp burrito with avocado instead of guac, and with the roasted salsa instead of pico de gallo. Yeah, I'm that annoying dude in front of you with an order like that. But seriously, you need to try this, and this is your ticket to happiness.

Do yourself a favor and get the shrimp or fish burrito/quesadilla here. I'm sure their steak and chicken are great or whatever, but if you don't get shrimp or fish, you are totally blowing it. It's the best in the city, as far as I'm concerned. It's cooked in this white wine and butter sauce that is just unreal. That, and if you can swap the roasted salsa in for the pico, you have now elevated your meal to divine status.

excerpts: The fish tacos were ok, bland and nothing special.

The best thing about this place was the salsa sauce and even that was only ok, in my mind 22 dollars is far to much for a one burrito and one order of fish tacos you can get better cheaper and more Mexican food pretty much anywhere in San Francisco.
Skip this place entirely.
fish.author: Charles W.
fish.review: Meh, is the best way to explain the food. The burrito was slightly below average in that it terribly wrapped and the insides were poorly distributed the flavor was ok and I really have no idea how this place has so many stars.  The fish tacos were ok, bland and nothing special. The best thing about this place was the salsa sauce and even that was only ok, in my mind 22 dollars is far to much for a one burrito and one order of fish tacos you can get better cheaper and more Mexican food pretty much anywhere in San Francisco. Skip this place entirely.

excerpts: On those rare times you have the space and minutes to sit down and dine in a civilized manner, the pollo al achiote and the fish tacos are the way to go.
fish.author: Tony B.
fish.review:
Love me my papalote and have for years. Particularly good are the carne asada super burrito (of course), the chicken mole, and when you're not needing to eat flesh, the soyrizo burrito super is super tasty. 

On those rare times you have the space and minutes to sit down and dine in a civilized manner, the pollo al achiote and the fish tacos are the way to go.

The salsa is so good I buy it in the fresh jars in their fridge and have it as an after-work snack with some local casa sanchez chips. 

I just wish they had a bigger space so it wasn't always so crowded! And I suspect their burritos have gotten slightly smaller in the 8 years I've been coming here.

excerpts: Fish tacos, +3.
I was trying to go to La Taqueria
but they were closed for winter cleaning.
I should've went to El Farolito instead.
fish.author: Spring L.
fish.review:
YELP. I am mad at you. 
Chips and dip, yeah okay.
Soyrizo Burrito, meh.
Fish tacos, +3. 
I was trying to go to La Taqueria but they were closed for winter cleaning. I should've went to El Farolito instead.

excerpts: Stan ordered the Fish tacos, Thomas and I ordered the crab special, and Monica opted for the chicken burrito.
fish.author: Chrysantha C.
fish.review:
"Good Friday" was definitely upgraded to "Amazing Friday" after I got my crack - I mean - Salsa fix at Papalate... but yo    it definitely didn't stop there!  Because of the Lenten season, (well I am assuming) they had a Dungeness Crab Enchilada special along with complimetary Sangria that I definitely could not turn down...

I spread the word and wether or not anyone wanted to tag along, I knew I was going to enjoy my lunch there REGARDLESS!  BUT I KNEW once I said FREE SANGRIA at least MONICA would be hooked! Monica, Stan, Thomas, and eventually Brian was sold on my advertisement and our Sunny Friday was set...

Stan ordered the Fish tacos, Thomas and I ordered the crab special, and Monica opted for the chicken burrito.  Everyone definitely agreed with me about the flavor, quality of fresh ingredients, and of course THE SALSA!

The sangria itself was delicious... being the "cheap date" that I am now, I was buzzing off of my first half glass... but it made my dining experience even better!

I really should have walked away with a bottle of salsa! ::kiking myself in the butt:: NOW!

There is nothing better than sharing amazing food with amazing friends!

excerpts: The quality of food was so so (fish taco too salty )  but the ladies at the front desk taking your order were far from being friendly,  borderline arrogant and rude
fish.author: M S.
fish.review: The quality of food was so so (fish taco too salty )  but the ladies at the front desk taking your order were far from being friendly,  borderline arrogant and rude

excerpts: Great place for burritos and fish tacos.
fish.author: Pico S.
fish.review:
Great place for burritos and fish tacos. Of course, the sauce is amazing along with the service.

The only knock against the place are the Prawn tacos. Unfortunately you get only two prawn per taco, so it's not going to take care of your hunger. Better off ordering the prawn burrito since the other fillings will ensure you're satisfied.

excerpts: I got the fish burrito most recently, and it was amazing.
fish.author: Anna K.
fish.review:
AH. SO GOOD!

I don't live in SF anymore, but when I come to visit, I love coming here. I got the fish burrito most recently, and it was amazing. Stuffed to the gills with guac, cheese, rice, and beans. Not only are their burritos enormous and filling, but they each come with an order of chips and salsa. And this salsa is some of the best salsa I've ever had: almost creamy in its texture, with a nice kick. 

And since Papalote's is located walking distance from Dolores Park, you  can grab your burrito, and then stroll over to Dolores Park and lounge in the (hopefully) sunny weather, watching the kids tumble on the newly-built jungle gym fantasy world, amidst the sunbathers and hipster locals. And then when you're done, (if you managed to finish this feast!) you can end your meal with a fresh ice cream cone from BiRite Creamery nearby. (I didn't finish my burrito, but it made a nice dinner for me later that day).

excerpts: I think I just had the best fish burrito ever here.....
fish.author: Jang David K.
fish.review:
El Farolito, move out the way.  Your PAPA is here to give you a smackdown on your burrito and show you how it is done.  People say this is one the best burrito place in northern california. i think so. 

free Chips and and homemade salsa=descent chips and AMAZING salsa.
Burrito=smoky/juicy chunks of carne asada. super flavorful.  all the ingredients are fresh.
I think I just had the best fish burrito ever here.....oh man.

it's a bit pricier than most burrito joints but huge portions make up for it.  4.5 stars for sure.

it's so good that sometimes, after a bite, i just want to get up and start shaking my body.  but then again, it may traumatize the people i'm eating with.

excerpts: your fish and prawn tacos, your mole sauce, your burritos...
fish.author: Peter S.
fish.review:
sadness...

I used to love you Papalote...you were cute, better than your average taqueria...your fish and prawn tacos, your mole sauce, your burritos...all had a little something extra, an attention to detail, maybe the fresh greens on the taco, the slices of radish, it was worth a couple extra bux.

But just like a good TV show, success has robbed you of everything that made you special.  Now all I see is:
-- OK Food, still good, but seems to have lost that something extra...no longer better than the cheaper taquerias one block away
--Crowded/long lines/noisy, people constantly standing around waiting, staring at you to finish so they can have your seat
--$$$ - No longer worth the extra few bucks

OH, and my tacos fell apart, they now use one corn tortilla instead of two - did that 2 cents per tortilla really save you that much money  Papalote? 
It pains me to see how success has ruined a formerly great little place.  I'll always remember you the way you were....sadness

excerpts: Niece had a pair of delicate Pescado (fish) taco.
The $5.95 meal comes delicate piece of buttered fish and salsa blanketed with a corn tortilla.
fish.author: Matt G.
fish.review:
Being single and poor, niece snuck up at Matt's worksite to gain access to his uncle's wallet and have a decent meal. Matt needs a niece-repellant spray or something.

We had a craving for a burrito, and many of the taquerias in the Mission district is crowded, in which it's no-brainer to figure out during noon. 

We landed at yuppie-like Papalote, and thank goodness, there wasn't much of a line. As we're waiting in line, Matt went to the beverage, which is located on the right side, and grabbed 2 glass bottles of Coke, this jerk right behind me and say,

"Hey buddy, you lost your space in the line. Go back to the very end." 

After the unnecessary remark, Matt retaliated and returned back with a dirty look at him. You can tell easily that the Yuppie neighborhood didn't favor us. 

Matt ordered the Chili Verde (pork w/ green Serrano Sauce) Super Burrito. The $6.50 Super silver-bullet had choice of beans, sour-cream, cheese, salsa and guacamole. Most of the burritos are wrapped in aluminum foil, but since we ate in, the burrito was loose and placed on a plate. So Matt had to eat the wrapped boy with a fork and knife, like a sophisticated yuppie. 

Niece had a pair of delicate Pescado (fish) taco. The $5.95 meal comes delicate piece of buttered fish and salsa blanketed with a corn tortilla. She was so hungry, that she devoured the pair in record time and beating his uncle.

Our meal comes with complimentary Tortilla chip, which tasted exactly like Doritos.  

We were seated at bar-stool near the public lavatory on the left of the restaurant. As we're resting after a hearty meal, a lady finished her #2 and left her massive stench of odor over the entire restaurant and ruining ours and most of the patron's appetite.  

We had a good meal, depsite overcoming what happened in the beginning and the end.

excerpts: Grilled fish, shrimp and chicken were our choice
and we were delighted with the results.
fish.author: Lynn S.
fish.review:
This storefront could be mistaken for a dive...delightfully, it is anything but.  Wonderful burritos, tacos and quesadillas with fresh, fresh, fresh ingredients are here in a simple store front with limited seating in the middle of a neighborhood where only authentic Mexican food can survive.  Grilled fish, shrimp and chicken were our choice and we were delighted with the results. I was sorry the salsa wasn't filled with tomato pieces instead of  simply a thick sauce, but nonetheless it was spicy and tasty.

This is another example of what the Mission does best, present ethnic cuisine without frills or fuss at a reasonable price.

Order at the front counter and they will bring your food  to the table when it is ready. (Try not to notice that no one wiped down the table after the last customer....he didn't leave any crumbs anyway). Think of  a visit here as a cultural immersion experience and take note of the colorful photographs on the cheerful, red walls.

excerpts: My friend digs the fish burrito
so I tried it
and it was pretty less than average.
Lack of flavor for me doesn't designate good food..
fish.author: Mitch A.
fish.review: Really don't understand why people dig this place.  My friend digs the fish burrito so I tried it and it was pretty less than average.   Lack of flavor for me doesn't designate good food..

excerpts: We sipped from the same bottle of Mexican Coke between bites of notable fish tacos.
fish.author: Mandy H.
fish.review:
You were right, the salsa is peerless.

I saw an ex-coworker from Palo Alto and her surgeon fiancee. We hugged. Then I returned to my date. We sipped from the same bottle of Mexican Coke between bites of notable fish tacos.

excerpts: Also tried their fish taco and that was not bad, but not awesome either.
Think I'll stick to El Farolito to supply my burrito fix.
fish.author: AhLin C.
fish.review:
The sauce/salsa is great.  Everything else in my Carne Asada Super Burrito was just ok.  One thing was that the avocado and sour cream was not evenly spread out in the burrito.  Also, not enough sour cream.. tsk tsk.. 

Anyway, the wait for a table can get quite long.   Not sure if it's worth the wait and price.  
Also tried their fish taco and that was not bad, but not awesome either. Think I'll stick to El Farolito to supply my burrito fix.

excerpts: The freshest and tastiest fish taco that I've had in my life!
Don't bother with the rest of the stuff.
fish.author: Javi V.
fish.review:
Wow!!!! The freshest and tastiest fish taco that I've had in my life! Don't bother with the rest of the stuff. F-I-S-H T-A-C-O

Got it :) ???

excerpts: I think I had a fish burrito
and he had pork.
In general I don't have chips when I go to a cheap Mexican place because most of the chips are recycled and other people might have touched them.
I know it's weird
but unless I am starving I do not go for the chips.
fish.author: Pinky And The B.
fish.review:
I was thrilled to try a burrito in the Mission district. The burrito itself didn't thrill me but it was good probably better than I have had anywhere else.  I am not a huge burrito fan but can enjoy them from time to time. 
I think I had a fish burrito and he had pork. 
In general I don't have chips when I go to a cheap Mexican place because most of the chips are recycled and other people might have touched them. I know it's weird but unless I am starving I do not go for the chips. So my husband said the chips and salsa were good. 
Fortunately for us there was no wait. None at all. We were the first people there when they opened. We actually got there before the place opened. So no complaints on a wait from me. 
I think it's one of those things you have to do when in San Fransisco go to the Mission district for  a burrito. I did so I can take it off my bucket list now. :)

excerpts: Once, my friend ordered two fish tacos and another friend ordered the nachos supreme.
The tacos were soggy
so it was difficult for my friend to enjoy them the way that is normally enjoyed, but the nachos were great!
fish.author: Reb R.
fish.review:
As a San Francisco native, their burrito is on point.  Especially that orange sauce that they give you with your chips!  Drizzle that all over your burrito and call it a day.  

I come here often with friends and family.  Once, my friend ordered two fish tacos and another friend ordered the nachos supreme.  The tacos were soggy so it was difficult for my friend to enjoy them the way that is normally enjoyed, but the nachos were great!  They do not serve the agua fresca that I love, but their Horchata is still comparable. 

Seating here is given to those who order first on a busy night.  I noticed that someone was kicked off their table before they had ordered, so definitely take note of that!

excerpts: The best thing by far is the fish, in any form.
The white wine and butter sauce is exquisite, and the fish is extremely moist and tender.
fish.author: Solomon W.
fish.review:
Yes, I took friends here just because I saw it on Throwdown.  I knew I had to get the salsa here, but we also tried some of their various dishes.  This place is cool for not over-advertising their fame, and also keeping their restaurant very local and quaint.  We had to wait a few minutes to even sit down for some quick-paced Mexican grub.

The food here is served in large portions, but the prices are quite up there.  They are known for their sun-dried tomato salsa, but it is somewhat one-dimensional in my opinion.  It lacks the freshness of salsa (they sell it by the bottle), and it has too much American jazziness to it.

The best thing by far is the fish, in any form.  The white wine and butter sauce is exquisite, and the fish is extremely moist and tender.  The quesadilla option is a bit pricey, though.

The chicken mole kind of stunk.  The sauce was pretty heavy on the sweetness; it could have used more chiles.  The chicken was not super moist, and it was $13.  The chicken burrito was a bit dry, but the chile verde pork was better.  The CV had a tangy, hearty sauce that paired well with the tender pork.

There is nothing to really rave about here, but I guess it is worth a shot if you are into unique salsas and stuff.  The food is a little pricier than normal, but it does the job, and there are offerings to satisfy everyone.

excerpts: I had a fish burrito.
It was tasty but not enough fish.
Had to take several bites to find the fish.
The biggest set back for me was the price.
$14 for a burrito with just a little fish is waaay too much for me.
They also need to work on a better system to take orders and deliver better service.
fish.author: sumaya g.
fish.review: I had a fish burrito. It was tasty but not enough fish. Had to take several bites to find the fish. The biggest set back for me was the price. $14 for a burrito with just a little fish is waaay too much for me. They also need to work on a better system to take orders and deliver better service.

excerpts: Once seated, we just paid $30 for a plate of fish tacos and a beef/chicken burrito, with a beer and a diet coke.
Examining the receipt, it became clear that we had been charged for fish tacos, a beef burrito AND a chicken burrito.
I tried the fish taco - and the fish was fresh and not deep-fried, the lettuce was crisp - but the cheese, as much as I tried to take it all off, ruined it for me.

Coincidentally - upon arriving home later in the evening, the very episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay" came on TV and I watched it with the remnants of Papalote's burrito and fish taco in my stomach.
fish.author: Grace K.
fish.review:
Give me a break!

On a perfectly nice Sunday - we were chilling out at Revolution Cafe w/ some beers indulging in nice conversation, a great live band, and "people-watching" the most interesting, odd folks who thought it normal to shush people at a cafe.  The three of us all being foodies - talk of food was inevitable as dinner time approached us.

JB mentioned a burrito place that had recently been featured on "Throwdown with Bobby Flay".  Now, I like Bobby as a person more than a chef, and I do enjoy this show from time to time but I had missed this episode.  But my interest was piqued in learning that Bobby had lost to the "triple threat burrito" at Papalote, so we started walking to check the place out for dinner.

Well, as we expected, there was a massive line of people wanting to try the place that had beaten the Iron Chef.  As it turned out, there were more people waiting for their placed order than wanting to order, so we were able to squeeze right through to the counter.

All three of us wanted the Triple Threat.  
All three of us gawked at the price: $20.

TWENTY DOLLARS?
The first natural question was: how big is it?
Answer:  same size as the other burritos... that average out at about $7.50 in cost.

*(looking around the room to make sure I'm on earth)*

ON WHAT PLANET DOES THAT MAKE SENSE?????????

Same size - 1/3 portion of beef, chicken and shrimp....
Almost 3X in cost.

FOR WHAT?

Forget that!  Do I have "IDIOT" written on my forehead?

We scored seating in the restaurant within 10 minutes, and that was good since our wait for the regular burritos would be over 30 minutes.

Once seated, we just paid $30 for a plate of fish tacos and a beef/chicken burrito, with a beer and a diet coke.  Examining the receipt, it became clear that we had been charged for fish tacos, a beef burrito AND a chicken burrito.

(Annoying.)

The chips were decent, and their "special secret sauce" (salsa) was pretty good in concept but overly salted, and not quite what *I* want from "salsa".  Nonetheless, it was tasty.

The burritos arrive.
Regular size.
I was SO not a fan of the Monterey Jack cheese - in cold state, not melted - that they sprinkle on everything.  Yuck.  Took a bite of the chicken/beef burrito - and the only noteworthy thing was the chicken was well marinaded/seasoned.  The rest?  Unimpressive.  Overall, for the burrito, I'd have given it three stars.

I tried the fish taco - and the fish was fresh and not deep-fried, the lettuce was crisp - but the cheese, as much as I tried to take it all off, ruined it for me.  If I had asked for no cheese - I would have given it three stars too.

There's a MUCH better burrito to be had at El Metate for a fraction of the cost and even better ambiance with better drinks and service, too.  ($5 for a burrito there - try it!)

The experience of eating at Papalote, due to the hype, was worth it.  The company made the whole night fun.  Perhaps, if we had been insane enough to splurge $20 to eat a burrito - my assessment would be higher.  But for a $20 burrito, I expect it to give me wings, and based on other reviews - nobody sprouted wings and took off.  It's unfortunate for the owners as they'd be making a WHOLE lot more money off the recent coverage if they charged $10 for the Triple Threat instead of attempting to price gouge their customers for $20.  Whatever number of Triple Threats they are selling right now for $20, they could sell 10X that amount had they charged $10.  Do the math.

Coincidentally - upon arriving home later in the evening, the very episode of "Throwdown w/ Bobby Flay" came on TV and I watched it with the remnants of Papalote's burrito and fish taco in my stomach.

Bobby was as cute as ever, and based on ingredients alone, I'd have preferred his "green burrito".  That said, the two brothers were funny and seemed like nice guys.

They just happen to be out of their freakin' minds.

$20 for a BURRITO?
That's just insulting.

excerpts: I ordered the fish tacos and they were alright.
Nothing special.
fish.author: Stacey B.
fish.review:
Came here after my husband saw Throw Down With Bobby Flay.  I'm a Bobby Flay fan and we were kind of having a fun "food network" adventure during our weekend in SF.

How did my Bobby Flay lose, I'll never know...

My husband got the triple threat burrito.  Most of the carne asada had to be spit out due to the gristle and the 3 prawns inside were over cooked and chewy.  The chicken, however, had a great flavor and left us wishing we'd just gotten the chicken burrito.  However, we were essentially there to try this particular burrito.

I ordered the fish tacos and they were alright.  Nothing special.  Oh well.

The chips were good and the salsa was fantastic.  The salsa was the only impressive thing about the place.  

If you decide to try Papalote, don't waste your time with the triple threat.  It's over-priced and over-rated.

excerpts: The boy toy and I  tried the fish tacos once
and I recommend NOT getting them.
They were not good.
fish.author: Julie S.
fish.review:
I am upgrading my review to a 4 1/2 for Papalote!

I've been back to Papalote a number of times since my first review.  And when I say a number of times, I mean like once a week.  I seriously crave the stuff.  

My favorites are the soy chorizo burrito (don't forget to make it a super burrito!) and the soy chorizo tacos.  I LOVE soy chorizo and Papalote incorporates it so well into its food.  The soy chorizo burrito and the soy chorizo tacos are positively bursting with flavor and I savor every last bite every time I go.  

The boy toy and I  tried the fish tacos once and I recommend NOT getting them.  They were not good.  Totally bland.

Other friends I have been with have tried the tofu in their tacos and burritos and really like it.  I've had a bite and it tastes like paneer.  Pretty damn good, but I'm not willing to cheat on soy chorizo for a cheap fling with the tofu.  I would love to try some of the other vegetarian options as well - Papalote has a ton!

Definitely come to Papalote if you want some delicious Mex food in the Mission.

excerpts: The cheesy fish quesadilla revisits me in my dreams sometimes
and I'm a fan of the sauce.
If you're going to Papalote, send me a fish quesadilla please.
fish.author: Ricky H.
fish.review:
Cheesy cheesy goodness...

The cheesy fish quesadilla revisits me in my dreams sometimes and I'm a fan of the sauce. Although I don't see what all the fuss is about it is still really good. 

The burritos were pleasing, not too fancy. 
The chicken mole was whack... avoid it. 

If you're going to Papalote, send me a fish quesadilla please.

excerpts: Their fish quesadilla is pretty delicious, insanely buttery and cheesy, i.e. kinda greasy if you're into health (but why are you having a quesadilla in the first place then?).
The fish reminded me of French food with all that butter-y tenderness.
fish.author: Jen Y.
fish.review:
The Mexican fare here definitely feels different, maybe more upscale? Well it's definitely more expensive, but the food is delicious. I recently got one of their breakfast plates and it was huge, reminded me of Chevy's/Tex-Mex almost, and delicious. Their fish quesadilla is pretty delicious, insanely buttery and cheesy, i.e. kinda greasy if you're into health (but why are you having a quesadilla in the first place then?). The fish reminded me of French food with all that butter-y tenderness.  

As for minuses, again price-y, but it seems like most Mexican places in the Mission have raised their prices. Their tacos and burritos are so-so, a bit bland. They are stingy with their chips and especially their tasty salsa now that they've started selling it in jars.

excerpts: I always get the Fish Burrito with everything.
Hello!
Sauted in Wine?
fish.author: Mark B.
fish.review:
The BEST burrito in CA in my experience.  I've had a lot of burritos in TX and CA and everyone is entitled to their opinion.  IMHO this is the #1.  

I always get the Fish Burrito with everything.  Hello!  Sauted in Wine?  How tasty is that?  

And REAL HOMEMADE Horchata!!!!!  Gotta love it.  

Finally, the salsa with the chips is worth coming in for alone.  Creamy!  Who whudda thunk?  So tasty.

excerpts: I enjoyed my fish taco
but I have a hard time giving it 4 stars.
fish.author: Nicole W.
fish.review: Good food, great salsa and chips.  The price seemed a little high considering there are about a thousand great taco/burrito places within a mile of here.  I enjoyed my fish taco but I have a hard time giving it 4 stars.  My boyfriend said his carne asada burrito was good but he liked El Faro/El Farolito better and its $3 cheaper.   Overall a good place to eat but I think there are other places just as good and a little cheaper just down 24th.

excerpts: One day I'll return to try their fish burrito.
Sauteed in white wine and butter?
In a burrito?
I am skeptical as to the taste (white wine flavor in a burrito?) but intrigued.
fish.author: Amy N.
fish.review:
I ordered the Adobo burrito (off menu). It's mildly-spiced chicken, rice, and tomatoes (no beans). I was expecting something more vinegar-y, more reminiscent of Filipino food, but it was just OK. I wanted the flavor to be more pronounced.

The mole burrito was pretty tasty, but somehow I thought it would taste stronger. It wasn't bland, just milder than I expected.

The salsa was excellent, though.

I wanted to get the triple threat burrito (with shrimp, chicken, and steak), but $20 for a burrito was more than I was willing to spend.

One day I'll return to try their fish burrito. Sauteed in white wine and butter? In a burrito? I am skeptical as to the taste (white wine flavor in a burrito?) but intrigued.

excerpts: I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.
YUMMMY fish!
Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.
Ok on the chicken mole.
I love that place.
Ok on the chicken mole.
I love that place.
fish.author: Anna C.
fish.review:
I recently moved to Bernal Heights and walk through the Mission everyday to get to and from BART.  The smell of grilled meats is enough to make me want to try every single mexican restaurant in the mission.  

I had the chicken mole tacos and fish tacos here.  YUMMMY fish!  Fresh and in my opinion, even better than Maya's.  Ok on the chicken mole. I love that place.  Looking forward to going back to try their carne asada and others.

excerpts: Finally a mexican joint that does fish burritos in the City.
Seriously,i've searched high and low throughout SF to find a place that can make fish burritos decently.
Nick's tacos off of irving?
Forget it.
Dry, puny burritos there.
The fish burrito is what I loved tho they lose 1 star because they overpacked it and the burrito fell apart after 2 bites needing fork and knife.
A burrito is a handheld affair.
Giant though with the flour tortilla nice and warm.
Big chunks of fish which I dunno why, is sauteed in butter and wine per their menu.
Finally found my fish burriot go to place.
And open 7 days a week!
nice.
fish.author: Bill N.
fish.review:
Finally a mexican joint that does fish burritos in the City. 

Seriously,i've searched high and low throughout SF to find a place that can make fish burritos decently. Nick's tacos off of irving? Forget it. Dry, puny burritos there. I've had to drive to San Carlos to Baja Fresh for my fix.  

Parking is iffy in that crowded neighborhood. Soon as you walk in you're at the cashier/order taker. Smiles and greetings. Gf ordered the pork burrito and myself pescado burrito with sour cream, guac and rice on. 

Seating's a bitch if it's rush hour so plan on coming right as they open or after lunch rush. We sat and immediately served chips with their famous salsa. Really good and the right heat to it. GF said it was too spicy. 

The fish burrito is what I loved tho they lose 1 star because they overpacked it and the burrito fell apart after 2 bites needing fork and knife. A burrito is a handheld affair. Giant though with the flour tortilla nice and warm. Big chunks of fish which I dunno why, is sauteed in butter and wine per their menu. Grilled would've been tastier and added an extra dimension. 

Finally found my fish burriot go to place. And open 7 days a week! nice.

excerpts: Wow, World class burritos, Fish tacos are old of this world.
I highly reccomend
fish.author: Candi G.
fish.review:
Wow, World class burritos, Fish tacos are old of this world.
  I highly reccomend

excerpts: We had a super fish burrito, two carne asada tacos, and two beers.
fish.author: Lucius M.
fish.review:
I don't want to get hung up on money, but we went to Papalote for dinner last night and spent $30!  That's a ton of money at a Mexican joint.  I was shocked when the guy at the cash register told me the amount we owed.  We had a super fish burrito, two carne asada tacos, and two beers.  It should be noted that the menu prices listed on the photo at this time on Yelp are really out of date.

As for the food, it was really good.  Unique, tasty sauce for the chips is a great way to start the dinner and everyone gets their own bowl of chips.  Because it's a smaller space, it can get packed quickly.

excerpts:
Here are my findings:

+1 for the delish salsa they bring while you wait at a table
+1 for the giant, tasty fish tacos.
fish.author: Mari C.
fish.review:
So this is one of those rare reviews that was held back until I had returned 5-10x for further research.  Here are my findings:

+1 for the delish salsa they bring while you wait at a table
+1 for the giant, tasty fish tacos.  They're all I ever get.
+1 for being pretty affordable
+1 for not being greasy like all the other burrito joints around here.
-2 for the crowds.  Sometimes you have to hover over (i.e. sit on)  people who are half-finished with their meal to ensure you get a table when your food is ready.  If you don't sit on them, someone else will.
+1 for having strangers sit on your lap while you eat your food.

Now I know what you're thinking:
"But Mari C, that math jus' don't add up... you gave em five stars but looks like they should only get three.  How does that work?"

Well you see, I have an art degree, not a math one.  It's open for interpretation.

excerpts: Two things to note: This place has DELICIOUS fish burritos and phone in because the wait can be super long.
I love my fish burritos.
And this place has them.
They have the most delicious fish burritos I've had in a while, this is the place.
Other places in the mission won't serve fish.
While I myself love this place for the fish burritos, they have a wide selection of other delicious goods.
fish.author: Rohan D.
fish.review:
Two things to note: This place has DELICIOUS fish burritos and phone in because the wait can be super long. 

Papalote is great high quality mexican food.  You can have your carne asada, chicken, and whatever other type of burrito. I love my fish burritos. And this place has them. They have the most delicious fish burritos I've had in a while, this is the place. Other places in the mission won't serve fish. 

While I myself love this place for the fish burritos, they have a wide selection of other delicious goods. The chips and salsa are pretty good.

Beware the wait. You can wait anywhere from 5 minutes to 45 minutes (dead serious, 45 minutes for a burrito is not acceptable) but I assumed that was a strange night.

excerpts: The meat, chicken, & fish wasn't seasoned, just grilled.
fish.author: SFer O.
fish.review:
Had lunch with a friend visiting from the UK, who was continuing on to NYC after SF.  Given the Bobby Flay Throwdown, we decided to have lunch here. Had to walk by it a couple times, as there's no signage. Look for blue tiles. We ordered a Champion Burrito with black beans, guac, salsa, sour cream for each of us. My friend got a Negra Modelo and I got a water =$52 before tip.

The burrito was hugh, could easily feed 2-3 people, and it was loaded (e.g., packed full) with grilled beef, grilled chicken, & large grilled prawns. I loved their roasted tomato salsa, and really liked that the burrito wasn't filled with rice & beans like other places do. It was good, but nothing amazing. The meat, chicken, & fish wasn't seasoned, just grilled. The Champion Burrito would be a goner w/o the salsa.

We got there about 1:30p and the restaurant was full - and this place is tiny(!). You eat elbow-to-elbow with the next table, tables lined up next to one another. Pulling your chair out means bumping the people behind you. If you've got long legs or are a big person, good luck. The staff move things along fast b/c people are waiting to be seated. You're still eating and are asked if you'd like foil to take your food with you.

I can say that I've tried Papalote's - and am over it. Too expensive, okay food, and a really uncomfortable place to eat (on a several levels). If Bobby Flay couldn't beat this burrito in a Throwdown, there's no hope.

excerpts: Next time, I'm trying the Mari C. endorsed fish taco.
fish.author: Sean C.
fish.review:
OK, so like really good mexican food. Its a little different than the traditional mexican that I was expecting. Its sort of like Cali-mex...really fresh ingredients, not super heavy, oh yeah...and muthafuckin soyrizo on the menu. Nice.

Whoop ass salsa fo' shizzle. They thankfully don't hold back too much on the hotness here...I'm a big fan, but this could peeve some. 

The place is flirting with 5 stars, but there is a wicked wait, pretty indifferent help, and seating is pretty much impossible. Be prepared to hover, pounce, and cry if needed to get a seat for your and your peeps. If you plan on going here with more than 4 people, you better not plan on staying if you arrive anywhere near a meal time. Some day, I'll head there when I'm wasted and try to turn it into a pickup scene. "Hey baby, want to nosh on my salsa?"...I predict 50% smack ratio.

Next time, I'm trying the Mari C. endorsed fish taco.

excerpts:
(Ref- 7x7- 100 eats b4 you die)

As I prefer my Mexican food greasy and my fish tacos not fishy
fish.author: Gabrielle J.
fish.review:
Surprisingly let down by this colorful joint.

As I prefer my chips thin and my salsa chunky, I definitely could die happy without having sampled this version of weird liquid salsa and painfully thick chips. (Ref- 7x7- 100 eats b4 you die)

As I prefer my Mexican food greasy and my fish tacos not fishy, next time I want "healthy Mexican food," I'll opt for Annies frozen Mexican entrees.

All in all, not where I would recommend satiating a starving belly craving Mexican food greatness.

excerpts: With Papalote, I really only get one thing: the fish cooked in white wine and butter that they serve in their fish tacos or fish burritos.
It is the bee's knees.
It's not that the other menu items are bad, it's just that the fish in butter and wine is so good, I can't quite order anything else
fish.author: Matthew R.
fish.review:
I feel really bad for the proprietors of other taquerias in the Mission because once I went to Papalote, I never went elsewhere. As a creature of habit, I usually find the best damn food selection anywhere and then repeat. With Papalote, I really only get one thing: the fish cooked in white wine and butter that they serve in their fish tacos or fish burritos. It is the bee's knees. It's not that the other menu items are bad, it's just that the fish in butter and wine is so good, I can't quite order anything else

And the salsa is all that. Exceeds the hype and now in bottles for sale.

Mmm, I'm hungry now

excerpts: $13.29 (including tax) for a fish burrito makes this easily
THE MOST EXPENSIVE FISH BURRITO IN THE CITY (or at least ONE of them).
Prices have probably been readjusted to account for the recent influx of Google/Facebook/Apple employees (and Papalote is laughing all the way to the bank, no doubt).
To be fair, the fish burrito is certainly GOOD, but is it $13 good?
In my opinion, no.
For $13, I can do a lot better than a burrito, to be sure.
I know I could have just walked away & not paid such an exorbitant price, but I must confess, I felt myself oddly curious what a $13 burrito might taste like
: Maybe it was sprinkled with gold dust or saffron, or maybe it came with 20 GB free storage on DropBox or something
(it didn't come with any of these things, unfortunately).
I'd probably give Papalote 4 stars if I restricted my criteria to just the QUALITY of the food.

But when you also take into account value for money, it begins to fall a bit flat (I'd prefer to give them 2 and a HALF stars, but that does not appear to be possible here, so I'm only giving them 2).

Perhaps we're just in a new economy, and Papalote's prices are simply reflective of the new standard, but I think we collectively need to take a step back & pay attention to what a fair price really is, and how much markup is really acceptable.

Consider that you can get a fish burrito (with grilled Salmon, no less) at the Little Chihuahua on Valencia for only $8.75, or a fish burrito with line-caught Mahi-Mahi at Tacobar, on California St & Fillmore (in Pacific Heights) for only $8.50, then it becomes harder & harder to justify Papalote's prices.
Their food is good, but they're absolutely taking the mick with the price.
fish.author: Eric H.
fish.review: $13.29 (including tax) for a fish burrito makes this easily THE MOST EXPENSIVE FISH BURRITO IN THE CITY (or at least ONE of them).  Prices have probably been readjusted to account for the recent influx of Google/Facebook/Apple employees (and Papalote is laughing all the way to the bank, no doubt).  To be fair, the fish burrito is certainly GOOD, but is it $13 good?  In my opinion, no.  For $13, I can do a lot better than a burrito, to be sure.  I know I could have just walked away & not paid such an exorbitant price, but I must confess, I felt myself oddly curious what a $13 burrito might taste like: Maybe it was sprinkled with gold dust or saffron, or maybe it came with 20 GB free storage on DropBox or something (it didn't come with any of these things, unfortunately).  I'd probably give Papalote 4 stars if I restricted my criteria to just the QUALITY of the food.  But when you also take into account value for money, it begins to fall a bit flat (I'd prefer to give them 2 and a HALF stars, but that does not appear to be possible here, so I'm only giving them 2).  Perhaps we're just in a new economy, and Papalote's prices are simply reflective of the new standard, but I think we collectively need to take a step back & pay attention to what a fair price really is, and how much markup is really acceptable.  Consider that you can get a fish burrito (with grilled Salmon, no less) at the Little Chihuahua on Valencia for only $8.75, or a fish burrito with line-caught Mahi-Mahi at Tacobar, on California St & Fillmore (in Pacific Heights) for only $8.50, then it becomes harder & harder to justify Papalote's prices.  Their food is good, but they're absolutely taking the mick with the price.

excerpts: The fish was freshly sauteed in white wine, butter, and herbs and it had much more flavor than the grilled fish at Nick's.
They also gave a good 0.5 lb of fish split between the two tacos (or maybe I just got lucky).
The crisp lettuce, onions, and tomatoes topping the tacos also tasted fresh and gave a nice cool contrast relative to the warm, buttery fish.
fish.author: Bipasha M.
fish.review:
Get the pescado tacos!!  Do it now!

So I've been here previously and found the mole chicken burrito to be meh.  Maybe mole isn't my thing.

Today I decided to be fair and give them another shot.  At $6.75 for two pescado tacos, I was a bit hesitant since I'm trying out that whole "staying on a budget" thing.  But it was SOOOOO worth it.  The fish was freshly sauteed in white wine, butter, and herbs and it had much more flavor than the grilled fish at Nick's.  They also gave a good 0.5 lb of fish split between the two tacos (or maybe I just got lucky).  The crisp lettuce, onions, and tomatoes topping the tacos also tasted fresh and gave a nice cool contrast relative to the warm, buttery fish.

Oh yea, and I've gotta agree with every salsa - it's probably the best I've ever had.

excerpts: I also split an order of fish tacos with my brother.
The fish tacos were a lot bigger than other taquerias I've been to and they are extremely hot (temperature wise) when they come out.
The fish tacos were recommended to us by the staff as their best tacos, and they were correct!
fish.author: Langdon N.
fish.review:
Bobby Flay lost for a reason!

I came here to eat lunch today after hearing that Bobby Flay had lost a "Throwdown" here. The Triple Threat Burrito was the challenge, and boy was it also a challenge to finish. 

First off, the free chips as an appetizer are delicious! I don't know what's so different about them but they have a natural crunch to them that make them irresistible to turn away. Also, the salsa served with the chips is probably as close to perfect salsa I have ever tasted in my life. The salsa is sweet, yet not too sweet, and spicy enough to have a kick in it but not too much where you can only eat a bit. There's also none of that burnt pepper taste in it. 

I also split an order of fish tacos with my brother. The fish tacos were a lot bigger than other taquerias I've been to and they are extremely hot (temperature wise) when they come out. The fish tacos were recommended to us by the staff as their best tacos, and they were correct!

Now on to the Triple Threat Burrito. This burrito is definitely not for the faint at heart. The sheer size of the burrito is comparable to other taquerias as maybe 1.2 to 1.5 times larger. They also recommend that the burrito be shared by two or more people, which I recommend as well. The shrimp inside is of the jumbo variety, and the chicken and steak are marinated to perfection in many spices. There is not too much rice in the burrito to mask any of the flavors, and for $0.99 more, they add in sour cream and guacamole to make the burrito perfect. The only downside to the burrito was the price, for $20 I could get 4 burritos at other taquerias, but I had to try this burrito at least once. 

On another note, this place is probably the closest thing to a temple for those with hangovers!

excerpts: Tried their fish tacos, which were scrumptious.
If you're big on eating, well, be warned, the portions are fairly small but filled with flavor and fresh ingredients.
fish.author: Dorothy S.
fish.review:
Definitely a fan of Papalote! Tried their fish tacos, which were scrumptious. If you're big on eating, well, be warned, the portions are fairly small but filled with flavor and fresh ingredients. Okay, this review is sounding way too commercial. 

Being a native San Franciscan, Papalote, certainly, caters to the palettes of the transplants but does it well, I must say. It's quite the hipster place to eat. How, you ask? Well, I'm sure soy and tofu don't enter the minds of cooks who make 'authentic' Mexican cuisine. However Papalote totally pulls off vegetarian and vegan options off well. It must if it wants to compete with the rest of the taquerias. I mean, this establishment is in the Mission, well, off Valencia, really. But, nevertheless, it has to compete. Yet, their food and service are certainly commendable. 

However, it's one of those places that gets really crowded on Friday and weekend evenings and, what do you know, it's filled with the cute boys and girls in glasses (probably transplants and college kids, whatever) and plaid with beat up converse or grimy Keds ordering some vegan burrito. No, no, no...not hatin' at all, just giving fair warning to those that may care or have a particular predilection towards a type of crowd.  Blah ba dee blah blah. Anyway, aside from the scene, it is a decent place and if you want the healthy option, Papalote will serve it up!

excerpts: Eat large quantities of their fish tacos and salsa.
fish.author: Karen R.
fish.review: Drop whatever you are doing and run to Papalote. Eat large quantities of their fish tacos and salsa.

excerpts: then I found my niche: The Fish Burrito with refried beans.
Damn the fact that it's 8.50, it was just so delicious in my mouth.
Plus the hot sauce!
fish.author: Salina Z.
fish.review:
Oh Papalote, I feel like I spend my whole life waiting for you...

...and waiting. and waiting.... in fact, I'm sitting in your lobby right now waiting.. am i waiting for Godot or for Papalote? I've lost track.

The first few times I came here were a miss. The tacos were not the kind I'm used to (ya know... like not skimpy) and the tofu burrito was pretty dry. The kind of of food I think the hipsters probs love. BUT I then I found my niche: The Fish Burrito with refried beans. Damn the fact that it's 8.50, it was just so delicious in my mouth. Plus the hot sauce! Not as good at La Vic's but not a bad 2nd place.

The wait was not delicious though and it's the only reason I have to take away the 2 stars. And it's always so unpredictable! Walking in, I waited 25 min. The second time walking in was 20 min. The third time walking in and taking it to go was 30 minutes. And the last time I called I was told 20 min and when I actually go there, it was another 25 min!! That's pretty redonkulous in my book. So consider this a 3.5 rating and make sure you call ahead and then lose track of time. Then I bet you'll leave this place super stoked.

excerpts: I can't add much to what everyone else has said except that the Fish Tacos are probably my favorite item on the menu.
fish.author: N B.
fish.review:
I can't add much to what everyone else has said except that the Fish Tacos are probably my favorite item on the menu. Mmmm!

And I am grateful they are so close to me in my new 'hood!

excerpts: The fish tacos are made with white wine and are wonderful.
The guacamole is juicy and thick and that's really all you need to know about a mexican restaurant to determine if it's good.
Will have to try the one on Fulton soon.
fish.author: Alexandra D.
fish.review:
On a friend's recommendation, my husband and I came here randomly one night. 
What a pleasant surprise! The fish tacos are made with white wine and are wonderful. The guacamole is juicy and thick and that's really all you need to know about a mexican restaurant to determine if it's good.
Will have to try the one on Fulton soon.

excerpts:
Seafood options on top of normal meat choices (Get the fish)
+Tortilla chips and amazing salsa that comes with every burrito
+

Ingredients are top notch compared to some other competitors
-Seating
fish.author: Alvin Y.
fish.review:
Favorite burrito joint in SF that I visit on a frequent basis. Not as authentic as El Farolito, but this Yuppified burrito is still tasty.

+Seafood options on top of normal meat choices (Get the fish)
+Tortilla chips and amazing salsa that comes with every burrito
+Ingredients are top notch compared to some other competitors
-Seating is quite difficult to come by if you come during rush hour.

A must-go.

excerpts:
carne asada burrito 
2. fish taco. 

fish taco- plain, but the fish was marinated well.
chips and salsa- chips were the thick kind, and salsa was liquidy, quite tasty, but left me craving the usual fresh, chunky salsa 
im used to.
price- higher than others. 
~7.15 burrito, $6.75 fish taco.
fish.author: Lina C.
fish.review:
BIG price, SMALL burrito. not as good as expected, based on the 100s of reviews. we ordered: 

1. carne asada burrito 
2. fish taco. 

burrito- wrap to stuffing ratio was off- too much wrap. mid-sized burrito, not the juicy fat type with thin skin.
fish taco- plain, but the fish was marinated well.
chips and salsa- chips were the thick kind, and salsa was liquidy, quite tasty, but left me craving the usual fresh, chunky salsa im used to.
price- higher than others. ~7.15 burrito, $6.75 fish taco.

this place is above average, but i enjoy El Farolito much more, or El Gruyense in Redwood City

excerpts: I love the super fish tacos (no sour cream) from Papalote.
My husb and I share one order and are both full after.
fish.author: Maria G.
fish.review:
Chip Stingy!

So you know, each person gets 1 bowl of chips and 1 cup of their wildly delicious salsa per order. If you want more you have to pay $1.50. 

I love the super fish tacos (no sour cream) from Papalote. My husb and I share one order and are both full after. Yesterday I decided to try the bean and cheese dip which turns out to be refried black beans with melted cheese. I asked if it came with a large bowl of chips and the gal at the counter ensured it did. So by my calculations we ordered two items for two people, one of which was supposed to have lots of chips. We got one bowl before the tacos and another bowl, same size with the dip. I kept asking the busser for another bowl but he knows the rules so he ignored my pleas. When I went to the counter the gal said they only have one size bowl. I reminded her she had said it came with a large serving of chips but that went right past her. She gave me another bowl but I could see contempt in her eyes as she handed it to me. Here's the thing, what is dip for if not chips? Secondly, the price for beans and cheese with a small bowl of chips would be fair at $3.50, still a huge mark-up. The actual price of $6.50 is just dumb, especially considering you don't get any type of garnish or extra chips. It's literally a plate of beans with melted cheese. Don't bother with this menu item. 

I'm giving this place 4 stars because the tacos and salsa are so good. They loose a star for being stingy.

excerpts:
: I would like to order fish taco's  with extra salsa.
Papalote: Anything else?
Me: Yes, I didn't get my extra salsa yesterday 
so I'd like you to not charge me for it today.
Papalote: We can't do that, sir.
Me: 
Wha? 
I still have the receipt from yesterday.
Papalote: You have to bring the bag back so we can check.
fish.author: iko o.
fish.review:
After a year I came back. Friendly, well prepared, tasty. During a pickup, I saw a server disinfect her hands - nice touch!

previous 1-star review:

Phone Conversation:

Me: I would like to order fish taco's  with extra salsa.
Papalote: Anything else?
Me: Yes, I didn't get my extra salsa yesterday so I'd like you to not charge me for it today.
Papalote: We can't do that, sir.
Me: Wha? I still have the receipt from yesterday.
Papalote: You have to bring the bag back so we can check.
Me: Cancel my order, then.

In fact, cancel my next 100 orders. That is how many time's I've eaten there in the last couple years. There is a kid there who always - and I mean *always* comes up short on my orders. I guess he doesn't like me. Oh well. 

Papalote. Decent food. But, be on your best behavior, or they won't let you eat it

excerpts: I recommend the fish burrito -- it's sautéed in butter and wine and tastes delicious.
The fish really carries the flavor of the rest of the ingredients and doesn't leave you feeling lethargic afterwards.
The orange salsa they serve with their chips is also excellent although the chips are usually stale :(
fish.author: Aaron V.
fish.review:
Although it's far too inconsistent to earn five stars, Papalote serves up some tasty food. This place is the heart of gringo Mexican food in SF -- the only Mexicans you'll find are the ones working behind the counter. Still, a lot of their food is very tasty provided they don't screw up your order or make it too sloppily. 

I recommend the fish burrito -- it's sautéed in butter and wine and tastes delicious. The fish really carries the flavor of the rest of the ingredients and doesn't leave you feeling lethargic afterwards. The orange salsa they serve with their chips is also excellent although the chips are usually stale :(

excerpts: I had some delish fish tacos for dinner last night.
Sauteed in butter and wine, wrapped in soft corn tortillas with salsa fresca, sour cream and guacamole on top... hmm...
In addition to my fish tacos, I had bites of a quesadilla, burrito, and chicken taco, so I got pretty good sampling of the menu.
fish.author: Stephanie P.
fish.review:
Ohhhh baby I had some delish fish tacos for dinner last night. Sauteed in butter and wine, wrapped in soft corn tortillas with salsa fresca, sour cream and guacamole on top... hmm... I think I'm ready for Round 2.

I've been meaning to hit up Papalote for a while now, because it looked so damn cute. Forget cute - this place is scrumptious! The food tastes fresh, not heavy and greasy. In addition to my fish tacos, I had bites of a quesadilla, burrito, and chicken taco, so I got pretty good sampling of the menu. Now I just need to try some of their veggie/vegan options like tofu tacos or a soyrizo burrito (how awesome is it that they offer these things!?). As a self-proclaimed breakfast burrito connoisseur, breakfast offerings all day are also highly appreciated.

A definite new favorite for Mexican food in San Francisco.

excerpts: So my foodie friend "foodgasms" over the fish tacos-
she says-
4 stars-
I say 3 because I don't do fish, and even though the food is cheap - for SF standards, my food was blah, bland, and just not impressive enough to rock the vote as the "Best Mexican" food in SF.
fish.author: Braden B.
fish.review:
I hath my friends who go ape shit for this place. Flipping ape shit. They say "Braden you MUST go to Paplote- it's the best Mexican food in the Mission, the best Mexican food in the CITY!" So - I grab a foodie friend of mine who also hasn't tried this place and we bee-bop over there. It's conviently close to BART and it smells great when you walk in the door.
