So my foodie friend "foodgasms" over the fish tacos- she says- 4 stars- I say 3 because I don't do fish, and even though the food is cheap - for SF standards, my food was blah, bland, and just not impressive enough to rock the vote as the "Best Mexican" food in SF. 

Salsa was actually the best I have tasted in SF. We have an issue with salsa in the city folks. There IS NO GOOD SALSA here- ok, well, there's GOOD salsa, but is there AMAZING APE SHIT salsa!???? If you've found it PLEASE let me know!

excerpts: We also had an order of fish tacos, an order of chicken, and an order of beef.
The fish tacos were the only ones that were double-wrapped with two tortillas each, and the other two orders were only single-wrapped.
Is this "authentic"?
The sole-double-wrapped fish taco was really wet and drippy, but I enjoyed that the fish wasn't battered and deep fried to the point of nonrecognition.
Rather, the fish in the tacos was abundant, moist, and juicy.
fish.author: Heather G.
fish.review:
On the recommendation of a local, we headed to Papalote to sample what I've always heard to be superior Mexican food to what we have here in Boston.  

Can I just interject and describe to you how completely obnoxious it is to live in Boston and, on a regular basis, hear San Fransisco transplants berate me about the low quality and in-authenticity of Mexican food in the Northeast?  It seems like every person who has ever even step foot within a 500 mile radius of the Mission district feels obligated to chime in and remind me that, yes, Mexican food in Boston sucks, and Mission burritos are tastier.  After years of this, I began to think that this was, in fact, a fact (yeah, intentional), and that my trip to San Fransisco would give me an epiphany and a fantastic culinary experience to boot.

Back to the task at hand.  I went to the Mission and chose Papalote for my field research, as it seemed to be widely accepted as the "best burrito."  

I should have known that something was awry when the guy at the counter told me they had just whooped Bobby Flay in a Throwdown.  I call this the Flay phenomenon - The inevitable inflow of traffic post-TV-debut brings crowds to a Throwdown winner's establishment that the restaurant perhaps wasn't ready for (or ill-equipped to handle).  I fear this, as a once-fabulous place could go downhill quickly, choosing to ride the popularity wave.

Needless to say, I did not have such a great experience here, and whether it's the show's fault or the restaurant's, I left a bit let down.

The prices are steep - $5.50 for an order of two tacos, and this "famous" burrito now costs $20. WHAT?  What do you put in a burrito to make it $20.  I will tell you this - this place charges extra for cheese, sour cream, and guac, so I'm not sure what's left.

We did not go for the $20 burrito, but we had a more modest $9 version, but did not opt to pay the extra for the dairy and guac.  The burrito (chicken) was, as a result, a bit bland and very dry.  If the burrito only tastes good with these extra-charge add-ons, then why bother making the burrito at all? 

We also had an order of fish tacos, an order of chicken, and an order of beef.  The fish tacos were the only ones that were double-wrapped with two tortillas each, and the other two orders were only single-wrapped.  Is this "authentic"?  I am not sure, as I am not well-versed in corn tortilla etiquette, but I thought the customary-two was the standard.

The sole-double-wrapped fish taco was really wet and drippy, but I enjoyed that the fish wasn't battered and deep fried to the point of nonrecognition.  Rather, the fish in the tacos was abundant, moist, and juicy.  The other two tacos tasted just like each other, and were both very dry.

The best thing about this place was definitely the creamy, spicy salsa that accompanied the chips.  Perhaps this has always been the practice, or maybe it was due to the new-found extreme popularity, but after the first complimentary order, the restaurant charges for refills.  I don't necessarily think that this is a bad practice, just an interesting one I'd not seen before.  Because we bought so much food, however, we were able to get 4 orders of these for free, and I opted to ditch the tacos and make a meal out of chips and salsa.

You can buy this salsa by the jar to go, and had we not been from out of town, I would certainly take advantage of that.

I will say that the employees are ALL extremely friendly.  Everyone is kind, courteous, and polite.  We must have gone at a bizarre hour, because there was no line whatsoever.   Food came out hot and prompt, and I was very pleased with the experience aside from the taste of the food.

I don't think I'd go back, but one great thing did come from the experience.  Now, back at home, when people launch a tirade about how much New England Mexican sucks compared to the beloved Mission Burritos, I am able to smile, nod, and smirk knowingly (and perhaps a bit judgmentally) as they ramble on, while silently thinking that Olecito is better Mexican food than what I found in SF.

excerpts: Last time I had a fish burrito, there were bitter spots in almost every piece of fish.
It's a burrito.
Burritos are supposed to be cheap.
This place isn't exactly cheap for being in the Mission, so I expect better quality in their ingredients!
fish.author: Jen K.
fish.review:
This place used to be one of my favorite Mission burrito joints. The salsa is amazing, but otherwise, they've really slipped in the level of quality and flavor of the food. 

Last time I had a fish burrito, there were bitter spots in almost every piece of fish. It's a burrito. Burritos are supposed to be cheap. This place isn't exactly cheap for being in the Mission, so I expect better quality in their ingredients!

excerpts:
You place your order, eg 
 a fish taco  get a place number, find a seat and wait for someone to actually catch a fish
( it took that long.)

This place is great for the
the scientists in our expedition, as we had to share various tables, 
and could mingle with the locals.
fish.author: Elle C.
fish.review:
This isn't just a review of Papalote, it is a  report for a class in Socioanthropolgy ( a dream class, where you wander at will and write a paper ...... THAT is what Yelp is!!!!
It was a perfect day for our biennale trip to the Mission District to investigate the gentrification of SF Distructs  and ti write an article for THe Yelp Anthro Journal.  NO smoke from forest fires was detected, but to make sure we re save from particulates, we took the BART in the morning before anyone burned down another forest.

Gentrification has continued,  This year all The Elderly were killed, or sent to nursing homes in San Leandro.  Coffee Houses now occupy every third shop.  Indian Restaurants, serving  the new drink, Marguerita Lhasi have proliferated.  Alll residential buildings have been repainted, non victorian colors.  However the paint was obviously applied in a very shoddy manner, perhaps sp further gentrification can take place.

The old Mexican Restaurants  have, of course been removed ( to San Leandro, no doubt)  , so the anthopologists went to a nouvelle MexRes, Papalote.

This new style eaterie is like the ubiquitous coffee house.  It is not a restaurant.  You place your order, eg 
 a fish taco  get a place number, find a seat and wait for someone to actually catch a fish ( it took that long.)  This place is great for the
the scientists in our expedition, as we had to share various tables, 
and could mingle with the locals.  They may all be droids, but we did not stay too long to investigate.

On the plus side   of the New Mission read reviews of  the Valencia Farmers Market

excerpts: I've tasted the fish tacos and not a fishy taste or smell about them.
fish.author: Liz P.
fish.review:
Everyone raves about the salsa and rightfully so.  Others bitch that  if you want extra, you pay extra.  Please, it's fifty cents more and worth every penny.  Unlike any other salsa I've tasted.  Hotness varies each visit.

I find the food hit or miss.  The carne asada is bland and tough.  Shrimp tacos are the same.  Tortillas are the stiff, packaged variety.

The chile verde is delicious and now my favorite item on the menu.  I've tasted the fish tacos and not a fishy taste or smell about them.  A friend gives raves to the veggie burrito.  The chilaquiles are divine.

Papalote is located in what I call N'mission -- on the edge of Noe and the Mission.  If you're not into kids, then beware of the Noe Stroller Set.  They can overtake the place with often times not so well-behaved children.  Or clueless parents.  And why oh why can't they leave their strollers on the sidewalk?  The place is tiny enough.

Only a few tables in the joint, so you usually have to hover over diners like a vulture and swoop in as soon as one is free.

excerpts: It's spicy and delightful, and whether you're putting it on chips, a veggie burrito, fish tacos, or carne asada, it's the bomb.
fish.author: Lisa F.
fish.review:
Who your papa? 

Say what? 

Who your papa?

PAPALOTE!!!! 

No, I wasn't a cheerleader in my past (or current life), but if eating at Paplote's somehow came down to cheerleading for a burrito, I would do it. Somehow I don't think one will ever have to don short skirts to eat here, but just for the record, I would. In a heartbeat. But anyway...

This is my favorite spot in the Mission (SF, for that matter) for a burrito. When I have visitors seeking culinary delights I take 'em here. The veggie burrito, loaded with potatoes, mushrooms, and carrots, is ama-to-the-zing. Add a little Paplote original spicy sauce, and you've got yourself a tastebud explosion! I love, love the sauce. It's spicy and delightful, and whether you're putting it on chips, a veggie burrito, fish tacos, or carne asada, it's the bomb. 

Don't be put off by the line or the small size of the restaurant. I've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to place my order, and believe you me, it's worth it no matter how long you wait. A little insider advice: call ahead and place your order to go. They make call-in orders quick snap. Before you know it,  you'll be lickin your paws clean after scarfing that delicious Papalote's treat.

excerpts: The fish tacos are a-ma-zing.
I went here with a friend and thought a burrito would be too much
so I opted for the tacos instead...
So.
Much.
Food.
So yummy!
The last time I had fish tacos this good was in San Felipe (apparently the home of the fish taco...)!
Oh and remember, if you have some of that salsa left by the time your food comes, throw some of it on those fish tacos, it's too good to waste!
fish.author: Melanie B.
fish.review:
Best salsa everrrrrrrrrrr (*sings*)!

The fish tacos are a-ma-zing.  I went here with a friend and thought a burrito would be too much so I opted for the tacos instead... So.  Much.  Food.  So yummy!  The last time I had fish tacos this good was in San Felipe (apparently the home of the fish taco...)!

Nom-nom-nom-full-full-full.

The burritos are good too, although I got a chicken mole quesadilla a couple of weeks ago and I think it was a mistake.  I'm not sure if I just wasn't keen on the chicken mole in a quesadilla, or if I wasn't keen on the mole sauce, or the chicken, or if I was just a bit too hung over to be eating it in the first place.  Either way, I have liked everything else I have eaten here.

The prices are perhaps a couple of dollars more than I would want to pay in an ideal world, but it doesn't stop me going back again and again because I loves it!  Oh and remember, if you have some of that salsa left by the time your food comes, throw some of it on those fish tacos, it's too good to waste!

excerpts: I enjoyed the fish burrito's.
fish.author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.
fish.review:
High quality food here. I enjoyed the fish burrito's. 

The salsa dip is delish even thought the chips themselves could have been more refined (just an idea) so that everything's in step with the Papalote reputation.

They also have the old skool version of Coke (not the really old version that contained an illegal substance) if you want to avoid all the high fructose corn syrup and taste the cane sugar original.

This one is in the top 3 for sure.

excerpts: The fish tacos are fantastic, and I love the prawn quesadilla, rice and bean taco, fish quesadille (seriously the only time fish and cheese can be used together) and nachos.
fish.author: Darcy V.
fish.review:
I go here at least 3 times a week and as Nish pointed out, probably much more than that. Papalote means kite, and the restaurant (you can sit down) is cheerfully painted and hung with beautiful elaborate handmade kits that look like frogs, bugs, etc... and a world class collection of Latin and other music is playing at all times.

Food: The fish tacos are fantastic, and I love the prawn quesadilla, rice and bean taco, fish quesadille (seriously the only time fish and cheese can be used together) and nachos. I recently tried the chile verde quesadilla and it was soooo good. It would be my new favorite except that it's pork, and I don't really eat pork. The pork pieces were tender and delicious though. Maybe next time I'll ask if they can leave out the pork pieces and just heap on that yummy green sauce.

For 99 cents, I always "super" my order because the guacamole rocks. You can't even get an avocado at the market for 99cents, and they give a generous portion. The salsa is smoky and just the right amount of kick to it. It's worth the 50 cent charge to get another helping! The chips are thin, crisp and always served warm. Yum. 

Service:  awesome. "Perdito", who flashes his ever cheerful silver accented smile, is already filling my "pepsi regular" when I walk in the door. When the owner Miguel is there he always takes a moment to say hello.  Update: the Pepsi machine is "out of order" apparently because of a tiff with an incompetent supplies. Miguel refuses to do business with the guy and as a result, I'm going through some kind of Pepsi withdrawal. The homemade horchata is good, but sometimes I want that chemical kick of Pepsi. Rrrrrrrrrrrrrrr. Judith, the girl at the counter is always friendly and polite and acts like it's totally normal that I eat there every day.

excerpts: The fish tacos are fantastic.
fish.author: Amy G.
fish.review:
So Papalote is literally the closest restaurant to my house.  I admit to eating here at least once a week.  The fish tacos are fantastic.  I love that there are lots of other non-lard/veggie options--that's the main reason to come here.  If you want a big fatty burrito, they are good here, but probably better elsewhere and you don't need to go far...

People rave about the salsa, I personally am not into it.  Does it have cream in it?  My friend visiting from New York thought it tasted like Doritios--I agree.

excerpts: Splurge and get the fish burrito...
IF YOU DARE.
The fish is delish (say it out loud, please!).
fish.author: Beah B.
fish.review:
I used to think that Papalote was trying to be a slightly hipper, more upscale, maybe even somewhat trendy alternative to the ol' San Francisco taqueria, a true institution. And, to some extent, it is. It's got those papery dragon thingies -- those are hip. And the logo is a "P" inscribed inside a circle -- that's a totally hip and now move as far as graphic design is concerned. 

But there are not downsides here (unless you despise style, which you probably do). It's not wildly over priced (rice and bean super burrito , $4), and you won't get any barfy 'tude from the servers, or fellow patrons. You'll just get some damn good burritos. DAMN GOOD, I say. Splurge and get the fish burrito... IF YOU DARE. The fish is delish (say it out loud, please!). 

Last night I ate my entire burrito, minus the glops of filling that feel onto the place. This does not indicate that the burrito is small (it isn't ), it indicates that the burrito is magical. That it finds away to fit itself entirely inside my stomach (much like my Honda Fit does in SF parking spaces). And by magical, I guess I mean these burritos are f*king tasty.

A final plus: it's fun to watch the burrito men make their magic behind the glass (how sanitary!). I even saw one guy wash his hands after extensively handling raw meat. Do you think all burrito guys do this? I doubt it. Google it. Then let me know.

excerpts: As far as Papalote goes on its own, I have been a long-time eater of their mushroom quesadilla (simple and good), their soyrizo nachos (great for us non meat eaters!), and their fish tacos (which are the healthy, non-beer battered kind).
fish.author: Shannon R.
fish.review:
There's not much to say about Papalote that hasn't already been said. However, I will say this: My boyfriend discovered this really bangin' combination: Have'a corn chips with Papalote salsa...I'm telling you, this is Latino-Asian fusion at it's finest, people! 

Sure, the chips they serve at Papalote are nice and fresh and good, but if you ever buy a jar of salsa to go from them, just go across the street to the Valencia Farmers Market grocery store, and pick up a bag of Have'a corn chips (they are basically very fresh, crispy tortilla chips infused with soy-sauce...as weird as it may sound, it works!) And with the Papalote Salsa, oh hells yeah!!!

As far as Papalote goes on its own, I have been a long-time eater of their mushroom quesadilla (simple and good), their soyrizo nachos (great for us non meat eaters!), and their fish tacos (which are the healthy, non-beer battered kind).

excerpts: The fish taco's were not that great and a little over priced.
fish.author: Blake W.
fish.review:
This place just didn't do it for me. 

The "7x7 Top 100" chips & salsa were just ok. The fish taco's were not that great and a little over priced. The carne asade burrito was average at best. 

Considering all the Mexican food options in the Mission, I don't think I will be going back to Papalote any time soon.

excerpts: I LOVE LOVE LOVE their fish tacos.
The fish is light, fluffy and perfectly seasoned.
They are super generous with how much meat they give you.
fish.author: Hm M.
fish.review: I LOVE LOVE LOVE their fish tacos.  The fish is light, fluffy and perfectly seasoned.  They are super generous with how much meat they give you.

excerpts: My friend ordered fish tacos, and I ordered quesadillas; and we both just sat there repeating, "Yum!
fish.author: jenn h.
fish.review:
Papalote is not new, but it's new to me. My family has been going to Pancho Villa for so long, that's my Mexican default. My friend ordered fish tacos, and I ordered quesadillas; and we both just sat there repeating, "Yum!" after every bite.

The ingredients were so fresh, I had to wonder if they had a secret tunnel directly linking them to Whole Foods. Maybe they fit a secret garden behind their kitchen? I don't know, but their "fresh & healthy" menu drew a motley crew of customers, from the typical Mission artsy types to conservative men in suits. They will definitely be getting repeat visits from me.

excerpts: How do you make fish really bad for you?
So... my advice: Give up the burrito for a meal and try some fish.
But do so with extreme caution.
fish.author: LeSLiE W.
fish.review:
How do you make fish really bad for you?  

Saute it in wine and butter, throw it in a tortilla with a bunch of cheese,  then add a little more grease to toast it up, that's how.  Papalote calls this a pescado quesadilla.  I call it evil.

Holy crap.   This thing is freaking delicious.  I'm usually more of a burrito kind of girl but my boyfriend brought one of these evil pescado thingys home recently. Soon he was annoyed with himself that he asked me if I wanted a bite because after that he couldn't' get rid of me.

Fortunately I live nowhere near this place and they don't deliver.  Because if either of those two realities existed, I would have quesadilla butt in about 2 weeks.

So... my advice: Give up the burrito for a meal and try some fish.  But do so with extreme caution.

excerpts: I've only been here once and had their Fish Tacos and Watermelon horchata - good stuff.
fish.author: eileen r.
fish.review:
I've only been here once and had their Fish Tacos and Watermelon horchata - good stuff. Oh and the chips and salsa are off the hook!

The decor is definitely hipper than most Taquerias in the Mission, but don't let that fool you.  This place is definitely a contender.

I can't wait to go back and try something else on the menu

excerpts: Fish taco is fresh and juicy.
One of the best I've had.
fish.author: Stacy T.
fish.review: The pink salsa has just the right amount of trailing spice. Fish taco is fresh and juicy. One of the best I've had.

excerpts: The fish tacos.
The awful: Crappy vegetarian options.
Just a little eggplant here or some potato there.
fish.author: Katie R.
fish.review:
The good: The salsa. The fish tacos. 
The awful: Crappy vegetarian options. Just a little eggplant here or some potato there. I had the worst quesadilla possible there, like a microwaved castrophe with barely any cheese and dried out tortilla, everything piled to one side. If you want to go veg, go to Little Chihuahua. Less money, better variety and fresher ingredients.

excerpts: I'd be willing to pay the $7 or so dollars for the special fish
burrito
I ordered.
fish.author: Shay F.
fish.review:
You shouldn't judge a book by its cover .....but you can definitely judge a Mexican place by its salsa, and Papalote definitely has some of the best that I've tasted in the city (so far).  Normally I'm not a hot salsa fan, but theirs has just the right (comfortable) amount of heat and you can't help but keep dipping chips and shoveling your face with food.

Overall, the prices aren't bad at all.  I'd be willing to pay the $7 or so dollars for the special fish burrito I ordered.  As other yelpers attested, the ingredients are fresh and the combination is deeeeelicious.

The seating area was a little limited, and we had to enact the "search and hover" method because we were a group of five.  Luckily, a table cleared away just as our food came.  

Definitely worth a trip out to the mission - especially if you have a slow work day!

excerpts: Also, pretty good fish tacos, a rarity of the Mission, but not Baja style.
Helpful hints:  at lunch time the strollers descend from the hilltop of Noe Valley and fill up the room
, it will take you about 20-30 min.
after ordering to get your food, and they will charge you something crazy for a side of guacamole.
Lastly, I feel like you kind of deserve it if you feel ripped off after dropping $20 on a burrito, even if you saw it on the TV, so stick to the menu that doesn't sound crazy
and you should be fine.
fish.author: Kathryn M.
fish.review: Known within my household as Papa-slo-te, because they must be some kind of union at the rate they out put a burrito.  They do make fresh and comparatively healthier Mexican fare with interesting burrito options like chili verde and mole with chicken or tofu.  Also, pretty good fish tacos, a rarity of the Mission, but not Baja style. Helpful hints:  at lunch time the strollers descend from the hilltop of Noe Valley and fill up the room, it will take you about 20-30 min. after ordering to get your food, and they will charge you something crazy for a side of guacamole.  Lastly, I feel like you kind of deserve it if you feel ripped off after dropping $20 on a burrito, even if you saw it on the TV, so stick to the menu that doesn't sound crazy and you should be fine.

excerpts: I'm allergic to fish & kind of think sauteed vegetables in a tortilla is lame.
fish.author: Rebekah K.
fish.review:
I'm allergic to fish & kind of think sauteed vegetables in a tortilla is lame. 

Their salsa is good, but why do they got to Jew you out of it? If you sit alone, they give you ONE small thing. If you sit with a friend they also give you ONE small thing of salsa. At El Farolito I could walk up to the salsa bar with a trough, fill it up & come back 10 minutes later for more. 

Really? This is the place you're all creaming yourselves for?

excerpts: Good burritos - particularly the carne asada, shrimp and fish ones and great salsa and chips.
You can get a  burrito card and receive your 11th burrito free!
Staff is super friendly, ingredients are super fresh and location is super close to Bart.
Super!
fish.author: Kamael S.
fish.review: It saddens me greatly that I have moved further away from Papalote.   Good burritos - particularly the carne asada, shrimp and fish ones and great salsa and chips. You can get a  burrito card and receive your 11th burrito free!  Staff is super friendly, ingredients are super fresh and location is super close to Bart. Super!

excerpts: I must say the fish anything is pretty good.
I thought they would fry the fish
but it's not!
Not a place for groups larger than 3 or 4
but I would come out again.
fish.author: Elvin T.
fish.review: I've never been here before but we were in the area so we thought we would give it a try.  I must say the fish anything is pretty good. I thought they would fry the fish but it's not!  Not a place for groups larger than 3 or 4 but I would come out again.

excerpts: I have to go back to try the fish tacos -
I hear they're divine
fish.author: E R.
fish.review:
I loved this place.  I was afraid of the idea of tofu or veggie burritos - and a mission food joint that uses No Lard....?  However, when I got to Papalote I decided to try it rather than going with the meat.  It was fabulous, filled with grilled spiced eggplant and zucchini!  So tasty!  I have to go back to try the fish tacos - I hear they're divine and maybe the fajitas...

It's crowded, there does always seem to be a line.  You can't sit until you've ordered, so by the time you get a seat your food is just about there and you don't have to deal with people squatting on tables who have not ordered yet - which I think is a good idea.

I was suprised by the price of the bottled beer, until I realized the beer was this gi-normous supersized bottle.

The price of the food is fair and the place is nice and clean especially for a place in the mission; )

excerpts: Fish tacos were awesome.
I went there for lunch today with some friends and everyone was extremely pleased with their seafoody selections: a shrimp quesadilla; fish burrito, and two of us ordered fish tacos.
fish.author: Deborah S.
fish.review:
Fish tacos were awesome. I went there for lunch today with some friends and everyone was extremely pleased with their seafoody selections: a shrimp quesadilla; fish burrito, and two of us ordered fish tacos. I actually split mine with a friend and one was totally satisfying. 

Salsa was great and we had a good time--I will definitely remember to stop by again and maybe bring some salsa home.

excerpts: I got the amazing fish tacos which were too stuffed to pick up and eat, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife.
The fish was sautéed with white wine and butter, a pleasant change from the fried I am used to.
The bf got a fish burrito, probably the biggest burrito I have ever seen and it was delicious to boot.
He definitely paid a little bit later for eating the whole thing.
fish.author: Lindsay E.
fish.review:
My boyfriend and I knew we had to get some Mexican food when we were visiting since it's the one culinary category we are really lacking good restaurants in in Boston. We trusted our friend from Palo Alto who had read good reviews about this place and she did not disappoint us. 

The place was crowded,  a good sign for 7 on a Saturday night. We ordered at the cash register and were seated rather quickly, though slightly awkwardly as we had to share table space with another group of 3. They had real Mexican Coke which the bf and friend were super hyped about. They brought us out yummy fresh chips and salsa to start. I got an aguas frescas which was pretty good, though a little too sweet. My friend got the mole chicken quesadilla which was super delicious. I got the amazing fish tacos which were too stuffed to pick up and eat, so I had to eat it with a fork and knife. The fish was sautéed with white wine and butter, a pleasant change from the fried I am used to. The bf got a fish burrito, probably the biggest burrito I have ever seen and it was delicious to boot. He definitely paid a little bit later for eating the whole thing.

excerpts: - I got two gigantic fish tacos and could barely finish one.
Might not be the choice for the fried or grilled fish enthusiast, but I love their butter and wine-sautéed take on my favorite taco filling.
My family got quesadillas, which are also fun and huge.
I am not the biggest fan of their salsa since I'm more of a see-the-chunks-of-vegetables kind of girl, but it's a great flavor and excitingly spicy.
I say go for it if you have a long lunch break!
fish.author: Megan E.
fish.review:
Very tasty! I got there on a Thursday around 11:30 just before the lunch-time madness; I worry that away from my flexible vacation schedule I wouldn't be able to take the rush. Love the area, though I do agree with other reviewers that it's not in the thick of the more authentic Mexican restaurants nearby. The restaurant is colorful and fun, and I like the neighborhood-hangout kind of feel.

Lots of food for your dollar here - I got two gigantic fish tacos and could barely finish one. Might not be the choice for the fried or grilled fish enthusiast, but I love their butter and wine-sautéed take on my favorite taco filling. My family got quesadillas, which are also fun and huge. I am not the biggest fan of their salsa since I'm more of a see-the-chunks-of-vegetables kind of girl, but it's a great flavor and excitingly spicy. I say go for it if you have a long lunch break!

excerpts: I'll stick with Pancho Villa's Super Burrito, or head to San Jalisco for their awesome mole, and go to El Metate for some great fish tacos.
fish.author: R.B. W.
fish.review: Not sure what all the fuss is about.  The place is cramped, not so clean, and devoid of personality.  I've heard people raving about the place, and finally had dinner there.  But wow...totally and completely underwhelmed.  I head out for Mex at least a couple times a week, but won't be revisiting Paplote.  Perhaps the buzz is because they offer vegan or soyrizo alternatives?  Even the much-vaunted salsa?  Meh. The food was okay, but way too much rice in the burrito, and perhaps three shrimp.  For a $11 burrito, I felt rooked.  I'll stick with Pancho Villa's Super Burrito, or head to San Jalisco for their awesome mole, and go to El Metate for some great fish tacos.

excerpts: I have had three different burritos there  up to date (carne, veggie and something with fish) and they were good.
Not great though.
fish.author: Jorge B.
fish.review:
Nice, but a bit overrated.

I have had three different burritos there  up to date (carne, veggie and something with fish) and they were good. Not great though.

excerpts: They really aren't kidding when they say the fish is marinated in butter.
This really hit the spot after too many months on the East Coast.
fish.author: Marcus C.
fish.review: They really aren't kidding when they say the fish is marinated in butter. This really hit the spot after too many months on the East Coast.

excerpts: What: I ordered the Veggie Super Burrito, they ordered chicken fajitas, veggie burrito, and fish tacos.
When: Friday night.
Line was a little long and seating limited, but it went fast....
Eat fast as well as people are waiting and watching you eat.
Why: I guess my expectations were a little high for this place, since Bobby Flay lost!
I didnt expect it to be as fast food-ish and fast eating!
I thought it was a sit down, and order type of place, but turned out to be order at the counter and if you want to eat there, wait for a seat.
Besides that point, the food was great.
The salsa was definitely worth talking about after as well as
the size of the portions- huge!
4 stars only because ambiance was more of a to-go place, vs eat there place.
fish.author: R P.
fish.review:
Who: Double date.
What: I ordered the Veggie Super Burrito, they ordered chicken fajitas, veggie burrito, and fish tacos.
When: Friday night. Line was a little long and seating limited, but it went fast....Eat fast as well as people are waiting and watching you eat.
Why: I guess my expectations were a little high for this place, since Bobby Flay lost! I didnt expect it to be as fast food-ish and fast eating! I thought it was a sit down, and order type of place, but turned out to be order at the counter and if you want to eat there, wait for a seat. Besides that point, the food was great. The salsa was definitely worth talking about after as well as the size of the portions- huge! 4 stars only because ambiance was more of a to-go place, vs eat there place.

excerpts: but, If you want a really kick ass fish burrito, this is the spot.
Now kick ass-itude don't come cheap... for a burrito that is.
This puppy will set you back like $10 ( I'm used to $5 burritos at El Metate)
but no other place comes anywhere close to being this good.
fish.author: Liz A.
fish.review: I don't know about all this triple threat nonsense... sounds like a boy burrito to me... but, If you want a really kick ass fish burrito, this is the spot.  Now kick ass-itude don't come cheap... for a burrito that is.  This puppy will set you back like $10 ( I'm used to $5 burritos at El Metate)  but no other place comes anywhere close to being this good.  I have actually never ordered anything else... but my boyfriend really likes their Chile Verde (although El Metate's is better and cheaper).  Oh, I almost forgot, Awesome salsa!

excerpts: i'm salivating just thinking about the fish tacos and that salsa.
fish.author: J W.
fish.review:
i'm salivating just thinking about the fish tacos and that salsa.  if the gods eat mexican, i'll bet they throw that sauce on their tacos.

I wish it were closer, and that there was more room to sit down (it gets pretty crowded, apparently the deliciousness of their secret salsa is no secret)
i also wish the food were less salty, the chicken was a little less dry, that it was a little cleaner, and that i could buy just one taco at a time instead of having to buy 2.  

that being said, i'm sure we'll keep going, probably at least once a week.

excerpts: but I have to admit that the soyrizo tacos are pretty tasty but my alltime favorite is the fish burrito - straight up, don't go super.
Why do I love the fish burrito?
It's is sauted in white wine with your choice of beans.
The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.
The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings.
You can usually share a fish burrito, and maybe get a quesadilla in case
fish.author: Spoon G.
fish.review:
++UPDATE 10/29: Last time I went in to pick up some food I spent some time reading their SF inspection report. Let's just say they failed the inspection - things like storing food on the floor, the refrigerator temperature was not low enough...basically they didn't get a score because they had to fix so many things. Should you be afraid? I haven't gotten sick, but it was a bit off putting so I am lowering my score to 3 stars.++

Why do I love Papalote in the Mission? A few good reasons. I am not a vegetarian but I have to admit that the soyrizo tacos are pretty tasty but my alltime favorite is the fish burrito - straight up, don't go super.

Why do I love the fish burrito? It's is sauted in white wine with your choice of beans. The usual garnishes of lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, guacamole are absent so as to preserve and highlight the flavor of the fish.  The burrito is hot (temperature) since there are no cold fillings. You can usually share a fish burrito, and maybe get a quesadilla in case one of you gets a bit hungry.

The chips and salsa are also acclaimed. I do like the salsa, but I have to say it is a touch too spice for my taste.

They also do a great takeout - they are on my speed dial.

excerpts: The salsa is awesome, and I LOVE the CHICKEN MOLE and the FISH TACOS!
fish.author: J K.
fish.review:
Changed from 3 stars to 4.

I've been back a few times recently, and loved everything I tried. I don't know why I didn't think it was "all-that" before. 

The salsa is awesome, and I LOVE the CHICKEN MOLE and the FISH TACOS!

excerpts: All you need to know: get the fish tacos.
fish.author: Liza T.
fish.review:
All you need to know: get the fish tacos. Am I kidding myself or is this guilt-free Mexican food?

The ambiente is a bit on the funk-side, but that's as it should be. Can be a little chilly when it's cold out, but the tacos will do the warming.

The salsa is magically delicious, but in our experience, they're asking 50 cents for a refill of the tiny cup they serve with chips! That's ballsy, I gotta say, but we ended up choking up the two quarters for another cup. I wonder how Adam L gets it for free??

excerpts: my fish tacos were muy bland.
fish.author: Ellen S.
fish.review:
underwhelmed!

my fish tacos were muy bland. my gf's chicken burrito also meh. not sure what all the fuss is about this place, unless it's just that some folks would rather only dine with other white people? 

thankfully we didn't have to wait too long as it was raining last night. don't think i'll be headed back here anytime soon...

excerpts: I recommend the fish burrito, pescado for the gringos.
They have a cooler stocked with corona and prohibition which compliment the food perfectly.
Probably the best burrito in the city, enjoy.
fish.author: bart b.
fish.review: Having lived in Los Angeles for many years I moved here with the expectation that you can get a great burrito anywhere, I was dead wrong. The team at Papalote makes a perfect burrito. The best thing about the burrito is that it's balanced. Not too much meat and it's not loaded down with cheap beans and rice. The sauces are authentic and teate great. I recommend the fish burrito, pescado for the gringos. They have a cooler stocked with corona and prohibition which compliment the food perfectly. Probably the best burrito in the city, enjoy.

excerpts: Best freaking fish burrito.
Hands down.
I used to live around the corner from the Fulton/Masonic location and was introduced to Papalote by roommates after being away from SF for more than a year.
The salsa is amazing.
Its what draws you in.
I started craving it.
I started thinking about it during the day, dreaming of it.
I started trying different things on the menu, just to see what it would taste like with the salsa.
Then they started bottling it.
Now I have jars of it around my house.
Eventually, I found Papalote's fish burrito.
It is sublime.
I crave it.
I dream about it during the day while at work.
Best freaking fish burrito.
I don't care much for the burrito wars in this city.
I will not prosthelytize, but I have heard many say and I will agree: this is the city's best burrito.
fish.author: christopher c.
fish.review: Best freaking fish burrito. Hands down. I used to live around the corner from the Fulton/Masonic location and was introduced to Papalote by roommates after being away from SF for more than a year. The salsa is amazing. Its what draws you in. I started craving it. I started thinking about it during the day, dreaming of it. I started trying different things on the menu, just to see what it would taste like with the salsa. Then they started bottling it. Now I have jars of it around my house. Eventually, I found Papalote's fish burrito. It is sublime. I crave it. I dream about it during the day while at work. Best freaking fish burrito. I don't care much for the burrito wars in this city. I will not prosthelytize, but I have heard many say and I will agree: this is the city's best burrito.

excerpts: Best fish tacos this side of the border.
I love ordering mine with extra prawns.
The salsa is to die for and I am thinking of reverse engineering it.
Grab a Pacifico if you want to remember your surfing days in Sayulita!
fish.author: Jasmine T.
fish.review: Best fish tacos this side of the border. I love ordering mine with extra prawns. The salsa is to die for and I am thinking of reverse engineering it. Grab a Pacifico if you want to remember your surfing days in Sayulita!

excerpts: I do buy burritos here fairly frequently as some of the more authentic places don't have a fish option and the salsa really is great and the Fulton one is convenient for me.
But I think the hype is way out of line.
It's a good burrito and sure
fish.author: Rebecca P.
fish.review:
I do buy burritos here fairly frequently as some of the more authentic places don't have a fish option and the salsa really is great and the Fulton one is convenient for me. But I think the hype is way out of line. It's a good burrito and sure, it's probably the best TOFU burrito in the city but not the best in town. 

I had been eating here for about a year or so when I saw Papalote on Bobby Flay's Throwdown on the Food Network -- the next time I ordered the burrito that was featured on the show. Not only did I think it was kind of mediocre but it cost me almost $20. Gimme a break.

excerpts: I am a big fan of fish tacos and the ones here are the best.
the fish is super fresh and the portion is large.
The salsa they give out with the chips is amazing, unless you don't like spicey, in that case it will make you cry.
If you're looking for great, cheap mexican food in the mission this is the place to go!
fish.author: Jennifer H.
fish.review: This place is super yummy and cheap. I am a big fan of fish tacos and the ones here are the best. the fish is super fresh and the portion is large. The salsa they give out with the chips is amazing, unless you don't like spicey, in that case it will make you cry. If you're looking for great, cheap mexican food in the mission this is the place to go!

excerpts: Love the fish tacos, fish burritos, super veggie burrito, and the breakfast is slammin too.
Huevos rancheros, yum.
If you don't like this place, something is wrong with you.
Oh, they are sticklers about the salsa, you get one cup, and they will charge you extra for more, so be prepared, but it is totally worth it.
fish.author: Brooke A.
fish.review: Salsa is one word, ORGASMIC!!! I absolutely love this place. I have even bought a whole jar of that heavenly salsa. Love the fish tacos, fish burritos, super veggie burrito, and the breakfast is slammin too. Huevos rancheros, yum. If you don't like this place, something is wrong with you. Oh, they are sticklers about the salsa, you get one cup, and they will charge you extra for more, so be prepared, but it is totally worth it.

excerpts: Just wanted to add that the fish burrito is ridiculously good.
And I suspect their salsa is laced with crack cocaine.
So good!
Wait still atrocious though...
fish.author: Maximillian M.
fish.review: Just wanted to add that the fish burrito is ridiculously good. And I suspect their salsa is laced with crack cocaine. So good! Wait still atrocious though...

excerpts: I started out with the Fish Tacos, but haven't been able to order anything other than the Carne Asada entree lately.
fish.author: Chris R.
fish.review: Another one of my frequent haunts. I started out with the Fish Tacos, but haven't been able to order anything other than the Carne Asada entree lately. The black refried beans and the jicama pico goes great with the with the thin cut steak. Also have to recommend the Machaca when you're feeling a bit partied-out the morning after. A bit hard to get into sometimes, but the staff is always on the ball getting tables ready.

excerpts: my bf and i have been sharing their humongous fish burritos once a week.
fish.author: Sheri N.
fish.review:
my bf and i have been sharing their humongous fish burritos once a week.  we're still not sick of them yet.  

i LOVE their spicy roasted salsa.  it's not easy on my back end the next day, but i'll pay the price for a taste of that spicy goodness.

excerpts: Friends swear by the fish tacos and burritos, but I prefer a classic deep-fried fish taco to Papalote's sauteed fish version.
There is beer in bottles and on tap here.
It is a tad (just a tad) more upscale than the average Mission burrito joint.
It is also very excellent to watch all the boys and girls walk by the large picture window on their way to and from BART.
Eye candy goes well with any meal.
fish.author: Emily N.
fish.review: Go for the vegan tofu mole burrito.  Stay for the best salsa in SF. This is a smooth, blended, just spicy enough orange colored thin salsa.  The above mentioned tofu mole burrito is sweet and delicious and doesn't ever leave me with that "oh god did I just eat that whole thing" feeling.  Friends swear by the fish tacos and burritos, but I prefer a classic deep-fried fish taco to Papalote's sauteed fish version.  There is beer in bottles and on tap here.  It is a tad (just a tad) more upscale than the average Mission burrito joint.  It is also very excellent to watch all the boys and girls walk by the large picture window on their way to and from BART.  Eye candy goes well with any meal.

excerpts: Word up on the fish tacos which are better than most.
fish.author: patrick g.
fish.review: Word up on the fish tacos which are better than most. And the veggie options are actually decent and extensive which is good if you have lots of whiny vegetarian friends like I do. But the meaty things? Try somewhere else.

excerpts: i'm crazy about their chicken burrito, but my friends love the fish and vegan dishes.
fish.author: frisco j.
fish.review:
let's start a burrito fight. i declare that papalote has the best burrito in the city! it's fresh, tasty, healthy and that sauce- what the heck is in that sauce? it's so yummy. i'm crazy about their chicken burrito, but my friends love the fish and vegan dishes. anyway, i'm so happy that papalote is in my hood...

the only caveat is that the traveling mariachi band doesn't make it down to papalote. perhaps it's too gringo for them? well, they're missing out.

excerpts: But I will give them props for their fish burrito which was soaked in buttery goodness.
The fish burrito was almost $10
so it's not cheap.
I would only go back if I were hungry and needed something to eat.
But I will say the salsa and chips is amazing - wish I could take a big jar of it home.
Never tasted anything like it.
fish.author: Jeanne C.
fish.review: I give Papalote 3.5 stars because it's the Chipotle of SF. Doesn't feel as authentic as other places in the Mission. But I will give them props for their fish burrito which was soaked in buttery goodness. I could have cared less for the mole burrito, but only because I don't really like my burrito to taste like chocolate. The fish burrito was almost $10 so it's not cheap. I would only go back if I were hungry and needed something to eat. But I will say the salsa and chips is amazing - wish I could take a big jar of it home. Never tasted anything like it.

excerpts: though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos.
my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
fish.author: beth l.
fish.review: this is no ordinary taqueria. SUPER amazing chips and salsa (not your typical chunky salsa, though i love that too), veggy options, and I love their fish tacos, mushroom quesadilla, and steak or shrimp burritos. my mouth is watering just thinking about it.

excerpts: The menu is very vegetarian friendly, with only two real meat options and a few fish choices to boot.
I picked a grilled shrimp burrito for myself and a fish burrito for Abby.
We both opted to make them "super" for an extra 99 cents, but my burrito especially had very little guacamole or sour cream (is there ever enough sour cream in a burrito anywhere?
Please do tell).
Both were super flavorful and had a very acceptable ratio of fillings, the shrimp were all nicely charred and the wine/butter sauce on the fish was pretty solid.
The icing on the cake at this place is their roasted tomato salsa.
While they don't have a salsa bar this one salsa makes up for it.
It's pureed, almost more of a sauce really, and must have some kind of oil in it because it was too good not to have a fat content.
fish.author: Alex D.
fish.review:
Headed home from work I stopped off here to pick up some take out. Parking was surprisingly easy for the Mission and I quickly found a spot. The menu is very vegetarian friendly, with only two real meat options and a few fish choices to boot. I picked a grilled shrimp burrito for myself and a fish burrito for Abby. We both opted to make them "super" for an extra 99 cents, but my burrito especially had very little guacamole or sour cream (is there ever enough sour cream in a burrito anywhere? Please do tell). Both were super flavorful and had a very acceptable ratio of fillings, the shrimp were all nicely charred and the wine/butter sauce on the fish was pretty solid. The icing on the cake at this place is their roasted tomato salsa. While they don't have a salsa bar this one salsa makes up for it. It's pureed, almost more of a sauce really, and must have some kind of oil in it because it was too good not to have a fat content. We will definitely try this place again (plus they have tall cans of PBR!).

FYI - Try calling ahead if you are in a hurry as the wait is a bit longer than you might expect it too be.

excerpts: Separately, the guacamole is good - though I wish it had a bit more of a kick and the fish tacos are also very tasty.
The fish is perfectly cooked and not dry like you typically find in fish tacos.
fish.author: Jason M.
fish.review:
Like a lemming, i joined the masses checking out Papalote after their Throwdown win over Bobby Flay.  And I will say it more than lived up to the hype.

I ordered the triple threat burrito made famous on the show and a side of guacamole.  Hold up, $20 for a burrito!  This better be an amazing burrito especially since every other burrito on the menu is only $8 or so!  Needless to say, I was not disappointed.  A large delicious burrito filled with carne asada, chicken and shrimp arrived along with a side of hauntingly smoky yet perfectly spicy salsa.  The salsa is the perfect complement to the wonderfully grilled and marinated contents of the burrito.  Having three types of meat inside means each bite is a sublime combination of flavors and textures.  My only quibble is that a few pieces of the shrimp were noticeably saltier than the rest of the meats - though it wasn't inedible by any means.

And for those concerned about portion sizes, this was one of the biggest burrito's I've eaten in a long time.  Unless you're Adam Richman, this should be plenty of food for anyone.

Separately, the guacamole is good - though I wish it had a bit more of a kick and the fish tacos are also very tasty.  The fish is perfectly cooked and not dry like you typically find in fish tacos.

excerpts: Killer fish tacos!
Tastiest refried black beans
(I still can't believe they're vegan)!
You just can't lose with this place.
fish.author: Donna A.
fish.review: Best salsa *ever*! Killer fish tacos! Tastiest refried black beans (I still can't believe they're vegan)! You just can't lose with this place.

excerpts: Their grilled fish tacos are my favorite.
It's a bit more then your typical tacqueria, but the quality is great.
The only drawback is they will charge you additional $.50 for their salsa for an eeny amount.
fish.author: Jaemi S.
fish.review: What do they put into that salsa of theirs?  I have never tasted it but it is SO good!  Their grilled fish tacos are my favorite.  It's a bit more then your typical tacqueria, but the quality is great.  The only drawback is they will charge you additional $.50 for their salsa for an eeny amount.

excerpts: Agree with the salsa and fish taco assessment.
Did you know you can get all the different flavor flour tortillas with tacos too?
Plus they're bigger than the corn ones!
fish.author: Esther K.
fish.review: I live around the corner, so eat here at least once a week (and have also watched it evolve).  Agree with the salsa and fish taco assessment.  Did you know you can get all the different flavor flour tortillas with tacos too?  Plus they're bigger than the corn ones!  Another favorite is the shrimp quesadilla with sauteed mushrooms.  Best time to eat here is during lunch or weekend dinner - much calmer and better service too.  A testament to how fresh it is:  I walk by in the mornings and see crates of vegetables delivered that day, with the tireless employees chopping them well before they're open.  Hats off to Miguel, Victor and team!

excerpts: I used to live right around the corner and would dine on the fish tacos regularly.
Their salsa is out of control good!
And the sell it separately.
Great gift.
It's hard to stray from the fish tacos, but I also enjoy the steak entree.
Lots of good memories.
fish.author: Roxanne L.
fish.review: I heart papalote! I used to live right around the corner and would dine on the fish tacos regularly. Their salsa is out of control good! And the sell it separately. Great gift. It's hard to stray from the fish tacos, but I also enjoy the steak entree. Lots of good memories.

excerpts: Really good fish tacos, and the most stylish taqueria interior.
I love the blue floor and red wall combination, though, you might want to wear sunglasses if you are sporting a hangover.
fish.author: Stellah D.
fish.review: Really good fish tacos, and the most stylish taqueria interior. I love the blue floor and red wall combination, though, you might want to wear sunglasses if you are sporting a hangover.

excerpts: The beans are delicious, the salsa incredible, the fish and prawns
fish.author: Rusty H.
fish.review:
OK. So it's really crowded at peak times.  And it's annoying they now charge for extra salsa.  But frankly, the salsa is worth it.  And it's fairly expensive. But it is SO GOOD that I rarely remember the annoying things about the place.

I suggest you go there somewhat off hours.  And complain about how they charge extra for salsa.  And then just enjoy the food.

Because this is a fresh-mex gourmet taqueria. I hear the owner comes from a long line of bay-area restaurateurs so he knows how to create a good establishment.

Did I mention how deliciously original this taqueria is? Sure, it's the same tacos, burritos and quesadillas that 100 other places have on their menus in SF, but it's done so nicely.  You don't feel like you got a gut bomb after eating here.  The beans are delicious, the salsa incredible, the fish and prawns so so so tasty.

Man. I wish I went there today instead of letting my friends drag me to El Metate (which is OK but not great, but usually costs a couple bucks less).

I'll have to try their new location. I never see the owner/founder at the original location any more.

excerpts: They have a variety of unique burritos, with fish, prawns, and grilled veggies among those offered.
Their salsa is different (where is the brown tint from? beans?)
but really yummy.
A little expensive, but worth it.
fish.author: Cyrelle D.
fish.review: A healthy and Americanized, but still delicious, provider of yummy Mexican food. They have a variety of unique burritos, with fish, prawns, and grilled veggies among those offered. Their salsa is different (where is the brown tint from? beans?) but really yummy. A little expensive, but worth it.

excerpts: The fish tacos are good though.
Gets pretty jammed at times, it always makes me feel a little harried.
I wish they wouldn't leave all those drinks pallettes blocking the doorway.
There is never anywhere to stand while you are waiting for your food.
If you live nearby it is best to call in your order and avoid the lines.
fish.author: Stuart J.
fish.review: This was my local regular burrito place for 6 months or so, and I really wanted to like it, but somehow I never was totally blown away. The Carne asada is fine but a little bland. The fish tacos are good though. Gets pretty jammed at times, it always makes me feel a little harried. I wish they wouldn't leave all those drinks pallettes blocking the doorway. There is never anywhere to stand while you are waiting for your food. If you live nearby it is best to call in your order and avoid the lines.

excerpts: The best fish tacos ever!
Sauteed, not fried, vegan black beans.
Smoky salsa will entice you to easily down two baskets of chips.
Mmmm.
fish.author: Amme P.
fish.review: The best fish tacos ever!  Sauteed, not fried, vegan black beans.  Smoky salsa will entice you to easily down two baskets of chips.   Mmmm.

excerpts: The raison d'etre of Papalote is their Fish Tacos.
Just remember, when you think of Fish Tacos, think of Papalote.
fish.author: Abendigo R.
fish.review: The raison d'etre of Papalote is their Fish Tacos.  Just remember, when you think of Fish Tacos, think of Papalote.

excerpts: Despite my previous plans and a lingering nausea I thought might be the stomach flu, I decided to trust the mob's judgement, step inside and order a fish burrito.
This was the best  San Francisco burrito decision I've ever made.
These guys have figured out a secret that few of the city's other burrito-makers have discovered: if you prepare the food to-order, it actually tastes better.
The cooks pan fried the fish, slapped my tortilla on the flat top, and assembled the whole thing right behind the counter, resulting in a piping hot, delicious burrito.
The ingredients tasted quality, and the prices were reasonable.
The chips tasted fresh, and the salsa, different, but good.
On top of that, the staff was super friendly despite the crowd and I noticed they had quite a drink (beer, bottled soda, aguas frescas) selection.
Other notes: dinner entrees available, 99 cent for "super" burrito, and decent indoor seating.
Best Burrito
I've had in the city so far.
fish.author: Charles C.
fish.review:
(The following paragraph has nothing to do with "El Papalote," but I've decided to included it for  "context," as this seems to be a custom on Yelp.)  I recently moved to the city but I'm pretty sure I have already figured out a few prerequisites to being one of the cool kids.  I've bought two pairs of tight pants, I'm looking for a hip (preferably ethnic) girlfriend, and I'm seeking to buy a vintage, multi-geared road bike.   Of course, I know a nondescript mountain bike would do me just fine, and a single speed would definitely be better, but I'm hoping for some kind of balance between style and city-bike practicality.  

So last night I was in the Mission to pick up a cheap bike I'd found on Craigslist, on my way to La Taqueria for a quick bite, when I noticed a crowd of people stuffed into a humble Mexican restaurant called "El Papalote."  

Despite my previous plans and a lingering nausea I thought might be the stomach flu, I decided to trust the mob's judgement, step inside and order a fish burrito.  This was the best  San Francisco burrito decision I've ever made.  These guys have figured out a secret that few of the city's other burrito-makers have discovered: if you prepare the food to-order, it actually tastes better.  The cooks pan fried the fish, slapped my tortilla on the flat top, and assembled the whole thing right behind the counter, resulting in a piping hot, delicious burrito.  The ingredients tasted quality, and the prices were reasonable.  The chips tasted fresh, and the salsa, different, but good.  On top of that, the staff was super friendly despite the crowd and I noticed they had quite a drink (beer, bottled soda, aguas frescas) selection.  Other notes: dinner entrees available, 99 cent for "super" burrito, and decent indoor seating.  Best Burrito I've had in the city so far.

excerpts: It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options.
It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for -
it's spicy and creamy and complex
-- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice.
The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried.
I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.
fish.author: Jennifer C.
fish.review: Papalote is my local burrito joint. It's healthier than your average Mexican joint and offers soyrizo, tofu, and fish and shrimp options in addition to the more pedestrain (but no less tasty) carne asada and chicken options. It's really great -- and the salsa is to die for - it's spicy and creamy and complex -- I get it in the large mason jars that they offer and lug it home along with my super burrito of choice. The only complaint I have is that the chips are not overly flavorful and are oftentimes overfried. I'm alson not a big fan of the guacamole - it's not chunky enough and isn't really "avocado-y" enough for me.

excerpts: I tend to order the fish burrito and my wife loves their corn quesadillas.
Despite a busy kitchen, everything is cooked to order which means it takes longer than your average taqueria where the meat is prepared ahead of time and food is served within a minute.
We tend to phone in an order, add 10-20 more minutes than what they say, and then pick up the food to eat at home.
Everything is so delicious!
Oh and their chips & salsa are amazing!
fish.author: Michael S.
fish.review: Excellent food - emphasis on fresh wholesome ingredients.  It's the Ton Kiang / PF Chang's of Mexican food.  I tend to order the fish burrito and my wife loves their corn quesadillas.  Despite a busy kitchen, everything is cooked to order which means it takes longer than your average taqueria where the meat is prepared ahead of time and food is served within a minute.  We tend to phone in an order, add 10-20 more minutes than what they say, and then pick up the food to eat at home.  Everything is so delicious! Oh and their chips & salsa are amazing!

excerpts: Up a star cause I just had the fish burrito.
SO yummy!
Big enough to split.
Love this place.
fish.author: Jessica I.
fish.review: Up a star cause I just had the fish burrito.  SO yummy!  Big enough to split.  Love this place.

excerpts: Always excellent, inexpensive food, with the best fish tacos.
This is hands down the best in the city.
fish.author: marie m.
fish.review: Always excellent, inexpensive food, with the best fish tacos.  This is hands down the best in the city.

excerpts: The tofu mole is interesting and quite good, but the fish tacos are a home run every time.
Their guac is excellent, the chips are fresh and hot, they have a good horchata, and enough vegetarian and vegan options to keep things interesting for the food geeks.
fish.author: A B.
fish.review: Best quality for the price, hands down.  If you really love Pancho Villa or Cancun, you might find this up (or down?) to your usual standards.  I'm vegetarian, so I can't speak to the quality of their meat offerings.  The tofu mole is interesting and quite good, but the fish tacos are a home run every time.  Their guac is excellent, the chips are fresh and hot, they have a good horchata, and enough vegetarian and vegan options to keep things interesting for the food geeks.

excerpts: Fish Tacos and the salsa makes it even better.
fish.author: T S.
fish.review: Best fresh burrito in the misson, I know you've heard it a millon times but this place is it. Veggie, Meaty, Seafood. It's all good. Lines are long which is weak but it's worth the wait. Fish Tacos and the salsa makes it even better.

excerpts: The fish tacos are divine; so is the tofu and mushroom quesadilla.
Not a sit and linger spot though, due to high volume of customers and small dining area.
fish.author: Jon R.
fish.review: Taqueria serving fresh Mexican fare made w/ quality ingredients. Meat is grilled to order; no mushy steam table food here. The fish tacos are divine; so is the tofu and mushroom quesadilla. Not a sit and linger spot though, due to high volume of customers and small dining area.

excerpts: the fish was not very well seasoned and the beans were bland. too much rice was used as stuffing the burrito so they wouldnt have to complement it with as much meat/fish.
the staff was nice but rushed and spread very thin.
this place is probably so popular because of its appearance with bobby flays show throwdown and their awards.
they probably lean on those credentials and with its high demand dont put out the quality they used to at one point.
oh yeah, very expensive for taqueria food, even for san francisco!
fish.author: Toby F.
fish.review: I went here with my family after reading all the good reviews on yelp. sorry to say, the yelpers have let me down. this place is very popular with an endless supply of customers, but i am baffled to why. my experience was that the food was satisfactory at best. we ordered the pescado burrito, carne asada entree plate, carne asada burrito, chicken nachos and a couple of tacos. the burrito have a toasted flour tortilla that does not hold shape and fell apart all over the plate. the meats were decent with not much flavor. ive had way better at many other places. the fish was not very well seasoned and the beans were bland. too much rice was used as stuffing the burrito so they wouldnt have to complement it with as much meat/fish. the staff was nice but rushed and spread very thin. this place is probably so popular because of its appearance with bobby flays show throwdown and their awards. they probably lean on those credentials and with its high demand dont put out the quality they used to at one point. oh yeah, very expensive for taqueria food, even for san francisco!

excerpts: Best homemade salsa and fish tacos in the city in a warm, vibrant, colorful atmosphere.
fish.author: Angela K.
fish.review: Best homemade salsa and fish tacos in the city in a warm, vibrant, colorful atmosphere.

excerpts: This place is great, we shared fish tacos and a chicken quesadilla.
The tacos were huge, overflowing with fresh veggies and plenty of chunks of fish.
The salsa was great, fairly spicy (be forewarned!), the chips were a little greasy for my taste, but obviously freshly fried in house.
The crowd was a mixed group of people who clearly know this place has great food at budget prices.
I'm definitely going to eat here again.
fish.author: Zephyr A.
fish.review: Had dinner with a friend recently. What a value! This place is great, we shared fish tacos and a chicken quesadilla. The tacos were huge, overflowing with fresh veggies and plenty of chunks of fish. The salsa was great, fairly spicy (be forewarned!), the chips were a little greasy for my taste, but obviously freshly fried in house. The crowd was a mixed group of people who clearly know this place has great food at budget prices. I'm definitely going to eat here again.

excerpts: The fish tacos are spectacular - I am a big cheese lover and usually have buyer's remorse if my plate of Mexican food doesn't include cheese but
the flavors in the fish tacos were so good
, I didn't feel like I missed out on a thing.
fish.author: Catherine H.
fish.review: SO GOOD!  The salsa is amazing.  If they sold it to take home, it would be worth the trip and the search for parking just to pick up a bottle.  That being said, everything else I've tried is incredible as well!  The fish tacos are spectacular - I am a big cheese lover and usually have buyer's remorse if my plate of Mexican food doesn't include cheese but the flavors in the fish tacos were so good, I didn't feel like I missed out on a thing.  The grilled veggie burrito is to die for - I've been thinking about it all week.  My husband is wild for their nachos and is even starting to suggest going to Papalote himself - this, from a die hard La Taqueria fan!  Keep it up Papalote, and I'll keep coming back for more!

excerpts: To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three".
I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy.

I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos.
Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it
but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa".
I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips.
Great place and good value.
fish.author: Abheek G.
fish.review: I have eaten here so many times that I feel obliged to write a review. Any time I tell people where I live, they say "Oh you're so close to Papalote, I've always wanted to eat there". To which I reply, "Get the fish taco/burrito or the shrimp quesadilla or the grilled veggie burrito, or, preferably, all three". I like the fact that their staff is always cheerful and polite, both on the phone or in person, even though they are always super busy. I make it a point to call about 20 minutes in advance if I am picking up food because I don't want to wait in their little waiting area for a long time, hungry and watching other people devour their burritos and tacos. Their salsa is very different from other places - most people love it but I know a few people who said "what's the deal with that orange-sauce they call salsa". I think it's great and love having it with their warm, fresh chips. Great place and good value.

excerpts: ...so I ordered fish.
The fish tacos (white fish sauteed in white wine sauce) are fabulous-- make sure to add avocado for pep.
They got me by for a while
and then Papalote started to die on the vine for me.
BUT THEN--
I decided to get some balls and order the meat.
It's amazing.
It's lean.
It's flavorful.
It's everything you want in a Mexican meal.
The salsa is fresh and tastes so rich it's as though it has a stick of butter in every ounce.
You should go to Papalote--really.
fish.author: Megan K.
fish.review: I used to be on the fence about this place. I was concerned about the Vegan and Vegetarian elements of the menu. I was afraid that the meat wasn't going to be good or that I was going to be stared down if I ordered Carne Asada...so I ordered fish. The fish tacos (white fish sauteed in white wine sauce) are fabulous-- make sure to add avocado for pep. They got me by for a while and then Papalote started to die on the vine for me. BUT THEN-- I decided to get some balls and order the meat. It's amazing. It's lean. It's flavorful. It's everything you want in a Mexican meal. The salsa is fresh and tastes so rich it's as though it has a stick of butter in every ounce. You should go to Papalote--really.

excerpts: The one star is for tasty fish that isn't breaded.
fish.author: Lily N.
fish.review: I couldn't agree more with some of the folks on this page.  If you're in a hurry...skip it.  If you're really hungry...skip it.  If you don't like creamy salsa...skip it.  If you're really broke...SKIP it.  If you have time, money, post nasal drip, and an English PhD - then by all means, have a seat.  The one star is for tasty fish that isn't breaded.

excerpts: and whats up with the fish???
it is drenched in butter (which takes away from the flavor of everything).
fish.author: SF U.
fish.review: this is certainly not my first choice for a 'lil south of the border. the food here is so average. the beans are flavorless and the meat is often mediocre. occasionally i'll go with friends who rave about their fav dishes, however i gotta say- there are many places i would rather go. and whats up with the fish??? it is drenched in butter (which takes away from the flavor of everything).

excerpts: The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.

My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.
Thank you very much.
fish.author: Jessica T.
fish.review: Papalote, I really do love you.  I am basically a yuppie, and I love how you cater to my yuppie tastes with tofu and soyrizo and various veggies options.  Although, I really do not like the grilled veggie, how can eggplant and zucchini, such delicious vegetables, taste so bitter?  Yuck.  The fish tacos, however, are delicious and light, and in my mind, a major food group since I eat them all the time.  My only complaint though is that when people order a jar of salsa, please give it to them, don't make them walk back to the store later that night or the next day because you forgot it once again, especially when they are in a taco haze, and can't be responsible for remembering things like whether or not they got a to-go jar.  Thank you very much.

excerpts: My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.
fish.author: M C.
fish.review: Prices have gone up a bit here and the wait can be long since the food is cooked per order, but the food is excellent. So many veggie options and the staff seem like they really want you to be there. Been coming here for years and love that you can call ahead for take out. My favorites are the fish tacos, tofu quesidilla, and the grilled veggie burrito.

excerpts: you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter.
i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something.
it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.
fish.author: Angi C.
fish.review: located on the noe/mission border, this taqueria is definitely fancier than the others on 24th. you can tell by the numerous veggie options available on the menu (soyrizo, marinated tofu) as well as the shrimp/fish sauteed in white wine and butter. i forgot what we ordered here, so that probably tells you something. it was decent but nothing outstanding...except for the house-made salsa.

excerpts: amazing fish tacos, slammin salsa that you just want to slurp up and healthy choices for the vegans and veggiemites in your life.
faves-- mushroom burrito con grilled tofu, groovy tunes, mission hipsters galore and bike parking in front.
bummers-- they could work on their chips and i get a bit grumbley about the 1 bowl of chips per party.
the salsa is just to good to limit the dipping.
fish.author: CTP p.
fish.review: right down the street from my house but i frequent it not because of the close proximity but because of the chow. amazing fish tacos, slammin salsa that you just want to slurp up and healthy choices for the vegans and veggiemites in your life. faves-- mushroom burrito con grilled tofu, groovy tunes, mission hipsters galore and bike parking in front. bummers-- they could work on their chips and i get a bit grumbley about the 1 bowl of chips per party. the salsa is just to good to limit the dipping.

excerpts: The fish burrito I had here was delicious.
Flaky chunks of white fish were distributed evenly among the rice and black beans.
I didn't care for the jicama salad though.
It tasted and looked like some kind of awkward mexican kimchee.
fish.author: Crystal L.
fish.review: The fish burrito I had here was delicious. Flaky chunks of white fish were distributed evenly among the rice and black beans. I didn't care for the jicama salad though. It tasted and looked like some kind of awkward mexican kimchee.

excerpts: ... and go ahead and throw in a fish taco while you're at it.
fish.author: Allison M.
fish.review: can i mail-order the salsa to new orleans please?  ... and go ahead and throw in a fish taco while you're at it.

excerpts: my friend's fish tacos were very good.
they did a great job cooking the fish.
i gladly and shamelessly ate the rest of her fish when she was done.
fish.author: Kan L.
fish.review:
i like that their salsa is different than your usual salsa. it's saucier in every way. 
my friend's fish tacos were very good. they did a great job cooking the fish. i gladly and shamelessly ate the rest of her fish when she was done. i had a chicken burrito. it was good, but i feel burritos are generally good and hard to screw up.

excerpts: I love that it's clean, that there's always new art up on the walls (though not always suiting my taste), and that their fish tacos are not fried but made with a butter-wine-garlic marinade.
Their salsa is not authentic (I don't think)
but it's very delicious.
fish.author: Christina C.
fish.review: My favorite Mexican place in the city.  I love that it's clean, that there's always new art up on the walls (though not always suiting my taste), and that their fish tacos are not fried but made with a butter-wine-garlic marinade.  Their salsa is not authentic (I don't think) but it's very delicious.

excerpts: I recommend the fish tacos, and the seasoned tofu is surprisingly good (I usually do not like tofu).
It reminds me of tandoori masala because of all the spices used.
So stay away of this place if:
You like extremely cheap and greasy Mexican food.
You care a lot about the people around you.
Yes, there is definitely less Latin people but this is hardly the only place that has less Latin people on this side of the Mission.
If you want to see Latin people stick to the ones by the Mission and to the East of it.
But if you are just a normal person looking for a clean and different taqueria, I recommend it.
If you read the other reviews they focus on political and ethnic stuff, which I think is ridiculous when you are reviewing food.
fish.author: Joseph B.
fish.review:
I lived in the mission for ten years just before I moved to Berkeley. I am originally from Guatemala, but have traveled a lot through Southern Mexico, the Mayan side of Mexico. 
So now that you know what I am not, I will let you know what I like about the place. First, the place is clean. If you care that your food is clean, this is necessary. Second, the food is fresh and not very greasy. It is simple, unassuming, and light. I recommend the fish tacos, and the seasoned tofu is surprisingly good (I usually do not like tofu). It reminds me of tandoori masala because of all the spices used. 
So stay away of this place if:
You like extremely cheap and greasy Mexican food. 
You care a lot about the people around you. Yes, there is definitely less Latin people but this is hardly the only place that has less Latin people on this side of the Mission. If you want to see Latin people stick to the ones by the Mission and to the East of it. 
But if you are just a normal person looking for a clean and different taqueria, I recommend it. If you read the other reviews they focus on political and ethnic stuff, which I think is ridiculous when you are reviewing food.

excerpts: Fish tacos were SOOOOOOOO good.
fish.author: E M.
fish.review: Fish tacos were SOOOOOOOO good. They give you chips and salsa too with your order! Completely affordable and plentiful. Everything seemed so fresh and was very well-seasoned as well. Definitely a return place for me!!!

excerpts: the super fish burrito is amazing, and the super chicken is also very good.
while i have never personally experienced it, i have heard underwhelming opinions of the burritos from friends and roommates.
when i ask if they got it super, they say "no," which is a fatal mistake.
Always get it SUPER.
fish.author: Pete A.
