fish.review: my favorite burrito.  the super fish burrito is amazing, and the super chicken is also very good.  while i have never personally experienced it, i have heard underwhelming opinions of the burritos from friends and roommates.  when i ask if they got it super, they say "no," which is a fatal mistake.  Always get it SUPER.

excerpts: i love the fish tacos and the pork burrito.
the signature salsa is to die for.
cool music, great atmosphere.
i go back whenever i am in town.
fish.author: kelly f.
fish.review: even though i live closer to mexico than ever, i still miss my old neighborhood haunt. i love the fish tacos and the pork burrito. the signature salsa is to die for. cool music, great atmosphere. i go back whenever i am in town.

excerpts: but, that minor flaw aside, these guys (and girls) know how to do a fish burrito right.
as jessica once told me when i wrote my first review, papalote's fish burritos are something to behold.
and, if you are not in san francisco, or have access to this amazing restaurant, you truly are not living life as it was meant to be lived.
(ok, that may be a bit much, but you get my point) something about marinating the fish in whatever wine they marinate it in really brings the whole package home.
a bit pricey for a burrito (i spent $10.60 something on just the burrito), but occasionally life requires you give a little extra.
fish.author: Jeremiah W.
fish.review: i was expecting a similar experience to the other papalote. learned that expectations are like assholes (and opinions), everyone has 'em, and they stink. this papalote would be perfect IF ONLY they weren't so slow about everything. the comment was made, and to which i agreed, that asking for something actually slows them down even more. but, that minor flaw aside, these guys (and girls) know how to do a fish burrito right. as jessica once told me when i wrote my first review, papalote's fish burritos are something to behold. and, if you are not in san francisco, or have access to this amazing restaurant, you truly are not living life as it was meant to be lived. (ok, that may be a bit much, but you get my point) something about marinating the fish in whatever wine they marinate it in really brings the whole package home. a bit pricey for a burrito (i spent $10.60 something on just the burrito), but occasionally life requires you give a little extra.

excerpts: Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish.
Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.
fish.author: Eugene P.
fish.review: Papalote is a healthful change of pace from the usual Mission fare, offering meats not drenched in lipids, refried beans without lard and various vegan ingredients like grilled marinated tofu, mole tofu and soyrizo. The lettuce, tomatoes, cilantro and other auxiliary ingredients are always fresh, and the award-winning house salsa, which is made from scratch every day, is dangerously addictive and worthy of its reputation as the best salsa in the city. Unfortunately the meats -- namely, the chile verde, carne asada and grilled chicken -- tend to be dry and a bit tough, possibly because it appears that the pork, beef and chicken are cooked with virtually all their fat trimmed away; even so, they are well-seasoned and thus quite enjoyable, especially when dispatched in a super burrito, which keeps the moisture level up by way of sour cream, cheese and guacamole. Omnivores not interested in smothering their meats in such heavy condiments may want to steer toward the marinated seafood options: prawns grilled with lime juice, sauteed shrimp and sauteed fish. Papalote may not provide what most would consider traditional Mexican food, but it does offer satisfying, heart-smart innovations in Mexican cuisine.

excerpts: We got the chorizo con queso which was amazing, and the carne asada which melted in our mouths.
The vibe here super cool, chill... and down to earth.
The service was great!
If I lived in the bay area this place would definitely be one that I would regularly frequent!
Highly recommend!
chorizo con queso.author: Chelsea V.
chorizo con queso.review: If you like delicious, authentic Mexican food- this is a great place to try! I came  this past weekend while in town visiting. My fiance and I were craving Mexican food, so some friends of ours suggested we check this place out. We got the chorizo con queso which was amazing, and the carne asada which melted in our mouths. The vibe here super cool, chill... and down to earth. The service was great! If I lived in the bay area this place would definitely be one that I would regularly frequent! Highly recommend!

excerpts: Before digging into that bad boy, we shared a large chorizo con queso apetizer which comes with choice of hot tortilla or chips.
If you use up the tortilla, they will give you chips - no losing there.
chorizo con queso.author: Scott C.
chorizo con queso.review: Second time here and both times the venue was selected by my dinner date as their respective favorite - so there is that. I am reasonably I had the super size buritto chicken mole the first time and I had it again on this visit. This is the best mole sauce I have ever had. BAM! Get it!!! Before digging into that bad boy, we shared a large chorizo con queso apetizer which comes with choice of hot tortilla or chips. If you use up the tortilla, they will give you chips - no losing there. On this visit, my date had the fish tacos and was thoroughly please with her selection as well. We will keep coming back. See ya!

excerpts: We ordered the Chorizo con Queso to start!
AMAZING...
a must try!
chorizo con queso.author: Julie J.
chorizo con queso.review:
Busy on a Wednesday, so I assume it is always busy! Beer only. 

We ordered the Chorizo con Queso to start! AMAZING...a must try! This dish comes with a lot of cheese melted on top of well marinated, spicy and juicy chorizo.  It was exceptional. 

The chips come salty, warm and crispy. It doesn't get better than that! 

I also ordered two fish tacos. They were massive! The flavor was subtle but fresh. 

Wished  I lived closer becuase I would come here more often!

excerpts: Soon you are ordering the chorizo con queso and a breakfast special and extra beans and you get the complimentary chips (2 bowls of them!)
with that special salsa.
You inhale the chips and then the chorizo con queso comes and my god
chorizo con queso.author: Annie M.
chorizo con queso.review:
You try to make good decisions in life, you try to be a good person. But then you are caught in a moment of weakness, after having flown across the country, jetlagged and slightly hungover. You arrive at Papalote with the intention of eating "something light" and just to "try it and see what the fuss is about" and then head to a fancy, heavy dinner. You arrive soon after it opens, around 11:30am, full of optimism and good intentions.

Then your dining partner orders a super burrito and all hell breaks loose. Soon you are ordering the chorizo con queso and a breakfast special and extra beans and you get the complimentary chips (2 bowls of them!) with that special salsa. You inhale the chips and then the chorizo con queso comes and my god that's a lot of cheese and fresh tortillas. There is not much hope for you at that point. The food is good. The food is very, very good. You, oh reader, must know this because you have already come to this page and you have come this far. Just travel a bit further and arrive at Papalote and make your own bad (but so good) consumption choices.

Long story short, we canceled our dinner plans and, after several hours of digesting, am still wondering how Papalote got the best of me. 

I can't wait to go back.

excerpts: That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas.

We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in.
grilled veggie fajitas.author: S H.
grilled veggie fajitas.review:
I will preface this review by noting that we should have called ahead and asked about the amount of garlic in their food. My husband has an allergy, & there were a lot of items on the menu he couldn't eat. That being said, we decided to share the grilled veggie fajitas. We received a small bowl of chips and a tiny amount of salsa when we were seated--it is nice to provide that complimentary appetizer, although visually it's perplexing to see the salsa served in the same size metal container that mayonnaise or ketchup usually come in. If my husband had been able to eat the salsa, it certainly wouldn't have been enough. 

The fajitas came out pretty quickly. The eggplant, zucchini & carrots were cooked a pleasant amount--not mushy. Lettuce, diced toms, and jicama (I think) all tasted fresh. The refried beans were good (though on the runnier end of the spectrum, just fyi) and the avocado slices were ripe and there were a good number of them. Wish the same had been true of  the tortillas! The order came with 3 clearly mass-produced, traditional-sized (i.e. taco, not burrito), flour tortillas--not enough to deal with even half of the food on the plate. Though they did not charge us extra when we asked for more, this just reinforced the impression created by the salsa--that they were trying to give us as little as possible. I suppose this could be a considered strategy to reduce food waste (which we would support!), though, if that's their rationale, it would help to explain that, and advise customers they need only ask for more. 

Overall, the food was fine, but not what I expected after hearing my sis talk about having seen this joint on TV, and seeing it mentioned in The Rough Guide to Cali. Could not shake the impression that you're not quite getting your money's worth. I may go back for the tofu mole everyone raves about, but probably only if I'm already in the neighborhood. I'll give 3 stars--because I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt that the absence of garlic really impacted the flavor of the food.

excerpts:
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.
grilled veggie fajitas.author: Cory C.
grilled veggie fajitas.review:
So looking through the reviews for this restaurant, I do realize that the food is ok, and most of the time the service is good.

I called papolote to order some food for my boyfriend and I.  I ordered, verbatim, 1 STEAK Fajitas and a Soyrizo SUPER Quesadilla.

We walked on down to the store a few minutes later to pick up the order.

"Hi, Im just here to pick up an Order for Cory"
"Oh Yes" she replies...
"1 Grilled VEggie Fajitas and a Soyrizo Super Quesadilla"

I explained to her that I ordered the Steak Fajitas.  On the Menu, the Steak Fajitas are $12.50, and the VEggie Fajitas are $10.50.

She begins to tell me that she didnt hear me on the phone say i wanted steak fajitas, and that now, because the order was already in the computer she would have to charge me 4.50 for a side of steak.  

I was extremely confused.  Because she couldnt hear that I wanted Steak over the phone, I have to pay more than what Steak Fajitas Cost?  She was extremely rude and unappologetic, all the while rolling her eyes and talking to me like i was the iddiot.  

I work in the service industry, and if the order comes out wrong, whether or not it was the customers fault, you get them a new order no questions asked.  

I explained to her that the price on the menu is 12.50 for Steak Fajitas, not 15.00 and that it didnt make sense to me that she couldnt fix this problem, and that she was making me feel like it was my fault,  

She turned to the woman working the other register and said something to her in Spanish, and the woman looked at her and said... JUST VOID IT.

I dont care about the price, it was all about principal.  ANd to top it off, my boyfriends Soyrizo Quesadilla didnt come with Guacamole and Sour Cream like we ordered, and all in all there were about 3 strips of steak in my order.  

Over all a bad experience.  Maybe the woman was having a bad day, but for some reason i got the impression that she always acts like that.

THe food wasnt that great.  Ive had better from El Farolito down the street on Mission and 24th.

Watch out for the woman who works the register and doesnt wear a uniform.  Shes Crazy!

excerpts:
But since everyone loves this place for the burritos, I wanted to comment on two things:

Pechuga al Achiote:
pechuga al achiote.author: Preetesh B.
pechuga al achiote.review:
Been here a million times and it gets better and better. But since everyone loves this place for the burritos, I wanted to comment on two things:

Pechuga al Achiote: SUPER healthy and great. I would recommend this if you're looking for a non-burrito option.

Mole Burrito - I would not recommend this one. Maybe its because I'm used to the freshness of the grilled pollo burrito but I was disappointed I chose this.

excerpts: I've used it to make chilaquiles & no other salsa has been better.
chilaquiles.author: Veronica M.
chilaquiles.review:
This is the best salsa in SF.
Of all the taquerias in town, authentic, hip, or trendy...this is the salsa.

Not like pico de gallo.  No no no.  Usually pico de gallo is way too chunky & bland for tortilla chip dipping or using as a topping for me.  This is smooth, creamy, rich, & deep.  It has perfect consistency.  And even in just their regular salsa, the heat is there.  If you don't pick up a jar, you can be confident that you're missing out.

It's fantastic w everything.  I've used it to make chilaquiles & no other salsa has been better.

Now, the food.

The super carne asada burrito was a bit of a let down for me.  The carne asada was chewy & dry.  And the only flavor punches were at the ends of the burrito, meaning the distribution was all whacked.  

No bueno.  

But I'll still be back.  I need to try the mexipino.  And of course, the triple threat.

The cashier was sweet.  Actually, all the staff was.

Their salsa is available all over town.  Bi-Rite, Safeway, Whole Foods, etc.

Lucky us.

It was a 3 star burrito.  But their salsas are totally 5 stars.

4 stars.

excerpts: The grilled prawn and lime tacos on soft corn tortillas, camarones (shrimp tacos cooked in butter and wine), chilaquiles and Papalote's incomparable salsa

(I've gingerly transported jars of Papalote salsa, bubble wrapped for good measure, to the East Coast to distribute amongst lucky friends but nothing beats fresh salsa at the Mission location) are all killer.
Add a strawberry agua fresca and I'm good to go.
chilaquiles.author: Cheryl L.
chilaquiles.review:
I love Papalote and always make sure to bring out-of-towners whenever friends come to visit.

The grilled prawn and lime tacos on soft corn tortillas, camarones (shrimp tacos cooked in butter and wine), chilaquiles and Papalote's incomparable salsa (I've gingerly transported jars of Papalote salsa, bubble wrapped for good measure, to the East Coast to distribute amongst lucky friends but nothing beats fresh salsa at the Mission location) are all killer. Add a strawberry agua fresca and I'm good to go.

excerpts: The Chilaquiles - enough said!
On top of the totally-killer, absolutely-supreme chilaquiles, Papalote has some bomb burritos.
chilaquiles.author: Tiffany K.
chilaquiles.review:
The Chilaquiles - enough said!

Okay - but actually, there's so much more. On top of the totally-killer, absolutely-supreme chilaquiles, Papalote has some bomb burritos. It's hard to find a good bean and cheese burrito, but they have perfected the art. 

Their in-house made salsa is also out of this world. Unique and creamy with a smokey base, I always ask for extra. Plus, you can buy it in-store for friends who may also be Papalote-fans. 

Tips: 
+ Looking to eat your burrito at home? Call ahead and pick it up. They're timely and have a register dedicated solely to phone orders. 
+ Only bummer is that they open late on weekends. Sometimes I need breakfast before 11am...

excerpts: Really tasty chilaquiles.
chilaquiles.author: Miriam W.
chilaquiles.review:
Excellent salsa. Really tasty chilaquiles. Heavenly black refried beans.

My only complaint? The too-tall tables paired with the too-short chairs in the back. Translation- you can't reach your food. So, if the chair looks like a bar stool, don't sit there otherwise you'll have trouble dipping your chips into their lovely salsa.

excerpts: I can't speak for anything else on the menu since all I ever get is the chilaquiles with fried eggs.
If everything else is like that, than I'm sure its f'ing FANTASTIC!!
It was so good, I can't even remember what my most loving and beautiful wife had.
I believe it was something lo-carb.
chilaquiles.author: Joe K.
chilaquiles.review:
Whats there to say.. First.  I love there salsa.  I don't know what it is, but the stuff is amazing.  I bought a jar last time I was there and so should you.

Second.  I can't speak for anything else on the menu since all I ever get is the chilaquiles with fried eggs.  If everything else is like that, than I'm sure its f'ing FANTASTIC!!  It was so good, I can't even remember what my most loving and beautiful wife had.  I believe it was something lo-carb.  Everyone there has always been very friendly every time I've been there.

Third, it was always a little chaotic when I would go there, but in the past 4 months they remodeled a bit and it's really really nice inside.  I love this place.  Done.

excerpts: Everything I've had here is DELICIOUS, from the chilaquiles to the breakfast omelet burrito, to the shrimp tacos, etc!
chilaquiles.author: Michele Z.
chilaquiles.review:
Everything I've had here is DELICIOUS, from the chilaquiles to the breakfast omelet burrito, to the shrimp tacos, etc!  And every once in a while they'll throw in a special/seasonal item, like the Adobo Burrito =) 

I also love that they're *green* about their yummy House Sauce (my fave salsa dip on the planet) ~ You can buy a refrigerated unlabeled one and bring it back for $1 off your next refill.  There are also labeled ones along the front of the cash register if you're a label whore like that  :) 

I usually walk here so can't complain about the parking.  But it's the Mission, so notorious for tricky parking.  Also have never had a problem with a long wait, except for once I had to stand in the doorjamb for a few minutes, no biggie.  Service is always fast and the tables are always cleaned pretty swiftly!

excerpts: They have great food, but I think their best dish is the chilaquiles.
Add eggs to it
and you'll be happy and full for a long long time.
Just writing this review is making my mouth water!
chilaquiles.author: Carlos E.
chilaquiles.review: They have great food, but I think their best dish is the chilaquiles. Add eggs to it and you'll be happy and full for a long long time. Just writing this review is making my mouth water!

excerpts:
Chilaquiles!

- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. 
I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.
chilaquiles.author: Amy H.
chilaquiles.review:
Chilaquiles!

After walking by a few months ago and seeing someone chow down on a huge plate of nachos through the window, I knew I had to come back and check this place out sometime. I actually had no idea it was featured on Throwdown until the day before we went.

We arrived at 11:45am and it was totally dead. But our friends weren't here yet so we walked around the corner for a cup of coffee. 20 minutes later we walked back and there was a huge line out the door. 

So it's definitely not worth all the hype but the food is still pretty decent, and it's not your typical greasy Mexican joint like one would expect.

- Chips and Salsa - I thought the chips were just average - I've had better. The salsa is fantastic though - creamy and orange with a bit of kick.
- Chilaquiles - "breakfast nachos", great for sharing as I don't think I can handle an entire serving. A generous serving of chips topped w/ cheese, sauce, and egg and served w/ beans and rice on the side
- Chile Verde burrito - a fat burrito, enough for two people. Consisting of just meat, rice and beans, it was tasty, but nothing to go crazy over. I didn't bother with the Triple Threat, and don't see how an extra 10 bucks and three different types of meat would have made it that much better.
- Chicken tacos - the chicken had a good seasoning, but the rest of the taco was pretty plain. Served on two flour tortillas w/ lettuce and tomatoes.

I would come back for the salsa and chilaquiles alone, and at least I know next time I can definitely skip the burritos/tacos.

One last note - the service is great and the staff was so friendly. With crowded tables and a 20 minute line out the door they could have easily been stressed out. But they all had a great attitude, were attentive, and thanked us with smiles on our way out.

excerpts: The chilaquiles are divine.
chilaquiles.author: Liz P.
chilaquiles.review:
Everyone raves about the salsa and rightfully so.  Others bitch that  if you want extra, you pay extra.  Please, it's fifty cents more and worth every penny.  Unlike any other salsa I've tasted.  Hotness varies each visit.

I find the food hit or miss.  The carne asada is bland and tough.  Shrimp tacos are the same.  Tortillas are the stiff, packaged variety.

The chile verde is delicious and now my favorite item on the menu.  I've tasted the fish tacos and not a fishy taste or smell about them.  A friend gives raves to the veggie burrito.  The chilaquiles are divine.

Papalote is located in what I call N'mission -- on the edge of Noe and the Mission.  If you're not into kids, then beware of the Noe Stroller Set.  They can overtake the place with often times not so well-behaved children.  Or clueless parents.  And why oh why can't they leave their strollers on the sidewalk?  The place is tiny enough.

Only a few tables in the joint, so you usually have to hover over diners like a vulture and swoop in as soon as one is free.

I love the chilaquiles at Palalote, and I end up needing 2 agua frescas because they are so damn spicy...
chilaquiles.author: Dora A.
chilaquiles.review:
Salsa.
Salsa.
Salsa.
Chilaquiles made with THE salsa. 

I love the chilaquiles at Palalote, and I end up needing 2 agua frescas because they are so damn spicy...but I love 'em anyway. 

I can't stand the little jicama side salad. It looks good; it has the potential to be good, but it seems overseasoned with some chile lime powder stuff. Sometimes the cashier is impatient and not so friendly, but I can definitely see the wide appeal of this place.

Chips were just ok, salsa awesome.

excerpts: My dad had the chilaquiles and seemed pretty satisfied about them.
chilaquiles.author: Christine S.
chilaquiles.review:
I used to walk by this place every day when I went to work and there was just something about it that repelled me from ever eating there.  Well, my sister decided to drag my dad and I there for lunch yesterday and I can't really say it was entirely worth it but it could be worse (like Chipotle, for example).  

The moment we got in, we ordered our food but guess what?  No seating.   I found this a little frustrating and sort of an unusual situation, since most taquerias I go to have at least some seating available.  Anyway, we finally got a table and sat down to some *delicious* salsa and chips.  I've never tasted anything like it and enjoyed it immensely.  Of course, I find out after I leave that they sell it behind the counter but oh well.  We finally got our meals.  My dad had the chilaquiles and seemed pretty satisfied about them.  I probably should have ordered that, because my shrimp tacos were shameful.  I got a measly four pieces of shrimp in each taco that I could barely see since it covered in a pile of lettuce and tomato.  I got a salad, basically, hugged inside a folded tortilla.  I grew up with TACOS: loaded with meat, dripping with pico de gallo and salsa.  These weren't tacos, not to me, at least.  

I am still not convinced this place is worth all the hullabaloo, but you never know.  I might have to make a second trip.  For now, I wish we had gone to La Santaneca or El Farolito instead.

excerpts: I don't live here anymore, but when I return to the Bay Area, it is imperative that I eat the chilaquiles.
Papalote makes the best salsa I have ever had.
Period.
Also, the first time I came in there when they had just opened
I was hungover and wanted some milk.
They didn't have any and ran out and bought some for me.
I thought that was nice.
Heh.

excerpts: I recommend Mexipino and Breakfast Burrito Machaca con Huevo.
Both are delicious options that can serve for 2 meals.
Be sure to enjoy some Agua fresca, and be patient.
machaca con huevo.author: Rodolfo C.
machaca con huevo.review:
By far the best burritos of SF. The salsa is what dreams are made of, and each burrito is 'solid' on how delicious it can be. This is not a Taqueria, this is a burrito shop, so be ready to enjoy amazing burritos. I recommend Mexipino and Breakfast Burrito Machaca con Huevo. Both are delicious options that can serve for 2 meals. Be sure to enjoy some Agua fresca, and be patient. The place can be really busy at night. 

I suggest to order on the phone for pick-up and in that way you can skip the waiting for the delicious burritos. 

Enjoy. You won't regret it.

excerpts: The fresh and not too salty chipotle salsa, whole wheat tortilla options and ginger soft drinks are also a nice touch.
soft drinks.author: Mark Y.
soft drinks.review:
When I want a real gourmet sit down burrito in a colorful place with Mexican bug kites on the ceiling, I'll put up with circling around a few times in the Mission to find parking when I come here. I don't know of any other place that basically grills up a fresh steak for you and chops it up for a really fresh and naturally juicy and chewy take on the average carne asada burrito.
 
The fresh and not too salty chipotle salsa, whole wheat tortilla options and ginger soft drinks are also a nice touch.

My buddy I brought who went for the first time had the chicken mole burrito and kept raving about it for days.
They have some interesting graffiti on the walls in the bathroom, let's leave it at that... some of that stuff was pretty funny to read.
